say one to anoth what is thi that god hath done unto us? 42:29
and they came unto jacob their father unto the land of canaan and
told him all that befel unto them; say 42:30 the man who is the
lord of the land spake roughli to us and took us for spi of the
countri

42:31 and we said unto him we are true men; we are no spies: 42:32 we
be twelv brethren son of our father; one is not and the youngest
is thi day with our father in the land of canaan

42:33 and the man the lord of the countri said unto us herebi shall
i know that ye are true men; leav one of your brethren here with me
and take food for the famin of your household and be gone: 42:34
and bring your youngest brother unto me: then shall i know that ye are
no spi but that ye are true men: so will i deliv you your
brother and ye shall traffick in the land

42:35 and it came to pass as they empti their sack that behold
everi man bundl of money wa in hi sack: and when both they and
their father saw the bundl of money they were afraid

42:36 and jacob their father said unto them me have ye bereav of my
children: joseph is not and simeon is not and ye will take benjamin
away: all these thing are against me

42:37 and reuben spake unto hi father say slay my two son if i
bring him not to thee: deliv him into my hand and i will bring him
to thee again

42:38 and he said my son shall not go down with you; for hi brother
is dead and he is left alone: if mischief befal him by the way in
the which ye go then shall ye bring down my gray hair with sorrow to
the grave

43:1 and the famin wa sore in the land

43:2 and it came to pass when they had eaten up the corn which they
had brought out of egypt their father said unto them go again buy
us a littl food

43:3 and judah spake unto him say the man did solemnli protest
unto us say ye shall not see my face except your brother be with
you

43:4 if thou wilt send our brother with us we will go down and buy
thee food: 43:5 but if thou wilt not send him we will not go down:
for the man said unto us ye shall not see my face except your
brother be with you

43:6 and israel said wherefor dealt ye so ill with me as to tell
the man whether ye had yet a brother? 43:7 and they said the man
ask us straitli of our state and of our kindr say is your
father yet alive? have ye anoth brother? and we told him accord
to the tenor of these words: could we certainli know that he would
say bring your brother down? 43:8 and judah said unto israel hi
father send the lad with me and we will aris and go; that we may
live and not die both we and thou and also our littl one

43:9 i will be sureti for him; of my hand shalt thou requir him: if i
bring him not unto thee and set him befor thee then let me bear the
blame for ever: 43:10 for except we had linger sure now we had
return thi second time

43:11 and their father israel said unto them if it must be so now do
this; take of the best fruit in the land in your vessel and carri
down the man a present a littl balm and a littl honey spice and
myrrh nut and almonds: 43:12 and take doubl money in your hand;
and the money that wa brought again in the mouth of your sack carri
it again in your hand; peradventur it wa an oversight: 43:13 take
also your brother and aris go again unto the man: 43:14 and god
almighti give you merci befor the man that he may send away your
other brother and benjamin if i be bereav of my children i am
bereav

43:15 and the men took that present and they took doubl money in
their hand and benjamin; and rose up and went down to egypt and
stood befor joseph

43:16 and when joseph saw benjamin with them he said to the ruler of
hi hous bring these men home and slay and make ready; for these
men shall dine with me at noon

43:17 and the man did as joseph bade; and the man brought the men into
joseph hous

43:18 and the men were afraid becaus they were brought into joseph
house; and they said becaus of the money that wa return in our
sack at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occas
against us and fall upon us and take us for bondmen and our ass

43:19 and they came near to the steward of joseph hous and they
commun with him at the door of the hous 43:20 and said o sir we
came inde down at the first time to buy food: 43:21 and it came to
pass when we came to the inn that we open our sack and behold
everi man money wa in the mouth of hi sack our money in full
weight: and we have brought it again in our hand

43:22 and other money have we brought down in our hand to buy food:
we cannot tell who put our money in our sack

43:23 and he said peac be to you fear not: your god and the god of
your father hath given you treasur in your sacks: i had your money
and he brought simeon out unto them

43:24 and the man brought the men into joseph hous and gave them
water and they wash their feet; and he gave their ass provend

43:25 and they made readi the present against joseph came at noon: for
they heard that they should eat bread there

43:26 and when joseph came home they brought him the present which
wa in their hand into the hous and bow themselv to him to the
earth

43:27 and he ask them of their welfar and said is your father
well the old man of whom ye spake? is he yet alive? 43:28 and they
answer thi servant our father is in good health he is yet aliv
and they bow down their head and made obeis

43:29 and he lift up hi eye and saw hi brother benjamin hi
mother son and said is thi your younger brother of whom ye spake
unto me? and he said god be graciou unto thee my son

43:30 and joseph made haste; for hi bowel did yearn upon hi
brother: and he sought where to weep; and he enter into hi chamber
and wept there

43:31 and he wash hi face and went out and refrain himself and
said set on bread

43:32 and they set on for him by himself and for them by themselv
and for the egyptian which did eat with him by themselves: becaus
the egyptian might not eat bread with the hebrews; for that is an
abomin unto the egyptian

43:33 and they sat befor him the firstborn accord to hi
birthright and the youngest accord to hi youth: and the men
marvel one at anoth

43:34 and he took and sent mess unto them from befor him: but
benjamin mess wa five time so much as ani of their and they
drank and were merri with him

44:1 and he command the steward of hi hous say fill the men
sack with food as much as they can carri and put everi man money
in hi sack mouth

44:2 and put my cup the silver cup in the sack mouth of the
youngest and hi corn money and he did accord to the word that
joseph had spoken

44:3 as soon as the morn wa light the men were sent away they
and their ass

44:4 and when they were gone out of the citi and not yet far off
joseph said unto hi steward up follow after the men; and when thou
dost overtak them say unto them wherefor have ye reward evil for
good? 44:5 is not thi it in which my lord drinketh and wherebi
inde he divineth? ye have done evil in so do

44:6 and he overtook them and he spake unto them these same word

44:7 and they said unto him wherefor saith my lord these words? god
forbid that thi servant should do accord to thi thing: 44:8
behold the money which we found in our sack mouth we brought
again unto thee out of the land of canaan: how then should we steal
out of thi lord hous silver or gold? 44:9 with whomsoev of thi
servant it be found both let him die and we also will be my lord
bondmen

44:10 and he said now also let it be accord unto your words: he
with whom it is found shall be my servant; and ye shall be blameless

44:11 then they speedili took down everi man hi sack to the ground
and open everi man hi sack

44:12 and he search and began at the eldest and left at the
youngest: and the cup wa found in benjamin sack

44:13 then they rent their cloth and lade everi man hi ass and
return to the citi

44:14 and judah and hi brethren came to joseph house; for he wa
yet there: and they fell befor him on the ground

44:15 and joseph said unto them what deed is thi that ye have done?
wot ye not that such a man as i can certainli divine? 44:16 and judah
said what shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak? or how
shall we clear ourselves? god hath found out the iniqu of thi
servants: behold we are my lord servant both we and he also with
whom the cup is found

44:17 and he said god forbid that i should do so: but the man in
whose hand the cup is found he shall be my servant; and as for you
get you up in peac unto your father

44:18 then judah came near unto him and said oh my lord let thi
servant i pray thee speak a word in my lord ear and let not
thine anger burn against thi servant: for thou art even as pharaoh

44:19 my lord ask hi servant say have ye a father or a
brother? 44:20 and we said unto my lord we have a father an old
man and a child of hi old age a littl one; and hi brother is
dead and he alon is left of hi mother and hi father loveth him

44:21 and thou saidst unto thi servant bring him down unto me that
i may set mine eye upon him

44:22 and we said unto my lord the lad cannot leav hi father: for
if he should leav hi father hi father would die

44:23 and thou saidst unto thi servant except your youngest brother
come down with you ye shall see my face no more

44:24 and it came to pass when we came up unto thi servant my father
we told him the word of my lord

44:25 and our father said go again and buy us a littl food

44:26 and we said we cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with
us then will we go down: for we may not see the man face except
our youngest brother be with us

44:27 and thi servant my father said unto us ye know that my wife
bare me two sons: 44:28 and the one went out from me and i said
sure he is torn in pieces; and i saw him not since: 44:29 and if ye
take thi also from me and mischief befal him ye shall bring down
my gray hair with sorrow to the grave

44:30 now therefor when i come to thi servant my father and the lad
be not with us; see that hi life is bound up in the lad life;
44:31 it shall come to pass when he seeth that the lad is not with
us that he will die: and thi servant shall bring down the gray hair
of thi servant our father with sorrow to the grave

44:32 for thi servant becam sureti for the lad unto my father
say if i bring him not unto thee then i shall bear the blame to
my father for ever

44:33 now therefor i pray thee let thi servant abid instead of the
lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with hi brethren

44:34 for how shall i go up to my father and the lad be not with me?
lest peradventur i see the evil that shall come on my father

45:1 then joseph could not refrain himself befor all them that stood
by him; and he cri caus everi man to go out from me and there
stood no man with him while joseph made himself known unto hi
brethren

45:2 and he wept aloud: and the egyptian and the hous of pharaoh
heard

45:3 and joseph said unto hi brethren i am joseph; doth my father
yet live? and hi brethren could not answer him; for they were
troubl at hi presenc

45:4 and joseph said unto hi brethren come near to me i pray you
and they came near and he said i am joseph your brother whom ye
sold into egypt

45:5 now therefor be not griev nor angri with yourselv that ye
sold me hither: for god did send me befor you to preserv life

45:6 for these two year hath the famin been in the land: and yet
there are five year in the which there shall neither be ear nor
harvest

45:7 and god sent me befor you to preserv you a poster in the
earth and to save your live by a great deliver

45:8 so now it wa not you that sent me hither but god: and he hath
made me a father to pharaoh and lord of all hi hous and a ruler
throughout all the land of egypt

45:9 hast ye and go up to my father and say unto him thu saith
thi son joseph god hath made me lord of all egypt: come down unto me
tarri not: 45:10 and thou shalt dwell in the land of goshen and thou
shalt be near unto me thou and thi children and thi children
children and thi flock and thi herd and all that thou hast: 45:11
and there will i nourish thee; for yet there are five year of famine;
lest thou and thi household and all that thou hast come to poverti

45:12 and behold your eye see and the eye of my brother benjamin
that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you

45:13 and ye shall tell my father of all my glori in egypt and of all
that ye have seen; and ye shall hast and bring down my father hither

45:14 and he fell upon hi brother benjamin neck and wept; and
benjamin wept upon hi neck

45:15 moreov he kiss all hi brethren and wept upon them: and
after that hi brethren talk with him

45:16 and the fame thereof wa heard in pharaoh hous say
joseph brethren are come: and it pleas pharaoh well and hi
servant

45:17 and pharaoh said unto joseph say unto thi brethren thi do ye;
lade your beast and go get you unto the land of canaan; 45:18 and
take your father and your household and come unto me: and i will
give you the good of the land of egypt and ye shall eat the fat of
the land

45:19 now thou art command thi do ye; take you wagon out of the
land of egypt for your littl one and for your wive and bring your
father and come

45:20 also regard not your stuff; for the good of all the land of
egypt is your

45:21 and the children of israel did so: and joseph gave them wagon
accord to the command of pharaoh and gave them provis for
the way

45:22 to all of them he gave each man chang of raiment; but to
benjamin he gave three hundr piec of silver and five chang of
raiment

45:23 and to hi father he sent after thi manner; ten ass laden
with the good thing of egypt and ten she ass laden with corn and
bread and meat for hi father by the way

45:24 so he sent hi brethren away and they departed: and he said
unto them see that ye fall not out by the way

45:25 and they went up out of egypt and came into the land of canaan
unto jacob their father 45:26 and told him say joseph is yet
aliv and he is governor over all the land of egypt and jacob
heart faint for he believ them not

45:27 and they told him all the word of joseph which he had said
unto them: and when he saw the wagon which joseph had sent to carri
him the spirit of jacob their father revived: 45:28 and israel said
it is enough; joseph my son is yet alive: i will go and see him befor
i die

46:1 and israel took hi journey with all that he had and came to
beersheba and offer sacrific unto the god of hi father isaac

46:2 and god spake unto israel in the vision of the night and said
jacob jacob and he said here am i

46:3 and he said i am god the god of thi father: fear not to go down
into egypt; for i will there make of thee a great nation: 46:4 i will
go down with thee into egypt; and i will also sure bring thee up
again: and joseph shall put hi hand upon thine eye

46:5 and jacob rose up from beersheba: and the son of israel carri
jacob their father and their littl one and their wive in the
wagon which pharaoh had sent to carri him

46:6 and they took their cattl and their good which they had
gotten in the land of canaan and came into egypt jacob and all hi
seed with him: 46:7 hi son and hi son son with him hi
daughter and hi son daughter and all hi seed brought he with
him into egypt

46:8 and these are the name of the children of israel which came
into egypt jacob and hi sons: reuben jacob firstborn

46:9 and the son of reuben; hanoch and phallu and hezron and
carmi

46:10 and the son of simeon; jemuel and jamin and ohad and jachin
and zohar and shaul the son of a canaanitish woman

46:11 and the son of levi; gershon kohath and merari

46:12 and the son of judah; er and onan and shelah and pharez and
zarah: but er and onan die in the land of canaan and the son of
pharez were hezron and hamul

46:13 and the son of issachar; tola and phuvah and job and
shimron

46:14 and the son of zebulun; sere and elon and jahleel

46:15 these be the son of leah which she bare unto jacob in
padanaram with hi daughter dinah: all the soul of hi son and hi
daughter were thirti and three

46:16 and the son of gad; ziphion and haggi shuni and ezbon eri
and arodi and are

46:17 and the son of asher; jimnah and ishuah and isui and beriah
and serah their sister: and the son of beriah; heber and malchiel

46:18 these are the son of zilpah whom laban gave to leah hi
daughter and these she bare unto jacob even sixteen soul

46:19 the son of rachel jacob wife; joseph and benjamin

46:20 and unto joseph in the land of egypt were born manasseh and
ephraim which asenath the daughter of potipherah priest of on bare
unto him

46:21 and the son of benjamin were belah and becher and ashbel
gera and naaman ehi and rosh muppim and huppim and ard

46:22 these are the son of rachel which were born to jacob: all the
soul were fourteen

46:23 and the son of dan; hushim

46:24 and the son of naphtali; jahzeel and guni and jezer and
shillem

46:25 these are the son of bilhah which laban gave unto rachel hi
daughter and she bare these unto jacob: all the soul were seven

46:26 all the soul that came with jacob into egypt which came out of
hi loin besid jacob son wive all the soul were threescor
and six; 46:27 and the son of joseph which were born him in egypt
were two souls: all the soul of the hous of jacob which came into
egypt were threescor and ten

46:28 and he sent judah befor him unto joseph to direct hi face
unto goshen; and they came into the land of goshen

46:29 and joseph made readi hi chariot and went up to meet israel
hi father to goshen and present himself unto him; and he fell on
hi neck and wept on hi neck a good while

46:30 and israel said unto joseph now let me die sinc i have seen
thi face becaus thou art yet aliv

46:31 and joseph said unto hi brethren and unto hi father hous
i will go up and shew pharaoh and say unto him my brethren and my
father hous which were in the land of canaan are come unto me;
46:32 and the men are shepherd for their trade hath been to feed
cattle; and they have brought their flock and their herd and all
that they have

46:33 and it shall come to pass when pharaoh shall call you and
shall say what is your occupation? 46:34 that ye shall say thi
servant trade hath been about cattl from our youth even until now
both we and also our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of
goshen; for everi shepherd is an abomin unto the egyptian

47:1 then joseph came and told pharaoh and said my father and my
brethren and their flock and their herd and all that they have
are come out of the land of canaan; and behold they are in the land
of goshen

47:2 and he took some of hi brethren even five men and present
them unto pharaoh

47:3 and pharaoh said unto hi brethren what is your occupation? and
they said unto pharaoh thi servant are shepherd both we and also
our father

47:4 they said morev unto pharaoh for to sojourn in the land are we
come; for thi servant have no pastur for their flocks; for the
famin is sore in the land of canaan: now therefor we pray thee let
thi servant dwell in the land of goshen

47:5 and pharaoh spake unto joseph say thi father and thi
brethren are come unto thee: 47:6 the land of egypt is befor thee; in
the best of the land make thi father and brethren to dwell; in the
land of goshen let them dwell: and if thou knowest ani men of activ
among them then make them ruler over my cattl

47:7 and joseph brought in jacob hi father and set him befor
pharaoh: and jacob bless pharaoh

47:8 and pharaoh said unto jacob how old art thou? 47:9 and jacob
said unto pharaoh the day of the year of my pilgrimag are an
hundr and thirti years: few and evil have the day of the year of
my life been and have not attain unto the day of the year of the
life of my father in the day of their pilgrimag

47:10 and jacob bless pharaoh and went out from befor pharaoh

47:11 and joseph place hi father and hi brethren and gave them a
possess in the land of egypt in the best of the land in the land
of rames as pharaoh had command

47:12 and joseph nourish hi father and hi brethren and all hi
father household with bread accord to their famili

47:13 and there wa no bread in all the land; for the famin wa veri
sore so that the land of egypt and all the land of canaan faint by
reason of the famin

47:14 and joseph gather up all the money that wa found in the land
of egypt and in the land of canaan for the corn which they bought:
and joseph brought the money into pharaoh hous

47:15 and when money fail in the land of egypt and in the land of
canaan all the egyptian came unto joseph and said give us bread:
for whi should we die in thi presence? for the money faileth

47:16 and joseph said give your cattle; and i will give you for your
cattl if money fail

47:17 and they brought their cattl unto joseph: and joseph gave them
bread in exchang for hors and for the flock and for the cattl
of the herd and for the asses: and he fed them with bread for all
their cattl for that year

47:18 when that year wa end they came unto him the second year
and said unto him we will not hide it from my lord how that our
money is spent; my lord also hath our herd of cattle; there is not
ought left in the sight of my lord but our bodi and our lands:
47:19 wherefor shall we die befor thine eye both we and our land?
buy us and our land for bread and we and our land will be servant
unto pharaoh: and give us seed that we may live and not die that
the land be not desol

47:20 and joseph bought all the land of egypt for pharaoh; for the
egyptian sold everi man hi field becaus the famin prevail over
them: so the land becam pharaoh

47:21 and as for the peopl he remov them to citi from one end of
the border of egypt even to the other end thereof

47:22 onli the land of the priest bought he not; for the priest had
a portion assign them of pharaoh and did eat their portion which
pharaoh gave them: wherefor they sold not their land

47:23 then joseph said unto the peopl behold i have bought you thi
day and your land for pharaoh: lo here is seed for you and ye shall
sow the land

47:24 and it shall come to pass in the increas that ye shall give
the fifth part unto pharaoh and four part shall be your own for
seed of the field and for your food and for them of your household
and for food for your littl one

47:25 and they said thou hast save our lives: let us find grace in
the sight of my lord and we will be pharaoh servant

47:26 and joseph made it a law over the land of egypt unto thi day
that pharaoh should have the fifth part except the land of the
priest onli which becam not pharaoh

47:27 and israel dwelt in the land of egypt in the countri of goshen;
and they had possess therein and grew and multipli
exceedingli

47:28 and jacob live in the land of egypt seventeen years: so the
whole age of jacob wa an hundr forti and seven year

47:29 and the time drew nigh that israel must die: and he call hi
son joseph and said unto him if now i have found grace in thi sight
put i pray thee thi hand under my thigh and deal kindli and truli
with me; buri me not i pray thee in egypt: 47:30 but i will lie with
my father and thou shalt carri me out of egypt and buri me in their
buryingplac and he said i will do as thou hast said

47:31 and he said swear unto me and he sware unto him and israel
bow himself upon the bed head

48:1 and it came to pass after these thing that one told joseph
behold thi father is sick: and he took with him hi two son
manasseh and ephraim

48:2 and one told jacob and said behold thi son joseph cometh unto
thee: and israel strengthen himself and sat upon the bed

48:3 and jacob said unto joseph god almighti appear unto me at luz
in the land of canaan and bless me 48:4 and said unto me behold
i will make thee fruit and multipli thee and i will make of thee
a multitud of people; and will give thi land to thi seed after thee
for an everlast possess

48:5 and now thi two son ephraim and manasseh which were born unto
thee in the land of egypt befor i came unto thee into egypt are
mine; as reuben and simeon they shall be mine

48:6 and thi issu which thou begettest after them shall be thine
and shall be call after the name of their brethren in their
inherit

48:7 and as for me when i came from padan rachel die by me in the
land of canaan in the way when yet there wa but a littl way to come
unto ephrath: and i buri her there in the way of ephrath; the same
is bethlehem

48:8 and israel beheld joseph son and said who are these? 48:9
and joseph said unto hi father they are my son whom god hath given
me in thi place and he said bring them i pray thee unto me and i
will bless them

48:10 now the eye of israel were dim for age so that he could not
see

and he brought them near unto him; and he kiss them and embrac
them

48:11 and israel said unto joseph i had not thought to see thi face:
and lo god hath shew me also thi seed

48:12 and joseph brought them out from between hi knee and he bow
himself with hi face to the earth

48:13 and joseph took them both ephraim in hi right hand toward
israel left hand and manasseh in hi left hand toward israel
right hand and brought them near unto him

48:14 and israel stretch out hi right hand and laid it upon
ephraim head who wa the younger and hi left hand upon manasseh
head guid hi hand wittingly; for manasseh wa the firstborn

48:15 and he bless joseph and said god befor whom my father
abraham and isaac did walk the god which fed me all my life long unto
thi day 48:16 the angel which redeem me from all evil bless the
lads; and let my name be name on them and the name of my father
abraham and isaac; and let them grow into a multitud in the midst of
the earth

48:17 and when joseph saw that hi father laid hi right hand upon the
head of ephraim it displeas him: and he held up hi father hand
to remov it from ephraim head unto manasseh head

48:18 and joseph said unto hi father not so my father: for thi is
the firstborn; put thi right hand upon hi head

48:19 and hi father refus and said i know it my son i know it:
he also shall becom a peopl and he also shall be great: but truli
hi younger brother shall be greater than he and hi seed shall
becom a multitud of nation

48:20 and he bless them that day say in thee shall israel
bless say god make thee as ephraim and as manasseh: and he set
ephraim befor manasseh

48:21 and israel said unto joseph behold i die: but god shall be
with you and bring you again unto the land of your father

48:22 moreov i have given to thee one portion abov thi brethren
which i took out of the hand of the amorit with my sword and with my
bow

49:1 and jacob call unto hi son and said gather yourselv
togeth that i may tell you that which shall befal you in the last
day

49:2 gather yourselv togeth and hear ye son of jacob; and
hearken unto israel your father

49:3 reuben thou art my firstborn my might and the begin of my
strength the excel of digniti and the excel of power: 49:4
unstabl as water thou shalt not excel; becaus thou wentest up to
thi father bed; then defiledst thou it: he went up to my couch

49:5 simeon and levi are brethren; instrument of cruelti are in their
habit

49:6 o my soul come not thou into their secret; unto their assembl
mine honour be not thou united: for in their anger they slew a man
and in their selfwil they dig down a wall

49:7 curs be their anger for it wa fierce; and their wrath for it
wa cruel: i will divid them in jacob and scatter them in israel

49:8 judah thou art he whom thi brethren shall praise: thi hand shall
be in the neck of thine enemies; thi father children shall bow down
befor thee

49:9 judah is a lion whelp: from the prey my son thou art gone up:
he stoop down he couch as a lion and as an old lion; who shall
rous him up? 49:10 the sceptr shall not depart from judah nor a
lawgiv from between hi feet until shiloh come; and unto him shall
the gather of the peopl be

49:11 bind hi foal unto the vine and hi asss colt unto the
choic vine; he wash hi garment in wine and hi cloth in the
blood of grapes: 49:12 hi eye shall be red with wine and hi teeth
white with milk

49:13 zebulun shall dwell at the haven of the sea; and he shall be for
an haven of ships; and hi border shall be unto zidon

49:14 issachar is a strong ass couch down between two burdens:
49:15 and he saw that rest wa good and the land that it wa
pleasant; and bow hi shoulder to bear and becam a servant unto
tribut

49:16 dan shall judg hi peopl as one of the tribe of israel

49:17 dan shall be a serpent by the way an adder in the path that
biteth the hors heel so that hi rider shall fall backward

49:18 i have wait for thi salvat o lord

49:19 gad a troop shall overcom him: but he shall overcom at the
last

49:20 out of asher hi bread shall be fat and he shall yield royal
dainti

49:21 naphtali is a hind let loose: he giveth goodli word

49:22 joseph is a fruit bough even a fruit bough by a well;
whose branch run over the wall: 49:23 the archer have sore
griev him and shot at him and hate him: 49:24 but hi bow abod
in strength and the arm of hi hand were made strong by the hand
of the mighti god of jacob; (from thenc is the shepherd the stone of
israel:) 49:25 even by the god of thi father who shall help thee; and
by the almighti who shall bless thee with bless of heaven abov
bless of the deep that lieth under bless of the breast and
of the womb: 49:26 the bless of thi father have prevail abov
the bless of my progenitor unto the utmost bound of the
everlast hills: they shall be on the head of joseph and on the
crown of the head of him that wa separ from hi brethren

49:27 benjamin shall ravin as a wolf: in the morn he shall devour
the prey and at night he shall divid the spoil

49:28 all these are the twelv tribe of israel: and thi is it that
their father spake unto them and bless them; everi one accord to
hi bless he bless them

49:29 and he charg them and said unto them i am to be gather
unto my people: buri me with my father in the cave that is in the
field of ephron the hittit 49:30 in the cave that is in the field of
machpelah which is befor mamr in the land of canaan which abraham
bought with the field of ephron the hittit for a possess of a
buryingplac

49:31 there they buri abraham and sarah hi wife; there they buri
isaac and rebekah hi wife; and there i buri leah

49:32 the purchas of the field and of the cave that is therein wa
from the children of heth

49:33 and when jacob had made an end of command hi son he
gather up hi feet into the bed and yield up the ghost and wa
gather unto hi peopl

50:1 and joseph fell upon hi father face and wept upon him and
kiss him

50:2 and joseph command hi servant the physician to embalm hi
father: and the physician embalm israel

50:3 and forti day were fulfil for him; for so are fulfil the
day of those which are embalmed: and the egyptian mourn for him
threescor and ten day

50:4 and when the day of hi mourn were past joseph spake unto
the hous of pharaoh say if now i have found grace in your eye
speak i pray you in the ear of pharaoh say 50:5 my father made
me swear say lo i die: in my grave which i have dig for me in
the land of canaan there shalt thou buri me now therefor let me go
up i pray thee and buri my father and i will come again

50:6 and pharaoh said go up and buri thi father accord as he
made thee swear

50:7 and joseph went up to buri hi father: and with him went up all
the servant of pharaoh the elder of hi hous and all the elder
of the land of egypt 50:8 and all the hous of joseph and hi
brethren and hi father house: onli their littl one and their
flock and their herd they left in the land of goshen

50:9 and there went up with him both chariot and horsemen: and it wa
a veri great compani

50:10 and they came to the threshingfloor of atad which is beyond
jordan and there they mourn with a great and veri sore lamentation:
and he made a mourn for hi father seven day

50:11 and when the inhabit of the land the canaanit saw the
mourn in the floor of atad they said thi is a grievou mourn
to the egyptians: wherefor the name of it wa call abelmizraim
which is beyond jordan

50:12 and hi son did unto him accord as he command them: 50:13
for hi son carri him into the land of canaan and buri him in
the cave of the field of machpelah which abraham bought with the
field for a possess of a buryingplac of ephron the hittit befor
mamr

50:14 and joseph return into egypt he and hi brethren and all
that went up with him to buri hi father after he had buri hi
father

50:15 and when joseph brethren saw that their father wa dead they
said joseph will peradventur hate us and will certainli requit us
all the evil which we did unto him

50:16 and they sent a messeng unto joseph say thi father did
command befor he die say 50:17 so shall ye say unto joseph
forgiv i pray thee now the trespass of thi brethren and their sin;
for they did unto thee evil: and now we pray thee forgiv the
trespass of the servant of the god of thi father and joseph wept
when they spake unto him

50:18 and hi brethren also went and fell down befor hi face; and
they said behold we be thi servant

50:19 and joseph said unto them fear not: for am i in the place of
god? 50:20 but as for you ye thought evil against me; but god meant
it unto good to bring to pass as it is thi day to save much peopl
aliv

50:21 now therefor fear ye not: i will nourish you and your littl
one

and he comfort them and spake kindli unto them

50:22 and joseph dwelt in egypt he and hi father house: and
joseph live an hundr and ten year

50:23 and joseph saw ephraim children of the third generation: the
children also of machir the son of manasseh were brought up upon
joseph knee

50:24 and joseph said unto hi brethren i die: and god will sure
visit you and bring you out of thi land unto the land which he sware
to abraham to isaac and to jacob

50:25 and joseph took an oath of the children of israel say god
will sure visit you and ye shall carri up my bone from henc

50:26 so joseph die be an hundr and ten year old: and they
embalm him and he wa put in a coffin in egypt




the second book of moses: call exodu


1:1 now these are the name of the children of israel which came
into egypt; everi man and hi household came with jacob

1:2 reuben simeon levi and judah 1:3 issachar zebulun and
benjamin 1:4 dan and naphtali gad and asher

1:5 and all the soul that came out of the loin of jacob were seventi
souls: for joseph wa in egypt alreadi

1:6 and joseph die and all hi brethren and all that gener

1:7 and the children of israel were fruit and increas
abundantli and multipli and wax exceed mighty; and the land
wa fill with them

1:8 now there aros up a new king over egypt which knew not joseph

1:9 and he said unto hi peopl behold the peopl of the children of
israel are more and mightier than we: 1:10 come on let us deal wise
with them; lest they multipli and it come to pass that when there
falleth out ani war they join also unto our enemi and fight
against us and so get them up out of the land

1:11 therefor they did set over them taskmast to afflict them with
their burden and they built for pharaoh treasur citi pithom and
raams

1:12 but the more they afflict them the more they multipli and
grew

and they were griev becaus of the children of israel

1:13 and the egyptian made the children of israel to serv with
rigour: 1:14 and they made their live bitter with hard bondag in
morter and in brick and in all manner of servic in the field: all
their servic wherein they made them serv wa with rigour

1:15 and the king of egypt spake to the hebrew midwiv of which the
name of the one wa shiphrah and the name of the other puah: 1:16 and
he said when ye do the offic of a midwif to the hebrew women and
see them upon the stools; if it be a son then ye shall kill him: but
if it be a daughter then she shall live

1:17 but the midwiv fear god and did not as the king of egypt
command them but save the men children aliv

1:18 and the king of egypt call for the midwiv and said unto
them whi have ye done thi thing and have save the men children
alive? 1:19 and the midwiv said unto pharaoh becaus the hebrew
women are not as the egyptian women; for they are live and are
deliv ere the midwiv come in unto them

1:20 therefor god dealt well with the midwives: and the peopl
multipli and wax veri mighti

1:21 and it came to pass becaus the midwiv fear god that he
made them hous

1:22 and pharaoh charg all hi peopl say everi son that is
born ye shall cast into the river and everi daughter ye shall save
aliv

2:1 and there went a man of the hous of levi and took to wife a
daughter of levi

2:2 and the woman conceiv and bare a son: and when she saw him that
he wa a goodli child she hid him three month

2:3 and when she could not longer hide him she took for him an ark of
bulrush and daub it with slime and with pitch and put the child
therein; and she laid it in the flag by the river brink

2:4 and hi sister stood afar off to wit what would be done to him

2:5 and the daughter of pharaoh came down to wash herself at the
river; and her maiden walk along by the river side; and when she
saw the ark among the flag she sent her maid to fetch it

2:6 and when she had open it she saw the child: and behold the
babe wept and she had compass on him and said thi is one of the
hebrew children

2:7 then said hi sister to pharaoh daughter shall i go and call to
thee a nurs of the hebrew women that she may nurs the child for
thee? 2:8 and pharaoh daughter said to her go and the maid went
and call the child mother

2:9 and pharaoh daughter said unto her take thi child away and
nurs it for me and i will give thee thi wage and the women took
the child and nurs it

2:10 and the child grew and she brought him unto pharaoh daughter
and he becam her son and she call hi name moses: and she said
becaus i drew him out of the water

2:11 and it came to pass in those day when mose wa grown that he
went out unto hi brethren and look on their burdens: and he spi
an egyptian smite an hebrew one of hi brethren

2:12 and he look thi way and that way and when he saw that there
wa no man he slew the egyptian and hid him in the sand

2:13 and when he went out the second day behold two men of the
hebrew strove together: and he said to him that did the wrong
wherefor smitest thou thi fellow? 2:14 and he said who made thee a
princ and a judg over us? intendest thou to kill me as thou
killedst the egyptian? and mose fear and said sure thi thing
is known

2:15 now when pharaoh heard thi thing he sought to slay mose but
mose fled from the face of pharaoh and dwelt in the land of midian:
and he sat down by a well

2:16 now the priest of midian had seven daughters: and they came and
drew water and fill the trough to water their father flock

2:17 and the shepherd came and drove them away: but mose stood up
and help them and water their flock

2:18 and when they came to reuel their father he said how is it that
ye are come so soon to day? 2:19 and they said an egyptian deliv
us out of the hand of the shepherd and also drew water enough for
us and water the flock

2:20 and he said unto hi daughter and where is he? whi is it that
ye have left the man? call him that he may eat bread

2:21 and mose wa content to dwell with the man: and he gave mose
zipporah hi daughter

2:22 and she bare him a son and he call hi name gershom: for he
said i have been a stranger in a strang land

2:23 and it came to pass in process of time that the king of egypt
died: and the children of israel sigh by reason of the bondag and
they cri and their cri came up unto god by reason of the bondag

2:24 and god heard their groan and god rememb hi coven
with abraham with isaac and with jacob

2:25 and god look upon the children of israel and god had respect
unto them

3:1 now mose kept the flock of jethro hi father in law the priest
of midian: and he led the flock to the backsid of the desert and
came to the mountain of god even to horeb

3:2 and the angel of the lord appear unto him in a flame of fire out
of the midst of a bush: and he look and behold the bush burn
with fire and the bush wa not consum

3:3 and mose said i will now turn asid and see thi great sight
whi the bush is not burnt

3:4 and when the lord saw that he turn asid to see god call unto
him out of the midst of the bush and said mose mose and he said
here am i

3:5 and he said draw not nigh hither: put off thi shoe from off thi
feet for the place whereon thou standest is holi ground

3:6 moreov he said i am the god of thi father the god of abraham
the god of isaac and the god of jacob and mose hid hi face; for he
wa afraid to look upon god

3:7 and the lord said i have sure seen the afflict of my peopl
which are in egypt and have heard their cri by reason of their
taskmasters; for i know their sorrows; 3:8 and i am come down to
deliv them out of the hand of the egyptian and to bring them up
out of that land unto a good land and a larg unto a land flow
with milk and honey; unto the place of the canaanit and the
hittit and the amorit and the perizzit and the hivit and
the jebusit

3:9 now therefor behold the cri of the children of israel is come
unto me: and i have also seen the oppress wherewith the egyptian
oppress them

3:10 come now therefor and i will send thee unto pharaoh that thou
mayest bring forth my peopl the children of israel out of egypt

3:11 and mose said unto god who am i that i should go unto pharaoh
and that i should bring forth the children of israel out of egypt?
3:12 and he said certainli i will be with thee; and thi shall be a
token unto thee that i have sent thee: when thou hast brought forth
the peopl out of egypt ye shall serv god upon thi mountain

3:13 and mose said unto god behold when i come unto the children of
israel and shall say unto them the god of your father hath sent me
unto you; and they shall say to me what is hi name? what shall i say
unto them? 3:14 and god said unto mose i am that i am: and he said
thu shalt thou say unto the children of israel i am hath sent me
unto you

3:15 and god said moreov unto mose thu shalt thou say unto the
children of israel the lord god of your father the god of abraham
the god of isaac and the god of jacob hath sent me unto you: thi is
my name for ever and thi is my memori unto all gener

3:16 go and gather the elder of israel togeth and say unto them
the lord god of your father the god of abraham of isaac and of
jacob appear unto me say i have sure visit you and seen
that which is done to you in egypt: 3:17 and i have said i will bring
you up out of the afflict of egypt unto the land of the canaanit
and the hittit and the amorit and the perizzit and the
hivit and the jebusit unto a land flow with milk and honey

3:18 and they shall hearken to thi voice: and thou shalt come thou
and the elder of israel unto the king of egypt and ye shall say
unto him the lord god of the hebrew hath met with us: and now let us
go we beseech thee three day journey into the wilder that we
may sacrific to the lord our god

3:19 and i am sure that the king of egypt will not let you go no not
by a mighti hand

3:20 and i will stretch out my hand and smite egypt with all my
wonder which i will do in the midst thereof: and after that he will
let you go

3:21 and i will give thi peopl favour in the sight of the egyptians:
and it shall come to pass that when ye go ye shall not go empti

3:22 but everi woman shall borrow of her neighbour and of her that
sojourneth in her hous jewel of silver and jewel of gold and
raiment: and ye shall put them upon your son and upon your
daughters; and ye shall spoil the egyptian

4:1 and mose answer and said but behold they will not believ
me nor hearken unto my voice: for they will say the lord hath not
appear unto thee

4:2 and the lord said unto him what is that in thine hand? and he
said a rod

4:3 and he said cast it on the ground and he cast it on the ground
and it becam a serpent; and mose fled from befor it

4:4 and the lord said unto mose put forth thine hand and take it by
the tail and he put forth hi hand and caught it and it becam a
rod in hi hand: 4:5 that they may believ that the lord god of their
father the god of abraham the god of isaac and the god of jacob
hath appear unto thee

4:6 and the lord said furthermor unto him put now thine hand into
thi bosom and he put hi hand into hi bosom: and when he took it
out behold hi hand wa leprou as snow

4:7 and he said put thine hand into thi bosom again and he put hi
hand into hi bosom again; and pluck it out of hi bosom and
behold it wa turn again as hi other flesh

4:8 and it shall come to pass if they will not believ thee neither
hearken to the voic of the first sign that they will believ the
voic of the latter sign

4:9 and it shall come to pass if they will not believ also these two
sign neither hearken unto thi voic that thou shalt take of the
water of the river and pour it upon the dri land: and the water which
thou takest out of the river shall becom blood upon the dri land

4:10 and mose said unto the lord o my lord i am not eloqu
neither heretofor nor sinc thou hast spoken unto thi servant: but i
am slow of speech and of a slow tongu

4:11 and the lord said unto him who hath made man mouth? or who
maketh the dumb or deaf or the see or the blind? have not i the
lord? 4:12 now therefor go and i will be with thi mouth and teach
thee what thou shalt say

4:13 and he said o my lord send i pray thee by the hand of him
whom thou wilt send

4:14 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against mose and he said
is not aaron the levit thi brother? i know that he can speak well
and also behold he cometh forth to meet thee: and when he seeth
thee he will be glad in hi heart

4:15 and thou shalt speak unto him and put word in hi mouth: and i
will be with thi mouth and with hi mouth and will teach you what ye
shall do

4:16 and he shall be thi spokesman unto the people: and he shall be
even he shall be to thee instead of a mouth and thou shalt be to him
instead of god

4:17 and thou shalt take thi rod in thine hand wherewith thou shalt
do sign

4:18 and mose went and return to jethro hi father in law and said
unto him let me go i pray thee and return unto my brethren which
are in egypt and see whether they be yet aliv and jethro said to
mose go in peac

4:19 and the lord said unto mose in midian go return into egypt:
for all the men are dead which sought thi life

4:20 and mose took hi wife and hi son and set them upon an ass
and he return to the land of egypt: and mose took the rod of god in
hi hand

4:21 and the lord said unto mose when thou goest to return into
egypt see that thou do all those wonder befor pharaoh which i have
put in thine hand: but i will harden hi heart that he shall not let
the peopl go

4:22 and thou shalt say unto pharaoh thu saith the lord israel is
my son even my firstborn: 4:23 and i say unto thee let my son go
that he may serv me: and if thou refus to let him go behold i will
slay thi son even thi firstborn

4:24 and it came to pass by the way in the inn that the lord met him
and sought to kill him

4:25 then zipporah took a sharp stone and cut off the foreskin of her
son and cast it at hi feet and said sure a bloodi husband art
thou to me

4:26 so he let him go: then she said a bloodi husband thou art
becaus of the circumcis

4:27 and the lord said to aaron go into the wilder to meet mose
and he went and met him in the mount of god and kiss him

4:28 and mose told aaron all the word of the lord who had sent him
and all the sign which he had command him

4:29 and mose and aaron went and gather togeth all the elder of
the children of israel: 4:30 and aaron spake all the word which the
lord had spoken unto mose and did the sign in the sight of the
peopl

4:31 and the peopl believed: and when they heard that the lord had
visit the children of israel and that he had look upon their
afflict then they bow their head and worship

5:1 and afterward mose and aaron went in and told pharaoh thu
saith the lord god of israel let my peopl go that they may hold a
feast unto me in the wilder

5:2 and pharaoh said who is the lord that i should obey hi voic to
let israel go? i know not the lord neither will i let israel go

5:3 and they said the god of the hebrew hath met with us: let us go
we pray thee three day journey into the desert and sacrific unto
the lord our god; lest he fall upon us with pestil or with the
sword

5:4 and the king of egypt said unto them wherefor do ye mose and
aaron let the peopl from their works? get you unto your burden

5:5 and pharaoh said behold the peopl of the land now are mani and
ye make them rest from their burden

5:6 and pharaoh command the same day the taskmast of the peopl
and their offic say 5:7 ye shall no more give the peopl straw
to make brick as heretofore: let them go and gather straw for
themselv

5:8 and the tale of the brick which they did make heretofor ye
shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be
idle; therefor they cri say let us go and sacrific to our god

5:9 let there more work be laid upon the men that they may labour
therein; and let them not regard vain word

5:10 and the taskmast of the peopl went out and their offic
and they spake to the peopl say thu saith pharaoh i will not
give you straw

5:11 go ye get you straw where ye can find it: yet not ought of your
work shall be diminish

5:12 so the peopl were scatter abroad throughout all the land of
egypt to gather stubbl instead of straw

5:13 and the taskmast hast them say fulfil your work your
daili task as when there wa straw

5:14 and the offic of the children of israel which pharaoh
taskmast had set over them were beaten and demand wherefor
have ye not fulfil your task in make brick both yesterday and to
day as heretofore? 5:15 then the offic of the children of israel
came and cri unto pharaoh say wherefor dealest thou thu with
thi servants? 5:16 there is no straw given unto thi servant and
they say to us make brick: and behold thi servant are beaten; but
the fault is in thine own peopl

5:17 but he said ye are idl ye are idle: therefor ye say let us
go and do sacrific to the lord

5:18 go therefor now and work; for there shall no straw be given
you yet shall ye deliv the tale of brick

5:19 and the offic of the children of israel did see that they were
in evil case after it wa said ye shall not minish ought from your
brick of your daili task

5:20 and they met mose and aaron who stood in the way as they came
forth from pharaoh: 5:21 and they said unto them the lord look upon
you and judge; becaus ye have made our savour to be abhor in the
eye of pharaoh and in the eye of hi servant to put a sword in
their hand to slay us

5:22 and mose return unto the lord and said lord wherefor hast
thou so evil entreat thi people? whi is it that thou hast sent me?
5:23 for sinc i came to pharaoh to speak in thi name he hath done
evil to thi people; neither hast thou deliv thi peopl at all

6:1 then the lord said unto mose now shalt thou see what i will do
to pharaoh: for with a strong hand shall he let them go and with a
strong hand shall he drive them out of hi land

6:2 and god spake unto mose and said unto him i am the lord: 6:3
and i appear unto abraham unto isaac and unto jacob by the name
of god almighti but by my name jehovah wa i not known to them

6:4 and i have also establish my coven with them to give them
the land of canaan the land of their pilgrimag wherein they were
stranger

6:5 and i have also heard the groan of the children of israel whom
the egyptian keep in bondage; and i have rememb my coven

6:6 wherefor say unto the children of israel i am the lord and i
will bring you out from under the burden of the egyptian and i will
rid you out of their bondag and i will redeem you with a stretch
out arm and with great judgments: 6:7 and i will take you to me for a
peopl and i will be to you a god: and ye shall know that i am the
lord your god which bringeth you out from under the burden of the
egyptian

6:8 and i will bring you in unto the land concern the which i did
swear to give it to abraham to isaac and to jacob; and i will give
it you for an heritage: i am the lord

6:9 and mose spake so unto the children of israel: but they hearken
not unto mose for anguish of spirit and for cruel bondag

6:10 and the lord spake unto mose say 6:11 go in speak unto
pharaoh king of egypt that he let the children of israel go out of
hi land

6:12 and mose spake befor the lord say behold the children of
israel have not hearken unto me; how then shall pharaoh hear me who
am of uncircumcis lips? 6:13 and the lord spake unto mose and unto
aaron and gave them a charg unto the children of israel and unto
pharaoh king of egypt to bring the children of israel out of the land
of egypt

6:14 these be the head of their father houses: the son of reuben
the firstborn of israel; hanoch and pallu hezron and carmi: these
be the famili of reuben

6:15 and the son of simeon; jemuel and jamin and ohad and jachin
and zohar and shaul the son of a canaanitish woman: these are the
famili of simeon

6:16 and these are the name of the son of levi accord to their
generations; gershon and kohath and merari: and the year of the
life of levi were an hundr thirti and seven year

6:17 the son of gershon; libni and shimi accord to their
famili

6:18 and the son of kohath; amram and izhar and hebron and uzziel:
and the year of the life of kohath were an hundr thirti and three
year

6:19 and the son of merari; mahali and mushi: these are the famili
of levi accord to their gener

6:20 and amram took him jocheb hi father sister to wife; and she
bare him aaron and moses: and the year of the life of amram were an
hundr and thirti and seven year

6:21 and the son of izhar; korah and nepheg and zichri

6:22 and the son of uzziel; mishael and elzaphan and zithri

6:23 and aaron took him elisheba daughter of amminadab sister of
naashon to wife; and she bare him nadab and abihu eleazar and
ithamar

6:24 and the son of korah; assir and elkanah and abiasaph: these
are the famili of the korhit

6:25 and eleazar aaron son took him one of the daughter of putiel
to wife; and she bare him phinehas: these are the head of the father
of the levit accord to their famili

6:26 these are that aaron and mose to whom the lord said bring out
the children of israel from the land of egypt accord to their
armi

6:27 these are they which spake to pharaoh king of egypt to bring out
the children of israel from egypt: these are that mose and aaron

6:28 and it came to pass on the day when the lord spake unto mose in
the land of egypt 6:29 that the lord spake unto mose say i am
the lord: speak thou unto pharaoh king of egypt all that i say unto
thee

6:30 and mose said befor the lord behold i am of uncircumcis
lip and how shall pharaoh hearken unto me? 7:1 and the lord said
unto mose see i have made thee a god to pharaoh: and aaron thi
brother shall be thi prophet

7:2 thou shalt speak all that i command thee: and aaron thi brother
shall speak unto pharaoh that he send the children of israel out of
hi land

7:3 and i will harden pharaoh heart and multipli my sign and my
wonder in the land of egypt

7:4 but pharaoh shall not hearken unto you that i may lay my hand
upon egypt and bring forth mine armi and my peopl the children of
israel out of the land of egypt by great judgment

7:5 and the egyptian shall know that i am the lord when i stretch
forth mine hand upon egypt and bring out the children of israel from
among them

7:6 and mose and aaron did as the lord command them so did they

7:7 and mose wa fourscor year old and aaron fourscor and three
year old when they spake unto pharaoh

7:8 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron say 7:9 when
pharaoh shall speak unto you say shew a miracl for you: then
thou shalt say unto aaron take thi rod and cast it befor pharaoh
and it shall becom a serpent

7:10 and mose and aaron went in unto pharaoh and they did so as the
lord had commanded: and aaron cast down hi rod befor pharaoh and
befor hi servant and it becam a serpent

7:11 then pharaoh also call the wise men and the sorcerers: now the
magician of egypt they also did in like manner with their
enchant

7:12 for they cast down everi man hi rod and they becam serpents:
but aaron rod swallow up their rod

7:13 and he harden pharaoh heart that he hearken not unto them;
as the lord had said

7:14 and the lord said unto mose pharaoh heart is harden he
refuseth to let the peopl go

7:15 get thee unto pharaoh in the morning; lo he goeth out unto the
water; and thou shalt stand by the river brink against he come; and
the rod which wa turn to a serpent shalt thou take in thine hand

7:16 and thou shalt say unto him the lord god of the hebrew hath
sent me unto thee say let my peopl go that they may serv me in
the wilderness: and behold hitherto thou wouldest not hear

7:17 thu saith the lord in thi thou shalt know that i am the lord:
behold i will smite with the rod that is in mine hand upon the water
which are in the river and they shall be turn to blood

7:18 and the fish that is in the river shall die and the river shall
stink; and the egyptian shall loth to drink of the water of the
river

7:19 and the lord spake unto mose say unto aaron take thi rod and
stretch out thine hand upon the water of egypt upon their stream
upon their river and upon their pond and upon all their pool of
water that they may becom blood; and that there may be blood
throughout all the land of egypt both in vessel of wood and in
vessel of stone

7:20 and mose and aaron did so as the lord commanded; and he lift
up the rod and smote the water that were in the river in the sight
of pharaoh and in the sight of hi servants; and all the water that
were in the river were turn to blood

7:21 and the fish that wa in the river died; and the river stank and
the egyptian could not drink of the water of the river; and there wa
blood throughout all the land of egypt

7:22 and the magician of egypt did so with their enchantments: and
pharaoh heart wa harden neither did he hearken unto them; as the
lord had said

7:23 and pharaoh turn and went into hi hous neither did he set
hi heart to thi also

7:24 and all the egyptian dig round about the river for water to
drink; for they could not drink of the water of the river

7:25 and seven day were fulfil after that the lord had smitten
the river

8:1 and the lord spake unto mose go unto pharaoh and say unto him
thu saith the lord let my peopl go that they may serv me

8:2 and if thou refus to let them go behold i will smite all thi
border with frogs: 8:3 and the river shall bring forth frog
abundantli which shall go up and come into thine hous and into thi
bedchamb and upon thi bed and into the hous of thi servant and
upon thi peopl and into thine oven and into thi kneadingtroughs:
8:4 and the frog shall come up both on thee and upon thi peopl and
upon all thi servant

8:5 and the lord spake unto mose say unto aaron stretch forth thine
hand with thi rod over the stream over the river and over the
pond and caus frog to come up upon the land of egypt

8:6 and aaron stretch out hi hand over the water of egypt; and the
frog came up and cover the land of egypt

8:7 and the magician did so with their enchant and brought up
frog upon the land of egypt

8:8 then pharaoh call for mose and aaron and said intreat the
lord that he may take away the frog from me and from my people; and
i will let the peopl go that they may do sacrific unto the lord

8:9 and mose said unto pharaoh glori over me: when shall i intreat
for thee and for thi servant and for thi peopl to destroy the
frog from thee and thi hous that they may remain in the river
only? 8:10 and he said to morrow and he said be it accord to
thi word: that thou mayest know that there is none like unto the lord
our god

8:11 and the frog shall depart from thee and from thi hous and
from thi servant and from thi people; they shall remain in the river
onli

8:12 and mose and aaron went out from pharaoh: and mose cri unto
the lord becaus of the frog which he had brought against pharaoh

8:13 and the lord did accord to the word of moses; and the frog
die out of the hous out of the villag and out of the field

8:14 and they gather them togeth upon heaps: and the land stank

8:15 but when pharaoh saw that there wa respit he harden hi
heart and hearken not unto them; as the lord had said

8:16 and the lord said unto mose say unto aaron stretch out thi
rod and smite the dust of the land that it may becom lice
throughout all the land of egypt

8:17 and they did so; for aaron stretch out hi hand with hi rod
and smote the dust of the earth and it becam lice in man and in
beast; all the dust of the land becam lice throughout all the land of
egypt

8:18 and the magician did so with their enchant to bring forth
lice but they could not: so there were lice upon man and upon beast

8:19 then the magician said unto pharaoh thi is the finger of god:
and pharaoh heart wa harden and he hearken not unto them; as
the lord had said

8:20 and the lord said unto mose rise up earli in the morn and
stand befor pharaoh; lo he cometh forth to the water; and say unto
him thu saith the lord let my peopl go that they may serv me

8:21 els if thou wilt not let my peopl go behold i will send
swarm of fli upon thee and upon thi servant and upon thi peopl
and into thi houses: and the hous of the egyptian shall be full of
swarm of fli and also the ground whereon they are

8:22 and i will sever in that day the land of goshen in which my
peopl dwell that no swarm of fli shall be there; to the end thou
mayest know that i am the lord in the midst of the earth

8:23 and i will put a divis between my peopl and thi people: to
morrow shall thi sign be

8:24 and the lord did so; and there came a grievou swarm of fli
into the hous of pharaoh and into hi servant hous and into all
the land of egypt: the land wa corrupt by reason of the swarm of
fli

8:25 and pharaoh call for mose and for aaron and said go ye
sacrific to your god in the land

8:26 and mose said it is not meet so to do; for we shall sacrific
the abomin of the egyptian to the lord our god: lo shall we
sacrific the abomin of the egyptian befor their eye and will
they not stone us? 8:27 we will go three day journey into the
wilder and sacrific to the lord our god as he shall command us

8:28 and pharaoh said i will let you go that ye may sacrific to the
lord your god in the wilderness; onli ye shall not go veri far away:
intreat for me

8:29 and mose said behold i go out from thee and i will intreat
the lord that the swarm of fli may depart from pharaoh from hi
servant and from hi peopl to morrow: but let not pharaoh deal
deceit ani more in not let the peopl go to sacrific to the
lord

8:30 and mose went out from pharaoh and intreat the lord

8:31 and the lord did accord to the word of moses; and he remov
the swarm of fli from pharaoh from hi servant and from hi
people; there remain not one

8:32 and pharaoh harden hi heart at thi time also neither would
he let the peopl go

9:1 then the lord said unto mose go in unto pharaoh and tell him
thu saith the lord god of the hebrew let my peopl go that they
may serv me

9:2 for if thou refus to let them go and wilt hold them still 9:3
behold the hand of the lord is upon thi cattl which is in the field
upon the hors upon the ass upon the camel upon the oxen and
upon the sheep: there shall be a veri grievou murrain

9:4 and the lord shall sever between the cattl of israel and the
cattl of egypt: and there shall noth die of all that is the
children of israel

9:5 and the lord appoint a set time say to morrow the lord
shall do thi thing in the land

9:6 and the lord did that thing on the morrow and all the cattl of
egypt died: but of the cattl of the children of israel die not one

9:7 and pharaoh sent and behold there wa not one of the cattl of
the israelit dead and the heart of pharaoh wa harden and he did
not let the peopl go

9:8 and the lord said unto mose and unto aaron take to you hand
of ash of the furnac and let mose sprinkl it toward the heaven
in the sight of pharaoh

9:9 and it shall becom small dust in all the land of egypt and shall
be a boil break forth with blain upon man and upon beast
throughout all the land of egypt

9:10 and they took ash of the furnac and stood befor pharaoh; and
mose sprinkl it up toward heaven; and it becam a boil break
forth with blain upon man and upon beast

9:11 and the magician could not stand befor mose becaus of the
boils; for the boil wa upon the magician and upon all the
egyptian

9:12 and the lord harden the heart of pharaoh and he hearken not
unto them; as the lord had spoken unto mose

9:13 and the lord said unto mose rise up earli in the morn and
stand befor pharaoh and say unto him thu saith the lord god of the
hebrew let my peopl go that they may serv me

9:14 for i will at thi time send all my plagu upon thine heart and
upon thi servant and upon thi people; that thou mayest know that
there is none like me in all the earth

9:15 for now i will stretch out my hand that i may smite thee and thi
peopl with pestilence; and thou shalt be cut off from the earth

9:16 and in veri deed for thi caus have i rais thee up for to
shew in thee my power; and that my name may be declar throughout all
the earth

9:17 as yet exaltest thou thyself against my peopl that thou wilt
not let them go? 9:18 behold to morrow about thi time i will caus
it to rain a veri grievou hail such as hath not been in egypt sinc
the foundat thereof even until now

9:19 send therefor now and gather thi cattl and all that thou hast
in the field; for upon everi man and beast which shall be found in the
field and shall not be brought home the hail shall come down upon
them and they shall die

9:20 he that fear the word of the lord among the servant of pharaoh
made hi servant and hi cattl flee into the houses: 9:21 and he
that regard not the word of the lord left hi servant and hi
cattl in the field

9:22 and the lord said unto mose stretch forth thine hand toward
heaven that there may be hail in all the land of egypt upon man and
upon beast and upon everi herb of the field throughout the land of
egypt

9:23 and mose stretch forth hi rod toward heaven: and the lord
sent thunder and hail and the fire ran along upon the ground; and the
lord rain hail upon the land of egypt

9:24 so there wa hail and fire mingl with the hail veri grievou
such as there wa none like it in all the land of egypt sinc it
becam a nation

9:25 and the hail smote throughout all the land of egypt all that wa
in the field both man and beast; and the hail smote everi herb of the
field and brake everi tree of the field

9:26 onli in the land of goshen where the children of israel were
wa there no hail

9:27 and pharaoh sent and call for mose and aaron and said unto
them i have sin thi time: the lord is righteou and i and my
peopl are wick

9:28 intreat the lord (for it is enough) that there be no more mighti
thunder and hail; and i will let you go and ye shall stay no
longer

9:29 and mose said unto him as soon as i am gone out of the citi i
will spread abroad my hand unto the lord; and the thunder shall
ceas neither shall there be ani more hail; that thou mayest know how
that the earth is the lord

9:30 but as for thee and thi servant i know that ye will not yet
fear the lord god

9:31 and the flax and the barley wa smitten: for the barley wa in
the ear and the flax wa boll

9:32 but the wheat and the rie were not smitten: for they were not
grown up

9:33 and mose went out of the citi from pharaoh and spread abroad
hi hand unto the lord: and the thunder and hail ceas and the
rain wa not pour upon the earth

9:34 and when pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunder
were ceas he sin yet more and harden hi heart he and hi
servant

9:35 and the heart of pharaoh wa harden neither would he let the
children of israel go; as the lord had spoken by mose

10:1 and the lord said unto mose go in unto pharaoh: for i have
harden hi heart and the heart of hi servant that i might shew
these my sign befor him: 10:2 and that thou mayest tell in the ear
of thi son and of thi son son what thing i have wrought in egypt
and my sign which i have done among them; that ye may know how that i
am the lord

10:3 and mose and aaron came in unto pharaoh and said unto him thu
saith the lord god of the hebrew how long wilt thou refus to humbl
thyself befor me? let my peopl go that they may serv me

10:4 els if thou refus to let my peopl go behold to morrow will
i bring the locust into thi coast: 10:5 and they shall cover the face
of the earth that one cannot be abl to see the earth: and they shall
eat the residu of that which is escap which remaineth unto you
from the hail and shall eat everi tree which groweth for you out of
the field: 10:6 and they shall fill thi hous and the hous of all
thi servant and the hous of all the egyptians; which neither thi
father nor thi father father have seen sinc the day that they
were upon the earth unto thi day and he turn himself and went out
from pharaoh

10:7 and pharaoh servant said unto him how long shall thi man be
a snare unto us? let the men go that they may serv the lord their
god: knowest thou not yet that egypt is destroyed? 10:8 and mose and
aaron were brought again unto pharaoh: and he said unto them go
serv the lord your god: but who are they that shall go? 10:9 and
mose said we will go with our young and with our old with our son
and with our daughter with our flock and with our herd will we go;
for we must hold a feast unto the lord

10:10 and he said unto them let the lord be so with you as i will
let you go and your littl ones: look to it; for evil is befor you

10:11 not so: go now ye that are men and serv the lord; for that ye
did desir and they were driven out from pharaoh presenc

10:12 and the lord said unto mose stretch out thine hand over the
land of egypt for the locust that they may come up upon the land of
egypt and eat everi herb of the land even all that the hail hath
left

10:13 and mose stretch forth hi rod over the land of egypt and
the lord brought an east wind upon the land all that day and all that
night; and when it wa morn the east wind brought the locust

10:14 and the locust went up over all the land of egypt and rest in
all the coast of egypt: veri grievou were they; befor them there
were no such locust as they neither after them shall be such

10:15 for they cover the face of the whole earth so that the land
wa darkened; and they did eat everi herb of the land and all the
fruit of the tree which the hail had left: and there remain not ani
green thing in the tree or in the herb of the field through all
the land of egypt

10:16 then pharaoh call for mose and aaron in haste; and he said i
have sin against the lord your god and against you

10:17 now therefor forgiv i pray thee my sin onli thi onc and
intreat the lord your god that he may take away from me thi death
onli

10:18 and he went out from pharaoh and intreat the lord

10:19 and the lord turn a mighti strong west wind which took away
the locust and cast them into the red sea; there remain not one
locust in all the coast of egypt

10:20 but the lord harden pharaoh heart so that he would not let
the children of israel go

10:21 and the lord said unto mose stretch out thine hand toward
heaven that there may be dark over the land of egypt even
dark which may be felt

10:22 and mose stretch forth hi hand toward heaven; and there wa
a thick dark in all the land of egypt three days: 10:23 they saw
not one anoth neither rose ani from hi place for three days: but
all the children of israel had light in their dwell

10:24 and pharaoh call unto mose and said go ye serv the lord;
onli let your flock and your herd be stayed: let your littl one
also go with you

10:25 and mose said thou must give us also sacrific and burnt
offer that we may sacrific unto the lord our god

10:26 our cattl also shall go with us; there shall not an hoof be
left behind; for thereof must we take to serv the lord our god; and
we know not with what we must serv the lord until we come thither

10:27 but the lord harden pharaoh heart and he would not let them
go

10:28 and pharaoh said unto him get thee from me take heed to
thyself see my face no more; for in that day thou seest my face thou
shalt die

10:29 and mose said thou hast spoken well i will see thi face again
no more

11:1 and the lord said unto mose yet will i bring one plagu more
upon pharaoh and upon egypt; afterward he will let you go hence:
when he shall let you go he shall sure thrust you out henc
altogeth

11:2 speak now in the ear of the peopl and let everi man borrow of
hi neighbour and everi woman of her neighbour jewel of silver and
jewel of gold

11:3 and the lord gave the peopl favour in the sight of the
egyptian

moreov the man mose wa veri great in the land of egypt in the
sight of pharaoh servant and in the sight of the peopl

11:4 and mose said thu saith the lord about midnight will i go out
into the midst of egypt: 11:5 and all the firstborn in the land of
egypt shall die from the first born of pharaoh that sitteth upon hi
throne even unto the firstborn of the maidserv that is behind the
mill; and all the firstborn of beast

11:6 and there shall be a great cri throughout all the land of egypt
such as there wa none like it nor shall be like it ani more

11:7 but against ani of the children of israel shall not a dog move
hi tongu against man or beast: that ye may know how that the lord
doth put a differ between the egyptian and israel

11:8 and all these thi servant shall come down unto me and bow down
themselv unto me say get thee out and all the peopl that
follow thee: and after that i will go out and he went out from
pharaoh in a great anger

11:9 and the lord said unto mose pharaoh shall not hearken unto you;
that my wonder may be multipli in the land of egypt

11:10 and mose and aaron did all these wonder befor pharaoh: and
the lord harden pharaoh heart so that he would not let the
children of israel go out of hi land

12:1 and the lord spake unto mose and aaron in the land of egypt
say 12:2 thi month shall be unto you the begin of months: it
shall be the first month of the year to you

12:3 speak ye unto all the congreg of israel say in the
tenth day of thi month they shall take to them everi man a lamb
accord to the hous of their father a lamb for an house: 12:4 and
if the household be too littl for the lamb let him and hi neighbour
next unto hi hous take it accord to the number of the souls;
everi man accord to hi eat shall make your count for the lamb

12:5 your lamb shall be without blemish a male of the first year: ye
shall take it out from the sheep or from the goats: 12:6 and ye shall
keep it up until the fourteenth day of the same month: and the whole
assembl of the congreg of israel shall kill it in the even

12:7 and they shall take of the blood and strike it on the two side
post and on the upper door post of the hous wherein they shall eat
it

12:8 and they shall eat the flesh in that night roast with fire and
unleaven bread; and with bitter herb they shall eat it

12:9 eat not of it raw nor sodden at all with water but roast with
fire; hi head with hi leg and with the purten thereof

12:10 and ye shall let noth of it remain until the morning; and
that which remaineth of it until the morn ye shall burn with fire

12:11 and thu shall ye eat it; with your loin gird your shoe on
your feet and your staff in your hand; and ye shall eat it in haste:
it is the lord passov

12:12 for i will pass through the land of egypt thi night and will
smite all the firstborn in the land of egypt both man and beast; and
against all the god of egypt i will execut judgment: i am the lord

12:13 and the blood shall be to you for a token upon the hous where
ye are: and when i see the blood i will pass over you and the plagu
shall not be upon you to destroy you when i smite the land of egypt

12:14 and thi day shall be unto you for a memorial; and ye shall keep
it a feast to the lord throughout your generations; ye shall keep it a
feast by an ordin for ever

12:15 seven day shall ye eat unleaven bread; even the first day ye
shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoev eateth
leaven bread from the first day until the seventh day that soul
shall be cut off from israel

12:16 and in the first day there shall be an holi convoc and in
the seventh day there shall be an holi convoc to you; no manner
of work shall be done in them save that which everi man must eat
that onli may be done of you

12:17 and ye shall observ the feast of unleaven bread; for in thi
selfsam day have i brought your armi out of the land of egypt:
therefor shall ye observ thi day in your gener by an
ordin for ever

12:18 in the first month on the fourteenth day of the month at even
ye shall eat unleaven bread until the one and twentieth day of the
month at even

12:19 seven day shall there be no leaven found in your houses: for
whosoev eateth that which is leaven even that soul shall be cut
off from the congreg of israel whether he be a stranger or born
in the land

12:20 ye shall eat noth leavened; in all your habit shall ye
eat unleaven bread

12:21 then mose call for all the elder of israel and said unto
them draw out and take you a lamb accord to your famili and
kill the passov

12:22 and ye shall take a bunch of hyssop and dip it in the blood
that is in the bason and strike the lintel and the two side post
with the blood that is in the bason; and none of you shall go out at
the door of hi hous until the morn

12:23 for the lord will pass through to smite the egyptians; and when
he seeth the blood upon the lintel and on the two side post the
lord will pass over the door and will not suffer the destroy to
come in unto your hous to smite you

12:24 and ye shall observ thi thing for an ordin to thee and to
thi son for ever

12:25 and it shall come to pass when ye be come to the land which the
lord will give you accord as he hath promis that ye shall keep
thi servic

12:26 and it shall come to pass when your children shall say unto
you what mean ye by thi service? 12:27 that ye shall say it is the
sacrific of the lord passov who pass over the hous of the
children of israel in egypt when he smote the egyptian and
deliv our hous and the peopl bow the head and worship

12:28 and the children of israel went away and did as the lord had
command mose and aaron so did they

12:29 and it came to pass that at midnight the lord smote all the
firstborn in the land of egypt from the firstborn of pharaoh that sat
on hi throne unto the firstborn of the captiv that wa in the
dungeon; and all the firstborn of cattl

12:30 and pharaoh rose up in the night he and all hi servant and
all the egyptians; and there wa a great cri in egypt; for there wa
not a hous where there wa not one dead

12:31 and he call for mose and aaron by night and said rise up
and get you forth from among my peopl both ye and the children of
israel; and go serv the lord as ye have said

12:32 also take your flock and your herd as ye have said and be
gone; and bless me also

12:33 and the egyptian were urgent upon the peopl that they might
send them out of the land in haste; for they said we be all dead men

12:34 and the peopl took their dough befor it wa leaven their
kneadingtrough be bound up in their cloth upon their shoulder

12:35 and the children of israel did accord to the word of moses;
and they borrow of the egyptian jewel of silver and jewel of
gold and raiment: 12:36 and the lord gave the peopl favour in the
sight of the egyptian so that they lent unto them such thing as
they requir and they spoil the egyptian

12:37 and the children of israel journey from rames to succoth
about six hundr thousand on foot that were men besid children

12:38 and a mix multitud went up also with them; and flock and
herd even veri much cattl

12:39 and they bake unleaven cake of the dough which they brought
forth out of egypt for it wa not leavened; becaus they were thrust
out of egypt and could not tarri neither had they prepar for
themselv ani victual
