lord all that ani man giveth of such unto the lord shall be holi

27:10 he shall not alter it nor chang it a good for a bad or a bad
for a good: and if he shall at all chang beast for beast then it and
the exchang thereof shall be holi

27:11 and if it be ani unclean beast of which they do not offer a
sacrific unto the lord then he shall present the beast befor the
priest: 27:12 and the priest shall valu it whether it be good or
bad: as thou valuest it who art the priest so shall it be

27:13 but if he will at all redeem it then he shall add a fifth part
thereof unto thi estim

27:14 and when a man shall sanctifi hi hous to be holi unto the
lord then the priest shall estim it whether it be good or bad: as
the priest shall estim it so shall it stand

27:15 and if he that sanctifi it will redeem hi hous then he
shall add the fifth part of the money of thi estim unto it and
it shall be hi

27:16 and if a man shall sanctifi unto the lord some part of a field
of hi possess then thi estim shall be accord to the seed
thereof: an homer of barley seed shall be valu at fifti shekel of
silver

27:17 if he sanctifi hi field from the year of jubil accord to
thi estim it shall stand

27:18 but if he sanctifi hi field after the jubil then the priest
shall reckon unto him the money accord to the year that remain
even unto the year of the jubil and it shall be abat from thi
estim

27:19 and if he that sanctifi the field will in ani wise redeem it
then he shall add the fifth part of the money of thi estim unto
it and it shall be assur to him

27:20 and if he will not redeem the field or if he have sold the
field to anoth man it shall not be redeem ani more

27:21 but the field when it goeth out in the jubil shall be holi
unto the lord as a field devoted; the possess thereof shall be the
priest

27:22 and if a man sanctifi unto the lord a field which he hath
bought which is not of the field of hi possession; 27:23 then the
priest shall reckon unto him the worth of thi estim even unto
the year of the jubile: and he shall give thine estim in that
day as a holi thing unto the lord

27:24 in the year of the jubil the field shall return unto him of
whom it wa bought even to him to whom the possess of the land did
belong

27:25 and all thi estim shall be accord to the shekel of the
sanctuary: twenti gerah shall be the shekel

27:26 onli the firstl of the beast which should be the lord
firstl no man shall sanctifi it; whether it be ox or sheep: it is
the lord

27:27 and if it be of an unclean beast then he shall redeem it
accord to thine estim and shall add a fifth part of it
thereto: or if it be not redeem then it shall be sold accord to
thi estim

27:28 notwithstand no devot thing that a man shall devot unto
the lord of all that he hath both of man and beast and of the field
of hi possess shall be sold or redeemed: everi devot thing is
most holi unto the lord

27:29 none devot which shall be devot of men shall be redeemed;
but shall sure be put to death

27:30 and all the tith of the land whether of the seed of the land
or of the fruit of the tree is the lords: it is holi unto the lord

27:31 and if a man will at all redeem ought of hi tith he shall
add thereto the fifth part thereof

27:32 and concern the tith of the herd or of the flock even of
whatsoev passeth under the rod the tenth shall be holi unto the
lord

27:33 he shall not search whether it be good or bad neither shall he
chang it: and if he chang it at all then both it and the chang
thereof shall be holy; it shall not be redeem

27:34 these are the command which the lord command mose for
the children of israel in mount sinai




the fourth book of moses: call number


1:1 and the lord spake unto mose in the wilder of sinai in the
tabernacl of the congreg on the first day of the second month
in the second year after they were come out of the land of egypt
say 1:2 take ye the sum of all the congreg of the children of
israel after their famili by the hous of their father with the
number of their name everi male by their polls; 1:3 from twenti
year old and upward all that are abl to go forth to war in israel:
thou and aaron shall number them by their armi

1:4 and with you there shall be a man of everi tribe; everi one head
of the hous of hi father

1:5 and these are the name of the men that shall stand with you: of
the tribe of reuben; elizur the son of shedeur

1:6 of simeon; shelumiel the son of zurishaddai

1:7 of judah; nahshon the son of amminadab

1:8 of issachar; nethaneel the son of zuar

1:9 of zebulun; eliab the son of helon

1:10 of the children of joseph: of ephraim; elishama the son of
ammihud: of manasseh; gamaliel the son of pedahzur

1:11 of benjamin; abidan the son of gideoni

1:12 of dan; ahiez the son of ammishaddai

1:13 of asher; pagiel the son of ocran

1:14 of gad; eliasaph the son of deuel

1:15 of naphtali; ahira the son of enan

1:16 these were the renown of the congreg princ of the
tribe of their father head of thousand in israel

1:17 and mose and aaron took these men which are express by their
names: 1:18 and they assembl all the congreg togeth on the
first day of the second month and they declar their pedigre after
their famili by the hous of their father accord to the number
of the name from twenti year old and upward by their poll

1:19 as the lord command mose so he number them in the
wilder of sinai

1:20 and the children of reuben israel eldest son by their
gener after their famili by the hous of their father
accord to the number of the name by their poll everi male from
twenti year old and upward all that were abl to go forth to war;
1:21 those that were number of them even of the tribe of reuben
were forti and six thousand and five hundr

1:22 of the children of simeon by their gener after their
famili by the hous of their father those that were number of
them accord to the number of the name by their poll everi male
from twenti year old and upward all that were abl to go forth to
war; 1:23 those that were number of them even of the tribe of
simeon were fifti and nine thousand and three hundr

1:24 of the children of gad by their gener after their
famili by the hous of their father accord to the number of
the name from twenti year old and upward all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:25 those that were number of them even of the tribe
of gad were forti and five thousand six hundr and fifti

1:26 of the children of judah by their gener after their
famili by the hous of their father accord to the number of
the name from twenti year old and upward all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:27 those that were number of them even of the tribe
of judah were threescor and fourteen thousand and six hundr

1:28 of the children of issachar by their gener after their
famili by the hous of their father accord to the number of
the name from twenti year old and upward all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:29 those that were number of them even of the tribe
of issachar were fifti and four thousand and four hundr

1:30 of the children of zebulun by their gener after their
famili by the hous of their father accord to the number of
the name from twenti year old and upward all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:31 those that were number of them even of the tribe
of zebulun were fifti and seven thousand and four hundr

1:32 of the children of joseph name of the children of ephraim by
their gener after their famili by the hous of their
father accord to the number of the name from twenti year old
and upward all that were abl to go forth to war; 1:33 those that
were number of them even of the tribe of ephraim were forti
thousand and five hundr

1:34 of the children of manasseh by their gener after their
famili by the hous of their father accord to the number of
the name from twenti year old and upward all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:35 those that were number of them even of the tribe
of manasseh were thirti and two thousand and two hundr

1:36 of the children of benjamin by their gener after their
famili by the hous of their father accord to the number of
the name from twenti year old and upward all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:37 those that were number of them even of the tribe
of benjamin were thirti and five thousand and four hundr

1:38 of the children of dan by their gener after their
famili by the hous of their father accord to the number of
the name from twenti year old and upward all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:39 those that were number of them even of the tribe
of dan were threescor and two thousand and seven hundr

1:40 of the children of asher by their gener after their
famili by the hous of their father accord to the number of
the name from twenti year old and upward all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:41 those that were number of them even of the tribe
of asher were forti and one thousand and five hundr

1:42 of the children of naphtali throughout their gener after
their famili by the hous of their father accord to the number
of the name from twenti year old and upward all that were abl to
go forth to war; 1:43 those that were number of them even of the
tribe of naphtali were fifti and three thousand and four hundr

1:44 these are those that were number which mose and aaron
number and the princ of israel be twelv men: each one wa
for the hous of hi father

1:45 so were all those that were number of the children of israel
by the hous of their father from twenti year old and upward all
that were abl to go forth to war in israel; 1:46 even all they that
were number were six hundr thousand and three thousand and five
hundr and fifti

1:47 but the levit after the tribe of their father were not
number among them

1:48 for the lord had spoken unto mose say 1:49 onli thou shalt
not number the tribe of levi neither take the sum of them among the
children of israel: 1:50 but thou shalt appoint the levit over the
tabernacl of testimoni and over all the vessel thereof and over
all thing that belong to it: they shall bear the tabernacl and all
the vessel thereof; and they shall minist unto it and shall encamp
round about the tabernacl

1:51 and when the tabernacl setteth forward the levit shall take
it down: and when the tabernacl is to be pitch the levit shall
set it up: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death

1:52 and the children of israel shall pitch their tent everi man by
hi own camp and everi man by hi own standard throughout their
host

1:53 but the levit shall pitch round about the tabernacl of
testimoni that there be no wrath upon the congreg of the
children of israel: and the levit shall keep the charg of the
tabernacl of testimoni

1:54 and the children of israel did accord to all that the lord
command mose so did they

2:1 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron say 2:2 everi
man of the children of israel shall pitch by hi own standard with
the ensign of their father house: far off about the tabernacl of
the congreg shall they pitch

2:3 and on the east side toward the rise of the sun shall they of
the standard of the camp of judah pitch throughout their armies: and
nahshon the son of amminadab shall be captain of the children of
judah

2:4 and hi host and those that were number of them were
threescor and fourteen thousand and six hundr

2:5 and those that do pitch next unto him shall be the tribe of
issachar: and nethaneel the son of zuar shall be captain of the
children of issachar

2:6 and hi host and those that were number thereof were fifti and
four thousand and four hundr

2:7 then the tribe of zebulun: and eliab the son of helon shall be
captain of the children of zebulun

2:8 and hi host and those that were number thereof were fifti and
seven thousand and four hundr

2:9 all that were number in the camp of judah were an hundr
thousand and fourscor thousand and six thousand and four hundr
throughout their armi these shall first set forth

2:10 on the south side shall be the standard of the camp of reuben
accord to their armies: and the captain of the children of reuben
shall be elizur the son of shedeur

2:11 and hi host and those that were number thereof were forti
and six thousand and five hundr

2:12 and those which pitch by him shall be the tribe of simeon: and
the captain of the children of simeon shall be shelumiel the son of
zurishaddai

2:13 and hi host and those that were number of them were fifti
and nine thousand and three hundr

2:14 then the tribe of gad: and the captain of the son of gad shall
be eliasaph the son of reuel

2:15 and hi host and those that were number of them were forti
and five thousand and six hundr and fifti

2:16 all that were number in the camp of reuben were an hundr
thousand and fifti and one thousand and four hundr and fifti
throughout their armi and they shall set forth in the second rank

2:17 then the tabernacl of the congreg shall set forward with
the camp of the levit in the midst of the camp: as they encamp so
shall they set forward everi man in hi place by their standard

2:18 on the west side shall be the standard of the camp of ephraim
accord to their armies: and the captain of the son of ephraim
shall be elishama the son of ammihud

2:19 and hi host and those that were number of them were forti
thousand and five hundr

2:20 and by him shall be the tribe of manasseh: and the captain of the
children of manasseh shall be gamaliel the son of pedahzur

2:21 and hi host and those that were number of them were thirti
and two thousand and two hundr

2:22 then the tribe of benjamin: and the captain of the son of
benjamin shall be abidan the son of gideoni

2:23 and hi host and those that were number of them were thirti
and five thousand and four hundr

2:24 all that were number of the camp of ephraim were an hundr
thousand and eight thousand and an hundr throughout their armi
and they shall go forward in the third rank

2:25 the standard of the camp of dan shall be on the north side by
their armies: and the captain of the children of dan shall be ahiez
the son of ammishaddai

2:26 and hi host and those that were number of them were
threescor and two thousand and seven hundr

2:27 and those that encamp by him shall be the tribe of asher: and the
captain of the children of asher shall be pagiel the son of ocran

2:28 and hi host and those that were number of them were forti
and one thousand and five hundr

2:29 then the tribe of naphtali: and the captain of the children of
naphtali shall be ahira the son of enan

2:30 and hi host and those that were number of them were fifti
and three thousand and four hundr

2:31 all they that were number in the camp of dan were an hundr
thousand and fifti and seven thousand and six hundr they shall go
hindmost with their standard

2:32 these are those which were number of the children of israel by
the hous of their fathers: all those that were number of the camp
throughout their host were six hundr thousand and three thousand
and five hundr and fifti

2:33 but the levit were not number among the children of israel;
as the lord command mose

2:34 and the children of israel did accord to all that the lord
command moses: so they pitch by their standard and so they set
forward everi one after their famili accord to the hous of
their father

3:1 these also are the gener of aaron and mose in the day that
the lord spake with mose in mount sinai

3:2 and these are the name of the son of aaron; nadab the firstborn
and abihu eleazar and ithamar

3:3 these are the name of the son of aaron the priest which were
anoint whom he consecr to minist in the priest offic

3:4 and nadab and abihu die befor the lord when they offer
strang fire befor the lord in the wilder of sinai and they had
no children: and eleazar and ithamar minist in the priest offic
in the sight of aaron their father

3:5 and the lord spake unto mose say 3:6 bring the tribe of levi
near and present them befor aaron the priest that they may minist
unto him

3:7 and they shall keep hi charg and the charg of the whole
congreg befor the tabernacl of the congreg to do the
servic of the tabernacl

3:8 and they shall keep all the instrument of the tabernacl of the
congreg and the charg of the children of israel to do the
servic of the tabernacl

3:9 and thou shalt give the levit unto aaron and to hi sons: they
are wholli given unto him out of the children of israel

3:10 and thou shalt appoint aaron and hi son and they shall wait on
their priest office: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put
to death

3:11 and the lord spake unto mose say 3:12 and i behold i have
taken the levit from among the children of israel instead of all the
firstborn that openeth the matrix among the children of israel:
therefor the levit shall be mine; 3:13 becaus all the firstborn
are mine; for on the day that i smote all the firstborn in the land of
egypt i hallow unto me all the firstborn in israel both man and
beast: mine shall they be: i am the lord

3:14 and the lord spake unto mose in the wilder of sinai say
3:15 number the children of levi after the hous of their father by
their families: everi male from a month old and upward shalt thou
number them

3:16 and mose number them accord to the word of the lord as he
wa command

3:17 and these were the son of levi by their names; gershon and
kohath and merari

3:18 and these are the name of the son of gershon by their families;
libni and shimei

3:19 and the son of kohath by their families; amram and izehar
hebron and uzziel

3:20 and the son of merari by their families; mahli and mushi these
are the famili of the levit accord to the hous of their
father

3:21 of gershon wa the famili of the libnit and the famili of the
shimites: these are the famili of the gershonit

3:22 those that were number of them accord to the number of all
the male from a month old and upward even those that were number
of them were seven thousand and five hundr

3:23 the famili of the gershonit shall pitch behind the tabernacl
westward

3:24 and the chief of the hous of the father of the gershonit shall
be eliasaph the son of lael

3:25 and the charg of the son of gershon in the tabernacl of the
congreg shall be the tabernacl and the tent the cover
thereof and the hang for the door of the tabernacl of the
congreg 3:26 and the hang of the court and the curtain for
the door of the court which is by the tabernacl and by the altar
round about and the cord of it for all the servic thereof

3:27 and of kohath wa the famili of the amramit and the famili of
the izeharit and the famili of the hebronit and the famili of
the uzzielites: these are the famili of the kohathit

3:28 in the number of all the male from a month old and upward were
eight thousand and six hundr keep the charg of the sanctuari

3:29 the famili of the son of kohath shall pitch on the side of the
tabernacl southward

3:30 and the chief of the hous of the father of the famili of the
kohathit shall be elizaphan the son of uzziel

3:31 and their charg shall be the ark and the tabl and the
candlestick and the altar and the vessel of the sanctuari
wherewith they minist and the hang and all the servic thereof

3:32 and eleazar the son of aaron the priest shall be chief over the
chief of the levit and have the oversight of them that keep the
charg of the sanctuari

3:33 of merari wa the famili of the mahlit and the famili of the
mushites: these are the famili of merari

3:34 and those that were number of them accord to the number of
all the male from a month old and upward were six thousand and two
hundr

3:35 and the chief of the hous of the father of the famili of
merari wa zuriel the son of abihail: these shall pitch on the side of
the tabernacl northward

3:36 and under the custodi and charg of the son of merari shall be
the board of the tabernacl and the bar thereof and the pillar
thereof and the socket thereof and all the vessel thereof and all
that serveth thereto 3:37 and the pillar of the court round about
and their socket and their pin and their cord

3:38 but those that encamp befor the tabernacl toward the east even
befor the tabernacl of the congreg eastward shall be mose
and aaron and hi son keep the charg of the sanctuari for the
charg of the children of israel; and the stranger that cometh nigh
shall be put to death

3:39 all that were number of the levit which mose and aaron
number at the command of the lord throughout their famili
all the male from a month old and upward were twenti and two
thousand

3:40 and the lord said unto mose number all the firstborn of the
male of the children of israel from a month old and upward and take
the number of their name

3:41 and thou shalt take the levit for me (i am the lord) instead of
all the firstborn among the children of israel; and the cattl of the
levit instead of all the firstl among the cattl of the children
of israel

3:42 and mose number as the lord command him all the firstborn
among the children of israel

3:43 and all the firstborn male by the number of name from a month
old and upward of those that were number of them were twenti and
two thousand two hundr and threescor and thirteen

3:44 and the lord spake unto mose say 3:45 take the levit
instead of all the firstborn among the children of israel and the
cattl of the levit instead of their cattle; and the levit shall
be mine: i am the lord

3:46 and for those that are to be redeem of the two hundr and
threescor and thirteen of the firstborn of the children of israel
which are more than the levites; 3:47 thou shalt even take five
shekel apiec by the poll after the shekel of the sanctuari shalt
thou take them: (the shekel is twenti gerahs:) 3:48 and thou shalt
give the money wherewith the odd number of them is to be redeem
unto aaron and to hi son

3:49 and mose took the redempt money of them that were over and
abov them that were redeem by the levites: 3:50 of the firstborn of
the children of israel took he the money; a thousand three hundr and
threescor and five shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary: 3:51
and mose gave the money of them that were redeem unto aaron and to
hi son accord to the word of the lord as the lord command
mose

4:1 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron say 4:2 take the
sum of the son of kohath from among the son of levi after their
famili by the hous of their father 4:3 from thirti year old and
upward even until fifti year old all that enter into the host to do
the work in the tabernacl of the congreg

4:4 thi shall be the servic of the son of kohath in the tabernacl
of the congreg about the most holi things: 4:5 and when the camp
setteth forward aaron shall come and hi son and they shall take
down the cover vail and cover the ark of testimoni with it: 4:6
and shall put thereon the cover of badger skin and shall spread
over it a cloth wholli of blue and shall put in the stave thereof

4:7 and upon the tabl of shewbread they shall spread a cloth of blue
and put thereon the dish and the spoon and the bowl and cover
to cover withal: and the continu bread shall be thereon: 4:8 and
they shall spread upon them a cloth of scarlet and cover the same
with a cover of badger skin and shall put in the stave
thereof

4:9 and they shall take a cloth of blue and cover the candlestick of
the light and hi lamp and hi tong and hi snuffdish and all
the oil vessel thereof wherewith they minist unto it: 4:10 and
they shall put it and all the vessel thereof within a cover of
badger skin and shall put it upon a bar

4:11 and upon the golden altar they shall spread a cloth of blue and
cover it with a cover of badger skin and shall put to the
stave thereof: 4:12 and they shall take all the instrument of
ministri wherewith they minist in the sanctuari and put them in a
cloth of blue and cover them with a cover of badger skin and
shall put them on a bar: 4:13 and they shall take away the ash from
the altar and spread a purpl cloth thereon: 4:14 and they shall put
upon it all the vessel thereof wherewith they minist about it
even the censer the fleshhook and the shovel and the bason all
the vessel of the altar; and they shall spread upon it a cover of
badger skin and put to the stave of it

4:15 and when aaron and hi son have made an end of cover the
sanctuari and all the vessel of the sanctuari as the camp is to set
forward; after that the son of kohath shall come to bear it: but
they shall not touch ani holi thing lest they die these thing are
the burden of the son of kohath in the tabernacl of the
congreg

4:16 and to the offic of eleazar the son of aaron the priest
pertaineth the oil for the light and the sweet incens and the daili
meat offer and the anoint oil and the oversight of all the
tabernacl and of all that therein is in the sanctuari and in the
vessel thereof

4:17 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron say 4:18 cut ye
not off the tribe of the famili of the kohathit from among the
levites: 4:19 but thu do unto them that they may live and not die
when they approach unto the most holi things: aaron and hi son shall
go in and appoint them everi one to hi servic and to hi burden:
4:20 but they shall not go in to see when the holi thing are cover
lest they die

4:21 and the lord spake unto mose say 4:22 take also the sum of
the son of gershon throughout the hous of their father by their
families; 4:23 from thirti year old and upward until fifti year old
shalt thou number them; all that enter in to perform the servic to
do the work in the tabernacl of the congreg

4:24 thi is the servic of the famili of the gershonit to serv
and for burdens: 4:25 and they shall bear the curtain of the
tabernacl and the tabernacl of the congreg hi cover and
the cover of the badger skin that is abov upon it and the
hang for the door of the tabernacl of the congreg 4:26 and
the hang of the court and the hang for the door of the gate of
the court which is by the tabernacl and by the altar round about
and their cord and all the instrument of their servic and all
that is made for them: so shall they serv

4:27 at the appoint of aaron and hi son shall be all the servic
of the son of the gershonit in all their burden and in all their
service: and ye shall appoint unto them in charg all their burden

4:28 thi is the servic of the famili of the son of gershon in the
tabernacl of the congregation: and their charg shall be under the
hand of ithamar the son of aaron the priest

4:29 as for the son of merari thou shalt number them after their
famili by the hous of their fathers; 4:30 from thirti year old
and upward even unto fifti year old shalt thou number them everi one
that entereth into the servic to do the work of the tabernacl of
the congreg

4:31 and thi is the charg of their burden accord to all their
servic in the tabernacl of the congregation; the board of the
tabernacl and the bar thereof and the pillar thereof and socket
thereof 4:32 and the pillar of the court round about and their
socket and their pin and their cord with all their instrument
and with all their service: and by name ye shall reckon the
instrument of the charg of their burden

4:33 thi is the servic of the famili of the son of merari
accord to all their servic in the tabernacl of the congreg
under the hand of ithamar the son of aaron the priest

4:34 and mose and aaron and the chief of the congreg number
the son of the kohathit after their famili and after the hous
of their father 4:35 from thirti year old and upward even unto
fifti year old everi one that entereth into the servic for the
work in the tabernacl of the congregation: 4:36 and those that were
number of them by their famili were two thousand seven hundr and
fifti

4:37 these were they that were number of the famili of the
kohathit all that might do servic in the tabernacl of the
congreg which mose and aaron did number accord to the
command of the lord by the hand of mose

4:38 and those that were number of the son of gershon throughout
their famili and by the hous of their father 4:39 from thirti
year old and upward even unto fifti year old everi one that
entereth into the servic for the work in the tabernacl of the
congreg 4:40 even those that were number of them throughout
their famili by the hous of their father were two thousand and
six hundr and thirti

4:41 these are they that were number of the famili of the son of
gershon of all that might do servic in the tabernacl of the
congreg whom mose and aaron did number accord to the
command of the lord

4:42 and those that were number of the famili of the son of
merari throughout their famili by the hous of their father 4:43
from thirti year old and upward even unto fifti year old everi one
that entereth into the servic for the work in the tabernacl of the
congreg 4:44 even those that were number of them after their
famili were three thousand and two hundr

4:45 these be those that were number of the famili of the son of
merari whom mose and aaron number accord to the word of the
lord by the hand of mose

4:46 all those that were number of the levit whom mose and aaron
and the chief of israel number after their famili and after the
hous of their father 4:47 from thirti year old and upward even
unto fifti year old everi one that came to do the servic of the
ministri and the servic of the burden in the tabernacl of the
congreg

4:48 even those that were number of them were eight thousand and
five hundr and fourscor 4:49 accord to the command of the
lord they were number by the hand of mose everi one accord to
hi servic and accord to hi burden: thu were they number of
him as the lord command mose

5:1 and the lord spake unto mose say 5:2 command the children of
israel that they put out of the camp everi leper and everi one that
hath an issu and whosoev is defil by the dead: 5:3 both male and
femal shall ye put out without the camp shall ye put them; that they
defil not their camp in the midst whereof i dwell

5:4 and the children of israel did so and put them out without the
camp: as the lord spake unto mose so did the children of israel

5:5 and the lord spake unto mose say 5:6 speak unto the children
of israel when a man or woman shall commit ani sin that men commit
to do a trespass against the lord and that person be guilty; 5:7 then
they shall confess their sin which they have done: and he shall
recompens hi trespass with the princip thereof and add unto it
the fifth part thereof and give it unto him against whom he hath
trespass

5:8 but if the man have no kinsman to recompens the trespass unto
let the trespass be recompens unto the lord even to the priest;
besid the ram of the aton wherebi an aton shall be made
for him

5:9 and everi offer of all the holi thing of the children of
israel which they bring unto the priest shall be hi

5:10 and everi man hallow thing shall be his: whatsoev ani man
giveth the priest it shall be hi

5:11 and the lord spake unto mose say 5:12 speak unto the
children of israel and say unto them if ani man wife go asid and
commit a trespass against him 5:13 and a man lie with her carnal
and it be hid from the eye of her husband and be kept close and she
be defil and there be no wit against her neither she be taken
with the manner; 5:14 and the spirit of jealousi come upon him and he
be jealou of hi wife and she be defiled: or if the spirit of
jealousi come upon him and he be jealou of hi wife and she be not
defiled: 5:15 then shall the man bring hi wife unto the priest and
he shall bring her offer for her the tenth part of an ephah of
barley meal; he shall pour no oil upon it nor put frankincens
thereon; for it is an offer of jealousi an offer of memori
bring iniqu to remembr

5:16 and the priest shall bring her near and set her befor the lord:
5:17 and the priest shall take holi water in an earthen vessel; and of
the dust that is in the floor of the tabernacl the priest shall take
and put it into the water: 5:18 and the priest shall set the woman
befor the lord and uncov the woman head and put the offer of
memori in her hand which is the jealousi offering: and the priest
shall have in hi hand the bitter water that causeth the curse: 5:19
and the priest shall charg her by an oath and say unto the woman if
no man have lain with thee and if thou hast not gone asid to
unclean with anoth instead of thi husband be thou free from
thi bitter water that causeth the curse: 5:20 but if thou hast gone
asid to anoth instead of thi husband and if thou be defil and
some man have lain with thee besid thine husband: 5:21 then the
priest shall charg the woman with an oath of curs and the priest
shall say unto the woman the lord make thee a curs and an oath among
thi peopl when the lord doth make thi thigh to rot and thi belli to
swell; 5:22 and thi water that causeth the curs shall go into thi
bowel to make thi belli to swell and thi thigh to rot: and the
woman shall say amen amen

5:23 and the priest shall write these curs in a book and he shall
blot them out with the bitter water: 5:24 and he shall caus the woman
to drink the bitter water that causeth the curse: and the water that
causeth the curs shall enter into her and becom bitter

5:25 then the priest shall take the jealousi offer out of the
woman hand and shall wave the offer befor the lord and offer
it upon the altar: 5:26 and the priest shall take an hand of the
offer even the memori thereof and burn it upon the altar and
afterward shall caus the woman to drink the water

5:27 and when he hath made her to drink the water then it shall come
to pass that if she be defil and have done trespass against her
husband that the water that causeth the curs shall enter into her
and becom bitter and her belli shall swell and her thigh shall rot:
and the woman shall be a curs among her peopl

5:28 and if the woman be not defil but be clean; then she shall be
free and shall conceiv seed

5:29 thi is the law of jealousi when a wife goeth asid to anoth
instead of her husband and is defiled; 5:30 or when the spirit of
jealousi cometh upon him and he be jealou over hi wife and shall
set the woman befor the lord and the priest shall execut upon her
all thi law

5:31 then shall the man be guiltless from iniqu and thi woman
shall bear her iniqu

6:1 and the lord spake unto mose say 6:2 speak unto the children
of israel and say unto them when either man or woman shall separ
themselv to vow a vow of a nazarit to separ themselv unto the
lord: 6:3 he shall separ himself from wine and strong drink and
shall drink no vinegar of wine or vinegar of strong drink neither
shall he drink ani liquor of grape nor eat moist grape or dri

6:4 all the day of hi separ shall he eat noth that is made
of the vine tree from the kernel even to the husk

6:5 all the day of the vow of hi separ there shall no razor
come upon hi head: until the day be fulfil in the which he
separateth himself unto the lord he shall be holi and shall let the
lock of the hair of hi head grow

6:6 all the day that he separateth himself unto the lord he shall
come at no dead bodi

6:7 he shall not make himself unclean for hi father or for hi
mother for hi brother or for hi sister when they die: becaus the
consecr of hi god is upon hi head

6:8 all the day of hi separ he is holi unto the lord

6:9 and if ani man die veri suddenli by him and he hath defil the
head of hi consecration; then he shall shave hi head in the day of
hi cleans on the seventh day shall he shave it

6:10 and on the eighth day he shall bring two turtl or two young
pigeon to the priest to the door of the tabernacl of the
congregation: 6:11 and the priest shall offer the one for a sin
offer and the other for a burnt offer and make an aton
for him for that he sin by the dead and shall hallow hi head
that same day

6:12 and he shall consecr unto the lord the day of hi separ
and shall bring a lamb of the first year for a trespass offering: but
the day that were befor shall be lost becaus hi separ wa
defil

6:13 and thi is the law of the nazarit when the day of hi
separ are fulfilled: he shall be brought unto the door of the
tabernacl of the congregation: 6:14 and he shall offer hi offer
unto the lord one he lamb of the first year without blemish for a
burnt offer and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish for
a sin offer and one ram without blemish for peac offer 6:15
and a basket of unleaven bread cake of fine flour mingl with
oil and wafer of unleaven bread anoint with oil and their meat
offer and their drink offer

6:16 and the priest shall bring them befor the lord and shall offer
hi sin offer and hi burnt offering: 6:17 and he shall offer the
ram for a sacrific of peac offer unto the lord with the basket
of unleaven bread: the priest shall offer also hi meat offer
and hi drink offer

6:18 and the nazarit shall shave the head of hi separ at the
door of the tabernacl of the congreg and shall take the hair of
the head of hi separ and put it in the fire which is under the
sacrific of the peac offer

6:19 and the priest shall take the sodden shoulder of the ram and one
unleaven cake out of the basket and one unleaven wafer and shall
put them upon the hand of the nazarit after the hair of hi
separ is shaven: 6:20 and the priest shall wave them for a wave
offer befor the lord: thi is holi for the priest with the wave
breast and heav shoulder: and after that the nazarit may drink wine

6:21 thi is the law of the nazarit who hath vow and of hi
offer unto the lord for hi separ besid that that hi hand
shall get: accord to the vow which he vow so he must do after
the law of hi separ

6:22 and the lord spake unto mose say 6:23 speak unto aaron and
unto hi son say on thi wise ye shall bless the children of
israel say unto them 6:24 the lord bless thee and keep thee:
6:25 the lord make hi face shine upon thee and be graciou unto
thee: 6:26 the lord lift up hi counten upon thee and give thee
peac

6:27 and they shall put my name upon the children of israel and i
will bless them

7:1 and it came to pass on the day that mose had fulli set up the
tabernacl and had anoint it and sanctifi it and all the
instrument thereof both the altar and all the vessel thereof and
had anoint them and sanctifi them; 7:2 that the princ of
israel head of the hous of their father who were the princ of
the tribe and were over them that were number offered: 7:3 and
they brought their offer befor the lord six cover wagon and
twelv oxen; a wagon for two of the princ and for each one an ox:
and they brought them befor the tabernacl

7:4 and the lord spake unto mose say 7:5 take it of them that
they may be to do the servic of the tabernacl of the congregation;
and thou shalt give them unto the levit to everi man accord to
hi servic

7:6 and mose took the wagon and the oxen and gave them unto the
levit

7:7 two wagon and four oxen he gave unto the son of gershon
accord to their service: 7:8 and four wagon and eight oxen he gave
unto the son of merari accord unto their servic under the hand
of ithamar the son of aaron the priest

7:9 but unto the son of kohath he gave none: becaus the servic of
the sanctuari belong unto them wa that they should bear upon their
shoulder

7:10 and the princ offer for dedic of the altar in the day
that it wa anoint even the princ offer their offer befor
the altar

7:11 and the lord said unto mose they shall offer their offer
each princ on hi day for the dedic of the altar

7:12 and he that offer hi offer the first day wa nahshon the
son of amminadab of the tribe of judah: 7:13 and hi offer wa one
silver charger the weight thereof wa an hundr and thirti shekel
one silver bowl of seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary;
both of them were full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat
offering: 7:14 one spoon of ten shekel of gold full of incense: 7:15
one young bullock one ram one lamb of the first year for a burnt
offering: 7:16 one kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:17 and for a
sacrific of peac offer two oxen five ram five he goat five
lamb of the first year: thi wa the offer of nahshon the son of
amminadab

7:18 on the second day nethaneel the son of zuar princ of issachar
did offer: 7:19 he offer for hi offer one silver charger the
weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekel one silver bowl of
seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full
of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:20 one spoon of
gold of ten shekel full of incense: 7:21 one young bullock one ram
one lamb of the first year for a burnt offering: 7:22 one kid of the
goat for a sin offering: 7:23 and for a sacrific of peac offer
two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of the first year: thi
wa the offer of nethaneel the son of zuar

7:24 on the third day eliab the son of helon princ of the children
of zebulun did offer: 7:25 hi offer wa one silver charger the
weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekel one silver bowl of
seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full
of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:26 one golden
spoon of ten shekel full of incense: 7:27 one young bullock one
ram one lamb of the first year for a burnt offering: 7:28 one kid of
the goat for a sin offering: 7:29 and for a sacrific of peac
offer two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of eliab the son of helon

7:30 on the fourth day elizur the son of shedeur princ of the
children of reuben did offer: 7:31 hi offer wa one silver
charger of the weight of an hundr and thirti shekel one silver
bowl of seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of
them full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:32 one
golden spoon of ten shekel full of incense: 7:33 one young bullock
one ram one lamb of the first year for a burnt offering: 7:34 one
kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:35 and for a sacrific of peac
offer two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of elizur the son of shedeur

7:36 on the fifth day shelumiel the son of zurishaddai princ of the
children of simeon did offer: 7:37 hi offer wa one silver
charger the weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekel one
silver bowl of seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary;
both of them full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering:
7:38 one golden spoon of ten shekel full of incense: 7:39 one young
bullock one ram one lamb of the first year for a burnt offering:
7:40 one kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:41 and for a sacrific
of peac offer two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of
the first year: thi wa the offer of shelumiel the son of
zurishaddai

7:42 on the sixth day eliasaph the son of deuel princ of the
children of gad offered: 7:43 hi offer wa one silver charger of
the weight of an hundr and thirti shekel a silver bowl of seventi
shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine
flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:44 one golden spoon of
ten shekel full of incense: 7:45 one young bullock one ram one
lamb of the first year for a burnt offering: 7:46 one kid of the
goat for a sin offering: 7:47 and for a sacrific of peac offer
two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of the first year: thi
wa the offer of eliasaph the son of deuel

7:48 on the seventh day elishama the son of ammihud princ of the
children of ephraim offered: 7:49 hi offer wa one silver
charger the weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekel one
silver bowl of seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary;
both of them full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering:
7:50 one golden spoon of ten shekel full of incense: 7:51 one young
bullock one ram one lamb of the first year for a burnt offering:
7:52 one kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:53 and for a sacrific
of peac offer two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of
the first year: thi wa the offer of elishama the son of ammihud

7:54 on the eighth day offer gamaliel the son of pedahzur princ of
the children of manasseh: 7:55 hi offer wa one silver charger of
the weight of an hundr and thirti shekel one silver bowl of
seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full
of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:56 one golden
spoon of ten shekel full of incense: 7:57 one young bullock one
ram one lamb of the first year for a burnt offering: 7:58 one kid of
the goat for a sin offering: 7:59 and for a sacrific of peac
offer two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of gamaliel the son of pedahzur

7:60 on the ninth day abidan the son of gideoni princ of the
children of benjamin offered: 7:61 hi offer wa one silver
charger the weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekel one
silver bowl of seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary;
both of them full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering:
7:62 one golden spoon of ten shekel full of incense: 7:63 one young
bullock one ram one lamb of the first year for a burnt offering:
7:64 one kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:65 and for a sacrific
of peac offer two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of
the first year: thi wa the offer of abidan the son of gideoni

7:66 on the tenth day ahiez the son of ammishaddai princ of the
children of dan offered: 7:67 hi offer wa one silver charger
the weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekel one silver bowl
of seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them
full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:68 one
golden spoon of ten shekel full of incense: 7:69 one young bullock
one ram one lamb of the first year for a burnt offering: 7:70 one
kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:71 and for a sacrific of peac
offer two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of ahiez the son of ammishaddai

7:72 on the eleventh day pagiel the son of ocran princ of the
children of asher offered: 7:73 hi offer wa one silver charger
the weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekel one silver bowl
of seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them
full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:74 one
golden spoon of ten shekel full of incense: 7:75 one young bullock
one ram one lamb of the first year for a burnt offering: 7:76 one
kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:77 and for a sacrific of peac
offer two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of pagiel the son of ocran

7:78 on the twelfth day ahira the son of enan princ of the children
of naphtali offered: 7:79 hi offer wa one silver charger the
weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekel one silver bowl of
seventi shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full
of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:80 one golden
spoon of ten shekel full of incense: 7:81 one young bullock one
ram one lamb of the first year for a burnt offering: 7:82 one kid of
the goat for a sin offering: 7:83 and for a sacrific of peac
offer two oxen five ram five he goat five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of ahira the son of enan

7:84 thi wa the dedic of the altar in the day when it wa
anoint by the princ of israel: twelv charger of silver twelv
silver bowl twelv spoon of gold: 7:85 each charger of silver
weigh an hundr and thirti shekel each bowl seventy: all the
silver vessel weigh two thousand and four hundr shekel after
the shekel of the sanctuary: 7:86 the golden spoon were twelv full
of incens weigh ten shekel apiec after the shekel of the
sanctuary: all the gold of the spoon wa an hundr and twenti
shekel

7:87 all the oxen for the burnt offer were twelv bullock the
ram twelv the lamb of the first year twelv with their meat
offering: and the kid of the goat for sin offer twelv

7:88 and all the oxen for the sacrific of the peac offer were
twenti and four bullock the ram sixti the he goat sixti the
lamb of the first year sixti thi wa the dedic of the altar
after that it wa anoint

7:89 and when mose wa gone into the tabernacl of the congreg
to speak with him then he heard the voic of one speak unto him
from off the merci seat that wa upon the ark of testimoni from
between the two cherubims: and he spake unto him

8:1 and the lord spake unto mose say 8:2 speak unto aaron and
say unto him when thou lightest the lamp the seven lamp shall give
light over against the candlestick

8:3 and aaron did so; he light the lamp thereof over against the
candlestick as the lord command mose

8:4 and thi work of the candlestick wa of beaten gold unto the
shaft thereof unto the flower thereof wa beaten work: accord
unto the pattern which the lord had shew mose so he made the
candlestick

8:5 and the lord spake unto mose say 8:6 take the levit from
among the children of israel and cleans them

8:7 and thu shalt thou do unto them to cleans them: sprinkl water
of purifi upon them and let them shave all their flesh and let
them wash their cloth and so make themselv clean

8:8 then let them take a young bullock with hi meat offer even
fine flour mingl with oil and anoth young bullock shalt thou take
for a sin offer

8:9 and thou shalt bring the levit befor the tabernacl of the
congregation: and thou shalt gather the whole assembl of the children
of israel together: 8:10 and thou shalt bring the levit befor the
lord: and the children of israel shall put their hand upon the
levites: 8:11 and aaron shall offer the levit befor the lord for an
offer of the children of israel that they may execut the servic
of the lord

8:12 and the levit shall lay their hand upon the head of the
bullocks: and thou shalt offer the one for a sin offer and the
other for a burnt offer unto the lord to make an aton for
the levit

8:13 and thou shalt set the levit befor aaron and befor hi son
and offer them for an offer unto the lord

8:14 thu shalt thou separ the levit from among the children of
israel: and the levit shall be mine

8:15 and after that shall the levit go in to do the servic of the
tabernacl of the congregation: and thou shalt cleans them and offer
them for an offer

8:16 for they are wholli given unto me from among the children of
israel; instead of such as open everi womb even instead of the
firstborn of all the children of israel have i taken them unto me

8:17 for all the firstborn of the children of israel are mine both
man and beast: on the day that i smote everi firstborn in the land of
egypt i sanctifi them for myself

8:18 and i have taken the levit for all the firstborn of the
children of israel

8:19 and i have given the levit as a gift to aaron and to hi son
from among the children of israel to do the servic of the children
of israel in the tabernacl of the congreg and to make an
aton for the children of israel: that there be no plagu among
the children of israel when the children of israel come nigh unto the
sanctuari

8:20 and mose and aaron and all the congreg of the children of
israel did to the levit accord unto all that the lord command
mose concern the levit so did the children of israel unto them

8:21 and the levit were purifi and they wash their clothes; and
aaron offer them as an offer befor the lord; and aaron made an
aton for them to cleans them

8:22 and after that went the levit in to do their servic in the
tabernacl of the congreg befor aaron and befor hi sons: as
the lord had command mose concern the levit so did they unto
them

8:23 and the lord spake unto mose say 8:24 thi is it that
belongeth unto the levites: from twenti and five year old and upward
they shall go in to wait upon the servic of the tabernacl of the
congregation: 8:25 and from the age of fifti year they shall ceas
wait upon the servic thereof and shall serv no more: 8:26 but
shall minist with their brethren in the tabernacl of the
congreg to keep the charg and shall do no servic thu shalt
thou do unto the levit touch their charg

9:1 and the lord spake unto mose in the wilder of sinai in the
first month of the second year after they were come out of the land of
egypt say 9:2 let the children of israel also keep the passov
at hi appoint season

9:3 in the fourteenth day of thi month at even ye shall keep it in
hi appoint season: accord to all the rite of it and accord
to all the ceremoni thereof shall ye keep it

9:4 and mose spake unto the children of israel that they should keep
the passov

9:5 and they kept the passov on the fourteenth day of the first
month at even in the wilder of sinai: accord to all that the
lord command mose so did the children of israel

9:6 and there were certain men who were defil by the dead bodi of a
man that they could not keep the passov on that day: and they came
befor mose and befor aaron on that day: 9:7 and those men said unto
him we are defil by the dead bodi of a man: wherefor are we kept
back that we may not offer an offer of the lord in hi appoint
season among the children of israel? 9:8 and mose said unto them
stand still and i will hear what the lord will command concern
you

9:9 and the lord spake unto mose say 9:10 speak unto the
children of israel say if ani man of you or of your poster
shall be unclean by reason of a dead bodi or be in a journey afar
off yet he shall keep the passov unto the lord

9:11 the fourteenth day of the second month at even they shall keep
it and eat it with unleaven bread and bitter herb

9:12 they shall leav none of it unto the morn nor break ani bone
of it: accord to all the ordin of the passov they shall keep
it

9:13 but the man that is clean and is not in a journey and
forbeareth to keep the passov even the same soul shall be cut off
from among hi people: becaus he brought not the offer of the lord
in hi appoint season that man shall bear hi sin

9:14 and if a stranger shall sojourn among you and will keep the
passov unto the lord; accord to the ordin of the passov
and accord to the manner thereof so shall he do: ye shall have one
ordin both for the stranger and for him that wa born in the
land

9:15 and on the day that the tabernacl wa rear up the cloud
cover the tabernacl name the tent of the testimony: and at even
there wa upon the tabernacl as it were the appear of fire until
the morn

9:16 so it wa alway: the cloud cover it by day and the appear
of fire by night

9:17 and when the cloud wa taken up from the tabernacl then after
that the children of israel journeyed: and in the place where the
cloud abod there the children of israel pitch their tent

9:18 at the command of the lord the children of israel journey
and at the command of the lord they pitched: as long as the cloud
abod upon the tabernacl they rest in their tent

9:19 and when the cloud tarri long upon the tabernacl mani day
then the children of israel kept the charg of the lord and journey
not

9:20 and so it wa when the cloud wa a few day upon the tabernacle;
accord to the command of the lord they abod in their tent
and accord to the command of the lord they journey

9:21 and so it wa when the cloud abod from even unto the morn
and that the cloud wa taken up in the morn then they journeyed:
whether it wa by day or by night that the cloud wa taken up they
journey

9:22 or whether it were two day or a month or a year that the
cloud tarri upon the tabernacl remain thereon the children of
israel abod in their tent and journey not: but when it wa taken
up they journey

9:23 at the command of the lord they rest in the tent and at
the command of the lord they journeyed: they kept the charg of
the lord at the command of the lord by the hand of mose

10:1 and the lord spake unto mose say 10:2 make thee two
trumpet of silver; of a whole piec shalt thou make them: that thou
mayest use them for the call of the assembl and for the
journey of the camp

10:3 and when they shall blow with them all the assembl shall
assembl themselv to thee at the door of the tabernacl of the
congreg

10:4 and if they blow but with one trumpet then the princ which
are head of the thousand of israel shall gather themselv unto
thee

10:5 when ye blow an alarm then the camp that lie on the east part
shall go forward

10:6 when ye blow an alarm the second time then the camp that lie on
the south side shall take their journey: they shall blow an alarm for
their journey

10:7 but when the congreg is to be gather togeth ye shall
blow but ye shall not sound an alarm

10:8 and the son of aaron the priest shall blow with the trumpets;
and they shall be to you for an ordin for ever throughout your
gener

10:9 and if ye go to war in your land against the enemi that
oppresseth you then ye shall blow an alarm with the trumpets; and ye
shall be rememb befor the lord your god and ye shall be save
from your enemi

10:10 also in the day of your glad and in your solemn day and
in the begin of your month ye shall blow with the trumpet over
your burnt offer and over the sacrific of your peac offerings;
that they may be to you for a memori befor your god: i am the lord
your god

10:11 and it came to pass on the twentieth day of the second month in
the second year that the cloud wa taken up from off the tabernacl
of the testimoni

10:12 and the children of israel took their journey out of the
wilder of sinai; and the cloud rest in the wilder of paran

10:13 and they first took their journey accord to the command
of the lord by the hand of mose

10:14 in the first place went the standard of the camp of the children
of judah accord to their armies: and over hi host wa nahshon the
son of amminadab

10:15 and over the host of the tribe of the children of issachar wa
nethaneel the son of zuar

10:16 and over the host of the tribe of the children of zebulun wa
eliab the son of helon

10:17 and the tabernacl wa taken down; and the son of gershon and
the son of merari set forward bear the tabernacl

10:18 and the standard of the camp of reuben set forward accord to
their armies: and over hi host wa elizur the son of shedeur

10:19 and over the host of the tribe of the children of simeon wa
shelumiel the son of zurishaddai

10:20 and over the host of the tribe of the children of gad wa
eliasaph the son of deuel

10:21 and the kohathit set forward bear the sanctuary: and the
other did set up the tabernacl against they came

10:22 and the standard of the camp of the children of ephraim set
forward accord to their armies: and over hi host wa elishama the
son of ammihud

10:23 and over the host of the tribe of the children of manasseh wa
gamaliel the son of pedahzur

10:24 and over the host of the tribe of the children of benjamin wa
abidan the son of gideoni

10:25 and the standard of the camp of the children of dan set forward
which wa the rereward of all the camp throughout their hosts: and
over hi host wa ahiez the son of ammishaddai

10:26 and over the host of the tribe of the children of asher wa
pagiel the son of ocran

10:27 and over the host of the tribe of the children of naphtali wa
ahira the son of enan

10:28 thu were the journey of the children of israel accord to
their armi when they set forward

10:29 and mose said unto hobab the son of raguel the midianit
mose father in law we are journey unto the place of which the
lord said i will give it you: come thou with us and we will do thee
good: for the lord hath spoken good concern israel

10:30 and he said unto him i will not go; but i will depart to mine
own land and to my kindr

10:31 and he said leav us not i pray thee; forasmuch as thou
knowest how we are to encamp in the wilder and thou mayest be to
us instead of eye

10:32 and it shall be if thou go with us yea it shall be that what
good the lord shall do unto us the same will we do unto thee

10:33 and they depart from the mount of the lord three day
journey: and the ark of the coven of the lord went befor them in
the three day journey to search out a rest place for them

10:34 and the cloud of the lord wa upon them by day when they went
out of the camp

10:35 and it came to pass when the ark set forward that mose said
rise up lord and let thine enemi be scattered; and let them that
hate thee flee befor thee

10:36 and when it rest he said return o lord unto the mani
thousand of israel

11:1 and when the peopl complain it displeas the lord: and the
lord heard it; and hi anger wa kindled; and the fire of the lord
burnt among them and consum them that were in the uttermost part
of the camp

11:2 and the peopl cri unto moses; and when mose pray unto the
lord the fire wa quench

11:3 and he call the name of the place taberah: becaus the fire of
the lord burnt among them

11:4 and the mixt multitud that wa among them fell a lusting: and
the children of israel also wept again and said who shall give us
flesh to eat? 11:5 we rememb the fish which we did eat in egypt
freely; the cucumb and the melon and the leek and the onion
and the garlick: 11:6 but now our soul is dri away: there is noth
at all besid thi manna befor our eye

11:7 and the manna wa as coriand seed and the colour thereof as
the colour of bdellium

11:8 and the peopl went about and gather it and ground it in
mill or beat it in a mortar and bake it in pan and made cake of
it: and the tast of it wa as the tast of fresh oil

11:9 and when the dew fell upon the camp in the night the manna fell
upon it

11:10 then mose heard the peopl weep throughout their famili
everi man in the door of hi tent: and the anger of the lord wa
kindl greatly; mose also wa displeas

11:11 and mose said unto the lord wherefor hast thou afflict thi
servant? and wherefor have i not found favour in thi sight that thou
layest the burden of all thi peopl upon me? 11:12 have i conceiv
all thi people? have i begotten them that thou shouldest say unto
me carri them in thi bosom as a nurs father beareth the suck
child unto the land which thou swarest unto their fathers? 11:13
whenc should i have flesh to give unto all thi people? for they weep
unto me say give us flesh that we may eat

11:14 i am not abl to bear all thi peopl alon becaus it is too
heavi for me

11:15 and if thou deal thu with me kill me i pray thee out of
hand if i have found favour in thi sight; and let me not see my
wretched

11:16 and the lord said unto mose gather unto me seventi men of the
elder of israel whom thou knowest to be the elder of the peopl
and offic over them; and bring them unto the tabernacl of the
congreg that they may stand there with thee

11:17 and i will come down and talk with thee there: and i will take
of the spirit which is upon thee and will put it upon them; and they
shall bear the burden of the peopl with thee that thou bear it not
thyself alon

11:18 and say thou unto the peopl sanctifi yourselv against to
morrow and ye shall eat flesh: for ye have wept in the ear of the
lord say who shall give us flesh to eat? for it wa well with us
in egypt: therefor the lord will give you flesh and ye shall eat

11:19 ye shall not eat one day nor two day nor five day neither
ten day nor twenti days; 11:20 but even a whole month until it come
out at your nostril and it be loathsom unto you: becaus that ye
have despis the lord which is among you and have wept befor him
say whi came we forth out of egypt? 11:21 and mose said the
peopl among whom i am are six hundr thousand footmen; and thou
hast said i will give them flesh that they may eat a whole month

11:22 shall the flock and the herd be slain for them to suffic
them? or shall all the fish of the sea be gather togeth for them
to suffic them? 11:23 and the lord said unto mose is the lord
hand wax short? thou shalt see now whether my word shall come to
pass unto thee or not

11:24 and mose went out and told the peopl the word of the lord
and gather the seventi men of the elder of the peopl and set them
round about the tabernacl

11:25 and the lord came down in a cloud and spake unto him and took
of the spirit that wa upon him and gave it unto the seventi elders:
and it came to pass that when the spirit rest upon them they
prophesi and did not ceas

11:26 but there remain two of the men in the camp the name of the
one wa eldad and the name of the other medad: and the spirit rest
upon them; and they were of them that were written but went not out
unto the tabernacle: and they prophesi in the camp

11:27 and there ran a young man and told mose and said eldad and
medad do prophesi in the camp

11:28 and joshua the son of nun the servant of mose one of hi
young men answer and said my lord mose forbid them

11:29 and mose said unto him enviest thou for my sake? would god
that all the lord peopl were prophet and that the lord would put
hi spirit upon them! 11:30 and mose gat him into the camp he and
the elder of israel

11:31 and there went forth a wind from the lord and brought quail
from the sea and let them fall by the camp as it were a day
journey on thi side and as it were a day journey on the other
side round about the camp and as it were two cubit high upon the
face of the earth

11:32 and the peopl stood up all that day and all that night and
all the next day and they gather the quails: he that gather least
gather ten homers: and they spread them all abroad for themselv
round about the camp

11:33 and while the flesh wa yet between their teeth ere it wa
chew the wrath of the lord wa kindl against the peopl and the
lord smote the peopl with a veri great plagu

11:34 and he call the name of that place kibrothhattaavah: becaus
there they buri the peopl that lust

11:35 and the peopl journey from kibrothhattaavah unto hazeroth;
and abod at hazeroth

12:1 and miriam and aaron spake against mose becaus of the ethiopian
woman whom he had married: for he had marri an ethiopian woman

12:2 and they said hath the lord inde spoken onli by moses? hath he
not spoken also by us? and the lord heard it

12:3 (now the man mose wa veri meek abov all the men which were
upon the face of the earth) 12:4 and the lord spake suddenli unto
mose and unto aaron and unto miriam come out ye three unto the
tabernacl of the congreg and they three came out

12:5 and the lord came down in the pillar of the cloud and stood in
the door of the tabernacl and call aaron and miriam: and they both
came forth

12:6 and he said hear now my words: if there be a prophet among you
i the lord will make myself known unto him in a vision and will speak
unto him in a dream

12:7 my servant mose is not so who is faith in all mine hous

12:8 with him will i speak mouth to mouth even appar and not in
dark speeches; and the similitud of the lord shall he behold:
wherefor then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant moses?
12:9 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against them; and he
depart

12:10 and the cloud depart from off the tabernacle; and behold
miriam becam leprou white as snow: and aaron look upon miriam
and behold she wa leprou

12:11 and aaron said unto mose ala my lord i beseech thee lay
not the sin upon us wherein we have done foolishli and wherein we
have sin

12:12 let her not be as one dead of whom the flesh is half consum
when he cometh out of hi mother womb

12:13 and mose cri unto the lord say heal her now o god i
beseech thee

12:14 and the lord said unto mose if her father had but spit in her
face should she not be asham seven days? let her be shut out from
the camp seven day and after that let her be receiv in again

12:15 and miriam wa shut out from the camp seven days: and the peopl
journey not till miriam wa brought in again

12:16 and afterward the peopl remov from hazeroth and pitch in
the wilder of paran

13:1 and the lord spake unto mose say 13:2 send thou men that
they may search the land of canaan which i give unto the children of
israel: of everi tribe of their father shall ye send a man everi one
a ruler among them

13:3 and mose by the command of the lord sent them from the
wilder of paran: all those men were head of the children of
israel

13:4 and these were their names: of the tribe of reuben shammua the
son of zaccur

13:5 of the tribe of simeon shaphat the son of hori

13:6 of the tribe of judah caleb the son of jephunneh

13:7 of the tribe of issachar igal the son of joseph

13:8 of the tribe of ephraim oshea the son of nun

13:9 of the tribe of benjamin palti the son of raphu

13:10 of the tribe of zebulun gaddiel the son of sodi

13:11 of the tribe of joseph name of the tribe of manasseh gaddi
the son of susi

13:12 of the tribe of dan ammiel the son of gemal

13:13 of the tribe of asher sethur the son of michael

13:14 of the tribe of naphtali nahbi the son of vophsi

13:15 of the tribe of gad geuel the son of machi

13:16 these are the name of the men which mose sent to spi out the
land

and mose call oshea the son of nun jehoshua

13:17 and mose sent them to spi out the land of canaan and said unto
them get you up thi way southward and go up into the mountain:
13:18 and see the land what it is and the peopl that dwelleth
therein whether they be strong or weak few or many; 13:19 and what
the land is that they dwell in whether it be good or bad; and what
citi they be that they dwell in whether in tent or in strong
holds; 13:20 and what the land is whether it be fat or lean whether
there be wood therein or not and be ye of good courag and bring of
the fruit of the land now the time wa the time of the firstrip
grape

13:21 so they went up and search the land from the wilder of
zin unto rehob as men come to hamath

13:22 and they ascend by the south and came unto hebron; where
ahiman sheshai and talmai the children of anak were (now hebron
wa built seven year befor zoan in egypt) 13:23 and they came unto
the brook of eshcol and cut down from thenc a branch with one
cluster of grape and they bare it between two upon a staff; and they
brought of the pomegran and of the fig

13:24 the place wa call the brook eshcol becaus of the cluster of
grape which the children of israel cut down from thenc

13:25 and they return from search of the land after forti day

13:26 and they went and came to mose and to aaron and to all the
congreg of the children of israel unto the wilder of paran
to kadesh; and brought back word unto them and unto all the
congreg and shew them the fruit of the land

13:27 and they told him and said we came unto the land whither thou
sentest us and sure it floweth with milk and honey; and thi is the
fruit of it

13:28 nevertheless the peopl be strong that dwell in the land and
the citi are wall and veri great: and moreov we saw the
children of anak there

13:29 the amalekit dwell in the land of the south: and the hittit
and the jebusit and the amorit dwell in the mountains: and the
canaanit dwell by the sea and by the coast of jordan

13:30 and caleb still the peopl befor mose and said let us go
up at onc and possess it; for we are well abl to overcom it

13:31 but the men that went up with him said we be not abl to go up
against the people; for they are stronger than we

13:32 and they brought up an evil report of the land which they had
search unto the children of israel say the land through which
we have gone to search it is a land that eateth up the inhabit
thereof; and all the peopl that we saw in it are men of a great
statur

13:33 and there we saw the giant the son of anak which come of the
giants: and we were in our own sight as grasshopp and so we were
in their sight

14:1 and all the congreg lift up their voic and cried; and
the peopl wept that night

14:2 and all the children of israel murmur against mose and against
aaron: and the whole congreg said unto them would god that we
had die in the land of egypt! or would god we had die in thi
wilderness! 14:3 and wherefor hath the lord brought us unto thi
land to fall by the sword that our wive and our children should be
a prey? were it not better for us to return into egypt? 14:4 and they
said one to anoth let us make a captain and let us return into
egypt

14:5 then mose and aaron fell on their face befor all the assembl
of the congreg of the children of israel

14:6 and joshua the son of nun and caleb the son of jephunneh which
were of them that search the land rent their clothes: 14:7 and they
spake unto all the compani of the children of israel say the
land which we pass through to search it is an exceed good land

14:8 if the lord delight in us then he will bring us into thi land
and give it us; a land which floweth with milk and honey

14:9 onli rebel not ye against the lord neither fear ye the peopl of
the land; for they are bread for us: their defenc is depart from
them and the lord is with us: fear them not

14:10 but all the congreg bade stone them with stone and the
glori of the lord appear in the tabernacl of the congreg
befor all the children of israel

14:11 and the lord said unto mose how long will thi peopl provok
me? and how long will it be ere they believ me for all the sign
which i have shew among them? 14:12 i will smite them with the
pestil and disinherit them and will make of thee a greater
nation and mightier than they

14:13 and mose said unto the lord then the egyptian shall hear it
(for thou broughtest up thi peopl in thi might from among them;)
14:14 and they will tell it to the inhabit of thi land: for they
have heard that thou lord art among thi peopl that thou lord art
seen face to face and that thi cloud standeth over them and that
thou goest befor them by day time in a pillar of a cloud and in a
pillar of fire by night

14:15 now if thou shalt kill all thi peopl as one man then the
nation which have heard the fame of thee will speak say 14:16
becaus the lord wa not abl to bring thi peopl into the land which
he sware unto them therefor he hath slain them in the wilder

14:17 and now i beseech thee let the power of my lord be great
accord as thou hast spoken say 14:18 the lord is
longsuff and of great merci forgiv iniqu and
transgress and by no mean clear the guilti visit the
iniqu of the father upon the children unto the third and fourth
gener

14:19 pardon i beseech thee the iniqu of thi peopl accord
unto the great of thi merci and as thou hast forgiven thi
peopl from egypt even until now

14:20 and the lord said i have pardon accord to thi word: 14:21
but as truli as i live all the earth shall be fill with the glori
of the lord

14:22 becaus all those men which have seen my glori and my miracl
which i did in egypt and in the wilder and have tempt me now
these ten time and have not hearken to my voice; 14:23 sure they
shall not see the land which i sware unto their father neither shall
ani of them that provok me see it: 14:24 but my servant caleb
becaus he had anoth spirit with him and hath follow me fulli
him will i bring into the land whereinto he went; and hi seed shall
possess it

14:25 (now the amalekit and the canaanit dwelt in the valley)
tomorrow turn you and get you into the wilder by the way of the
red sea

14:26 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron say 14:27 how
long shall i bear with thi evil congreg which murmur against
me? i have heard the murmur of the children of israel which they
murmur against me

14:28 say unto them as truli as i live saith the lord as ye have
spoken in mine ear so will i do to you: 14:29 your carcas shall
fall in thi wilderness; and all that were number of you accord
to your whole number from twenti year old and upward which have
murmur against me

14:30 doubtless ye shall not come into the land concern which i
sware to make you dwell therein save caleb the son of jephunneh and
joshua the son of nun

14:31 but your littl one which ye said should be a prey them will
i bring in and they shall know the land which ye have despis

14:32 but as for you your carcas they shall fall in thi
wilder

14:33 and your children shall wander in the wilder forti year
and bear your whoredom until your carcas be wast in the
wilder

14:34 after the number of the day in which ye search the land even
forti day each day for a year shall ye bear your iniqu even
forti year and ye shall know my breach of promis

14:35 i the lord have said i will sure do it unto all thi evil
congreg that are gather togeth against me: in thi
wilder they shall be consum and there they shall die

14:36 and the men which mose sent to search the land who return
and made all the congreg to murmur against him by bring up a
slander upon the land 14:37 even those men that did bring up the evil
report upon the land die by the plagu befor the lord

14:38 but joshua the son of nun and caleb the son of jephunneh which
were of the men that went to search the land live still

14:39 and mose told these say unto all the children of israel:
and the peopl mourn greatli

14:40 and they rose up earli in the morn and gat them up into the
top of the mountain say lo we be here and will go up unto the
place which the lord hath promised: for we have sin

14:41 and mose said wherefor now do ye transgress the command
of the lord? but it shall not prosper

14:42 go not up for the lord is not among you; that ye be not smitten
befor your enemi

14:43 for the amalekit and the canaanit are there befor you and
ye shall fall by the sword: becaus ye are turn away from the lord
therefor the lord will not be with you

14:44 but they presum to go up unto the hill top: nevertheless the
ark of the coven of the lord and mose depart not out of the
camp

14:45 then the amalekit came down and the canaanit which dwelt in
that hill and smote them and discomfit them even unto hormah

15:1 and the lord spake unto mose say 15:2 speak unto the
children of israel and say unto them when ye be come into the land
of your habit which i give unto you 15:3 and will make an
offer by fire unto the lord a burnt offer or a sacrific in
perform a vow or in a freewil offer or in your solemn feast
to make a sweet savour unto the lord of the herd or of the flock:
15:4 then shall he that offereth hi offer unto the lord bring a
meat offer of a tenth deal of flour mingl with the fourth part of
an hin of oil

15:5 and the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offer shalt
thou prepar with the burnt offer or sacrific for one lamb

15:6 or for a ram thou shalt prepar for a meat offer two tenth
deal of flour mingl with the third part of an hin of oil

15:7 and for a drink offer thou shalt offer the third part of an
hin of wine for a sweet savour unto the lord

15:8 and when thou preparest a bullock for a burnt offer or for a
sacrific in perform a vow or peac offer unto the lord: 15:9
then shall he bring with a bullock a meat offer of three tenth
deal of flour mingl with half an hin of oil

15:10 and thou shalt bring for a drink offer half an hin of wine
for an offer made by fire of a sweet savour unto the lord

15:11 thu shall it be done for one bullock or for one ram or for a
lamb or a kid

15:12 accord to the number that ye shall prepar so shall ye do to
everi one accord to their number

15:13 all that are born of the countri shall do these thing after
thi manner in offer an offer made by fire of a sweet savour
unto the lord

15:14 and if a stranger sojourn with you or whosoev be among you in
your gener and will offer an offer made by fire of a sweet
savour unto the lord; as ye do so he shall do

15:15 one ordin shall be both for you of the congreg and
also for the stranger that sojourneth with you an ordin for ever
in your generations: as ye are so shall the stranger be befor the
lord

15:16 one law and one manner shall be for you and for the stranger
that sojourneth with you

15:17 and the lord spake unto mose say 15:18 speak unto the
children of israel and say unto them when ye come into the land
whither i bring you 15:19 then it shall be that when ye eat of the
bread of the land ye shall offer up an heav offer unto the lord

15:20 ye shall offer up a cake of the first of your dough for an heav
offering: as ye do the heav offer of the threshingfloor so shall
ye heav it

15:21 of the first of your dough ye shall give unto the lord an heav
offer in your gener

15:22 and if ye have er and not observ all these command
which the lord hath spoken unto mose 15:23 even all that the lord
hath command you by the hand of mose from the day that the lord
command mose and henceforward among your generations; 15:24 then
it shall be if ought be commit by ignor without the knowledg
of the congreg that all the congreg shall offer one young
bullock for a burnt offer for a sweet savour unto the lord with
hi meat offer and hi drink offer accord to the manner
and one kid of the goat for a sin offer
