the wilder of etham and pitch in marah

33:9 and they remov from marah and came unto elim: and in elim were
twelv fountain of water and threescor and ten palm trees; and they
pitch there

33:10 and they remov from elim and encamp by the red sea

33:11 and they remov from the red sea and encamp in the
wilder of sin

33:12 and they took their journey out of the wilder of sin and
encamp in dophkah

33:13 and they depart from dophkah and encamp in alush

33:14 and they remov from alush and encamp at rephidim where wa
no water for the peopl to drink

33:15 and they depart from rephidim and pitch in the wilder
of sinai

33:16 and they remov from the desert of sinai and pitch at
kibrothhattaavah

33:17 and they depart from kibrothhattaavah and encamp at
hazeroth

33:18 and they depart from hazeroth and pitch in rithmah

33:19 and they depart from rithmah and pitch at rimmonparez

33:20 and they depart from rimmonparez and pitch in libnah

33:21 and they remov from libnah and pitch at rissah

33:22 and they journey from rissah and pitch in kehelathah

33:23 and they went from kehelathah and pitch in mount shapher

33:24 and they remov from mount shapher and encamp in haradah

33:25 and they remov from haradah and pitch in makheloth

33:26 and they remov from makheloth and encamp at tahath

33:27 and they depart from tahath and pitch at tarah

33:28 and they remov from tarah and pitch in mithcah

33:29 and they went from mithcah and pitch in hashmonah

33:30 and they depart from hashmonah and encamp at moseroth

33:31 and they depart from moseroth and pitch in benejaakan

33:32 and they remov from benejaakan and encamp at horhagidgad

33:33 and they went from horhagidgad and pitch in jotbathah

33:34 and they remov from jotbathah and encamp at ebronah

33:35 and they depart from ebronah and encamp at eziongab

33:36 and they remov from eziongab and pitch in the wilder
of zin which is kadesh

33:37 and they remov from kadesh and pitch in mount hor in the
edg of the land of edom

33:38 and aaron the priest went up into mount hor at the command
of the lord and die there in the fortieth year after the children
of israel were come out of the land of egypt in the first day of the
fifth month

33:39 and aaron wa an hundr and twenti and three year old when he
die in mount hor

33:40 and king arad the canaanit which dwelt in the south in the
land of canaan heard of the come of the children of israel

33:41 and they depart from mount hor and pitch in zalmonah

33:42 and they depart from zalmonah and pitch in punon

33:43 and they depart from punon and pitch in oboth

33:44 and they depart from oboth and pitch in ijeabarim in the
border of moab

33:45 and they depart from iim and pitch in dibongad

33:46 and they remov from dibongad and encamp in almondiblathaim

33:47 and they remov from almondiblathaim and pitch in the
mountain of abarim befor nebo

33:48 and they depart from the mountain of abarim and pitch in
the plain of moab by jordan near jericho

33:49 and they pitch by jordan from bethjesimoth even unto
abelshittim in the plain of moab

33:50 and the lord spake unto mose in the plain of moab by jordan
near jericho say 33:51 speak unto the children of israel and say
unto them when ye are pass over jordan into the land of canaan;
33:52 then ye shall drive out all the inhabit of the land from
befor you and destroy all their pictur and destroy all their
molten imag and quit pluck down all their high places: 33:53 and
ye shall dispossess the inhabit of the land and dwell therein:
for i have given you the land to possess it

33:54 and ye shall divid the land by lot for an inherit among
your families: and to the more ye shall give the more inherit and
to the fewer ye shall give the less inheritance: everi man
inherit shall be in the place where hi lot falleth; accord to
the tribe of your father ye shall inherit

33:55 but if ye will not drive out the inhabit of the land from
befor you; then it shall come to pass that those which ye let remain
of them shall be prick in your eye and thorn in your side and
shall vex you in the land wherein ye dwell

33:56 moreov it shall come to pass that i shall do unto you as i
thought to do unto them

34:1 and the lord spake unto mose say 34:2 command the children
of israel and say unto them when ye come into the land of canaan;
(thi is the land that shall fall unto you for an inherit even
the land of canaan with the coast thereof:) 34:3 then your south
quarter shall be from the wilder of zin along by the coast of
edom and your south border shall be the outmost coast of the salt sea
eastward: 34:4 and your border shall turn from the south to the ascent
of akrabbim and pass on to zin: and the go forth thereof shall be
from the south to kadeshbarnea and shall go on to hazaraddar and
pass on to azmon: 34:5 and the border shall fetch a compass from azmon
unto the river of egypt and the go out of it shall be at the sea

34:6 and as for the western border ye shall even have the great sea
for a border: thi shall be your west border

34:7 and thi shall be your north border: from the great sea ye shall
point out for you mount hor: 34:8 from mount hor ye shall point out
your border unto the entranc of hamath; and the go forth of the
border shall be to zedad: 34:9 and the border shall go on to ziphron
and the go out of it shall be at hazarenan: thi shall be your
north border

34:10 and ye shall point out your east border from hazarenan to
shepham: 34:11 and the coast shall go down from shepham to riblah on
the east side of ain; and the border shall descend and shall reach
unto the side of the sea of chinnereth eastward: 34:12 and the border
shall go down to jordan and the go out of it shall be at the salt
sea: thi shall be your land with the coast thereof round about

34:13 and mose command the children of israel say thi is the
land which ye shall inherit by lot which the lord command to give
unto the nine tribe and to the half tribe: 34:14 for the tribe of
the children of reuben accord to the hous of their father and
the tribe of the children of gad accord to the hous of their
father have receiv their inheritance; and half the tribe of
manasseh have receiv their inheritance: 34:15 the two tribe and the
half tribe have receiv their inherit on thi side jordan near
jericho eastward toward the sunris

34:16 and the lord spake unto mose say 34:17 these are the name
of the men which shall divid the land unto you: eleazar the priest
and joshua the son of nun

34:18 and ye shall take one princ of everi tribe to divid the land
by inherit

34:19 and the name of the men are these: of the tribe of judah caleb
the son of jephunneh

34:20 and of the tribe of the children of simeon shemuel the son of
ammihud

34:21 of the tribe of benjamin elidad the son of chislon

34:22 and the princ of the tribe of the children of dan bukki the
son of jogli

34:23 the princ of the children of joseph for the tribe of the
children of manasseh hanniel the son of ephod

34:24 and the princ of the tribe of the children of ephraim kemuel
the son of shiphtan

34:25 and the princ of the tribe of the children of zebulun
elizaphan the son of parnach

34:26 and the princ of the tribe of the children of issachar paltiel
the son of azzan

34:27 and the princ of the tribe of the children of asher ahihud the
son of shelomi

34:28 and the princ of the tribe of the children of naphtali pedahel
the son of ammihud

34:29 these are they whom the lord command to divid the inherit
unto the children of israel in the land of canaan

35:1 and the lord spake unto mose in the plain of moab by jordan
near jericho say 35:2 command the children of israel that they
give unto the levit of the inherit of their possess citi to
dwell in; and ye shall give also unto the levit suburb for the
citi round about them

35:3 and the citi shall they have to dwell in; and the suburb of
them shall be for their cattl and for their good and for all their
beast

35:4 and the suburb of the citi which ye shall give unto the
levit shall reach from the wall of the citi and outward a thousand
cubit round about

35:5 and ye shall measur from without the citi on the east side two
thousand cubit and on the south side two thousand cubit and on the
west side two thousand cubit and on the north side two thousand
cubits; and the citi shall be in the midst: thi shall be to them the
suburb of the citi

35:6 and among the citi which ye shall give unto the levit there
shall be six citi for refug which ye shall appoint for the
manslay that he may flee thither: and to them ye shall add forti
and two citi

35:7 so all the citi which ye shall give to the levit shall be
forti and eight cities: them shall ye give with their suburb

35:8 and the citi which ye shall give shall be of the possess of
the children of israel: from them that have mani ye shall give many;
but from them that have few ye shall give few: everi one shall give of
hi citi unto the levit accord to hi inherit which he
inheriteth

35:9 and the lord spake unto mose say 35:10 speak unto the
children of israel and say unto them when ye be come over jordan
into the land of canaan; 35:11 then ye shall appoint you citi to be
citi of refug for you; that the slayer may flee thither which
killeth ani person at unawar

35:12 and they shall be unto you citi for refug from the avenger;
that the manslay die not until he stand befor the congreg in
judgment

35:13 and of these citi which ye shall give six citi shall ye have
for refug

35:14 ye shall give three citi on thi side jordan and three citi
shall ye give in the land of canaan which shall be citi of refug

35:15 these six citi shall be a refug both for the children of
israel and for the stranger and for the sojourn among them: that
everi one that killeth ani person unawar may flee thither

35:16 and if he smite him with an instrument of iron so that he die
he is a murderer: the murder shall sure be put to death

35:17 and if he smite him with throw a stone wherewith he may die
and he die he is a murderer: the murder shall sure be put to
death

35:18 or if he smite him with an hand weapon of wood wherewith he may
die and he die he is a murderer: the murder shall sure be put to
death

35:19 the reveng of blood himself shall slay the murderer: when he
meeteth him he shall slay him

35:20 but if he thrust him of hatr or hurl at him by lay of
wait that he die; 35:21 or in enmiti smite him with hi hand that he
die: he that smote him shall sure be put to death; for he is a
murderer: the reveng of blood shall slay the murder when he
meeteth him

35:22 but if he thrust him suddenli without enmiti or have cast upon
him ani thing without lay of wait 35:23 or with ani stone
wherewith a man may die see him not and cast it upon him that he
die and wa not hi enemi neither sought hi harm: 35:24 then the
congreg shall judg between the slayer and the reveng of blood
accord to these judgments: 35:25 and the congreg shall deliv
the slayer out of the hand of the reveng of blood and the
congreg shall restor him to the citi of hi refug whither he
wa fled: and he shall abid in it unto the death of the high priest
which wa anoint with the holi oil

35:26 but if the slayer shall at ani time come without the border of
the citi of hi refug whither he wa fled; 35:27 and the reveng of
blood find him without the border of the citi of hi refug and the
reveng of blood kill the slayer; he shall not be guilti of blood:
35:28 becaus he should have remain in the citi of hi refug until
the death of the high priest: but after the death of the high priest
the slayer shall return into the land of hi possess

35:29 so these thing shall be for a statut of judgment unto you
throughout your gener in all your dwell

35:30 whoso killeth ani person the murder shall be put to death by
the mouth of witnesses: but one wit shall not testifi against ani
person to caus him to die

35:31 moreov ye shall take no satisfact for the life of a
murder which is guilti of death: but he shall be sure put to
death

35:32 and ye shall take no satisfact for him that is fled to the
citi of hi refug that he should come again to dwell in the land
until the death of the priest

35:33 so ye shall not pollut the land wherein ye are: for blood it
defileth the land: and the land cannot be cleans of the blood that
is shed therein but by the blood of him that shed it

35:34 defil not therefor the land which ye shall inhabit wherein i
dwell: for i the lord dwell among the children of israel

36:1 and the chief father of the famili of the children of gilead
the son of machir the son of manasseh of the famili of the son of
joseph came near and spake befor mose and befor the princ the
chief father of the children of israel: 36:2 and they said the lord
command my lord to give the land for an inherit by lot to the
children of israel: and my lord wa command by the lord to give the
inherit of zelophehad our brother unto hi daughter

36:3 and if they be marri to ani of the son of the other tribe of
the children of israel then shall their inherit be taken from the
inherit of our father and shall be put to the inherit of the
tribe whereunto they are received: so shall it be taken from the lot
of our inherit

36:4 and when the jubil of the children of israel shall be then
shall their inherit be put unto the inherit of the tribe
whereunto they are received: so shall their inherit be taken away
from the inherit of the tribe of our father

36:5 and mose command the children of israel accord to the word
of the lord say the tribe of the son of joseph hath said well

36:6 thi is the thing which the lord doth command concern the
daughter of zelophehad say let them marri to whom they think
best; onli to the famili of the tribe of their father shall they
marri

36:7 so shall not the inherit of the children of israel remov
from tribe to tribe: for everi one of the children of israel shall
keep himself to the inherit of the tribe of hi father

36:8 and everi daughter that possesseth an inherit in ani tribe
of the children of israel shall be wife unto one of the famili of the
tribe of her father that the children of israel may enjoy everi man
the inherit of hi father

36:9 neither shall the inherit remov from one tribe to anoth
tribe; but everi one of the tribe of the children of israel shall
keep himself to hi own inherit

36:10 even as the lord command mose so did the daughter of
zelophehad: 36:11 for mahlah tirzah and hoglah and milcah and
noah the daughter of zelophehad were marri unto their father
brother sons: 36:12 and they were marri into the famili of the
son of manasseh the son of joseph and their inherit remain in
the tribe of the famili of their father

36:13 these are the command and the judgment which the lord
command by the hand of mose unto the children of israel in the
plain of moab by jordan near jericho




the fifth book of moses: call deuteronomi


1:1 these be the word which mose spake unto all israel on thi side
jordan in the wilder in the plain over against the red sea
between paran and tophel and laban and hazeroth and dizahab

1:2 (there are eleven day journey from horeb by the way of mount
seir unto kadeshbarnea) 1:3 and it came to pass in the fortieth
year in the eleventh month on the first day of the month that mose
spake unto the children of israel accord unto all that the lord
had given him in command unto them; 1:4 after he had slain sihon
the king of the amorit which dwelt in heshbon and og the king of
bashan which dwelt at astaroth in edrei: 1:5 on thi side jordan in
the land of moab began mose to declar thi law say 1:6 the
lord our god spake unto us in horeb say ye have dwelt long enough
in thi mount: 1:7 turn you and take your journey and go to the
mount of the amorit and unto all the place nigh thereunto in the
plain in the hill and in the vale and in the south and by the sea
side to the land of the canaanit and unto lebanon unto the great
river the river euphrat

1:8 behold i have set the land befor you: go in and possess the land
which the lord sware unto your father abraham isaac and jacob to
give unto them and to their seed after them

1:9 and i spake unto you at that time say i am not abl to bear
you myself alone: 1:10 the lord your god hath multipli you and
behold ye are thi day as the star of heaven for multitud

1:11 (the lord god of your father make you a thousand time so mani
more as ye are and bless you as he hath promis you!) 1:12 how can
i myself alon bear your cumbranc and your burden and your strife?
1:13 take you wise men and understand and known among your
tribe and i will make them ruler over you

1:14 and ye answer me and said the thing which thou hast spoken is
good for us to do

1:15 so i took the chief of your tribe wise men and known and made
them head over you captain over thousand and captain over
hundr and captain over fifti and captain over ten and
offic among your tribe

1:16 and i charg your judg at that time say hear the caus
between your brethren and judg righteous between everi man and hi
brother and the stranger that is with him

1:17 ye shall not respect person in judgment; but ye shall hear the
small as well as the great; ye shall not be afraid of the face of man;
for the judgment is gods: and the caus that is too hard for you
bring it unto me and i will hear it

1:18 and i command you at that time all the thing which ye should
do

1:19 and when we depart from horeb we went through all that great
and terribl wilder which ye saw by the way of the mountain of
the amorit as the lord our god command us; and we came to
kadeshbarnea

1:20 and i said unto you ye are come unto the mountain of the
amorit which the lord our god doth give unto us

1:21 behold the lord thi god hath set the land befor thee: go up and
possess it as the lord god of thi father hath said unto thee; fear
not neither be discourag

1:22 and ye came near unto me everi one of you and said we will send
men befor us and they shall search us out the land and bring us
word again by what way we must go up and into what citi we shall
come

1:23 and the say pleas me well: and i took twelv men of you one
of a tribe: 1:24 and they turn and went up into the mountain and
came unto the valley of eshcol and search it out

1:25 and they took of the fruit of the land in their hand and
brought it down unto us and brought us word again and said it is a
good land which the lord our god doth give us

1:26 notwithstand ye would not go up but rebel against the
command of the lord your god: 1:27 and ye murmur in your tent
and said becaus the lord hate us he hath brought us forth out of
the land of egypt to deliv us into the hand of the amorit to
destroy us

1:28 whither shall we go up? our brethren have discourag our heart
say the peopl is greater and taller than we; the citi are great
and wall up to heaven; and moreov we have seen the son of the
anakim there

1:29 then i said unto you dread not neither be afraid of them

1:30 the lord your god which goeth befor you he shall fight for you
accord to all that he did for you in egypt befor your eyes; 1:31
and in the wilder where thou hast seen how that the lord thi god
bare thee as a man doth bear hi son in all the way that ye went
until ye came into thi place

1:32 yet in thi thing ye did not believ the lord your god 1:33 who
went in the way befor you to search you out a place to pitch your
tent in in fire by night to shew you by what way ye should go and
in a cloud by day

1:34 and the lord heard the voic of your word and wa wroth and
sware say 1:35 sure there shall not one of these men of thi
evil gener see that good land which i sware to give unto your
father

1:36 save caleb the son of jephunneh; he shall see it and to him will
i give the land that he hath trodden upon and to hi children
becaus he hath wholli follow the lord

1:37 also the lord wa angri with me for your sake say thou also
shalt not go in thither

1:38 but joshua the son of nun which standeth befor thee he shall
go in thither: encourag him: for he shall caus israel to inherit it

1:39 moreov your littl one which ye said should be a prey and
your children which in that day had no knowledg between good and
evil they shall go in thither and unto them will i give it and they
shall possess it

1:40 but as for you turn you and take your journey into the
wilder by the way of the red sea

1:41 then ye answer and said unto me we have sin against the
lord we will go up and fight accord to all that the lord our god
command us

and when ye had gird on everi man hi weapon of war ye were readi
to go up into the hill

1:42 and the lord said unto me say unto them go not up neither
fight; for i am not among you; lest ye be smitten befor your enemi

1:43 so i spake unto you; and ye would not hear but rebel against
the command of the lord and went presumptu up into the hill

1:44 and the amorit which dwelt in that mountain came out against
you and chase you as bee do and destroy you in seir even unto
hormah

1:45 and ye return and wept befor the lord; but the lord would not
hearken to your voic nor give ear unto you

1:46 so ye abod in kadesh mani day accord unto the day that ye
abod there

2:1 then we turn and took our journey into the wilder by the
way of the red sea as the lord spake unto me: and we compass mount
seir mani day

2:2 and the lord spake unto me say 2:3 ye have compass thi
mountain long enough: turn you northward

2:4 and command thou the peopl say ye are to pass through the
coast of your brethren the children of esau which dwell in seir; and
they shall be afraid of you: take ye good heed unto yourselv
therefore: 2:5 meddl not with them; for i will not give you of their
land no not so much as a foot breadth; becaus i have given mount
seir unto esau for a possess

2:6 ye shall buy meat of them for money that ye may eat; and ye shall
also buy water of them for money that ye may drink

2:7 for the lord thi god hath bless thee in all the work of thi
hand: he knoweth thi walk through thi great wilderness: these
forti year the lord thi god hath been with thee; thou hast lack
noth

2:8 and when we pass by from our brethren the children of esau
which dwelt in seir through the way of the plain from elath and from
eziongab we turn and pass by the way of the wilder of moab

2:9 and the lord said unto me distress not the moabit neither
contend with them in battle: for i will not give thee of their land
for a possession; becaus i have given ar unto the children of lot for
a possess

2:10 the emim dwelt therein in time past a peopl great and mani
and tall as the anakims; 2:11 which also were account giant as
the anakims; but the moabit call them emim

2:12 the horim also dwelt in seir beforetime; but the children of
esau succeed them when they had destroy them from befor them
and dwelt in their stead; as israel did unto the land of hi
possess which the lord gave unto them

2:13 now rise up said i and get you over the brook zere and we
went over the brook zere

2:14 and the space in which we came from kadeshbarnea until we were
come over the brook zere wa thirti and eight years; until all the
gener of the men of war were wast out from among the host as
the lord sware unto them

2:15 for inde the hand of the lord wa against them to destroy them
from among the host until they were consum

2:16 so it came to pass when all the men of war were consum and
dead from among the peopl 2:17 that the lord spake unto me say
2:18 thou art to pass over through ar the coast of moab thi day:
2:19 and when thou comest nigh over against the children of ammon
distress them not nor meddl with them: for i will not give thee of
the land of the children of ammon ani possession; becaus i have given
it unto the children of lot for a possess

2:20 (that also wa account a land of giants: giant dwelt therein
in old time; and the ammonit call them zamzummims; 2:21 a peopl
great and mani and tall as the anakims; but the lord destroy them
befor them; and they succeed them and dwelt in their stead: 2:22
as he did to the children of esau which dwelt in seir when he
destroy the horim from befor them; and they succeed them and
dwelt in their stead even unto thi day: 2:23 and the avim which
dwelt in hazerim even unto azzah the caphtorim which came forth
out of caphtor destroy them and dwelt in their stead) 2:24 rise
ye up take your journey and pass over the river arnon: behold i
have given into thine hand sihon the amorit king of heshbon and hi
land: begin to possess it and contend with him in battl

2:25 thi day will i begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of
thee upon the nation that are under the whole heaven who shall hear
report of thee and shall trembl and be in anguish becaus of thee

2:26 and i sent messeng out of the wilder of kedemoth unto
sihon king of heshbon with word of peac say 2:27 let me pass
through thi land: i will go along by the high way i will neither turn
unto the right hand nor to the left

2:28 thou shalt sell me meat for money that i may eat; and give me
water for money that i may drink: onli i will pass through on my
feet; 2:29 (a the children of esau which dwell in seir and the
moabit which dwell in ar did unto me;) until i shall pass over
jordan into the land which the lord our god giveth us

2:30 but sihon king of heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the
lord thi god harden hi spirit and made hi heart obstin that
he might deliv him into thi hand as appeareth thi day

2:31 and the lord said unto me behold i have begun to give sihon and
hi land befor thee: begin to possess that thou mayest inherit hi
land

2:32 then sihon came out against us he and all hi peopl to fight
at jahaz

2:33 and the lord our god deliv him befor us; and we smote him
and hi son and all hi peopl

2:34 and we took all hi citi at that time and utterli destroy
the men and the women and the littl one of everi citi we left
none to remain: 2:35 onli the cattl we took for a prey unto
ourselv and the spoil of the citi which we took

2:36 from aroer which is by the brink of the river of arnon and from
the citi that is by the river even unto gilead there wa not one
citi too strong for us: the lord our god deliv all unto us: 2:37
onli unto the land of the children of ammon thou camest not nor unto
ani place of the river jabbok nor unto the citi in the mountain
nor unto whatsoev the lord our god forbad us

3:1 then we turn and went up the way to bashan: and og the king of
bashan came out against us he and all hi peopl to battl at edrei

3:2 and the lord said unto me fear him not: for i will deliv him
and all hi peopl and hi land into thi hand; and thou shalt do
unto him as thou didst unto sihon king of the amorit which dwelt at
heshbon

3:3 so the lord our god deliv into our hand og also the king of
bashan and all hi people: and we smote him until none wa left to
him remain

3:4 and we took all hi citi at that time there wa not a citi
which we took not from them threescor citi all the region of
argob the kingdom of og in bashan

3:5 all these citi were fenc with high wall gate and bars;
besid unwal town a great mani

3:6 and we utterli destroy them as we did unto sihon king of
heshbon utterli destroy the men women and children of everi
citi

3:7 but all the cattl and the spoil of the citi we took for a
prey to ourselv

3:8 and we took at that time out of the hand of the two king of the
amorit the land that wa on thi side jordan from the river of
arnon unto mount hermon; 3:9 (which hermon the sidonian call sirion;
and the amorit call it shenir;) 3:10 all the citi of the plain
and all gilead and all bashan unto salchah and edrei citi of the
kingdom of og in bashan

3:11 for onli og king of bashan remain of the remnant of giants;
behold hi bedstead wa a bedstead of iron; is it not in rabbath of
the children of ammon? nine cubit wa the length thereof and four
cubit the breadth of it after the cubit of a man

3:12 and thi land which we possess at that time from aroer which
is by the river arnon and half mount gilead and the citi thereof
gave i unto the reubenit and to the gadit

3:13 and the rest of gilead and all bashan be the kingdom of og
gave i unto the half tribe of manasseh; all the region of argob with
all bashan which wa call the land of giant

3:14 jair the son of manasseh took all the countri of argob unto the
coast of geshuri and maachathi; and call them after hi own name
bashanhavothjair unto thi day

3:15 and i gave gilead unto machir

3:16 and unto the reubenit and unto the gadit i gave from gilead
even unto the river arnon half the valley and the border even unto
the river jabbok which is the border of the children of ammon; 3:17
the plain also and jordan and the coast thereof from chinnereth
even unto the sea of the plain even the salt sea under ashdothpisgah
eastward

3:18 and i command you at that time say the lord your god hath
given you thi land to possess it: ye shall pass over arm befor
your brethren the children of israel all that are meet for the war

3:19 but your wive and your littl one and your cattl (for i
know that ye have much cattle) shall abid in your citi which i
have given you; 3:20 until the lord have given rest unto your
brethren as well as unto you and until they also possess the land
which the lord your god hath given them beyond jordan: and then shall
ye return everi man unto hi possess which i have given you

3:21 and i command joshua at that time say thine eye have seen
all that the lord your god hath done unto these two kings: so shall
the lord do unto all the kingdom whither thou passest

3:22 ye shall not fear them: for the lord your god he shall fight for
you

3:23 and i besought the lord at that time say 3:24 o lord god
thou hast begun to shew thi servant thi great and thi mighti
hand: for what god is there in heaven or in earth that can do
accord to thi work and accord to thi might? 3:25 i pray thee
let me go over and see the good land that is beyond jordan that
goodli mountain and lebanon

3:26 but the lord wa wroth with me for your sake and would not hear
me: and the lord said unto me let it suffic thee; speak no more unto
me of thi matter

3:27 get thee up into the top of pisgah and lift up thine eye
westward and northward and southward and eastward and behold it
with thine eyes: for thou shalt not go over thi jordan

3:28 but charg joshua and encourag him and strengthen him: for he
shall go over befor thi peopl and he shall caus them to inherit
the land which thou shalt see

3:29 so we abod in the valley over against bethpeor

4:1 now therefor hearken o israel unto the statut and unto the
judgment which i teach you for to do them that ye may live and go
in and possess the land which the lord god of your father giveth you

4:2 ye shall not add unto the word which i command you neither shall
ye diminish ought from it that ye may keep the command of the
lord your god which i command you

4:3 your eye have seen what the lord did becaus of baalpeor: for all
the men that follow baalpeor the lord thi god hath destroy them
from among you

4:4 but ye that did cleav unto the lord your god are aliv everi one
of you thi day

4:5 behold i have taught you statut and judgment even as the lord
my god command me that ye should do so in the land whither ye go to
possess it

4:6 keep therefor and do them; for thi is your wisdom and your
understand in the sight of the nation which shall hear all these
statut and say sure thi great nation is a wise and
understand peopl

4:7 for what nation is there so great who hath god so nigh unto them
as the lord our god is in all thing that we call upon him for? 4:8
and what nation is there so great that hath statut and judgment so
righteou as all thi law which i set befor you thi day? 4:9 onli
take heed to thyself and keep thi soul dilig lest thou forget
the thing which thine eye have seen and lest they depart from thi
heart all the day of thi life: but teach them thi son and thi son
sons; 4:10 special the day that thou stoodest befor the lord thi
god in horeb when the lord said unto me gather me the peopl
togeth and i will make them hear my word that they may learn to
fear me all the day that they shall live upon the earth and that
they may teach their children

4:11 and ye came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain
burn with fire unto the midst of heaven with dark cloud and
thick dark

4:12 and the lord spake unto you out of the midst of the fire: ye
heard the voic of the word but saw no similitude; onli ye heard a
voic

4:13 and he declar unto you hi coven which he command you to
perform even ten commandments; and he wrote them upon two tabl of
stone

4:14 and the lord command me at that time to teach you statut and
judgment that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to
possess it

4:15 take ye therefor good heed unto yourselves; for ye saw no manner
of similitud on the day that the lord spake unto you in horeb out of
the midst of the fire: 4:16 lest ye corrupt yourselv and make you a
graven imag the similitud of ani figur the like of male or
femal 4:17 the like of ani beast that is on the earth the
like of ani wing fowl that flieth in the air 4:18 the like
of ani thing that creepeth on the ground the like of ani fish
that is in the water beneath the earth: 4:19 and lest thou lift up
thine eye unto heaven and when thou seest the sun and the moon and
the star even all the host of heaven shouldest be driven to worship
them and serv them which the lord thi god hath divid unto all
nation under the whole heaven

4:20 but the lord hath taken you and brought you forth out of the
iron furnac even out of egypt to be unto him a peopl of
inherit as ye are thi day

4:21 furthermor the lord wa angri with me for your sake and sware
that i should not go over jordan and that i should not go in unto
that good land which the lord thi god giveth thee for an inheritance:
4:22 but i must die in thi land i must not go over jordan: but ye
shall go over and possess that good land

4:23 take heed unto yourselv lest ye forget the coven of the
lord your god which he made with you and make you a graven imag or
the like of ani thing which the lord thi god hath forbidden thee

4:24 for the lord thi god is a consum fire even a jealou god

4:25 when thou shalt beget children and children children and ye
shall have remain long in the land and shall corrupt yourselv
and make a graven imag or the like of ani thing and shall do
evil in the sight of the lord thi god to provok him to anger: 4:26 i
call heaven and earth to wit against you thi day that ye shall
soon utterli perish from off the land whereunto ye go over jordan to
possess it; ye shall not prolong your day upon it but shall utterli
be destroy

4:27 and the lord shall scatter you among the nation and ye shall be
left few in number among the heathen whither the lord shall lead you

4:28 and there ye shall serv god the work of men hand wood and
stone which neither see nor hear nor eat nor smell

4:29 but if from thenc thou shalt seek the lord thi god thou shalt
find him if thou seek him with all thi heart and with all thi soul

4:30 when thou art in tribul and all these thing are come upon
thee even in the latter day if thou turn to the lord thi god and
shalt be obedi unto hi voice; 4:31 (for the lord thi god is a
merci god;) he will not forsak thee neither destroy thee nor
forget the coven of thi father which he sware unto them

4:32 for ask now of the day that are past which were befor thee
sinc the day that god creat man upon the earth and ask from the
one side of heaven unto the other whether there hath been ani such
thing as thi great thing is or hath been heard like it? 4:33 did
ever peopl hear the voic of god speak out of the midst of the
fire as thou hast heard and live? 4:34 or hath god assay to go
and take him a nation from the midst of anoth nation by
temptat by sign and by wonder and by war and by a mighti
hand and by a stretch out arm and by great terror accord to
all that the lord your god did for you in egypt befor your eyes?
4:35 unto thee it wa shew that thou mightest know that the lord he
is god; there is none els besid him

4:36 out of heaven he made thee to hear hi voic that he might
instruct thee: and upon earth he shew thee hi great fire; and thou
heardest hi word out of the midst of the fire

4:37 and becaus he love thi father therefor he chose their seed
after them and brought thee out in hi sight with hi mighti power
out of egypt; 4:38 to drive out nation from befor thee greater and
mightier than thou art to bring thee in to give thee their land for
an inherit as it is thi day

4:39 know therefor thi day and consid it in thine heart that the
lord he is god in heaven abov and upon the earth beneath: there is
none els

4:40 thou shalt keep therefor hi statut and hi command
which i command thee thi day that it may go well with thee and with
thi children after thee and that thou mayest prolong thi day upon
the earth which the lord thi god giveth thee for ever

4:41 then mose sever three citi on thi side jordan toward the
sunrising; 4:42 that the slayer might flee thither which should kill
hi neighbour unawar and hate him not in time past; and that
flee unto one of these citi he might live: 4:43 name bezer in
the wilder in the plain countri of the reubenites; and ramoth in
gilead of the gadites; and golan in bashan of the manassit

4:44 and thi is the law which mose set befor the children of
israel: 4:45 these are the testimoni and the statut and the
judgment which mose spake unto the children of israel after they
came forth out of egypt

4:46 on thi side jordan in the valley over against bethpeor in the
land of sihon king of the amorit who dwelt at heshbon whom mose
and the children of israel smote after they were come forth out of
egypt: 4:47 and they possess hi land and the land of og king of
bashan two king of the amorit which were on thi side jordan
toward the sunrising; 4:48 from aroer which is by the bank of the
river arnon even unto mount sion which is hermon 4:49 and all the
plain on thi side jordan eastward even unto the sea of the plain
under the spring of pisgah

5:1 and mose call all israel and said unto them hear o israel
the statut and judgment which i speak in your ear thi day that
ye may learn them and keep and do them

5:2 the lord our god made a coven with us in horeb

5:3 the lord made not thi coven with our father but with us
even us who are all of us here aliv thi day

5:4 the lord talk with you face to face in the mount out of the
midst of the fire 5:5 (i stood between the lord and you at that time
to shew you the word of the lord: for ye were afraid by reason of the
fire and went not up into the mount;) say 5:6 i am the lord thi
god which brought thee out of the land of egypt from the hous of
bondag

5:7 thou shalt have none other god befor me

5:8 thou shalt not make thee ani graven imag or ani like of ani
thing that is in heaven abov or that is in the earth beneath or
that is in the water beneath the earth: 5:9 thou shalt not bow down
thyself unto them nor serv them: for i the lord thi god am a jealou
god visit the iniqu of the father upon the children unto the
third and fourth gener of them that hate me 5:10 and shew
merci unto thousand of them that love me and keep my command

5:11 thou shalt not take the name of the lord thi god in vain: for the
lord will not hold him guiltless that taketh hi name in vain

5:12 keep the sabbath day to sanctifi it as the lord thi god hath
command thee

5:13 six day thou shalt labour and do all thi work: 5:14 but the
seventh day is the sabbath of the lord thi god: in it thou shalt not
do ani work thou nor thi son nor thi daughter nor thi manserv
nor thi maidserv nor thine ox nor thine ass nor ani of thi
cattl nor thi stranger that is within thi gates; that thi manserv
and thi maidserv may rest as well as thou

5:15 and rememb that thou wast a servant in the land of egypt and
that the lord thi god brought thee out thenc through a mighti hand
and by a stretch out arm: therefor the lord thi god command thee
to keep the sabbath day

5:16 honour thi father and thi mother as the lord thi god hath
command thee; that thi day may be prolong and that it may go
well with thee in the land which the lord thi god giveth thee

5:17 thou shalt not kill

5:18 neither shalt thou commit adulteri

5:19 neither shalt thou steal

5:20 neither shalt thou bear fals wit against thi neighbour

5:21 neither shalt thou desir thi neighbour wife neither shalt
thou covet thi neighbour hous hi field or hi manserv or hi
maidserv hi ox or hi ass or ani thing that is thi neighbour

5:22 these word the lord spake unto all your assembl in the mount
out of the midst of the fire of the cloud and of the thick dark
with a great voice: and he ad no more and he wrote them in two
tabl of stone and deliv them unto me

5:23 and it came to pass when ye heard the voic out of the midst of
the dark (for the mountain did burn with fire) that ye came near
unto me even all the head of your tribe and your elders; 5:24 and
ye said behold the lord our god hath shew us hi glori and hi
great and we have heard hi voic out of the midst of the fire:
we have seen thi day that god doth talk with man and he liveth

5:25 now therefor whi should we die? for thi great fire will consum
us: if we hear the voic of the lord our god ani more then we shall
die

5:26 for who is there of all flesh that hath heard the voic of the
live god speak out of the midst of the fire as we have and
lived? 5:27 go thou near and hear all that the lord our god shall
say: and speak thou unto us all that the lord our god shall speak unto
thee; and we will hear it and do it

5:28 and the lord heard the voic of your word when ye spake unto
me; and the lord said unto me i have heard the voic of the word of
thi peopl which they have spoken unto thee: they have well said all
that they have spoken

5:29 o that there were such an heart in them that they would fear me
and keep all my command alway that it might be well with them
and with their children for ever! 5:30 go say to them get you into
your tent again

5:31 but as for thee stand thou here by me and i will speak unto
thee all the command and the statut and the judgment which
thou shalt teach them that they may do them in the land which i give
them to possess it

5:32 ye shall observ to do therefor as the lord your god hath
command you: ye shall not turn asid to the right hand or to the
left

5:33 ye shall walk in all the way which the lord your god hath
command you that ye may live and that it may be well with you and
that ye may prolong your day in the land which ye shall possess

6:1 now these are the command the statut and the judgment
which the lord your god command to teach you that ye might do them
in the land whither ye go to possess it: 6:2 that thou mightest fear
the lord thi god to keep all hi statut and hi command which
i command thee thou and thi son and thi son son all the day of
thi life; and that thi day may be prolong

6:3 hear therefor o israel and observ to do it; that it may be
well with thee and that ye may increas mightili as the lord god of
thi father hath promis thee in the land that floweth with milk and
honey

6:4 hear o israel: the lord our god is one lord: 6:5 and thou shalt
love the lord thi god with all thine heart and with all thi soul and
with all thi might

6:6 and these word which i command thee thi day shall be in thine
heart: 6:7 and thou shalt teach them dilig unto thi children and
shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thine hous and when thou
walkest by the way and when thou liest down and when thou risest up

6:8 and thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thine hand and they
shall be as frontlet between thine eye

6:9 and thou shalt write them upon the post of thi hous and on thi
gate

6:10 and it shall be when the lord thi god shall have brought thee
into the land which he sware unto thi father to abraham to isaac
and to jacob to give thee great and goodli citi which thou
buildedst not 6:11 and hous full of all good thing which thou
filledst not and well dig which thou diggedst not vineyard and
oliv tree which thou plantedst not; when thou shalt have eaten and
be full; 6:12 then bewar lest thou forget the lord which brought
thee forth out of the land of egypt from the hous of bondag

6:13 thou shalt fear the lord thi god and serv him and shalt swear
by hi name

6:14 ye shall not go after other god of the god of the peopl which
are round about you; 6:15 (for the lord thi god is a jealou god among
you) lest the anger of the lord thi god be kindl against thee and
destroy thee from off the face of the earth

6:16 ye shall not tempt the lord your god as ye tempt him in
massah

6:17 ye shall dilig keep the command of the lord your god
and hi testimoni and hi statut which he hath command thee

6:18 and thou shalt do that which is right and good in the sight of
the lord: that it may be well with thee and that thou mayest go in
and possess the good land which the lord sware unto thi father

6:19 to cast out all thine enemi from befor thee as the lord hath
spoken

6:20 and when thi son asketh thee in time to come say what mean
the testimoni and the statut and the judgment which the lord
our god hath command you? 6:21 then thou shalt say unto thi son we
were pharaoh bondmen in egypt; and the lord brought us out of egypt
with a mighti hand: 6:22 and the lord shew sign and wonder great
and sore upon egypt upon pharaoh and upon all hi household befor
our eyes: 6:23 and he brought us out from thenc that he might bring
us in to give us the land which he sware unto our father

6:24 and the lord command us to do all these statut to fear the
lord our god for our good alway that he might preserv us aliv as
it is at thi day

6:25 and it shall be our righteous if we observ to do all these
command befor the lord our god as he hath command us

7:1 when the lord thi god shall bring thee into the land whither thou
goest to possess it and hath cast out mani nation befor thee the
hittit and the girgashit and the amorit and the canaanit
and the perizzit and the hivit and the jebusit seven nation
greater and mightier than thou; 7:2 and when the lord thi god shall
deliv them befor thee; thou shalt smite them and utterli destroy
them; thou shalt make no coven with them nor shew merci unto them:
7:3 neither shalt thou make marriag with them; thi daughter thou
shalt not give unto hi son nor hi daughter shalt thou take unto thi
son

7:4 for they will turn away thi son from follow me that they may
serv other gods: so will the anger of the lord be kindl against
you and destroy thee suddenli

7:5 but thu shall ye deal with them; ye shall destroy their altar
and break down their imag and cut down their grove and burn their
graven imag with fire

7:6 for thou art an holi peopl unto the lord thi god: the lord thi
god hath chosen thee to be a special peopl unto himself abov all
peopl that are upon the face of the earth

7:7 the lord did not set hi love upon you nor choos you becaus ye
were more in number than ani people; for ye were the fewest of all
people: 7:8 but becaus the lord love you and becaus he would keep
the oath which he had sworn unto your father hath the lord brought
you out with a mighti hand and redeem you out of the hous of
bondmen from the hand of pharaoh king of egypt

7:9 know therefor that the lord thi god he is god the faith god
which keepeth coven and merci with them that love him and keep hi
command to a thousand generations; 7:10 and repayeth them that
hate him to their face to destroy them: he will not be slack to him
that hateth him he will repay him to hi face

7:11 thou shalt therefor keep the command and the statut and
the judgment which i command thee thi day to do them

7:12 wherefor it shall come to pass if ye hearken to these
judgment and keep and do them that the lord thi god shall keep
unto thee the coven and the merci which he sware unto thi fathers:
7:13 and he will love thee and bless thee and multipli thee: he will
also bless the fruit of thi womb and the fruit of thi land thi corn
and thi wine and thine oil the increas of thi kine and the flock
of thi sheep in the land which he sware unto thi father to give
thee

7:14 thou shalt be bless abov all people: there shall not be male
or femal barren among you or among your cattl

7:15 and the lord will take away from thee all sick and will put
none of the evil diseas of egypt which thou knowest upon thee; but
will lay them upon all them that hate thee

7:16 and thou shalt consum all the peopl which the lord thi god
shall deliv thee; thine eye shall have no piti upon them: neither
shalt thou serv their gods; for that will be a snare unto thee

7:17 if thou shalt say in thine heart these nation are more than i;
how can i dispossess them? 7:18 thou shalt not be afraid of them: but
shalt well rememb what the lord thi god did unto pharaoh and unto
all egypt; 7:19 the great temptat which thine eye saw and the
sign and the wonder and the mighti hand and the stretch out
arm wherebi the lord thi god brought thee out: so shall the lord thi
god do unto all the peopl of whom thou art afraid

7:20 moreov the lord thi god will send the hornet among them until
they that are left and hide themselv from thee be destroy

7:21 thou shalt not be affright at them: for the lord thi god is
among you a mighti god and terribl

7:22 and the lord thi god will put out those nation befor thee by
littl and little: thou mayest not consum them at onc lest the
beast of the field increas upon thee

7:23 but the lord thi god shall deliv them unto thee and shall
destroy them with a mighti destruct until they be destroy

7:24 and he shall deliv their king into thine hand and thou shalt
destroy their name from under heaven: there shall no man be abl to
stand befor thee until thou have destroy them

7:25 the graven imag of their god shall ye burn with fire: thou
shalt not desir the silver or gold that is on them nor take it unto
thee lest thou be snare therin: for it is an abomin to the lord
thi god

7:26 neither shalt thou bring an abomin into thine hous lest
thou be a curs thing like it: but thou shalt utterli detest it and
thou shalt utterli abhor it; for it is a curs thing

8:1 all the command which i command thee thi day shall ye
observ to do that ye may live and multipli and go in and possess
the land which the lord sware unto your father

8:2 and thou shalt rememb all the way which the lord thi god led
thee these forti year in the wilder to humbl thee and to prove
thee to know what wa in thine heart whether thou wouldest keep hi
command or no

8:3 and he humbl thee and suffer thee to hunger and fed thee
with manna which thou knewest not neither did thi father know; that
he might make thee know that man doth not live by bread onli but by
everi word that proceedeth out of the mouth of the lord doth man live

8:4 thi raiment wax not old upon thee neither did thi foot swell
these forti year

8:5 thou shalt also consid in thine heart that as a man chasteneth
hi son so the lord thi god chasteneth thee

8:6 therefor thou shalt keep the command of the lord thi god to
walk in hi way and to fear him

8:7 for the lord thi god bringeth thee into a good land a land of
brook of water of fountain and depth that spring out of valley
and hills; 8:8 a land of wheat and barley and vine and fig tree
and pomegranates; a land of oil oliv and honey; 8:9 a land wherein
thou shalt eat bread without scarc thou shalt not lack ani thing
in it; a land whose stone are iron and out of whose hill thou
mayest dig brass

8:10 when thou hast eaten and art full then thou shalt bless the lord
thi god for the good land which he hath given thee

8:11 bewar that thou forget not the lord thi god in not keep hi
command and hi judgment and hi statut which i command
thee thi day: 8:12 lest when thou hast eaten and art full and hast
built goodli hous and dwelt therein; 8:13 and when thi herd and
thi flock multipli and thi silver and thi gold is multipli and
all that thou hast is multiplied; 8:14 then thine heart be lift up
and thou forget the lord thi god which brought thee forth out of the
land of egypt from the hous of bondage; 8:15 who led thee through
that great and terribl wilder wherein were fieri serpent and
scorpion and drought where there wa no water; who brought thee
forth water out of the rock of flint; 8:16 who fed thee in the
wilder with manna which thi father knew not that he might
humbl thee and that he might prove thee to do thee good at thi
latter end; 8:17 and thou say in thine heart my power and the might
of mine hand hath gotten me thi wealth

8:18 but thou shalt rememb the lord thi god: for it is he that
giveth thee power to get wealth that he may establish hi coven
which he sware unto thi father as it is thi day

8:19 and it shall be if thou do at all forget the lord thi god and
walk after other god and serv them and worship them i testifi
against you thi day that ye shall sure perish

8:20 as the nation which the lord destroyeth befor your face so
shall ye perish; becaus ye would not be obedi unto the voic of
the lord your god

9:1 hear o israel: thou art to pass over jordan thi day to go in to
possess nation greater and mightier than thyself citi great and
fenc up to heaven 9:2 a peopl great and tall the children of the
anakim whom thou knowest and of whom thou hast heard say who can
stand befor the children of anak! 9:3 understand therefor thi day
that the lord thi god is he which goeth over befor thee; as a
consum fire he shall destroy them and he shall bring them down
befor thi face: so shalt thou drive them out and destroy them
quickli as the lord hath said unto thee

9:4 speak not thou in thine heart after that the lord thi god hath
cast them out from befor thee say for my righteous the lord
hath brought me in to possess thi land: but for the wicked of
these nation the lord doth drive them out from befor thee

9:5 not for thi righteous or for the upright of thine heart
dost thou go to possess their land: but for the wicked of these
nation the lord thi god doth drive them out from befor thee and
that he may perform the word which the lord sware unto thi father
abraham isaac and jacob

9:6 understand therefor that the lord thi god giveth thee not thi
good land to possess it for thi righteousness; for thou art a
stiffneck peopl

9:7 rememb and forget not how thou provokedst the lord thi god to
wrath in the wilderness: from the day that thou didst depart out of
the land of egypt until ye came unto thi place ye have been
rebelli against the lord

9:8 also in horeb ye provok the lord to wrath so that the lord wa
angri with you to have destroy you

9:9 when i wa gone up into the mount to receiv the tabl of stone
even the tabl of the coven which the lord made with you then i
abod in the mount forti day and forti night i neither did eat
bread nor drink water: 9:10 and the lord deliv unto me two tabl
of stone written with the finger of god; and on them wa written
accord to all the word which the lord spake with you in the mount
out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembl

9:11 and it came to pass at the end of forti day and forti night
that the lord gave me the two tabl of stone even the tabl of the
coven

9:12 and the lord said unto me aris get thee down quickli from
hence; for thi peopl which thou hast brought forth out of egypt have
corrupt themselves; they are quickli turn asid out of the way
which i command them; they have made them a molten imag

9:13 furthermor the lord spake unto me say i have seen thi
peopl and behold it is a stiffneck people: 9:14 let me alon
that i may destroy them and blot out their name from under heaven:
and i will make of thee a nation mightier and greater than they

9:15 so i turn and came down from the mount and the mount burn
with fire: and the two tabl of the coven were in my two hand

9:16 and i look and behold ye had sin against the lord your
god and had made you a molten calf: ye had turn asid quickli out
of the way which the lord had command you

9:17 and i took the two tabl and cast them out of my two hand and
brake them befor your eye

9:18 and i fell down befor the lord as at the first forti day and
forti nights: i did neither eat bread nor drink water becaus of all
your sin which ye sin in do wickedli in the sight of the lord
to provok him to anger

9:19 for i wa afraid of the anger and hot displeasur wherewith the
lord wa wroth against you to destroy you but the lord hearken unto
me at that time also

9:20 and the lord wa veri angri with aaron to have destroy him: and
i pray for aaron also the same time

9:21 and i took your sin the calf which ye had made and burnt it
with fire and stamp it and ground it veri small even until it wa
as small as dust: and i cast the dust thereof into the brook that
descend out of the mount

9:22 and at taberah and at massah and at kibrothhattaavah ye
provok the lord to wrath

9:23 likewis when the lord sent you from kadeshbarnea say go up
and possess the land which i have given you; then ye rebel against
the command of the lord your god and ye believ him not nor
hearken to hi voic

9:24 ye have been rebelli against the lord from the day that i knew
you

9:25 thu i fell down befor the lord forti day and forti night as
i fell down at the first; becaus the lord had said he would destroy
you

9:26 i pray therefor unto the lord and said o lord god destroy
not thi peopl and thine inherit which thou hast redeem through
thi great which thou hast brought forth out of egypt with a
mighti hand

9:27 rememb thi servant abraham isaac and jacob; look not unto
the stubborn of thi peopl nor to their wicked nor to their
sin: 9:28 lest the land whenc thou broughtest us out say becaus the
lord wa not abl to bring them into the land which he promis them
and becaus he hate them he hath brought them out to slay them in
the wilder

9:29 yet they are thi peopl and thine inherit which thou
broughtest out by thi mighti power and by thi stretch out arm

10:1 at that time the lord said unto me hew thee two tabl of stone
like unto the first and come up unto me into the mount and make thee
an ark of wood

10:2 and i will write on the tabl the word that were in the first
tabl which thou brakest and thou shalt put them in the ark

10:3 and i made an ark of shittim wood and hew two tabl of stone
like unto the first and went up into the mount have the two tabl
in mine hand

10:4 and he wrote on the tabl accord to the first write the
ten command which the lord spake unto you in the mount out of
the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: and the lord gave
them unto me

10:5 and i turn myself and came down from the mount and put the
tabl in the ark which i had made; and there they be as the lord
command me

10:6 and the children of israel took their journey from beeroth of the
children of jaakan to mosera: there aaron die and there he wa
buried; and eleazar hi son minist in the priest offic in hi
stead

10:7 from thenc they journey unto gudgodah; and from gudgodah to
jotbath a land of river of water

10:8 at that time the lord separ the tribe of levi to bear the
ark of the coven of the lord to stand befor the lord to minist
unto him and to bless in hi name unto thi day

10:9 wherefor levi hath no part nor inherit with hi brethren;
the lord is hi inherit accord as the lord thi god promis
him

10:10 and i stay in the mount accord to the first time forti
day and forti nights; and the lord hearken unto me at that time
also and the lord would not destroy thee

10:11 and the lord said unto me aris take thi journey befor the
peopl that they may go in and possess the land which i sware unto
their father to give unto them

10:12 and now israel what doth the lord thi god requir of thee but
to fear the lord thi god to walk in all hi way and to love him
and to serv the lord thi god with all thi heart and with all thi
soul 10:13 to keep the command of the lord and hi statut
which i command thee thi day for thi good? 10:14 behold the heaven
and the heaven of heaven is the lord thi god the earth also with
all that therein is

10:15 onli the lord had a delight in thi father to love them and he
chose their seed after them even you abov all peopl as it is thi
day

10:16 circumcis therefor the foreskin of your heart and be no more
stiffneck

10:17 for the lord your god is god of god and lord of lord a great
god a mighti and a terribl which regardeth not person nor taketh
reward: 10:18 he doth execut the judgment of the fatherless and
widow and loveth the stranger in give him food and raiment

10:19 love ye therefor the stranger: for ye were stranger in the
land of egypt

10:20 thou shalt fear the lord thi god; him shalt thou serv and to
him shalt thou cleav and swear by hi name

10:21 he is thi prais and he is thi god that hath done for thee
these great and terribl thing which thine eye have seen

10:22 thi father went down into egypt with threescor and ten
persons; and now the lord thi god hath made thee as the star of
heaven for multitud

11:1 therefor thou shalt love the lord thi god and keep hi charg
and hi statut and hi judgment and hi command alway

11:2 and know ye thi day: for i speak not with your children which
have not known and which have not seen the chastis of the lord
your god hi great hi mighti hand and hi stretch out arm
11:3 and hi miracl and hi act which he did in the midst of
egypt unto pharaoh the king of egypt and unto all hi land; 11:4 and
what he did unto the armi of egypt unto their hors and to their
chariots; how he made the water of the red sea to overflow them as
they pursu after you and how the lord hath destroy them unto thi
day; 11:5 and what he did unto you in the wilder until ye came
into thi place; 11:6 and what he did unto dathan and abiram the son
of eliab the son of reuben: how the earth open her mouth and
swallow them up and their household and their tent and all the
substanc that wa in their possess in the midst of all israel:
11:7 but your eye have seen all the great act of the lord which he
did

11:8 therefor shall ye keep all the command which i command you
thi day that ye may be strong and go in and possess the land
whither ye go to possess it; 11:9 and that ye may prolong your day in
the land which the lord sware unto your father to give unto them and
to their seed a land that floweth with milk and honey

11:10 for the land whither thou goest in to possess it is not as the
land of egypt from whenc ye came out where thou sowedst thi seed
and wateredst it with thi foot as a garden of herbs: 11:11 but the
land whither ye go to possess it is a land of hill and valley and
drinketh water of the rain of heaven: 11:12 a land which the lord thi
god careth for: the eye of the lord thi god are alway upon it from
the begin of the year even unto the end of the year

11:13 and it shall come to pass if ye shall hearken dilig unto
my command which i command you thi day to love the lord your
god and to serv him with all your heart and with all your soul
11:14 that i will give you the rain of your land in hi due season
the first rain and the latter rain that thou mayest gather in thi
corn and thi wine and thine oil

11:15 and i will send grass in thi field for thi cattl that thou
mayest eat and be full

11:16 take heed to yourselv that your heart be not deceiv and ye
turn asid and serv other god and worship them; 11:17 and then the
lord wrath be kindl against you and he shut up the heaven that
there be no rain and that the land yield not her fruit; and lest ye
perish quickli from off the good land which the lord giveth you

11:18 therefor shall ye lay up these my word in your heart and in
your soul and bind them for a sign upon your hand that they may be
as frontlet between your eye

11:19 and ye shall teach them your children speak of them when
thou sittest in thine hous and when thou walkest by the way when
thou liest down and when thou risest up

11:20 and thou shalt write them upon the door post of thine hous
and upon thi gates: 11:21 that your day may be multipli and the
day of your children in the land which the lord sware unto your
father to give them as the day of heaven upon the earth

11:22 for if ye shall dilig keep all these command which i
command you to do them to love the lord your god to walk in all hi
way and to cleav unto him; 11:23 then will the lord drive out all
these nation from befor you and ye shall possess greater nation
and mightier than yourselv

11:24 everi place whereon the sole of your feet shall tread shall be
yours: from the wilder and lebanon from the river the river
euphrat even unto the uttermost sea shall your coast be

11:25 there shall no man be abl to stand befor you: for the lord
your god shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you upon all the
land that ye shall tread upon as he hath said unto you

11:26 behold i set befor you thi day a bless and a curse; 11:27
a bless if ye obey the command of the lord your god which i
command you thi day: 11:28 and a curs if ye will not obey the
command of the lord your god but turn asid out of the way which
i command you thi day to go after other god which ye have not
known

11:29 and it shall come to pass when the lord thi god hath brought
thee in unto the land whither thou goest to possess it that thou
shalt put the bless upon mount gerizim and the curs upon mount
ebal

11:30 are they not on the other side jordan by the way where the sun
goeth down in the land of the canaanit which dwell in the
champaign over against gilgal besid the plain of moreh? 11:31 for
ye shall pass over jordan to go in to possess the land which the lord
your god giveth you and ye shall possess it and dwell therein

11:32 and ye shall observ to do all the statut and judgment which
i set befor you thi day

12:1 these are the statut and judgment which ye shall observ to
do in the land which the lord god of thi father giveth thee to
possess it all the day that ye live upon the earth

12:2 ye shall utterli destroy all the place wherein the nation
which ye shall possess serv their god upon the high mountain and
upon the hill and under everi green tree: 12:3 and ye shall
overthrow their altar and break their pillar and burn their grove
with fire; and ye shall hew down the graven imag of their god and
destroy the name of them out of that place

12:4 ye shall not do so unto the lord your god

12:5 but unto the place which the lord your god shall choos out of
all your tribe to put hi name there even unto hi habit shall
ye seek and thither thou shalt come: 12:6 and thither ye shall bring
your burnt offer and your sacrific and your tith and heav
offer of your hand and your vow and your freewil offer
and the firstl of your herd and of your flocks: 12:7 and there ye
shall eat befor the lord your god and ye shall rejoic in all that
ye put your hand unto ye and your household wherein the lord thi
god hath bless thee

12:8 ye shall not do after all the thing that we do here thi day
everi man whatsoev is right in hi own eye

12:9 for ye are not as yet come to the rest and to the inherit
which the lord your god giveth you

12:10 but when ye go over jordan and dwell in the land which the lord
your god giveth you to inherit and when he giveth you rest from all
your enemi round about so that ye dwell in safety; 12:11 then there
shall be a place which the lord your god shall choos to caus hi
name to dwell there; thither shall ye bring all that i command you;
your burnt offer and your sacrific your tith and the heav
offer of your hand and all your choic vow which ye vow unto the
lord: 12:12 and ye shall rejoic befor the lord your god ye and
your son and your daughter and your menserv and your
maidserv and the levit that is within your gates; forasmuch as
he hath no part nor inherit with you

12:13 take heed to thyself that thou offer not thi burnt offer in
everi place that thou seest: 12:14 but in the place which the lord
shall choos in one of thi tribe there thou shalt offer thi burnt
offer and there thou shalt do all that i command thee

12:15 notwithstand thou mayest kill and eat flesh in all thi gate
whatsoev thi soul lusteth after accord to the bless of the
lord thi god which he hath given thee: the unclean and the clean may
eat thereof as of the roebuck and as of the hart

12:16 onli ye shall not eat the blood; ye shall pour it upon the earth
as water

12:17 thou mayest not eat within thi gate the tith of thi corn or
of thi wine or of thi oil or the firstl of thi herd or of thi
flock nor ani of thi vow which thou vowest nor thi freewil
offer or heav offer of thine hand: 12:18 but thou must eat
them befor the lord thi god in the place which the lord thi god shall
choos thou and thi son and thi daughter and thi manserv and
thi maidserv and the levit that is within thi gates: and thou
shalt rejoic befor the lord thi god in all that thou puttest thine
hand unto

12:19 take heed to thyself that thou forsak not the levit as long as
thou livest upon the earth

12:20 when the lord thi god shall enlarg thi border as he hath
promis thee and thou shalt say i will eat flesh becaus thi soul
longeth to eat flesh; thou mayest eat flesh whatsoev thi soul
lusteth after

12:21 if the place which the lord thi god hath chosen to put hi name
there be too far from thee then thou shalt kill of thi herd and of
thi flock which the lord hath given thee as i have command thee
and thou shalt eat in thi gate whatsoev thi soul lusteth after

12:22 even as the roebuck and the hart is eaten so thou shalt eat
them: the unclean and the clean shall eat of them alik

12:23 onli be sure that thou eat not the blood: for the blood is the
life; and thou mayest not eat the life with the flesh

12:24 thou shalt not eat it; thou shalt pour it upon the earth as
water

12:25 thou shalt not eat it; that it may go well with thee and with
thi children after thee when thou shalt do that which is right in the
sight of the lord

12:26 onli thi holi thing which thou hast and thi vow thou shalt
take and go unto the place which the lord shall choose: 12:27 and
thou shalt offer thi burnt offer the flesh and the blood upon
the altar of the lord thi god: and the blood of thi sacrific shall
be pour out upon the altar of the lord thi god and thou shalt eat
the flesh

12:28 observ and hear all these word which i command thee that it
may go well with thee and with thi children after thee for ever when
thou doest that which is good and right in the sight of the lord thi
god

12:29 when the lord thi god shall cut off the nation from befor
thee whither thou goest to possess them and thou succeedest them
and dwellest in their land; 12:30 take heed to thyself that thou be
not snare by follow them after that they be destroy from befor
thee; and that thou enquir not after their god say how did
these nation serv their gods? even so will i do likewis

12:31 thou shalt not do so unto the lord thi god: for everi
abomin to the lord which he hateth have they done unto their
gods; for even their son and their daughter they have burnt in the
fire to their god

12:32 what thing soever i command you observ to do it: thou shalt
not add thereto nor diminish from it

13:1 if there aris among you a prophet or a dreamer of dream and
giveth thee a sign or a wonder 13:2 and the sign or the wonder come
to pass whereof he spake unto thee say let us go after other
god which thou hast not known and let us serv them; 13:3 thou
shalt not hearken unto the word of that prophet or that dreamer of
dreams: for the lord your god proveth you to know whether ye love the
lord your god with all your heart and with all your soul

13:4 ye shall walk after the lord your god and fear him and keep hi
command and obey hi voic and ye shall serv him and cleav
unto him

13:5 and that prophet or that dreamer of dream shall be put to
death; becaus he hath spoken to turn you away from the lord your god
which brought you out of the land of egypt and redeem you out of
the hous of bondag to thrust thee out of the way which the lord thi
god command thee to walk in so shalt thou put the evil away from
the midst of thee

13:6 if thi brother the son of thi mother or thi son or thi
daughter or the wife of thi bosom or thi friend which is as thine
own soul entic thee secretli say let us go and serv other
god which thou hast not known thou nor thi fathers; 13:7 name
of the god of the peopl which are round about you nigh unto thee
or far off from thee from the one end of the earth even unto the
other end of the earth; 13:8 thou shalt not consent unto him nor
hearken unto him; neither shall thine eye piti him neither shalt thou
spare neither shalt thou conceal him: 13:9 but thou shalt sure kill
him; thine hand shall be first upon him to put him to death and
afterward the hand of all the peopl

13:10 and thou shalt stone him with stone that he die; becaus he
hath sought to thrust thee away from the lord thi god which brought
thee out of the land of egypt from the hous of bondag

13:11 and all israel shall hear and fear and shall do no more ani
such wicked as thi is among you

13:12 if thou shalt hear say in one of thi citi which the lord thi
god hath given thee to dwell there say 13:13 certain men the
children of belial are gone out from among you and have withdrawn
the inhabit of their citi say let us go and serv other god
which ye have not known; 13:14 then shalt thou enquir and make
search and ask diligently; and behold if it be truth and the thing
certain that such abomin is wrought among you; 13:15 thou shalt
sure smite the inhabit of that citi with the edg of the sword
destroy it utterli and all that is therein and the cattl
thereof with the edg of the sword

13:16 and thou shalt gather all the spoil of it into the midst of the
street thereof and shalt burn with fire the citi and all the spoil
thereof everi whit for the lord thi god: and it shall be an heap for
ever; it shall not be built again

13:17 and there shall cleav nought of the curs thing to thine hand:
that the lord may turn from the fierc of hi anger and shew thee
merci and have compass upon thee and multipli thee as he hath
sworn unto thi fathers; 13:18 when thou shalt hearken to the voic of
the lord thi god to keep all hi command which i command thee
thi day to do that which is right in the eye of the lord thi god

14:1 ye are the children of the lord your god: ye shall not cut
yourselv nor make ani bald between your eye for the dead

14:2 for thou art an holi peopl unto the lord thi god and the lord
hath chosen thee to be a peculiar peopl unto himself abov all the
nation that are upon the earth

14:3 thou shalt not eat ani abomin thing

14:4 these are the beast which ye shall eat: the ox the sheep and
the goat 14:5 the hart and the roebuck and the fallow deer and the
wild goat and the pygarg and the wild ox and the chamoi

14:6 and everi beast that parteth the hoof and cleaveth the cleft
into two claw and cheweth the cud among the beast that ye shall
eat

14:7 nevertheless these ye shall not eat of them that chew the cud or
of them that divid the cloven hoof; as the camel and the hare and
the coney: for they chew the cud but divid not the hoof; therefor
they are unclean unto you

14:8 and the swine becaus it divideth the hoof yet cheweth not the
cud it is unclean unto you: ye shall not eat of their flesh nor
touch their dead carcas

14:9 these ye shall eat of all that are in the waters: all that have
fin and scale shall ye eat: 14:10 and whatsoev hath not fin and
scale ye may not eat; it is unclean unto you

14:11 of all clean bird ye shall eat

14:12 but these are they of which ye shall not eat: the eagl and the
ossifrag and the ospray 14:13 and the glede and the kite and the
vultur after hi kind 14:14 and everi raven after hi kind 14:15
and the owl and the night hawk and the cuckow and the hawk after
hi kind 14:16 the littl owl and the great owl and the swan 14:17
and the pelican and the gier eagl and the cormor 14:18 and the
stork and the heron after her kind and the lapw and the bat

14:19 and everi creep thing that flieth is unclean unto you: they
shall not be eaten

14:20 but of all clean fowl ye may eat

14:21 ye shall not eat of anyth that dieth of itself: thou shalt
give it unto the stranger that is in thi gate that he may eat it; or
thou mayest sell it unto an alien: for thou art an holi peopl unto
the lord thi god

thou shalt not seeth a kid in hi mother milk

14:22 thou shalt truli tith all the increas of thi seed that the
field bringeth forth year by year

14:23 and thou shalt eat befor the lord thi god in the place which
he shall choos to place hi name there the tith of thi corn of thi
wine and of thine oil and the firstl of thi herd and of thi
flocks; that thou mayest learn to fear the lord thi god alway

14:24 and if the way be too long for thee so that thou art not abl
to carri it; or if the place be too far from thee which the lord thi
god shall choos to set hi name there when the lord thi god hath
bless thee: 14:25 then shalt thou turn it into money and bind up
the money in thine hand and shalt go unto the place which the lord
thi god shall choose: 14:26 and thou shalt bestow that money for
whatsoev thi soul lusteth after for oxen or for sheep or for
wine or for strong drink or for whatsoev thi soul desireth: and
thou shalt eat there befor the lord thi god and thou shalt rejoic
thou and thine household 14:27 and the levit that is within thi
gates; thou shalt not forsak him; for he hath no part nor inherit
with thee

14:28 at the end of three year thou shalt bring forth all the tith
of thine increas the same year and shalt lay it up within thi gates:
14:29 and the levit (becaus he hath no part nor inherit with
thee) and the stranger and the fatherless and the widow which are
within thi gate shall come and shall eat and be satisfied; that the
lord thi god may bless thee in all the work of thine hand which thou
doest

15:1 at the end of everi seven year thou shalt make a releas

15:2 and thi is the manner of the release: everi creditor that
lendeth ought unto hi neighbour shall releas it; he shall not exact
it of hi neighbour or of hi brother; becaus it is call the
lord releas

15:3 of a foreign thou mayest exact it again: but that which is
thine with thi brother thine hand shall release; 15:4 save when there
shall be no poor among you; for the lord shall greatli bless thee in
the land which the lord thi god giveth thee for an inherit to
possess it: 15:5 onli if thou care hearken unto the voic of the
lord thi god to observ to do all these command which i command
thee thi day

15:6 for the lord thi god blesseth thee as he promis thee: and thou
shalt lend unto mani nation but thou shalt not borrow; and thou
shalt reign over mani nation but they shall not reign over thee

15:7 if there be among you a poor man of one of thi brethren within
ani of thi gate in thi land which the lord thi god giveth thee thou
shalt not harden thine heart nor shut thine hand from thi poor
brother: 15:8 but thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him and shalt
sure lend him suffici for hi need in that which he wanteth

15:9 bewar that there be not a thought in thi wick heart say
the seventh year the year of releas is at hand; and thine eye be
evil against thi poor brother and thou givest him nought; and he cri
unto the lord against thee and it be sin unto thee

15:10 thou shalt sure give him and thine heart shall not be griev
when thou givest unto him: becaus that for thi thing the lord thi
god shall bless thee in all thi work and in all that thou puttest
thine hand unto

15:11 for the poor shall never ceas out of the land: therefor i
command thee say thou shalt open thine hand wide unto thi
brother to thi poor and to thi needi in thi land

15:12 and if thi brother an hebrew man or an hebrew woman be sold
unto thee and serv thee six years; then in the seventh year thou
shalt let him go free from thee

15:13 and when thou sendest him out free from thee thou shalt not let
him go away empty: 15:14 thou shalt furnish him liber out of thi
flock and out of thi floor and out of thi winepress: of that
