wherewith the lord thi god hath bless thee thou shalt give unto him

15:15 and thou shalt rememb that thou wast a bondman in the land of
egypt and the lord thi god redeem thee: therefor i command thee
thi thing to day

15:16 and it shall be if he say unto thee i will not go away from
thee; becaus he loveth thee and thine hous becaus he is well with
thee; 15:17 then thou shalt take an aul and thrust it through hi ear
unto the door and he shall be thi servant for ever and also unto thi
maidserv thou shalt do likewis

15:18 it shall not seem hard unto thee when thou sendest him away
free from thee; for he hath been worth a doubl hire servant to thee
in serv thee six years: and the lord thi god shall bless thee in
all that thou doest

15:19 all the firstl male that come of thi herd and of thi flock
thou shalt sanctifi unto the lord thi god: thou shalt do no work with
the firstl of thi bullock nor shear the firstl of thi sheep

15:20 thou shalt eat it befor the lord thi god year by year in the
place which the lord shall choos thou and thi household

15:21 and if there be ani blemish therein as if it be lame or blind
or have ani ill blemish thou shalt not sacrific it unto the lord thi
god

15:22 thou shalt eat it within thi gates: the unclean and the clean
person shall eat it alik as the roebuck and as the hart

15:23 onli thou shalt not eat the blood thereof; thou shalt pour it
upon the ground as water

16:1 observ the month of abib and keep the passov unto the lord
thi god: for in the month of abib the lord thi god brought thee forth
out of egypt by night

16:2 thou shalt therefor sacrific the passov unto the lord thi
god of the flock and the herd in the place which the lord shall
choos to place hi name there

16:3 thou shalt eat no leaven bread with it; seven day shalt thou
eat unleaven bread therewith even the bread of affliction; for thou
camest forth out of the land of egypt in haste: that thou mayest
rememb the day when thou camest forth out of the land of egypt all
the day of thi life

16:4 and there shall be no leaven bread seen with thee in all thi
coast seven days; neither shall there ani thing of the flesh which
thou sacrificedst the first day at even remain all night until the
morn

16:5 thou mayest not sacrific the passov within ani of thi gate
which the lord thi god giveth thee: 16:6 but at the place which the
lord thi god shall choos to place hi name in there thou shalt
sacrific the passov at even at the go down of the sun at the
season that thou camest forth out of egypt

16:7 and thou shalt roast and eat it in the place which the lord thi
god shall choose: and thou shalt turn in the morn and go unto thi
tent

16:8 six day thou shalt eat unleaven bread: and on the seventh day
shall be a solemn assembl to the lord thi god: thou shalt do no work
therein

16:9 seven week shalt thou number unto thee: begin to number the
seven week from such time as thou beginnest to put the sickl to the
corn

16:10 and thou shalt keep the feast of week unto the lord thi god
with a tribut of a freewil offer of thine hand which thou shalt
give unto the lord thi god accord as the lord thi god hath bless
thee: 16:11 and thou shalt rejoic befor the lord thi god thou and
thi son and thi daughter and thi manserv and thi maidserv
and the levit that is within thi gate and the stranger and the
fatherless and the widow that are among you in the place which the
lord thi god hath chosen to place hi name there

16:12 and thou shalt rememb that thou wast a bondman in egypt: and
thou shalt observ and do these statut

16:13 thou shalt observ the feast of tabernacl seven day after
that thou hast gather in thi corn and thi wine: 16:14 and thou shalt
rejoic in thi feast thou and thi son and thi daughter and thi
manserv and thi maidserv and the levit the stranger and the
fatherless and the widow that are within thi gate

16:15 seven day shalt thou keep a solemn feast unto the lord thi god
in the place which the lord shall choose: becaus the lord thi god
shall bless thee in all thine increas and in all the work of thine
hand therefor thou shalt sure rejoic

16:16 three time in a year shall all thi male appear befor the lord
thi god in the place which he shall choose; in the feast of unleaven
bread and in the feast of week and in the feast of tabernacles: and
they shall not appear befor the lord empty: 16:17 everi man shall
give as he is abl accord to the bless of the lord thi god
which he hath given thee

16:18 judg and offic shalt thou make thee in all thi gate which
the lord thi god giveth thee throughout thi tribes: and they shall
judg the peopl with just judgment

16:19 thou shalt not wrest judgment; thou shalt not respect person
neither take a gift: for a gift doth blind the eye of the wise and
pervert the word of the righteou

16:20 that which is altogeth just shalt thou follow that thou
mayest live and inherit the land which the lord thi god giveth thee

16:21 thou shalt not plant thee a grove of ani tree near unto the
altar of the lord thi god which thou shalt make thee

16:22 neither shalt thou set thee up ani image; which the lord thi god
hateth

17:1 thou shalt not sacrific unto the lord thi god ani bullock or
sheep wherein is blemish or ani evilfavouredness: for that is an
abomin unto the lord thi god

17:2 if there be found among you within ani of thi gate which the
lord thi god giveth thee man or woman that hath wrought wicked
in the sight of the lord thi god in transgress hi coven 17:3
and hath gone and serv other god and worship them either the
sun or moon or ani of the host of heaven which i have not
commanded; 17:4 and it be told thee and thou hast heard of it and
enquir dilig and behold it be true and the thing certain
that such abomin is wrought in israel: 17:5 then shalt thou bring
forth that man or that woman which have commit that wick thing
unto thi gate even that man or that woman and shalt stone them with
stone till they die

17:6 at the mouth of two wit or three wit shall he that
is worthi of death be put to death; but at the mouth of one wit he
shall not be put to death

17:7 the hand of the wit shall be first upon him to put him to
death and afterward the hand of all the peopl so thou shalt put
the evil away from among you

17:8 if there aris a matter too hard for thee in judgment between
blood and blood between plea and plea and between stroke and stroke
be matter of controversi within thi gates: then shalt thou aris
and get thee up into the place which the lord thi god shall choose;
17:9 and thou shalt come unto the priest the levit and unto the
judg that shall be in those day and enquire; and they shall shew
thee the sentenc of judgment: 17:10 and thou shalt do accord to
the sentenc which they of that place which the lord shall choos
shall shew thee; and thou shalt observ to do accord to all that
they inform thee: 17:11 accord to the sentenc of the law which
they shall teach thee and accord to the judgment which they shall
tell thee thou shalt do: thou shalt not declin from the sentenc
which they shall shew thee to the right hand nor to the left

17:12 and the man that will do presumptu and will not hearken
unto the priest that standeth to minist there befor the lord thi
god or unto the judg even that man shall die: and thou shalt put
away the evil from israel

17:13 and all the peopl shall hear and fear and do no more
presumptu

17:14 when thou art come unto the land which the lord thi god giveth
thee and shalt possess it and shalt dwell therein and shalt say i
will set a king over me like as all the nation that are about me;
17:15 thou shalt in ani wise set him king over thee whom the lord thi
god shall choose: one from among thi brethren shalt thou set king over
thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee which is not thi
brother

17:16 but he shall not multipli hors to himself nor caus the
peopl to return to egypt to the end that he should multipli horses:
forasmuch as the lord hath said unto you ye shall henceforth return
no more that way

17:17 neither shall he multipli wive to himself that hi heart turn
not away: neither shall he greatli multipli to himself silver and
gold

17:18 and it shall be when he sitteth upon the throne of hi kingdom
that he shall write him a copi of thi law in a book out of that which
is befor the priest the levites: 17:19 and it shall be with him and
he shall read therein all the day of hi life: that he may learn to
fear the lord hi god to keep all the word of thi law and these
statut to do them: 17:20 that hi heart be not lift up abov hi
brethren and that he turn not asid from the command to the
right hand or to the left: to the end that he may prolong hi day in
hi kingdom he and hi children in the midst of israel

18:1 the priest the levit and all the tribe of levi shall have no
part nor inherit with israel: they shall eat the offer of the
lord made by fire and hi inherit

18:2 therefor shall they have no inherit among their brethren:
the lord is their inherit as he hath said unto them

18:3 and thi shall be the priest due from the peopl from them
that offer a sacrific whether it be ox or sheep; and they shall give
unto the priest the shoulder and the two cheek and the maw

18:4 the firstfruit also of thi corn of thi wine and of thine oil
and the first of the fleec of thi sheep shalt thou give him

18:5 for the lord thi god hath chosen him out of all thi tribe to
stand to minist in the name of the lord him and hi son for ever

18:6 and if a levit come from ani of thi gate out of all israel
where he sojourn and come with all the desir of hi mind unto the
place which the lord shall choose; 18:7 then he shall minist in the
name of the lord hi god as all hi brethren the levit do which
stand there befor the lord

18:8 they shall have like portion to eat besid that which cometh of
the sale of hi patrimoni

18:9 when thou art come into the land which the lord thi god giveth
thee thou shalt not learn to do after the abomin of those
nation

18:10 there shall not be found among you ani one that maketh hi son
or hi daughter to pass through the fire or that useth divin or
an observ of time or an enchant or a witch

18:11 or a charmer or a consult with familiar spirit or a wizard
or a necromanc

18:12 for all that do these thing are an abomin unto the lord:
and becaus of these abomin the lord thi god doth drive them out
from befor thee

18:13 thou shalt be perfect with the lord thi god

18:14 for these nation which thou shalt possess hearken unto
observ of time and unto diviners: but as for thee the lord thi
god hath not suffer thee so to do

18:15 the lord thi god will rais up unto thee a prophet from the
midst of thee of thi brethren like unto me; unto him ye shall
hearken; 18:16 accord to all that thou desiredst of the lord thi
god in horeb in the day of the assembl say let me not hear again
the voic of the lord my god neither let me see thi great fire ani
more that i die not

18:17 and the lord said unto me they have well spoken that which they
have spoken

18:18 i will rais them up a prophet from among their brethren like
unto thee and will put my word in hi mouth; and he shall speak unto
them all that i shall command him

18:19 and it shall come to pass that whosoev will not hearken unto
my word which he shall speak in my name i will requir it of him

18:20 but the prophet which shall presum to speak a word in my name
which i have not command him to speak or that shall speak in the
name of other god even that prophet shall die

18:21 and if thou say in thine heart how shall we know the word which
the lord hath not spoken? 18:22 when a prophet speaketh in the name
of the lord if the thing follow not nor come to pass that is the
thing which the lord hath not spoken but the prophet hath spoken it
presumptuously: thou shalt not be afraid of him

19:1 when the lord thi god hath cut off the nation whose land the
lord thi god giveth thee and thou succeedest them and dwellest in
their citi and in their houses; 19:2 thou shalt separ three
citi for thee in the midst of thi land which the lord thi god
giveth thee to possess it

19:3 thou shalt prepar thee a way and divid the coast of thi land
which the lord thi god giveth thee to inherit into three part that
everi slayer may flee thither

19:4 and thi is the case of the slayer which shall flee thither
that he may live: whoso killeth hi neighbour ignorantli whom he
hate not in time past; 19:5 as when a man goeth into the wood with
hi neighbour to hew wood and hi hand fetcheth a stroke with the axe
to cut down the tree and the head slippeth from the helv and
lighteth upon hi neighbour that he die; he shall flee unto one of
those citi and live: 19:6 lest the aveng of the blood pursu the
slayer while hi heart is hot and overtak him becaus the way is
long and slay him; wherea he wa not worthi of death inasmuch as he
hate him not in time past

19:7 wherefor i command thee say thou shalt separ three
citi for thee

19:8 and if the lord thi god enlarg thi coast as he hath sworn unto
thi father and give thee all the land which he promis to give unto
thi fathers; 19:9 if thou shalt keep all these command to do
them which i command thee thi day to love the lord thi god and to
walk ever in hi ways; then shalt thou add three citi more for thee
besid these three: 19:10 that innoc blood be not shed in thi land
which the lord thi god giveth thee for an inherit and so blood be
upon thee

19:11 but if ani man hate hi neighbour and lie in wait for him and
rise up against him and smite him mortal that he die and fleeth
into one of these cities: 19:12 then the elder of hi citi shall send
and fetch him thenc and deliv him into the hand of the aveng of
blood that he may die

19:13 thine eye shall not piti him but thou shalt put away the guilt
of innoc blood from israel that it may go well with thee

19:14 thou shalt not remov thi neighbour landmark which they of
old time have set in thine inherit which thou shalt inherit in
the land that the lord thi god giveth thee to possess it

19:15 one wit shall not rise up against a man for ani iniqu or
for ani sin in ani sin that he sinneth: at the mouth of two
wit or at the mouth of three wit shall the matter be
establish

19:16 if a fals wit rise up against ani man to testifi against
him that which is wrong; 19:17 then both the men between whom the
controversi is shall stand befor the lord befor the priest and
the judg which shall be in those days; 19:18 and the judg shall
make dilig inquisition: and behold if the wit be a fals
wit and hath testifi fals against hi brother; 19:19 then
shall ye do unto him as he had thought to have done unto hi brother:
so shalt thou put the evil away from among you

19:20 and those which remain shall hear and fear and shall
henceforth commit no more ani such evil among you

19:21 and thine eye shall not pity; but life shall go for life eye
for eye tooth for tooth hand for hand foot for foot

20:1 when thou goest out to battl against thine enemi and seest
hors and chariot and a peopl more than thou be not afraid of
them: for the lord thi god is with thee which brought thee up out of
the land of egypt

20:2 and it shall be when ye are come nigh unto the battl that the
priest shall approach and speak unto the peopl 20:3 and shall say
unto them hear o israel ye approach thi day unto battl against
your enemies: let not your heart faint fear not and do not trembl
neither be ye terrifi becaus of them; 20:4 for the lord your god is
he that goeth with you to fight for you against your enemi to save
you

20:5 and the offic shall speak unto the peopl say what man is
there that hath built a new hous and hath not dedic it? let him
go and return to hi hous lest he die in the battl and anoth man
dedic it

20:6 and what man is he that hath plant a vineyard and hath not yet
eaten of it? let him also go and return unto hi hous lest he die in
the battl and anoth man eat of it

20:7 and what man is there that hath betroth a wife and hath not
taken her? let him go and return unto hi hous lest he die in the
battl and anoth man take her

20:8 and the offic shall speak further unto the peopl and they
shall say what man is there that is fear and fainthearted? let him
go and return unto hi hous lest hi brethren heart faint as well
as hi heart

20:9 and it shall be when the offic have made an end of speak
unto the peopl that they shall make captain of the armi to lead
the peopl

20:10 when thou comest nigh unto a citi to fight against it then
proclaim peac unto it

20:11 and it shall be if it make thee answer of peac and open unto
thee then it shall be that all the peopl that is found therein
shall be tributari unto thee and they shall serv thee

20:12 and if it will make no peac with thee but will make war
against thee then thou shalt besieg it: 20:13 and when the lord thi
god hath deliv it into thine hand thou shalt smite everi male
thereof with the edg of the sword: 20:14 but the women and the
littl one and the cattl and all that is in the citi even all the
spoil thereof shalt thou take unto thyself; and thou shalt eat the
spoil of thine enemi which the lord thi god hath given thee

20:15 thu shalt thou do unto all the citi which are veri far off
from thee which are not of the citi of these nation

20:16 but of the citi of these peopl which the lord thi god doth
give thee for an inherit thou shalt save aliv noth that
breatheth: 20:17 but thou shalt utterli destroy them; name the
hittit and the amorit the canaanit and the perizzit the
hivit and the jebusites; as the lord thi god hath command thee:
20:18 that they teach you not to do after all their abomin
which they have done unto their gods; so should ye sin against the
lord your god

20:19 when thou shalt besieg a citi a long time in make war
against it to take it thou shalt not destroy the tree thereof by
forc an axe against them: for thou mayest eat of them and thou
shalt not cut them down (for the tree of the field is man life) to
employ them in the siege: 20:20 onli the tree which thou knowest that
they be not tree for meat thou shalt destroy and cut them down; and
thou shalt build bulwark against the citi that maketh war with thee
until it be subdu

21:1 if one be found slain in the land which the lord thi god giveth
thee to possess it lie in the field and it be not known who hath
slain him: 21:2 then thi elder and thi judg shall come forth and
they shall measur unto the citi which are round about him that is
slain: 21:3 and it shall be that the citi which is next unto the
slain man even the elder of that citi shall take an heifer which
hath not been wrought with and which hath not drawn in the yoke; 21:4
and the elder of that citi shall bring down the heifer unto a rough
valley which is neither ear nor sown and shall strike off the
heifer neck there in the valley: 21:5 and the priest the son of
levi shall come near; for them the lord thi god hath chosen to
minist unto him and to bless in the name of the lord; and by their
word shall everi controversi and everi stroke be tried: 21:6 and all
the elder of that citi that are next unto the slain man shall wash
their hand over the heifer that is behead in the valley: 21:7 and
they shall answer and say our hand have not shed thi blood neither
have our eye seen it

21:8 be merci o lord unto thi peopl israel whom thou hast
redeem and lay not innoc blood unto thi peopl of israel
charg and the blood shall be forgiven them

21:9 so shalt thou put away the guilt of innoc blood from among
you when thou shalt do that which is right in the sight of the lord

21:10 when thou goest forth to war against thine enemi and the lord
thi god hath deliv them into thine hand and thou hast taken them
captiv 21:11 and seest among the captiv a beauti woman and
hast a desir unto her that thou wouldest have her to thi wife; 21:12
then thou shalt bring her home to thine hous and she shall shave her
head and pare her nails; 21:13 and she shall put the raiment of her
captiv from off her and shall remain in thine hous and bewail
her father and her mother a full month: and after that thou shalt go
in unto her and be her husband and she shall be thi wife

21:14 and it shall be if thou have no delight in her then thou shalt
let her go whither she will; but thou shalt not sell her at all for
money thou shalt not make merchandis of her becaus thou hast
humbl her

21:15 if a man have two wive one belov and anoth hate and
they have born him children both the belov and the hated; and if
the firstborn son be her that wa hated: 21:16 then it shall be when
he maketh hi son to inherit that which he hath that he may not make
the son of the belov firstborn befor the son of the hate which is
inde the firstborn: 21:17 but he shall acknowledg the son of the
hate for the firstborn by give him a doubl portion of all that he
hath: for he is the begin of hi strength; the right of the
firstborn is hi

21:18 if a man have a stubborn and rebelli son which will not obey
the voic of hi father or the voic of hi mother and that when
they have chasten him will not hearken unto them: 21:19 then shall
hi father and hi mother lay hold on him and bring him out unto the
elder of hi citi and unto the gate of hi place; 21:20 and they
shall say unto the elder of hi citi thi our son is stubborn and
rebelli he will not obey our voice; he is a glutton and a
drunkard

21:21 and all the men of hi citi shall stone him with stone that he
die: so shalt thou put evil away from among you; and all israel shall
hear and fear

21:22 and if a man have commit a sin worthi of death and he be to
be put to death and thou hang him on a tree: 21:23 hi bodi shall not
remain all night upon the tree but thou shalt in ani wise buri him
that day; (for he that is hang is accurs of god;) that thi land be
not defil which the lord thi god giveth thee for an inherit

22:1 thou shalt not see thi brother ox or hi sheep go astray and
hide thyself from them: thou shalt in ani case bring them again unto
thi brother

22:2 and if thi brother be not nigh unto thee or if thou know him
not then thou shalt bring it unto thine own hous and it shall be
with thee until thi brother seek after it and thou shalt restor it
to him again

22:3 in like manner shalt thou do with hi ass; and so shalt thou do
with hi raiment; and with all lost thing of thi brother which he
hath lost and thou hast found shalt thou do likewise: thou mayest
not hide thyself

22:4 thou shalt not see thi brother ass or hi ox fall down by the
way and hide thyself from them: thou shalt sure help him to lift
them up again

22:5 the woman shall not wear that which pertaineth unto a man
neither shall a man put on a woman garment: for all that do so are
abomin unto the lord thi god

22:6 if a bird nest chanc to be befor thee in the way in ani tree
or on the ground whether they be young one or egg and the dam
sit upon the young or upon the egg thou shalt not take the dam
with the young: 22:7 but thou shalt in ani wise let the dam go and
take the young to thee; that it may be well with thee and that thou
mayest prolong thi day

22:8 when thou buildest a new hous then thou shalt make a battlement
for thi roof that thou bring not blood upon thine hous if ani man
fall from thenc

22:9 thou shalt not sow thi vineyard with diver seeds: lest the fruit
of thi seed which thou hast sown and the fruit of thi vineyard be
defil

22:10 thou shalt not plow with an ox and an ass togeth

22:11 thou shalt not wear a garment of diver sort as of woollen and
linen togeth

22:12 thou shalt make thee fring upon the four quarter of thi
vestur wherewith thou coverest thyself

22:13 if ani man take a wife and go in unto her and hate her 22:14
and give occas of speech against her and bring up an evil name
upon her and say i took thi woman and when i came to her i found
her not a maid: 22:15 then shall the father of the damsel and her
mother take and bring forth the token of the damsel virgin unto
the elder of the citi in the gate: 22:16 and the damsel father
shall say unto the elder i gave my daughter unto thi man to wife
and he hateth her; 22:17 and lo he hath given occas of speech
against her say i found not thi daughter a maid; and yet these
are the token of my daughter virgin and they shall spread the
cloth befor the elder of the citi

22:18 and the elder of that citi shall take that man and chastis
him; 22:19 and they shall amerc him in an hundr shekel of silver
and give them unto the father of the damsel becaus he hath brought
up an evil name upon a virgin of israel: and she shall be hi wife; he
may not put her away all hi day

22:20 but if thi thing be true and the token of virgin be not
found for the damsel: 22:21 then they shall bring out the damsel to
the door of her father hous and the men of her citi shall stone
her with stone that she die: becaus she hath wrought folli in
israel to play the whore in her father house: so shalt thou put
evil away from among you

22:22 if a man be found lie with a woman marri to an husband then
they shall both of them die both the man that lay with the woman and
the woman: so shalt thou put away evil from israel

22:23 if a damsel that is a virgin be betroth unto an husband and a
man find her in the citi and lie with her; 22:24 then ye shall bring
them both out unto the gate of that citi and ye shall stone them with
stone that they die; the damsel becaus she cri not be in the
city; and the man becaus he hath humbl hi neighbour wife: so
thou shalt put away evil from among you

22:25 but if a man find a betroth damsel in the field and the man
forc her and lie with her: then the man onli that lay with her shall
die

22:26 but unto the damsel thou shalt do nothing; there is in the
damsel no sin worthi of death: for as when a man riseth against hi
neighbour and slayeth him even so is thi matter: 22:27 for he found
her in the field and the betroth damsel cri and there wa none
to save her

22:28 if a man find a damsel that is a virgin which is not betroth
and lay hold on her and lie with her and they be found; 22:29 then
the man that lay with her shall give unto the damsel father fifti
shekel of silver and she shall be hi wife; becaus he hath humbl
her he may not put her away all hi day

22:30 a man shall not take hi father wife nor discov hi
father skirt

23:1 he that is wound in the stone or hath hi privi member cut
off shall not enter into the congreg of the lord

23:2 a bastard shall not enter into the congreg of the lord; even
to hi tenth gener shall he not enter into the congreg of
the lord

23:3 an ammonit or moabit shall not enter into the congreg of
the lord; even to their tenth gener shall they not enter into the
congreg of the lord for ever: 23:4 becaus they met you not with
bread and with water in the way when ye came forth out of egypt; and
becaus they hire against thee balaam the son of beor of pethor of
mesopotamia to curs thee

23:5 nevertheless the lord thi god would not hearken unto balaam; but
the lord thi god turn the curs into a bless unto thee becaus
the lord thi god love thee

23:6 thou shalt not seek their peac nor their prosper all thi day
for ever

23:7 thou shalt not abhor an edomite; for he is thi brother: thou
shalt not abhor an egyptian; becaus thou wast a stranger in hi land

23:8 the children that are begotten of them shall enter into the
congreg of the lord in their third gener

23:9 when the host goeth forth against thine enemi then keep thee
from everi wick thing

23:10 if there be among you ani man that is not clean by reason of
unclean that chanceth him by night then shall he go abroad out of
the camp he shall not come within the camp: 23:11 but it shall be
when even cometh on he shall wash himself with water: and when the
sun is down he shall come into the camp again

23:12 thou shalt have a place also without the camp whither thou
shalt go forth abroad: 23:13 and thou shalt have a paddl upon thi
weapon; and it shall be when thou wilt eas thyself abroad thou
shalt dig therewith and shalt turn back and cover that which cometh
from thee: 23:14 for the lord thi god walketh in the midst of thi
camp to deliv thee and to give up thine enemi befor thee;
therefor shall thi camp be holy: that he see no unclean thing in
thee and turn away from thee

23:15 thou shalt not deliv unto hi master the servant which is
escap from hi master unto thee: 23:16 he shall dwell with thee
even among you in that place which he shall choos in one of thi
gate where it liketh him best: thou shalt not oppress him

23:17 there shall be no whore of the daughter of israel nor a
sodomit of the son of israel

23:18 thou shalt not bring the hire of a whore or the price of a dog
into the hous of the lord thi god for ani vow: for even both these
are abomin unto the lord thi god

23:19 thou shalt not lend upon usuri to thi brother; usuri of money
usuri of victual usuri of ani thing that is lent upon usury: 23:20
unto a stranger thou mayest lend upon usury; but unto thi brother thou
shalt not lend upon usury: that the lord thi god may bless thee in all
that thou settest thine hand to in the land whither thou goest to
possess it

23:21 when thou shalt vow a vow unto the lord thi god thou shalt not
slack to pay it: for the lord thi god will sure requir it of thee;
and it would be sin in thee

23:22 but if thou shalt forbear to vow it shall be no sin in thee

23:23 that which is gone out of thi lip thou shalt keep and perform;
even a freewil offer accord as thou hast vow unto the lord
thi god which thou hast promis with thi mouth

23:24 when thou comest into thi neighbour vineyard then thou mayest
eat grape thi fill at thine own pleasure; but thou shalt not put ani
in thi vessel

23:25 when thou comest into the stand corn of thi neighbour then
thou mayest pluck the ear with thine hand; but thou shalt not move a
sickl unto thi neighbour stand corn

24:1 when a man hath taken a wife and marri her and it come to
pass that she find no favour in hi eye becaus he hath found some
unclean in her: then let him write her a bill of divorc and
give it in her hand and send her out of hi hous

24:2 and when she is depart out of hi hous she may go and be
anoth man wife

24:3 and if the latter husband hate her and write her a bill of
divorc and giveth it in her hand and sendeth her out of hi
house; or if the latter husband die which took her to be hi wife;
24:4 her former husband which sent her away may not take her again
to be hi wife after that she is defiled; for that is abomin
befor the lord: and thou shalt not caus the land to sin which the
lord thi god giveth thee for an inherit

24:5 when a man hath taken a new wife he shall not go out to war
neither shall he be charg with ani business: but he shall be free at
home one year and shall cheer up hi wife which he hath taken

24:6 no man shall take the nether or the upper millston to pledge:
for he taketh a man life to pledg

24:7 if a man be found steal ani of hi brethren of the children of
israel and maketh merchandis of him or selleth him; then that thief
shall die; and thou shalt put evil away from among you

24:8 take heed in the plagu of leprosi that thou observ dilig
and do accord to all that the priest the levit shall teach you:
as i command them so ye shall observ to do

24:9 rememb what the lord thi god did unto miriam by the way after
that ye were come forth out of egypt

24:10 when thou dost lend thi brother ani thing thou shalt not go
into hi hous to fetch hi pledg

24:11 thou shalt stand abroad and the man to whom thou dost lend
shall bring out the pledg abroad unto thee

24:12 and if the man be poor thou shalt not sleep with hi pledge:
24:13 in ani case thou shalt deliv him the pledg again when the sun
goeth down that he may sleep in hi own raiment and bless thee: and
it shall be righteous unto thee befor the lord thi god

24:14 thou shalt not oppress an hire servant that is poor and needi
whether he be of thi brethren or of thi stranger that are in thi
land within thi gates: 24:15 at hi day thou shalt give him hi hire
neither shall the sun go down upon it; for he is poor and setteth hi
heart upon it: lest he cri against thee unto the lord and it be sin
unto thee

24:16 the father shall not be put to death for the children neither
shall the children be put to death for the fathers: everi man shall be
put to death for hi own sin

24:17 thou shalt not pervert the judgment of the stranger nor of the
fatherless; nor take a widow raiment to pledge: 24:18 but thou shalt
rememb that thou wast a bondman in egypt and the lord thi god
redeem thee thence: therefor i command thee to do thi thing

24:19 when thou cuttest down thine harvest in thi field and hast
forgot a sheaf in the field thou shalt not go again to fetch it: it
shall be for the stranger for the fatherless and for the widow: that
the lord thi god may bless thee in all the work of thine hand

24:20 when thou beatest thine oliv tree thou shalt not go over the
bough again: it shall be for the stranger for the fatherless and
for the widow

24:21 when thou gatherest the grape of thi vineyard thou shalt not
glean it afterward: it shall be for the stranger for the fatherless
and for the widow

24:22 and thou shalt rememb that thou wast a bondman in the land of
egypt: therefor i command thee to do thi thing

25:1 if there be a controversi between men and they come unto
judgment that the judg may judg them; then they shall justifi the
righteou and condemn the wick

25:2 and it shall be if the wick man be worthi to be beaten that
the judg shall caus him to lie down and to be beaten befor hi
face accord to hi fault by a certain number

25:3 forti stripe he may give him and not exceed: lest if he should
exceed and beat him abov these with mani stripe then thi brother
should seem vile unto thee

25:4 thou shalt not muzzl the ox when he treadeth out the corn

25:5 if brethren dwell togeth and one of them die and have no
child the wife of the dead shall not marri without unto a stranger:
her husband brother shall go in unto her and take her to him to
wife and perform the duti of an husband brother unto her

25:6 and it shall be that the firstborn which she beareth shall
succeed in the name of hi brother which is dead that hi name be not
put out of israel

25:7 and if the man like not to take hi brother wife then let hi
brother wife go up to the gate unto the elder and say my
husband brother refuseth to rais up unto hi brother a name in
israel he will not perform the duti of my husband brother

25:8 then the elder of hi citi shall call him and speak unto him:
and if he stand to it and say i like not to take her; 25:9 then
shall hi brother wife come unto him in the presenc of the elder
and loos hi shoe from off hi foot and spit in hi face and shall
answer and say so shall it be done unto that man that will not build
up hi brother hous

25:10 and hi name shall be call in israel the hous of him that
hath hi shoe loos

25:11 when men strive togeth one with anoth and the wife of the
one draweth near for to deliv her husband out of the hand of him
that smiteth him and putteth forth her hand and taketh him by the
secrets: 25:12 then thou shalt cut off her hand thine eye shall not
piti her

25:13 thou shalt not have in thi bag diver weight a great and a
small

25:14 thou shalt not have in thine hous diver measur a great and
a small

25:15 but thou shalt have a perfect and just weight a perfect and
just measur shalt thou have: that thi day may be lengthen in the
land which the lord thi god giveth thee

25:16 for all that do such thing and all that do unright are
an abomin unto the lord thi god

25:17 rememb what amalek did unto thee by the way when ye were come
forth out of egypt; 25:18 how he met thee by the way and smote the
hindmost of thee even all that were feebl behind thee when thou
wast faint and weary; and he fear not god

25:19 therefor it shall be when the lord thi god hath given thee
rest from all thine enemi round about in the land which the lord
thi god giveth thee for an inherit to possess it that thou shalt
blot out the remembr of amalek from under heaven; thou shalt not
forget it

26:1 and it shall be when thou art come in unto the land which the
lord thi god giveth thee for an inherit and possessest it and
dwellest therein; 26:2 that thou shalt take of the first of all the
fruit of the earth which thou shalt bring of thi land that the lord
thi god giveth thee and shalt put it in a basket and shalt go unto
the place which the lord thi god shall choos to place hi name there

26:3 and thou shalt go unto the priest that shall be in those day
and say unto him i profess thi day unto the lord thi god that i am
come unto the countri which the lord sware unto our father for to
give us

26:4 and the priest shall take the basket out of thine hand and set
it down befor the altar of the lord thi god

26:5 and thou shalt speak and say befor the lord thi god a syrian
readi to perish wa my father and he went down into egypt and
sojourn there with a few and becam there a nation great mighti
and populous: 26:6 and the egyptian evil entreat us and afflict
us and laid upon us hard bondage: 26:7 and when we cri unto the
lord god of our father the lord heard our voic and look on our
afflict and our labour and our oppression: 26:8 and the lord
brought us forth out of egypt with a mighti hand and with an
outstretch arm and with great terribl and with sign and
with wonders: 26:9 and he hath brought us into thi place and hath
given us thi land even a land that floweth with milk and honey

26:10 and now behold i have brought the firstfruit of the land
which thou o lord hast given me and thou shalt set it befor the
lord thi god and worship befor the lord thi god: 26:11 and thou
shalt rejoic in everi good thing which the lord thi god hath given
unto thee and unto thine hous thou and the levit and the
stranger that is among you

26:12 when thou hast made an end of tith all the tith of thine
increas the third year which is the year of tith and hast given
it unto the levit the stranger the fatherless and the widow that
they may eat within thi gate and be filled; 26:13 then thou shalt
say befor the lord thi god i have brought away the hallow thing
out of mine hous and also have given them unto the levit and unto
the stranger to the fatherless and to the widow accord to all
thi command which thou hast command me: i have not transgress
thi command neither have i forgotten them

26:14 i have not eaten thereof in my mourn neither have i taken
away ought thereof for ani unclean use nor given ought thereof for
the dead: but i have hearken to the voic of the lord my god and
have done accord to all that thou hast command me

26:15 look down from thi holi habit from heaven and bless thi
peopl israel and the land which thou hast given us as thou swarest
unto our father a land that floweth with milk and honey

26:16 thi day the lord thi god hath command thee to do these
statut and judgments: thou shalt therefor keep and do them with all
thine heart and with all thi soul

26:17 thou hast avouch the lord thi day to be thi god and to walk
in hi way and to keep hi statut and hi command and hi
judgment and to hearken unto hi voice: 26:18 and the lord hath
avouch thee thi day to be hi peculiar peopl as he hath promis
thee and that thou shouldest keep all hi commandments; 26:19 and to
make thee high abov all nation which he hath made in prais and in
name and in honour; and that thou mayest be an holi peopl unto the
lord thi god as he hath spoken

27:1 and mose with the elder of israel command the peopl say
keep all the command which i command you thi day

27:2 and it shall be on the day when ye shall pass over jordan unto
the land which the lord thi god giveth thee that thou shalt set thee
up great stone and plaister them with plaister: 27:3 and thou shalt
write upon them all the word of thi law when thou art pass over
that thou mayest go in unto the land which the lord thi god giveth
thee a land that floweth with milk and honey; as the lord god of thi
father hath promis thee

27:4 therefor it shall be when ye be gone over jordan that ye shall
set up these stone which i command you thi day in mount ebal and
thou shalt plaister them with plaister

27:5 and there shalt thou build an altar unto the lord thi god an
altar of stones: thou shalt not lift up ani iron tool upon them

27:6 thou shalt build the altar of the lord thi god of whole stones:
and thou shalt offer burnt offer thereon unto the lord thi god:
27:7 and thou shalt offer peac offer and shalt eat there and
rejoic befor the lord thi god

27:8 and thou shalt write upon the stone all the word of thi law
veri plainli

27:9 and mose and the priest the levit spake unto all israel
say take heed and hearken o israel; thi day thou art becom the
peopl of the lord thi god

27:10 thou shalt therefor obey the voic of the lord thi god and do
hi command and hi statut which i command thee thi day

27:11 and mose charg the peopl the same day say 27:12 these
shall stand upon mount gerizim to bless the peopl when ye are come
over jordan; simeon and levi and judah and issachar and joseph
and benjamin: 27:13 and these shall stand upon mount ebal to curse;
reuben gad and asher and zebulun dan and naphtali

27:14 and the levit shall speak and say unto all the men of israel
with a loud voic 27:15 curs be the man that maketh ani graven or
molten imag an abomin unto the lord the work of the hand of
the craftsman and putteth it in a secret place and all the peopl
shall answer and say amen

27:16 curs be he that setteth light by hi father or hi mother and
all the peopl shall say amen

27:17 curs be he that removeth hi neighbour landmark and all the
peopl shall say amen

27:18 curs be he that maketh the blind to wander out of the way and
all the peopl shall say amen

27:19 curs be he that perverteth the judgment of the stranger
fatherless and widow and all the peopl shall say amen

27:20 curs be he that lieth with hi father wife; becaus he
uncovereth hi father skirt and all the peopl shall say amen

27:21 curs be he that lieth with ani manner of beast and all the
peopl shall say amen

27:22 curs be he that lieth with hi sister the daughter of hi
father or the daughter of hi mother and all the peopl shall say
amen

27:23 curs be he that lieth with hi mother in law and all the
peopl shall say amen

27:24 curs be he that smiteth hi neighbour secretli and all the
peopl shall say amen

27:25 curs be he that taketh reward to slay an innoc person and
all the peopl shall say amen

27:26 curs be he that confirmeth not all the word of thi law to do
them and all the peopl shall say amen

28:1 and it shall come to pass if thou shalt hearken dilig unto
the voic of the lord thi god to observ and to do all hi
command which i command thee thi day that the lord thi god will
set thee on high abov all nation of the earth: 28:2 and all these
bless shall come on thee and overtak thee if thou shalt hearken
unto the voic of the lord thi god

28:3 bless shalt thou be in the citi and bless shalt thou be in
the field

28:4 bless shall be the fruit of thi bodi and the fruit of thi
ground and the fruit of thi cattl the increas of thi kine and the
flock of thi sheep

28:5 bless shall be thi basket and thi store

28:6 bless shalt thou be when thou comest in and bless shalt thou
be when thou goest out

28:7 the lord shall caus thine enemi that rise up against thee to
be smitten befor thi face: they shall come out against thee one way
and flee befor thee seven way

28:8 the lord shall command the bless upon thee in thi storehous
and in all that thou settest thine hand unto; and he shall bless thee
in the land which the lord thi god giveth thee

28:9 the lord shall establish thee an holi peopl unto himself as he
hath sworn unto thee if thou shalt keep the command of the lord
thi god and walk in hi way

28:10 and all peopl of the earth shall see that thou art call by
the name of the lord; and they shall be afraid of thee

28:11 and the lord shall make thee plenteou in good in the fruit of
thi bodi and in the fruit of thi cattl and in the fruit of thi
ground in the land which the lord sware unto thi father to give
thee

28:12 the lord shall open unto thee hi good treasur the heaven to
give the rain unto thi land in hi season and to bless all the work
of thine hand: and thou shalt lend unto mani nation and thou shalt
not borrow

28:13 and the lord shall make thee the head and not the tail; and
thou shalt be abov onli and thou shalt not be beneath; if that thou
hearken unto the command of the lord thi god which i command
thee thi day to observ and to do them: 28:14 and thou shalt not go
asid from ani of the word which i command thee thi day to the
right hand or to the left to go after other god to serv them

28:15 but it shall come to pass if thou wilt not hearken unto the
voic of the lord thi god to observ to do all hi command and
hi statut which i command thee thi day; that all these curs
shall come upon thee and overtak thee: 28:16 curs shalt thou be in
the citi and curs shalt thou be in the field

28:17 curs shall be thi basket and thi store

28:18 curs shall be the fruit of thi bodi and the fruit of thi
land the increas of thi kine and the flock of thi sheep

28:19 curs shalt thou be when thou comest in and curs shalt thou
be when thou goest out

28:20 the lord shall send upon thee curs vexat and rebuk in
all that thou settest thine hand unto for to do until thou be
destroy and until thou perish quickly; becaus of the wicked of
thi do wherebi thou hast forsaken me

28:21 the lord shall make the pestil cleav unto thee until he
have consum thee from off the land whither thou goest to possess
it

28:22 the lord shall smite thee with a consumpt and with a fever
and with an inflamm and with an extrem burn and with the
sword and with blast and with mildew; and they shall pursu thee
until thou perish

28:23 and thi heaven that is over thi head shall be brass and the
earth that is under thee shall be iron

28:24 the lord shall make the rain of thi land powder and dust: from
heaven shall it come down upon thee until thou be destroy

28:25 the lord shall caus thee to be smitten befor thine enemies:
thou shalt go out one way against them and flee seven way befor
them: and shalt be remov into all the kingdom of the earth

28:26 and thi carcas shall be meat unto all fowl of the air and
unto the beast of the earth and no man shall fray them away

28:27 the lord will smite thee with the botch of egypt and with the
emerod and with the scab and with the itch whereof thou canst not
be heal

28:28 the lord shall smite thee with mad and blind and
astonish of heart: 28:29 and thou shalt grope at noonday as the
blind gropeth in dark and thou shalt not prosper in thi ways: and
thou shalt be onli oppress and spoil evermor and no man shall
save thee

28:30 thou shalt betroth a wife and anoth man shall lie with her:
thou shalt build an hous and thou shalt not dwell therein: thou
shalt plant a vineyard and shalt not gather the grape thereof

28:31 thine ox shall be slain befor thine eye and thou shalt not
eat thereof: thine ass shall be violent taken away from befor thi
face and shall not be restor to thee: thi sheep shall be given unto
thine enemi and thou shalt have none to rescu them

28:32 thi son and thi daughter shall be given unto anoth peopl
and thine eye shall look and fail with long for them all the day
long; and there shall be no might in thine hand

28:33 the fruit of thi land and all thi labour shall a nation which
thou knowest not eat up; and thou shalt be onli oppress and crush
alway: 28:34 so that thou shalt be mad for the sight of thine eye
which thou shalt see

28:35 the lord shall smite thee in the knee and in the leg with a
sore botch that cannot be heal from the sole of thi foot unto the
top of thi head

28:36 the lord shall bring thee and thi king which thou shalt set
over thee unto a nation which neither thou nor thi father have
known; and there shalt thou serv other god wood and stone

28:37 and thou shalt becom an astonish a proverb and a byword
among all nation whither the lord shall lead thee

28:38 thou shalt carri much seed out into the field and shalt gather
but littl in; for the locust shall consum it

28:39 thou shalt plant vineyard and dress them but shalt neither
drink of the wine nor gather the grapes; for the worm shall eat
them

28:40 thou shalt have oliv tree throughout all thi coast but thou
shalt not anoint thyself with the oil; for thine oliv shall cast hi
fruit

28:41 thou shalt beget son and daughter but thou shalt not enjoy
them; for they shall go into captiv

28:42 all thi tree and fruit of thi land shall the locust consum

28:43 the stranger that is within thee shall get up abov thee veri
high; and thou shalt come down veri low

28:44 he shall lend to thee and thou shalt not lend to him: he shall
be the head and thou shalt be the tail

28:45 moreov all these curs shall come upon thee and shall pursu
thee and overtak thee till thou be destroyed; becaus thou
hearkenedst not unto the voic of the lord thi god to keep hi
command and hi statut which he command thee: 28:46 and they
shall be upon thee for a sign and for a wonder and upon thi seed for
ever

28:47 becaus thou servedst not the lord thi god with joy and
with glad of heart for the abund of all things; 28:48
therefor shalt thou serv thine enemi which the lord shall send
against thee in hunger and in thirst and in naked and in want
of all things: and he shall put a yoke of iron upon thi neck until he
have destroy thee

28:49 the lord shall bring a nation against thee from far from the
end of the earth as swift as the eagl flieth; a nation whose tongu
thou shalt not understand; 28:50 a nation of fierc counten which
shall not regard the person of the old nor shew favour to the young:
28:51 and he shall eat the fruit of thi cattl and the fruit of thi
land until thou be destroyed: which also shall not leav thee either
corn wine or oil or the increas of thi kine or flock of thi
sheep until he have destroy thee

28:52 and he shall besieg thee in all thi gate until thi high and
fenc wall come down wherein thou trustedst throughout all thi
land: and he shall besieg thee in all thi gate throughout all thi
land which the lord thi god hath given thee

28:53 and thou shalt eat the fruit of thine own bodi the flesh of thi
son and of thi daughter which the lord thi god hath given thee in
the sieg and in the strait wherewith thine enemi shall
distress thee: 28:54 so that the man that is tender among you and
veri delic hi eye shall be evil toward hi brother and toward
the wife of hi bosom and toward the remnant of hi children which he
shall leave: 28:55 so that he will not give to ani of them of the
flesh of hi children whom he shall eat: becaus he hath noth left
him in the sieg and in the strait wherewith thine enemi shall
distress thee in all thi gate

28:56 the tender and delic woman among you which would not
adventur to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for delic
and tender her eye shall be evil toward the husband of her bosom
and toward her son and toward her daughter 28:57 and toward her
young one that cometh out from between her feet and toward her
children which she shall bear: for she shall eat them for want of all
thing secretli in the sieg and strait wherewith thine enemi
shall distress thee in thi gate

28:58 if thou wilt not observ to do all the word of thi law that
are written in thi book that thou mayest fear thi gloriou and
fear name the lord thi god; 28:59 then the lord will make thi
plagu wonder and the plagu of thi seed even great plagu
and of long continu and sore sick and of long continu

28:60 moreov he will bring upon thee all the diseas of egypt
which thou wast afraid of; and they shall cleav unto thee

28:61 also everi sick and everi plagu which is not written in
the book of thi law them will the lord bring upon thee until thou
be destroy

28:62 and ye shall be left few in number wherea ye were as the star
of heaven for multitude; becaus thou wouldest not obey the voic of
the lord thi god

28:63 and it shall come to pass that as the lord rejoic over you to
do you good and to multipli you; so the lord will rejoic over you to
destroy you and to bring you to nought; and ye shall be pluck from
off the land whither thou goest to possess it

28:64 and the lord shall scatter thee among all peopl from the one
end of the earth even unto the other; and there thou shalt serv other
god which neither thou nor thi father have known even wood and
stone

28:65 and among these nation shalt thou find no eas neither shall
the sole of thi foot have rest: but the lord shall give thee there a
trembl heart and fail of eye and sorrow of mind: 28:66 and
thi life shall hang in doubt befor thee; and thou shalt fear day and
night and shalt have none assur of thi life: 28:67 in the morn
thou shalt say would god it were even! and at even thou shalt say
would god it were morning! for the fear of thine heart wherewith thou
shalt fear and for the sight of thine eye which thou shalt see

28:68 and the lord shall bring thee into egypt again with ship by
the way whereof i spake unto thee thou shalt see it no more again:
and there ye shall be sold unto your enemi for bondmen and
bondwomen and no man shall buy you

29:1 these are the word of the coven which the lord command
mose to make with the children of israel in the land of moab besid
the coven which he made with them in horeb

29:2 and mose call unto all israel and said unto them ye have
seen all that the lord did befor your eye in the land of egypt unto
pharaoh and unto all hi servant and unto all hi land; 29:3 the
great temptat which thine eye have seen the sign and those
great miracles: 29:4 yet the lord hath not given you an heart to
perceiv and eye to see and ear to hear unto thi day

29:5 and i have led you forti year in the wilderness: your cloth
are not waxen old upon you and thi shoe is not waxen old upon thi
foot

29:6 ye have not eaten bread neither have ye drunk wine or strong
drink: that ye might know that i am the lord your god

29:7 and when ye came unto thi place sihon the king of heshbon and
og the king of bashan came out against us unto battl and we smote
them: 29:8 and we took their land and gave it for an inherit unto
the reubenit and to the gadit and to the half tribe of manasseh

29:9 keep therefor the word of thi coven and do them that ye
may prosper in all that ye do

29:10 ye stand thi day all of you befor the lord your god; your
captain of your tribe your elder and your offic with all the
men of israel 29:11 your littl one your wive and thi stranger
that is in thi camp from the hewer of thi wood unto the drawer of thi
water: 29:12 that thou shouldest enter into coven with the lord thi
god and into hi oath which the lord thi god maketh with thee thi
day: 29:13 that he may establish thee to day for a peopl unto
himself and that he may be unto thee a god as he hath said unto
thee and as he hath sworn unto thi father to abraham to isaac and
to jacob

29:14 neither with you onli do i make thi coven and thi oath;
29:15 but with him that standeth here with us thi day befor the lord
our god and also with him that is not here with us thi day: 29:16
(for ye know how we have dwelt in the land of egypt; and how we came
through the nation which ye pass by; 29:17 and ye have seen their
abomin and their idol wood and stone silver and gold which
were among them:) 29:18 lest there should be among you man or woman
or famili or tribe whose heart turneth away thi day from the lord
our god to go and serv the god of these nations; lest there should
be among you a root that beareth gall and wormwood; 29:19 and it come
to pass when he heareth the word of thi curs that he bless
himself in hi heart say i shall have peac though i walk in the
imagin of mine heart to add drunken to thirst: 29:20 the
lord will not spare him but then the anger of the lord and hi
jealousi shall smoke against that man and all the curs that are
written in thi book shall lie upon him and the lord shall blot out
hi name from under heaven

29:21 and the lord shall separ him unto evil out of all the tribe
of israel accord to all the curs of the coven that are
written in thi book of the law: 29:22 so that the gener to come
of your children that shall rise up after you and the stranger that
shall come from a far land shall say when they see the plagu of
that land and the sick which the lord hath laid upon it; 29:23
and that the whole land thereof is brimston and salt and burn
that it is not sown nor beareth nor ani grass groweth therein like
the overthrow of sodom and gomorrah admah and zeboim which the
lord overthrew in hi anger and in hi wrath: 29:24 even all nation
shall say wherefor hath the lord done thu unto thi land? what
meaneth the heat of thi great anger? 29:25 then men shall say
becaus they have forsaken the coven of the lord god of their
father which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the
land of egypt: 29:26 for they went and serv other god and
worship them god whom they knew not and whom he had not given
unto them: 29:27 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against thi
land to bring upon it all the curs that are written in thi book:
29:28 and the lord root them out of their land in anger and in
wrath and in great indign and cast them into anoth land as
it is thi day

29:29 the secret thing belong unto the lord our god: but those thing
which are reveal belong unto us and to our children for ever that
we may do all the word of thi law

30:1 and it shall come to pass when all these thing are come upon
thee the bless and the curs which i have set befor thee and
thou shalt call them to mind among all the nation whither the lord
thi god hath driven thee 30:2 and shalt return unto the lord thi god
and shalt obey hi voic accord to all that i command thee thi
day thou and thi children with all thine heart and with all thi
soul; 30:3 that then the lord thi god will turn thi captiv and
have compass upon thee and will return and gather thee from all
the nation whither the lord thi god hath scatter thee

30:4 if ani of thine be driven out unto the outmost part of heaven
from thenc will the lord thi god gather thee and from thenc will he
fetch thee: 30:5 and the lord thi god will bring thee into the land
which thi father possess and thou shalt possess it; and he will do
thee good and multipli thee abov thi father

30:6 and the lord thi god will circumcis thine heart and the heart
of thi seed to love the lord thi god with all thine heart and with
all thi soul that thou mayest live

30:7 and the lord thi god will put all these curs upon thine
enemi and on them that hate thee which persecut thee

30:8 and thou shalt return and obey the voic of the lord and do all
hi command which i command thee thi day

30:9 and the lord thi god will make thee plenteou in everi work of
thine hand in the fruit of thi bodi and in the fruit of thi cattl
and in the fruit of thi land for good: for the lord will again
rejoic over thee for good as he rejoic over thi fathers: 30:10 if
thou shalt hearken unto the voic of the lord thi god to keep hi
command and hi statut which are written in thi book of the
law and if thou turn unto the lord thi god with all thine heart and
with all thi soul

30:11 for thi command which i command thee thi day it is not
hidden from thee neither is it far off

30:12 it is not in heaven that thou shouldest say who shall go up
for us to heaven and bring it unto us that we may hear it and do
it? 30:13 neither is it beyond the sea that thou shouldest say who
shall go over the sea for us and bring it unto us that we may hear
it and do it? 30:14 but the word is veri nigh unto thee in thi
mouth and in thi heart that thou mayest do it

30:15 see i have set befor thee thi day life and good and death
and evil; 30:16 in that i command thee thi day to love the lord thi
god to walk in hi way and to keep hi command and hi
statut and hi judgment that thou mayest live and multiply: and
the lord thi god shall bless thee in the land whither thou goest to
possess it

30:17 but if thine heart turn away so that thou wilt not hear but
shalt be drawn away and worship other god and serv them; 30:18 i
denounc unto you thi day that ye shall sure perish and that ye
shall not prolong your day upon the land whither thou passest over
jordan to go to possess it

30:19 i call heaven and earth to record thi day against you that i
have set befor you life and death bless and cursing: therefor
choos life that both thou and thi seed may live: 30:20 that thou
mayest love the lord thi god and that thou mayest obey hi voic and
that thou mayest cleav unto him: for he is thi life and the length
of thi days: that thou mayest dwell in the land which the lord sware
unto thi father to abraham to isaac and to jacob to give them

31:1 and mose went and spake these word unto all israel

31:2 and he said unto them i am an hundr and twenti year old thi
day; i can no more go out and come in: also the lord hath said unto
me thou shalt not go over thi jordan

31:3 the lord thi god he will go over befor thee and he will
destroy these nation from befor thee and thou shalt possess them:
and joshua he shall go over befor thee as the lord hath said

31:4 and the lord shall do unto them as he did to sihon and to og
king of the amorit and unto the land of them whom he destroy

31:5 and the lord shall give them up befor your face that ye may do
unto them accord unto all the command which i have command
you

31:6 be strong and of a good courag fear not nor be afraid of them:
for the lord thi god he it is that doth go with thee; he will not
fail thee nor forsak thee

31:7 and mose call unto joshua and said unto him in the sight of
all israel be strong and of a good courage: for thou must go with
thi peopl unto the land which the lord hath sworn unto their father
to give them; and thou shalt caus them to inherit it

31:8 and the lord he it is that doth go befor thee; he will be with
thee he will not fail thee neither forsak thee: fear not neither
be dismay

31:9 and mose wrote thi law and deliv it unto the priest the
son of levi which bare the ark of the coven of the lord and unto
all the elder of israel

31:10 and mose command them say at the end of everi seven
year in the solemn of the year of releas in the feast of
tabernacl 31:11 when all israel is come to appear befor the lord
thi god in the place which he shall choos thou shalt read thi law
befor all israel in their hear

31:12 gather the peopl togeth men and women and children and thi
stranger that is within thi gate that they may hear and that they
may learn and fear the lord your god and observ to do all the word
of thi law: 31:13 and that their children which have not known ani
thing may hear and learn to fear the lord your god as long as ye
live in the land whither ye go over jordan to possess it

31:14 and the lord said unto mose behold thi day approach that
thou must die: call joshua and present yourselv in the tabernacl
of the congreg that i may give him a charg and mose and
joshua went and present themselv in the tabernacl of the
congreg

31:15 and the lord appear in the tabernacl in a pillar of a cloud:
and the pillar of the cloud stood over the door of the tabernacl

31:16 and the lord said unto mose behold thou shalt sleep with thi
fathers; and thi peopl will rise up and go a whore after the god
of the stranger of the land whither they go to be among them and
will forsak me and break my coven which i have made with them

31:17 then my anger shall be kindl against them in that day and i
will forsak them and i will hide my face from them and they shall
be devour and mani evil and troubl shall befal them; so that
they will say in that day are not these evil come upon us becaus
our god is not among us? 31:18 and i will sure hide my face in that
day for all the evil which they shall have wrought in that they are
turn unto other god

31:19 now therefor write ye thi song for you and teach it the
children of israel: put it in their mouth that thi song may be a
wit for me against the children of israel

31:20 for when i shall have brought them into the land which i sware
unto their father that floweth with milk and honey; and they shall
have eaten and fill themselv and waxen fat; then will they turn
unto other god and serv them and provok me and break my
coven

31:21 and it shall come to pass when mani evil and troubl are
befallen them that thi song shall testifi against them as a witness;
for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouth of their seed: for i
know their imagin which they go about even now befor i have
brought them into the land which i sware

31:22 mose therefor wrote thi song the same day and taught it the
children of israel

31:23 and he gave joshua the son of nun a charg and said be strong
and of a good courage: for thou shalt bring the children of israel
into the land which i sware unto them: and i will be with thee

31:24 and it came to pass when mose had made an end of write the
word of thi law in a book until they were finish 31:25 that
mose command the levit which bare the ark of the coven of the
lord say 31:26 take thi book of the law and put it in the side
of the ark of the coven of the lord your god that it may be there
for a wit against thee

31:27 for i know thi rebellion and thi stiff neck: behold while i am
yet aliv with you thi day ye have been rebelli against the lord;
and how much more after my death? 31:28 gather unto me all the elder
of your tribe and your offic that i may speak these word in
their ear and call heaven and earth to record against them

31:29 for i know that after my death ye will utterli corrupt
yourselv and turn asid from the way which i have command you;
and evil will befal you in the latter days; becaus ye will do evil
in the sight of the lord to provok him to anger through the work of
your hand

31:30 and mose spake in the ear of all the congreg of israel
the word of thi song until they were end

32:1 give ear o ye heaven and i will speak; and hear o earth the
word of my mouth

32:2 my doctrin shall drop as the rain my speech shall distil as the
dew as the small rain upon the tender herb and as the shower upon
the grass: 32:3 becaus i will publish the name of the lord: ascrib
ye great unto our god

32:4 he is the rock hi work is perfect: for all hi way are
judgment: a god of truth and without iniqu just and right is he

32:5 they have corrupt themselv their spot is not the spot of hi
children: they are a pervers and crook gener

32:6 do ye thu requit the lord o foolish peopl and unwise? is not
he thi father that hath bought thee? hath he not made thee and
establish thee? 32:7 rememb the day of old consid the year
of mani generations: ask thi father and he will shew thee; thi
elder and they will tell thee

32:8 when the most high divid to the nation their inherit when
he separ the son of adam he set the bound of the peopl
accord to the number of the children of israel

32:9 for the lord portion is hi people; jacob is the lot of hi
inherit

32:10 he found him in a desert land and in the wast howl
wilderness; he led him about he instruct him he kept him as the
appl of hi eye

32:11 as an eagl stirreth up her nest fluttereth over her young
spreadeth abroad her wing taketh them beareth them on her wings:
32:12 so the lord alon did lead him and there wa no strang god
with him

32:13 he made him ride on the high place of the earth that he might
eat the increas of the fields; and he made him to suck honey out of
the rock and oil out of the flinti rock; 32:14 butter of kine and
milk of sheep with fat of lamb and ram of the breed of bashan and
goat with the fat of kidney of wheat; and thou didst drink the pure
blood of the grape

32:15 but jeshurun wax fat and kicked: thou art waxen fat thou art
grown thick thou art cover with fatness; then he forsook god which
made him and lightli esteem the rock of hi salvat

32:16 they provok him to jealousi with strang god with
abomin provok they him to anger

32:17 they sacrif unto devil not to god; to god whom they knew
not to new god that came newli up whom your father fear not

32:18 of the rock that begat thee thou art unmind and hast
forgotten god that form thee

32:19 and when the lord saw it he abhor them becaus of the
provok of hi son and of hi daughter

32:20 and he said i will hide my face from them i will see what
their end shall be: for they are a veri froward gener children
in whom is no faith

32:21 they have move me to jealousi with that which is not god; they
have provok me to anger with their vanities: and i will move them to
jealousi with those which are not a people; i will provok them to
anger with a foolish nation

32:22 for a fire is kindl in mine anger and shall burn unto the
lowest hell and shall consum the earth with her increas and set on
fire the foundat of the mountain

32:23 i will heap mischief upon them; i will spend mine arrow upon
them

32:24 they shall be burnt with hunger and devour with burn heat
and with bitter destruction: i will also send the teeth of beast upon
them with the poison of serpent of the dust

32:25 the sword without and terror within shall destroy both the
young man and the virgin the suckl also with the man of gray
hair

32:26 i said i would scatter them into corner i would make the
remembr of them to ceas from among men: 32:27 were it not that i
fear the wrath of the enemi lest their adversari should behav
themselv strang and lest they should say our hand is high and
the lord hath not done all thi

32:28 for they are a nation void of counsel neither is there ani
understand in them

32:29 o that they were wise that they understood thi that they
would consid their latter end! 32:30 how should one chase a
thousand and two put ten thousand to flight except their rock had
sold them and the lord had shut them up? 32:31 for their rock is not
as our rock even our enemi themselv be judg

32:32 for their vine is of the vine of sodom and of the field of
gomorrah: their grape are grape of gall their cluster are bitter:
32:33 their wine is the poison of dragon and the cruel venom of
asp

32:34 is not thi laid up in store with me and seal up among my
treasures? 32:35 to me belongeth vengeanc and recompence; their foot
shall slide in due time: for the day of their calam is at hand and
the thing that shall come upon them make hast

32:36 for the lord shall judg hi peopl and repent himself for hi
servant when he seeth that their power is gone and there is none
shut up or left

32:37 and he shall say where are their god their rock in whom they
trust 32:38 which did eat the fat of their sacrific and drank
the wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you and
be your protect

32:39 see now that i even i am he and there is no god with me: i
kill and i make alive; i wound and i heal: neither is there ani that
can deliv out of my hand

32:40 for i lift up my hand to heaven and say i live for ever

32:41 if i whet my glitter sword and mine hand take hold on
judgment; i will render vengeanc to mine enemi and will reward
them that hate me

32:42 i will make mine arrow drunk with blood and my sword shall
devour flesh; and that with the blood of the slain and of the
captiv from the begin of reveng upon the enemi

32:43 rejoic o ye nation with hi people: for he will aveng the
blood of hi servant and will render vengeanc to hi adversari
and will be merci unto hi land and to hi peopl

32:44 and mose came and spake all the word of thi song in the ear
of the peopl he and hoshea the son of nun

32:45 and mose made an end of speak all these word to all israel:
32:46 and he said unto them set your heart unto all the word which
i testifi among you thi day which ye shall command your children to
observ to do all the word of thi law

32:47 for it is not a vain thing for you; becaus it is your life: and
through thi thing ye shall prolong your day in the land whither ye
go over jordan to possess it

32:48 and the lord spake unto mose that selfsam day say 32:49
get thee up into thi mountain abarim unto mount nebo which is in
the land of moab that is over against jericho; and behold the land of
canaan which i give unto the children of israel for a possession:
32:50 and die in the mount whither thou goest up and be gather unto
thi people; as aaron thi brother die in mount hor and wa gather
unto hi people: 32:51 becaus ye trespass against me among the
children of israel at the water of meribahkadesh in the wilder
of zin; becaus ye sanctifi me not in the midst of the children of
israel

32:52 yet thou shalt see the land befor thee; but thou shalt not go
thither unto the land which i give the children of israel

33:1 and thi is the bless wherewith mose the man of god bless
the children of israel befor hi death

33:2 and he said the lord came from sinai and rose up from seir unto
them; he shine forth from mount paran and he came with ten thousand
of saints: from hi right hand went a fieri law for them

33:3 yea he love the people; all hi saint are in thi hand: and
they sat down at thi feet; everi one shall receiv of thi word

33:4 mose command us a law even the inherit of the
congreg of jacob

33:5 and he wa king in jeshurun when the head of the peopl and the
tribe of israel were gather togeth

33:6 let reuben live and not die; and let not hi men be few

33:7 and thi is the bless of judah: and he said hear lord the
voic of judah and bring him unto hi people: let hi hand be
suffici for him; and be thou an help to him from hi enemi

33:8 and of levi he said let thi thummim and thi urim be with thi
holi one whom thou didst prove at massah and with whom thou didst
strive at the water of meribah; 33:9 who said unto hi father and to
hi mother i have not seen him; neither did he acknowledg hi
brethren nor knew hi own children: for they have observ thi word
and kept thi coven

33:10 they shall teach jacob thi judgment and israel thi law: they
shall put incens befor thee and whole burnt sacrific upon thine
altar

33:11 bless lord hi substanc and accept the work of hi hands;
smite through the loin of them that rise against him and of them
that hate him that they rise not again

33:12 and of benjamin he said the belov of the lord shall dwell in
safeti by him; and the lord shall cover him all the day long and he
shall dwell between hi shoulder

33:13 and of joseph he said bless of the lord be hi land for the
preciou thing of heaven for the dew and for the deep that coucheth
beneath 33:14 and for the preciou fruit brought forth by the sun
and for the preciou thing put forth by the moon 33:15 and for the
chief thing of the ancient mountain and for the preciou thing of
the last hill 33:16 and for the preciou thing of the earth and
ful thereof and for the good will of him that dwelt in the bush:
let the bless come upon the head of joseph and upon the top of the
head of him that wa separ from hi brethren

33:17 hi glori is like the firstl of hi bullock and hi horn
are like the horn of unicorns: with them he shall push the peopl
togeth to the end of the earth: and they are the ten thousand of
ephraim and they are the thousand of manasseh

33:18 and of zebulun he said rejoic zebulun in thi go out; and
issachar in thi tent

33:19 they shall call the peopl unto the mountain; there they shall
offer sacrific of righteousness: for they shall suck of the
abund of the sea and of treasur hid in the sand

33:20 and of gad he said bless be he that enlargeth gad: he
dwelleth as a lion and teareth the arm with the crown of the head

33:21 and he provid the first part for himself becaus there in a
portion of the lawgiv wa he seated; and he came with the head of
the peopl he execut the justic of the lord and hi judgment
with israel

33:22 and of dan he said dan is a lion whelp: he shall leap from
bashan

33:23 and of naphtali he said o naphtali satisfi with favour and
full with the bless of the lord: possess thou the west and the
south

33:24 and of asher he said let asher be bless with children; let
him be accept to hi brethren and let him dip hi foot in oil

33:25 thi shoe shall be iron and brass; and as thi day so shall thi
strength be

33:26 there is none like unto the god of jeshurun who rideth upon the
heaven in thi help and in hi excel on the sky

33:27 the etern god is thi refug and underneath are the
everlast arms: and he shall thrust out the enemi from befor thee;
and shall say destroy them

33:28 israel then shall dwell in safeti alone: the fountain of jacob
shall be upon a land of corn and wine; also hi heaven shall drop
down dew

33:29 happi art thou o israel: who is like unto thee o peopl save
by the lord the shield of thi help and who is the sword of thi
excellency! and thine enemi shall be found liar unto thee; and thou
shalt tread upon their high place

34:1 and mose went up from the plain of moab unto the mountain of
nebo to the top of pisgah that is over against jericho and the lord
shew him all the land of gilead unto dan 34:2 and all naphtali
and the land of ephraim and manasseh and all the land of judah unto
the utmost sea 34:3 and the south and the plain of the valley of
jericho the citi of palm tree unto zoar

34:4 and the lord said unto him thi is the land which i sware unto
abraham unto isaac and unto jacob say i will give it unto thi
seed: i have caus thee to see it with thine eye but thou shalt not
go over thither

34:5 so mose the servant of the lord die there in the land of moab
accord to the word of the lord

34:6 and he buri him in a valley in the land of moab over against
bethpeor: but no man knoweth of hi sepulchr unto thi day

34:7 and mose wa an hundr and twenti year old when he died: hi
eye wa not dim nor hi natur forc abat

34:8 and the children of israel wept for mose in the plain of moab
thirti days: so the day of weep and mourn for mose were end

34:9 and joshua the son of nun wa full of the spirit of wisdom; for
mose had laid hi hand upon him: and the children of israel
hearken unto him and did as the lord command mose

34:10 and there aros not a prophet sinc in israel like unto mose
whom the lord knew face to face 34:11 in all the sign and the
wonder which the lord sent him to do in the land of egypt to
pharaoh and to all hi servant and to all hi land 34:12 and in
all that mighti hand and in all the great terror which mose shew
in the sight of all israel




the book of joshua


1:1 now after the death of mose the servant of the lord it came to
pass that the lord spake unto joshua the son of nun mose minist
say 1:2 mose my servant is dead; now therefor aris go over
thi jordan thou and all thi peopl unto the land which i do give
to them even to the children of israel

1:3 everi place that the sole of your foot shall tread upon that have
i given unto you as i said unto mose

1:4 from the wilder and thi lebanon even unto the great river
the river euphrat all the land of the hittit and unto the great
sea toward the go down of the sun shall be your coast

1:5 there shall not ani man be abl to stand befor thee all the day
of thi life: as i wa with mose so i will be with thee: i will not
fail thee nor forsak thee

1:6 be strong and of a good courage: for unto thi peopl shalt thou
divid for an inherit the land which i sware unto their father
to give them

1:7 onli be thou strong and veri courag that thou mayest observ
to do accord to all the law which mose my servant command thee:
turn not from it to the right hand or to the left that thou mayest
prosper withersoev thou goest

1:8 thi book of the law shall not depart out of thi mouth; but thou
shalt medit therein day and night that thou mayest observ to do
accord to all that is written therein: for then thou shalt make thi
way prosper and then thou shalt have good success

1:9 have not i command thee? be strong and of a good courage; be not
afraid neither be thou dismayed: for the lord thi god is with thee
whithersoev thou goest

1:10 then joshua command the offic of the peopl say 1:11
pass through the host and command the peopl say prepar you
