kartah with her suburb 21:35 dimnah with her suburb nahal with
her suburbs; four citi

21:36 and out of the tribe of reuben bezer with her suburb and
jahazah with her suburb 21:37 kedemoth with her suburb and
mephaath with her suburbs; four citi

21:38 and out of the tribe of gad ramoth in gilead with her suburb
to be a citi of refug for the slayer; and mahanaim with her suburb
21:39 heshbon with her suburb jazer with her suburbs; four citi in
all

21:40 so all the citi for the children of merari by their famili
which were remain of the famili of the levit were by their lot
twelv citi

21:41 all the citi of the levit within the possess of the
children of israel were forti and eight citi with their suburb

21:42 these citi were everi one with their suburb round about them:
thu were all these citi

21:43 and the lord gave unto israel all the land which he sware to
give unto their fathers; and they possess it and dwelt therein

21:44 and the lord gave them rest round about accord to all that
he sware unto their fathers: and there stood not a man of all their
enemi befor them; the lord deliv all their enemi into their
hand

21:45 there fail not ought of ani good thing which the lord had
spoken unto the hous of israel; all came to pass

22:1 then joshua call the reubenit and the gadit and the half
tribe of manasseh 22:2 and said unto them ye have kept all that
mose the servant of the lord command you and have obey my voic
in all that i command you: 22:3 ye have not left your brethren these
mani day unto thi day but have kept the charg of the command
of the lord your god

22:4 and now the lord your god hath given rest unto your brethren as
he promis them: therefor now return ye and get you unto your
tent and unto the land of your possess which mose the servant
of the lord gave you on the other side jordan

22:5 but take dilig heed to do the command and the law which
mose the servant of the lord charg you to love the lord your god
and to walk in all hi way and to keep hi command and to
cleav unto him and to serv him with all your heart and with all
your soul

22:6 so joshua bless them and sent them away: and they went unto
their tent

22:7 now to the one half of the tribe of manasseh mose had given
possess in bashan: but unto the other half thereof gave joshua
among their brethren on thi side jordan westward and when joshua
sent them away also unto their tent then he bless them 22:8 and
he spake unto them say return with much rich unto your tent
and with veri much cattl with silver and with gold and with brass
and with iron and with veri much raiment: divid the spoil of your
enemi with your brethren

22:9 and the children of reuben and the children of gad and the half
tribe of manasseh return and depart from the children of israel
out of shiloh which is in the land of canaan to go unto the countri
of gilead to the land of their possess whereof they were
possess accord to the word of the lord by the hand of mose

22:10 and when they came unto the border of jordan that are in the
land of canaan the children of reuben and the children of gad and the
half tribe of manasseh built there an altar by jordan a great altar
to see to

22:11 and the children of israel heard say behold the children of
reuben and the children of gad and the half tribe of manasseh have
built an altar over against the land of canaan in the border of
jordan at the passag of the children of israel

22:12 and when the children of israel heard of it the whole
congreg of the children of israel gather themselv togeth at
shiloh to go up to war against them

22:13 and the children of israel sent unto the children of reuben and
to the children of gad and to the half tribe of manasseh into the
land of gilead phineha the son of eleazar the priest 22:14 and with
him ten princ of each chief hous a princ throughout all the
tribe of israel; and each one wa an head of the hous of their
father among the thousand of israel

22:15 and they came unto the children of reuben and to the children
of gad and to the half tribe of manasseh unto the land of gilead
and they spake with them say 22:16 thu saith the whole
congreg of the lord what trespass is thi that ye have commit
against the god of israel to turn away thi day from follow the
lord in that ye have build you an altar that ye might rebel thi
day against the lord? 22:17 is the iniqu of peor too littl for
us from which we are not cleans until thi day although there wa
a plagu in the congreg of the lord 22:18 but that ye must turn
away thi day from follow the lord? and it will be see ye rebel
to day against the lord that to morrow he will be wroth with the
whole congreg of israel

22:19 notwithstand if the land of your possess be unclean then
pass ye over unto the land of the possess of the lord wherein the
lord tabernacl dwelleth and take possess among us: but rebel
not against the lord nor rebel against us in build you an altar
besid the altar of the lord our god

22:20 did not achan the son of zerah commit a trespass in the accurs
thing and wrath fell on all the congreg of israel? and that man
perish not alon in hi iniqu

22:21 then the children of reuben and the children of gad and the half
tribe of manasseh answer and said unto the head of the thousand
of israel 22:22 the lord god of god the lord god of god he
knoweth and israel he shall know; if it be in rebellion or if in
transgress against the lord (save us not thi day) 22:23 that we
have built us an altar to turn from follow the lord or if to offer
thereon burnt offer or meat offer or if to offer peac
offer thereon let the lord himself requir it; 22:24 and if we
have not rather done it for fear of thi thing say in time to
come your children might speak unto our children say what have ye
to do with the lord god of israel? 22:25 for the lord hath made
jordan a border between us and you ye children of reuben and children
of gad; ye have no part in the lord: so shall your children make our
children ceas from fear the lord

22:26 therefor we said let us now prepar to build us an altar not
for burnt offer nor for sacrifice: 22:27 but that it may be a
wit between us and you and our gener after us that we
might do the servic of the lord befor him with our burnt offer
and with our sacrific and with our peac offerings; that your
children may not say to our children in time to come ye have no part
in the lord

22:28 therefor said we that it shall be when they should so say to
us or to our gener in time to come that we may say again
behold the pattern of the altar of the lord which our father made
not for burnt offer nor for sacrifices; but it is a wit
between us and you

22:29 god forbid that we should rebel against the lord and turn thi
day from follow the lord to build an altar for burnt offer
for meat offer or for sacrific besid the altar of the lord
our god that is befor hi tabernacl

22:30 and when phineha the priest and the princ of the
congreg and head of the thousand of israel which were with him
heard the word that the children of reuben and the children of gad
and the children of manasseh spake it pleas them

22:31 and phineha the son of eleazar the priest said unto the
children of reuben and to the children of gad and to the children of
manasseh thi day we perceiv that the lord is among us becaus ye
have not commit thi trespass against the lord: now ye have
deliv the children of israel out of the hand of the lord

22:32 and phineha the son of eleazar the priest and the princ
return from the children of reuben and from the children of gad
out of the land of gilead unto the land of canaan to the children of
israel and brought them word again

22:33 and the thing pleas the children of israel; and the children
of israel bless god and did not intend to go up against them in
battl to destroy the land wherein the children of reuben and gad
dwelt

22:34 and the children of reuben and the children of gad call the
altar ed: for it shall be a wit between us that the lord is god

23:1 and it came to pass a long time after that the lord had given
rest unto israel from all their enemi round about that joshua wax
old and stricken in age

23:2 and joshua call for all israel and for their elder and for
their head and for their judg and for their offic and said
unto them i am old and stricken in age: 23:3 and ye have seen all
that the lord your god hath done unto all these nation becaus of
you; for the lord your god is he that hath fought for you

23:4 behold i have divid unto you by lot these nation that remain
to be an inherit for your tribe from jordan with all the
nation that i have cut off even unto the great sea westward

23:5 and the lord your god he shall expel them from befor you and
drive them from out of your sight; and ye shall possess their land as
the lord your god hath promis unto you

23:6 be ye therefor veri courag to keep and to do all that is
written in the book of the law of mose that ye turn not asid
therefrom to the right hand or to the left; 23:7 that ye come not
among these nation these that remain among you; neither make mention
of the name of their god nor caus to swear by them neither serv
them nor bow yourselv unto them: 23:8 but cleav unto the lord your
god as ye have done unto thi day

23:9 for the lord hath driven out from befor you great nation and
strong: but as for you no man hath been abl to stand befor you unto
thi day

23:10 one man of you shall chase a thousand: for the lord your god he
it is that fighteth for you as he hath promis you

23:11 take good heed therefor unto yourselv that ye love the lord
your god

23:12 els if ye do in ani wise go back and cleav unto the remnant
of these nation even these that remain among you and shall make
marriag with them and go in unto them and they to you: 23:13 know
for a certainti that the lord your god will no more drive out ani of
these nation from befor you; but they shall be snare and trap unto
you and scourg in your side and thorn in your eye until ye
perish from off thi good land which the lord your god hath given you

23:14 and behold thi day i am go the way of all the earth: and
ye know in all your heart and in all your soul that not one thing
hath fail of all the good thing which the lord your god spake
concern you; all are come to pass unto you and not one thing hath
fail thereof

23:15 therefor it shall come to pass that as all good thing are
come upon you which the lord your god promis you; so shall the lord
bring upon you all evil thing until he have destroy you from off
thi good land which the lord your god hath given you

23:16 when ye have transgress the coven of the lord your god
which he command you and have gone and serv other god and bow
yourselv to them; then shall the anger of the lord be kindl
against you and ye shall perish quickli from off the good land which
he hath given unto you

24:1 and joshua gather all the tribe of israel to shechem and
call for the elder of israel and for their head and for their
judg and for their officers; and they present themselv befor
god

24:2 and joshua said unto all the peopl thu saith the lord god of
israel your father dwelt on the other side of the flood in old time
even terah the father of abraham and the father of nachor: and they
serv other god

24:3 and i took your father abraham from the other side of the flood
and led him throughout all the land of canaan and multipli hi
seed and gave him isaac

24:4 and i gave unto isaac jacob and esau: and i gave unto esau mount
seir to possess it; but jacob and hi children went down into egypt

24:5 i sent mose also and aaron and i plagu egypt accord to
that which i did among them: and afterward i brought you out

24:6 and i brought your father out of egypt: and ye came unto the
sea; and the egyptian pursu after your father with chariot and
horsemen unto the red sea

24:7 and when they cri unto the lord he put dark between you
and the egyptian and brought the sea upon them and cover them;
and your eye have seen what i have done in egypt: and ye dwelt in the
wilder a long season

24:8 and i brought you into the land of the amorit which dwelt on
the other side jordan; and they fought with you: and i gave them into
your hand that ye might possess their land; and i destroy them from
befor you

24:9 then balak the son of zippor king of moab aros and war
against israel and sent and call balaam the son of beor to curs
you: 24:10 but i would not hearken unto balaam; therefor he bless
you still: so i deliv you out of hi hand

24:11 and you went over jordan and came unto jericho: and the men of
jericho fought against you the amorit and the perizzit and the
canaanit and the hittit and the girgashit the hivit and
the jebusites; and i deliv them into your hand

24:12 and i sent the hornet befor you which drave them out from
befor you even the two king of the amorites; but not with thi
sword nor with thi bow

24:13 and i have given you a land for which ye did not labour and
citi which ye built not and ye dwell in them; of the vineyard and
oliveyard which ye plant not do ye eat

24:14 now therefor fear the lord and serv him in sincer and in
truth: and put away the god which your father serv on the other
side of the flood and in egypt; and serv ye the lord

24:15 and if it seem evil unto you to serv the lord choos you thi
day whom ye will serve; whether the god which your father serv
that were on the other side of the flood or the god of the amorit
in whose land ye dwell: but as for me and my hous we will serv the
lord

24:16 and the peopl answer and said god forbid that we should
forsak the lord to serv other gods; 24:17 for the lord our god he
it is that brought us up and our father out of the land of egypt
from the hous of bondag and which did those great sign in our
sight and preserv us in all the way wherein we went and among all
the peopl through whom we passed: 24:18 and the lord drave out from
befor us all the peopl even the amorit which dwelt in the land:
therefor will we also serv the lord; for he is our god

24:19 and joshua said unto the peopl ye cannot serv the lord: for
he is an holi god; he is a jealou god; he will not forgiv your
transgress nor your sin

24:20 if ye forsak the lord and serv strang god then he will
turn and do you hurt and consum you after that he hath done you
good

24:21 and the peopl said unto joshua nay; but we will serv the
lord

24:22 and joshua said unto the peopl ye are wit against
yourselv that ye have chosen you the lord to serv him and they
said we are wit

24:23 now therefor put away said he the strang god which are
among you and inclin your heart unto the lord god of israel

24:24 and the peopl said unto joshua the lord our god will we serv
and hi voic will we obey

24:25 so joshua made a coven with the peopl that day and set them
a statut and an ordin in shechem

24:26 and joshua wrote these word in the book of the law of god and
took a great stone and set it up there under an oak that wa by the
sanctuari of the lord

24:27 and joshua said unto all the peopl behold thi stone shall be
a wit unto us; for it hath heard all the word of the lord which
he spake unto us: it shall be therefor a wit unto you lest ye
deni your god

24:28 so joshua let the peopl depart everi man unto hi inherit

24:29 and it came to pass after these thing that joshua the son of
nun the servant of the lord die be an hundr and ten year
old

24:30 and they buri him in the border of hi inherit in
timnathserah which is in mount ephraim on the north side of the hill
of gaash

24:31 and israel serv the lord all the day of joshua and all the
day of the elder that overliv joshua and which had known all the
work of the lord that he had done for israel

24:32 and the bone of joseph which the children of israel brought up
out of egypt buri they in shechem in a parcel of ground which
jacob bought of the son of hamor the father of shechem for an hundr
piec of silver: and it becam the inherit of the children of
joseph

24:33 and eleazar the son of aaron died; and they buri him in a hill
that pertain to phineha hi son which wa given him in mount
ephraim




the book of judg


1:1 now after the death of joshua it came to pass that the children
of israel ask the lord say who shall go up for us against the
canaanit first to fight against them? 1:2 and the lord said judah
shall go up: behold i have deliv the land into hi hand

1:3 and judah said unto simeon hi brother come up with me into my
lot that we may fight against the canaanites; and i likewis will go
with thee into thi lot so simeon went with him

1:4 and judah went up; and the lord deliv the canaanit and the
perizzit into their hand: and they slew of them in bezek ten
thousand men

1:5 and they found adonibezek in bezek: and they fought against him
and they slew the canaanit and the perizzit

1:6 but adonibezek fled; and they pursu after him and caught him
and cut off hi thumb and hi great toe

1:7 and adonibezek said threescor and ten king have their thumb
and their great toe cut off gather their meat under my table: as i
have done so god hath requit me and they brought him to jerusalem
and there he die

1:8 now the children of judah had fought against jerusalem and had
taken it and smitten it with the edg of the sword and set the citi
on fire

1:9 and afterward the children of judah went down to fight against the
canaanit that dwelt in the mountain and in the south and in the
valley

1:10 and judah went against the canaanit that dwelt in hebron: (now
the name of hebron befor wa kirjatharba:) and they slew sheshai and
ahiman and talmai

1:11 and from thenc he went against the inhabit of debir: and the
name of debir befor wa kirjathsepher: 1:12 and caleb said he that
smiteth kirjathseph and taketh it to him will i give achsah my
daughter to wife

1:13 and othniel the son of kenaz caleb younger brother took it:
and he gave him achsah hi daughter to wife

1:14 and it came to pass when she came to him that she move him to
ask of her father a field: and she light from off her ass; and caleb
said unto her what wilt thou? 1:15 and she said unto him give me a
blessing: for thou hast given me a south land; give me also spring of
water and caleb gave her the upper spring and the nether spring

1:16 and the children of the kenit mose father in law went up out
of the citi of palm tree with the children of judah into the
wilder of judah which lieth in the south of arad; and they went
and dwelt among the peopl

1:17 and judah went with simeon hi brother and they slew the
canaanit that inhabit zephath and utterli destroy it and the
name of the citi wa call hormah

1:18 also judah took gaza with the coast thereof and askelon with the
coast thereof and ekron with the coast thereof

1:19 and the lord wa with judah; and he drave out the inhabit of
the mountain; but could not drive out the inhabit of the valley
becaus they had chariot of iron

1:20 and they gave hebron unto caleb as mose said: and he expel
thenc the three son of anak

1:21 and the children of benjamin did not drive out the jebusit that
inhabit jerusalem; but the jebusit dwell with the children of
benjamin in jerusalem unto thi day

1:22 and the hous of joseph they also went up against bethel: and
the lord wa with them

1:23 and the hous of joseph sent to descri bethel (now the name of
the citi befor wa luz) 1:24 and the spi saw a man come forth out
of the citi and they said unto him shew us we pray thee the
entranc into the citi and we will shew thee merci

1:25 and when he shew them the entranc into the citi they smote
the citi with the edg of the sword; but they let go the man and all
hi famili

1:26 and the man went into the land of the hittit and built a citi
and call the name thereof luz: which is the name thereof unto thi
day

1:27 neither did manasseh drive out the inhabit of bethshean and
her town nor taanach and her town nor the inhabit of dor and
her town nor the inhabit of ibleam and her town nor the
inhabit of megiddo and her towns: but the canaanit would dwell
in that land

1:28 and it came to pass when israel wa strong that they put the
canaanit to tribut and did not utterli drive them out

1:29 neither did ephraim drive out the canaanit that dwelt in gezer;
but the canaanit dwelt in gezer among them

1:30 neither did zebulun drive out the inhabit of kitron nor the
inhabit of nahalol; but the canaanit dwelt among them and
becam tributari

1:31 neither did asher drive out the inhabit of accho nor the
inhabit of zidon nor of ahlab nor of achzib nor of helbah nor
of aphik nor of rehob: 1:32 but the asherit dwelt among the
canaanit the inhabit of the land: for they did not drive them
out

1:33 neither did naphtali drive out the inhabit of bethshemesh
nor the inhabit of bethanath; but he dwelt among the canaanit
the inhabit of the land: nevertheless the inhabit of
bethshemesh and of bethanath becam tributari unto them

1:34 and the amorit forc the children of dan into the mountain:
for they would not suffer them to come down to the valley: 1:35 but
the amorit would dwell in mount here in aijalon and in shaalbim:
yet the hand of the hous of joseph prevail so that they becam
tributari

1:36 and the coast of the amorit wa from the go up to akrabbim
from the rock and upward

2:1 and an angel of the lord came up from gilgal to bochim and said
i made you to go up out of egypt and have brought you unto the land
which i sware unto your fathers; and i said i will never break my
coven with you

2:2 and ye shall make no leagu with the inhabit of thi land; ye
shall throw down their altars: but ye have not obey my voice: whi
have ye done this? 2:3 wherefor i also said i will not drive them
out from befor you; but they shall be as thorn in your side and
their god shall be a snare unto you

2:4 and it came to pass when the angel of the lord spake these word
unto all the children of israel that the peopl lift up their
voic and wept

2:5 and they call the name of that place bochim: and they sacrif
there unto the lord

2:6 and when joshua had let the peopl go the children of israel went
everi man unto hi inherit to possess the land

2:7 and the peopl serv the lord all the day of joshua and all the
day of the elder that outliv joshua who had seen all the great
work of the lord that he did for israel

2:8 and joshua the son of nun the servant of the lord die be an
hundr and ten year old

2:9 and they buri him in the border of hi inherit in
timnathher in the mount of ephraim on the north side of the hill
gaash

2:10 and also all that gener were gather unto their fathers:
and there aros anoth gener after them which knew not the
lord nor yet the work which he had done for israel

2:11 and the children of israel did evil in the sight of the lord and
serv baalim: 2:12 and they forsook the lord god of their father
which brought them out of the land of egypt and follow other god
of the god of the peopl that were round about them and bow
themselv unto them and provok the lord to anger

2:13 and they forsook the lord and serv baal and ashtaroth

2:14 and the anger of the lord wa hot against israel and he
deliv them into the hand of spoiler that spoil them and he
sold them into the hand of their enemi round about so that they
could not ani longer stand befor their enemi

2:15 whithersoev they went out the hand of the lord wa against
them for evil as the lord had said and as the lord had sworn unto
them: and they were greatli distress

2:16 nevertheless the lord rais up judg which deliv them out
of the hand of those that spoil them

2:17 and yet they would not hearken unto their judg but they went a
whore after other god and bow themselv unto them: they turn
quickli out of the way which their father walk in obey the
command of the lord; but they did not so

2:18 and when the lord rais them up judg then the lord wa with
the judg and deliv them out of the hand of their enemi all the
day of the judge: for it repent the lord becaus of their groan
by reason of them that oppress them and vex them

2:19 and it came to pass when the judg wa dead that they return
and corrupt themselv more than their father in follow other
god to serv them and to bow down unto them; they ceas not from
their own do nor from their stubborn way

2:20 and the anger of the lord wa hot against israel; and he said
becaus that thi peopl hath transgress my coven which i
command their father and have not hearken unto my voice; 2:21 i
also will not henceforth drive out ani from befor them of the nation
which joshua left when he died: 2:22 that through them i may prove
israel whether they will keep the way of the lord to walk therein as
their father did keep it or not

2:23 therefor the lord left those nation without drive them out
hastily; neither deliv he them into the hand of joshua

3:1 now these are the nation which the lord left to prove israel by
them even as mani of israel as had not known all the war of canaan;
3:2 onli that the gener of the children of israel might know to
teach them war at the least such as befor knew noth thereof; 3:3
name five lord of the philistin and all the canaanit and the
sidonian and the hivit that dwelt in mount lebanon from mount
baalhermon unto the enter in of hamath

3:4 and they were to prove israel by them to know whether they would
hearken unto the command of the lord which he command their
father by the hand of mose

3:5 and the children of israel dwelt among the canaanit hittit
and amorit and perizzit and hivit and jebusites: 3:6 and they
took their daughter to be their wive and gave their daughter to
their son and serv their god

3:7 and the children of israel did evil in the sight of the lord and
forgat the lord their god and serv baalim and the grove

3:8 therefor the anger of the lord wa hot against israel and he
sold them into the hand of chushanrishathaim king of mesopotamia: and
the children of israel serv chushanrishathaim eight year

3:9 and when the children of israel cri unto the lord the lord
rais up a deliver to the children of israel who deliv them
even othniel the son of kenaz caleb younger brother

3:10 and the spirit of the lord came upon him and he judg israel
and went out to war: and the lord deliv chushanrishathaim king of
mesopotamia into hi hand; and hi hand prevail against
chushanrishathaim

3:11 and the land had rest forti year and othniel the son of kenaz
die

3:12 and the children of israel did evil again in the sight of the
lord: and the lord strengthen eglon the king of moab against israel
becaus they had done evil in the sight of the lord

3:13 and he gather unto him the children of ammon and amalek and
went and smote israel and possess the citi of palm tree

3:14 so the children of israel serv eglon the king of moab eighteen
year

3:15 but when the children of israel cri unto the lord the lord
rais them up a deliver ehud the son of gera a benjamit a man
lefthanded: and by him the children of israel sent a present unto
eglon the king of moab

3:16 but ehud made him a dagger which had two edg of a cubit
length; and he did gird it under hi raiment upon hi right thigh

3:17 and he brought the present unto eglon king of moab: and eglon wa
a veri fat man

3:18 and when he had made an end to offer the present he sent away
the peopl that bare the present

3:19 but he himself turn again from the quarri that were by
gilgal and said i have a secret errand unto thee o king: who said
keep silenc and all that stood by him went out from him

3:20 and ehud came unto him; and he wa sit in a summer parlour
which he had for himself alon and ehud said i have a messag from
god unto thee

and he aros out of hi seat

3:21 and ehud put forth hi left hand and took the dagger from hi
right thigh and thrust it into hi belly: 3:22 and the haft also went
in after the blade; and the fat close upon the blade so that he
could not draw the dagger out of hi belly; and the dirt came out

3:23 then ehud went forth through the porch and shut the door of the
parlour upon him and lock them

3:24 when he wa gone out hi servant came; and when they saw that
behold the door of the parlour were lock they said sure he
covereth hi feet in hi summer chamber

3:25 and they tarri till they were ashamed: and behold he open
not the door of the parlour; therefor they took a key and open
them: and behold their lord wa fallen down dead on the earth

3:26 and ehud escap while they tarri and pass beyond the
quarri and escap unto seirath

3:27 and it came to pass when he wa come that he blew a trumpet in
the mountain of ephraim and the children of israel went down with him
from the mount and he befor them

3:28 and he said unto them follow after me: for the lord hath
deliv your enemi the moabit into your hand and they went down
after him and took the ford of jordan toward moab and suffer not
a man to pass over

3:29 and they slew of moab at that time about ten thousand men all
lusti and all men of valour; and there escap not a man

3:30 so moab wa subdu that day under the hand of israel and the
land had rest fourscor year

3:31 and after him wa shamgar the son of anath which slew of the
philistin six hundr men with an ox goad: and he also deliv
israel

4:1 and the children of israel again did evil in the sight of the
lord when ehud wa dead

4:2 and the lord sold them into the hand of jabin king of canaan that
reign in hazor; the captain of whose host wa sisera which dwelt in
harosheth of the gentil

4:3 and the children of israel cri unto the lord: for he had nine
hundr chariot of iron; and twenti year he mightili oppress the
children of israel

4:4 and deborah a prophetess the wife of lapidoth she judg israel
at that time

4:5 and she dwelt under the palm tree of deborah between ramah and
bethel in mount ephraim: and the children of israel came up to her for
judgment

4:6 and she sent and call barak the son of abinoam out of
kedeshnaphtali and said unto him hath not the lord god of israel
command say go and draw toward mount tabor and take with thee
ten thousand men of the children of naphtali and of the children of
zebulun? 4:7 and i will draw unto thee to the river kishon sisera
the captain of jabin armi with hi chariot and hi multitude; and
i will deliv him into thine hand

4:8 and barak said unto her if thou wilt go with me then i will go:
but if thou wilt not go with me then i will not go

4:9 and she said i will sure go with thee: notwithstand the
journey that thou takest shall not be for thine honour; for the lord
shall sell sisera into the hand of a woman and deborah aros and
went with barak to kedesh

4:10 and barak call zebulun and naphtali to kedesh; and he went up
with ten thousand men at hi feet: and deborah went up with him

4:11 now heber the kenit which wa of the children of hobab the
father in law of mose had sever himself from the kenit and
pitch hi tent unto the plain of zaanaim which is by kedesh

4:12 and they shew sisera that barak the son of abinoam wa gone up
to mount tabor

4:13 and sisera gather togeth all hi chariot even nine hundr
chariot of iron and all the peopl that were with him from
harosheth of the gentil unto the river of kishon

4:14 and deborah said unto barak up; for thi is the day in which the
lord hath deliv sisera into thine hand: is not the lord gone out
befor thee? so barak went down from mount tabor and ten thousand men
after him

4:15 and the lord discomfit sisera and all hi chariot and all
hi host with the edg of the sword befor barak; so that sisera
light down off hi chariot and fled away on hi feet

4:16 but barak pursu after the chariot and after the host unto
harosheth of the gentiles: and all the host of sisera fell upon the
edg of the sword; and there wa not a man left

4:17 howbeit sisera fled away on hi feet to the tent of jael the wife
of heber the kenite: for there wa peac between jabin the king of
hazor and the hous of heber the kenit

4:18 and jael went out to meet sisera and said unto him turn in my
lord turn in to me; fear not and when he had turn in unto her into
the tent she cover him with a mantl

4:19 and he said unto her give me i pray thee a littl water to
drink; for i am thirsti and she open a bottl of milk and gave him
drink and cover him

4:20 again he said unto her stand in the door of the tent and it
shall be when ani man doth come and enquir of thee and say is
there ani man here? that thou shalt say no

4:21 then jael heber wife took a nail of the tent and took an
hammer in her hand and went softli unto him and smote the nail into
hi templ and fasten it into the ground: for he wa fast asleep
and weari so he die

4:22 and behold as barak pursu sisera jael came out to meet him
and said unto him come and i will shew thee the man whom thou
seekest and when he came into her tent behold sisera lay dead and
the nail wa in hi templ

4:23 so god subdu on that day jabin the king of canaan befor the
children of israel

4:24 and the hand of the children of israel prosper and prevail
against jabin the king of canaan until they had destroy jabin king
of canaan

5:1 then sang deborah and barak the son of abinoam on that day
say 5:2 prais ye the lord for the aveng of israel when the
peopl willingli offer themselv

5:3 hear o ye kings; give ear o ye princes; i even i will sing
unto the lord; i will sing prais to the lord god of israel

5:4 lord when thou wentest out of seir when thou marchedst out of
the field of edom the earth trembl and the heaven drop the
cloud also drop water

5:5 the mountain melt from befor the lord even that sinai from
befor the lord god of israel

5:6 in the day of shamgar the son of anath in the day of jael the
highway were unoccupi and the travel walk through byway

5:7 the inhabit of the villag ceas they ceas in israel
until that i deborah aros that i aros a mother in israel

5:8 they chose new gods; then wa war in the gates: wa there a shield
or spear seen among forti thousand in israel? 5:9 my heart is toward
the governor of israel that offer themselv willingli among the
peopl bless ye the lord

5:10 speak ye that ride on white ass ye that sit in judgment and
walk by the way

5:11 they that are deliv from the nois of archer in the place
of draw water there shall they rehears the righteou act of the
lord even the righteou act toward the inhabit of hi villag
in israel: then shall the peopl of the lord go down to the gate

5:12 awak awak deborah: awak awak utter a song: aris barak
and lead thi captiv captiv thou son of abinoam

5:13 then he made him that remaineth have dominion over the nobl
among the people: the lord made me have dominion over the mighti

5:14 out of ephraim wa there a root of them against amalek; after
thee benjamin among thi people; out of machir came down governor
and out of zebulun they that handl the pen of the writer

5:15 and the princ of issachar were with deborah; even issachar and
also barak: he wa sent on foot into the valley for the divis of
reuben there were great thought of heart

5:16 whi abodest thou among the sheepfold to hear the bleat of
the flocks? for the divis of reuben there were great search of
heart

5:17 gilead abod beyond jordan: and whi did dan remain in ships?
asher continu on the sea shore and abod in hi breach

5:18 zebulun and naphtali were a peopl that jeopard their live
unto the death in the high place of the field

5:19 the king came and fought then fought the king of canaan in
taanach by the water of megiddo; they took no gain of money

5:20 they fought from heaven; the star in their cours fought
against sisera

5:21 the river of kishon swept them away that ancient river the
river kishon o my soul thou hast trodden down strength

5:22 then were the horsehoof broken by the mean of the prans
the prans of their mighti one

5:23 curs ye meroz said the angel of the lord curs ye bitterli the
inhabit thereof; becaus they came not to the help of the lord to
the help of the lord against the mighti

5:24 bless abov women shall jael the wife of heber the kenit be
bless shall she be abov women in the tent

5:25 he ask water and she gave him milk; she brought forth butter
in a lordli dish

5:26 she put her hand to the nail and her right hand to the workmen
hammer; and with the hammer she smote sisera she smote off hi head
when she had pierc and stricken through hi templ

5:27 at her feet he bow he fell he lay down: at her feet he bow
he fell: where he bow there he fell down dead

5:28 the mother of sisera look out at a window and cri through
the lattic whi is hi chariot so long in coming? whi tarri the
wheel of hi chariots? 5:29 her wise ladi answer her yea she
return answer to herself 5:30 have they not sped? have they not
divid the prey; to everi man a damsel or two; to sisera a prey of
diver colour a prey of diver colour of needlework of diver
colour of needlework on both side meet for the neck of them that
take the spoil? 5:31 so let all thine enemi perish o lord: but let
them that love him be as the sun when he goeth forth in hi might and
the land had rest forti year

6:1 and the children of israel did evil in the sight of the lord: and
the lord deliv them into the hand of midian seven year

6:2 and the hand of midian prevail against israel: and becaus of
the midianit the children of israel made them the den which are in
the mountain and cave and strong hold

6:3 and so it wa when israel had sown that the midianit came up
and the amalekit and the children of the east even they came up
against them; 6:4 and they encamp against them and destroy the
increas of the earth till thou come unto gaza and left no
susten for israel neither sheep nor ox nor ass

6:5 for they came up with their cattl and their tent and they came
as grasshopp for multitude; for both they and their camel were
without number: and they enter into the land to destroy it

6:6 and israel wa greatli impoverish becaus of the midianites; and
the children of israel cri unto the lord

6:7 and it came to pass when the children of israel cri unto the
lord becaus of the midianit 6:8 that the lord sent a prophet unto
the children of israel which said unto them thu saith the lord god
of israel i brought you up from egypt and brought you forth out of
the hous of bondage; 6:9 and i deliv you out of the hand of the
egyptian and out of the hand of all that oppress you and drave
them out from befor you and gave you their land; 6:10 and i said
unto you i am the lord your god; fear not the god of the amorit
in whose land ye dwell: but ye have not obey my voic

6:11 and there came an angel of the lord and sat under an oak which
wa in ophrah that pertain unto joash the abiezrite: and hi son
gideon thresh wheat by the winepress to hide it from the
midianit

6:12 and the angel of the lord appear unto him and said unto him
the lord is with thee thou mighti man of valour

6:13 and gideon said unto him oh my lord if the lord be with us whi
then is all thi befallen us? and where be all hi miracl which our
father told us of say did not the lord bring us up from egypt?
but now the lord hath forsaken us and deliv us into the hand of
the midianit

6:14 and the lord look upon him and said go in thi thi might and
thou shalt save israel from the hand of the midianites: have not i
sent thee? 6:15 and he said unto him oh my lord wherewith shall i
save israel? behold my famili is poor in manasseh and i am the
least in my father hous

6:16 and the lord said unto him sure i will be with thee and thou
shalt smite the midianit as one man

6:17 and he said unto him if now i have found grace in thi sight
then shew me a sign that thou talkest with me

6:18 depart not henc i pray thee until i come unto thee and bring
forth my present and set it befor thee and he said i will tarri
until thou come again

6:19 and gideon went in and made readi a kid and unleaven cake of
an ephah of flour: the flesh he put in a basket and he put the broth
in a pot and brought it out unto him under the oak and present it

6:20 and the angel of god said unto him take the flesh and the
unleaven cake and lay them upon thi rock and pour out the broth
and he did so

6:21 then the angel of the lord put forth the end of the staff that
wa in hi hand and touch the flesh and the unleaven cakes; and
there rose up fire out of the rock and consum the flesh and the
unleaven cake then the angel of the lord depart out of hi
sight

6:22 and when gideon perceiv that he wa an angel of the lord
gideon said ala o lord god! for becaus i have seen an angel of the
lord face to face

6:23 and the lord said unto him peac be unto thee; fear not: thou
shalt not die

6:24 then gideon built an altar there unto the lord and call it
jehovahshalom: unto thi day it is yet in ophrah of the abiezrit

6:25 and it came to pass the same night that the lord said unto him
take thi father young bullock even the second bullock of seven
year old and throw down the altar of baal that thi father hath and
cut down the grove that is by it: 6:26 and build an altar unto the
lord thi god upon the top of thi rock in the order place and take
the second bullock and offer a burnt sacrific with the wood of the
grove which thou shalt cut down

6:27 then gideon took ten men of hi servant and did as the lord had
said unto him: and so it wa becaus he fear hi father
household and the men of the citi that he could not do it by day
that he did it by night

6:28 and when the men of the citi aros earli in the morn behold
the altar of baal wa cast down and the grove wa cut down that wa
by it and the second bullock wa offer upon the altar that wa
built

6:29 and they said one to anoth who hath done thi thing? and when
they enquir and ask they said gideon the son of joash hath done
thi thing

6:30 then the men of the citi said unto joash bring out thi son that
he may die: becaus he hath cast down the altar of baal and becaus
he hath cut down the grove that wa by it

6:31 and joash said unto all that stood against him will ye plead for
baal? will ye save him? he that will plead for him let him be put to
death whilst it is yet morning: if he be a god let him plead for
himself becaus one hath cast down hi altar

6:32 therefor on that day he call him jerubba say let baal
plead against him becaus he hath thrown down hi altar

6:33 then all the midianit and the amalekit and the children of
the east were gather togeth and went over and pitch in the
valley of jezreel

6:34 but the spirit of the lord came upon gideon and he blew a
trumpet; and abiez wa gather after him

6:35 and he sent messeng throughout all manasseh; who also wa
gather after him: and he sent messeng unto asher and unto
zebulun and unto naphtali; and they came up to meet them

6:36 and gideon said unto god if thou wilt save israel by mine hand
as thou hast said 6:37 behold i will put a fleec of wool in the
floor; and if the dew be on the fleec onli and it be dri upon all
the earth besid then shall i know that thou wilt save israel by mine
hand as thou hast said

6:38 and it wa so: for he rose up earli on the morrow and thrust the
fleec togeth and wring the dew out of the fleec a bowl full of
water

6:39 and gideon said unto god let not thine anger be hot against me
and i will speak but thi once: let me prove i pray thee but thi
onc with the fleece; let it now be dri onli upon the fleec and upon
all the ground let there be dew

6:40 and god did so that night: for it wa dri upon the fleec onli
and there wa dew on all the ground

7:1 then jerubba who is gideon and all the peopl that were with
him rose up earli and pitch besid the well of harod: so that the
host of the midianit were on the north side of them by the hill of
moreh in the valley

7:2 and the lord said unto gideon the peopl that are with thee are
too mani for me to give the midianit into their hand lest israel
vaunt themselv against me say mine own hand hath save me

7:3 now therefor go to proclaim in the ear of the peopl say
whosoev is fear and afraid let him return and depart earli from
mount gilead and there return of the peopl twenti and two
thousand; and there remain ten thousand

7:4 and the lord said unto gideon the peopl are yet too many; bring
them down unto the water and i will tri them for thee there: and it
shall be that of whom i say unto thee thi shall go with thee the
same shall go with thee; and of whomsoev i say unto thee thi shall
not go with thee the same shall not go

7:5 so he brought down the peopl unto the water: and the lord said
unto gideon everi one that lappeth of the water with hi tongu as a
dog lappeth him shalt thou set by himself; likewis everi one that
boweth down upon hi knee to drink

7:6 and the number of them that lap put their hand to their
mouth were three hundr men: but all the rest of the peopl bow
down upon their knee to drink water

7:7 and the lord said unto gideon by the three hundr men that
lap will i save you and deliv the midianit into thine hand:
and let all the other peopl go everi man unto hi place

7:8 so the peopl took victual in their hand and their trumpets: and
he sent all the rest of israel everi man unto hi tent and retain
those three hundr men: and the host of midian wa beneath him in the
valley

7:9 and it came to pass the same night that the lord said unto him
aris get thee down unto the host; for i have deliv it into thine
hand

7:10 but if thou fear to go down go thou with phurah thi servant down
to the host: 7:11 and thou shalt hear what they say; and afterward
shall thine hand be strengthen to go down unto the host then went
he down with phurah hi servant unto the outsid of the arm men that
were in the host

7:12 and the midianit and the amalekit and all the children of the
east lay along in the valley like grasshopp for multitude; and
their camel were without number as the sand by the sea side for
multitud

7:13 and when gideon wa come behold there wa a man that told a
dream unto hi fellow and said behold i dream a dream and lo a
cake of barley bread tumbl into the host of midian and came unto a
tent and smote it that it fell and overturn it that the tent lay
along

7:14 and hi fellow answer and said thi is noth els save the
sword of gideon the son of joash a man of israel: for into hi hand
hath god deliv midian and all the host

7:15 and it wa so when gideon heard the tell of the dream and
the interpret thereof that he worship and return into the
host of israel and said arise; for the lord hath deliv into your
hand the host of midian

7:16 and he divid the three hundr men into three compani and he
put a trumpet in everi man hand with empti pitcher and lamp
within the pitcher

7:17 and he said unto them look on me and do likewise: and behold
when i come to the outsid of the camp it shall be that as i do so
shall ye do

7:18 when i blow with a trumpet i and all that are with me then blow
ye the trumpet also on everi side of all the camp and say the sword
of the lord and of gideon

7:19 so gideon and the hundr men that were with him came unto the
outsid of the camp in the begin of the middl watch; and they had
but newli set the watch: and they blew the trumpet and brake the
pitcher that were in their hand

7:20 and the three compani blew the trumpet and brake the
pitcher and held the lamp in their left hand and the trumpet in
their right hand to blow withal: and they cri the sword of the
lord and of gideon

7:21 and they stood everi man in hi place round about the camp; and
all the host ran and cri and fled

7:22 and the three hundr blew the trumpet and the lord set everi
man sword against hi fellow even throughout all the host: and the
host fled to bethshittah in zererath and to the border of
abelmeholah unto tabbath

7:23 and the men of israel gather themselv togeth out of
naphtali and out of asher and out of all manasseh and pursu after
the midianit

7:24 and gideon sent messeng throughout all mount ephraim say
come down against the midianit and take befor them the water unto
bethbarah and jordan then all the men of ephraim gather themselv
togeth and took the water unto bethbarah and jordan

7:25 and they took two princ of the midianit oreb and zeeb; and
they slew oreb upon the rock oreb and zeeb they slew at the winepress
of zeeb and pursu midian and brought the head of oreb and zeeb to
gideon on the other side jordan

8:1 and the men of ephraim said unto him whi hast thou serv us
thu that thou calledst us not when thou wentest to fight with the
midianites? and they did chide with him sharpli

8:2 and he said unto them what have i done now in comparison of you?
is not the glean of the grape of ephraim better than the vintag
of abiezer? 8:3 god hath deliv into your hand the princ of
midian oreb and zeeb: and what wa i abl to do in comparison of you?
then their anger wa abat toward him when he had said that

8:4 and gideon came to jordan and pass over he and the three
hundr men that were with him faint yet pursu them

8:5 and he said unto the men of succoth give i pray you loav of
bread unto the peopl that follow me; for they be faint and i am
pursu after zebah and zalmunna king of midian

8:6 and the princ of succoth said are the hand of zebah and
zalmunna now in thine hand that we should give bread unto thine army?
8:7 and gideon said therefor when the lord hath deliv zebah and
zalmunna into mine hand then i will tear your flesh with the thorn
of the wilder and with brier

8:8 and he went up thenc to penuel and spake unto them likewise: and
the men of penuel answer him as the men of succoth had answer him

8:9 and he spake also unto the men of penuel say when i come
again in peac i will break down thi tower

8:10 now zebah and zalmunna were in karkor and their host with them
about fifteen thousand men all that were left of all the host of the
children of the east: for there fell an hundr and twenti thousand
men that drew sword

8:11 and gideon went up by the way of them that dwelt in tent on the
east of nobah and jogbehah and smote the host; for the host wa
secur

8:12 and when zebah and zalmunna fled he pursu after them and took
the two king of midian zebah and zalmunna and discomfit all the
host

8:13 and gideon the son of joash return from battl befor the sun
wa up 8:14 and caught a young man of the men of succoth and
enquir of him: and he describ unto him the princ of succoth and
the elder thereof even threescor and seventeen men

8:15 and he came unto the men of succoth and said behold zebah and
zalmunna with whom ye did upbraid me say are the hand of zebah
and zalmunna now in thine hand that we should give bread unto thi men
that are weary? 8:16 and he took the elder of the citi and thorn
of the wilder and brier and with them he taught the men of
succoth

8:17 and he beat down the tower of penuel and slew the men of the
citi

8:18 then said he unto zebah and zalmunna what manner of men were
they whom ye slew at tabor? and they answer as thou art so were
they; each one resembl the children of a king

8:19 and he said they were my brethren even the son of my mother:
as the lord liveth if ye had save them aliv i would not slay you

8:20 and he said unto jether hi firstborn up and slay them but the
youth drew not hi sword: for he fear becaus he wa yet a youth

8:21 then zebah and zalmunna said rise thou and fall upon us: for as
the man is so is hi strength and gideon aros and slew zebah and
zalmunna and took away the ornament that were on their camel
neck

8:22 then the men of israel said unto gideon rule thou over us both
thou and thi son and thi son son also: for thou hast deliv us
from the hand of midian

8:23 and gideon said unto them i will not rule over you neither
shall my son rule over you: the lord shall rule over you

8:24 and gideon said unto them i would desir a request of you that
ye would give me everi man the ear of hi prey (for they had
golden ear becaus they were ishmaelites) 8:25 and they
answer we will willingli give them and they spread a garment and
did cast therein everi man the ear of hi prey

8:26 and the weight of the golden ear that he request wa a
thousand and seven hundr shekel of gold; besid ornament and
collar and purpl raiment that wa on the king of midian and
besid the chain that were about their camel neck

8:27 and gideon made an ephod thereof and put it in hi citi even in
ophrah: and all israel went thither a whore after it: which thing
becam a snare unto gideon and to hi hous

8:28 thu wa midian subdu befor the children of israel so that
they lift up their head no more and the countri wa in quiet
forti year in the day of gideon

8:29 and jerubba the son of joash went and dwelt in hi own hous

8:30 and gideon had threescor and ten son of hi bodi begotten: for
he had mani wive

8:31 and hi concubin that wa in shechem she also bare him a son
whose name he call abimelech

8:32 and gideon the son of joash die in a good old age and wa
buri in the sepulchr of joash hi father in ophrah of the
abiezrit

8:33 and it came to pass as soon as gideon wa dead that the
children of israel turn again and went a whore after baalim and
made baalberith their god

8:34 and the children of israel rememb not the lord their god who
had deliv them out of the hand of all their enemi on everi
side: 8:35 neither shew they kind to the hous of jerubba
name gideon accord to all the good which he had shew unto
israel

9:1 and abimelech the son of jerubba went to shechem unto hi
mother brethren and commun with them and with all the famili of
the hous of hi mother father say 9:2 speak i pray you in
the ear of all the men of shechem whether is better for you either
that all the son of jerubba which are threescor and ten person
reign over you or that one reign over you? rememb also that i am
your bone and your flesh

9:3 and hi mother brethren spake of him in the ear of all the men
of shechem all these words: and their heart inclin to follow
abimelech; for they said he is our brother

9:4 and they gave him threescor and ten piec of silver out of the
hous of baalberith wherewith abimelech hire vain and light person
which follow him

9:5 and he went unto hi father hous at ophrah and slew hi
brethren the son of jerubba be threescor and ten person upon
one stone: notwithstand yet jotham the youngest son of jerubba
wa left; for he hid himself

9:6 and all the men of shechem gather togeth and all the hous of
millo and went and made abimelech king by the plain of the pillar
that wa in shechem

9:7 and when they told it to jotham he went and stood in the top of
mount gerizim and lift up hi voic and cri and said unto them
hearken unto me ye men of shechem that god may hearken unto you

9:8 the tree went forth on a time to anoint a king over them; and
they said unto the oliv tree reign thou over us

9:9 but the oliv tree said unto them should i leav my fat
wherewith by me they honour god and man and go to be promot over
the trees? 9:10 and the tree said to the fig tree come thou and
reign over us

9:11 but the fig tree said unto them should i forsak my sweet
and my good fruit and go to be promot over the trees? 9:12 then
said the tree unto the vine come thou and reign over us

9:13 and the vine said unto them should i leav my wine which
cheereth god and man and go to be promot over the trees? 9:14 then
said all the tree unto the brambl come thou and reign over us

9:15 and the brambl said unto the tree if in truth ye anoint me
king over you then come and put your trust in my shadow: and if not
let fire come out of the brambl and devour the cedar of lebanon

9:16 now therefor if ye have done truli and sincer in that ye
have made abimelech king and if ye have dealt well with jerubba and
hi hous and have done unto him accord to the deserv of hi
hands; 9:17 (for my father fought for you and adventur hi life
far and deliv you out of the hand of midian: 9:18 and ye are
risen up against my father hous thi day and have slain hi son
threescor and ten person upon one stone and have made abimelech
the son of hi maidserv king over the men of shechem becaus he
is your brother;) 9:19 if ye then have dealt truli and sincer with
jerubba and with hi hous thi day then rejoic ye in abimelech
and let him also rejoic in you: 9:20 but if not let fire come out
from abimelech and devour the men of shechem and the hous of millo;
and let fire come out from the men of shechem and from the hous of
millo and devour abimelech

9:21 and jotham ran away and fled and went to beer and dwelt there
for fear of abimelech hi brother

9:22 when abimelech had reign three year over israel 9:23 then god
sent an evil spirit between abimelech and the men of shechem; and the
men of shechem dealt treacher with abimelech: 9:24 that the
cruelti done to the threescor and ten son of jerubba might come
and their blood be laid upon abimelech their brother which slew them;
and upon the men of shechem which aid him in the kill of hi
brethren

9:25 and the men of shechem set lier in wait for him in the top of
the mountain and they rob all that came along that way by them:
and it wa told abimelech

9:26 and gaal the son of ebe came with hi brethren and went over to
shechem: and the men of shechem put their confid in him

9:27 and they went out into the field and gather their vineyard
and trode the grape and made merri and went into the hous of their
god and did eat and drink and curs abimelech

9:28 and gaal the son of ebe said who is abimelech and who is
shechem that we should serv him? is not he the son of jerubbaal? and
zebul hi officer? serv the men of hamor the father of shechem: for
whi should we serv him? 9:29 and would to god thi peopl were under
my hand! then would i remov abimelech and he said to abimelech
increas thine armi and come out

9:30 and when zebul the ruler of the citi heard the word of gaal the
son of ebe hi anger wa kindl

9:31 and he sent messeng unto abimelech privili say behold
gaal the son of ebe and hi brethren be come to shechem; and behold
they fortifi the citi against thee

9:32 now therefor up by night thou and the peopl that is with thee
and lie in wait in the field: 9:33 and it shall be that in the
morn as soon as the sun is up thou shalt rise earli and set upon
the city: and behold when he and the peopl that is with him come
out against thee then mayest thou do to them as thou shalt find
occas

9:34 and abimelech rose up and all the peopl that were with him by
night and they laid wait against shechem in four compani

9:35 and gaal the son of ebe went out and stood in the enter of
the gate of the city: and abimelech rose up and the peopl that were
with him from lie in wait

9:36 and when gaal saw the peopl he said to zebul behold there
come peopl down from the top of the mountain and zebul said unto
him thou seest the shadow of the mountain as if they were men

9:37 and gaal spake again and said see there come peopl down by the
middl of the land and anoth compani come along by the plain of
meonenim

9:38 then said zebul unto him where is now thi mouth wherewith thou
saidst who is abimelech that we should serv him? is not thi the
peopl that thou hast despised? go out i pray now and fight with
them

9:39 and gaal went out befor the men of shechem and fought with
abimelech

9:40 and abimelech chase him and he fled befor him and mani were
overthrown and wound even unto the enter of the gate

9:41 and abimelech dwelt at arumah: and zebul thrust out gaal and hi
brethren that they should not dwell in shechem

9:42 and it came to pass on the morrow that the peopl went out into
the field; and they told abimelech

9:43 and he took the peopl and divid them into three compani
and laid wait in the field and look and behold the peopl were
come forth out of the city; and he rose up against them and smote
them

9:44 and abimelech and the compani that wa with him rush forward
and stood in the enter of the gate of the city: and the two other
compani ran upon all the peopl that were in the field and slew
them

9:45 and abimelech fought against the citi all that day; and he took
the citi and slew the peopl that wa therein and beat down the
citi and sow it with salt

9:46 and when all the men of the tower of shechem heard that they
enter into an hold of the hous of the god berith

9:47 and it wa told abimelech that all the men of the tower of
shechem were gather togeth

9:48 and abimelech gat him up to mount zalmon he and all the peopl
that were with him; and abimelech took an axe in hi hand and cut
down a bough from the tree and took it and laid it on hi shoulder
and said unto the peopl that were with him what ye have seen me do
make hast and do as i have done

9:49 and all the peopl likewis cut down everi man hi bough and
follow abimelech and put them to the hold and set the hold on fire
upon them; so that all the men of the tower of shechem die also
about a thousand men and women

9:50 then went abimelech to thebez and encamp against thebez and
took it

9:51 but there wa a strong tower within the citi and thither fled
all the men and women and all they of the citi and shut it to them
and gat them up to the top of the tower

9:52 and abimelech came unto the tower and fought against it and
went hard unto the door of the tower to burn it with fire

9:53 and a certain woman cast a piec of a millston upon abimelech
head and all to brake hi skull

9:54 then he call hastili unto the young man hi armourbear and
said unto him draw thi sword and slay me that men say not of me a
women slew him and hi young man thrust him through and he die

9:55 and when the men of israel saw that abimelech wa dead they
depart everi man unto hi place

9:56 thu god render the wicked of abimelech which he did unto
hi father in slay hi seventi brethren: 9:57 and all the evil of
the men of shechem did god render upon their heads: and upon them came
the curs of jotham the son of jerubba

10:1 and after abimelech there aros to defend israel tola the son of
puah the son of dodo a man of issachar; and he dwelt in shamir in
mount ephraim

10:2 and he judg israel twenti and three year and die and wa
buri in shamir

10:3 and after him aros jair a gileadit and judg israel twenti
and two year

10:4 and he had thirti son that rode on thirti ass colt and they
had thirti citi which are call havothjair unto thi day which
are in the land of gilead

10:5 and jair die and wa buri in camon

10:6 and the children of israel did evil again in the sight of the
lord and serv baalim and ashtaroth and the god of syria and the
god of zidon and the god of moab and the god of the children of
ammon and the god of the philistin and forsook the lord and
serv not him

10:7 and the anger of the lord wa hot against israel and he sold
them into the hand of the philistin and into the hand of the
children of ammon

10:8 and that year they vex and oppress the children of israel:
eighteen year all the children of israel that were on the other side
jordan in the land of the amorit which is in gilead

10:9 moreov the children of ammon pass over jordan to fight also
against judah and against benjamin and against the hous of ephraim;
so that israel wa sore distress

10:10 and the children of israel cri unto the lord say we have
sin against thee both becaus we have forsaken our god and also
serv baalim

10:11 and the lord said unto the children of israel did not i deliv
you from the egyptian and from the amorit from the children of
ammon and from the philistines? 10:12 the zidonian also and the
amalekit and the maonit did oppress you; and ye cri to me and
i deliv you out of their hand

10:13 yet ye have forsaken me and serv other gods: wherefor i will
deliv you no more

10:14 go and cri unto the god which ye have chosen; let them deliv
you in the time of your tribul

10:15 and the children of israel said unto the lord we have sinned:
do thou unto us whatsoev seemeth good unto thee; deliv us onli we
pray thee thi day

10:16 and they put away the strang god from among them and serv
the lord: and hi soul wa griev for the miseri of israel

10:17 then the children of ammon were gather togeth and encamp
in gilead and the children of israel assembl themselv togeth
and encamp in mizpeh

10:18 and the peopl and princ of gilead said one to anoth what
man is he that will begin to fight against the children of ammon? he
shall be head over all the inhabit of gilead

11:1 now jephthah the gileadit wa a mighti man of valour and he wa
the son of an harlot: and gilead begat jephthah

11:2 and gilead wife bare him sons; and hi wife son grew up and
they thrust out jephthah and said unto him thou shalt not inherit in
our father house; for thou art the son of a strang woman

11:3 then jephthah fled from hi brethren and dwelt in the land of
tob: and there were gather vain men to jephthah and went out with
him

11:4 and it came to pass in process of time that the children of
ammon made war against israel

11:5 and it wa so that when the children of ammon made war against
israel the elder of gilead went to fetch jephthah out of the land of
tob: 11:6 and they said unto jephthah come and be our captain that
we may fight with the children of ammon

11:7 and jephthah said unto the elder of gilead did not ye hate me
and expel me out of my father house? and whi are ye come unto me now
when ye are in distress? 11:8 and the elder of gilead said unto
jephthah therefor we turn again to thee now that thou mayest go
with us and fight against the children of ammon and be our head over
all the inhabit of gilead

11:9 and jephthah said unto the elder of gilead if ye bring me home
again to fight against the children of ammon and the lord deliv
them befor me shall i be your head? 11:10 and the elder of gilead
said unto jephthah the lord be wit between us if we do not so
accord to thi word

11:11 then jephthah went with the elder of gilead and the peopl
made him head and captain over them: and jephthah utter all hi
word befor the lord in mizpeh

11:12 and jephthah sent messeng unto the king of the children of
ammon say what hast thou to do with me that thou art come
against me to fight in my land? 11:13 and the king of the children of
ammon answer unto the messeng of jephthah becaus israel took
away my land when they came up out of egypt from arnon even unto
jabbok and unto jordan: now therefor restor those land again
peaceabl

11:14 and jephthah sent messeng again unto the king of the children
of ammon: 11:15 and said unto him thu saith jephthah israel took
not away the land of moab nor the land of the children of ammon:
11:16 but when israel came up from egypt and walk through the
wilder unto the red sea and came to kadesh; 11:17 then israel
sent messeng unto the king of edom say let me i pray thee
pass through thi land: but the king of edom would not hearken thereto
and in like manner they sent unto the king of moab: but he would not
consent: and israel abod in kadesh

11:18 then they went along through the wilder and compass the
land of edom and the land of moab and came by the east side of the
land of moab and pitch on the other side of arnon but came not
within the border of moab: for arnon wa the border of moab

11:19 and israel sent messeng unto sihon king of the amorit the
king of heshbon; and israel said unto him let us pass we pray thee
through thi land into my place

11:20 but sihon trust not israel to pass through hi coast: but
sihon gather all hi peopl togeth and pitch in jahaz and
fought against israel

11:21 and the lord god of israel deliv sihon and all hi peopl
into the hand of israel and they smote them: so israel possess all
the land of the amorit the inhabit of that countri

11:22 and they possess all the coast of the amorit from arnon
even unto jabbok and from the wilder even unto jordan

11:23 so now the lord god of israel hath dispossess the amorit
from befor hi peopl israel and shouldest thou possess it? 11:24
wilt not thou possess that which chemosh thi god giveth thee to
possess? so whomsoev the lord our god shall drive out from befor
us them will we possess

11:25 and now art thou ani thing better than balak the son of zippor
king of moab? did he ever strive against israel or did he ever fight
against them 11:26 while israel dwelt in heshbon and her town and
in aroer and her town and in all the citi that be along by the
coast of arnon three hundr years? whi therefor did ye not recov
them within that time? 11:27 wherefor i have not sin against
thee but thou doest me wrong to war against me: the lord the judg be
judg thi day between the children of israel and the children of
ammon

11:28 howbeit the king of the children of ammon hearken not unto the
word of jephthah which he sent him

11:29 then the spirit of the lord came upon jephthah and he pass
over gilead and manasseh and pass over mizpeh of gilead and from
mizpeh of gilead he pass over unto the children of ammon

11:30 and jephthah vow a vow unto the lord and said if thou shalt
without fail deliv the children of ammon into mine hand 11:31 then
it shall be that whatsoev cometh forth of the door of my hous to
meet me when i return in peac from the children of ammon shall
sure be the lord and i will offer it up for a burnt offer

11:32 so jephthah pass over unto the children of ammon to fight
against them; and the lord deliv them into hi hand

11:33 and he smote them from aroer even till thou come to minnith
even twenti citi and unto the plain of the vineyard with a veri
great slaughter thu the children of ammon were subdu befor the
children of israel

11:34 and jephthah came to mizpeh unto hi hous and behold hi
daughter came out to meet him with timbrel and with dances: and she
wa hi onli child; besid her he had neither son nor daughter

11:35 and it came to pass when he saw her that he rent hi cloth
and said ala my daughter! thou hast brought me veri low and thou
art one of them that troubl me: for i have open my mouth unto the
lord and i cannot go back

11:36 and she said unto him my father if thou hast open thi mouth
unto the lord do to me accord to that which hath proceed out of
thi mouth; forasmuch as the lord hath taken vengeanc for thee of
thine enemi even of the children of ammon

11:37 and she said unto her father let thi thing be done for me: let
me alon two month that i may go up and down upon the mountain and
bewail my virgin i and my fellow

11:38 and he said go and he sent her away for two months: and she
went with her companion and bewail her virgin upon the
mountain

11:39 and it came to pass at the end of two month that she return
unto her father who did with her accord to hi vow which he had
vowed: and she knew no man and it wa a custom in israel 11:40 that
the daughter of israel went yearli to lament the daughter of jephthah
the gileadit four day in a year

12:1 and the men of ephraim gather themselv togeth and went
northward and said unto jephthah wherefor passedst thou over to
fight against the children of ammon and didst not call us to go with
thee? we will burn thine hous upon thee with fire

12:2 and jephthah said unto them i and my peopl were at great strife
with the children of ammon; and when i call you ye deliv me not
out of their hand

12:3 and when i saw that ye deliv me not i put my life in my
hand and pass over against the children of ammon and the lord
deliv them into my hand: wherefor then are ye come up unto me
thi day to fight against me? 12:4 then jephthah gather togeth
all the men of gilead and fought with ephraim: and the men of gilead
smote ephraim becaus they said ye gileadit are fugit of
ephraim among the ephraimit and among the manassit

12:5 and the gileadit took the passag of jordan befor the
ephraimites: and it wa so that when those ephraimit which were
escap said let me go over; that the men of gilead said unto him
art thou an ephraimite? if he said nay; 12:6 then said they unto him
say now shibboleth: and he said sibboleth: for he could not frame to
pronounc it right then they took him and slew him at the passag
of jordan: and there fell at that time of the ephraimit forti and
two thousand

12:7 and jephthah judg israel six year then die jephthah the
gileadit and wa buri in one of the citi of gilead

12:8 and after him ibzan of bethlehem judg israel

12:9 and he had thirti son and thirti daughter whom he sent
abroad and took in thirti daughter from abroad for hi son and he
judg israel seven year

12:10 then die ibzan and wa buri at bethlehem

12:11 and after him elon a zebulonit judg israel; and he judg
israel ten year

12:12 and elon the zebulonit die and wa buri in aijalon in the
countri of zebulun

12:13 and after him abdon the son of hillel a pirathonit judg
israel

12:14 and he had forti son and thirti nephew that rode on
threescor and ten ass colts: and he judg israel eight year

12:15 and abdon the son of hillel the pirathonit die and wa buri
in pirathon in the land of ephraim in the mount of the amalekit

13:1 and the children of israel did evil again in the sight of the
lord; and the lord deliv them into the hand of the philistin
forti year

13:2 and there wa a certain man of zorah of the famili of the
danit whose name wa manoah; and hi wife wa barren and bare not

13:3 and the angel of the lord appear unto the woman and said unto
her behold now thou art barren and bearest not: but thou shalt
conceiv and bear a son

13:4 now therefor bewar i pray thee and drink not wine nor strong
drink and eat not ani unclean thing: 13:5 for lo thou shalt
conceiv and bear a son; and no razor shall come on hi head: for the
child shall be a nazarit unto god from the womb: and he shall begin
to deliv israel out of the hand of the philistin

13:6 then the woman came and told her husband say a man of god
came unto me and hi counten wa like the counten of an angel
of god veri terrible: but i ask him not whenc he wa neither told
he me hi name: 13:7 but he said unto me behold thou shalt conceiv
and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink neither eat
ani unclean thing: for the child shall be a nazarit to god from the
womb to the day of hi death

13:8 then manoah intreat the lord and said o my lord let the man
of god which thou didst send come again unto us and teach us what we
shall do unto the child that shall be born

13:9 and god hearken to the voic of manoah; and the angel of god
came again unto the woman as she sat in the field: but manoah her
husband wa not with her

13:10 and the woman made hast and ran and shew her husband and
said unto him behold the man hath appear unto me that came unto
me the other day

13:11 and manoah aros and went after hi wife and came to the man
and said unto him art thou the man that spakest unto the woman? and
he said i am

13:12 and manoah said now let thi word come to pass how shall we
order the child and how shall we do unto him? 13:13 and the angel of
the lord said unto manoah of all that i said unto the woman let her
bewar

13:14 she may not eat of ani thing that cometh of the vine neither
let her drink wine or strong drink nor eat ani unclean thing: all
that i command her let her observ

13:15 and manoah said unto the angel of the lord i pray thee let us
detain thee until we shall have made readi a kid for thee

13:16 and the angel of the lord said unto manoah though thou detain
me i will not eat of thi bread: and if thou wilt offer a burnt
offer thou must offer it unto the lord for manoah knew not that
he wa an angel of the lord

13:17 and manoah said unto the angel of the lord what is thi name
that when thi say come to pass we may do thee honour? 13:18 and
the angel of the lord said unto him whi askest thou thu after my
name see it is secret? 13:19 so manoah took a kid with a meat
offer and offer it upon a rock unto the lord: and the angel did
wonderously; and manoah and hi wife look on

13:20 for it came to pass when the flame went up toward heaven from
off the altar that the angel of the lord ascend in the flame of the
altar and manoah and hi wife look on it and fell on their face
to the ground

13:21 but the angel of the lord did no more appear to manoah and to
hi wife then manoah knew that he wa an angel of the lord

13:22 and manoah said unto hi wife we shall sure die becaus we
have seen god

13:23 but hi wife said unto him if the lord were pleas to kill us
he would not have receiv a burnt offer and a meat offer at our
hand neither would he have shew us all these thing nor would as
at thi time have told us such thing as these

13:24 and the woman bare a son and call hi name samson: and the
child grew and the lord bless him

13:25 and the spirit of the lord began to move him at time in the
camp of dan between zorah and eshtaol

14:1 and samson went down to timnath and saw a woman in timnath of
the daughter of the philistin

14:2 and he came up and told hi father and hi mother and said i
have seen a woman in timnath of the daughter of the philistines: now
therefor get her for me to wife

14:3 then hi father and hi mother said unto him is there never a
woman among the daughter of thi brethren or among all my peopl
that thou goest to take a wife of the uncircumcis philistines? and
samson said unto hi father get her for me; for she pleaseth me well

14:4 but hi father and hi mother knew not that it wa of the lord
that he sought an occas against the philistines: for at that time
the philistin had dominion over israel

14:5 then went samson down and hi father and hi mother to timnath
and came to the vineyard of timnath: and behold a young lion roar
against him

14:6 and the spirit of the lord came mightili upon him and he rent
him as he would have rent a kid and he had noth in hi hand: but
he told not hi father or hi mother what he had done

14:7 and he went down and talk with the woman; and she pleas
samson well

14:8 and after a time he return to take her and he turn asid to
see the carcas of the lion: and behold there wa a swarm of bee
and honey in the carcas of the lion

14:9 and he took thereof in hi hand and went on eat and came to
hi father and mother and he gave them and they did eat: but he told
not them that he had taken the honey out of the carcas of the lion

14:10 so hi father went down unto the woman: and samson made there a
feast; for so use the young men to do

14:11 and it came to pass when they saw him that they brought thirti
companion to be with him

14:12 and samson said unto them i will now put forth a riddl unto
you: if ye can certainli declar it me within the seven day of the
feast and find it out then i will give you thirti sheet and thirti
chang of garments: 14:13 but if ye cannot declar it me then shall
ye give me thirti sheet and thirti chang of garment and they said
unto him put forth thi riddl that we may hear it

14:14 and he said unto them out of the eater came forth meat and out
of the strong came forth sweet and they could not in three day
expound the riddl

14:15 and it came to pass on the seventh day that they said unto
samson wife entic thi husband that he may declar unto us the
riddl lest we burn thee and thi father hous with fire: have ye
call us to take that we have? is it not so? 14:16 and samson wife
wept befor him and said thou dost but hate me and lovest me not:
thou hast put forth a riddl unto the children of my peopl and hast
not told it me and he said unto her behold i have not told it my
father nor my mother and shall i tell it thee? 14:17 and she wept
befor him the seven day while their feast lasted: and it came to
pass on the seventh day that he told her becaus she lay sore upon
him: and she told the riddl to the children of her peopl

14:18 and the men of the citi said unto him on the seventh day befor
the sun went down what is sweeter than honey? and what is stronger
than a lion? and he said unto them if ye had not plow with my
heifer ye had not found out my riddl

14:19 and the spirit of the lord came upon him and he went down to
ashkelon and slew thirti men of them and took their spoil and gave
chang of garment unto them which expound the riddl and hi anger
wa kindl and he went up to hi father hous

14:20 but samson wife wa given to hi companion whom he had use
as hi friend

15:1 but it came to pass within a while after in the time of wheat
harvest that samson visit hi wife with a kid; and he said i will
go in to my wife into the chamber but her father would not suffer him
to go in

15:2 and her father said i verili thought that thou hadst utterli
