hate her; therefor i gave her to thi companion: is not her younger
sister fairer than she? take her i pray thee instead of her

15:3 and samson said concern them now shall i be more blameless
than the philistin though i do them a displeasur

15:4 and samson went and caught three hundr fox and took
firebrand and turn tail to tail and put a firebrand in the midst
between two tail

15:5 and when he had set the brand on fire he let them go into the
stand corn of the philistin and burnt up both the shock and
also the stand corn with the vineyard and oliv

15:6 then the philistin said who hath done this? and they answer
samson the son in law of the timnit becaus he had taken hi wife
and given her to hi companion and the philistin came up and burnt
her and her father with fire

15:7 and samson said unto them though ye have done thi yet will i
be aveng of you and after that i will ceas

15:8 and he smote them hip and thigh with a great slaughter: and he
went down and dwelt in the top of the rock etam

15:9 then the philistin went up and pitch in judah and spread
themselv in lehi

15:10 and the men of judah said whi are ye come up against us? and
they answer to bind samson are we come up to do to him as he hath
done to us

15:11 then three thousand men of judah went to the top of the rock
etam and said to samson knowest thou not that the philistin are
ruler over us? what is thi that thou hast done unto us? and he said
unto them as they did unto me so have i done unto them

15:12 and they said unto him we are come down to bind thee that we
may deliv thee into the hand of the philistin and samson said
unto them swear unto me that ye will not fall upon me yourselv

15:13 and they spake unto him say no; but we will bind thee fast
and deliv thee into their hand: but sure we will not kill thee
and they bound him with two new cord and brought him up from the
rock

15:14 and when he came unto lehi the philistin shout against him:
and the spirit of the lord came mightili upon him and the cord that
were upon hi arm becam as flax that wa burnt with fire and hi
band loos from off hi hand

15:15 and he found a new jawbon of an ass and put forth hi hand
and took it and slew a thousand men therewith

15:16 and samson said with the jawbon of an ass heap upon heap
with the jaw of an ass have i slain a thousand men

15:17 and it came to pass when he had made an end of speak that
he cast away the jawbon out of hi hand and call that place
ramathlehi

15:18 and he wa sore athirst and call on the lord and said thou
hast given thi great deliver into the hand of thi servant: and
now shall i die for thirst and fall into the hand of the
uncircumcised? 15:19 but god clave an hollow place that wa in the
jaw and there came water thereout; and when he had drunk hi spirit
came again and he revived: wherefor he call the name thereof
enhakkor which is in lehi unto thi day

15:20 and he judg israel in the day of the philistin twenti
year

16:1 then went samson to gaza and saw there an harlot and went in
unto her

16:2 and it wa told the gazit say samson is come hither and
they compass him in and laid wait for him all night in the gate of
the citi and were quiet all the night say in the morn when
it is day we shall kill him

16:3 and samson lay till midnight and aros at midnight and took the
door of the gate of the citi and the two post and went away with
them bar and all and put them upon hi shoulder and carri them
up to the top of an hill that is befor hebron

16:4 and it came to pass afterward that he love a woman in the
valley of sorek whose name wa delilah

16:5 and the lord of the philistin came up unto her and said unto
her entic him and see wherein hi great strength lieth and by what
mean we may prevail against him that we may bind him to afflict him;
and we will give thee everi one of us eleven hundr piec of silver

16:6 and delilah said to samson tell me i pray thee wherein thi
great strength lieth and wherewith thou mightest be bound to afflict
thee

16:7 and samson said unto her if they bind me with seven green with
that were never dri then shall i be weak and be as anoth man

16:8 then the lord of the philistin brought up to her seven green
with which had not been dri and she bound him with them

16:9 now there were men lie in wait abid with her in the
chamber

and she said unto him the philistin be upon thee samson and he
brake the with as a thread of tow is broken when it toucheth the
fire so hi strength wa not known

16:10 and delilah said unto samson behold thou hast mock me and
told me lies: now tell me i pray thee wherewith thou mightest be
bound

16:11 and he said unto her if they bind me fast with new rope that
never were occupi then shall i be weak and be as anoth man

16:12 delilah therefor took new rope and bound him therewith and
said unto him the philistin be upon thee samson and there were
lier in wait abid in the chamber and he brake them from off hi
arm like a thread

16:13 and delilah said unto samson hitherto thou hast mock me and
told me lies: tell me wherewith thou mightest be bound and he said
unto her if thou weavest the seven lock of my head with the web

16:14 and she fasten it with the pin and said unto him the
philistin be upon thee samson and he awak out of hi sleep and
went away with the pin of the beam and with the web

16:15 and she said unto him how canst thou say i love thee when
thine heart is not with me? thou hast mock me these three time and
hast not told me wherein thi great strength lieth

16:16 and it came to pass when she press him daili with her word
and urg him so that hi soul wa vex unto death; 16:17 that he
told her all hi heart and said unto her there hath not come a razor
upon mine head; for i have been a nazarit unto god from my mother
womb: if i be shaven then my strength will go from me and i shall
becom weak and be like ani other man

16:18 and when delilah saw that he had told her all hi heart she
sent and call for the lord of the philistin say come up thi
onc for he hath shew me all hi heart then the lord of the
philistin came up unto her and brought money in their hand

16:19 and she made him sleep upon her knees; and she call for a man
and she caus him to shave off the seven lock of hi head; and she
began to afflict him and hi strength went from him

16:20 and she said the philistin be upon thee samson and he awok
out of hi sleep and said i will go out as at other time befor
and shake myself and he wist not that the lord wa depart from him

16:21 but the philistin took him and put out hi eye and brought
him down to gaza and bound him with fetter of brass; and he did
grind in the prison hous

16:22 howbeit the hair of hi head began to grow again after he wa
shaven

16:23 then the lord of the philistin gather them togeth for to
offer a great sacrific unto dagon their god and to rejoice: for they
said our god hath deliv samson our enemi into our hand

16:24 and when the peopl saw him they prais their god: for they
said our god hath deliv into our hand our enemi and the
destroy of our countri which slew mani of us

16:25 and it came to pass when their heart were merri that they
said call for samson that he may make us sport and they call for
samson out of the prison house; and he made them sport: and they set
him between the pillar

16:26 and samson said unto the lad that held him by the hand suffer
me that i may feel the pillar whereupon the hous standeth that i
may lean upon them

16:27 now the hous wa full of men and women; and all the lord of
the philistin were there; and there were upon the roof about three
thousand men and women that beheld while samson made sport

16:28 and samson call unto the lord and said o lord god rememb
me i pray thee and strengthen me i pray thee onli thi onc o
god that i may be at onc aveng of the philistin for my two eye

16:29 and samson took hold of the two middl pillar upon which the
hous stood and on which it wa born up of the one with hi right
hand and of the other with hi left

16:30 and samson said let me die with the philistin and he bow
himself with all hi might; and the hous fell upon the lord and
upon all the peopl that were therein so the dead which he slew at
hi death were more than they which he slew in hi life

16:31 then hi brethren and all the hous of hi father came down and
took him and brought him up and buri him between zorah and eshtaol
in the buryingplac of manoah hi father and he judg israel twenti
year

17:1 and there wa a man of mount ephraim whose name wa micah

17:2 and he said unto hi mother the eleven hundr shekel of silver
that were taken from thee about which thou cursedst and spakest of
also in mine ear behold the silver is with me; i took it and hi
mother said bless be thou of the lord my son

17:3 and when he had restor the eleven hundr shekel of silver to
hi mother hi mother said i had wholli dedic the silver unto
the lord from my hand for my son to make a graven imag and a molten
image: now therefor i will restor it unto thee

17:4 yet he restor the money unto hi mother; and hi mother took
two hundr shekel of silver and gave them to the founder who made
thereof a graven imag and a molten image: and they were in the hous
of micah

17:5 and the man micah had an hous of god and made an ephod and
teraphim and consecr one of hi son who becam hi priest

17:6 in those day there wa no king in israel but everi man did that
which wa right in hi own eye

17:7 and there wa a young man out of bethlehemjudah of the famili of
judah who wa a levit and he sojourn there

17:8 and the man depart out of the citi from bethlehemjudah to
sojourn where he could find a place: and he came to mount ephraim to
the hous of micah as he journey

17:9 and micah said unto him whenc comest thou? and he said unto
him i am a levit of bethlehemjudah and i go to sojourn where i may
find a place

17:10 and micah said unto him dwell with me and be unto me a father
and a priest and i will give thee ten shekel of silver by the year
and a suit of apparel and thi victual so the levit went in

17:11 and the levit wa content to dwell with the man; and the young
man wa unto him as one of hi son

17:12 and micah consecr the levite; and the young man becam hi
priest and wa in the hous of micah

17:13 then said micah now know i that the lord will do me good
see i have a levit to my priest

18:1 in those day there wa no king in israel: and in those day the
tribe of the danit sought them an inherit to dwell in; for unto
that day all their inherit had not fallen unto them among the
tribe of israel

18:2 and the children of dan sent of their famili five men from their
coast men of valour from zorah and from eshtaol to spi out the
land and to search it; and they said unto them go search the land:
who when they came to mount ephraim to the hous of micah they
lodg there

18:3 when they were by the hous of micah they knew the voic of the
young man the levite: and they turn in thither and said unto him
who brought thee hither? and what makest thou in thi place? and what
hast thou here? 18:4 and he said unto them thu and thu dealeth
micah with me and hath hire me and i am hi priest

18:5 and they said unto him ask counsel we pray thee of god that
we may know whether our way which we go shall be prosper

18:6 and the priest said unto them go in peace: befor the lord is
your way wherein ye go

18:7 then the five men depart and came to laish and saw the peopl
that were therein how they dwelt careless after the manner of the
zidonian quiet and secure; and there wa no magistr in the land
that might put them to shame in ani thing; and they were far from the
zidonian and had no busi with ani man

18:8 and they came unto their brethren to zorah and eshtaol: and their
brethren said unto them what say ye? 18:9 and they said aris that
we may go up against them: for we have seen the land and behold it
is veri good: and are ye still? be not sloth to go and to enter to
possess the land

18:10 when ye go ye shall come unto a peopl secur and to a larg
land: for god hath given it into your hands; a place where there is no
want of ani thing that is in the earth

18:11 and there went from thenc of the famili of the danit out of
zorah and out of eshtaol six hundr men appoint with weapon of
war

18:12 and they went up and pitch in kirjathjearim in judah:
wherefor they call that place mahanehdan unto thi day: behold it
is behind kirjathjearim

18:13 and they pass thenc unto mount ephraim and came unto the
hous of micah

18:14 then answer the five men that went to spi out the countri of
laish and said unto their brethren do ye know that there is in these
hous an ephod and teraphim and a graven imag and a molten image?
now therefor consid what ye have to do

18:15 and they turn thitherward and came to the hous of the young
man the levit even unto the hous of micah and salut him

18:16 and the six hundr men appoint with their weapon of war
which were of the children of dan stood by the enter of the gate

18:17 and the five men that went to spi out the land went up and came
in thither and took the graven imag and the ephod and the
teraphim and the molten image: and the priest stood in the enter
of the gate with the six hundr men that were appoint with weapon
of war

18:18 and these went into micah hous and fetch the carv imag
the ephod and the teraphim and the molten imag then said the
priest unto them what do ye? 18:19 and they said unto him hold thi
peac lay thine hand upon thi mouth and go with us and be to us a
father and a priest: is it better for thee to be a priest unto the
hous of one man or that thou be a priest unto a tribe and a famili
in israel? 18:20 and the priest heart wa glad and he took the
ephod and the teraphim and the graven imag and went in the midst
of the peopl

18:21 so they turn and depart and put the littl one and the
cattl and the carriag befor them

18:22 and when they were a good way from the hous of micah the men
that were in the hous near to micah hous were gather togeth
and overtook the children of dan

18:23 and they cri unto the children of dan and they turn their
face and said unto micah what aileth thee that thou comest with
such a company? 18:24 and he said ye have taken away my god which i
made and the priest and ye are gone away: and what have i more? and
what is thi that ye say unto me what aileth thee? 18:25 and the
children of dan said unto him let not thi voic be heard among us
lest angri fellow run upon thee and thou lose thi life with the
live of thi household

18:26 and the children of dan went their way: and when micah saw that
they were too strong for him he turn and went back unto hi hous

18:27 and they took the thing which micah had made and the priest
which he had and came unto laish unto a peopl that were at quiet
and secure: and they smote them with the edg of the sword and burnt
the citi with fire

18:28 and there wa no deliver becaus it wa far from zidon and
they had no busi with ani man; and it wa in the valley that lieth
by bethrehob and they built a citi and dwelt therein

18:29 and they call the name of the citi dan after the name of dan
their father who wa born unto israel: howbeit the name of the citi
wa laish at the first

18:30 and the children of dan set up the graven image: and jonathan
the son of gershom the son of manasseh he and hi son were priest
to the tribe of dan until the day of the captiv of the land

18:31 and they set them up micah graven imag which he made all
the time that the hous of god wa in shiloh

19:1 and it came to pass in those day when there wa no king in
israel that there wa a certain levit sojourn on the side of
mount ephraim who took to him a concubin out of bethlehemjudah

19:2 and hi concubin play the whore against him and went away
from him unto her father hous to bethlehemjudah and wa there four
whole month

19:3 and her husband aros and went after her to speak friendli unto
her and to bring her again have hi servant with him and a coupl
of asses: and she brought him into her father house: and when the
father of the damsel saw him he rejoic to meet him

19:4 and hi father in law the damsel father retain him; and he
abod with him three days: so they did eat and drink and lodg
there

19:5 and it came to pass on the fourth day when they aros earli in
the morn that he rose up to depart: and the damsel father said
unto hi son in law comfort thine heart with a morsel of bread and
afterward go your way

19:6 and they sat down and did eat and drink both of them together:
for the damsel father had said unto the man be content i pray
thee and tarri all night and let thine heart be merri

19:7 and when the man rose up to depart hi father in law urg him:
therefor he lodg there again

19:8 and he aros earli in the morn on the fifth day to depart; and
the damsel father said comfort thine heart i pray thee and they
tarri until afternoon and they did eat both of them

19:9 and when the man rose up to depart he and hi concubin and
hi servant hi father in law the damsel father said unto him
behold now the day draweth toward even i pray you tarri all
night: behold the day groweth to an end lodg here that thine heart
may be merry; and to morrow get you earli on your way that thou
mayest go home

19:10 but the man would not tarri that night but he rose up and
depart and came over against jebu which is jerusalem; and there
were with him two ass saddl hi concubin also wa with him

19:11 and when they were by jebu the day wa far spent; and the
servant said unto hi master come i pray thee and let us turn in
into thi citi of the jebusit and lodg in it

19:12 and hi master said unto him we will not turn asid hither into
the citi of a stranger that is not of the children of israel; we will
pass over to gibeah

19:13 and he said unto hi servant come and let us draw near to one
of these place to lodg all night in gibeah or in ramah

19:14 and they pass on and went their way; and the sun went down
upon them when they were by gibeah which belongeth to benjamin

19:15 and they turn asid thither to go in and to lodg in gibeah:
and when he went in he sat him down in a street of the city: for
there wa no man that took them into hi hous to lodg

19:16 and behold there came an old man from hi work out of the
field at even which wa also of mount ephraim; and he sojourn in
gibeah: but the men of the place were benjamit

19:17 and when he had lift up hi eye he saw a wayfar man in
the street of the city: and the old man said whither goest thou? and
whenc comest thou? 19:18 and he said unto him we are pass from
bethlehemjudah toward the side of mount ephraim; from thenc am i: and
i went to bethlehemjudah but i am now go to the hous of the lord;
and there is no man that receiveth me to hous

19:19 yet there is both straw and provend for our asses; and there
is bread and wine also for me and for thi handmaid and for the young
man which is with thi servants: there is no want of ani thing

19:20 and the old man said peac be with thee; howsoev let all thi
want lie upon me; onli lodg not in the street

19:21 so he brought him into hi hous and gave provend unto the
asses: and they wash their feet and did eat and drink

19:22 now as they were make their heart merri behold the men of
the citi certain son of belial beset the hous round about and
beat at the door and spake to the master of the hous the old man
say bring forth the man that came into thine hous that we may
know him

19:23 and the man the master of the hous went out unto them and
said unto them nay my brethren nay i pray you do not so wickedly;
see that thi man is come into mine hous do not thi folli

19:24 behold here is my daughter a maiden and hi concubine; them i
will bring out now and humbl ye them and do with them what seemeth
good unto you: but unto thi man do not so vile a thing

19:25 but the men would not hearken to him: so the man took hi
concubin and brought her forth unto them; and they knew her and
abus her all the night until the morning: and when the day began to
spring they let her go

19:26 then came the woman in the dawn of the day and fell down at
the door of the man hous where her lord wa till it wa light

19:27 and her lord rose up in the morn and open the door of the
hous and went out to go hi way: and behold the woman hi
concubin wa fallen down at the door of the hous and her hand were
upon the threshold

19:28 and he said unto her up and let us be go but none
answer

then the man took her up upon an ass and the man rose up and gat him
unto hi place

19:29 and when he wa come into hi hous he took a knife and laid
hold on hi concubin and divid her togeth with her bone into
twelv piec and sent her into all the coast of israel

19:30 and it wa so that all that saw it said there wa no such deed
done nor seen from the day that the children of israel came up out of
the land of egypt unto thi day: consid of it take advic and
speak your mind

20:1 then all the children of israel went out and the congreg
wa gather togeth as one man from dan even to beersheba with the
land of gilead unto the lord in mizpeh

20:2 and the chief of all the peopl even of all the tribe of
israel present themselv in the assembl of the peopl of god
four hundr thousand footmen that drew sword

20:3 (now the children of benjamin heard that the children of israel
were gone up to mizpeh) then said the children of israel tell us
how wa thi wickedness? 20:4 and the levit the husband of the
woman that wa slain answer and said i came into gibeah that
belongeth to benjamin i and my concubin to lodg

20:5 and the men of gibeah rose against me and beset the hous round
about upon me by night and thought to have slain me: and my concubin
have they forc that she is dead

20:6 and i took my concubin and cut her in piec and sent her
throughout all the countri of the inherit of israel: for they have
commit lewd and folli in israel

20:7 behold ye are all children of israel; give here your advic and
counsel

20:8 and all the peopl aros as one man say we will not ani of
us go to hi tent neither will we ani of us turn into hi hous

20:9 but now thi shall be the thing which we will do to gibeah; we
will go up by lot against it; 20:10 and we will take ten men of an
hundr throughout all the tribe of israel and an hundr of a
thousand and a thousand out of ten thousand to fetch victual for the
peopl that they may do when they come to gibeah of benjamin
accord to all the folli that they have wrought in israel

20:11 so all the men of israel were gather against the citi knit
togeth as one man

20:12 and the tribe of israel sent men through all the tribe of
benjamin say what wicked is thi that is done among you?
20:13 now therefor deliv us the men the children of belial which
are in gibeah that we may put them to death and put away evil from
israel but the children of benjamin would not hearken to the voic of
their brethren the children of israel

20:14 but the children of benjamin gather themselv togeth out of
the citi unto gibeah to go out to battl against the children of
israel

20:15 and the children of benjamin were number at that time out of
the citi twenti and six thousand men that drew sword besid the
inhabit of gibeah which were number seven hundr chosen men

20:16 among all thi peopl there were seven hundr chosen men
lefthanded; everi one could sling stone at an hair breadth and not
miss

20:17 and the men of israel besid benjamin were number four
hundr thousand men that drew sword: all these were men of war

20:18 and the children of israel aros and went up to the hous of
god and ask counsel of god and said which of us shall go up first
to the battl against the children of benjamin? and the lord said
judah shall go up first

20:19 and the children of israel rose up in the morn and encamp
against gibeah

20:20 and the men of israel went out to battl against benjamin; and
the men of israel put themselv in array to fight against them at
gibeah

20:21 and the children of benjamin came forth out of gibeah and
destroy down to the ground of the israelit that day twenti and two
thousand men

20:22 and the peopl the men of israel encourag themselv and set
their battl again in array in the place where they put themselv in
array the first day

20:23 (and the children of israel went up and wept befor the lord
until even and ask counsel of the lord say shall i go up again
to battl against the children of benjamin my brother? and the lord
said go up against him) 20:24 and the children of israel came near
against the children of benjamin the second day

20:25 and benjamin went forth against them out of gibeah the second
day and destroy down to the ground of the children of israel again
eighteen thousand men; all these drew the sword

20:26 then all the children of israel and all the peopl went up
and came unto the hous of god and wept and sat there befor the
lord and fast that day until even and offer burnt offer and
peac offer befor the lord

20:27 and the children of israel enquir of the lord (for the ark of
the coven of god wa there in those day 20:28 and phineha the
son of eleazar the son of aaron stood befor it in those days)
say shall i yet again go out to battl against the children of
benjamin my brother or shall i cease? and the lord said go up; for
to morrow i will deliv them into thine hand

20:29 and israel set lier in wait round about gibeah

20:30 and the children of israel went up against the children of
benjamin on the third day and put themselv in array against gibeah
as at other time

20:31 and the children of benjamin went out against the peopl and
were drawn away from the city; and they began to smite of the peopl
and kill as at other time in the highway of which one goeth up to
the hous of god and the other to gibeah in the field about thirti
men of israel

20:32 and the children of benjamin said they are smitten down befor
us as at the first but the children of israel said let us flee and
draw them from the citi unto the highway

20:33 and all the men of israel rose up out of their place and put
themselv in array at baaltamar: and the lier in wait of israel came
forth out of their place even out of the meadow of gibeah

20:34 and there came against gibeah ten thousand chosen men out of all
israel and the battl wa sore: but they knew not that evil wa near
them

20:35 and the lord smote benjamin befor israel: and the children of
israel destroy of the benjamit that day twenti and five thousand
and an hundr men: all these drew the sword

20:36 so the children of benjamin saw that they were smitten: for the
men of israel gave place to the benjamit becaus they trust unto
the lier in wait which they had set besid gibeah

20:37 and the lier in wait hast and rush upon gibeah; and the
lier in wait drew themselv along and smote all the citi with the
edg of the sword

20:38 now there wa an appoint sign between the men of israel and
the lier in wait that they should make a great flame with smoke rise
up out of the citi

20:39 and when the men of israel retir in the battl benjamin began
to smite and kill of the men of israel about thirti persons: for they
said sure they are smitten down befor us as in the first battl

20:40 but when the flame began to aris up out of the citi with a
pillar of smoke the benjamit look behind them and behold the
flame of the citi ascend up to heaven

20:41 and when the men of israel turn again the men of benjamin
were amazed: for they saw that evil wa come upon them

20:42 therefor they turn their back befor the men of israel unto
the way of the wilderness; but the battl overtook them; and them
which came out of the citi they destroy in the midst of them

20:43 thu they inclos the benjamit round about and chase them
and trode them down with eas over against gibeah toward the
sunris

20:44 and there fell of benjamin eighteen thousand men; all these were
men of valour

20:45 and they turn and fled toward the wilder unto the rock of
rimmon: and they glean of them in the highway five thousand men;
and pursu hard after them unto gidom and slew two thousand men of
them

20:46 so that all which fell that day of benjamin were twenti and five
thousand men that drew the sword; all these were men of valour

20:47 but six hundr men turn and fled to the wilder unto the
rock rimmon and abod in the rock rimmon four month

20:48 and the men of israel turn again upon the children of
benjamin and smote them with the edg of the sword as well the men
of everi citi as the beast and all that came to hand: also they set
on fire all the citi that they came to

21:1 now the men of israel had sworn in mizpeh say there shall
not ani of us give hi daughter unto benjamin to wife

21:2 and the peopl came to the hous of god and abod there till
even befor god and lift up their voic and wept sore; 21:3 and
said o lord god of israel whi is thi come to pass in israel that
there should be to day one tribe lack in israel? 21:4 and it came
to pass on the morrow that the peopl rose earli and built there an
altar and offer burnt offer and peac offer

21:5 and the children of israel said who is there among all the
tribe of israel that came not up with the congreg unto the lord?
for they had made a great oath concern him that came not up to the
lord to mizpeh say he shall sure be put to death

21:6 and the children of israel repent them for benjamin their
brother and said there is one tribe cut off from israel thi day

21:7 how shall we do for wive for them that remain see we have
sworn by the lord that we will not give them of our daughter to
wives? 21:8 and they said what one is there of the tribe of israel
that came not up to mizpeh to the lord? and behold there came none
to the camp from jabeshgilead to the assembl

21:9 for the peopl were number and behold there were none of the
inhabit of jabeshgilead there

21:10 and the congreg sent thither twelv thousand men of the
valiantest and command them say go and smite the inhabit
of jabeshgilead with the edg of the sword with the women and the
children

21:11 and thi is the thing that ye shall do ye shall utterli destroy
everi male and everi woman that hath lain by man

21:12 and they found among the inhabit of jabeshgilead four
hundr young virgin that had known no man by lie with ani male:
and they brought them unto the camp to shiloh which is in the land of
canaan

21:13 and the whole congreg sent some to speak to the children of
benjamin that were in the rock rimmon and to call peaceabl unto
them

21:14 and benjamin came again at that time; and they gave them wive
which they had save aliv of the women of jabeshgilead: and yet so
they suffic them not

21:15 and the peopl repent them for benjamin becaus that the lord
had made a breach in the tribe of israel

21:16 then the elder of the congreg said how shall we do for
wive for them that remain see the women are destroy out of
benjamin? 21:17 and they said there must be an inherit for them
that be escap of benjamin that a tribe be not destroy out of
israel

21:18 howbeit we may not give them wive of our daughters: for the
children of israel have sworn say curs be he that giveth a wife
to benjamin

21:19 then they said behold there is a feast of the lord in shiloh
yearli in a place which is on the north side of bethel on the east
side of the highway that goeth up from bethel to shechem and on the
south of lebonah

21:20 therefor they command the children of benjamin say go
and lie in wait in the vineyards; 21:21 and see and behold if the
daughter of shiloh come out to danc in danc then come ye out of
the vineyard and catch you everi man hi wife of the daughter of
shiloh and go to the land of benjamin

21:22 and it shall be when their father or their brethren come unto
us to complain that we will say unto them be favour unto them
for our sakes: becaus we reserv not to each man hi wife in the
war: for ye did not give unto them at thi time that ye should be
guilti

21:23 and the children of benjamin did so and took them wive
accord to their number of them that danc whom they caught: and
they went and return unto their inherit and repair the
citi and dwelt in them

21:24 and the children of israel depart thenc at that time everi
man to hi tribe and to hi famili and they went out from thenc
everi man to hi inherit

21:25 in those day there wa no king in israel: everi man did that
which wa right in hi own eye



the book of ruth


1:1 now it came to pass in the day when the judg rule that there
wa a famin in the land and a certain man of bethlehemjudah went to
sojourn in the countri of moab he and hi wife and hi two son

1:2 and the name of the man wa elimelech and the name of hi wife
naomi and the name of hi two son mahlon and chilion ephrathit of
bethlehemjudah and they came into the countri of moab and continu
there

1:3 and elimelech naomi husband died; and she wa left and her two
son

1:4 and they took them wive of the women of moab; the name of the one
wa orpah and the name of the other ruth: and they dwell there
about ten year

1:5 and mahlon and chilion die also both of them; and the woman wa
left of her two son and her husband

1:6 then she aros with her daughter in law that she might return
from the countri of moab: for she had heard in the countri of moab how
that the lord had visit hi peopl in give them bread

1:7 wherefor she went forth out of the place where she wa and her
two daughter in law with her; and they went on the way to return unto
the land of judah

1:8 and naomi said unto her two daughter in law go return each to
her mother house: the lord deal kindli with you as ye have dealt
with the dead and with me

1:9 the lord grant you that ye may find rest each of you in the hous
of her husband then she kiss them; and they lift up their voic
and wept

1:10 and they said unto her sure we will return with thee unto thi
peopl

1:11 and naomi said turn again my daughters: whi will ye go with me?
are there yet ani more son in my womb that they may be your
husbands? 1:12 turn again my daughter go your way; for i am too
old to have an husband if i should say i have hope if i should have
an husband also to night and should also bear sons; 1:13 would ye
tarri for them till they were grown? would ye stay for them from
have husbands? nay my daughters; for it grieveth me much for your
sake that the hand of the lord is gone out against me

1:14 and they lift up their voic and wept again: and orpah kiss
her mother in law; but ruth clave unto her

1:15 and she said behold thi sister in law is gone back unto her
peopl and unto her gods: return thou after thi sister in law

1:16 and ruth said intreat me not to leav thee or to return from
follow after thee: for whither thou goest i will go; and where
thou lodgest i will lodge: thi peopl shall be my peopl and thi god
my god: 1:17 where thou diest will i die and there will i be buried:
the lord do so to me and more also if ought but death part thee and
me

1:18 when she saw that she wa stedfastli mind to go with her then
she left speak unto her

1:19 so they two went until they came to bethlehem and it came to
pass when they were come to bethlehem that all the citi wa move
about them and they said is thi naomi? 1:20 and she said unto
them call me not naomi call me mara: for the almighti hath dealt
veri bitterli with me

1:21 i went out full and the lord hath brought me home again empty:
whi then call ye me naomi see the lord hath testifi against me
and the almighti hath afflict me? 1:22 so naomi return and ruth
the moabitess her daughter in law with her which return out of
the countri of moab: and they came to bethlehem in the begin of
barley harvest

2:1 and naomi had a kinsman of her husband a mighti man of wealth
of the famili of elimelech; and hi name wa boaz

2:2 and ruth the moabitess said unto naomi let me now go to the
field and glean ear of corn after him in whose sight i shall find
grace

and she said unto her go my daughter

2:3 and she went and came and glean in the field after the
reapers: and her hap wa to light on a part of the field belong
unto boaz who wa of the kindr of elimelech

2:4 and behold boaz came from bethlehem and said unto the reaper
the lord be with you and they answer him the lord bless thee

2:5 then said boaz unto hi servant that wa set over the reaper
whose damsel is this? 2:6 and the servant that wa set over the
reaper answer and said it is the moabitish damsel that came back
with naomi out of the countri of moab: 2:7 and she said i pray you
let me glean and gather after the reaper among the sheaves: so she
came and hath continu even from the morn until now that she
tarri a littl in the hous

2:8 then said boaz unto ruth hearest thou not my daughter? go not to
glean in anoth field neither go from henc but abid here fast by
my maidens: 2:9 let thine eye be on the field that they do reap and
go thou after them: have i not charg the young men that they shall
not touch thee? and when thou art athirst go unto the vessel and
drink of that which the young men have drawn

2:10 then she fell on her face and bow herself to the ground and
said unto him whi have i found grace in thine eye that thou
shouldest take knowledg of me see i am a stranger? 2:11 and boaz
answer and said unto her it hath fulli been shew me all that
thou hast done unto thi mother in law sinc the death of thine
husband: and how thou hast left thi father and thi mother and the
land of thi nativ and art come unto a peopl which thou knewest
not heretofor

2:12 the lord recompens thi work and a full reward be given thee of
the lord god of israel under whose wing thou art come to trust

2:13 then she said let me find favour in thi sight my lord; for that
thou hast comfort me and for that thou hast spoken friendli unto
thine handmaid though i be not like unto one of thine handmaiden

2:14 and boaz said unto her at mealtim come thou hither and eat of
the bread and dip thi morsel in the vinegar and she sat besid the
reapers: and he reach her parch corn and she did eat and wa
suffic and left

2:15 and when she wa risen up to glean boaz command hi young men
say let her glean even among the sheav and reproach her not:
2:16 and let fall also some of the hand of purpos for her and
leav them that she may glean them and rebuk her not

2:17 so she glean in the field until even and beat out that she had
gleaned: and it wa about an ephah of barley

2:18 and she took it up and went into the city: and her mother in law
saw what she had gleaned: and she brought forth and gave to her that
she had reserv after she wa suffic

2:19 and her mother in law said unto her where hast thou glean to
day? and where wroughtest thou? bless be he that did take knowledg
of thee and she shew her mother in law with whom she had wrought
and said the man name with whom i wrought to day is boaz

2:20 and naomi said unto her daughter in law bless be he of the
lord who hath not left off hi kind to the live and to the
dead and naomi said unto her the man is near of kin unto us one of
our next kinsmen

2:21 and ruth the moabitess said he said unto me also thou shalt
keep fast by my young men until they have end all my harvest

2:22 and naomi said unto ruth her daughter in law it is good my
daughter that thou go out with hi maiden that they meet thee not
in ani other field

2:23 so she kept fast by the maiden of boaz to glean unto the end of
barley harvest and of wheat harvest; and dwelt with her mother in law

3:1 then naomi her mother in law said unto her my daughter shall i
not seek rest for thee that it may be well with thee? 3:2 and now is
not boaz of our kindr with whose maiden thou wast? behold he
winnoweth barley to night in the threshingfloor

3:3 wash thyself therefor and anoint thee and put thi raiment upon
thee and get thee down to the floor: but make not thyself known unto
the man until he shall have done eat and drink

3:4 and it shall be when he lieth down that thou shalt mark the
place where he shall lie and thou shalt go in and uncov hi feet
and lay thee down; and he will tell thee what thou shalt do

3:5 and she said unto her all that thou sayest unto me i will do

3:6 and she went down unto the floor and did accord to all that
her mother in law bade her

3:7 and when boaz had eaten and drunk and hi heart wa merri he
went to lie down at the end of the heap of corn: and she came softli
and uncov hi feet and laid her down

3:8 and it came to pass at midnight that the man wa afraid and
turn himself: and behold a woman lay at hi feet

3:9 and he said who art thou? and she answer i am ruth thine
handmaid: spread therefor thi skirt over thine handmaid; for thou art
a near kinsman

3:10 and he said bless be thou of the lord my daughter: for thou
hast shew more kind in the latter end than at the begin
inasmuch as thou followedst not young men whether poor or rich

3:11 and now my daughter fear not; i will do to thee all that thou
requirest: for all the citi of my peopl doth know that thou art a
virtuou woman

3:12 and now it is true that i am thi near kinsman: howbeit there is a
kinsman nearer than i

3:13 tarri thi night and it shall be in the morn that if he will
perform unto thee the part of a kinsman well; let him do the
kinsman part: but if he will not do the part of a kinsman to thee
then will i do the part of a kinsman to thee as the lord liveth: lie
down until the morn

3:14 and she lay at hi feet until the morning: and she rose up befor
one could know anoth and he said let it not be known that a woman
came into the floor

3:15 also he said bring the vail that thou hast upon thee and hold
it

and when she held it he measur six measur of barley and laid it
on her: and she went into the citi

3:16 and when she came to her mother in law she said who art thou
my daughter? and she told her all that the man had done to her

3:17 and she said these six measur of barley gave he me; for he
said to me go not empti unto thi mother in law

3:18 then said she sit still my daughter until thou know how the
matter will fall: for the man will not be in rest until he have
finish the thing thi day

4:1 then went boaz up to the gate and sat him down there: and
behold the kinsman of whom boaz spake came by; unto whom he said ho
such a one! turn asid sit down here and he turn asid and sat
down

4:2 and he took ten men of the elder of the citi and said sit ye
down here and they sat down

4:3 and he said unto the kinsman naomi that is come again out of the
countri of moab selleth a parcel of land which wa our brother
elimelechs: 4:4 and i thought to advertis thee say buy it
befor the inhabit and befor the elder of my peopl if thou
wilt redeem it redeem it: but if thou wilt not redeem it then tell
me that i may know: for there is none to redeem it besid thee; and i
am after thee and he said i will redeem it

4:5 then said boaz what day thou buyest the field of the hand of
naomi thou must buy it also of ruth the moabitess the wife of the
dead to rais up the name of the dead upon hi inherit

4:6 and the kinsman said i cannot redeem it for myself lest i mar
mine own inheritance: redeem thou my right to thyself; for i cannot
redeem it

4:7 now thi wa the manner in former time in israel concern
redeem and concern chang for to confirm all things; a man
pluck off hi shoe and gave it to hi neighbour: and thi wa a
testimoni in israel

4:8 therefor the kinsman said unto boaz buy it for thee so he drew
off hi shoe

4:9 and boaz said unto the elder and unto all the peopl ye are
wit thi day that i have bought all that wa elimelech and
all that wa chilion and mahlon of the hand of naomi

4:10 moreov ruth the moabitess the wife of mahlon have i purchas
to be my wife to rais up the name of the dead upon hi inherit
that the name of the dead be not cut off from among hi brethren and
from the gate of hi place: ye are wit thi day

4:11 and all the peopl that were in the gate and the elder said
we are wit the lord make the woman that is come into thine
hous like rachel and like leah which two did build the hous of
israel: and do thou worthili in ephratah and be famou in bethlehem:
4:12 and let thi hous be like the hous of pharez whom tamar bare
unto judah of the seed which the lord shall give thee of thi young
woman

4:13 so boaz took ruth and she wa hi wife: and when he went in unto
her the lord gave her concept and she bare a son

4:14 and the women said unto naomi bless be the lord which hath
not left thee thi day without a kinsman that hi name may be famou
in israel

4:15 and he shall be unto thee a restor of thi life and a nourish
of thine old age: for thi daughter in law which loveth thee which is
better to thee than seven son hath born him

4:16 and naomi took the child and laid it in her bosom and becam
nurs unto it

4:17 and the women her neighbour gave it a name say there is a
son born to naomi; and they call hi name obed: he is the father of
jess the father of david

4:18 now these are the gener of pharez: pharez begat hezron
4:19 and hezron begat ram and ram begat amminadab 4:20 and amminadab
begat nahshon and nahshon begat salmon 4:21 and salmon begat boaz
and boaz begat obe 4:22 and obe begat jess and jess begat david




the first book of samuel

otherwis called:

the first book of the king


1:1 now there wa a certain man of ramathaimzophim of mount ephraim
and hi name wa elkanah the son of jeroham the son of elihu the
son of tohu the son of zuph an ephrathite: 1:2 and he had two wives;
the name of the one wa hannah and the name of the other peninnah:
and peninnah had children but hannah had no children

1:3 and thi man went up out of hi citi yearli to worship and to
sacrific unto the lord of host in shiloh and the two son of eli
hophni and phineha the priest of the lord were there

1:4 and when the time wa that elkanah offer he gave to peninnah
hi wife and to all her son and her daughter portions: 1:5 but
unto hannah he gave a worthi portion; for he love hannah: but the
lord had shut up her womb

1:6 and her adversari also provok her sore for to make her fret
becaus the lord had shut up her womb

1:7 and as he did so year by year when she went up to the hous of
the lord so she provok her; therefor she wept and did not eat

1:8 then said elkanah her husband to her hannah whi weepest thou?
and whi eatest thou not? and whi is thi heart grieved? am not i better
to thee than ten sons? 1:9 so hannah rose up after they had eaten in
shiloh and after they had drunk now eli the priest sat upon a seat
by a post of the templ of the lord

1:10 and she wa in bitter of soul and pray unto the lord and
wept sore

1:11 and she vow a vow and said o lord of host if thou wilt
inde look on the afflict of thine handmaid and rememb me and
not forget thine handmaid but wilt give unto thine handmaid a man
child then i will give him unto the lord all the day of hi life
and there shall no razor come upon hi head

1:12 and it came to pass as she continu pray befor the lord
that eli mark her mouth

1:13 now hannah she spake in her heart; onli her lip move but her
voic wa not heard: therefor eli thought she had been drunken

1:14 and eli said unto her how long wilt thou be drunken? put away
thi wine from thee

1:15 and hannah answer and said no my lord i am a woman of a
sorrow spirit: i have drunk neither wine nor strong drink but have
pour out my soul befor the lord

1:16 count not thine handmaid for a daughter of belial: for out of the
abund of my complaint and grief have i spoken hitherto

1:17 then eli answer and said go in peace: and the god of israel
grant thee thi petit that thou hast ask of him

1:18 and she said let thine handmaid find grace in thi sight so the
woman went her way and did eat and her counten wa no more sad

1:19 and they rose up in the morn earli and worship befor the
lord and return and came to their hous to ramah: and elkanah knew
hannah hi wife; and the lord rememb her

1:20 wherefor it came to pass when the time wa come about after
hannah had conceiv that she bare a son and call hi name samuel
say becaus i have ask him of the lord

1:21 and the man elkanah and all hi hous went up to offer unto the
lord the yearli sacrific and hi vow

1:22 but hannah went not up; for she said unto her husband i will not
go up until the child be wean and then i will bring him that he
may appear befor the lord and there abid for ever

1:23 and elkanah her husband said unto her do what seemeth thee good;
tarri until thou have wean him; onli the lord establish hi word so
the woman abod and gave her son suck until she wean him

1:24 and when she had wean him she took him up with her with three
bullock and one ephah of flour and a bottl of wine and brought
him unto the hous of the lord in shiloh: and the child wa young

1:25 and they slew a bullock and brought the child to eli

1:26 and she said oh my lord as thi soul liveth my lord i am the
woman that stood by thee here pray unto the lord

1:27 for thi child i prayed; and the lord hath given me my petit
which i ask of him: 1:28 therefor also i have lent him to the lord;
as long as he liveth he shall be lent to the lord and he worship
the lord there

2:1 and hannah pray and said my heart rejoiceth in the lord mine
horn is exalt in the lord: my mouth is enlarg over mine enemies;
becaus i rejoic in thi salvat

2:2 there is none holi as the lord: for there is none besid thee:
neither is there ani rock like our god

2:3 talk no more so exceed proudly; let not arrog come out of
your mouth: for the lord is a god of knowledg and by him action are
weigh

2:4 the bow of the mighti men are broken and they that stumbl are
gird with strength

2:5 they that were full have hire out themselv for bread; and they
that were hungri ceased: so that the barren hath born seven; and she
that hath mani children is wax feebl

2:6 the lord killeth and maketh alive: he bringeth down to the grave
and bringeth up

2:7 the lord maketh poor and maketh rich: he bringeth low and
lifteth up

2:8 he raiseth up the poor out of the dust and lifteth up the beggar
from the dunghil to set them among princ and to make them inherit
the throne of glory: for the pillar of the earth are the lord and
he hath set the world upon them

2:9 he will keep the feet of hi saint and the wick shall be
silent in darkness; for by strength shall no man prevail

2:10 the adversari of the lord shall be broken to pieces; out of
heaven shall he thunder upon them: the lord shall judg the end of
the earth; and he shall give strength unto hi king and exalt the
horn of hi anoint

2:11 and elkanah went to ramah to hi hous and the child did
minist unto the lord befor eli the priest

2:12 now the son of eli were son of belial; they knew not the lord

2:13 and the priest custom with the peopl wa that when ani man
offer sacrific the priest servant came while the flesh wa in
seeth with a fleshhook of three teeth in hi hand; 2:14 and he
struck it into the pan or kettl or caldron or pot; all that the
fleshhook brought up the priest took for himself so they did in
shiloh unto all the israelit that came thither

2:15 also befor they burnt the fat the priest servant came and
said to the man that sacrif give flesh to roast for the priest;
for he will not have sodden flesh of thee but raw

2:16 and if ani man said unto him let them not fail to burn the fat
present and then take as much as thi soul desireth; then he would
answer him nay; but thou shalt give it me now: and if not i will
take it by forc

2:17 wherefor the sin of the young men wa veri great befor the
lord: for men abhor the offer of the lord

2:18 but samuel minist befor the lord be a child gird with
a linen ephod

2:19 moreov hi mother made him a littl coat and brought it to him
from year to year when she came up with her husband to offer the
yearli sacrific

2:20 and eli bless elkanah and hi wife and said the lord give
thee seed of thi woman for the loan which is lent to the lord and
they went unto their own home

2:21 and the lord visit hannah so that she conceiv and bare
three son and two daughter and the child samuel grew befor the
lord

2:22 now eli wa veri old and heard all that hi son did unto all
israel; and how they lay with the women that assembl at the door of
the tabernacl of the congreg

2:23 and he said unto them whi do ye such things? for i hear of your
evil deal by all thi peopl

2:24 nay my sons; for it is no good report that i hear: ye make the
lord peopl to transgress

2:25 if one man sin against anoth the judg shall judg him: but if
a man sin against the lord who shall intreat for him? notwithstand
they hearken not unto the voic of their father becaus the lord
would slay them

2:26 and the child samuel grew on and wa in favour both with the
lord and also with men

2:27 and there came a man of god unto eli and said unto him thu
saith the lord did i plainli appear unto the hous of thi father
when they were in egypt in pharaoh house? 2:28 and did i choos him
out of all the tribe of israel to be my priest to offer upon mine
altar to burn incens to wear an ephod befor me? and did i give
unto the hous of thi father all the offer made by fire of the
children of israel? 2:29 wherefor kick ye at my sacrific and at
mine offer which i have command in my habitation; and honourest
thi son abov me to make yourselv fat with the chiefest of all the
offer of israel my people? 2:30 wherefor the lord god of israel
saith i said inde that thi hous and the hous of thi father
should walk befor me for ever: but now the lord saith be it far from
me; for them that honour me i will honour and they that despis me
shall be lightli esteem

2:31 behold the day come that i will cut off thine arm and the arm
of thi father hous that there shall not be an old man in thine
hous

2:32 and thou shalt see an enemi in my habit in all the wealth
which god shall give israel: and there shall not be an old man in
thine hous for ever

2:33 and the man of thine whom i shall not cut off from mine altar
shall be to consum thine eye and to griev thine heart: and all the
increas of thine hous shall die in the flower of their age

2:34 and thi shall be a sign unto thee that shall come upon thi two
son on hophni and phinehas; in one day they shall die both of them

2:35 and i will rais me up a faith priest that shall do accord
to that which is in mine heart and in my mind: and i will build him a
sure house; and he shall walk befor mine anoint for ever

2:36 and it shall come to pass that everi one that is left in thine
hous shall come and crouch to him for a piec of silver and a morsel
of bread and shall say put me i pray thee into one of the priest
offic that i may eat a piec of bread

3:1 and the child samuel minist unto the lord befor eli and the
word of the lord wa preciou in those days; there wa no open vision

3:2 and it came to pass at that time when eli wa laid down in hi
place and hi eye began to wax dim that he could not see; 3:3 and
ere the lamp of god went out in the templ of the lord where the ark
of god wa and samuel wa laid down to sleep; 3:4 that the lord
call samuel: and he answer here am i

3:5 and he ran unto eli and said here am i; for thou calledst me
and he said i call not; lie down again and he went and lay down

3:6 and the lord call yet again samuel and samuel aros and went
to eli and said here am i; for thou didst call me and he answer
i call not my son; lie down again

3:7 now samuel did not yet know the lord neither wa the word of the
lord yet reveal unto him

3:8 and the lord call samuel again the third time and he aros and
went to eli and said here am i; for thou didst call me and eli
perceiv that the lord had call the child

3:9 therefor eli said unto samuel go lie down: and it shall be if
he call thee that thou shalt say speak lord; for thi servant
heareth so samuel went and lay down in hi place

3:10 and the lord came and stood and call as at other time
samuel samuel then samuel answer speak; for thi servant heareth

3:11 and the lord said to samuel behold i will do a thing in israel
at which both the ear of everi one that heareth it shall tingl

3:12 in that day i will perform against eli all thing which i have
spoken concern hi house: when i begin i will also make an end

3:13 for i have told him that i will judg hi hous for ever for the
iniqu which he knoweth; becaus hi son made themselv vile and
he restrain them not

3:14 and therefor i have sworn unto the hous of eli that the
iniqu of eli hous shall not be purg with sacrific nor
offer for ever

3:15 and samuel lay until the morn and open the door of the
hous of the lord and samuel fear to shew eli the vision

3:16 then eli call samuel and said samuel my son and he
answer here am i

3:17 and he said what is the thing that the lord hath said unto thee?
i pray thee hide it not from me: god do so to thee and more also if
thou hide ani thing from me of all the thing that he said unto thee

3:18 and samuel told him everi whit and hid noth from him and he
said it is the lord: let him do what seemeth him good

3:19 and samuel grew and the lord wa with him and did let none of
hi word fall to the ground

3:20 and all israel from dan even to beersheba knew that samuel wa
establish to be a prophet of the lord

3:21 and the lord appear again in shiloh: for the lord reveal
himself to samuel in shiloh by the word of the lord

4:1 and the word of samuel came to all israel now israel went out
against the philistin to battl and pitch besid ebenezer: and
the philistin pitch in aphek

4:2 and the philistin put themselv in array against israel: and
when they join battl israel wa smitten befor the philistines:
and they slew of the armi in the field about four thousand men

4:3 and when the peopl were come into the camp the elder of israel
said wherefor hath the lord smitten us to day befor the
philistines? let us fetch the ark of the coven of the lord out of
shiloh unto us that when it cometh among us it may save us out of
the hand of our enemi

4:4 so the peopl sent to shiloh that they might bring from thenc
the ark of the coven of the lord of host which dwelleth between
the cherubims: and the two son of eli hophni and phineha were
there with the ark of the coven of god

4:5 and when the ark of the coven of the lord came into the camp
all israel shout with a great shout so that the earth rang again

4:6 and when the philistin heard the nois of the shout they said
what meaneth the nois of thi great shout in the camp of the hebrews?
and they understood that the ark of the lord wa come into the camp

4:7 and the philistin were afraid for they said god is come into
the camp and they said woe unto us! for there hath not been such a
thing heretofor

4:8 woe unto us! who shall deliv us out of the hand of these mighti
gods? these are the god that smote the egyptian with all the plagu
in the wilder

4:9 be strong and quit yourselv like men o ye philistin that ye
be not servant unto the hebrew as they have been to you: quit
yourselv like men and fight

4:10 and the philistin fought and israel wa smitten and they fled
everi man into hi tent: and there wa a veri great slaughter; for
there fell of israel thirti thousand footmen

4:11 and the ark of god wa taken; and the two son of eli hophni and
phineha were slain

4:12 and there ran a man of benjamin out of the armi and came to
shiloh the same day with hi cloth rent and with earth upon hi
head

4:13 and when he came lo eli sat upon a seat by the waysid
watching: for hi heart trembl for the ark of god and when the man
came into the citi and told it all the citi cri out

4:14 and when eli heard the nois of the cri he said what meaneth
the nois of thi tumult? and the man came in hastili and told eli

4:15 now eli wa nineti and eight year old; and hi eye were dim
that he could not see

4:16 and the man said unto eli i am he that came out of the armi and
i fled to day out of the armi and he said what is there done my
son? 4:17 and the messeng answer and said israel is fled befor
the philistin and there hath been also a great slaughter among the
peopl and thi two son also hophni and phineha are dead and the
ark of god is taken

4:18 and it came to pass when he made mention of the ark of god that
he fell from off the seat backward by the side of the gate and hi
neck brake and he died: for he wa an old man and heavi and he had
judg israel forti year

4:19 and hi daughter in law phineha wife wa with child near to
be delivered: and when she heard the tide that the ark of god wa
taken and that her father in law and her husband were dead she bow
herself and travailed; for her pain came upon her

4:20 and about the time of her death the women that stood by her said
unto her fear not; for thou hast born a son but she answer not
neither did she regard it

4:21 and she name the child ichabod say the glori is depart
from israel: becaus the ark of god wa taken and becaus of her
father in law and her husband

4:22 and she said the glori is depart from israel: for the ark of
god is taken

5:1 and the philistin took the ark of god and brought it from
ebenez unto ashdod

5:2 when the philistin took the ark of god they brought it into the
hous of dagon and set it by dagon

5:3 and when they of ashdod aros earli on the morrow behold dagon
wa fallen upon hi face to the earth befor the ark of the lord and
they took dagon and set him in hi place again

5:4 and when they aros earli on the morrow morn behold dagon wa
fallen upon hi face to the ground befor the ark of the lord; and the
head of dagon and both the palm of hi hand were cut off upon the
threshold; onli the stump of dagon wa left to him

5:5 therefor neither the priest of dagon nor ani that come into
dagon hous tread on the threshold of dagon in ashdod unto thi
day

5:6 but the hand of the lord wa heavi upon them of ashdod and he
destroy them and smote them with emerod even ashdod and the
coast thereof

5:7 and when the men of ashdod saw that it wa so they said the ark
of the god of israel shall not abid with us: for hi hand is sore
upon us and upon dagon our god

5:8 they sent therefor and gather all the lord of the philistin
unto them and said what shall we do with the ark of the god of
israel? and they answer let the ark of the god of israel be carri
about unto gath and they carri the ark of the god of israel about
thither

5:9 and it wa so that after they had carri it about the hand of
the lord wa against the citi with a veri great destruction: and he
smote the men of the citi both small and great and they had emerod
in their secret part

5:10 therefor they sent the ark of god to ekron and it came to pass
as the ark of god came to ekron that the ekronit cri out say
they have brought about the ark of the god of israel to us to slay us
and our peopl

5:11 so they sent and gather togeth all the lord of the
philistin and said send away the ark of the god of israel and let
it go again to hi own place that it slay us not and our people: for
there wa a deadli destruct throughout all the city; the hand of
god wa veri heavi there

5:12 and the men that die not were smitten with the emerods: and the
cri of the citi went up to heaven

6:1 and the ark of the lord wa in the countri of the philistin
seven month

6:2 and the philistin call for the priest and the divin
say what shall we do to the ark of the lord? tell us wherewith we
shall send it to hi place

6:3 and they said if ye send away the ark of the god of israel send
it not empty; but in ani wise return him a trespass offering: then ye
shall be heal and it shall be known to you whi hi hand is not
remov from you

6:4 then said they what shall be the trespass offer which we shall
return to him? they answer five golden emerod and five golden
mice accord to the number of the lord of the philistines: for one
plagu wa on you all and on your lord

6:5 wherefor ye shall make imag of your emerod and imag of your
mice that mar the land; and ye shall give glori unto the god of
israel: peradventur he will lighten hi hand from off you and from
off your god and from off your land

6:6 wherefor then do ye harden your heart as the egyptian and
pharaoh harden their hearts? when he had wrought wonder among
them did they not let the peopl go and they departed? 6:7 now
therefor make a new cart and take two milch kine on which there
hath come no yoke and tie the kine to the cart and bring their
calv home from them: 6:8 and take the ark of the lord and lay it
upon the cart; and put the jewel of gold which ye return him for a
trespass offer in a coffer by the side thereof; and send it away
that it may go

6:9 and see if it goeth up by the way of hi own coast to
bethshemesh then he hath done us thi great evil: but if not then we
shall know that it is not hi hand that smote us: it wa a chanc that
happen to us

6:10 and the men did so; and took two milch kine and tie them to the
cart and shut up their calv at home: 6:11 and they laid the ark of
the lord upon the cart and the coffer with the mice of gold and the
imag of their emerod

6:12 and the kine took the straight way to the way of bethshemesh and
went along the highway low as they went and turn not asid to
the right hand or to the left; and the lord of the philistin went
after them unto the border of bethshemesh

6:13 and they of bethshemesh were reap their wheat harvest in the
valley: and they lift up their eye and saw the ark and rejoic
to see it

6:14 and the cart came into the field of joshua a bethshemit and
stood there where there wa a great stone: and they clave the wood of
the cart and offer the kine a burnt offer unto the lord

6:15 and the levit took down the ark of the lord and the coffer
that wa with it wherein the jewel of gold were and put them on the
great stone: and the men of bethshemesh offer burnt offer and
sacrif sacrific the same day unto the lord

6:16 and when the five lord of the philistin had seen it they
return to ekron the same day

6:17 and these are the golden emerod which the philistin return
for a trespass offer unto the lord; for ashdod one for gaza one
for askelon one for gath one for ekron one; 6:18 and the golden
mice accord to the number of all the citi of the philistin
belong to the five lord both of fenc citi and of countri
villag even unto the great stone of abel whereon they set down the
ark of the lord: which stone remaineth unto thi day in the field of
joshua the bethshemit

6:19 and he smote the men of bethshemesh becaus they had look into
the ark of the lord even he smote of the peopl fifti thousand and
threescor and ten men: and the peopl lament becaus the lord had
smitten mani of the peopl with a great slaughter

6:20 and the men of bethshemesh said who is abl to stand befor thi
holi lord god? and to whom shall he go up from us? 6:21 and they sent
messeng to the inhabit of kirjathjearim say the
philistin have brought again the ark of the lord; come ye down and
fetch it up to you

7:1 and the men of kirjathjearim came and fetch up the ark of the
lord and brought it into the hous of abinadab in the hill and
sanctifi eleazar hi son to keep the ark of the lord

7:2 and it came to pass while the ark abod in kirjathjearim that
the time wa long; for it wa twenti years: and all the hous of
israel lament after the lord

7:3 and samuel spake unto all the hous of israel say if ye do
return unto the lord with all your heart then put away the strang
god and ashtaroth from among you and prepar your heart unto the
lord and serv him only: and he will deliv you out of the hand of
the philistin

7:4 then the children of israel did put away baalim and ashtaroth and
serv the lord onli

7:5 and samuel said gather all israel to mizpeh and i will pray for
you unto the lord

7:6 and they gather togeth to mizpeh and drew water and pour
it out befor the lord and fast on that day and said there we
have sin against the lord and samuel judg the children of israel
in mizpeh

7:7 and when the philistin heard that the children of israel were
gather togeth to mizpeh the lord of the philistin went up
against israel and when the children of israel heard it they were
afraid of the philistin

7:8 and the children of israel said to samuel ceas not to cri unto
the lord our god for us that he will save us out of the hand of the
philistin

7:9 and samuel took a suck lamb and offer it for a burnt
offer wholli unto the lord: and samuel cri unto the lord for
israel; and the lord heard him

7:10 and as samuel wa offer up the burnt offer the philistin
drew near to battl against israel: but the lord thunder with a
great thunder on that day upon the philistin and discomfit them;
and they were smitten befor israel

7:11 and the men of israel went out of mizpeh and pursu the
philistin and smote them until they came under bethcar

7:12 then samuel took a stone and set it between mizpeh and shen and
call the name of it ebenez say hitherto hath the lord help
us

7:13 so the philistin were subdu and they came no more into the
coast of israel: and the hand of the lord wa against the philistin
all the day of samuel

7:14 and the citi which the philistin had taken from israel were
restor to israel from ekron even unto gath; and the coast thereof
did israel deliv out of the hand of the philistin and there wa
peac between israel and the amorit

7:15 and samuel judg israel all the day of hi life

7:16 and he went from year to year in circuit to bethel and gilgal
and mizpeh and judg israel in all those place

7:17 and hi return wa to ramah; for there wa hi house; and there
he judg israel; and there he built an altar unto the lord

8:1 and it came to pass when samuel wa old that he made hi son
judg over israel

8:2 now the name of hi firstborn wa joel; and the name of hi
second abiah: they were judg in beersheba

8:3 and hi son walk not in hi way but turn asid after lucr
and took bribe and pervert judgment

8:4 then all the elder of israel gather themselv togeth and
came to samuel unto ramah 8:5 and said unto him behold thou art
old and thi son walk not in thi ways: now make us a king to judg us
like all the nation

8:6 but the thing displeas samuel when they said give us a king to
judg us and samuel pray unto the lord

8:7 and the lord said unto samuel hearken unto the voic of the
peopl in all that they say unto thee: for they have not reject
thee but they have reject me that i should not reign over them

8:8 accord to all the work which they have done sinc the day that
i brought them up out of egypt even unto thi day wherewith they have
forsaken me and serv other god so do they also unto thee

8:9 now therefor hearken unto their voice: howbeit yet protest
solemnli unto them and shew them the manner of the king that shall
reign over them

8:10 and samuel told all the word of the lord unto the peopl that
ask of him a king

8:11 and he said thi will be the manner of the king that shall reign
over you: he will take your son and appoint them for himself for
hi chariot and to be hi horsemen; and some shall run befor hi
chariot

8:12 and he will appoint him captain over thousand and captain
over fifties; and will set them to ear hi ground and to reap hi
harvest and to make hi instrument of war and instrument of hi
chariot

8:13 and he will take your daughter to be confectionari and to be
cook and to be baker

8:14 and he will take your field and your vineyard and your
oliveyard even the best of them and give them to hi servant

8:15 and he will take the tenth of your seed and of your vineyard
and give to hi offic and to hi servant

8:16 and he will take your menserv and your maidserv and
your goodliest young men and your ass and put them to hi work

8:17 he will take the tenth of your sheep: and ye shall be hi
servant

8:18 and ye shall cri out in that day becaus of your king which ye
shall have chosen you; and the lord will not hear you in that day

8:19 nevertheless the peopl refus to obey the voic of samuel; and
they said nay; but we will have a king over us; 8:20 that we also may
be like all the nations; and that our king may judg us and go out
befor us and fight our battl

8:21 and samuel heard all the word of the peopl and he rehears
them in the ear of the lord

8:22 and the lord said to samuel hearken unto their voic and make
them a king and samuel said unto the men of israel go ye everi man
unto hi citi

9:1 now there wa a man of benjamin whose name wa kish the son of
abiel the son of zeror the son of bechorath the son of aphiah a
benjamit a mighti man of power

9:2 and he had a son whose name wa saul a choic young man and a
goodly: and there wa not among the children of israel a goodlier
person than he: from hi shoulder and upward he wa higher than ani
of the peopl

9:3 and the ass of kish saul father were lost and kish said to
saul hi son take now one of the servant with thee and aris go
seek the ass

9:4 and he pass through mount ephraim and pass through the land
of shalisha but they found them not: then they pass through the
land of shalim and there they were not: and he pass through the
land of the benjamit but they found them not

9:5 and when they were come to the land of zuph saul said to hi
servant that wa with him come and let us return; lest my father
leav care for the ass and take thought for us

9:6 and he said unto him behold now there is in thi citi a man of
god and he is an honour man; all that he saith cometh sure to
pass: now let us go thither; peradventur he can shew us our way that
we should go

9:7 then said saul to hi servant but behold if we go what shall
we bring the man? for the bread is spent in our vessel and there is
not a present to bring to the man of god: what have we? 9:8 and the
servant answer saul again and said behold i have here at hand the
fourth part of a shekel of silver: that will i give to the man of god
to tell us our way

9:9 (beforetim in israel when a man went to enquir of god thu he
spake come and let us go to the seer: for he that is now call a
prophet wa beforetim call a seer) 9:10 then said saul to hi
servant well said; come let us go so they went unto the citi where
the man of god wa

9:11 and as they went up the hill to the citi they found young
maiden go out to draw water and said unto them is the seer here?
9:12 and they answer them and said he is; behold he is befor
you: make hast now for he came to day to the city; for there is a
sacrific of the peopl to day in the high place: 9:13 as soon as ye
be come into the citi ye shall straightway find him befor he go up
to the high place to eat: for the peopl will not eat until he come
becaus he doth bless the sacrifice; and afterward they eat that be
bidden now therefor get you up; for about thi time ye shall find
him

9:14 and they went up into the city: and when they were come into the
citi behold samuel came out against them for to go up to the high
place

9:15 now the lord had told samuel in hi ear a day befor saul came
say 9:16 to morrow about thi time i will send thee a man out of
the land of benjamin and thou shalt anoint him to be captain over my
peopl israel that he may save my peopl out of the hand of the
philistines: for i have look upon my peopl becaus their cri is
come unto me

9:17 and when samuel saw saul the lord said unto him behold the man
whom i spake to thee of! thi same shall reign over my peopl

9:18 then saul drew near to samuel in the gate and said tell me i
pray thee where the seer hous is

9:19 and samuel answer saul and said i am the seer: go up befor
me unto the high place; for ye shall eat with me to day and to morrow
i will let thee go and will tell thee all that is in thine heart

9:20 and as for thine ass that were lost three day ago set not thi
mind on them; for they are found and on whom is all the desir of
israel? is it not on thee and on all thi father house? 9:21 and
saul answer and said am not i a benjamit of the smallest of the
tribe of israel? and my famili the least of all the famili of the
tribe of benjamin? wherefor then speakest thou so to me? 9:22 and
samuel took saul and hi servant and brought them into the parlour
and made them sit in the chiefest place among them that were bidden
which were about thirti person

9:23 and samuel said unto the cook bring the portion which i gave
thee of which i said unto thee set it by thee

9:24 and the cook took up the shoulder and that which wa upon it
and set it befor saul and samuel said behold that which is left!
set it befor thee and eat: for unto thi time hath it been kept for
thee sinc i said i have invit the peopl so saul did eat with
samuel that day

9:25 and when they were come down from the high place into the citi
samuel commun with saul upon the top of the hous

9:26 and they aros early: and it came to pass about the spring of the
day that samuel call saul to the top of the hous say up that
i may send thee away and saul aros and they went out both of them
he and samuel abroad

9:27 and as they were go down to the end of the citi samuel said
to saul bid the servant pass on befor us (and he pass on) but
stand thou still a while that i may shew thee the word of god

10:1 then samuel took a vial of oil and pour it upon hi head and
kiss him and said is it not becaus the lord hath anoint thee to
be captain over hi inheritance? 10:2 when thou art depart from me
to day then thou shalt find two men by rachel sepulchr in the
border of benjamin at zelzah; and they will say unto thee the ass
which thou wentest to seek are found: and lo thi father hath left
the care of the ass and sorroweth for you say what shall i do
for my son? 10:3 then shalt thou go on forward from thenc and thou
shalt come to the plain of tabor and there shall meet thee three men
go up to god to bethel one carri three kid and anoth
carri three loav of bread and anoth carri a bottl of wine:
10:4 and they will salut thee and give thee two loav of bread;
which thou shalt receiv of their hand

10:5 after that thou shalt come to the hill of god where is the
garrison of the philistines: and it shall come to pass when thou art
come thither to the citi that thou shalt meet a compani of prophet
come down from the high place with a psalteri and a tabret and a
pipe and a harp befor them; and they shall prophesy: 10:6 and the
spirit of the lord will come upon thee and thou shalt prophesi with
them and shalt be turn into anoth man

10:7 and let it be when these sign are come unto thee that thou do
as occas serv thee; for god is with thee

10:8 and thou shalt go down befor me to gilgal; and behold i will
come down unto thee to offer burnt offer and to sacrific
sacrific of peac offerings: seven day shalt thou tarri till i
come to thee and shew thee what thou shalt do

10:9 and it wa so that when he had turn hi back to go from
samuel god gave him anoth heart: and all those sign came to pass
that day

10:10 and when they came thither to the hill behold a compani of
prophet met him; and the spirit of god came upon him and he
prophesi among them

10:11 and it came to pass when all that knew him beforetim saw that
behold he prophesi among the prophet then the peopl said one to
anoth what is thi that is come unto the son of kish? is saul also
among the prophets? 10:12 and one of the same place answer and
said but who is their father? therefor it becam a proverb is saul
also among the prophets? 10:13 and when he had made an end of
prophesi he came to the high place

10:14 and saul uncl said unto him and to hi servant whither went
ye? and he said to seek the asses: and when we saw that they were no
where we came to samuel

10:15 and saul uncl said tell me i pray thee what samuel said
unto you

10:16 and saul said unto hi uncl he told us plainli that the ass
were found but of the matter of the kingdom whereof samuel spake he
told him not

10:17 and samuel call the peopl togeth unto the lord to mizpeh;
10:18 and said unto the children of israel thu saith the lord god of
israel i brought up israel out of egypt and deliv you out of the
hand of the egyptian and out of the hand of all kingdom and of
them that oppress you: 10:19 and ye have thi day reject your god
who himself save you out of all your advers and your
tribulations; and ye have said unto him nay but set a king over us
now therefor present yourselv befor the lord by your tribe and
by your thousand
