10:20 and when samuel had caus all the tribe of israel to come
near the tribe of benjamin wa taken

10:21 when he had caus the tribe of benjamin to come near by their
famili the famili of matri wa taken and saul the son of kish wa
taken: and when they sought him he could not be found

10:22 therefor they enquir of the lord further if the man should
yet come thither and the lord answer behold he hath hid himself
among the stuff

10:23 and they ran and fetch him thence: and when he stood among the
peopl he wa higher than ani of the peopl from hi shoulder and
upward

10:24 and samuel said to all the peopl see ye him whom the lord hath
chosen that there is none like him among all the people? and all the
peopl shout and said god save the king

10:25 then samuel told the peopl the manner of the kingdom and wrote
it in a book and laid it up befor the lord and samuel sent all the
peopl away everi man to hi hous

10:26 and saul also went home to gibeah; and there went with him a
band of men whose heart god had touch

10:27 but the children of belial said how shall thi man save us? and
they despis him and brought no present but he held hi peac

11:1 then nahash the ammonit came up and encamp against
jabeshgilead: and all the men of jabesh said unto nahash make a
coven with us and we will serv thee

11:2 and nahash the ammonit answer them on thi condit will i
make a coven with you that i may thrust out all your right eye
and lay it for a reproach upon all israel

11:3 and the elder of jabesh said unto him give us seven day
respit that we may send messeng unto all the coast of israel:
and then if there be no man to save us we will come out to thee

11:4 then came the messeng to gibeah of saul and told the tide
in the ear of the people: and all the peopl lift up their voic
and wept

11:5 and behold saul came after the herd out of the field; and saul
said what aileth the peopl that they weep? and they told him the
tide of the men of jabesh

11:6 and the spirit of god came upon saul when he heard those tide
and hi anger wa kindl greatli

11:7 and he took a yoke of oxen and hew them in piec and sent
them throughout all the coast of israel by the hand of messeng
say whosoev cometh not forth after saul and after samuel so
shall it be done unto hi oxen and the fear of the lord fell on the
peopl and they came out with one consent

11:8 and when he number them in bezek the children of israel were
three hundr thousand and the men of judah thirti thousand

11:9 and they said unto the messeng that came thu shall ye say
unto the men of jabeshgilead to morrow by that time the sun be hot
ye shall have help and the messeng came and shew it to the men
of jabesh; and they were glad

11:10 therefor the men of jabesh said to morrow we will come out
unto you and ye shall do with us all that seemeth good unto you

11:11 and it wa so on the morrow that saul put the peopl in three
companies; and they came into the midst of the host in the morn
watch and slew the ammonit until the heat of the day: and it came
to pass that they which remain were scatter so that two of them
were not left togeth

11:12 and the peopl said unto samuel who is he that said shall saul
reign over us? bring the men that we may put them to death

11:13 and saul said there shall not a man be put to death thi day:
for to day the lord hath wrought salvat in israel

11:14 then said samuel to the peopl come and let us go to gilgal
and renew the kingdom there

11:15 and all the peopl went to gilgal; and there they made saul king
befor the lord in gilgal; and there they sacrif sacrific of
peac offer befor the lord; and there saul and all the men of
israel rejoic greatli

12:1 and samuel said unto all israel behold i have hearken unto
your voic in all that ye said unto me and have made a king over you

12:2 and now behold the king walketh befor you: and i am old and
grayheaded; and behold my son are with you: and i have walk
befor you from my childhood unto thi day

12:3 behold here i am: wit against me befor the lord and befor
hi anointed: whose ox have i taken? or whose ass have i taken? or
whom have i defrauded? whom have i oppressed? or of whose hand have i
receiv ani bribe to blind mine eye therewith? and i will restor it
you

12:4 and they said thou hast not defraud us nor oppress us
neither hast thou taken ought of ani man hand

12:5 and he said unto them the lord is wit against you and hi
anoint is wit thi day that ye have not found ought in my hand
and they answer he is wit

12:6 and samuel said unto the peopl it is the lord that advanc
mose and aaron and that brought your father up out of the land of
egypt

12:7 now therefor stand still that i may reason with you befor the
lord of all the righteou act of the lord which he did to you and to
your father

12:8 when jacob wa come into egypt and your father cri unto the
lord then the lord sent mose and aaron which brought forth your
father out of egypt and made them dwell in thi place

12:9 and when they forgat the lord their god he sold them into the
hand of sisera captain of the host of hazor and into the hand of the
philistin and into the hand of the king of moab and they fought
against them

12:10 and they cri unto the lord and said we have sin becaus
we have forsaken the lord and have serv baalim and ashtaroth: but
now deliv us out of the hand of our enemi and we will serv thee

12:11 and the lord sent jerubba and bedan and jephthah and
samuel and deliv you out of the hand of your enemi on everi
side and ye dwell safe

12:12 and when ye saw that nahash the king of the children of ammon
came against you ye said unto me nay; but a king shall reign over
us: when the lord your god wa your king

12:13 now therefor behold the king whom ye have chosen and whom ye
have desired! and behold the lord hath set a king over you

12:14 if ye will fear the lord and serv him and obey hi voic and
not rebel against the command of the lord then shall both ye and
also the king that reigneth over you continu follow the lord your
god: 12:15 but if ye will not obey the voic of the lord but rebel
against the command of the lord then shall the hand of the lord
be against you as it wa against your father

12:16 now therefor stand and see thi great thing which the lord
will do befor your eye

12:17 is it not wheat harvest to day? i will call unto the lord and
he shall send thunder and rain; that ye may perceiv and see that your
wicked is great which ye have done in the sight of the lord in
ask you a king

12:18 so samuel call unto the lord; and the lord sent thunder and
rain that day: and all the peopl greatli fear the lord and samuel

12:19 and all the peopl said unto samuel pray for thi servant unto
the lord thi god that we die not: for we have ad unto all our sin
thi evil to ask us a king

12:20 and samuel said unto the peopl fear not: ye have done all thi
wickedness: yet turn not asid from follow the lord but serv the
lord with all your heart; 12:21 and turn ye not aside: for then should
ye go after vain thing which cannot profit nor deliver; for they are
vain

12:22 for the lord will not forsak hi peopl for hi great name
sake: becaus it hath pleas the lord to make you hi peopl

12:23 moreov as for me god forbid that i should sin against the
lord in ceas to pray for you: but i will teach you the good and the
right way: 12:24 onli fear the lord and serv him in truth with all
your heart: for consid how great thing he hath done for you

12:25 but if ye shall still do wickedli ye shall be consum both ye
and your king

13:1 saul reign one year; and when he had reign two year over
israel 13:2 saul chose him three thousand men of israel; whereof two
thousand were with saul in michmash and in mount bethel and a
thousand were with jonathan in gibeah of benjamin: and the rest of the
peopl he sent everi man to hi tent

13:3 and jonathan smote the garrison of the philistin that wa in
geba and the philistin heard of it and saul blew the trumpet
throughout all the land say let the hebrew hear

13:4 and all israel heard say that saul had smitten a garrison of the
philistin and that israel also wa had in abomin with the
philistin and the peopl were call togeth after saul to gilgal

13:5 and the philistin gather themselv togeth to fight with
israel thirti thousand chariot and six thousand horsemen and
peopl as the sand which is on the sea shore in multitude: and they
came up and pitch in michmash eastward from bethaven

13:6 when the men of israel saw that they were in a strait (for the
peopl were distressed) then the peopl did hide themselv in cave
and in thicket and in rock and in high place and in pit

13:7 and some of the hebrew went over jordan to the land of gad and
gilead as for saul he wa yet in gilgal and all the peopl follow
him trembl

13:8 and he tarri seven day accord to the set time that samuel
had appointed: but samuel came not to gilgal; and the peopl were
scatter from him

13:9 and saul said bring hither a burnt offer to me and peac
offer and he offer the burnt offer

13:10 and it came to pass that as soon as he had made an end of
offer the burnt offer behold samuel came; and saul went out to
meet him that he might salut him

13:11 and samuel said what hast thou done? and saul said becaus i
saw that the peopl were scatter from me and that thou camest not
within the day appoint and that the philistin gather
themselv togeth at michmash; 13:12 therefor said i the
philistin will come down now upon me to gilgal and i have not made
supplic unto the lord: i forc myself therefor and offer a
burnt offer

13:13 and samuel said to saul thou hast done foolishly: thou hast not
kept the command of the lord thi god which he command thee: for
now would the lord have establish thi kingdom upon israel for ever

13:14 but now thi kingdom shall not continue: the lord hath sought him
a man after hi own heart and the lord hath command him to be
captain over hi peopl becaus thou hast not kept that which the
lord command thee

13:15 and samuel aros and gat him up from gilgal unto gibeah of
benjamin and saul number the peopl that were present with him
about six hundr men

13:16 and saul and jonathan hi son and the peopl that were present
with them abod in gibeah of benjamin: but the philistin encamp
in michmash

13:17 and the spoiler came out of the camp of the philistin in
three companies: one compani turn unto the way that leadeth to
ophrah unto the land of shual: 13:18 and anoth compani turn the
way to bethhoron: and anoth compani turn to the way of the border
that looketh to the valley of zeboim toward the wilder

13:19 now there wa no smith found throughout all the land of israel:
for the philistin said lest the hebrew make them sword or spears:
13:20 but all the israelit went down to the philistin to sharpen
everi man hi share and hi coulter and hi axe and hi mattock

13:21 yet they had a file for the mattock and for the coulter and
for the fork and for the axe and to sharpen the goad

13:22 so it came to pass in the day of battl that there wa neither
sword nor spear found in the hand of ani of the peopl that were with
saul and jonathan: but with saul and with jonathan hi son wa there
found

13:23 and the garrison of the philistin went out to the passag of
michmash

14:1 now it came to pass upon a day that jonathan the son of saul
said unto the young man that bare hi armour come and let us go over
to the philistin garrison that is on the other side but he told
not hi father

14:2 and saul tarri in the uttermost part of gibeah under a
pomegran tree which is in migron: and the peopl that were with him
were about six hundr men; 14:3 and ahiah the son of ahitub
ichabod brother the son of phineha the son of eli the lord
priest in shiloh wear an ephod and the peopl knew not that
jonathan wa gone

14:4 and between the passag by which jonathan sought to go over
unto the philistin garrison there wa a sharp rock on the one
side and a sharp rock on the other side: and the name of the one wa
bozez and the name of the other seneh

14:5 the forefront of the one wa situat northward over against
michmash and the other southward over against gibeah

14:6 and jonathan said to the young man that bare hi armour come
and let us go over unto the garrison of these uncircumcised: it may be
that the lord will work for us: for there is no restraint to the lord
to save by mani or by few

14:7 and hi armourbear said unto him do all that is in thine
heart: turn thee; behold i am with thee accord to thi heart

14:8 then said jonathan behold we will pass over unto these men and
we will discov ourselv unto them

14:9 if they say thu unto us tarri until we come to you; then we
will stand still in our place and will not go up unto them

14:10 but if they say thu come up unto us; then we will go up: for
the lord hath deliv them into our hand: and thi shall be a sign
unto us

14:11 and both of them discov themselv unto the garrison of the
philistines: and the philistin said behold the hebrew come forth
out of the hole where they had hid themselv

14:12 and the men of the garrison answer jonathan and hi
armourbear and said come up to us and we will shew you a thing
and jonathan said unto hi armourbear come up after me: for the
lord hath deliv them into the hand of israel

14:13 and jonathan climb up upon hi hand and upon hi feet and
hi armourbear after him: and they fell befor jonathan; and hi
armourbear slew after him

14:14 and that first slaughter which jonathan and hi armourbear
made wa about twenti men within as it were an half acr of land
which a yoke of oxen might plow

14:15 and there wa trembl in the host in the field and among all
the people: the garrison and the spoiler they also trembl and
the earth quaked: so it wa a veri great trembl

14:16 and the watchmen of saul in gibeah of benjamin looked; and
behold the multitud melt away and they went on beat down one
anoth

14:17 then said saul unto the peopl that were with him number now
and see who is gone from us and when they had number behold
jonathan and hi armourbear were not there

14:18 and saul said unto ahiah bring hither the ark of god for the
ark of god wa at that time with the children of israel

14:19 and it came to pass while saul talk unto the priest that the
nois that wa in the host of the philistin went on and increased:
and saul said unto the priest withdraw thine hand

14:20 and saul and all the peopl that were with him assembl
themselv and they came to the battle: and behold everi man
sword wa against hi fellow and there wa a veri great discomfitur

14:21 moreov the hebrew that were with the philistin befor that
time which went up with them into the camp from the countri round
about even they also turn to be with the israelit that were with
saul and jonathan

14:22 likewis all the men of israel which had hid themselv in mount
ephraim when they heard that the philistin fled even they also
follow hard after them in the battl

14:23 so the lord save israel that day: and the battl pass over
unto bethaven

14:24 and the men of israel were distress that day: for saul had
adjur the peopl say curs be the man that eateth ani food
until even that i may be aveng on mine enemi so none of the
peopl tast ani food

14:25 and all they of the land came to a wood; and there wa honey
upon the ground

14:26 and when the peopl were come into the wood behold the honey
dropped; but no man put hi hand to hi mouth: for the peopl fear
the oath

14:27 but jonathan heard not when hi father charg the peopl with
the oath: wherefor he put forth the end of the rod that wa in hi
hand and dip it in an honeycomb and put hi hand to hi mouth;
and hi eye were enlighten

14:28 then answer one of the peopl and said thi father straitli
charg the peopl with an oath say curs be the man that eateth
ani food thi day and the peopl were faint

14:29 then said jonathan my father hath troubl the land: see i
pray you how mine eye have been enlighten becaus i tast a
littl of thi honey

14:30 how much more if hapli the peopl had eaten freeli to day of
the spoil of their enemi which they found? for had there not been
now a much greater slaughter among the philistines? 14:31 and they
smote the philistin that day from michmash to aijalon: and the
peopl were veri faint

14:32 and the peopl flew upon the spoil and took sheep and oxen
and calv and slew them on the ground: and the peopl did eat them
with the blood

14:33 then they told saul say behold the peopl sin against the
lord in that they eat with the blood and he said ye have
transgressed: roll a great stone unto me thi day

14:34 and saul said dispers yourselv among the peopl and say
unto them bring me hither everi man hi ox and everi man hi sheep
and slay them here and eat; and sin not against the lord in eat
with the blood

and all the peopl brought everi man hi ox with him that night and
slew them there

14:35 and saul built an altar unto the lord: the same wa the first
altar that he built unto the lord

14:36 and saul said let us go down after the philistin by night
and spoil them until the morn light and let us not leav a man of
them and they said do whatsoev seemeth good unto thee then said
the priest let us draw near hither unto god

14:37 and saul ask counsel of god shall i go down after the
philistines? wilt thou deliv them into the hand of israel? but he
answer him not that day

14:38 and saul said draw ye near hither all the chief of the people:
and know and see wherein thi sin hath been thi day

14:39 for as the lord liveth which saveth israel though it be in
jonathan my son he shall sure die but there wa not a man among
all the peopl that answer him

14:40 then said he unto all israel be ye on one side and i and
jonathan my son will be on the other side and the peopl said unto
saul do what seemeth good unto thee

14:41 therefor saul said unto the lord god of israel give a perfect
lot

and saul and jonathan were taken: but the peopl escap

14:42 and saul said cast lot between me and jonathan my son and
jonathan wa taken

14:43 then saul said to jonathan tell me what thou hast done and
jonathan told him and said i did but tast a littl honey with the
end of the rod that wa in mine hand and lo i must die

14:44 and saul answer god do so and more also: for thou shalt
sure die jonathan

14:45 and the peopl said unto saul shall jonathan die who hath
wrought thi great salvat in israel? god forbid: as the lord
liveth there shall not one hair of hi head fall to the ground; for
he hath wrought with god thi day so the peopl rescu jonathan
that he die not

14:46 then saul went up from follow the philistines: and the
philistin went to their own place

14:47 so saul took the kingdom over israel and fought against all hi
enemi on everi side against moab and against the children of
ammon and against edom and against the king of zobah and against
the philistines: and whithersoev he turn himself he vex them

14:48 and he gather an host and smote the amalekit and deliv
israel out of the hand of them that spoil them

14:49 now the son of saul were jonathan and ishui and melchishua:
and the name of hi two daughter were these; the name of the
firstborn merab and the name of the younger michal: 14:50 and the
name of saul wife wa ahinoam the daughter of ahimaaz: and the name
of the captain of hi host wa abner the son of ner saul uncl

14:51 and kish wa the father of saul; and ner the father of abner wa
the son of abiel

14:52 and there wa sore war against the philistin all the day of
saul: and when saul saw ani strong man or ani valiant man he took
him unto him

15:1 samuel also said unto saul the lord sent me to anoint thee to be
king over hi peopl over israel: now therefor hearken thou unto the
voic of the word of the lord

15:2 thu saith the lord of host i rememb that which amalek did to
israel how he laid wait for him in the way when he came up from
egypt

15:3 now go and smite amalek and utterli destroy all that they have
and spare them not; but slay both man and woman infant and suckl
ox and sheep camel and ass

15:4 and saul gather the peopl togeth and number them in
telaim two hundr thousand footmen and ten thousand men of judah

15:5 and saul came to a citi of amalek and laid wait in the valley

15:6 and saul said unto the kenit go depart get you down from
among the amalekit lest i destroy you with them: for ye shew
kind to all the children of israel when they came up out of
egypt so the kenit depart from among the amalekit

15:7 and saul smote the amalekit from havilah until thou comest to
shur that is over against egypt

15:8 and he took agag the king of the amalekit aliv and utterli
destroy all the peopl with the edg of the sword

15:9 but saul and the peopl spare agag and the best of the sheep
and of the oxen and of the fatl and the lamb and all that wa
good and would not utterli destroy them: but everi thing that wa
vile and refus that they destroy utterli

15:10 then came the word of the lord unto samuel say 15:11 it
repenteth me that i have set up saul to be king: for he is turn back
from follow me and hath not perform my command and it
griev samuel; and he cri unto the lord all night

15:12 and when samuel rose earli to meet saul in the morn it wa
told samuel say saul came to carmel and behold he set him up a
place and is gone about and pass on and gone down to gilgal

15:13 and samuel came to saul: and saul said unto him bless be thou
of the lord: i have perform the command of the lord

15:14 and samuel said what meaneth then thi bleat of the sheep in
mine ear and the low of the oxen which i hear? 15:15 and saul
said they have brought them from the amalekites: for the peopl
spare the best of the sheep and of the oxen to sacrific unto the
lord thi god; and the rest we have utterli destroy

15:16 then samuel said unto saul stay and i will tell thee what the
lord hath said to me thi night and he said unto him say on

15:17 and samuel said when thou wast littl in thine own sight wast
thou not made the head of the tribe of israel and the lord anoint
thee king over israel? 15:18 and the lord sent thee on a journey and
said go and utterli destroy the sinner the amalekit and fight
against them until they be consum

15:19 wherefor then didst thou not obey the voic of the lord but
didst fli upon the spoil and didst evil in the sight of the lord?
15:20 and saul said unto samuel yea i have obey the voic of the
lord and have gone the way which the lord sent me and have brought
agag the king of amalek and have utterli destroy the amalekit

15:21 but the peopl took of the spoil sheep and oxen the chief of
the thing which should have been utterli destroy to sacrific unto
the lord thi god in gilgal

15:22 and samuel said hath the lord as great delight in burnt
offer and sacrific as in obey the voic of the lord? behold
to obey is better than sacrific and to hearken than the fat of ram

15:23 for rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft and stubborn is
as iniqu and idolatri becaus thou hast reject the word of the
lord he hath also reject thee from be king

15:24 and saul said unto samuel i have sinned: for i have
transgress the command of the lord and thi words: becaus i
fear the peopl and obey their voic

15:25 now therefor i pray thee pardon my sin and turn again with
me that i may worship the lord

15:26 and samuel said unto saul i will not return with thee: for thou
hast reject the word of the lord and the lord hath reject thee
from be king over israel

15:27 and as samuel turn about to go away he laid hold upon the
skirt of hi mantl and it rent

15:28 and samuel said unto him the lord hath rent the kingdom of
israel from thee thi day and hath given it to a neighbour of thine
that is better than thou

15:29 and also the strength of israel will not lie nor repent: for he
is not a man that he should repent

15:30 then he said i have sinned: yet honour me now i pray thee
befor the elder of my peopl and befor israel and turn again with
me that i may worship the lord thi god

15:31 so samuel turn again after saul; and saul worship the lord

15:32 then said samuel bring ye hither to me agag the king of the
amalekit and agag came unto him delic and agag said sure
the bitter of death is past

15:33 and samuel said as the sword hath made women childless so
shall thi mother be childless among women and samuel hew agag in
piec befor the lord in gilgal

15:34 then samuel went to ramah; and saul went up to hi hous to
gibeah of saul

15:35 and samuel came no more to see saul until the day of hi death:
nevertheless samuel mourn for saul: and the lord repent that he
had made saul king over israel

16:1 and the lord said unto samuel how long wilt thou mourn for saul
see i have reject him from reign over israel? fill thine horn
with oil and go i will send thee to jess the bethlehemite: for i
have provid me a king among hi son

16:2 and samuel said how can i go? if saul hear it he will kill me
and the lord said take an heifer with thee and say i am come to
sacrific to the lord

16:3 and call jess to the sacrific and i will shew thee what thou
shalt do: and thou shalt anoint unto me him whom i name unto thee

16:4 and samuel did that which the lord spake and came to bethlehem
and the elder of the town trembl at hi come and said comest
thou peaceably? 16:5 and he said peaceably: i am come to sacrific
unto the lord: sanctifi yourselv and come with me to the sacrific
and he sanctifi jess and hi son and call them to the
sacrific

16:6 and it came to pass when they were come that he look on
eliab and said sure the lord anoint is befor him

16:7 but the lord said unto samuel look not on hi counten or on
the height of hi stature; becaus i have refus him: for the lord
seeth not as man seeth; for man looketh on the outward appear but
the lord looketh on the heart

16:8 then jess call abinadab and made him pass befor samuel and
he said neither hath the lord chosen thi

16:9 then jess made shammah to pass by and he said neither hath the
lord chosen thi

16:10 again jess made seven of hi son to pass befor samuel and
samuel said unto jess the lord hath not chosen these

16:11 and samuel said unto jess are here all thi children? and he
said there remaineth yet the youngest and behold he keepeth the
sheep and samuel said unto jess send and fetch him: for we will not
sit down till he come hither

16:12 and he sent and brought him in now he wa ruddi and withal of
a beauti counten and goodli to look to and the lord said
aris anoint him: for thi is he

16:13 then samuel took the horn of oil and anoint him in the midst
of hi brethren: and the spirit of the lord came upon david from that
day forward so samuel rose up and went to ramah

16:14 but the spirit of the lord depart from saul and an evil
spirit from the lord troubl him

16:15 and saul servant said unto him behold now an evil spirit
from god troubleth thee

16:16 let our lord now command thi servant which are befor thee to
seek out a man who is a cun player on an harp: and it shall come
to pass when the evil spirit from god is upon thee that he shall
play with hi hand and thou shalt be well

16:17 and saul said unto hi servant provid me now a man that can
play well and bring him to me

16:18 then answer one of the servant and said behold i have seen
a son of jess the bethlehemit that is cun in play and a
mighti valiant man and a man of war and prudent in matter and a
come person and the lord is with him

16:19 wherefor saul sent messeng unto jess and said send me
david thi son which is with the sheep

16:20 and jess took an ass laden with bread and a bottl of wine
and a kid and sent them by david hi son unto saul

16:21 and david came to saul and stood befor him: and he love him
greatly; and he becam hi armourbear

16:22 and saul sent to jess say let david i pray thee stand
befor me; for he hath found favour in my sight

16:23 and it came to pass when the evil spirit from god wa upon
saul that david took an harp and play with hi hand: so saul wa
refresh and wa well and the evil spirit depart from him

17:1 now the philistin gather togeth their armi to battl and
were gather togeth at shochoh which belongeth to judah and
pitch between shochoh and azekah in ephesdammim

17:2 and saul and the men of israel were gather togeth and
pitch by the valley of elah and set the battl in array against the
philistin

17:3 and the philistin stood on a mountain on the one side and
israel stood on a mountain on the other side: and there wa a valley
between them

17:4 and there went out a champion out of the camp of the philistin
name goliath of gath whose height wa six cubit and a span

17:5 and he had an helmet of brass upon hi head and he wa arm
with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat wa five thousand
shekel of brass

17:6 and he had greav of brass upon hi leg and a target of brass
between hi shoulder

17:7 and the staff of hi spear wa like a weaver beam; and hi
spear head weigh six hundr shekel of iron: and one bear a
shield went befor him

17:8 and he stood and cri unto the armi of israel and said unto
them whi are ye come out to set your battl in array? am not i a
philistin and ye servant to saul? choos you a man for you and let
him come down to me

17:9 if he be abl to fight with me and to kill me then will we be
your servants: but if i prevail against him and kill him then shall
ye be our servant and serv us

17:10 and the philistin said i defi the armi of israel thi day;
give me a man that we may fight togeth

17:11 when saul and all israel heard those word of the philistin
they were dismay and greatli afraid

17:12 now david wa the son of that ephrathit of bethlehemjudah
whose name wa jesse; and he had eight sons: and the man went among
men for an old man in the day of saul

17:13 and the three eldest son of jess went and follow saul to the
battle: and the name of hi three son that went to the battl were
eliab the firstborn and next unto him abinadab and the third
shammah

17:14 and david wa the youngest: and the three eldest follow saul

17:15 but david went and return from saul to feed hi father sheep
at bethlehem

17:16 and the philistin drew near morn and even and present
himself forti day

17:17 and jess said unto david hi son take now for thi brethren an
ephah of thi parch corn and these ten loav and run to the camp
of thi brethren; 17:18 and carri these ten chees unto the captain of
their thousand and look how thi brethren fare and take their pledg

17:19 now saul and they and all the men of israel were in the
valley of elah fight with the philistin

17:20 and david rose up earli in the morn and left the sheep with
a keeper and took and went as jess had command him; and he came
to the trench as the host wa go forth to the fight and shout
for the battl

17:21 for israel and the philistin had put the battl in array armi
against armi

17:22 and david left hi carriag in the hand of the keeper of the
carriag and ran into the armi and came and salut hi brethren

17:23 and as he talk with them behold there came up the champion
the philistin of gath goliath by name out of the armi of the
philistin and spake accord to the same words: and david heard
them

17:24 and all the men of israel when they saw the man fled from him
and were sore afraid

17:25 and the men of israel said have ye seen thi man that is come
up? sure to defi israel is he come up: and it shall be that the
man who killeth him the king will enrich him with great rich and
will give him hi daughter and make hi father hous free in
israel

17:26 and david spake to the men that stood by him say what shall
be done to the man that killeth thi philistin and taketh away the
reproach from israel? for who is thi uncircumcis philistin that
he should defi the armi of the live god? 17:27 and the peopl
answer him after thi manner say so shall it be done to the man
that killeth him

17:28 and eliab hi eldest brother heard when he spake unto the men;
and eliab anger wa kindl against david and he said whi camest
thou down hither? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the
wilderness? i know thi pride and the naughti of thine heart; for
thou art come down that thou mightest see the battl

17:29 and david said what have i now done? is there not a cause?
17:30 and he turn from him toward anoth and spake after the same
manner: and the peopl answer him again after the former manner

17:31 and when the word were heard which david spake they rehears
them befor saul: and he sent for him

17:32 and david said to saul let no man heart fail becaus of him;
thi servant will go and fight with thi philistin

17:33 and saul said to david thou art not abl to go against thi
philistin to fight with him: for thou art but a youth and he a man
of war from hi youth

17:34 and david said unto saul thi servant kept hi father sheep
and there came a lion and a bear and took a lamb out of the flock:
17:35 and i went out after him and smote him and deliv it out of
hi mouth: and when he aros against me i caught him by hi beard
and smote him and slew him

17:36 thi servant slew both the lion and the bear: and thi
uncircumcis philistin shall be as one of them see he hath
defi the armi of the live god

17:37 david said moreov the lord that deliv me out of the paw
of the lion and out of the paw of the bear he will deliv me out of
the hand of thi philistin and saul said unto david go and the
lord be with thee

17:38 and saul arm david with hi armour and he put an helmet of
brass upon hi head; also he arm him with a coat of mail

17:39 and david gird hi sword upon hi armour and he assay to
go; for he had not prove it and david said unto saul i cannot go
with these; for i have not prove them and david put them off him

17:40 and he took hi staff in hi hand and chose him five smooth
stone out of the brook and put them in a shepherd bag which he
had even in a scrip; and hi sling wa in hi hand: and he drew near
to the philistin

17:41 and the philistin came on and drew near unto david; and the man
that bare the shield went befor him

17:42 and when the philistin look about and saw david he
disdain him: for he wa but a youth and ruddi and of a fair
counten

17:43 and the philistin said unto david am i a dog that thou comest
to me with staves? and the philistin curs david by hi god

17:44 and the philistin said to david come to me and i will give
thi flesh unto the fowl of the air and to the beast of the field

17:45 then said david to the philistin thou comest to me with a
sword and with a spear and with a shield: but i come to thee in the
name of the lord of host the god of the armi of israel whom thou
hast defi

17:46 thi day will the lord deliv thee into mine hand; and i will
smite thee and take thine head from thee; and i will give the
carcas of the host of the philistin thi day unto the fowl of the
air and to the wild beast of the earth; that all the earth may know
that there is a god in israel

17:47 and all thi assembl shall know that the lord saveth not with
sword and spear: for the battl is the lord and he will give you
into our hand

17:48 and it came to pass when the philistin aros and came and
drew nigh to meet david that david hasten and ran toward the armi
to meet the philistin

17:49 and david put hi hand in hi bag and took thenc a stone and
slang it and smote the philistin in hi forehead that the stone
sunk into hi forehead; and he fell upon hi face to the earth

17:50 so david prevail over the philistin with a sling and with a
stone and smote the philistin and slew him; but there wa no sword
in the hand of david

17:51 therefor david ran and stood upon the philistin and took hi
sword and drew it out of the sheath thereof and slew him and cut
off hi head therewith and when the philistin saw their champion
wa dead they fled

17:52 and the men of israel and of judah aros and shout and
pursu the philistin until thou come to the valley and to the
gate of ekron

and the wound of the philistin fell down by the way to shaaraim
even unto gath and unto ekron

17:53 and the children of israel return from chase after the
philistin and they spoil their tent

17:54 and david took the head of the philistin and brought it to
jerusalem; but he put hi armour in hi tent

17:55 and when saul saw david go forth against the philistin he said
unto abner the captain of the host abner whose son is thi youth?
and abner said as thi soul liveth o king i cannot tell

17:56 and the king said enquir thou whose son the stripl is

17:57 and as david return from the slaughter of the philistin
abner took him and brought him befor saul with the head of the
philistin in hi hand

17:58 and saul said to him whose son art thou thou young man? and
david answer i am the son of thi servant jess the bethlehemit

18:1 and it came to pass when he had made an end of speak unto
saul that the soul of jonathan wa knit with the soul of david and
jonathan love him as hi own soul

18:2 and saul took him that day and would let him go no more home to
hi father hous

18:3 then jonathan and david made a coven becaus he love him as
hi own soul

18:4 and jonathan strip himself of the robe that wa upon him and
gave it to david and hi garment even to hi sword and to hi bow
and to hi girdl

18:5 and david went out whithersoev saul sent him and behav
himself wisely: and saul set him over the men of war and he wa
accept in the sight of all the peopl and also in the sight of
saul servant

18:6 and it came to pass as they came when david wa return from
the slaughter of the philistin that the women came out of all citi
of israel sing and danc to meet king saul with tabret with
joy and with instrument of musick

18:7 and the women answer one anoth as they play and said saul
hath slain hi thousand and david hi ten thousand

18:8 and saul wa veri wroth and the say displeas him; and he
said they have ascrib unto david ten thousand and to me they have
ascrib but thousands: and what can he have more but the kingdom?
18:9 and saul eye david from that day and forward

18:10 and it came to pass on the morrow that the evil spirit from god
came upon saul and he prophesi in the midst of the house: and david
play with hi hand as at other times: and there wa a javelin in
saul hand

18:11 and saul cast the javelin; for he said i will smite david even
to the wall with it and david avoid out of hi presenc twice

18:12 and saul wa afraid of david becaus the lord wa with him and
wa depart from saul

18:13 therefor saul remov him from him and made him hi captain
over a thousand; and he went out and came in befor the peopl

18:14 and david behav himself wise in all hi ways; and the lord
wa with him

18:15 wherefor when saul saw that he behav himself veri wise he
wa afraid of him

18:16 but all israel and judah love david becaus he went out and
came in befor them

18:17 and saul said to david behold my elder daughter merab her will
i give thee to wife: onli be thou valiant for me and fight the lord
battl

for saul said let not mine hand be upon him but let the hand of the
philistin be upon him

18:18 and david said unto saul who am i? and what is my life or my
father famili in israel that i should be son in law to the king?
18:19 but it came to pass at the time when merab saul daughter
should have been given to david that she wa given unto adriel the
meholathit to wife

18:20 and michal saul daughter love david: and they told saul and
the thing pleas him

18:21 and saul said i will give him her that she may be a snare to
him and that the hand of the philistin may be against him
wherefor saul said to david thou shalt thi day be my son in law in
the one of the twain

18:22 and saul command hi servant say commun with david
secretli and say behold the king hath delight in thee and all hi
servant love thee: now therefor be the king son in law

18:23 and saul servant spake those word in the ear of david and
david said seemeth it to you a light thing to be a king son in law
see that i am a poor man and lightli esteemed? 18:24 and the
servant of saul told him say on thi manner spake david

18:25 and saul said thu shall ye say to david the king desireth not
ani dowri but an hundr foreskin of the philistin to be aveng
of the king enemi but saul thought to make david fall by the hand
of the philistin

18:26 and when hi servant told david these word it pleas david
well to be the king son in law: and the day were not expir

18:27 wherefor david aros and went he and hi men and slew of the
philistin two hundr men; and david brought their foreskin and
they gave them in full tale to the king that he might be the king
son in law and saul gave him michal hi daughter to wife

18:28 and saul saw and knew that the lord wa with david and that
michal saul daughter love him

18:29 and saul wa yet the more afraid of david; and saul becam
david enemi continu

18:30 then the princ of the philistin went forth: and it came to
pass after they went forth that david behav himself more wise
than all the servant of saul; so that hi name wa much set by

19:1 and saul spake to jonathan hi son and to all hi servant that
they should kill david

19:2 but jonathan saul son delight much in david: and jonathan
told david say saul my father seeketh to kill thee: now
therefor i pray thee take heed to thyself until the morn and
abid in a secret place and hide thyself: 19:3 and i will go out and
stand besid my father in the field where thou art and i will commun
with my father of thee; and what i see that i will tell thee

19:4 and jonathan spake good of david unto saul hi father and said
unto him let not the king sin against hi servant against david;
becaus he hath not sin against thee and becaus hi work have
been to thee-ward veri good: 19:5 for he did put hi life in hi hand
and slew the philistin and the lord wrought a great salvat for
all israel: thou sawest it and didst rejoice: wherefor then wilt
thou sin against innoc blood to slay david without a cause? 19:6
and saul hearken unto the voic of jonathan: and saul sware as the
lord liveth he shall not be slain

19:7 and jonathan call david and jonathan shew him all those
thing

and jonathan brought david to saul and he wa in hi presenc as in
time past

19:8 and there wa war again: and david went out and fought with the
philistin and slew them with a great slaughter; and they fled from
him

19:9 and the evil spirit from the lord wa upon saul as he sat in hi
hous with hi javelin in hi hand: and david play with hi hand

19:10 and saul sought to smite david even to the wall with the
javelin: but he slip away out of saul presenc and he smote the
javelin into the wall: and david fled and escap that night

19:11 saul also sent messeng unto david hous to watch him and
to slay him in the morning: and michal david wife told him say
if thou save not thi life to night to morrow thou shalt be slain

19:12 so michal let david down through a window: and he went and
fled and escap

19:13 and michal took an imag and laid it in the bed and put a
pillow of goat hair for hi bolster and cover it with a cloth

19:14 and when saul sent messeng to take david she said he is
sick

19:15 and saul sent the messeng again to see david say bring
him up to me in the bed that i may slay him

19:16 and when the messeng were come in behold there wa an imag
in the bed with a pillow of goat hair for hi bolster

19:17 and saul said unto michal whi hast thou deceiv me so and
sent away mine enemi that he is escaped? and michal answer saul he
said unto me let me go; whi should i kill thee? 19:18 so david fled
and escap and came to samuel to ramah and told him all that saul
had done to him and he and samuel went and dwelt in naioth

19:19 and it wa told saul say behold david is at naioth in
ramah

19:20 and saul sent messeng to take david: and when they saw the
compani of the prophet prophesi and samuel stand as appoint
over them the spirit of god wa upon the messeng of saul and they
also prophesi

19:21 and when it wa told saul he sent other messeng and they
prophesi likewis and saul sent messeng again the third time
and they prophesi also

19:22 then went he also to ramah and came to a great well that is in
sechu: and he ask and said where are samuel and david? and one
said behold they be at naioth in ramah

19:23 and he went thither to naioth in ramah: and the spirit of god
wa upon him also and he went on and prophesi until he came to
naioth in ramah

19:24 and he strip off hi cloth also and prophesi befor
samuel in like manner and lay down nake all that day and all that
night wherefor they say is saul also among the prophets? 20:1 and
david fled from naioth in ramah and came and said befor jonathan
what have i done? what is mine iniquity? and what is my sin befor thi
father that he seeketh my life? 20:2 and he said unto him god
forbid; thou shalt not die: behold my father will do noth either
great or small but that he will shew it me: and whi should my father
hide thi thing from me? it is not so

20:3 and david sware moreov and said thi father certainli knoweth
that i have found grace in thine eyes; and he saith let not jonathan
know thi lest he be grieved: but truli as the lord liveth and as
thi soul liveth there is but a step between me and death

20:4 then said jonathan unto david whatsoev thi soul desireth i
will even do it for thee

20:5 and david said unto jonathan behold to morrow is the new moon
and i should not fail to sit with the king at meat: but let me go
that i may hide myself in the field unto the third day at even

20:6 if thi father at all miss me then say david earnestli ask
leav of me that he might run to bethlehem hi city: for there is a
yearli sacrific there for all the famili

20:7 if he say thu it is well; thi servant shall have peace: but if
he be veri wroth then be sure that evil is determin by him

20:8 therefor thou shalt deal kindli with thi servant; for thou hast
brought thi servant into a coven of the lord with thee:
notwithstand if there be in me iniqu slay me thyself; for whi
shouldest thou bring me to thi father? 20:9 and jonathan said far be
it from thee: for if i knew certainli that evil were determin by my
father to come upon thee then would not i tell it thee? 20:10 then
said david to jonathan who shall tell me? or what if thi father
answer thee roughly? 20:11 and jonathan said unto david come and
let us go out into the field and they went out both of them into the
field

20:12 and jonathan said unto david o lord god of israel when i have
sound my father about to morrow ani time or the third day and
behold if there be good toward david and i then send not unto thee
and shew it thee; 20:13 the lord do so and much more to jonathan: but
if it pleas my father to do thee evil then i will shew it thee and
send thee away that thou mayest go in peace: and the lord be with
thee as he hath been with my father

20:14 and thou shalt not onli while yet i live shew me the kind of
the lord that i die not: 20:15 but also thou shalt not cut off thi
kind from my hous for ever: no not when the lord hath cut off
the enemi of david everi one from the face of the earth

20:16 so jonathan made a coven with the hous of david say let
the lord even requir it at the hand of david enemi

20:17 and jonathan caus david to swear again becaus he love him:
for he love him as he love hi own soul

20:18 then jonathan said to david to morrow is the new moon: and thou
shalt be miss becaus thi seat will be empti

20:19 and when thou hast stay three day then thou shalt go down
quickli and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself when the
busi wa in hand and shalt remain by the stone ezel

20:20 and i will shoot three arrow on the side thereof as though i
shot at a mark

20:21 and behold i will send a lad say go find out the arrow
if i expressli say unto the lad behold the arrow are on thi side
of thee take them; then come thou: for there is peac to thee and no
hurt; as the lord liveth

20:22 but if i say thu unto the young man behold the arrow are
beyond thee; go thi way: for the lord hath sent thee away

20:23 and as touch the matter which thou and i have spoken of
behold the lord be between thee and me for ever

20:24 so david hid himself in the field: and when the new moon wa
come the king sat him down to eat meat

20:25 and the king sat upon hi seat as at other time even upon a
seat by the wall: and jonathan aros and abner sat by saul side
and david place wa empti

20:26 nevertheless saul spake not ani thing that day: for he thought
someth hath befallen him he is not clean; sure he is not clean

20:27 and it came to pass on the morrow which wa the second day of
the month that david place wa empty: and saul said unto jonathan
hi son wherefor cometh not the son of jess to meat neither
yesterday nor to day? 20:28 and jonathan answer saul david
earnestli ask leav of me to go to bethlehem: 20:29 and he said let
me go i pray thee; for our famili hath a sacrific in the city; and
my brother he hath command me to be there: and now if i have found
favour in thine eye let me get away i pray thee and see my
brethren therefor he cometh not unto the king tabl

20:30 then saul anger wa kindl against jonathan and he said unto
him thou son of the pervers rebelli woman do not i know that
thou hast chosen the son of jess to thine own confus and unto the
confus of thi mother nakedness? 20:31 for as long as the son of
jess liveth upon the ground thou shalt not be establish nor thi
kingdom wherefor now send and fetch him unto me for he shall sure
die

20:32 and jonathan answer saul hi father and said unto him
wherefor shall he be slain? what hath he done? 20:33 and saul cast a
javelin at him to smite him: wherebi jonathan knew that it wa
determin of hi father to slay david

20:34 so jonathan aros from the tabl in fierc anger and did eat no
meat the second day of the month: for he wa griev for david
becaus hi father had done him shame

20:35 and it came to pass in the morn that jonathan went out into
the field at the time appoint with david and a littl lad with him

20:36 and he said unto hi lad run find out now the arrow which i
shoot and as the lad ran he shot an arrow beyond him

20:37 and when the lad wa come to the place of the arrow which
jonathan had shot jonathan cri after the lad and said is not the
arrow beyond thee? 20:38 and jonathan cri after the lad make
speed hast stay not and jonathan lad gather up the arrow and
came to hi master

20:39 but the lad knew not ani thing: onli jonathan and david knew the
matter

20:40 and jonathan gave hi artilleri unto hi lad and said unto him
go carri them to the citi

20:41 and as soon as the lad wa gone david aros out of a place
toward the south and fell on hi face to the ground and bow
himself three times: and they kiss one anoth and wept one with
anoth until david exceed

20:42 and jonathan said to david go in peac forasmuch as we have
sworn both of us in the name of the lord say the lord be between
me and thee and between my seed and thi seed for ever and he aros
and departed: and jonathan went into the citi

21:1 then came david to nob to ahimelech the priest: and ahimelech wa
afraid at the meet of david and said unto him whi art thou alon
and no man with thee? 21:2 and david said unto ahimelech the priest
the king hath command me a busi and hath said unto me let no
man know ani thing of the busi whereabout i send thee and what i
have command thee: and i have appoint my servant to such and such
a place

21:3 now therefor what is under thine hand? give me five loav of
bread in mine hand or what there is present

21:4 and the priest answer david and said there is no common bread
under mine hand but there is hallow bread; if the young men have
kept themselv at least from women

21:5 and david answer the priest and said unto him of a truth
women have been kept from us about these three day sinc i came out
and the vessel of the young men are holi and the bread is in a
manner common yea though it were sanctifi thi day in the vessel

21:6 so the priest gave him hallow bread: for there wa no bread
there but the shewbread that wa taken from befor the lord to put
hot bread in the day when it wa taken away

21:7 now a certain man of the servant of saul wa there that day
detain befor the lord; and hi name wa doeg an edomit the
chiefest of the herdmen that belong to saul

21:8 and david said unto ahimelech and is there not here under thine
hand spear or sword? for i have neither brought my sword nor my
weapon with me becaus the king busi requir hast

21:9 and the priest said the sword of goliath the philistin whom
thou slewest in the valley of elah behold it is here wrap in a
cloth behind the ephod: if thou wilt take that take it: for there is
no other save that here and david said there is none like that; give
it me

21:10 and david aros and fled that day for fear of saul and went to
achish the king of gath

21:11 and the servant of achish said unto him is not thi david the
king of the land? did they not sing one to anoth of him in danc
say saul hath slain hi thousand and david hi ten thousands?
21:12 and david laid up these word in hi heart and wa sore afraid
of achish the king of gath

21:13 and he chang hi behaviour befor them and feign himself
mad in their hand and scrabbl on the door of the gate and let
hi spittl fall down upon hi beard

21:14 then said achish unto hi servant lo ye see the man is mad:
wherefor then have ye brought him to me? 21:15 have i need of mad
men that ye have brought thi fellow to play the mad man in my
presence? shall thi fellow come into my house? 22:1 david therefor
depart thenc and escap to the cave adullam: and when hi
brethren and all hi father hous heard it they went down thither
to him

22:2 and everi one that wa in distress and everi one that wa in
debt and everi one that wa discont gather themselv unto
him; and he becam a captain over them: and there were with him about
four hundr men

22:3 and david went thenc to mizpeh of moab: and he said unto the
king of moab let my father and my mother i pray thee come forth
and be with you till i know what god will do for me

22:4 and he brought them befor the king of moab: and they dwelt with
him all the while that david wa in the hold

22:5 and the prophet gad said unto david abid not in the hold;
depart and get thee into the land of judah then david depart and
came into the forest of hareth

22:6 when saul heard that david wa discov and the men that were
with him (now saul abod in gibeah under a tree in ramah have hi
spear in hi hand and all hi servant were stand about him;) 22:7
then saul said unto hi servant that stood about him hear now ye
benjamites; will the son of jess give everi one of you field and
vineyard and make you all captain of thousand and captain of
hundreds; 22:8 that all of you have conspir against me and there is
none that sheweth me that my son hath made a leagu with the son of
jess and there is none of you that is sorri for me or sheweth unto
me that my son hath stir up my servant against me to lie in wait
as at thi day? 22:9 then answer doeg the edomit which wa set
over the servant of saul and said i saw the son of jess come to
nob to ahimelech the son of ahitub

22:10 and he enquir of the lord for him and gave him victual and
gave him the sword of goliath the philistin

22:11 then the king sent to call ahimelech the priest the son of
ahitub and all hi father hous the priest that were in nob: and
they came all of them to the king

22:12 and saul said hear now thou son of ahitub and he answer
here i am my lord

22:13 and saul said unto him whi have ye conspir against me thou
and the son of jess in that thou hast given him bread and a sword
and hast enquir of god for him that he should rise against me to
lie in wait as at thi day? 22:14 then ahimelech answer the king
and said and who is so faith among all thi servant as david
which is the king son in law and goeth at thi bid and is
honour in thine house? 22:15 did i then begin to enquir of god
for him? be it far from me: let not the king imput ani thing unto hi
servant nor to all the hous of my father: for thi servant knew
noth of all thi less or more

22:16 and the king said thou shalt sure die ahimelech thou and
all thi father hous

22:17 and the king said unto the footmen that stood about him turn
and slay the priest of the lord: becaus their hand also is with
david and becaus they knew when he fled and did not shew it to me
but the servant of the king would not put forth their hand to fall
upon the priest of the lord

22:18 and the king said to doeg turn thou and fall upon the priest
and doeg the edomit turn and he fell upon the priest and slew on
that day fourscor and five person that did wear a linen ephod

22:19 and nob the citi of the priest smote he with the edg of the
sword both men and women children and suckl and oxen and
ass and sheep with the edg of the sword

22:20 and one of the son of ahimelech the son of ahitub name
abiathar escap and fled after david

22:21 and abiathar shew david that saul had slain the lord
priest

22:22 and david said unto abiathar i knew it that day when doeg the
edomit wa there that he would sure tell saul: i have occas
the death of all the person of thi father hous

22:23 abid thou with me fear not: for he that seeketh my life
seeketh thi life: but with me thou shalt be in safeguard

23:1 then they told david say behold the philistin fight
against keilah and they rob the threshingfloor

23:2 therefor david enquir of the lord say shall i go and
smite these philistines? and the lord said unto david go and smite
the philistin and save keilah

23:3 and david men said unto him behold we be afraid here in
judah: how much more then if we come to keilah against the armi of
the philistines? 23:4 then david enquir of the lord yet again and
the lord answer him and said aris go down to keilah; for i will
deliv the philistin into thine hand

23:5 so david and hi men went to keilah and fought with the
philistin and brought away their cattl and smote them with a
great slaughter so david save the inhabit of keilah

23:6 and it came to pass when abiathar the son of ahimelech fled to
david to keilah that he came down with an ephod in hi hand

23:7 and it wa told saul that david wa come to keilah and saul
said god hath deliv him into mine hand; for he is shut in by
enter into a town that hath gate and bar

23:8 and saul call all the peopl togeth to war to go down to
keilah to besieg david and hi men

23:9 and david knew that saul secretli practis mischief against him;
and he said to abiathar the priest bring hither the ephod

23:10 then said david o lord god of israel thi servant hath
certainli heard that saul seeketh to come to keilah to destroy the
citi for my sake

23:11 will the men of keilah deliv me up into hi hand? will saul
come down as thi servant hath heard? o lord god of israel i beseech
thee tell thi servant and the lord said he will come down

23:12 then said david will the men of keilah deliv me and my men
into the hand of saul? and the lord said they will deliv thee up

23:13 then david and hi men which were about six hundr aros and
depart out of keilah and went whithersoev they could go and it
wa told saul that david wa escap from keilah; and he forbar to go
forth

23:14 and david abod in the wilder in strong hold and remain
in a mountain in the wilder of ziph and saul sought him everi
day but god deliv him not into hi hand

23:15 and david saw that saul wa come out to seek hi life: and david
wa in the wilder of ziph in a wood

23:16 and jonathan saul son aros and went to david into the wood
and strengthen hi hand in god

23:17 and he said unto him fear not: for the hand of saul my father
shall not find thee; and thou shalt be king over israel and i shall
be next unto thee; and that also saul my father knoweth

23:18 and they two made a coven befor the lord: and david abod in
the wood and jonathan went to hi hous

23:19 then came up the ziphit to saul to gibeah say doth not
david hide himself with us in strong hold in the wood in the hill of
hachilah which is on the south of jeshimon? 23:20 now therefor o
king come down accord to all the desir of thi soul to come down;
and our part shall be to deliv him into the king hand

23:21 and saul said bless be ye of the lord; for ye have compass
on me

23:22 go i pray you prepar yet and know and see hi place where
hi haunt is and who hath seen him there: for it is told me that he
dealeth veri subtilli

23:23 see therefor and take knowledg of all the lurk place
where he hideth himself and come ye again to me with the certainti
and i will go with you: and it shall come to pass if he be in the
land that i will search him out throughout all the thousand of
judah

23:24 and they aros and went to ziph befor saul: but david and hi
men were in the wilder of maon in the plain on the south of
jeshimon

23:25 saul also and hi men went to seek him and they told david;
wherefor he came down into a rock and abod in the wilder of
maon and when saul heard that he pursu after david in the
wilder of maon

23:26 and saul went on thi side of the mountain and david and hi
men on that side of the mountain: and david made hast to get away for
fear of saul; for saul and hi men compass david and hi men round
about to take them

23:27 but there came a messeng unto saul say hast thee and
come; for the philistin have invad the land

23:28 wherefor saul return from pursu after david and went
against the philistines: therefor they call that place
selahammahlekoth

23:29 and david went up from thenc and dwelt in strong hold at
engedi

24:1 and it came to pass when saul wa return from follow the
philistin that it wa told him say behold david is in the
wilder of engedi

24:2 then saul took three thousand chosen men out of all israel and
went to seek david and hi men upon the rock of the wild goat

24:3 and he came to the sheepcot by the way where wa a cave; and
saul went in to cover hi feet: and david and hi men remain in the
side of the cave

24:4 and the men of david said unto him behold the day of which the
lord said unto thee behold i will deliv thine enemi into thine
hand that thou mayest do to him as it shall seem good unto thee then
david aros and cut off the skirt of saul robe privili

24:5 and it came to pass afterward that david heart smote him
becaus he had cut off saul skirt

24:6 and he said unto hi men the lord forbid that i should do thi
thing unto my master the lord anoint to stretch forth mine hand
against him see he is the anoint of the lord

24:7 so david stay hi servant with these word and suffer them
not to rise against saul but saul rose up out of the cave and went
on hi way

24:8 david also aros afterward and went out of the cave and cri
after saul say my lord the king and when saul look behind him
david stoop with hi face to the earth and bow himself

24:9 and david said to saul wherefor hearest thou men word
say behold david seeketh thi hurt? 24:10 behold thi day thine
eye have seen how that the lord had deliv thee to day into mine
hand in the cave: and some bade me kill thee: but mine eye spare
thee; and i said i will not put forth mine hand against my lord; for
he is the lord anoint

24:11 moreov my father see yea see the skirt of thi robe in my
hand: for in that i cut off the skirt of thi robe and kill thee
not know thou and see that there is neither evil nor transgress in
mine hand and i have not sin against thee; yet thou huntest my
soul to take it

24:12 the lord judg between me and thee and the lord aveng me of
thee: but mine hand shall not be upon thee

24:13 as saith the proverb of the ancient wicked proceedeth from
the wicked: but mine hand shall not be upon thee

24:14 after whom is the king of israel come out? after whom dost thou
pursue? after a dead dog after a flea

24:15 the lord therefor be judg and judg between me and thee and
see and plead my caus and deliv me out of thine hand

24:16 and it came to pass when david had made an end of speak
these word unto saul that saul said is thi thi voic my son
david? and saul lift up hi voic and wept

24:17 and he said to david thou art more righteou than i: for thou
hast reward me good wherea i have reward thee evil

24:18 and thou hast shew thi day how that thou hast dealt well with
me: forasmuch as when the lord had deliv me into thine hand thou
killedst me not

24:19 for if a man find hi enemi will he let him go well away?
wherefor the lord reward thee good for that thou hast done unto me
thi day

24:20 and now behold i know well that thou shalt sure be king and
that the kingdom of israel shall be establish in thine hand

24:21 swear now therefor unto me by the lord that thou wilt not cut
off my seed after me and that thou wilt not destroy my name out of my
father hous

24:22 and david sware unto saul and saul went home; but david and hi
men gat them up unto the hold

25:1 and samuel died; and all the israelit were gather togeth
and lament him and buri him in hi hous at ramah and david
aros and went down to the wilder of paran

25:2 and there wa a man in maon whose possess were in carmel;
and the man wa veri great and he had three thousand sheep and a
thousand goats: and he wa shear hi sheep in carmel

25:3 now the name of the man wa nabal; and the name of hi wife
abigail: and she wa a woman of good understand and of a beauti
countenance: but the man wa churlish and evil in hi doings; and he
wa of the hous of caleb

25:4 and david heard in the wilder that nabal did shear hi sheep

25:5 and david sent out ten young men and david said unto the young
men get you up to carmel and go to nabal and greet him in my name:
25:6 and thu shall ye say to him that liveth in prosper peac be
both to thee and peac be to thine hous and peac be unto all that
thou hast

25:7 and now i have heard that thou hast shearers: now thi shepherd
which were with us we hurt them not neither wa there ought miss
unto them all the while they were in carmel

25:8 ask thi young men and they will shew thee wherefor let the
young men find favour in thine eyes: for we come in a good day: give
i pray thee whatsoev cometh to thine hand unto thi servant and to
thi son david

25:9 and when david young men came they spake to nabal accord to
all those word in the name of david and ceas

25:10 and nabal answer david servant and said who is david? and
who is the son of jesse? there be mani servant now a day that break
away everi man from hi master

25:11 shall i then take my bread and my water and my flesh that i
have kill for my shearer and give it unto men whom i know not
whenc they be? 25:12 so david young men turn their way and went
again and came and told him all those say

25:13 and david said unto hi men gird ye on everi man hi sword and
they gird on everi man hi sword; and david also gird on hi
sword: and there went up after david about four hundr men; and two
hundr abod by the stuff

25:14 but one of the young men told abigail nabal wife say
behold david sent messeng out of the wilder to salut our
master; and he rail on them

25:15 but the men were veri good unto us and we were not hurt
neither miss we ani thing as long as we were convers with them
when we were in the fields: 25:16 they were a wall unto us both by
night and day all the while we were with them keep the sheep

25:17 now therefor know and consid what thou wilt do; for evil is
determin against our master and against all hi household: for he
is such a son of belial that a man cannot speak to him

25:18 then abigail made hast and took two hundr loav and two
bottl of wine and five sheep readi dress and five measur of
parch corn and an hundr cluster of raisin and two hundr
cake of fig and laid them on ass

25:19 and she said unto her servant go on befor me; behold i come
after you but she told not her husband nabal

25:20 and it wa so as she rode on the ass that she came down by the
covert on the hill and behold david and hi men came down against
her; and she met them

25:21 now david had said sure in vain have i kept all that thi
fellow hath in the wilder so that noth wa miss of all that
pertain unto him: and he hath requit me evil for good

25:22 so and more also do god unto the enemi of david if i leav of
all that pertain to him by the morn light ani that pisseth against
the wall

25:23 and when abigail saw david she hast and light off the ass
and fell befor david on her face and bow herself to the ground
25:24 and fell at hi feet and said upon me my lord upon me let
thi iniqu be: and let thine handmaid i pray thee speak in thine
audienc and hear the word of thine handmaid

25:25 let not my lord i pray thee regard thi man of belial even
nabal: for as hi name is so is he; nabal is hi name and folli is
with him: but i thine handmaid saw not the young men of my lord whom
thou didst send

25:26 now therefor my lord as the lord liveth and as thi soul
liveth see the lord hath withholden thee from come to shed
blood and from aveng thyself with thine own hand now let thine
enemi and they that seek evil to my lord be as nabal

25:27 and now thi bless which thine handmaid hath brought unto my
lord let it even be given unto the young men that follow my lord

25:28 i pray thee forgiv the trespass of thine handmaid: for the
lord will certainli make my lord a sure house; becaus my lord
fighteth the battl of the lord and evil hath not been found in thee
all thi day

25:29 yet a man is risen to pursu thee and to seek thi soul: but the
soul of my lord shall be bound in the bundl of life with the lord thi
god; and the soul of thine enemi them shall he sling out as out
of the middl of a sling

25:30 and it shall come to pass when the lord shall have done to my
lord accord to all the good that he hath spoken concern thee
and shall have appoint thee ruler over israel; 25:31 that thi shall
be no grief unto thee nor offenc of heart unto my lord either that
thou hast shed blood causeless or that my lord hath aveng himself:
but when the lord shall have dealt well with my lord then rememb
thine handmaid

25:32 and david said to abigail bless be the lord god of israel
which sent thee thi day to meet me: 25:33 and bless be thi advic
and bless be thou which hast kept me thi day from come to shed
blood and from aveng myself with mine own hand

25:34 for in veri deed as the lord god of israel liveth which hath
kept me back from hurt thee except thou hadst hast and come to
meet me sure there had not been left unto nabal by the morn
light ani that pisseth against the wall

25:35 so david receiv of her hand that which she had brought him
and said unto her go up in peac to thine house; see i have
hearken to thi voic and have accept thi person

25:36 and abigail came to nabal; and behold he held a feast in hi
hous like the feast of a king; and nabal heart wa merri within
him for he wa veri drunken: wherefor she told him noth less or
more until the morn light

25:37 but it came to pass in the morn when the wine wa gone out
of nabal and hi wife had told him these thing that hi heart die
within him and he becam as a stone

25:38 and it came to pass about ten day after that the lord smote
nabal that he die

25:39 and when david heard that nabal wa dead he said bless be
the lord that hath plead the caus of my reproach from the hand of
nabal and hath kept hi servant from evil: for the lord hath return
the wicked of nabal upon hi own head and david sent and commun
with abigail to take her to him to wife

25:40 and when the servant of david were come to abigail to carmel
they spake unto her say david sent us unto thee to take thee to
him to wife

25:41 and she aros and bow herself on her face to the earth and
said behold let thine handmaid be a servant to wash the feet of the
servant of my lord

25:42 and abigail hast and aros and rode upon an ass with five
damsel of her that went after her; and she went after the messeng
of david and becam hi wife

25:43 david also took ahinoam of jezreel; and they were also both of
them hi wive

25:44 but saul had given michal hi daughter david wife to phalti
the son of laish which wa of gallim

26:1 and the ziphit came unto saul to gibeah say doth not david
hide himself in the hill of hachilah which is befor jeshimon? 26:2
then saul aros and went down to the wilder of ziph have three
thousand chosen men of israel with him to seek david in the
wilder of ziph

26:3 and saul pitch in the hill of hachilah which is befor
jeshimon by the way but david abod in the wilder and he saw
that saul came after him into the wilder

26:4 david therefor sent out spi and understood that saul wa come
in veri deed

26:5 and david aros and came to the place where saul had pitched:
and david beheld the place where saul lay and abner the son of ner
the captain of hi host: and saul lay in the trench and the peopl
pitch round about him

26:6 then answer david and said to ahimelech the hittit and to
abishai the son of zeruiah brother to joab say who will go down
with me to saul to the camp? and abishai said i will go down with
thee

26:7 so david and abishai came to the peopl by night: and behold
saul lay sleep within the trench and hi spear stuck in the ground
at hi bolster: but abner and the peopl lay round about him

26:8 then said abishai to david god hath deliv thine enemi into
thine hand thi day: now therefor let me smite him i pray thee with
the spear even to the earth at onc and i will not smite him the
second time

26:9 and david said to abishai destroy him not: for who can stretch
forth hi hand against the lord anoint and be guiltless? 26:10
david said furthermor as the lord liveth the lord shall smite him;
or hi day shall come to die; or he shall descend into battl and
perish

26:11 the lord forbid that i should stretch forth mine hand against
the lord anointed: but i pray thee take thou now the spear that is
at hi bolster and the cruse of water and let us go

26:12 so david took the spear and the cruse of water from saul
bolster; and they gat them away and no man saw it nor knew it
neither awaked: for they were all asleep; becaus a deep sleep from
the lord wa fallen upon them

26:13 then david went over to the other side and stood on the top of
an hill afar off; a great space be between them: 26:14 and david
cri to the peopl and to abner the son of ner say answerest
thou not abner? then abner answer and said who art thou that
criest to the king? 26:15 and david said to abner art not thou a
valiant man? and who is like to thee in israel? wherefor then hast
thou not kept thi lord the king? for there came one of the peopl in
to destroy the king thi lord

26:16 thi thing is not good that thou hast done as the lord liveth
ye are worthi to die becaus ye have not kept your master the lord
anoint

and now see where the king spear is and the cruse of water that wa
at hi bolster

26:17 and saul knew david voic and said is thi thi voic my son
david? and david said it is my voic my lord o king

26:18 and he said wherefor doth my lord thu pursu after hi
servant? for what have i done? or what evil is in mine hand? 26:19
now therefor i pray thee let my lord the king hear the word of hi
servant if the lord have stir thee up against me let him accept
an offering: but if they be the children of men curs be they befor
the lord; for they have driven me out thi day from abid in the
inherit of the lord say go serv other god

26:20 now therefor let not my blood fall to the earth befor the
face of the lord: for the king of israel is come out to seek a flea
as when one doth hunt a partridg in the mountain

26:21 then said saul i have sinned: return my son david: for i will
no more do thee harm becaus my soul wa preciou in thine eye thi
day: behold i have play the fool and have er exceedingli

26:22 and david answer and said behold the king spear! and let
one of the young men come over and fetch it

26:23 the lord render to everi man hi righteous and hi
faithfulness; for the lord deliv thee into my hand to day but i
would not stretch forth mine hand against the lord anoint

26:24 and behold as thi life wa much set by thi day in mine eye
so let my life be much set by in the eye of the lord and let him
deliv me out of all tribul

26:25 then saul said to david bless be thou my son david: thou
shalt both do great thing and also shalt still prevail so david
went on hi way and saul return to hi place

27:1 and david said in hi heart i shall now perish one day by the
hand of saul: there is noth better for me than that i should
speedili escap into the land of the philistines; and saul shall
despair of me to seek me ani more in ani coast of israel: so shall i
escap out of hi hand

27:2 and david aros and he pass over with the six hundr men that
were with him unto achish the son of maoch king of gath

27:3 and david dwelt with achish at gath he and hi men everi man
with hi household even david with hi two wive ahinoam the
jezreelitess and abigail the carmelitess nabal wife

27:4 and it wa told saul that david wa fled to gath: and he sought
no more again for him

27:5 and david said unto achish if i have now found grace in thine
eye let them give me a place in some town in the countri that i may
dwell there: for whi should thi servant dwell in the royal citi with
thee? 27:6 then achish gave him ziklag that day: wherefor ziklag
pertaineth unto the king of judah unto thi day

27:7 and the time that david dwelt in the countri of the philistin
wa a full year and four month

27:8 and david and hi men went up and invad the geshurit and
the gezrit and the amalekites: for those nation were of old the
inhabit of the land as thou goest to shur even unto the land of
egypt

27:9 and david smote the land and left neither man nor woman aliv
and took away the sheep and the oxen and the ass and the camel
and the apparel and return and came to achish

27:10 and achish said whither have ye made a road to day? and david
said against the south of judah and against the south of the
jerahmeelit and against the south of the kenit

27:11 and david save neither man nor woman aliv to bring tide to
gath say lest they should tell on us say so did david and
so will be hi manner all the while he dwelleth in the countri of the
philistin

27:12 and achish believ david say he hath made hi peopl
israel utterli to abhor him; therefor he shall be my servant for
ever

28:1 and it came to pass in those day that the philistin gather
their armi togeth for warfar to fight with israel and achish
said unto david know thou assuredli that thou shalt go out with me
to battl thou and thi men

28:2 and david said to achish sure thou shalt know what thi servant
can do and achish said to david therefor will i make thee keeper of
mine head for ever

28:3 now samuel wa dead and all israel had lament him and buri
him in ramah even in hi own citi and saul had put away those that
had familiar spirit and the wizard out of the land

28:4 and the philistin gather themselv togeth and came and
pitch in shunem: and saul gather all israel togeth and they
pitch in gilboa

28:5 and when saul saw the host of the philistin he wa afraid and
hi heart greatli trembl

28:6 and when saul enquir of the lord the lord answer him not
neither by dream nor by urim nor by prophet

28:7 then said saul unto hi servant seek me a woman that hath a
familiar spirit that i may go to her and enquir of her and hi
servant said to him behold there is a woman that hath a familiar
spirit at endor

28:8 and saul disguis himself and put on other raiment and he
went and two men with him and they came to the woman by night: and
he said i pray thee divin unto me by the familiar spirit and bring
me him up whom i shall name unto thee

28:9 and the woman said unto him behold thou knowest what saul hath
done how he hath cut off those that have familiar spirit and the
wizard out of the land: wherefor then layest thou a snare for my
life to caus me to die? 28:10 and saul sware to her by the lord
say as the lord liveth there shall no punish happen to thee
for thi thing

28:11 then said the woman whom shall i bring up unto thee? and he
said bring me up samuel

28:12 and when the woman saw samuel she cri with a loud voice: and
the woman spake to saul say whi hast thou deceiv me? for thou
art saul
