28:13 and the king said unto her be not afraid: for what sawest thou?
and the woman said unto saul i saw god ascend out of the earth

28:14 and he said unto her what form is he of? and she said an old
man cometh up; and he is cover with a mantl and saul perceiv
that it wa samuel and he stoop with hi face to the ground and
bow himself

28:15 and samuel said to saul whi hast thou disquiet me to bring
me up? and saul answer i am sore distressed; for the philistin
make war against me and god is depart from me and answereth me no
more neither by prophet nor by dreams: therefor i have call
thee that thou mayest make known unto me what i shall do

28:16 then said samuel wherefor then dost thou ask of me see the
lord is depart from thee and is becom thine enemy? 28:17 and the
lord hath done to him as he spake by me: for the lord hath rent the
kingdom out of thine hand and given it to thi neighbour even to
david: 28:18 becaus thou obeyedst not the voic of the lord nor
executedst hi fierc wrath upon amalek therefor hath the lord done
thi thing unto thee thi day

28:19 moreov the lord will also deliv israel with thee into the
hand of the philistines: and to morrow shalt thou and thi son be with
me: the lord also shall deliv the host of israel into the hand of
the philistin

28:20 then saul fell straightway all along on the earth and wa sore
afraid becaus of the word of samuel: and there wa no strength in
him; for he had eaten no bread all the day nor all the night

28:21 and the woman came unto saul and saw that he wa sore troubl
and said unto him behold thine handmaid hath obey thi voic and i
have put my life in my hand and have hearken unto thi word which
thou spakest unto me

28:22 now therefor i pray thee hearken thou also unto the voic of
thine handmaid and let me set a morsel of bread befor thee; and eat
that thou mayest have strength when thou goest on thi way

28:23 but he refus and said i will not eat but hi servant
togeth with the woman compel him; and he hearken unto their
voic so he aros from the earth and sat upon the bed

28:24 and the woman had a fat calf in the house; and she hast and
kill it and took flour and knead it and did bake unleaven
bread thereof: 28:25 and she brought it befor saul and befor hi
servants; and they did eat then they rose up and went away that
night

29:1 now the philistin gather togeth all their armi to aphek:
and the israelit pitch by a fountain which is in jezreel

29:2 and the lord of the philistin pass on by hundr and by
thousands: but david and hi men pass on in the rereward with
achish

29:3 then said the princ of the philistin what do these hebrew
here? and achish said unto the princ of the philistin is not
thi david the servant of saul the king of israel which hath been
with me these day or these year and i have found no fault in him
sinc he fell unto me unto thi day? 29:4 and the princ of the
philistin were wroth with him; and the princ of the philistin
said unto him make thi fellow return that he may go again to hi
place which thou hast appoint him and let him not go down with us
to battl lest in the battl he be an adversari to us: for wherewith
should he reconcil himself unto hi master? should it not be with the
head of these men? 29:5 is not thi david of whom they sang one to
anoth in danc say saul slew hi thousand and david hi ten
thousands? 29:6 then achish call david and said unto him sure
as the lord liveth thou hast been upright and thi go out and thi
come in with me in the host is good in my sight: for i have not
found evil in thee sinc the day of thi come unto me unto thi day:
nevertheless the lord favour thee not

29:7 wherefor now return and go in peac that thou displeas not
the lord of the philistin

29:8 and david said unto achish but what have i done? and what hast
thou found in thi servant so long as i have been with thee unto thi
day that i may not go fight against the enemi of my lord the king?
29:9 and achish answer and said to david i know that thou art good
in my sight as an angel of god: notwithstand the princ of the
philistin have said he shall not go up with us to the battl

29:10 wherefor now rise up earli in the morn with thi master
servant that are come with thee: and as soon as ye be up earli in the
morn and have light depart

29:11 so david and hi men rose up earli to depart in the morn to
return into the land of the philistin and the philistin went up
to jezreel

30:1 and it came to pass when david and hi men were come to ziklag
on the third day that the amalekit had invad the south and
ziklag and smitten ziklag and burn it with fire; 30:2 and had
taken the women captiv that were therein: they slew not ani either
great or small but carri them away and went on their way

30:3 so david and hi men came to the citi and behold it wa burn
with fire; and their wive and their son and their daughter were
taken captiv

30:4 then david and the peopl that were with him lift up their
voic and wept until they had no more power to weep

30:5 and david two wive were taken captiv ahinoam the
jezreelitess and abigail the wife of nabal the carmelit

30:6 and david wa greatli distressed; for the peopl spake of stone
him becaus the soul of all the peopl wa griev everi man for hi
son and for hi daughters: but david encourag himself in the lord
hi god

30:7 and david said to abiathar the priest ahimelech son i pray
thee bring me hither the ephod and abiathar brought thither the
ephod to david

30:8 and david enquir at the lord say shall i pursu after thi
troop? shall i overtak them? and he answer him pursue: for thou
shalt sure overtak them and without fail recov all

30:9 so david went he and the six hundr men that were with him and
came to the brook besor where those that were left behind stay

30:10 but david pursu he and four hundr men: for two hundr
abod behind which were so faint that they could not go over the
brook besor

30:11 and they found an egyptian in the field and brought him to
david and gave him bread and he did eat; and they made him drink
water; 30:12 and they gave him a piec of a cake of fig and two
cluster of raisins: and when he had eaten hi spirit came again to
him: for he had eaten no bread nor drunk ani water three day and
three night

30:13 and david said unto him to whom belongest thou? and whenc art
thou? and he said i am a young man of egypt servant to an amalekite;
and my master left me becaus three day agon i fell sick

30:14 we made an invas upon the south of the cherethit and upon
the coast which belongeth to judah and upon the south of caleb; and
we burn ziklag with fire

30:15 and david said to him canst thou bring me down to thi company?
and he said swear unto me by god that thou wilt neither kill me nor
deliv me into the hand of my master and i will bring thee down to
thi compani

30:16 and when he had brought him down behold they were spread
abroad upon all the earth eat and drink and danc becaus
of all the great spoil that they had taken out of the land of the
philistin and out of the land of judah

30:17 and david smote them from the twilight even unto the even of
the next day: and there escap not a man of them save four hundr
young men which rode upon camel and fled

30:18 and david recov all that the amalekit had carri away:
and david rescu hi two wive

30:19 and there wa noth lack to them neither small nor great
neither son nor daughter neither spoil nor ani thing that they had
taken to them: david recov all

30:20 and david took all the flock and the herd which they drave
befor those other cattl and said thi is david spoil

30:21 and david came to the two hundr men which were so faint that
they could not follow david whom they had made also to abid at the
brook besor: and they went forth to meet david and to meet the peopl
that were with him: and when david came near to the peopl he salut
them

30:22 then answer all the wick men and men of belial of those
that went with david and said becaus they went not with us we will
not give them ought of the spoil that we have recov save to everi
man hi wife and hi children that they may lead them away and
depart

30:23 then said david ye shall not do so my brethren with that
which the lord hath given us who hath preserv us and deliv the
compani that came against us into our hand

30:24 for who will hearken unto you in thi matter? but as hi part is
that goeth down to the battl so shall hi part be that tarrieth by
the stuff: they shall part alik

30:25 and it wa so from that day forward that he made it a statut
and an ordin for israel unto thi day

30:26 and when david came to ziklag he sent of the spoil unto the
elder of judah even to hi friend say behold a present for you
of the spoil of the enemi of the lord; 30:27 to them which were in
bethel and to them which were in south ramoth and to them which were
in jattir 30:28 and to them which were in aroer and to them which
were in siphmoth and to them which were in eshtemoa 30:29 and to
them which were in rachal and to them which were in the citi of the
jerahmeelit and to them which were in the citi of the kenit
30:30 and to them which were in hormah and to them which were in
chorashan and to them which were in athach 30:31 and to them which
were in hebron and to all the place where david himself and hi men
were wont to haunt

31:1 now the philistin fought against israel: and the men of israel
fled from befor the philistin and fell down slain in mount gilboa

31:2 and the philistin follow hard upon saul and upon hi sons;
and the philistin slew jonathan and abinadab and melchishua
saul son

31:3 and the battl went sore against saul and the archer hit him;
and he wa sore wound of the archer

31:4 then said saul unto hi armourbear draw thi sword and thrust
me through therewith; lest these uncircumcis come and thrust me
through and abus me but hi armourbear would not; for he wa sore
afraid therefor saul took a sword and fell upon it

31:5 and when hi armourbear saw that saul wa dead he fell
likewis upon hi sword and die with him

31:6 so saul die and hi three son and hi armourbear and all
hi men that same day togeth

31:7 and when the men of israel that were on the other side of the
valley and they that were on the other side jordan saw that the men
of israel fled and that saul and hi son were dead they forsook the
citi and fled; and the philistin came and dwelt in them

31:8 and it came to pass on the morrow when the philistin came to
strip the slain that they found saul and hi three son fallen in
mount gilboa

31:9 and they cut off hi head and strip off hi armour and sent
into the land of the philistin round about to publish it in the
hous of their idol and among the peopl

31:10 and they put hi armour in the hous of ashtaroth: and they
fasten hi bodi to the wall of bethshan

31:11 and when the inhabit of jabeshgilead heard of that which the
philistin had done to saul; 31:12 all the valiant men aros and
went all night and took the bodi of saul and the bodi of hi son
from the wall of bethshan and came to jabesh and burnt them there

31:13 and they took their bone and buri them under a tree at
jabesh and fast seven day




the second book of samuel

otherwis called:

the second book of the king


1:1 now it came to pass after the death of saul when david wa
return from the slaughter of the amalekit and david had abod two
day in ziklag; 1:2 it came even to pass on the third day that
behold a man came out of the camp from saul with hi cloth rent
and earth upon hi head: and so it wa when he came to david that he
fell to the earth and did obeis

1:3 and david said unto him from whenc comest thou? and he said unto
him out of the camp of israel am i escap

1:4 and david said unto him how went the matter? i pray thee tell
me

and he answer that the peopl are fled from the battl and mani of
the peopl also are fallen and dead; and saul and jonathan hi son are
dead also

1:5 and david said unto the young man that told him how knowest thou
that saul and jonathan hi son be dead? 1:6 and the young man that
told him said as i happen by chanc upon mount gilboa behold saul
lean upon hi spear; and lo the chariot and horsemen follow
hard after him

1:7 and when he look behind him he saw me and call unto me and
i answer here am i

1:8 and he said unto me who art thou? and i answer him i am an
amalekit

1:9 he said unto me again stand i pray thee upon me and slay me:
for anguish is come upon me becaus my life is yet whole in me

1:10 so i stood upon him and slew him becaus i wa sure that he
could not live after that he wa fallen: and i took the crown that wa
upon hi head and the bracelet that wa on hi arm and have brought
them hither unto my lord

1:11 then david took hold on hi cloth and rent them; and likewis
all the men that were with him: 1:12 and they mourn and wept and
fast until even for saul and for jonathan hi son and for the
peopl of the lord and for the hous of israel; becaus they were
fallen by the sword

1:13 and david said unto the young man that told him whenc art thou?
and he answer i am the son of a stranger an amalekit

1:14 and david said unto him how wast thou not afraid to stretch
forth thine hand to destroy the lord anointed? 1:15 and david
call one of the young men and said go near and fall upon him and
he smote him that he die

1:16 and david said unto him thi blood be upon thi head; for thi
mouth hath testifi against thee say i have slain the lord
anoint

1:17 and david lament with thi lament over saul and over
jonathan hi son: 1:18 (also he bade them teach the children of judah
the use of the bow: behold it is written in the book of jasher)
1:19 the beauti of israel is slain upon thi high places: how are the
mighti fallen! 1:20 tell it not in gath publish it not in the
street of askelon; lest the daughter of the philistin rejoic
lest the daughter of the uncircumcis triumph

1:21 ye mountain of gilboa let there be no dew neither let there be
rain upon you nor field of offerings: for there the shield of the
mighti is vile cast away the shield of saul as though he had not
been anoint with oil

1:22 from the blood of the slain from the fat of the mighti the bow
of jonathan turn not back and the sword of saul return not empti

1:23 saul and jonathan were love and pleasant in their live and in
their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagl they
were stronger than lion

1:24 ye daughter of israel weep over saul who cloth you in
scarlet with other delight who put on ornament of gold upon your
apparel

1:25 how are the mighti fallen in the midst of the battle! o jonathan
thou wast slain in thine high place

1:26 i am distress for thee my brother jonathan: veri pleasant hast
thou been unto me: thi love to me wa wonder pass the love of
women

1:27 how are the mighti fallen and the weapon of war perished! 2:1
and it came to pass after thi that david enquir of the lord
say shall i go up into ani of the citi of judah? and the lord
said unto him go up and david said whither shall i go up? and he
said unto hebron

2:2 so david went up thither and hi two wive also ahinoam the
jezreelitess and abigail nabal wife the carmelit

2:3 and hi men that were with him did david bring up everi man with
hi household: and they dwelt in the citi of hebron

2:4 and the men of judah came and there they anoint david king over
the hous of judah and they told david say that the men of
jabeshgilead were they that buri saul

2:5 and david sent messeng unto the men of jabeshgilead and said
unto them bless be ye of the lord that ye have shew thi
kind unto your lord even unto saul and have buri him

2:6 and now the lord shew kind and truth unto you: and i also will
requit you thi kind becaus ye have done thi thing

2:7 therefor now let your hand be strengthen and be ye valiant:
for your master saul is dead and also the hous of judah have
anoint me king over them

2:8 but abner the son of ner captain of saul host took ishbosheth
the son of saul and brought him over to mahanaim; 2:9 and made him
king over gilead and over the ashurit and over jezreel and over
ephraim and over benjamin and over all israel

2:10 ishbosheth saul son wa forti year old when he began to reign
over israel and reign two year but the hous of judah follow
david

2:11 and the time that david wa king in hebron over the hous of
judah wa seven year and six month

2:12 and abner the son of ner and the servant of ishbosheth the son
of saul went out from mahanaim to gibeon

2:13 and joab the son of zeruiah and the servant of david went out
and met togeth by the pool of gibeon: and they sat down the one on
the one side of the pool and the other on the other side of the pool

2:14 and abner said to joab let the young men now aris and play
befor us and joab said let them aris

2:15 then there aros and went over by number twelv of benjamin
which pertain to ishbosheth the son of saul and twelv of the
servant of david

2:16 and they caught everi one hi fellow by the head and thrust hi
sword in hi fellow side; so they fell down together: wherefor that
place wa call helkathhazzurim which is in gibeon

2:17 and there wa a veri sore battl that day; and abner wa beaten
and the men of israel befor the servant of david

2:18 and there were three son of zeruiah there joab and abishai
and asahel: and asahel wa as light of foot as a wild roe

2:19 and asahel pursu after abner; and in go he turn not to the
right hand nor to the left from follow abner

2:20 then abner look behind him and said art thou asahel? and he
answer i am

2:21 and abner said to him turn thee asid to thi right hand or to
thi left and lay thee hold on one of the young men and take thee hi
armour

but asahel would not turn asid from follow of him

2:22 and abner said again to asahel turn thee asid from follow
me: wherefor should i smite thee to the ground? how then should i
hold up my face to joab thi brother? 2:23 howbeit he refus to turn
aside: wherefor abner with the hinder end of the spear smote him
under the fifth rib that the spear came out behind him; and he fell
down there and die in the same place: and it came to pass that as
mani as came to the place where asahel fell down and die stood still

2:24 joab also and abishai pursu after abner: and the sun went down
when they were come to the hill of ammah that lieth befor giah by
the way of the wilder of gibeon

2:25 and the children of benjamin gather themselv togeth after
abner and becam one troop and stood on the top of an hill

2:26 then abner call to joab and said shall the sword devour for
ever? knowest thou not that it will be bitter in the latter end?
how long shall it be then ere thou bid the peopl return from
follow their brethren? 2:27 and joab said as god liveth unless
thou hadst spoken sure then in the morn the peopl had gone up
everi one from follow hi brother

2:28 so joab blew a trumpet and all the peopl stood still and
pursu after israel no more neither fought they ani more

2:29 and abner and hi men walk all that night through the plain
and pass over jordan and went through all bithron and they came to
mahanaim

2:30 and joab return from follow abner: and when he had gather
all the peopl togeth there lack of david servant nineteen men
and asahel

2:31 but the servant of david had smitten of benjamin and of abner
men so that three hundr and threescor men die

2:32 and they took up asahel and buri him in the sepulchr of hi
father which wa in bethlehem and joab and hi men went all night
and they came to hebron at break of day

3:1 now there wa long war between the hous of saul and the hous of
david: but david wax stronger and stronger and the hous of saul
wax weaker and weaker

3:2 and unto david were son born in hebron: and hi firstborn wa
amnon of ahinoam the jezreelitess; 3:3 and hi second chileab of
abigail the wife of nabal the carmelite; and the third absalom the
son of maacah the daughter of talmai king of geshur; 3:4 and the
fourth adonijah the son of haggith; and the fifth shephatiah the son
of abital; 3:5 and the sixth ithream by eglah david wife these
were born to david in hebron

3:6 and it came to pass while there wa war between the hous of saul
and the hous of david that abner made himself strong for the hous
of saul

3:7 and saul had a concubin whose name wa rizpah the daughter of
aiah: and ishbosheth said to abner wherefor hast thou gone in unto
my father concubine? 3:8 then wa abner veri wroth for the word of
ishbosheth and said am i a dog head which against judah do shew
kind thi day unto the hous of saul thi father to hi brethren
and to hi friend and have not deliv thee into the hand of
david that thou chargest me to day with a fault concern thi
woman? 3:9 so do god to abner and more also except as the lord
hath sworn to david even so i do to him; 3:10 to translat the
kingdom from the hous of saul and to set up the throne of david over
israel and over judah from dan even to beersheba

3:11 and he could not answer abner a word again becaus he fear
him

3:12 and abner sent messeng to david on hi behalf say whose
is the land? say also make thi leagu with me and behold my
hand shall be with thee to bring about all israel unto thee

3:13 and he said well; i will make a leagu with thee: but one thing
i requir of thee that is thou shalt not see my face except thou
first bring michal saul daughter when thou comest to see my face

3:14 and david sent messeng to ishbosheth saul son say
deliv me my wife michal which i espous to me for an hundr
foreskin of the philistin

3:15 and ishbosheth sent and took her from her husband even from
phaltiel the son of laish

3:16 and her husband went with her along weep behind her to
bahurim

then said abner unto him go return and he return

3:17 and abner had commun with the elder of israel say ye
sought for david in time past to be king over you: 3:18 now then do
it: for the lord hath spoken of david say by the hand of my
servant david i will save my peopl israel out of the hand of the
philistin and out of the hand of all their enemi

3:19 and abner also spake in the ear of benjamin: and abner went also
to speak in the ear of david in hebron all that seem good to
israel and that seem good to the whole hous of benjamin

3:20 so abner came to david to hebron and twenti men with him and
david made abner and the men that were with him a feast

3:21 and abner said unto david i will aris and go and will gather
all israel unto my lord the king that they may make a leagu with
thee and that thou mayest reign over all that thine heart desireth
and david sent abner away; and he went in peac

3:22 and behold the servant of david and joab came from pursu a
troop and brought in a great spoil with them: but abner wa not with
david in hebron; for he had sent him away and he wa gone in peac

3:23 when joab and all the host that wa with him were come they told
joab say abner the son of ner came to the king and he hath sent
him away and he is gone in peac

3:24 then joab came to the king and said what hast thou done?
behold abner came unto thee; whi is it that thou hast sent him away
and he is quit gone? 3:25 thou knowest abner the son of ner that he
came to deceiv thee and to know thi go out and thi come in and
to know all that thou doest

3:26 and when joab wa come out from david he sent messeng after
abner which brought him again from the well of sirah: but david knew
it not

3:27 and when abner wa return to hebron joab took him asid in the
gate to speak with him quietli and smote him there under the fifth
rib that he die for the blood of asahel hi brother

3:28 and afterward when david heard it he said i and my kingdom are
guiltless befor the lord for ever from the blood of abner the son of
ner: 3:29 let it rest on the head of joab and on all hi father
house; and let there not fail from the hous of joab one that hath an
issu or that is a leper or that leaneth on a staff or that falleth
on the sword or that lacketh bread

3:30 so joab and abishai hi brother slew abner becaus he had slain
their brother asahel at gibeon in the battl

3:31 and david said to joab and to all the peopl that were with him
rend your cloth and gird you with sackcloth and mourn befor
abner and king david himself follow the bier

3:32 and they buri abner in hebron: and the king lift up hi
voic and wept at the grave of abner; and all the peopl wept

3:33 and the king lament over abner and said die abner as a fool
dieth? 3:34 thi hand were not bound nor thi feet put into fetters:
as a man falleth befor wick men so fellest thou and all the
peopl wept again over him

3:35 and when all the peopl came to caus david to eat meat while it
wa yet day david sware say so do god to me and more also if i
tast bread or ought els till the sun be down

3:36 and all the peopl took notic of it and it pleas them: as
whatsoev the king did pleas all the peopl

3:37 for all the peopl and all israel understood that day that it wa
not of the king to slay abner the son of ner

3:38 and the king said unto hi servant know ye not that there is a
princ and a great man fallen thi day in israel? 3:39 and i am thi
day weak though anoint king; and these men the son of zeruiah be
too hard for me: the lord shall reward the doer of evil accord to
hi wicked

4:1 and when saul son heard that abner wa dead in hebron hi hand
were feebl and all the israelit were troubl

4:2 and saul son had two men that were captain of bands: the name
of the one wa baanah and the name of the other rechab the son of
rimmon a beerothit of the children of benjamin: (for beeroth also
wa reckon to benjamin

4:3 and the beerothit fled to gittaim and were sojourn there
until thi day) 4:4 and jonathan saul son had a son that wa
lame of hi feet he wa five year old when the tide came of saul
and jonathan out of jezreel and hi nurs took him up and fled: and
it came to pass as she made hast to flee that he fell and becam
lame and hi name wa mephibosheth

4:5 and the son of rimmon the beerothit rechab and baanah went
and came about the heat of the day to the hous of ishbosheth who lay
on a bed at noon

4:6 and they came thither into the midst of the hous as though they
would have fetch wheat; and they smote him under the fifth rib: and
rechab and baanah hi brother escap

4:7 for when they came into the hous he lay on hi bed in hi
bedchamb and they smote him and slew him and behead him and
took hi head and gat them away through the plain all night

4:8 and they brought the head of ishbosheth unto david to hebron and
said to the king behold the head of ishbosheth the son of saul thine
enemi which sought thi life; and the lord hath aveng my lord the
king thi day of saul and of hi seed

4:9 and david answer rechab and baanah hi brother the son of
rimmon the beerothit and said unto them as the lord liveth who
hath redeem my soul out of all advers 4:10 when one told me
say behold saul is dead think to have brought good tide i
took hold of him and slew him in ziklag who thought that i would
have given him a reward for hi tidings: 4:11 how much more when
wick men have slain a righteou person in hi own hous upon hi
bed? shall i not therefor now requir hi blood of your hand and
take you away from the earth? 4:12 and david command hi young men
and they slew them and cut off their hand and their feet and hang
them up over the pool in hebron but they took the head of ishbosheth
and buri it in the sepulchr of abner in hebron

5:1 then came all the tribe of israel to david unto hebron and
spake say behold we are thi bone and thi flesh

5:2 also in time past when saul wa king over us thou wast he that
leddest out and broughtest in israel: and the lord said to thee thou
shalt feed my peopl israel and thou shalt be a captain over israel

5:3 so all the elder of israel came to the king to hebron; and king
david made a leagu with them in hebron befor the lord: and they
anoint david king over israel

5:4 david wa thirti year old when he began to reign and he reign
forti year

5:5 in hebron he reign over judah seven year and six months: and in
jerusalem he reign thirti and three year over all israel and judah

5:6 and the king and hi men went to jerusalem unto the jebusit the
inhabit of the land: which spake unto david say except thou
take away the blind and the lame thou shalt not come in hither:
think david cannot come in hither

5:7 nevertheless david took the strong hold of zion: the same is the
citi of david

5:8 and david said on that day whosoev getteth up to the gutter
and smiteth the jebusit and the lame and the blind that are hate
of david soul he shall be chief and captain wherefor they said
the blind and the lame shall not come into the hous

5:9 so david dwelt in the fort and call it the citi of david and
david built round about from millo and inward

5:10 and david went on and grew great and the lord god of host wa
with him

5:11 and hiram king of tyre sent messeng to david and cedar tree
and carpent and masons: and they built david an hous

5:12 and david perceiv that the lord had establish him king over
israel and that he had exalt hi kingdom for hi peopl israel
sake

5:13 and david took him more concubin and wive out of jerusalem
after he wa come from hebron: and there were yet son and daughter
born to david

5:14 and these be the name of those that were born unto him in
jerusalem; shammuah and shobab and nathan and solomon 5:15 ibhar
also and elishua and nepheg and japhia 5:16 and elishama and
eliada and eliphalet

5:17 but when the philistin heard that they had anoint david king
over israel all the philistin came up to seek david; and david
heard of it and went down to the hold

5:18 the philistin also came and spread themselv in the valley of
rephaim

5:19 and david enquir of the lord say shall i go up to the
philistines? wilt thou deliv them into mine hand? and the lord said
unto david go up: for i will doubtless deliv the philistin into
thine hand

5:20 and david came to baalperazim and david smote them there and
said the lord hath broken forth upon mine enemi befor me as the
breach of water therefor he call the name of that place
baalperazim

5:21 and there they left their imag and david and hi men burn
them

5:22 and the philistin came up yet again and spread themselv in
the valley of rephaim

5:23 and when david enquir of the lord he said thou shalt not go
up; but fetch a compass behind them and come upon them over against
the mulberri tree

5:24 and let it be when thou hearest the sound of a go in the top
of the mulberri tree that then thou shalt bestir thyself: for then
shall the lord go out befor thee to smite the host of the
philistin

5:25 and david did so as the lord had command him; and smote the
philistin from geba until thou come to gazer

6:1 again david gather togeth all the chosen men of israel
thirti thousand

6:2 and david aros and went with all the peopl that were with him
from baal of judah to bring up from thenc the ark of god whose
name is call by the name of the lord of host that dwelleth between
the cherubim

6:3 and they set the ark of god upon a new cart and brought it out of
the hous of abinadab that wa in gibeah: and uzzah and ahio the son
of abinadab drave the new cart

6:4 and they brought it out of the hous of abinadab which wa at
gibeah accompani the ark of god: and ahio went befor the ark

6:5 and david and all the hous of israel play befor the lord on
all manner of instrument made of fir wood even on harp and on
psalteri and on timbrel and on cornet and on cymbal

6:6 and when they came to nachon threshingfloor uzzah put forth hi
hand to the ark of god and took hold of it; for the oxen shook it

6:7 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against uzzah; and god smote
him there for hi error; and there he die by the ark of god

6:8 and david wa displeas becaus the lord had made a breach upon
uzzah: and he call the name of the place perezuzzah to thi day

6:9 and david wa afraid of the lord that day and said how shall the
ark of the lord come to me? 6:10 so david would not remov the ark of
the lord unto him into the citi of david: but david carri it asid
into the hous of obededom the gittit

6:11 and the ark of the lord continu in the hous of obededom the
gittit three months: and the lord bless obededom and all hi
household

6:12 and it wa told king david say the lord hath bless the
hous of obededom and all that pertaineth unto him becaus of the
ark of god so david went and brought up the ark of god from the hous
of obededom into the citi of david with glad

6:13 and it wa so that when they that bare the ark of the lord had
gone six pace he sacrif oxen and fatl

6:14 and david danc befor the lord with all hi might; and david
wa gird with a linen ephod

6:15 so david and all the hous of israel brought up the ark of the
lord with shout and with the sound of the trumpet

6:16 and as the ark of the lord came into the citi of david michal
saul daughter look through a window and saw king david leap
and danc befor the lord; and she despis him in her heart

6:17 and they brought in the ark of the lord and set it in hi place
in the midst of the tabernacl that david had pitch for it: and
david offer burnt offer and peac offer befor the lord

6:18 and as soon as david had made an end of offer burnt offer
and peac offer he bless the peopl in the name of the lord of
host

6:19 and he dealt among all the peopl even among the whole multitud
of israel as well to the women as men to everi one a cake of bread
and a good piec of flesh and a flagon of wine so all the peopl
depart everi one to hi hous

6:20 then david return to bless hi household and michal the
daughter of saul came out to meet david and said how gloriou wa
the king of israel to day who uncov himself to day in the eye of
the handmaid of hi servant as one of the vain fellow shamelessli
uncovereth himself! 6:21 and david said unto michal it wa befor
the lord which chose me befor thi father and befor all hi hous
to appoint me ruler over the peopl of the lord over israel:
therefor will i play befor the lord

6:22 and i will yet be more vile than thu and will be base in mine
own sight: and of the maidserv which thou hast spoken of of them
shall i be had in honour

6:23 therefor michal the daughter of saul had no child unto the day
of her death

7:1 and it came to pass when the king sat in hi hous and the lord
had given him rest round about from all hi enemies; 7:2 that the king
said unto nathan the prophet see now i dwell in an hous of cedar
but the ark of god dwelleth within curtain

7:3 and nathan said to the king go do all that is in thine heart;
for the lord is with thee

7:4 and it came to pass that night that the word of the lord came
unto nathan say 7:5 go and tell my servant david thu saith the
lord shalt thou build me an hous for me to dwell in? 7:6 wherea i
have not dwelt in ani hous sinc the time that i brought up the
children of israel out of egypt even to thi day but have walk in
a tent and in a tabernacl

7:7 in all the place wherein i have walk with all the children of
israel spake i a word with ani of the tribe of israel whom i
command to feed my peopl israel say whi build ye not me an
hous of cedar? 7:8 now therefor so shalt thou say unto my servant
david thu saith the lord of host i took thee from the sheepcot
from follow the sheep to be ruler over my peopl over israel: 7:9
and i wa with thee whithersoev thou wentest and have cut off all
thine enemi out of thi sight and have made thee a great name like
unto the name of the great men that are in the earth

7:10 moreov i will appoint a place for my peopl israel and will
plant them that they may dwell in a place of their own and move no
more; neither shall the children of wicked afflict them ani more
as beforetim 7:11 and as sinc the time that i command judg to
be over my peopl israel and have caus thee to rest from all thine
enemi also the lord telleth thee that he will make thee an hous

7:12 and when thi day be fulfil and thou shalt sleep with thi
father i will set up thi seed after thee which shall proceed out of
thi bowel and i will establish hi kingdom

7:13 he shall build an hous for my name and i will stablish the
throne of hi kingdom for ever

7:14 i will be hi father and he shall be my son if he commit
iniqu i will chasten him with the rod of men and with the stripe
of the children of men: 7:15 but my merci shall not depart away from
him as i took it from saul whom i put away befor thee

7:16 and thine hous and thi kingdom shall be establish for ever
befor thee: thi throne shall be establish for ever

7:17 accord to all these word and accord to all thi vision
so did nathan speak unto david

7:18 then went king david in and sat befor the lord and he said
who am i o lord god? and what is my hous that thou hast brought me
hitherto? 7:19 and thi wa yet a small thing in thi sight o lord
god; but thou hast spoken also of thi servant hous for a great
while to come and is thi the manner of man o lord god? 7:20 and
what can david say more unto thee? for thou lord god knowest thi
servant

7:21 for thi word sake and accord to thine own heart hast thou
done all these great thing to make thi servant know them

7:22 wherefor thou art great o lord god: for there is none like
thee neither is there ani god besid thee accord to all that we
have heard with our ear

7:23 and what one nation in the earth is like thi peopl even like
israel whom god went to redeem for a peopl to himself and to make
him a name and to do for you great thing and terribl for thi land
befor thi peopl which thou redeemedst to thee from egypt from the
nation and their gods? 7:24 for thou hast confirm to thyself thi
peopl israel to be a peopl unto thee for ever: and thou lord art
becom their god

7:25 and now o lord god the word that thou hast spoken concern
thi servant and concern hi hous establish it for ever and do
as thou hast said

7:26 and let thi name be magnifi for ever say the lord of host
is the god over israel: and let the hous of thi servant david be
establish befor thee

7:27 for thou o lord of host god of israel hast reveal to thi
servant say i will build thee an house: therefor hath thi
servant found in hi heart to pray thi prayer unto thee

7:28 and now o lord god thou art that god and thi word be true
and thou hast promis thi good unto thi servant: 7:29 therefor
now let it pleas thee to bless the hous of thi servant that it may
continu for ever befor thee: for thou o lord god hast spoken it:
and with thi bless let the hous of thi servant be bless for
ever

8:1 and after thi it came to pass that david smote the philistin
and subdu them: and david took methegammah out of the hand of the
philistin

8:2 and he smote moab and measur them with a line cast them
down to the ground; even with two line measur he to put to death
and with one full line to keep aliv and so the moabit becam
david servant and brought gift

8:3 david smote also hadadez the son of rehob king of zobah as he
went to recov hi border at the river euphrat

8:4 and david took from him a thousand chariot and seven hundr
horsemen and twenti thousand footmen: and david hough all the
chariot hors but reserv of them for an hundr chariot

8:5 and when the syrian of damascu came to succour hadadez king of
zobah david slew of the syrian two and twenti thousand men

8:6 then david put garrison in syria of damascus: and the syrian
becam servant to david and brought gift and the lord preserv
david whithersoev he went

8:7 and david took the shield of gold that were on the servant of
hadadez and brought them to jerusalem

8:8 and from betah and from berothai citi of hadadez king david
took exceed much brass

8:9 when toi king of hamath heard that david had smitten all the host
of hadadez 8:10 then toi sent joram hi son unto king david to
salut him and to bless him becaus he had fought against hadadez
and smitten him: for hadadez had war with toi and joram brought
with him vessel of silver and vessel of gold and vessel of brass:
8:11 which also king david did dedic unto the lord with the silver
and gold that he had dedic of all nation which he subdued; 8:12
of syria and of moab and of the children of ammon and of the
philistin and of amalek and of the spoil of hadadez son of
rehob king of zobah

8:13 and david gat him a name when he return from smite of the
syrian in the valley of salt be eighteen thousand men

8:14 and he put garrison in edom; throughout all edom put he
garrison and all they of edom becam david servant and the lord
preserv david whithersoev he went

8:15 and david reign over all israel; and david execut judgment
and justic unto all hi peopl

8:16 and joab the son of zeruiah wa over the host; and jehoshaphat
the son of ahilud wa recorder; 8:17 and zadok the son of ahitub and
ahimelech the son of abiathar were the priests; and seraiah wa the
scribe; 8:18 and benaiah the son of jehoiada wa over both the
cherethit and the pelethites; and david son were chief ruler

9:1 and david said is there yet ani that is left of the hous of
saul that i may shew him kind for jonathan sake? 9:2 and there
wa of the hous of saul a servant whose name wa ziba and when they
had call him unto david the king said unto him art thou ziba? and
he said thi servant is he

9:3 and the king said is there not yet ani of the hous of saul that
i may shew the kind of god unto him? and ziba said unto the king
jonathan hath yet a son which is lame on hi feet

9:4 and the king said unto him where is he? and ziba said unto the
king behold he is in the hous of machir the son of ammiel in
lodebar

9:5 then king david sent and fetch him out of the hous of machir
the son of ammiel from lodebar

9:6 now when mephibosheth the son of jonathan the son of saul wa
come unto david he fell on hi face and did rever and david
said mephibosheth and he answer behold thi servant! 9:7 and
david said unto him fear not: for i will sure shew thee kind
for jonathan thi father sake and will restor thee all the land of
saul thi father; and thou shalt eat bread at my tabl continu

9:8 and he bow himself and said what is thi servant that thou
shouldest look upon such a dead dog as i am? 9:9 then the king call
to ziba saul servant and said unto him i have given unto thi
master son all that pertain to saul and to all hi hous

9:10 thou therefor and thi son and thi servant shall till the
land for him and thou shalt bring in the fruit that thi master
son may have food to eat: but mephibosheth thi master son shall eat
bread alway at my tabl now ziba had fifteen son and twenti
servant

9:11 then said ziba unto the king accord to all that my lord the
king hath command hi servant so shall thi servant do as for
mephibosheth said the king he shall eat at my tabl as one of the
king son

9:12 and mephibosheth had a young son whose name wa micha and all
that dwelt in the hous of ziba were servant unto mephibosheth

9:13 so mephibosheth dwelt in jerusalem: for he did eat continu at
the king table; and wa lame on both hi feet

10:1 and it came to pass after thi that the king of the children of
ammon die and hanun hi son reign in hi stead

10:2 then said david i will shew kind unto hanun the son of
nahash as hi father shew kind unto me and david sent to
comfort him by the hand of hi servant for hi father and david
servant came into the land of the children of ammon

10:3 and the princ of the children of ammon said unto hanun their
lord thinkest thou that david doth honour thi father that he hath
sent comfort unto thee? hath not david rather sent hi servant
unto thee to search the citi and to spi it out and to overthrow it?
10:4 wherefor hanun took david servant and shave off the one
half of their beard and cut off their garment in the middl even
to their buttock and sent them away

10:5 when they told it unto david he sent to meet them becaus the
men were greatli ashamed: and the king said tarri at jericho until
your beard be grown and then return

10:6 and when the children of ammon saw that they stank befor david
the children of ammon sent and hire the syrian of bethrehob and the
syrian of zoba twenti thousand footmen and of king maacah a
thousand men and of ishtob twelv thousand men

10:7 and when david heard of it he sent joab and all the host of the
mighti men

10:8 and the children of ammon came out and put the battl in array
at the enter in of the gate: and the syrian of zoba and of rehob
and ishtob and maacah were by themselv in the field

10:9 when joab saw that the front of the battl wa against him befor
and behind he chose of all the choic men of israel and put them in
array against the syrians: 10:10 and the rest of the peopl he
deliv into the hand of abishai hi brother that he might put them
in array against the children of ammon

10:11 and he said if the syrian be too strong for me then thou
shalt help me: but if the children of ammon be too strong for thee
then i will come and help thee

10:12 be of good courag and let us play the men for our peopl and
for the citi of our god: and the lord do that which seemeth him
good

10:13 and joab drew nigh and the peopl that were with him unto the
battl against the syrians: and they fled befor him

10:14 and when the children of ammon saw that the syrian were fled
then fled they also befor abishai and enter into the citi so joab
return from the children of ammon and came to jerusalem

10:15 and when the syrian saw that they were smitten befor israel
they gather themselv togeth

10:16 and hadarez sent and brought out the syrian that were beyond
the river: and they came to helam; and shobach the captain of the host
of hadarez went befor them

10:17 and when it wa told david he gather all israel togeth and
pass over jordan and came to helam and the syrian set themselv
in array against david and fought with him

10:18 and the syrian fled befor israel; and david slew the men of
seven hundr chariot of the syrian and forti thousand horsemen
and smote shobach the captain of their host who die there

10:19 and when all the king that were servant to hadarez saw that
they were smitten befor israel they made peac with israel and
serv them so the syrian fear to help the children of ammon ani
more

11:1 and it came to pass after the year wa expir at the time when
king go forth to battl that david sent joab and hi servant with
him and all israel; and they destroy the children of ammon and
besieg rabbah but david tarri still at jerusalem

11:2 and it came to pass in an eveningtid that david aros from off
hi bed and walk upon the roof of the king house: and from the
roof he saw a woman wash herself; and the woman wa veri beauti
to look upon

11:3 and david sent and enquir after the woman and one said is not
thi bathsheba the daughter of eliam the wife of uriah the hittite?
11:4 and david sent messeng and took her; and she came in unto
him and he lay with her; for she wa purifi from her uncleanness:
and she return unto her hous

11:5 and the woman conceiv and sent and told david and said i am
with child

11:6 and david sent to joab say send me uriah the hittit and
joab sent uriah to david

11:7 and when uriah wa come unto him david demand of him how joab
did and how the peopl did and how the war prosper

11:8 and david said to uriah go down to thi hous and wash thi feet
and uriah depart out of the king hous and there follow him a
mess of meat from the king

11:9 but uriah slept at the door of the king hous with all the
servant of hi lord and went not down to hi hous

11:10 and when they had told david say uriah went not down unto
hi hous david said unto uriah camest thou not from thi journey?
whi then didst thou not go down unto thine house? 11:11 and uriah
said unto david the ark and israel and judah abid in tents; and
my lord joab and the servant of my lord are encamp in the open
fields; shall i then go into mine hous to eat and to drink and to
lie with my wife? as thou livest and as thi soul liveth i will not
do thi thing

11:12 and david said to uriah tarri here to day also and to morrow i
will let thee depart so uriah abod in jerusalem that day and the
morrow

11:13 and when david had call him he did eat and drink befor him;
and he made him drunk: and at even he went out to lie on hi bed with
the servant of hi lord but went not down to hi hous

11:14 and it came to pass in the morn that david wrote a letter to
joab and sent it by the hand of uriah

11:15 and he wrote in the letter say set ye uriah in the
forefront of the hottest battl and retir ye from him that he may
be smitten and die

11:16 and it came to pass when joab observ the citi that he
assign uriah unto a place where he knew that valiant men were

11:17 and the men of the citi went out and fought with joab: and
there fell some of the peopl of the servant of david; and uriah the
hittit die also

11:18 then joab sent and told david all the thing concern the war;
11:19 and charg the messeng say when thou hast made an end of
tell the matter of the war unto the king 11:20 and if so be that
the king wrath aris and he say unto thee wherefor approach ye
so nigh unto the citi when ye did fight? knew ye not that they would
shoot from the wall? 11:21 who smote abimelech the son of
jerubbesheth? did not a woman cast a piec of a millston upon him
from the wall that he die in thebez? whi went ye nigh the wall? then
say thou thi servant uriah the hittit is dead also

11:22 so the messeng went and came and shew david all that joab
had sent him for

11:23 and the messeng said unto david sure the men prevail
against us and came out unto us into the field and we were upon them
even unto the enter of the gate

11:24 and the shooter shot from off the wall upon thi servants; and
some of the king servant be dead and thi servant uriah the hittit
is dead also

11:25 then david said unto the messeng thu shalt thou say unto
joab let not thi thing displeas thee for the sword devoureth one
as well as another: make thi battl more strong against the citi and
overthrow it: and encourag thou him

11:26 and when the wife of uriah heard that uriah her husband wa
dead she mourn for her husband

11:27 and when the mourn wa past david sent and fetch her to
hi hous and she becam hi wife and bare him a son but the thing
that david had done displeas the lord

12:1 and the lord sent nathan unto david and he came unto him and
said unto him there were two men in one city; the one rich and the
other poor

12:2 the rich man had exceed mani flock and herds: 12:3 but the
poor man had noth save one littl ewe lamb which he had bought
and nourish up: and it grew up togeth with him and with hi
children; it did eat of hi own meat and drank of hi own cup and
lay in hi bosom and wa unto him as a daughter

12:4 and there came a travel unto the rich man and he spare to
take of hi own flock and of hi own herd to dress for the wayfar
man that wa come unto him; but took the poor man lamb and dress
it for the man that wa come to him

12:5 and david anger wa greatli kindl against the man; and he
said to nathan as the lord liveth the man that hath done thi thing
shall sure die: 12:6 and he shall restor the lamb fourfold becaus
he did thi thing and becaus he had no piti

12:7 and nathan said to david thou art the man thu saith the lord
god of israel i anoint thee king over israel and i deliv thee
out of the hand of saul; 12:8 and i gave thee thi master hous and
thi master wive into thi bosom and gave thee the hous of israel
and of judah; and if that had been too littl i would moreov have
given unto thee such and such thing

12:9 wherefor hast thou despis the command of the lord to do
evil in hi sight? thou hast kill uriah the hittit with the sword
and hast taken hi wife to be thi wife and hast slain him with the
sword of the children of ammon

12:10 now therefor the sword shall never depart from thine house;
becaus thou hast despis me and hast taken the wife of uriah the
hittit to be thi wife

12:11 thu saith the lord behold i will rais up evil against thee
out of thine own hous and i will take thi wive befor thine eye
and give them unto thi neighbour and he shall lie with thi wive in
the sight of thi sun

12:12 for thou didst it secretly: but i will do thi thing befor all
israel and befor the sun

12:13 and david said unto nathan i have sin against the lord and
nathan said unto david the lord also hath put away thi sin; thou
shalt not die

12:14 howbeit becaus by thi deed thou hast given great occas to
the enemi of the lord to blasphem the child also that is born unto
thee shall sure die

12:15 and nathan depart unto hi hous and the lord struck the
child that uriah wife bare unto david and it wa veri sick

12:16 david therefor besought god for the child; and david fast
and went in and lay all night upon the earth

12:17 and the elder of hi hous aros and went to him to rais him
up from the earth: but he would not neither did he eat bread with
them

12:18 and it came to pass on the seventh day that the child die and
the servant of david fear to tell him that the child wa dead: for
they said behold while the child wa yet aliv we spake unto him
and he would not hearken unto our voice: how will he then vex himself
if we tell him that the child is dead? 12:19 but when david saw that
hi servant whisper david perceiv that the child wa dead:
therefor david said unto hi servant is the child dead? and they
said he is dead

12:20 then david aros from the earth and wash and anoint
himself and chang hi apparel and came into the hous of the lord
and worshipped: then he came to hi own house; and when he requir
they set bread befor him and he did eat

12:21 then said hi servant unto him what thing is thi that thou
hast done? thou didst fast and weep for the child while it wa alive;
but when the child wa dead thou didst rise and eat bread

12:22 and he said while the child wa yet aliv i fast and wept:
for i said who can tell whether god will be graciou to me that the
child may live? 12:23 but now he is dead wherefor should i fast?
can i bring him back again? i shall go to him but he shall not return
to me

12:24 and david comfort bathsheba hi wife and went in unto her
and lay with her: and she bare a son and he call hi name solomon:
and the lord love him

12:25 and he sent by the hand of nathan the prophet; and he call hi
name jedidiah becaus of the lord

12:26 and joab fought against rabbah of the children of ammon and
took the royal citi

12:27 and joab sent messeng to david and said i have fought
against rabbah and have taken the citi of water

12:28 now therefor gather the rest of the peopl togeth and encamp
against the citi and take it: lest i take the citi and it be call
after my name

12:29 and david gather all the peopl togeth and went to rabbah
and fought against it and took it

12:30 and he took their king crown from off hi head the weight
whereof wa a talent of gold with the preciou stones: and it wa set
on david head and he brought forth the spoil of the citi in great
abund

12:31 and he brought forth the peopl that were therein and put them
under saw and under harrow of iron and under axe of iron and
made them pass through the brick-kiln: and thu did he unto all the
citi of the children of ammon so david and all the peopl return
unto jerusalem

13:1 and it came to pass after thi that absalom the son of david had
a fair sister whose name wa tamar; and amnon the son of david love
her

13:2 and amnon wa so vex that he fell sick for hi sister tamar;
for she wa a virgin; and amnon thought it hard for him to do anyth
to her

13:3 but amnon had a friend whose name wa jonadab the son of
shimeah david brother: and jonadab wa a veri subtil man

13:4 and he said unto him whi art thou be the king son lean
from day to day? wilt thou not tell me? and amnon said unto him i
love tamar my brother absalom sister

13:5 and jonadab said unto him lay thee down on thi bed and make
thyself sick: and when thi father cometh to see thee say unto him i
pray thee let my sister tamar come and give me meat and dress the
meat in my sight that i may see it and eat it at her hand

13:6 so amnon lay down and made himself sick: and when the king wa
come to see him amnon said unto the king i pray thee let tamar my
sister come and make me a coupl of cake in my sight that i may eat
at her hand

13:7 then david sent home to tamar say go now to thi brother
amnon hous and dress him meat

13:8 so tamar went to her brother amnon house; and he wa laid down
and she took flour and knead it and made cake in hi sight and
did bake the cake

13:9 and she took a pan and pour them out befor him; but he
refus to eat and amnon said have out all men from me and they
went out everi man from him

13:10 and amnon said unto tamar bring the meat into the chamber that
i may eat of thine hand and tamar took the cake which she had made
and brought them into the chamber to amnon her brother

13:11 and when she had brought them unto him to eat he took hold of
her and said unto her come lie with me my sister

13:12 and she answer him nay my brother do not forc me; for no
such thing ought to be done in israel: do not thou thi folli

13:13 and i whither shall i caus my shame to go? and as for thee
thou shalt be as one of the fool in israel now therefor i pray
thee speak unto the king; for he will not withhold me from thee

13:14 howbeit he would not hearken unto her voice: but be stronger
than she forc her and lay with her

13:15 then amnon hate her exceedingly; so that the hatr wherewith
he hate her wa greater than the love wherewith he had love her and
amnon said unto her aris be gone

13:16 and she said unto him there is no cause: thi evil in send
me away is greater than the other that thou didst unto me but he
would not hearken unto her

13:17 then he call hi servant that minist unto him and said
put now thi woman out from me and bolt the door after her

13:18 and she had a garment of diver colour upon her: for with such
robe were the king daughter that were virgin apparel then hi
servant brought her out and bolt the door after her

13:19 and tamar put ash on her head and rent her garment of diver
colour that wa on her and laid her hand on her head and went on
cri

13:20 and absalom her brother said unto her hath amnon thi brother
been with thee? but hold now thi peac my sister: he is thi brother;
regard not thi thing so tamar remain desol in her brother
absalom hous

13:21 but when king david heard of all these thing he wa veri
wroth

13:22 and absalom spake unto hi brother amnon neither good nor bad:
for absalom hate amnon becaus he had forc hi sister tamar

13:23 and it came to pass after two full year that absalom had
sheepshear in baalhazor which is besid ephraim: and absalom
invit all the king son

13:24 and absalom came to the king and said behold now thi servant
hath sheepshearers; let the king i beseech thee and hi servant go
with thi servant

13:25 and the king said to absalom nay my son let us not all now
go lest we be chargeabl unto thee and he press him: howbeit he
would not go but bless him

13:26 then said absalom if not i pray thee let my brother amnon go
with us and the king said unto him whi should he go with thee?
13:27 but absalom press him that he let amnon and all the king
son go with him

13:28 now absalom had command hi servant say mark ye now when
amnon heart is merri with wine and when i say unto you smite
amnon; then kill him fear not: have not i command you? be
courag and be valiant

13:29 and the servant of absalom did unto amnon as absalom had
command

then all the king son aros and everi man gat him up upon hi
mule and fled

13:30 and it came to pass while they were in the way that tide
came to david say absalom hath slain all the king son and
there is not one of them left

13:31 then the king aros and tare hi garment and lay on the
earth; and all hi servant stood by with their cloth rent

13:32 and jonadab the son of shimeah david brother answer and
said let not my lord suppos that they have slain all the young men
the king sons; for amnon onli is dead: for by the appoint of
absalom thi hath been determin from the day that he forc hi
sister tamar

13:33 now therefor let not my lord the king take the thing to hi
heart to think that all the king son are dead: for amnon onli is
dead

13:34 but absalom fled and the young man that kept the watch lift
up hi eye and look and behold there came much peopl by the
way of the hill side behind him

13:35 and jonadab said unto the king behold the king son come: as
thi servant said so it is

13:36 and it came to pass as soon as he had made an end of speak
that behold the king son came and lift up their voic and
wept: and the king also and all hi servant wept veri sore

13:37 but absalom fled and went to talmai the son of ammihud king
of geshur and david mourn for hi son everi day

13:38 so absalom fled and went to geshur and wa there three year

13:39 and the soul of king david long to go forth unto absalom: for
he wa comfort concern amnon see he wa dead

14:1 now joab the son of zeruiah perceiv that the king heart wa
toward absalom

14:2 and joab sent to tekoah and fetch thenc a wise woman and
said unto her i pray thee feign thyself to be a mourner and put on
now mourn apparel and anoint not thyself with oil but be as a
woman that had a long time mourn for the dead: 14:3 and come to the
king and speak on thi manner unto him so joab put the word in her
mouth

14:4 and when the woman of tekoah spake to the king she fell on her
face to the ground and did obeis and said help o king

14:5 and the king said unto her what aileth thee? and she answer i
am inde a widow woman and mine husband is dead

14:6 and thi handmaid had two son and they two strove togeth in
the field and there wa none to part them but the one smote the
other and slew him

14:7 and behold the whole famili is risen against thine handmaid
and they said deliv him that smote hi brother that we may kill
him for the life of hi brother whom he slew; and we will destroy the
heir also: and so they shall quench my coal which is left and shall
not leav to my husband neither name nor remaind upon the earth

14:8 and the king said unto the woman go to thine hous and i will
give charg concern thee

14:9 and the woman of tekoah said unto the king my lord o king the
iniqu be on me and on my father house: and the king and hi
throne be guiltless

14:10 and the king said whoever saith ought unto thee bring him to
me and he shall not touch thee ani more

14:11 then said she i pray thee let the king rememb the lord thi
god that thou wouldest not suffer the reveng of blood to destroy
ani more lest they destroy my son and he said as the lord liveth
there shall not one hair of thi son fall to the earth

14:12 then the woman said let thine handmaid i pray thee speak one
word unto my lord the king and he said say on

14:13 and the woman said wherefor then hast thou thought such a
thing against the peopl of god? for the king doth speak thi thing as
one which is faulti in that the king doth not fetch home again hi
banish

14:14 for we must need die and are as water spilt on the ground
which cannot be gather up again; neither doth god respect ani
person: yet doth he devis mean that hi banish be not expel
from him

14:15 now therefor that i am come to speak of thi thing unto my lord
the king it is becaus the peopl have made me afraid: and thi
handmaid said i will now speak unto the king; it may be that the king
will perform the request of hi handmaid

14:16 for the king will hear to deliv hi handmaid out of the hand
of the man that would destroy me and my son togeth out of the
inherit of god

14:17 then thine handmaid said the word of my lord the king shall now
be comfortable: for as an angel of god so is my lord the king to
discern good and bad: therefor the lord thi god will be with thee

14:18 then the king answer and said unto the woman hide not from
me i pray thee the thing that i shall ask thee and the woman said
let my lord the king now speak

14:19 and the king said is not the hand of joab with thee in all
this? and the woman answer and said as thi soul liveth my lord
the king none can turn to the right hand or to the left from ought
that my lord the king hath spoken: for thi servant joab he bade me
and he put all these word in the mouth of thine handmaid: 14:20 to
fetch about thi form of speech hath thi servant joab done thi thing:
and my lord is wise accord to the wisdom of an angel of god to
know all thing that are in the earth

14:21 and the king said unto joab behold now i have done thi thing:
go therefor bring the young man absalom again

14:22 and joab fell to the ground on hi face and bow himself and
thank the king: and joab said to day thi servant knoweth that i
have found grace in thi sight my lord o king in that the king hath
fulfil the request of hi servant

14:23 so joab aros and went to geshur and brought absalom to
jerusalem

14:24 and the king said let him turn to hi own hous and let him
not see my face so absalom return to hi own hous and saw not the
king face

14:25 but in all israel there wa none to be so much prais as
absalom for hi beauty: from the sole of hi foot even to the crown of
hi head there wa no blemish in him

14:26 and when he poll hi head (for it wa at everi year end
that he poll it: becaus the hair wa heavi on him therefor he
poll it:) he weigh the hair of hi head at two hundr shekel
after the king weight

14:27 and unto absalom there were born three son and one daughter
whose name wa tamar: she wa a woman of a fair counten

14:28 so absalom dwelt two full year in jerusalem and saw not the
king face

14:29 therefor absalom sent for joab to have sent him to the king;
but he would not come to him: and when he sent again the second time
he would not come

14:30 therefor he said unto hi servant see joab field is near
mine and he hath barley there; go and set it on fire and absalom
servant set the field on fire

14:31 then joab aros and came to absalom unto hi hous and said
unto him wherefor have thi servant set my field on fire? 14:32 and
absalom answer joab behold i sent unto thee say come hither
that i may send thee to the king to say wherefor am i come from
geshur? it had been good for me to have been there still: now
therefor let me see the king face; and if there be ani iniqu in
me let him kill me

14:33 so joab came to the king and told him: and when he had call
for absalom he came to the king and bow himself on hi face to the
ground befor the king: and the king kiss absalom

15:1 and it came to pass after thi that absalom prepar him
chariot and hors and fifti men to run befor him

15:2 and absalom rose up earli and stood besid the way of the gate:
and it wa so that when ani man that had a controversi came to the
king for judgment then absalom call unto him and said of what
citi art thou? and he said thi servant is of one of the tribe of
israel

15:3 and absalom said unto him see thi matter are good and right;
but there is no man deput of the king to hear thee

15:4 absalom said moreov oh that i were made judg in the land
that everi man which hath ani suit or caus might come unto me and i
would do him justice! 15:5 and it wa so that when ani man came nigh
to him to do him obeis he put forth hi hand and took him and
kiss him

15:6 and on thi manner did absalom to all israel that came to the
king for judgment: so absalom stole the heart of the men of israel

15:7 and it came to pass after forti year that absalom said unto the
king i pray thee let me go and pay my vow which i have vow unto
the lord in hebron

15:8 for thi servant vow a vow while i abod at geshur in syria
say if the lord shall bring me again inde to jerusalem then i
will serv the lord

15:9 and the king said unto him go in peac so he aros and went to
hebron

15:10 but absalom sent spi throughout all the tribe of israel
say as soon as ye hear the sound of the trumpet then ye shall
say absalom reigneth in hebron

15:11 and with absalom went two hundr men out of jerusalem that
were called; and they went in their simplic and they knew not ani
thing

15:12 and absalom sent for ahithophel the gilonit david
counsellor from hi citi even from giloh while he offer
sacrific and the conspiraci wa strong; for the peopl increas
continu with absalom

15:13 and there came a messeng to david say the heart of the
men of israel are after absalom

15:14 and david said unto all hi servant that were with him at
jerusalem aris and let us flee; for we shall not els escap from
absalom: make speed to depart lest he overtak us suddenli and bring
evil upon us and smite the citi with the edg of the sword

15:15 and the king servant said unto the king behold thi servant
are readi to do whatsoev my lord the king shall appoint

15:16 and the king went forth and all hi household after him and
the king left ten women which were concubin to keep the hous

15:17 and the king went forth and all the peopl after him and
tarri in a place that wa far off

15:18 and all hi servant pass on besid him; and all the
cherethit and all the pelethit and all the gittit six hundr
men which came after him from gath pass on befor the king

15:19 then said the king to ittai the gittit wherefor goest thou
also with us? return to thi place and abid with the king: for thou
art a stranger and also an exil

15:20 wherea thou camest but yesterday should i thi day make thee
go up and down with us? see i go whither i may return thou and
take back thi brethren: merci and truth be with thee

15:21 and ittai answer the king and said as the lord liveth and
as my lord the king liveth sure in what place my lord the king
shall be whether in death or life even there also will thi servant
be

15:22 and david said to ittai go and pass over and ittai the gittit
pass over and all hi men and all the littl one that were with
him

15:23 and all the countri wept with a loud voic and all the peopl
pass over: the king also himself pass over the brook kidron and
all the peopl pass over toward the way of the wilder

15:24 and lo zadok also and all the levit were with him bear
the ark of the coven of god: and they set down the ark of god; and
abiathar went up until all the peopl had done pass out of the
citi

15:25 and the king said unto zadok carri back the ark of god into the
city: if i shall find favour in the eye of the lord he will bring me
again and shew me both it and hi habitation: 15:26 but if he thu
say i have no delight in thee; behold here am i let him do to me as
seemeth good unto him

15:27 the king said also unto zadok the priest art not thou a seer?
return into the citi in peac and your two son with you ahimaaz thi
son and jonathan the son of abiathar

15:28 see i will tarri in the plain of the wilder until there
come word from you to certifi me

15:29 zadok therefor and abiathar carri the ark of god again to
jerusalem: and they tarri there

15:30 and david went up by the ascent of mount olivet and wept as he
went up and had hi head cover and he went barefoot: and all the
peopl that wa with him cover everi man hi head and they went up
weep as they went up

15:31 and one told david say ahithophel is among the conspir
with absalom and david said o lord i pray thee turn the counsel of
ahithophel into foolish

15:32 and it came to pass that when david wa come to the top of the
mount where he worship god behold hushai the archit came to
meet him with hi coat rent and earth upon hi head: 15:33 unto whom
david said if thou passest on with me then thou shalt be a burden
unto me: 15:34 but if thou return to the citi and say unto absalom i
will be thi servant o king; as i have been thi father servant
hitherto so will i now also be thi servant: then mayest thou for me
defeat the counsel of ahithophel

15:35 and hast thou not there with thee zadok and abiathar the
priests? therefor it shall be that what thing soever thou shalt
hear out of the king hous thou shalt tell it to zadok and abiathar
the priest

15:36 behold they have there with them their two son ahimaaz
zadok son and jonathan abiathar son; and by them ye shall send
unto me everi thing that ye can hear

15:37 so hushai david friend came into the citi and absalom came
into jerusalem

16:1 and when david wa a littl past the top of the hill behold
ziba the servant of mephibosheth met him with a coupl of ass
saddl and upon them two hundr loav of bread and an hundr
bunch of raisin and an hundr of summer fruit and a bottl of
wine

16:2 and the king said unto ziba what meanest thou by these? and ziba
said the ass be for the king household to ride on; and the bread
and summer fruit for the young men to eat; and the wine that such as
be faint in the wilder may drink

16:3 and the king said and where is thi master son? and ziba said
unto the king behold he abideth at jerusalem: for he said to day
shall the hous of israel restor me the kingdom of my father

16:4 then said the king to ziba behold thine are all that pertain
unto mephibosheth and ziba said i humbl beseech thee that i may
find grace in thi sight my lord o king

16:5 and when king david came to bahurim behold thenc came out a
man of the famili of the hous of saul whose name wa shimei the son
of gera: he came forth and curs still as he came

16:6 and he cast stone at david and at all the servant of king
david: and all the peopl and all the mighti men were on hi right
hand and on hi left

16:7 and thu said shimei when he curs come out come out thou
bloodi man and thou man of belial: 16:8 the lord hath return upon
thee all the blood of the hous of saul in whose stead thou hast
reigned; and the lord hath deliv the kingdom into the hand of
absalom thi son: and behold thou art taken in thi mischief becaus
thou art a bloodi man

16:9 then said abishai the son of zeruiah unto the king whi should
thi dead dog curs my lord the king? let me go over i pray thee and
take off hi head

16:10 and the king said what have i to do with you ye son of
zeruiah? so let him curs becaus the lord hath said unto him curs
david who shall then say wherefor hast thou done so? 16:11 and
david said to abishai and to all hi servant behold my son which
came forth of my bowel seeketh my life: how much more now may thi
benjamit do it? let him alon and let him curse; for the lord hath
bidden him

16:12 it may be that the lord will look on mine afflict and that
the lord will requit me good for hi curs thi day

16:13 and as david and hi men went by the way shimei went along on
the hill side over against him and curs as he went and threw
stone at him and cast dust

16:14 and the king and all the peopl that were with him came weari
and refresh themselv there

16:15 and absalom and all the peopl the men of israel came to
jerusalem and ahithophel with him

16:16 and it came to pass when hushai the archit david friend
wa come unto absalom that hushai said unto absalom god save the
king god save the king

16:17 and absalom said to hushai is thi thi kind to thi friend?
whi wentest thou not with thi friend? 16:18 and hushai said unto
absalom nay; but whom the lord and thi peopl and all the men of
israel choos hi will i be and with him will i abid

16:19 and again whom should i serve? should i not serv in the
presenc of hi son? as i have serv in thi father presenc so
will i be in thi presenc

16:20 then said absalom to ahithophel give counsel among you what we
shall do

16:21 and ahithophel said unto absalom go in unto thi father
concubin which he hath left to keep the house; and all israel shall
hear that thou art abhor of thi father: then shall the hand of all
that are with thee be strong

16:22 so they spread absalom a tent upon the top of the house; and
absalom went in unto hi father concubin in the sight of all
israel

16:23 and the counsel of ahithophel which he counsel in those
day wa as if a man had enquir at the oracl of god: so wa all
the counsel of ahithophel both with david and with absalom

17:1 moreov ahithophel said unto absalom let me now choos out
twelv thousand men and i will aris and pursu after david thi
night: 17:2 and i will come upon him while he is weari and weak
hand and will make him afraid: and all the peopl that are with him
shall flee; and i will smite the king only: 17:3 and i will bring back
all the peopl unto thee: the man whom thou seekest is as if all
returned: so all the peopl shall be in peac

17:4 and the say pleas absalom well and all the elder of
israel

17:5 then said absalom call now hushai the archit also and let us
hear likewis what he saith

17:6 and when hushai wa come to absalom absalom spake unto him
say ahithophel hath spoken after thi manner: shall we do after
hi saying? if not; speak thou

17:7 and hushai said unto absalom the counsel that ahithophel hath
given is not good at thi time

17:8 for said hushai thou knowest thi father and hi men that they
be mighti men and they be chafe in their mind as a bear rob of
her whelp in the field: and thi father is a man of war and will not
lodg with the peopl

17:9 behold he is hid now in some pit or in some other place: and it
will come to pass when some of them be overthrown at the first that
whosoev heareth it will say there is a slaughter among the peopl
that follow absalom

17:10 and he also that is valiant whose heart is as the heart of a
lion shall utterli melt: for all israel knoweth that thi father is a
mighti man and they which be with him are valiant men

17:11 therefor i counsel that all israel be gener gather unto
thee from dan even to beersheba as the sand that is by the sea for
multitude; and that thou go to battl in thine own person

17:12 so shall we come upon him in some place where he shall be found
and we will light upon him as the dew falleth on the ground: and of
him and of all the men that are with him there shall not be left so
much as one

17:13 moreov if he be gotten into a citi then shall all israel
bring rope to that citi and we will draw it into the river until
there be not one small stone found there

17:14 and absalom and all the men of israel said the counsel of
hushai the archit is better than the counsel of ahithophel for the
lord had appoint to defeat the good counsel of ahithophel to the
intent that the lord might bring evil upon absalom

17:15 then said hushai unto zadok and to abiathar the priest thu
and thu did ahithophel counsel absalom and the elder of israel; and
thu and thu have i counsel

17:16 now therefor send quickli and tell david say lodg not
thi night in the plain of the wilder but speedili pass over;
lest the king be swallow up and all the peopl that are with him

17:17 now jonathan and ahimaaz stay by enrogel; for they might not
be seen to come into the city: and a wench went and told them; and
they went and told king david

17:18 nevertheless a lad saw them and told absalom: but they went
both of them away quickli and came to a man hous in bahurim which
had a well in hi court; whither they went down

17:19 and the woman took and spread a cover over the well mouth
and spread ground corn thereon; and the thing wa not known

17:20 and when absalom servant came to the woman to the hous they
said where is ahimaaz and jonathan? and the woman said unto them
they be gone over the brook of water and when they had sought and
could not find them they return to jerusalem

17:21 and it came to pass after they were depart that they came up
out of the well and went and told king david and said unto david
aris and pass quickli over the water: for thu hath ahithophel
counsel against you

17:22 then david aros and all the peopl that were with him and
they pass over jordan: by the morn light there lack not one of
them that wa not gone over jordan

17:23 and when ahithophel saw that hi counsel wa not follow he
saddl hi ass and aros and gat him home to hi hous to hi
citi and put hi household in order and hang himself and die
and wa buri in the sepulchr of hi father

17:24 then david came to mahanaim and absalom pass over jordan he
and all the men of israel with him

17:25 and absalom made amasa captain of the host instead of joab:
which amasa wa a man son whose name wa ithra an israelit that
went in to abigail the daughter of nahash sister to zeruiah joab
mother

17:26 so israel and absalom pitch in the land of gilead

17:27 and it came to pass when david wa come to mahanaim that shobi
