the son of nahash of rabbah of the children of ammon and machir the
son of ammiel of lodebar and barzillai the gileadit of rogelim
17:28 brought bed and bason and earthen vessel and wheat and
barley and flour and parch corn and bean and lentil and
parch puls 17:29 and honey and butter and sheep and chees of
kine for david and for the peopl that were with him to eat: for
they said the peopl is hungri and weari and thirsti in the
wilder

18:1 and david number the peopl that were with him and set
captain of thousand and captain of hundr over them

18:2 and david sent forth a third part of the peopl under the hand of
joab and a third part under the hand of abishai the son of zeruiah
joab brother and a third part under the hand of ittai the gittit
and the king said unto the peopl i will sure go forth with you
myself also

18:3 but the peopl answer thou shalt not go forth: for if we flee
away they will not care for us; neither if half of us die will they
care for us: but now thou art worth ten thousand of us: therefor now
it is better that thou succour us out of the citi

18:4 and the king said unto them what seemeth you best i will do and
the king stood by the gate side and all the peopl came out by
hundr and by thousand

18:5 and the king command joab and abishai and ittai say deal
gentli for my sake with the young man even with absalom and all the
peopl heard when the king gave all the captain charg concern
absalom

18:6 so the peopl went out into the field against israel: and the
battl wa in the wood of ephraim; 18:7 where the peopl of israel
were slain befor the servant of david and there wa there a great
slaughter that day of twenti thousand men

18:8 for the battl wa there scatter over the face of all the
country: and the wood devour more peopl that day than the sword
devour

18:9 and absalom met the servant of david and absalom rode upon a
mule and the mule went under the thick bough of a great oak and hi
head caught hold of the oak and he wa taken up between the heaven
and the earth; and the mule that wa under him went away

18:10 and a certain man saw it and told joab and said behold i saw
absalom hang in an oak

18:11 and joab said unto the man that told him and behold thou
sawest him and whi didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and
i would have given thee ten shekel of silver and a girdl

18:12 and the man said unto joab though i should receiv a thousand
shekel of silver in mine hand yet would i not put forth mine hand
against the king son: for in our hear the king charg thee and
abishai and ittai say bewar that none touch the young man
absalom

18:13 otherwis i should have wrought falsehood against mine own life:
for there is no matter hid from the king and thou thyself wouldest
have set thyself against me

18:14 then said joab i may not tarri thu with thee and he took
three dart in hi hand and thrust them through the heart of absalom
while he wa yet aliv in the midst of the oak

18:15 and ten young men that bare joab armour compass about and
smote absalom and slew him

18:16 and joab blew the trumpet and the peopl return from pursu
after israel: for joab held back the peopl

18:17 and they took absalom and cast him into a great pit in the
wood and laid a veri great heap of stone upon him: and all israel
fled everi one to hi tent

18:18 now absalom in hi lifetim had taken and rear up for himself
a pillar which is in the king dale: for he said i have no son to
keep my name in remembrance: and he call the pillar after hi own
name: and it is call unto thi day absalom place

18:19 then said ahimaaz the son of zadok let me now run and bear the
king tide how that the lord hath aveng him of hi enemi

18:20 and joab said unto him thou shalt not bear tide thi day
but thou shalt bear tide anoth day: but thi day thou shalt bear
no tide becaus the king son is dead

18:21 then said joab to cushi go tell the king what thou hast seen
and cushi bow himself unto joab and ran

18:22 then said ahimaaz the son of zadok yet again to joab but
howsoev let me i pray thee also run after cushi and joab said
wherefor wilt thou run my son see that thou hast no tide
ready? 18:23 but howsoev said he let me run and he said unto
him run then ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain and overran cushi

18:24 and david sat between the two gates: and the watchman went up to
the roof over the gate unto the wall and lift up hi eye and
look and behold a man run alon

18:25 and the watchman cri and told the king and the king said if
he be alon there is tide in hi mouth and he came apac and
drew near

18:26 and the watchman saw anoth man running: and the watchman
call unto the porter and said behold anoth man run alon
and the king said he also bringeth tide

18:27 and the watchman said me thinketh the run of the foremost
is like the run of ahimaaz the son of zadok and the king said he
is a good man and cometh with good tide

18:28 and ahimaaz call and said unto the king all is well and he
fell down to the earth upon hi face befor the king and said
bless be the lord thi god which hath deliv up the men that
lift up their hand against my lord the king

18:29 and the king said is the young man absalom safe? and ahimaaz
answer when joab sent the king servant and me thi servant i saw
a great tumult but i knew not what it wa

18:30 and the king said unto him turn asid and stand here and he
turn asid and stood still

18:31 and behold cushi came; and cushi said tide my lord the
king: for the lord hath aveng thee thi day of all them that rose up
against thee

18:32 and the king said unto cushi is the young man absalom safe? and
cushi answer the enemi of my lord the king and all that rise
against thee to do thee hurt be as that young man is

18:33 and the king wa much move and went up to the chamber over the
gate and wept: and as he went thu he said o my son absalom my
son my son absalom! would god i had die for thee o absalom my son
my son! 19:1 and it wa told joab behold the king weepeth and
mourneth for absalom

19:2 and the victori that day wa turn into mourn unto all the
people: for the peopl heard say that day how the king wa griev for
hi son

19:3 and the peopl gat them by stealth that day into the citi as
peopl be asham steal away when they flee in battl

19:4 but the king cover hi face and the king cri with a loud
voic o my son absalom o absalom my son my son! 19:5 and joab
came into the hous to the king and said thou hast shame thi day
the face of all thi servant which thi day have save thi life and
the live of thi son and of thi daughter and the live of thi
wive and the live of thi concubines; 19:6 in that thou lovest thine
enemi and hatest thi friend for thou hast declar thi day that
thou regardest neither princ nor servants: for thi day i perceiv
that if absalom had live and all we had die thi day then it had
pleas thee well

19:7 now therefor aris go forth and speak comfort unto thi
servants: for i swear by the lord if thou go not forth there will
not tarri one with thee thi night: and that will be wors unto thee
than all the evil that befel thee from thi youth until now

19:8 then the king aros and sat in the gate and they told unto all
the peopl say behold the king doth sit in the gate and all the
peopl came befor the king: for israel had fled everi man to hi
tent

19:9 and all the peopl were at strife throughout all the tribe of
israel say the king save us out of the hand of our enemi and
he deliv us out of the hand of the philistines; and now he is fled
out of the land for absalom

19:10 and absalom whom we anoint over us is dead in battl now
therefor whi speak ye not a word of bring the king back? 19:11
and king david sent to zadok and to abiathar the priest say
speak unto the elder of judah say whi are ye the last to bring
the king back to hi house? see the speech of all israel is come to
the king even to hi hous

19:12 ye are my brethren ye are my bone and my flesh: wherefor then
are ye the last to bring back the king? 19:13 and say ye to amasa
art thou not of my bone and of my flesh? god do so to me and more
also if thou be not captain of the host befor me continu in the
room of joab

19:14 and he bow the heart of all the men of judah even as the
heart of one man; so that they sent thi word unto the king return
thou and all thi servant

19:15 so the king return and came to jordan and judah came to
gilgal to go to meet the king to conduct the king over jordan

19:16 and shimei the son of gera a benjamit which wa of bahurim
hast and came down with the men of judah to meet king david

19:17 and there were a thousand men of benjamin with him and ziba the
servant of the hous of saul and hi fifteen son and hi twenti
servant with him; and they went over jordan befor the king

19:18 and there went over a ferri boat to carri over the king
household and to do what he thought good and shimei the son of gera
fell down befor the king as he wa come over jordan; 19:19 and said
unto the king let not my lord imput iniqu unto me neither do
thou rememb that which thi servant did pervers the day that my
lord the king went out of jerusalem that the king should take it to
hi heart

19:20 for thi servant doth know that i have sinned: therefor behold
i am come the first thi day of all the hous of joseph to go down to
meet my lord the king

19:21 but abishai the son of zeruiah answer and said shall not
shimei be put to death for thi becaus he curs the lord
anointed? 19:22 and david said what have i to do with you ye son
of zeruiah that ye should thi day be adversari unto me? shall
there ani man be put to death thi day in israel? for do not i know
that i am thi day king over israel? 19:23 therefor the king said
unto shimei thou shalt not die and the king sware unto him

19:24 and mephibosheth the son of saul came down to meet the king and
had neither dress hi feet nor trim hi beard nor wash hi
cloth from the day the king depart until the day he came again in
peac

19:25 and it came to pass when he wa come to jerusalem to meet the
king that the king said unto him wherefor wentest not thou with me
mephibosheth? 19:26 and he answer my lord o king my servant
deceiv me: for thi servant said i will saddl me an ass that i may
ride thereon and go to the king; becaus thi servant is lame

19:27 and he hath slander thi servant unto my lord the king; but my
lord the king is as an angel of god: do therefor what is good in
thine eye

19:28 for all of my father hous were but dead men befor my lord
the king: yet didst thou set thi servant among them that did eat at
thine own tabl what right therefor have i yet to cri ani more unto
the king? 19:29 and the king said unto him whi speakest thou ani
more of thi matters? i have said thou and ziba divid the land

19:30 and mephibosheth said unto the king yea let him take all
forasmuch as my lord the king is come again in peac unto hi own
hous

19:31 and barzillai the gileadit came down from rogelim and went
over jordan with the king to conduct him over jordan

19:32 now barzillai wa a veri age man even fourscor year old: and
he had provid the king of susten while he lay at mahanaim; for
he wa a veri great man

19:33 and the king said unto barzillai come thou over with me and i
will feed thee with me in jerusalem

19:34 and barzillai said unto the king how long have i to live that
i should go up with the king unto jerusalem? 19:35 i am thi day
fourscor year old: and can i discern between good and evil? can thi
servant tast what i eat or what i drink? can i hear ani more the
voic of sing men and sing women? wherefor then should thi
servant be yet a burden unto my lord the king? 19:36 thi servant will
go a littl way over jordan with the king: and whi should the king
recompens it me with such a reward? 19:37 let thi servant i pray
thee turn back again that i may die in mine own citi and be buri
by the grave of my father and of my mother but behold thi servant
chimham; let him go over with my lord the king; and do to him what
shall seem good unto thee

19:38 and the king answer chimham shall go over with me and i will
do to him that which shall seem good unto thee: and whatsoev thou
shalt requir of me that will i do for thee

19:39 and all the peopl went over jordan and when the king wa come
over the king kiss barzillai and bless him; and he return unto
hi own place

19:40 then the king went on to gilgal and chimham went on with him:
and all the peopl of judah conduct the king and also half the
peopl of israel

19:41 and behold all the men of israel came to the king and said
unto the king whi have our brethren the men of judah stolen thee
away and have brought the king and hi household and all david
men with him over jordan? 19:42 and all the men of judah answer
the men of israel becaus the king is near of kin to us: wherefor
then be ye angri for thi matter? have we eaten at all of the king
cost? or hath he given us ani gift? 19:43 and the men of israel
answer the men of judah and said we have ten part in the king
and we have also more right in david than ye: whi then did ye despis
us that our advic should not be first had in bring back our king?
and the word of the men of judah were fiercer than the word of the
men of israel

20:1 and there happen to be there a man of belial whose name wa
sheba the son of bichri a benjamite: and he blew a trumpet and
said we have no part in david neither have we inherit in the son
of jesse: everi man to hi tent o israel

20:2 so everi man of israel went up from after david and follow
sheba the son of bichri: but the men of judah clave unto their king
from jordan even to jerusalem

20:3 and david came to hi hous at jerusalem; and the king took the
ten women hi concubin whom he had left to keep the hous and put
them in ward and fed them but went not in unto them so they were
shut up unto the day of their death live in widowhood

20:4 then said the king to amasa assembl me the men of judah within
three day and be thou here present

20:5 so amasa went to assembl the men of judah: but he tarri longer
than the set time which he had appoint him

20:6 and david said to abishai now shall sheba the son of bichri do
us more harm than did absalom: take thou thi lord servant and
pursu after him lest he get him fenc citi and escap us

20:7 and there went out after him joab men and the cherethit and
the pelethit and all the mighti men: and they went out of
jerusalem to pursu after sheba the son of bichri

20:8 when they were at the great stone which is in gibeon amasa went
befor them and joab garment that he had put on wa gird unto
him and upon it a girdl with a sword fasten upon hi loin in the
sheath thereof; and as he went forth it fell out

20:9 and joab said to amasa art thou in health my brother? and joab
took amasa by the beard with the right hand to kiss him

20:10 but amasa took no heed to the sword that wa in joab hand: so
he smote him therewith in the fifth rib and shed out hi bowel to
the ground and struck him not again; and he die so joab and abishai
hi brother pursu after sheba the son of bichri

20:11 and one of joab men stood by him and said he that favoureth
joab and he that is for david let him go after joab

20:12 and amasa wallow in blood in the midst of the highway and
when the man saw that all the peopl stood still he remov amasa out
of the highway into the field and cast a cloth upon him when he saw
that everi one that came by him stood still

20:13 when he wa remov out of the highway all the peopl went on
after joab to pursu after sheba the son of bichri

20:14 and he went through all the tribe of israel unto abel and to
bethmaachah and all the berites: and they were gather togeth and
went also after him

20:15 and they came and besieg him in abel of bethmaachah and they
cast up a bank against the citi and it stood in the trench: and all
the peopl that were with joab batter the wall to throw it down

20:16 then cri a wise woman out of the citi hear hear; say i pray
you unto joab come near hither that i may speak with thee

20:17 and when he wa come near unto her the woman said art thou
joab? and he answer i am he then she said unto him hear the
word of thine handmaid and he answer i do hear

20:18 then she spake say they were wont to speak in old time
say they shall sure ask counsel at abel: and so they end the
matter

20:19 i am one of them that are peaceabl and faith in israel: thou
seekest to destroy a citi and a mother in israel: whi wilt thou
swallow up the inherit of the lord? 20:20 and joab answer and
said far be it far be it from me that i should swallow up or
destroy

20:21 the matter is not so: but a man of mount ephraim sheba the son
of bichri by name hath lift up hi hand against the king even
against david: deliv him onli and i will depart from the citi and
the woman said unto joab behold hi head shall be thrown to thee
over the wall

20:22 then the woman went unto all the peopl in her wisdom and they
cut off the head of sheba the son of bichri and cast it out to joab
and he blew a trumpet and they retir from the citi everi man to
hi tent and joab return to jerusalem unto the king

20:23 now joab wa over all the host of israel: and benaiah the son of
jehoiada wa over the cherethit and over the pelethites: 20:24 and
adoram wa over the tribute: and jehoshaphat the son of ahilud wa
recorder: 20:25 and sheva wa scribe: and zadok and abiathar were the
priests: 20:26 and ira also the jairit wa a chief ruler about david

21:1 then there wa a famin in the day of david three year year
after year; and david enquir of the lord and the lord answer it
is for saul and for hi bloodi hous becaus he slew the gibeonit

21:2 and the king call the gibeonit and said unto them; (now the
gibeonit were not of the children of israel but of the remnant of
the amorites; and the children of israel had sworn unto them: and saul
sought to slay them in hi zeal to the children of israel and judah)
21:3 wherefor david said unto the gibeonit what shall i do for
you? and wherewith shall i make the aton that ye may bless the
inherit of the lord? 21:4 and the gibeonit said unto him we
will have no silver nor gold of saul nor of hi house; neither for us
shalt thou kill ani man in israel and he said what ye shall say
that will i do for you

21:5 and they answer the king the man that consum us and that
devis against us that we should be destroy from remain in ani
of the coast of israel 21:6 let seven men of hi son be deliv
unto us and we will hang them up unto the lord in gibeah of saul
whom the lord did choos and the king said i will give them

21:7 but the king spare mephibosheth the son of jonathan the son of
saul becaus of the lord oath that wa between them between david
and jonathan the son of saul

21:8 but the king took the two son of rizpah the daughter of aiah
whom she bare unto saul armoni and mephibosheth; and the five son of
michal the daughter of saul whom she brought up for adriel the son of
barzillai the meholathite: 21:9 and he deliv them into the hand
of the gibeonit and they hang them in the hill befor the lord:
and they fell all seven togeth and were put to death in the day of
harvest in the first day in the begin of barley harvest

21:10 and rizpah the daughter of aiah took sackcloth and spread it
for her upon the rock from the begin of harvest until water
drop upon them out of heaven and suffer neither the bird of the
air to rest on them by day nor the beast of the field by night

21:11 and it wa told david what rizpah the daughter of aiah the
concubin of saul had done

21:12 and david went and took the bone of saul and the bone of
jonathan hi son from the men of jabeshgilead which had stolen them
from the street of bethshan where the philistin had hang them
when the philistin had slain saul in gilboa: 21:13 and he brought up
from thenc the bone of saul and the bone of jonathan hi son; and
they gather the bone of them that were hang

21:14 and the bone of saul and jonathan hi son buri they in the
countri of benjamin in zelah in the sepulchr of kish hi father: and
they perform all that the king command and after that god wa
intreat for the land

21:15 moreov the philistin had yet war again with israel; and
david went down and hi servant with him and fought against the
philistines: and david wax faint

21:16 and ishbibenob which wa of the son of the giant the weight
of whose spear weigh three hundr shekel of brass in weight he
be gird with a new sword thought to have slain david

21:17 but abishai the son of zeruiah succour him and smote the
philistin and kill him then the men of david sware unto him
say thou shalt go no more out with us to battl that thou quench
not the light of israel

21:18 and it came to pass after thi that there wa again a battl
with the philistin at gob: then sibbechai the hushathit slew saph
which wa of the son of the giant

21:19 and there wa again a battl in gob with the philistin where
elhanan the son of jaareoregim a bethlehemit slew the brother of
goliath the gittit the staff of whose spear wa like a weaver
beam

21:20 and there wa yet a battl in gath where wa a man of great
statur that had on everi hand six finger and on everi foot six
toe four and twenti in number; and he also wa born to the giant

21:21 and when he defi israel jonathan the son of shimeah the
brother of david slew him

21:22 these four were born to the giant in gath and fell by the hand
of david and by the hand of hi servant

22:1 and david spake unto the lord the word of thi song in the day
that the lord had deliv him out of the hand of all hi enemi
and out of the hand of saul: 22:2 and he said the lord is my rock
and my fortress and my deliverer; 22:3 the god of my rock; in him
will i trust: he is my shield and the horn of my salvat my high
tower and my refug my saviour; thou savest me from violenc

22:4 i will call on the lord who is worthi to be praised: so shall i
be save from mine enemi

22:5 when the wave of death compass me the flood of ungodli men
made me afraid; 22:6 the sorrow of hell compass me about; the
snare of death prevent me; 22:7 in my distress i call upon the
lord and cri to my god: and he did hear my voic out of hi templ
and my cri did enter into hi ear

22:8 then the earth shook and trembled; the foundat of heaven
move and shook becaus he wa wroth

22:9 there went up a smoke out of hi nostril and fire out of hi
mouth devoured: coal were kindl by it

22:10 he bow the heaven also and came down; and dark wa under
hi feet

22:11 and he rode upon a cherub and did fly: and he wa seen upon the
wing of the wind

22:12 and he made dark pavilion round about him dark water and
thick cloud of the sky

22:13 through the bright befor him were coal of fire kindl

22:14 the lord thunder from heaven and the most high utter hi
voic

22:15 and he sent out arrow and scatter them; lightn and
discomfit them

22:16 and the channel of the sea appear the foundat of the
world were discov at the rebuk of the lord at the blast of
the breath of hi nostril

22:17 he sent from abov he took me; he drew me out of mani waters;
22:18 he deliv me from my strong enemi and from them that hate
me: for they were too strong for me

22:19 they prevent me in the day of my calamity: but the lord wa my
stay

22:20 he brought me forth also into a larg place: he deliv me
becaus he delight in me

22:21 the lord reward me accord to my righteousness: accord to
the clean of my hand hath he recompens me

22:22 for i have kept the way of the lord and have not wickedli
depart from my god

22:23 for all hi judgment were befor me: and as for hi statut i
did not depart from them

22:24 i wa also upright befor him and have kept myself from mine
iniqu

22:25 therefor the lord hath recompens me accord to my
righteousness; accord to my clean in hi eye sight

22:26 with the merci thou wilt shew thyself merci and with the
upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright

22:27 with the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward
thou wilt shew thyself unsavouri

22:28 and the afflict peopl thou wilt save: but thine eye are upon
the haughti that thou mayest bring them down

22:29 for thou art my lamp o lord: and the lord will lighten my
dark

22:30 for by thee i have run through a troop: by my god have i leap
over a wall

22:31 as for god hi way is perfect; the word of the lord is tried:
he is a buckler to all them that trust in him

22:32 for who is god save the lord? and who is a rock save our god?
22:33 god is my strength and power: and he maketh my way perfect

22:34 he maketh my feet like hind feet: and setteth me upon my high
place

22:35 he teacheth my hand to war; so that a bow of steel is broken by
mine arm

22:36 thou hast also given me the shield of thi salvation: and thi
gentl hath made me great

22:37 thou hast enlarg my step under me; so that my feet did not
slip

22:38 i have pursu mine enemi and destroy them; and turn not
again until i had consum them

22:39 and i have consum them and wound them that they could not
arise: yea they are fallen under my feet

22:40 for thou hast gird me with strength to battle: them that rose
up against me hast thou subdu under me

22:41 thou hast also given me the neck of mine enemi that i might
destroy them that hate me

22:42 they look but there wa none to save; even unto the lord but
he answer them not

22:43 then did i beat them as small as the dust of the earth i did
stamp them as the mire of the street and did spread them abroad

22:44 thou also hast deliv me from the strive of my peopl
thou hast kept me to be head of the heathen: a peopl which i knew not
shall serv me

22:45 stranger shall submit themselv unto me: as soon as they hear
they shall be obedi unto me

22:46 stranger shall fade away and they shall be afraid out of their
close place

22:47 the lord liveth; and bless be my rock; and exalt be the god
of the rock of my salvat

22:48 it is god that avengeth me and that bringeth down the peopl
under me

22:49 and that bringeth me forth from mine enemies: thou also hast
lift me up on high abov them that rose up against me: thou hast
deliv me from the violent man

22:50 therefor i will give thank unto thee o lord among the
heathen and i will sing prais unto thi name

22:51 he is the tower of salvat for hi king: and sheweth merci to
hi anoint unto david and to hi seed for evermor

23:1 now these be the last word of david david the son of jess
said and the man who wa rais up on high the anoint of the god
of jacob and the sweet psalmist of israel said 23:2 the spirit of
the lord spake by me and hi word wa in my tongu

23:3 the god of israel said the rock of israel spake to me he that
ruleth over men must be just rule in the fear of god

23:4 and he shall be as the light of the morn when the sun riseth
even a morn without clouds; as the tender grass spring out of
the earth by clear shine after rain

23:5 although my hous be not so with god; yet he hath made with me an
everlast coven order in all thing and sure: for thi is all
my salvat and all my desir although he make it not to grow

23:6 but the son of belial shall be all of them as thorn thrust
away becaus they cannot be taken with hands: 23:7 but the man that
shall touch them must be fenc with iron and the staff of a spear;
and they shall be utterli burn with fire in the same place

23:8 these be the name of the mighti men whom david had: the
tachmonit that sat in the seat chief among the captains; the same
wa adino the eznite: he lift up hi spear against eight hundr whom
he slew at one time

23:9 and after him wa eleazar the son of dodo the ahohit one of the
three mighti men with david when they defi the philistin that
were there gather togeth to battl and the men of israel were
gone away: 23:10 he aros and smote the philistin until hi hand
wa weari and hi hand clave unto the sword: and the lord wrought a
great victori that day; and the peopl return after him onli to
spoil

23:11 and after him wa shammah the son of age the hararit and the
philistin were gather togeth into a troop where wa a piec of
ground full of lentiles: and the peopl fled from the philistin

23:12 but he stood in the midst of the ground and defend it and
slew the philistines: and the lord wrought a great victori

23:13 and three of the thirti chief went down and came to david in
the harvest time unto the cave of adullam: and the troop of the
philistin pitch in the valley of rephaim

23:14 and david wa then in an hold and the garrison of the
philistin wa then in bethlehem

23:15 and david long and said oh that one would give me drink of
the water of the well of bethlehem which is by the gate! 23:16 and
the three mighti men brake through the host of the philistin and
drew water out of the well of bethlehem that wa by the gate and
took it and brought it to david: nevertheless he would not drink
thereof but pour it out unto the lord

23:17 and he said be it far from me o lord that i should do this:
is not thi the blood of the men that went in jeopardi of their lives?
therefor he would not drink it these thing did these three mighti
men

23:18 and abishai the brother of joab the son of zeruiah wa chief
among three and he lift up hi spear against three hundr and
slew them and had the name among three

23:19 wa he not most honour of three? therefor he wa their
captain: howbeit he attain not unto the first three

23:20 and benaiah the son of jehoiada the son of a valiant man of
kabzeel who had done mani act he slew two lionlik men of moab: he
went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow:
23:21 and he slew an egyptian a goodli man: and the egyptian had a
spear in hi hand; but he went down to him with a staff and pluck
the spear out of the egyptian hand and slew him with hi own spear

23:22 these thing did benaiah the son of jehoiada and had the name
among three mighti men

23:23 he wa more honour than the thirti but he attain not to
the first three and david set him over hi guard

23:24 asahel the brother of joab wa one of the thirty; elhanan the
son of dodo of bethlehem 23:25 shammah the harodit elika the
harodit 23:26 helez the paltit ira the son of ikkesh the tekoit
23:27 abiez the anethothit mebunnai the hushathit 23:28 zalmon
the ahohit maharai the netophathit 23:29 heleb the son of baanah
a netophathit ittai the son of ribai out of gibeah of the children
of benjamin 23:30 benaiah the pirathonit hiddai of the brook of
gaash 23:31 abialbon the arbathit azmaveth the barhumit 23:32
eliahba the shaalbonit of the son of jashen jonathan 23:33
shammah the hararit ahiam the son of sharar the hararit 23:34
eliphelet the son of ahasbai the son of the maachathit eliam the
son of ahithophel the gilonit 23:35 hezrai the carmelit paarai the
arbit 23:36 igal the son of nathan of zobah bani the gadit 23:37
zelek the ammonit nahari the beerothit armourbear to joab the
son of zeruiah 23:38 ira an ithrit gareb an ithrit 23:39 uriah
the hittite: thirti and seven in all

24:1 and again the anger of the lord wa kindl against israel and
he move david against them to say go number israel and judah

24:2 for the king said to joab the captain of the host which wa with
him go now through all the tribe of israel from dan even to
beersheba and number ye the peopl that i may know the number of the
peopl

24:3 and joab said unto the king now the lord thi god add unto the
peopl how mani soever they be an hundredfold and that the eye of
my lord the king may see it: but whi doth my lord the king delight in
thi thing? 24:4 notwithstand the king word prevail against
joab and against the captain of the host and joab and the captain
of the host went out from the presenc of the king to number the
peopl of israel

24:5 and they pass over jordan and pitch in aroer on the right
side of the citi that lieth in the midst of the river of gad and
toward jazer: 24:6 then they came to gilead and to the land of
tahtimhodshi; and they came to danjaan and about to zidon 24:7 and
came to the strong hold of tyre and to all the citi of the hivit
and of the canaanites: and they went out to the south of judah even
to beersheba

24:8 so when they had gone through all the land they came to
jerusalem at the end of nine month and twenti day

24:9 and joab gave up the sum of the number of the peopl unto the
king: and there were in israel eight hundr thousand valiant men that
drew the sword; and the men of judah were five hundr thousand men

24:10 and david heart smote him after that he had number the
peopl

and david said unto the lord i have sin greatli in that i have
done: and now i beseech thee o lord take away the iniqu of thi
servant; for i have done veri foolishli

24:11 for when david wa up in the morn the word of the lord came
unto the prophet gad david seer say 24:12 go and say unto
david thu saith the lord i offer thee three things; choos thee one
of them that i may do it unto thee

24:13 so gad came to david and told him and said unto him shall
seven year of famin come unto thee in thi land? or wilt thou flee
three month befor thine enemi while they pursu thee? or that
there be three day pestil in thi land? now advis and see what
answer i shall return to him that sent me

24:14 and david said unto gad i am in a great strait: let us fall now
into the hand of the lord; for hi merci are great: and let me not
fall into the hand of man

24:15 so the lord sent a pestil upon israel from the morn even
to the time appointed: and there die of the peopl from dan even to
beersheba seventi thousand men

24:16 and when the angel stretch out hi hand upon jerusalem to
destroy it the lord repent him of the evil and said to the angel
that destroy the peopl it is enough: stay now thine hand and the
angel of the lord wa by the threshingplac of araunah the jebusit

24:17 and david spake unto the lord when he saw the angel that smote
the peopl and said lo i have sin and i have done wickedly: but
these sheep what have they done? let thine hand i pray thee be
against me and against my father hous

24:18 and gad came that day to david and said unto him go up rear
an altar unto the lord in the threshingfloor of araunah the jebusit

24:19 and david accord to the say of gad went up as the lord
command

24:20 and araunah look and saw the king and hi servant come on
toward him: and araunah went out and bow himself befor the king on
hi face upon the ground

24:21 and araunah said wherefor is my lord the king come to hi
servant? and david said to buy the threshingfloor of thee to build
an altar unto the lord that the plagu may be stay from the peopl

24:22 and araunah said unto david let my lord the king take and offer
up what seemeth good unto him: behold here be oxen for burnt
sacrific and thresh instrument and other instrument of the oxen
for wood

24:23 all these thing did araunah as a king give unto the king and
araunah said unto the king the lord thi god accept thee

24:24 and the king said unto araunah nay; but i will sure buy it of
thee at a price: neither will i offer burnt offer unto the lord my
god of that which doth cost me noth so david bought the
threshingfloor and the oxen for fifti shekel of silver

24:25 and david built there an altar unto the lord and offer burnt
offer and peac offer so the lord wa intreat for the land
and the plagu wa stay from israel




the first book of the king

commonli called:

the third book of the king


1:1 now king david wa old and stricken in years; and they cover
him with cloth but he gat no heat

1:2 wherefor hi servant said unto him let there be sought for my
lord the king a young virgin: and let her stand befor the king and
let her cherish him and let her lie in thi bosom that my lord the
king may get heat

1:3 so they sought for a fair damsel throughout all the coast of
israel and found abishag a shunammit and brought her to the king

1:4 and the damsel wa veri fair and cherish the king and
minist to him: but the king knew her not

1:5 then adonijah the son of haggith exalt himself say i will
be king: and he prepar him chariot and horsemen and fifti men to
run befor him

1:6 and hi father had not displeas him at ani time in say whi
hast thou done so? and he also wa a veri goodli man; and hi mother
bare him after absalom

1:7 and he confer with joab the son of zeruiah and with abiathar
the priest: and they follow adonijah help him

1:8 but zadok the priest and benaiah the son of jehoiada and nathan
the prophet and shimei and rei and the mighti men which belong to
david were not with adonijah

1:9 and adonijah slew sheep and oxen and fat cattl by the stone of
zoheleth which is by enrogel and call all hi brethren the king
son and all the men of judah the king servants: 1:10 but nathan
the prophet and benaiah and the mighti men and solomon hi brother
he call not

1:11 wherefor nathan spake unto bathsheba the mother of solomon
say hast thou not heard that adonijah the son of haggith doth
reign and david our lord knoweth it not? 1:12 now therefor come
let me i pray thee give thee counsel that thou mayest save thine
own life and the life of thi son solomon

1:13 go and get thee in unto king david and say unto him didst not
thou my lord o king swear unto thine handmaid say assuredli
solomon thi son shall reign after me and he shall sit upon my throne?
whi then doth adonijah reign? 1:14 behold while thou yet talkest
there with the king i also will come in after thee and confirm thi
word

1:15 and bathsheba went in unto the king into the chamber: and the
king wa veri old; and abishag the shunammit minist unto the
king

1:16 and bathsheba bow and did obeis unto the king and the
king said what wouldest thou? 1:17 and she said unto him my lord
thou swarest by the lord thi god unto thine handmaid say
assuredli solomon thi son shall reign after me and he shall sit upon
my throne

1:18 and now behold adonijah reigneth; and now my lord the king
thou knowest it not: 1:19 and he hath slain oxen and fat cattl and
sheep in abund and hath call all the son of the king and
abiathar the priest and joab the captain of the host: but solomon thi
servant hath he not call

1:20 and thou my lord o king the eye of all israel are upon thee
that thou shouldest tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord
the king after him

1:21 otherwis it shall come to pass when my lord the king shall
sleep with hi father that i and my son solomon shall be count
offend

1:22 and lo while she yet talk with the king nathan the prophet
also came in

1:23 and they told the king say behold nathan the prophet and
when he wa come in befor the king he bow himself befor the king
with hi face to the ground

1:24 and nathan said my lord o king hast thou said adonijah shall
reign after me and he shall sit upon my throne? 1:25 for he is gone
down thi day and hath slain oxen and fat cattl and sheep in
abund and hath call all the king son and the captain of
the host and abiathar the priest; and behold they eat and drink
befor him and say god save king adonijah

1:26 but me even me thi servant and zadok the priest and benaiah
the son of jehoiada and thi servant solomon hath he not call

1:27 is thi thing done by my lord the king and thou hast not shew
it unto thi servant who should sit on the throne of my lord the king
after him? 1:28 then king david answer and said call me bathsheba
and she came into the king presenc and stood befor the king

1:29 and the king sware and said as the lord liveth that hath
redeem my soul out of all distress 1:30 even as i sware unto thee
by the lord god of israel say assuredli solomon thi son shall
reign after me and he shall sit upon my throne in my stead; even so
will i certainli do thi day

1:31 then bathsheba bow with her face to the earth and did
rever to the king and said let my lord king david live for ever

1:32 and king david said call me zadok the priest and nathan the
prophet and benaiah the son of jehoiada and they came befor the
king

1:33 the king also said unto them take with you the servant of your
lord and caus solomon my son to ride upon mine own mule and bring
him down to gihon: 1:34 and let zadok the priest and nathan the
prophet anoint him there king over israel: and blow ye with the
trumpet and say god save king solomon

1:35 then ye shall come up after him that he may come and sit upon my
throne; for he shall be king in my stead: and i have appoint him to
be ruler over israel and over judah

1:36 and benaiah the son of jehoiada answer the king and said
amen: the lord god of my lord the king say so too

1:37 as the lord hath been with my lord the king even so be he with
solomon and make hi throne greater than the throne of my lord king
david

1:38 so zadok the priest and nathan the prophet and benaiah the son
of jehoiada and the cherethit and the pelethit went down and
caus solomon to ride upon king david mule and brought him to
gihon

1:39 and zadok the priest took an horn of oil out of the tabernacl
and anoint solomon and they blew the trumpet; and all the peopl
said god save king solomon

1:40 and all the peopl came up after him and the peopl pipe with
pipe and rejoic with great joy so that the earth rent with the
sound of them

1:41 and adonijah and all the guest that were with him heard it as
they had made an end of eat and when joab heard the sound of the
trumpet he said wherefor is thi nois of the citi be in an
uproar? 1:42 and while he yet spake behold jonathan the son of
abiathar the priest came; and adonijah said unto him come in; for
thou art a valiant man and bringest good tide

1:43 and jonathan answer and said to adonijah verili our lord king
david hath made solomon king

1:44 and the king hath sent with him zadok the priest and nathan the
prophet and benaiah the son of jehoiada and the cherethit and the
pelethit and they have caus him to ride upon the king mule:
1:45 and zadok the priest and nathan the prophet have anoint him
king in gihon: and they are come up from thenc rejoic so that the
citi rang again thi is the nois that ye have heard

1:46 and also solomon sitteth on the throne of the kingdom

1:47 and moreov the king servant came to bless our lord king
david say god make the name of solomon better than thi name and
make hi throne greater than thi throne and the king bow himself
upon the bed

1:48 and also thu said the king bless be the lord god of israel
which hath given one to sit on my throne thi day mine eye even
see it

1:49 and all the guest that were with adonijah were afraid and rose
up and went everi man hi way

1:50 and adonijah fear becaus of solomon and aros and went and
caught hold on the horn of the altar

1:51 and it wa told solomon say behold adonijah feareth king
solomon: for lo he hath caught hold on the horn of the altar
say let king solomon swear unto me today that he will not slay hi
servant with the sword

1:52 and solomon said if he will shew himself a worthi man there
shall not an hair of him fall to the earth: but if wicked shall be
found in him he shall die

1:53 so king solomon sent and they brought him down from the altar
and he came and bow himself to king solomon: and solomon said unto
him go to thine hous

2:1 now the day of david drew nigh that he should die; and he charg
solomon hi son say 2:2 i go the way of all the earth: be thou
strong therefor and shew thyself a man; 2:3 and keep the charg of
the lord thi god to walk in hi way to keep hi statut and hi
command and hi judgment and hi testimoni as it is written
in the law of mose that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest
and whithersoev thou turnest thyself: 2:4 that the lord may continu
hi word which he spake concern me say if thi children take
heed to their way to walk befor me in truth with all their heart and
with all their soul there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on the
throne of israel

2:5 moreov thou knowest also what joab the son of zeruiah did to me
and what he did to the two captain of the host of israel unto abner
the son of ner and unto amasa the son of jether whom he slew and
shed the blood of war in peac and put the blood of war upon hi
girdl that wa about hi loin and in hi shoe that were on hi
feet

2:6 do therefor accord to thi wisdom and let not hi hoar head go
down to the grave in peac

2:7 but shew kind unto the son of barzillai the gileadit and
let them be of those that eat at thi table: for so they came to me
when i fled becaus of absalom thi brother

2:8 and behold thou hast with thee shimei the son of gera a
benjamit of bahurim which curs me with a grievou curs in the day
when i went to mahanaim: but he came down to meet me at jordan and i
sware to him by the lord say i will not put thee to death with
the sword

2:9 now therefor hold him not guiltless: for thou art a wise man and
knowest what thou oughtest to do unto him; but hi hoar head bring
thou down to the grave with blood

2:10 so david slept with hi father and wa buri in the citi of
david

2:11 and the day that david reign over israel were forti years:
seven year reign he in hebron and thirti and three year reign
he in jerusalem

2:12 then sat solomon upon the throne of david hi father; and hi
kingdom wa establish greatli

2:13 and adonijah the son of haggith came to bathsheba the mother of
solomon and she said comest thou peaceably? and he said peaceabl

2:14 he said moreov i have somewhat to say unto thee and she said
say on

2:15 and he said thou knowest that the kingdom wa mine and that all
israel set their face on me that i should reign: howbeit the kingdom
is turn about and is becom my brothers: for it wa hi from the
lord

2:16 and now i ask one petit of thee deni me not and she said
unto him say on

2:17 and he said speak i pray thee unto solomon the king (for he
will not say thee nay) that he give me abishag the shunammit to
wife

2:18 and bathsheba said well; i will speak for thee unto the king

2:19 bathsheba therefor went unto king solomon to speak unto him for
adonijah and the king rose up to meet her and bow himself unto
her and sat down on hi throne and caus a seat to be set for the
king mother; and she sat on hi right hand

2:20 then she said i desir one small petit of thee; i pray thee
say me not nay and the king said unto her ask on my mother: for i
will not say thee nay

2:21 and she said let abishag the shunammit be given to adonijah thi
brother to wife

2:22 and king solomon answer and said unto hi mother and whi dost
thou ask abishag the shunammit for adonijah? ask for him the kingdom
also; for he is mine elder brother; even for him and for abiathar the
priest and for joab the son of zeruiah

2:23 then king solomon sware by the lord say god do so to me and
more also if adonijah have not spoken thi word against hi own life

2:24 now therefor as the lord liveth which hath establish me and
set me on the throne of david my father and who hath made me an
hous as he promis adonijah shall be put to death thi day

2:25 and king solomon sent by the hand of benaiah the son of jehoiada;
and he fell upon him that he die

2:26 and unto abiathar the priest said the king get thee to anathoth
unto thine own fields; for thou art worthi of death: but i will not at
thi time put thee to death becaus thou barest the ark of the lord
god befor david my father and becaus thou hast been afflict in
all wherein my father wa afflict

2:27 so solomon thrust out abiathar from be priest unto the lord;
that he might fulfil the word of the lord which he spake concern
the hous of eli in shiloh

2:28 then tide came to joab: for joab had turn after adonijah
though he turn not after absalom and joab fled unto the tabernacl
of the lord and caught hold on the horn of the altar

2:29 and it wa told king solomon that joab wa fled unto the
tabernacl of the lord; and behold he is by the altar then solomon
sent benaiah the son of jehoiada say go fall upon him

2:30 and benaiah came to the tabernacl of the lord and said unto
him thu saith the king come forth and he said nay; but i will die
here and benaiah brought the king word again say thu said joab
and thu he answer me

2:31 and the king said unto him do as he hath said and fall upon
him and buri him; that thou mayest take away the innoc blood
which joab shed from me and from the hous of my father

2:32 and the lord shall return hi blood upon hi own head who fell
upon two men more righteou and better than he and slew them with the
sword my father david not know thereof to wit abner the son of
ner captain of the host of israel and amasa the son of jether
captain of the host of judah

2:33 their blood shall therefor return upon the head of joab and
upon the head of hi seed for ever: but upon david and upon hi seed
and upon hi hous and upon hi throne shall there be peac for ever
from the lord

2:34 so benaiah the son of jehoiada went up and fell upon him and
slew him: and he wa buri in hi own hous in the wilder

2:35 and the king put benaiah the son of jehoiada in hi room over the
host: and zadok the priest did the king put in the room of abiathar

2:36 and the king sent and call for shimei and said unto him build
thee an hous in jerusalem and dwell there and go not forth thenc
ani whither

2:37 for it shall be that on the day thou goest out and passest over
the brook kidron thou shalt know for certain that thou shalt sure
die: thi blood shall be upon thine own head

2:38 and shimei said unto the king the say is good: as my lord the
king hath said so will thi servant do and shimei dwelt in jerusalem
mani day

2:39 and it came to pass at the end of three year that two of the
servant of shimei ran away unto achish son of maachah king of gath
and they told shimei say behold thi servant be in gath

2:40 and shimei aros and saddl hi ass and went to gath to achish
to seek hi servants: and shimei went and brought hi servant from
gath

2:41 and it wa told solomon that shimei had gone from jerusalem to
gath and wa come again

2:42 and the king sent and call for shimei and said unto him did i
not make thee to swear by the lord and protest unto thee say
know for a certain on the day thou goest out and walkest abroad ani
whither that thou shalt sure die? and thou saidst unto me the word
that i have heard is good

2:43 whi then hast thou not kept the oath of the lord and the
command that i have charg thee with? 2:44 the king said
moreov to shimei thou knowest all the wicked which thine heart
is privi to that thou didst to david my father: therefor the lord
shall return thi wicked upon thine own head; 2:45 and king solomon
shall be bless and the throne of david shall be establish befor
the lord for ever

2:46 so the king command benaiah the son of jehoiada; which went
out and fell upon him that he die and the kingdom wa establish
in the hand of solomon

3:1 and solomon made affin with pharaoh king of egypt and took
pharaoh daughter and brought her into the citi of david until he
had made an end of build hi own hous and the hous of the lord
and the wall of jerusalem round about

3:2 onli the peopl sacrif in high place becaus there wa no
hous built unto the name of the lord until those day

3:3 and solomon love the lord walk in the statut of david hi
father: onli he sacrif and burnt incens in high place

3:4 and the king went to gibeon to sacrific there; for that wa the
great high place: a thousand burnt offer did solomon offer upon
that altar

3:5 in gibeon the lord appear to solomon in a dream by night: and
god said ask what i shall give thee

3:6 and solomon said thou hast shew unto thi servant david my
father great merci accord as he walk befor thee in truth and
in righteous and in upright of heart with thee; and thou hast
kept for him thi great kind that thou hast given him a son to
sit on hi throne as it is thi day

3:7 and now o lord my god thou hast made thi servant king instead of
david my father: and i am but a littl child: i know not how to go out
or come in

3:8 and thi servant is in the midst of thi peopl which thou hast
chosen a great peopl that cannot be number nor count for
multitud

3:9 give therefor thi servant an understand heart to judg thi
peopl that i may discern between good and bad: for who is abl to
judg thi thi so great a people? 3:10 and the speech pleas the
lord that solomon had ask thi thing

3:11 and god said unto him becaus thou hast ask thi thing and
hast not ask for thyself long life; neither hast ask rich for
thyself nor hast ask the life of thine enemies; but hast ask for
thyself understand to discern judgment; 3:12 behold i have done
accord to thi words: lo i have given thee a wise and an
understand heart; so that there wa none like thee befor thee
neither after thee shall ani aris like unto thee

3:13 and i have also given thee that which thou hast not ask both
rich and honour: so that there shall not be ani among the king
like unto thee all thi day

3:14 and if thou wilt walk in my way to keep my statut and my
command as thi father david did walk then i will lengthen thi
day

3:15 and solomon awoke; and behold it wa a dream and he came to
jerusalem and stood befor the ark of the coven of the lord and
offer up burnt offer and offer peac offer and made a
feast to all hi servant

3:16 then came there two women that were harlot unto the king and
stood befor him

3:17 and the one woman said o my lord i and thi woman dwell in one
house; and i wa deliv of a child with her in the hous

3:18 and it came to pass the third day after that i wa deliv
that thi woman wa deliv also: and we were together; there wa no
stranger with us in the hous save we two in the hous

3:19 and thi woman child die in the night; becaus she overlaid
it

3:20 and she aros at midnight and took my son from besid me while
thine handmaid slept and laid it in her bosom and laid her dead
child in my bosom

3:21 and when i rose in the morn to give my child suck behold it
wa dead: but when i had consid it in the morn behold it wa
not my son which i did bear

3:22 and the other woman said nay; but the live is my son and the
dead is thi son and thi said no; but the dead is thi son and the
live is my son thu they spake befor the king

3:23 then said the king the one saith thi is my son that liveth
and thi son is the dead: and the other saith nay; but thi son is the
dead and my son is the live

3:24 and the king said bring me a sword and they brought a sword
befor the king

3:25 and the king said divid the live child in two and give half
to the one and half to the other

3:26 then spake the woman whose the live child wa unto the king
for her bowel yearn upon her son and she said o my lord give her
the live child and in no wise slay it but the other said let it
be neither mine nor thine but divid it

3:27 then the king answer and said give her the live child and
in no wise slay it: she is the mother thereof

3:28 and all israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged;
and they fear the king: for they saw that the wisdom of god wa in
him to do judgment

4:1 so king solomon wa king over all israel

4:2 and these were the princ which he had; azariah the son of zadok
the priest 4:3 elihoreph and ahiah the son of shisha scribes;
jehoshaphat the son of ahilud the record

4:4 and benaiah the son of jehoiada wa over the host: and zadok and
abiathar were the priests: 4:5 and azariah the son of nathan wa over
the officers: and zabud the son of nathan wa princip offic and
the king friend: 4:6 and ahishar wa over the household: and
adoniram the son of abda wa over the tribut

4:7 and solomon had twelv offic over all israel which provid
victual for the king and hi household: each man hi month in a year
made provis

4:8 and these are their names: the son of hur in mount ephraim: 4:9
the son of dekar in makaz and in shaalbim and bethshemesh and
elonbethhanan: 4:10 the son of hese in aruboth; to him pertain
sochoh and all the land of hepher: 4:11 the son of abinadab in all
the region of dor; which had taphath the daughter of solomon to wife:
4:12 baana the son of ahilud; to him pertain taanach and megiddo
and all bethshean which is by zartanah beneath jezreel from
bethshean to abelmeholah even unto the place that is beyond jokneam:
4:13 the son of geber in ramothgilead; to him pertain the town of
jair the son of manasseh which are in gilead; to him also pertain
the region of argob which is in bashan threescor great citi with
wall and brasen bars: 4:14 ahinadab the son of iddo had mahanaim:
4:15 ahimaaz wa in naphtali; he also took basmath the daughter of
solomon to wife: 4:16 baanah the son of hushai wa in asher and in
aloth: 4:17 jehoshaphat the son of paruah in issachar: 4:18 shimei
the son of elah in benjamin: 4:19 geber the son of uri wa in the
countri of gilead in the countri of sihon king of the amorit and
of og king of bashan; and he wa the onli offic which wa in the
land

4:20 judah and israel were mani as the sand which is by the sea in
multitud eat and drink and make merri

4:21 and solomon reign over all kingdom from the river unto the
land of the philistin and unto the border of egypt: they brought
present and serv solomon all the day of hi life

4:22 and solomon provis for one day wa thirti measur of fine
flour and threescor measur of meal 4:23 ten fat oxen and twenti
oxen out of the pastur and an hundr sheep besid hart and
roebuck and fallowd and fat fowl

4:24 for he had dominion over all the region on thi side the river
from tiphsah even to azzah over all the king on thi side the river:
and he had peac on all side round about him

4:25 and judah and israel dwelt safe everi man under hi vine and
under hi fig tree from dan even to beersheba all the day of
solomon

4:26 and solomon had forti thousand stall of hors for hi chariot
and twelv thousand horsemen

4:27 and those offic provid victual for king solomon and for all
that came unto king solomon tabl everi man in hi month: they
lack noth

4:28 barley also and straw for the hors and dromedari brought they
unto the place where the offic were everi man accord to hi
charg

4:29 and god gave solomon wisdom and understand exceed much and
larg of heart even as the sand that is on the sea shore

4:30 and solomon wisdom excel the wisdom of all the children of
the east countri and all the wisdom of egypt

4:31 for he wa wiser than all men; than ethan the ezrahit and
heman and chalcol and darda the son of mahol: and hi fame wa in
all nation round about

4:32 and he spake three thousand proverbs: and hi song were a
thousand and five

4:33 and he spake of tree from the cedar tree that is in lebanon
even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall: he spake also of
beast and of fowl and of creep thing and of fish

4:34 and there came of all peopl to hear the wisdom of solomon from
all king of the earth which had heard of hi wisdom

5:1 and hiram king of tyre sent hi servant unto solomon; for he had
heard that they had anoint him king in the room of hi father: for
hiram wa ever a lover of david

5:2 and solomon sent to hiram say 5:3 thou knowest how that david
my father could not build an hous unto the name of the lord hi god
for the war which were about him on everi side until the lord put
them under the sole of hi feet

5:4 but now the lord my god hath given me rest on everi side so that
there is neither adversari nor evil occurr

5:5 and behold i purpos to build an hous unto the name of the lord
my god as the lord spake unto david my father say thi son whom
i will set upon thi throne in thi room he shall build an hous unto
my name

5:6 now therefor command thou that they hew me cedar tree out of
lebanon; and my servant shall be with thi servants: and unto thee
will i give hire for thi servant accord to all that thou shalt
appoint: for thou knowest that there is not among us ani that can
skill to hew timber like unto the sidonian

5:7 and it came to pass when hiram heard the word of solomon that
he rejoic greatli and said bless be the lord thi day which
hath given unto david a wise son over thi great peopl

5:8 and hiram sent to solomon say i have consid the thing
which thou sentest to me for: and i will do all thi desir concern
timber of cedar and concern timber of fir

5:9 my servant shall bring them down from lebanon unto the sea: and i
will convey them by sea in float unto the place that thou shalt
appoint me and will caus them to be discharg there and thou shalt
receiv them: and thou shalt accomplish my desir in give food for
my household

5:10 so hiram gave solomon cedar tree and fir tree accord to all
hi desir

5:11 and solomon gave hiram twenti thousand measur of wheat for food
to hi household and twenti measur of pure oil: thu gave solomon
to hiram year by year

5:12 and the lord gave solomon wisdom as he promis him: and there
wa peac between hiram and solomon; and they two made a leagu
togeth

5:13 and king solomon rais a levi out of all israel; and the levi
wa thirti thousand men

5:14 and he sent them to lebanon ten thousand a month by courses: a
month they were in lebanon and two month at home: and adoniram wa
over the levi

5:15 and solomon had threescor and ten thousand that bare burden
and fourscor thousand hewer in the mountains; 5:16 besid the chief
of solomon offic which were over the work three thousand and
three hundr which rule over the peopl that wrought in the work

5:17 and the king command and they brought great stone costli
stone and hew stone to lay the foundat of the hous

5:18 and solomon builder and hiram builder did hew them and the
stonesquarers: so they prepar timber and stone to build the hous

6:1 and it came to pass in the four hundr and eightieth year after
the children of israel were come out of the land of egypt in the
fourth year of solomon reign over israel in the month zif which is
the second month that he began to build the hous of the lord

6:2 and the hous which king solomon built for the lord the length
thereof wa threescor cubit and the breadth thereof twenti cubit
and the height thereof thirti cubit

6:3 and the porch befor the templ of the hous twenti cubit wa
the length thereof accord to the breadth of the house; and ten
cubit wa the breadth thereof befor the hous

6:4 and for the hous he made window of narrow light

6:5 and against the wall of the hous he built chamber round about
against the wall of the hous round about both of the templ and of
the oracle: and he made chamber round about: 6:6 the nethermost
chamber wa five cubit broad and the middl wa six cubit broad
and the third wa seven cubit broad: for without in the wall of the
hous he made narrow rest round about that the beam should not be
fasten in the wall of the hous

6:7 and the hous when it wa in build wa built of stone made
readi befor it wa brought thither: so that there wa neither hammer
nor axe nor ani tool of iron heard in the hous while it wa in
build

6:8 the door for the middl chamber wa in the right side of the
house: and they went up with wind stair into the middl chamber
and out of the middl into the third

6:9 so he built the hous and finish it; and cover the hous with
beam and board of cedar

6:10 and then he built chamber against all the hous five cubit
high: and they rest on the hous with timber of cedar

6:11 and the word of the lord came to solomon say 6:12 concern
thi hous which thou art in build if thou wilt walk in my
statut and execut my judgment and keep all my command to
walk in them; then will i perform my word with thee which i spake
unto david thi father: 6:13 and i will dwell among the children of
israel and will not forsak my peopl israel

6:14 so solomon built the hous and finish it

6:15 and he built the wall of the hous within with board of cedar
both the floor of the hous and the wall of the ceiling: and he
cover them on the insid with wood and cover the floor of the
hous with plank of fir

6:16 and he built twenti cubit on the side of the hous both the
floor and the wall with board of cedar: he even built them for it
within even for the oracl even for the most holi place

6:17 and the hous that is the templ befor it wa forti cubit
long

6:18 and the cedar of the hous within wa carv with knop and open
flowers: all wa cedar; there wa no stone seen

6:19 and the oracl he prepar in the hous within to set there the
ark of the coven of the lord

6:20 and the oracl in the forepart wa twenti cubit in length and
twenti cubit in breadth and twenti cubit in the height thereof: and
he overlaid it with pure gold; and so cover the altar which wa of
cedar

6:21 so solomon overlaid the hous within with pure gold: and he made
a partit by the chain of gold befor the oracle; and he overlaid
it with gold

6:22 and the whole hous he overlaid with gold until he had finish
all the house: also the whole altar that wa by the oracl he overlaid
with gold

6:23 and within the oracl he made two cherubim of oliv tree each
ten cubit high

6:24 and five cubit wa the one wing of the cherub and five cubit
the other wing of the cherub: from the uttermost part of the one wing
unto the uttermost part of the other were ten cubit

6:25 and the other cherub wa ten cubits: both the cherubim were of
one measur and one size

6:26 the height of the one cherub wa ten cubit and so wa it of the
other cherub

6:27 and he set the cherubim within the inner house: and they
stretch forth the wing of the cherubim so that the wing of the
one touch the one wall and the wing of the other cherub touch the
other wall; and their wing touch one anoth in the midst of the
hous

6:28 and he overlaid the cherubim with gold

6:29 and he carv all the wall of the hous round about with carv
figur of cherubim and palm tree and open flower within and
without

6:30 and the floor of the hous he overlaid with gold within and
without

6:31 and for the enter of the oracl he made door of oliv tree:
the lintel and side post were a fifth part of the wall

6:32 the two door also were of oliv tree; and he carv upon them
carv of cherubim and palm tree and open flower and overlaid
them with gold and spread gold upon the cherubim and upon the palm
tree

6:33 so also made he for the door of the templ post of oliv tree a
fourth part of the wall

6:34 and the two door were of fir tree: the two leav of the one
door were fold and the two leav of the other door were fold

6:35 and he carv thereon cherubim and palm tree and open flowers:
and cover them with gold fit upon the carv work

6:36 and he built the inner court with three row of hew stone and
a row of cedar beam

6:37 in the fourth year wa the foundat of the hous of the lord
laid in the month zif: 6:38 and in the eleventh year in the month
bul which is the eighth month wa the hous finish throughout all
the part thereof and accord to all the fashion of it so wa he
seven year in build it

7:1 but solomon wa build hi own hous thirteen year and he
finish all hi hous

7:2 he built also the hous of the forest of lebanon; the length
thereof wa an hundr cubit and the breadth thereof fifti cubit
and the height thereof thirti cubit upon four row of cedar pillar
with cedar beam upon the pillar

7:3 and it wa cover with cedar abov upon the beam that lay on
forti five pillar fifteen in a row

7:4 and there were window in three row and light wa against light
in three rank

7:5 and all the door and post were squar with the windows: and
light wa against light in three rank

7:6 and he made a porch of pillars; the length thereof wa fifti
cubit and the breadth thereof thirti cubits: and the porch wa
befor them: and the other pillar and the thick beam were befor
them

7:7 then he made a porch for the throne where he might judg even the
porch of judgment: and it wa cover with cedar from one side of the
floor to the other

7:8 and hi hous where he dwelt had anoth court within the porch
which wa of the like work solomon made also an hous for pharaoh
daughter whom he had taken to wife like unto thi porch

7:9 all these were of costli stone accord to the measur of
hew stone saw with saw within and without even from the
foundat unto the cope and so on the outsid toward the great
court

7:10 and the foundat wa of costli stone even great stone
stone of ten cubit and stone of eight cubit

7:11 and abov were costli stone after the measur of hew stone
and cedar

7:12 and the great court round about wa with three row of hew
stone and a row of cedar beam both for the inner court of the
hous of the lord and for the porch of the hous

7:13 and king solomon sent and fetch hiram out of tyre

7:14 he wa a widow son of the tribe of naphtali and hi father wa
a man of tyre a worker in brass: and he wa fill with wisdom and
understand and cun to work all work in brass and he came to
king solomon and wrought all hi work

7:15 for he cast two pillar of brass of eighteen cubit high apiece:
and a line of twelv cubit did compass either of them about

7:16 and he made two chapit of molten brass to set upon the top
of the pillars: the height of the one chapit wa five cubit and
the height of the other chapit wa five cubits: 7:17 and net of
checker work and wreath of chain work for the chapit which were
upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one chapit and seven for
the other chapit

7:18 and he made the pillar and two row round about upon the one
network to cover the chapit that were upon the top with
pomegranates: and so did he for the other chapit

7:19 and the chapit that were upon the top of the pillar were of
lili work in the porch four cubit

7:20 and the chapit upon the two pillar had pomegran also
abov over against the belli which wa by the network: and the
pomegran were two hundr in row round about upon the other
chapit

7:21 and he set up the pillar in the porch of the temple: and he set
up the right pillar and call the name thereof jachin: and he set up
the left pillar and call the name thereof boaz

7:22 and upon the top of the pillar wa lili work: so wa the work of
the pillar finish

7:23 and he made a molten sea ten cubit from the one brim to the
other: it wa round all about and hi height wa five cubits: and a
line of thirti cubit did compass it round about

7:24 and under the brim of it round about there were knop compass
it ten in a cubit compass the sea round about: the knop were
cast in two row when it wa cast

7:25 it stood upon twelv oxen three look toward the north and
three look toward the west and three look toward the south and
three look toward the east: and the sea wa set abov upon them
and all their hinder part were inward

7:26 and it wa an hand breadth thick and the brim thereof wa
wrought like the brim of a cup with flower of lilies: it contain
two thousand bath

7:27 and he made ten base of brass; four cubit wa the length of one
base and four cubit the breadth thereof and three cubit the height
of it

7:28 and the work of the base wa on thi manner: they had border
and the border were between the ledges: 7:29 and on the border that
were between the ledg were lion oxen and cherubims: and upon the
ledg there wa a base above: and beneath the lion and oxen were
certain addit made of thin work

7:30 and everi base had four brasen wheel and plate of brass: and
the four corner thereof had undersetters: under the laver were
undersett molten at the side of everi addit

7:31 and the mouth of it within the chapit and abov wa a cubit:
but the mouth thereof wa round after the work of the base a cubit
and an half: and also upon the mouth of it were grave with their
border foursquar not round

7:32 and under the border were four wheels; and the axletre of the
wheel were join to the base: and the height of a wheel wa a cubit
and half a cubit

7:33 and the work of the wheel wa like the work of a chariot wheel:
their axletre and their nave and their fello and their spoke
were all molten

7:34 and there were four undersett to the four corner of one base:
and the undersett were of the veri base itself

7:35 and in the top of the base wa there a round compass of half a
cubit high: and on the top of the base the ledg thereof and the
border thereof were of the same

7:36 for on the plate of the ledg thereof and on the border
thereof he grave cherubim lion and palm tree accord to the
proport of everi one and addit round about

7:37 after thi manner he made the ten bases: all of them had one
cast one measur and one size

7:38 then made he ten laver of brass: one laver contain forti
baths: and everi laver wa four cubits: and upon everi one of the ten
base one laver

7:39 and he put five base on the right side of the hous and five on
the left side of the house: and he set the sea on the right side of
the hous eastward over against the south

7:40 and hiram made the laver and the shovel and the bason so
hiram made an end of do all the work that he made king solomon for
the hous of the lord: 7:41 the two pillar and the two bowl of the
chapit that were on the top of the two pillars; and the two
network to cover the two bowl of the chapit which were upon the
top of the pillars; 7:42 and four hundr pomegran for the two
network even two row of pomegran for one network to cover the
two bowl of the chapit that were upon the pillars; 7:43 and the
ten base and ten laver on the bases; 7:44 and one sea and twelv
oxen under the sea; 7:45 and the pot and the shovel and the
basons: and all these vessel which hiram made to king solomon for
the hous of the lord were of bright brass

7:46 in the plain of jordan did the king cast them in the clay ground
between succoth and zarthan

7:47 and solomon left all the vessel unweigh becaus they were
exceed many: neither wa the weight of the brass found out

7:48 and solomon made all the vessel that pertain unto the hous of
the lord: the altar of gold and the tabl of gold whereupon the
shewbread wa 7:49 and the candlestick of pure gold five on the
right side and five on the left befor the oracl with the flower
and the lamp and the tong of gold 7:50 and the bowl and the
snuffer and the bason and the spoon and the censer of pure
gold; and the hing of gold both for the door of the inner hous
the most holi place and for the door of the hous to wit of the
templ

7:51 so wa end all the work that king solomon made for the hous of
the lord and solomon brought in the thing which david hi father had
dedicated; even the silver and the gold and the vessel did he put
among the treasur of the hous of the lord

8:1 then solomon assembl the elder of israel and all the head of
the tribe the chief of the father of the children of israel unto
king solomon in jerusalem that they might bring up the ark of the
coven of the lord out of the citi of david which is zion

8:2 and all the men of israel assembl themselv unto king solomon
at the feast in the month ethanim which is the seventh month

8:3 and all the elder of israel came and the priest took up the
ark

8:4 and they brought up the ark of the lord and the tabernacl of the
congreg and all the holi vessel that were in the tabernacl
even those did the priest and the levit bring up

8:5 and king solomon and all the congreg of israel that were
assembl unto him were with him befor the ark sacrif sheep
and oxen that could not be told nor number for multitud

8:6 and the priest brought in the ark of the coven of the lord
unto hi place into the oracl of the hous to the most holi place
even under the wing of the cherubim

8:7 for the cherubim spread forth their two wing over the place of
the ark and the cherubim cover the ark and the stave thereof
abov

8:8 and they drew out the stave that the end of the stave were
seen out in the holi place befor the oracl and they were not seen
without: and there they are unto thi day

8:9 there wa noth in the ark save the two tabl of stone which
mose put there at horeb when the lord made a coven with the
children of israel when they came out of the land of egypt

8:10 and it came to pass when the priest were come out of the holi
place that the cloud fill the hous of the lord 8:11 so that the
priest could not stand to minist becaus of the cloud: for the
glori of the lord had fill the hous of the lord

8:12 then spake solomon the lord said that he would dwell in the
thick dark

8:13 i have sure built thee an hous to dwell in a settl place
for thee to abid in for ever

8:14 and the king turn hi face about and bless all the
congreg of israel: (and all the congreg of israel stood;)
8:15 and he said bless be the lord god of israel which spake with
hi mouth unto david my father and hath with hi hand fulfil it
say 8:16 sinc the day that i brought forth my peopl israel out
of egypt i chose no citi out of all the tribe of israel to build an
hous that my name might be therein; but i chose david to be over my
peopl israel

8:17 and it wa in the heart of david my father to build an hous for
the name of the lord god of israel

8:18 and the lord said unto david my father wherea it wa in thine
heart to build an hous unto my name thou didst well that it wa in
thine heart

8:19 nevertheless thou shalt not build the house; but thi son that
shall come forth out of thi loin he shall build the hous unto my
name

8:20 and the lord hath perform hi word that he spake and i am
risen up in the room of david my father and sit on the throne of
israel as the lord promis and have built an hous for the name of
the lord god of israel

8:21 and i have set there a place for the ark wherein is the coven
of the lord which he made with our father when he brought them out
of the land of egypt

8:22 and solomon stood befor the altar of the lord in the presenc of
all the congreg of israel and spread forth hi hand toward
heaven: 8:23 and he said lord god of israel there is no god like
thee in heaven abov or on earth beneath who keepest coven and
merci with thi servant that walk befor thee with all their heart:
8:24 who hast kept with thi servant david my father that thou
promisedst him: thou spakest also with thi mouth and hast fulfil
it with thine hand as it is thi day

8:25 therefor now lord god of israel keep with thi servant david my
father that thou promisedst him say there shall not fail thee a
man in my sight to sit on the throne of israel; so that thi children
take heed to their way that they walk befor me as thou hast walk
befor me

8:26 and now o god of israel let thi word i pray thee be verifi
which thou spakest unto thi servant david my father

8:27 but will god inde dwell on the earth? behold the heaven and
heaven of heaven cannot contain thee; how much less thi hous that i
have builded? 8:28 yet have thou respect unto the prayer of thi
servant and to hi supplic o lord my god to hearken unto the
cri and to the prayer which thi servant prayeth befor thee to day:
8:29 that thine eye may be open toward thi hous night and day even
toward the place of which thou hast said my name shall be there: that
thou mayest hearken unto the prayer which thi servant shall make
toward thi place

8:30 and hearken thou to the supplic of thi servant and of thi
peopl israel when they shall pray toward thi place: and hear thou
in heaven thi dwell place: and when thou hearest forgiv

8:31 if ani man trespass against hi neighbour and an oath be laid
upon him to caus him to swear and the oath come befor thine altar
in thi house: 8:32 then hear thou in heaven and do and judg thi
servant condemn the wick to bring hi way upon hi head; and
justifi the righteou to give him accord to hi righteous

8:33 when thi peopl israel be smitten down befor the enemi becaus
they have sin against thee and shall turn again to thee and
confess thi name and pray and make supplic unto thee in thi
house: 8:34 then hear thou in heaven and forgiv the sin of thi
peopl israel and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest
unto their father

8:35 when heaven is shut up and there is no rain becaus they have
sin against thee; if they pray toward thi place and confess thi
name and turn from their sin when thou afflictest them: 8:36 then
hear thou in heaven and forgiv the sin of thi servant and of thi
peopl israel that thou teach them the good way wherein they should
walk and give rain upon thi land which thou hast given to thi peopl
for an inherit

8:37 if there be in the land famin if there be pestil blast
mildew locust or if there be caterpiller; if their enemi besieg
them in the land of their cities; whatsoev plagu whatsoev
sick there be; 8:38 what prayer and supplic soever be made by
ani man or by all thi peopl israel which shall know everi man the
