plagu of hi own heart and spread forth hi hand toward thi house:
8:39 then hear thou in heaven thi dwell place and forgiv and do
and give to everi man accord to hi way whose heart thou knowest;
(for thou even thou onli knowest the heart of all the children of
men;) 8:40 that they may fear thee all the day that they live in the
land which thou gavest unto our father

8:41 moreov concern a stranger that is not of thi peopl israel
but cometh out of a far countri for thi name sake; 8:42 (for they
shall hear of thi great name and of thi strong hand and of thi
stretch out arm;) when he shall come and pray toward thi house;
8:43 hear thou in heaven thi dwell place and do accord to all
that the stranger calleth to thee for: that all peopl of the earth
may know thi name to fear thee as do thi peopl israel; and that
they may know that thi hous which i have build is call by thi
name

8:44 if thi peopl go out to battl against their enemi whithersoev
thou shalt send them and shall pray unto the lord toward the citi
which thou hast chosen and toward the hous that i have built for thi
name: 8:45 then hear thou in heaven their prayer and their
supplic and maintain their caus

8:46 if they sin against thee (for there is no man that sinneth not)
and thou be angri with them and deliv them to the enemi so that
they carri them away captiv unto the land of the enemi far or near;
8:47 yet if they shall bethink themselv in the land whither they
were carri captiv and repent and make supplic unto thee in
the land of them that carri them captiv say we have sin
and have done pervers we have commit wickedness; 8:48 and so
return unto thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the
land of their enemi which led them away captiv and pray unto thee
toward their land which thou gavest unto their father the citi
which thou hast chosen and the hous which i have built for thi name:
8:49 then hear thou their prayer and their supplic in heaven thi
dwell place and maintain their caus 8:50 and forgiv thi peopl
that have sin against thee and all their transgress wherein
they have transgress against thee and give them compass befor
them who carri them captiv that they may have compass on them:
8:51 for they be thi peopl and thine inherit which thou
broughtest forth out of egypt from the midst of the furnac of iron:
8:52 that thine eye may be open unto the supplic of thi servant
and unto the supplic of thi peopl israel to hearken unto them
in all that they call for unto thee

8:53 for thou didst separ them from among all the peopl of the
earth to be thine inherit as thou spakest by the hand of mose
thi servant when thou broughtest our father out of egypt o lord
god

8:54 and it wa so that when solomon had made an end of pray all
thi prayer and supplic unto the lord he aros from befor the
altar of the lord from kneel on hi knee with hi hand spread up
to heaven

8:55 and he stood and bless all the congreg of israel with a
loud voic say 8:56 bless be the lord that hath given rest
unto hi peopl israel accord to all that he promised: there hath
not fail one word of all hi good promis which he promis by the
hand of mose hi servant

8:57 the lord our god be with us as he wa with our fathers: let him
not leav us nor forsak us: 8:58 that he may inclin our heart unto
him to walk in all hi way and to keep hi command and hi
statut and hi judgment which he command our father

8:59 and let these my word wherewith i have made supplic befor
the lord be nigh unto the lord our god day and night that he
maintain the caus of hi servant and the caus of hi peopl israel
at all time as the matter shall require: 8:60 that all the peopl of
the earth may know that the lord is god and that there is none els

8:61 let your heart therefor be perfect with the lord our god to
walk in hi statut and to keep hi command as at thi day

8:62 and the king and all israel with him offer sacrific befor
the lord

8:63 and solomon offer a sacrific of peac offer which he
offer unto the lord two and twenti thousand oxen and an hundr
and twenti thousand sheep so the king and all the children of israel
dedic the hous of the lord

8:64 the same day did the king hallow the middl of the court that wa
befor the hous of the lord: for there he offer burnt offer
and meat offer and the fat of the peac offerings: becaus the
brasen altar that wa befor the lord wa too littl to receiv the
burnt offer and meat offer and the fat of the peac
offer

8:65 and at that time solomon held a feast and all israel with him a
great congreg from the enter in of hamath unto the river of
egypt befor the lord our god seven day and seven day even
fourteen day

8:66 on the eighth day he sent the peopl away: and they bless the
king and went unto their tent joy and glad of heart for all the
good that the lord had done for david hi servant and for israel
hi peopl

9:1 and it came to pass when solomon had finish the build of the
hous of the lord and the king hous and all solomon desir
which he wa pleas to do 9:2 that the lord appear to solomon the
second time as he had appear unto him at gibeon

9:3 and the lord said unto him i have heard thi prayer and thi
supplic that thou hast made befor me: i have hallow thi
hous which thou hast built to put my name there for ever; and mine
eye and mine heart shall be there perpetu

9:4 and if thou wilt walk befor me as david thi father walk in
integr of heart and in upright to do accord to all that i
have command thee and wilt keep my statut and my judgments: 9:5
then i will establish the throne of thi kingdom upon israel for ever
as i promis to david thi father say there shall not fail thee a
man upon the throne of israel

9:6 but if ye shall at all turn from follow me ye or your
children and will not keep my command and my statut which i
have set befor you but go and serv other god and worship them:
9:7 then will i cut off israel out of the land which i have given
them; and thi hous which i have hallow for my name will i cast
out of my sight; and israel shall be a proverb and a byword among all
people: 9:8 and at thi hous which is high everi one that passeth
by it shall be astonish and shall hiss; and they shall say whi
hath the lord done thu unto thi land and to thi house? 9:9 and
they shall answer becaus they forsook the lord their god who
brought forth their father out of the land of egypt and have taken
hold upon other god and have worship them and serv them:
therefor hath the lord brought upon them all thi evil

9:10 and it came to pass at the end of twenti year when solomon had
built the two hous the hous of the lord and the king hous
9:11 (now hiram the king of tyre had furnish solomon with cedar
tree and fir tree and with gold accord to all hi desire) that
then king solomon gave hiram twenti citi in the land of galile

9:12 and hiram came out from tyre to see the citi which solomon had
given him; and they pleas him not

9:13 and he said what citi are these which thou hast given me my
brother? and he call them the land of cabul unto thi day

9:14 and hiram sent to the king sixscor talent of gold

9:15 and thi is the reason of the levi which king solomon raised; for
to build the hous of the lord and hi own hous and millo and the
wall of jerusalem and hazor and megiddo and gezer

9:16 for pharaoh king of egypt had gone up and taken gezer and burnt
it with fire and slain the canaanit that dwelt in the citi and
given it for a present unto hi daughter solomon wife

9:17 and solomon built gezer and bethhoron the nether 9:18 and
baalath and tadmor in the wilder in the land 9:19 and all the
citi of store that solomon had and citi for hi chariot and
citi for hi horsemen and that which solomon desir to build in
jerusalem and in lebanon and in all the land of hi dominion

9:20 and all the peopl that were left of the amorit hittit
perizzit hivit and jebusit which were not of the children of
israel 9:21 their children that were left after them in the land
whom the children of israel also were not abl utterli to destroy
upon those did solomon levi a tribut of bondservic unto thi day

9:22 but of the children of israel did solomon make no bondmen: but
they were men of war and hi servant and hi princ and hi
captain and ruler of hi chariot and hi horsemen

9:23 these were the chief of the offic that were over solomon
work five hundr and fifti which bare rule over the peopl that
wrought in the work

9:24 but pharaoh daughter came up out of the citi of david unto her
hous which solomon had built for her: then did he build millo

9:25 and three time in a year did solomon offer burnt offer and
peac offer upon the altar which he built unto the lord and he
burnt incens upon the altar that wa befor the lord so he finish
the hous

9:26 and king solomon made a navi of ship in eziongeb which is
besid eloth on the shore of the red sea in the land of edom

9:27 and hiram sent in the navi hi servant shipmen that had
knowledg of the sea with the servant of solomon

9:28 and they came to ophir and fetch from thenc gold four
hundr and twenti talent and brought it to king solomon

10:1 and when the queen of sheba heard of the fame of solomon
concern the name of the lord she came to prove him with hard
question

10:2 and she came to jerusalem with a veri great train with camel
that bare spice and veri much gold and preciou stones: and when
she wa come to solomon she commun with him of all that wa in her
heart

10:3 and solomon told her all her questions: there wa not ani thing
hid from the king which he told her not

10:4 and when the queen of sheba had seen all solomon wisdom and
the hous that he had built 10:5 and the meat of hi tabl and the
sit of hi servant and the attend of hi minist and
their apparel and hi cupbear and hi ascent by which he went up
unto the hous of the lord; there wa no more spirit in her

10:6 and she said to the king it wa a true report that i heard in
mine own land of thi act and of thi wisdom

10:7 howbeit i believ not the word until i came and mine eye had
seen it: and behold the half wa not told me: thi wisdom and
prosper exceedeth the fame which i heard

10:8 happi are thi men happi are these thi servant which stand
continu befor thee and that hear thi wisdom

10:9 bless be the lord thi god which delight in thee to set thee
on the throne of israel: becaus the lord love israel for ever
therefor made he thee king to do judgment and justic

10:10 and she gave the king an hundr and twenti talent of gold and
of spice veri great store and preciou stones: there came no more
such abund of spice as these which the queen of sheba gave to
king solomon

10:11 and the navi also of hiram that brought gold from ophir
brought in from ophir great plenti of almug tree and preciou
stone

10:12 and the king made of the almug tree pillar for the hous of
the lord and for the king hous harp also and psalteri for
singers: there came no such almug tree nor were seen unto thi day

10:13 and king solomon gave unto the queen of sheba all her desir
whatsoev she ask besid that which solomon gave her of hi royal
bounti

so she turn and went to her own countri she and her servant

10:14 now the weight of gold that came to solomon in one year wa six
hundr threescor and six talent of gold 10:15 besid that he had
of the merchantmen and of the traffick of the spice merchant and of
all the king of arabia and of the governor of the countri

10:16 and king solomon made two hundr target of beaten gold: six
hundr shekel of gold went to one target

10:17 and he made three hundr shield of beaten gold; three pound of
gold went to one shield: and the king put them in the hous of the
forest of lebanon

10:18 moreov the king made a great throne of ivori and overlaid it
with the best gold

10:19 the throne had six step and the top of the throne wa round
behind: and there were stay on either side on the place of the seat
and two lion stood besid the stay

10:20 and twelv lion stood there on the one side and on the other
upon the six steps: there wa not the like made in ani kingdom

10:21 and all king solomon drink vessel were of gold and all
the vessel of the hous of the forest of lebanon were of pure gold;
none were of silver: it wa noth account of in the day of
solomon

10:22 for the king had at sea a navi of tharshish with the navi of
hiram: onc in three year came the navi of tharshish bring gold
and silver ivori and ape and peacock

10:23 so king solomon exceed all the king of the earth for rich
and for wisdom

10:24 and all the earth sought to solomon to hear hi wisdom which
god had put in hi heart

10:25 and they brought everi man hi present vessel of silver and
vessel of gold and garment and armour and spice hors and
mule a rate year by year

10:26 and solomon gather togeth chariot and horsemen: and he had
a thousand and four hundr chariot and twelv thousand horsemen
whom he bestow in the citi for chariot and with the king at
jerusalem

10:27 and the king made silver to be in jerusalem as stone and
cedar made he to be as the sycomor tree that are in the vale for
abund

10:28 and solomon had hors brought out of egypt and linen yarn: the
king merchant receiv the linen yarn at a price

10:29 and a chariot came up and went out of egypt for six hundr
shekel of silver and an hors for an hundr and fifty: and so for
all the king of the hittit and for the king of syria did they
bring them out by their mean

11:1 but king solomon love mani strang women togeth with the
daughter of pharaoh women of the moabit ammonit edomit
zidonian and hittites: 11:2 of the nation concern which the lord
said unto the children of israel ye shall not go in to them neither
shall they come in unto you: for sure they will turn away your heart
after their gods: solomon clave unto these in love

11:3 and he had seven hundr wive princess and three hundr
concubines: and hi wive turn away hi heart

11:4 for it came to pass when solomon wa old that hi wive turn
away hi heart after other gods: and hi heart wa not perfect with
the lord hi god as wa the heart of david hi father

11:5 for solomon went after ashtoreth the goddess of the zidonian
and after milcom the abomin of the ammonit

11:6 and solomon did evil in the sight of the lord and went not fulli
after the lord as did david hi father

11:7 then did solomon build an high place for chemosh the abomin
of moab in the hill that is befor jerusalem and for molech the
abomin of the children of ammon

11:8 and likewis did he for all hi strang wive which burnt
incens and sacrif unto their god

11:9 and the lord wa angri with solomon becaus hi heart wa turn
from the lord god of israel which had appear unto him twice 11:10
and had command him concern thi thing that he should not go
after other gods: but he kept not that which the lord command

11:11 wherefor the lord said unto solomon forasmuch as thi is done
of thee and thou hast not kept my coven and my statut which i
have command thee i will sure rend the kingdom from thee and
will give it to thi servant

11:12 notwithstand in thi day i will not do it for david thi
father sake: but i will rend it out of the hand of thi son

11:13 howbeit i will not rend away all the kingdom; but will give one
tribe to thi son for david my servant sake and for jerusalem sake
which i have chosen

11:14 and the lord stir up an adversari unto solomon hadad the
edomite: he wa of the king seed in edom

11:15 for it came to pass when david wa in edom and joab the
captain of the host wa gone up to buri the slain after he had
smitten everi male in edom; 11:16 (for six month did joab remain
there with all israel until he had cut off everi male in edom:) 11:17
that hadad fled he and certain edomit of hi father servant with
him to go into egypt; hadad be yet a littl child

11:18 and they aros out of midian and came to paran: and they took
men with them out of paran and they came to egypt unto pharaoh king
of egypt; which gave him an hous and appoint him victual and
gave him land

11:19 and hadad found great favour in the sight of pharaoh so that he
gave him to wife the sister of hi own wife the sister of tahpen
the queen

11:20 and the sister of tahpen bare him genubath hi son whom
tahpen wean in pharaoh house: and genubath wa in pharaoh
household among the son of pharaoh

11:21 and when hadad heard in egypt that david slept with hi father
and that joab the captain of the host wa dead hadad said to pharaoh
let me depart that i may go to mine own countri

11:22 then pharaoh said unto him but what hast thou lack with me
that behold thou seekest to go to thine own country? and he
answer nothing: howbeit let me go in ani wise

11:23 and god stir him up anoth adversari rezon the son of
eliadah which fled from hi lord hadadez king of zobah: 11:24 and
he gather men unto him and becam captain over a band when david
slew them of zobah: and they went to damascu and dwelt therein and
reign in damascu

11:25 and he wa an adversari to israel all the day of solomon
besid the mischief that hadad did: and he abhor israel and
reign over syria

11:26 and jeroboam the son of nebat an ephrathit of zereda
solomon servant whose mother name wa zeruah a widow woman even
he lift up hi hand against the king

11:27 and thi wa the caus that he lift up hi hand against the
king: solomon built millo and repair the breach of the citi of
david hi father

11:28 and the man jeroboam wa a mighti man of valour: and solomon
see the young man that he wa industri he made him ruler over
all the charg of the hous of joseph

11:29 and it came to pass at that time when jeroboam went out of
jerusalem that the prophet ahijah the shilonit found him in the way;
and he had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alon in
the field: 11:30 and ahijah caught the new garment that wa on him
and rent it in twelv pieces: 11:31 and he said to jeroboam take thee
ten pieces: for thu saith the lord the god of israel behold i will
rend the kingdom out of the hand of solomon and will give ten tribe
to thee: 11:32 (but he shall have one tribe for my servant david
sake and for jerusalem sake the citi which i have chosen out of
all the tribe of israel:) 11:33 becaus that they have forsaken me
and have worship ashtoreth the goddess of the zidonian chemosh
the god of the moabit and milcom the god of the children of ammon
and have not walk in my way to do that which is right in mine
eye and to keep my statut and my judgment as did david hi
father

11:34 howbeit i will not take the whole kingdom out of hi hand: but i
will make him princ all the day of hi life for david my servant
sake whom i chose becaus he kept my command and my statutes:
11:35 but i will take the kingdom out of hi son hand and will give
it unto thee even ten tribe

11:36 and unto hi son will i give one tribe that david my servant
may have a light alway befor me in jerusalem the citi which i have
chosen me to put my name there

11:37 and i will take thee and thou shalt reign accord to all that
thi soul desireth and shalt be king over israel

11:38 and it shall be if thou wilt hearken unto all that i command
thee and wilt walk in my way and do that is right in my sight to
keep my statut and my command as david my servant did; that i
will be with thee and build thee a sure hous as i built for david
and will give israel unto thee

11:39 and i will for thi afflict the seed of david but not for ever

11:40 solomon sought therefor to kill jeroboam and jeroboam aros
and fled into egypt unto shishak king of egypt and wa in egypt
until the death of solomon

11:41 and the rest of the act of solomon and all that he did and
hi wisdom are they not written in the book of the act of solomon?
11:42 and the time that solomon reign in jerusalem over all israel
wa forti year

11:43 and solomon slept with hi father and wa buri in the citi
of david hi father: and rehoboam hi son reign in hi stead

12:1 and rehoboam went to shechem: for all israel were come to shechem
to make him king

12:2 and it came to pass when jeroboam the son of nebat who wa yet
in egypt heard of it (for he wa fled from the presenc of king
solomon and jeroboam dwelt in egypt;) 12:3 that they sent and call
him and jeroboam and all the congreg of israel came and spake
unto rehoboam say 12:4 thi father made our yoke grievous: now
therefor make thou the grievou servic of thi father and hi heavi
yoke which he put upon us lighter and we will serv thee

12:5 and he said unto them depart yet for three day then come again
to me and the peopl depart

12:6 and king rehoboam consult with the old men that stood befor
solomon hi father while he yet live and said how do ye advis that
i may answer thi people? 12:7 and they spake unto him say if
thou wilt be a servant unto thi peopl thi day and wilt serv them
and answer them and speak good word to them then they will be thi
servant for ever

12:8 but he forsook the counsel of the old men which they had given
him and consult with the young men that were grown up with him and
which stood befor him: 12:9 and he said unto them what counsel give
ye that we may answer thi peopl who have spoken to me say make
the yoke which thi father did put upon us lighter? 12:10 and the
young men that were grown up with him spake unto him say thu
shalt thou speak unto thi peopl that spake unto thee say thi
father made our yoke heavi but make thou it lighter unto us; thu
shalt thou say unto them my littl finger shall be thicker than my
father loin

12:11 and now wherea my father did lade you with a heavi yoke i will
add to your yoke: my father hath chastis you with whip but i will
chastis you with scorpion

12:12 so jeroboam and all the peopl came to rehoboam the third day
as the king had appoint say come to me again the third day

12:13 and the king answer the peopl roughli and forsook the old
men counsel that they gave him; 12:14 and spake to them after the
counsel of the young men say my father made your yoke heavi and
i will add to your yoke: my father also chastis you with whip but
i will chastis you with scorpion

12:15 wherefor the king hearken not unto the people; for the caus
wa from the lord that he might perform hi say which the lord
spake by ahijah the shilonit unto jeroboam the son of nebat

12:16 so when all israel saw that the king hearken not unto them
the peopl answer the king say what portion have we in david?
neither have we inherit in the son of jesse: to your tent o
israel: now see to thine own hous david so israel depart unto
their tent

12:17 but as for the children of israel which dwelt in the citi of
judah rehoboam reign over them

12:18 then king rehoboam sent adoram who wa over the tribute; and
all israel stone him with stone that he die therefor king
rehoboam made speed to get him up to hi chariot to flee to
jerusalem

12:19 so israel rebel against the hous of david unto thi day

12:20 and it came to pass when all israel heard that jeroboam wa
come again that they sent and call him unto the congreg and
made him king over all israel: there wa none that follow the hous
of david but the tribe of judah onli

12:21 and when rehoboam wa come to jerusalem he assembl all the
hous of judah with the tribe of benjamin an hundr and fourscor
thousand chosen men which were warrior to fight against the hous
of israel to bring the kingdom again to rehoboam the son of solomon

12:22 but the word of god came unto shemaiah the man of god say
12:23 speak unto rehoboam the son of solomon king of judah and unto
all the hous of judah and benjamin and to the remnant of the peopl
say 12:24 thu saith the lord ye shall not go up nor fight
against your brethren the children of israel: return everi man to hi
house; for thi thing is from me they hearken therefor to the word
of the lord and return to depart accord to the word of the
lord

12:25 then jeroboam built shechem in mount ephraim and dwelt therein;
and went out from thenc and built penuel

12:26 and jeroboam said in hi heart now shall the kingdom return to
the hous of david: 12:27 if thi peopl go up to do sacrific in the
hous of the lord at jerusalem then shall the heart of thi peopl
turn again unto their lord even unto rehoboam king of judah and they
shall kill me and go again to rehoboam king of judah

12:28 whereupon the king took counsel and made two calv of gold
and said unto them it is too much for you to go up to jerusalem:
behold thi god o israel which brought thee up out of the land of
egypt

12:29 and he set the one in bethel and the other put he in dan

12:30 and thi thing becam a sin: for the peopl went to worship
befor the one even unto dan

12:31 and he made an hous of high place and made priest of the
lowest of the peopl which were not of the son of levi

12:32 and jeroboam ordain a feast in the eighth month on the
fifteenth day of the month like unto the feast that is in judah and
he offer upon the altar so did he in bethel sacrif unto the
calv that he had made: and he place in bethel the priest of the
high place which he had made

12:33 so he offer upon the altar which he had made in bethel the
fifteenth day of the eighth month even in the month which he had
devis of hi own heart; and ordain a feast unto the children of
israel: and he offer upon the altar and burnt incens

13:1 and behold there came a man of god out of judah by the word of
the lord unto bethel: and jeroboam stood by the altar to burn incens

13:2 and he cri against the altar in the word of the lord and said
o altar altar thu saith the lord; behold a child shall be born
unto the hous of david josiah by name; and upon thee shall he offer
the priest of the high place that burn incens upon thee and men
bone shall be burnt upon thee

13:3 and he gave a sign the same day say thi is the sign which
the lord hath spoken; behold the altar shall be rent and the ash
that are upon it shall be pour out

13:4 and it came to pass when king jeroboam heard the say of the
man of god which had cri against the altar in bethel that he put
forth hi hand from the altar say lay hold on him and hi hand
which he put forth against him dri up so that he could not pull it
in again to him

13:5 the altar also wa rent and the ash pour out from the altar
accord to the sign which the man of god had given by the word of
the lord

13:6 and the king answer and said unto the man of god intreat now
the face of the lord thi god and pray for me that my hand may be
restor me again and the man of god besought the lord and the
king hand wa restor him again and becam as it wa befor

13:7 and the king said unto the man of god come home with me and
refresh thyself and i will give thee a reward

13:8 and the man of god said unto the king if thou wilt give me half
thine hous i will not go in with thee neither will i eat bread nor
drink water in thi place: 13:9 for so wa it charg me by the word
of the lord say eat no bread nor drink water nor turn again by
the same way that thou camest

13:10 so he went anoth way and return not by the way that he came
to bethel

13:11 now there dwelt an old prophet in bethel; and hi son came and
told him all the work that the man of god had done that day in
bethel: the word which he had spoken unto the king them they told
also to their father

13:12 and their father said unto them what way went he? for hi son
had seen what way the man of god went which came from judah

13:13 and he said unto hi son saddl me the ass so they saddl
him the ass: and he rode thereon 13:14 and went after the man of god
and found him sit under an oak: and he said unto him art thou the
man of god that camest from judah? and he said i am

13:15 then he said unto him come home with me and eat bread

13:16 and he said i may not return with thee nor go in with thee:
neither will i eat bread nor drink water with thee in thi place:
13:17 for it wa said to me by the word of the lord thou shalt eat no
bread nor drink water there nor turn again to go by the way that thou
camest

13:18 he said unto him i am a prophet also as thou art; and an angel
spake unto me by the word of the lord say bring him back with
thee into thine hous that he may eat bread and drink water but he
lie unto him

13:19 so he went back with him and did eat bread in hi hous and
drank water

13:20 and it came to pass as they sat at the tabl that the word of
the lord came unto the prophet that brought him back: 13:21 and he
cri unto the man of god that came from judah say thu saith the
lord forasmuch as thou hast disobey the mouth of the lord and hast
not kept the command which the lord thi god command thee 13:22
but camest back and hast eaten bread and drunk water in the place of
the which the lord did say to thee eat no bread and drink no water;
thi carcas shall not come unto the sepulchr of thi father

13:23 and it came to pass after he had eaten bread and after he had
drunk that he saddl for him the ass to wit for the prophet whom
he had brought back

13:24 and when he wa gone a lion met him by the way and slew him:
and hi carcas wa cast in the way and the ass stood by it the lion
also stood by the carcas

13:25 and behold men pass by and saw the carcas cast in the way
and the lion stand by the carcase: and they came and told it in the
citi where the old prophet dwelt

13:26 and when the prophet that brought him back from the way heard
thereof he said it is the man of god who wa disobedi unto the
word of the lord: therefor the lord hath deliv him unto the lion
which hath torn him and slain him accord to the word of the lord
which he spake unto him

13:27 and he spake to hi son say saddl me the ass and they
saddl him

13:28 and he went and found hi carcas cast in the way and the ass
and the lion stand by the carcase: the lion had not eaten the
carcas nor torn the ass

13:29 and the prophet took up the carcas of the man of god and laid
it upon the ass and brought it back: and the old prophet came to the
citi to mourn and to buri him

13:30 and he laid hi carcas in hi own grave; and they mourn over
him say ala my brother! 13:31 and it came to pass after he
had buri him that he spake to hi son say when i am dead
then buri me in the sepulchr wherein the man of god is buried; lay my
bone besid hi bones: 13:32 for the say which he cri by the
word of the lord against the altar in bethel and against all the
hous of the high place which are in the citi of samaria shall
sure come to pass

13:33 after thi thing jeroboam return not from hi evil way but
made again of the lowest of the peopl priest of the high places:
whosoev would he consecr him and he becam one of the priest
of the high place

13:34 and thi thing becam sin unto the hous of jeroboam even to
cut it off and to destroy it from off the face of the earth

14:1 at that time abijah the son of jeroboam fell sick

14:2 and jeroboam said to hi wife aris i pray thee and disguis
thyself that thou be not known to be the wife of jeroboam; and get
thee to shiloh: behold there is ahijah the prophet which told me
that i should be king over thi peopl

14:3 and take with thee ten loav and cracknel and a cruse of
honey and go to him: he shall tell thee what shall becom of the
child

14:4 and jeroboam wife did so and aros and went to shiloh and
came to the hous of ahijah but ahijah could not see; for hi eye
were set by reason of hi age

14:5 and the lord said unto ahijah behold the wife of jeroboam
cometh to ask a thing of thee for her son; for he is sick: thu and
thu shalt thou say unto her: for it shall be when she cometh in
that she shall feign herself to be anoth woman

14:6 and it wa so when ahijah heard the sound of her feet as she
came in at the door that he said come in thou wife of jeroboam; whi
feignest thou thyself to be another? for i am sent to thee with heavi
tide

14:7 go tell jeroboam thu saith the lord god of israel forasmuch
as i exalt thee from among the peopl and made thee princ over my
peopl israel 14:8 and rent the kingdom away from the hous of david
and gave it thee: and yet thou hast not been as my servant david who
kept my command and who follow me with all hi heart to do
that onli which wa right in mine eyes; 14:9 but hast done evil abov
all that were befor thee: for thou hast gone and made thee other
god and molten imag to provok me to anger and hast cast me
behind thi back: 14:10 therefor behold i will bring evil upon the
hous of jeroboam and will cut off from jeroboam him that pisseth
against the wall and him that is shut up and left in israel and will
take away the remnant of the hous of jeroboam as a man taketh away
dung till it be all gone

14:11 him that dieth of jeroboam in the citi shall the dog eat; and
him that dieth in the field shall the fowl of the air eat: for the
lord hath spoken it

14:12 aris thou therefor get thee to thine own house: and when thi
feet enter into the citi the child shall die

14:13 and all israel shall mourn for him and buri him: for he onli of
jeroboam shall come to the grave becaus in him there is found some
good thing toward the lord god of israel in the hous of jeroboam

14:14 moreov the lord shall rais him up a king over israel who
shall cut off the hous of jeroboam that day: but what? even now

14:15 for the lord shall smite israel as a reed is shaken in the
water and he shall root up israel out of thi good land which he
gave to their father and shall scatter them beyond the river
becaus they have made their grove provok the lord to anger

14:16 and he shall give israel up becaus of the sin of jeroboam who
did sin and who made israel to sin

14:17 and jeroboam wife aros and depart and came to tirzah: and
when she came to the threshold of the door the child died; 14:18 and
they buri him; and all israel mourn for him accord to the word
of the lord which he spake by the hand of hi servant ahijah the
prophet

14:19 and the rest of the act of jeroboam how he war and how he
reign behold they are written in the book of the chronicl of the
king of israel

14:20 and the day which jeroboam reign were two and twenti years:
and he slept with hi father and nadab hi son reign in hi stead

14:21 and rehoboam the son of solomon reign in judah rehoboam wa
forti and one year old when he began to reign and he reign
seventeen year in jerusalem the citi which the lord did choos out
of all the tribe of israel to put hi name there and hi mother
name wa naamah an ammonitess

14:22 and judah did evil in the sight of the lord and they provok
him to jealousi with their sin which they had commit abov all
that their father had done

14:23 for they also built them high place and imag and grove on
everi high hill and under everi green tree

14:24 and there were also sodomit in the land: and they did
accord to all the abomin of the nation which the lord cast
out befor the children of israel

14:25 and it came to pass in the fifth year of king rehoboam that
shishak king of egypt came up against jerusalem: 14:26 and he took
away the treasur of the hous of the lord and the treasur of the
king house; he even took away all: and he took away all the shield
of gold which solomon had made

14:27 and king rehoboam made in their stead brasen shield and
commit them unto the hand of the chief of the guard which kept
the door of the king hous

14:28 and it wa so when the king went into the hous of the lord
that the guard bare them and brought them back into the guard
chamber

14:29 now the rest of the act of rehoboam and all that he did are
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?
14:30 and there wa war between rehoboam and jeroboam all their day

14:31 and rehoboam slept with hi father and wa buri with hi
father in the citi of david and hi mother name wa naamah an
ammonitess and abijam hi son reign in hi stead

15:1 now in the eighteenth year of king jeroboam the son of nebat
reign abijam over judah

15:2 three year reign he in jerusalem and hi mother name wa
maachah the daughter of abishalom

15:3 and he walk in all the sin of hi father which he had done
befor him: and hi heart wa not perfect with the lord hi god as
the heart of david hi father

15:4 nevertheless for david sake did the lord hi god give him a
lamp in jerusalem to set up hi son after him and to establish
jerusalem: 15:5 becaus david did that which wa right in the eye of
the lord and turn not asid from ani thing that he command him
all the day of hi life save onli in the matter of uriah the
hittit

15:6 and there wa war between rehoboam and jeroboam all the day of
hi life

15:7 now the rest of the act of abijam and all that he did are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah? and
there wa war between abijam and jeroboam

15:8 and abijam slept with hi fathers; and they buri him in the
citi of david: and asa hi son reign in hi stead

15:9 and in the twentieth year of jeroboam king of israel reign asa
over judah

15:10 and forti and one year reign he in jerusalem and hi
mother name wa maachah the daughter of abishalom

15:11 and asa did that which wa right in the eye of the lord as did
david hi father

15:12 and he took away the sodomit out of the land and remov all
the idol that hi father had made

15:13 and also maachah hi mother even her he remov from be
queen becaus she had made an idol in a grove; and asa destroy her
idol and burnt it by the brook kidron

15:14 but the high place were not removed: nevertheless asa heart
wa perfect with the lord all hi day

15:15 and he brought in the thing which hi father had dedic and
the thing which himself had dedic into the hous of the lord
silver and gold and vessel

15:16 and there wa war between asa and baasha king of israel all
their day

15:17 and baasha king of israel went up against judah and built
ramah that he might not suffer ani to go out or come in to asa king
of judah

15:18 then asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the
treasur of the hous of the lord and the treasur of the king
hous and deliv them into the hand of hi servants: and king asa
sent them to benhadad the son of tabrimon the son of hezion king of
syria that dwelt at damascu say 15:19 there is a leagu between
me and thee and between my father and thi father: behold i have sent
unto thee a present of silver and gold; come and break thi leagu with
baasha king of israel that he may depart from me

15:20 so benhadad hearken unto king asa and sent the captain of
the host which he had against the citi of israel and smote ijon
and dan and abelbethmaachah and all cinneroth with all the land of
naphtali

15:21 and it came to pass when baasha heard thereof that he left off
build of ramah and dwelt in tirzah

15:22 then king asa made a proclam throughout all judah; none wa
exempted: and they took away the stone of ramah and the timber
thereof wherewith baasha had builded; and king asa built with them
geba of benjamin and mizpah

15:23 the rest of all the act of asa and all hi might and all that
he did and the citi which he built are they not written in the
book of the chronicl of the king of judah? nevertheless in the time
of hi old age he wa diseas in hi feet

15:24 and asa slept with hi father and wa buri with hi father
in the citi of david hi father: and jehoshaphat hi son reign in
hi stead

15:25 and nadab the son of jeroboam began to reign over israel in the
second year of asa king of judah and reign over israel two year

15:26 and he did evil in the sight of the lord and walk in the way
of hi father and in hi sin wherewith he made israel to sin

15:27 and baasha the son of ahijah of the hous of issachar
conspir against him; and baasha smote him at gibbethon which
belong to the philistines; for nadab and all israel laid sieg to
gibbethon

15:28 even in the third year of asa king of judah did baasha slay him
and reign in hi stead

15:29 and it came to pass when he reign that he smote all the
hous of jeroboam; he left not to jeroboam ani that breath until he
had destroy him accord unto the say of the lord which he
spake by hi servant ahijah the shilonite: 15:30 becaus of the sin
of jeroboam which he sin and which he made israel sin by hi
provoc wherewith he provok the lord god of israel to anger

15:31 now the rest of the act of nadab and all that he did are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel?
15:32 and there wa war between asa and baasha king of israel all
their day

15:33 in the third year of asa king of judah began baasha the son of
ahijah to reign over all israel in tirzah twenti and four year

15:34 and he did evil in the sight of the lord and walk in the way
of jeroboam and in hi sin wherewith he made israel to sin

16:1 then the word of the lord came to jehu the son of hanani against
baasha say 16:2 forasmuch as i exalt thee out of the dust and
made thee princ over my peopl israel; and thou hast walk in the
way of jeroboam and hast made my peopl israel to sin to provok me
to anger with their sins; 16:3 behold i will take away the poster
of baasha and the poster of hi house; and will make thi hous
like the hous of jeroboam the son of nebat

16:4 him that dieth of baasha in the citi shall the dog eat; and him
that dieth of hi in the field shall the fowl of the air eat

16:5 now the rest of the act of baasha and what he did and hi
might are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king
of israel? 16:6 so baasha slept with hi father and wa buri in
tirzah: and elah hi son reign in hi stead

16:7 and also by the hand of the prophet jehu the son of hanani came
the word of the lord against baasha and against hi hous even for
all the evil that he did in the sight of the lord in provok him to
anger with the work of hi hand in be like the hous of jeroboam;
and becaus he kill him

16:8 in the twenti and sixth year of asa king of judah began elah the
son of baasha to reign over israel in tirzah two year

16:9 and hi servant zimri captain of half hi chariot conspir
against him as he wa in tirzah drink himself drunk in the hous
of arza steward of hi hous in tirzah

16:10 and zimri went in and smote him and kill him in the twenti
and seventh year of asa king of judah and reign in hi stead

16:11 and it came to pass when he began to reign as soon as he sat
on hi throne that he slew all the hous of baasha: he left him not
one that pisseth against a wall neither of hi kinsfolk nor of hi
friend

16:12 thu did zimri destroy all the hous of baasha accord to the
word of the lord which he spake against baasha by jehu the prophet

16:13 for all the sin of baasha and the sin of elah hi son by
which they sin and by which they made israel to sin in provok
the lord god of israel to anger with their vaniti

16:14 now the rest of the act of elah and all that he did are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel?
16:15 in the twenti and seventh year of asa king of judah did zimri
reign seven day in tirzah and the peopl were encamp against
gibbethon which belong to the philistin

16:16 and the peopl that were encamp heard say zimri hath
conspir and hath also slain the king: wherefor all israel made
omri the captain of the host king over israel that day in the camp

16:17 and omri went up from gibbethon and all israel with him and
they besieg tirzah

16:18 and it came to pass when zimri saw that the citi wa taken
that he went into the palac of the king hous and burnt the king
hous over him with fire and die

16:19 for hi sin which he sin in do evil in the sight of the
lord in walk in the way of jeroboam and in hi sin which he did
to make israel to sin

16:20 now the rest of the act of zimri and hi treason that he
wrought are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the
king of israel? 16:21 then were the peopl of israel divid into
two parts: half of the peopl follow tibni the son of ginath to
make him king; and half follow omri

16:22 but the peopl that follow omri prevail against the peopl
that follow tibni the son of ginath: so tibni die and omri
reign

16:23 in the thirti and first year of asa king of judah began omri to
reign over israel twelv years: six year reign he in tirzah

16:24 and he bought the hill samaria of shemer for two talent of
silver and built on the hill and call the name of the citi which
he built after the name of shemer owner of the hill samaria

16:25 but omri wrought evil in the eye of the lord and did wors
than all that were befor him

16:26 for he walk in all the way of jeroboam the son of nebat and
in hi sin wherewith he made israel to sin to provok the lord god of
israel to anger with their vaniti

16:27 now the rest of the act of omri which he did and hi might
that he shew are they not written in the book of the chronicl of
the king of israel? 16:28 so omri slept with hi father and wa
buri in samaria: and ahab hi son reign in hi stead

16:29 and in the thirti and eighth year of asa king of judah began
ahab the son of omri to reign over israel: and ahab the son of omri
reign over israel in samaria twenti and two year

16:30 and ahab the son of omri did evil in the sight of the lord abov
all that were befor him

16:31 and it came to pass as if it had been a light thing for him to
walk in the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat that he took to wife
jezebel the daughter of ethbaal king of the zidonian and went and
serv baal and worship him

16:32 and he rear up an altar for baal in the hous of baal which
he had built in samaria

16:33 and ahab made a grove; and ahab did more to provok the lord god
of israel to anger than all the king of israel that were befor him

16:34 in hi day did hiel the bethelit build jericho: he laid the
foundat thereof in abiram hi firstborn and set up the gate
thereof in hi youngest son segub accord to the word of the lord
which he spake by joshua the son of nun

17:1 and elijah the tishbit who wa of the inhabit of gilead
said unto ahab as the lord god of israel liveth befor whom i stand
there shall not be dew nor rain these year but accord to my word

17:2 and the word of the lord came unto him say 17:3 get thee
henc and turn thee eastward and hide thyself by the brook cherith
that is befor jordan

17:4 and it shall be that thou shalt drink of the brook; and i have
command the raven to feed thee there

17:5 so he went and did accord unto the word of the lord: for he
went and dwelt by the brook cherith that is befor jordan

17:6 and the raven brought him bread and flesh in the morn and
bread and flesh in the evening; and he drank of the brook

17:7 and it came to pass after a while that the brook dri up
becaus there had been no rain in the land

17:8 and the word of the lord came unto him say 17:9 aris get
thee to zarephath which belongeth to zidon and dwell there: behold
i have command a widow woman there to sustain thee

17:10 so he aros and went to zarephath and when he came to the gate
of the citi behold the widow woman wa there gather of sticks:
and he call to her and said fetch me i pray thee a littl water
in a vessel that i may drink

17:11 and as she wa go to fetch it he call to her and said
bring me i pray thee a morsel of bread in thine hand

17:12 and she said as the lord thi god liveth i have not a cake but
an hand of meal in a barrel and a littl oil in a cruse: and
behold i am gather two stick that i may go in and dress it for
me and my son that we may eat it and die

17:13 and elijah said unto her fear not; go and do as thou hast said:
but make me thereof a littl cake first and bring it unto me and
after make for thee and for thi son

17:14 for thu saith the lord god of israel the barrel of meal shall
not wast neither shall the cruse of oil fail until the day that the
lord sendeth rain upon the earth

17:15 and she went and did accord to the say of elijah: and she
and he and her hous did eat mani day

17:16 and the barrel of meal wast not neither did the cruse of oil
fail accord to the word of the lord which he spake by elijah

17:17 and it came to pass after these thing that the son of the
woman the mistress of the hous fell sick; and hi sick wa so
sore that there wa no breath left in him

17:18 and she said unto elijah what have i to do with thee o thou
man of god? art thou come unto me to call my sin to remembr and
to slay my son? 17:19 and he said unto her give me thi son and he
took him out of her bosom and carri him up into a loft where he
abod and laid him upon hi own bed

17:20 and he cri unto the lord and said o lord my god hast thou
also brought evil upon the widow with whom i sojourn by slay her
son? 17:21 and he stretch himself upon the child three time and
cri unto the lord and said o lord my god i pray thee let thi
child soul come into him again

17:22 and the lord heard the voic of elijah; and the soul of the
child came into him again and he reviv

17:23 and elijah took the child and brought him down out of the
chamber into the hous and deliv him unto hi mother: and elijah
said see thi son liveth

17:24 and the woman said to elijah now by thi i know that thou art a
man of god and that the word of the lord in thi mouth is truth

18:1 and it came to pass after mani day that the word of the lord
came to elijah in the third year say go shew thyself unto ahab;
and i will send rain upon the earth

18:2 and elijah went to shew himself unto ahab and there wa a sore
famin in samaria

18:3 and ahab call obadiah which wa the governor of hi hous
(now obadiah fear the lord greatly: 18:4 for it wa so when jezebel
cut off the prophet of the lord that obadiah took an hundr
prophet and hid them by fifti in a cave and fed them with bread and
water) 18:5 and ahab said unto obadiah go into the land unto all
fountain of water and unto all brooks: peradventur we may find
grass to save the hors and mule aliv that we lose not all the
beast

18:6 so they divid the land between them to pass throughout it: ahab
went one way by himself and obadiah went anoth way by himself

18:7 and as obadiah wa in the way behold elijah met him: and he
knew him and fell on hi face and said art thou that my lord
elijah? 18:8 and he answer him i am: go tell thi lord behold
elijah is here

18:9 and he said what have i sin that thou wouldest deliv thi
servant into the hand of ahab to slay me? 18:10 as the lord thi god
liveth there is no nation or kingdom whither my lord hath not sent
to seek thee: and when they said he is not there; he took an oath of
the kingdom and nation that they found thee not

18:11 and now thou sayest go tell thi lord behold elijah is here

18:12 and it shall come to pass as soon as i am gone from thee that
the spirit of the lord shall carri thee whither i know not; and so
when i come and tell ahab and he cannot find thee he shall slay me:
but i thi servant fear the lord from my youth

18:13 wa it not told my lord what i did when jezebel slew the
prophet of the lord how i hid an hundr men of the lord prophet
by fifti in a cave and fed them with bread and water? 18:14 and now
thou sayest go tell thi lord behold elijah is here: and he shall
slay me

18:15 and elijah said as the lord of host liveth befor whom i
stand i will sure shew myself unto him to day

18:16 so obadiah went to meet ahab and told him: and ahab went to
meet elijah

18:17 and it came to pass when ahab saw elijah that ahab said unto
him art thou he that troubleth israel? 18:18 and he answer i have
not troubl israel; but thou and thi father hous in that ye have
forsaken the command of the lord and thou hast follow baalim

18:19 now therefor send and gather to me all israel unto mount
carmel and the prophet of baal four hundr and fifti and the
prophet of the grove four hundr which eat at jezebel tabl

18:20 so ahab sent unto all the children of israel and gather the
prophet togeth unto mount carmel

18:21 and elijah came unto all the peopl and said how long halt ye
between two opinions? if the lord be god follow him: but if baal
then follow him and the peopl answer him not a word

18:22 then said elijah unto the peopl i even i onli remain a
prophet of the lord; but baal prophet are four hundr and fifti
men

18:23 let them therefor give us two bullocks; and let them choos one
bullock for themselv and cut it in piec and lay it on wood and
put no fire under: and i will dress the other bullock and lay it on
wood and put no fire under: 18:24 and call ye on the name of your
god and i will call on the name of the lord: and the god that
answereth by fire let him be god and all the peopl answer and
said it is well spoken

18:25 and elijah said unto the prophet of baal choos you one
bullock for yourselv and dress it first; for ye are many; and call
on the name of your god but put no fire under

18:26 and they took the bullock which wa given them and they dress
it and call on the name of baal from morn even until noon
say o baal hear us but there wa no voic nor ani that
answer and they leap upon the altar which wa made

18:27 and it came to pass at noon that elijah mock them and said
cri aloud: for he is a god; either he is talk or he is pursu
or he is in a journey or peradventur he sleepeth and must be
awak

18:28 and they cri aloud and cut themselv after their manner with
knive and lancet till the blood gush out upon them

18:29 and it came to pass when midday wa past and they prophesi
until the time of the offer of the even sacrific that there
wa neither voic nor ani to answer nor ani that regard

18:30 and elijah said unto all the peopl come near unto me and all
the peopl came near unto him and he repair the altar of the lord
that wa broken down

18:31 and elijah took twelv stone accord to the number of the
tribe of the son of jacob unto whom the word of the lord came
say israel shall be thi name: 18:32 and with the stone he built
an altar in the name of the lord: and he made a trench about the
altar as great as would contain two measur of seed

18:33 and he put the wood in order and cut the bullock in piec and
laid him on the wood and said fill four barrel with water and pour
it on the burnt sacrific and on the wood

18:34 and he said do it the second time and they did it the second
time

and he said do it the third time and they did it the third time

18:35 and the water ran round about the altar; and he fill the
trench also with water

18:36 and it came to pass at the time of the offer of the even
sacrific that elijah the prophet came near and said lord god of
abraham isaac and of israel let it be known thi day that thou art
god in israel and that i am thi servant and that i have done all
these thing at thi word

18:37 hear me o lord hear me that thi peopl may know that thou
art the lord god and that thou hast turn their heart back again

18:38 then the fire of the lord fell and consum the burnt
sacrific and the wood and the stone and the dust and lick up
the water that wa in the trench

18:39 and when all the peopl saw it they fell on their faces: and
they said the lord he is the god; the lord he is the god

18:40 and elijah said unto them take the prophet of baal; let not
one of them escap and they took them: and elijah brought them down
to the brook kishon and slew them there

18:41 and elijah said unto ahab get thee up eat and drink; for there
is a sound of abund of rain

18:42 so ahab went up to eat and to drink and elijah went up to the
top of carmel; and he cast himself down upon the earth and put hi
face between hi knee 18:43 and said to hi servant go up now look
toward the sea and he went up and look and said there is
noth and he said go again seven time

18:44 and it came to pass at the seventh time that he said behold
there ariseth a littl cloud out of the sea like a man hand and he
said go up say unto ahab prepar thi chariot and get thee down
that the rain stop thee not

18:45 and it came to pass in the mean while that the heaven wa black
with cloud and wind and there wa a great rain and ahab rode and
went to jezreel

18:46 and the hand of the lord wa on elijah; and he gird up hi
loin and ran befor ahab to the entranc of jezreel

19:1 and ahab told jezebel all that elijah had done and withal how he
had slain all the prophet with the sword

19:2 then jezebel sent a messeng unto elijah say so let the
god do to me and more also if i make not thi life as the life of
one of them by to morrow about thi time

19:3 and when he saw that he aros and went for hi life and came
to beersheba which belongeth to judah and left hi servant there

19:4 but he himself went a day journey into the wilder and came
and sat down under a junip tree: and he request for himself that
he might die; and said it is enough; now o lord take away my life;
for i am not better than my father

19:5 and as he lay and slept under a junip tree behold then an
angel touch him and said unto him aris and eat

19:6 and he look and behold there wa a cake baken on the coal
and a cruse of water at hi head and he did eat and drink and laid
him down again

19:7 and the angel of the lord came again the second time and touch
him and said aris and eat; becaus the journey is too great for
thee

19:8 and he aros and did eat and drink and went in the strength of
that meat forti day and forti night unto horeb the mount of god

19:9 and he came thither unto a cave and lodg there; and behold
the word of the lord came to him and he said unto him what doest
thou here elijah? 19:10 and he said i have been veri jealou for
the lord god of hosts: for the children of israel have forsaken thi
coven thrown down thine altar and slain thi prophet with the
sword; and i even i onli am left; and they seek my life to take it
away

19:11 and he said go forth and stand upon the mount befor the lord

and behold the lord pass by and a great and strong wind rent the
mountain and brake in piec the rock befor the lord; but the lord
wa not in the wind: and after the wind an earthquake; but the lord
wa not in the earthquake: 19:12 and after the earthquak a fire; but
the lord wa not in the fire: and after the fire a still small voic

19:13 and it wa so when elijah heard it that he wrap hi face in
hi mantl and went out and stood in the enter in of the cave
and behold there came a voic unto him and said what doest thou
here elijah? 19:14 and he said i have been veri jealou for the
lord god of hosts: becaus the children of israel have forsaken thi
coven thrown down thine altar and slain thi prophet with the
sword; and i even i onli am left; and they seek my life to take it
away

19:15 and the lord said unto him go return on thi way to the
wilder of damascus: and when thou comest anoint hazael to be king
over syria: 19:16 and jehu the son of nimshi shalt thou anoint to be
king over israel: and elisha the son of shaphat of abelmeholah shalt
thou anoint to be prophet in thi room

19:17 and it shall come to pass that him that escapeth the sword of
hazael shall jehu slay: and him that escapeth from the sword of jehu
shall elisha slay

19:18 yet i have left me seven thousand in israel all the knee which
have not bow unto baal and everi mouth which hath not kiss him

19:19 so he depart thenc and found elisha the son of shaphat who
wa plow with twelv yoke of oxen befor him and he with the
twelfth: and elijah pass by him and cast hi mantl upon him

19:20 and he left the oxen and ran after elijah and said let me i
pray thee kiss my father and my mother and then i will follow thee
and he said unto him go back again: for what have i done to thee?
19:21 and he return back from him and took a yoke of oxen and slew
them and boil their flesh with the instrument of the oxen and
gave unto the peopl and they did eat then he aros and went after
elijah and minist unto him

20:1 and benhadad the king of syria gather all hi host together:
and there were thirti and two king with him and hors and
chariots; and he went up and besieg samaria and war against it

20:2 and he sent messeng to ahab king of israel into the citi and
said unto him thu saith benhadad 20:3 thi silver and thi gold is
mine; thi wive also and thi children even the goodliest are mine

20:4 and the king of israel answer and said my lord o king
accord to thi say i am thine and all that i have

20:5 and the messeng came again and said thu speaketh benhadad
say although i have sent unto thee say thou shalt deliv me
thi silver and thi gold and thi wive and thi children; 20:6 yet i
will send my servant unto thee to morrow about thi time and they
shall search thine hous and the hous of thi servants; and it shall
be that whatsoev is pleasant in thine eye they shall put it in
their hand and take it away

20:7 then the king of israel call all the elder of the land and
said mark i pray you and see how thi man seeketh mischief: for he
sent unto me for my wive and for my children and for my silver and
for my gold; and i deni him not

20:8 and all the elder and all the peopl said unto him hearken not
unto him nor consent

20:9 wherefor he said unto the messeng of benhadad tell my lord
the king all that thou didst send for to thi servant at the first i
will do: but thi thing i may not do and the messeng depart and
brought him word again

20:10 and benhadad sent unto him and said the god do so unto me
and more also if the dust of samaria shall suffic for hand for
all the peopl that follow me

20:11 and the king of israel answer and said tell him let not him
that girdeth on hi har boast himself as he that putteth it off

20:12 and it came to pass when ben-hadad heard thi messag as he
wa drink he and the king in the pavilion that he said unto hi
servant set yourselv in array and they set themselv in array
against the citi

20:13 and behold there came a prophet unto ahab king of israel
say thu saith the lord hast thou seen all thi great multitude?
behold i will deliv it into thine hand thi day; and thou shalt
know that i am the lord

20:14 and ahab said by whom? and he said thu saith the lord even
by the young men of the princ of the provinc then he said who
shall order the battle? and he answer thou

20:15 then he number the young men of the princ of the provinc
and they were two hundr and thirti two: and after them he number
all the peopl even all the children of israel be seven thousand

20:16 and they went out at noon but benhadad wa drink himself
drunk in the pavilion he and the king the thirti and two king
that help him

20:17 and the young men of the princ of the provinc went out
first; and benhadad sent out and they told him say there are men
come out of samaria

20:18 and he said whether they be come out for peac take them
alive; or whether they be come out for war take them aliv

20:19 so these young men of the princ of the provinc came out of
the citi and the armi which follow them

20:20 and they slew everi one hi man: and the syrian fled; and
israel pursu them: and benhadad the king of syria escap on an
hors with the horsemen

20:21 and the king of israel went out and smote the hors and
chariot and slew the syrian with a great slaughter

20:22 and the prophet came to the king of israel and said unto him
go strengthen thyself and mark and see what thou doest: for at the
return of the year the king of syria will come up against thee

20:23 and the servant of the king of syria said unto him their god
are god of the hills; therefor they were stronger than we; but let
us fight against them in the plain and sure we shall be stronger
than they

20:24 and do thi thing take the king away everi man out of hi
place and put captain in their rooms: 20:25 and number thee an armi
like the armi that thou hast lost hors for hors and chariot for
chariot: and we will fight against them in the plain and sure we
shall be stronger than they and he hearken unto their voic and
did so

20:26 and it came to pass at the return of the year that benhadad
number the syrian and went up to aphek to fight against israel

20:27 and the children of israel were number and were all present
and went against them: and the children of israel pitch befor them
like two littl flock of kids; but the syrian fill the countri

20:28 and there came a man of god and spake unto the king of israel
and said thu saith the lord becaus the syrian have said the lord
is god of the hill but he is not god of the valley therefor will
i deliv all thi great multitud into thine hand and ye shall know
that i am the lord

20:29 and they pitch one over against the other seven day and so
it wa that in the seventh day the battl wa joined: and the
children of israel slew of the syrian an hundr thousand footmen in
one day

20:30 but the rest fled to aphek into the city; and there a wall fell
upon twenti and seven thousand of the men that were left and benhadad
fled and came into the citi into an inner chamber

20:31 and hi servant said unto him behold now we have heard that
the king of the hous of israel are merci kings: let us i pray
thee put sackcloth on our loin and rope upon our head and go out
to the king of israel: peradventur he will save thi life

20:32 so they gird sackcloth on their loin and put rope on their
head and came to the king of israel and said thi servant benhadad
saith i pray thee let me live and he said is he yet alive? he is
my brother

20:33 now the men did dilig observ whether ani thing would come
from him and did hastili catch it: and they said thi brother
benhadad then he said go ye bring him then benhadad came forth to
him; and he caus him to come up into the chariot

20:34 and ben-hadad said unto him the citi which my father took
from thi father i will restore; and thou shalt make street for thee
in damascu as my father made in samaria then said ahab i will send
thee away with thi coven so he made a coven with him and sent
him away

20:35 and a certain man of the son of the prophet said unto hi
neighbour in the word of the lord smite me i pray thee and the man
refus to smite him

20:36 then said he unto him becaus thou hast not obey the voic of
the lord behold as soon as thou art depart from me a lion shall
slay thee

and as soon as he wa depart from him a lion found him and slew
him

20:37 then he found anoth man and said smite me i pray thee and
the man smote him so that in smite he wound him

20:38 so the prophet depart and wait for the king by the way and
disguis himself with ash upon hi face

20:39 and as the king pass by he cri unto the king: and he said
thi servant went out into the midst of the battle; and behold a man
turn asid and brought a man unto me and said keep thi man: if
by ani mean he be miss then shall thi life be for hi life or
els thou shalt pay a talent of silver

20:40 and as thi servant wa busi here and there he wa gone and the
king of israel said unto him so shall thi judgment be; thyself hast
decid it

20:41 and he hast and took the ash away from hi face; and the
king of israel discern him that he wa of the prophet

20:42 and he said unto him thu saith the lord becaus thou hast let
go out of thi hand a man whom i appoint to utter destruct
therefor thi life shall go for hi life and thi peopl for hi
peopl

20:43 and the king of israel went to hi hous heavi and displeas
and came to samaria

21:1 and it came to pass after these thing that naboth the
jezreelit had a vineyard which wa in jezreel hard by the palac of
ahab king of samaria

21:2 and ahab spake unto naboth say give me thi vineyard that i
may have it for a garden of herb becaus it is near unto my house:
and i will give thee for it a better vineyard than it; or if it seem
good to thee i will give thee the worth of it in money

21:3 and naboth said to ahab the lord forbid it me that i should
give the inherit of my father unto thee

21:4 and ahab came into hi hous heavi and displeas becaus of the
word which naboth the jezreelit had spoken to him: for he had said i
will not give thee the inherit of my father and he laid him down
upon hi bed and turn away hi face and would eat no bread

21:5 but jezebel hi wife came to him and said unto him whi is thi
spirit so sad that thou eatest no bread? 21:6 and he said unto her
becaus i spake unto naboth the jezreelit and said unto him give me
thi vineyard for money; or els if it pleas thee i will give thee
anoth vineyard for it: and he answer i will not give thee my
vineyard

21:7 and jezebel hi wife said unto him dost thou now govern the
kingdom of israel? aris and eat bread and let thine heart be merry:
i will give thee the vineyard of naboth the jezreelit

21:8 so she wrote letter in ahab name and seal them with hi
seal and sent the letter unto the elder and to the nobl that were
in hi citi dwell with naboth

21:9 and she wrote in the letter say proclaim a fast and set
naboth on high among the people: 21:10 and set two men son of
belial befor him to bear wit against him say thou didst
blasphem god and the king and then carri him out and stone him
that he may die

21:11 and the men of hi citi even the elder and the nobl who were
the inhabit in hi citi did as jezebel had sent unto them and as
it wa written in the letter which she had sent unto them

21:12 they proclaim a fast and set naboth on high among the peopl

21:13 and there came in two men children of belial and sat befor
him: and the men of belial wit against him even against naboth
in the presenc of the peopl say naboth did blasphem god and
the king then they carri him forth out of the citi and stone him
with stone that he die

21:14 then they sent to jezebel say naboth is stone and is
dead

21:15 and it came to pass when jezebel heard that naboth wa stone
and wa dead that jezebel said to ahab aris take possess of the
vineyard of naboth the jezreelit which he refus to give thee for
money: for naboth is not aliv but dead

21:16 and it came to pass when ahab heard that naboth wa dead that
ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of naboth the jezreelit to
take possess of it

21:17 and the word of the lord came to elijah the tishbit say
21:18 aris go down to meet ahab king of israel which is in samaria:
behold he is in the vineyard of naboth whither he is gone down to
possess it

21:19 and thou shalt speak unto him say thu saith the lord hast
thou kill and also taken possession? and thou shalt speak unto him
say thu saith the lord in the place where dog lick the blood
of naboth shall dog lick thi blood even thine

21:20 and ahab said to elijah hast thou found me o mine enemy? and
he answer i have found thee: becaus thou hast sold thyself to work
evil in the sight of the lord

21:21 behold i will bring evil upon thee and will take away thi
poster and will cut off from ahab him that pisseth against the
wall and him that is shut up and left in israel 21:22 and will make
thine hous like the hous of jeroboam the son of nebat and like the
hous of baasha the son of ahijah for the provoc wherewith thou
hast provok me to anger and made israel to sin

21:23 and of jezebel also spake the lord say the dog shall eat
jezebel by the wall of jezreel

21:24 him that dieth of ahab in the citi the dog shall eat; and him
that dieth in the field shall the fowl of the air eat

21:25 but there wa none like unto ahab which did sell himself to
work wicked in the sight of the lord whom jezebel hi wife
stir up

21:26 and he did veri abomin in follow idol accord to all
thing as did the amorit whom the lord cast out befor the children
of israel

21:27 and it came to pass when ahab heard those word that he rent
hi cloth and put sackcloth upon hi flesh and fast and lay in
sackcloth and went softli

21:28 and the word of the lord came to elijah the tishbit say
21:29 seest thou how ahab humbleth himself befor me? becaus he
humbleth himself befor me i will not bring the evil in hi days: but
in hi son day will i bring the evil upon hi hous

22:1 and they continu three year without war between syria and
israel

22:2 and it came to pass in the third year that jehoshaphat the king
of judah came down to the king of israel

22:3 and the king of israel said unto hi servant know ye that
ramoth in gilead is our and we be still and take it not out of the
hand of the king of syria? 22:4 and he said unto jehoshaphat wilt
thou go with me to battl to ramothgilead? and jehoshaphat said to the
king of israel i am as thou art my peopl as thi peopl my hors
as thi hors

22:5 and jehoshaphat said unto the king of israel enquir i pray
thee at the word of the lord to day

22:6 then the king of israel gather the prophet togeth about
four hundr men and said unto them shall i go against ramothgilead
to battl or shall i forbear? and they said go up; for the lord
shall deliv it into the hand of the king

22:7 and jehoshaphat said is there not here a prophet of the lord
besid that we might enquir of him? 22:8 and the king of israel
said unto jehoshaphat there is yet one man micaiah the son of imlah
by whom we may enquir of the lord: but i hate him; for he doth not
prophesi good concern me but evil and jehoshaphat said let not
the king say so

22:9 then the king of israel call an offic and said hasten
hither micaiah the son of imlah

22:10 and the king of israel and jehoshaphat the king of judah sat
each on hi throne have put on their robe in a void place in the
entranc of the gate of samaria; and all the prophet prophesi
befor them

22:11 and zedekiah the son of chenaanah made him horn of iron: and he
said thu saith the lord with these shalt thou push the syrian
until thou have consum them

22:12 and all the prophet prophesi so say go up to
ramothgilead and prosper: for the lord shall deliv it into the
king hand

22:13 and the messeng that wa gone to call micaiah spake unto him
say behold now the word of the prophet declar good unto the
king with one mouth: let thi word i pray thee be like the word of
one of them and speak that which is good

22:14 and micaiah said as the lord liveth what the lord saith unto
me that will i speak

22:15 so he came to the king and the king said unto him micaiah
shall we go against ramothgilead to battl or shall we forbear? and
he answer him go and prosper: for the lord shall deliv it into
the hand of the king

22:16 and the king said unto him how mani time shall i adjur thee
that thou tell me noth but that which is true in the name of the
lord? 22:17 and he said i saw all israel scatter upon the hill
as sheep that have not a shepherd: and the lord said these have no
master: let them return everi man to hi hous in peac

22:18 and the king of israel said unto jehoshaphat did i not tell
thee that he would prophesi no good concern me but evil? 22:19
and he said hear thou therefor the word of the lord: i saw the lord
sit on hi throne and all the host of heaven stand by him on
hi right hand and on hi left

22:20 and the lord said who shall persuad ahab that he may go up
and fall at ramothgilead? and one said on thi manner and anoth
said on that manner

22:21 and there came forth a spirit and stood befor the lord and
said i will persuad him

22:22 and the lord said unto him wherewith? and he said i will go
forth and i will be a lie spirit in the mouth of all hi prophet
and he said thou shalt persud him and prevail also: go forth and
do so

22:23 now therefor behold the lord hath put a lie spirit in the
mouth of all these thi prophet and the lord hath spoken evil
concern thee

22:24 but zedekiah the son of chenaanah went near and smote micaiah
on the cheek and said which way went the spirit of the lord from me
to speak unto thee? 22:25 and micaiah said behold thou shalt see in
that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself

22:26 and the king of israel said take micaiah and carri him back
unto amon the governor of the citi and to joash the king son; 22:27
and say thu saith the king put thi fellow in the prison and feed
him with bread of afflict and with water of afflict until i
come in peac

22:28 and micaiah said if thou return at all in peac the lord hath
not spoken by me and he said hearken o peopl everi one of you

22:29 so the king of israel and jehoshaphat the king of judah went up
to ramothgilead

22:30 and the king of israel said unto jehoshaphat i will disguis
myself and enter into the battle; but put thou on thi robe and the
king of israel disguis himself and went into the battl

22:31 but the king of syria command hi thirti and two captain that
had rule over hi chariot say fight neither with small nor
great save onli with the king of israel

22:32 and it came to pass when the captain of the chariot saw
jehoshaphat that they said sure it is the king of israel and they
turn asid to fight against him: and jehoshaphat cri out

22:33 and it came to pass when the captain of the chariot perceiv
that it wa not the king of israel that they turn back from
pursu him

22:34 and a certain man drew a bow at a ventur and smote the king of
israel between the joint of the harness: wherefor he said unto the
driver of hi chariot turn thine hand and carri me out of the host;
for i am wound

22:35 and the battl increas that day: and the king wa stay up in
hi chariot against the syrian and die at even: and the blood ran
out of the wound into the midst of the chariot

22:36 and there went a proclam throughout the host about the
go down of the sun say everi man to hi citi and everi man to
hi own countri

22:37 so the king die and wa brought to samaria; and they buri
the king in samaria

22:38 and one wash the chariot in the pool of samaria; and the dog
lick up hi blood; and they wash hi armour; accord unto the
word of the lord which he spake

22:39 now the rest of the act of ahab and all that he did and the
ivori hous which he made and all the citi that he built are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel?
22:40 so ahab slept with hi fathers; and ahaziah hi son reign in
hi stead

22:41 and jehoshaphat the son of asa began to reign over judah in the
fourth year of ahab king of israel

22:42 jehoshaphat wa thirti and five year old when he began to
reign; and he reign twenti and five year in jerusalem and hi
mother name wa azubah the daughter of shilhi

22:43 and he walk in all the way of asa hi father; he turn not
asid from it do that which wa right in the eye of the lord:
nevertheless the high place were not taken away; for the peopl
offer and burnt incens yet in the high place

22:44 and jehoshaphat made peac with the king of israel

22:45 now the rest of the act of jehoshaphat and hi might that he
shew and how he war are they not written in the book of the
chronicl of the king of judah? 22:46 and the remnant of the
sodomit which remain in the day of hi father asa he took out
of the land

22:47 there wa then no king in edom: a deputi wa king

22:48 jehoshaphat made ship of tharshish to go to ophir for gold: but
they went not; for the ship were broken at eziongeb

22:49 then said ahaziah the son of ahab unto jehoshaphat let my
servant go with thi servant in the ship but jehoshaphat would not

22:50 and jehoshaphat slept with hi father and wa buri with hi
father in the citi of david hi father: and jehoram hi son reign
in hi stead

22:51 ahaziah the son of ahab began to reign over israel in samaria
the seventeenth year of jehoshaphat king of judah and reign two
year over israel

22:52 and he did evil in the sight of the lord and walk in the way
of hi father and in the way of hi mother and in the way of
jeroboam the son of nebat who made israel to sin: 22:53 for he serv
baal and worship him and provok to anger the lord god of
israel accord to all that hi father had done




the first book of the king

commonli called:

the fourth book of the king


1:1 then moab rebel against israel after the death of ahab

1:2 and ahaziah fell down through a lattic in hi upper chamber that
wa in samaria and wa sick: and he sent messeng and said unto
them go enquir of baalzebub the god of ekron whether i shall
recov of thi diseas

1:3 but the angel of the lord said to elijah the tishbit aris go
up to meet the messeng of the king of samaria and say unto them
is it not becaus there is not a god in israel that ye go to enquir
of baalzebub the god of ekron? 1:4 now therefor thu saith the lord
thou shalt not come down from that bed on which thou art gone up but
shalt sure die and elijah depart

1:5 and when the messeng turn back unto him he said unto them
whi are ye now turn back? 1:6 and they said unto him there came a
man up to meet us and said unto us go turn again unto the king that
sent you and say unto him thu saith the lord is it not becaus
there is not a god in israel that thou sendest to enquir of
