baalzebub the god of ekron? therefor thou shalt not come down from
that bed on which thou art gone up but shalt sure die

1:7 and he said unto them what manner of man wa he which came up to
meet you and told you these words? 1:8 and they answer him he wa
an hairi man and girt with a girdl of leather about hi loin and
he said it is elijah the tishbit

1:9 then the king sent unto him a captain of fifti with hi fifti and
he went up to him: and behold he sat on the top of an hill and he
spake unto him thou man of god the king hath said come down

1:10 and elijah answer and said to the captain of fifti if i be a
man of god then let fire come down from heaven and consum thee and
thi fifti

and there came down fire from heaven and consum him and hi fifti

1:11 again also he sent unto him anoth captain of fifti with hi
fifti

and he answer and said unto him o man of god thu hath the king
said come down quickli

1:12 and elijah answer and said unto them if i be a man of god let
fire come down from heaven and consum thee and thi fifti and the
fire of god came down from heaven and consum him and hi fifti

1:13 and he sent again a captain of the third fifti with hi fifti
and the third captain of fifti went up and came and fell on hi knee
befor elijah and besought him and said unto him o man of god i
pray thee let my life and the life of these fifti thi servant be
preciou in thi sight

1:14 behold there came fire down from heaven and burnt up the two
captain of the former fifti with their fifties: therefor let my
life now be preciou in thi sight

1:15 and the angel of the lord said unto elijah go down with him: be
not afraid of him and he aros and went down with him unto the king

1:16 and he said unto him thu saith the lord forasmuch as thou hast
sent messeng to enquir of baalzebub the god of ekron is it not
becaus there is no god in israel to enquir of hi word? therefor
thou shalt not come down off that bed on which thou art gone up but
shalt sure die

1:17 so he die accord to the word of the lord which elijah had
spoken

and jehoram reign in hi stead in the second year of jehoram the son
of jehoshaphat king of judah; becaus he had no son

1:18 now the rest of the act of ahaziah which he did are they not
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel? 2:1 and
it came to pass when the lord would take up elijah into heaven by a
whirlwind that elijah went with elisha from gilgal

2:2 and elijah said unto elisha tarri here i pray thee; for the lord
hath sent me to bethel and elisha said unto him as the lord liveth
and as thi soul liveth i will not leav thee so they went down to
bethel

2:3 and the son of the prophet that were at bethel came forth to
elisha and said unto him knowest thou that the lord will take away
thi master from thi head to day? and he said yea i know it; hold ye
your peac

2:4 and elijah said unto him elisha tarri here i pray thee; for the
lord hath sent me to jericho and he said as the lord liveth and as
thi soul liveth i will not leav thee so they came to jericho

2:5 and the son of the prophet that were at jericho came to elisha
and said unto him knowest thou that the lord will take away thi
master from thi head to day? and he answer yea i know it; hold ye
your peac

2:6 and elijah said unto him tarri i pray thee here; for the lord
hath sent me to jordan and he said as the lord liveth and as thi
soul liveth i will not leav thee and they two went on

2:7 and fifti men of the son of the prophet went and stood to view
afar off: and they two stood by jordan

2:8 and elijah took hi mantl and wrap it togeth and smote the
water and they were divid hither and thither so that they two
went over on dri ground

2:9 and it came to pass when they were gone over that elijah said
unto elisha ask what i shall do for thee befor i be taken away from
thee and elisha said i pray thee let a doubl portion of thi spirit
be upon me

2:10 and he said thou hast ask a hard thing: nevertheless if thou
see me when i am taken from thee it shall be so unto thee; but if
not it shall not be so

2:11 and it came to pass as they still went on and talk that
behold there appear a chariot of fire and hors of fire and
part them both asunder; and elijah went up by a whirlwind into
heaven

2:12 and elisha saw it and he cri my father my father the
chariot of israel and the horsemen thereof and he saw him no more:
and he took hold of hi own cloth and rent them in two piec

2:13 he took up also the mantl of elijah that fell from him and went
back and stood by the bank of jordan; 2:14 and he took the mantl of
elijah that fell from him and smote the water and said where is
the lord god of elijah? and when he also had smitten the water they
part hither and thither: and elisha went over

2:15 and when the son of the prophet which were to view at jericho
saw him they said the spirit of elijah doth rest on elisha and they
came to meet him and bow themselv to the ground befor him

2:16 and they said unto him behold now there be with thi servant
fifti strong men; let them go we pray thee and seek thi master: lest
peradventur the spirit of the lord hath taken him up and cast him
upon some mountain or into some valley and he said ye shall not
send

2:17 and when they urg him till he wa asham he said send they
sent therefor fifti men; and they sought three day but found him
not

2:18 and when they came again to him (for he tarri at jericho) he
said unto them did i not say unto you go not? 2:19 and the men of
the citi said unto elisha behold i pray thee the situat of thi
citi is pleasant as my lord seeth: but the water is naught and the
ground barren

2:20 and he said bring me a new cruse and put salt therein and they
brought it to him

2:21 and he went forth unto the spring of the water and cast the
salt in there and said thu saith the lord i have heal these
waters; there shall not be from thenc ani more death or barren land

2:22 so the water were heal unto thi day accord to the say
of elisha which he spake

2:23 and he went up from thenc unto bethel: and as he wa go up by
the way there came forth littl children out of the citi and mock
him and said unto him go up thou bald head; go up thou bald head

2:24 and he turn back and look on them and curs them in the
name of the lord and there came forth two she bear out of the wood
and tare forti and two children of them

2:25 and he went from thenc to mount carmel and from thenc he
return to samaria

3:1 now jehoram the son of ahab began to reign over israel in samaria
the eighteenth year of jehoshaphat king of judah and reign twelv
year

3:2 and he wrought evil in the sight of the lord; but not like hi
father and like hi mother: for he put away the imag of baal that
hi father had made

3:3 nevertheless he cleav unto the sin of jeroboam the son of
nebat which made israel to sin; he depart not therefrom

3:4 and mesha king of moab wa a sheepmast and render unto the
king of israel an hundr thousand lamb and an hundr thousand
ram with the wool

3:5 but it came to pass when ahab wa dead that the king of moab
rebel against the king of israel

3:6 and king jehoram went out of samaria the same time and number
all israel

3:7 and he went and sent to jehoshaphat the king of judah say the
king of moab hath rebel against me: wilt thou go with me against
moab to battle? and he said i will go up: i am as thou art my peopl
as thi peopl and my hors as thi hors

3:8 and he said which way shall we go up? and he answer the way
through the wilder of edom

3:9 so the king of israel went and the king of judah and the king of
edom: and they fetch a compass of seven day journey: and there wa
no water for the host and for the cattl that follow them

3:10 and the king of israel said alas! that the lord hath call
these three king togeth to deliv them into the hand of moab!
3:11 but jehoshaphat said is there not here a prophet of the lord
that we may enquir of the lord by him? and one of the king of
israel servant answer and said here is elisha the son of
shaphat which pour water on the hand of elijah

3:12 and jehoshaphat said the word of the lord is with him so the
king of israel and jehoshaphat and the king of edom went down to him

3:13 and elisha said unto the king of israel what have i to do with
thee? get thee to the prophet of thi father and to the prophet of
thi mother

and the king of israel said unto him nay: for the lord hath call
these three king togeth to deliv them into the hand of moab

3:14 and elisha said as the lord of host liveth befor whom i
stand sure were it not that i regard the presenc of jehoshaphat
the king of judah i would not look toward thee nor see thee

3:15 but now bring me a minstrel and it came to pass when the
minstrel play that the hand of the lord came upon him

3:16 and he said thu saith the lord make thi valley full of
ditch

3:17 for thu saith the lord ye shall not see wind neither shall ye
see rain; yet that valley shall be fill with water that ye may
drink both ye and your cattl and your beast

3:18 and thi is but a light thing in the sight of the lord: he will
deliv the moabit also into your hand

3:19 and ye shall smite everi fenc citi and everi choic citi and
shall fell everi good tree and stop all well of water and mar everi
good piec of land with stone

3:20 and it came to pass in the morn when the meat offer wa
offer that behold there came water by the way of edom and the
countri wa fill with water

3:21 and when all the moabit heard that the king were come up to
fight against them they gather all that were abl to put on armour
and upward and stood in the border

3:22 and they rose up earli in the morn and the sun shone upon the
water and the moabit saw the water on the other side as red as
blood: 3:23 and they said thi is blood: the king are sure slain
and they have smitten one another: now therefor moab to the spoil

3:24 and when they came to the camp of israel the israelit rose up
and smote the moabit so that they fled befor them: but they went
forward smite the moabit even in their countri

3:25 and they beat down the citi and on everi good piec of land
cast everi man hi stone and fill it; and they stop all the
well of water and fell all the good trees: onli in kirharaseth
left they the stone thereof; howbeit the slinger went about it and
smote it

3:26 and when the king of moab saw that the battl wa too sore for
him he took with him seven hundr men that drew sword to break
through even unto the king of edom: but they could not

3:27 then he took hi eldest son that should have reign in hi
stead and offer him for a burnt offer upon the wall and there
wa great indign against israel: and they depart from him and
return to their own land

4:1 now there cri a certain woman of the wive of the son of the
prophet unto elisha say thi servant my husband is dead; and thou
knowest that thi servant did fear the lord: and the creditor is come
to take unto him my two son to be bondmen

4:2 and elisha said unto her what shall i do for thee? tell me what
hast thou in the house? and she said thine handmaid hath not ani
thing in the hous save a pot of oil

4:3 then he said go borrow thee vessel abroad of all thi
neighbour even empti vessels; borrow not a few

4:4 and when thou art come in thou shalt shut the door upon thee and
upon thi son and shalt pour out into all those vessel and thou
shalt set asid that which is full

4:5 so she went from him and shut the door upon her and upon her
son who brought the vessel to her; and she pour out

4:6 and it came to pass when the vessel were full that she said
unto her son bring me yet a vessel and he said unto her there is
not a vessel more and the oil stay

4:7 then she came and told the man of god and he said go sell the
oil and pay thi debt and live thou and thi children of the rest

4:8 and it fell on a day that elisha pass to shunem where wa a
great woman; and she constrain him to eat bread and so it wa that
as oft as he pass by he turn in thither to eat bread

4:9 and she said unto her husband behold now i perceiv that thi is
an holi man of god which passeth by us continu

4:10 let us make a littl chamber i pray thee on the wall; and let
us set for him there a bed and a tabl and a stool and a
candlestick: and it shall be when he cometh to us that he shall turn
in thither

4:11 and it fell on a day that he came thither and he turn into
the chamber and lay there

4:12 and he said to gehazi hi servant call thi shunammit and when
he had call her she stood befor him

4:13 and he said unto him say now unto her behold thou hast been
care for us with all thi care; what is to be done for thee?
wouldest thou be spoken for to the king or to the captain of the
host? and she answer i dwell among mine own peopl

4:14 and he said what then is to be done for her? and gehazi
answer verili she hath no child and her husband is old

4:15 and he said call her and when he had call her she stood in
the door

4:16 and he said about thi season accord to the time of life
thou shalt embrac a son and she said nay my lord thou man of god
do not lie unto thine handmaid

4:17 and the woman conceiv and bare a son at that season that
elisha had said unto her accord to the time of life

4:18 and when the child wa grown it fell on a day that he went out
to hi father to the reaper

4:19 and he said unto hi father my head my head and he said to a
lad carri him to hi mother

4:20 and when he had taken him and brought him to hi mother he sat
on her knee till noon and then die

4:21 and she went up and laid him on the bed of the man of god and
shut the door upon him and went out

4:22 and she call unto her husband and said send me i pray thee
one of the young men and one of the ass that i may run to the man
of god and come again

4:23 and he said wherefor wilt thou go to him to day? it is neither
new moon nor sabbath and she said it shall be well

4:24 then she saddl an ass and said to her servant drive and go
forward; slack not thi ride for me except i bid thee

4:25 so she went and came unto the man of god to mount carmel and it
came to pass when the man of god saw her afar off that he said to
gehazi hi servant behold yonder is that shunammite: 4:26 run now i
pray thee to meet her and say unto her is it well with thee? is it
well with thi husband? is it well with the child? and she answer it
is well: 4:27 and when she came to the man of god to the hill she
caught him by the feet: but gehazi came near to thrust her away and
the man of god said let her alone; for her soul is vex within her:
and the lord hath hid it from me and hath not told me

4:28 then she said did i desir a son of my lord? did i not say do
not deceiv me? 4:29 then he said to gehazi gird up thi loin and
take my staff in thine hand and go thi way: if thou meet ani man
salut him not; and if ani salut thee answer him not again: and lay
my staff upon the face of the child

4:30 and the mother of the child said as the lord liveth and as thi
soul liveth i will not leav thee and he aros and follow her

4:31 and gehazi pass on befor them and laid the staff upon the
face of the child; but there wa neither voic nor hear wherefor
he went again to meet him and told him say the child is not
awak

4:32 and when elisha wa come into the hous behold the child wa
dead and laid upon hi bed

4:33 he went in therefor and shut the door upon them twain and
pray unto the lord

4:34 and he went up and lay upon the child and put hi mouth upon
hi mouth and hi eye upon hi eye and hi hand upon hi hands:
and stretch himself upon the child; and the flesh of the child wax
warm

4:35 then he return and walk in the hous to and fro; and went
up and stretch himself upon him: and the child sneez seven time
and the child open hi eye

4:36 and he call gehazi and said call thi shunammit so he
call her and when she wa come in unto him he said take up thi
son

4:37 then she went in and fell at hi feet and bow herself to the
ground and took up her son and went out

4:38 and elisha came again to gilgal: and there wa a dearth in the
land; and the son of the prophet were sit befor him: and he
said unto hi servant set on the great pot and seeth pottag for
the son of the prophet

4:39 and one went out into the field to gather herb and found a wild
vine and gather thereof wild gourd hi lap full and came and
shred them into the pot of pottage: for they knew them not

4:40 so they pour out for the men to eat and it came to pass as
they were eat of the pottag that they cri out and said o thou
man of god there is death in the pot and they could not eat thereof

4:41 but he said then bring meal and he cast it into the pot; and he
said pour out for the peopl that they may eat and there wa no
harm in the pot

4:42 and there came a man from baalshalisha and brought the man of
god bread of the firstfruit twenti loav of barley and full ear
of corn in the husk thereof and he said give unto the peopl that
they may eat

4:43 and hi servitor said what should i set thi befor an hundr
men? he said again give the peopl that they may eat: for thu
saith the lord they shall eat and shall leav thereof

4:44 so he set it befor them and they did eat and left thereof
accord to the word of the lord

5:1 now naaman captain of the host of the king of syria wa a great
man with hi master and honour becaus by him the lord had given
deliver unto syria: he wa also a mighti man in valour but he wa
a leper

5:2 and the syrian had gone out by compani and had brought away
captiv out of the land of israel a littl maid; and she wait on
naaman wife

5:3 and she said unto her mistress would god my lord were with the
prophet that is in samaria! for he would recov him of hi leprosi

5:4 and one went in and told hi lord say thu and thu said the
maid that is of the land of israel

5:5 and the king of syria said go to go and i will send a letter
unto the king of israel and he depart and took with him ten
talent of silver and six thousand piec of gold and ten chang of
raiment

5:6 and he brought the letter to the king of israel say now when
thi letter is come unto thee behold i have therewith sent naaman my
servant to thee that thou mayest recov him of hi leprosi

5:7 and it came to pass when the king of israel had read the letter
that he rent hi cloth and said am i god to kill and to make
aliv that thi man doth send unto me to recov a man of hi
leprosy? wherefor consid i pray you and see how he seeketh a
quarrel against me

5:8 and it wa so when elisha the man of god had heard that the king
of israel had rent hi cloth that he sent to the king say
wherefor hast thou rent thi clothes? let him come now to me and he
shall know that there is a prophet in israel

5:9 so naaman came with hi hors and with hi chariot and stood at
the door of the hous of elisha

5:10 and elisha sent a messeng unto him say go and wash in
jordan seven time and thi flesh shall come again to thee and thou
shalt be clean

5:11 but naaman wa wroth and went away and said behold i thought
he will sure come out to me and stand and call on the name of the
lord hi god and strike hi hand over the place and recov the
leper

5:12 are not abana and pharpar river of damascu better than all
the water of israel? may i not wash in them and be clean? so he
turn and went away in a rage

5:13 and hi servant came near and spake unto him and said my
father if the prophet had bid thee do some great thing wouldest thou
not have done it? how much rather then when he saith to thee wash
and be clean? 5:14 then went he down and dip himself seven time
in jordan accord to the say of the man of god: and hi flesh
came again like unto the flesh of a littl child and he wa clean

5:15 and he return to the man of god he and all hi compani and
came and stood befor him: and he said behold now i know that there
is no god in all the earth but in israel: now therefor i pray thee
take a bless of thi servant

5:16 but he said as the lord liveth befor whom i stand i will
receiv none and he urg him to take it; but he refus

5:17 and naaman said shall there not then i pray thee be given to
thi servant two mule burden of earth? for thi servant will
henceforth offer neither burnt offer nor sacrific unto other god
but unto the lord

5:18 in thi thing the lord pardon thi servant that when my master
goeth into the hous of rimmon to worship there and he leaneth on my
hand and i bow myself in the hous of rimmon: when i bow down myself
in the hous of rimmon the lord pardon thi servant in thi thing

5:19 and he said unto him go in peac so he depart from him a
littl way

5:20 but gehazi the servant of elisha the man of god said behold
my master hath spare naaman thi syrian in not receiv at hi
hand that which he brought: but as the lord liveth i will run after
him and take somewhat of him

5:21 so gehazi follow after naaman and when naaman saw him run
after him he light down from the chariot to meet him and said is
all well? 5:22 and he said all is well my master hath sent me
say behold even now there be come to me from mount ephraim two
young men of the son of the prophets: give them i pray thee a
talent of silver and two chang of garment

5:23 and naaman said be content take two talent and he urg him
and bound two talent of silver in two bag with two chang of
garment and laid them upon two of hi servants; and they bare them
befor him

5:24 and when he came to the tower he took them from their hand and
bestow them in the house: and he let the men go and they depart

5:25 but he went in and stood befor hi master and elisha said unto
him whenc comest thou gehazi? and he said thi servant went no
whither

5:26 and he said unto him went not mine heart with thee when the man
turn again from hi chariot to meet thee? is it a time to receiv
money and to receiv garment and oliveyard and vineyard and
sheep and oxen and menserv and maidservants? 5:27 the leprosi
therefor of naaman shall cleav unto thee and unto thi seed for
ever and he went out from hi presenc a leper as white as snow

6:1 and the son of the prophet said unto elisha behold now the
place where we dwell with thee is too strait for us

6:2 let us go we pray thee unto jordan and take thenc everi man a
beam and let us make us a place there where we may dwell and he
answer go ye

6:3 and one said be content i pray thee and go with thi servant
and he answer i will go

6:4 so he went with them and when they came to jordan they cut down
wood

6:5 but as one wa fell a beam the axe head fell into the water:
and he cri and said ala master! for it wa borrow

6:6 and the man of god said where fell it? and he shew him the
place

and he cut down a stick and cast it in thither; and the iron did
swim

6:7 therefor said he take it up to thee and he put out hi hand
and took it

6:8 then the king of syria war against israel and took counsel
with hi servant say in such and such a place shall be my camp

6:9 and the man of god sent unto the king of israel say bewar
that thou pass not such a place; for thither the syrian are come
down

6:10 and the king of israel sent to the place which the man of god
told him and warn him of and save himself there not onc nor
twice

6:11 therefor the heart of the king of syria wa sore troubl for
thi thing; and he call hi servant and said unto them will ye
not shew me which of us is for the king of israel? 6:12 and one of
hi servant said none my lord o king: but elisha the prophet that
is in israel telleth the king of israel the word that thou speakest
in thi bedchamb

6:13 and he said go and spi where he is that i may send and fetch
him

and it wa told him say behold he is in dothan

6:14 therefor sent he thither hors and chariot and a great host:
and they came by night and compass the citi about

6:15 and when the servant of the man of god wa risen earli and gone
forth behold an host compass the citi both with hors and
chariot and hi servant said unto him ala my master! how shall we
do? 6:16 and he answer fear not: for they that be with us are more
than they that be with them

6:17 and elisha pray and said lord i pray thee open hi eye
that he may see and the lord open the eye of the young man; and he
saw: and behold the mountain wa full of hors and chariot of fire
round about elisha

6:18 and when they came down to him elisha pray unto the lord and
said smite thi peopl i pray thee with blind and he smote
them with blind accord to the word of elisha

6:19 and elisha said unto them thi is not the way neither is thi
the city: follow me and i will bring you to the man whom ye seek but
he led them to samaria

6:20 and it came to pass when they were come into samaria that
elisha said lord open the eye of these men that they may see and
the lord open their eye and they saw; and behold they were in
the midst of samaria

6:21 and the king of israel said unto elisha when he saw them my
father shall i smite them? shall i smite them? 6:22 and he answer
thou shalt not smite them: wouldest thou smite those whom thou hast
taken captiv with thi sword and with thi bow? set bread and water
befor them that they may eat and drink and go to their master

6:23 and he prepar great provis for them: and when they had eaten
and drunk he sent them away and they went to their master so the
band of syria came no more into the land of israel

6:24 and it came to pass after thi that benhadad king of syria
gather all hi host and went up and besieg samaria

6:25 and there wa a great famin in samaria: and behold they
besieg it until an asss head wa sold for fourscor piec of
silver and the fourth part of a cab of dove dung for five piec of
silver

6:26 and as the king of israel wa pass by upon the wall there
cri a woman unto him say help my lord o king

6:27 and he said if the lord do not help thee whenc shall i help
thee? out of the barnfloor or out of the winepress? 6:28 and the
king said unto her what aileth thee? and she answer thi woman
said unto me give thi son that we may eat him to day and we will
eat my son to morrow

6:29 so we boil my son and did eat him: and i said unto her on the
next day give thi son that we may eat him: and she hath hid her son

6:30 and it came to pass when the king heard the word of the woman
that he rent hi clothes; and he pass by upon the wall and the
peopl look and behold he had sackcloth within upon hi flesh

6:31 then he said god do so and more also to me if the head of
elisha the son of shaphat shall stand on him thi day

6:32 but elisha sat in hi hous and the elder sat with him; and the
king sent a man from befor him: but ere the messeng came to him he
said to the elder see ye how thi son of a murder hath sent to
take away mine head? look when the messeng cometh shut the door
and hold him fast at the door: is not the sound of hi master feet
behind him? 6:33 and while he yet talk with them behold the
messeng came down unto him: and he said behold thi evil is of the
lord; what should i wait for the lord ani longer? 7:1 then elisha
said hear ye the word of the lord; thu saith the lord to morrow
about thi time shall a measur of fine flour be sold for a shekel
and two measur of barley for a shekel in the gate of samaria

7:2 then a lord on whose hand the king lean answer the man of god
and said behold if the lord would make window in heaven might thi
thing be? and he said behold thou shalt see it with thine eye but
shalt not eat thereof

7:3 and there were four leprou men at the enter in of the gate:
and they said one to anoth whi sit we here until we die? 7:4 if we
say we will enter into the citi then the famin is in the citi and
we shall die there: and if we sit still here we die also now
therefor come and let us fall unto the host of the syrians: if they
save us aliv we shall live; and if they kill us we shall but die

7:5 and they rose up in the twilight to go unto the camp of the
syrians: and when they were come to the uttermost part of the camp of
syria behold there wa no man there

7:6 for the lord had made the host of the syrian to hear a nois of
chariot and a nois of hors even the nois of a great host: and
they said one to anoth lo the king of israel hath hire against us
the king of the hittit and the king of the egyptian to come
upon us

7:7 wherefor they aros and fled in the twilight and left their
tent and their hors and their ass even the camp as it wa and
fled for their life

7:8 and when these leper came to the uttermost part of the camp they
went into one tent and did eat and drink and carri thenc silver
and gold and raiment and went and hid it; and came again and
enter into anoth tent and carri thenc also and went and hid
it

7:9 then they said one to anoth we do not well: thi day is a day
of good tide and we hold our peace: if we tarri till the morn
light some mischief will come upon us: now therefor come that we
may go and tell the king household

7:10 so they came and call unto the porter of the city: and they
told them say we came to the camp of the syrian and behold
there wa no man there neither voic of man but hors tie and
ass tie and the tent as they were

7:11 and he call the porters; and they told it to the king hous
within

7:12 and the king aros in the night and said unto hi servant i
will now shew you what the syrian have done to us they know that we
be hungry; therefor are they gone out of the camp to hide themselv
in the field say when they come out of the citi we shall catch
them aliv and get into the citi

7:13 and one of hi servant answer and said let some take i pray
thee five of the hors that remain which are left in the citi
(behold they are as all the multitud of israel that are left in it:
behold i say they are even as all the multitud of the israelit
that are consumed:) and let us send and see

7:14 they took therefor two chariot horses; and the king sent after
the host of the syrian say go and see

7:15 and they went after them unto jordan: and lo all the way wa
full of garment and vessel which the syrian had cast away in their
hast and the messeng return and told the king

7:16 and the peopl went out and spoil the tent of the syrian so
a measur of fine flour wa sold for a shekel and two measur of
barley for a shekel accord to the word of the lord

7:17 and the king appoint the lord on whose hand he lean to have
the charg of the gate: and the peopl trode upon him in the gate and
he die as the man of god had said who spake when the king came down
to him

7:18 and it came to pass as the man of god had spoken to the king
say two measur of barley for a shekel and a measur of fine
flour for a shekel shall be to morrow about thi time in the gate of
samaria: 7:19 and that lord answer the man of god and said now
behold if the lord should make window in heaven might such a thing
be? and he said behold thou shalt see it with thine eye but shalt
not eat thereof

7:20 and so it fell out unto him: for the peopl trode upon him in the
gate and he die

8:1 then spake elisha unto the woman whose son he had restor to
life say aris and go thou and thine household and sojourn
wheresoev thou canst sojourn: for the lord hath call for a famine;
and it shall also come upon the land seven year

8:2 and the woman aros and did after the say of the man of god:
and she went with her household and sojourn in the land of the
philistin seven year

8:3 and it came to pass at the seven year end that the woman
return out of the land of the philistines: and she went forth to cri
unto the king for her hous and for her land

8:4 and the king talk with gehazi the servant of the man of god
say tell me i pray thee all the great thing that elisha hath
done

8:5 and it came to pass as he wa tell the king how he had
restor a dead bodi to life that behold the woman whose son he
had restor to life cri to the king for her hous and for her
land and gehazi said my lord o king thi is the woman and thi is
her son whom elisha restor to life

8:6 and when the king ask the woman she told him so the king
appoint unto her a certain offic say restor all that wa
her and all the fruit of the field sinc the day that she left the
land even until now

8:7 and elisha came to damascus; and benhadad the king of syria wa
sick; and it wa told him say the man of god is come hither

8:8 and the king said unto hazael take a present in thine hand and
go meet the man of god and enquir of the lord by him say shall
i recov of thi disease? 8:9 so hazael went to meet him and took a
present with him even of everi good thing of damascu forti camel
burden and came and stood befor him and said thi son benhadad king
of syria hath sent me to thee say shall i recov of thi
disease? 8:10 and elisha said unto him go say unto him thou mayest
certainli recover: howbeit the lord hath shew me that he shall
sure die

8:11 and he settl hi counten stedfastli until he wa ashamed:
and the man of god wept

8:12 and hazael said whi weepeth my lord? and he answer becaus i
know the evil that thou wilt do unto the children of israel: their
strong hold wilt thou set on fire and their young men wilt thou slay
with the sword and wilt dash their children and rip up their women
with child

8:13 and hazael said but what is thi servant a dog that he should
do thi great thing? and elisha answer the lord hath shew me that
thou shalt be king over syria

8:14 so he depart from elisha and came to hi master; who said to
him what said elisha to thee? and he answer he told me that thou
shouldest sure recov

8:15 and it came to pass on the morrow that he took a thick cloth
and dip it in water and spread it on hi face so that he died:
and hazael reign in hi stead

8:16 and in the fifth year of joram the son of ahab king of israel
jehoshaphat be then king of judah jehoram the son of je hoshaphat
king of judah began to reign

8:17 thirti and two year old wa he when he began to reign; and he
reign eight year in jerusalem

8:18 and he walk in the way of the king of israel as did the hous
of ahab: for the daughter of ahab wa hi wife: and he did evil in the
sight of the lord

8:19 yet the lord would not destroy judah for david hi servant
sake as he promis him to give him alway a light and to hi
children

8:20 in hi day edom revolt from under the hand of judah and made
a king over themselv

8:21 so joram went over to zair and all the chariot with him: and he
rose by night and smote the edomit which compass him about and
the captain of the chariots: and the peopl fled into their tent

8:22 yet edom revolt from under the hand of judah unto thi day
then libnah revolt at the same time

8:23 and the rest of the act of joram and all that he did are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah? 8:24
and joram slept with hi father and wa buri with hi father in
the citi of david: and ahaziah hi son reign in hi stead

8:25 in the twelfth year of joram the son of ahab king of israel did
ahaziah the son of jehoram king of judah begin to reign

8:26 two and twenti year old wa ahaziah when he began to reign; and
he reign one year in jerusalem and hi mother name wa athaliah
the daughter of omri king of israel

8:27 and he walk in the way of the hous of ahab and did evil in
the sight of the lord as did the hous of ahab: for he wa the son in
law of the hous of ahab

8:28 and he went with joram the son of ahab to the war against hazael
king of syria in ramothgilead; and the syrian wound joram

8:29 and king joram went back to be heal in jezreel of the wound
which the syrian had given him at ramah when he fought against
hazael king of syria and ahaziah the son of jehoram king of judah
went down to see joram the son of ahab in jezreel becaus he wa
sick

9:1 and elisha the prophet call one of the children of the prophet
and said unto him gird up thi loin and take thi box of oil in
thine hand and go to ramothgilead: 9:2 and when thou comest thither
look out there jehu the son of jehoshaphat the son of nimshi and go
in and make him aris up from among hi brethren and carri him to an
inner chamber; 9:3 then take the box of oil and pour it on hi head
and say thu saith the lord i have anoint thee king over israel
then open the door and flee and tarri not

9:4 so the young man even the young man the prophet went to
ramothgilead

9:5 and when he came behold the captain of the host were sitting;
and he said i have an errand to thee o captain and jehu said unto
which of all us? and he said to thee o captain

9:6 and he aros and went into the house; and he pour the oil on
hi head and said unto him thu saith the lord god of israel i have
anoint thee king over the peopl of the lord even over israel

9:7 and thou shalt smite the hous of ahab thi master that i may
aveng the blood of my servant the prophet and the blood of all the
servant of the lord at the hand of jezebel

9:8 for the whole hous of ahab shall perish: and i will cut off from
ahab him that pisseth against the wall and him that is shut up and
left in israel: 9:9 and i will make the hous of ahab like the hous
of jeroboam the son of nebat and like the hous of baasha the son of
ahijah: 9:10 and the dog shall eat jezebel in the portion of jezreel
and there shall be none to buri her and he open the door and fled

9:11 then jehu came forth to the servant of hi lord: and one said
unto him is all well? wherefor came thi mad fellow to thee? and he
said unto them ye know the man and hi commun

9:12 and they said it is false; tell us now and he said thu and
thu spake he to me say thu saith the lord i have anoint thee
king over israel

9:13 then they hast and took everi man hi garment and put it
under him on the top of the stair and blew with trumpet say
jehu is king

9:14 so jehu the son of jehoshaphat the son of nimshi conspir
against joram (now joram had kept ramothgilead he and all israel
becaus of hazael king of syria

9:15 but king joram wa return to be heal in jezreel of the wound
which the syrian had given him when he fought with hazael king of
syria) and jehu said if it be your mind then let none go forth
nor escap out of the citi to go to tell it in jezreel

9:16 so jehu rode in a chariot and went to jezreel; for joram lay
there

and ahaziah king of judah wa come down to see joram

9:17 and there stood a watchman on the tower in jezreel and he spi
the compani of jehu as he came and said i see a compani and joram
said take an horseman and send to meet them and let him say is it
peace? 9:18 so there went one on horseback to meet him and said
thu saith the king is it peace? and jehu said what hast thou to do
with peace? turn thee behind me and the watchman told say the
messeng came to them but he cometh not again

9:19 then he sent out a second on horseback which came to them and
said thu saith the king is it peace? and jehu answer what hast
thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me

9:20 and the watchman told say he came even unto them and cometh
not again: and the drive is like the drive of jehu the son of
nimshi; for he driveth furious

9:21 and joram said make readi and hi chariot wa made readi and
joram king of israel and ahaziah king of judah went out each in hi
chariot and they went out against jehu and met him in the portion of
naboth the jezreelit

9:22 and it came to pass when joram saw jehu that he said is it
peac jehu? and he answer what peac so long as the whoredom of
thi mother jezebel and her witchcraft are so many? 9:23 and joram
turn hi hand and fled and said to ahaziah there is treacheri o
ahaziah

9:24 and jehu drew a bow with hi full strength and smote jehoram
between hi arm and the arrow went out at hi heart and he sunk
down in hi chariot

9:25 then said jehu to bidkar hi captain take up and cast him in
the portion of the field of naboth the jezreelite: for rememb how
that when i and thou rode togeth after ahab hi father the lord
laid thi burden upon him; 9:26 sure i have seen yesterday the blood
of naboth and the blood of hi son saith the lord; and i will
requit thee in thi plat saith the lord now therefor take and cast
him into the plat of ground accord to the word of the lord

9:27 but when ahaziah the king of judah saw thi he fled by the way
of the garden hous and jehu follow after him and said smite him
also in the chariot and they did so at the go up to gur which is
by ibleam

and he fled to megiddo and die there

9:28 and hi servant carri him in a chariot to jerusalem and
buri him in hi sepulchr with hi father in the citi of david

9:29 and in the eleventh year of joram the son of ahab began ahaziah
to reign over judah

9:30 and when jehu wa come to jezreel jezebel heard of it; and she
paint her face and tire her head and look out at a window

9:31 and as jehu enter in at the gate she said had zimri peac
who slew hi master? 9:32 and he lift up hi face to the window
and said who is on my side? who? and there look out to him two or
three eunuch

9:33 and he said throw her down so they threw her down: and some of
her blood wa sprinkl on the wall and on the horses: and he trode
her under foot

9:34 and when he wa come in he did eat and drink and said go see
now thi curs woman and buri her: for she is a king daughter

9:35 and they went to buri her: but they found no more of her than the
skull and the feet and the palm of her hand

9:36 wherefor they came again and told him and he said thi is the
word of the lord which he spake by hi servant elijah the tishbit
say in the portion of jezreel shall dog eat the flesh of jezebel:
9:37 and the carcas of jezebel shall be as dung upon the face of the
field in the portion of jezreel; so that they shall not say thi is
jezebel

10:1 and ahab had seventi son in samaria and jehu wrote letter and
sent to samaria unto the ruler of jezreel to the elder and to
them that brought up ahab children say 10:2 now as soon as thi
letter cometh to you see your master son are with you and
there are with you chariot and hors a fenc citi also and
armour; 10:3 look even out the best and meetest of your master son
and set him on hi father throne and fight for your master hous

10:4 but they were exceedingli afraid and said behold two king
stood not befor him: how then shall we stand? 10:5 and he that wa
over the hous and he that wa over the citi the elder also and
the bringer up of the children sent to jehu say we are thi
servant and will do all that thou shalt bid us; we will not make ani
king: do thou that which is good in thine eye

10:6 then he wrote a letter the second time to them say if ye be
mine and if ye will hearken unto my voic take ye the head of the
men your master son and come to me to jezreel by to morrow thi
time now the king son be seventi person were with the great
men of the citi which brought them up

10:7 and it came to pass when the letter came to them that they took
the king son and slew seventi person and put their head in
basket and sent him them to jezreel

10:8 and there came a messeng and told him say they have
brought the head of the king son and he said lay ye them in two
heap at the enter in of the gate until the morn

10:9 and it came to pass in the morn that he went out and stood
and said to all the peopl ye be righteous: behold i conspir
against my master and slew him: but who slew all these? 10:10 know
now that there shall fall unto the earth noth of the word of the
lord which the lord spake concern the hous of ahab: for the lord
hath done that which he spake by hi servant elijah

10:11 so jehu slew all that remain of the hous of ahab in jezreel
and all hi great men and hi kinsfolk and hi priest until he
left him none remain

10:12 and he aros and depart and came to samaria and as he wa at
the shear hous in the way 10:13 jehu met with the brethren of
ahaziah king of judah and said who are ye? and they answer we are
the brethren of ahaziah; and we go down to salut the children of the
king and the children of the queen

10:14 and he said take them aliv and they took them aliv and slew
them at the pit of the shear hous even two and forti men; neither
left he ani of them

10:15 and when he wa depart thenc he light on jehonadab the son
of rechab come to meet him: and he salut him and said to him is
thine heart right as my heart is with thi heart? and jehonadab
answer it is if it be give me thine hand and he gave him hi
hand; and he took him up to him into the chariot

10:16 and he said come with me and see my zeal for the lord so they
made him ride in hi chariot

10:17 and when he came to samaria he slew all that remain unto ahab
in samaria till he had destroy him accord to the say of the
lord which he spake to elijah

10:18 and jehu gather all the peopl togeth and said unto them
ahab serv baal a little; but jehu shall serv him much

10:19 now therefor call unto me all the prophet of baal all hi
servant and all hi priests; let none be wanting: for i have a great
sacrific to do to baal; whosoev shall be want he shall not
live but jehu did it in subtilti to the intent that he might destroy
the worshipp of baal

10:20 and jehu said proclaim a solemn assembl for baal and they
proclaim it

10:21 and jehu sent through all israel: and all the worshipp of
baal came so that there wa not a man left that came not and they
came into the hous of baal; and the hous of baal wa full from one
end to anoth

10:22 and he said unto him that wa over the vestri bring forth
vestment for all the worshipp of baal and he brought them forth
vestment

10:23 and jehu went and jehonadab the son of rechab into the hous
of baal and said unto the worshipp of baal search and look that
there be here with you none of the servant of the lord but the
worshipp of baal onli

10:24 and when they went in to offer sacrific and burnt offer
jehu appoint fourscor men without and said if ani of the men whom
i have brought into your hand escap he that letteth him go hi
life shall be for the life of him

10:25 and it came to pass as soon as he had made an end of offer
the burnt offer that jehu said to the guard and to the captain
go in and slay them; let none come forth and they smote them with
the edg of the sword; and the guard and the captain cast them out
and went to the citi of the hous of baal

10:26 and they brought forth the imag out of the hous of baal and
burn them

10:27 and they brake down the imag of baal and brake down the hous
of baal and made it a draught hous unto thi day

10:28 thu jehu destroy baal out of israel

10:29 howbeit from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat who made
israel to sin jehu depart not from after them to wit the golden
calv that were in bethel and that were in dan

10:30 and the lord said unto jehu becaus thou hast done well in
execut that which is right in mine eye and hast done unto the
hous of ahab accord to all that wa in mine heart thi children of
the fourth gener shall sit on the throne of israel

10:31 but jehu took no heed to walk in the law of the lord god of
israel with all hi heart: for he depart not from the sin of
jeroboam which made israel to sin

10:32 in those day the lord began to cut israel short: and hazael
smote them in all the coast of israel; 10:33 from jordan eastward
all the land of gilead the gadit and the reubenit and the
manassit from aroer which is by the river arnon even gilead and
bashan

10:34 now the rest of the act of jehu and all that he did and all
hi might are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the
king of israel? 10:35 and jehu slept with hi fathers: and they
buri him in samaria and jehoahaz hi son reign in hi stead

10:36 and the time that jehu reign over israel in samaria wa twenti
and eight year

11:1 and when athaliah the mother of ahaziah saw that her son wa
dead she aros and destroy all the seed royal

11:2 but jehosheba the daughter of king joram sister of ahaziah
took joash the son of ahaziah and stole him from among the king
son which were slain; and they hid him even him and hi nurs in
the bedchamb from athaliah so that he wa not slain

11:3 and he wa with her hid in the hous of the lord six year and
athaliah did reign over the land

11:4 and the seventh year jehoiada sent and fetch the ruler over
hundr with the captain and the guard and brought them to him
into the hous of the lord and made a coven with them and took an
oath of them in the hous of the lord and shew them the king son

11:5 and he command them say thi is the thing that ye shall
do; a third part of you that enter in on the sabbath shall even be
keeper of the watch of the king house; 11:6 and a third part shall
be at the gate of sur; and a third part at the gate behind the guard:
so shall ye keep the watch of the hous that it be not broken down

11:7 and two part of all you that go forth on the sabbath even they
shall keep the watch of the hous of the lord about the king

11:8 and ye shall compass the king round about everi man with hi
weapon in hi hand: and he that cometh within the rang let him be
slain: and be ye with the king as he goeth out and as he cometh in

11:9 and the captain over the hundr did accord to all thing
that jehoiada the priest commanded: and they took everi man hi men
that were to come in on the sabbath with them that should go out on
the sabbath and came to jehoiada the priest

11:10 and to the captain over hundr did the priest give king
david spear and shield that were in the templ of the lord

11:11 and the guard stood everi man with hi weapon in hi hand
round about the king from the right corner of the templ to the left
corner of the templ along by the altar and the templ

11:12 and he brought forth the king son and put the crown upon him
and gave him the testimony; and they made him king and anoint him;
and they clap their hand and said god save the king

11:13 and when athaliah heard the nois of the guard and of the
peopl she came to the peopl into the templ of the lord

11:14 and when she look behold the king stood by a pillar as the
manner wa and the princ and the trumpet by the king and all
the peopl of the land rejoic and blew with trumpets: and athaliah
rent her cloth and cri treason treason

11:15 but jehoiada the priest command the captain of the hundr
the offic of the host and said unto them have her forth without
the ranges: and him that followeth her kill with the sword for the
priest had said let her not be slain in the hous of the lord

11:16 and they laid hand on her; and she went by the way by the which
the hors came into the king house: and there wa she slain

11:17 and jehoiada made a coven between the lord and the king and
the peopl that they should be the lord people; between the king
also and the peopl

11:18 and all the peopl of the land went into the hous of baal and
brake it down; hi altar and hi imag brake they in piec
thoroughli and slew mattan the priest of baal befor the altar and
the priest appoint offic over the hous of the lord

11:19 and he took the ruler over hundr and the captain and the
guard and all the peopl of the land; and they brought down the king
from the hous of the lord and came by the way of the gate of the
guard to the king hous and he sat on the throne of the king

11:20 and all the peopl of the land rejoic and the citi wa in
quiet: and they slew athaliah with the sword besid the king hous

11:21 seven year old wa jehoash when he began to reign

12:1 in the seventh year of jehu jehoash began to reign; and forti
year reign he in jerusalem and hi mother name wa zibiah of
beersheba

12:2 and jehoash did that which wa right in the sight of the lord all
hi day wherein jehoiada the priest instruct him

12:3 but the high place were not taken away: the peopl still
sacrif and burnt incens in the high place

12:4 and jehoash said to the priest all the money of the dedic
thing that is brought into the hous of the lord even the money of
everi one that passeth the account the money that everi man is set
at and all the money that cometh into ani man heart to bring into
the hous of the lord 12:5 let the priest take it to them everi man
of hi acquaintance: and let them repair the breach of the hous
wheresoev ani breach shall be found

12:6 but it wa so that in the three and twentieth year of king
jehoash the priest had not repair the breach of the hous

12:7 then king jehoash call for jehoiada the priest and the other
priest and said unto them whi repair ye not the breach of the
house? now therefor receiv no more money of your acquaint but
deliv it for the breach of the hous

12:8 and the priest consent to receiv no more money of the peopl
neither to repair the breach of the hous

12:9 but jehoiada the priest took a chest and bore a hole in the lid
of it and set it besid the altar on the right side as one cometh
into the hous of the lord: and the priest that kept the door put
therein all the money that wa brought into the hous of the lord

12:10 and it wa so when they saw that there wa much money in the
chest that the king scribe and the high priest came up and they
put up in bag and told the money that wa found in the hous of the
lord

12:11 and they gave the money be told into the hand of them that
did the work that had the oversight of the hous of the lord: and
they laid it out to the carpent and builder that wrought upon the
hous of the lord 12:12 and to mason and hewer of stone and to
buy timber and hew stone to repair the breach of the hous of the
lord and for all that wa laid out for the hous to repair it

12:13 howbeit there were not made for the hous of the lord bowl of
silver snuffer bason trumpet ani vessel of gold or vessel of
silver of the money that wa brought into the hous of the lord:
12:14 but they gave that to the workmen and repair therewith the
hous of the lord

12:15 moreov they reckon not with the men into whose hand they
deliv the money to be bestow on workmen: for they dealt
faith

12:16 the trespass money and sin money wa not brought into the hous
of the lord: it wa the priest

12:17 then hazael king of syria went up and fought against gath and
took it: and hazael set hi face to go up to jerusalem

12:18 and jehoash king of judah took all the hallow thing that
jehoshaphat and jehoram and ahaziah hi father king of judah
had dedic and hi own hallow thing and all the gold that wa
found in the treasur of the hous of the lord and in the king
hous and sent it to hazael king of syria: and he went away from
jerusalem

12:19 and the rest of the act of joash and all that he did are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?
12:20 and hi servant aros and made a conspiraci and slew joash in
the hous of millo which goeth down to silla

12:21 for jozachar the son of shimeath and jehozabad the son of
shomer hi servant smote him and he died; and they buri him with
hi father in the citi of david: and amaziah hi son reign in hi
stead

13:1 in the three and twentieth year of joash the son of ahaziah king
of judah jehoahaz the son of jehu began to reign over israel in
samaria and reign seventeen year

13:2 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord and
follow the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat which made israel to
sin; he depart not therefrom

13:3 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against israel and he
deliv them into the hand of hazael king of syria and into the
hand of benhadad the son of hazael all their day

13:4 and jehoahaz besought the lord and the lord hearken unto him:
for he saw the oppress of israel becaus the king of syria
oppress them

13:5 (and the lord gave israel a saviour so that they went out from
under the hand of the syrians: and the children of israel dwelt in
their tent as beforetim

13:6 nevertheless they depart not from the sin of the hous of
jeroboam who made israel sin but walk therein: and there remain
the grove also in samaria) 13:7 neither did he leav of the peopl
to jehoahaz but fifti horsemen and ten chariot and ten thousand
footmen; for the king of syria had destroy them and had made them
like the dust by thresh

13:8 now the rest of the act of jehoahaz and all that he did and
hi might are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the
king of israel? 13:9 and jehoahaz slept with hi fathers; and they
buri him in samaria: and joash hi son reign in hi stead

13:10 in the thirti and seventh year of joash king of judah began
jehoash the son of jehoahaz to reign over israel in samaria and
reign sixteen year

13:11 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord; he
depart not from all the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat who made
israel sin: but he walk therein

13:12 and the rest of the act of joash and all that he did and hi
might wherewith he fought against amaziah king of judah are they not
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel? 13:13
and joash slept with hi fathers; and jeroboam sat upon hi throne:
and joash wa buri in samaria with the king of israel

13:14 now elisha wa fallen sick of hi sick whereof he die and
joash the king of israel came down unto him and wept over hi face
and said o my father my father the chariot of israel and the
horsemen thereof

13:15 and elisha said unto him take bow and arrow and he took unto
him bow and arrow

13:16 and he said to the king of israel put thine hand upon the bow
and he put hi hand upon it: and elisha put hi hand upon the king
hand

13:17 and he said open the window eastward and he open it then
elisha said shoot and he shot and he said the arrow of the lord
deliver and the arrow of deliver from syria: for thou shalt
smite the syrian in aphek till thou have consum them

13:18 and he said take the arrow and he took them and he said unto
the king of israel smite upon the ground and he smote thrice and
stay

13:19 and the man of god wa wroth with him and said thou shouldest
have smitten five or six times; then hadst thou smitten syria till
thou hadst consum it: wherea now thou shalt smite syria but thrice

13:20 and elisha die and they buri him and the band of the
moabit invad the land at the come in of the year

13:21 and it came to pass as they were buri a man that behold
they spi a band of men; and they cast the man into the sepulchr of
elisha: and when the man wa let down and touch the bone of
elisha he reviv and stood up on hi feet

13:22 but hazael king of syria oppress israel all the day of
jehoahaz

13:23 and the lord wa graciou unto them and had compass on them
and had respect unto them becaus of hi coven with abraham
isaac and jacob and would not destroy them neither cast he them
from hi presenc as yet

13:24 so hazael king of syria died; and benhadad hi son reign in
hi stead

13:25 and jehoash the son of jehoahaz took again out of the hand of
benhadad the son of hazael the citi which he had taken out of the
hand of jehoahaz hi father by war three time did joash beat him
and recov the citi of israel

14:1 in the second year of joash son of jehoahaz king of israel
reign amaziah the son of joash king of judah

14:2 he wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign and
reign twenti and nine year in jerusalem and hi mother name wa
jehoaddan of jerusalem

14:3 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord yet not
like david hi father: he did accord to all thing as joash hi
father did

14:4 howbeit the high place were not taken away: as yet the peopl
did sacrific and burnt incens on the high place

14:5 and it came to pass as soon as the kingdom wa confirm in hi
hand that he slew hi servant which had slain the king hi father

14:6 but the children of the murder he slew not: accord unto
that which is written in the book of the law of mose wherein the
lord command say the father shall not be put to death for the
children nor the children be put to death for the fathers; but everi
man shall be put to death for hi own sin

14:7 he slew of edom in the valley of salt ten thousand and took
selah by war and call the name of it joktheel unto thi day

14:8 then amaziah sent messeng to jehoash the son of jehoahaz son
of jehu king of israel say come let us look one anoth in the
face

14:9 and jehoash the king of israel sent to amaziah king of judah
say the thistl that wa in lebanon sent to the cedar that wa in
lebanon say give thi daughter to my son to wife: and there pass
by a wild beast that wa in lebanon and trode down the thistl

14:10 thou hast inde smitten edom and thine heart hath lift thee
up: glori of thi and tarri at home: for whi shouldest thou meddl to
thi hurt that thou shouldest fall even thou and judah with thee?
14:11 but amaziah would not hear therefor jehoash king of israel
went up; and he and amaziah king of judah look one anoth in the
face at bethshemesh which belongeth to judah

14:12 and judah wa put to the wors befor israel; and they fled
everi man to their tent

14:13 and jehoash king of israel took amaziah king of judah the son
of jehoash the son of ahaziah at bethshemesh and came to jerusalem
and brake down the wall of jerusalem from the gate of ephraim unto the
corner gate four hundr cubit

14:14 and he took all the gold and silver and all the vessel that
were found in the hous of the lord and in the treasur of the
king hous and hostag and return to samaria

14:15 now the rest of the act of jehoash which he did and hi might
and how he fought with amaziah king of judah are they not written in
the book of the chronicl of the king of israel? 14:16 and jehoash
slept with hi father and wa buri in samaria with the king of
israel; and jeroboam hi son reign in hi stead

14:17 and amaziah the son of joash king of judah live after the death
of jehoash son of jehoahaz king of israel fifteen year

14:18 and the rest of the act of amaziah are they not written in the
book of the chronicl of the king of judah? 14:19 now they made a
conspiraci against him in jerusalem: and he fled to lachish; but they
sent after him to lachish and slew him there

14:20 and they brought him on horses: and he wa buri at jerusalem
with hi father in the citi of david

14:21 and all the peopl of judah took azariah which wa sixteen
year old and made him king instead of hi father amaziah

14:22 he built elath and restor it to judah after that the king
slept with hi father

14:23 in the fifteenth year of amaziah the son of joash king of judah
jeroboam the son of joash king of israel began to reign in samaria
and reign forti and one year

14:24 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord: he
depart not from all the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat who made
israel to sin

14:25 he restor the coast of israel from the enter of hamath unto
the sea of the plain accord to the word of the lord god of israel
which he spake by the hand of hi servant jonah the son of amittai
the prophet which wa of gathheph

14:26 for the lord saw the afflict of israel that it wa veri
bitter: for there wa not ani shut up nor ani left nor ani helper
for israel

14:27 and the lord said not that he would blot out the name of israel
from under heaven: but he save them by the hand of jeroboam the son
of joash

14:28 now the rest of the act of jeroboam and all that he did and
hi might how he war and how he recov damascu and hamath
which belong to judah for israel are they not written in the book
of the chronicl of the king of israel? 14:29 and jeroboam slept
with hi father even with the king of israel; and zachariah hi son
reign in hi stead

15:1 in the twenti and seventh year of jeroboam king of israel began
azariah son of amaziah king of judah to reign

15:2 sixteen year old wa he when he began to reign and he reign
two and fifti year in jerusalem and hi mother name wa jecholiah
of jerusalem

15:3 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord
accord to all that hi father amaziah had done; 15:4 save that the
high place were not removed: the peopl sacrif and burnt incens
still on the high place

15:5 and the lord smote the king so that he wa a leper unto the day
of hi death and dwelt in a sever hous and jotham the king son
wa over the hous judg the peopl of the land

15:6 and the rest of the act of azariah and all that he did are
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?
15:7 so azariah slept with hi fathers; and they buri him with hi
father in the citi of david: and jotham hi son reign in hi stead

15:8 in the thirti and eighth year of azariah king of judah did
zachariah the son of jeroboam reign over israel in samaria six month

15:9 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord as hi
father had done: he depart not from the sin of jeroboam the son of
nebat who made israel to sin

15:10 and shallum the son of jabesh conspir against him and smote
him befor the peopl and slew him and reign in hi stead

15:11 and the rest of the act of zachariah behold they are written
in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel

15:12 thi wa the word of the lord which he spake unto jehu say
thi son shall sit on the throne of israel unto the fourth gener
and so it came to pass

15:13 shallum the son of jabesh began to reign in the nine and
thirtieth year of uzziah king of judah; and he reign a full month in
samaria

15:14 for menahem the son of gadi went up from tirzah and came to
samaria and smote shallum the son of jabesh in samaria and slew him
and reign in hi stead

15:15 and the rest of the act of shallum and hi conspiraci which he
made behold they are written in the book of the chronicl of the
king of israel

15:16 then menahem smote tiphsah and all that were therein and the
coast thereof from tirzah: becaus they open not to him therefor
he smote it; and all the women therein that were with child he rip
up

15:17 in the nine and thirtieth year of azariah king of judah began
menahem the son of gadi to reign over israel and reign ten year in
samaria

15:18 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord: he
depart not all hi day from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat
who made israel to sin

15:19 and pul the king of assyria came against the land: and menahem
gave pul a thousand talent of silver that hi hand might be with him
to confirm the kingdom in hi hand

15:20 and menahem exact the money of israel even of all the mighti
men of wealth of each man fifti shekel of silver to give to the
king of assyria so the king of assyria turn back and stay not
there in the land

15:21 and the rest of the act of menahem and all that he did are
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel?
15:22 and menahem slept with hi fathers; and pekahiah hi son reign
in hi stead

15:23 in the fiftieth year of azariah king of judah pekahiah the son
of menahem began to reign over israel in samaria and reign two
year

15:24 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord: he
depart not from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat who made
israel to sin

15:25 but pekah the son of remaliah a captain of hi conspir
against him and smote him in samaria in the palac of the king
hous with argob and arieh and with him fifti men of the gileadites:
and he kill him and reign in hi room

15:26 and the rest of the act of pekahiah and all that he did
behold they are written in the book of the chronicl of the king of
israel

15:27 in the two and fiftieth year of azariah king of judah pekah the
son of remaliah began to reign over israel in samaria and reign
twenti year

15:28 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord: he
depart not from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat who made
israel to sin

15:29 in the day of pekah king of israel came tiglathpiles king of
assyria and took ijon and abelbethmaachah and janoah and kedesh
and hazor and gilead and galile all the land of naphtali and
carri them captiv to assyria

15:30 and hoshea the son of elah made a conspiraci against pekah the
son of remaliah and smote him and slew him and reign in hi
stead in the twentieth year of jotham the son of uzziah

15:31 and the rest of the act of pekah and all that he did behold
they are written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel

15:32 in the second year of pekah the son of remaliah king of israel
began jotham the son of uzziah king of judah to reign

15:33 five and twenti year old wa he when he began to reign and he
reign sixteen year in jerusalem and hi mother name wa jerusha
the daughter of zadok

15:34 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord: he did
accord to all that hi father uzziah had done

15:35 howbeit the high place were not removed: the peopl sacrif
and burn incens still in the high place he built the higher gate
of the hous of the lord

15:36 now the rest of the act of jotham and all that he did are
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?
15:37 in those day the lord began to send against judah rezin the
king of syria and pekah the son of remaliah

15:38 and jotham slept with hi father and wa buri with hi
father in the citi of david hi father: and ahaz hi son reign in
hi stead

16:1 in the seventeenth year of pekah the son of remaliah ahaz the son
of jotham king of judah began to reign

16:2 twenti year old wa ahaz when he began to reign and reign
sixteen year in jerusalem and did not that which wa right in the
sight of the lord hi god like david hi father

16:3 but he walk in the way of the king of israel yea and made
hi son to pass through the fire accord to the abomin of the
heathen whom the lord cast out from befor the children of israel

16:4 and he sacrif and burnt incens in the high place and on
the hill and under everi green tree

16:5 then rezin king of syria and pekah son of remaliah king of israel
came up to jerusalem to war: and they besieg ahaz but could not
overcom him

16:6 at that time rezin king of syria recov elath to syria and
drave the jew from elath: and the syrian came to elath and dwelt
there unto thi day

16:7 so ahaz sent messeng to tiglathpiles king of assyria
say i am thi servant and thi son: come up and save me out of the
hand of the king of syria and out of the hand of the king of israel
which rise up against me

16:8 and ahaz took the silver and gold that wa found in the hous of
the lord and in the treasur of the king hous and sent it for a
present to the king of assyria

16:9 and the king of assyria hearken unto him: for the king of
assyria went up against damascu and took it and carri the peopl
of it captiv to kir and slew rezin

16:10 and king ahaz went to damascu to meet tiglathpiles king of
assyria and saw an altar that wa at damascus: and king ahaz sent to
urijah the priest the fashion of the altar and the pattern of it
accord to all the workmanship thereof

16:11 and urijah the priest built an altar accord to all that king
ahaz had sent from damascus: so urijah the priest made it against king
ahaz came from damascu

16:12 and when the king wa come from damascu the king saw the
altar: and the king approach to the altar and offer thereon

16:13 and he burnt hi burnt offer and hi meat offer and
pour hi drink offer and sprinkl the blood of hi peac
offer upon the altar

16:14 and he brought also the brasen altar which wa befor the lord
from the forefront of the hous from between the altar and the hous
of the lord and put it on the north side of the altar

16:15 and king ahaz command urijah the priest say upon the
great altar burn the morn burnt offer and the even meat
offer and the king burnt sacrific and hi meat offer with
the burnt offer of all the peopl of the land and their meat
offer and their drink offerings; and sprinkl upon it all the
blood of the burnt offer and all the blood of the sacrifice: and
the brasen altar shall be for me to enquir by

16:16 thu did urijah the priest accord to all that king ahaz
command

16:17 and king ahaz cut off the border of the base and remov the
laver from off them; and took down the sea from off the brasen oxen
that were under it and put it upon the pavement of stone

16:18 and the covert for the sabbath that they had built in the hous
and the king entri without turn he from the hous of the lord for
the king of assyria

16:19 now the rest of the act of ahaz which he did are they not
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah? 16:20
and ahaz slept with hi father and wa buri with hi father in
the citi of david: and hezekiah hi son reign in hi stead

17:1 in the twelfth year of ahaz king of judah began hoshea the son of
elah to reign in samaria over israel nine year

17:2 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord but not
as the king of israel that were befor him

17:3 against him came up shalmanes king of assyria; and hoshea
becam hi servant and gave him present

17:4 and the king of assyria found conspiraci in hoshea: for he had
sent messeng to so king of egypt and brought no present to the
king of assyria as he had done year by year: therefor the king of
assyria shut him up and bound him in prison

17:5 then the king of assyria came up throughout all the land and
went up to samaria and besieg it three year

17:6 in the ninth year of hoshea the king of assyria took samaria and
carri israel away into assyria and place them in halah and in
habor by the river of gozan and in the citi of the mede

17:7 for so it wa that the children of israel had sin against the
lord their god which had brought them up out of the land of egypt
from under the hand of pharaoh king of egypt and had fear other
god 17:8 and walk in the statut of the heathen whom the lord
cast out from befor the children of israel and of the king of
israel which they had made

17:9 and the children of israel did secretli those thing that were
not right against the lord their god and they built them high place
in all their citi from the tower of the watchmen to the fenc
citi

17:10 and they set them up imag and grove in everi high hill and
under everi green tree: 17:11 and there they burnt incens in all the
high place as did the heathen whom the lord carri away befor
them; and wrought wick thing to provok the lord to anger: 17:12
for they serv idol whereof the lord had said unto them ye shall
not do thi thing

17:13 yet the lord testifi against israel and against judah by all
the prophet and by all the seer say turn ye from your evil
way and keep my command and my statut accord to all the
law which i command your father and which i sent to you by my
servant the prophet

17:14 notwithstand they would not hear but harden their neck
like to the neck of their father that did not believ in the lord
their god

17:15 and they reject hi statut and hi coven that he made
with their father and hi testimoni which he testifi against
them; and they follow vaniti and becam vain and went after the
heathen that were round about them concern whom the lord had
charg them that they should not do like them

17:16 and they left all the command of the lord their god and
made them molten imag even two calv and made a grove and
worship all the host of heaven and serv baal

17:17 and they caus their son and their daughter to pass through
the fire and use divin and enchant and sold themselv to
do evil in the sight of the lord to provok him to anger

17:18 therefor the lord wa veri angri with israel and remov them
out of hi sight: there wa none left but the tribe of judah onli

17:19 also judah kept not the command of the lord their god but
walk in the statut of israel which they made

17:20 and the lord reject all the seed of israel and afflict
them and deliv them into the hand of spoiler until he had cast
them out of hi sight

17:21 for he rent israel from the hous of david; and they made
jeroboam the son of nebat king: and jeroboam drave israel from
follow the lord and made them sin a great sin

17:22 for the children of israel walk in all the sin of jeroboam
which he did; they depart not from them; 17:23 until the lord
remov israel out of hi sight as he had said by all hi servant
the prophet so wa israel carri away out of their own land to
assyria unto thi day

17:24 and the king of assyria brought men from babylon and from
cuthah and from ava and from hamath and from sepharvaim and place
them in the citi of samaria instead of the children of israel: and
they possess samaria and dwelt in the citi thereof

17:25 and so it wa at the begin of their dwell there that
they fear not the lord: therefor the lord sent lion among them
which slew some of them

17:26 wherefor they spake to the king of assyria say the nation
which thou hast remov and place in the citi of samaria know not
the manner of the god of the land: therefor he hath sent lion among
them and behold they slay them becaus they know not the manner of
the god of the land

17:27 then the king of assyria command say carri thither one of
the priest whom ye brought from thence; and let them go and dwell
there and let him teach them the manner of the god of the land

17:28 then one of the priest whom they had carri away from samaria
came and dwelt in bethel and taught them how they should fear the
lord

17:29 howbeit everi nation made god of their own and put them in the
hous of the high place which the samaritan had made everi nation
in their citi wherein they dwelt

17:30 and the men of babylon made succothbenoth and the men of cuth
made nergal and the men of hamath made ashima 17:31 and the avit
made nibhaz and tartak and the sepharvit burnt their children in
fire to adrammelech and anammelech the god of sepharvaim

17:32 so they fear the lord and made unto themselv of the lowest
of them priest of the high place which sacrif for them in the
hous of the high place

17:33 they fear the lord and serv their own god after the
manner of the nation whom they carri away from thenc

17:34 unto thi day they do after the former manners: they fear not
the lord neither do they after their statut or after their
ordin or after the law and command which the lord command
the children of jacob whom he name israel; 17:35 with whom the lord
had made a coven and charg them say ye shall not fear other
god nor bow yourselv to them nor serv them nor sacrific to
them: 17:36 but the lord who brought you up out of the land of egypt
with great power and a stretch out arm him shall ye fear and him
shall ye worship and to him shall ye do sacrific

17:37 and the statut and the ordin and the law and the
command which he wrote for you ye shall observ to do for
evermore; and ye shall not fear other god

17:38 and the coven that i have made with you ye shall not forget;
neither shall ye fear other god

17:39 but the lord your god ye shall fear; and he shall deliv you
out of the hand of all your enemi

17:40 howbeit they did not hearken but they did after their former
manner

17:41 so these nation fear the lord and serv their graven
imag both their children and their children children: as did
their father so do they unto thi day

18:1 now it came to pass in the third year of hoshea son of elah king
of israel that hezekiah the son of ahaz king of judah began to reign

18:2 twenti and five year old wa he when he began to reign; and he
reign twenti and nine year in jerusalem hi mother name also wa
abi the daughter of zachariah

18:3 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord
accord to all that david hi father did

18:4 he remov the high place and brake the imag and cut down
the grove and brake in piec the brasen serpent that mose had
made: for unto those day the children of israel did burn incens to
it: and he call it nehushtan

18:5 he trust in the lord god of israel; so that after him wa none
like him among all the king of judah nor ani that were befor him

18:6 for he clave to the lord and depart not from follow him
but kept hi command which the lord command mose

18:7 and the lord wa with him; and he prosper whithersoev he went
forth: and he rebel against the king of assyria and serv him
not

18:8 he smote the philistin even unto gaza and the border
thereof from the tower of the watchmen to the fenc citi

18:9 and it came to pass in the fourth year of king hezekiah which
wa the seventh year of hoshea son of elah king of israel that
shalmanes king of assyria came up against samaria and besieg it

18:10 and at the end of three year they took it: even in the sixth
year of hezekiah that is in the ninth year of hoshea king of israel
samaria wa taken

18:11 and the king of assyria did carri away israel unto assyria and
put them in halah and in habor by the river of gozan and in the
citi of the medes: 18:12 becaus they obey not the voic of the
lord their god but transgress hi coven and all that mose the
servant of the lord command and would not hear them nor do them
