land of egypt i chose no citi among all the tribe of israel to build
an hous in that my name might be there; neither chose i ani man to
be a ruler over my peopl israel: 6:6 but i have chosen jerusalem
that my name might be there; and have chosen david to be over my
peopl israel

6:7 now it wa in the heart of david my father to build an hous for
the name of the lord god of israel

6:8 but the lord said to david my father forasmuch as it wa in thine
heart to build an hous for my name thou didst well in that it wa in
thine heart: 6:9 notwithstand thou shalt not build the house; but
thi son which shall come forth out of thi loin he shall build the
hous for my name

6:10 the lord therefor hath perform hi word that he hath spoken:
for i am risen up in the room of david my father and am set on the
throne of israel as the lord promis and have built the hous for
the name of the lord god of israel

6:11 and in it have i put the ark wherein is the coven of the
lord that he made with the children of israel

6:12 and he stood befor the altar of the lord in the presenc of all
the congreg of israel and spread forth hi hands: 6:13 for
solomon had made a brasen scaffold of five cubit long and five
cubit broad and three cubit high and had set it in the midst of
the court: and upon it he stood and kneel down upon hi knee
befor all the congreg of israel and spread forth hi hand
toward heaven

6:14 and said o lord god of israel there is no god like thee in the
heaven nor in the earth; which keepest coven and shewest merci
unto thi servant that walk befor thee with all their hearts: 6:15
thou which hast kept with thi servant david my father that which thou
hast promis him; and spakest with thi mouth and hast fulfil it
with thine hand as it is thi day

6:16 now therefor o lord god of israel keep with thi servant david
my father that which thou hast promis him say there shall not
fail thee a man in my sight to sit upon the throne of israel; yet so
that thi children take heed to their way to walk in my law as thou
hast walk befor me

6:17 now then o lord god of israel let thi word be verifi which
thou hast spoken unto thi servant david

6:18 but will god in veri deed dwell with men on the earth? behold
heaven and the heaven of heaven cannot contain thee; how much less
thi hous which i have built! 6:19 have respect therefor to the
prayer of thi servant and to hi supplic o lord my god to
hearken unto the cri and the prayer which thi servant prayeth befor
thee: 6:20 that thine eye may be open upon thi hous day and night
upon the place whereof thou hast said that thou wouldest put thi name
there; to hearken unto the prayer which thi servant prayeth toward
thi place

6:21 hearken therefor unto the supplic of thi servant and of
thi peopl israel which they shall make toward thi place: hear thou
from thi dwell place even from heaven; and when thou hearest
forgiv

6:22 if a man sin against hi neighbour and an oath be laid upon him
to make him swear and the oath come befor thine altar in thi house;
6:23 then hear thou from heaven and do and judg thi servant by
requit the wick by recompens hi way upon hi own head; and
by justifi the righteou by give him accord to hi
righteous

6:24 and if thi peopl israel be put to the wors befor the enemi
becaus they have sin against thee; and shall return and confess
thi name and pray and make supplic befor thee in thi house;
6:25 then hear thou from the heaven and forgiv the sin of thi
peopl israel and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest to
them and to their father

6:26 when the heaven is shut up and there is no rain becaus they
have sin against thee; yet if they pray toward thi place and
confess thi name and turn from their sin when thou dost afflict
them; 6:27 then hear thou from heaven and forgiv the sin of thi
servant and of thi peopl israel when thou hast taught them the
good way wherein they should walk; and send rain upon thi land which
thou hast given unto thi peopl for an inherit

6:28 if there be dearth in the land if there be pestil if there
be blast or mildew locust or caterpillers; if their enemi
besieg them in the citi of their land; whatsoev sore or
whatsoev sick there be: 6:29 then what prayer or what
supplic soever shall be made of ani man or of all thi peopl
israel when everi one shall know hi own sore and hi own grief and
shall spread forth hi hand in thi house: 6:30 then hear thou from
heaven thi dwell place and forgiv and render unto everi man
accord unto all hi way whose heart thou knowest; (for thou onli
knowest the heart of the children of men:) 6:31 that they may fear
thee to walk in thi way so long as they live in the land which thou
gavest unto our father

6:32 moreov concern the stranger which is not of thi peopl
israel but is come from a far countri for thi great name sake and
thi mighti hand and thi stretch out arm; if they come and pray in
thi house; 6:33 then hear thou from the heaven even from thi
dwell place and do accord to all that the stranger calleth to
thee for; that all peopl of the earth may know thi name and fear
thee as doth thi peopl israel and may know that thi hous which i
have built is call by thi name

6:34 if thi peopl go out to war against their enemi by the way that
thou shalt send them and they pray unto thee toward thi citi which
thou hast chosen and the hous which i have built for thi name; 6:35
then hear thou from the heaven their prayer and their supplic
and maintain their caus

6:36 if they sin against thee (for there is no man which sinneth
not) and thou be angri with them and deliv them over befor their
enemi and they carri them away captiv unto a land far off or
near; 6:37 yet if they bethink themselv in the land whither they are
carri captiv and turn and pray unto thee in the land of their
captiv say we have sin we have done amiss and have dealt
wickedly; 6:38 if they return to thee with all their heart and with
all their soul in the land of their captiv whither they have
carri them captiv and pray toward their land which thou gavest
unto their father and toward the citi which thou hast chosen and
toward the hous which i have built for thi name: 6:39 then hear thou
from the heaven even from thi dwell place their prayer and their
supplic and maintain their caus and forgiv thi peopl which
have sin against thee

6:40 now my god let i beseech thee thine eye be open and let
thine ear be attent unto the prayer that is made in thi place

6:41 now therefor aris o lord god into thi rest place thou
and the ark of thi strength: let thi priest o lord god be cloth
with salvat and let thi saint rejoic in good

6:42 o lord god turn not away the face of thine anointed: rememb
the merci of david thi servant

7:1 now when solomon had made an end of pray the fire came down
from heaven and consum the burnt offer and the sacrifices; and
the glori of the lord fill the hous

7:2 and the priest could not enter into the hous of the lord
becaus the glori of the lord had fill the lord hous

7:3 and when all the children of israel saw how the fire came down
and the glori of the lord upon the hous they bow themselv with
their face to the ground upon the pavement and worship and
prais the lord say for he is good; for hi merci endureth for
ever

7:4 then the king and all the peopl offer sacrific befor the
lord

7:5 and king solomon offer a sacrific of twenti and two thousand
oxen and an hundr and twenti thousand sheep: so the king and all
the peopl dedic the hous of god

7:6 and the priest wait on their offices: the levit also with
instrument of musick of the lord which david the king had made to
prais the lord becaus hi merci endureth for ever when david
prais by their ministry; and the priest sound trumpet befor
them and all israel stood

7:7 moreov solomon hallow the middl of the court that wa befor
the hous of the lord: for there he offer burnt offer and the
fat of the peac offer becaus the brasen altar which solomon had
made wa not abl to receiv the burnt offer and the meat
offer and the fat

7:8 also at the same time solomon kept the feast seven day and all
israel with him a veri great congreg from the enter in of
hamath unto the river of egypt

7:9 and in the eighth day they made a solemn assembly: for they kept
the dedic of the altar seven day and the feast seven day

7:10 and on the three and twentieth day of the seventh month he sent
the peopl away into their tent glad and merri in heart for the
good that the lord had shew unto david and to solomon and to
israel hi peopl

7:11 thu solomon finish the hous of the lord and the king
house: and all that came into solomon heart to make in the hous of
the lord and in hi own hous he prosper effect

7:12 and the lord appear to solomon by night and said unto him i
have heard thi prayer and have chosen thi place to myself for an
hous of sacrific

7:13 if i shut up heaven that there be no rain or if i command the
locust to devour the land or if i send pestil among my people;
7:14 if my peopl which are call by my name shall humbl
themselv and pray and seek my face and turn from their wick
ways; then will i hear from heaven and will forgiv their sin and
will heal their land

7:15 now mine eye shall be open and mine ear attent unto the prayer
that is made in thi place

7:16 for now have i chosen and sanctifi thi hous that my name may
be there for ever: and mine eye and mine heart shall be there
perpetu

7:17 and as for thee if thou wilt walk befor me as david thi father
walk and do accord to all that i have command thee and shalt
observ my statut and my judgments; 7:18 then will i stablish the
throne of thi kingdom accord as i have coven with david thi
father say there shall not fail thee a man to be ruler in israel

7:19 but if ye turn away and forsak my statut and my command
which i have set befor you and shall go and serv other god and
worship them; 7:20 then will i pluck them up by the root out of my
land which i have given them; and thi hous which i have sanctifi
for my name will i cast out of my sight and will make it to be a
proverb and a byword among all nation

7:21 and thi hous which is high shall be an astonish to everi
one that passeth by it; so that he shall say whi hath the lord done
thu unto thi land and unto thi house? 7:22 and it shall be
answer becaus they forsook the lord god of their father which
brought them forth out of the land of egypt and laid hold on other
god and worship them and serv them: therefor hath he brought
all thi evil upon them

8:1 and it came to pass at the end of twenti year wherein solomon
had built the hous of the lord and hi own hous 8:2 that the
citi which huram had restor to solomon solomon built them and
caus the children of israel to dwell there

8:3 and solomon went to hamathzobah and prevail against it

8:4 and he built tadmor in the wilder and all the store citi
which he built in hamath

8:5 also he built bethhoron the upper and bethhoron the nether
fenc citi with wall gate and bars; 8:6 and baalath and all
the store citi that solomon had and all the chariot citi and the
citi of the horsemen and all that solomon desir to build in
jerusalem and in lebanon and throughout all the land of hi
dominion

8:7 as for all the peopl that were left of the hittit and the
amorit and the perizzit and the hivit and the jebusit
which were not of israel 8:8 but of their children who were left
after them in the land whom the children of israel consum not them
did solomon make to pay tribut until thi day

8:9 but of the children of israel did solomon make no servant for hi
work; but they were men of war and chief of hi captain and
captain of hi chariot and horsemen

8:10 and these were the chief of king solomon offic even two
hundr and fifti that bare rule over the peopl

8:11 and solomon brought up the daughter of pharaoh out of the citi of
david unto the hous that he had built for her: for he said my wife
shall not dwell in the hous of david king of israel becaus the
place are holi whereunto the ark of the lord hath come

8:12 then solomon offer burnt offer unto the lord on the altar
of the lord which he had built befor the porch 8:13 even after a
certain rate everi day offer accord to the command of
mose on the sabbath and on the new moon and on the solemn
feast three time in the year even in the feast of unleaven
bread and in the feast of week and in the feast of tabernacl

8:14 and he appoint accord to the order of david hi father the
cours of the priest to their servic and the levit to their
charg to prais and minist befor the priest as the duti of
everi day required: the porter also by their cours at everi gate:
for so had david the man of god command

8:15 and they depart not from the command of the king unto the
priest and levit concern ani matter or concern the
treasur

8:16 now all the work of solomon wa prepar unto the day of the
foundat of the hous of the lord and until it wa finish so the
hous of the lord wa perfect

8:17 then went solomon to eziongeb and to eloth at the sea side in
the land of edom

8:18 and huram sent him by the hand of hi servant ship and
servant that had knowledg of the sea; and they went with the
servant of solomon to ophir and took thenc four hundr and fifti
talent of gold and brought them to king solomon

9:1 and when the queen of sheba heard of the fame of solomon she came
to prove solomon with hard question at jerusalem with a veri great
compani and camel that bare spice and gold in abund and
preciou stones: and when she wa come to solomon she commun with
him of all that wa in her heart

9:2 and solomon told her all her questions: and there wa noth hid
from solomon which he told her not

9:3 and when the queen of sheba had seen the wisdom of solomon and
the hous that he had built 9:4 and the meat of hi tabl and the
sit of hi servant and the attend of hi minist and
their apparel; hi cupbear also and their apparel; and hi ascent
by which he went up into the hous of the lord; there wa no more
spirit in her

9:5 and she said to the king it wa a true report which i heard in
mine own land of thine act and of thi wisdom: 9:6 howbeit i believ
not their word until i came and mine eye had seen it: and behold
the one half of the great of thi wisdom wa not told me: for thou
exceedest the fame that i heard

9:7 happi are thi men and happi are these thi servant which stand
continu befor thee and hear thi wisdom

9:8 bless be the lord thi god which delight in thee to set thee
on hi throne to be king for the lord thi god: becaus thi god love
israel to establish them for ever therefor made he thee king over
them to do judgment and justic

9:9 and she gave the king an hundr and twenti talent of gold and
of spice great abund and preciou stones: neither wa there ani
such spice as the queen of sheba gave king solomon

9:10 and the servant also of huram and the servant of solomon
which brought gold from ophir brought algum tree and preciou
stone

9:11 and the king made of the algum tree terrac to the hous of the
lord and to the king palac and harp and psalteri for singers:
and there were none such seen befor in the land of judah

9:12 and king solomon gave to the queen of sheba all her desir
whatsoev she ask besid that which she had brought unto the king
so she turn and went away to her own land she and her servant

9:13 now the weight of gold that came to solomon in one year wa six
hundr and threescor and six talent of gold; 9:14 besid that which
chapmen and merchant brought and all the king of arabia and
governor of the countri brought gold and silver to solomon

9:15 and king solomon made two hundr target of beaten gold: six
hundr shekel of beaten gold went to one target

9:16 and three hundr shield made he of beaten gold: three hundr
shekel of gold went to one shield and the king put them in the hous
of the forest of lebanon

9:17 moreov the king made a great throne of ivori and overlaid it
with pure gold

9:18 and there were six step to the throne with a footstool of gold
which were fasten to the throne and stay on each side of the
sit place and two lion stand by the stays: 9:19 and twelv
lion stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six step
there wa not the like made in ani kingdom

9:20 and all the drink vessel of king solomon were of gold and
all the vessel of the hous of the forest of lebanon were of pure
gold: none were of silver; it wa not ani thing account of in the
day of solomon

9:21 for the king ship went to tarshish with the servant of huram:
everi three year onc came the ship of tarshish bring gold and
silver ivori and ape and peacock

9:22 and king solomon pass all the king of the earth in rich and
wisdom

9:23 and all the king of the earth sought the presenc of solomon to
hear hi wisdom that god had put in hi heart

9:24 and they brought everi man hi present vessel of silver and
vessel of gold and raiment har and spice hors and mule
a rate year by year

9:25 and solomon had four thousand stall for hors and chariot and
twelv thousand horsemen; whom he bestow in the chariot citi and
with the king at jerusalem

9:26 and he reign over all the king from the river even unto the
land of the philistin and to the border of egypt

9:27 and the king made silver in jerusalem as stone and cedar tree
made he as the sycomor tree that are in the low plain in abund

9:28 and they brought unto solomon hors out of egypt and out of all
land

9:29 now the rest of the act of solomon first and last are they not
written in the book of nathan the prophet and in the propheci of
ahijah the shilonit and in the vision of iddo the seer against
jeroboam the son of nebat? 9:30 and solomon reign in jerusalem over
all israel forti year

9:31 and solomon slept with hi father and he wa buri in the citi
of david hi father: and rehoboam hi son reign in hi stead

10:1 and rehoboam went to shechem: for to shechem were all israel come
to make him king

10:2 and it came to pass when jeroboam the son of nebat who wa in
egypt whither he fled from the presenc of solomon the king heard
it that jeroboam return out of egypt

10:3 and they sent and call him so jeroboam and all israel came and
spake to rehoboam say 10:4 thi father made our yoke grievous: now
therefor eas thou somewhat the grievou servitud of thi father and
hi heavi yoke that he put upon us and we will serv thee

10:5 and he said unto them come again unto me after three day and
the peopl depart

10:6 and king rehoboam took counsel with the old men that had stood
befor solomon hi father while he yet live say what counsel
give ye me to return answer to thi people? 10:7 and they spake unto
him say if thou be kind to thi peopl and pleas them and
speak good word to them they will be thi servant for ever

10:8 but he forsook the counsel which the old men gave him and took
counsel with the young men that were brought up with him that stood
befor him

10:9 and he said unto them what advic give ye that we may return
answer to thi peopl which have spoken to me say eas somewhat
the yoke that thi father did put upon us? 10:10 and the young men
that were brought up with him spake unto him say thu shalt thou
answer the peopl that spake unto thee say thi father made our
yoke heavi but make thou it somewhat lighter for us; thu shalt thou
say unto them my littl finger shall be thicker than my father
loin

10:11 for wherea my father put a heavi yoke upon you i will put more
to your yoke: my father chastis you with whip but i will chastis
you with scorpion

10:12 so jeroboam and all the peopl came to rehoboam on the third
day as the king bade say come again to me on the third day

10:13 and the king answer them roughly; and king rehoboam forsook
the counsel of the old men 10:14 and answer them after the advic
of the young men say my father made your yoke heavi but i will
add thereto: my father chastis you with whip but i will chastis
you with scorpion

10:15 so the king hearken not unto the people: for the caus wa of
god that the lord might perform hi word which he spake by the hand
of ahijah the shilonit to jeroboam the son of nebat

10:16 and when all israel saw that the king would not hearken unto
them the peopl answer the king say what portion have we in
david? and we have none inherit in the son of jesse: everi man to
your tent o israel: and now david see to thine own hous so all
israel went to their tent

10:17 but as for the children of israel that dwelt in the citi of
judah rehoboam reign over them

10:18 then king rehoboam sent hadoram that wa over the tribute; and
the children of israel stone him with stone that he die but king
rehoboam made speed to get him up to hi chariot to flee to
jerusalem

10:19 and israel rebel against the hous of david unto thi day

11:1 and when rehoboam wa come to jerusalem he gather of the hous
of judah and benjamin an hundr and fourscor thousand chosen men
which were warrior to fight against israel that he might bring the
kingdom again to rehoboam

11:2 but the word of the lord came to shemaiah the man of god say
11:3 speak unto rehoboam the son of solomon king of judah and to all
israel in judah and benjamin say 11:4 thu saith the lord ye
shall not go up nor fight against your brethren: return everi man to
hi house: for thi thing is done of me and they obey the word of
the lord and return from go against jeroboam

11:5 and rehoboam dwelt in jerusalem and built citi for defenc in
judah

11:6 he built even bethlehem and etam and tekoa 11:7 and bethzur
and shoco and adullam 11:8 and gath and mareshah and ziph 11:9
and adoraim and lachish and azekah 11:10 and zorah and aijalon
and hebron which are in judah and in benjamin fenc citi

11:11 and he fortifi the strong hold and put captain in them and
store of victual and of oil and wine

11:12 and in everi sever citi he put shield and spear and made
them exceed strong have judah and benjamin on hi side

11:13 and the priest and the levit that were in all israel resort
to him out of all their coast

11:14 for the levit left their suburb and their possess and
came to judah and jerusalem: for jeroboam and hi son had cast them
off from execut the priest offic unto the lord: 11:15 and he
ordain him priest for the high place and for the devil and for
the calv which he had made

11:16 and after them out of all the tribe of israel such as set their
heart to seek the lord god of israel came to jerusalem to sacrific
unto the lord god of their father

11:17 so they strengthen the kingdom of judah and made rehoboam the
son of solomon strong three years: for three year they walk in the
way of david and solomon

11:18 and rehoboam took him mahalath the daughter of jerimoth the son
of david to wife and abihail the daughter of eliab the son of jesse;
11:19 which bare him children; jeush and shamariah and zaham

11:20 and after her he took maachah the daughter of absalom; which
bare him abijah and attai and ziza and shelomith

11:21 and rehoboam love maachah the daughter of absalom abov all hi
wive and hi concubines: (for he took eighteen wive and threescor
concubines; and begat twenti and eight son and threescor
daughters) 11:22 and rehoboam made abijah the son of maachah the
chief to be ruler among hi brethren: for he thought to make him
king

11:23 and he dealt wise and dispers of all hi children
throughout all the countri of judah and benjamin unto everi fenc
city: and he gave them victual in abund and he desir mani
wive

12:1 and it came to pass when rehoboam had establish the kingdom
and had strengthen himself he forsook the law of the lord and all
israel with him

12:2 and it came to pass that in the fifth year of king rehoboam
shishak king of egypt came up against jerusalem becaus they had
transgress against the lord 12:3 with twelv hundr chariot and
threescor thousand horsemen: and the peopl were without number that
came with him out of egypt; the lubim the sukkiim and the
ethiopian

12:4 and he took the fenc citi which pertain to judah and came
to jerusalem

12:5 then came shemaiah the prophet to rehoboam and to the princ of
judah that were gather togeth to jerusalem becaus of shishak
and said unto them thu saith the lord ye have forsaken me and
therefor have i also left you in the hand of shishak

12:6 whereupon the princ of israel and the king humbl themselves;
and they said the lord is righteou

12:7 and when the lord saw that they humbl themselv the word of
the lord came to shemaiah say they have humbl themselves;
therefor i will not destroy them but i will grant them some
deliverance; and my wrath shall not be pour out upon jerusalem by
the hand of shishak

12:8 nevertheless they shall be hi servants; that they may know my
servic and the servic of the kingdom of the countri

12:9 so shishak king of egypt came up against jerusalem and took away
the treasur of the hous of the lord and the treasur of the
king house; he took all: he carri away also the shield of gold
which solomon had made

12:10 instead of which king rehoboam made shield of brass and
commit them to the hand of the chief of the guard that kept the
entranc of the king hous

12:11 and when the king enter into the hous of the lord the guard
came and fetch them and brought them again into the guard chamber

12:12 and when he humbl himself the wrath of the lord turn from
him that he would not destroy him altogether: and also in judah
thing went well

12:13 so king rehoboam strengthen himself in jerusalem and reigned:
for rehoboam wa one and forti year old when he began to reign and
he reign seventeen year in jerusalem the citi which the lord had
chosen out of all the tribe of israel to put hi name there and hi
mother name wa naamah an ammonitess

12:14 and he did evil becaus he prepar not hi heart to seek the
lord

12:15 now the act of rehoboam first and last are they not written
in the book of shemaiah the prophet and of iddo the seer concern
genealogies? and there were war between rehoboam and jeroboam
continu

12:16 and rehoboam slept with hi father and wa buri in the citi
of david: and abijah hi son reign in hi stead

13:1 now in the eighteenth year of king jeroboam began abijah to reign
over judah

13:2 he reign three year in jerusalem hi mother name also wa
michaiah the daughter of uriel of gibeah and there wa war between
abijah and jeroboam

13:3 and abijah set the battl in array with an armi of valiant men of
war even four hundr thousand chosen men: jeroboam also set the
battl in array against him with eight hundr thousand chosen men
be mighti men of valour

13:4 and abijah stood up upon mount zemaraim which is in mount
ephraim and said hear me thou jeroboam and all israel; 13:5 ought
ye not to know that the lord god of israel gave the kingdom over
israel to david for ever even to him and to hi son by a coven of
salt? 13:6 yet jeroboam the son of nebat the servant of solomon the
son of david is risen up and hath rebel against hi lord

13:7 and there are gather unto him vain men the children of belial
and have strengthen themselv against rehoboam the son of solomon
when rehoboam wa young and tenderheart and could not withstand
them

13:8 and now ye think to withstand the kingdom of the lord in the hand
of the son of david; and ye be a great multitud and there are with
your golden calv which jeroboam made you for god

13:9 have ye not cast out the priest of the lord the son of aaron
and the levit and have made you priest after the manner of the
nation of other lands? so that whosoev cometh to consecr himself
with a young bullock and seven ram the same may be a priest of them
that are no god

13:10 but as for us the lord is our god and we have not forsaken
him; and the priest which minist unto the lord are the son of
aaron and the levit wait upon their business: 13:11 and they burn
unto the lord everi morn and everi even burnt sacrific and
sweet incense: the shewbread also set they in order upon the pure
table; and the candlestick of gold with the lamp thereof to burn
everi evening: for we keep the charg of the lord our god; but ye have
forsaken him

13:12 and behold god himself is with us for our captain and hi
priest with sound trumpet to cri alarm against you o children of
israel fight ye not against the lord god of your fathers; for ye
shall not prosper

13:13 but jeroboam caus an ambush to come about behind them: so
they were befor judah and the ambush wa behind them

13:14 and when judah look back behold the battl wa befor and
behind: and they cri unto the lord and the priest sound with the
trumpet

13:15 then the men of judah gave a shout: and as the men of judah
shout it came to pass that god smote jeroboam and all israel
befor abijah and judah

13:16 and the children of israel fled befor judah: and god deliv
them into their hand

13:17 and abijah and hi peopl slew them with a great slaughter: so
there fell down slain of israel five hundr thousand chosen men

13:18 thu the children of israel were brought under at that time and
the children of judah prevail becaus they reli upon the lord god
of their father

13:19 and abijah pursu after jeroboam and took citi from him
bethel with the town thereof and jeshanah with the town thereof
and ephraim with the town thereof

13:20 neither did jeroboam recov strength again in the day of
abijah: and the lord struck him and he die

13:21 but abijah wax mighti and marri fourteen wive and begat
twenti and two son and sixteen daughter

13:22 and the rest of the act of abijah and hi way and hi
say are written in the stori of the prophet iddo

14:1 so abijah slept with hi father and they buri him in the citi
of david: and asa hi son reign in hi stead in hi day the land
wa quiet ten year

14:2 and asa did that which wa good and right in the eye of the lord
hi god: 14:3 for he took away the altar of the strang god and the
high place and brake down the imag and cut down the groves: 14:4
and command judah to seek the lord god of their father and to do
the law and the command

14:5 also he took away out of all the citi of judah the high place
and the images: and the kingdom wa quiet befor him

14:6 and he built fenc citi in judah: for the land had rest and
he had no war in those years; becaus the lord had given him rest

14:7 therefor he said unto judah let us build these citi and make
about them wall and tower gate and bar while the land is yet
befor us; becaus we have sought the lord our god we have sought
him and he hath given us rest on everi side so they built and
prosper

14:8 and asa had an armi of men that bare target and spear out of
judah three hundr thousand; and out of benjamin that bare shield
and drew bow two hundr and fourscor thousand: all these were
mighti men of valour

14:9 and there came out against them zerah the ethiopian with an host
of a thousand thousand and three hundr chariots; and came unto
mareshah

14:10 then asa went out against him and they set the battl in array
in the valley of zephathah at mareshah

14:11 and asa cri unto the lord hi god and said lord it is
noth with thee to help whether with mani or with them that have
no power: help us o lord our god; for we rest on thee and in thi
name we go against thi multitud o lord thou art our god; let no
man prevail against thee

14:12 so the lord smote the ethiopian befor asa and befor judah;
and the ethiopian fled

14:13 and asa and the peopl that were with him pursu them unto
gerar: and the ethiopian were overthrown that they could not recov
themselves; for they were destroy befor the lord and befor hi
host; and they carri away veri much spoil

14:14 and they smote all the citi round about gerar; for the fear of
the lord came upon them: and they spoil all the cities; for there
wa exceed much spoil in them

14:15 they smote also the tent of cattl and carri away sheep and
camel in abund and return to jerusalem

15:1 and the spirit of god came upon azariah the son of oded: 15:2 and
he went out to meet asa and said unto him hear ye me asa and all
judah and benjamin; the lord is with you while ye be with him; and if
ye seek him he will be found of you; but if ye forsak him he will
forsak you

15:3 now for a long season israel hath been without the true god and
without a teach priest and without law

15:4 but when they in their troubl did turn unto the lord god of
israel and sought him he wa found of them

15:5 and in those time there wa no peac to him that went out nor
to him that came in but great vexat were upon all the inhabit
of the countri

15:6 and nation wa destroy of nation and citi of city: for god did
vex them with all advers

15:7 be ye strong therefor and let not your hand be weak: for your
work shall be reward

15:8 and when asa heard these word and the propheci of ode the
prophet he took courag and put away the abomin idol out of all
the land of judah and benjamin and out of the citi which he had
taken from mount ephraim and renew the altar of the lord that wa
befor the porch of the lord

15:9 and he gather all judah and benjamin and the stranger with
them out of ephraim and manasseh and out of simeon: for they fell to
him out of israel in abund when they saw that the lord hi god
wa with him

15:10 so they gather themselv togeth at jerusalem in the third
month in the fifteenth year of the reign of asa

15:11 and they offer unto the lord the same time of the spoil which
they had brought seven hundr oxen and seven thousand sheep

15:12 and they enter into a coven to seek the lord god of their
father with all their heart and with all their soul; 15:13 that
whosoev would not seek the lord god of israel should be put to
death whether small or great whether man or woman

15:14 and they sware unto the lord with a loud voic and with
shout and with trumpet and with cornet

15:15 and all judah rejoic at the oath: for they had sworn with all
their heart and sought him with their whole desire; and he wa found
of them: and the lord gave them rest round about

15:16 and also concern maachah the mother of asa the king he
remov her from be queen becaus she had made an idol in a grove:
and asa cut down her idol and stamp it and burnt it at the brook
kidron

15:17 but the high place were not taken away out of israel:
nevertheless the heart of asa wa perfect all hi day

15:18 and he brought into the hous of god the thing that hi father
had dedic and that he himself had dedic silver and gold
and vessel

15:19 and there wa no more war unto the five and thirtieth year of
the reign of asa

16:1 in the six and thirtieth year of the reign of asa baasha king of
israel came up against judah and built ramah to the intent that he
might let none go out or come in to asa king of judah

16:2 then asa brought out silver and gold out of the treasur of the
hous of the lord and of the king hous and sent to benhadad king
of syria that dwelt at damascu say 16:3 there is a leagu
between me and thee as there wa between my father and thi father:
behold i have sent thee silver and gold; go break thi leagu with
baasha king of israel that he may depart from me

16:4 and benhadad hearken unto king asa and sent the captain of
hi armi against the citi of israel; and they smote ijon and dan
and abelmaim and all the store citi of naphtali

16:5 and it came to pass when baasha heard it that he left off
build of ramah and let hi work ceas

16:6 then asa the king took all judah; and they carri away the
stone of ramah and the timber thereof wherewith baasha wa
building; and he built therewith geba and mizpah

16:7 and at that time hanani the seer came to asa king of judah and
said unto him becaus thou hast reli on the king of syria and not
reli on the lord thi god therefor is the host of the king of syria
escap out of thine hand

16:8 were not the ethiopian and the lubim a huge host with veri
mani chariot and horsemen? yet becaus thou didst reli on the lord
he deliv them into thine hand

16:9 for the eye of the lord run to and fro throughout the whole
earth to shew himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is
perfect toward him herein thou hast done foolishly: therefor from
henceforth thou shalt have war

16:10 then asa wa wroth with the seer and put him in a prison house;
for he wa in a rage with him becaus of thi thing and asa oppress
some of the peopl the same time

16:11 and behold the act of asa first and last lo they are
written in the book of the king of judah and israel

16:12 and asa in the thirti and ninth year of hi reign wa diseas
in hi feet until hi diseas wa exceed great: yet in hi diseas
he sought not to the lord but to the physician

16:13 and asa slept with hi father and die in the one and fortieth
year of hi reign

16:14 and they buri him in hi own sepulchr which he had made for
himself in the citi of david and laid him in the bed which wa fill
with sweet odour and diver kind of spice prepar by the
apothecari art: and they made a veri great burn for him

17:1 and jehoshaphat hi son reign in hi stead and strengthen
himself against israel

17:2 and he place forc in all the fenc citi of judah and set
garrison in the land of judah and in the citi of ephraim which
asa hi father had taken

17:3 and the lord wa with jehoshaphat becaus he walk in the first
way of hi father david and sought not unto baalim; 17:4 but sought
to the lord god of hi father and walk in hi command and not
after the do of israel

17:5 therefor the lord stablish the kingdom in hi hand; and all
judah brought to jehoshaphat presents; and he had rich and honour in
abund

17:6 and hi heart wa lift up in the way of the lord: moreov he
took away the high place and grove out of judah

17:7 also in the third year of hi reign he sent to hi princ even
to benhail and to obadiah and to zechariah and to nethaneel and to
michaiah to teach in the citi of judah

17:8 and with them he sent levit even shemaiah and nethaniah and
zebadiah and asahel and shemiramoth and jehonathan and adonijah
and tobijah and tobadonijah levites; and with them elishama and
jehoram priest

17:9 and they taught in judah and had the book of the law of the lord
with them and went about throughout all the citi of judah and
taught the peopl

17:10 and the fear of the lord fell upon all the kingdom of the land
that were round about judah so that they made no war against
jehoshaphat

17:11 also some of the philistin brought jehoshaphat present and
tribut silver; and the arabian brought him flock seven thousand
and seven hundr ram and seven thousand and seven hundr he goat

17:12 and jehoshaphat wax great exceedingly; and he built in judah
castl and citi of store

17:13 and he had much busi in the citi of judah: and the men of
war mighti men of valour were in jerusalem

17:14 and these are the number of them accord to the hous of
their fathers: of judah the captain of thousands; adnah the chief
and with him mighti men of valour three hundr thousand

17:15 and next to him wa jehohanan the captain and with him two
hundr and fourscor thousand

17:16 and next him wa amasiah the son of zichri who willingli
offer himself unto the lord; and with him two hundr thousand
mighti men of valour

17:17 and of benjamin; eliada a mighti man of valour and with him
arm men with bow and shield two hundr thousand

17:18 and next him wa jehozabad and with him an hundr and
fourscor thousand readi prepar for the war

17:19 these wait on the king besid those whom the king put in the
fenc citi throughout all judah

18:1 now jehoshaphat had rich and honour in abund and join
affin with ahab

18:2 and after certain year he went down to ahab to samaria and ahab
kill sheep and oxen for him in abund and for the peopl that he
had with him and persuad him to go up with him to ramothgilead

18:3 and ahab king of israel said unto jehoshaphat king of judah wilt
thou go with me to ramothgilead? and he answer him i am as thou
art and my peopl as thi people; and we will be with thee in the war

18:4 and jehoshaphat said unto the king of israel enquir i pray
thee at the word of the lord to day

18:5 therefor the king of israel gather togeth of prophet four
hundr men and said unto them shall we go to ramothgilead to
battl or shall i forbear? and they said go up; for god will deliv
it into the king hand

18:6 but jehoshaphat said is there not here a prophet of the lord
besid that we might enquir of him? 18:7 and the king of israel
said unto jehoshaphat there is yet one man by whom we may enquir of
the lord: but i hate him; for he never prophesi good unto me but
alway evil: the same is micaiah the son of imla and jehoshaphat
said let not the king say so

18:8 and the king of israel call for one of hi offic and said
fetch quickli micaiah the son of imla

18:9 and the king of israel and jehoshaphat king of judah sat either
of them on hi throne cloth in their robe and they sat in a void
place at the enter in of the gate of samaria; and all the prophet
prophesi befor them

18:10 and zedekiah the son of chenaanah had made him horn of iron
and said thu saith the lord with these thou shalt push syria until
they be consum

18:11 and all the prophet prophesi so say go up to
ramothgilead and prosper: for the lord shall deliv it into the hand
of the king

18:12 and the messeng that went to call micaiah spake to him
say behold the word of the prophet declar good to the king
with one assent; let thi word therefor i pray thee be like one of
their and speak thou good

18:13 and micaiah said as the lord liveth even what my god saith
that will i speak

18:14 and when he wa come to the king the king said unto him
micaiah shall we go to ramothgilead to battl or shall i forbear?
and he said go ye up and prosper and they shall be deliv into
your hand

18:15 and the king said to him how mani time shall i adjur thee
that thou say noth but the truth to me in the name of the lord?
18:16 then he said i did see all israel scatter upon the mountain
as sheep that have no shepherd: and the lord said these have no
master; let them return therefor everi man to hi hous in peac

18:17 and the king of israel said to jehoshaphat did i not tell thee
that he would not prophesi good unto me but evil? 18:18 again he
said therefor hear the word of the lord; i saw the lord sit upon
hi throne and all the host of heaven stand on hi right hand and
on hi left

18:19 and the lord said who shall entic ahab king of israel that he
may go up and fall at ramothgilead? and one spake say after thi
manner and anoth say after that manner

18:20 then there came out a spirit and stood befor the lord and
said i will entic him and the lord said unto him wherewith? 18:21
and he said i will go out and be a lie spirit in the mouth of all
hi prophet and the lord said thou shalt entic him and thou shalt
also prevail: go out and do even so

18:22 now therefor behold the lord hath put a lie spirit in the
mouth of these thi prophet and the lord hath spoken evil against
thee

18:23 then zedekiah the son of chenaanah came near and smote micaiah
upon the cheek and said which way went the spirit of the lord from
me to speak unto thee? 18:24 and micaiah said behold thou shalt see
on that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself

18:25 then the king of israel said take ye micaiah and carri him
back to amon the governor of the citi and to joash the king son;
18:26 and say thu saith the king put thi fellow in the prison and
feed him with bread of afflict and with water of afflict until
i return in peac

18:27 and micaiah said if thou certainli return in peac then hath
not the lord spoken by me and he said hearken all ye peopl

18:28 so the king of israel and jehoshaphat the king of judah went up
to ramothgilead

18:29 and the king of israel said unto jehoshaphat i will disguis
myself and i will go to the battle; but put thou on thi robe so the
king of israel disguis himself; and they went to the battl

18:30 now the king of syria had command the captain of the chariot
that were with him say fight ye not with small or great save
onli with the king of israel

18:31 and it came to pass when the captain of the chariot saw
jehoshaphat that they said it is the king of israel therefor they
compass about him to fight: but jehoshaphat cri out and the lord
help him; and god move them to depart from him

18:32 for it came to pass that when the captain of the chariot
perceiv that it wa not the king of israel they turn back again
from pursu him

18:33 and a certain man drew a bow at a ventur and smote the king of
israel between the joint of the harness: therefor he said to hi
chariot man turn thine hand that thou mayest carri me out of the
host; for i am wound

18:34 and the battl increas that day: howbeit the king of israel
stay himself up in hi chariot against the syrian until the even:
and about the time of the sun go down he die

19:1 and jehoshaphat the king of judah return to hi hous in peac
to jerusalem

19:2 and jehu the son of hanani the seer went out to meet him and
said to king jehoshaphat shouldest thou help the ungodli and love
them that hate the lord? therefor is wrath upon thee from befor the
lord

19:3 nevertheless there are good thing found in thee in that thou
hast taken away the grove out of the land and hast prepar thine
heart to seek god

19:4 and jehoshaphat dwelt at jerusalem: and he went out again through
the peopl from beersheba to mount ephraim and brought them back unto
the lord god of their father

19:5 and he set judg in the land throughout all the fenc citi of
judah citi by citi 19:6 and said to the judg take heed what ye
do: for ye judg not for man but for the lord who is with you in the
judgment

19:7 wherefor now let the fear of the lord be upon you; take heed and
do it: for there is no iniqu with the lord our god nor respect of
person nor take of gift

19:8 moreov in jerusalem did jehoshaphat set of the levit and of
the priest and of the chief of the father of israel for the
judgment of the lord and for controversi when they return to
jerusalem

19:9 and he charg them say thu shall ye do in the fear of the
lord faith and with a perfect heart

19:10 and what caus soever shall come to you of your brethren that
dwell in your citi between blood and blood between law and
command statut and judgment ye shall even warn them that they
trespass not against the lord and so wrath come upon you and upon
your brethren: thi do and ye shall not trespass

19:11 and behold amariah the chief priest is over you in all matter
of the lord; and zebadiah the son of ishmael the ruler of the hous
of judah for all the king matters: also the levit shall be
offic befor you deal courag and the lord shall be with the
good

20:1 it came to pass after thi also that the children of moab and
the children of ammon and with them other besid the ammonit came
against jehoshaphat to battl

20:2 then there came some that told jehoshaphat say there cometh
a great multitud against thee from beyond the sea on thi side syria;
and behold they be in hazazontamar which is engedi

20:3 and jehoshaphat fear and set himself to seek the lord and
proclaim a fast throughout all judah

20:4 and judah gather themselv togeth to ask help of the lord:
even out of all the citi of judah they came to seek the lord

20:5 and jehoshaphat stood in the congreg of judah and jerusalem
in the hous of the lord befor the new court 20:6 and said o lord
god of our father art not thou god in heaven? and rulest not thou
over all the kingdom of the heathen? and in thine hand is there not
power and might so that none is abl to withstand thee? 20:7 art not
thou our god who didst drive out the inhabit of thi land befor
thi peopl israel and gavest it to the seed of abraham thi friend for
ever? 20:8 and they dwelt therein and have built thee a sanctuari
therein for thi name say 20:9 if when evil cometh upon us as
the sword judgment or pestil or famin we stand befor thi
hous and in thi presenc (for thi name is in thi house) and cri
unto thee in our afflict then thou wilt hear and help

20:10 and now behold the children of ammon and moab and mount seir
whom thou wouldest not let israel invad when they came out of the
land of egypt but they turn from them and destroy them not;
20:11 behold i say how they reward us to come to cast us out of thi
possess which thou hast given us to inherit

20:12 o our god wilt thou not judg them? for we have no might
against thi great compani that cometh against us; neither know we
what to do: but our eye are upon thee

20:13 and all judah stood befor the lord with their littl one
their wive and their children

20:14 then upon jahaziel the son of zechariah the son of benaiah the
son of jeiel the son of mattaniah a levit of the son of asaph
came the spirit of the lord in the midst of the congregation; 20:15
and he said hearken ye all judah and ye inhabit of jerusalem
and thou king jehoshaphat thu saith the lord unto you be not afraid
nor dismay by reason of thi great multitude; for the battl is not
your but god

20:16 to morrow go ye down against them: behold they come up by the
cliff of ziz; and ye shall find them at the end of the brook befor
the wilder of jeruel

20:17 ye shall not need to fight in thi battle: set yourselv stand
ye still and see the salvat of the lord with you o judah and
jerusalem: fear not nor be dismayed; to morrow go out against them:
for the lord will be with you

20:18 and jehoshaphat bow hi head with hi face to the ground: and
all judah and the inhabit of jerusalem fell befor the lord
worship the lord

20:19 and the levit of the children of the kohathit and of the
children of the korhit stood up to prais the lord god of israel
with a loud voic on high

20:20 and they rose earli in the morn and went forth into the
wilder of tekoa: and as they went forth jehoshaphat stood and
said hear me o judah and ye inhabit of jerusalem; believ in
the lord your god so shall ye be established; believ hi prophet
so shall ye prosper

20:21 and when he had consult with the peopl he appoint singer
unto the lord and that should prais the beauti of holi as they
went out befor the armi and to say prais the lord; for hi merci
endureth for ever

20:22 and when they began to sing and to prais the lord set
ambush against the children of ammon moab and mount seir which
were come against judah; and they were smitten

20:23 for the children of ammon and moab stood up against the
inhabit of mount seir utterli to slay and destroy them: and when
they had made an end of the inhabit of seir everi one help to
destroy anoth

20:24 and when judah came toward the watch tower in the wilder
they look unto the multitud and behold they were dead bodi
fallen to the earth and none escap

20:25 and when jehoshaphat and hi peopl came to take away the spoil
of them they found among them in abund both rich with the dead
bodi and preciou jewel which they strip off for themselv
more than they could carri away: and they were three day in gather
of the spoil it wa so much

20:26 and on the fourth day they assembl themselv in the valley of
berachah; for there they bless the lord: therefor the name of the
same place wa call the valley of berachah unto thi day

20:27 then they return everi man of judah and jerusalem and
jehoshaphat in the forefront of them to go again to jerusalem with
joy; for the lord had made them to rejoic over their enemi

20:28 and they came to jerusalem with psalteri and harp and
trumpet unto the hous of the lord

20:29 and the fear of god wa on all the kingdom of those countri
when they had heard that the lord fought against the enemi of
israel

20:30 so the realm of jehoshaphat wa quiet: for hi god gave him rest
round about

20:31 and jehoshaphat reign over judah: he wa thirti and five year
old when he began to reign and he reign twenti and five year in
jerusalem

and hi mother name wa azubah the daughter of shilhi

20:32 and he walk in the way of asa hi father and depart not
from it do that which wa right in the sight of the lord

20:33 howbeit the high place were not taken away: for as yet the
peopl had not prepar their heart unto the god of their father

20:34 now the rest of the act of jehoshaphat first and last behold
they are written in the book of jehu the son of hanani who is
mention in the book of the king of israel

20:35 and after thi did jehoshaphat king of judah join himself with
ahaziah king of israel who did veri wickedly: 20:36 and he join
himself with him to make ship to go to tarshish: and they made the
ship in eziongab

20:37 then eliez the son of dodavah of mareshah prophesi against
jehoshaphat say becaus thou hast join thyself with ahaziah
the lord hath broken thi work and the ship were broken that they
were not abl to go to tarshish

21:1 now jehoshaphat slept with hi father and wa buri with hi
father in the citi of david and jehoram hi son reign in hi
stead

21:2 and he had brethren the son of jehoshaphat azariah and jehiel
and zechariah and azariah and michael and shephatiah: all these
were the son of jehoshaphat king of israel

21:3 and their father gave them great gift of silver and of gold
and of preciou thing with fenc citi in judah: but the kingdom
gave he to jehoram; becaus he wa the firstborn

21:4 now when jehoram wa risen up to the kingdom of hi father he
strengthen himself and slew all hi brethren with the sword and
diver also of the princ of israel

21:5 jehoram wa thirti and two year old when he began to reign and
he reign eight year in jerusalem

21:6 and he walk in the way of the king of israel like as did the
hous of ahab: for he had the daughter of ahab to wife: and he wrought
that which wa evil in the eye of the lord

21:7 howbeit the lord would not destroy the hous of david becaus of
the coven that he had made with david and as he promis to give a
light to him and to hi son for ever

21:8 in hi day the edomit revolt from under the dominion of
judah and made themselv a king

21:9 then jehoram went forth with hi princ and all hi chariot
with him: and he rose up by night and smote the edomit which
compass him in and the captain of the chariot

21:10 so the edomit revolt from under the hand of judah unto thi
day

the same time also did libnah revolt from under hi hand; becaus he
had forsaken the lord god of hi father

21:11 moreov he made high place in the mountain of judah and
caus the inhabit of jerusalem to commit fornic and
compel judah thereto

21:12 and there came a write to him from elijah the prophet say
thu saith the lord god of david thi father becaus thou hast not
walk in the way of jehoshaphat thi father nor in the way of asa
king of judah 21:13 but hast walk in the way of the king of
israel and hast made judah and the inhabit of jerusalem to go a
whore like to the whoredom of the hous of ahab and also hast
slain thi brethren of thi father hous which were better than
thyself: 21:14 behold with a great plagu will the lord smite thi
peopl and thi children and thi wive and all thi goods: 21:15 and
thou shalt have great sick by diseas of thi bowel until thi
bowel fall out by reason of the sick day by day

21:16 moreov the lord stir up against jehoram the spirit of the
philistin and of the arabian that were near the ethiopians: 21:17
and they came up into judah and brake into it and carri away all
the substanc that wa found in the king hous and hi son also
and hi wives; so that there wa never a son left him save jehoahaz
the youngest of hi son

21:18 and after all thi the lord smote him in hi bowel with an
incur diseas

21:19 and it came to pass that in process of time after the end of
two year hi bowel fell out by reason of hi sickness: so he die
of sore diseas and hi peopl made no burn for him like the
burn of hi father

21:20 thirti and two year old wa he when he began to reign and he
reign in jerusalem eight year and depart without be desir
howbeit they buri him in the citi of david but not in the
sepulchr of the king

22:1 and the inhabit of jerusalem made ahaziah hi youngest son
king in hi stead: for the band of men that came with the arabian to
the camp had slain all the eldest so ahaziah the son of jehoram king
of judah reign

22:2 forti and two year old wa ahaziah when he began to reign and
he reign one year in jerusalem hi mother name also wa athaliah
the daughter of omri

22:3 he also walk in the way of the hous of ahab: for hi mother
wa hi counsellor to do wickedli

22:4 wherefor he did evil in the sight of the lord like the hous of
ahab: for they were hi counsellor after the death of hi father to
hi destruct

22:5 he walk also after their counsel and went with jehoram the son
of ahab king of israel to war against hazael king of syria at
ramothgilead: and the syrian smote joram

22:6 and he return to be heal in jezreel becaus of the wound
which were given him at ramah when he fought with hazael king of
syria and azariah the son of jehoram king of judah went down to see
jehoram the son of ahab at jezreel becaus he wa sick

22:7 and the destruct of ahaziah wa of god by come to joram: for
when he wa come he went out with jehoram against jehu the son of
nimshi whom the lord had anoint to cut off the hous of ahab

22:8 and it came to pass that when jehu wa execut judgment upon
the hous of ahab and found the princ of judah and the son of the
brethren of ahaziah that minist to ahaziah he slew them

22:9 and he sought ahaziah: and they caught him (for he wa hid in
samaria) and brought him to jehu: and when they had slain him they
buri him: becaus said they he is the son of jehoshaphat who
sought the lord with all hi heart so the hous of ahaziah had no
power to keep still the kingdom

22:10 but when athaliah the mother of ahaziah saw that her son wa
dead she aros and destroy all the seed royal of the hous of
judah

22:11 but jehoshabeath the daughter of the king took joash the son
of ahaziah and stole him from among the king son that were slain
and put him and hi nurs in a bedchamb so jehoshabeath the
daughter of king jehoram the wife of jehoiada the priest (for she
wa the sister of ahaziah) hid him from athaliah so that she slew
him not

22:12 and he wa with them hid in the hous of god six years: and
athaliah reign over the land

23:1 and in the seventh year jehoiada strengthen himself and took
the captain of hundr azariah the son of jeroham and ishmael the
son of jehohanan and azariah the son of obe and maaseiah the son of
adaiah and elishaphat the son of zichri into coven with him

23:2 and they went about in judah and gather the levit out of all
the citi of judah and the chief of the father of israel and they
came to jerusalem

23:3 and all the congreg made a coven with the king in the
hous of god and he said unto them behold the king son shall
reign as the lord hath said of the son of david

23:4 thi is the thing that ye shall do; a third part of you enter
on the sabbath of the priest and of the levit shall be porter of
the doors; 23:5 and a third part shall be at the king house; and a
third part at the gate of the foundation: and all the peopl shall be
in the court of the hous of the lord

23:6 but let none come into the hous of the lord save the priest
and they that minist of the levites; they shall go in for they are
holy: but all the peopl shall keep the watch of the lord

23:7 and the levit shall compass the king round about everi man
with hi weapon in hi hand; and whosoev els cometh into the
hous he shall be put to death: but be ye with the king when he
cometh in and when he goeth out

23:8 so the levit and all judah did accord to all thing that
jehoiada the priest had command and took everi man hi men that
were to come in on the sabbath with them that were to go out on the
sabbath: for jehoiada the priest dismiss not the cours

23:9 moreov jehoiada the priest deliv to the captain of
hundr spear and buckler and shield that had been king
david which were in the hous of god

23:10 and he set all the peopl everi man have hi weapon in hi
hand from the right side of the templ to the left side of the
templ along by the altar and the templ by the king round about

23:11 then they brought out the king son and put upon him the
crown and gave him the testimoni and made him king and jehoiada and
hi son anoint him and said god save the king

23:12 now when athaliah heard the nois of the peopl run and
prais the king she came to the peopl into the hous of the lord:
23:13 and she look and behold the king stood at hi pillar at the
enter in and the princ and the trumpet by the king: and all the
peopl of the land rejoic and sound with trumpet also the
singer with instrument of musick and such as taught to sing prais
then athaliah rent her cloth and said treason treason

23:14 then jehoiada the priest brought out the captain of hundr
that were set over the host and said unto them have her forth of the
ranges: and whoso followeth her let him be slain with the sword for
the priest said slay her not in the hous of the lord

23:15 so they laid hand on her; and when she wa come to the enter
of the hors gate by the king hous they slew her there

23:16 and jehoiada made a coven between him and between all the
peopl and between the king that they should be the lord peopl

23:17 then all the peopl went to the hous of baal and brake it
down and brake hi altar and hi imag in piec and slew mattan
the priest of baal befor the altar

23:18 also jehoiada appoint the offic of the hous of the lord by
the hand of the priest the levit whom david had distribut in the
hous of the lord to offer the burnt offer of the lord as it is
written in the law of mose with rejoic and with sing as it
wa ordain by david

23:19 and he set the porter at the gate of the hous of the lord
that none which wa unclean in ani thing should enter in

23:20 and he took the captain of hundr and the nobl and the
governor of the peopl and all the peopl of the land and brought
down the king from the hous of the lord: and they came through the
high gate into the king hous and set the king upon the throne of
the kingdom

23:21 and all the peopl of the land rejoiced: and the citi wa quiet
after that they had slain athaliah with the sword

24:1 joash wa seven year old when he began to reign and he reign
forti year in jerusalem hi mother name also wa zibiah of
beersheba

24:2 and joash did that which wa right in the sight of the lord all
the day of jehoiada the priest

24:3 and jehoiada took for him two wives; and he begat son and
daughter

24:4 and it came to pass after thi that joash wa mind to repair
the hous of the lord

24:5 and he gather togeth the priest and the levit and said to
them go out unto the citi of judah and gather of all israel money
to repair the hous of your god from year to year and see that ye
hasten the matter howbeit the levit hasten it not

24:6 and the king call for jehoiada the chief and said unto him
whi hast thou not requir of the levit to bring in out of judah and
out of jerusalem the collect accord to the command of mose
the servant of the lord and of the congreg of israel for the
tabernacl of witness? 24:7 for the son of athaliah that wick
woman had broken up the hous of god; and also all the dedic
thing of the hous of the lord did they bestow upon baalim

24:8 and at the king command they made a chest and set it
without at the gate of the hous of the lord

24:9 and they made a proclam through judah and jerusalem to
bring in to the lord the collect that mose the servant of god laid
upon israel in the wilder

24:10 and all the princ and all the peopl rejoic and brought in
and cast into the chest until they had made an end

24:11 now it came to pass that at what time the chest wa brought
unto the king offic by the hand of the levit and when they saw
that there wa much money the king scribe and the high priest
offic came and empti the chest and took it and carri it to hi
place again thu they did day by day and gather money in
abund

24:12 and the king and jehoiada gave it to such as did the work of the
servic of the hous of the lord and hire mason and carpent to
repair the hous of the lord and also such as wrought iron and brass
to mend the hous of the lord

24:13 so the workmen wrought and the work wa perfect by them and
they set the hous of god in hi state and strengthen it

24:14 and when they had finish it they brought the rest of the
money befor the king and jehoiada whereof were made vessel for the
hous of the lord even vessel to minist and to offer withal and
spoon and vessel of gold and silver and they offer burnt
offer in the hous of the lord continu all the day of
jehoiada

24:15 but jehoiada wax old and wa full of day when he died; an
hundr and thirti year old wa he when he die

24:16 and they buri him in the citi of david among the king
becaus he had done good in israel both toward god and toward hi
hous

24:17 now after the death of jehoiada came the princ of judah and
made obeis to the king then the king hearken unto them

24:18 and they left the hous of the lord god of their father and
serv grove and idols: and wrath came upon judah and jerusalem for
thi their trespass

24:19 yet he sent prophet to them to bring them again unto the lord;
and they testifi against them: but they would not give ear

24:20 and the spirit of god came upon zechariah the son of jehoiada
the priest which stood abov the peopl and said unto them thu
saith god whi transgress ye the command of the lord that ye
cannot prosper? becaus ye have forsaken the lord he hath also
forsaken you

24:21 and they conspir against him and stone him with stone at
the command of the king in the court of the hous of the lord

24:22 thu joash the king rememb not the kind which jehoiada
hi father had done to him but slew hi son and when he die he
said the lord look upon it and requir it

24:23 and it came to pass at the end of the year that the host of
syria came up against him: and they came to judah and jerusalem and
destroy all the princ of the peopl from among the peopl and
sent all the spoil of them unto the king of damascu

24:24 for the armi of the syrian came with a small compani of men
and the lord deliv a veri great host into their hand becaus they
had forsaken the lord god of their father so they execut judgment
against joash

24:25 and when they were depart from him (for they left him in
great diseases) hi own servant conspir against him for the blood
of the son of jehoiada the priest and slew him on hi bed and he
died: and they buri him in the citi of david but they buri him
not in the sepulchr of the king

24:26 and these are they that conspir against him; zabad the son of
shimeath an ammonitess and jehozabad the son of shimrith a moabitess

24:27 now concern hi son and the great of the burden laid
upon him and the repair of the hous of god behold they are
written in the stori of the book of the king and amaziah hi son
reign in hi stead

25:1 amaziah wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign and
he reign twenti and nine year in jerusalem and hi mother name
wa jehoaddan of jerusalem

25:2 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord but not
with a perfect heart

25:3 now it came to pass when the kingdom wa establish to him
that he slew hi servant that had kill the king hi father

25:4 but he slew not their children but did as it is written in the
law in the book of mose where the lord command say the
father shall not die for the children neither shall the children die
for the father but everi man shall die for hi own sin

25:5 moreov amaziah gather judah togeth and made them captain
over thousand and captain over hundr accord to the hous of
their father throughout all judah and benjamin: and he number them
from twenti year old and abov and found them three hundr thousand
choic men abl to go forth to war that could handl spear and
shield

25:6 he hire also an hundr thousand mighti men of valour out of
israel for an hundr talent of silver

25:7 but there came a man of god to him say o king let not the
armi of israel go with thee; for the lord is not with israel to wit
with all the children of ephraim

25:8 but if thou wilt go do it; be strong for the battle: god shall
make thee fall befor the enemy: for god hath power to help and to
cast down

25:9 and amaziah said to the man of god but what shall we do for the
hundr talent which i have given to the armi of israel? and the man
of god answer the lord is abl to give thee much more than thi

25:10 then amaziah separ them to wit the armi that wa come to
him out of ephraim to go home again: wherefor their anger wa
greatli kindl against judah and they return home in great anger

25:11 and amaziah strengthen himself and led forth hi peopl and
went to the valley of salt and smote of the children of seir ten
thousand

25:12 and other ten thousand left aliv did the children of judah
carri away captiv and brought them unto the top of the rock and
cast them down from the top of the rock that they all were broken in
piec

25:13 but the soldier of the armi which amaziah sent back that they
should not go with him to battl fell upon the citi of judah from
samaria even unto bethhoron and smote three thousand of them and
took much spoil

25:14 now it came to pass after that amaziah wa come from the
slaughter of the edomit that he brought the god of the children of
seir and set them up to be hi god and bow down himself befor
them and burn incens unto them

25:15 wherefor the anger of the lord wa kindl against amaziah and
he sent unto him a prophet which said unto him whi hast thou sought
after the god of the peopl which could not deliv their own peopl
out of thine hand? 25:16 and it came to pass as he talk with him
that the king said unto him art thou made of the king counsel?
forbear; whi shouldest thou be smitten? then the prophet forbar and
said i know that god hath determin to destroy thee becaus thou
hast done thi and hast not hearken unto my counsel

25:17 then amaziah king of judah took advic and sent to joash the
son of jehoahaz the son of jehu king of israel say come let us
see one anoth in the face

25:18 and joash king of israel sent to amaziah king of judah say
the thistl that wa in lebanon sent to the cedar that wa in lebanon
say give thi daughter to my son to wife: and there pass by a
wild beast that wa in lebanon and trode down the thistl

25:19 thou sayest lo thou hast smitten the edomites; and thine heart
lifteth thee up to boast: abid now at home; whi shouldest thou meddl
to thine hurt that thou shouldest fall even thou and judah with
thee? 25:20 but amaziah would not hear; for it came of god that he
might deliv them into the hand of their enemi becaus they sought
after the god of edom

25:21 so joash the king of israel went up; and they saw one anoth in
the face both he and amaziah king of judah at bethshemesh which
belongeth to judah

25:22 and judah wa put to the wors befor israel and they fled
everi man to hi tent

25:23 and joash the king of israel took amaziah king of judah the son
of joash the son of jehoahaz at bethshemesh and brought him to
jerusalem and brake down the wall of jerusalem from the gate of
ephraim to the corner gate four hundr cubit

25:24 and he took all the gold and the silver and all the vessel
that were found in the hous of god with obededom and the treasur
of the king hous the hostag also and return to samaria

25:25 and amaziah the son of joash king of judah live after the death
of joash son of jehoahaz king of israel fifteen year

25:26 now the rest of the act of amaziah first and last behold are
they not written in the book of the king of judah and israel? 25:27
now after the time that amaziah did turn away from follow the lord
they made a conspiraci against him in jerusalem; and he fled to
lachish: but they sent to lachish after him and slew him there

25:28 and they brought him upon hors and buri him with hi
father in the citi of judah

26:1 then all the peopl of judah took uzziah who wa sixteen year
old and made him king in the room of hi father amaziah

26:2 he built eloth and restor it to judah after that the king
slept with hi father

26:3 sixteen year old wa uzziah when he began to reign and he
reign fifti and two year in jerusalem hi mother name also wa
jecoliah of jerusalem

26:4 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord
accord to all that hi father amaziah did

26:5 and he sought god in the day of zechariah who had understand
in the vision of god: and as long as he sought the lord god made him
to prosper

26:6 and he went forth and war against the philistin and brake
down the wall of gath and the wall of jabneh and the wall of ashdod
and built citi about ashdod and among the philistin

26:7 and god help him against the philistin and against the
arabian that dwelt in gurbaal and the mehunim

26:8 and the ammonit gave gift to uzziah: and hi name spread
abroad even to the enter in of egypt; for he strengthen himself
exceedingli

26:9 moreov uzziah built tower in jerusalem at the corner gate and
at the valley gate and at the turn of the wall and fortifi
them

26:10 also he built tower in the desert and dig mani wells: for
he had much cattl both in the low countri and in the plains:
husbandmen also and vine dresser in the mountain and in carmel:
for he love husbandri

26:11 moreov uzziah had an host of fight men that went out to
war by band accord to the number of their account by the hand of
jeiel the scribe and maaseiah the ruler under the hand of hananiah
one of the king captain

26:12 the whole number of the chief of the father of the mighti men
of valour were two thousand and six hundr

26:13 and under their hand wa an armi three hundr thousand and
seven thousand and five hundr that made war with mighti power to
help the king against the enemi

26:14 and uzziah prepar for them throughout all the host shield
and spear and helmet and habergeon and bow and sling to cast
stone

26:15 and he made in jerusalem engin invent by cun men to be
on the tower and upon the bulwark to shoot arrow and great stone
withal

and hi name spread far abroad; for he wa marvel help till
he wa strong

26:16 but when he wa strong hi heart wa lift up to hi
destruction: for he transgress against the lord hi god and went
into the templ of the lord to burn incens upon the altar of incens

26:17 and azariah the priest went in after him and with him fourscor
priest of the lord that were valiant men: 26:18 and they withstood
uzziah the king and said unto him it appertaineth not unto thee
uzziah to burn incens unto the lord but to the priest the son of
aaron that are consecr to burn incense: go out of the sanctuary;
for thou hast trespassed; neither shall it be for thine honour from
the lord god

26:19 then uzziah wa wroth and had a censer in hi hand to burn
incense: and while he wa wroth with the priest the leprosi even
rose up in hi forehead befor the priest in the hous of the lord
from besid the incens altar

26:20 and azariah the chief priest and all the priest look upon
him and behold he wa leprou in hi forehead and they thrust him
out from thence; yea himself hast also to go out becaus the lord
had smitten him

26:21 and uzziah the king wa a leper unto the day of hi death and
dwelt in a sever hous be a leper; for he wa cut off from the
hous of the lord: and jotham hi son wa over the king hous
judg the peopl of the land

26:22 now the rest of the act of uzziah first and last did isaiah
the prophet the son of amoz write

26:23 so uzziah slept with hi father and they buri him with hi
father in the field of the burial which belong to the kings; for
they said he is a leper: and jotham hi son reign in hi stead

27:1 jotham wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign and
he reign sixteen year in jerusalem hi mother name also wa
jerushah the daughter of zadok

27:2 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord
accord to all that hi father uzziah did: howbeit he enter not
into the templ of the lord and the peopl did yet corruptli

27:3 he built the high gate of the hous of the lord and on the wall
of ophel he built much

27:4 moreov he built citi in the mountain of judah and in the
forest he built castl and tower

27:5 he fought also with the king of the ammonit and prevail
against them and the children of ammon gave him the same year an
hundr talent of silver and ten thousand measur of wheat and ten
thousand of barley so much did the children of ammon pay unto him
both the second year and the third

27:6 so jotham becam mighti becaus he prepar hi way befor the
lord hi god

27:7 now the rest of the act of jotham and all hi war and hi
way lo they are written in the book of the king of israel and
judah

27:8 he wa five and twenti year old when he began to reign and
reign sixteen year in jerusalem

27:9 and jotham slept with hi father and they buri him in the
citi of david: and ahaz hi son reign in hi stead

28:1 ahaz wa twenti year old when he began to reign and he reign
sixteen year in jerusalem: but he did not that which wa right in the
sight of the lord like david hi father: 28:2 for he walk in the
way of the king of israel and made also molten imag for baalim

28:3 moreov he burnt incens in the valley of the son of hinnom and
burnt hi children in the fire after the abomin of the heathen
whom the lord had cast out befor the children of israel

28:4 he sacrif also and burnt incens in the high place and on
the hill and under everi green tree

28:5 wherefor the lord hi god deliv him into the hand of the
king of syria; and they smote him and carri away a great multitud
of them captiv and brought them to damascu and he wa also
deliv into the hand of the king of israel who smote him with a
great slaughter

28:6 for pekah the son of remaliah slew in judah an hundr and twenti
thousand in one day which were all valiant men; becaus they had
forsaken the lord god of their father

28:7 and zichri a mighti man of ephraim slew maaseiah the king
son and azrikam the governor of the hous and elkanah that wa next
to the king

28:8 and the children of israel carri away captiv of their brethren
two hundr thousand women son and daughter and took also away
much spoil from them and brought the spoil to samaria

28:9 but a prophet of the lord wa there whose name wa oded: and he
went out befor the host that came to samaria and said unto them
behold becaus the lord god of your father wa wroth with judah he
hath deliv them into your hand and ye have slain them in a rage
that reacheth up unto heaven

28:10 and now ye purpos to keep under the children of judah and
jerusalem for bondmen and bondwomen unto you: but are there not with
you even with you sin against the lord your god? 28:11 now hear me
therefor and deliv the captiv again which ye have taken captiv
of your brethren: for the fierc wrath of the lord is upon you

28:12 then certain of the head of the children of ephraim azariah
the son of johanan berechiah the son of meshillemoth and jehizkiah
the son of shallum and amasa the son of hadlai stood up against them
that came from the war 28:13 and said unto them ye shall not bring
in the captiv hither: for wherea we have offend against the lord
alreadi ye intend to add more to our sin and to our trespass: for
our trespass is great and there is fierc wrath against israel

28:14 so the arm men left the captiv and the spoil befor the
princ and all the congreg

28:15 and the men which were express by name rose up and took the
captiv and with the spoil cloth all that were nake among them
and array them and shod them and gave them to eat and to drink
and anoint them and carri all the feebl of them upon ass and
brought them to jericho the citi of palm tree to their brethren:
then they return to samaria

28:16 at that time did king ahaz send unto the king of assyria to
help him

28:17 for again the edomit had come and smitten judah and carri
away captiv

28:18 the philistin also had invad the citi of the low countri
and of the south of judah and had taken bethshemesh and ajalon and
gederoth and shocho with the villag thereof and timnah with the
villag thereof gimzo also and the villag thereof: and they dwelt
there

28:19 for the lord brought judah low becaus of ahaz king of israel;
for he made judah nake and transgress sore against the lord

28:20 and tilgathpilnes king of assyria came unto him and
distress him but strengthen him not

28:21 for ahaz took away a portion out of the hous of the lord and
out of the hous of the king and of the princ and gave it unto the
