king of assyria: but he help him not

28:22 and in the time of hi distress did he trespass yet more against
the lord: thi is that king ahaz

28:23 for he sacrif unto the god of damascu which smote him:
and he said becaus the god of the king of syria help them
therefor will i sacrific to them that they may help me but they
were the ruin of him and of all israel

28:24 and ahaz gather togeth the vessel of the hous of god and
cut in piec the vessel of the hous of god and shut up the door
of the hous of the lord and he made him altar in everi corner of
jerusalem

28:25 and in everi sever citi of judah he made high place to burn
incens unto other god and provok to anger the lord god of hi
father

28:26 now the rest of hi act and of all hi way first and last
behold they are written in the book of the king of judah and israel

28:27 and ahaz slept with hi father and they buri him in the
citi even in jerusalem: but they brought him not into the sepulchr
of the king of israel: and hezekiah hi son reign in hi stead

29:1 hezekiah began to reign when he wa five and twenti year old
and he reign nine and twenti year in jerusalem and hi mother
name wa abijah the daughter of zechariah

29:2 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord
accord to all that david hi father had done

29:3 he in the first year of hi reign in the first month open the
door of the hous of the lord and repair them

29:4 and he brought in the priest and the levit and gather them
togeth into the east street 29:5 and said unto them hear me ye
levit sanctifi now yourselv and sanctifi the hous of the lord
god of your father and carri forth the filthi out of the holi
place

29:6 for our father have trespass and done that which wa evil in
the eye of the lord our god and have forsaken him and have turn
away their face from the habit of the lord and turn their
back

29:7 also they have shut up the door of the porch and put out the
lamp and have not burn incens nor offer burnt offer in the
holi place unto the god of israel

29:8 wherefor the wrath of the lord wa upon judah and jerusalem and
he hath deliv them to troubl to astonish and to hiss as
ye see with your eye

29:9 for lo our father have fallen by the sword and our son and
our daughter and our wive are in captiv for thi

29:10 now it is in mine heart to make a coven with the lord god of
israel that hi fierc wrath may turn away from us

29:11 my son be not now negligent: for the lord hath chosen you to
stand befor him to serv him and that ye should minist unto him
and burn incens

29:12 then the levit aros mahath the son of amasai and joel the
son of azariah of the son of the kohathites: and of the son of
merari kish the son of abdi and azariah the son of jehalelel: and of
the gershonites; joah the son of zimmah and eden the son of joah:
29:13 and of the son of elizaphan; shimri and jeiel: and of the son
of asaph; zechariah and mattaniah: 29:14 and of the son of heman;
jehiel and shimei: and of the son of jeduthun; shemaiah and uzziel

29:15 and they gather their brethren and sanctifi themselv and
came accord to the command of the king by the word of the
lord to cleans the hous of the lord

29:16 and the priest went into the inner part of the hous of the
lord to cleans it and brought out all the unclean that they
found in the templ of the lord into the court of the hous of the
lord and the levit took it to carri it out abroad into the brook
kidron

29:17 now they began on the first day of the first month to sanctifi
and on the eighth day of the month came they to the porch of the lord:
so they sanctifi the hous of the lord in eight days; and in the
sixteenth day of the first month they made an end

29:18 then they went in to hezekiah the king and said we have
cleans all the hous of the lord and the altar of burnt offer
with all the vessel thereof and the shewbread tabl with all the
vessel thereof

29:19 moreov all the vessel which king ahaz in hi reign did cast
away in hi transgress have we prepar and sanctifi and
behold they are befor the altar of the lord

29:20 then hezekiah the king rose earli and gather the ruler of
the citi and went up to the hous of the lord

29:21 and they brought seven bullock and seven ram and seven
lamb and seven he goat for a sin offer for the kingdom and for
the sanctuari and for judah and he command the priest the son of
aaron to offer them on the altar of the lord

29:22 so they kill the bullock and the priest receiv the blood
and sprinkl it on the altar: likewis when they had kill the
ram they sprinkl the blood upon the altar: they kill also the
lamb and they sprinkl the blood upon the altar

29:23 and they brought forth the he goat for the sin offer befor
the king and the congregation; and they laid their hand upon them:
29:24 and the priest kill them and they made reconcili with
their blood upon the altar to make an aton for all israel: for
the king command that the burnt offer and the sin offer should
be made for all israel

29:25 and he set the levit in the hous of the lord with cymbal
with psalteri and with harp accord to the command of
david and of gad the king seer and nathan the prophet: for so wa
the command of the lord by hi prophet

29:26 and the levit stood with the instrument of david and the
priest with the trumpet

29:27 and hezekiah command to offer the burnt offer upon the
altar

and when the burnt offer began the song of the lord began also
with the trumpet and with the instrument ordain by david king of
israel

29:28 and all the congreg worship and the singer sang and
the trumpet sounded: and all thi continu until the burnt
offer wa finish

29:29 and when they had made an end of offer the king and all that
were present with him bow themselv and worship

29:30 moreov hezekiah the king and the princ command the levit
to sing prais unto the lord with the word of david and of asaph the
seer and they sang prais with glad and they bow their head
and worship

29:31 then hezekiah answer and said now ye have consecr
yourselv unto the lord come near and bring sacrific and thank
offer into the hous of the lord and the congreg brought in
sacrific and thank offerings; and as mani as were of a free heart
burnt offer

29:32 and the number of the burnt offer which the congreg
brought wa threescor and ten bullock an hundr ram and two
hundr lambs: all these were for a burnt offer to the lord

29:33 and the consecr thing were six hundr oxen and three
thousand sheep

29:34 but the priest were too few so that they could not flay all
the burnt offerings: wherefor their brethren the levit did help
them till the work wa end and until the other priest had
sanctifi themselves: for the levit were more upright in heart to
sanctifi themselv than the priest

29:35 and also the burnt offer were in abund with the fat of
the peac offer and the drink offer for everi burnt offer
so the servic of the hous of the lord wa set in order

29:36 and hezekiah rejoic and all the peopl that god had prepar
the people: for the thing wa done suddenli

30:1 and hezekiah sent to all israel and judah and wrote letter also
to ephraim and manasseh that they should come to the hous of the
lord at jerusalem to keep the passov unto the lord god of israel

30:2 for the king had taken counsel and hi princ and all the
congreg in jerusalem to keep the passov in the second month

30:3 for they could not keep it at that time becaus the priest had
not sanctifi themselv suffici neither had the peopl
gather themselv togeth to jerusalem

30:4 and the thing pleas the king and all the congreg

30:5 so they establish a decre to make proclam throughout all
israel from beersheba even to dan that they should come to keep the
passov unto the lord god of israel at jerusalem: for they had not
done it of a long time in such sort as it wa written

30:6 so the post went with the letter from the king and hi princ
throughout all israel and judah and accord to the command of
the king say ye children of israel turn again unto the lord god
of abraham isaac and israel and he will return to the remnant of
you that are escap out of the hand of the king of assyria

30:7 and be not ye like your father and like your brethren which
trespass against the lord god of their father who therefor gave
them up to desol as ye see

30:8 now be ye not stiffneck as your father were but yield
yourselv unto the lord and enter into hi sanctuari which he hath
sanctifi for ever: and serv the lord your god that the fierc
of hi wrath may turn away from you

30:9 for if ye turn again unto the lord your brethren and your
children shall find compass befor them that lead them captiv so
that they shall come again into thi land: for the lord your god is
graciou and merci and will not turn away hi face from you if ye
return unto him

30:10 so the post pass from citi to citi through the countri of
ephraim and manasseh even unto zebulun: but they laugh them to
scorn and mock them

30:11 nevertheless diver of asher and manasseh and of zebulun humbl
themselv and came to jerusalem

30:12 also in judah the hand of god wa to give them one heart to do
the command of the king and of the princ by the word of the
lord

30:13 and there assembl at jerusalem much peopl to keep the feast
of unleaven bread in the second month a veri great congreg

30:14 and they aros and took away the altar that were in jerusalem
and all the altar for incens took they away and cast them into the
brook kidron

30:15 then they kill the passov on the fourteenth day of the
second month: and the priest and the levit were asham and
sanctifi themselv and brought in the burnt offer into the
hous of the lord

30:16 and they stood in their place after their manner accord to
the law of mose the man of god: the priest sprinkl the blood
which they receiv of the hand of the levit

30:17 for there were mani in the congreg that were not
sanctified: therefor the levit had the charg of the kill of the
passov for everi one that wa not clean to sanctifi them unto the
lord

30:18 for a multitud of the peopl even mani of ephraim and
manasseh issachar and zebulun had not cleans themselv yet did
they eat the passov otherwis than it wa written but hezekiah
pray for them say the good lord pardon everi one 30:19 that
prepareth hi heart to seek god the lord god of hi father though
he be not cleans accord to the purif of the sanctuari

30:20 and the lord hearken to hezekiah and heal the peopl

30:21 and the children of israel that were present at jerusalem kept
the feast of unleaven bread seven day with great gladness: and the
levit and the priest prais the lord day by day sing with loud
instrument unto the lord

30:22 and hezekiah spake comfort unto all the levit that taught
the good knowledg of the lord: and they did eat throughout the feast
seven day offer peac offer and make confess to the
lord god of their father

30:23 and the whole assembl took counsel to keep other seven days:
and they kept other seven day with glad

30:24 for hezekiah king of judah did give to the congreg a
thousand bullock and seven thousand sheep; and the princ gave to
the congreg a thousand bullock and ten thousand sheep: and a
great number of priest sanctifi themselv

30:25 and all the congreg of judah with the priest and the
levit and all the congreg that came out of israel and the
stranger that came out of the land of israel and that dwelt in
judah rejoic

30:26 so there wa great joy in jerusalem: for sinc the time of
solomon the son of david king of israel there wa not the like in
jerusalem

30:27 then the priest the levit aros and bless the people: and
their voic wa heard and their prayer came up to hi holi dwell
place even unto heaven

31:1 now when all thi wa finish all israel that were present went
out to the citi of judah and brake the imag in piec and cut
down the grove and threw down the high place and the altar out of
all judah and benjamin in ephraim also and manasseh until they had
utterli destroy them all then all the children of israel return
everi man to hi possess into their own citi

31:2 and hezekiah appoint the cours of the priest and the levit
after their cours everi man accord to hi servic the priest
and levit for burnt offer and for peac offer to minist
and to give thank and to prais in the gate of the tent of the
lord

31:3 he appoint also the king portion of hi substanc for the
burnt offer to wit for the morn and even burnt offer
and the burnt offer for the sabbath and for the new moon and
for the set feast as it is written in the law of the lord

31:4 moreov he command the peopl that dwelt in jerusalem to give
the portion of the priest and the levit that they might be
encourag in the law of the lord

31:5 and as soon as the command came abroad the children of
israel brought in abund the firstfruit of corn wine and oil
and honey and of all the increas of the field; and the tith of all
thing brought they in abundantli

31:6 and concern the children of israel and judah that dwelt in
the citi of judah they also brought in the tith of oxen and sheep
and the tith of holi thing which were consecr unto the lord
their god and laid them by heap

31:7 in the third month they began to lay the foundat of the heap
and finish them in the seventh month

31:8 and when hezekiah and the princ came and saw the heap they
bless the lord and hi peopl israel

31:9 then hezekiah question with the priest and the levit
concern the heap

31:10 and azariah the chief priest of the hous of zadok answer him
and said sinc the peopl began to bring the offer into the hous
of the lord we have had enough to eat and have left plenty: for the
lord hath bless hi people; and that which is left is thi great
store

31:11 then hezekiah command to prepar chamber in the hous of the
lord; and they prepar them 31:12 and brought in the offer and
the tith and the dedic thing faithfully: over which cononiah
the levit wa ruler and shimei hi brother wa the next

31:13 and jehiel and azaziah and nahath and asahel and jerimoth
and jozabad and eliel and ismachiah and mahath and benaiah were
overs under the hand of cononiah and shimei hi brother at the
command of hezekiah the king and azariah the ruler of the hous
of god

31:14 and kore the son of imnah the levit the porter toward the
east wa over the freewil offer of god to distribut the
oblat of the lord and the most holi thing

31:15 and next him were eden and miniamin and jeshua and shemaiah
amariah and shecaniah in the citi of the priest in their set
offic to give to their brethren by cours as well to the great as
to the small: 31:16 besid their genealog of male from three year
old and upward even unto everi one that entereth into the hous of
the lord hi daili portion for their servic in their charg
accord to their courses; 31:17 both to the genealog of the priest
by the hous of their father and the levit from twenti year old
and upward in their charg by their courses; 31:18 and to the
genealog of all their littl one their wive and their son and
their daughter through all the congregation: for in their set offic
they sanctifi themselv in holiness: 31:19 also of the son of
aaron the priest which were in the field of the suburb of their
citi in everi sever citi the men that were express by name to
give portion to all the male among the priest and to all that were
reckon by genealog among the levit

31:20 and thu did hezekiah throughout all judah and wrought that
which wa good and right and truth befor the lord hi god

31:21 and in everi work that he began in the servic of the hous of
god and in the law and in the command to seek hi god he did
it with all hi heart and prosper

32:1 after these thing and the establish thereof sennacherib
king of assyria came and enter into judah and encamp against the
fenc citi and thought to win them for himself

32:2 and when hezekiah saw that sennacherib wa come and that he wa
purpos to fight against jerusalem 32:3 he took counsel with hi
princ and hi mighti men to stop the water of the fountain which
were without the city: and they did help him

32:4 so there wa gather much peopl togeth who stop all the
fountain and the brook that ran through the midst of the land
say whi should the king of assyria come and find much water?
32:5 also he strengthen himself and built up all the wall that wa
broken and rais it up to the tower and anoth wall without and
repair millo in the citi of david and made dart and shield in
abund

32:6 and he set captain of war over the peopl and gather them
togeth to him in the street of the gate of the citi and spake
comfort to them say 32:7 be strong and courag be not
afraid nor dismay for the king of assyria nor for all the multitud
that is with him: for there be more with us than with him: 32:8 with
him is an arm of flesh; but with us is the lord our god to help us
and to fight our battl and the peopl rest themselv upon the
word of hezekiah king of judah

32:9 after thi did sennacherib king of assyria send hi servant to
jerusalem (but he himself laid sieg against lachish and all hi
power with him) unto hezekiah king of judah and unto all judah that
were at jerusalem say 32:10 thu saith sennacherib king of
assyria whereon do ye trust that ye abid in the sieg in jerusalem?
32:11 doth not hezekiah persuad you to give over yourselv to die by
famin and by thirst say the lord our god shall deliv us out of
the hand of the king of assyria? 32:12 hath not the same hezekiah
taken away hi high place and hi altar and command judah and
jerusalem say ye shall worship befor one altar and burn incens
upon it? 32:13 know ye not what i and my father have done unto all
the peopl of other lands? were the god of the nation of those land
ani way abl to deliv their land out of mine hand? 32:14 who wa
there among all the god of those nation that my father utterli
destroy that could deliv hi peopl out of mine hand that your
god should be abl to deliv you out of mine hand? 32:15 now
therefor let not hezekiah deceiv you nor persuad you on thi
manner neither yet believ him: for no god of ani nation or kingdom
wa abl to deliv hi peopl out of mine hand and out of the hand
of my fathers: how much less shall your god deliv you out of mine
hand? 32:16 and hi servant spake yet more against the lord god and
against hi servant hezekiah

32:17 he wrote also letter to rail on the lord god of israel and to
speak against him say as the god of the nation of other land
have not deliv their peopl out of mine hand so shall not the god
of hezekiah deliv hi peopl out of mine hand

32:18 then they cri with a loud voic in the jew speech unto the
peopl of jerusalem that were on the wall to affright them and to
troubl them; that they might take the citi

32:19 and they spake against the god of jerusalem as against the god
of the peopl of the earth which were the work of the hand of man

32:20 and for thi caus hezekiah the king and the prophet isaiah the
son of amoz pray and cri to heaven

32:21 and the lord sent an angel which cut off all the mighti men of
valour and the leader and captain in the camp of the king of
assyria so he return with shame of face to hi own land and when
he wa come into the hous of hi god they that came forth of hi own
bowel slew him there with the sword

32:22 thu the lord save hezekiah and the inhabit of jerusalem
from the hand of sennacherib the king of assyria and from the hand of
all other and guid them on everi side

32:23 and mani brought gift unto the lord to jerusalem and present
to hezekiah king of judah: so that he wa magnifi in the sight of
all nation from thenceforth

32:24 in those day hezekiah wa sick to the death and pray unto
the lord: and he spake unto him and he gave him a sign

32:25 but hezekiah render not again accord to the benefit done
unto him; for hi heart wa lift up: therefor there wa wrath upon
him and upon judah and jerusalem

32:26 notwithstand hezekiah humbl himself for the pride of hi
heart both he and the inhabit of jerusalem so that the wrath of
the lord came not upon them in the day of hezekiah

32:27 and hezekiah had exceed much rich and honour: and he made
himself treasuri for silver and for gold and for preciou stone
and for spice and for shield and for all manner of pleasant
jewels; 32:28 storehous also for the increas of corn and wine and
oil; and stall for all manner of beast and cote for flock

32:29 moreov he provid him citi and possess of flock and
herd in abundance: for god had given him substanc veri much

32:30 thi same hezekiah also stop the upper watercours of gihon
and brought it straight down to the west side of the citi of david
and hezekiah prosper in all hi work

32:31 howbeit in the busi of the ambassador of the princ of
babylon who sent unto him to enquir of the wonder that wa done in
the land god left him to tri him that he might know all that wa in
hi heart

32:32 now the rest of the act of hezekiah and hi good behold
they are written in the vision of isaiah the prophet the son of amoz
and in the book of the king of judah and israel

32:33 and hezekiah slept with hi father and they buri him in the
chiefest of the sepulchr of the son of david: and all judah and the
inhabit of jerusalem did him honour at hi death and manasseh hi
son reign in hi stead

33:1 manasseh wa twelv year old when he began to reign and he
reign fifti and five year in jerusalem: 33:2 but did that which wa
evil in the sight of the lord like unto the abomin of the
heathen whom the lord had cast out befor the children of israel

33:3 for he built again the high place which hezekiah hi father had
broken down and he rear up altar for baalim and made grove and
worship all the host of heaven and serv them

33:4 also he built altar in the hous of the lord whereof the lord
had said in jerusalem shall my name be for ever

33:5 and he built altar for all the host of heaven in the two court
of the hous of the lord

33:6 and he caus hi children to pass through the fire in the valley
of the son of hinnom: also he observ time and use enchant
and use witchcraft and dealt with a familiar spirit and with
wizards: he wrought much evil in the sight of the lord to provok him
to anger

33:7 and he set a carv imag the idol which he had made in the
hous of god of which god had said to david and to solomon hi son
in thi hous and in jerusalem which i have chosen befor all the
tribe of israel will i put my name for ever: 33:8 neither will i ani
more remov the foot of israel from out of the land which i have
appoint for your fathers; so that they will take heed to do all that
i have command them accord to the whole law and the statut and
the ordin by the hand of mose

33:9 so manasseh made judah and the inhabit of jerusalem to err
and to do wors than the heathen whom the lord had destroy befor
the children of israel

33:10 and the lord spake to manasseh and to hi people: but they
would not hearken

33:11 wherefor the lord brought upon them the captain of the host of
the king of assyria which took manasseh among the thorn and bound
him with fetter and carri him to babylon

33:12 and when he wa in afflict he besought the lord hi god and
humbl himself greatli befor the god of hi father 33:13 and
pray unto him: and he wa intreat of him and heard hi
supplic and brought him again to jerusalem into hi kingdom
then manasseh knew that the lord he wa god

33:14 now after thi he built a wall without the citi of david on the
west side of gihon in the valley even to the enter in at the fish
gate and compass about ophel and rais it up a veri great height
and put captain of war in all the fenc citi of judah

33:15 and he took away the strang god and the idol out of the hous
of the lord and all the altar that he had built in the mount of the
hous of the lord and in jerusalem and cast them out of the citi

33:16 and he repair the altar of the lord and sacrif thereon
peac offer and thank offer and command judah to serv the
lord god of israel

33:17 nevertheless the peopl did sacrific still in the high place
yet unto the lord their god onli

33:18 now the rest of the act of manasseh and hi prayer unto hi
god and the word of the seer that spake to him in the name of the
lord god of israel behold they are written in the book of the king
of israel

33:19 hi prayer also and how god wa intreat of him and all hi
sin and hi trespass and the place wherein he built high place
and set up grove and graven imag befor he wa humbled: behold
they are written among the say of the seer

33:20 so manasseh slept with hi father and they buri him in hi
own house: and amon hi son reign in hi stead

33:21 amon wa two and twenti year old when he began to reign and
reign two year in jerusalem

33:22 but he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord as did
manasseh hi father: for amon sacrif unto all the carv imag
which manasseh hi father had made and serv them; 33:23 and humbl
not himself befor the lord as manasseh hi father had humbl
himself; but amon trespass more and more

33:24 and hi servant conspir against him and slew him in hi own
hous

33:25 but the peopl of the land slew all them that had conspir
against king amon; and the peopl of the land made josiah hi son king
in hi stead

34:1 josiah wa eight year old when he began to reign and he reign
in jerusalem one and thirti year

34:2 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord and
walk in the way of david hi father and declin neither to the
right hand nor to the left

34:3 for in the eighth year of hi reign while he wa yet young he
began to seek after the god of david hi father: and in the twelfth
year he began to purg judah and jerusalem from the high place and
the grove and the carv imag and the molten imag

34:4 and they brake down the altar of baalim in hi presence; and the
imag that were on high abov them he cut down; and the grove and
the carv imag and the molten imag he brake in piec and made
dust of them and strow it upon the grave of them that had
sacrif unto them

34:5 and he burnt the bone of the priest upon their altar and
cleans judah and jerusalem

34:6 and so did he in the citi of manasseh and ephraim and simeon
even unto naphtali with their mattock round about

34:7 and when he had broken down the altar and the grove and had
beaten the graven imag into powder and cut down all the idol
throughout all the land of israel he return to jerusalem

34:8 now in the eighteenth year of hi reign when he had purg the
land and the hous he sent shaphan the son of azaliah and maaseiah
the governor of the citi and joah the son of joahaz the record to
repair the hous of the lord hi god

34:9 and when they came to hilkiah the high priest they deliv the
money that wa brought into the hous of god which the levit that
kept the door had gather of the hand of manasseh and ephraim and
of all the remnant of israel and of all judah and benjamin; and they
return to jerusalem

34:10 and they put it in the hand of the workmen that had the
oversight of the hous of the lord and they gave it to the workmen
that wrought in the hous of the lord to repair and amend the house:
34:11 even to the artific and builder gave they it to buy hewn
stone and timber for coupl and to floor the hous which the
king of judah had destroy

34:12 and the men did the work faithfully: and the overs of them
were jahath and obadiah the levit of the son of merari; and
zechariah and meshullam of the son of the kohathit to set it
forward; and other of the levit all that could skill of instrument
of musick

34:13 also they were over the bearer of burden and were overs
of all that wrought the work in ani manner of service: and of the
levit there were scribe and offic and porter

34:14 and when they brought out the money that wa brought into the
hous of the lord hilkiah the priest found a book of the law of the
lord given by mose

34:15 and hilkiah answer and said to shaphan the scribe i have
found the book of the law in the hous of the lord and hilkiah
deliv the book to shaphan

34:16 and shaphan carri the book to the king and brought the king
word back again say all that wa commit to thi servant they
do it

34:17 and they have gather togeth the money that wa found in the
hous of the lord and have deliv it into the hand of the
overs and to the hand of the workmen

34:18 then shaphan the scribe told the king say hilkiah the
priest hath given me a book and shaphan read it befor the king

34:19 and it came to pass when the king had heard the word of the
law that he rent hi cloth

34:20 and the king command hilkiah and ahikam the son of shaphan
and abdon the son of micah and shaphan the scribe and asaiah a
servant of the king say 34:21 go enquir of the lord for me
and for them that are left in israel and in judah concern the
word of the book that is found: for great is the wrath of the lord
that is pour out upon us becaus our father have not kept the word
of the lord to do after all that is written in thi book

34:22 and hilkiah and they that the king had appoint went to
huldah the prophetess the wife of shallum the son of tikvath the son
of hasrah keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in jerusalem in the
college:) and they spake to her to that effect

34:23 and she answer them thu saith the lord god of israel tell
ye the man that sent you to me 34:24 thu saith the lord behold i
will bring evil upon thi place and upon the inhabit thereof
even all the curs that are written in the book which they have read
befor the king of judah: 34:25 becaus they have forsaken me and
have burn incens unto other god that they might provok me to
anger with all the work of their hands; therefor my wrath shall be
pour out upon thi place and shall not be quench

34:26 and as for the king of judah who sent you to enquir of the
lord so shall ye say unto him thu saith the lord god of israel
concern the word which thou hast heard; 34:27 becaus thine heart
wa tender and thou didst humbl thyself befor god when thou
heardest hi word against thi place and against the inhabit
thereof and humbledst thyself befor me and didst rend thi cloth
and weep befor me; i have even heard thee also saith the lord

34:28 behold i will gather thee to thi father and thou shalt be
gather to thi grave in peac neither shall thine eye see all the
evil that i will bring upon thi place and upon the inhabit of
the same so they brought the king word again

34:29 then the king sent and gather togeth all the elder of judah
and jerusalem

34:30 and the king went up into the hous of the lord and all the men
of judah and the inhabit of jerusalem and the priest and the
levit and all the peopl great and small: and he read in their
ear all the word of the book of the coven that wa found in the
hous of the lord

34:31 and the king stood in hi place and made a coven befor the
lord to walk after the lord and to keep hi command and hi
testimoni and hi statut with all hi heart and with all hi
soul to perform the word of the coven which are written in thi
book

34:32 and he caus all that were present in jerusalem and benjamin to
stand to it and the inhabit of jerusalem did accord to the
coven of god the god of their father

34:33 and josiah took away all the abomin out of all the
countri that pertain to the children of israel and made all that
were present in israel to serv even to serv the lord their god and
all hi day they depart not from follow the lord the god of
their father

35:1 moreov josiah kept a passov unto the lord in jerusalem: and
they kill the passov on the fourteenth day of the first month

35:2 and he set the priest in their charg and encourag them to
the servic of the hous of the lord 35:3 and said unto the levit
that taught all israel which were holi unto the lord put the holi
ark in the hous which solomon the son of david king of israel did
build; it shall not be a burden upon your shoulders: serv now the
lord your god and hi peopl israel 35:4 and prepar yourselv by
the hous of your father after your cours accord to the
write of david king of israel and accord to the write of
solomon hi son

35:5 and stand in the holi place accord to the divis of the
famili of the father of your brethren the peopl and after the
divis of the famili of the levit

35:6 so kill the passov and sanctifi yourselv and prepar your
brethren that they may do accord to the word of the lord by the
hand of mose

35:7 and josiah gave to the peopl of the flock lamb and kid all
for the passov offer for all that were present to the number
of thirti thousand and three thousand bullocks: these were of the
king substanc

35:8 and hi princ gave willingli unto the peopl to the priest
and to the levites: hilkiah and zechariah and jehiel ruler of the
hous of god gave unto the priest for the passov offer two
thousand and six hundr small cattl and three hundr oxen

35:9 conaniah also and shemaiah and nethaneel hi brethren and
hashabiah and jeiel and jozabad chief of the levit gave unto the
levit for passov offer five thousand small cattl and five
hundr oxen

35:10 so the servic wa prepar and the priest stood in their
place and the levit in their cours accord to the king
command

35:11 and they kill the passov and the priest sprinkl the
blood from their hand and the levit flay them

35:12 and they remov the burnt offer that they might give
accord to the divis of the famili of the peopl to offer
unto the lord as it is written in the book of mose and so did they
with the oxen

35:13 and they roast the passov with fire accord to the
ordinance: but the other holi offer sod they in pot and in
caldron and in pan and divid them speedili among all the peopl

35:14 and afterward they made readi for themselv and for the
priests: becaus the priest the son of aaron were busi in offer
of burnt offer and the fat until night; therefor the levit
prepar for themselv and for the priest the son of aaron

35:15 and the singer the son of asaph were in their place accord
to the command of david and asaph and heman and jeduthun the
king seer; and the porter wait at everi gate; they might not
depart from their service; for their brethren the levit prepar for
them

35:16 so all the servic of the lord wa prepar the same day to
keep the passov and to offer burnt offer upon the altar of the
lord accord to the command of king josiah

35:17 and the children of israel that were present kept the passov
at that time and the feast of unleaven bread seven day

35:18 and there wa no passov like to that kept in israel from the
day of samuel the prophet; neither did all the king of israel keep
such a passov as josiah kept and the priest and the levit and
all judah and israel that were present and the inhabit of
jerusalem

35:19 in the eighteenth year of the reign of josiah wa thi passov
kept

35:20 after all thi when josiah had prepar the templ necho king
of egypt came up to fight against charchemish by euphrates: and josiah
went out against him

35:21 but he sent ambassador to him say what have i to do with
thee thou king of judah? i come not against thee thi day but
against the hous wherewith i have war: for god command me to make
haste: forbear thee from meddl with god who is with me that he
destroy thee not

35:22 nevertheless josiah would not turn hi face from him but
disguis himself that he might fight with him and hearken not
unto the word of necho from the mouth of god and came to fight in
the valley of megiddo

35:23 and the archer shot at king josiah; and the king said to hi
servant have me away; for i am sore wound

35:24 hi servant therefor took him out of that chariot and put him
in the second chariot that he had; and they brought him to jerusalem
and he die and wa buri in one of the sepulchr of hi father
and all judah and jerusalem mourn for josiah

35:25 and jeremiah lament for josiah: and all the sing men and
the sing women spake of josiah in their lament to thi day
and made them an ordin in israel: and behold they are written in
the lament

35:26 now the rest of the act of josiah and hi good accord
to that which wa written in the law of the lord 35:27 and hi deed
first and last behold they are written in the book of the king of
israel and judah

36:1 then the peopl of the land took jehoahaz the son of josiah and
made him king in hi father stead in jerusalem

36:2 jehoahaz wa twenti and three year old when he began to reign
and he reign three month in jerusalem

36:3 and the king of egypt put him down at jerusalem and condemn
the land in an hundr talent of silver and a talent of gold

36:4 and the king of egypt made eliakim hi brother king over judah
and jerusalem and turn hi name to jehoiakim and necho took
jehoahaz hi brother and carri him to egypt

36:5 jehoiakim wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign
and he reign eleven year in jerusalem: and he did that which wa
evil in the sight of the lord hi god

36:6 against him came up nebuchadnezzar king of babylon and bound him
in fetter to carri him to babylon

36:7 nebuchadnezzar also carri of the vessel of the hous of the
lord to babylon and put them in hi templ at babylon

36:8 now the rest of the act of jehoiakim and hi abomin which
he did and that which wa found in him behold they are written in
the book of the king of israel and judah: and jehoiachin hi son
reign in hi stead

36:9 jehoiachin wa eight year old when he began to reign and he
reign three month and ten day in jerusalem: and he did that which
wa evil in the sight of the lord

36:10 and when the year wa expir king nebuchadnezzar sent and
brought him to babylon with the goodli vessel of the hous of the
lord and made zedekiah hi brother king over judah and jerusalem

36:11 zedekiah wa one and twenti year old when he began to reign
and reign eleven year in jerusalem

36:12 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord hi god
and humbl not himself befor jeremiah the prophet speak from the
mouth of the lord

36:13 and he also rebel against king nebuchadnezzar who had made
him swear by god: but he stiffen hi neck and harden hi heart
from turn unto the lord god of israel

36:14 moreov all the chief of the priest and the peopl
transgress veri much after all the abomin of the heathen; and
pollut the hous of the lord which he had hallow in jerusalem

36:15 and the lord god of their father sent to them by hi
messeng rise up betim and sending; becaus he had compass
on hi peopl and on hi dwell place: 36:16 but they mock the
messeng of god and despis hi word and misus hi prophet
until the wrath of the lord aros against hi peopl till there wa
no remedi

36:17 therefor he brought upon them the king of the chalde who
slew their young men with the sword in the hous of their sanctuari
and had no compass upon young man or maiden old man or him that
stoop for age: he gave them all into hi hand

36:18 and all the vessel of the hous of god great and small and
the treasur of the hous of the lord and the treasur of the king
and of hi princes; all these he brought to babylon

36:19 and they burnt the hous of god and brake down the wall of
jerusalem and burnt all the palac thereof with fire and destroy
all the goodli vessel thereof

36:20 and them that had escap from the sword carri he away to
babylon; where they were servant to him and hi son until the reign
of the kingdom of persia: 36:21 to fulfil the word of the lord by the
mouth of jeremiah until the land had enjoy her sabbaths: for as
long as she lay desol she kept sabbath to fulfil threescor and
ten year

36:22 now in the first year of cyru king of persia that the word of
the lord spoken by the mouth of jeremiah might be accomplish the
lord stir up the spirit of cyru king of persia that he made a
proclam throughout all hi kingdom and put it also in write
say 36:23 thu saith cyru king of persia all the kingdom of the
earth hath the lord god of heaven given me; and he hath charg me to
build him an hous in jerusalem which is in judah who is there among
you of all hi people? the lord hi god be with him and let him go up



ezra


1:1 now in the first year of cyru king of persia that the word of
the lord by the mouth of jeremiah might be fulfil the lord stir
up the spirit of cyru king of persia that he made a proclam
throughout all hi kingdom and put it also in write say 1:2
thu saith cyru king of persia the lord god of heaven hath given me
all the kingdom of the earth; and he hath charg me to build him an
hous at jerusalem which is in judah

1:3 who is there among you of all hi people? hi god be with him and
let him go up to jerusalem which is in judah and build the hous of
the lord god of israel (he is the god) which is in jerusalem

1:4 and whosoev remaineth in ani place where he sojourneth let the
men of hi place help him with silver and with gold and with good
and with beast besid the freewil offer for the hous of god
that is in jerusalem

1:5 then rose up the chief of the father of judah and benjamin and
the priest and the levit with all them whose spirit god had
rais to go up to build the hous of the lord which is in jerusalem

1:6 and all they that were about them strengthen their hand with
vessel of silver with gold with good and with beast and with
preciou thing besid all that wa willingli offer

1:7 also cyru the king brought forth the vessel of the hous of the
lord which nebuchadnezzar had brought forth out of jerusalem and had
put them in the hous of hi gods; 1:8 even those did cyru king of
persia bring forth by the hand of mithredath the treasur and
number them unto sheshbazzar the princ of judah

1:9 and thi is the number of them: thirti charger of gold a
thousand charger of silver nine and twenti knive 1:10 thirti
bason of gold silver bason of a second sort four hundr and ten
and other vessel a thousand

1:11 all the vessel of gold and of silver were five thousand and four
hundr all these did sheshbazzar bring up with them of the captiv
that were brought up from babylon unto jerusalem

2:1 now these are the children of the provinc that went up out of the
captiv of those which had been carri away whom nebuchadnezzar
the king of babylon had carri away unto babylon and came again unto
jerusalem and judah everi one unto hi city; 2:2 which came with
zerubbabel: jeshua nehemiah seraiah reelaiah mordecai bilshan
mizpar bigvai rehum baanah the number of the men of the peopl of
israel: 2:3 the children of parosh two thousand an hundr seventi
and two

2:4 the children of shephatiah three hundr seventi and two

2:5 the children of arah seven hundr seventi and five

2:6 the children of pahathmoab of the children of jeshua and joab
two thousand eight hundr and twelv

2:7 the children of elam a thousand two hundr fifti and four

2:8 the children of zattu nine hundr forti and five

2:9 the children of zaccai seven hundr and threescor

2:10 the children of bani six hundr forti and two

2:11 the children of bebai six hundr twenti and three

2:12 the children of azgad a thousand two hundr twenti and two

2:13 the children of adonikam six hundr sixti and six

2:14 the children of bigvai two thousand fifti and six

2:15 the children of adin four hundr fifti and four

2:16 the children of ater of hezekiah nineti and eight

2:17 the children of bezai three hundr twenti and three

2:18 the children of jorah an hundr and twelv

2:19 the children of hashum two hundr twenti and three

2:20 the children of gibbar nineti and five

2:21 the children of bethlehem an hundr twenti and three

2:22 the men of netophah fifti and six

2:23 the men of anathoth an hundr twenti and eight

2:24 the children of azmaveth forti and two

2:25 the children of kirjatharim chephirah and beeroth seven
hundr and forti and three

2:26 the children of ramah and gaba six hundr twenti and one

2:27 the men of michma an hundr twenti and two

2:28 the men of bethel and ai two hundr twenti and three

2:29 the children of nebo fifti and two

2:30 the children of magbish an hundr fifti and six

2:31 the children of the other elam a thousand two hundr fifti and
four

2:32 the children of harim three hundr and twenti

2:33 the children of lod hadid and ono seven hundr twenti and
five

2:34 the children of jericho three hundr forti and five

2:35 the children of senaah three thousand and six hundr and
thirti

2:36 the priests: the children of jedaiah of the hous of jeshua
nine hundr seventi and three

2:37 the children of immer a thousand fifti and two

2:38 the children of pashur a thousand two hundr forti and seven

2:39 the children of harim a thousand and seventeen

2:40 the levites: the children of jeshua and kadmiel of the children
of hodaviah seventi and four

2:41 the singers: the children of asaph an hundr twenti and eight

2:42 the children of the porters: the children of shallum the
children of ater the children of talmon the children of akkub the
children of hatita the children of shobai in all an hundr thirti
and nine

2:43 the nethinims: the children of ziha the children of hasupha the
children of tabbaoth 2:44 the children of kero the children of
siaha the children of padon 2:45 the children of lebanah the
children of hagabah the children of akkub 2:46 the children of
hagab the children of shalmai the children of hanan 2:47 the
children of giddel the children of gahar the children of reaiah
2:48 the children of rezin the children of nekoda the children of
gazzam 2:49 the children of uzza the children of paseah the
children of besai 2:50 the children of asnah the children of
mehunim the children of nephusim 2:51 the children of bakbuk the
children of hakupha the children of harhur 2:52 the children of
bazluth the children of mehida the children of harsha 2:53 the
children of barko the children of sisera the children of thamah
2:54 the children of neziah the children of hatipha

2:55 the children of solomon servants: the children of sotai the
children of sophereth the children of peruda 2:56 the children of
jaalah the children of darkon the children of giddel 2:57 the
children of shephatiah the children of hattil the children of
pochereth of zebaim the children of ami

2:58 all the nethinim and the children of solomon servant were
three hundr nineti and two

2:59 and these were they which went up from telmelah telharsa
cherub addan and immer: but they could not shew their father
hous and their seed whether they were of israel: 2:60 the children
of delaiah the children of tobiah the children of nekoda six
hundr fifti and two

2:61 and of the children of the priests: the children of habaiah the
children of koz the children of barzillai; which took a wife of the
daughter of barzillai the gileadit and wa call after their name:
2:62 these sought their regist among those that were reckon by
genealog but they were not found: therefor were they as pollut
put from the priesthood

2:63 and the tirshatha said unto them that they should not eat of the
most holi thing till there stood up a priest with urim and with
thummim

2:64 the whole congreg togeth wa forti and two thousand three
hundr and threescor 2:65 besid their servant and their maid of
whom there were seven thousand three hundr thirti and seven: and
there were among them two hundr sing men and sing women

2:66 their hors were seven hundr thirti and six; their mule two
hundr forti and five; 2:67 their camel four hundr thirti and
five; their ass six thousand seven hundr and twenti

2:68 and some of the chief of the father when they came to the hous
of the lord which is at jerusalem offer freeli for the hous of god
to set it up in hi place: 2:69 they gave after their abil unto the
treasur of the work threescor and one thousand dram of gold and
five thousand pound of silver and one hundr priest garment

2:70 so the priest and the levit and some of the peopl and the
singer and the porter and the nethinim dwelt in their citi
and all israel in their citi

3:1 and when the seventh month wa come and the children of israel
were in the citi the peopl gather themselv togeth as one man
to jerusalem

3:2 then stood up jeshua the son of jozadak and hi brethren the
priest and zerubbabel the son of shealtiel and hi brethren and
build the altar of the god of israel to offer burnt offer
thereon as it is written in the law of mose the man of god

3:3 and they set the altar upon hi bases; for fear wa upon them
becaus of the peopl of those countries: and they offer burnt
offer thereon unto the lord even burnt offer morn and
even

3:4 they kept also the feast of tabernacl as it is written and
offer the daili burnt offer by number accord to the custom
as the duti of everi day required; 3:5 and afterward offer the
continu burnt offer both of the new moon and of all the set
feast of the lord that were consecr and of everi one that
willingli offer a freewil offer unto the lord

3:6 from the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt
offer unto the lord but the foundat of the templ of the lord
wa not yet laid

3:7 they gave money also unto the mason and to the carpenters; and
meat and drink and oil unto them of zidon and to them of tyre to
bring cedar tree from lebanon to the sea of joppa accord to the
grant that they had of cyru king of persia

3:8 now in the second year of their come unto the hous of god at
jerusalem in the second month began zerubbabel the son of shealtiel
and jeshua the son of jozadak and the remnant of their brethren the
priest and the levit and all they that were come out of the
captiv unto jerusalem; and appoint the levit from twenti year
old and upward to set forward the work of the hous of the lord

3:9 then stood jeshua with hi son and hi brethren kadmiel and hi
son the son of judah togeth to set forward the workmen in the
hous of god: the son of henadad with their son and their brethren
the levit

3:10 and when the builder laid the foundat of the templ of the
lord they set the priest in their apparel with trumpet and the
levit the son of asaph with cymbal to prais the lord after the
ordin of david king of israel

3:11 and they sang togeth by cours in prais and give thank
unto the lord; becaus he is good for hi merci endureth for ever
toward israel

and all the peopl shout with a great shout when they prais the
lord becaus the foundat of the hous of the lord wa laid

3:12 but mani of the priest and levit and chief of the father who
were ancient men that had seen the first hous when the foundat
of thi hous wa laid befor their eye wept with a loud voice; and
mani shout aloud for joy: 3:13 so that the peopl could not discern
the nois of the shout of joy from the nois of the weep of the
people: for the peopl shout with a loud shout and the nois wa
heard afar off

4:1 now when the adversari of judah and benjamin heard that the
children of the captiv build the templ unto the lord god of
israel; 4:2 then they came to zerubbabel and to the chief of the
father and said unto them let us build with you: for we seek your
god as ye do; and we do sacrific unto him sinc the day of
esarhaddon king of assur which brought us up hither

4:3 but zerubbabel and jeshua and the rest of the chief of the
father of israel said unto them ye have noth to do with us to
build an hous unto our god; but we ourselv togeth will build unto
the lord god of israel as king cyru the king of persia hath
command us

4:4 then the peopl of the land weaken the hand of the peopl of
judah and troubl them in build 4:5 and hire counsellor
against them to frustrat their purpos all the day of cyru king
of persia even until the reign of dariu king of persia

4:6 and in the reign of ahasueru in the begin of hi reign
wrote they unto him an accus against the inhabit of judah and
jerusalem

4:7 and in the day of artaxerx wrote bishlam mithredath tabeel
and the rest of their companion unto artaxerx king of persia; and
the write of the letter wa written in the syrian tongu and
interpret in the syrian tongu

4:8 rehum the chancellor and shimshai the scribe wrote a letter
against jerusalem to artaxerx the king in thi sort: 4:9 then wrote
rehum the chancellor and shimshai the scribe and the rest of their
companions; the dinait the apharsathchit the tarpelit the
apharsit the archevit the babylonian the susanchit the
dehavit and the elamit 4:10 and the rest of the nation whom the
great and nobl asnapp brought over and set in the citi of
samaria and the rest that are on thi side the river and at such a
time

4:11 thi is the copi of the letter that they sent unto him even unto
artaxerx the king; thi servant the men on thi side the river and
at such a time

4:12 be it known unto the king that the jew which came up from thee
to us are come unto jerusalem build the rebelli and the bad
citi and have set up the wall thereof and join the foundat

4:13 be it known now unto the king that if thi citi be build and
the wall set up again then will they not pay toll tribut and
custom and so thou shalt endamag the revenu of the king

4:14 now becaus we have mainten from the king palac and it
wa not meet for us to see the king dishonour therefor have we
sent and certifi the king; 4:15 that search may be made in the book
of the record of thi fathers: so shalt thou find in the book of the
record and know that thi citi is a rebelli citi and hurt
unto king and provinc and that they have move sedit within the
same of old time: for which caus wa thi citi destroy

4:16 we certifi the king that if thi citi be build again and the
wall thereof set up by thi mean thou shalt have no portion on thi
side the river

4:17 then sent the king an answer unto rehum the chancellor and to
shimshai the scribe and to the rest of their companion that dwell in
samaria and unto the rest beyond the river peac and at such a
time

4:18 the letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainli read befor
me

4:19 and i command and search hath been made and it is found that
thi citi of old time hath made insurrect against king and that
rebellion and sedit have been made therein

4:20 there have been mighti king also over jerusalem which have
rule over all countri beyond the river; and toll tribut and
custom wa paid unto them

4:21 give ye now command to caus these men to ceas and that
thi citi be not build until anoth command shall be given
from me

4:22 take heed now that ye fail not to do this: whi should damag grow
to the hurt of the kings? 4:23 now when the copi of king artaxerx
letter wa read befor rehum and shimshai the scribe and their
companion they went up in hast to jerusalem unto the jew and made
them to ceas by forc and power

4:24 then ceas the work of the hous of god which is at jerusalem
so it ceas unto the second year of the reign of dariu king of
persia

5:1 then the prophet haggai the prophet and zechariah the son of
iddo prophesi unto the jew that were in judah and jerusalem in the
name of the god of israel even unto them

5:2 then rose up zerubbabel the son of shealtiel and jeshua the son
of jozadak and began to build the hous of god which is at jerusalem:
and with them were the prophet of god help them

5:3 at the same time came to them tatnai governor on thi side the
river and shetharboznai and their companion and said thu unto
them who hath command you to build thi hous and to make up thi
wall? 5:4 then said we unto them after thi manner what are the
name of the men that make thi building? 5:5 but the eye of their
god wa upon the elder of the jew that they could not caus them to
ceas till the matter came to darius: and then they return answer
by letter concern thi matter

5:6 the copi of the letter that tatnai governor on thi side the
river and shetharboznai and hi companion the apharsachit which
were on thi side the river sent unto dariu the king: 5:7 they sent
a letter unto him wherein wa written thus; unto dariu the king all
peac

5:8 be it known unto the king that we went into the provinc of
judea to the hous of the great god which is build with great
stone and timber is laid in the wall and thi work goeth fast on
and prospereth in their hand

5:9 then ask we those elder and said unto them thu who command
you to build thi hous and to make up these walls? 5:10 we ask
their name also to certifi thee that we might write the name of
the men that were the chief of them

5:11 and thu they return us answer say we are the servant of
the god of heaven and earth and build the hous that wa build
these mani year ago which a great king of israel build and set up

5:12 but after that our father had provok the god of heaven unto
wrath he gave them into the hand of nebuchadnezzar the king of
babylon the chaldean who destroy thi hous and carri the
peopl away into babylon

5:13 but in the first year of cyru the king of babylon the same king
cyru made a decre to build thi hous of god

5:14 and the vessel also of gold and silver of the hous of god
which nebuchadnezzar took out of the templ that wa in jerusalem and
brought them into the templ of babylon those did cyru the king take
out of the templ of babylon and they were deliv unto one whose
name wa sheshbazzar whom he had made governor; 5:15 and said unto
him take these vessel go carri them into the templ that is in
jerusalem and let the hous of god be build in hi place

5:16 then came the same sheshbazzar and laid the foundat of the
hous of god which is in jerusalem: and sinc that time even until now
hath it been in build and yet it is not finish

5:17 now therefor if it seem good to the king let there be search
made in the king treasur hous which is there at babylon whether
it be so that a decre wa made of cyru the king to build thi hous
of god at jerusalem and let the king send hi pleasur to us
concern thi matter

6:1 then dariu the king made a decre and search wa made in the
hous of the roll where the treasur were laid up in babylon

6:2 and there wa found at achmetha in the palac that is in the
provinc of the mede a roll and therein wa a record thu written:
6:3 in the first year of cyru the king the same cyru the king made a
decre concern the hous of god at jerusalem let the hous be
build the place where they offer sacrific and let the
foundat thereof be strongli laid; the height thereof threescor
cubit and the breadth thereof threescor cubits; 6:4 with three row
of great stone and a row of new timber: and let the expens be
given out of the king house: 6:5 and also let the golden and silver
vessel of the hous of god which nebuchadnezzar took forth out of
the templ which is at jerusalem and brought unto babylon be
restor and brought again unto the templ which is at jerusalem
everi one to hi place and place them in the hous of god

6:6 now therefor tatnai governor beyond the river shetharboznai
and your companion the apharsachit which are beyond the river be
ye far from thence: 6:7 let the work of thi hous of god alone; let
the governor of the jew and the elder of the jew build thi hous
of god in hi place

6:8 moreov i make a decre what ye shall do to the elder of these
jew for the build of thi hous of god: that of the king good
even of the tribut beyond the river forthwith expens be given unto
these men that they be not hinder

6:9 and that which they have need of both young bullock and ram
and lamb for the burnt offer of the god of heaven wheat salt
wine and oil accord to the appoint of the priest which are
at jerusalem let it be given them day by day without fail: 6:10 that
they may offer sacrific of sweet savour unto the god of heaven and
pray for the life of the king and of hi son

6:11 also i have made a decre that whosoev shall alter thi word
let timber be pull down from hi hous and be set up let him be
hang thereon; and let hi hous be made a dunghil for thi

6:12 and the god that hath caus hi name to dwell there destroy all
king and peopl that shall put to their hand to alter and to destroy
thi hous of god which is at jerusalem i dariu have made a decree;
let it be done with speed

6:13 then tatnai governor on thi side the river shetharboznai and
their companion accord to that which dariu the king had sent so
they did speedili

6:14 and the elder of the jew build and they prosper through
the prophesi of haggai the prophet and zechariah the son of iddo
and they build and finish it accord to the command of the
god of israel and accord to the command of cyru and dariu
and artaxerx king of persia

6:15 and thi hous wa finish on the third day of the month adar
which wa in the sixth year of the reign of dariu the king

6:16 and the children of israel the priest and the levit and the
rest of the children of the captiv kept the dedic of thi
hous of god with joy

6:17 and offer at the dedic of thi hous of god an hundr
bullock two hundr ram four hundr lambs; and for a sin offer
for all israel twelv he goat accord to the number of the tribe
of israel

6:18 and they set the priest in their divis and the levit in
their cours for the servic of god which is at jerusalem; as it is
written in the book of mose

6:19 and the children of the captiv kept the passov upon the
fourteenth day of the first month

6:20 for the priest and the levit were purifi togeth all of
them were pure and kill the passov for all the children of the
captiv and for their brethren the priest and for themselv

6:21 and the children of israel which were come again out of
captiv and all such as had separ themselv unto them from the
filthi of the heathen of the land to seek the lord god of israel
did eat 6:22 and kept the feast of unleaven bread seven day with
joy: for the lord had made them joy and turn the heart of the
king of assyria unto them to strengthen their hand in the work of
the hous of god the god of israel

7:1 now after these thing in the reign of artaxerx king of persia
ezra the son of seraiah the son of azariah the son of hilkiah 7:2
the son of shallum the son of zadok the son of ahitub 7:3 the son
of amariah the son of azariah the son of meraioth 7:4 the son of
zerahiah the son of uzzi the son of bukki 7:5 the son of abishua
the son of phineha the son of eleazar the son of aaron the chief
priest: 7:6 thi ezra went up from babylon; and he wa a readi scribe
in the law of mose which the lord god of israel had given: and the
king grant him all hi request accord to the hand of the lord
hi god upon him

7:7 and there went up some of the children of israel and of the
priest and the levit and the singer and the porter and the
nethinim unto jerusalem in the seventh year of artaxerx the king

7:8 and he came to jerusalem in the fifth month which wa in the
seventh year of the king

7:9 for upon the first day of the first month began he to go up from
babylon and on the first day of the fifth month came he to jerusalem
accord to the good hand of hi god upon him

7:10 for ezra had prepar hi heart to seek the law of the lord and
to do it and to teach in israel statut and judgment

7:11 now thi is the copi of the letter that the king artaxerx gave
unto ezra the priest the scribe even a scribe of the word of the
command of the lord and of hi statut to israel

7:12 artaxerx king of king unto ezra the priest a scribe of the
law of the god of heaven perfect peac and at such a time

7:13 i make a decre that all they of the peopl of israel and of
hi priest and levit in my realm which are mind of their own
freewil to go up to jerusalem go with thee

7:14 forasmuch as thou art sent of the king and of hi seven
counsellor to enquir concern judah and jerusalem accord to
the law of thi god which is in thine hand; 7:15 and to carri the
silver and gold which the king and hi counsellor have freeli
offer unto the god of israel whose habit is in jerusalem 7:16
and all the silver and gold that thou canst find in all the provinc
of babylon with the freewil offer of the peopl and of the
priest offer willingli for the hous of their god which is in
jerusalem: 7:17 that thou mayest buy speedili with thi money
bullock ram lamb with their meat offer and their drink
offer and offer them upon the altar of the hous of your god
which is in jerusalem

7:18 and whatsoev shall seem good to thee and to thi brethren to
do with the rest of the silver and the gold that do after the will of
your god

7:19 the vessel also that are given thee for the servic of the hous
of thi god those deliv thou befor the god of jerusalem

7:20 and whatsoev more shall be need for the hous of thi god
which thou shalt have occas to bestow bestow it out of the king
treasur hous

7:21 and i even i artaxerx the king do make a decre to all the
treasur which are beyond the river that whatsoev ezra the
priest the scribe of the law of the god of heaven shall requir of
you it be done speedili 7:22 unto an hundr talent of silver and
to an hundr measur of wheat and to an hundr bath of wine and
to an hundr bath of oil and salt without prescrib how much

7:23 whatsoev is command by the god of heaven let it be
dilig done for the hous of the god of heaven: for whi should
there be wrath against the realm of the king and hi sons? 7:24 also
we certifi you that touch ani of the priest and levit singer
porter nethinim or minist of thi hous of god it shall not be
law to impos toll tribut or custom upon them

7:25 and thou ezra after the wisdom of thi god that is in thine
hand set magistr and judg which may judg all the peopl that
are beyond the river all such as know the law of thi god; and teach
ye them that know them not

7:26 and whosoev will not do the law of thi god and the law of the
king let judgment be execut speedili upon him whether it be unto
death or to banish or to confisc of good or to
imprison

7:27 bless be the lord god of our father which hath put such a
thing as thi in the king heart to beautifi the hous of the lord
which is in jerusalem: 7:28 and hath extend merci unto me befor the
king and hi counsellor and befor all the king mighti princ
and i wa strengthen as the hand of the lord my god wa upon me and
i gather togeth out of israel chief men to go up with me

8:1 these are now the chief of their father and thi is the
genealog of them that went up with me from babylon in the reign of
artaxerx the king

8:2 of the son of phinehas; gershom: of the son of ithamar; daniel:
of the son of david; hattush

8:3 of the son of shechaniah of the son of pharosh; zechariah: and
with him were reckon by genealog of the male an hundr and fifti

8:4 of the son of pahathmoab; elihoenai the son of zerahiah and with
him two hundr male

8:5 of the son of shechaniah; the son of jahaziel and with him three
hundr male

8:6 of the son also of adin; ebe the son of jonathan and with him
fifti male

8:7 and of the son of elam; jeshaiah the son of athaliah and with
him seventi male

8:8 and of the son of shephatiah; zebadiah the son of michael and
with him fourscor male

8:9 of the son of joab; obadiah the son of jehiel and with him two
hundr and eighteen male

8:10 and of the son of shelomith; the son of josiphiah and with him
an hundr and threescor male

8:11 and of the son of bebai; zechariah the son of bebai and with
him twenti and eight male

8:12 and of the son of azgad; johanan the son of hakkatan and with
him an hundr and ten male

8:13 and of the last son of adonikam whose name are these
eliphelet jeiel and shemaiah and with them threescor male

8:14 of the son also of bigvai; uthai and zabbud and with them
seventi male

8:15 and i gather them togeth to the river that runneth to ahava;
and there abod we in tent three days: and i view the peopl and
the priest and found there none of the son of levi

8:16 then sent i for eliez for ariel for shemaiah and for
elnathan and for jarib and for elnathan and for nathan and for
zechariah and for meshullam chief men; also for joiarib and for
elnathan men of understand

8:17 and i sent them with command unto iddo the chief at the place
casiphia and i told them what they should say unto iddo and to hi
brethren the nethinim at the place casiphia that they should bring
unto us minist for the hous of our god

8:18 and by the good hand of our god upon us they brought us a man of
understand of the son of mahli the son of levi the son of
israel; and sherebiah with hi son and hi brethren eighteen; 8:19
and hashabiah and with him jeshaiah of the son of merari hi
brethren and their son twenty; 8:20 also of the nethinim whom
david and the princ had appoint for the servic of the levit
two hundr and twenti nethinims: all of them were express by name

8:21 then i proclaim a fast there at the river of ahava that we
might afflict ourselv befor our god to seek of him a right way for
us and for our littl one and for all our substanc

8:22 for i wa asham to requir of the king a band of soldier and
horsemen to help us against the enemi in the way: becaus we had
spoken unto the king say the hand of our god is upon all them for
good that seek him; but hi power and hi wrath is against all them
that forsak him

8:23 so we fast and besought our god for this: and he wa intreat
of us

8:24 then i separ twelv of the chief of the priest sherebiah
hashabiah and ten of their brethren with them 8:25 and weigh unto
them the silver and the gold and the vessel even the offer of
the hous of our god which the king and hi counsellor and hi
lord and all israel there present had offered: 8:26 i even weigh
unto their hand six hundr and fifti talent of silver and silver
vessel an hundr talent and of gold an hundr talents; 8:27 also
twenti bason of gold of a thousand drams; and two vessel of fine
copper preciou as gold

8:28 and i said unto them ye are holi unto the lord; the vessel are
holi also; and the silver and the gold are a freewil offer unto
the lord god of your father

8:29 watch ye and keep them until ye weigh them befor the chief of
the priest and the levit and chief of the father of israel at
jerusalem in the chamber of the hous of the lord

8:30 so took the priest and the levit the weight of the silver and
the gold and the vessel to bring them to jerusalem unto the hous
of our god

8:31 then we depart from the river of ahava on the twelfth day of
the first month to go unto jerusalem: and the hand of our god wa
upon us and he deliv us from the hand of the enemi and of such
as lay in wait by the way

8:32 and we came to jerusalem and abod there three day

8:33 now on the fourth day wa the silver and the gold and the vessel
weigh in the hous of our god by the hand of meremoth the son of
uriah the priest; and with him wa eleazar the son of phinehas; and
with them wa jozabad the son of jeshua and noadiah the son of
binnui levites; 8:34 by number and by weight of everi one: and all
the weight wa written at that time

8:35 also the children of those that had been carri away which were
come out of the captiv offer burnt offer unto the god of
israel twelv bullock for all israel nineti and six ram seventi
and seven lamb twelv he goat for a sin offering: all thi wa a
burnt offer unto the lord

8:36 and they deliv the king commiss unto the king
lieuten and to the governor on thi side the river: and they
further the peopl and the hous of god

9:1 now when these thing were done the princ came to me say
the peopl of israel and the priest and the levit have not
separ themselv from the peopl of the land do accord to
their abomin even of the canaanit the hittit the
perizzit the jebusit the ammonit the moabit the egyptian
and the amorit

9:2 for they have taken of their daughter for themselv and for
their sons: so that the holi seed have mingl themselv with the
peopl of those lands: yea the hand of the princ and ruler hath
been chief in thi trespass

9:3 and when i heard thi thing i rent my garment and my mantl and
pluck off the hair of my head and of my beard and sat down
astoni

9:4 then were assembl unto me everi one that trembl at the word
of the god of israel becaus of the transgress of those that had
been carri away; and i sat astoni until the even sacrific

9:5 and at the even sacrific i aros up from my heaviness; and
have rent my garment and my mantl i fell upon my knee and spread
out my hand unto the lord my god 9:6 and said o my god i am
asham and blush to lift up my face to thee my god: for our
iniqu are increas over our head and our trespass is grown up
unto the heaven

9:7 sinc the day of our father have we been in a great trespass
unto thi day; and for our iniqu have we our king and our
priest been deliv into the hand of the king of the land to
the sword to captiv and to a spoil and to confus of face as
it is thi day

9:8 and now for a littl space grace hath been shew from the lord
our god to leav us a remnant to escap and to give us a nail in hi
holi place that our god may lighten our eye and give us a littl
reviv in our bondag

9:9 for we were bondmen; yet our god hath not forsaken us in our
bondag but hath extend merci unto us in the sight of the king of
persia to give us a reviv to set up the hous of our god and to
repair the desol thereof and to give us a wall in judah and in
jerusalem

9:10 and now o our god what shall we say after this? for we have
forsaken thi command 9:11 which thou hast command by thi
servant the prophet say the land unto which ye go to possess
it is an unclean land with the filthi of the peopl of the land
with their abomin which have fill it from one end to anoth
with their unclean

9:12 now therefor give not your daughter unto their son neither
take their daughter unto your son nor seek their peac or their
wealth for ever: that ye may be strong and eat the good of the land
and leav it for an inherit to your children for ever

9:13 and after all that is come upon us for our evil deed and for
our great trespass see that thou our god hast punish us less
than our iniqu deserv and hast given us such deliver as
this; 9:14 should we again break thi command and join in
affin with the peopl of these abominations? wouldest not thou be
angri with us till thou hadst consum us so that there should be no
remnant nor escaping? 9:15 o lord god of israel thou art righteous:
for we remain yet escap as it is thi day: behold we are befor
thee in our trespasses: for we cannot stand befor thee becaus of
thi

10:1 now when ezra had pray and when he had confess weep and
cast himself down befor the hous of god there assembl unto him
out of israel a veri great congreg of men and women and children:
for the peopl wept veri sore

10:2 and shechaniah the son of jehiel one of the son of elam
answer and said unto ezra we have trespass against our god and
have taken strang wive of the peopl of the land: yet now there is
hope in israel concern thi thing

10:3 now therefor let us make a coven with our god to put away all
the wive and such as are born of them accord to the counsel of
my lord and of those that trembl at the command of our god; and
let it be done accord to the law

10:4 arise; for thi matter belongeth unto thee: we also will be with
thee: be of good courag and do it

10:5 then aros ezra and made the chief priest the levit and all
israel to swear that they should do accord to thi word and they
sware

10:6 then ezra rose up from befor the hous of god and went into the
chamber of johanan the son of eliashib: and when he came thither he
did eat no bread nor drink water: for he mourn becaus of the
transgress of them that had been carri away

10:7 and they made proclam throughout judah and jerusalem unto
all the children of the captiv that they should gather themselv
togeth unto jerusalem; 10:8 and that whosoev would not come within
three day accord to the counsel of the princ and the elder
all hi substanc should be forfeit and himself separ from the
congreg of those that had been carri away

10:9 then all the men of judah and benjamin gather themselv
togeth unto jerusalem within three day it wa the ninth month on
the twentieth day of the month; and all the peopl sat in the street
of the hous of god trembl becaus of thi matter and for the
great rain

10:10 and ezra the priest stood up and said unto them ye have
transgress and have taken strang wive to increas the trespass
of israel

10:11 now therefor make confess unto the lord god of your father
and do hi pleasure: and separ yourselv from the peopl of the
land and from the strang wive

10:12 then all the congreg answer and said with a loud voic
as thou hast said so must we do

10:13 but the peopl are mani and it is a time of much rain and we
are not abl to stand without neither is thi a work of one day or
two: for we are mani that have transgress in thi thing

10:14 let now our ruler of all the congreg stand and let all
them which have taken strang wive in our citi come at appoint
time and with them the elder of everi citi and the judg thereof
until the fierc wrath of our god for thi matter be turn from us

10:15 onli jonathan the son of asahel and jahaziah the son of tikvah
were employ about thi matter: and meshullam and shabbethai the
levit help them

10:16 and the children of the captiv did so and ezra the priest
with certain chief of the father after the hous of their father
and all of them by their name were separ and sat down in the
first day of the tenth month to examin the matter

10:17 and they made an end with all the men that had taken strang
wive by the first day of the first month

10:18 and among the son of the priest there were found that had
taken strang wives: name of the son of jeshua the son of jozadak
and hi brethren; maaseiah and eliez and jarib and gedaliah

10:19 and they gave their hand that they would put away their wives;
and be guilti they offer a ram of the flock for their trespass

10:20 and of the son of immer; hanani and zebadiah

10:21 and of the son of harim; maaseiah and elijah and shemaiah
and jehiel and uzziah

10:22 and of the son of pashur; elioenai maaseiah ishmael
nethaneel jozabad and elasah

10:23 also of the levites; jozabad and shimei and kelaiah (the same
is kelita) pethahiah judah and eliez

10:24 of the singer also; eliashib: and of the porters; shallum and
telem and uri

10:25 moreov of israel: of the son of parosh; ramiah and jeziah
and malchiah and miamin and eleazar and malchijah and benaiah

10:26 and of the son of elam; mattaniah zechariah and jehiel and
abdi and jeremoth and eliah

10:27 and of the son of zattu; elioenai eliashib mattaniah and
jeremoth and zabad and aziza

10:28 of the son also of bebai; jehohanan hananiah zabbai and
athlai

10:29 and of the son of bani; meshullam malluch and adaiah jashub
and sheal and ramoth

10:30 and of the son of pahathmoab; adna and chelal benaiah
maaseiah mattaniah bezaleel and binnui and manasseh

10:31 and of the son of harim; eliez ishijah malchiah shemaiah
shimeon 10:32 benjamin malluch and shemariah

10:33 of the son of hashum; mattenai mattathah zabad eliphelet
jeremai manasseh and shimei

10:34 of the son of bani; maadai amram and uel 10:35 benaiah
bedeiah chelluh 10:36 vaniah meremoth eliashib 10:37 mattaniah
mattenai and jaasau 10:38 and bani and binnui shimei 10:39 and
shelemiah and nathan and adaiah 10:40 machnadebai shashai sharai
10:41 azareel and shelemiah shemariah 10:42 shallum amariah and
joseph

10:43 of the son of nebo; jeiel mattithiah zabad zebina jadau
and joel benaiah

10:44 all these had taken strang wives: and some of them had wive by
whom they had children



the book of nehemiah


1:1 the word of nehemiah the son of hachaliah and it came to pass
in the month chisleu in the twentieth year as i wa in shushan the
palac 1:2 that hanani one of my brethren came he and certain men
of judah; and i ask them concern the jew that had escap which
were left of the captiv and concern jerusalem

1:3 and they said unto me the remnant that are left of the captiv
there in the provinc are in great afflict and reproach: the wall
of jerusalem also is broken down and the gate thereof are burn
with fire

1:4 and it came to pass when i heard these word that i sat down and
wept and mourn certain day and fast and pray befor the god
of heaven 1:5 and said i beseech thee o lord god of heaven the
great and terribl god that keepeth coven and merci for them that
love him and observ hi commandments: 1:6 let thine ear now be
attent and thine eye open that thou mayest hear the prayer of
thi servant which i pray befor thee now day and night for the
children of israel thi servant and confess the sin of the children
of israel which we have sin against thee: both i and my father
hous have sin

1:7 we have dealt veri corruptli against thee and have not kept the
command nor the statut nor the judgment which thou
commandedst thi servant mose
