1:8 rememb i beseech thee the word that thou commandedst thi
servant mose say if ye transgress i will scatter you abroad
among the nations: 1:9 but if ye turn unto me and keep my
command and do them; though there were of you cast out unto the
uttermost part of the heaven yet will i gather them from thenc and
will bring them unto the place that i have chosen to set my name
there

1:10 now these are thi servant and thi peopl whom thou hast
redeem by thi great power and by thi strong hand

1:11 o lord i beseech thee let now thine ear be attent to the
prayer of thi servant and to the prayer of thi servant who desir
to fear thi name: and prosper i pray thee thi servant thi day and
grant him merci in the sight of thi man for i wa the king
cupbear

2:1 and it came to pass in the month nisan in the twentieth year of
artaxerx the king that wine wa befor him: and i took up the wine
and gave it unto the king now i had not been beforetim sad in hi
presenc

2:2 wherefor the king said unto me whi is thi counten sad
see thou art not sick? thi is noth els but sorrow of heart
then i wa veri sore afraid 2:3 and said unto the king let the king
live for ever: whi should not my counten be sad when the citi
the place of my father sepulchr lieth wast and the gate
thereof are consum with fire? 2:4 then the king said unto me for
what dost thou make request? so i pray to the god of heaven

2:5 and i said unto the king if it pleas the king and if thi
servant have found favour in thi sight that thou wouldest send me
unto judah unto the citi of my father sepulchr that i may build
it

2:6 and the king said unto me (the queen also sit by him) for
how long shall thi journey be? and when wilt thou return? so it
pleas the king to send me; and i set him a time

2:7 moreov i said unto the king if it pleas the king let letter
be given me to the governor beyond the river that they may convey me
over till i come into judah; 2:8 and a letter unto asaph the keeper of
the king forest that he may give me timber to make beam for the
gate of the palac which appertain to the hous and for the wall
of the citi and for the hous that i shall enter into and the king
grant me accord to the good hand of my god upon me

2:9 then i came to the governor beyond the river and gave them the
king letter now the king had sent captain of the armi and
horsemen with me

2:10 when sanballat the horonit and tobiah the servant the
ammonit heard of it it griev them exceedingli that there wa come
a man to seek the welfar of the children of israel

2:11 so i came to jerusalem and wa there three day

2:12 and i aros in the night i and some few men with me; neither
told i ani man what my god had put in my heart to do at jerusalem:
neither wa there ani beast with me save the beast that i rode upon

2:13 and i went out by night by the gate of the valley even befor
the dragon well and to the dung port and view the wall of
jerusalem which were broken down and the gate thereof were consum
with fire

2:14 then i went on to the gate of the fountain and to the king
pool: but there wa no place for the beast that wa under me to pass

2:15 then went i up in the night by the brook and view the wall
and turn back and enter by the gate of the valley and so
return

2:16 and the ruler knew not whither i went or what i did; neither
had i as yet told it to the jew nor to the priest nor to the
nobl nor to the ruler nor to the rest that did the work

2:17 then said i unto them ye see the distress that we are in how
jerusalem lieth wast and the gate thereof are burn with fire:
come and let us build up the wall of jerusalem that we be no more a
reproach

2:18 then i told them of the hand of my god which wa good upon me; as
also the king word that he had spoken unto me and they said let
us rise up and build so they strengthen their hand for thi good
work

2:19 but when sanballat the horonit and tobiah the servant the
ammonit and geshem the arabian heard it they laugh us to scorn
and despis us and said what is thi thing that ye do? will ye
rebel against the king? 2:20 then answer i them and said unto
them the god of heaven he will prosper us; therefor we hi servant
will aris and build: but ye have no portion nor right nor memori
in jerusalem

3:1 then eliashib the high priest rose up with hi brethren the
priest and they build the sheep gate; they sanctifi it and set
up the door of it; even unto the tower of meah they sanctifi it
unto the tower of hananeel

3:2 and next unto him build the men of jericho and next to them
build zaccur the son of imri

3:3 but the fish gate did the son of hassenaah build who also laid
the beam thereof and set up the door thereof the lock thereof
and the bar thereof

3:4 and next unto them repair meremoth the son of urijah the son of
koz and next unto them repair meshullam the son of berechiah the
son of meshezabeel and next unto them repair zadok the son of
baana

3:5 and next unto them the tekoit repaired; but their nobl put not
their neck to the work of their lord

3:6 moreov the old gate repair jehoiada the son of paseah and
meshullam the son of besodeiah; they laid the beam thereof and set
up the door thereof and the lock thereof and the bar thereof

3:7 and next unto them repair melatiah the gibeonit and jadon the
meronothit the men of gibeon and of mizpah unto the throne of the
governor on thi side the river

3:8 next unto him repair uzziel the son of harhaiah of the
goldsmith

next unto him also repair hananiah the son of one of the
apothecari and they fortifi jerusalem unto the broad wall

3:9 and next unto them repair rephaiah the son of hur the ruler of
the half part of jerusalem

3:10 and next unto them repair jedaiah the son of harumaph even
over against hi hous and next unto him repair hattush the son of
hashabniah

3:11 malchijah the son of harim and hashub the son of pahathmoab
repair the other piec and the tower of the furnac

3:12 and next unto him repair shallum the son of halohesh the ruler
of the half part of jerusalem he and hi daughter

3:13 the valley gate repair hanun and the inhabit of zanoah;
they built it and set up the door thereof the lock thereof and
the bar thereof and a thousand cubit on the wall unto the dung
gate

3:14 but the dung gate repair malchiah the son of rechab the ruler
of part of bethhaccerem; he built it and set up the door thereof
the lock thereof and the bar thereof

3:15 but the gate of the fountain repair shallun the son of
colhozeh the ruler of part of mizpah; he built it and cover it
and set up the door thereof the lock thereof and the bar thereof
and the wall of the pool of siloah by the king garden and unto the
stair that go down from the citi of david

3:16 after him repair nehemiah the son of azbuk the ruler of the
half part of bethzur unto the place over against the sepulchr of
david and to the pool that wa made and unto the hous of the
mighti

3:17 after him repair the levit rehum the son of bani next unto
him repair hashabiah the ruler of the half part of keilah in hi
part

3:18 after him repair their brethren bavai the son of henadad the
ruler of the half part of keilah

3:19 and next to him repair ezer the son of jeshua the ruler of
mizpah anoth piec over against the go up to the armouri at the
turn of the wall

3:20 after him baruch the son of zabbai earnestli repair the other
piec from the turn of the wall unto the door of the hous of
eliashib the high priest

3:21 after him repair meremoth the son of urijah the son of koz
anoth piec from the door of the hous of eliashib even to the end
of the hous of eliashib

3:22 and after him repair the priest the men of the plain

3:23 after him repair benjamin and hashub over against their hous

after him repair azariah the son of maaseiah the son of ananiah by
hi hous

3:24 after him repair binnui the son of henadad anoth piec from
the hous of azariah unto the turn of the wall even unto the
corner

3:25 palal the son of uzai over against the turn of the wall and
the tower which lieth out from the king high hous that wa by the
court of the prison after him pedaiah the son of parosh

3:26 moreov the nethinim dwelt in ophel unto the place over
against the water gate toward the east and the tower that lieth out

3:27 after them the tekoit repair anoth piec over against the
great tower that lieth out even unto the wall of ophel

3:28 from abov the hors gate repair the priest everi one over
against hi hous

3:29 after them repair zadok the son of immer over against hi
hous

after him repair also shemaiah the son of shechaniah the keeper of
the east gate

3:30 after him repair hananiah the son of shelemiah and hanun the
sixth son of zalaph anoth piec after him repair meshullam the
son of berechiah over against hi chamber

3:31 after him repair malchiah the goldsmith son unto the place of
the nethinim and of the merchant over against the gate miphkad
and to the go up of the corner

3:32 and between the go up of the corner unto the sheep gate
repair the goldsmith and the merchant

4:1 but it came to pass that when sanballat heard that we build the
wall he wa wroth and took great indign and mock the jew

4:2 and he spake befor hi brethren and the armi of samaria and
said what do these feebl jews? will they fortifi themselves? will
they sacrifice? will they make an end in a day? will they reviv the
stone out of the heap of the rubbish which are burned? 4:3 now
tobiah the ammonit wa by him and he said even that which they
build if a fox go up he shall even break down their stone wall

4:4 hear o our god; for we are despised: and turn their reproach upon
their own head and give them for a prey in the land of captivity: 4:5
and cover not their iniqu and let not their sin be blot out
from befor thee: for they have provok thee to anger befor the
builder

4:6 so built we the wall; and all the wall wa join togeth unto
the half thereof: for the peopl had a mind to work

4:7 but it came to pass that when sanballat and tobiah and the
arabian and the ammonit and the ashdodit heard that the wall
of jerusalem were made up and that the breach began to be stop
then they were veri wroth 4:8 and conspir all of them togeth to
come and to fight against jerusalem and to hinder it

4:9 nevertheless we made our prayer unto our god and set a watch
against them day and night becaus of them

4:10 and judah said the strength of the bearer of burden is
decay and there is much rubbish; so that we are not abl to build
the wall

4:11 and our adversari said they shall not know neither see till
we come in the midst among them and slay them and caus the work to
ceas

4:12 and it came to pass that when the jew which dwelt by them came
they said unto us ten time from all place whenc ye shall return
unto us they will be upon you

4:13 therefor set i in the lower place behind the wall and on the
higher place i even set the peopl after their famili with their
sword their spear and their bow

4:14 and i look and rose up and said unto the nobl and to the
ruler and to the rest of the peopl be not ye afraid of them:
rememb the lord which is great and terribl and fight for your
brethren your son and your daughter your wive and your hous

4:15 and it came to pass when our enemi heard that it wa known
unto us and god had brought their counsel to nought that we return
all of us to the wall everi one unto hi work

4:16 and it came to pass from that time forth that the half of my
servant wrought in the work and the other half of them held both the
spear the shield and the bow and the habergeons; and the ruler
were behind all the hous of judah

4:17 they which build on the wall and they that bare burden with
those that lade everi one with one of hi hand wrought in the work
and with the other hand held a weapon

4:18 for the builder everi one had hi sword gird by hi side and
so build and he that sound the trumpet wa by me

4:19 and i said unto the nobl and to the ruler and to the rest of
the peopl the work is great and larg and we are separ upon the
wall one far from anoth

4:20 in what place therefor ye hear the sound of the trumpet resort
ye thither unto us: our god shall fight for us

4:21 so we labour in the work: and half of them held the spear from
the rise of the morn till the star appear

4:22 likewis at the same time said i unto the peopl let everi one
with hi servant lodg within jerusalem that in the night they may be
a guard to us and labour on the day

4:23 so neither i nor my brethren nor my servant nor the men of
the guard which follow me none of us put off our cloth save
that everi one put them off for wash

5:1 and there wa a great cri of the peopl and of their wive against
their brethren the jew

5:2 for there were that said we our son and our daughter are
many: therefor we take up corn for them that we may eat and live

5:3 some also there were that said we have mortgag our land
vineyard and hous that we might buy corn becaus of the dearth

5:4 there were also that said we have borrow money for the king
tribut and that upon our land and vineyard

5:5 yet now our flesh is as the flesh of our brethren our children as
their children: and lo we bring into bondag our son and our
daughter to be servant and some of our daughter are brought unto
bondag already: neither is it in our power to redeem them; for other
men have our land and vineyard

5:6 and i wa veri angri when i heard their cri and these word

5:7 then i consult with myself and i rebuk the nobl and the
ruler and said unto them ye exact usuri everi one of hi brother
and i set a great assembl against them

5:8 and i said unto them we after our abil have redeem our
brethren the jew which were sold unto the heathen; and will ye even
sell your brethren? or shall they be sold unto us? then held they
their peac and found noth to answer

5:9 also i said it is not good that ye do: ought ye not to walk in
the fear of our god becaus of the reproach of the heathen our
enemies? 5:10 i likewis and my brethren and my servant might
exact of them money and corn: i pray you let us leav off thi usuri

5:11 restor i pray you to them even thi day their land their
vineyard their oliveyard and their hous also the hundredth part
of the money and of the corn the wine and the oil that ye exact of
them

5:12 then said they we will restor them and will requir noth of
them; so will we do as thou sayest then i call the priest and
took an oath of them that they should do accord to thi promis

5:13 also i shook my lap and said so god shake out everi man from
hi hous and from hi labour that performeth not thi promis even
thu be he shaken out and empti and all the congreg said
amen and prais the lord and the peopl did accord to thi
promis

5:14 moreov from the time that i wa appoint to be their governor
in the land of judah from the twentieth year even unto the two and
thirtieth year of artaxerx the king that is twelv year i and my
brethren have not eaten the bread of the governor

5:15 but the former governor that had been befor me were chargeabl
unto the peopl and had taken of them bread and wine besid forti
shekel of silver; yea even their servant bare rule over the people:
but so did not i becaus of the fear of god

5:16 yea also i continu in the work of thi wall neither bought we
ani land: and all my servant were gather thither unto the work

5:17 moreov there were at my tabl an hundr and fifti of the jew
and ruler besid those that came unto us from among the heathen that
are about us

5:18 now that which wa prepar for me daili wa one ox and six
choic sheep; also fowl were prepar for me and onc in ten day
store of all sort of wine: yet for all thi requir not i the bread
of the governor becaus the bondag wa heavi upon thi peopl

5:19 think upon me my god for good accord to all that i have
done for thi peopl

6:1 now it came to pass when sanballat and tobiah and geshem the
arabian and the rest of our enemi heard that i had build the
wall and that there wa no breach left therein; (though at that time
i had not set up the door upon the gates;) 6:2 that sanballat and
geshem sent unto me say come let us meet togeth in some one of
the villag in the plain of ono but they thought to do me mischief

6:3 and i sent messeng unto them say i am do a great work
so that i cannot come down: whi should the work ceas whilst i leav
it and come down to you? 6:4 yet they sent unto me four time after
thi sort; and i answer them after the same manner

6:5 then sent sanballat hi servant unto me in like manner the fifth
time with an open letter in hi hand; 6:6 wherein wa written it is
report among the heathen and gashmu saith it that thou and the
jew think to rebel: for which caus thou buildest the wall that thou
mayest be their king accord to these word

6:7 and thou hast also appoint prophet to preach of thee at
jerusalem say there is a king in judah: and now shall it be
report to the king accord to these word come now therefor and
let us take counsel togeth

6:8 then i sent unto him say there are no such thing done as
thou sayest but thou feignest them out of thine own heart

6:9 for they all made us afraid say their hand shall be weaken
from the work that it be not done now therefor o god strengthen
my hand

6:10 afterward i came unto the hous of shemaiah the son of delaiah
the son of mehetabeel who wa shut up; and he said let us meet
togeth in the hous of god within the templ and let us shut the
door of the temple: for they will come to slay thee; yea in the
night will they come to slay thee

6:11 and i said should such a man as i flee? and who is there that
be as i am would go into the templ to save hi life? i will not
go in

6:12 and lo i perceiv that god had not sent him; but that he
pronounc thi propheci against me: for tobiah and sanballat had
hire him

6:13 therefor wa he hire that i should be afraid and do so and
sin and that they might have matter for an evil report that they
might reproach me

6:14 my god think thou upon tobiah and sanballat accord to these
their work and on the prophetess noadiah and the rest of the
prophet that would have put me in fear

6:15 so the wall wa finish in the twenti and fifth day of the month
elul in fifti and two day

6:16 and it came to pass that when all our enemi heard thereof and
all the heathen that were about us saw these thing they were much
cast down in their own eyes: for they perceiv that thi work wa
wrought of our god

6:17 moreov in those day the nobl of judah sent mani letter unto
tobiah and the letter of tobiah came unto them

6:18 for there were mani in judah sworn unto him becaus he wa the
son in law of shechaniah the son of arah; and hi son johanan had
taken the daughter of meshullam the son of berechiah

6:19 also they report hi good deed befor me and utter my word
to him and tobiah sent letter to put me in fear

7:1 now it came to pass when the wall wa built and i had set up the
door and the porter and the singer and the levit were appoint
7:2 that i gave my brother hanani and hananiah the ruler of the
palac charg over jerusalem: for he wa a faith man and fear
god abov mani

7:3 and i said unto them let not the gate of jerusalem be open
until the sun be hot; and while they stand by let them shut the
door and bar them: and appoint watch of the inhabit of
jerusalem everi one in hi watch and everi one to be over against
hi hous

7:4 now the citi wa larg and great: but the peopl were few therein
and the hous were not build

7:5 and my god put into mine heart to gather togeth the nobl and
the ruler and the peopl that they might be reckon by genealog
and i found a regist of the genealog of them which came up at the
first and found written therein 7:6 these are the children of the
provinc that went up out of the captiv of those that had been
carri away whom nebuchadnezzar the king of babylon had carri
away and came again to jerusalem and to judah everi one unto hi
city; 7:7 who came with zerubbabel jeshua nehemiah azariah
raamiah nahamani mordecai bilshan mispereth bigvai nehum
baanah the number i say of the men of the peopl of israel wa
this; 7:8 the children of parosh two thousand an hundr seventi and
two

7:9 the children of shephatiah three hundr seventi and two

7:10 the children of arah six hundr fifti and two

7:11 the children of pahathmoab of the children of jeshua and joab
two thousand and eight hundr and eighteen

7:12 the children of elam a thousand two hundr fifti and four

7:13 the children of zattu eight hundr forti and five

7:14 the children of zaccai seven hundr and threescor

7:15 the children of binnui six hundr forti and eight

7:16 the children of bebai six hundr twenti and eight

7:17 the children of azgad two thousand three hundr twenti and two

7:18 the children of adonikam six hundr threescor and seven

7:19 the children of bigvai two thousand threescor and seven

7:20 the children of adin six hundr fifti and five

7:21 the children of ater of hezekiah nineti and eight

7:22 the children of hashum three hundr twenti and eight

7:23 the children of bezai three hundr twenti and four

7:24 the children of hariph an hundr and twelv

7:25 the children of gibeon nineti and five

7:26 the men of bethlehem and netophah an hundr fourscor and
eight

7:27 the men of anathoth an hundr twenti and eight

7:28 the men of bethazmaveth forti and two

7:29 the men of kirjathjearim chephirah and beeroth seven hundr
forti and three

7:30 the men of ramah and gaba six hundr twenti and one

7:31 the men of michma an hundr and twenti and two

7:32 the men of bethel and ai an hundr twenti and three

7:33 the men of the other nebo fifti and two

7:34 the children of the other elam a thousand two hundr fifti and
four

7:35 the children of harim three hundr and twenti

7:36 the children of jericho three hundr forti and five

7:37 the children of lod hadid and ono seven hundr twenti and
one

7:38 the children of senaah three thousand nine hundr and thirti

7:39 the priests: the children of jedaiah of the hous of jeshua
nine hundr seventi and three

7:40 the children of immer a thousand fifti and two

7:41 the children of pashur a thousand two hundr forti and seven

7:42 the children of harim a thousand and seventeen

7:43 the levites: the children of jeshua of kadmiel and of the
children of hodevah seventi and four

7:44 the singers: the children of asaph an hundr forti and eight

7:45 the porters: the children of shallum the children of ater the
children of talmon the children of akkub the children of hatita the
children of shobai an hundr thirti and eight

7:46 the nethinims: the children of ziha the children of hashupha
the children of tabbaoth 7:47 the children of kero the children of
sia the children of padon 7:48 the children of lebana the children
of hagaba the children of shalmai 7:49 the children of hanan the
children of giddel the children of gahar 7:50 the children of
reaiah the children of rezin the children of nekoda 7:51 the
children of gazzam the children of uzza the children of phaseah
7:52 the children of besai the children of meunim the children of
nephishesim 7:53 the children of bakbuk the children of hakupha the
children of harhur 7:54 the children of bazlith the children of
mehida the children of harsha 7:55 the children of barko the
children of sisera the children of tamah 7:56 the children of
neziah the children of hatipha

7:57 the children of solomon servants: the children of sotai the
children of sophereth the children of perida 7:58 the children of
jaala the children of darkon the children of giddel 7:59 the
children of shephatiah the children of hattil the children of
pochereth of zebaim the children of amon

7:60 all the nethinim and the children of solomon servant were
three hundr nineti and two

7:61 and these were they which went up also from telmelah telharesha
cherub addon and immer: but they could not shew their father
hous nor their seed whether they were of israel

7:62 the children of delaiah the children of tobiah the children of
nekoda six hundr forti and two

7:63 and of the priests: the children of habaiah the children of koz
the children of barzillai which took one of the daughter of
barzillai the gileadit to wife and wa call after their name

7:64 these sought their regist among those that were reckon by
genealog but it wa not found: therefor were they as pollut put
from the priesthood

7:65 and the tirshatha said unto them that they should not eat of the
most holi thing till there stood up a priest with urim and thummim

7:66 the whole congreg togeth wa forti and two thousand three
hundr and threescor 7:67 besid their manserv and their
maidserv of whom there were seven thousand three hundr thirti
and seven: and they had two hundr forti and five sing men and
sing women

7:68 their hors seven hundr thirti and six: their mule two
hundr forti and five: 7:69 their camel four hundr thirti and
five: six thousand seven hundr and twenti ass

7:70 and some of the chief of the father gave unto the work the
tirshatha gave to the treasur a thousand dram of gold fifti bason
five hundr and thirti priest garment

7:71 and some of the chief of the father gave to the treasur of the
work twenti thousand dram of gold and two thousand and two hundr
pound of silver

7:72 and that which the rest of the peopl gave wa twenti thousand
dram of gold and two thousand pound of silver and threescor and
seven priest garment

7:73 so the priest and the levit and the porter and the
singer and some of the peopl and the nethinim and all israel
dwelt in their cities; and when the seventh month came the children
of israel were in their citi

8:1 and all the peopl gather themselv togeth as one man into
the street that wa befor the water gate; and they spake unto ezra
the scribe to bring the book of the law of mose which the lord had
command to israel

8:2 and ezra the priest brought the law befor the congreg both
of men and women and all that could hear with understand upon the
first day of the seventh month

8:3 and he read therein befor the street that wa befor the water
gate from the morn until midday befor the men and the women and
those that could understand; and the ear of all the peopl were
attent unto the book of the law

8:4 and ezra the scribe stood upon a pulpit of wood which they had
made for the purpose; and besid him stood mattithiah and shema and
anaiah and urijah and hilkiah and maaseiah on hi right hand; and
on hi left hand pedaiah and mishael and malchiah and hashum and
hashbadana zechariah and meshullam

8:5 and ezra open the book in the sight of all the people; (for he
wa abov all the people;) and when he open it all the peopl stood
up: 8:6 and ezra bless the lord the great god and all the peopl
answer amen amen with lift up their hands: and they bow
their head and worship the lord with their face to the ground

8:7 also jeshua and bani and sherebiah jamin akkub shabbethai
hodijah maaseiah kelita azariah jozabad hanan pelaiah and the
levit caus the peopl to understand the law: and the peopl stood
in their place

8:8 so they read in the book in the law of god distinctli and gave
the sens and caus them to understand the read

8:9 and nehemiah which is the tirshatha and ezra the priest the
scribe and the levit that taught the peopl said unto all the
peopl thi day is holi unto the lord your god; mourn not nor weep
for all the peopl wept when they heard the word of the law

8:10 then he said unto them go your way eat the fat and drink the
sweet and send portion unto them for whom noth is prepared: for
thi day is holi unto our lord: neither be ye sorry; for the joy of
the lord is your strength

8:11 so the levit still all the peopl say hold your peac
for the day is holy; neither be ye griev

8:12 and all the peopl went their way to eat and to drink and to
send portion and to make great mirth becaus they had understood
the word that were declar unto them

8:13 and on the second day were gather togeth the chief of the
father of all the peopl the priest and the levit unto ezra the
scribe even to understand the word of the law

8:14 and they found written in the law which the lord had command by
mose that the children of israel should dwell in booth in the feast
of the seventh month: 8:15 and that they should publish and proclaim
in all their citi and in jerusalem say go forth unto the
mount and fetch oliv branch and pine branch and myrtl
branch and palm branch and branch of thick tree to make
booth as it is written

8:16 so the peopl went forth and brought them and made themselv
booth everi one upon the roof of hi hous and in their court and
in the court of the hous of god and in the street of the water
gate and in the street of the gate of ephraim

8:17 and all the congreg of them that were come again out of the
captiv made booth and sat under the booths: for sinc the day of
jeshua the son of nun unto that day had not the children of israel
done so and there wa veri great glad

8:18 also day by day from the first day unto the last day he read in
the book of the law of god and they kept the feast seven days; and on
the eighth day wa a solemn assembl accord unto the manner

9:1 now in the twenti and fourth day of thi month the children of
israel were assembl with fast and with sackcloth and earth
upon them

9:2 and the seed of israel separ themselv from all stranger
and stood and confess their sin and the iniqu of their
father

9:3 and they stood up in their place and read in the book of the law
of the lord their god one fourth part of the day; and anoth fourth
part they confess and worship the lord their god

9:4 then stood up upon the stair of the levit jeshua and bani
kadmiel shebaniah bunni sherebiah bani and chenani and cri
with a loud voic unto the lord their god

9:5 then the levit jeshua and kadmiel bani hashabniah
sherebiah hodijah shebaniah and pethahiah said stand up and bless
the lord your god for ever and ever: and bless be thi gloriou name
which is exalt abov all bless and prais

9:6 thou even thou art lord alone; thou hast made heaven the heaven
of heaven with all their host the earth and all thing that are
therein the sea and all that is therein and thou preservest them
all; and the host of heaven worshippeth thee

9:7 thou art the lord the god who didst choos abram and broughtest
him forth out of ur of the chalde and gavest him the name of
abraham; 9:8 and foundest hi heart faith befor thee and madest a
coven with him to give the land of the canaanit the hittit
the amorit and the perizzit and the jebusit and the
girgashit to give it i say to hi seed and hast perform thi
words; for thou art righteous: 9:9 and didst see the afflict of our
father in egypt and heardest their cri by the red sea; 9:10 and
shewedst sign and wonder upon pharaoh and on all hi servant and
on all the peopl of hi land: for thou knewest that they dealt
proudli against them so didst thou get thee a name as it is thi
day

9:11 and thou didst divid the sea befor them so that they went
through the midst of the sea on the dri land; and their persecutor
thou threwest into the deep as a stone into the mighti water

9:12 moreov thou leddest them in the day by a cloudi pillar; and in
the night by a pillar of fire to give them light in the way wherein
they should go

9:13 thou camest down also upon mount sinai and spakest with them
from heaven and gavest them right judgment and true law good
statut and commandments: 9:14 and madest known unto them thi holi
sabbath and commandedst them precept statut and law by the
hand of mose thi servant: 9:15 and gavest them bread from heaven for
their hunger and broughtest forth water for them out of the rock for
their thirst and promisedst them that they should go in to possess
the land which thou hadst sworn to give them

9:16 but they and our father dealt proudli and harden their neck
and hearken not to thi command 9:17 and refus to obey
neither were mind of thi wonder that thou didst among them; but
harden their neck and in their rebellion appoint a captain to
return to their bondage: but thou art a god readi to pardon graciou
and merci slow to anger and of great kind and forsookest
them not

9:18 yea when they had made them a molten calf and said thi is thi
god that brought thee up out of egypt and had wrought great
provocations; 9:19 yet thou in thi manifold merci forsookest them
not in the wilderness: the pillar of the cloud depart not from them
by day to lead them in the way; neither the pillar of fire by night
to shew them light and the way wherein they should go

9:20 thou gavest also thi good spirit to instruct them and
withheldest not thi manna from their mouth and gavest them water for
their thirst

9:21 yea forti year didst thou sustain them in the wilder so
that they lack nothing; their cloth wax not old and their feet
swell not

9:22 moreov thou gavest them kingdom and nation and didst divid
them into corners: so they possess the land of sihon and the land
of the king of heshbon and the land of og king of bashan

9:23 their children also multipliedst thou as the star of heaven and
broughtest them into the land concern which thou hadst promis to
their father that they should go in to possess it

9:24 so the children went in and possess the land and thou
subduedst befor them the inhabit of the land the canaanit and
gavest them into their hand with their king and the peopl of the
land that they might do with them as they would

9:25 and they took strong citi and a fat land and possess hous
full of all good well dig vineyard and oliveyard and fruit
tree in abundance: so they did eat and were fill and becam fat
and delight themselv in thi great good

9:26 nevertheless they were disobedi and rebel against thee
and cast thi law behind their back and slew thi prophet which
testifi against them to turn them to thee and they wrought great
provoc

9:27 therefor thou deliveredst them into the hand of their enemi
who vex them: and in the time of their troubl when they cri unto
thee thou heardest them from heaven; and accord to thi manifold
merci thou gavest them saviour who save them out of the hand of
their enemi

9:28 but after they had rest they did evil again befor thee:
therefor leftest thou them in the land of their enemi so that they
had the dominion over them: yet when they return and cri unto
thee thou heardest them from heaven; and mani time didst thou
deliv them accord to thi mercies; 9:29 and testifiedst against
them that thou mightest bring them again unto thi law: yet they dealt
proudli and hearken not unto thi command but sin against
thi judgment (which if a man do he shall live in them;) and
withdrew the shoulder and harden their neck and would not hear

9:30 yet mani year didst thou forbear them and testifiedst against
them by thi spirit in thi prophets: yet would they not give ear:
therefor gavest thou them into the hand of the peopl of the land

9:31 nevertheless for thi great merci sake thou didst not utterli
consum them nor forsak them; for thou art a graciou and merci
god

9:32 now therefor our god the great the mighti and the terribl
god who keepest coven and merci let not all the troubl seem
littl befor thee that hath come upon us on our king on our
princ and on our priest and on our prophet and on our father
and on all thi peopl sinc the time of the king of assyria unto
thi day

9:33 howbeit thou art just in all that is brought upon us; for thou
hast done right but we have done wickedly: 9:34 neither have our
king our princ our priest nor our father kept thi law nor
hearken unto thi command and thi testimoni wherewith thou
didst testifi against them

9:35 for they have not serv thee in their kingdom and in thi great
good that thou gavest them and in the larg and fat land which
thou gavest befor them neither turn they from their wick work

9:36 behold we are servant thi day and for the land that thou
gavest unto our father to eat the fruit thereof and the good thereof
behold we are servant in it: 9:37 and it yieldeth much increas unto
the king whom thou hast set over us becaus of our sins: also they
have dominion over our bodi and over our cattl at their pleasur
and we are in great distress

9:38 and becaus of all thi we make a sure coven and write it;
and our princ levit and priest seal unto it

10:1 now those that seal were nehemiah the tirshatha the son of
hachaliah and zidkijah 10:2 seraiah azariah jeremiah 10:3 pashur
amariah malchijah 10:4 hattush shebaniah malluch 10:5 harim
meremoth obadiah 10:6 daniel ginnethon baruch 10:7 meshullam
abijah mijamin 10:8 maaziah bilgai shemaiah: these were the
priest

10:9 and the levites: both jeshua the son of azaniah binnui of the
son of henadad kadmiel; 10:10 and their brethren shebaniah
hodijah kelita pelaiah hanan 10:11 micha rehob hashabiah 10:12
zaccur sherebiah shebaniah 10:13 hodijah bani beninu

10:14 the chief of the people; parosh pahathmoab elam zatthu bani
10:15 bunni azgad bebai 10:16 adonijah bigvai adin 10:17 ater
hizkijah azzur 10:18 hodijah hashum bezai 10:19 hariph anathoth
nebai 10:20 magpiash meshullam hezir 10:21 meshezabeel zadok
jaddua 10:22 pelatiah hanan anaiah 10:23 hoshea hananiah hashub
10:24 hallohesh pileha shobek 10:25 rehum hashabnah maaseiah
10:26 and ahijah hanan anan 10:27 malluch harim baanah

10:28 and the rest of the peopl the priest the levit the
porter the singer the nethinim and all they that had separ
themselv from the peopl of the land unto the law of god their
wive their son and their daughter everi one have knowledg
and have understanding; 10:29 they clave to their brethren their
nobl and enter into a curs and into an oath to walk in god
law which wa given by mose the servant of god and to observ and
do all the command of the lord our lord and hi judgment and
hi statutes; 10:30 and that we would not give our daughter unto the
peopl of the land not take their daughter for our sons: 10:31 and
if the peopl of the land bring ware or ani victual on the sabbath
day to sell that we would not buy it of them on the sabbath or on
the holi day: and that we would leav the seventh year and the
exact of everi debt

10:32 also we made ordin for us to charg ourselv yearli with
the third part of a shekel for the servic of the hous of our god;
10:33 for the shewbread and for the continu meat offer and for
the continu burnt offer of the sabbath of the new moon for
the set feast and for the holi thing and for the sin offer to
make an aton for israel and for all the work of the hous of our
god

10:34 and we cast the lot among the priest the levit and the
peopl for the wood offer to bring it into the hous of our god
after the hous of our father at time appoint year by year to
burn upon the altar of the lord our god as it is written in the law:
10:35 and to bring the firstfruit of our ground and the firstfruit
of all fruit of all tree year by year unto the hous of the lord:
10:36 also the firstborn of our son and of our cattl as it is
written in the law and the firstl of our herd and of our flock
to bring to the hous of our god unto the priest that minist in
the hous of our god: 10:37 and that we should bring the firstfruit
of our dough and our offer and the fruit of all manner of tree
of wine and of oil unto the priest to the chamber of the hous of
our god; and the tith of our ground unto the levit that the same
levit might have the tith in all the citi of our tillag

10:38 and the priest the son of aaron shall be with the levit when
the levit take tithes: and the levit shall bring up the tith of
the tith unto the hous of our god to the chamber into the
treasur hous

10:39 for the children of israel and the children of levi shall bring
the offer of the corn of the new wine and the oil unto the
chamber where are the vessel of the sanctuari and the priest that
minist and the porter and the singers: and we will not forsak
the hous of our god

11:1 and the ruler of the peopl dwelt at jerusalem: the rest of the
peopl also cast lot to bring one of ten to dwell in jerusalem the
holi citi and nine part to dwell in other citi

11:2 and the peopl bless all the men that willingli offer
themselv to dwell at jerusalem

11:3 now these are the chief of the provinc that dwelt in jerusalem:
but in the citi of judah dwelt everi one in hi possess in their
citi to wit israel the priest and the levit and the
nethinim and the children of solomon servant

11:4 and at jerusalem dwelt certain of the children of judah and of
the children of benjamin of the children of judah; athaiah the son of
uzziah the son of zechariah the son of amariah the son of
shephatiah the son of mahalaleel of the children of perez; 11:5 and
maaseiah the son of baruch the son of colhozeh the son of hazaiah
the son of adaiah the son of joiarib the son of zechariah the son
of shiloni

11:6 all the son of perez that dwelt at jerusalem were four hundr
threescor and eight valiant men

11:7 and these are the son of benjamin; sallu the son of meshullam
the son of jo the son of pedaiah the son of kolaiah the son of
maaseiah the son of ithiel the son of jesaiah

11:8 and after him gabbai sallai nine hundr twenti and eight

11:9 and joel the son of zichri wa their overseer: and judah the son
of senuah wa second over the citi

11:10 of the priests: jedaiah the son of joiarib jachin

11:11 seraiah the son of hilkiah the son of meshullam the son of
zadok the son of meraioth the son of ahitub wa the ruler of the
hous of god

11:12 and their brethren that did the work of the hous were eight
hundr twenti and two: and adaiah the son of jeroham the son of
pelaliah the son of amzi the son of zechariah the son of pashur
the son of malchiah

11:13 and hi brethren chief of the father two hundr forti and
two: and amashai the son of azareel the son of ahasai the son of
meshillemoth the son of immer 11:14 and their brethren mighti men
of valour an hundr twenti and eight: and their overs wa
zabdiel the son of one of the great men

11:15 also of the levites: shemaiah the son of hashub the son of
azrikam the son of hashabiah the son of bunni; 11:16 and shabbethai
and jozabad of the chief of the levit had the oversight of the
outward busi of the hous of god

11:17 and mattaniah the son of micha the son of zabdi the son of
asaph wa the princip to begin the thanksgiv in prayer: and
bakbukiah the second among hi brethren and abda the son of shammua
the son of galal the son of jeduthun

11:18 all the levit in the holi citi were two hundr fourscor and
four

11:19 moreov the porter akkub talmon and their brethren that
kept the gate were an hundr seventi and two

11:20 and the residu of israel of the priest and the levit were
in all the citi of judah everi one in hi inherit

11:21 but the nethinim dwelt in ophel: and ziha and gispa were over
the nethinim

11:22 the overs also of the levit at jerusalem wa uzzi the son
of bani the son of hashabiah the son of mattaniah the son of micha
of the son of asaph the singer were over the busi of the hous
of god

11:23 for it wa the king command concern them that a
certain portion should be for the singer due for everi day

11:24 and pethahiah the son of meshezabeel of the children of zerah
the son of judah wa at the king hand in all matter concern the
peopl

11:25 and for the villag with their field some of the children of
judah dwelt at kirjatharba and in the villag thereof and at dibon
and in the villag thereof and at jekabzeel and in the villag
thereof 11:26 and at jeshua and at moladah and at bethphelet 11:27
and at hazarshu and at beersheba and in the villag thereof
11:28 and at ziklag and at mekonah and in the villag thereof
11:29 and at enrimmon and at zareah and at jarmuth 11:30 zanoah
adullam and in their villag at lachish and the field thereof at
azekah and in the villag thereof and they dwelt from beersheba
unto the valley of hinnom

11:31 the children also of benjamin from geba dwelt at michmash and
aija and bethel and in their villag

11:32 and at anathoth nob ananiah 11:33 hazor ramah gittaim
11:34 hadid zeboim neballat 11:35 lod and ono the valley of
craftsmen

11:36 and of the levit were divis in judah and in benjamin

12:1 now these are the priest and the levit that went up with
zerubbabel the son of shealtiel and jeshua: seraiah jeremiah ezra
12:2 amariah malluch hattush 12:3 shechaniah rehum meremoth 12:4
iddo ginnetho abijah 12:5 miamin maadiah bilgah 12:6 shemaiah
and joiarib jedaiah 12:7 sallu amok hilkiah jedaiah these were
the chief of the priest and of their brethren in the day of jeshua

12:8 moreov the levites: jeshua binnui kadmiel sherebiah judah
and mattaniah which wa over the thanksgiv he and hi brethren

12:9 also bakbukiah and unni their brethren were over against them
in the watch

12:10 and jeshua begat joiakim joiakim also begat eliashib and
eliashib begat joiada 12:11 and joiada begat jonathan and jonathan
begat jaddua

12:12 and in the day of joiakim were priest the chief of the
fathers: of seraiah meraiah; of jeremiah hananiah; 12:13 of ezra
meshullam; of amariah jehohanan; 12:14 of melicu jonathan; of
shebaniah joseph; 12:15 of harim adna; of meraioth helkai; 12:16 of
iddo zechariah; of ginnethon meshullam; 12:17 of abijah zichri; of
miniamin of moadiah piltai: 12:18 of bilgah shammua; of shemaiah
jehonathan; 12:19 and of joiarib mattenai; of jedaiah uzzi; 12:20 of
sallai kallai; of amok eber; 12:21 of hilkiah hashabiah; of
jedaiah nethaneel

12:22 the levit in the day of eliashib joiada and johanan and
jaddua were record chief of the fathers: also the priest to the
reign of dariu the persian

12:23 the son of levi the chief of the father were written in the
book of the chronicl even until the day of johanan the son of
eliashib

12:24 and the chief of the levites: hashabiah sherebiah and jeshua
the son of kadmiel with their brethren over against them to prais
and to give thank accord to the command of david the man of
god ward over against ward

12:25 mattaniah and bakbukiah obadiah meshullam talmon akkub
were porter keep the ward at the threshold of the gate

12:26 these were in the day of joiakim the son of jeshua the son of
jozadak and in the day of nehemiah the governor and of ezra the
priest the scribe

12:27 and at the dedic of the wall of jerusalem they sought the
levit out of all their place to bring them to jerusalem to keep
the dedic with glad both with thanksgiv and with
sing with cymbal psalteri and with harp

12:28 and the son of the singer gather themselv togeth both
out of the plain countri round about jerusalem and from the villag
of netophathi; 12:29 also from the hous of gilgal and out of the
field of geba and azmaveth: for the singer had build them villag
round about jerusalem

12:30 and the priest and the levit purifi themselv and
purifi the peopl and the gate and the wall

12:31 then i brought up the princ of judah upon the wall and
appoint two great compani of them that gave thank whereof one
went on the right hand upon the wall toward the dung gate: 12:32 and
after them went hoshaiah and half of the princ of judah 12:33 and
azariah ezra and meshullam 12:34 judah and benjamin and shemaiah
and jeremiah 12:35 and certain of the priest son with trumpets;
name zechariah the son of jonathan the son of shemaiah the son of
mattaniah the son of michaiah the son of zaccur the son of asaph:
12:36 and hi brethren shemaiah and azarael milalai gilalai maai
nethaneel and judah hanani with the music instrument of david
the man of god and ezra the scribe befor them

12:37 and at the fountain gate which wa over against them they went
up by the stair of the citi of david at the go up of the wall
abov the hous of david even unto the water gate eastward

12:38 and the other compani of them that gave thank went over against
them and i after them and the half of the peopl upon the wall from
beyond the tower of the furnac even unto the broad wall; 12:39 and
from abov the gate of ephraim and abov the old gate and abov the
fish gate and the tower of hananeel and the tower of meah even unto
the sheep gate: and they stood still in the prison gate

12:40 so stood the two compani of them that gave thank in the hous
of god and i and the half of the ruler with me: 12:41 and the
priests; eliakim maaseiah miniamin michaiah elioenai zechariah
and hananiah with trumpets; 12:42 and maaseiah and shemaiah and
eleazar and uzzi and jehohanan and malchijah and elam and ezer
and the singer sang loud with jezrahiah their overs

12:43 also that day they offer great sacrific and rejoiced: for
god had made them rejoic with great joy: the wive also and the
children rejoiced: so that the joy of jerusalem wa heard even afar
off

12:44 and at that time were some appoint over the chamber for the
treasur for the offer for the firstfruit and for the tith
to gather into them out of the field of the citi the portion of
the law for the priest and levites: for judah rejoic for the
priest and for the levit that wait

12:45 and both the singer and the porter kept the ward of their god
and the ward of the purif accord to the command of
david and of solomon hi son

12:46 for in the day of david and asaph of old there were chief of
the singer and song of prais and thanksgiv unto god

12:47 and all israel in the day of zerubbabel and in the day of
nehemiah gave the portion of the singer and the porter everi day
hi portion: and they sanctifi holi thing unto the levites; and the
levit sanctifi them unto the children of aaron

13:1 on that day they read in the book of mose in the audienc of the
people; and therein wa found written that the ammonit and the
moabit should not come into the congreg of god for ever; 13:2
becaus they met not the children of israel with bread and with water
but hire balaam against them that he should curs them: howbeit our
god turn the curs into a bless

13:3 now it came to pass when they had heard the law that they
separ from israel all the mix multitud

13:4 and befor thi eliashib the priest have the oversight of the
chamber of the hous of our god wa alli unto tobiah: 13:5 and he
had prepar for him a great chamber where aforetim they laid the
meat offer the frankincens and the vessel and the tith of
the corn the new wine and the oil which wa command to be given
to the levit and the singer and the porters; and the offer of
the priest

13:6 but in all thi time wa not i at jerusalem: for in the two and
thirtieth year of artaxerx king of babylon came i unto the king and
after certain day obtain i leav of the king: 13:7 and i came to
jerusalem and understood of the evil that eliashib did for tobiah in
prepar him a chamber in the court of the hous of god

13:8 and it griev me sore: therefor i cast forth all the household
stuff to tobiah out of the chamber

13:9 then i command and they cleans the chambers: and thither
brought i again the vessel of the hous of god with the meat
offer and the frankincens

13:10 and i perceiv that the portion of the levit had not been
given them: for the levit and the singer that did the work were
fled everi one to hi field

13:11 then contend i with the ruler and said whi is the hous of
god forsaken? and i gather them togeth and set them in their
place

13:12 then brought all judah the tith of the corn and the new wine
and the oil unto the treasuri

13:13 and i made treasur over the treasuri shelemiah the priest
and zadok the scribe and of the levit pedaiah: and next to them
wa hanan the son of zaccur the son of mattaniah: for they were
count faith and their offic wa to distribut unto their
brethren

13:14 rememb me o my god concern thi and wipe not out my good
deed that i have done for the hous of my god and for the offic
thereof

13:15 in those day saw i in judah some tread wine press on the
sabbath and bring in sheav and lade asses; as also wine
grape and fig and all manner of burden which they brought into
jerusalem on the sabbath day: and i testifi against them in the day
wherein they sold victual

13:16 there dwelt men of tyre also therein which brought fish and
all manner of ware and sold on the sabbath unto the children of
judah and in jerusalem

13:17 then i contend with the nobl of judah and said unto them
what evil thing is thi that ye do and profan the sabbath day?
13:18 did not your father thu and did not our god bring all thi
evil upon us and upon thi city? yet ye bring more wrath upon israel
by profan the sabbath

13:19 and it came to pass that when the gate of jerusalem began to
be dark befor the sabbath i command that the gate should be shut
and charg that they should not be open till after the sabbath: and
some of my servant set i at the gate that there should no burden be
brought in on the sabbath day

13:20 so the merchant and seller of all kind of ware lodg without
jerusalem onc or twice

13:21 then i testifi against them and said unto them whi lodg ye
about the wall? if ye do so again i will lay hand on you from that
time forth came they no more on the sabbath

13:22 and i command the levit that they should cleans themselv
and that they should come and keep the gate to sanctifi the sabbath
day

rememb me o my god concern thi also and spare me accord to
the great of thi merci

13:23 in those day also saw i jew that had marri wive of ashdod
of ammon and of moab: 13:24 and their children spake half in the
speech of ashdod and could not speak in the jew languag but
accord to the languag of each peopl

13:25 and i contend with them and curs them and smote certain of
them and pluck off their hair and made them swear by god say
ye shall not give your daughter unto their son nor take their
daughter unto your son or for yourselv

13:26 did not solomon king of israel sin by these things? yet among
mani nation wa there no king like him who wa belov of hi god
and god made him king over all israel: nevertheless even him did
outlandish women caus to sin

13:27 shall we then hearken unto you to do all thi great evil to
transgress against our god in marri strang wives? 13:28 and one
of the son of joiada the son of eliashib the high priest wa son in
law to sanballat the horonite: therefor i chase him from me

13:29 rememb them o my god becaus they have defil the
priesthood and the coven of the priesthood and of the levit

13:30 thu cleans i them from all stranger and appoint the ward
of the priest and the levit everi one in hi business; 13:31 and
for the wood offer at time appoint and for the firstfruit
rememb me o my god for good




the book of esther


1:1 now it came to pass in the day of ahasueru (thi is ahasueru
which reign from india even unto ethiopia over an hundr and
seven and twenti provinces:) 1:2 that in those day when the king
ahasueru sat on the throne of hi kingdom which wa in shushan the
palac 1:3 in the third year of hi reign he made a feast unto all
hi princ and hi servants; the power of persia and media the
nobl and princ of the provinc be befor him: 1:4 when he
shew the rich of hi gloriou kingdom and the honour of hi
excel majesti mani day even an hundr and fourscor day

1:5 and when these day were expir the king made a feast unto all
the peopl that were present in shushan the palac both unto great
and small seven day in the court of the garden of the king
palace; 1:6 where were white green and blue hang fasten with
cord of fine linen and purpl to silver ring and pillar of marble:
the bed were of gold and silver upon a pavement of red and blue
and white and black marbl

1:7 and they gave them drink in vessel of gold (the vessel be
divers one from another) and royal wine in abund accord to
the state of the king

1:8 and the drink wa accord to the law; none did compel: for so
the king had appoint to all the offic of hi hous that they
should do accord to everi man pleasur

1:9 also vashti the queen made a feast for the women in the royal
hous which belong to king ahasueru

1:10 on the seventh day when the heart of the king wa merri with
wine he command mehuman biztha harbona bigtha and abagtha
zethar and carca the seven chamberlain that serv in the presenc
of ahasueru the king 1:11 to bring vashti the queen befor the king
with the crown royal to shew the peopl and the princ her beauty:
for she wa fair to look on

1:12 but the queen vashti refus to come at the king command by
hi chamberlains: therefor wa the king veri wroth and hi anger
burn in him

1:13 then the king said to the wise men which knew the time (for so
wa the king manner toward all that knew law and judgment: 1:14 and
the next unto him wa carshena shethar admatha tarshish mere
marsena and memucan the seven princ of persia and media which saw
the king face and which sat the first in the kingdom;) 1:15 what
shall we do unto the queen vashti accord to law becaus she hath
not perform the command of the king ahasueru by the
chamberlains? 1:16 and memucan answer befor the king and the
princ vashti the queen hath not done wrong to the king onli but
also to all the princ and to all the peopl that are in all the
provinc of the king ahasueru

1:17 for thi deed of the queen shall come abroad unto all women so
that they shall despis their husband in their eye when it shall be
report the king ahasueru command vashti the queen to be brought
in befor him but she came not

1:18 likewis shall the ladi of persia and media say thi day unto
all the king princ which have heard of the deed of the queen
thu shall there aris too much contempt and wrath

1:19 if it pleas the king let there go a royal command from him
and let it be written among the law of the persian and the mede
that it be not alter that vashti come no more befor king
ahasuerus; and let the king give her royal estat unto anoth that is
better than she

1:20 and when the king decre which he shall make shall be publish
throughout all hi empir (for it is great) all the wive shall give
to their husband honour both to great and small

1:21 and the say pleas the king and the princes; and the king did
accord to the word of memucan: 1:22 for he sent letter into all
the king provinc into everi provinc accord to the write
thereof and to everi peopl after their languag that everi man
should bear rule in hi own hous and that it should be publish
accord to the languag of everi peopl

2:1 after these thing when the wrath of king ahasueru wa appeas
he rememb vashti and what she had done and what wa decre
against her

2:2 then said the king servant that minist unto him let there
be fair young virgin sought for the king: 2:3 and let the king
appoint offic in all the provinc of hi kingdom that they may
gather togeth all the fair young virgin unto shushan the palac to
the hous of the women unto the custodi of hege the king
chamberlain keeper of the women; and let their thing for
purif be given them: 2:4 and let the maiden which pleaseth the
king be queen instead of vashti

and the thing pleas the king; and he did so

2:5 now in shushan the palac there wa a certain jew whose name wa
mordecai the son of jair the son of shimei the son of kish a
benjamite; 2:6 who had been carri away from jerusalem with the
captiv which had been carri away with jeconiah king of judah
whom nebuchadnezzar the king of babylon had carri away

2:7 and he brought up hadassah that is esther hi uncl daughter:
for she had neither father nor mother and the maid wa fair and
beautiful; whom mordecai when her father and mother were dead took
for hi own daughter

2:8 so it came to pass when the king command and hi decre wa
heard and when mani maiden were gather togeth unto shushan the
palac to the custodi of hegai that esther wa brought also unto the
king hous to the custodi of hegai keeper of the women

2:9 and the maiden pleas him and she obtain kind of him; and
he speedili gave her her thing for purif with such thing as
belong to her and seven maiden which were meet to be given her
out of the king house: and he prefer her and her maid unto the
best place of the hous of the women

2:10 esther had not shew her peopl nor her kindred: for mordecai
had charg her that she should not shew it

2:11 and mordecai walk everi day befor the court of the women
hous to know how esther did and what should becom of her

2:12 now when everi maid turn wa come to go in to king ahasueru
after that she had been twelv month accord to the manner of the
women (for so were the day of their purif accomplish to
wit six month with oil of myrrh and six month with sweet odour
and with other thing for the purifi of the women;) 2:13 then thu
came everi maiden unto the king; whatsoev she desir wa given her
to go with her out of the hous of the women unto the king hous

2:14 in the even she went and on the morrow she return into the
second hous of the women to the custodi of shaashgaz the king
chamberlain which kept the concubines: she came in unto the king no
more except the king delight in her and that she were call by
name

2:15 now when the turn of esther the daughter of abihail the uncl of
mordecai who had taken her for hi daughter wa come to go in unto
the king she requir noth but what hegai the king chamberlain
the keeper of the women appoint and esther obtain favour in the
sight of all them that look upon her

2:16 so esther wa taken unto king ahasueru into hi hous royal in
the tenth month which is the month tebeth in the seventh year of hi
reign

2:17 and the king love esther abov all the women and she obtain
grace and favour in hi sight more than all the virgins; so that he
set the royal crown upon her head and made her queen instead of
vashti

2:18 then the king made a great feast unto all hi princ and hi
servant even esther feast; and he made a releas to the provinc
and gave gift accord to the state of the king

2:19 and when the virgin were gather togeth the second time then
mordecai sat in the king gate

2:20 esther had not yet shew her kindr nor her people; as mordecai
had charg her: for esther did the command of mordecai like as
when she wa brought up with him

2:21 in those day while mordecai sat in the king gate two of the
king chamberlain bigthan and teresh of those which kept the door
were wroth and sought to lay hand on the king ahasueru

2:22 and the thing wa known to mordecai who told it unto esther the
queen; and esther certifi the king thereof in mordecai name

2:23 and when inquisit wa made of the matter it wa found out;
therefor they were both hang on a tree: and it wa written in the
book of the chronicl befor the king

3:1 after these thing did king ahasueru promot haman the son of
hammedatha the agagit and advanc him and set hi seat abov all
the princ that were with him

3:2 and all the king servant that were in the king gate bow
and reverenc haman: for the king had so command concern him
but mordecai bow not nor did him rever

3:3 then the king servant which were in the king gate said unto
mordecai whi transgressest thou the king commandment? 3:4 now it
came to pass when they spake daili unto him and he hearken not
unto them that they told haman to see whether mordecai matter
would stand: for he had told them that he wa a jew

3:5 and when haman saw that mordecai bow not nor did him rever
then wa haman full of wrath

3:6 and he thought scorn to lay hand on mordecai alone; for they had
shew him the peopl of mordecai: wherefor haman sought to destroy
all the jew that were throughout the whole kingdom of ahasueru even
the peopl of mordecai

3:7 in the first month that is the month nisan in the twelfth year
of king ahasueru they cast pur that is the lot befor haman from
day to day and from month to month to the twelfth month that is
the month adar

3:8 and haman said unto king ahasueru there is a certain peopl
scatter abroad and dispers among the peopl in all the provinc
of thi kingdom; and their law are divers from all people; neither
keep they the king laws: therefor it is not for the king profit
to suffer them

3:9 if it pleas the king let it be written that they may be
destroyed: and i will pay ten thousand talent of silver to the hand
of those that have the charg of the busi to bring it into the
king treasuri

3:10 and the king took hi ring from hi hand and gave it unto haman
the son of hammedatha the agagit the jew enemi

3:11 and the king said unto haman the silver is given to thee the
peopl also to do with them as it seemeth good to thee

3:12 then were the king scribe call on the thirteenth day of the
first month and there wa written accord to all that haman had
command unto the king lieuten and to the governor that were
over everi provinc and to the ruler of everi peopl of everi
provinc accord to the write thereof and to everi peopl after
their language; in the name of king ahasueru wa it written and
seal with the king ring

3:13 and the letter were sent by post into all the king provinc
to destroy to kill and to caus to perish all jew both young and
old littl children and women in one day even upon the thirteenth
day of the twelfth month which is the month adar and to take the
spoil of them for a prey

3:14 the copi of the write for a command to be given in everi
provinc wa publish unto all peopl that they should be readi
against that day

3:15 the post went out be hasten by the king command and
the decre wa given in shushan the palac and the king and haman sat
down to drink; but the citi shushan wa perplex

4:1 when mordecai perceiv all that wa done mordecai rent hi
cloth and put on sackcloth with ash and went out into the midst
of the citi and cri with a loud and a bitter cry; 4:2 and came even
befor the king gate: for none might enter into the king gate
cloth with sackcloth

4:3 and in everi provinc whithersoev the king command and
hi decre came there wa great mourn among the jew and fast
and weep and wailing; and mani lay in sackcloth and ash

4:4 so esther maid and her chamberlain came and told it her then
wa the queen exceedingli grieved; and she sent raiment to cloth
mordecai and to take away hi sackcloth from him: but he receiv it
not

4:5 then call esther for hatach one of the king chamberlain
whom he had appoint to attend upon her and gave him a command
to mordecai to know what it wa and whi it wa

4:6 so hatach went forth to mordecai unto the street of the citi
which wa befor the king gate

4:7 and mordecai told him of all that had happen unto him and of
the sum of the money that haman had promis to pay to the king
treasuri for the jew to destroy them

4:8 also he gave him the copi of the write of the decre that wa
given at shushan to destroy them to shew it unto esther and to
declar it unto her and to charg her that she should go in unto the
king to make supplic unto him and to make request befor him
for her peopl

4:9 and hatach came and told esther the word of mordecai

4:10 again esther spake unto hatach and gave him command unto
mordecai; 4:11 all the king servant and the peopl of the king
provinc do know that whosoev whether man or women shall come
unto the king into the inner court who is not call there is one
law of hi to put him to death except such to whom the king shall
hold out the golden sceptr that he may live: but i have not been
call to come in unto the king these thirti day

4:12 and they told to mordecai esther word

4:13 then mordecai command to answer esther think not with thyself
that thou shalt escap in the king hous more than all the jew

4:14 for if thou altogeth holdest thi peac at thi time then shall
there enlarg and deliver aris to the jew from anoth
place; but thou and thi father hous shall be destroyed: and who
knoweth whether thou art come to the kingdom for such a time as this?
4:15 then esther bade them return mordecai thi answer 4:16 go
gather togeth all the jew that are present in shushan and fast ye
for me and neither eat nor drink three day night or day: i also and
my maiden will fast likewise; and so will i go in unto the king
which is not accord to the law: and if i perish i perish

4:17 so mordecai went hi way and did accord to all that esther
had command him

5:1 now it came to pass on the third day that esther put on her royal
apparel and stood in the inner court of the king hous over
against the king house: and the king sat upon hi royal throne in
the royal hous over against the gate of the hous

5:2 and it wa so when the king saw esther the queen stand in the
court that she obtain favour in hi sight: and the king held out to
esther the golden sceptr that wa in hi hand so esther drew near
and touch the top of the sceptr

5:3 then said the king unto her what wilt thou queen esther? and
what is thi request? it shall be even given thee to the half of the
kingdom

5:4 and esther answer if it seem good unto the king let the king
and haman come thi day unto the banquet that i have prepar for him

5:5 then the king said caus haman to make hast that he may do as
esther hath said so the king and haman came to the banquet that
esther had prepar

5:6 and the king said unto esther at the banquet of wine what is thi
petition? and it shall be grant thee: and what is thi request? even
to the half of the kingdom it shall be perform

5:7 then answer esther and said my petit and my request is; 5:8
if i have found favour in the sight of the king and if it pleas the
king to grant my petit and to perform my request let the king and
haman come to the banquet that i shall prepar for them and i will do
to morrow as the king hath said

5:9 then went haman forth that day joy and with a glad heart: but
when haman saw mordecai in the king gate that he stood not up nor
move for him he wa full of indign against mordecai

5:10 nevertheless haman refrain himself: and when he came home he
sent and call for hi friend and zeresh hi wife

5:11 and haman told them of the glori of hi rich and the multitud
of hi children and all the thing wherein the king had promot him
and how he had advanc him abov the princ and servant of the
king

5:12 haman said moreov yea esther the queen did let no man come in
with the king unto the banquet that she had prepar but myself; and
to morrow am i invit unto her also with the king

5:13 yet all thi availeth me noth so long as i see mordecai the
jew sit at the king gate

5:14 then said zeresh hi wife and all hi friend unto him let a
gallow be made of fifti cubit high and to morrow speak thou unto
the king that mordecai may be hang thereon: then go thou in merrili
with the king unto the banquet and the thing pleas haman; and he
caus the gallow to be made

6:1 on that night could not the king sleep and he command to bring
the book of record of the chronicles; and they were read befor the
king

6:2 and it wa found written that mordecai had told of bigthana and
teresh two of the king chamberlain the keeper of the door who
sought to lay hand on the king ahasueru

6:3 and the king said what honour and digniti hath been done to
mordecai for this? then said the king servant that minist unto
him there is noth done for him

6:4 and the king said who is in the court? now haman wa come into
the outward court of the king hous to speak unto the king to hang
mordecai on the gallow that he had prepar for him

6:5 and the king servant said unto him behold haman standeth in
the court and the king said let him come in

6:6 so haman came in and the king said unto him what shall be done
unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour? now haman thought in
hi heart to whom would the king delight to do honour more than to
myself? 6:7 and haman answer the king for the man whom the king
delighteth to honour 6:8 let the royal apparel be brought which the
king useth to wear and the hors that the king rideth upon and the
crown royal which is set upon hi head: 6:9 and let thi apparel and
hors be deliv to the hand of one of the king most nobl
princ that they may array the man withal whom the king delighteth
to honour and bring him on horseback through the street of the citi
and proclaim befor him thu shall it be done to the man whom the
king delighteth to honour

6:10 then the king said to haman make hast and take the apparel and
the hors as thou hast said and do even so to mordecai the jew that
sitteth at the king gate: let noth fail of all that thou hast
spoken

6:11 then took haman the apparel and the hors and array mordecai
and brought him on horseback through the street of the citi and
proclaim befor him thu shall it be done unto the man whom the
king delighteth to honour

6:12 and mordecai came again to the king gate but haman hast to
hi hous mourn and have hi head cover

6:13 and haman told zeresh hi wife and all hi friend everi thing
that had befallen him then said hi wise men and zeresh hi wife unto
him if mordecai be of the seed of the jew befor whom thou hast
begun to fall thou shalt not prevail against him but shalt sure
fall befor him

6:14 and while they were yet talk with him came the king
chamberlain and hast to bring haman unto the banquet that esther
had prepar

7:1 so the king and haman came to banquet with esther the queen

7:2 and the king said again unto esther on the second day at the
banquet of wine what is thi petit queen esther? and it shall be
grant thee: and what is thi request? and it shall be perform even
to the half of the kingdom

7:3 then esther the queen answer and said if i have found favour in
thi sight o king and if it pleas the king let my life be given me
at my petit and my peopl at my request: 7:4 for we are sold i
and my peopl to be destroy to be slain and to perish but if we
had been sold for bondmen and bondwomen i had held my tongu
although the enemi could not countervail the king damag

7:5 then the king ahasueru answer and said unto esther the queen
who is he and where is he that durst presum in hi heart to do so?
7:6 and esther said the adversari and enemi is thi wick haman
then haman wa afraid befor the king and the queen

7:7 and the king aris from the banquet of wine in hi wrath went
into the palac garden: and haman stood up to make request for hi
life to esther the queen; for he saw that there wa evil determin
against him by the king

7:8 then the king return out of the palac garden into the place of
the banquet of wine; and haman wa fallen upon the bed whereon esther
wa then said the king will he forc the queen also befor me in the
house? as the word went out of king mouth they cover haman
face

7:9 and harbonah one of the chamberlain said befor the king
behold also the gallow fifti cubit high which haman had made for
mordecai who spoken good for the king standeth in the hous of
haman then the king said hang him thereon

7:10 so they hang haman on the gallow that he had prepar for
mordecai then wa the king wrath pacifi

8:1 on that day did the king ahasueru give the hous of haman the
jew enemi unto esther the queen and mordecai came befor the king;
for esther had told what he wa unto her

8:2 and the king took off hi ring which he had taken from haman and
gave it unto mordecai and esther set mordecai over the hous of
haman

8:3 and esther spake yet again befor the king and fell down at hi
feet and besought him with tear to put away the mischief of haman
the agagit and hi devic that he had devis against the jew

8:4 then the king held out the golden sceptr toward esther so esther
aros and stood befor the king 8:5 and said if it pleas the king
and if i have favour in hi sight and the thing seem right befor the
king and i be pleas in hi eye let it be written to revers the
letter devis by haman the son of hammedatha the agagit which he
wrote to destroy the jew which are in all the king provinces: 8:6
for how can i endur to see the evil that shall come unto my people?
or how can i endur to see the destruct of my kindred? 8:7 then
the king ahasueru said unto esther the queen and to mordecai the jew
behold i have given esther the hous of haman and him they have
hang upon the gallow becaus he laid hi hand upon the jew

8:8 write ye also for the jew as it liketh you in the king name
and seal it with the king ring: for the write which is written in
the king name and seal with the king ring may no man revers

8:9 then were the king scribe call at that time in the third
month that is the month sivan on the three and twentieth day
thereof; and it wa written accord to all that mordecai command
unto the jew and to the lieuten and the deputi and ruler of
the provinc which are from india unto ethiopia an hundr twenti
and seven provinc unto everi provinc accord to the write
thereof and unto everi peopl after their languag and to the jew
accord to their write and accord to their languag

8:10 and he wrote in the king ahasueru name and seal it with the
king ring and sent letter by post on horseback and rider on
mule camel and young dromedaries: 8:11 wherein the king grant
the jew which were in everi citi to gather themselv togeth and
to stand for their life to destroy to slay and to caus to perish
all the power of the peopl and provinc that would assault them both
littl one and women and to take the spoil of them for a prey 8:12
upon one day in all the provinc of king ahasueru name upon the
thirteenth day of the twelfth month which is the month adar

8:13 the copi of the write for a command to be given in everi
provinc wa publish unto all peopl and that the jew should be
readi against that day to aveng themselv on their enemi

8:14 so the post that rode upon mule and camel went out be
hasten and press on by the king command and the decre wa
given at shushan the palac

8:15 and mordecai went out from the presenc of the king in royal
apparel of blue and white and with a great crown of gold and with a
garment of fine linen and purple: and the citi of shushan rejoic and
wa glad

8:16 the jew had light and glad and joy and honour

8:17 and in everi provinc and in everi citi whithersoev the
king command and hi decre came the jew had joy and glad
a feast and a good day and mani of the peopl of the land becam
jews; for the fear of the jew fell upon them

9:1 now in the twelfth month that is the month adar on the
thirteenth day of the same when the king command and hi decre
drew near to be put in execut in the day that the enemi of the
jew hope to have power over them (though it wa turn to the
contrari that the jew had rule over them that hate them;) 9:2 the
jew gather themselv togeth in their citi throughout all the
provinc of the king ahasueru to lay hand on such as sought their
hurt: and no man could withstand them; for the fear of them fell upon
all peopl

9:3 and all the ruler of the provinc and the lieuten and the
deputi and offic of the king help the jews; becaus the fear
of mordecai fell upon them

9:4 for mordecai wa great in the king hous and hi fame went out
throughout all the provinces: for thi man mordecai wax greater and
greater

9:5 thu the jew smote all their enemi with the stroke of the
sword and slaughter and destruct and did what they would unto
those that hate them

9:6 and in shushan the palac the jew slew and destroy five hundr
men

9:7 and parshandatha and dalphon and aspatha 9:8 and poratha and
adalia and aridatha 9:9 and parmashta and arisai and aridai and
vajezatha 9:10 the ten son of haman the son of hammedatha the enemi
of the jew slew they; but on the spoil laid they not their hand

9:11 on that day the number of those that were slain in shushan the
palac wa brought befor the king

9:12 and the king said unto esther the queen the jew have slain and
destroy five hundr men in shushan the palac and the ten son of
haman; what have they done in the rest of the king provinces? now
what is thi petition? and it shall be grant thee: or what is thi
request further? and it shall be done

9:13 then said esther if it pleas the king let it be grant to the
jew which are in shushan to do to morrow also accord unto thi
day decre and let haman ten son be hang upon the gallow

9:14 and the king command it so to be done: and the decre wa given
at shushan; and they hang haman ten son

9:15 for the jew that were in shushan gather themselv togeth on
the fourteenth day also of the month adar and slew three hundr men
at shushan; but on the prey they laid not their hand

9:16 but the other jew that were in the king provinc gather
themselv togeth and stood for their live and had rest from
their enemi and slew of their foe seventi and five thousand but
they laid not their hand on the prey 9:17 on the thirteenth day of
the month adar; and on the fourteenth day of the same rest they and
made it a day of feast and glad
