9:18 but the jew that were at shushan assembl togeth on the
thirteenth day thereof and on the fourteenth thereof; and on the
fifteenth day of the same they rest and made it a day of feast
and glad

9:19 therefor the jew of the villag that dwelt in the unwal
town made the fourteenth day of the month adar a day of glad and
feast and a good day and of send portion one to anoth

9:20 and mordecai wrote these thing and sent letter unto all the
jew that were in all the provinc of the king ahasueru both nigh
and far 9:21 to stablish thi among them that they should keep the
fourteenth day of the month adar and the fifteenth day of the same
yearli 9:22 as the day wherein the jew rest from their enemi
and the month which wa turn unto them from sorrow to joy and from
mourn into a good day: that they should make them day of feast
and joy and of send portion one to anoth and gift to the
poor

9:23 and the jew undertook to do as they had begun and as mordecai
had written unto them; 9:24 becaus haman the son of hammedatha the
agagit the enemi of all the jew had devis against the jew to
destroy them and had cast pur that is the lot to consum them and
to destroy them; 9:25 but when esther came befor the king he
command by letter that hi wick devic which he devis against
the jew should return upon hi own head and that he and hi son
should be hang on the gallow

9:26 wherefor they call these day purim after the name of pur

therefor for all the word of thi letter and of that which they had
seen concern thi matter and which had come unto them 9:27 the
jew ordain and took upon them and upon their seed and upon all
such as join themselv unto them so as it should not fail that
they would keep these two day accord to their write and
accord to their appoint time everi year; 9:28 and that these day
should be rememb and kept throughout everi gener everi
famili everi provinc and everi city; and that these day of purim
should not fail from among the jew nor the memori of them perish
from their seed

9:29 then esther the queen the daughter of abihail and mordecai the
jew wrote with all author to confirm thi second letter of purim

9:30 and he sent the letter unto all the jew to the hundr twenti
and seven provinc of the kingdom of ahasueru with word of peac
and truth 9:31 to confirm these day of purim in their time
appoint accord as mordecai the jew and esther the queen had
enjoin them and as they had decre for themselv and for their
seed the matter of the fast and their cri

9:32 and the decre of esther confirm these matter of purim; and it
wa written in the book

10:1 and the king ahasueru laid a tribut upon the land and upon the
isl of the sea

10:2 and all the act of hi power and of hi might and the
declar of the great of mordecai whereunto the king advanc
him are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king
of media and persia? 10:3 for mordecai the jew wa next unto king
ahasueru and great among the jew and accept of the multitud of
hi brethren seek the wealth of hi peopl and speak peac to
all hi seed




the book of job


1:1 there wa a man in the land of uz whose name wa job; and that
man wa perfect and upright and one that fear god and eschew evil

1:2 and there were born unto him seven son and three daughter

1:3 hi substanc also wa seven thousand sheep and three thousand
camel and five hundr yoke of oxen and five hundr she ass and
a veri great household; so that thi man wa the greatest of all the
men of the east

1:4 and hi son went and feast in their hous everi one hi day;
and sent and call for their three sister to eat and to drink with
them

1:5 and it wa so when the day of their feast were gone about
that job sent and sanctifi them and rose up earli in the morn
and offer burnt offer accord to the number of them all: for
job said it may be that my son have sin and curs god in their
heart thu did job continu

1:6 now there wa a day when the son of god came to present
themselv befor the lord and satan came also among them

1:7 and the lord said unto satan whenc comest thou? then satan
answer the lord and said from go to and fro in the earth and
from walk up and down in it

1:8 and the lord said unto satan hast thou consid my servant job
that there is none like him in the earth a perfect and an upright
man one that feareth god and escheweth evil? 1:9 then satan
answer the lord and said doth job fear god for nought? 1:10 hast
not thou made an hedg about him and about hi hous and about all
that he hath on everi side? thou hast bless the work of hi hand
and hi substanc is increas in the land

1:11 but put forth thine hand now and touch all that he hath and he
will curs thee to thi face

1:12 and the lord said unto satan behold all that he hath is in thi
power; onli upon himself put not forth thine hand so satan went forth
from the presenc of the lord

1:13 and there wa a day when hi son and hi daughter were eat
and drink wine in their eldest brother house: 1:14 and there came
a messeng unto job and said the oxen were plow and the ass
feed besid them: 1:15 and the sabean fell upon them and took
them away; yea they have slain the servant with the edg of the
sword; and i onli am escap alon to tell thee

1:16 while he wa yet speak there came also anoth and said the
fire of god is fallen from heaven and hath burn up the sheep and
the servant and consum them; and i onli am escap alon to tell
thee

1:17 while he wa yet speak there came also anoth and said the
chaldean made out three band and fell upon the camel and have
carri them away yea and slain the servant with the edg of the
sword; and i onli am escap alon to tell thee

1:18 while he wa yet speak there came also anoth and said thi
son and thi daughter were eat and drink wine in their eldest
brother house: 1:19 and behold there came a great wind from the
wilder and smote the four corner of the hous and it fell upon
the young men and they are dead; and i onli am escap alon to tell
thee

1:20 then job aros and rent hi mantl and shave hi head and
fell down upon the ground and worship 1:21 and said nake came i
out of my mother womb and nake shall i return thither: the lord
gave and the lord hath taken away; bless be the name of the lord

1:22 in all thi job sin not nor charg god foolishli

2:1 again there wa a day when the son of god came to present
themselv befor the lord and satan came also among them to present
himself befor the lord

2:2 and the lord said unto satan from whenc comest thou? and satan
answer the lord and said from go to and fro in the earth and
from walk up and down in it

2:3 and the lord said unto satan hast thou consid my servant job
that there is none like him in the earth a perfect and an upright
man one that feareth god and escheweth evil? and still he holdeth
fast hi integr although thou movedst me against him to destroy
him without caus

2:4 and satan answer the lord and said skin for skin yea all
that a man hath will he give for hi life

2:5 but put forth thine hand now and touch hi bone and hi flesh
and he will curs thee to thi face

2:6 and the lord said unto satan behold he is in thine hand; but
save hi life

2:7 so went satan forth from the presenc of the lord and smote job
with sore boil from the sole of hi foot unto hi crown

2:8 and he took him a potsherd to scrape himself withal; and he sat
down among the ash

2:9 then said hi wife unto him dost thou still retain thine
integrity? curs god and die

2:10 but he said unto her thou speakest as one of the foolish women
speaketh what? shall we receiv good at the hand of god and shall we
not receiv evil? in all thi did not job sin with hi lip

2:11 now when job three friend heard of all thi evil that wa come
upon him they came everi one from hi own place; eliphaz the
temanit and bildad the shuhit and zophar the naamathite: for they
had made an appoint togeth to come to mourn with him and to
comfort him

2:12 and when they lift up their eye afar off and knew him not
they lift up their voic and wept; and they rent everi one hi
mantl and sprinkl dust upon their head toward heaven

2:13 so they sat down with him upon the ground seven day and seven
night and none spake a word unto him: for they saw that hi grief
wa veri great

3:1 after thi open job hi mouth and curs hi day

3:2 and job spake and said 3:3 let the day perish wherein i wa
born and the night in which it wa said there is a man child
conceiv

3:4 let that day be darkness; let not god regard it from abov
neither let the light shine upon it

3:5 let dark and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell
upon it; let the black of the day terrifi it

3:6 as for that night let dark seiz upon it; let it not be
join unto the day of the year let it not come into the number of
the month

3:7 lo let that night be solitari let no joy voic come therein

3:8 let them curs it that curs the day who are readi to rais up
their mourn

3:9 let the star of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for
light but have none; neither let it see the dawn of the day: 3:10
becaus it shut not up the door of my mother womb nor hid sorrow
from mine eye

3:11 whi die i not from the womb? whi did i not give up the ghost
when i came out of the belly? 3:12 whi did the knee prevent me? or
whi the breast that i should suck? 3:13 for now should i have lain
still and been quiet i should have slept: then had i been at rest
3:14 with king and counsellor of the earth which build desol
place for themselves; 3:15 or with princ that had gold who fill
their hous with silver: 3:16 or as an hidden untim birth i had
not been; as infant which never saw light

3:17 there the wick ceas from troubling; and there the weari be at
rest

3:18 there the prison rest together; they hear not the voic of the
oppressor

3:19 the small and great are there; and the servant is free from hi
master

3:20 wherefor is light given to him that is in miseri and life unto
the bitter in soul; 3:21 which long for death but it cometh not; and
dig for it more than for hid treasures; 3:22 which rejoic
exceedingli and are glad when they can find the grave? 3:23 whi is
light given to a man whose way is hid and whom god hath hedg in?
3:24 for my sigh cometh befor i eat and my roar are pour
out like the water

3:25 for the thing which i greatli fear is come upon me and that
which i wa afraid of is come unto me

3:26 i wa not in safeti neither had i rest neither wa i quiet; yet
troubl came

4:1 then eliphaz the temanit answer and said 4:2 if we assay to
commun with thee wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself
from speaking? 4:3 behold thou hast instruct mani and thou hast
strengthen the weak hand

4:4 thi word have upholden him that wa fall and thou hast
strengthen the feebl knee

4:5 but now it is come upon thee and thou faintest; it toucheth thee
and thou art troubl

4:6 is not thi thi fear thi confid thi hope and the
upright of thi ways? 4:7 rememb i pray thee who ever
perish be innocent? or where were the righteou cut off? 4:8
even as i have seen they that plow iniqu and sow wicked reap
the same

4:9 by the blast of god they perish and by the breath of hi nostril
are they consum

4:10 the roar of the lion and the voic of the fierc lion and
the teeth of the young lion are broken

4:11 the old lion perisheth for lack of prey and the stout lion
whelp are scatter abroad

4:12 now a thing wa secretli brought to me and mine ear receiv a
littl thereof

4:13 in thought from the vision of the night when deep sleep
falleth on men 4:14 fear came upon me and trembl which made all
my bone to shake

4:15 then a spirit pass befor my face; the hair of my flesh stood
up: 4:16 it stood still but i could not discern the form thereof: an
imag wa befor mine eye there wa silenc and i heard a voic
say 4:17 shall mortal man be more just than god? shall a man be
more pure than hi maker? 4:18 behold he put no trust in hi
servants; and hi angel he charg with folly: 4:19 how much less in
them that dwell in hous of clay whose foundat is in the dust
which are crush befor the moth? 4:20 they are destroy from
morn to evening: they perish for ever without ani regard it

4:21 doth not their excel which is in them go away? they die
even without wisdom

5:1 call now if there be ani that will answer thee; and to which of
the saint wilt thou turn? 5:2 for wrath killeth the foolish man and
envi slayeth the silli one

5:3 i have seen the foolish take root: but suddenli i curs hi
habit

5:4 hi children are far from safeti and they are crush in the
gate neither is there ani to deliv them

5:5 whose harvest the hungri eateth up and taketh it even out of the
thorn and the robber swalloweth up their substanc

5:6 although afflict cometh not forth of the dust neither doth
troubl spring out of the ground; 5:7 yet man is born unto troubl as
the spark fli upward

5:8 i would seek unto god and unto god would i commit my cause: 5:9
which doeth great thing and unsearchable; marvel thing without
number: 5:10 who giveth rain upon the earth and sendeth water upon
the fields: 5:11 to set up on high those that be low; that those which
mourn may be exalt to safeti

5:12 he disappointeth the devic of the crafti so that their hand
cannot perform their enterpris

5:13 he taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of
the froward is carri headlong

5:14 they meet with dark in the day time and grope in the noonday
as in the night

5:15 but he saveth the poor from the sword from their mouth and from
the hand of the mighti

5:16 so the poor hath hope and iniqu stoppeth her mouth

5:17 behold happi is the man whom god correcteth: therefor despis
not thou the chasten of the almighty: 5:18 for he maketh sore and
bindeth up: he woundeth and hi hand make whole

5:19 he shall deliv thee in six troubles: yea in seven there shall
no evil touch thee

5:20 in famin he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the
power of the sword

5:21 thou shalt be hid from the scourg of the tongue: neither shalt
thou be afraid of destruct when it cometh

5:22 at destruct and famin thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be
afraid of the beast of the earth

5:23 for thou shalt be in leagu with the stone of the field: and the
beast of the field shall be at peac with thee

5:24 and thou shalt know that thi tabernacl shall be in peace; and
thou shalt visit thi habit and shalt not sin

5:25 thou shalt know also that thi seed shall be great and thine
offspr as the grass of the earth

5:26 thou shalt come to thi grave in a full age like as a shock of
corn cometh in in hi season

5:27 lo thi we have search it so it is; hear it and know thou it
for thi good

6:1 but job answer and said 6:2 oh that my grief were throughli
weigh and my calam laid in the balanc together! 6:3 for now
it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefor my word are
swallow up

6:4 for the arrow of the almighti are within me the poison whereof
drinketh up my spirit: the terror of god do set themselv in array
against me

6:5 doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over
hi fodder? 6:6 can that which is unsavouri be eaten without salt? or
is there ani tast in the white of an egg? 6:7 the thing that my
soul refus to touch are as my sorrow meat

6:8 oh that i might have my request; and that god would grant me the
thing that i long for! 6:9 even that it would pleas god to destroy
me; that he would let loos hi hand and cut me off! 6:10 then
should i yet have comfort; yea i would harden myself in sorrow: let
him not spare; for i have not conceal the word of the holi one

6:11 what is my strength that i should hope? and what is mine end
that i should prolong my life? 6:12 is my strength the strength of
stones? or is my flesh of brass? 6:13 is not my help in me? and is
wisdom driven quit from me? 6:14 to him that is afflict piti
should be shew from hi friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the
almighti

6:15 my brethren have dealt deceit as a brook and as the stream
of brook they pass away; 6:16 which are blackish by reason of the
ice and wherein the snow is hid: 6:17 what time they wax warm they
vanish: when it is hot they are consum out of their place

6:18 the path of their way are turn aside; they go to noth and
perish

6:19 the troop of tema look the compani of sheba wait for
them

6:20 they were confound becaus they had hoped; they came thither
and were asham

6:21 for now ye are nothing; ye see my cast down and are afraid

6:22 did i say bring unto me? or give a reward for me of your
substance? 6:23 or deliv me from the enemi hand? or redeem me
from the hand of the mighty? 6:24 teach me and i will hold my
tongue: and caus me to understand wherein i have er

6:25 how forcibl are right words! but what doth your argu reprove?
6:26 do ye imagin to reprov word and the speech of one that is
desper which are as wind? 6:27 yea ye overwhelm the fatherless
and ye dig a pit for your friend

6:28 now therefor be content look upon me; for it is evid unto
you if i lie

6:29 return i pray you let it not be iniquity; yea return again my
righteous is in it

6:30 is there iniqu in my tongue? cannot my tast discern pervers
things? 7:1 is there not an appoint time to man upon earth? are not
hi day also like the day of an hireling? 7:2 as a servant
earnestli desireth the shadow and as an hirel looketh for the
reward of hi work: 7:3 so am i made to possess month of vaniti and
wearisom night are appoint to me

7:4 when i lie down i say when shall i aris and the night be gone?
and i am full of toss to and fro unto the dawn of the day

7:5 my flesh is cloth with worm and clod of dust; my skin is
broken and becom loathsom

7:6 my day are swifter than a weaver shuttl and are spent without
hope

7:7 o rememb that my life is wind: mine eye shall no more see good

7:8 the eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eye
are upon me and i am not

7:9 as the cloud is consum and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down
to the grave shall come up no more

7:10 he shall return no more to hi hous neither shall hi place
know him ani more

7:11 therefor i will not refrain my mouth; i will speak in the
anguish of my spirit; i will complain in the bitter of my soul

7:12 am i a sea or a whale that thou settest a watch over me? 7:13
when i say my bed shall comfort me my couch shall eas my
complaints; 7:14 then thou scarest me with dream and terrifiest me
through visions: 7:15 so that my soul chooseth strangl and death
rather than my life

7:16 i loath it; i would not live alway: let me alone; for my day
are vaniti

7:17 what is man that thou shouldest magnifi him? and that thou
shouldest set thine heart upon him? 7:18 and that thou shouldest
visit him everi morn and tri him everi moment? 7:19 how long wilt
thou not depart from me nor let me alon till i swallow down my
spittle? 7:20 i have sinned; what shall i do unto thee o thou
preserv of men? whi hast thou set me as a mark against thee so
that i am a burden to myself? 7:21 and whi dost thou not pardon my
transgress and take away my iniquity? for now shall i sleep in the
dust; and thou shalt seek me in the morn but i shall not be

8:1 then answer bildad the shuhit and said 8:2 how long wilt thou
speak these things? and how long shall the word of thi mouth be like
a strong wind? 8:3 doth god pervert judgment? or doth the almighti
pervert justice? 8:4 if thi children have sin against him and he
have cast them away for their transgression; 8:5 if thou wouldest seek
unto god betim and make thi supplic to the almighty; 8:6 if
thou wert pure and upright; sure now he would awak for thee and
make the habit of thi righteous prosper

8:7 though thi begin wa small yet thi latter end should greatli
increas

8:8 for enquir i pray thee of the former age and prepar thyself
to the search of their fathers: 8:9 (for we are but of yesterday and
know noth becaus our day upon earth are a shadow:) 8:10 shall
not they teach thee and tell thee and utter word out of their
heart? 8:11 can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow
without water? 8:12 whilst it is yet in hi green and not cut
down it withereth befor ani other herb

8:13 so are the path of all that forget god; and the hypocrit hope
shall perish: 8:14 whose hope shall be cut off and whose trust shall
be a spider web

8:15 he shall lean upon hi hous but it shall not stand: he shall
hold it fast but it shall not endur

8:16 he is green befor the sun and hi branch shooteth forth in hi
garden

8:17 hi root are wrap about the heap and seeth the place of
stone

8:18 if he destroy him from hi place then it shall deni him say
i have not seen thee

8:19 behold thi is the joy of hi way and out of the earth shall
other grow

8:20 behold god will not cast away a perfect man neither will he
help the evil doers: 8:21 till he fill thi mouth with laugh and
thi lip with rejoic

8:22 they that hate thee shall be cloth with shame; and the dwell
place of the wick shall come to nought

9:1 then job answer and said 9:2 i know it is so of a truth: but
how should man be just with god? 9:3 if he will contend with him he
cannot answer him one of a thousand

9:4 he is wise in heart and mighti in strength: who hath harden
himself against him and hath prospered? 9:5 which removeth the
mountain and they know not: which overturneth them in hi anger

9:6 which shaketh the earth out of her place and the pillar thereof
trembl

9:7 which commandeth the sun and it riseth not; and sealeth up the
star

9:8 which alon spreadeth out the heaven and treadeth upon the wave
of the sea

9:9 which maketh arcturu orion and pleiad and the chamber of
the south

9:10 which doeth great thing past find out; yea and wonder
without number

9:11 lo he goeth by me and i see him not: he passeth on also but i
perceiv him not

9:12 behold he taketh away who can hinder him? who will say unto
him what doest thou? 9:13 if god will not withdraw hi anger the
proud helper do stoop under him

9:14 how much less shall i answer him and choos out my word to
reason with him? 9:15 whom though i were righteou yet would i not
answer but i would make supplic to my judg

9:16 if i had call and he had answer me; yet would i not believ
that he had hearken unto my voic

9:17 for he breaketh me with a tempest and multiplieth my wound
without caus

9:18 he will not suffer me to take my breath but filleth me with
bitter

9:19 if i speak of strength lo he is strong: and if of judgment who
shall set me a time to plead? 9:20 if i justifi myself mine own
mouth shall condemn me: if i say i am perfect it shall also prove me
pervers

9:21 though i were perfect yet would i not know my soul: i would
despis my life

9:22 thi is one thing therefor i said it he destroyeth the perfect
and the wick

9:23 if the scourg slay suddenli he will laugh at the trial of the
innoc

9:24 the earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covereth the
face of the judg thereof; if not where and who is he? 9:25 now
my day are swifter than a post: they flee away they see no good

9:26 they are pass away as the swift ships: as the eagl that
hasteth to the prey

9:27 if i say i will forget my complaint i will leav off my
heavi and comfort myself: 9:28 i am afraid of all my sorrow i
know that thou wilt not hold me innoc

9:29 if i be wick whi then labour i in vain? 9:30 if i wash myself
with snow water and make my hand never so clean; 9:31 yet shalt thou
plung me in the ditch and mine own cloth shall abhor me

9:32 for he is not a man as i am that i should answer him and we
should come togeth in judgment

9:33 neither is there ani daysman betwixt us that might lay hi hand
upon us both

9:34 let him take hi rod away from me and let not hi fear terrifi
me: 9:35 then would i speak and not fear him; but it is not so with
me

10:1 my soul is weari of my life; i will leav my complaint upon
myself; i will speak in the bitter of my soul

10:2 i will say unto god do not condemn me; shew me wherefor thou
contendest with me

10:3 is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress that thou
shouldest despis the work of thine hand and shine upon the counsel
of the wicked? 10:4 hast thou eye of flesh? or seest thou as man
seeth? 10:5 are thi day as the day of man? are thi year as man
day 10:6 that thou enquirest after mine iniqu and searchest
after my sin? 10:7 thou knowest that i am not wicked; and there is
none that can deliv out of thine hand

10:8 thine hand have made me and fashion me togeth round about;
yet thou dost destroy me

10:9 rememb i beseech thee that thou hast made me as the clay; and
wilt thou bring me into dust again? 10:10 hast thou not pour me out
as milk and curdl me like cheese? 10:11 thou hast cloth me with
skin and flesh and hast fenc me with bone and sinew

10:12 thou hast grant me life and favour and thi visit hath
preserv my spirit

10:13 and these thing hast thou hid in thine heart: i know that thi
is with thee

10:14 if i sin then thou markest me and thou wilt not acquit me from
mine iniqu

10:15 if i be wick woe unto me; and if i be righteou yet will i
not lift up my head i am full of confusion; therefor see thou mine
affliction; 10:16 for it increaseth thou huntest me as a fierc lion:
and again thou shewest thyself marvel upon me

10:17 thou renewest thi wit against me and increasest thine
indign upon me; chang and war are against me

10:18 wherefor then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? oh
that i had given up the ghost and no eye had seen me! 10:19 i should
have been as though i had not been; i should have been carri from
the womb to the grave

10:20 are not my day few? ceas then and let me alon that i may
take comfort a littl 10:21 befor i go whenc i shall not return
even to the land of dark and the shadow of death; 10:22 a land of
dark as dark itself; and of the shadow of death without ani
order and where the light is as dark

11:1 then answer zophar the naamathit and said 11:2 should not
the multitud of word be answered? and should a man full of talk be
justified? 11:3 should thi lie make men hold their peace? and when
thou mockest shall no man make thee ashamed? 11:4 for thou hast
said my doctrin is pure and i am clean in thine eye

11:5 but oh that god would speak and open hi lip against thee; 11:6
and that he would shew thee the secret of wisdom that they are
doubl to that which is! know therefor that god exacteth of thee less
than thine iniqu deserveth

11:7 canst thou by search find out god? canst thou find out the
almighti unto perfection? 11:8 it is as high as heaven; what canst
thou do? deeper than hell; what canst thou know? 11:9 the measur
thereof is longer than the earth and broader than the sea

11:10 if he cut off and shut up or gather togeth then who can
hinder him? 11:11 for he knoweth vain men: he seeth wicked also;
will he not then consid it? 11:12 for vain men would be wise
though man be born like a wild asss colt

11:13 if thou prepar thine heart and stretch out thine hand toward
him; 11:14 if iniqu be in thine hand put it far away and let not
wicked dwell in thi tabernacl

11:15 for then shalt thou lift up thi face without spot; yea thou
shalt be stedfast and shalt not fear: 11:16 becaus thou shalt forget
thi miseri and rememb it as water that pass away: 11:17 and thine
age shall be clearer than the noonday: thou shalt shine forth thou
shalt be as the morn

11:18 and thou shalt be secur becaus there is hope; yea thou shalt
dig about thee and thou shalt take thi rest in safeti

11:19 also thou shalt lie down and none shall make thee afraid; yea
mani shall make suit unto thee

11:20 but the eye of the wick shall fail and they shall not
escap and their hope shall be as the give up of the ghost

12:1 and job answer and said 12:2 no doubt but ye are the peopl
and wisdom shall die with you

12:3 but i have understand as well as you; i am not inferior to
you: yea who knoweth not such thing as these? 12:4 i am as one
mock of hi neighbour who calleth upon god and he answereth him:
the just upright man is laugh to scorn

12:5 he that is readi to slip with hi feet is as a lamp despis in
the thought of him that is at eas

12:6 the tabernacl of robber prosper and they that provok god are
secure; into whose hand god bringeth abundantli

12:7 but ask now the beast and they shall teach thee; and the fowl
of the air and they shall tell thee: 12:8 or speak to the earth and
it shall teach thee: and the fish of the sea shall declar unto
thee

12:9 who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the lord hath
wrought this? 12:10 in whose hand is the soul of everi live thing
and the breath of all mankind

12:11 doth not the ear tri words? and the mouth tast hi meat? 12:12
with the ancient is wisdom; and in length of day understand

12:13 with him is wisdom and strength he hath counsel and
understand

12:14 behold he breaketh down and it cannot be built again: he
shutteth up a man and there can be no open

12:15 behold he withholdeth the water and they dri up: also he
sendeth them out and they overturn the earth

12:16 with him is strength and wisdom: the deceiv and the deceiv
are hi

12:17 he leadeth counsellor away spoil and maketh the judg
fool

12:18 he looseth the bond of king and girdeth their loin with a
girdl

12:19 he leadeth princ away spoil and overthroweth the mighti

12:20 he removeth away the speech of the trusti and taketh away the
understand of the age

12:21 he poureth contempt upon princ and weakeneth the strength of
the mighti

12:22 he discovereth deep thing out of dark and bringeth out to
light the shadow of death

12:23 he increaseth the nation and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the
nation and straiteneth them again

12:24 he taketh away the heart of the chief of the peopl of the
earth and causeth them to wander in a wilder where there is no
way

12:25 they grope in the dark without light and he maketh them to
stagger like a drunken man

13:1 lo mine eye hath seen all thi mine ear hath heard and
understood it

13:2 what ye know the same do i know also: i am not inferior unto
you

13:3 sure i would speak to the almighti and i desir to reason with
god

13:4 but ye are forger of lie ye are all physician of no valu

13:5 o that ye would altogeth hold your peace! and it should be your
wisdom

13:6 hear now my reason and hearken to the plead of my lip

13:7 will ye speak wickedli for god? and talk deceit for him?
13:8 will ye accept hi person? will ye contend for god? 13:9 is it
good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh anoth do
ye so mock him? 13:10 he will sure reprov you if ye do secretli
accept person

13:11 shall not hi excel make you afraid? and hi dread fall
upon you? 13:12 your remembr are like unto ash your bodi to
bodi of clay

13:13 hold your peac let me alon that i may speak and let come on
me what will

13:14 wherefor do i take my flesh in my teeth and put my life in
mine hand? 13:15 though he slay me yet will i trust in him: but i
will maintain mine own way befor him

13:16 he also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrit shall not come
befor him

13:17 hear dilig my speech and my declar with your ear

13:18 behold now i have order my cause; i know that i shall be
justifi

13:19 who is he that will plead with me? for now if i hold my tongu
i shall give up the ghost

13:20 onli do not two thing unto me: then will i not hide myself from
thee

13:21 withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thi dread make me
afraid

13:22 then call thou and i will answer: or let me speak and answer
thou me

13:23 how mani are mine iniqu and sins? make me to know my
transgress and my sin

13:24 wherefor hidest thou thi face and holdest me for thine enemy?
13:25 wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursu
the dri stubble? 13:26 for thou writest bitter thing against me and
makest me to possess the iniqu of my youth

13:27 thou puttest my feet also in the stock and lookest narrowli
unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heel of my feet

13:28 and he as a rotten thing consumeth as a garment that is moth
eaten

14:1 man that is born of a woman is of few day and full of troubl

14:2 he cometh forth like a flower and is cut down: he fleeth also as
a shadow and continueth not

14:3 and doth thou open thine eye upon such an one and bringest me
into judgment with thee? 14:4 who can bring a clean thing out of an
unclean? not one

14:5 see hi day are determin the number of hi month are with
thee thou hast appoint hi bound that he cannot pass; 14:6 turn
from him that he may rest till he shall accomplish as an hirel
hi day

14:7 for there is hope of a tree if it be cut down that it will
sprout again and that the tender branch thereof will not ceas

14:8 though the root thereof wax old in the earth and the stock
thereof die in the ground; 14:9 yet through the scent of water it will
bud and bring forth bough like a plant

14:10 but man dieth and wasteth away: yea man giveth up the ghost
and where is he? 14:11 as the water fail from the sea and the flood
decayeth and drieth up: 14:12 so man lieth down and riseth not: till
the heaven be no more they shall not awak nor be rais out of
their sleep

14:13 o that thou wouldest hide me in the grave that thou wouldest
keep me secret until thi wrath be past that thou wouldest appoint me
a set time and rememb me! 14:14 if a man die shall he live again?
all the day of my appoint time will i wait till my chang come

14:15 thou shalt call and i will answer thee: thou wilt have a desir
to the work of thine hand

14:16 for now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my
sin? 14:17 my transgress is seal up in a bag and thou sewest up
mine iniqu

14:18 and sure the mountain fall cometh to nought and the rock
is remov out of hi place

14:19 the water wear the stones: thou washest away the thing which
grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of
man

14:20 thou prevailest for ever against him and he passeth: thou
changest hi counten and sendest him away

14:21 hi son come to honour and he knoweth it not; and they are
brought low but he perceiveth it not of them

14:22 but hi flesh upon him shall have pain and hi soul within him
shall mourn

15:1 then answer eliphaz the temanit and said 15:2 should a wise
man utter vain knowledg and fill hi belli with the east wind? 15:3
should he reason with unprofit talk? or with speech wherewith he
can do no good? 15:4 yea thou castest off fear and restrainest
prayer befor god

15:5 for thi mouth uttereth thine iniqu and thou choosest the
tongu of the crafti

15:6 thine own mouth condemneth thee and not i: yea thine own lip
testifi against thee

15:7 art thou the first man that wa born? or wast thou made befor
the hills? 15:8 hast thou heard the secret of god? and dost thou
restrain wisdom to thyself? 15:9 what knowest thou that we know not?
what understandest thou which is not in us? 15:10 with us are both
the grayhead and veri age men much elder than thi father

15:11 are the consol of god small with thee? is there ani secret
thing with thee? 15:12 whi doth thine heart carri thee away? and what
do thi eye wink at 15:13 that thou turnest thi spirit against god
and lettest such word go out of thi mouth? 15:14 what is man that
he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman that he should be
righteous? 15:15 behold he putteth no trust in hi saints; yea the
heaven are not clean in hi sight

15:16 how much more abomin and filthi is man which drinketh
iniqu like water? 15:17 i will shew thee hear me; and that which
i have seen i will declare; 15:18 which wise men have told from their
father and have not hid it: 15:19 unto whom alon the earth wa
given and no stranger pass among them

15:20 the wick man travaileth with pain all hi day and the number
of year is hidden to the oppressor

15:21 a dread sound is in hi ears: in prosper the destroy
shall come upon him

15:22 he believeth not that he shall return out of dark and he is
wait for of the sword

15:23 he wandereth abroad for bread say where is it? he knoweth
that the day of dark is readi at hi hand

15:24 troubl and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail
against him as a king readi to the battl

15:25 for he stretcheth out hi hand against god and strengtheneth
himself against the almighti

15:26 he runneth upon him even on hi neck upon the thick boss of
hi bucklers: 15:27 becaus he covereth hi face with hi fat and
maketh collop of fat on hi flank

15:28 and he dwelleth in desol citi and in hous which no man
inhabiteth which are readi to becom heap

15:29 he shall not be rich neither shall hi substanc continu
neither shall he prolong the perfect thereof upon the earth

15:30 he shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dri up hi
branch and by the breath of hi mouth shall he go away

15:31 let not him that is deceiv trust in vanity: for vaniti shall
be hi recomp

15:32 it shall be accomplish befor hi time and hi branch shall
not be green

15:33 he shall shake off hi unrip grape as the vine and shall cast
off hi flower as the oliv

15:34 for the congreg of hypocrit shall be desol and fire
shall consum the tabernacl of briberi

15:35 they conceiv mischief and bring forth vaniti and their belli
prepareth deceit

16:1 then job answer and said 16:2 i have heard mani such things:
miser comfort are ye all

16:3 shall vain word have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou
answerest? 16:4 i also could speak as ye do: if your soul were in my
soul stead i could heap up word against you and shake mine head
at you

16:5 but i would strengthen you with my mouth and the move of my
lip should asswag your grief

16:6 though i speak my grief is not asswaged: and though i forbear
what am i eased? 16:7 but now he hath made me weary: thou hast made
desol all my compani

16:8 and thou hast fill me with wrinkl which is a wit against
me: and my lean rise up in me beareth wit to my face

16:9 he teareth me in hi wrath who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me
with hi teeth; mine enemi sharpeneth hi eye upon me

16:10 they have gape upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me
upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gather themselv togeth
against me

16:11 god hath deliv me to the ungodli and turn me over into
the hand of the wick

16:12 i wa at eas but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken
me by my neck and shaken me to piec and set me up for hi mark

16:13 hi archer compass me round about he cleaveth my rein
asund and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground

16:14 he breaketh me with breach upon breach he runneth upon me like
a giant

16:15 i have sew sackcloth upon my skin and defil my horn in the
dust

16:16 my face is foul with weep and on my eyelid is the shadow of
death; 16:17 not for ani injustic in mine hands: also my prayer is
pure

16:18 o earth cover not thou my blood and let my cri have no place

16:19 also now behold my wit is in heaven and my record is on
high

16:20 my friend scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tear unto god

16:21 o that one might plead for a man with god as a man pleadeth for
hi neighbour! 16:22 when a few year are come then i shall go the
way whenc i shall not return

17:1 my breath is corrupt my day are extinct the grave are readi
for me

17:2 are there not mocker with me? and doth not mine eye continu in
their provocation? 17:3 lay down now put me in a sureti with thee;
who is he that will strike hand with me? 17:4 for thou hast hid
their heart from understanding: therefor shalt thou not exalt them

17:5 he that speaketh flatteri to hi friend even the eye of hi
children shall fail

17:6 he hath made me also a byword of the people; and aforetim i wa
as a tabret

17:7 mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow and all my member are
as a shadow

17:8 upright men shall be astoni at thi and the innoc shall
stir up himself against the hypocrit

17:9 the righteou also shall hold on hi way and he that hath clean
hand shall be stronger and stronger

17:10 but as for you all do ye return and come now: for i cannot
find one wise man among you

17:11 my day are past my purpos are broken off even the thought
of my heart

17:12 they chang the night into day: the light is short becaus of
dark

17:13 if i wait the grave is mine house: i have made my bed in the
dark

17:14 i have said to corrupt thou art my father: to the worm thou
art my mother and my sister

17:15 and where is now my hope? as for my hope who shall see it?
17:16 they shall go down to the bar of the pit when our rest
togeth is in the dust

18:1 then answer bildad the shuhit and said 18:2 how long will it
be ere ye make an end of words? mark and afterward we will speak

18:3 wherefor are we count as beast and reput vile in your
sight? 18:4 he teareth himself in hi anger: shall the earth be
forsaken for thee? and shall the rock be remov out of hi place?
18:5 yea the light of the wick shall be put out and the spark of
hi fire shall not shine

18:6 the light shall be dark in hi tabernacl and hi candl shall
be put out with him

18:7 the step of hi strength shall be straiten and hi own
counsel shall cast him down

18:8 for he is cast into a net by hi own feet and he walketh upon a
snare

18:9 the gin shall take him by the heel and the robber shall prevail
against him

18:10 the snare is laid for him in the ground and a trap for him in
the way

18:11 terror shall make him afraid on everi side and shall drive him
to hi feet

18:12 hi strength shall be hungerbitten and destruct shall be
readi at hi side

18:13 it shall devour the strength of hi skin: even the firstborn of
death shall devour hi strength

18:14 hi confid shall be root out of hi tabernacl and it
shall bring him to the king of terror

18:15 it shall dwell in hi tabernacl becaus it is none of his:
brimston shall be scatter upon hi habit

18:16 hi root shall be dri up beneath and abov shall hi branch
be cut off

18:17 hi remembr shall perish from the earth and he shall have
no name in the street

18:18 he shall be driven from light into dark and chase out of
the world

18:19 he shall neither have son nor nephew among hi peopl nor ani
remain in hi dwell

18:20 they that come after him shall be astoni at hi day as they
that went befor were affright

18:21 sure such are the dwell of the wick and thi is the
place of him that knoweth not god

19:1 then job answer and said 19:2 how long will ye vex my soul
and break me in piec with words? 19:3 these ten time have ye
reproach me: ye are not asham that ye make yourselv strang to
me

19:4 and be it inde that i have er mine error remaineth with
myself

19:5 if inde ye will magnifi yourselv against me and plead
against me my reproach: 19:6 know now that god hath overthrown me and
hath compass me with hi net

19:7 behold i cri out of wrong but i am not heard: i cri aloud but
there is no judgment

19:8 he hath fenc up my way that i cannot pass and he hath set
dark in my path

19:9 he hath strip me of my glori and taken the crown from my
head

19:10 he hath destroy me on everi side and i am gone: and mine hope
hath he remov like a tree

19:11 he hath also kindl hi wrath against me and he counteth me
unto him as one of hi enemi

19:12 hi troop come togeth and rais up their way against me and
encamp round about my tabernacl

19:13 he hath put my brethren far from me and mine acquaint are
verili estrang from me

19:14 my kinsfolk have fail and my familiar friend have forgotten
me

19:15 they that dwell in mine hous and my maid count me for a
stranger: i am an alien in their sight

19:16 i call my servant and he gave me no answer; i intreat him
with my mouth

19:17 my breath is strang to my wife though i intreat for the
children sake of mine own bodi

19:18 yea young children despis me; i aros and they spake against
me

19:19 all my inward friend abhor me: and they whom i love are
turn against me

19:20 my bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh and i am escap
with the skin of my teeth

19:21 have piti upon me have piti upon me o ye my friends; for the
hand of god hath touch me

19:22 whi do ye persecut me as god and are not satisfi with my
flesh? 19:23 oh that my word were now written! oh that they were
print in a book! 19:24 that they were graven with an iron pen and
lead in the rock for ever! 19:25 for i know that my redeem liveth
and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth: 19:26 and
though after my skin worm destroy thi bodi yet in my flesh shall i
see god: 19:27 whom i shall see for myself and mine eye shall
behold and not another; though my rein be consum within me

19:28 but ye should say whi persecut we him see the root of the
matter is found in me? 19:29 be ye afraid of the sword: for wrath
bringeth the punish of the sword that ye may know there is a
judgment

20:1 then answer zophar the naamathit and said 20:2 therefor do
my thought caus me to answer and for thi i make hast

20:3 i have heard the check of my reproach and the spirit of my
understand causeth me to answer

20:4 knowest thou not thi of old sinc man wa place upon earth
20:5 that the triumph of the wick is short and the joy of the
hypocrit but for a moment? 20:6 though hi excel mount up to
the heaven and hi head reach unto the clouds; 20:7 yet he shall
perish for ever like hi own dung: they which have seen him shall say
where is he? 20:8 he shall fli away as a dream and shall not be
found: yea he shall be chase away as a vision of the night

20:9 the eye also which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall
hi place ani more behold him

20:10 hi children shall seek to pleas the poor and hi hand shall
restor their good

20:11 hi bone are full of the sin of hi youth which shall lie down
with him in the dust

20:12 though wicked be sweet in hi mouth though he hide it under
hi tongue; 20:13 though he spare it and forsak it not; but keep it
still within hi mouth: 20:14 yet hi meat in hi bowel is turn it
is the gall of asp within him

20:15 he hath swallow down rich and he shall vomit them up again:
god shall cast them out of hi belli

20:16 he shall suck the poison of asps: the viper tongu shall slay
him

20:17 he shall not see the river the flood the brook of honey and
butter

20:18 that which he labour for shall he restor and shall not
swallow it down: accord to hi substanc shall the restitut be
and he shall not rejoic therein

20:19 becaus he hath oppress and hath forsaken the poor; becaus he
hath violent taken away an hous which he build not; 20:20 sure
he shall not feel quiet in hi belli he shall not save of that
which he desir

20:21 there shall none of hi meat be left; therefor shall no man
look for hi good

20:22 in the ful of hi suffici he shall be in straits: everi
hand of the wick shall come upon him

20:23 when he is about to fill hi belli god shall cast the furi of
hi wrath upon him and shall rain it upon him while he is eat

20:24 he shall flee from the iron weapon and the bow of steel shall
strike him through

20:25 it is drawn and cometh out of the body; yea the glitter
sword cometh out of hi gall: terror are upon him

20:26 all dark shall be hid in hi secret places: a fire not blown
shall consum him; it shall go ill with him that is left in hi
tabernacl

20:27 the heaven shall reveal hi iniquity; and the earth shall rise
up against him

20:28 the increas of hi hous shall depart and hi good shall flow
away in the day of hi wrath

20:29 thi is the portion of a wick man from god and the heritag
appoint unto him by god

21:1 but job answer and said 21:2 hear dilig my speech and
let thi be your consol

21:3 suffer me that i may speak; and after that i have spoken mock
on

21:4 as for me is my complaint to man? and if it were so whi should
not my spirit be troubled? 21:5 mark me and be astonish and lay
your hand upon your mouth

21:6 even when i rememb i am afraid and trembl taketh hold on my
flesh

21:7 wherefor do the wick live becom old yea are mighti in
power? 21:8 their seed is establish in their sight with them and
their offspr befor their eye

21:9 their hous are safe from fear neither is the rod of god upon
them

21:10 their bull gendereth and faileth not; their cow calveth and
casteth not her calf

21:11 they send forth their littl one like a flock and their
children danc

21:12 they take the timbrel and harp and rejoic at the sound of the
organ

21:13 they spend their day in wealth and in a moment go down to the
grave

21:14 therefor they say unto god depart from us; for we desir not
the knowledg of thi way

21:15 what is the almighti that we should serv him? and what profit
should we have if we pray unto him? 21:16 lo their good is not in
their hand: the counsel of the wick is far from me

21:17 how oft is the candl of the wick put out! and how oft cometh
their destruct upon them! god distributeth sorrow in hi anger

21:18 they are as stubbl befor the wind and as chaff that the storm
carrieth away

21:19 god layeth up hi iniqu for hi children: he rewardeth him
and he shall know it

21:20 hi eye shall see hi destruct and he shall drink of the
wrath of the almighti

21:21 for what pleasur hath he in hi hous after him when the
number of hi month is cut off in the midst? 21:22 shall ani teach
god knowledge? see he judgeth those that are high

21:23 one dieth in hi full strength be wholli at eas and quiet

21:24 hi breast are full of milk and hi bone are moisten with
marrow

21:25 and anoth dieth in the bitter of hi soul and never
eateth with pleasur

21:26 they shall lie down alik in the dust and the worm shall cover
them

21:27 behold i know your thought and the devic which ye
wrong imagin against me

21:28 for ye say where is the hous of the prince? and where are the
dwell place of the wicked? 21:29 have ye not ask them that go
by the way? and do ye not know their token 21:30 that the wick is
reserv to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the
day of wrath

21:31 who shall declar hi way to hi face? and who shall repay him
what he hath done? 21:32 yet shall he be brought to the grave and
shall remain in the tomb

21:33 the clod of the valley shall be sweet unto him and everi man
shall draw after him as there are innumer befor him

21:34 how then comfort ye me in vain see in your answer there
remaineth falsehood? 22:1 then eliphaz the temanit answer and
said 22:2 can a man be profit unto god as he that is wise may be
profit unto himself? 22:3 is it ani pleasur to the almighti
that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him that thou makest thi
way perfect? 22:4 will he reprov thee for fear of thee? will he
enter with thee into judgment? 22:5 is not thi wicked great? and
thine iniqu infinite? 22:6 for thou hast taken a pledg from thi
brother for nought and strip the nake of their cloth

22:7 thou hast not given water to the weari to drink and thou hast
withholden bread from the hungri

22:8 but as for the mighti man he had the earth; and the honour
man dwelt in it

22:9 thou hast sent widow away empti and the arm of the fatherless
have been broken

22:10 therefor snare are round about thee and sudden fear troubleth
thee; 22:11 or dark that thou canst not see; and abund of
water cover thee

22:12 is not god in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the
star how high they are! 22:13 and thou sayest how doth god know?
can he judg through the dark cloud? 22:14 thick cloud are a
cover to him that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of
heaven

22:15 hast thou mark the old way which wick men have trodden?
22:16 which were cut down out of time whose foundat wa overflown
with a flood: 22:17 which said unto god depart from us: and what can
the almighti do for them? 22:18 yet he fill their hous with good
things: but the counsel of the wick is far from me

22:19 the righteou see it and are glad: and the innoc laugh them
to scorn

22:20 wherea our substanc is not cut down but the remnant of them
the fire consumeth

22:21 acquaint now thyself with him and be at peace: therebi good
shall come unto thee

22:22 receiv i pray thee the law from hi mouth and lay up hi
word in thine heart

22:23 if thou return to the almighti thou shalt be built up thou
shalt put away iniqu far from thi tabernacl

22:24 then shalt thou lay up gold as dust and the gold of ophir as
the stone of the brook

22:25 yea the almighti shall be thi defenc and thou shalt have
plenti of silver

22:26 for then shalt thou have thi delight in the almighti and shalt
lift up thi face unto god

22:27 thou shalt make thi prayer unto him and he shall hear thee and
thou shalt pay thi vow

22:28 thou shalt also decre a thing and it shall be establish unto
thee: and the light shall shine upon thi way

22:29 when men are cast down then thou shalt say there is lift
up; and he shall save the humbl person

22:30 he shall deliv the island of the innocent: and it is deliv
by the pure of thine hand

23:1 then job answer and said 23:2 even to day is my complaint
bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groan

23:3 oh that i knew where i might find him! that i might come even to
hi seat! 23:4 i would order my caus befor him and fill my mouth
with argument

23:5 i would know the word which he would answer me and understand
what he would say unto me

23:6 will he plead against me with hi great power? no; but he would
put strength in me

23:7 there the righteou might disput with him; so should i be
deliv for ever from my judg

23:8 behold i go forward but he is not there; and backward but i
cannot perceiv him: 23:9 on the left hand where he doth work but i
cannot behold him: he hideth himself on the right hand that i cannot
see him: 23:10 but he knoweth the way that i take: when he hath tri
me i shall come forth as gold

23:11 my foot hath held hi step hi way have i kept and not
declin

23:12 neither have i gone back from the command of hi lips; i
have esteem the word of hi mouth more than my necessari food

23:13 but he is in one mind and who can turn him? and what hi soul
desireth even that he doeth

23:14 for he performeth the thing that is appoint for me: and mani
such thing are with him

23:15 therefor am i troubl at hi presence: when i consid i am
afraid of him

23:16 for god maketh my heart soft and the almighti troubleth me:
23:17 becaus i wa not cut off befor the dark neither hath he
cover the dark from my face

24:1 whi see time are not hidden from the almighti do they that
know him not see hi days? 24:2 some remov the landmarks; they
violent take away flock and feed thereof

24:3 they drive away the ass of the fatherless they take the widow
ox for a pledg

24:4 they turn the needi out of the way: the poor of the earth hide
themselv togeth

24:5 behold as wild ass in the desert go they forth to their work;
rise betim for a prey: the wilder yieldeth food for them and
for their children

24:6 they reap everi one hi corn in the field: and they gather the
vintag of the wick

24:7 they caus the nake to lodg without cloth that they have no
cover in the cold

24:8 they are wet with the shower of the mountain and embrac the
rock for want of a shelter

24:9 they pluck the fatherless from the breast and take a pledg of
the poor

24:10 they caus him to go nake without cloth and they take away
the sheaf from the hungry; 24:11 which make oil within their wall
and tread their winepress and suffer thirst

24:12 men groan from out of the citi and the soul of the wound
crieth out: yet god layeth not folli to them

24:13 they are of those that rebel against the light; they know not
the way thereof nor abid in the path thereof

24:14 the murder rise with the light killeth the poor and needi
and in the night is as a thief

24:15 the eye also of the adulter waiteth for the twilight say
no eye shall see me: and disguiseth hi face

24:16 in the dark they dig through hous which they had mark for
themselv in the daytime: they know not the light

24:17 for the morn is to them even as the shadow of death: if one
know them they are in the terror of the shadow of death

24:18 he is swift as the waters; their portion is curs in the earth:
he beholdeth not the way of the vineyard

24:19 drought and heat consum the snow waters: so doth the grave
those which have sin

24:20 the womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetli on him;
he shall be no more remembered; and wicked shall be broken as a
tree

24:21 he evil entreateth the barren that beareth not: and doeth not
good to the widow

24:22 he draweth also the mighti with hi power: he riseth up and no
man is sure of life

24:23 though it be given him to be in safeti whereon he resteth; yet
hi eye are upon their way

24:24 they are exalt for a littl while but are gone and brought
low; they are taken out of the way as all other and cut off as the
top of the ear of corn

24:25 and if it be not so now who will make me a liar and make my
speech noth worth? 25:1 then answer bildad the shuhit and
said 25:2 dominion and fear are with him he maketh peac in hi high
place

25:3 is there ani number of hi armies? and upon whom doth not hi
light arise? 25:4 how then can man be justifi with god? or how can
he be clean that is born of a woman? 25:5 behold even to the moon
and it shineth not; yea the star are not pure in hi sight

25:6 how much less man that is a worm? and the son of man which is a
worm? 26:1 but job answer and said 26:2 how hast thou help him
that is without power? how savest thou the arm that hath no strength?
26:3 how hast thou counsel him that hath no wisdom? and how hast
thou plenti declar the thing as it is? 26:4 to whom hast thou
utter words? and whose spirit came from thee? 26:5 dead thing are
form from under the water and the inhabit thereof

26:6 hell is nake befor him and destruct hath no cover

26:7 he stretcheth out the north over the empti place and hangeth the
earth upon noth

26:8 he bindeth up the water in hi thick clouds; and the cloud is
not rent under them

26:9 he holdeth back the face of hi throne and spreadeth hi cloud
upon it

26:10 he hath compass the water with bound until the day and
night come to an end

26:11 the pillar of heaven trembl and are astonish at hi reproof

26:12 he divideth the sea with hi power and by hi understand he
smiteth through the proud

26:13 by hi spirit he hath garnish the heavens; hi hand hath
form the crook serpent

26:14 lo these are part of hi ways: but how littl a portion is
heard of him? but the thunder of hi power who can understand? 27:1
moreov job continu hi parabl and said 27:2 as god liveth who
hath taken away my judgment; and the almighti who hath vex my soul;
27:3 all the while my breath is in me and the spirit of god is in my
nostrils; 27:4 my lip shall not speak wicked nor my tongu utter
deceit

27:5 god forbid that i should justifi you: till i die i will not
remov mine integr from me

27:6 my righteous i hold fast and will not let it go: my heart
shall not reproach me so long as i live

27:7 let mine enemi be as the wick and he that riseth up against me
as the unright

27:8 for what is the hope of the hypocrit though he hath gain
when god taketh away hi soul? 27:9 will god hear hi cri when
troubl cometh upon him? 27:10 will he delight himself in the
almighty? will he alway call upon god? 27:11 i will teach you by the
hand of god: that which is with the almighti will i not conceal

27:12 behold all ye yourselv have seen it; whi then are ye thu
altogeth vain? 27:13 thi is the portion of a wick man with god
and the heritag of oppressor which they shall receiv of the
almighti

27:14 if hi children be multipli it is for the sword: and hi
offspr shall not be satisfi with bread

27:15 those that remain of him shall be buri in death: and hi
widow shall not weep

27:16 though he heap up silver as the dust and prepar raiment as the
clay; 27:17 he may prepar it but the just shall put it on and the
innoc shall divid the silver

27:18 he buildeth hi hous as a moth and as a booth that the keeper
maketh

27:19 the rich man shall lie down but he shall not be gathered: he
openeth hi eye and he is not

27:20 terror take hold on him as water a tempest stealeth him away
in the night

27:21 the east wind carrieth him away and he departeth: and as a
storm hurleth him out of hi place

27:22 for god shall cast upon him and not spare: he would fain flee
out of hi hand

27:23 men shall clap their hand at him and shall hiss him out of hi
place

28:1 sure there is a vein for the silver and a place for gold where
they fine it

28:2 iron is taken out of the earth and brass is molten out of the
stone

28:3 he setteth an end to dark and searcheth out all perfection:
the stone of dark and the shadow of death

28:4 the flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the water
forgotten of the foot: they are dri up they are gone away from men

28:5 as for the earth out of it cometh bread: and under it is turn
up as it were fire

28:6 the stone of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of
gold

28:7 there is a path which no fowl knoweth and which the vultur
eye hath not seen: 28:8 the lion whelp have not trodden it nor the
fierc lion pass by it

28:9 he putteth forth hi hand upon the rock; he overturneth the
mountain by the root

28:10 he cutteth out river among the rocks; and hi eye seeth everi
preciou thing

28:11 he bindeth the flood from overflowing; and the thing that is
hid bringeth he forth to light

28:12 but where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of
understanding? 28:13 man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it
found in the land of the live

28:14 the depth saith it is not in me: and the sea saith it is not
with me

28:15 it cannot be gotten for gold neither shall silver be weigh
for the price thereof

28:16 it cannot be valu with the gold of ophir with the preciou
onyx or the sapphir

28:17 the gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchang of it
shall not be for jewel of fine gold

28:18 no mention shall be made of coral or of pearls: for the price
of wisdom is abov rubi

28:19 the topaz of ethiopia shall not equal it neither shall it be
valu with pure gold

28:20 whenc then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of
understanding? 28:21 see it is hid from the eye of all live
and kept close from the fowl of the air

28:22 destruct and death say we have heard the fame thereof with
our ear

28:23 god understandeth the way thereof and he knoweth the place
thereof

28:24 for he looketh to the end of the earth and seeth under the
whole heaven; 28:25 to make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth
the water by measur

28:26 when he made a decre for the rain and a way for the lightn
of the thunder: 28:27 then did he see it and declar it; he prepar
it yea and search it out

28:28 and unto man he said behold the fear of the lord that is
wisdom; and to depart from evil is understand

29:1 moreov job continu hi parabl and said 29:2 oh that i were
as in month past as in the day when god preserv me; 29:3 when hi
candl shine upon my head and when by hi light i walk through
darkness; 29:4 as i wa in the day of my youth when the secret of
god wa upon my tabernacle; 29:5 when the almighti wa yet with me
when my children were about me; 29:6 when i wash my step with
butter and the rock pour me out river of oil; 29:7 when i went out
to the gate through the citi when i prepar my seat in the street!
29:8 the young men saw me and hid themselves: and the age aros and
stood up

29:9 the princ refrain talk and laid their hand on their
mouth

29:10 the nobl held their peac and their tongu cleav to the
roof of their mouth

29:11 when the ear heard me then it bless me; and when the eye saw
me it gave wit to me: 29:12 becaus i deliv the poor that
cri and the fatherless and him that had none to help him

29:13 the bless of him that wa readi to perish came upon me: and i
caus the widow heart to sing for joy

29:14 i put on righteous and it cloth me: my judgment wa as a
robe and a diadem

29:15 i wa eye to the blind and feet wa i to the lame

29:16 i wa a father to the poor: and the caus which i knew not i
search out

29:17 and i brake the jaw of the wick and pluck the spoil out of
hi teeth

29:18 then i said i shall die in my nest and i shall multipli my
day as the sand

29:19 my root wa spread out by the water and the dew lay all night
upon my branch

29:20 my glori wa fresh in me and my bow wa renew in my hand

29:21 unto me men gave ear and wait and kept silenc at my
counsel

29:22 after my word they spake not again; and my speech drop upon
them

29:23 and they wait for me as for the rain; and they open their
mouth wide as for the latter rain

29:24 if i laugh on them they believ it not; and the light of my
counten they cast not down

29:25 i chose out their way and sat chief and dwelt as a king in the
armi as one that comforteth the mourner

30:1 but now they that are younger than i have me in deris whose
father i would have disdain to have set with the dog of my flock

30:2 yea whereto might the strength of their hand profit me in whom
old age wa perished? 30:3 for want and famin they were solitary;
flee into the wilder in former time desol and wast

30:4 who cut up mallow by the bush and junip root for their
meat

30:5 they were driven forth from among men (they cri after them as
after a thief;) 30:6 to dwell in the cliff of the valley in cave
of the earth and in the rock

30:7 among the bush they brayed; under the nettl they were
gather togeth

30:8 they were children of fool yea children of base men: they were
viler than the earth

30:9 and now am i their song yea i am their byword

30:10 they abhor me they flee far from me and spare not to spit in
my face

30:11 becaus he hath loos my cord and afflict me they have also
let loos the bridl befor me

30:12 upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet and
they rais up against me the way of their destruct

30:13 they mar my path they set forward my calam they have no
helper

30:14 they came upon me as a wide break in of waters: in the
desol they roll themselv upon me

30:15 terror are turn upon me: they pursu my soul as the wind: and
my welfar passeth away as a cloud

30:16 and now my soul is pour out upon me; the day of afflict
have taken hold upon me

30:17 my bone are pierc in me in the night season: and my sinew
take no rest

30:18 by the great forc of my diseas is my garment changed: it
bindeth me about as the collar of my coat

30:19 he hath cast me into the mire and i am becom like dust and
ash

30:20 i cri unto thee and thou dost not hear me: i stand up and thou
regardest me not

30:21 thou art becom cruel to me: with thi strong hand thou opposest
thyself against me

30:22 thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it
and dissolvest my substanc

30:23 for i know that thou wilt bring me to death and to the hous
appoint for all live

30:24 howbeit he will not stretch out hi hand to the grave though
they cri in hi destruct

30:25 did not i weep for him that wa in trouble? wa not my soul
griev for the poor? 30:26 when i look for good then evil came
unto me: and when i wait for light there came dark

30:27 my bowel boil and rest not: the day of afflict
prevent me

30:28 i went mourn without the sun: i stood up and i cri in the
congreg

30:29 i am a brother to dragon and a companion to owl

30:30 my skin is black upon me and my bone are burn with heat

30:31 my harp also is turn to mourn and my organ into the voic
of them that weep

31:1 i made a coven with mine eyes; whi then should i think upon a
maid? 31:2 for what portion of god is there from above? and what
inherit of the almighti from on high? 31:3 is not destruct to
the wicked? and a strang punish to the worker of iniquity? 31:4
doth not he see my way and count all my steps? 31:5 if i have
walk with vaniti or if my foot hath hast to deceit; 31:6 let me
be weigh in an even balanc that god may know mine integr

31:7 if my step hath turn out of the way and mine heart walk
after mine eye and if ani blot hath cleav to mine hands; 31:8 then
let me sow and let anoth eat; yea let my offspr be root out

31:9 if mine heart have been deceiv by a woman or if i have laid
wait at my neighbour door; 31:10 then let my wife grind unto
anoth and let other bow down upon her

31:11 for thi is an heinou crime; yea it is an iniqu to be
punish by the judg

31:12 for it is a fire that consumeth to destruct and would root
out all mine increas

31:13 if i did despis the caus of my manserv or of my
maidserv when they contend with me; 31:14 what then shall i do
when god riseth up? and when he visiteth what shall i answer him?
31:15 did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one
fashion us in the womb? 31:16 if i have withheld the poor from their
desir or have caus the eye of the widow to fail; 31:17 or have
eaten my morsel myself alon and the fatherless hath not eaten
thereof; 31:18 (for from my youth he wa brought up with me as with a
father and i have guid her from my mother womb;) 31:19 if i have
seen ani perish for want of cloth or ani poor without covering;
31:20 if hi loin have not bless me and if he were not warm with
the fleec of my sheep; 31:21 if i have lift up my hand against the
fatherless when i saw my help in the gate: 31:22 then let mine arm
fall from my shoulder blade and mine arm be broken from the bone

31:23 for destruct from god wa a terror to me and by reason of
hi high i could not endur

31:24 if i have made gold my hope or have said to the fine gold thou
art my confidence; 31:25 if i rejoic becaus my wealth wa great and
becaus mine hand had gotten much; 31:26 if i beheld the sun when it
shine or the moon walk in brightness; 31:27 and my heart hath
been secretli entic or my mouth hath kiss my hand: 31:28 thi
also were an iniqu to be punish by the judge: for i should have
deni the god that is abov

31:29 if i rejoic at the destruct of him that hate me or lift
up myself when evil found him: 31:30 neither have i suffer my mouth
to sin by wish a curs to hi soul

31:31 if the men of my tabernacl said not oh that we had of hi
flesh! we cannot be satisfi

31:32 the stranger did not lodg in the street: but i open my door
to the travel

31:33 if i cover my transgress as adam by hide mine iniqu
in my bosom: 31:34 did i fear a great multitud or did the contempt
of famili terrifi me that i kept silenc and went not out of the
door? 31:35 oh that one would hear me! behold my desir is that the
almighti would answer me and that mine adversari had written a book

31:36 sure i would take it upon my shoulder and bind it as a crown
to me

31:37 i would declar unto him the number of my steps; as a princ
would i go near unto him

31:38 if my land cri against me or that the furrow likewis thereof
complain; 31:39 if i have eaten the fruit thereof without money or
have caus the owner thereof to lose their life: 31:40 let thistl
grow instead of wheat and cockl instead of barley

the word of job are end

32:1 so these three men ceas to answer job becaus he wa righteou
in hi own eye

32:2 then wa kindl the wrath of elihu the son of barachel the
buzit of the kindr of ram: against job wa hi wrath kindl
becaus he justifi himself rather than god

32:3 also against hi three friend wa hi wrath kindl becaus
they had found no answer and yet had condemn job

32:4 now elihu had wait till job had spoken becaus they were elder
than he

32:5 when elihu saw that there wa no answer in the mouth of these
three men then hi wrath wa kindl

32:6 and elihu the son of barachel the buzit answer and said i am
young and ye are veri old; wherefor i wa afraid and durst not shew
you mine opinion

32:7 i said day should speak and multitud of year should teach
wisdom

32:8 but there is a spirit in man: and the inspir of the almighti
giveth them understand

32:9 great men are not alway wise: neither do the age understand
judgment

32:10 therefor i said hearken to me; i also will shew mine opinion

32:11 behold i wait for your words; i gave ear to your reason
whilst ye search out what to say

32:12 yea i attend unto you and behold there wa none of you
that convinc job or that answer hi words: 32:13 lest ye should
say we have found out wisdom: god thrusteth him down not man

32:14 now he hath not direct hi word against me: neither will i
answer him with your speech

32:15 they were amaz they answer no more: they left off speak

32:16 when i had wait (for they spake not but stood still and
answer no more;) 32:17 i said i will answer also my part i also
will shew mine opinion

32:18 for i am full of matter the spirit within me constraineth me

32:19 behold my belli is as wine which hath no vent; it is readi to
burst like new bottl

32:20 i will speak that i may be refreshed: i will open my lip and
answer

32:21 let me not i pray you accept ani man person neither let me
give flatter titl unto man

32:22 for i know not to give flatter titles; in so do my maker
would soon take me away

33:1 wherefor job i pray thee hear my speech and hearken to all
my word

33:2 behold now i have open my mouth my tongu hath spoken in my
mouth

33:3 my word shall be of the upright of my heart: and my lip
shall utter knowledg clearli

33:4 the spirit of god hath made me and the breath of the almighti
hath given me life

33:5 if thou canst answer me set thi word in order befor me stand
up

33:6 behold i am accord to thi wish in god stead: i also am
form out of the clay

33:7 behold my terror shall not make thee afraid neither shall my
hand be heavi upon thee

33:8 sure thou hast spoken in mine hear and i have heard the
voic of thi word say 33:9 i am clean without transgress i
am innocent; neither is there iniqu in me

33:10 behold he findeth occas against me he counteth me for hi
enemi 33:11 he putteth my feet in the stock he marketh all my
path

33:12 behold in thi thou art not just: i will answer thee that god
is greater than man

33:13 whi dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of
ani of hi matter

33:14 for god speaketh onc yea twice yet man perceiveth it not

33:15 in a dream in a vision of the night when deep sleep falleth
upon men in slumber upon the bed; 33:16 then he openeth the ear
of men and sealeth their instruct 33:17 that he may withdraw man
from hi purpos and hide pride from man

33:18 he keepeth back hi soul from the pit and hi life from
perish by the sword

33:19 he is chasten also with pain upon hi bed and the multitud
of hi bone with strong pain: 33:20 so that hi life abhorreth bread
and hi soul dainti meat

33:21 hi flesh is consum away that it cannot be seen; and hi
bone that were not seen stick out

33:22 yea hi soul draweth near unto the grave and hi life to the
destroy

33:23 if there be a messeng with him an interpret one among a
thousand to shew unto man hi uprightness: 33:24 then he is graciou
unto him and saith deliv him from go down to the pit: i have
found a ransom

33:25 hi flesh shall be fresher than a childs: he shall return to
the day of hi youth: 33:26 he shall pray unto god and he will be
favour unto him: and he shall see hi face with joy: for he will
render unto man hi righteous

33:27 he looketh upon men and if ani say i have sin and
pervert that which wa right and it profit me not; 33:28 he will
deliv hi soul from go into the pit and hi life shall see the
light

33:29 lo all these thing worketh god oftentim with man 33:30 to
bring back hi soul from the pit to be enlighten with the light of
the live

33:31 mark well o job hearken unto me: hold thi peac and i will
speak

33:32 if thou hast anyth to say answer me: speak for i desir to
justifi thee

33:33 if not hearken unto me: hold thi peac and i shall teach thee
wisdom

34:1 furthermor elihu answer and said 34:2 hear my word o ye
wise men; and give ear unto me ye that have knowledg

34:3 for the ear trieth word as the mouth tasteth meat

34:4 let us choos to us judgment: let us know among ourselv what is
good

34:5 for job hath said i am righteous: and god hath taken away my
judgment

34:6 should i lie against my right? my wound is incur without
transgress

34:7 what man is like job who drinketh up scorn like water? 34:8
which goeth in compani with the worker of iniqu and walketh with
wick men

34:9 for he hath said it profiteth a man noth that he should
delight himself with god

34:10 therefor hearken unto me ye men of understanding: far be it
from god that he should do wickedness; and from the almighti that he
should commit iniqu

34:11 for the work of a man shall he render unto him and caus everi
man to find accord to hi way

34:12 yea sure god will not do wickedli neither will the almighti
pervert judgment

34:13 who hath given him a charg over the earth? or who hath dispos
the whole world? 34:14 if he set hi heart upon man if he gather
unto himself hi spirit and hi breath; 34:15 all flesh shall perish
togeth and man shall turn again unto dust

34:16 if now thou hast understand hear this: hearken to the voic
of my word

34:17 shall even he that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn
him that is most just? 34:18 is it fit to say to a king thou art
wicked? and to princ ye are ungodly? 34:19 how much less to him
that accepteth not the person of princ nor regardeth the rich more
than the poor? for they all are the work of hi hand

34:20 in a moment shall they die and the peopl shall be troubl at
midnight and pass away: and the mighti shall be taken away without
hand

34:21 for hi eye are upon the way of man and he seeth all hi
go

34:22 there is no dark nor shadow of death where the worker of
iniqu may hide themselv

34:23 for he will not lay upon man more than right; that he should
enter into judgment with god

34:24 he shall break in piec mighti men without number and set
other in their stead

34:25 therefor he knoweth their work and he overturneth them in the
night so that they are destroy

34:26 he striketh them as wick men in the open sight of others;
34:27 becaus they turn back from him and would not consid ani of
hi ways: 34:28 so that they caus the cri of the poor to come unto
him and he heareth the cri of the afflict

34:29 when he giveth quiet who then can make trouble? and when he
hideth hi face who then can behold him? whether it be done against a
nation or against a man only: 34:30 that the hypocrit reign not
lest the peopl be ensnar

34:31 sure it is meet to be said unto god i have born
chastis i will not offend ani more: 34:32 that which i see not
teach thou me: if i have done iniqu i will do no more

34:33 should it be accord to thi mind? he will recompens it
whether thou refus or whether thou choose; and not i: therefor
speak what thou knowest

34:34 let men of understand tell me and let a wise man hearken
unto me

34:35 job hath spoken without knowledg and hi word were without
wisdom

34:36 my desir is that job may be tri unto the end becaus of hi
answer for wick men

34:37 for he addeth rebellion unto hi sin he clappeth hi hand
among us and multiplieth hi word against god

35:1 elihu spake moreov and said 35:2 thinkest thou thi to be
right that thou saidst my righteous is more than gods? 35:3
for thou saidst what advantag will it be unto thee? and what profit
shall i have if i be cleans from my sin? 35:4 i will answer thee
and thi companion with thee

35:5 look unto the heaven and see; and behold the cloud which are
higher than thou

35:6 if thou sinnest what doest thou against him? or if thi
transgress be multipli what doest thou unto him? 35:7 if thou
be righteou what givest thou him? or what receiveth he of thine
hand? 35:8 thi wicked may hurt a man as thou art; and thi
righteous may profit the son of man

35:9 by reason of the multitud of oppress they make the oppress
to cry: they cri out by reason of the arm of the mighti

35:10 but none saith where is god my maker who giveth song in the
night; 35:11 who teacheth us more than the beast of the earth and
maketh us wiser than the fowl of heaven? 35:12 there they cri but
none giveth answer becaus of the pride of evil men

35:13 sure god will not hear vaniti neither will the almighti
regard it

35:14 although thou sayest thou shalt not see him yet judgment is
befor him; therefor trust thou in him

35:15 but now becaus it is not so he hath visit in hi anger; yet
he knoweth it not in great extremity: 35:16 therefor doth job open
hi mouth in vain; he multiplieth word without knowledg

36:1 elihu also proceed and said 36:2 suffer me a littl and i
will shew thee that i have yet to speak on god behalf
