36:3 i will fetch my knowledg from afar and will ascrib
righteous to my maker

36:4 for truli my word shall not be false: he that is perfect in
knowledg is with thee

36:5 behold god is mighti and despiseth not any: he is mighti in
strength and wisdom

36:6 he preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the
poor

36:7 he withdraweth not hi eye from the righteous: but with king
are they on the throne; yea he doth establish them for ever and they
are exalt

36:8 and if they be bound in fetter and be holden in cord of
affliction; 36:9 then he sheweth them their work and their
transgress that they have exceed

36:10 he openeth also their ear to disciplin and commandeth that
they return from iniqu

36:11 if they obey and serv him they shall spend their day in
prosper and their year in pleasur

36:12 but if they obey not they shall perish by the sword and they
shall die without knowledg

36:13 but the hypocrit in heart heap up wrath: they cri not when he
bindeth them

36:14 they die in youth and their life is among the unclean

36:15 he delivereth the poor in hi afflict and openeth their ear
in oppress

36:16 even so would he have remov thee out of the strait into a
broad place where there is no straitness; and that which should be
set on thi tabl should be full of fat

36:17 but thou hast fulfil the judgment of the wicked: judgment and
justic take hold on thee

36:18 becaus there is wrath bewar lest he take thee away with hi
stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliv thee

36:19 will he esteem thi riches? no not gold nor all the forc of
strength

36:20 desir not the night when peopl are cut off in their place

36:21 take heed regard not iniquity: for thi hast thou chosen rather
than afflict

36:22 behold god exalteth by hi power: who teacheth like him? 36:23
who hath enjoin him hi way? or who can say thou hast wrought
iniquity? 36:24 rememb that thou magnifi hi work which men
behold

36:25 everi man may see it; man may behold it afar off

36:26 behold god is great and we know him not neither can the
number of hi year be search out

36:27 for he maketh small the drop of water: they pour down rain
accord to the vapour thereof: 36:28 which the cloud do drop and
distil upon man abundantli

36:29 also can ani understand the spread of the cloud or the
nois of hi tabernacle? 36:30 behold he spreadeth hi light upon
it and covereth the bottom of the sea

36:31 for by them judgeth he the people; he giveth meat in abund

36:32 with cloud he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to
shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt

36:33 the nois thereof sheweth concern it the cattl also
concern the vapour

37:1 at thi also my heart trembleth and is move out of hi place

37:2 hear attent the nois of hi voic and the sound that goeth
out of hi mouth

37:3 he directeth it under the whole heaven and hi lightn unto
the end of the earth

37:4 after it a voic roareth: he thundereth with the voic of hi
excellency; and he will not stay them when hi voic is heard

37:5 god thundereth marvel with hi voice; great thing doeth
he which we cannot comprehend

37:6 for he saith to the snow be thou on the earth; likewis to the
small rain and to the great rain of hi strength

37:7 he sealeth up the hand of everi man; that all men may know hi
work

37:8 then the beast go into den and remain in their place

37:9 out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north

37:10 by the breath of god frost is given: and the breadth of the
water is straiten

37:11 also by water he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth hi
bright cloud: 37:12 and it is turn round about by hi counsels: that
they may do whatsoev he commandeth them upon the face of the world
in the earth

37:13 he causeth it to come whether for correct or for hi land
or for merci

37:14 hearken unto thi o job: stand still and consid the wondrou
work of god

37:15 dost thou know when god dispos them and caus the light of
hi cloud to shine? 37:16 dost thou know the balanc of the
cloud the wondrou work of him which is perfect in knowledge?
37:17 how thi garment are warm when he quieteth the earth by the
south wind? 37:18 hast thou with him spread out the sky which is
strong and as a molten look glass? 37:19 teach us what we shall
say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of dark

37:20 shall it be told him that i speak? if a man speak sure he
shall be swallow up

37:21 and now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but
the wind passeth and cleanseth them

37:22 fair weather cometh out of the north: with god is terribl
majesti

37:23 touch the almighti we cannot find him out: he is excel
in power and in judgment and in plenti of justice: he will not
afflict

37:24 men do therefor fear him: he respecteth not ani that are wise
of heart

38:1 then the lord answer job out of the whirlwind and said 38:2
who is thi that darkeneth counsel by word without knowledge? 38:3
gird up now thi loin like a man; for i will demand of thee and
answer thou me

38:4 where wast thou when i laid the foundat of the earth?
declar if thou hast understand

38:5 who hath laid the measur thereof if thou knowest? or who hath
stretch the line upon it? 38:6 whereupon are the foundat
thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof; 38:7 when the
morn star sang togeth and all the son of god shout for joy?
38:8 or who shut up the sea with door when it brake forth as if it
had issu out of the womb? 38:9 when i made the cloud the garment
thereof and thick dark a swaddlingband for it 38:10 and brake up
for it my decre place and set bar and door 38:11 and said
hitherto shalt thou come but no further: and here shall thi proud
wave be stayed? 38:12 hast thou command the morn sinc thi
days; and caus the dayspr to know hi place; 38:13 that it might
take hold of the end of the earth that the wick might be shaken
out of it? 38:14 it is turn as clay to the seal; and they stand as
a garment

38:15 and from the wick their light is withholden and the high arm
shall be broken

38:16 hast thou enter into the spring of the sea? or hast thou
walk in the search of the depth? 38:17 have the gate of death been
open unto thee? or hast thou seen the door of the shadow of death?
38:18 hast thou perceiv the breadth of the earth? declar if thou
knowest it all

38:19 where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for dark
where is the place thereof 38:20 that thou shouldest take it to the
bound thereof and that thou shouldest know the path to the hous
thereof? 38:21 knowest thou it becaus thou wast then born? or
becaus the number of thi day is great? 38:22 hast thou enter into
the treasur of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasur of the
hail 38:23 which i have reserv against the time of troubl against
the day of battl and war? 38:24 by what way is the light part
which scattereth the east wind upon the earth? 38:25 who hath divid
a watercours for the overflow of water or a way for the
lightn of thunder; 38:26 to caus it to rain on the earth where no
man is; on the wilder wherein there is no man; 38:27 to satisfi
the desol and wast ground; and to caus the bud of the tender herb
to spring forth? 38:28 hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten
the drop of dew? 38:29 out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoari
frost of heaven who hath gender it? 38:30 the water are hid as
with a stone and the face of the deep is frozen

38:31 canst thou bind the sweet influenc of pleiad or loos the
band of orion? 38:32 canst thou bring forth mazzaroth in hi season?
or canst thou guid arcturu with hi sons? 38:33 knowest thou the
ordin of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the
earth? 38:34 canst thou lift up thi voic to the cloud that
abund of water may cover thee? 38:35 canst thou send lightn
that they may go and say unto thee here we are? 38:36 who hath put
wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understand to the
heart? 38:37 who can number the cloud in wisdom? or who can stay the
bottl of heaven 38:38 when the dust groweth into hard and the
clod cleav fast together? 38:39 wilt thou hunt the prey for the
lion? or fill the appetit of the young lion 38:40 when they couch
in their den and abid in the covert to lie in wait? 38:41 who
provideth for the raven hi food? when hi young one cri unto god
they wander for lack of meat

39:1 knowest thou the time when the wild goat of the rock bring
forth? or canst thou mark when the hind do calve? 39:2 canst thou
number the month that they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they
bring forth? 39:3 they bow themselv they bring forth their young
one they cast out their sorrow

39:4 their young one are in good like they grow up with corn; they
go forth and return not unto them

39:5 who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loos the band
of the wild ass? 39:6 whose hous i have made the wilder and the
barren land hi dwell

39:7 he scorneth the multitud of the citi neither regardeth he the
cri of the driver

39:8 the rang of the mountain is hi pastur and he searcheth after
everi green thing

39:9 will the unicorn be will to serv thee or abid by thi crib?
39:10 canst thou bind the unicorn with hi band in the furrow? or will
he harrow the valley after thee? 39:11 wilt thou trust him becaus
hi strength is great? or wilt thou leav thi labour to him? 39:12
wilt thou believ him that he will bring home thi seed and gather it
into thi barn? 39:13 gavest thou the goodli wing unto the peacocks?
or wing and feather unto the ostrich? 39:14 which leaveth her egg
in the earth and warmeth them in dust 39:15 and forgetteth that the
foot may crush them or that the wild beast may break them

39:16 she is harden against her young one as though they were not
hers: her labour is in vain without fear; 39:17 becaus god hath
depriv her of wisdom neither hath he impart to her understand

39:18 what time she lifteth up herself on high she scorneth the hors
and hi rider

39:19 hast thou given the hors strength? hast thou cloth hi neck
with thunder? 39:20 canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the
glori of hi nostril is terribl

39:21 he paweth in the valley and rejoiceth in hi strength: he goeth
on to meet the arm men

39:22 he mocketh at fear and is not affrighted; neither turneth he
back from the sword

39:23 the quiver rattleth against him the glitter spear and the
shield

39:24 he swalloweth the ground with fierc and rage: neither
believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet

39:25 he saith among the trumpet ha ha; and he smelleth the battl
afar off the thunder of the captain and the shout

39:26 doth the hawk fli by thi wisdom and stretch her wing toward
the south? 39:27 doth the eagl mount up at thi command and make her
nest on high? 39:28 she dwelleth and abideth on the rock upon the
crag of the rock and the strong place

39:29 from thenc she seeketh the prey and her eye behold afar off

39:30 her young one also suck up blood: and where the slain are
there is she

40:1 moreov the lord answer job and said 40:2 shall he that
contendeth with the almighti instruct him? he that reproveth god let
him answer it

40:3 then job answer the lord and said 40:4 behold i am vile;
what shall i answer thee? i will lay mine hand upon my mouth

40:5 onc have i spoken; but i will not answer: yea twice; but i will
proceed no further

40:6 then answer the lord unto job out of the whirlwind and said
40:7 gird up thi loin now like a man: i will demand of thee and
declar thou unto me

40:8 wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me that
thou mayest be righteous? 40:9 hast thou an arm like god? or canst
thou thunder with a voic like him? 40:10 deck thyself now with
majesti and excellency; and array thyself with glori and beauti

40:11 cast abroad the rage of thi wrath: and behold everi one that is
proud and abas him

40:12 look on everi one that is proud and bring him low; and tread
down the wick in their place

40:13 hide them in the dust together; and bind their face in secret

40:14 then will i also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can
save thee

40:15 behold now behemoth which i made with thee; he eateth grass as
an ox

40:16 lo now hi strength is in hi loin and hi forc is in the
navel of hi belli

40:17 he moveth hi tail like a cedar: the sinew of hi stone are
wrap togeth

40:18 hi bone are as strong piec of brass; hi bone are like bar
of iron

40:19 he is the chief of the way of god: he that made him can make
hi sword to approach unto him

40:20 sure the mountain bring him forth food where all the beast
of the field play

40:21 he lieth under the shadi tree in the covert of the reed and
fen

40:22 the shadi tree cover him with their shadow; the willow of the
brook compass him about

40:23 behold he drinketh up a river and hasteth not: he trusteth
that he can draw up jordan into hi mouth

40:24 he taketh it with hi eyes: hi nose pierceth through snare

41:1 canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or hi tongu with a
cord which thou lettest down? 41:2 canst thou put an hook into hi
nose? or bore hi jaw through with a thorn? 41:3 will he make mani
supplic unto thee? will he speak soft word unto thee? 41:4
will he make a coven with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant
for ever? 41:5 wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou
bind him for thi maidens? 41:6 shall the companion make a banquet of
him? shall they part him among the merchants? 41:7 canst thou fill
hi skin with barb irons? or hi head with fish spears? 41:8 lay
thine hand upon him rememb the battl do no more

41:9 behold the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down
even at the sight of him? 41:10 none is so fierc that dare stir him
up: who then is abl to stand befor me? 41:11 who hath prevent me
that i should repay him? whatsoev is under the whole heaven is mine

41:12 i will not conceal hi part nor hi power nor hi come
proport

41:13 who can discov the face of hi garment? or who can come to him
with hi doubl bridle? 41:14 who can open the door of hi face? hi
teeth are terribl round about

41:15 hi scale are hi pride shut up togeth as with a close seal

41:16 one is so near to anoth that no air can come between them

41:17 they are join one to anoth they stick togeth that they
cannot be sunder

41:18 by hi nees a light doth shine and hi eye are like the
eyelid of the morn

41:19 out of hi mouth go burn lamp and spark of fire leap out

41:20 out of hi nostril goeth smoke as out of a seeth pot or
caldron

41:21 hi breath kindleth coal and a flame goeth out of hi mouth

41:22 in hi neck remaineth strength and sorrow is turn into joy
befor him

41:23 the flake of hi flesh are join together: they are firm in
themselves; they cannot be move

41:24 hi heart is as firm as a stone; yea as hard as a piec of the
nether millston

41:25 when he raiseth up himself the mighti are afraid: by reason of
break they purifi themselv

41:26 the sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear the
dart nor the habergeon

41:27 he esteemeth iron as straw and brass as rotten wood

41:28 the arrow cannot make him flee: slingston are turn with him
into stubbl

41:29 dart are count as stubble: he laugheth at the shake of a
spear

41:30 sharp stone are under him: he spreadeth sharp point thing
upon the mire

41:31 he maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a
pot of ointment

41:32 he maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to
be hoari

41:33 upon earth there is not hi like who is made without fear

41:34 he beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children
of pride

42:1 then job answer the lord and said 42:2 i know that thou canst
do everi thing and that no thought can be withholden from thee

42:3 who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge? therefor have i
utter that i understood not; thing too wonder for me which i
knew not

42:4 hear i beseech thee and i will speak: i will demand of thee
and declar thou unto me

42:5 i have heard of thee by the hear of the ear: but now mine eye
seeth thee

42:6 wherefor i abhor myself and repent in dust and ash

42:7 and it wa so that after the lord had spoken these word unto
job the lord said to eliphaz the temanit my wrath is kindl
against thee and against thi two friends: for ye have not spoken of
me the thing that is right as my servant job hath

42:8 therefor take unto you now seven bullock and seven ram and go
to my servant job and offer up for yourselv a burnt offering; and
my servant job shall pray for you: for him will i accept: lest i deal
with you after your folli in that ye have not spoken of me the thing
which is right like my servant job

42:9 so eliphaz the temanit and bildad the shuhit and zophar the
naamathit went and did accord as the lord command them: the
lord also accept job

42:10 and the lord turn the captiv of job when he pray for hi
friends: also the lord gave job twice as much as he had befor

42:11 then came there unto him all hi brethren and all hi sister
and all they that had been of hi acquaint befor and did eat
bread with him in hi house: and they bemoan him and comfort him
over all the evil that the lord had brought upon him: everi man also
gave him a piec of money and everi one an ear of gold

42:12 so the lord bless the latter end of job more than hi
beginning: for he had fourteen thousand sheep and six thousand
camel and a thousand yoke of oxen and a thousand she ass

42:13 he had also seven son and three daughter

42:14 and he call the name of the first jemima; and the name of the
second kezia; and the name of the third kerenhappuch

42:15 and in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughter
of job: and their father gave them inherit among their brethren

42:16 after thi live job an hundr and forti year and saw hi
son and hi son son even four gener

42:17 so job die be old and full of day




the book of psalm


1:1 bless is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodli
nor standeth in the way of sinner nor sitteth in the seat of the
scorn

1:2 but hi delight is in the law of the lord; and in hi law doth he
medit day and night

1:3 and he shall be like a tree plant by the river of water that
bringeth forth hi fruit in hi season; hi leaf also shall not
wither; and whatsoev he doeth shall prosper

1:4 the ungodli are not so: but are like the chaff which the wind
driveth away

1:5 therefor the ungodli shall not stand in the judgment nor sinner
in the congreg of the righteou

1:6 for the lord knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the
ungodli shall perish



2:1 whi do the heathen rage and the peopl imagin a vain thing?

2:2 the king of the earth set themselv and the ruler take counsel
togeth against the lord and against hi anoint say

2:3 let us break their band asund and cast away their cord from
us

2:4 he that sitteth in the heaven shall laugh: the lord shall have
them in deris

2:5 then shall he speak unto them in hi wrath and vex them in hi
sore displeasur

2:6 yet have i set my king upon my holi hill of zion

2:7 i will declar the decree: the lord hath said unto me thou art my
son; thi day have i begotten thee

2:8 ask of me and i shall give thee the heathen for thine
inherit and the uttermost part of the earth for thi possess

2:9 thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in
piec like a potter vessel

2:10 be wise now therefor o ye kings: be instruct ye judg of
the earth

2:11 serv the lord with fear and rejoic with trembl

2:12 kiss the son lest he be angri and ye perish from the way when
hi wrath is kindl but a littl bless are all they that put their
trust in him



3:1 lord how are they increas that troubl me! mani are they that
rise up against me

3:2 mani there be which say of my soul there is no help for him in
god

selah

3:3 but thou o lord art a shield for me; my glori and the lifter up
of mine head

3:4 i cri unto the lord with my voic and he heard me out of hi
holi hill selah

3:5 i laid me down and slept; i awaked; for the lord sustain me

3:6 i will not be afraid of ten thousand of peopl that have set
themselv against me round about

3:7 aris o lord; save me o my god: for thou hast smitten all mine
enemi upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the
ungodli

3:8 salvat belongeth unto the lord: thi bless is upon thi
peopl

selah



4:1 hear me when i call o god of my righteousness: thou hast enlarg
me when i wa in distress; have merci upon me and hear my prayer

4:2 o ye son of men how long will ye turn my glori into shame? how
long will ye love vaniti and seek after leasing? selah

4:3 but know that the lord hath set apart him that is godli for
himself: the lord will hear when i call unto him

4:4 stand in awe and sin not: commun with your own heart upon your
bed and be still selah

4:5 offer the sacrific of righteous and put your trust in the
lord

4:6 there be mani that say who will shew us ani good? lord lift thou
up the light of thi counten upon us

4:7 thou hast put glad in my heart more than in the time that
their corn and their wine increas

4:8 i will both lay me down in peac and sleep: for thou lord onli
makest me dwell in safeti



5:1 give ear to my word o lord consid my medit

5:2 hearken unto the voic of my cri my king and my god: for unto
thee will i pray

5:3 my voic shalt thou hear in the morn o lord; in the morn
will i direct my prayer unto thee and will look up

5:4 for thou art not a god that hath pleasur in wickedness: neither
shall evil dwell with thee

5:5 the foolish shall not stand in thi sight: thou hatest all worker
of iniqu

5:6 thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the lord will abhor
the bloodi and deceit man

5:7 but as for me i will come into thi hous in the multitud of thi
mercy: and in thi fear will i worship toward thi holi templ

5:8 lead me o lord in thi righteous becaus of mine enemies;
make thi way straight befor my face

5:9 for there is no faith in their mouth; their inward part is
veri wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with
their tongu

5:10 destroy thou them o god; let them fall by their own counsels;
cast them out in the multitud of their transgressions; for they have
rebel against thee

5:11 but let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them
ever shout for joy becaus thou defendest them: let them also that
love thi name be joy in thee

5:12 for thou lord wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou
compass him as with a shield



6:1 o lord rebuk me not in thine anger neither chasten me in thi
hot displeasur

6:2 have merci upon me o lord; for i am weak: o lord heal me; for my
bone are vex

6:3 my soul is also sore vexed: but thou o lord how long?

6:4 return o lord deliv my soul: oh save me for thi merci sake

6:5 for in death there is no remembr of thee: in the grave who
shall give thee thanks?

6:6 i am weari with my groaning; all the night make i my bed to swim;
i water my couch with my tear

6:7 mine eye is consum becaus of grief; it waxeth old becaus of
all mine enemi

6:8 depart from me all ye worker of iniquity; for the lord hath
heard the voic of my weep

6:9 the lord hath heard my supplication; the lord will receiv my
prayer

6:10 let all mine enemi be asham and sore vexed: let them return
and be asham suddenli



7:1 o lord my god in thee do i put my trust: save me from all them
that persecut me and deliv me:

7:2 lest he tear my soul like a lion rend it in piec while
there is none to deliv

7:3 o lord my god if i have done this; if there be iniqu in my
hands;

7:4 if i have reward evil unto him that wa at peac with me; (yea
i have deliv him that without caus is mine enemy:)

7:5 let the enemi persecut my soul and take it; yea let him tread
down my life upon the earth and lay mine honour in the dust selah

7:6 aris o lord in thine anger lift up thyself becaus of the rage
of mine enemies: and awak for me to the judgment that thou hast
command

7:7 so shall the congreg of the peopl compass thee about: for
their sake therefor return thou on high

7:8 the lord shall judg the people: judg me o lord accord to my
righteous and accord to mine integr that is in me

7:9 oh let the wicked of the wick come to an end; but establish
the just: for the righteou god trieth the heart and rein

7:10 my defenc is of god which saveth the upright in heart

7:11 god judgeth the righteou and god is angri with the wick everi
day

7:12 if he turn not he will whet hi sword; he hath bent hi bow and
made it readi

7:13 he hath also prepar for him the instrument of death; he
ordaineth hi arrow against the persecutor

7:14 behold he travaileth with iniqu and hath conceiv mischief
and brought forth falsehood

7:15 he made a pit and dig it and is fallen into the ditch which
he made

7:16 hi mischief shall return upon hi own head and hi violent
deal shall come down upon hi own pate

7:17 i will prais the lord accord to hi righteousness: and will
sing prais to the name of the lord most high



8:1 o lord our lord how excel is thi name in all the earth! who
hast set thi glori abov the heaven

8:2 out of the mouth of babe and suckl hast thou ordain
strength becaus of thine enemi that thou mightest still the enemi
and the aveng

8:3 when i consid thi heaven the work of thi finger the moon and
the star which thou hast ordained;

8:4 what is man that thou art mind of him? and the son of man
that thou visitest him?

8:5 for thou hast made him a littl lower than the angel and hast
crown him with glori and honour

8:6 thou madest him to have dominion over the work of thi hands; thou
hast put all thing under hi feet:

8:7 all sheep and oxen yea and the beast of the field;

8:8 the fowl of the air and the fish of the sea and whatsoev
passeth through the path of the sea

8:9 o lord our lord how excel is thi name in all the earth!





9:1 i will prais thee o lord with my whole heart; i will shew forth
all thi marvel work

9:2 i will be glad and rejoic in thee: i will sing prais to thi
name o thou most high

9:3 when mine enemi are turn back they shall fall and perish at
thi presenc

9:4 for thou hast maintain my right and my cause; thou satest in the
throne judg right

9:5 thou hast rebuk the heathen thou hast destroy the wick
thou hast put out their name for ever and ever

9:6 o thou enemi destruct are come to a perpetu end: and thou
hast destroy cities; their memori is perish with them

9:7 but the lord shall endur for ever: he hath prepar hi throne
for judgment

9:8 and he shall judg the world in righteous he shall minist
judgment to the peopl in upright

9:9 the lord also will be a refug for the oppress a refug in
time of troubl

9:10 and they that know thi name will put their trust in thee: for
thou lord hast not forsaken them that seek thee

9:11 sing prais to the lord which dwelleth in zion: declar among
the peopl hi do

9:12 when he maketh inquisit for blood he remembereth them: he
forgetteth not the cri of the humbl

9:13 have merci upon me o lord; consid my troubl which i suffer of
them that hate me thou that liftest me up from the gate of death:

9:14 that i may shew forth all thi prais in the gate of the daughter
of zion: i will rejoic in thi salvat

9:15 the heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net
which they hid is their own foot taken

9:16 the lord is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wick
is snare in the work of hi own hand higgaion selah

9:17 the wick shall be turn into hell and all the nation that
forget god

9:18 for the needi shall not alway be forgotten: the expect of
the poor shall not perish for ever

9:19 aris o lord; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judg in
thi sight

9:20 put them in fear o lord: that the nation may know themselv to
be but men selah



10:1 whi standest thou afar off o lord? whi hidest thou thyself in
time of trouble?

10:2 the wick in hi pride doth persecut the poor: let them be
taken in the devic that they have imagin

10:3 for the wick boasteth of hi heart desir and blesseth the
covet whom the lord abhorreth

10:4 the wick through the pride of hi counten will not seek
after god: god is not in all hi thought

10:5 hi way are alway grievous; thi judgment are far abov out of
hi sight: as for all hi enemi he puffeth at them

10:6 he hath said in hi heart i shall not be moved: for i shall
never be in advers

10:7 hi mouth is full of curs and deceit and fraud: under hi
tongu is mischief and vaniti

10:8 he sitteth in the lurk place of the villages: in the secret
place doth he murder the innocent: hi eye are privili set against
the poor

10:9 he lieth in wait secretli as a lion in hi den: he lieth in wait
to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor when he draweth him into
hi net

10:10 he croucheth and humbleth himself that the poor may fall by
hi strong one

10:11 he hath said in hi heart god hath forgotten: he hideth hi
face; he will never see it

10:12 aris o lord; o god lift up thine hand: forget not the humbl

10:13 wherefor doth the wick contemn god? he hath said in hi
heart thou wilt not requir it

10:14 thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite to
requit it with thi hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou
art the helper of the fatherless

10:15 break thou the arm of the wick and the evil man: seek out hi
wicked till thou find none

10:16 the lord is king for ever and ever: the heathen are perish out
of hi land

10:17 lord thou hast heard the desir of the humble: thou wilt
prepar their heart thou wilt caus thine ear to hear:

10:18 to judg the fatherless and the oppress that the man of the
earth may no more oppress



11:1 in the lord put i my trust: how say ye to my soul flee as a bird
to your mountain?

11:2 for lo the wick bend their bow they make readi their arrow
upon the string that they may privili shoot at the upright in heart

11:3 if the foundat be destroy what can the righteou do?

11:4 the lord is in hi holi templ the lord throne is in heaven:
hi eye behold hi eyelid tri the children of men

11:5 the lord trieth the righteous: but the wick and him that loveth
violenc hi soul hateth

11:6 upon the wick he shall rain snare fire and brimston and an
horribl tempest: thi shall be the portion of their cup

11:7 for the righteou lord loveth righteousness; hi counten doth
behold the upright



12:1 help lord; for the godli man ceaseth; for the faith fail from
among the children of men

12:2 they speak vaniti everi one with hi neighbour: with flatter
lip and with a doubl heart do they speak

12:3 the lord shall cut off all flatter lip and the tongu that
speaketh proud things:

12:4 who have said with our tongu will we prevail; our lip are our
own: who is lord over us?

12:5 for the oppress of the poor for the sigh of the needi now
will i aris saith the lord; i will set him in safeti from him that
puffeth at him

12:6 the word of the lord are pure words: as silver tri in a
furnac of earth purifi seven time

12:7 thou shalt keep them o lord thou shalt preserv them from thi
gener for ever

12:8 the wick walk on everi side when the vilest men are exalt



13:1 how long wilt thou forget me o lord? for ever? how long wilt
thou hide thi face from me?

13:2 how long shall i take counsel in my soul have sorrow in my
heart daily? how long shall mine enemi be exalt over me?

13:3 consid and hear me o lord my god: lighten mine eye lest i
sleep the sleep of death;

13:4 lest mine enemi say i have prevail against him; and those that
troubl me rejoic when i am move

13:5 but i have trust in thi mercy; my heart shall rejoic in thi
salvat

13:6 i will sing unto the lord becaus he hath dealt bounti with
me



14:1 the fool hath said in hi heart there is no god they are
corrupt they have done abomin work there is none that doeth
good

14:2 the lord look down from heaven upon the children of men to see
if there were ani that did understand and seek god

14:3 they are all gone asid they are all togeth becom filthy:
there is none that doeth good no not one

14:4 have all the worker of iniqu no knowledge? who eat up my
peopl as they eat bread and call not upon the lord

14:5 there were they in great fear: for god is in the gener of
the righteou

14:6 ye have shame the counsel of the poor becaus the lord is hi
refug

14:7 oh that the salvat of israel were come out of zion! when the
lord bringeth back the captiv of hi peopl jacob shall rejoic
and israel shall be glad



15:1 lord who shall abid in thi tabernacle? who shall dwell in thi
holi hill?

15:2 he that walketh uprightli and worketh righteous and
speaketh the truth in hi heart

15:3 he that backbiteth not with hi tongu nor doeth evil to hi
neighbour nor taketh up a reproach against hi neighbour

15:4 in whose eye a vile person is contemned; but he honoureth them
that fear the lord he that sweareth to hi own hurt and changeth
not

15:5 he that putteth not out hi money to usuri nor taketh reward
against the innoc he that doeth these thing shall never be move



16:1 preserv me o god: for in thee do i put my trust

16:2 o my soul thou hast said unto the lord thou art my lord: my
good extendeth not to thee;

16:3 but to the saint that are in the earth and to the excel in
whom is all my delight

16:4 their sorrow shall be multipli that hasten after anoth god:
their drink offer of blood will i not offer nor take up their
name into my lip

16:5 the lord is the portion of mine inherit and of my cup: thou
maintainest my lot

16:6 the line are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea i have a
goodli heritag

16:7 i will bless the lord who hath given me counsel: my rein also
instruct me in the night season

16:8 i have set the lord alway befor me: becaus he is at my right
hand i shall not be move

16:9 therefor my heart is glad and my glori rejoiceth: my flesh also
shall rest in hope

16:10 for thou wilt not leav my soul in hell; neither wilt thou
suffer thine holi one to see corrupt

16:11 thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thi presenc is ful
of joy; at thi right hand there are pleasur for evermor



17:1 hear the right o lord attend unto my cri give ear unto my
prayer that goeth not out of feign lip

17:2 let my sentenc come forth from thi presence; let thine eye
behold the thing that are equal

17:3 thou hast prove mine heart; thou hast visit me in the night;
thou hast tri me and shalt find nothing; i am purpos that my
mouth shall not transgress

17:4 concern the work of men by the word of thi lip i have kept
me from the path of the destroy

17:5 hold up my go in thi path that my footstep slip not

17:6 i have call upon thee for thou wilt hear me o god: inclin
thine ear unto me and hear my speech

17:7 shew thi marvel lovingkind o thou that savest by thi
right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up
against them

17:8 keep me as the appl of the eye hide me under the shadow of thi
wing

17:9 from the wick that oppress me from my deadli enemi who
compass me about

17:10 they are inclos in their own fat: with their mouth they speak
proudli

17:11 they have now compass us in our steps: they have set their
eye bow down to the earth;

17:12 like as a lion that is greedi of hi prey and as it were a
young lion lurk in secret place

17:13 aris o lord disappoint him cast him down: deliv my soul
from the wick which is thi sword:

17:14 from men which are thi hand o lord from men of the world
which have their portion in thi life and whose belli thou fillest
with thi hid treasure: they are full of children and leav the rest
of their substanc to their babe

17:15 as for me i will behold thi face in righteousness: i shall be
satisfi when i awak with thi like



18:1 i will love thee o lord my strength

18:2 the lord is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer; my god
my strength in whom i will trust; my buckler and the horn of my
salvat and my high tower

18:3 i will call upon the lord who is worthi to be praised: so shall
i be save from mine enemi

18:4 the sorrow of death compass me and the flood of ungodli men
made me afraid

18:5 the sorrow of hell compass me about: the snare of death
prevent me

18:6 in my distress i call upon the lord and cri unto my god: he
heard my voic out of hi templ and my cri came befor him even
into hi ear

18:7 then the earth shook and trembled; the foundat also of the
hill move and were shaken becaus he wa wroth

18:8 there went up a smoke out of hi nostril and fire out of hi
mouth devoured: coal were kindl by it

18:9 he bow the heaven also and came down: and dark wa under
hi feet

18:10 and he rode upon a cherub and did fly: yea he did fli upon the
wing of the wind

18:11 he made dark hi secret place; hi pavilion round about him
were dark water and thick cloud of the sky

18:12 at the bright that wa befor him hi thick cloud pass
hail stone and coal of fire

18:13 the lord also thunder in the heaven and the highest gave hi
voice; hail stone and coal of fire

18:14 yea he sent out hi arrow and scatter them; and he shot out
lightn and discomfit them

18:15 then the channel of water were seen and the foundat of
the world were discov at thi rebuk o lord at the blast of the
breath of thi nostril

18:16 he sent from abov he took me he drew me out of mani water

18:17 he deliv me from my strong enemi and from them which hate
me: for they were too strong for me

18:18 they prevent me in the day of my calamity: but the lord wa my
stay

18:19 he brought me forth also into a larg place; he deliv me
becaus he delight in me

18:20 the lord reward me accord to my righteousness; accord to
the clean of my hand hath he recompens me

18:21 for i have kept the way of the lord and have not wickedli
depart from my god

18:22 for all hi judgment were befor me and i did not put away hi
statut from me

18:23 i wa also upright befor him and i kept myself from mine
iniqu

18:24 therefor hath the lord recompens me accord to my
righteous accord to the clean of my hand in hi eyesight

18:25 with the merci thou wilt shew thyself merciful; with an
upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright;

18:26 with the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward
thou wilt shew thyself froward

18:27 for thou wilt save the afflict people; but wilt bring down
high look

18:28 for thou wilt light my candle: the lord my god will enlighten my
dark

18:29 for by thee i have run through a troop; and by my god have i
leap over a wall

18:30 as for god hi way is perfect: the word of the lord is tried:
he is a buckler to all those that trust in him

18:31 for who is god save the lord? or who is a rock save our god?

18:32 it is god that girdeth me with strength and maketh my way
perfect

18:33 he maketh my feet like hind feet and setteth me upon my high
place

18:34 he teacheth my hand to war so that a bow of steel is broken by
mine arm

18:35 thou hast also given me the shield of thi salvation: and thi
right hand hath holden me up and thi gentl hath made me great

18:36 thou hast enlarg my step under me that my feet did not slip

18:37 i have pursu mine enemi and overtaken them: neither did i
turn again till they were consum

18:38 i have wound them that they were not abl to rise: they are
fallen under my feet

18:39 for thou hast gird me with strength unto the battle: thou hast
subdu under me those that rose up against me

18:40 thou hast also given me the neck of mine enemies; that i might
destroy them that hate me

18:41 they cri but there wa none to save them: even unto the lord
but he answer them not

18:42 then did i beat them small as the dust befor the wind: i did
cast them out as the dirt in the street

18:43 thou hast deliv me from the strive of the people; and
thou hast made me the head of the heathen: a peopl whom i have not
known shall serv me

18:44 as soon as they hear of me they shall obey me: the stranger
shall submit themselv unto me

18:45 the stranger shall fade away and be afraid out of their close
place

18:46 the lord liveth; and bless be my rock; and let the god of my
salvat be exalt

18:47 it is god that avengeth me and subdueth the peopl under me

18:48 he delivereth me from mine enemies: yea thou liftest me up
abov those that rise up against me: thou hast deliv me from the
violent man

18:49 therefor will i give thank unto thee o lord among the
heathen and sing prais unto thi name

18:50 great deliver giveth he to hi king; and sheweth merci to
hi anoint to david and to hi seed for evermor



19:1 the heaven declar the glori of god; and the firmament sheweth
hi handywork

19:2 day unto day uttereth speech and night unto night sheweth
knowledg

19:3 there is no speech nor languag where their voic is not heard

19:4 their line is gone out through all the earth and their word to
the end of the world in them hath he set a tabernacl for the sun

19:5 which is as a bridegroom come out of hi chamber and rejoiceth
as a strong man to run a race

19:6 hi go forth is from the end of the heaven and hi circuit
unto the end of it: and there is noth hid from the heat thereof

19:7 the law of the lord is perfect convert the soul: the
testimoni of the lord is sure make wise the simpl

19:8 the statut of the lord are right rejoic the heart: the
command of the lord is pure enlighten the eye

19:9 the fear of the lord is clean endur for ever: the judgment
of the lord are true and righteou altogeth

19:10 more to be desir are they than gold yea than much fine gold:
sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb

19:11 moreov by them is thi servant warned: and in keep of them
there is great reward

19:12 who can understand hi errors? cleans thou me from secret
fault

19:13 keep back thi servant also from presumptu sins; let them not
have dominion over me: then shall i be upright and i shall be
innoc from the great transgress

19:14 let the word of my mouth and the medit of my heart be
accept in thi sight o lord my strength and my redeem



20:1 the lord hear thee in the day of trouble; the name of the god of
jacob defend thee;

20:2 send thee help from the sanctuari and strengthen thee out of
zion;

20:3 rememb all thi offer and accept thi burnt sacrifice;
selah

20:4 grant thee accord to thine own heart and fulfil all thi
counsel

20:5 we will rejoic in thi salvat and in the name of our god we
will set up our banners: the lord fulfil all thi petit

20:6 now know i that the lord saveth hi anointed; he will hear him
from hi holi heaven with the save strength of hi right hand

20:7 some trust in chariot and some in horses: but we will rememb
the name of the lord our god

20:8 they are brought down and fallen: but we are risen and stand
upright

20:9 save lord: let the king hear us when we call



21:1 the king shall joy in thi strength o lord; and in thi salvat
how greatli shall he rejoice!

21:2 thou hast given him hi heart desir and hast not withholden
the request of hi lip selah

21:3 for thou preventest him with the bless of goodness: thou
settest a crown of pure gold on hi head

21:4 he ask life of thee and thou gavest it him even length of
day for ever and ever

21:5 hi glori is great in thi salvation: honour and majesti hast thou
laid upon him

21:6 for thou hast made him most bless for ever: thou hast made him
exceed glad with thi counten

21:7 for the king trusteth in the lord and through the merci of the
most high he shall not be move

21:8 thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thi right hand shall
find out those that hate thee

21:9 thou shalt make them as a fieri oven in the time of thine anger:
the lord shall swallow them up in hi wrath and the fire shall devour
them

21:10 their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth and their seed
from among the children of men

21:11 for they intend evil against thee: they imagin a mischiev
devic which they are not abl to perform

21:12 therefor shalt thou make them turn their back when thou shalt
make readi thine arrow upon thi string against the face of them

21:13 be thou exalt lord in thine own strength: so will we sing
and prais thi power



22:1 my god my god whi hast thou forsaken me? whi art thou so far
from help me and from the word of my roaring?

22:2 o my god i cri in the day time but thou hearest not; and in the
night season and am not silent

22:3 but thou art holi o thou that inhabitest the prais of israel

22:4 our father trust in thee: they trust and thou didst deliv
them

22:5 they cri unto thee and were delivered: they trust in thee
and were not confound

22:6 but i am a worm and no man; a reproach of men and despis of
the peopl

22:7 all they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip
they shake the head say

22:8 he trust on the lord that he would deliv him: let him deliv
him see he delight in him

22:9 but thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me
hope when i wa upon my mother breast

22:10 i wa cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my god from my
mother belli

22:11 be not far from me; for troubl is near; for there is none to
help

22:12 mani bull have compass me: strong bull of bashan have beset
me round

22:13 they gape upon me with their mouth as a raven and a
roar lion

22:14 i am pour out like water and all my bone are out of joint:
my heart is like wax; it is melt in the midst of my bowel

22:15 my strength is dri up like a potsherd; and my tongu cleaveth
to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death

22:16 for dog have compass me: the assembl of the wick have
inclos me: they pierc my hand and my feet

22:17 i may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me

22:18 they part my garment among them and cast lot upon my vestur

22:19 but be not thou far from me o lord: o my strength hast thee
to help me

22:20 deliv my soul from the sword; my darl from the power of the
dog

22:21 save me from the lion mouth: for thou hast heard me from the
horn of the unicorn

22:22 i will declar thi name unto my brethren: in the midst of the
congreg will i prais thee

22:23 ye that fear the lord prais him; all ye the seed of jacob
glorifi him; and fear him all ye the seed of israel

22:24 for he hath not despis nor abhor the afflict of the
afflicted; neither hath he hid hi face from him; but when he cri
unto him he heard

22:25 my prais shall be of thee in the great congregation: i will pay
my vow befor them that fear him

22:26 the meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall prais the lord
that seek him: your heart shall live for ever

22:27 all the end of the world shall rememb and turn unto the lord:
and all the kindr of the nation shall worship befor thee

22:28 for the kingdom is the lords: and he is the governor among the
nation

22:29 all they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they
that go down to the dust shall bow befor him: and none can keep aliv
hi own soul

22:30 a seed shall serv him; it shall be account to the lord for a
gener

22:31 they shall come and shall declar hi righteous unto a
peopl that shall be born that he hath done thi



23:1 the lord is my shepherd; i shall not want

23:2 he maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me besid
the still water

23:3 he restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the path of righteous
for hi name sake

23:4 yea though i walk through the valley of the shadow of death i
will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thi rod and thi staff they
comfort me

23:5 thou preparest a tabl befor me in the presenc of mine enemies:
thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over

23:6 sure good and merci shall follow me all the day of my
life: and i will dwell in the hous of the lord for ever



24:1 the earth is the lord and the ful thereof; the world and
they that dwell therein

24:2 for he hath found it upon the sea and establish it upon the
flood

24:3 who shall ascend into the hill of the lord? or who shall stand in
hi holi place?

24:4 he that hath clean hand and a pure heart; who hath not lift
up hi soul unto vaniti nor sworn deceit

24:5 he shall receiv the bless from the lord and righteous
from the god of hi salvat

24:6 thi is the gener of them that seek him that seek thi face
o jacob selah

24:7 lift up your head o ye gates; and be ye lift up ye everlast
doors; and the king of glori shall come in

24:8 who is thi king of glory? the lord strong and mighti the lord
mighti in battl

24:9 lift up your head o ye gates; even lift them up ye everlast
doors; and the king of glori shall come in

24:10 who is thi king of glory? the lord of host he is the king of
glori selah



25:1 unto thee o lord do i lift up my soul

25:2 o my god i trust in thee: let me not be asham let not mine
enemi triumph over me

25:3 yea let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be asham
which transgress without caus

25:4 shew me thi way o lord; teach me thi path

25:5 lead me in thi truth and teach me: for thou art the god of my
salvation; on thee do i wait all the day

25:6 rememb o lord thi tender merci and thi lovingkindnesses;
for they have been ever of old

25:7 rememb not the sin of my youth nor my transgressions:
accord to thi merci rememb thou me for thi good sake o
lord

25:8 good and upright is the lord: therefor will he teach sinner in
the way

25:9 the meek will he guid in judgment: and the meek will he teach
hi way

25:10 all the path of the lord are merci and truth unto such as keep
hi coven and hi testimoni

25:11 for thi name sake o lord pardon mine iniquity; for it is
great

25:12 what man is he that feareth the lord? him shall he teach in the
way that he shall choos

25:13 hi soul shall dwell at ease; and hi seed shall inherit the
earth

25:14 the secret of the lord is with them that fear him; and he will
shew them hi coven

25:15 mine eye are ever toward the lord; for he shall pluck my feet
out of the net

25:16 turn thee unto me and have merci upon me; for i am desol and
afflict

25:17 the troubl of my heart are enlarged: o bring thou me out of my
distress

25:18 look upon mine afflict and my pain; and forgiv all my sin

25:19 consid mine enemies; for they are many; and they hate me with
cruel hatr

25:20 o keep my soul and deliv me: let me not be ashamed; for i put
my trust in thee

25:21 let integr and upright preserv me; for i wait on thee

25:22 redeem israel o god out of all hi troubl



26:1 judg me o lord; for i have walk in mine integrity: i have
trust also in the lord; therefor i shall not slide

26:2 examin me o lord and prove me; tri my rein and my heart

26:3 for thi lovingkind is befor mine eyes: and i have walk in
thi truth

26:4 i have not sat with vain person neither will i go in with
dissembl

26:5 i have hate the congreg of evil doers; and will not sit
with the wick

26:6 i will wash mine hand in innocency: so will i compass thine
altar o lord:

26:7 that i may publish with the voic of thanksgiv and tell of
all thi wondrou work

26:8 lord i have love the habit of thi hous and the place
where thine honour dwelleth

26:9 gather not my soul with sinner nor my life with bloodi men:

26:10 in whose hand is mischief and their right hand is full of
bribe

26:11 but as for me i will walk in mine integrity: redeem me and be
merci unto me

26:12 my foot standeth in an even place: in the congreg will i
bless the lord



27:1 the lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall i fear? the
lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall i be afraid?

27:2 when the wick even mine enemi and my foe came upon me to
eat up my flesh they stumbl and fell

27:3 though an host should encamp against me my heart shall not fear:
though war should rise against me in thi will i be confid

27:4 one thing have i desir of the lord that will i seek after;
that i may dwell in the hous of the lord all the day of my life to
behold the beauti of the lord and to enquir in hi templ

27:5 for in the time of troubl he shall hide me in hi pavilion: in
the secret of hi tabernacl shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon
a rock

27:6 and now shall mine head be lift up abov mine enemi round
about me: therefor will i offer in hi tabernacl sacrific of joy;
i will sing yea i will sing prais unto the lord

27:7 hear o lord when i cri with my voice: have merci also upon me
and answer me

27:8 when thou saidst seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee thi
face lord will i seek

27:9 hide not thi face far from me; put not thi servant away in anger:
thou hast been my help; leav me not neither forsak me o god of my
salvat

27:10 when my father and my mother forsak me then the lord will take
me up

27:11 teach me thi way o lord and lead me in a plain path becaus
of mine enemi

27:12 deliv me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for fals
wit are risen up against me and such as breath out cruelti

27:13 i had faint unless i had believ to see the good of the
lord in the land of the live

27:14 wait on the lord: be of good courag and he shall strengthen
thine heart: wait i say on the lord



28:1 unto thee will i cri o lord my rock; be not silent to me: lest
if thou be silent to me i becom like them that go down into the pit

28:2 hear the voic of my supplic when i cri unto thee when i
lift up my hand toward thi holi oracl

28:3 draw me not away with the wick and with the worker of
iniqu which speak peac to their neighbour but mischief is in
their heart

28:4 give them accord to their deed and accord to the
wicked of their endeavours: give them after the work of their
hands; render to them their desert

28:5 becaus they regard not the work of the lord nor the oper
of hi hand he shall destroy them and not build them up

28:6 bless be the lord becaus he hath heard the voic of my
supplic

28:7 the lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trust in him
and i am helped: therefor my heart greatli rejoiceth; and with my
song will i prais him

28:8 the lord is their strength and he is the save strength of hi
anoint

28:9 save thi peopl and bless thine inheritance: feed them also and
lift them up for ever



29:1 give unto the lord o ye mighti give unto the lord glori and
strength

29:2 give unto the lord the glori due unto hi name; worship the lord
in the beauti of holi

29:3 the voic of the lord is upon the waters: the god of glori
thundereth: the lord is upon mani water

29:4 the voic of the lord is powerful; the voic of the lord is full
of majesti

29:5 the voic of the lord breaketh the cedars; yea the lord breaketh
the cedar of lebanon

29:6 he maketh them also to skip like a calf; lebanon and sirion like
a young unicorn

29:7 the voic of the lord divideth the flame of fire

29:8 the voic of the lord shaketh the wilderness; the lord shaketh
the wilder of kadesh

29:9 the voic of the lord maketh the hind to calv and discovereth
the forests: and in hi templ doth everi one speak of hi glori

29:10 the lord sitteth upon the flood; yea the lord sitteth king for
ever

29:11 the lord will give strength unto hi people; the lord will bless
hi peopl with peac



30:1 i will extol thee o lord; for thou hast lift me up and hast
not made my foe to rejoic over me

30:2 o lord my god i cri unto thee and thou hast heal me

30:3 o lord thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast
kept me aliv that i should not go down to the pit

30:4 sing unto the lord o ye saint of hi and give thank at the
remembr of hi holi

30:5 for hi anger endureth but a moment; in hi favour is life:
weep may endur for a night but joy cometh in the morn

30:6 and in my prosper i said i shall never be move

30:7 lord by thi favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong:
thou didst hide thi face and i wa troubl

30:8 i cri to thee o lord; and unto the lord i made supplic

30:9 what profit is there in my blood when i go down to the pit?
shall the dust prais thee? shall it declar thi truth?

30:10 hear o lord and have merci upon me: lord be thou my helper

30:11 thou hast turn for me my mourn into dancing: thou hast put
off my sackcloth and gird me with gladness;

30:12 to the end that my glori may sing prais to thee and not be
silent

o lord my god i will give thank unto thee for ever



31:1 in thee o lord do i put my trust; let me never be ashamed:
deliv me in thi righteous

31:2 bow down thine ear to me; deliv me speedily: be thou my strong
rock for an hous of defenc to save me

31:3 for thou art my rock and my fortress; therefor for thi name
sake lead me and guid me

31:4 pull me out of the net that they have laid privili for me: for
thou art my strength

31:5 into thine hand i commit my spirit: thou hast redeem me o lord
god of truth

31:6 i have hate them that regard lie vanities: but i trust in the
lord

31:7 i will be glad and rejoic in thi mercy: for thou hast consid
my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;

31:8 and hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set
my feet in a larg room

31:9 have merci upon me o lord for i am in trouble: mine eye is
consum with grief yea my soul and my belli

31:10 for my life is spent with grief and my year with sighing: my
strength faileth becaus of mine iniqu and my bone are consum

31:11 i wa a reproach among all mine enemi but especi among my
neighbour and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me
without fled from me

31:12 i am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: i am like a broken
vessel

31:13 for i have heard the slander of many: fear wa on everi side:
while they took counsel togeth against me they devis to take away
my life

31:14 but i trust in thee o lord: i said thou art my god

31:15 my time are in thi hand: deliv me from the hand of mine
enemi and from them that persecut me

31:16 make thi face to shine upon thi servant: save me for thi
merci sake

31:17 let me not be asham o lord; for i have call upon thee: let
the wick be asham and let them be silent in the grave

31:18 let the lie lip be put to silence; which speak grievou
thing proudli and contemptu against the righteou

31:19 oh how great is thi good which thou hast laid up for them
that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee
befor the son of men!

31:20 thou shalt hide them in the secret of thi presenc from the
pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretli in a pavilion from the
strife of tongu

31:21 bless be the lord: for he hath shew me hi marvel
kind in a strong citi

31:22 for i said in my hast i am cut off from befor thine eyes:
nevertheless thou heardest the voic of my supplic when i cri
unto thee

31:23 o love the lord all ye hi saints: for the lord preserveth the
faith and plenti rewardeth the proud doer

31:24 be of good courag and he shall strengthen your heart all ye
that hope in the lord



32:1 bless is he whose transgress is forgiven whose sin is
cover

32:2 bless is the man unto whom the lord imputeth not iniqu and
in whose spirit there is no guil

32:3 when i kept silenc my bone wax old through my roar all
the day long

32:4 for day and night thi hand wa heavi upon me: my moistur is
turn into the drought of summer selah

32:5 i acknowledg my sin unto thee and mine iniqu have i not hid
i said i will confess my transgress unto the lord; and thou
forgavest the iniqu of my sin selah

32:6 for thi shall everi one that is godli pray unto thee in a time
when thou mayest be found: sure in the flood of great water they
shall not come nigh unto him

32:7 thou art my hide place; thou shalt preserv me from trouble;
thou shalt compass me about with song of deliver selah

32:8 i will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt
go: i will guid thee with mine eye

32:9 be ye not as the hors or as the mule which have no
understanding: whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridl lest
they come near unto thee

32:10 mani sorrow shall be to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the
lord merci shall compass him about

32:11 be glad in the lord and rejoic ye righteous: and shout for
joy all ye that are upright in heart



33:1 rejoic in the lord o ye righteous: for prais is come for the
upright

33:2 prais the lord with harp: sing unto him with the psalteri and an
instrument of ten string

33:3 sing unto him a new song; play skil with a loud nois

33:4 for the word of the lord is right; and all hi work are done in
truth

33:5 he loveth righteous and judgment: the earth is full of the
good of the lord

33:6 by the word of the lord were the heaven made; and all the host
of them by the breath of hi mouth

33:7 he gathereth the water of the sea togeth as an heap: he layeth
up the depth in storehous

33:8 let all the earth fear the lord: let all the inhabit of the
world stand in awe of him

33:9 for he spake and it wa done; he command and it stood fast

33:10 the lord bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought: he
maketh the devic of the peopl of none effect

33:11 the counsel of the lord standeth for ever the thought of hi
heart to all gener

33:12 bless is the nation whose god is the lord; and the peopl whom
he hath chosen for hi own inherit

33:13 the lord looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the son of men

33:14 from the place of hi habit he looketh upon all the
inhabit of the earth

33:15 he fashioneth their heart alike; he considereth all their
work

33:16 there is no king save by the multitud of an host: a mighti man
is not deliv by much strength

33:17 an hors is a vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliv
ani by hi great strength

33:18 behold the eye of the lord is upon them that fear him upon
them that hope in hi mercy;

33:19 to deliv their soul from death and to keep them aliv in
famin

33:20 our soul waiteth for the lord: he is our help and our shield

33:21 for our heart shall rejoic in him becaus we have trust in
hi holi name

33:22 let thi merci o lord be upon us accord as we hope in thee



34:1 i will bless the lord at all times: hi prais shall continu
be in my mouth

34:2 my soul shall make her boast in the lord: the humbl shall hear
thereof and be glad

34:3 o magnifi the lord with me and let us exalt hi name togeth

34:4 i sought the lord and he heard me and deliv me from all my
fear

34:5 they look unto him and were lightened: and their face were
not asham

34:6 thi poor man cri and the lord heard him and save him out of
all hi troubl

34:7 the angel of the lord encampeth round about them that fear him
and delivereth them

34:8 o tast and see that the lord is good: bless is the man that
trusteth in him

34:9 o fear the lord ye hi saints: for there is no want to them that
fear him

34:10 the young lion do lack and suffer hunger: but they that seek
the lord shall not want ani good thing

34:11 come ye children hearken unto me: i will teach you the fear of
the lord

34:12 what man is he that desireth life and loveth mani day that he
may see good?

34:13 keep thi tongu from evil and thi lip from speak guil

34:14 depart from evil and do good; seek peac and pursu it

34:15 the eye of the lord are upon the righteou and hi ear are
open unto their cri

34:16 the face of the lord is against them that do evil to cut off
the remembr of them from the earth

34:17 the righteou cri and the lord heareth and delivereth them out
of all their troubl

34:18 the lord is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and
saveth such as be of a contrit spirit

34:19 mani are the afflict of the righteous: but the lord
delivereth him out of them all

34:20 he keepeth all hi bones: not one of them is broken

34:21 evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteou
shall be desol

34:22 the lord redeemeth the soul of hi servants: and none of them
that trust in him shall be desol



35:1 plead my caus o lord with them that strive with me: fight
against them that fight against me

35:2 take hold of shield and buckler and stand up for mine help

35:3 draw out also the spear and stop the way against them that
persecut me: say unto my soul i am thi salvat

35:4 let them be confound and put to shame that seek after my soul:
let them be turn back and brought to confus that devis my hurt

35:5 let them be as chaff befor the wind: and let the angel of the
lord chase them

35:6 let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the lord
persecut them

35:7 for without caus have they hid for me their net in a pit which
without caus they have dig for my soul

35:8 let destruct come upon him at unawares; and let hi net that
he hath hid catch himself: into that veri destruct let him fall

35:9 and my soul shall be joy in the lord: it shall rejoic in hi
salvat

35:10 all my bone shall say lord who is like unto thee which
deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him yea the poor
and the needi from him that spoileth him?

35:11 fals wit did rise up; they laid to my charg thing that
i knew not

35:12 they reward me evil for good to the spoil of my soul

35:13 but as for me when they were sick my cloth wa sackcloth: i
humbl my soul with fasting; and my prayer return into mine own
bosom

35:14 i behav myself as though he had been my friend or brother: i
bow down heavili as one that mourneth for hi mother

35:15 but in mine advers they rejoic and gather themselv
together: yea the abject gather themselv togeth against me
and i knew it not; they did tear me and ceas not:

35:16 with hypocrit mocker in feast they gnash upon me with
their teeth

35:17 lord how long wilt thou look on? rescu my soul from their
destruct my darl from the lion

35:18 i will give thee thank in the great congregation: i will prais
thee among much peopl

35:19 let not them that are mine enemi wrong rejoic over me:
neither let them wink with the eye that hate me without a caus

35:20 for they speak not peace: but they devis deceit matter
against them that are quiet in the land

35:21 yea they open their mouth wide against me and said aha
aha our eye hath seen it

35:22 thi thou hast seen o lord: keep not silence: o lord be not
far from me

35:23 stir up thyself and awak to my judgment even unto my caus
my god and my lord

35:24 judg me o lord my god accord to thi righteousness; and let
them not rejoic over me

35:25 let them not say in their heart ah so would we have it: let
them not say we have swallow him up

35:26 let them be asham and brought to confus togeth that
rejoic at mine hurt: let them be cloth with shame and dishonour
that magnifi themselv against me

35:27 let them shout for joy and be glad that favour my righteou
cause: yea let them say continu let the lord be magnifi which
hath pleasur in the prosper of hi servant

35:28 and my tongu shall speak of thi righteous and of thi prais
all the day long



36:1 the transgress of the wick saith within my heart that there
is no fear of god befor hi eye

36:2 for he flattereth himself in hi own eye until hi iniqu be
found to be hate

36:3 the word of hi mouth are iniqu and deceit: he hath left off
to be wise and to do good

36:4 he deviseth mischief upon hi bed; he setteth himself in a way
that is not good; he abhorreth not evil

36:5 thi merci o lord is in the heavens; and thi faith
reacheth unto the cloud

36:6 thi righteous is like the great mountains; thi judgment are
a great deep: o lord thou preservest man and beast

36:7 how excel is thi lovingkind o god! therefor the
children of men put their trust under the shadow of thi wing

36:8 they shall be abundantli satisfi with the fat of thi house;
and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thi pleasur

36:9 for with thee is the fountain of life: in thi light shall we see
light

36:10 o continu thi lovingkind unto them that know thee; and thi
righteous to the upright in heart

36:11 let not the foot of pride come against me and let not the hand
of the wick remov me

36:12 there are the worker of iniqu fallen: they are cast down
and shall not be abl to rise



37:1 fret not thyself becaus of evildo neither be thou enviou
against the worker of iniqu

37:2 for they shall soon be cut down like the grass and wither as the
green herb

37:3 trust in the lord and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land
and verili thou shalt be fed

37:4 delight thyself also in the lord: and he shall give thee the
desir of thine heart

37:5 commit thi way unto the lord; trust also in him; and he shall
bring it to pass

37:6 and he shall bring forth thi righteous as the light and thi
judgment as the noonday

37:7 rest in the lord and wait patient for him: fret not thyself
becaus of him who prospereth in hi way becaus of the man who
bringeth wick devic to pass

37:8 ceas from anger and forsak wrath: fret not thyself in ani wise
to do evil

37:9 for evildo shall be cut off: but those that wait upon the
lord they shall inherit the earth

37:10 for yet a littl while and the wick shall not be: yea thou
shalt dilig consid hi place and it shall not be

37:11 but the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight
themselv in the abund of peac

37:12 the wick plotteth against the just and gnasheth upon him with
hi teeth

37:13 the lord shall laugh at him: for he seeth that hi day is
come

37:14 the wick have drawn out the sword and have bent their bow to
cast down the poor and needi and to slay such as be of upright
convers

37:15 their sword shall enter into their own heart and their bow
shall be broken

37:16 a littl that a righteou man hath is better than the rich of
mani wick

37:17 for the arm of the wick shall be broken: but the lord
upholdeth the righteou

37:18 the lord knoweth the day of the upright: and their inherit
shall be for ever

37:19 they shall not be asham in the evil time: and in the day of
famin they shall be satisfi

37:20 but the wick shall perish and the enemi of the lord shall
be as the fat of lambs: they shall consume; into smoke shall they
consum away

37:21 the wick borroweth and payeth not again: but the righteou
sheweth merci and giveth

37:22 for such as be bless of him shall inherit the earth; and they
that be curs of him shall be cut off

37:23 the step of a good man are order by the lord: and he
delighteth in hi way

37:24 though he fall he shall not be utterli cast down: for the lord
upholdeth him with hi hand

37:25 i have been young and now am old; yet have i not seen the
righteou forsaken nor hi seed beg bread

37:26 he is ever merci and lendeth; and hi seed is bless

37:27 depart from evil and do good; and dwell for evermor

37:28 for the lord loveth judgment and forsaketh not hi saints; they
are preserv for ever: but the seed of the wick shall be cut off

37:29 the righteou shall inherit the land and dwell therein for
ever

37:30 the mouth of the righteou speaketh wisdom and hi tongu
talketh of judgment

37:31 the law of hi god is in hi heart; none of hi step shall
slide

37:32 the wick watcheth the righteou and seeketh to slay him

37:33 the lord will not leav him in hi hand nor condemn him when he
is judg

37:34 wait on the lord and keep hi way and he shall exalt thee to
inherit the land: when the wick are cut off thou shalt see it

37:35 i have seen the wick in great power and spread himself
like a green bay tree

37:36 yet he pass away and lo he wa not: yea i sought him but
he could not be found

37:37 mark the perfect man and behold the upright: for the end of
that man is peac

37:38 but the transgressor shall be destroy together: the end of
the wick shall be cut off

37:39 but the salvat of the righteou is of the lord: he is their
strength in the time of troubl

37:40 and the lord shall help them and deliv them: he shall deliv
them from the wick and save them becaus they trust in him



38:1 o lord rebuk me not in thi wrath: neither chasten me in thi hot
displeasur

38:2 for thine arrow stick fast in me and thi hand presseth me sore

38:3 there is no sound in my flesh becaus of thine anger; neither
is there ani rest in my bone becaus of my sin

38:4 for mine iniqu are gone over mine head: as an heavi burden
they are too heavi for me

38:5 my wound stink and are corrupt becaus of my foolish

38:6 i am troubled; i am bow down greatly; i go mourn all the day
long

38:7 for my loin are fill with a loathsom disease: and there is no
sound in my flesh

38:8 i am feebl and sore broken: i have roar by reason of the
disquiet of my heart

38:9 lord all my desir is befor thee; and my groan is not hid
from thee

38:10 my heart panteth my strength faileth me: as for the light of
mine eye it also is gone from me

38:11 my lover and my friend stand aloof from my sore; and my
kinsmen stand afar off

38:12 they also that seek after my life lay snare for me: and they
that seek my hurt speak mischiev thing and imagin deceit all
the day long

38:13 but i as a deaf man heard not; and i wa as a dumb man that
openeth not hi mouth

38:14 thu i wa as a man that heareth not and in whose mouth are no
reproof

38:15 for in thee o lord do i hope: thou wilt hear o lord my god

38:16 for i said hear me lest otherwis they should rejoic over me:
when my foot slippeth they magnifi themselv against me

38:17 for i am readi to halt and my sorrow is continu befor me

38:18 for i will declar mine iniquity; i will be sorri for my sin

38:19 but mine enemi are live and they are strong: and they that
hate me wrong are multipli

38:20 they also that render evil for good are mine adversaries;
becaus i follow the thing that good is

38:21 forsak me not o lord: o my god be not far from me

38:22 make hast to help me o lord my salvat



39:1 i said i will take heed to my way that i sin not with my
tongue: i will keep my mouth with a bridl while the wick is befor
me

39:2 i wa dumb with silenc i held my peac even from good; and my
sorrow wa stir

39:3 my heart wa hot within me while i wa muse the fire burned:
then spake i with my tongu

39:4 lord make me to know mine end and the measur of my day what
it is: that i may know how frail i am

39:5 behold thou hast made my day as an handbreadth; and mine age is
as noth befor thee: verili everi man at hi best state is
altogeth vaniti

selah

39:6 sure everi man walketh in a vain shew: sure they are
disquiet in vain: he heapeth up rich and knoweth not who shall
gather them

39:7 and now lord what wait i for? my hope is in thee

39:8 deliv me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach
of the foolish

39:9 i wa dumb i open not my mouth; becaus thou didst it

39:10 remov thi stroke away from me: i am consum by the blow of
thine hand

39:11 when thou with rebuk dost correct man for iniqu thou
makest hi beauti to consum away like a moth: sure everi man is
vaniti selah

39:12 hear my prayer o lord and give ear unto my cry; hold not thi
peac at my tears: for i am a stranger with thee and a sojourn as
all my father were

39:13 o spare me that i may recov strength befor i go henc and
be no more



40:1 i wait patient for the lord; and he inclin unto me and
heard my cri

40:2 he brought me up also out of an horribl pit out of the miri
clay and set my feet upon a rock and establish my go

40:3 and he hath put a new song in my mouth even prais unto our god:
mani shall see it and fear and shall trust in the lord

40:4 bless is that man that maketh the lord hi trust and
respecteth not the proud nor such as turn asid to lie

40:5 mani o lord my god are thi wonder work which thou hast
done and thi thought which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckon
up in order unto thee: if i would declar and speak of them they are
more than can be number

40:6 sacrific and offer thou didst not desire; mine ear hast thou
opened: burnt offer and sin offer hast thou not requir

40:7 then said i lo i come: in the volum of the book it is written
of me

40:8 i delight to do thi will o my god: yea thi law is within my
heart

40:9 i have preach righteous in the great congregation: lo i
have not refrain my lip o lord thou knowest

40:10 i have not hid thi righteous within my heart; i have
declar thi faith and thi salvation: i have not conceal thi
lovingkind and thi truth from the great congreg

40:11 withhold not thou thi tender merci from me o lord: let thi
lovingkind and thi truth continu preserv me

40:12 for innumer evil have compass me about: mine iniqu
have taken hold upon me so that i am not abl to look up; they are
more than the hair of mine head: therefor my heart faileth me

40:13 be pleas o lord to deliv me: o lord make hast to help
me

40:14 let them be asham and confound togeth that seek after my
soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that
wish me evil

40:15 let them be desol for a reward of their shame that say unto
me aha aha

40:16 let all those that seek thee rejoic and be glad in thee: let
such as love thi salvat say continu the lord be magnifi

40:17 but i am poor and needy; yet the lord thinketh upon me: thou art
my help and my deliverer; make no tarri o my god



41:1 bless is he that considereth the poor: the lord will deliv
him in time of troubl

41:2 the lord will preserv him and keep him alive; and he shall be
bless upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliv him unto the will of
hi enemi

41:3 the lord will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou
wilt make all hi bed in hi sick

41:4 i said lord be merci unto me: heal my soul; for i have
sin against thee

41:5 mine enemi speak evil of me when shall he die and hi name
perish?

41:6 and if he come to see me he speaketh vanity: hi heart gathereth
iniqu to itself; when he goeth abroad he telleth it

41:7 all that hate me whisper togeth against me: against me do they
devis my hurt

41:8 an evil diseas say they cleaveth fast unto him: and now that
he lieth he shall rise up no more

41:9 yea mine own familiar friend in whom i trust which did eat
of my bread hath lift up hi heel against me

41:10 but thou o lord be merci unto me and rais me up that i
may requit them

41:11 by thi i know that thou favourest me becaus mine enemi doth
not triumph over me

41:12 and as for me thou upholdest me in mine integr and settest
me befor thi face for ever

41:13 bless be the lord god of israel from everlast and to
everlast amen and amen



42:1 as the hart panteth after the water brook so panteth my soul
after thee o god

42:2 my soul thirsteth for god for the live god: when shall i come
and appear befor god?

42:3 my tear have been my meat day and night while they continu
say unto me where is thi god?

42:4 when i rememb these thing i pour out my soul in me: for i had
gone with the multitud i went with them to the hous of god with
the voic of joy and prais with a multitud that kept holyday

42:5 whi art thou cast down o my soul? and whi art thou disquiet in
me? hope thou in god: for i shall yet prais him for the help of hi
counten

42:6 o my god my soul is cast down within me: therefor will i
rememb thee from the land of jordan and of the hermonit from the
hill mizar

42:7 deep calleth unto deep at the nois of thi waterspouts: all thi
wave and thi billow are gone over me

42:8 yet the lord will command hi lovingkind in the day time and
in the night hi song shall be with me and my prayer unto the god of
my life

42:9 i will say unto god my rock whi hast thou forgotten me? whi go i
mourn becaus of the oppress of the enemy?

42:10 as with a sword in my bone mine enemi reproach me; while
they say daili unto me where is thi god?

42:11 whi art thou cast down o my soul? and whi art thou disquiet
within me? hope thou in god: for i shall yet prais him who is the
health of my counten and my god



43:1 judg me o god and plead my caus against an ungodli nation: o
deliv me from the deceit and unjust man

43:2 for thou art the god of my strength: whi dost thou cast me off?
whi go i mourn becaus of the oppress of the enemy?

43:3 o send out thi light and thi truth: let them lead me; let them
bring me unto thi holi hill and to thi tabernacl

43:4 then will i go unto the altar of god unto god my exceed joy:
yea upon the harp will i prais thee o god my god

43:5 whi art thou cast down o my soul? and whi art thou disquiet
within me? hope in god: for i shall yet prais him who is the health
of my counten and my god



44:1 we have heard with our ear o god our father have told us
what work thou didst in their day in the time of old

44:2 how thou didst drive out the heathen with thi hand and plantedst
them; how thou didst afflict the peopl and cast them out

44:3 for they got not the land in possess by their own sword
neither did their own arm save them: but thi right hand and thine
arm and the light of thi counten becaus thou hadst a favour
unto them

44:4 thou art my king o god: command deliver for jacob

44:5 through thee will we push down our enemies: through thi name will
we tread them under that rise up against us
