93:5 thi testimoni are veri sure: holi becometh thine hous o
lord for ever



94:1 o lord god to whom vengeanc belongeth; o god to whom vengeanc
belongeth shew thyself

94:2 lift up thyself thou judg of the earth: render a reward to the
proud

94:3 lord how long shall the wick how long shall the wick
triumph?

94:4 how long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the
worker of iniqu boast themselves?

94:5 they break in piec thi peopl o lord and afflict thine
heritag

94:6 they slay the widow and the stranger and murder the fatherless

94:7 yet they say the lord shall not see neither shall the god of
jacob regard it

94:8 understand ye brutish among the people: and ye fool when will
ye be wise?

94:9 he that plant the ear shall he not hear? he that form the
eye shall he not see?

94:10 he that chastiseth the heathen shall not he correct? he that
teacheth man knowledg shall not he know?

94:11 the lord knoweth the thought of man that they are vaniti

94:12 bless is the man whom thou chastenest o lord and teachest
him out of thi law;

94:13 that thou mayest give him rest from the day of advers until
the pit be dig for the wick

94:14 for the lord will not cast off hi peopl neither will he
forsak hi inherit

94:15 but judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the
upright in heart shall follow it

94:16 who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand
up for me against the worker of iniquity?

94:17 unless the lord had been my help my soul had almost dwelt in
silenc

94:18 when i said my foot slippeth; thi merci o lord held me up

94:19 in the multitud of my thought within me thi comfort delight
my soul

94:20 shall the throne of iniqu have fellowship with thee which
frameth mischief by a law?

94:21 they gather themselv togeth against the soul of the
righteou and condemn the innoc blood

94:22 but the lord is my defence; and my god is the rock of my refug

94:23 and he shall bring upon them their own iniqu and shall cut
them off in their own wickedness; yea the lord our god shall cut them
off



95:1 o come let us sing unto the lord: let us make a joy nois to
the rock of our salvat

95:2 let us come befor hi presenc with thanksgiv and make a
joy nois unto him with psalm

95:3 for the lord is a great god and a great king abov all god

95:4 in hi hand are the deep place of the earth: the strength of the
hill is hi also

95:5 the sea is hi and he made it: and hi hand form the dri
land

95:6 o come let us worship and bow down: let us kneel befor the lord
our maker

95:7 for he is our god; and we are the peopl of hi pastur and the
sheep of hi hand to day if ye will hear hi voic

95:8 harden not your heart as in the provoc and as in the day
of temptat in the wilderness:

95:9 when your father tempt me prove me and saw my work

95:10 forti year long wa i griev with thi gener and said
it is a peopl that do err in their heart and they have not known my
ways:

95:11 unto whom i sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my
rest



96:1 o sing unto the lord a new song: sing unto the lord all the
earth

96:2 sing unto the lord bless hi name; shew forth hi salvat from
day to day

96:3 declar hi glori among the heathen hi wonder among all
peopl

96:4 for the lord is great and greatli to be praised: he is to be
fear abov all god

96:5 for all the god of the nation are idols: but the lord made the
heaven

96:6 honour and majesti are befor him: strength and beauti are in hi
sanctuari

96:7 give unto the lord o ye kindr of the peopl give unto the
lord glori and strength

96:8 give unto the lord the glori due unto hi name: bring an
offer and come into hi court

96:9 o worship the lord in the beauti of holiness: fear befor him
all the earth

96:10 say among the heathen that the lord reigneth: the world also
shall be establish that it shall not be moved: he shall judg the
peopl righteous

96:11 let the heaven rejoic and let the earth be glad; let the sea
roar and the ful thereof

96:12 let the field be joy and all that is therein: then shall all
the tree of the wood rejoic

96:13 befor the lord: for he cometh for he cometh to judg the
earth: he shall judg the world with righteous and the peopl
with hi truth



97:1 the lord reigneth; let the earth rejoice; let the multitud of
isl be glad thereof

97:2 cloud and dark are round about him: righteous and
judgment are the habit of hi throne

97:3 a fire goeth befor him and burneth up hi enemi round about

97:4 hi lightn enlighten the world: the earth saw and
trembl

97:5 the hill melt like wax at the presenc of the lord at the
presenc of the lord of the whole earth

97:6 the heaven declar hi righteous and all the peopl see hi
glori

97:7 confound be all they that serv graven imag that boast
themselv of idols: worship him all ye god

97:8 zion heard and wa glad; and the daughter of judah rejoic
becaus of thi judgment o lord

97:9 for thou lord art high abov all the earth: thou art exalt
far abov all god

97:10 ye that love the lord hate evil: he preserveth the soul of hi
saints; he delivereth them out of the hand of the wick

97:11 light is sown for the righteou and glad for the upright in
heart

97:12 rejoic in the lord ye righteous; and give thank at the
remembr of hi holi



98:1 o sing unto the lord a new song; for he hath done marvel
things: hi right hand and hi holi arm hath gotten him the victori

98:2 the lord hath made known hi salvation: hi righteous hath he
openli shew in the sight of the heathen

98:3 he hath rememb hi merci and hi truth toward the hous of
israel: all the end of the earth have seen the salvat of our god

98:4 make a joy nois unto the lord all the earth: make a loud
nois and rejoic and sing prais

98:5 sing unto the lord with the harp; with the harp and the voic of
a psalm

98:6 with trumpet and sound of cornet make a joy nois befor the
lord the king

98:7 let the sea roar and the ful thereof; the world and they
that dwell therein

98:8 let the flood clap their hands: let the hill be joy togeth

98:9 befor the lord; for he cometh to judg the earth: with
righteous shall he judg the world and the peopl with equiti



99:1 the lord reigneth; let the peopl tremble: he sitteth between the
cherubims; let the earth be move

99:2 the lord is great in zion; and he is high abov all the peopl

99:3 let them prais thi great and terribl name; for it is holi

99:4 the king strength also loveth judgment; thou dost establish
equiti thou executest judgment and righteous in jacob

99:5 exalt ye the lord our god and worship at hi footstool; for he
is holi

99:6 mose and aaron among hi priest and samuel among them that
call upon hi name; they call upon the lord and he answer them

99:7 he spake unto them in the cloudi pillar: they kept hi
testimoni and the ordin that he gave them

99:8 thou answeredst them o lord our god: thou wast a god that
forgavest them though thou tookest vengeanc of their invent

99:9 exalt the lord our god and worship at hi holi hill; for the
lord our god is holi



100:1 make a joy nois unto the lord all ye land

100:2 serv the lord with gladness: come befor hi presenc with
sing

100:3 know ye that the lord he is god: it is he that hath made us and
not we ourselves; we are hi peopl and the sheep of hi pastur

100:4 enter into hi gate with thanksgiv and into hi court with
praise: be thank unto him and bless hi name

100:5 for the lord is good; hi merci is everlasting; and hi truth
endureth to all gener



101:1 i will sing of merci and judgment: unto thee o lord will i
sing

101:2 i will behav myself wise in a perfect way o when wilt thou
come unto me? i will walk within my hous with a perfect heart

101:3 i will set no wick thing befor mine eyes: i hate the work of
them that turn aside; it shall not cleav to me

101:4 a froward heart shall depart from me: i will not know a wick
person

101:5 whoso privili slandereth hi neighbour him will i cut off: him
that hath an high look and a proud heart will not i suffer

101:6 mine eye shall be upon the faith of the land that they may
dwell with me: he that walketh in a perfect way he shall serv me

101:7 he that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house: he that
telleth lie shall not tarri in my sight

101:8 i will earli destroy all the wick of the land; that i may cut
off all wick doer from the citi of the lord



102:1 hear my prayer o lord and let my cri come unto thee

102:2 hide not thi face from me in the day when i am in trouble;
inclin thine ear unto me: in the day when i call answer me speedili

102:3 for my day are consum like smoke and my bone are burn as
an hearth

102:4 my heart is smitten and wither like grass; so that i forget
to eat my bread

102:5 by reason of the voic of my groan my bone cleav to my
skin

102:6 i am like a pelican of the wilderness: i am like an owl of the
desert

102:7 i watch and am as a sparrow alon upon the hous top

102:8 mine enemi reproach me all the day; and they that are mad
against me are sworn against me

102:9 for i have eaten ash like bread and mingl my drink with
weep

102:10 becaus of thine indign and thi wrath: for thou hast
lift me up and cast me down

102:11 my day are like a shadow that declineth; and i am wither
like grass

102:12 but thou o lord shall endur for ever; and thi remembr
unto all gener

102:13 thou shalt aris and have merci upon zion: for the time to
favour her yea the set time is come

102:14 for thi servant take pleasur in her stone and favour the
dust thereof

102:15 so the heathen shall fear the name of the lord and all the
king of the earth thi glori

102:16 when the lord shall build up zion he shall appear in hi
glori

102:17 he will regard the prayer of the destitut and not despis
their prayer

102:18 thi shall be written for the gener to come: and the
peopl which shall be creat shall prais the lord

102:19 for he hath look down from the height of hi sanctuary; from
heaven did the lord behold the earth;

102:20 to hear the groan of the prisoner; to loos those that are
appoint to death;

102:21 to declar the name of the lord in zion and hi prais in
jerusalem;

102:22 when the peopl are gather togeth and the kingdom to
serv the lord

102:23 he weaken my strength in the way; he shorten my day

102:24 i said o my god take me not away in the midst of my days: thi
year are throughout all gener

102:25 of old hast thou laid the foundat of the earth: and the
heaven are the work of thi hand

102:26 they shall perish but thou shalt endure: yea all of them
shall wax old like a garment; as a vestur shalt thou chang them and
they shall be changed:

102:27 but thou art the same and thi year shall have no end

102:28 the children of thi servant shall continu and their seed
shall be establish befor thee



103:1 bless the lord o my soul: and all that is within me bless hi
holi name

103:2 bless the lord o my soul and forget not all hi benefits:

103:3 who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thi
diseases;

103:4 who redeemeth thi life from destruction; who crowneth thee with
lovingkind and tender mercies;

103:5 who satisfieth thi mouth with good things; so that thi youth is
renew like the eagl

103:6 the lord executeth righteous and judgment for all that are
oppress

103:7 he made known hi way unto mose hi act unto the children of
israel

103:8 the lord is merci and graciou slow to anger and plenteou
in merci

103:9 he will not alway chide: neither will he keep hi anger for
ever

103:10 he hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor reward us
accord to our iniqu

103:11 for as the heaven is high abov the earth so great is hi
merci toward them that fear him

103:12 as far as the east is from the west so far hath he remov our
transgress from us

103:13 like as a father pitieth hi children so the lord pitieth them
that fear him

103:14 for he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust

103:15 as for man hi day are as grass: as a flower of the field so
he flourisheth

103:16 for the wind passeth over it and it is gone; and the place
thereof shall know it no more

103:17 but the merci of the lord is from everlast to everlast
upon them that fear him and hi righteous unto children
children;

103:18 to such as keep hi coven and to those that rememb hi
command to do them

103:19 the lord hath prepar hi throne in the heavens; and hi
kingdom ruleth over all

103:20 bless the lord ye hi angel that excel in strength that do
hi command hearken unto the voic of hi word

103:21 bless ye the lord all ye hi hosts; ye minist of hi that
do hi pleasur

103:22 bless the lord all hi work in all place of hi dominion:
bless the lord o my soul



104:1 bless the lord o my soul o lord my god thou art veri great;
thou art cloth with honour and majesti

104:2 who coverest thyself with light as with a garment: who
stretchest out the heaven like a curtain:

104:3 who layeth the beam of hi chamber in the waters: who maketh
the cloud hi chariot: who walketh upon the wing of the wind:

104:4 who maketh hi angel spirits; hi minist a flame fire:

104:5 who laid the foundat of the earth that it should not be
remov for ever

104:6 thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the water
stood abov the mountain

104:7 at thi rebuk they fled; at the voic of thi thunder they hast
away

104:8 they go up by the mountains; they go down by the valley unto
the place which thou hast found for them

104:9 thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; that they
turn not again to cover the earth

104:10 he sendeth the spring into the valley which run among the
hill

104:11 they give drink to everi beast of the field: the wild ass
quench their thirst

104:12 by them shall the fowl of the heaven have their habit
which sing among the branch

104:13 he watereth the hill from hi chambers: the earth is satisfi
with the fruit of thi work

104:14 he causeth the grass to grow for the cattl and herb for the
servic of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;

104:15 and wine that maketh glad the heart of man and oil to make hi
face to shine and bread which strengtheneth man heart

104:16 the tree of the lord are full of sap; the cedar of lebanon
which he hath planted;

104:17 where the bird make their nests: as for the stork the fir
tree are her hous

104:18 the high hill are a refug for the wild goats; and the rock
for the coni

104:19 he appoint the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth hi go
down

104:20 thou makest dark and it is night: wherein all the beast
of the forest do creep forth

104:21 the young lion roar after their prey and seek their meat from
god

104:22 the sun ariseth they gather themselv togeth and lay them
down in their den

104:23 man goeth forth unto hi work and to hi labour until the
even

104:24 o lord how manifold are thi works! in wisdom hast thou made
them all: the earth is full of thi rich

104:25 so is thi great and wide sea wherein are thing creep
innumer both small and great beast

104:26 there go the ships: there is that leviathan whom thou hast
made to play therein

104:27 these wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give them their meat
in due season

104:28 that thou givest them they gather: thou openest thine hand
they are fill with good

104:29 thou hidest thi face they are troubled: thou takest away their
breath they die and return to their dust

104:30 thou sendest forth thi spirit they are created: and thou
renewest the face of the earth

104:31 the glori of the lord shall endur for ever: the lord shall
rejoic in hi work

104:32 he looketh on the earth and it trembleth: he toucheth the
hill and they smoke

104:33 i will sing unto the lord as long as i live: i will sing prais
to my god while i have my be

104:34 my medit of him shall be sweet: i will be glad in the
lord

104:35 let the sinner be consum out of the earth and let the
wick be no more bless thou the lord o my soul prais ye the lord



105:1 o give thank unto the lord; call upon hi name: make known hi
deed among the peopl

105:2 sing unto him sing psalm unto him: talk ye of all hi wondrou
work

105:3 glori ye in hi holi name: let the heart of them rejoic that
seek the lord

105:4 seek the lord and hi strength: seek hi face evermor

105:5 rememb hi marvel work that he hath done; hi wonder
and the judgment of hi mouth;

105:6 o ye seed of abraham hi servant ye children of jacob hi
chosen

105:7 he is the lord our god: hi judgment are in all the earth

105:8 he hath rememb hi coven for ever the word which he
command to a thousand gener

105:9 which coven he made with abraham and hi oath unto isaac;

105:10 and confirm the same unto jacob for a law and to israel for
an everlast covenant:

105:11 say unto thee will i give the land of canaan the lot of
your inheritance:

105:12 when they were but a few men in number; yea veri few and
stranger in it

105:13 when they went from one nation to anoth from one kingdom to
anoth people;

105:14 he suffer no man to do them wrong: yea he reprov king for
their sakes;

105:15 say touch not mine anoint and do my prophet no harm

105:16 moreov he call for a famin upon the land: he brake the
whole staff of bread

105:17 he sent a man befor them even joseph who wa sold for a
servant:

105:18 whose feet they hurt with fetters: he wa laid in iron:

105:19 until the time that hi word came: the word of the lord tri
him

105:20 the king sent and loos him; even the ruler of the peopl and
let him go free

105:21 he made him lord of hi hous and ruler of all hi substance:

105:22 to bind hi princ at hi pleasure; and teach hi senat
wisdom

105:23 israel also came into egypt; and jacob sojourn in the land of
ham

105:24 and he increas hi peopl greatly; and made them stronger
than their enemi

105:25 he turn their heart to hate hi peopl to deal subtilli with
hi servant

105:26 he sent mose hi servant; and aaron whom he had chosen

105:27 they shew hi sign among them and wonder in the land of
ham

105:28 he sent dark and made it dark; and they rebel not
against hi word

105:29 he turn their water into blood and slew their fish

105:30 their land brought forth frog in abund in the chamber of
their king

105:31 he spake and there came diver sort of fli and lice in all
their coast

105:32 he gave them hail for rain and flame fire in their land

105:33 he smote their vine also and their fig trees; and brake the
tree of their coast

105:34 he spake and the locust came and caterpil and that
without number

105:35 and did eat up all the herb in their land and devour the
fruit of their ground

105:36 he smote also all the firstborn in their land the chief of all
their strength

105:37 he brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there wa
not one feebl person among their tribe

105:38 egypt wa glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell
upon them

105:39 he spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the
night

105:40 the peopl ask and he brought quail and satisfi them
with the bread of heaven

105:41 he open the rock and the water gush out; they ran in the
dri place like a river

105:42 for he rememb hi holi promis and abraham hi servant

105:43 and he brought forth hi peopl with joy and hi chosen with
gladness:

105:44 and gave them the land of the heathen: and they inherit the
labour of the people;

105:45 that they might observ hi statut and keep hi law prais
ye the lord



106:1 prais ye the lord o give thank unto the lord; for he is good:
for hi merci endureth for ever

106:2 who can utter the mighti act of the lord? who can shew forth
all hi praise?

106:3 bless are they that keep judgment and he that doeth
righteous at all time

106:4 rememb me o lord with the favour that thou bearest unto thi
people: o visit me with thi salvation;

106:5 that i may see the good of thi chosen that i may rejoic in the
glad of thi nation that i may glori with thine inherit

106:6 we have sin with our father we have commit iniqu we
have done wickedli

106:7 our father understood not thi wonder in egypt; they rememb
not the multitud of thi mercies; but provok him at the sea even at
the red sea

106:8 nevertheless he save them for hi name sake that he might
make hi mighti power to be known

106:9 he rebuk the red sea also and it wa dri up: so he led them
through the depth as through the wilder

106:10 and he save them from the hand of him that hate them and
redeem them from the hand of the enemi

106:11 and the water cover their enemies: there wa not one of them
left

106:12 then believ they hi words; they sang hi prais

106:13 they soon forgat hi works; they wait not for hi counsel:

106:14 but lust exceedingli in the wilder and tempt god in
the desert

106:15 and he gave them their request; but sent lean into their
soul

106:16 they envi mose also in the camp and aaron the saint of the
lord

106:17 the earth open and swallow up dathan and cover the
compani of abiram

106:18 and a fire wa kindl in their company; the flame burn up
the wick

106:19 they made a calf in horeb and worship the molten imag

106:20 thu they chang their glori into the similitud of an ox that
eateth grass

106:21 they forgat god their saviour which had done great thing in
egypt;

106:22 wondrou work in the land of ham and terribl thing by the
red sea

106:23 therefor he said that he would destroy them had not mose hi
chosen stood befor him in the breach to turn away hi wrath lest he
should destroy them

106:24 yea they despis the pleasant land they believ not hi
word:

106:25 but murmur in their tent and hearken not unto the voic
of the lord

106:26 therefor he lift up hi hand against them to overthrow them
in the wilderness:

106:27 to overthrow their seed also among the nation and to scatter
them in the land

106:28 they join themselv also unto baalpeor and ate the
sacrific of the dead

106:29 thu they provok him to anger with their inventions: and the
plagu brake in upon them

106:30 then stood up phineha and execut judgment: and so the
plagu wa stay

106:31 and that wa count unto him for righteous unto all
gener for evermor

106:32 they anger him also at the water of strife so that it went
ill with mose for their sakes:

106:33 becaus they provok hi spirit so that he spake unadvisedli
with hi lip

106:34 they did not destroy the nation concern whom the lord
command them:

106:35 but were mingl among the heathen and learn their work

106:36 and they serv their idols: which were a snare unto them

106:37 yea they sacrif their son and their daughter unto
devil

106:38 and shed innoc blood even the blood of their son and of
their daughter whom they sacrif unto the idol of canaan: and
the land wa pollut with blood

106:39 thu were they defil with their own work and went a whore
with their own invent

106:40 therefor wa the wrath of the lord kindl against hi peopl
insomuch that he abhor hi own inherit

106:41 and he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that
hate them rule over them

106:42 their enemi also oppress them and they were brought into
subject under their hand

106:43 mani time did he deliv them; but they provok him with
their counsel and were brought low for their iniqu

106:44 nevertheless he regard their afflict when he heard their
cry:

106:45 and he rememb for them hi coven and repent accord
to the multitud of hi merci

106:46 he made them also to be piti of all those that carri them
captiv

106:47 save us o lord our god and gather us from among the heathen
to give thank unto thi holi name and to triumph in thi prais

106:48 bless be the lord god of israel from everlast to
everlasting: and let all the peopl say amen prais ye the lord



107:1 o give thank unto the lord for he is good: for hi merci
endureth for ever

107:2 let the redeem of the lord say so whom he hath redeem from
the hand of the enemy;

107:3 and gather them out of the land from the east and from the
west from the north and from the south

107:4 they wander in the wilder in a solitari way; they found no
citi to dwell in

107:5 hungri and thirsti their soul faint in them

107:6 then they cri unto the lord in their troubl and he deliv
them out of their distress

107:7 and he led them forth by the right way that they might go to a
citi of habit

107:8 oh that men would prais the lord for hi good and for hi
wonder work to the children of men!

107:9 for he satisfieth the long soul and filleth the hungri soul
with good

107:10 such as sit in dark and in the shadow of death be bound
in afflict and iron;

107:11 becaus they rebel against the word of god and contemn
the counsel of the most high:

107:12 therefor he brought down their heart with labour; they fell
down and there wa none to help

107:13 then they cri unto the lord in their troubl and he save
them out of their distress

107:14 he brought them out of dark and the shadow of death and
brake their band in sunder

107:15 oh that men would prais the lord for hi good and for hi
wonder work to the children of men!

107:16 for he hath broken the gate of brass and cut the bar of iron
in sunder

107:17 fool becaus of their transgress and becaus of their
iniqu are afflict

107:18 their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near
unto the gate of death

107:19 then they cri unto the lord in their troubl and he saveth
them out of their distress

107:20 he sent hi word and heal them and deliv them from
their destruct

107:21 oh that men would prais the lord for hi good and for hi
wonder work to the children of men!

107:22 and let them sacrific the sacrific of thanksgiv and
declar hi work with rejoic

107:23 they that go down to the sea in ship that do busi in
great waters;

107:24 these see the work of the lord and hi wonder in the deep

107:25 for he commandeth and raiseth the stormi wind which lifteth
up the wave thereof

107:26 they mount up to the heaven they go down again to the depths:
their soul is melt becaus of troubl

107:27 they reel to and fro and stagger like a drunken man and are
at their wit end

107:28 then they cri unto the lord in their troubl and he bringeth
them out of their distress

107:29 he maketh the storm a calm so that the wave thereof are
still

107:30 then are they glad becaus they be quiet; so he bringeth them
unto their desir haven

107:31 oh that men would prais the lord for hi good and for hi
wonder work to the children of men!

107:32 let them exalt him also in the congreg of the peopl and
prais him in the assembl of the elder

107:33 he turneth river into a wilder and the waterspr into
dri ground;

107:34 a fruit land into barren for the wicked of them
that dwell therein

107:35 he turneth the wilder into a stand water and dri ground
into waterspr

107:36 and there he maketh the hungri to dwell that they may prepar
a citi for habitation;

107:37 and sow the field and plant vineyard which may yield fruit
of increas

107:38 he blesseth them also so that they are multipli greatly; and
suffereth not their cattl to decreas

107:39 again they are minish and brought low through oppress
afflict and sorrow

107:40 he poureth contempt upon princ and causeth them to wander in
the wilder where there is no way

107:41 yet setteth he the poor on high from afflict and maketh him
famili like a flock

107:42 the righteou shall see it and rejoice: and all iniqu shall
stop her mouth

107:43 whoso is wise and will observ these thing even they shall
understand the lovingkind of the lord



108:1 o god my heart is fixed; i will sing and give prais even with
my glori

108:2 awak psalteri and harp: i myself will awak earli

108:3 i will prais thee o lord among the people: and i will sing
prais unto thee among the nation

108:4 for thi merci is great abov the heavens: and thi truth reacheth
unto the cloud

108:5 be thou exalt o god abov the heavens: and thi glori abov
all the earth;

108:6 that thi belov may be delivered: save with thi right hand and
answer me

108:7 god hath spoken in hi holiness; i will rejoic i will divid
shechem and mete out the valley of succoth

108:8 gilead is mine; manasseh is mine; ephraim also is the strength
of mine head; judah is my lawgiver;

108:9 moab is my washpot; over edom will i cast out my shoe; over
philistia will i triumph

108:10 who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into
edom?

108:11 wilt not thou o god who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou
o god go forth with our hosts?

108:12 give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man

108:13 through god we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall
tread down our enemi



109:1 hold not thi peac o god of my praise;

109:2 for the mouth of the wick and the mouth of the deceit are
open against me: they have spoken against me with a lie tongu

109:3 they compass me about also with word of hatred; and fought
against me without a caus

109:4 for my love they are my adversaries: but i give myself unto
prayer

109:5 and they have reward me evil for good and hatr for my love

109:6 set thou a wick man over him: and let satan stand at hi right
hand

109:7 when he shall be judg let him be condemned: and let hi
prayer becom sin

109:8 let hi day be few; and let anoth take hi offic

109:9 let hi children be fatherless and hi wife a widow

109:10 let hi children be continu vagabond and beg: let them
seek their bread also out of their desol place

109:11 let the extortion catch all that he hath; and let the
stranger spoil hi labour

109:12 let there be none to extend merci unto him: neither let there
be ani to favour hi fatherless children

109:13 let hi poster be cut off; and in the gener follow
let their name be blot out

109:14 let the iniqu of hi father be rememb with the lord;
and let not the sin of hi mother be blot out

109:15 let them be befor the lord continu that he may cut off
the memori of them from the earth

109:16 becaus that he rememb not to shew merci but persecut
the poor and needi man that he might even slay the broken in heart

109:17 as he love curs so let it come unto him: as he delight
not in bless so let it be far from him

109:18 as he cloth himself with curs like as with hi garment so
let it come into hi bowel like water and like oil into hi bone

109:19 let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him and for a
girdl wherewith he is gird continu

109:20 let thi be the reward of mine adversari from the lord and
of them that speak evil against my soul

109:21 but do thou for me o god the lord for thi name sake:
becaus thi merci is good deliv thou me

109:22 for i am poor and needi and my heart is wound within me

109:23 i am gone like the shadow when it declineth: i am toss up and
down as the locust

109:24 my knee are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of
fat

109:25 i becam also a reproach unto them: when they look upon me
they shake their head

109:26 help me o lord my god: o save me accord to thi mercy:

109:27 that they may know that thi is thi hand; that thou lord hast
done it

109:28 let them curs but bless thou: when they aris let them be
ashamed; but let thi servant rejoic

109:29 let mine adversari be cloth with shame and let them cover
themselv with their own confus as with a mantl

109:30 i will greatli prais the lord with my mouth; yea i will
prais him among the multitud

109:31 for he shall stand at the right hand of the poor to save him
from those that condemn hi soul



110:1 the lord said unto my lord sit thou at my right hand until i
make thine enemi thi footstool

110:2 the lord shall send the rod of thi strength out of zion: rule
thou in the midst of thine enemi

110:3 thi peopl shall be will in the day of thi power in the
beauti of holi from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew
of thi youth

110:4 the lord hath sworn and will not repent thou art a priest for
ever after the order of melchizedek

110:5 the lord at thi right hand shall strike through king in the day
of hi wrath

110:6 he shall judg among the heathen he shall fill the place with
the dead bodies; he shall wound the head over mani countri

110:7 he shall drink of the brook in the way: therefor shall he lift
up the head



111:1 prais ye the lord i will prais the lord with my whole heart
in the assembl of the upright and in the congreg

111:2 the work of the lord are great sought out of all them that
have pleasur therein

111:3 hi work is honour and glorious: and hi righteous
endureth for ever

111:4 he hath made hi wonder work to be remembered: the lord is
graciou and full of compass

111:5 he hath given meat unto them that fear him: he will ever be
mind of hi coven

111:6 he hath shew hi peopl the power of hi work that he may
give them the heritag of the heathen

111:7 the work of hi hand are veriti and judgment; all hi
command are sure

111:8 they stand fast for ever and ever and are done in truth and
upright

111:9 he sent redempt unto hi people: he hath command hi
coven for ever: holi and reverend is hi name

111:10 the fear of the lord is the begin of wisdom: a good
understand have all they that do hi commandments: hi prais
endureth for ever



112:1 prais ye the lord bless is the man that feareth the lord
that delighteth greatli in hi command

112:2 hi seed shall be mighti upon earth: the gener of the
upright shall be bless

112:3 wealth and rich shall be in hi house: and hi righteous
endureth for ever

112:4 unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: he is
graciou and full of compass and righteou

112:5 a good man sheweth favour and lendeth: he will guid hi
affair with discret

112:6 sure he shall not be move for ever: the righteou shall be in
everlast remembr

112:7 he shall not be afraid of evil tidings: hi heart is fix
trust in the lord

112:8 hi heart is establish he shall not be afraid until he see
hi desir upon hi enemi

112:9 he hath dispers he hath given to the poor; hi righteous
endureth for ever; hi horn shall be exalt with honour

112:10 the wick shall see it and be grieved; he shall gnash with
hi teeth and melt away: the desir of the wick shall perish



113:1 prais ye the lord prais o ye servant of the lord prais
the name of the lord

113:2 bless be the name of the lord from thi time forth and for
evermor

113:3 from the rise of the sun unto the go down of the same the
lord name is to be prais

113:4 the lord is high abov all nation and hi glori abov the
heaven

113:5 who is like unto the lord our god who dwelleth on high

113:6 who humbleth himself to behold the thing that are in heaven
and in the earth!

113:7 he raiseth up the poor out of the dust and lifteth the needi
out of the dunghill;

113:8 that he may set him with princ even with the princ of hi
peopl

113:9 he maketh the barren woman to keep hous and to be a joy
mother of children prais ye the lord



114:1 when israel went out of egypt the hous of jacob from a peopl
of strang language;

114:2 judah wa hi sanctuari and israel hi dominion

114:3 the sea saw it and fled: jordan wa driven back

114:4 the mountain skip like ram and the littl hill like
lamb

114:5 what ail thee o thou sea that thou fleddest? thou jordan
that thou wast driven back?

114:6 ye mountain that ye skip like rams; and ye littl hill
like lambs?

114:7 trembl thou earth at the presenc of the lord at the
presenc of the god of jacob;

114:8 which turn the rock into a stand water the flint into a
fountain of water



115:1 not unto us o lord not unto us but unto thi name give glori
for thi merci and for thi truth sake

115:2 wherefor should the heathen say where is now their god?

115:3 but our god is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoev he hath
pleas

115:4 their idol are silver and gold the work of men hand

115:5 they have mouth but they speak not: eye have they but they
see not:

115:6 they have ear but they hear not: nose have they but they
smell not:

115:7 they have hand but they handl not: feet have they but they
walk not: neither speak they through their throat

115:8 they that make them are like unto them; so is everi one that
trusteth in them

115:9 o israel trust thou in the lord: he is their help and their
shield

115:10 o hous of aaron trust in the lord: he is their help and their
shield

115:11 ye that fear the lord trust in the lord: he is their help and
their shield

115:12 the lord hath been mind of us: he will bless us; he will
bless the hous of israel; he will bless the hous of aaron

115:13 he will bless them that fear the lord both small and great

115:14 the lord shall increas you more and more you and your
children

115:15 ye are bless of the lord which made heaven and earth

115:16 the heaven even the heaven are the lords: but the earth
hath he given to the children of men

115:17 the dead prais not the lord neither ani that go down into
silenc

115:18 but we will bless the lord from thi time forth and for
evermor

prais the lord



116:1 i love the lord becaus he hath heard my voic and my
supplic

116:2 becaus he hath inclin hi ear unto me therefor will i call
upon him as long as i live

116:3 the sorrow of death compass me and the pain of hell gat
hold upon me: i found troubl and sorrow

116:4 then call i upon the name of the lord; o lord i beseech thee
deliv my soul

116:5 graciou is the lord and righteous; yea our god is merci

116:6 the lord preserveth the simple: i wa brought low and he help
me

116:7 return unto thi rest o my soul; for the lord hath dealt
bounti with thee

116:8 for thou hast deliv my soul from death mine eye from
tear and my feet from fall

116:9 i will walk befor the lord in the land of the live

116:10 i believ therefor have i spoken: i wa greatli afflicted:

116:11 i said in my hast all men are liar

116:12 what shall i render unto the lord for all hi benefit toward
me?

116:13 i will take the cup of salvat and call upon the name of the
lord

116:14 i will pay my vow unto the lord now in the presenc of all hi
peopl

116:15 preciou in the sight of the lord is the death of hi saint

116:16 o lord truli i am thi servant; i am thi servant and the son
of thine handmaid: thou hast loos my bond

116:17 i will offer to thee the sacrific of thanksgiv and will
call upon the name of the lord

116:18 i will pay my vow unto the lord now in the presenc of all hi
peopl

116:19 in the court of the lord hous in the midst of thee o
jerusalem prais ye the lord



117:1 o prais the lord all ye nations: prais him all ye peopl

117:2 for hi merci kind is great toward us: and the truth of
the lord endureth for ever prais ye the lord



118:1 o give thank unto the lord; for he is good: becaus hi merci
endureth for ever

118:2 let israel now say that hi merci endureth for ever

118:3 let the hous of aaron now say that hi merci endureth for
ever

118:4 let them now that fear the lord say that hi merci endureth for
ever

118:5 i call upon the lord in distress: the lord answer me and
set me in a larg place

118:6 the lord is on my side; i will not fear: what can man do unto
me?

118:7 the lord taketh my part with them that help me: therefor shall
i see my desir upon them that hate me

118:8 it is better to trust in the lord than to put confid in man

118:9 it is better to trust in the lord than to put confid in
princ

118:10 all nation compass me about: but in the name of the lord
will i destroy them

118:11 they compass me about; yea they compass me about: but in
the name of the lord i will destroy them

118:12 they compass me about like bees: they are quench as the
fire of thorns: for in the name of the lord i will destroy them

118:13 thou hast thrust sore at me that i might fall: but the lord
help me

118:14 the lord is my strength and song and is becom my salvat

118:15 the voic of rejoic and salvat is in the tabernacl of
the righteous: the right hand of the lord doeth valiantli

118:16 the right hand of the lord is exalted: the right hand of the
lord doeth valiantli

118:17 i shall not die but live and declar the work of the lord

118:18 the lord hath chasten me sore: but he hath not given me over
unto death

118:19 open to me the gate of righteousness: i will go into them and
i will prais the lord:

118:20 thi gate of the lord into which the righteou shall enter

118:21 i will prais thee: for thou hast heard me and art becom my
salvat

118:22 the stone which the builder refus is becom the head stone
of the corner

118:23 thi is the lord doing; it is marvel in our eye

118:24 thi is the day which the lord hath made; we will rejoic and
be glad in it

118:25 save now i beseech thee o lord: o lord i beseech thee send
now prosper

118:26 bless be he that cometh in the name of the lord: we have
bless you out of the hous of the lord

118:27 god is the lord which hath shew us light: bind the sacrific
with cord even unto the horn of the altar

118:28 thou art my god and i will prais thee: thou art my god i
will exalt thee

118:29 o give thank unto the lord; for he is good: for hi merci
endureth for ever



119:1 bless are the undefil in the way who walk in the law of the
lord

119:2 bless are they that keep hi testimoni and that seek him
with the whole heart

119:3 they also do no iniquity: they walk in hi way

119:4 thou hast command us to keep thi precept dilig

119:5 o that my way were direct to keep thi statutes!

119:6 then shall i not be asham when i have respect unto all thi
command

119:7 i will prais thee with upright of heart when i shall have
learn thi righteou judgment

119:8 i will keep thi statutes: o forsak me not utterli

119:9 wherewith shall a young man cleans hi way? by take heed
thereto accord to thi word

119:10 with my whole heart have i sought thee: o let me not wander
from thi command

119:11 thi word have i hid in mine heart that i might not sin against
thee

119:12 bless art thou o lord: teach me thi statut

119:13 with my lip have i declar all the judgment of thi mouth

119:14 i have rejoic in the way of thi testimoni as much as in
all rich

119:15 i will medit in thi precept and have respect unto thi
way

119:16 i will delight myself in thi statutes: i will not forget thi
word

119:17 deal bounti with thi servant that i may live and keep
thi word

119:18 open thou mine eye that i may behold wondrou thing out of
thi law

119:19 i am a stranger in the earth: hide not thi command from
me

119:20 my soul breaketh for the long that it hath unto thi
judgment at all time

119:21 thou hast rebuk the proud that are curs which do err from
thi command

119:22 remov from me reproach and contempt; for i have kept thi
testimoni

119:23 princ also did sit and speak against me: but thi servant did
medit in thi statut

119:24 thi testimoni also are my delight and my counsellorsleth

119:25 my soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me accord to
thi word

119:26 i have declar my way and thou heardest me: teach me thi
statut

119:27 make me to understand the way of thi precepts: so shall i talk
of thi wondrou work

119:28 my soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me accord
unto thi word

119:29 remov from me the way of lying: and grant me thi law
gracious

119:30 i have chosen the way of truth: thi judgment have i laid
befor me

119:31 i have stuck unto thi testimonies: o lord put me not to shame

119:32 i will run the way of thi command when thou shalt enlarg
my heart

119:33 teach me o lord the way of thi statutes; and i shall keep it
unto the end

119:34 give me understand and i shall keep thi law; yea i shall
observ it with my whole heart

119:35 make me to go in the path of thi commandments; for therein do i
delight

119:36 inclin my heart unto thi testimoni and not to covet

119:37 turn away mine eye from behold vanity; and quicken thou me
in thi way

119:38 stablish thi word unto thi servant who is devot to thi fear

119:39 turn away my reproach which i fear: for thi judgment are good

119:40 behold i have long after thi precepts: quicken me in thi
righteous

119:41 let thi merci come also unto me o lord even thi salvat
accord to thi word

119:42 so shall i have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me:
for i trust in thi word

119:43 and take not the word of truth utterli out of my mouth; for i
have hope in thi judgment

119:44 so shall i keep thi law continu for ever and ever

119:45 and i will walk at liberty: for i seek thi precept

119:46 i will speak of thi testimoni also befor king and will not
be asham

119:47 and i will delight myself in thi command which i have
love

119:48 my hand also will i lift up unto thi command which i
have loved; and i will medit in thi statut

119:49 rememb the word unto thi servant upon which thou hast caus
me to hope

119:50 thi is my comfort in my affliction: for thi word hath
quicken me

119:51 the proud have had me greatli in derision: yet have i not
declin from thi law

119:52 i rememb thi judgment of old o lord; and have comfort
myself

119:53 horror hath taken hold upon me becaus of the wick that
forsak thi law

119:54 thi statut have been my song in the hous of my pilgrimag

119:55 i have rememb thi name o lord in the night and have kept
thi law

119:56 thi i had becaus i kept thi precept

119:57 thou art my portion o lord: i have said that i would keep thi
word

119:58 i intreat thi favour with my whole heart: be merci unto me
accord to thi word

119:59 i thought on my way and turn my feet unto thi testimoni

119:60 i made hast and delay not to keep thi command

119:61 the band of the wick have rob me: but i have not
forgotten thi law

119:62 at midnight i will rise to give thank unto thee becaus of thi
righteou judgment

119:63 i am a companion of all them that fear thee and of them that
keep thi precept

119:64 the earth o lord is full of thi mercy: teach me thi statut

119:65 thou hast dealt well with thi servant o lord accord unto
thi word

119:66 teach me good judgment and knowledge: for i have believ thi
command

119:67 befor i wa afflict i went astray: but now have i kept thi
word

119:68 thou art good and doest good; teach me thi statut

119:69 the proud have forg a lie against me: but i will keep thi
precept with my whole heart

119:70 their heart is as fat as grease; but i delight in thi law

119:71 it is good for me that i have been afflicted; that i might
learn thi statut

119:72 the law of thi mouth is better unto me than thousand of gold
and silver

119:73 thi hand have made me and fashion me: give me understand
that i may learn thi command

119:74 they that fear thee will be glad when they see me; becaus i
have hope in thi word

119:75 i know o lord that thi judgment are right and that thou in
faith hast afflict me

119:76 let i pray thee thi merci kind be for my comfort
accord to thi word unto thi servant

119:77 let thi tender merci come unto me that i may live: for thi
law is my delight

119:78 let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt pervers with me
without a cause: but i will medit in thi precept

119:79 let those that fear thee turn unto me and those that have
known thi testimoni

119:80 let my heart be sound in thi statutes; that i be not asham

119:81 my soul fainteth for thi salvation: but i hope in thi word

119:82 mine eye fail for thi word say when wilt thou comfort me?

119:83 for i am becom like a bottl in the smoke; yet do i not forget
thi statut

119:84 how mani are the day of thi servant? when wilt thou execut
judgment on them that persecut me?

119:85 the proud have dig pit for me which are not after thi law

119:86 all thi command are faithful: they persecut me
wrongfully; help thou me

119:87 they had almost consum me upon earth; but i forsook not thi
precept

119:88 quicken me after thi lovingkindness; so shall i keep the
testimoni of thi mouth

119:89 for ever o lord thi word is settl in heaven

119:90 thi faith is unto all generations: thou hast establish
the earth and it abideth

119:91 they continu thi day accord to thine ordinances: for all
are thi servant

119:92 unless thi law had been my delight i should then have
perish in mine afflict

119:93 i will never forget thi precepts: for with them thou hast
quicken me

119:94 i am thine save me: for i have sought thi precept

119:95 the wick have wait for me to destroy me: but i will
consid thi testimoni

119:96 i have seen an end of all perfection: but thi command is
exceed broad

119:97 o how i love thi law! it is my medit all the day

119:98 thou through thi command hast made me wiser than mine
enemies: for they are ever with me

119:99 i have more understand than all my teachers: for thi
testimoni are my medit

119:100 i understand more than the ancient becaus i keep thi
precept

119:101 i have refrain my feet from everi evil way that i might
keep thi word

119:102 i have not depart from thi judgments: for thou hast taught
me

119:103 how sweet are thi word unto my taste! yea sweeter than honey
to my mouth!

119:104 through thi precept i get understanding: therefor i hate
everi fals way

119:105 thi word is a lamp unto my feet and a light unto my path

119:106 i have sworn and i will perform it that i will keep thi
righteou judgment

119:107 i am afflict veri much: quicken me o lord accord unto
thi word

119:108 accept i beseech thee the freewil offer of my mouth o
lord and teach me thi judgment

119:109 my soul is continu in my hand: yet do i not forget thi
law

119:110 the wick have laid a snare for me: yet i er not from thi
precept

119:111 thi testimoni have i taken as an heritag for ever: for they
are the rejoic of my heart

119:112 i have inclin mine heart to perform thi statut alway even
unto the end

119:113 i hate vain thoughts: but thi law do i love

119:114 thou art my hide place and my shield: i hope in thi word

119:115 depart from me ye evildoers: for i will keep the command
of my god

119:116 uphold me accord unto thi word that i may live: and let me
not be asham of my hope

119:117 hold thou me up and i shall be safe: and i will have respect
unto thi statut continu

119:118 thou hast trodden down all them that err from thi statutes:
for their deceit is falsehood

119:119 thou puttest away all the wick of the earth like dross:
therefor i love thi testimoni

119:120 my flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and i am afraid of thi
judgment

119:121 i have done judgment and justice: leav me not to mine
oppressor

119:122 be sureti for thi servant for good: let not the proud oppress
me

119:123 mine eye fail for thi salvat and for the word of thi
righteous

119:124 deal with thi servant accord unto thi merci and teach me
thi statut

119:125 i am thi servant; give me understand that i may know thi
testimoni

119:126 it is time for thee lord to work: for they have made void
thi law

119:127 therefor i love thi command abov gold; yea abov fine
gold

119:128 therefor i esteem all thi precept concern all thing to
be right; and i hate everi fals way

119:129 thi testimoni are wonderful: therefor doth my soul keep
them

119:130 the entranc of thi word giveth light; it giveth
understand unto the simpl

119:131 i open my mouth and panted: for i long for thi
command

119:132 look thou upon me and be merci unto me as thou usest to
do unto those that love thi name

119:133 order my step in thi word: and let not ani iniqu have
dominion over me

119:134 deliv me from the oppress of man: so will i keep thi
precept

119:135 make thi face to shine upon thi servant; and teach me thi
statut

119:136 river of water run down mine eye becaus they keep not thi
law

119:137 righteou art thou o lord and upright are thi judgment

119:138 thi testimoni that thou hast command are righteou and
veri faith

119:139 my zeal hath consum me becaus mine enemi have forgotten
thi word

119:140 thi word is veri pure: therefor thi servant loveth it

119:141 i am small and despised: yet do not i forget thi precept

119:142 thi righteous is an everlast righteous and thi law
is the truth

119:143 troubl and anguish have taken hold on me: yet thi
command are my delight

119:144 the righteous of thi testimoni is everlasting: give me
understand and i shall live

119:145 i cri with my whole heart; hear me o lord: i will keep thi
statut

119:146 i cri unto thee; save me and i shall keep thi testimoni

119:147 i prevent the dawn of the morn and cried: i hope in
thi word

119:148 mine eye prevent the night watch that i might medit in
thi word

119:149 hear my voic accord unto thi lovingkindness: o lord
quicken me accord to thi judgment

119:150 they draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from
thi law

119:151 thou art near o lord; and all thi command are truth

119:152 concern thi testimoni i have known of old that thou hast
found them for ever

119:153 consid mine afflict and deliv me: for i do not forget
thi law

119:154 plead my caus and deliv me: quicken me accord to thi
word

119:155 salvat is far from the wicked: for they seek not thi
statut

119:156 great are thi tender merci o lord: quicken me accord to
thi judgment

119:157 mani are my persecutor and mine enemies; yet do i not declin
from thi testimoni

119:158 i beheld the transgressor and wa grieved; becaus they kept
not thi word

119:159 consid how i love thi precepts: quicken me o lord
accord to thi lovingkind

119:160 thi word is true from the beginning: and everi one of thi
righteou judgment endureth for ever

119:161 princ have persecut me without a cause: but my heart
standeth in awe of thi word

119:162 i rejoic at thi word as one that findeth great spoil

119:163 i hate and abhor lying: but thi law do i love

119:164 seven time a day do i prais thee becaus of thi righteou
judgment

119:165 great peac have they which love thi law: and noth shall
offend them

119:166 lord i have hope for thi salvat and done thi
command

119:167 my soul hath kept thi testimonies; and i love them
exceedingli

119:168 i have kept thi precept and thi testimonies: for all my way
are befor thee

119:169 let my cri come near befor thee o lord: give me
understand accord to thi word

119:170 let my supplic come befor thee: deliv me accord to
thi word

119:171 my lip shall utter prais when thou hast taught me thi
statut

119:172 my tongu shall speak of thi word: for all thi command
are righteous

119:173 let thine hand help me; for i have chosen thi precept

119:174 i have long for thi salvat o lord; and thi law is my
delight

119:175 let my soul live and it shall prais thee; and let thi
judgment help me

119:176 i have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thi servant; for i
do not forget thi command



120:1 in my distress i cri unto the lord and he heard me

120:2 deliv my soul o lord from lie lip and from a deceit
tongu

120:3 what shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee
thou fals tongue?

120:4 sharp arrow of the mighti with coal of junip

120:5 woe is me that i sojourn in mesech that i dwell in the tent
of kedar!

120:6 my soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peac

120:7 i am for peace: but when i speak they are for war



121:1 i will lift up mine eye unto the hill from whenc cometh my
help

121:2 my help cometh from the lord which made heaven and earth

121:3 he will not suffer thi foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee
will not slumber

121:4 behold he that keepeth israel shall neither slumber nor sleep

121:5 the lord is thi keeper: the lord is thi shade upon thi right
hand

121:6 the sun shall not smite thee by day nor the moon by night

121:7 the lord shall preserv thee from all evil: he shall preserv
thi soul

121:8 the lord shall preserv thi go out and thi come in from
thi time forth and even for evermor



122:1 i wa glad when they said unto me let us go into the hous of
the lord

122:2 our feet shall stand within thi gate o jerusalem

122:3 jerusalem is build as a citi that is compact together:

122:4 whither the tribe go up the tribe of the lord unto the
testimoni of israel to give thank unto the name of the lord

122:5 for there are set throne of judgment the throne of the hous
of david

122:6 pray for the peac of jerusalem: they shall prosper that love
thee

122:7 peac be within thi wall and prosper within thi palac

122:8 for my brethren and companion sake i will now say peac be
within thee

122:9 becaus of the hous of the lord our god i will seek thi good



123:1 unto thee lift i up mine eye o thou that dwellest in the
heaven

123:2 behold as the eye of servant look unto the hand of their
master and as the eye of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; so
our eye wait upon the lord our god until that he have merci upon us

123:3 have merci upon us o lord have merci upon us: for we are
exceedingli fill with contempt

123:4 our soul is exceedingli fill with the scorn of those that
are at eas and with the contempt of the proud



124:1 if it had not been the lord who wa on our side now may israel
say;

124:2 if it had not been the lord who wa on our side when men rose
up against us:

124:3 then they had swallow us up quick when their wrath wa
kindl against us:

124:4 then the water had overwhelm us the stream had gone over our
soul:

124:5 then the proud water had gone over our soul

124:6 bless be the lord who hath not given us as a prey to their
teeth

124:7 our soul is escap as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers:
the snare is broken and we are escap

124:8 our help is in the name of the lord who made heaven and earth



125:1 they that trust in the lord shall be as mount zion which cannot
be remov but abideth for ever

125:2 as the mountain are round about jerusalem so the lord is round
about hi peopl from henceforth even for ever

125:3 for the rod of the wick shall not rest upon the lot of the
righteous; lest the righteou put forth their hand unto iniqu

125:4 do good o lord unto those that be good and to them that are
upright in their heart

125:5 as for such as turn asid unto their crook way the lord
shall lead them forth with the worker of iniquity: but peac shall be
upon israel



126:1 when the lord turn again the captiv of zion we were like
them that dream

126:2 then wa our mouth fill with laughter and our tongu with
singing: then said they among the heathen the lord hath done great
thing for them

126:3 the lord hath done great thing for us; whereof we are glad

126:4 turn again our captiv o lord as the stream in the south

126:5 they that sow in tear shall reap in joy

126:6 he that goeth forth and weepeth bear preciou seed shall
doubtless come again with rejoic bring hi sheav with him



127:1 except the lord build the hous they labour in vain that build
it: except the lord keep the citi the watchman waketh but in vain

127:2 it is vain for you to rise up earli to sit up late to eat the
bread of sorrows: for so he giveth hi belov sleep

127:3 lo children are an heritag of the lord: and the fruit of the
womb is hi reward

127:4 as arrow are in the hand of a mighti man; so are children of
the youth

127:5 happi is the man that hath hi quiver full of them: they shall
not be asham but they shall speak with the enemi in the gate



128:1 bless is everi one that feareth the lord; that walketh in hi
way

128:2 for thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happi shalt thou
be and it shall be well with thee

128:3 thi wife shall be as a fruit vine by the side of thine
house: thi children like oliv plant round about thi tabl

128:4 behold that thu shall the man be bless that feareth the
lord

128:5 the lord shall bless thee out of zion: and thou shalt see the
good of jerusalem all the day of thi life

128:6 yea thou shalt see thi children children and peac upon
israel



129:1 mani a time have they afflict me from my youth may israel now
say:

129:2 mani a time have they afflict me from my youth: yet they have
not prevail against me

129:3 the plower plow upon my back: they made long their furrow

129:4 the lord is righteous: he hath cut asund the cord of the
wick

129:5 let them all be confound and turn back that hate zion

129:6 let them be as the grass upon the housetop which withereth
afor it groweth up:

129:7 wherewith the mower filleth not hi hand; nor he that bindeth
sheav hi bosom

129:8 neither do they which go by say the bless of the lord be
upon you: we bless you in the name of the lord



130:1 out of the depth have i cri unto thee o lord

130:2 lord hear my voice: let thine ear be attent to the voic of
my supplic

130:3 if thou lord shouldest mark iniqu o lord who shall
stand?

130:4 but there is forgiv with thee that thou mayest be fear

130:5 i wait for the lord my soul doth wait and in hi word do i
hope

130:6 my soul waiteth for the lord more than they that watch for the
morning: i say more than they that watch for the morn

130:7 let israel hope in the lord: for with the lord there is merci
and with him is plenteou redempt

130:8 and he shall redeem israel from all hi iniqu



131:1 lord my heart is not haughti nor mine eye lofty: neither do i
exercis myself in great matter or in thing too high for me

131:2 sure i have behav and quiet myself as a child that is
wean of hi mother: my soul is even as a wean child

131:3 let israel hope in the lord from henceforth and for ever



132:1 lord rememb david and all hi afflictions:

132:2 how he sware unto the lord and vow unto the mighti god of
jacob;

132:3 sure i will not come into the tabernacl of my hous nor go
up into my bed;

132:4 i will not give sleep to mine eye or slumber to mine eyelid

132:5 until i find out a place for the lord an habit for the
mighti god of jacob

132:6 lo we heard of it at ephratah: we found it in the field of the
wood

132:7 we will go into hi tabernacles: we will worship at hi
footstool

132:8 aris o lord into thi rest; thou and the ark of thi strength

132:9 let thi priest be cloth with righteousness; and let thi
saint shout for joy

132:10 for thi servant david sake turn not away the face of thine
anoint

132:11 the lord hath sworn in truth unto david; he will not turn from
it; of the fruit of thi bodi will i set upon thi throne

132:12 if thi children will keep my coven and my testimoni that i
shall teach them their children shall also sit upon thi throne for
evermor

132:13 for the lord hath chosen zion; he hath desir it for hi
habit

132:14 thi is my rest for ever: here will i dwell; for i have desir
it

132:15 i will abundantli bless her provision: i will satisfi her poor
with bread

132:16 i will also cloth her priest with salvation: and her saint
shall shout aloud for joy

132:17 there will i make the horn of david to bud: i have ordain a
lamp for mine anoint

132:18 hi enemi will i cloth with shame: but upon himself shall
hi crown flourish



133:1 behold how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell
togeth in unity!

133:2 it is like the preciou ointment upon the head that ran down
upon the beard even aaron beard: that went down to the skirt of
hi garments;

133:3 as the dew of hermon and as the dew that descend upon the
mountain of zion: for there the lord command the bless even
life for evermor



134:1 behold bless ye the lord all ye servant of the lord which by
night stand in the hous of the lord

134:2 lift up your hand in the sanctuari and bless the lord

134:3 the lord that made heaven and earth bless thee out of zion



135:1 prais ye the lord prais ye the name of the lord; prais him
o ye servant of the lord

135:2 ye that stand in the hous of the lord in the court of the
hous of our god

135:3 prais the lord; for the lord is good: sing prais unto hi
name; for it is pleasant

135:4 for the lord hath chosen jacob unto himself and israel for hi
peculiar treasur

135:5 for i know that the lord is great and that our lord is abov
all god

135:6 whatsoev the lord pleas that did he in heaven and in
earth in the sea and all deep place

135:7 he causeth the vapour to ascend from the end of the earth; he
maketh lightn for the rain; he bringeth the wind out of hi
treasuri

135:8 who smote the firstborn of egypt both of man and beast

135:9 who sent token and wonder into the midst of thee o egypt
upon pharaoh and upon all hi servant

135:10 who smote great nation and slew mighti kings;

135:11 sihon king of the amorit and og king of bashan and all the
kingdom of canaan:

135:12 and gave their land for an heritag an heritag unto israel
hi peopl

135:13 thi name o lord endureth for ever; and thi memori o lord
throughout all gener

135:14 for the lord will judg hi peopl and he will repent himself
concern hi servant

135:15 the idol of the heathen are silver and gold the work of men
hand

135:16 they have mouth but they speak not; eye have they but they
see not;

135:17 they have ear but they hear not; neither is there ani breath
in their mouth

135:18 they that make them are like unto them: so is everi one that
trusteth in them

135:19 bless the lord o hous of israel: bless the lord o hous of
aaron:

135:20 bless the lord o hous of levi: ye that fear the lord bless
the lord

135:21 bless be the lord out of zion which dwelleth at jerusalem

prais ye the lord



136:1 o give thank unto the lord; for he is good: for hi merci
endureth for ever

136:2 o give thank unto the god of gods: for hi merci endureth for
ever

136:3 o give thank to the lord of lords: for hi merci endureth for
ever

136:4 to him who alon doeth great wonders: for hi merci endureth for
ever

136:5 to him that by wisdom made the heavens: for hi merci endureth
for ever

136:6 to him that stretch out the earth abov the waters: for hi
merci endureth for ever

136:7 to him that made great lights: for hi merci endureth for ever:

136:8 the sun to rule by day: for hi merci endureth for ever:

136:9 the moon and star to rule by night: for hi merci endureth for
ever

136:10 to him that smote egypt in their firstborn: for hi merci
endureth for ever:

136:11 and brought out israel from among them: for hi merci endureth
for ever:

136:12 with a strong hand and with a stretch out arm: for hi merci
endureth for ever

136:13 to him which divid the red sea into parts: for hi merci
endureth for ever:

136:14 and made israel to pass through the midst of it: for hi merci
endureth for ever:

136:15 but overthrew pharaoh and hi host in the red sea: for hi
merci endureth for ever

136:16 to him which led hi peopl through the wilderness: for hi
merci endureth for ever

136:17 to him which smote great kings: for hi merci endureth for
ever:

136:18 and slew famou kings: for hi merci endureth for ever:

136:19 sihon king of the amorites: for hi merci endureth for ever:

136:20 and og the king of bashan: for hi merci endureth for ever:

136:21 and gave their land for an heritage: for hi merci endureth for
ever:

136:22 even an heritag unto israel hi servant: for hi merci
endureth for ever

136:23 who rememb us in our low estate: for hi merci endureth for
ever:

136:24 and hath redeem us from our enemies: for hi merci endureth
for ever

136:25 who giveth food to all flesh: for hi merci endureth for ever

136:26 o give thank unto the god of heaven: for hi merci endureth
for ever



137:1 by the river of babylon there we sat down yea we wept when
we rememb zion

137:2 we hang our harp upon the willow in the midst thereof

137:3 for there they that carri us away captiv requir of us a
song; and they that wast us requir of us mirth say sing us
one of the song of zion

137:4 how shall we sing the lord song in a strang land?

137:5 if i forget thee o jerusalem let my right hand forget her
cun

137:6 if i do not rememb thee let my tongu cleav to the roof of
my mouth; if i prefer not jerusalem abov my chief joy

137:7 rememb o lord the children of edom in the day of jerusalem;
who said rase it rase it even to the foundat thereof

137:8 o daughter of babylon who art to be destroyed; happi shall he
be that rewardeth thee as thou hast serv us

137:9 happi shall he be that taketh and dasheth thi littl one
against the stone



138:1 i will prais thee with my whole heart: befor the god will i
sing prais unto thee

138:2 i will worship toward thi holi templ and prais thi name for
thi lovingkind and for thi truth: for thou hast magnifi thi word
abov all thi name

138:3 in the day when i cri thou answeredst me and strengthenedst
me with strength in my soul

138:4 all the king of the earth shall prais thee o lord when they
hear the word of thi mouth

138:5 yea they shall sing in the way of the lord: for great is the
glori of the lord

138:6 though the lord be high yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but
the proud he knoweth afar off

138:7 though i walk in the midst of troubl thou wilt reviv me: thou
shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemi and
thi right hand shall save me

138:8 the lord will perfect that which concerneth me: thi merci o
lord endureth for ever: forsak not the work of thine own hand



139:1 o lord thou hast search me and known me

139:2 thou knowest my downsit and mine upris thou
understandest my thought afar off

139:3 thou compassest my path and my lie down and art acquaint
with all my way

139:4 for there is not a word in my tongu but lo o lord thou
knowest it altogeth

139:5 thou hast beset me behind and befor and laid thine hand upon
me

139:6 such knowledg is too wonder for me; it is high i cannot
attain unto it

139:7 whither shall i go from thi spirit? or whither shall i flee from
thi presence?

139:8 if i ascend up into heaven thou art there: if i make my bed in
hell behold thou art there

139:9 if i take the wing of the morn and dwell in the uttermost
part of the sea;

139:10 even there shall thi hand lead me and thi right hand shall
hold me

139:11 if i say sure the dark shall cover me; even the night
shall be light about me

139:12 yea the dark hideth not from thee; but the night shineth
as the day: the dark and the light are both alik to thee

139:13 for thou hast possess my reins: thou hast cover me in my
mother womb

139:14 i will prais thee; for i am fear and wonder made:
marvel are thi works; and that my soul knoweth right well

139:15 my substanc wa not hid from thee when i wa made in secret
and curious wrought in the lowest part of the earth

139:16 thine eye did see my substanc yet be unperfect; and in
thi book all my member were written which in continu were
fashion when as yet there wa none of them

139:17 how preciou also are thi thought unto me o god! how great is
the sum of them!

139:18 if i should count them they are more in number than the sand:
when i awak i am still with thee

139:19 sure thou wilt slay the wick o god: depart from me
therefor ye bloodi men

139:20 for they speak against thee wickedli and thine enemi take
thi name in vain

139:21 do not i hate them o lord that hate thee? and am not i
griev with those that rise up against thee?

139:22 i hate them with perfect hatred: i count them mine enemi

139:23 search me o god and know my heart: tri me and know my
thoughts:

139:24 and see if there be ani wick way in me and lead me in the
way everlast



140:1 deliv me o lord from the evil man: preserv me from the
violent man;

140:2 which imagin mischief in their heart; continu are they
gather togeth for war

140:3 they have sharpen their tongu like a serpent; adder poison
is under their lip selah

140:4 keep me o lord from the hand of the wicked; preserv me from
the violent man; who have purpos to overthrow my go

140:5 the proud have hid a snare for me and cords; they have spread a
net by the wayside; they have set gin for me selah

140:6 i said unto the lord thou art my god: hear the voic of my
supplic o lord

140:7 o god the lord the strength of my salvat thou hast cover
my head in the day of battl

140:8 grant not o lord the desir of the wicked: further not hi
wick device; lest they exalt themselv selah

140:9 as for the head of those that compass me about let the mischief
of their own lip cover them

140:10 let burn coal fall upon them: let them be cast into the
fire; into deep pit that they rise not up again

140:11 let not an evil speaker be establish in the earth: evil shall
hunt the violent man to overthrow him

140:12 i know that the lord will maintain the caus of the afflict
and the right of the poor

140:13 sure the righteou shall give thank unto thi name: the
upright shall dwell in thi presenc



141:1 lord i cri unto thee: make hast unto me; give ear unto my
voic when i cri unto thee

141:2 let my prayer be set forth befor thee as incense; and the
lift up of my hand as the even sacrific

141:3 set a watch o lord befor my mouth; keep the door of my lip

141:4 inclin not my heart to ani evil thing to practis wick work
with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainti

141:5 let the righteou smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him
reprov me; it shall be an excel oil which shall not break my
head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calam

141:6 when their judg are overthrown in stoni place they shall
hear my words; for they are sweet

141:7 our bone are scatter at the grave mouth as when one
cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth

141:8 but mine eye are unto thee o god the lord: in thee is my
trust; leav not my soul destitut

141:9 keep me from the snare which they have laid for me and the
gin of the worker of iniqu

141:10 let the wick fall into their own net whilst that i withal
escap



142:1 i cri unto the lord with my voice; with my voic unto the lord
did i make my supplic

142:2 i pour out my complaint befor him; i shew befor him my
troubl

142:3 when my spirit wa overwhelm within me then thou knewest my
path

in the way wherein i walk have they privili laid a snare for me

142:4 i look on my right hand and beheld but there wa no man that
would know me: refug fail me; no man care for my soul

142:5 i cri unto thee o lord: i said thou art my refug and my
portion in the land of the live

142:6 attend unto my cry; for i am brought veri low: deliv me from
my persecutors; for they are stronger than i

142:7 bring my soul out of prison that i may prais thi name: the
righteou shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bounti with
me



143:1 hear my prayer o lord give ear to my supplications: in thi
faith answer me and in thi righteous

143:2 and enter not into judgment with thi servant: for in thi sight
shall no man live be justifi

143:3 for the enemi hath persecut my soul; he hath smitten my life
down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in dark as those
that have been long dead

143:4 therefor is my spirit overwhelm within me; my heart within me
is desol

143:5 i rememb the day of old; i medit on all thi works; i muse
on the work of thi hand

143:6 i stretch forth my hand unto thee: my soul thirsteth after
thee as a thirsti land selah

143:7 hear me speedili o lord: my spirit faileth: hide not thi face
from me lest i be like unto them that go down into the pit

143:8 caus me to hear thi lovingkind in the morning; for in thee
do i trust: caus me to know the way wherein i should walk; for i lift
up my soul unto thee

143:9 deliv me o lord from mine enemies: i flee unto thee to hide
me

143:10 teach me to do thi will; for thou art my god: thi spirit is
good; lead me into the land of upright

143:11 quicken me o lord for thi name sake: for thi righteous
sake bring my soul out of troubl

143:12 and of thi merci cut off mine enemi and destroy all them
that afflict my soul: for i am thi servant



144:1 bless be the lord my strength which teacheth my hand to war
and my finger to fight:

144:2 my good and my fortress; my high tower and my deliverer;
my shield and he in whom i trust; who subdueth my peopl under me

144:3 lord what is man that thou takest knowledg of him! or the son
of man that thou makest account of him!

144:4 man is like to vanity: hi day are as a shadow that passeth
away

144:5 bow thi heaven o lord and come down: touch the mountain and
they shall smoke

144:6 cast forth lightn and scatter them: shoot out thine arrow
and destroy them

144:7 send thine hand from above; rid me and deliv me out of great
water from the hand of strang children;

144:8 whose mouth speaketh vaniti and their right hand is a right
hand of falsehood

144:9 i will sing a new song unto thee o god: upon a psalteri and an
instrument of ten string will i sing prais unto thee

144:10 it is he that giveth salvat unto kings: who delivereth david
hi servant from the hurt sword

144:11 rid me and deliv me from the hand of strang children whose
mouth speaketh vaniti and their right hand is a right hand of
falsehood:

144:12 that our son may be as plant grown up in their youth; that
our daughter may be as corner stone polish after the similitud
of a palace:

144:13 that our garner may be full afford all manner of store:
that our sheep may bring forth thousand and ten thousand in our
streets:

144:14 that our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no
break in nor go out; that there be no complain in our
street

144:15 happi is that peopl that is in such a case: yea happi is
that peopl whose god is the lord



145:1 i will extol thee my god o king; and i will bless thi name for
ever and ever

145:2 everi day will i bless thee; and i will prais thi name for ever
and ever

145:3 great is the lord and greatli to be praised; and hi great
is unsearch

145:4 one gener shall prais thi work to anoth and shall
declar thi mighti act

145:5 i will speak of the gloriou honour of thi majesti and of thi
wondrou work

145:6 and men shall speak of the might of thi terribl acts: and i
will declar thi great

145:7 they shall abundantli utter the memori of thi great good
and shall sing of thi righteous

145:8 the lord is graciou and full of compassion; slow to anger and
of great merci

145:9 the lord is good to all: and hi tender merci are over all hi
work

145:10 all thi work shall prais thee o lord; and thi saint shall
bless thee

145:11 they shall speak of the glori of thi kingdom and talk of thi
power;

145:12 to make known to the son of men hi mighti act and the
gloriou majesti of hi kingdom

145:13 thi kingdom is an everlast kingdom and thi dominion
endureth throughout all gener

145:14 the lord upholdeth all that fall and raiseth up all those that
be bow down

145:15 the eye of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their meat
in due season

145:16 thou openest thine hand and satisfiest the desir of everi
live thing

145:17 the lord is righteou in all hi way and holi in all hi
work

145:18 the lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him to all that
call upon him in truth

145:19 he will fulfil the desir of them that fear him: he also will
hear their cri and will save them

145:20 the lord preserveth all them that love him: but all the wick
will he destroy

145:21 my mouth shall speak the prais of the lord: and let all flesh
bless hi holi name for ever and ever



146:1 prais ye the lord prais the lord o my soul

146:2 while i live will i prais the lord: i will sing prais unto my
god while i have ani be

146:3 put not your trust in princ nor in the son of man in whom
there is no help

146:4 hi breath goeth forth he returneth to hi earth; in that veri
day hi thought perish

146:5 happi is he that hath the god of jacob for hi help whose hope
is in the lord hi god:

146:6 which made heaven and earth the sea and all that therein is:
which keepeth truth for ever:

146:7 which executeth judgment for the oppressed: which giveth food to
the hungri the lord looseth the prisoners:

146:8 the lord openeth the eye of the blind: the lord raiseth them
that are bow down: the lord loveth the righteous:

146:9 the lord preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless
and widow: but the way of the wick he turneth upsid down

146:10 the lord shall reign for ever even thi god o zion unto all
gener prais ye the lord



147:1 prais ye the lord: for it is good to sing prais unto our god;
for it is pleasant; and prais is come

147:2 the lord doth build up jerusalem: he gathereth togeth the
outcast of israel

147:3 he healeth the broken in heart and bindeth up their wound

147:4 he telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their
name

147:5 great is our lord and of great power: hi understand is
infinit

147:6 the lord lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wick down to the
ground

147:7 sing unto the lord with thanksgiving; sing prais upon the harp
unto our god:

147:8 who covereth the heaven with cloud who prepareth rain for the
earth who maketh grass to grow upon the mountain

147:9 he giveth to the beast hi food and to the young raven which
cri

147:10 he delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not
pleasur in the leg of a man
