30:20 such is the way of an adulter woman; she eateth and wipeth
her mouth and saith i have done no wicked

30:21 for three thing the earth is disquiet and for four which it
cannot bear: 30:22 for a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he
is fill with meat; 30:23 for an odiou woman when she is married;
and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress

30:24 there be four thing which are littl upon the earth but they
are exceed wise: 30:25 the ant are a peopl not strong yet they
prepar their meat in the summer; 30:26 the coni are but a feebl
folk yet make they their hous in the rocks; 30:27 the locust have
no king yet go they forth all of them by bands; 30:28 the spider
taketh hold with her hand and is in king palac

30:29 there be three thing which go well yea four are come in
going: 30:30 a lion which is strongest among beast and turneth not
away for any; 30:31 a greyhound; an he goat also; and a king against
whom there is no rise up

30:32 if thou hast done foolishli in lift up thyself or if thou
hast thought evil lay thine hand upon thi mouth

30:33 sure the churn of milk bringeth forth butter and the
wring of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forc of wrath
bringeth forth strife

31:1 the word of king lemuel the propheci that hi mother taught
him

31:2 what my son? and what the son of my womb? and what the son of
my vows? 31:3 give not thi strength unto women nor thi way to that
which destroyeth king

31:4 it is not for king o lemuel it is not for king to drink wine;
nor for princ strong drink: 31:5 lest they drink and forget the
law and pervert the judgment of ani of the afflict

31:6 give strong drink unto him that is readi to perish and wine unto
those that be of heavi heart

31:7 let him drink and forget hi poverti and rememb hi miseri no
more

31:8 open thi mouth for the dumb in the caus of all such as are
appoint to destruct

31:9 open thi mouth judg righteous and plead the caus of the
poor and needi

31:10 who can find a virtuou woman? for her price is far abov
rubi

31:11 the heart of her husband doth safe trust in her so that he
shall have no need of spoil

31:12 she will do him good and not evil all the day of her life

31:13 she seeketh wool and flax and worketh willingli with her
hand

31:14 she is like the merchant ships; she bringeth her food from
afar

31:15 she riseth also while it is yet night and giveth meat to her
household and a portion to her maiden

31:16 she considereth a field and buyeth it: with the fruit of her
hand she planteth a vineyard

31:17 she girdeth her loin with strength and strengtheneth her arm

31:18 she perceiveth that her merchandis is good: her candl goeth
not out by night

31:19 she layeth her hand to the spindl and her hand hold the
distaff

31:20 she stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea she reacheth forth
her hand to the needi

31:21 she is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her
household are cloth with scarlet

31:22 she maketh herself cover of tapestry; her cloth is silk
and purpl

31:23 her husband is known in the gate when he sitteth among the
elder of the land

31:24 she maketh fine linen and selleth it; and delivereth girdl
unto the merchant

31:25 strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoic in
time to come

31:26 she openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongu is the law
of kind

31:27 she looketh well to the way of her household and eateth not
the bread of idl

31:28 her children aris up and call her blessed; her husband also
and he praiseth her

31:29 mani daughter have done virtuous but thou excellest them
all

31:30 favour is deceit and beauti is vain: but a woman that
feareth the lord she shall be prais

31:31 give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own work prais
her in the gate




ecclesiast

or

the preacher


1:1 the word of the preacher the son of david king in jerusalem

1:2 vaniti of vaniti saith the preacher vaniti of vanities; all is
vaniti

1:3 what profit hath a man of all hi labour which he taketh under the
sun? 1:4 one gener passeth away and anoth gener cometh:
but the earth abideth for ever

1:5 the sun also ariseth and the sun goeth down and hasteth to hi
place where he aros

1:6 the wind goeth toward the south and turneth about unto the north;
it whirleth about continu and the wind returneth again accord
to hi circuit

1:7 all the river run into the sea; yet the sea is not full; unto the
place from whenc the river come thither they return again

1:8 all thing are full of labour; man cannot utter it: the eye is not
satisfi with see nor the ear fill with hear

1:9 the thing that hath been it is that which shall be; and that
which is done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing
under the sun

1:10 is there ani thing whereof it may be said see thi is new? it
hath been alreadi of old time which wa befor us

1:11 there is no remembr of former things; neither shall there be
ani remembr of thing that are to come with those that shall come
after

1:12 i the preacher wa king over israel in jerusalem

1:13 and i gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concern
all thing that are done under heaven: thi sore travail hath god
given to the son of man to be exercis therewith

1:14 i have seen all the work that are done under the sun; and
behold all is vaniti and vexat of spirit

1:15 that which is crook cannot be made straight: and that which is
want cannot be number

1:16 i commun with mine own heart say lo i am come to great
estat and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been
befor me in jerusalem: yea my heart had great experi of wisdom
and knowledg

1:17 and i gave my heart to know wisdom and to know mad and
folly: i perceiv that thi also is vexat of spirit

1:18 for in much wisdom is much grief: and he that increaseth
knowledg increaseth sorrow

2:1 i said in mine heart go to now i will prove thee with mirth
therefor enjoy pleasure: and behold thi also is vaniti

2:2 i said of laughter it is mad: and of mirth what doeth it? 2:3 i
sought in mine heart to give myself unto wine yet acquaint mine
heart with wisdom; and to lay hold on folli till i might see what wa
that good for the son of men which they should do under the heaven
all the day of their life

2:4 i made me great works; i build me houses; i plant me
vineyards: 2:5 i made me garden and orchard and i plant tree in
them of all kind of fruits: 2:6 i made me pool of water to water
therewith the wood that bringeth forth trees: 2:7 i got me servant
and maiden and had servant born in my house; also i had great
possess of great and small cattl abov all that were in jerusalem
befor me: 2:8 i gather me also silver and gold and the peculiar
treasur of king and of the provinces: i gat me men singer and women
singer and the delight of the son of men as music instrument
and that of all sort

2:9 so i wa great and increas more than all that were befor me in
jerusalem: also my wisdom remain with me

2:10 and whatsoev mine eye desir i kept not from them i withheld
not my heart from ani joy; for my heart rejoic in all my labour: and
thi wa my portion of all my labour

2:11 then i look on all the work that my hand had wrought and on
the labour that i had labour to do: and behold all wa vaniti and
vexat of spirit and there wa no profit under the sun

2:12 and i turn myself to behold wisdom and mad and folly: for
what can the man do that cometh after the king? even that which hath
been alreadi done

2:13 then i saw that wisdom excelleth folli as far as light excelleth
dark

2:14 the wise man eye are in hi head; but the fool walketh in
darkness: and i myself perceiv also that one event happeneth to them
all

2:15 then said i in my heart as it happeneth to the fool so it
happeneth even to me; and whi wa i then more wise? then i said in my
heart that thi also is vaniti

2:16 for there is no remembr of the wise more than of the fool for
ever; see that which now is in the day to come shall all be
forgotten

and how dieth the wise man? as the fool

2:17 therefor i hate life; becaus the work that is wrought under
the sun is grievou unto me: for all is vaniti and vexat of spirit

2:18 yea i hate all my labour which i had taken under the sun:
becaus i should leav it unto the man that shall be after me

2:19 and who knoweth whether he shall be a wise man or a fool? yet
shall he have rule over all my labour wherein i have labour and
wherein i have shew myself wise under the sun thi is also vaniti

2:20 therefor i went about to caus my heart to despair of all the
labour which i took under the sun

2:21 for there is a man whose labour is in wisdom and in knowledg
and in equity; yet to a man that hath not labour therein shall he
leav it for hi portion thi also is vaniti and a great evil

2:22 for what hath man of all hi labour and of the vexat of hi
heart wherein he hath labour under the sun? 2:23 for all hi day
are sorrow and hi travail grief; yea hi heart taketh not rest in
the night thi is also vaniti

2:24 there is noth better for a man than that he should eat and
drink and that he should make hi soul enjoy good in hi labour thi
also i saw that it wa from the hand of god

2:25 for who can eat or who els can hasten hereunto more than i?
2:26 for god giveth to a man that is good in hi sight wisdom and
knowledg and joy: but to the sinner he giveth travail to gather and
to heap up that he may give to him that is good befor god thi also
is vaniti and vexat of spirit

3:1 to everi thing there is a season and a time to everi purpos
under the heaven: 3:2 a time to be born and a time to die; a time to
plant and a time to pluck up that which is planted; 3:3 a time to
kill and a time to heal; a time to break down and a time to build
up; 3:4 a time to weep and a time to laugh; a time to mourn and a
time to dance; 3:5 a time to cast away stone and a time to gather
stone together; a time to embrac and a time to refrain from
embracing; 3:6 a time to get and a time to lose; a time to keep and
a time to cast away; 3:7 a time to rend and a time to sew; a time to
keep silenc and a time to speak; 3:8 a time to love and a time to
hate; a time of war and a time of peac

3:9 what profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth?
3:10 i have seen the travail which god hath given to the son of men
to be exercis in it

3:11 he hath made everi thing beauti in hi time: also he hath set
the world in their heart so that no man can find out the work that
god maketh from the begin to the end

3:12 i know that there is no good in them but for a man to rejoic
and to do good in hi life

3:13 and also that everi man should eat and drink and enjoy the good
of all hi labour it is the gift of god

3:14 i know that whatsoev god doeth it shall be for ever: noth
can be put to it nor ani thing taken from it: and god doeth it that
men should fear befor him

3:15 that which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath alreadi
been; and god requireth that which is past

3:16 and moreov i saw under the sun the place of judgment that
wicked wa there; and the place of righteous that iniqu
wa there

3:17 i said in mine heart god shall judg the righteou and the
wicked: for there is a time there for everi purpos and for everi
work

3:18 i said in mine heart concern the estat of the son of men
that god might manifest them and that they might see that they
themselv are beast

3:19 for that which befalleth the son of men befalleth beasts; even
one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth so dieth the other; yea
they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preemin abov a
beast: for all is vaniti

3:20 all go unto one place; all are of the dust and all turn to dust
again

3:21 who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward and the spirit
of the beast that goeth downward to the earth? 3:22 wherefor i
perceiv that there is noth better than that a man should rejoic
in hi own works; for that is hi portion: for who shall bring him to
see what shall be after him? 4:1 so i return and consid all
the oppress that are done under the sun: and behold the tear of
such as were oppress and they had no comforter; and on the side of
their oppressor there wa power; but they had no comfort

4:2 wherefor i prais the dead which are alreadi dead more than the
live which are yet aliv

4:3 yea better is he than both they which hath not yet been who
hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun

4:4 again i consid all travail and everi right work that for
thi a man is envi of hi neighbour thi is also vaniti and
vexat of spirit

4:5 the fool foldeth hi hand togeth and eateth hi own flesh

4:6 better is an hand with quiet than both the hand full with
travail and vexat of spirit

4:7 then i return and i saw vaniti under the sun

4:8 there is one alon and there is not a second; yea he hath
neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all hi labour;
neither is hi eye satisfi with riches; neither saith he for whom
do i labour and bereav my soul of good? thi is also vaniti yea it
is a sore travail

4:9 two are better than one; becaus they have a good reward for their
labour

4:10 for if they fall the one will lift up hi fellow: but woe to him
that is alon when he falleth; for he hath not anoth to help him up

4:11 again if two lie togeth then they have heat: but how can one
be warm alone? 4:12 and if one prevail against him two shall
withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickli broken

4:13 better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king
who will no more be admonish

4:14 for out of prison he cometh to reign; wherea also he that is
born in hi kingdom becometh poor

4:15 i consid all the live which walk under the sun with the
second child that shall stand up in hi stead

4:16 there is no end of all the peopl even of all that have been
befor them: they also that come after shall not rejoic in him
sure thi also is vaniti and vexat of spirit

5:1 keep thi foot when thou goest to the hous of god and be more
readi to hear than to give the sacrific of fools: for they consid
not that they do evil

5:2 be not rash with thi mouth and let not thine heart be hasti to
utter ani thing befor god: for god is in heaven and thou upon earth:
therefor let thi word be few

5:3 for a dream cometh through the multitud of business; and a fool
voic is known by multitud of word

5:4 when thou vowest a vow unto god defer not to pay it; for he hath
no pleasur in fools: pay that which thou hast vow

5:5 better is it that thou shouldest not vow than that thou shouldest
vow and not pay

5:6 suffer not thi mouth to caus thi flesh to sin; neither say thou
befor the angel that it wa an error: wherefor should god be angri
at thi voic and destroy the work of thine hands? 5:7 for in the
multitud of dream and mani word there are also diver vanities: but
fear thou god

5:8 if thou seest the oppress of the poor and violent pervert
of judgment and justic in a provinc marvel not at the matter: for
he that is higher than the highest regardeth; and there be higher than
they

5:9 moreov the profit of the earth is for all: the king himself is
serv by the field

5:10 he that loveth silver shall not be satisfi with silver; nor he
that loveth abund with increase: thi is also vaniti

5:11 when good increas they are increas that eat them: and what
good is there to the owner thereof save the behold of them with
their eyes? 5:12 the sleep of a labour man is sweet whether he
eat littl or much: but the abund of the rich will not suffer him
to sleep

5:13 there is a sore evil which i have seen under the sun name
rich kept for the owner thereof to their hurt

5:14 but those rich perish by evil travail: and he begetteth a son
and there is noth in hi hand

5:15 as he came forth of hi mother womb nake shall he return to
go as he came and shall take noth of hi labour which he may
carri away in hi hand

5:16 and thi also is a sore evil that in all point as he came so
shall he go: and what profit hath he that hath labour for the wind?
5:17 all hi day also he eateth in dark and he hath much sorrow
and wrath with hi sick

5:18 behold that which i have seen: it is good and come for one to
eat and to drink and to enjoy the good of all hi labour that he
taketh under the sun all the day of hi life which god giveth him:
for it is hi portion

5:19 everi man also to whom god hath given rich and wealth and hath
given him power to eat thereof and to take hi portion and to
rejoic in hi labour; thi is the gift of god

5:20 for he shall not much rememb the day of hi life; becaus god
answereth him in the joy of hi heart

6:1 there is an evil which i have seen under the sun and it is common
among men: 6:2 a man to whom god hath given rich wealth and
honour so that he wanteth noth for hi soul of all that he
desireth yet god giveth him not power to eat thereof but a stranger
eateth it: thi is vaniti and it is an evil diseas

6:3 if a man beget an hundr children and live mani year so that
the day of hi year be mani and hi soul be not fill with good
and also that he have no burial; i say that an untim birth is
better than he

6:4 for he cometh in with vaniti and departeth in dark and hi
name shall be cover with dark

6:5 moreov he hath not seen the sun nor known ani thing: thi hath
more rest than the other

6:6 yea though he live a thousand year twice told yet hath he seen
no good: do not all go to one place? 6:7 all the labour of man is for
hi mouth and yet the appetit is not fill

6:8 for what hath the wise more than the fool? what hath the poor
that knoweth to walk befor the living? 6:9 better is the sight of
the eye than the wander of the desire: thi is also vaniti and
vexat of spirit

6:10 that which hath been is name alreadi and it is known that it is
man: neither may he contend with him that is mightier than he

6:11 see there be mani thing that increas vaniti what is man the
better? 6:12 for who knoweth what is good for man in thi life all
the day of hi vain life which he spendeth as a shadow? for who can
tell a man what shall be after him under the sun? 7:1 a good name is
better than preciou ointment; and the day of death than the day of
one birth

7:2 it is better to go to the hous of mourn than to go to the
hous of feasting: for that is the end of all men; and the live will
lay it to hi heart

7:3 sorrow is better than laughter: for by the sad of the
counten the heart is made better

7:4 the heart of the wise is in the hous of mourning; but the heart
of fool is in the hous of mirth

7:5 it is better to hear the rebuk of the wise than for a man to
hear the song of fool

7:6 for as the crackl of thorn under a pot so is the laughter of
the fool: thi also is vaniti

7:7 sure oppress maketh a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the
heart

7:8 better is the end of a thing than the begin thereof: and the
patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit

7:9 be not hasti in thi spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the
bosom of fool

7:10 say not thou what is the caus that the former day were better
than these? for thou dost not enquir wise concern thi

7:11 wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to
them that see the sun

7:12 for wisdom is a defenc and money is a defence: but the
excel of knowledg is that wisdom giveth life to them that have
it

7:13 consid the work of god: for who can make that straight which
he hath made crooked? 7:14 in the day of prosper be joy but in
the day of advers consider: god also hath set the one over against
the other to the end that man should find noth after him

7:15 all thing have i seen in the day of my vanity: there is a just
man that perisheth in hi righteous and there is a wick man
that prolongeth hi life in hi wicked

7:16 be not righteou over much; neither make thyself over wise: whi
shouldest thou destroy thyself ? 7:17 be not over much wick
neither be thou foolish: whi shouldest thou die befor thi time? 7:18
it is good that thou shouldest take hold of this; yea also from thi
withdraw not thine hand: for he that feareth god shall come forth of
them all

7:19 wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighti men which are
in the citi

7:20 for there is not a just man upon earth that doeth good and
sinneth not

7:21 also take no heed unto all word that are spoken; lest thou hear
thi servant curs thee: 7:22 for oftentim also thine own heart
knoweth that thou thyself likewis hast curs other

7:23 all thi have i prove by wisdom: i said i will be wise; but it
wa far from me

7:24 that which is far off and exceed deep who can find it out?
7:25 i appli mine heart to know and to search and to seek out
wisdom and the reason of thing and to know the wicked of folli
even of foolish and madness: 7:26 and i find more bitter than
death the woman whose heart is snare and net and her hand as
bands: whoso pleaseth god shall escap from her; but the sinner shall
be taken by her

7:27 behold thi have i found saith the preacher count one by
one to find out the account: 7:28 which yet my soul seeketh but i
find not: one man among a thousand have i found; but a woman among all
those have i not found

7:29 lo thi onli have i found that god hath made man upright; but
they have sought out mani invent

8:1 who is as the wise man? and who knoweth the interpret of a
thing? a man wisdom maketh hi face to shine and the bold of
hi face shall be chang

8:2 i counsel thee to keep the king command and that in regard
of the oath of god

8:3 be not hasti to go out of hi sight: stand not in an evil thing;
for he doeth whatsoev pleaseth him

8:4 where the word of a king is there is power: and who may say unto
him what doest thou? 8:5 whoso keepeth the command shall feel no
evil thing: and a wise man heart discerneth both time and judgment

8:6 becaus to everi purpos there is time and judgment therefor the
miseri of man is great upon him

8:7 for he knoweth not that which shall be: for who can tell him when
it shall be? 8:8 there is no man that hath power over the spirit to
retain the spirit; neither hath he power in the day of death: and
there is no discharg in that war; neither shall wicked deliv
those that are given to it

8:9 all thi have i seen and appli my heart unto everi work that is
done under the sun: there is a time wherein one man ruleth over
anoth to hi own hurt

8:10 and so i saw the wick buri who had come and gone from the
place of the holi and they were forgotten in the citi where they had
so done: thi is also vaniti

8:11 becaus sentenc against an evil work is not execut speedili
therefor the heart of the son of men is fulli set in them to do
evil

8:12 though a sinner do evil an hundr time and hi day be
prolong yet sure i know that it shall be well with them that fear
god which fear befor him: 8:13 but it shall not be well with the
wick neither shall he prolong hi day which are as a shadow;
becaus he feareth not befor god

8:14 there is a vaniti which is done upon the earth; that there be
just men unto whom it happeneth accord to the work of the wicked;
again there be wick men to whom it happeneth accord to the work
of the righteous: i said that thi also is vaniti

8:15 then i commend mirth becaus a man hath no better thing under
the sun than to eat and to drink and to be merry: for that shall
abid with him of hi labour the day of hi life which god giveth
him under the sun

8:16 when i appli mine heart to know wisdom and to see the busi
that is done upon the earth: (for also there is that neither day nor
night seeth sleep with hi eyes:) 8:17 then i beheld all the work of
god that a man cannot find out the work that is done under the sun:
becaus though a man labour to seek it out yet he shall not find it;
yea farther; though a wise man think to know it yet shall he not be
abl to find it

9:1 for all thi i consid in my heart even to declar all thi
that the righteou and the wise and their work are in the hand of
god: no man knoweth either love or hatr by all that is befor them

9:2 all thing come alik to all: there is one event to the righteou
and to the wicked; to the good and to the clean and to the unclean;
to him that sacrificeth and to him that sacrificeth not: as is the
good so is the sinner; and he that sweareth as he that feareth an
oath

9:3 thi is an evil among all thing that are done under the sun that
there is one event unto all: yea also the heart of the son of men is
full of evil and mad is in their heart while they live and after
that they go to the dead

9:4 for to him that is join to all the live there is hope: for a
live dog is better than a dead lion

9:5 for the live know that they shall die: but the dead know not ani
thing neither have they ani more a reward; for the memori of them is
forgotten

9:6 also their love and their hatr and their envi is now
perished; neither have they ani more a portion for ever in ani thing
that is done under the sun

9:7 go thi way eat thi bread with joy and drink thi wine with a
merri heart; for god now accepteth thi work

9:8 let thi garment be alway white; and let thi head lack no
ointment

9:9 live joy with the wife whom thou lovest all the day of the
life of thi vaniti which he hath given thee under the sun all the
day of thi vanity: for that is thi portion in thi life and in thi
labour which thou takest under the sun

9:10 whatsoev thi hand findeth to do do it with thi might; for
there is no work nor devic nor knowledg nor wisdom in the grave
whither thou goest

9:11 i return and saw under the sun that the race is not to the
swift nor the battl to the strong neither yet bread to the wise
nor yet rich to men of understand nor yet favour to men of
skill; but time and chanc happeneth to them all

9:12 for man also knoweth not hi time: as the fish that are taken
in an evil net and as the bird that are caught in the snare; so are
the son of men snare in an evil time when it falleth suddenli upon
them

9:13 thi wisdom have i seen also under the sun and it seem great
unto me: 9:14 there wa a littl citi and few men within it; and
there came a great king against it and besieg it and built great
bulwark against it: 9:15 now there wa found in it a poor wise man
and he by hi wisdom deliv the city; yet no man rememb that
same poor man

9:16 then said i wisdom is better than strength: nevertheless the
poor man wisdom is despis and hi word are not heard

9:17 the word of wise men are heard in quiet more than the cri of him
that ruleth among fool

9:18 wisdom is better than weapon of war: but one sinner destroyeth
much good

10:1 dead fli caus the ointment of the apothecari to send forth a
stink savour: so doth a littl folli him that is in reput for
wisdom and honour

10:2 a wise man heart is at hi right hand; but a fool heart at
hi left

10:3 yea also when he that is a fool walketh by the way hi wisdom
faileth him and he saith to everi one that he is a fool

10:4 if the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee leav not thi
place; for yield pacifieth great offenc

10:5 there is an evil which i have seen under the sun as an error
which proceedeth from the ruler: 10:6 folli is set in great digniti
and the rich sit in low place

10:7 i have seen servant upon hors and princ walk as servant
upon the earth

10:8 he that diggeth a pit shall fall into it; and whoso breaketh an
hedg a serpent shall bite him

10:9 whoso removeth stone shall be hurt therewith; and he that
cleaveth wood shall be endang therebi

10:10 if the iron be blunt and he do not whet the edg then must he
put to more strength: but wisdom is profit to direct

10:11 sure the serpent will bite without enchantment; and a babbler
is no better

10:12 the word of a wise man mouth are gracious; but the lip of a
fool will swallow up himself

10:13 the begin of the word of hi mouth is foolishness: and the
end of hi talk is mischiev mad

10:14 a fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what shall be;
and what shall be after him who can tell him? 10:15 the labour of
the foolish wearieth everi one of them becaus he knoweth not how to
go to the citi

10:16 woe to thee o land when thi king is a child and thi princ
eat in the morning! 10:17 bless art thou o land when thi king is
the son of nobl and thi princ eat in due season for strength
and not for drunkenness! 10:18 by much sloth the build
decayeth; and through idl of the hand the hous droppeth
through

10:19 a feast is made for laughter and wine maketh merry: but money
answereth all thing

10:20 curs not the king no not in thi thought; and curs not the
rich in thi bedchamber: for a bird of the air shall carri the voic
and that which hath wing shall tell the matter

11:1 cast thi bread upon the waters: for thou shalt find it after mani
day

11:2 give a portion to seven and also to eight; for thou knowest not
what evil shall be upon the earth

11:3 if the cloud be full of rain they empti themselv upon the
earth: and if the tree fall toward the south or toward the north in
the place where the tree falleth there it shall be

11:4 he that observeth the wind shall not sow; and he that regardeth
the cloud shall not reap

11:5 as thou knowest not what is the way of the spirit nor how the
bone do grow in the womb of her that is with child: even so thou
knowest not the work of god who maketh all

11:6 in the morn sow thi seed and in the even withhold not
thine hand: for thou knowest not whether shall prosper either thi or
that or whether they both shall be alik good

11:7 truli the light is sweet and a pleasant thing it is for the eye
to behold the sun: 11:8 but if a man live mani year and rejoic in
them all; yet let him rememb the day of darkness; for they shall be
mani all that cometh is vaniti

11:9 rejoic o young man in thi youth; and let thi heart cheer thee
in the day of thi youth and walk in the way of thine heart and in
the sight of thine eyes: but know thou that for all these thing god
will bring thee into judgment

11:10 therefor remov sorrow from thi heart and put away evil from
thi flesh: for childhood and youth are vaniti

12:1 rememb now thi creator in the day of thi youth while the evil
day come not nor the year draw nigh when thou shalt say i have no
pleasur in them; 12:2 while the sun or the light or the moon or
the star be not darken nor the cloud return after the rain: 12:3
in the day when the keeper of the hous shall trembl and the strong
men shall bow themselv and the grinder ceas becaus they are few
and those that look out of the window be darken 12:4 and the door
shall be shut in the street when the sound of the grind is low
and he shall rise up at the voic of the bird and all the daughter
of musick shall be brought low; 12:5 also when they shall be afraid of
that which is high and fear shall be in the way and the almond tree
shall flourish and the grasshopp shall be a burden and desir
shall fail: becaus man goeth to hi long home and the mourner go
about the streets: 12:6 or ever the silver cord be loos or the
golden bowl be broken or the pitcher be broken at the fountain or
the wheel broken at the cistern

12:7 then shall the dust return to the earth as it was: and the spirit
shall return unto god who gave it

12:8 vaniti of vaniti saith the preacher; all is vaniti

12:9 and moreov becaus the preacher wa wise he still taught the
peopl knowledge; yea he gave good heed and sought out and set in
order mani proverb

12:10 the preacher sought to find out accept words: and that which
wa written wa upright even word of truth

12:11 the word of the wise are as goad and as nail fasten by the
master of assembl which are given from one shepherd

12:12 and further by these my son be admonished: of make mani
book there is no end; and much studi is a weari of the flesh

12:13 let us hear the conclus of the whole matter: fear god and
keep hi commandments: for thi is the whole duti of man

12:14 for god shall bring everi work into judgment with everi secret
thing whether it be good or whether it be evil




the song of solomon


1:1 the song of song which is solomon

1:2 let him kiss me with the kiss of hi mouth: for thi love is
better than wine

1:3 becaus of the savour of thi good ointment thi name is as
ointment pour forth therefor do the virgin love thee

1:4 draw me we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into hi
chambers: we will be glad and rejoic in thee we will rememb thi
love more than wine: the upright love thee

1:5 i am black but come o ye daughter of jerusalem as the tent
of kedar as the curtain of solomon

1:6 look not upon me becaus i am black becaus the sun hath look
upon me: my mother children were angri with me; they made me the
keeper of the vineyards; but mine own vineyard have i not kept

1:7 tell me o thou whom my soul loveth where thou feedest where
thou makest thi flock to rest at noon: for whi should i be as one that
turneth asid by the flock of thi companions? 1:8 if thou know not
o thou fairest among women go thi way forth by the footstep of the
flock and feed thi kid besid the shepherd tent

1:9 i have compar thee o my love to a compani of hors in
pharaoh chariot

1:10 thi cheek are come with row of jewel thi neck with chain
of gold

1:11 we will make thee border of gold with stud of silver

1:12 while the king sitteth at hi tabl my spikenard sendeth forth
the smell thereof

1:13 a bundl of myrrh is my well-belov unto me; he shall lie all
night betwixt my breast

1:14 my belov is unto me as a cluster of camphir in the vineyard
of engedi

1:15 behold thou art fair my love; behold thou art fair; thou hast
dove eye

1:16 behold thou art fair my belov yea pleasant: also our bed is
green

1:17 the beam of our hous are cedar and our rafter of fir

2:1 i am the rose of sharon and the lili of the valley

2:2 as the lili among thorn so is my love among the daughter

2:3 as the appl tree among the tree of the wood so is my belov
among the son i sat down under hi shadow with great delight and
hi fruit wa sweet to my tast

2:4 he brought me to the banquet hous and hi banner over me wa
love

2:5 stay me with flagon comfort me with apples: for i am sick of
love

2:6 hi left hand is under my head and hi right hand doth embrac
me

2:7 i charg you o ye daughter of jerusalem by the roe and by the
hind of the field that ye stir not up nor awak my love till he
pleas

2:8 the voic of my beloved! behold he cometh leap upon the
mountain skip upon the hill

2:9 my belov is like a roe or a young hart: behold he standeth
behind our wall he looketh forth at the window shew himself
through the lattic

2:10 my belov spake and said unto me rise up my love my fair
one and come away

2:11 for lo the winter is past the rain is over and gone; 2:12 the
flower appear on the earth; the time of the sing of bird is come
and the voic of the turtl is heard in our land; 2:13 the fig tree
putteth forth her green fig and the vine with the tender grape give
a good smell aris my love my fair one and come away

2:14 o my dove that art in the cleft of the rock in the secret
place of the stair let me see thi counten let me hear thi
voice; for sweet is thi voic and thi counten is come

2:15 take us the fox the littl fox that spoil the vines: for
our vine have tender grape

2:16 my belov is mine and i am his: he feedeth among the lili

2:17 until the day break and the shadow flee away turn my belov
and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountain of bether

3:1 by night on my bed i sought him whom my soul loveth: i sought him
but i found him not

3:2 i will rise now and go about the citi in the street and in the
broad way i will seek him whom my soul loveth: i sought him but i
found him not

3:3 the watchmen that go about the citi found me: to whom i said saw
ye him whom my soul loveth? 3:4 it wa but a littl that i pass
from them but i found him whom my soul loveth: i held him and would
not let him go until i had brought him into my mother hous and
into the chamber of her that conceiv me

3:5 i charg you o ye daughter of jerusalem by the roe and by the
hind of the field that ye stir not up nor awak my love till he
pleas

3:6 who is thi that cometh out of the wilder like pillar of
smoke perfum with myrrh and frankincens with all powder of the
merchant? 3:7 behold hi bed which is solomons; threescor valiant
men are about it of the valiant of israel

3:8 they all hold sword be expert in war: everi man hath hi
sword upon hi thigh becaus of fear in the night

3:9 king solomon made himself a chariot of the wood of lebanon

3:10 he made the pillar thereof of silver the bottom thereof of
gold the cover of it of purpl the midst thereof be pave with
love for the daughter of jerusalem

3:11 go forth o ye daughter of zion and behold king solomon with
the crown wherewith hi mother crown him in the day of hi
espous and in the day of the glad of hi heart

4:1 behold thou art fair my love; behold thou art fair; thou hast
dove eye within thi locks: thi hair is as a flock of goat that
appear from mount gilead

4:2 thi teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn which
came up from the washing; whereof everi one bear twin and none is
barren among them

4:3 thi lip are like a thread of scarlet and thi speech is comely:
thi templ are like a piec of a pomegran within thi lock

4:4 thi neck is like the tower of david build for an armouri
whereon there hang a thousand buckler all shield of mighti men

4:5 thi two breast are like two young roe that are twin which feed
among the lili

4:6 until the day break and the shadow flee away i will get me to
the mountain of myrrh and to the hill of frankincens

4:7 thou art all fair my love; there is no spot in thee

4:8 come with me from lebanon my spous with me from lebanon: look
from the top of amana from the top of shenir and hermon from the
lion den from the mountain of the leopard

4:9 thou hast ravish my heart my sister my spouse; thou hast
ravish my heart with one of thine eye with one chain of thi neck

4:10 how fair is thi love my sister my spouse! how much better is
thi love than wine! and the smell of thine ointment than all spices!
4:11 thi lip o my spous drop as the honeycomb: honey and milk are
under thi tongue; and the smell of thi garment is like the smell of
lebanon

4:12 a garden inclos is my sister my spouse; a spring shut up a
fountain seal

4:13 thi plant are an orchard of pomegran with pleasant fruits;
camphir with spikenard 4:14 spikenard and saffron; calamu and
cinnamon with all tree of frankincense; myrrh and alo with all
the chief spices: 4:15 a fountain of garden a well of live water
and stream from lebanon

4:16 awak o north wind; and come thou south; blow upon my garden
that the spice thereof may flow out let my belov come into hi
garden and eat hi pleasant fruit

5:1 i am come into my garden my sister my spouse: i have gather my
myrrh with my spice; i have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; i have
drunk my wine with my milk: eat o friends; drink yea drink
abundantli o belov

5:2 i sleep but my heart waketh: it is the voic of my belov that
knocketh say open to me my sister my love my dove my
undefiled: for my head is fill with dew and my lock with the drop
of the night

5:3 i have put off my coat; how shall i put it on? i have wash my
feet; how shall i defil them? 5:4 my belov put in hi hand by the
hole of the door and my bowel were move for him

5:5 i rose up to open to my beloved; and my hand drop with myrrh
and my finger with sweet smell myrrh upon the handl of the
lock

5:6 i open to my beloved; but my belov had withdrawn himself and
wa gone: my soul fail when he spake: i sought him but i could not
find him; i call him but he gave me no answer

5:7 the watchmen that went about the citi found me they smote me
they wound me; the keeper of the wall took away my veil from me

5:8 i charg you o daughter of jerusalem if ye find my belov
that ye tell him that i am sick of love

5:9 what is thi belov more than anoth belov o thou fairest
among women? what is thi belov more than anoth belov that thou
dost so charg us? 5:10 my belov is white and ruddi the chiefest
among ten thousand

5:11 hi head is as the most fine gold hi lock are bushi and black
as a raven

5:12 hi eye are as the eye of dove by the river of water wash
with milk and fitli set

5:13 hi cheek are as a bed of spice as sweet flowers: hi lip
like lili drop sweet smell myrrh

5:14 hi hand are as gold ring set with the beryl: hi belli is as
bright ivori overlaid with sapphir

5:15 hi leg are as pillar of marbl set upon socket of fine gold:
hi counten is as lebanon excel as the cedar

5:16 hi mouth is most sweet: yea he is altogeth love thi is my
belov and thi is my friend o daughter of jerusalem

6:1 whither is thi belov gone o thou fairest among women? whither
is thi belov turn aside? that we may seek him with thee

6:2 my belov is gone down into hi garden to the bed of spice to
feed in the garden and to gather lili

6:3 i am my belov and my belov is mine: he feedeth among the
lili

6:4 thou art beauti o my love as tirzah come as jerusalem
terribl as an armi with banner

6:5 turn away thine eye from me for they have overcom me: thi hair
is as a flock of goat that appear from gilead

6:6 thi teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the wash
whereof everi one beareth twin and there is not one barren among
them

6:7 as a piec of a pomegran are thi templ within thi lock

6:8 there are threescor queen and fourscor concubin and virgin
without number

6:9 my dove my undefil is but one; she is the onli one of her
mother she is the choic one of her that bare her the daughter saw
her and bless her; yea the queen and the concubin and they
prais her

6:10 who is she that looketh forth as the morn fair as the moon
clear as the sun and terribl as an armi with banners? 6:11 i went
down into the garden of nut to see the fruit of the valley and to
see whether the vine flourish and the pomegran bud

6:12 or ever i wa awar my soul made me like the chariot of
amminadib

6:13 return return o shulamite; return return that we may look
upon thee what will ye see in the shulamite? as it were the compani
of two armi

7:1 how beauti are thi feet with shoe o princ daughter! the
joint of thi thigh are like jewel the work of the hand of a
cun workman

7:2 thi navel is like a round goblet which wanteth not liquor: thi
belli is like an heap of wheat set about with lili

7:3 thi two breast are like two young roe that are twin

7:4 thi neck is as a tower of ivory; thine eye like the fishpool in
heshbon by the gate of bathrabbim: thi nose is as the tower of
lebanon which looketh toward damascu

7:5 thine head upon thee is like carmel and the hair of thine head
like purple; the king is held in the galleri

7:6 how fair and how pleasant art thou o love for delights! 7:7
thi thi statur is like to a palm tree and thi breast to cluster
of grape

7:8 i said i will go up to the palm tree i will take hold of the
bough thereof: now also thi breast shall be as cluster of the vine
and the smell of thi nose like apples; 7:9 and the roof of thi mouth
like the best wine for my belov that goeth down sweetli caus
the lip of those that are asleep to speak

7:10 i am my belov and hi desir is toward me

7:11 come my belov let us go forth into the field; let us lodg in
the villag

7:12 let us get up earli to the vineyards; let us see if the vine
flourish whether the tender grape appear and the pomegran bud
forth: there will i give thee my love

7:13 the mandrak give a smell and at our gate are all manner of
pleasant fruit new and old which i have laid up for thee o my
belov

8:1 o that thou wert as my brother that suck the breast of my
mother! when i should find thee without i would kiss thee; yea i
should not be despis

8:2 i would lead thee and bring thee into my mother hous who
would instruct me: i would caus thee to drink of spice wine of the
juic of my pomegran

8:3 hi left hand should be under my head and hi right hand should
embrac me

8:4 i charg you o daughter of jerusalem that ye stir not up nor
awak my love until he pleas

8:5 who is thi that cometh up from the wilder lean upon her
beloved? i rais thee up under the appl tree: there thi mother
brought thee forth: there she brought thee forth that bare thee

8:6 set me as a seal upon thine heart as a seal upon thine arm: for
love is strong as death; jealousi is cruel as the grave: the coal
thereof are coal of fire which hath a most vehement flame

8:7 mani water cannot quench love neither can the flood drown it:
if a man would give all the substanc of hi hous for love it would
utterli be contemn

8:8 we have a littl sister and she hath no breasts: what shall we do
for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for? 8:9 if she be
a wall we will build upon her a palac of silver: and if she be a
door we will inclos her with board of cedar

8:10 i am a wall and my breast like towers: then wa i in hi eye
as one that found favour

8:11 solomon had a vineyard at baalhamon; he let out the vineyard unto
keepers; everi one for the fruit thereof wa to bring a thousand
piec of silver

8:12 my vineyard which is mine is befor me: thou o solomon must
have a thousand and those that keep the fruit thereof two hundr

8:13 thou that dwellest in the garden the companion hearken to thi
voice: caus me to hear it

8:14 make hast my belov and be thou like to a roe or to a young
hart upon the mountain of spice




the book of the prophet isaiah


1:1 the vision of isaiah the son of amoz which he saw concern
judah and jerusalem in the day of uzziah jotham ahaz and hezekiah
king of judah

1:2 hear o heaven and give ear o earth: for the lord hath spoken
i have nourish and brought up children and they have rebel
against me

1:3 the ox knoweth hi owner and the ass hi master crib: but
israel doth not know my peopl doth not consid

1:4 ah sin nation a peopl laden with iniqu a seed of
evildo children that are corrupters: they have forsaken the lord
they have provok the holi one of israel unto anger they are gone
away backward

1:5 whi should ye be stricken ani more? ye will revolt more and more:
the whole head is sick and the whole heart faint

1:6 from the sole of the foot even unto the head there is no sound
in it; but wound and bruis and putrifi sores: they have not
been close neither bound up neither mollifi with ointment

1:7 your countri is desol your citi are burn with fire: your
land stranger devour it in your presenc and it is desol as
overthrown by stranger

1:8 and the daughter of zion is left as a cottag in a vineyard as a
lodg in a garden of cucumb as a besieg citi

1:9 except the lord of host had left unto us a veri small remnant we
should have been as sodom and we should have been like unto gomorrah

1:10 hear the word of the lord ye ruler of sodom; give ear unto the
law of our god ye peopl of gomorrah

1:11 to what purpos is the multitud of your sacrific unto me?
saith the lord: i am full of the burnt offer of ram and the fat
of fed beasts; and i delight not in the blood of bullock or of
lamb or of he goat

1:12 when ye come to appear befor me who hath requir thi at your
hand to tread my courts? 1:13 bring no more vain oblations; incens
is an abomin unto me; the new moon and sabbath the call of
assembl i cannot away with; it is iniqu even the solemn
meet

1:14 your new moon and your appoint feast my soul hateth: they are
a troubl unto me; i am weari to bear them

1:15 and when ye spread forth your hand i will hide mine eye from
you: yea when ye make mani prayer i will not hear: your hand are
full of blood

1:16 wash you make you clean; put away the evil of your do from
befor mine eyes; ceas to do evil; 1:17 learn to do well; seek
judgment reliev the oppress judg the fatherless plead for the
widow

1:18 come now and let us reason togeth saith the lord: though your
sin be as scarlet they shall be as white as snow; though they be red
like crimson they shall be as wool

1:19 if ye be will and obedi ye shall eat the good of the land:
1:20 but if ye refus and rebel ye shall be devour with the sword:
for the mouth of the lord hath spoken it

1:21 how is the faith citi becom an harlot! it wa full of
judgment; righteous lodg in it; but now murder

1:22 thi silver is becom dross thi wine mix with water: 1:23 thi
princ are rebelli and companion of thieves: everi one loveth
gift and followeth after rewards: they judg not the fatherless
neither doth the caus of the widow come unto them

1:24 therefor saith the lord the lord of host the mighti one of
israel ah i will eas me of mine adversari and aveng me of mine
enemies: 1:25 and i will turn my hand upon thee and pure purg away
thi dross and take away all thi tin: 1:26 and i will restor thi
judg as at the first and thi counsellor as at the beginning:
afterward thou shalt be call the citi of righteous the
faith citi

1:27 zion shall be redeem with judgment and her convert with
righteous

1:28 and the destruct of the transgressor and of the sinner shall
be togeth and they that forsak the lord shall be consum

1:29 for they shall be asham of the oak which ye have desir and
ye shall be confound for the garden that ye have chosen

1:30 for ye shall be as an oak whose leaf fadeth and as a garden that
hath no water

1:31 and the strong shall be as tow and the maker of it as a spark
and they shall both burn togeth and none shall quench them

2:1 the word that isaiah the son of amoz saw concern judah and
jerusalem

2:2 and it shall come to pass in the last day that the mountain of
the lord hous shall be establish in the top of the mountain and
shall be exalt abov the hills; and all nation shall flow unto it

2:3 and mani peopl shall go and say come ye and let us go up to the
mountain of the lord to the hous of the god of jacob; and he will
teach us of hi way and we will walk in hi paths: for out of zion
shall go forth the law and the word of the lord from jerusalem

2:4 and he shall judg among the nation and shall rebuk mani
people: and they shall beat their sword into plowshar and their
spear into pruninghooks: nation shall not lift up sword against
nation neither shall they learn war ani more

2:5 o hous of jacob come ye and let us walk in the light of the
lord

2:6 therefor thou hast forsaken thi peopl the hous of jacob
becaus they be replenish from the east and are soothsay like
the philistin and they pleas themselv in the children of
stranger

2:7 their land also is full of silver and gold neither is there ani
end of their treasures; their land is also full of hors neither is
there ani end of their chariots: 2:8 their land also is full of idols;
they worship the work of their own hand that which their own finger
have made: 2:9 and the mean man boweth down and the great man
humbleth himself: therefor forgiv them not

2:10 enter into the rock and hide thee in the dust for fear of the
lord and for the glori of hi majesti

2:11 the lofti look of man shall be humbl and the haughti of
men shall be bow down and the lord alon shall be exalt in that
day

2:12 for the day of the lord of host shall be upon everi one that is
proud and lofti and upon everi one that is lift up; and he shall be
brought low: 2:13 and upon all the cedar of lebanon that are high
and lift up and upon all the oak of bashan 2:14 and upon all the
high mountain and upon all the hill that are lift up 2:15 and
upon everi high tower and upon everi fenc wall 2:16 and upon all
the ship of tarshish and upon all pleasant pictur

2:17 and the lofti of man shall be bow down and the haughti
of men shall be made low: and the lord alon shall be exalt in that
day

2:18 and the idol he shall utterli abolish

2:19 and they shall go into the hole of the rock and into the cave
of the earth for fear of the lord and for the glori of hi majesti
when he ariseth to shake terribl the earth

2:20 in that day a man shall cast hi idol of silver and hi idol
of gold which they made each one for himself to worship to the mole
and to the bats; 2:21 to go into the cleft of the rock and into the
top of the rag rock for fear of the lord and for the glori of
hi majesti when he ariseth to shake terribl the earth

2:22 ceas ye from man whose breath is in hi nostrils: for wherein
is he to be account of ? 3:1 for behold the lord the lord of
host doth take away from jerusalem and from judah the stay and the
staff the whole stay of bread and the whole stay of water

3:2 the mighti man and the man of war the judg and the prophet
and the prudent and the ancient 3:3 the captain of fifti and the
honour man and the counsellor and the cun artific and the
eloqu orat

3:4 and i will give children to be their princ and babe shall rule
over them

3:5 and the peopl shall be oppress everi one by anoth and everi
one by hi neighbour: the child shall behav himself proudli against
the ancient and the base against the honour

3:6 when a man shall take hold of hi brother of the hous of hi
father say thou hast cloth be thou our ruler and let thi
ruin be under thi hand: 3:7 in that day shall he swear say i will
not be an healer; for in my hous is neither bread nor clothing: make
me not a ruler of the peopl

3:8 for jerusalem is ruin and judah is fallen: becaus their tongu
and their do are against the lord to provok the eye of hi
glori

3:9 the shew of their counten doth wit against them; and they
declar their sin as sodom they hide it not woe unto their soul! for
they have reward evil unto themselv

3:10 say ye to the righteou that it shall be well with him: for they
shall eat the fruit of their do

3:11 woe unto the wicked! it shall be ill with him: for the reward of
hi hand shall be given him

3:12 as for my peopl children are their oppressor and women rule
over them o my peopl they which lead thee caus thee to err and
destroy the way of thi path

3:13 the lord standeth up to plead and standeth to judg the peopl

3:14 the lord will enter into judgment with the ancient of hi
peopl and the princ thereof: for ye have eaten up the vineyard;
the spoil of the poor is in your hous

3:15 what mean ye that ye beat my peopl to piec and grind the
face of the poor? saith the lord god of host

3:16 moreov the lord saith becaus the daughter of zion are
haughti and walk with stretch forth neck and wanton eye walk
and minc as they go and make a tinkl with their feet: 3:17
therefor the lord will smite with a scab the crown of the head of the
daughter of zion and the lord will discov their secret part

3:18 in that day the lord will take away the braveri of their tinkl
ornament about their feet and their caul and their round tire
like the moon 3:19 the chain and the bracelet and the muffler
3:20 the bonnet and the ornament of the leg and the headband
and the tablet and the ear 3:21 the ring and nose jewel
3:22 the changeabl suit of apparel and the mantl and the
wimpl and the crisp pin 3:23 the glass and the fine linen
and the hood and the vail

3:24 and it shall come to pass that instead of sweet smell there
shall be stink; and instead of a girdl a rent; and instead of well
set hair baldness; and instead of a stomach a gird of sackcloth;
and burn instead of beauti

3:25 thi men shall fall by the sword and thi mighti in the war

3:26 and her gate shall lament and mourn; and she be desol
shall sit upon the ground

4:1 and in that day seven women shall take hold of one man say we
will eat our own bread and wear our own apparel: onli let us be
call by thi name to take away our reproach

4:2 in that day shall the branch of the lord be beauti and
gloriou and the fruit of the earth shall be excel and come for
them that are escap of israel

4:3 and it shall come to pass that he that is left in zion and he
that remaineth in jerusalem shall be call holi even everi one that
is written among the live in jerusalem: 4:4 when the lord shall have
wash away the filth of the daughter of zion and shall have purg
the blood of jerusalem from the midst thereof by the spirit of
judgment and by the spirit of burn

4:5 and the lord will creat upon everi dwell place of mount zion
and upon her assembl a cloud and smoke by day and the shine of
a flame fire by night: for upon all the glori shall be a defenc

4:6 and there shall be a tabernacl for a shadow in the day time from
the heat and for a place of refug and for a covert from storm and
from rain

5:1 now will i sing to my wellbelov a song of my belov touch
hi vineyard my wellbelov hath a vineyard in a veri fruit hill:
5:2 and he fenc it and gather out the stone thereof and plant
it with the choicest vine and built a tower in the midst of it and
also made a winepress therein: and he look that it should bring
forth grape and it brought forth wild grape

5:3 and now o inhabit of jerusalem and men of judah judg i
pray you betwixt me and my vineyard

5:4 what could have been done more to my vineyard that i have not
done in it? wherefor when i look that it should bring forth
grape brought it forth wild grapes? 5:5 and now go to; i will tell
you what i will do to my vineyard: i will take away the hedg thereof
and it shall be eaten up; and break down the wall thereof and it
shall be trodden down: 5:6 and i will lay it waste: it shall not be
prune nor digged; but there shall come up brier and thorns: i will
also command the cloud that they rain no rain upon it

5:7 for the vineyard of the lord of host is the hous of israel and
the men of judah hi pleasant plant: and he look for judgment but
behold oppression; for righteous but behold a cri

5:8 woe unto them that join hous to hous that lay field to field
till there be no place that they may be place alon in the midst of
the earth! 5:9 in mine ear said the lord of host of a truth mani
hous shall be desol even great and fair without inhabit

5:10 yea ten acr of vineyard shall yield one bath and the seed of
an homer shall yield an ephah

5:11 woe unto them that rise up earli in the morn that they may
follow strong drink; that continu until night till wine inflam
them! 5:12 and the harp and the viol the tabret and pipe and
wine are in their feasts: but they regard not the work of the lord
neither consid the oper of hi hand

5:13 therefor my peopl are gone into captiv becaus they have no
knowledge: and their honour men are famish and their multitud
dri up with thirst

5:14 therefor hell hath enlarg herself and open her mouth
without measure: and their glori and their multitud and their pomp
and he that rejoiceth shall descend into it

5:15 and the mean man shall be brought down and the mighti man shall
be humbl and the eye of the lofti shall be humbled: 5:16 but the
lord of host shall be exalt in judgment and god that is holi shall
be sanctifi in righteous

5:17 then shall the lamb feed after their manner and the wast
place of the fat one shall stranger eat

5:18 woe unto them that draw iniqu with cord of vaniti and sin as
it were with a cart rope: 5:19 that say let him make speed and
hasten hi work that we may see it: and let the counsel of the holi
one of israel draw nigh and come that we may know it! 5:20 woe unto
them that call evil good and good evil; that put dark for light
and light for darkness; that put bitter for sweet and sweet for
bitter! 5:21 woe unto them that are wise in their own eye and
prudent in their own sight! 5:22 woe unto them that are mighti to
drink wine and men of strength to mingl strong drink: 5:23 which
justifi the wick for reward and take away the righteous of the
righteou from him! 5:24 therefor as the fire devoureth the stubbl
and the flame consumeth the chaff so their root shall be as
rotten and their blossom shall go up as dust: becaus they have
cast away the law of the lord of host and despis the word of the
holi one of israel

5:25 therefor is the anger of the lord kindl against hi peopl
and he hath stretch forth hi hand against them and hath smitten
them: and the hill did trembl and their carcas were torn in the
midst of the street

for all thi hi anger is not turn away but hi hand is stretch
out still

5:26 and he will lift up an ensign to the nation from far and will
hiss unto them from the end of the earth: and behold they shall come
with speed swiftly: 5:27 none shall be weari nor stumbl among them;
none shall slumber nor sleep; neither shall the girdl of their loin
be loos nor the latchet of their shoe be broken: 5:28 whose arrow
are sharp and all their bow bent their hors hoof shall be
count like flint and their wheel like a whirlwind: 5:29 their
roar shall be like a lion they shall roar like young lions: yea
they shall roar and lay hold of the prey and shall carri it away
safe and none shall deliv it

5:30 and in that day they shall roar against them like the roar of
the sea: and if one look unto the land behold dark and sorrow
and the light is darken in the heaven thereof

6:1 in the year that king uzziah die i saw also the lord sit upon
a throne high and lift up and hi train fill the templ

6:2 abov it stood the seraphims: each one had six wings; with twain
he cover hi face and with twain he cover hi feet and with
twain he did fli

6:3 and one cri unto anoth and said holi holi holi is the
lord of hosts: the whole earth is full of hi glori

6:4 and the post of the door move at the voic of him that cri
and the hous wa fill with smoke

6:5 then said i woe is me! for i am undone; becaus i am a man of
unclean lip and i dwell in the midst of a peopl of unclean lips:
for mine eye have seen the king the lord of host

6:6 then flew one of the seraphim unto me have a live coal in hi
hand which he had taken with the tong from off the altar: 6:7 and he
laid it upon my mouth and said lo thi hath touch thi lips; and
thine iniqu is taken away and thi sin purg

6:8 also i heard the voic of the lord say whom shall i send and
who will go for us? then said i here am i; send me

6:9 and he said go and tell thi peopl hear ye inde but
understand not; and see ye inde but perceiv not

6:10 make the heart of thi peopl fat and make their ear heavi and
shut their eyes; lest they see with their eye and hear with their
ear and understand with their heart and convert and be heal

6:11 then said i lord how long? and he answer until the citi be
wast without inhabit and the hous without man and the land be
utterli desol 6:12 and the lord have remov men far away and
there be a great forsak in the midst of the land

6:13 but yet in it shall be a tenth and it shall return and shall be
eaten: as a teil tree and as an oak whose substanc is in them when
they cast their leaves: so the holi seed shall be the substanc
thereof

7:1 and it came to pass in the day of ahaz the son of jotham the son
of uzziah king of judah that rezin the king of syria and pekah the
son of remaliah king of israel went up toward jerusalem to war
against it but could not prevail against it

7:2 and it wa told the hous of david say syria is confeder
with ephraim and hi heart wa move and the heart of hi peopl as
the tree of the wood are move with the wind

7:3 then said the lord unto isaiah go forth now to meet ahaz thou
and shearjashub thi son at the end of the conduit of the upper pool
in the highway of the fuller field; 7:4 and say unto him take heed
and be quiet; fear not neither be faintheart for the two tail of
these smoke firebrand for the fierc anger of rezin with syria
and of the son of remaliah

7:5 becaus syria ephraim and the son of remaliah have taken evil
counsel against thee say 7:6 let us go up against judah and vex
it and let us make a breach therein for us and set a king in the
midst of it even the son of tabeal: 7:7 thu saith the lord god it
shall not stand neither shall it come to pass

7:8 for the head of syria is damascu and the head of damascu is
rezin; and within threescor and five year shall ephraim be broken
that it be not a peopl

7:9 and the head of ephraim is samaria and the head of samaria is
remaliah son if ye will not believ sure ye shall not be
establish

7:10 moreov the lord spake again unto ahaz say 7:11 ask thee a
sign of the lord thi god; ask it either in the depth or in the height
abov

7:12 but ahaz said i will not ask neither will i tempt the lord

7:13 and he said hear ye now o hous of david; is it a small thing
for you to weari men but will ye weari my god also? 7:14 therefor
the lord himself shall give you a sign; behold a virgin shall
conceiv and bear a son and shall call hi name immanuel

7:15 butter and honey shall he eat that he may know to refus the
evil and choos the good

7:16 for befor the child shall know to refus the evil and choos
the good the land that thou abhorrest shall be forsaken of both her
king

7:17 the lord shall bring upon thee and upon thi peopl and upon thi
father hous day that have not come from the day that ephraim
depart from judah; even the king of assyria

7:18 and it shall come to pass in that day that the lord shall hiss
for the fli that is in the uttermost part of the river of egypt and
for the bee that is in the land of assyria

7:19 and they shall come and shall rest all of them in the desol
valley and in the hole of the rock and upon all thorn and upon
all bush

7:20 in the same day shall the lord shave with a razor that is hire
name by them beyond the river by the king of assyria the head
and the hair of the feet: and it shall also consum the beard

7:21 and it shall come to pass in that day that a man shall nourish a
young cow and two sheep; 7:22 and it shall come to pass for the
abund of milk that they shall give he shall eat butter: for butter
and honey shall everi one eat that is left in the land

7:23 and it shall come to pass in that day that everi place shall be
where there were a thousand vine at a thousand silverl it shall
even be for brier and thorn

7:24 with arrow and with bow shall men come thither; becaus all the
land shall becom brier and thorn

7:25 and on all hill that shall be dig with the mattock there
shall not come thither the fear of brier and thorns: but it shall be
for the send forth of oxen and for the tread of lesser cattl

8:1 moreov the lord said unto me take thee a great roll and write
in it with a man pen concern mahershalalhashbaz

8:2 and i took unto me faith wit to record uriah the priest
and zechariah the son of jeberechiah

8:3 and i went unto the prophetess; and she conceiv and bare a son

then said the lord to me call hi name mahershalalhashbaz

8:4 for befor the child shall have knowledg to cri my father and
my mother the rich of damascu and the spoil of samaria shall be
taken away befor the king of assyria

8:5 the lord spake also unto me again say 8:6 forasmuch as thi
peopl refuseth the water of shiloah that go softli and rejoic in
rezin and remaliah son; 8:7 now therefor behold the lord bringeth
up upon them the water of the river strong and mani even the king
of assyria and all hi glory: and he shall come up over all hi
channel and go over all hi banks: 8:8 and he shall pass through
judah; he shall overflow and go over he shall reach even to the neck;
and the stretch out of hi wing shall fill the breadth of thi
land o immanuel

8:9 associ yourselv o ye peopl and ye shall be broken in
pieces; and give ear all ye of far countries: gird yourselv and ye
shall be broken in pieces; gird yourselv and ye shall be broken in
piec

8:10 take counsel togeth and it shall come to nought; speak the
word and it shall not stand: for god is with us

8:11 for the lord spake thu to me with a strong hand and instruct
me that i should not walk in the way of thi peopl say 8:12 say
ye not a confederaci to all them to whom thi peopl shall say a
confederacy; neither fear ye their fear nor be afraid

8:13 sanctifi the lord of host himself; and let him be your fear and
let him be your dread

8:14 and he shall be for a sanctuary; but for a stone of stumbl and
for a rock of offenc to both the hous of israel for a gin and for
a snare to the inhabit of jerusalem

8:15 and mani among them shall stumbl and fall and be broken and
be snare and be taken

8:16 bind up the testimoni seal the law among my discipl

8:17 and i will wait upon the lord that hideth hi face from the
hous of jacob and i will look for him

8:18 behold i and the children whom the lord hath given me are for
sign and for wonder in israel from the lord of host which dwelleth
in mount zion

8:19 and when they shall say unto you seek unto them that have
familiar spirit and unto wizard that peep and that mutter: should
not a peopl seek unto their god? for the live to the dead? 8:20 to
the law and to the testimony: if they speak not accord to thi
word it is becaus there is no light in them

8:21 and they shall pass through it hardli bestead and hungry: and it
shall come to pass that when they shall be hungri they shall fret
themselv and curs their king and their god and look upward

8:22 and they shall look unto the earth; and behold troubl and
dark dim of anguish; and they shall be driven to dark

9:1 nevertheless the dim shall not be such as wa in her vexat
when at the first he lightli afflict the land of zebulun and the
land of naphtali and afterward did more grievous afflict her by the
way of the sea beyond jordan in galile of the nation

9:2 the peopl that walk in dark have seen a great light: they
that dwell in the land of the shadow of death upon them hath the
light shine

9:3 thou hast multipli the nation and not increas the joy: they
joy befor thee accord to the joy in harvest and as men rejoic
when they divid the spoil

9:4 for thou hast broken the yoke of hi burden and the staff of hi
shoulder the rod of hi oppressor as in the day of midian

9:5 for everi battl of the warrior is with confus nois and
garment roll in blood; but thi shall be with burn and fuel of
fire

9:6 for unto us a child is born unto us a son is given: and the
govern shall be upon hi shoulder: and hi name shall be call
wonder counsellor the mighti god the everlast father the
princ of peac

9:7 of the increas of hi govern and peac there shall be no end
upon the throne of david and upon hi kingdom to order it and to
establish it with judgment and with justic from henceforth even for
ever the zeal of the lord of host will perform thi

9:8 the lord sent a word into jacob and it hath light upon israel

9:9 and all the peopl shall know even ephraim and the inhabit of
samaria that say in the pride and stout of heart 9:10 the brick
are fallen down but we will build with hewn stones: the sycomor are
cut down but we will chang them into cedar

9:11 therefor the lord shall set up the adversari of rezin against
him and join hi enemi together; 9:12 the syrian befor and the
philistin behind; and they shall devour israel with open mouth for
all thi hi anger is not turn away but hi hand is stretch out
still

9:13 for the peopl turneth not unto him that smiteth them neither do
they seek the lord of host

9:14 therefor the lord will cut off from israel head and tail branch
and rush in one day

9:15 the ancient and honour he is the head; and the prophet that
teacheth lie he is the tail

9:16 for the leader of thi peopl caus them to err; and they that
are led of them are destroy

9:17 therefor the lord shall have no joy in their young men neither
shall have merci on their fatherless and widows: for everi one is an
hypocrit and an evildo and everi mouth speaketh folli for all
thi hi anger is not turn away but hi hand is stretch out
still

9:18 for wicked burneth as the fire: it shall devour the brier
and thorn and shall kindl in the thicket of the forest and they
shall mount up like the lift up of smoke

9:19 through the wrath of the lord of host is the land darken and
the peopl shall be as the fuel of the fire: no man shall spare hi
brother

9:20 and he shall snatch on the right hand and be hungry; and he
shall eat on the left hand and they shall not be satisfied: they
shall eat everi man the flesh of hi own arm: 9:21 manasseh ephraim;
and ephraim manasseh: and they togeth shall be against judah for
all thi hi anger is not turn away but hi hand is stretch out
still

10:1 woe unto them that decre unright decre and that write
grievous which they have prescribed; 10:2 to turn asid the needi
from judgment and to take away the right from the poor of my peopl
that widow may be their prey and that they may rob the fatherless!
10:3 and what will ye do in the day of visit and in the
desol which shall come from far? to whom will ye flee for help?
and where will ye leav your glory? 10:4 without me they shall bow
down under the prison and they shall fall under the slain for all
thi hi anger is not turn away but hi hand is stretch out
still

10:5 o assyrian the rod of mine anger and the staff in their hand is
mine indign

10:6 i will send him against an hypocrit nation and against the
peopl of my wrath will i give him a charg to take the spoil and to
take the prey and to tread them down like the mire of the street

10:7 howbeit he meaneth not so neither doth hi heart think so; but
it is in hi heart to destroy and cut off nation not a few

10:8 for he saith are not my princ altogeth kings? 10:9 is not
calno as carchemish? is not hamath as arpad? is not samaria as
damascus? 10:10 as my hand hath found the kingdom of the idol and
whose graven imag did excel them of jerusalem and of samaria; 10:11
shall i not as i have done unto samaria and her idol so do to
jerusalem and her idols? 10:12 wherefor it shall come to pass that
when the lord hath perform hi whole work upon mount zion and on
jerusalem i will punish the fruit of the stout heart of the king of
assyria and the glori of hi high look

10:13 for he saith by the strength of my hand i have done it and by
my wisdom; for i am prudent: and i have remov the bound of the
peopl and have rob their treasur and i have put down the
inhabit like a valiant man: 10:14 and my hand hath found as a nest
the rich of the people: and as one gathereth egg that are left
have i gather all the earth; and there wa none that move the wing
or open the mouth or peep

10:15 shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? or
shall the saw magnifi itself against him that shaketh it? as if the
rod should shake itself against them that lift it up or as if the
staff should lift up itself as if it were no wood

10:16 therefor shall the lord the lord of host send among hi fat
one leanness; and under hi glori he shall kindl a burn like the
burn of a fire

10:17 and the light of israel shall be for a fire and hi holi one
for a flame: and it shall burn and devour hi thorn and hi brier in
one day; 10:18 and shall consum the glori of hi forest and of hi
fruit field both soul and body: and they shall be as when a
standard-bear fainteth

10:19 and the rest of the tree of hi forest shall be few that a
child may write them

10:20 and it shall come to pass in that day that the remnant of
israel and such as are escap of the hous of jacob shall no more
again stay upon him that smote them; but shall stay upon the lord the
holi one of israel in truth

10:21 the remnant shall return even the remnant of jacob unto the
mighti god

10:22 for though thi peopl israel be as the sand of the sea yet a
remnant of them shall return: the consumpt decre shall overflow
with righteous

10:23 for the lord god of host shall make a consumpt even
determin in the midst of all the land

10:24 therefor thu saith the lord god of host o my peopl that
dwellest in zion be not afraid of the assyrian: he shall smite thee
with a rod and shall lift up hi staff against thee after the manner
of egypt

10:25 for yet a veri littl while and the indign shall ceas
and mine anger in their destruct

10:26 and the lord of host shall stir up a scourg for him accord
to the slaughter of midian at the rock of oreb: and as hi rod wa
upon the sea so shall he lift it up after the manner of egypt

10:27 and it shall come to pass in that day that hi burden shall be
taken away from off thi shoulder and hi yoke from off thi neck and
the yoke shall be destroy becaus of the anoint

10:28 he is come to aiath he is pass to migron; at michmash he hath
laid up hi carriages: 10:29 they are gone over the passage: they have
taken up their lodg at geba; ramah is afraid; gibeah of saul is
fled

10:30 lift up thi voic o daughter of gallim: caus it to be heard
unto laish o poor anathoth

10:31 madmenah is removed; the inhabit of gebim gather themselv
to flee

10:32 as yet shall he remain at nob that day: he shall shake hi hand
against the mount of the daughter of zion the hill of jerusalem

10:33 behold the lord the lord of host shall lop the bough with
terror: and the high one of statur shall be hewn down and the
haughti shall be humbl

10:34 and he shall cut down the thicket of the forest with iron and
lebanon shall fall by a mighti one

11:1 and there shall come forth a rod out of the stem of jess and a
branch shall grow out of hi roots: 11:2 and the spirit of the lord
shall rest upon him the spirit of wisdom and understand the
spirit of counsel and might the spirit of knowledg and of the fear
of the lord; 11:3 and shall make him of quick understand in the
fear of the lord: and he shall not judg after the sight of hi eye
neither reprov after the hear of hi ears: 11:4 but with
righteous shall he judg the poor and reprov with equiti for the
meek of the earth: and he shall smite the earth: with the rod of hi
mouth and with the breath of hi lip shall he slay the wick

11:5 and righteous shall be the girdl of hi loin and
faith the girdl of hi rein

11:6 the wolf also shall dwell with the lamb and the leopard shall
lie down with the kid; and the calf and the young lion and the fatl
together; and a littl child shall lead them

11:7 and the cow and the bear shall feed; their young one shall lie
down together: and the lion shall eat straw like the ox

11:8 and the suck child shall play on the hole of the asp and the
wean child shall put hi hand on the cockatric den

11:9 they shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holi mountain: for the
earth shall be full of the knowledg of the lord as the water cover
the sea

11:10 and in that day there shall be a root of jess which shall
stand for an ensign of the people; to it shall the gentil seek: and
hi rest shall be gloriou

11:11 and it shall come to pass in that day that the lord shall set
hi hand again the second time to recov the remnant of hi peopl
which shall be left from assyria and from egypt and from pathro
and from cush and from elam and from shinar and from hamath and
from the island of the sea

11:12 and he shall set up an ensign for the nation and shall
assembl the outcast of israel and gather togeth the dispers of
judah from the four corner of the earth

11:13 the envi also of ephraim shall depart and the adversari of
judah shall be cut off: ephraim shall not envi judah and judah shall
not vex ephraim

11:14 but they shall fli upon the shoulder of the philistin toward
the west; they shall spoil them of the east together: they shall lay
their hand upon edom and moab; and the children of ammon shall obey
them

11:15 and the lord shall utterli destroy the tongu of the egyptian
sea; and with hi mighti wind shall he shake hi hand over the river
and shall smite it in the seven stream and make men go over dryshod

11:16 and there shall be an highway for the remnant of hi peopl
which shall be left from assyria; like as it wa to israel in the day
that he came up out of the land of egypt

12:1 and in that day thou shalt say o lord i will prais thee:
though thou wast angri with me thine anger is turn away and thou
comfortedst me

12:2 behold god is my salvation; i will trust and not be afraid: for
the lord jehovah is my strength and my song; he also is becom my
salvat

12:3 therefor with joy shall ye draw water out of the well of
salvat

12:4 and in that day shall ye say prais the lord call upon hi
name declar hi do among the peopl make mention that hi name
is exalt

12:5 sing unto the lord; for he hath done excel things: thi is
known in all the earth

12:6 cri out and shout thou inhabit of zion: for great is the holi
one of israel in the midst of thee

13:1 the burden of babylon which isaiah the son of amoz did see

13:2 lift ye up a banner upon the high mountain exalt the voic unto
them shake the hand that they may go into the gate of the nobl

13:3 i have command my sanctifi one i have also call my mighti
one for mine anger even them that rejoic in my high

13:4 the nois of a multitud in the mountain like as of a great
