god: i will strengthen thee; yea i will help thee; yea i will uphold
thee with the right hand of my righteous

41:11 behold all they that were incens against thee shall be
asham and confounded: they shall be as nothing; and they that strive
with thee shall perish

41:12 thou shalt seek them and shalt not find them even them that
contend with thee: they that war against thee shall be as noth
and as a thing of nought

41:13 for i the lord thi god will hold thi right hand say unto
thee fear not; i will help thee

41:14 fear not thou worm jacob and ye men of israel; i will help
thee saith the lord and thi redeem the holi one of israel

41:15 behold i will make thee a new sharp thresh instrument have
teeth: thou shalt thresh the mountain and beat them small and shalt
make the hill as chaff

41:16 thou shalt fan them and the wind shall carri them away and the
whirlwind shall scatter them: and thou shalt rejoic in the lord and
shalt glori in the holi one of israel

41:17 when the poor and needi seek water and there is none and their
tongu faileth for thirst i the lord will hear them i the god of
israel will not forsak them

41:18 i will open river in high place and fountain in the midst of
the valleys: i will make the wilder a pool of water and the dri
land spring of water

41:19 i will plant in the wilder the cedar the shittah tree and
the myrtl and the oil tree; i will set in the desert the fir tree
and the pine and the box tree together: 41:20 that they may see and
know and consid and understand togeth that the hand of the lord
hath done thi and the holi one of israel hath creat it

41:21 produc your caus saith the lord; bring forth your strong
reason saith the king of jacob

41:22 let them bring them forth and shew us what shall happen: let
them shew the former thing what they be that we may consid them
and know the latter end of them; or declar us thing for to come

41:23 shew the thing that are to come hereaft that we may know
that ye are gods: yea do good or do evil that we may be dismay
and behold it togeth

41:24 behold ye are of noth and your work of nought: an
abomin is he that chooseth you

41:25 i have rais up one from the north and he shall come: from the
rise of the sun shall he call upon my name: and he shall come upon
princ as upon morter and as the potter treadeth clay

41:26 who hath declar from the begin that we may know? and
beforetim that we may say he is righteous? yea there is none that
sheweth yea there is none that declareth yea there is none that
heareth your word

41:27 the first shall say to zion behold behold them: and i will
give to jerusalem one that bringeth good tide

41:28 for i beheld and there wa no man; even among them and there
wa no counsellor that when i ask of them could answer a word

41:29 behold they are all vanity; their work are nothing: their
molten imag are wind and confus

42:1 behold my servant whom i uphold; mine elect in whom my soul
delighteth; i have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth
judgment to the gentil

42:2 he shall not cri nor lift up nor caus hi voic to be heard in
the street

42:3 a bruis reed shall he not break and the smoke flax shall he
not quench: he shall bring forth judgment unto truth

42:4 he shall not fail nor be discourag till he have set judgment
in the earth: and the isl shall wait for hi law

42:5 thu saith god the lord he that creat the heaven and
stretch them out; he that spread forth the earth and that which
cometh out of it; he that giveth breath unto the peopl upon it and
spirit to them that walk therein: 42:6 i the lord have call thee in
righteous and will hold thine hand and will keep thee and give
thee for a coven of the peopl for a light of the gentiles; 42:7
to open the blind eye to bring out the prison from the prison
and them that sit in dark out of the prison hous

42:8 i am the lord: that is my name: and my glori will i not give to
anoth neither my prais to graven imag

42:9 behold the former thing are come to pass and new thing do i
declare: befor they spring forth i tell you of them

42:10 sing unto the lord a new song and hi prais from the end of
the earth ye that go down to the sea and all that is therein; the
isl and the inhabit thereof

42:11 let the wilder and the citi thereof lift up their voic
the villag that kedar doth inhabit: let the inhabit of the rock
sing let them shout from the top of the mountain

42:12 let them give glori unto the lord and declar hi prais in the
island

42:13 the lord shall go forth as a mighti man he shall stir up
jealousi like a man of war: he shall cri yea roar; he shall prevail
against hi enemi

42:14 i have long time holden my peace; i have been still and
refrain myself: now will i cri like a travail woman; i will
destroy and devour at onc

42:15 i will make wast mountain and hill and dri up all their
herbs; and i will make the river island and i will dri up the
pool

42:16 and i will bring the blind by a way that they knew not; i will
lead them in path that they have not known: i will make dark
light befor them and crook thing straight these thing will i do
unto them and not forsak them

42:17 they shall be turn back they shall be greatli asham that
trust in graven imag that say to the molten imag ye are our
god

42:18 hear ye deaf; and look ye blind that ye may see

42:19 who is blind but my servant? or deaf as my messeng that i
sent? who is blind as he that is perfect and blind as the lord
servant? 42:20 see mani thing but thou observest not; open
the ear but he heareth not

42:21 the lord is well pleas for hi righteous sake; he will
magnifi the law and make it honour

42:22 but thi is a peopl rob and spoiled; they are all of them
snare in hole and they are hid in prison houses: they are for a
prey and none delivereth; for a spoil and none saith restor

42:23 who among you will give ear to this? who will hearken and hear
for the time to come? 42:24 who gave jacob for a spoil and israel to
the robbers? did not the lord he against whom we have sinned? for
they would not walk in hi way neither were they obedi unto hi
law

42:25 therefor he hath pour upon him the furi of hi anger and the
strength of battle: and it hath set him on fire round about yet he
knew not; and it burn him yet he laid it not to heart

43:1 but now thu saith the lord that creat thee o jacob and he
that form thee o israel fear not: for i have redeem thee i have
call thee by thi name; thou art mine

43:2 when thou passest through the water i will be with thee; and
through the river they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest
through the fire thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame
kindl upon thee

43:3 for i am the lord thi god the holi one of israel thi saviour: i
gave egypt for thi ransom ethiopia and seba for thee

43:4 sinc thou wast preciou in my sight thou hast been honour
and i have love thee: therefor will i give men for thee and peopl
for thi life

43:5 fear not: for i am with thee: i will bring thi seed from the
east and gather thee from the west; 43:6 i will say to the north
give up; and to the south keep not back: bring my son from far and
my daughter from the end of the earth; 43:7 even everi one that is
call by my name: for i have creat him for my glori i have form
him; yea i have made him

43:8 bring forth the blind peopl that have eye and the deaf that
have ear

43:9 let all the nation be gather togeth and let the peopl be
assembled: who among them can declar thi and shew us former things?
let them bring forth their wit that they may be justified: or
let them hear and say it is truth

43:10 ye are my wit saith the lord and my servant whom i have
chosen: that ye may know and believ me and understand that i am he:
befor me there wa no god form neither shall there be after me

43:11 i even i am the lord; and besid me there is no saviour

43:12 i have declar and have save and i have shew when there
wa no strang god among you: therefor ye are my wit saith the
lord that i am god

43:13 yea befor the day wa i am he; and there is none that can
deliv out of my hand: i will work and who shall let it? 43:14 thu
saith the lord your redeem the holi one of israel; for your sake i
have sent to babylon and have brought down all their nobl and the
chaldean whose cri is in the ship

43:15 i am the lord your holi one the creator of israel your king

43:16 thu saith the lord which maketh a way in the sea and a path
in the mighti waters; 43:17 which bringeth forth the chariot and
hors the armi and the power; they shall lie down togeth they
shall not rise: they are extinct they are quench as tow

43:18 rememb ye not the former thing neither consid the thing
of old

43:19 behold i will do a new thing; now it shall spring forth; shall
ye not know it? i will even make a way in the wilder and river
in the desert

43:20 the beast of the field shall honour me the dragon and the
owls: becaus i give water in the wilder and river in the
desert to give drink to my peopl my chosen

43:21 thi peopl have i form for myself; they shall shew forth my
prais

43:22 but thou hast not call upon me o jacob; but thou hast been
weari of me o israel

43:23 thou hast not brought me the small cattl of thi burnt
offerings; neither hast thou honour me with thi sacrific i have
not caus thee to serv with an offer nor weari thee with
incens

43:24 thou hast bought me no sweet cane with money neither hast thou
fill me with the fat of thi sacrifices: but thou hast made me to
serv with thi sin thou hast weari me with thine iniqu

43:25 i even i am he that blotteth out thi transgress for mine
own sake and will not rememb thi sin

43:26 put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declar thou that
thou mayest be justifi

43:27 thi first father hath sin and thi teacher have transgress
against me

43:28 therefor i have profan the princ of the sanctuari and have
given jacob to the curs and israel to reproach

44:1 yet now hear o jacob my servant; and israel whom i have chosen:
44:2 thu saith the lord that made thee and form thee from the
womb which will help thee; fear not o jacob my servant; and thou
jesurun whom i have chosen

44:3 for i will pour water upon him that is thirsti and flood upon
the dri ground: i will pour my spirit upon thi seed and my bless
upon thine offspring: 44:4 and they shall spring up as among the
grass as willow by the water cours

44:5 one shall say i am the lords; and anoth shall call himself by
the name of jacob; and anoth shall subscrib with hi hand unto the
lord and surnam himself by the name of israel

44:6 thu saith the lord the king of israel and hi redeem the lord
of hosts; i am the first and i am the last; and besid me there is no
god

44:7 and who as i shall call and shall declar it and set it in
order for me sinc i appoint the ancient people? and the thing
that are come and shall come let them shew unto them

44:8 fear ye not neither be afraid: have not i told thee from that
time and have declar it? ye are even my wit is there a god
besid me? yea there is no god; i know not ani

44:9 they that make a graven imag are all of them vanity; and their
delect thing shall not profit; and they are their own witnesses;
they see not nor know; that they may be asham

44:10 who hath form a god or molten a graven imag that is
profit for nothing? 44:11 behold all hi fellow shall be
ashamed: and the workmen they are of men: let them all be gather
togeth let them stand up; yet they shall fear and they shall be
asham togeth

44:12 the smith with the tong both worketh in the coal and
fashioneth it with hammer and worketh it with the strength of hi
arms: yea he is hungri and hi strength faileth: he drinketh no
water and is faint

44:13 the carpent stretcheth out hi rule; he marketh it out with a
line; he fitteth it with plane and he marketh it out with the
compass and maketh it after the figur of a man accord to the
beauti of a man; that it may remain in the hous

44:14 he heweth him down cedar and taketh the cypress and the oak
which he strengtheneth for himself among the tree of the forest: he
planteth an ash and the rain doth nourish it

44:15 then shall it be for a man to burn: for he will take thereof
and warm himself; yea he kindleth it and baketh bread; yea he
maketh a god and worshippeth it; he maketh it a graven imag and
falleth down thereto

44:16 he burneth part thereof in the fire; with part thereof he eateth
flesh; he roasteth roast and is satisfied: yea he warmeth himself
and saith aha i am warm i have seen the fire: 44:17 and the residu
thereof he maketh a god even hi graven image: he falleth down unto
it and worshippeth it and prayeth unto it and saith deliv me;
for thou art my god

44:18 they have not known nor understood: for he hath shut their eye
that they cannot see; and their heart that they cannot understand

44:19 and none considereth in hi heart neither is there knowledg
nor understand to say i have burn part of it in the fire; yea
also i have bake bread upon the coal thereof; i have roast flesh
and eaten it: and shall i make the residu thereof an abomination?
shall i fall down to the stock of a tree? 44:20 he feedeth on ashes:
a deceiv heart hath turn him asid that he cannot deliv hi
soul nor say is there not a lie in my right hand? 44:21 rememb
these o jacob and israel; for thou art my servant: i have form
thee; thou art my servant: o israel thou shalt not be forgotten of
me

44:22 i have blot out as a thick cloud thi transgress and
as a cloud thi sins: return unto me; for i have redeem thee

44:23 sing o ye heavens; for the lord hath done it: shout ye lower
part of the earth: break forth into sing ye mountain o forest
and everi tree therein: for the lord hath redeem jacob and
glorifi himself in israel

44:24 thu saith the lord thi redeem and he that form thee from
the womb i am the lord that maketh all things; that stretcheth forth
the heaven alone; that spreadeth abroad the earth by myself; 44:25
that frustrateth the token of the liar and maketh divin mad;
that turneth wise men backward and maketh their knowledg foolish;
44:26 that confirmeth the word of hi servant and performeth the
counsel of hi messengers; that saith to jerusalem thou shalt be
inhabited; and to the citi of judah ye shall be built and i will
rais up the decay place thereof: 44:27 that saith to the deep be
dri and i will dri up thi rivers: 44:28 that saith of cyru he is my
shepherd and shall perform all my pleasure: even say to jerusalem
thou shalt be built; and to the templ thi foundat shall be laid

45:1 thu saith the lord to hi anoint to cyru whose right hand i
have holden to subdu nation befor him; and i will loos the loin
of king to open befor him the two leav gates; and the gate shall
not be shut; 45:2 i will go befor thee and make the crook place
straight: i will break in piec the gate of brass and cut in sunder
the bar of iron: 45:3 and i will give thee the treasur of dark
and hidden rich of secret place that thou mayest know that i the
lord which call thee by thi name am the god of israel

45:4 for jacob my servant sake and israel mine elect i have even
call thee by thi name: i have surnam thee though thou hast not
known me

45:5 i am the lord and there is none els there is no god besid me:
i gird thee though thou hast not known me: 45:6 that they may know
from the rise of the sun and from the west that there is none
besid me i am the lord and there is none els

45:7 i form the light and creat darkness: i make peac and creat
evil: i the lord do all these thing

45:8 drop down ye heaven from abov and let the sky pour down
righteousness: let the earth open and let them bring forth salvat
and let righteous spring up together; i the lord have creat it

45:9 woe unto him that striveth with hi maker! let the potsherd
strive with the potsherd of the earth shall the clay say to him that
fashioneth it what makest thou? or thi work he hath no hands? 45:10
woe unto him that saith unto hi father what begettest thou? or to
the woman what hast thou brought forth? 45:11 thu saith the lord
the holi one of israel and hi maker ask me of thing to come
concern my son and concern the work of my hand command ye me

45:12 i have made the earth and creat man upon it: i even my
hand have stretch out the heaven and all their host have i
command

45:13 i have rais him up in righteous and i will direct all hi
ways: he shall build my citi and he shall let go my captiv not for
price nor reward saith the lord of host

45:14 thu saith the lord the labour of egypt and merchandis of
ethiopia and of the sabean men of statur shall come over unto
thee and they shall be thine: they shall come after thee; in chain
they shall come over and they shall fall down unto thee they shall
make supplic unto thee say sure god is in thee; and there
is none els there is no god

45:15 verili thou art a god that hidest thyself o god of israel the
saviour

45:16 they shall be asham and also confound all of them: they
shall go to confus togeth that are maker of idol

45:17 but israel shall be save in the lord with an everlast
salvation: ye shall not be asham nor confound world without end

45:18 for thu saith the lord that creat the heavens; god himself
that form the earth and made it; he hath establish it he creat
it not in vain he form it to be inhabited: i am the lord; and there
is none els

45:19 i have not spoken in secret in a dark place of the earth: i
said not unto the seed of jacob seek ye me in vain: i the lord speak
righteous i declar thing that are right

45:20 assembl yourselv and come; draw near togeth ye that are
escap of the nations: they have no knowledg that set up the wood of
their graven imag and pray unto a god that cannot save

45:21 tell ye and bring them near; yea let them take counsel
together: who hath declar thi from ancient time? who hath told it
from that time? have not i the lord? and there is no god els besid
me; a just god and a saviour; there is none besid me

45:22 look unto me and be ye save all the end of the earth: for i
am god and there is none els

45:23 i have sworn by myself the word is gone out of my mouth in
righteous and shall not return that unto me everi knee shall
bow everi tongu shall swear

45:24 sure shall one say in the lord have i righteous and
strength: even to him shall men come; and all that are incens
against him shall be asham

45:25 in the lord shall all the seed of israel be justifi and shall
glori

46:1 bel boweth down nebo stoopeth their idol were upon the beast
and upon the cattle: your carriag were heavi loaden; they are a
burden to the weari beast

46:2 they stoop they bow down together; they could not deliv the
burden but themselv are gone into captiv

46:3 hearken unto me o hous of jacob and all the remnant of the
hous of israel which are born by me from the belli which are
carri from the womb: 46:4 and even to your old age i am he; and even
to hoar hair will i carri you: i have made and i will bear; even i
will carri and will deliv you

46:5 to whom will ye liken me and make me equal and compar me that
we may be like? 46:6 they lavish gold out of the bag and weigh
silver in the balanc and hire a goldsmith; and he maketh it a god:
they fall down yea they worship

46:7 they bear him upon the shoulder they carri him and set him in
hi place and he standeth; from hi place shall he not remove: yea
one shall cri unto him yet can he not answer nor save him out of hi
troubl

46:8 rememb thi and shew yourselv men: bring it again to mind o
ye transgressor

46:9 rememb the former thing of old: for i am god and there is
none else; i am god and there is none like me 46:10 declar the
end from the begin and from ancient time the thing that are not
yet done say my counsel shall stand and i will do all my
pleasure: 46:11 call a raven bird from the east the man that
executeth my counsel from a far country: yea i have spoken it i will
also bring it to pass; i have purpos it i will also do it

46:12 hearken unto me ye stoutheart that are far from
righteousness: 46:13 i bring near my righteousness; it shall not be
far off and my salvat shall not tarry: and i will place salvat
in zion for israel my glori

47:1 come down and sit in the dust o virgin daughter of babylon sit
on the ground: there is no throne o daughter of the chaldeans: for
thou shalt no more be call tender and delic

47:2 take the millston and grind meal: uncov thi lock make bare
the leg uncov the thigh pass over the river

47:3 thi naked shall be uncov yea thi shame shall be seen: i
will take vengeanc and i will not meet thee as a man

47:4 as for our redeem the lord of host is hi name the holi one
of israel

47:5 sit thou silent and get thee into dark o daughter of the
chaldeans: for thou shalt no more be call the ladi of kingdom

47:6 i wa wroth with my peopl i have pollut mine inherit and
given them into thine hand: thou didst shew them no mercy; upon the
ancient hast thou veri heavili laid thi yoke

47:7 and thou saidst i shall be a ladi for ever: so that thou didst
not lay these thing to thi heart neither didst rememb the latter
end of it

47:8 therefor hear now thi thou that art given to pleasur that
dwellest carelessli that sayest in thine heart i am and none els
besid me; i shall not sit as a widow neither shall i know the loss
of children: 47:9 but these two thing shall come to thee in a moment
in one day the loss of children and widowhood: they shall come upon
thee in their perfect for the multitud of thi sorceri and for
the great abund of thine enchant

47:10 for thou hast trust in thi wickedness: thou hast said none
seeth me thi wisdom and thi knowledg it hath pervert thee; and
thou hast said in thine heart i am and none els besid me

47:11 therefor shall evil come upon thee; thou shalt not know from
whenc it riseth: and mischief shall fall upon thee; thou shalt not be
abl to put it off: and desol shall come upon thee suddenli
which thou shalt not know

47:12 stand now with thine enchant and with the multitud of thi
sorceri wherein thou hast labour from thi youth; if so be thou
shalt be abl to profit if so be thou mayest prevail

47:13 thou art weari in the multitud of thi counsel let now the
astrolog the stargaz the monthli prognost stand up
and save thee from these thing that shall come upon thee

47:14 behold they shall be as stubble; the fire shall burn them; they
shall not deliv themselv from the power of the flame: there shall
not be a coal to warm at nor fire to sit befor it

47:15 thu shall they be unto thee with whom thou hast labour even
thi merchant from thi youth: they shall wander everi one to hi
quarter; none shall save thee

48:1 hear ye thi o hous of jacob which are call by the name of
israel and are come forth out of the water of judah which swear by
the name of the lord and make mention of the god of israel but not
in truth nor in righteous

48:2 for they call themselv of the holi citi and stay themselv
upon the god of israel; the lord of host is hi name

48:3 i have declar the former thing from the beginning; and they
went forth out of my mouth and i shew them; i did them suddenli
and they came to pass

48:4 becaus i knew that thou art obstin and thi neck is an iron
sinew and thi brow brass; 48:5 i have even from the begin
declar it to thee; befor it came to pass i shew it thee: lest
thou shouldest say mine idol hath done them and my graven imag and
my molten imag hath command them

48:6 thou hast heard see all this; and will not ye declar it? i have
shew thee new thing from thi time even hidden thing and thou
didst not know them

48:7 they are creat now and not from the beginning; even befor the
day when thou heardest them not; lest thou shouldest say behold i
knew them

48:8 yea thou heardest not; yea thou knewest not; yea from that
time that thine ear wa not opened: for i knew that thou wouldest deal
veri treacher and wast call a transgressor from the womb

48:9 for my name sake will i defer mine anger and for my prais
will i refrain for thee that i cut thee not off

48:10 behold i have refin thee but not with silver; i have chosen
thee in the furnac of afflict

48:11 for mine own sake even for mine own sake will i do it: for how
should my name be polluted? and i will not give my glori unto anoth

48:12 hearken unto me o jacob and israel my called; i am he; i am
the first i also am the last

48:13 mine hand also hath laid the foundat of the earth and my
right hand hath span the heavens: when i call unto them they stand
up togeth

48:14 all ye assembl yourselv and hear; which among them hath
declar these things? the lord hath love him: he will do hi
pleasur on babylon and hi arm shall be on the chaldean

48:15 i even i have spoken; yea i have call him: i have brought
him and he shall make hi way prosper

48:16 come ye near unto me hear ye this; i have not spoken in secret
from the beginning; from the time that it wa there am i: and now the
lord god and hi spirit hath sent me

48:17 thu saith the lord thi redeem the holi one of israel; i am
the lord thi god which teacheth thee to profit which leadeth thee by
the way that thou shouldest go

48:18 o that thou hadst hearken to my commandments! then had thi
peac been as a river and thi righteous as the wave of the sea:
48:19 thi seed also had been as the sand and the offspr of thi
bowel like the gravel thereof; hi name should not have been cut off
nor destroy from befor me

48:20 go ye forth of babylon flee ye from the chaldean with a voic
of sing declar ye tell thi utter it even to the end of the
earth; say ye the lord hath redeem hi servant jacob

48:21 and they thirst not when he led them through the deserts: he
caus the water to flow out of the rock for them: he clave the rock
also and the water gush out

48:22 there is no peac saith the lord unto the wick

49:1 listen o isl unto me; and hearken ye peopl from far; the
lord hath call me from the womb; from the bowel of my mother hath
he made mention of my name

49:2 and he hath made my mouth like a sharp sword; in the shadow of
hi hand hath he hid me and made me a polish shaft; in hi quiver
hath he hid me; 49:3 and said unto me thou art my servant o israel
in whom i will be glorifi

49:4 then i said i have labour in vain i have spent my strength
for nought and in vain: yet sure my judgment is with the lord and
my work with my god

49:5 and now saith the lord that form me from the womb to be hi
servant to bring jacob again to him though israel be not gather
yet shall i be gloriou in the eye of the lord and my god shall be
my strength

49:6 and he said it is a light thing that thou shouldest be my
servant to rais up the tribe of jacob and to restor the preserv
of israel: i will also give thee for a light to the gentil that
thou mayest be my salvat unto the end of the earth

49:7 thu saith the lord the redeem of israel and hi holi one to
him whom man despiseth to him whom the nation abhorreth to a servant
of ruler king shall see and aris princ also shall worship
becaus of the lord that is faith and the holi one of israel and
he shall choos thee

49:8 thu saith the lord in an accept time have i heard thee and
in a day of salvat have i help thee: and i will preserv thee
and give thee for a coven of the peopl to establish the earth to
caus to inherit the desol heritages; 49:9 that thou mayest say to
the prison go forth; to them that are in dark shew
yourselv they shall feed in the way and their pastur shall be
in all high place

49:10 they shall not hunger nor thirst; neither shall the heat nor sun
smite them: for he that hath merci on them shall lead them even by
the spring of water shall he guid them

49:11 and i will make all my mountain a way and my highway shall be
exalt

49:12 behold these shall come from far: and lo these from the north
and from the west; and these from the land of sinim

49:13 sing o heavens; and be joy o earth; and break forth into
sing o mountains: for the lord hath comfort hi peopl and will
have merci upon hi afflict

49:14 but zion said the lord hath forsaken me and my lord hath
forgotten me

49:15 can a woman forget her suck child that she should not have
compass on the son of her womb? yea they may forget yet will i
not forget thee

49:16 behold i have graven thee upon the palm of my hands; thi wall
are continu befor me

49:17 thi children shall make haste; thi destroy and they that made
thee wast shall go forth of thee

49:18 lift up thine eye round about and behold: all these gather
themselv togeth and come to thee as i live saith the lord thou
shalt sure cloth thee with them all as with an ornament and bind
them on thee as a bride doeth

49:19 for thi wast and thi desol place and the land of thi
destruct shall even now be too narrow by reason of the
inhabit and they that swallow thee up shall be far away

49:20 the children which thou shalt have after thou hast lost the
other shall say again in thine ear the place is too strait for me:
give place to me that i may dwell

49:21 then shalt thou say in thine heart who hath begotten me these
see i have lost my children and am desol a captiv and
remov to and fro? and who hath brought up these? behold i wa left
alone; these where had they been? 49:22 thu saith the lord god
behold i will lift up mine hand to the gentil and set up my
standard to the people: and they shall bring thi son in their arm
and thi daughter shall be carri upon their shoulder

49:23 and king shall be thi nurs father and their queen thi
nurs mothers: they shall bow down to thee with their face toward
the earth and lick up the dust of thi feet; and thou shalt know that
i am the lord: for they shall not be asham that wait for me

49:24 shall the prey be taken from the mighti or the law captiv
delivered? 49:25 but thu saith the lord even the captiv of the
mighti shall be taken away and the prey of the terribl shall be
delivered: for i will contend with him that contendeth with thee and
i will save thi children

49:26 and i will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh; and
they shall be drunken with their own blood as with sweet wine: and
all flesh shall know that i the lord am thi saviour and thi redeem
the mighti one of jacob

50:1 thu saith the lord where is the bill of your mother
divorc whom i have put away? or which of my creditor is it to
whom i have sold you? behold for your iniqu have ye sold
yourselv and for your transgress is your mother put away

50:2 wherefor when i came wa there no man? when i call wa
there none to answer? is my hand shorten at all that it cannot
redeem? or have i no power to deliver? behold at my rebuk i dri up
the sea i make the river a wilderness: their fish stinketh becaus
there is no water and dieth for thirst

50:3 i cloth the heaven with black and i make sackcloth their
cover

50:4 the lord god hath given me the tongu of the learn that i
should know how to speak a word in season to him that is weary: he
wakeneth morn by morn he wakeneth mine ear to hear as the
learn

50:5 the lord god hath open mine ear and i wa not rebelli
neither turn away back

50:6 i gave my back to the smiter and my cheek to them that pluck
off the hair: i hid not my face from shame and spit

50:7 for the lord god will help me; therefor shall i not be
confounded: therefor have i set my face like a flint and i know that
i shall not be asham

50:8 he is near that justifieth me; who will contend with me? let us
stand together: who is mine adversary? let him come near to me

50:9 behold the lord god will help me; who is he that shall condemn
me? lo they all shall wax old as a garment; the moth shall eat them
up

50:10 who is among you that feareth the lord that obeyeth the voic
of hi servant that walketh in dark and hath no light? let him
trust in the name of the lord and stay upon hi god

50:11 behold all ye that kindl a fire that compass yourselv about
with sparks: walk in the light of your fire and in the spark that ye
have kindl thi shall ye have of mine hand; ye shall lie down in
sorrow

51:1 hearken to me ye that follow after righteous ye that seek
the lord: look unto the rock whenc ye are hewn and to the hole of
the pit whenc ye are dig

51:2 look unto abraham your father and unto sarah that bare you: for
i call him alon and bless him and increas him

51:3 for the lord shall comfort zion: he will comfort all her wast
places; and he will make her wilder like eden and her desert like
the garden of the lord; joy and glad shall be found therein
thanksgiv and the voic of melodi

51:4 hearken unto me my people; and give ear unto me o my nation:
for a law shall proceed from me and i will make my judgment to rest
for a light of the peopl

51:5 my righteous is near; my salvat is gone forth and mine
arm shall judg the people; the isl shall wait upon me and on mine
arm shall they trust

51:6 lift up your eye to the heaven and look upon the earth
beneath: for the heaven shall vanish away like smoke and the earth
shall wax old like a garment and they that dwell therein shall die in
like manner: but my salvat shall be for ever and my righteous
shall not be abolish

51:7 hearken unto me ye that know righteous the peopl in whose
heart is my law; fear ye not the reproach of men neither be ye afraid
of their revil

51:8 for the moth shall eat them up like a garment and the worm shall
eat them like wool: but my righteous shall be for ever and my
salvat from gener to gener

51:9 awak awak put on strength o arm of the lord; awak as in
the ancient day in the gener of old art thou not it that hath
cut rahab and wound the dragon? 51:10 art thou not it which hath
dri the sea the water of the great deep; that hath made the depth
of the sea a way for the ransom to pass over? 51:11 therefor the
redeem of the lord shall return and come with sing unto zion;
and everlast joy shall be upon their head: they shall obtain
glad and joy; and sorrow and mourn shall flee away

51:12 i even i am he that comforteth you: who art thou that thou
shouldest be afraid of a man that shall die and of the son of man
which shall be made as grass; 51:13 and forgettest the lord thi maker
that hath stretch forth the heaven and laid the foundat of the
earth; and hast fear continu everi day becaus of the furi of
the oppressor as if he were readi to destroy? and where is the furi
of the oppressor? 51:14 the captiv exil hasteneth that he may be
loos and that he should not die in the pit nor that hi bread
should fail

51:15 but i am the lord thi god that divid the sea whose wave
roared: the lord of host is hi name

51:16 and i have put my word in thi mouth and i have cover thee in
the shadow of mine hand that i may plant the heaven and lay the
foundat of the earth and say unto zion thou art my peopl

51:17 awak awak stand up o jerusalem which hast drunk at the
hand of the lord the cup of hi fury; thou hast drunken the dreg of
the cup of trembl and wrung them out

51:18 there is none to guid her among all the son whom she hath
brought forth; neither is there ani that taketh her by the hand of all
the son that she hath brought up

51:19 these two thing are come unto thee; who shall be sorri for
thee? desol and destruct and the famin and the sword: by
whom shall i comfort thee? 51:20 thi son have faint they lie at
the head of all the street as a wild bull in a net: they are full of
the furi of the lord the rebuk of thi god

51:21 therefor hear now thi thou afflict and drunken but not
with wine: 51:22 thu saith thi lord the lord and thi god that
pleadeth the caus of hi peopl behold i have taken out of thine
hand the cup of trembl even the dreg of the cup of my fury; thou
shalt no more drink it again: 51:23 but i will put it into the hand of
them that afflict thee; which have said to thi soul bow down that we
may go over: and thou hast laid thi bodi as the ground and as the
street to them that went over

52:1 awak awake; put on thi strength o zion; put on thi beauti
garment o jerusalem the holi city: for henceforth there shall no
more come into thee the uncircumcis and the unclean

52:2 shake thyself from the dust; aris and sit down o jerusalem:
loos thyself from the band of thi neck o captiv daughter of zion

52:3 for thu saith the lord ye have sold yourselv for nought; and
ye shall be redeem without money

52:4 for thu saith the lord god my peopl went down aforetim into
egypt to sojourn there; and the assyrian oppress them without caus

52:5 now therefor what have i here saith the lord that my peopl
is taken away for nought? they that rule over them make them to howl
saith the lord; and my name continu everi day is blasphem

52:6 therefor my peopl shall know my name: therefor they shall know
in that day that i am he that doth speak: behold it is i

52:7 how beauti upon the mountain are the feet of him that
bringeth good tide that publisheth peace; that bringeth good
tide of good that publisheth salvation; that saith unto zion thi
god reigneth! 52:8 thi watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the
voic togeth shall they sing: for they shall see eye to eye when
the lord shall bring again zion

52:9 break forth into joy sing togeth ye wast place of
jerusalem: for the lord hath comfort hi peopl he hath redeem
jerusalem

52:10 the lord hath made bare hi holi arm in the eye of all the
nations; and all the end of the earth shall see the salvat of our
god

52:11 depart ye depart ye go ye out from thenc touch no unclean
thing; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean that bear the
vessel of the lord

52:12 for ye shall not go out with hast nor go by flight: for the
lord will go befor you; and the god of israel will be your rereward

52:13 behold my servant shall deal prudent he shall be exalt and
extol and be veri high

52:14 as mani were astoni at thee; hi visag wa so mar more
than ani man and hi form more than the son of men: 52:15 so shall
he sprinkl mani nations; the king shall shut their mouth at him:
for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which
they had not heard shall they consid

53:1 who hath believ our report? and to whom is the arm of the lord
revealed? 53:2 for he shall grow up befor him as a tender plant and
as a root out of a dri ground: he hath no form nor comeliness; and
when we shall see him there is no beauti that we should desir him

53:3 he is despis and reject of men; a man of sorrow and
acquaint with grief: and we hid as it were our face from him; he
wa despis and we esteem him not

53:4 sure he hath born our grief and carri our sorrows: yet we
did esteem him stricken smitten of god and afflict

53:5 but he wa wound for our transgress he wa bruis for our
iniquities: the chastis of our peac wa upon him; and with hi
stripe we are heal

53:6 all we like sheep have gone astray; we have turn everi one to
hi own way; and the lord hath laid on him the iniqu of us all

53:7 he wa oppress and he wa afflict yet he open not hi
mouth: he is brought as a lamb to the slaughter and as a sheep befor
her shearer is dumb so he openeth not hi mouth

53:8 he wa taken from prison and from judgment: and who shall declar
hi generation? for he wa cut off out of the land of the living: for
the transgress of my peopl wa he stricken

53:9 and he made hi grave with the wick and with the rich in hi
death; becaus he had done no violenc neither wa ani deceit in hi
mouth

53:10 yet it pleas the lord to bruis him; he hath put him to grief:
when thou shalt make hi soul an offer for sin he shall see hi
seed he shall prolong hi day and the pleasur of the lord shall
prosper in hi hand

53:11 he shall see of the travail of hi soul and shall be satisfied:
by hi knowledg shall my righteou servant justifi many; for he shall
bear their iniqu

53:12 therefor will i divid him a portion with the great and he
shall divid the spoil with the strong; becaus he hath pour out hi
soul unto death: and he wa number with the transgressors; and he
bare the sin of mani and made intercess for the transgressor

54:1 sing o barren thou that didst not bear; break forth into
sing and cri aloud thou that didst not travail with child: for
more are the children of the desol than the children of the marri
wife saith the lord

54:2 enlarg the place of thi tent and let them stretch forth the
curtain of thine habitations: spare not lengthen thi cord and
strengthen thi stakes; 54:3 for thou shalt break forth on the right
hand and on the left; and thi seed shall inherit the gentil and
make the desol citi to be inhabit

54:4 fear not; for thou shalt not be ashamed: neither be thou
confounded; for thou shalt not be put to shame: for thou shalt forget
the shame of thi youth and shalt not rememb the reproach of thi
widowhood ani more

54:5 for thi maker is thine husband; the lord of host is hi name;
and thi redeem the holi one of israel; the god of the whole earth
shall he be call

54:6 for the lord hath call thee as a woman forsaken and griev in
spirit and a wife of youth when thou wast refus saith thi god

54:7 for a small moment have i forsaken thee; but with great merci
will i gather thee

54:8 in a littl wrath i hid my face from thee for a moment; but with
everlast kind will i have merci on thee saith the lord thi
redeem

54:9 for thi is as the water of noah unto me: for as i have sworn
that the water of noah should no more go over the earth; so have i
sworn that i would not be wroth with thee nor rebuk thee

54:10 for the mountain shall depart and the hill be removed; but my
kind shall not depart from thee neither shall the coven of my
peac be remov saith the lord that hath merci on thee

54:11 o thou afflict toss with tempest and not comfort
behold i will lay thi stone with fair colour and lay thi
foundat with sapphir

54:12 and i will make thi window of agat and thi gate of
carbuncl and all thi border of pleasant stone

54:13 and all thi children shall be taught of the lord; and great
shall be the peac of thi children

54:14 in righteous shalt thou be established: thou shalt be far
from oppression; for thou shalt not fear: and from terror; for it
shall not come near thee

54:15 behold they shall sure gather togeth but not by me:
whosoev shall gather togeth against thee shall fall for thi sake

54:16 behold i have creat the smith that bloweth the coal in the
fire and that bringeth forth an instrument for hi work; and i have
creat the waster to destroy

54:17 no weapon that is form against thee shall prosper; and everi
tongu that shall rise against thee in judgment thou shalt condemn
thi is the heritag of the servant of the lord and their
righteous is of me saith the lord

55:1 ho everi one that thirsteth come ye to the water and he that
hath no money; come ye buy and eat; yea come buy wine and milk
without money and without price

55:2 wherefor do ye spend money for that which is not bread? and your
labour for that which satisfieth not? hearken dilig unto me and
eat ye that which is good and let your soul delight itself in
fat

55:3 inclin your ear and come unto me: hear and your soul shall
live; and i will make an everlast coven with you even the sure
merci of david

55:4 behold i have given him for a wit to the peopl a leader
and command to the peopl

55:5 behold thou shalt call a nation that thou knowest not and
nation that knew not thee shall run unto thee becaus of the lord thi
god and for the holi one of israel; for he hath glorifi thee

55:6 seek ye the lord while he may be found call ye upon him while he
is near: 55:7 let the wick forsak hi way and the unright man
hi thoughts: and let him return unto the lord and he will have merci
upon him; and to our god for he will abundantli pardon

55:8 for my thought are not your thought neither are your way my
way saith the lord

55:9 for as the heaven are higher than the earth so are my way
higher than your way and my thought than your thought

55:10 for as the rain cometh down and the snow from heaven and
returneth not thither but watereth the earth and maketh it bring
forth and bud that it may give seed to the sower and bread to the
eater: 55:11 so shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth: it
shall not return unto me void but it shall accomplish that which i
pleas and it shall prosper in the thing whereto i sent it

55:12 for ye shall go out with joy and be led forth with peace: the
mountain and the hill shall break forth befor you into sing and
all the tree of the field shall clap their hand

55:13 instead of the thorn shall come up the fir tree and instead of
the brier shall come up the myrtl tree: and it shall be to the lord
for a name for an everlast sign that shall not be cut off

56:1 thu saith the lord keep ye judgment and do justice: for my
salvat is near to come and my righteous to be reveal

56:2 bless is the man that doeth thi and the son of man that
layeth hold on it; that keepeth the sabbath from pollut it and
keepeth hi hand from do ani evil

56:3 neither let the son of the stranger that hath join himself to
the lord speak say the lord hath utterli separ me from hi
people: neither let the eunuch say behold i am a dri tree

56:4 for thu saith the lord unto the eunuch that keep my sabbath
and choos the thing that pleas me and take hold of my covenant;
56:5 even unto them will i give in mine hous and within my wall a
place and a name better than of son and of daughters: i will give
them an everlast name that shall not be cut off

56:6 also the son of the stranger that join themselv to the lord
to serv him and to love the name of the lord to be hi servant
everi one that keepeth the sabbath from pollut it and taketh hold
of my covenant; 56:7 even them will i bring to my holi mountain and
make them joy in my hous of prayer: their burnt offer and
their sacrific shall be accept upon mine altar; for mine hous
shall be call an hous of prayer for all peopl

56:8 the lord god which gathereth the outcast of israel saith yet
will i gather other to him besid those that are gather unto him

56:9 all ye beast of the field come to devour yea all ye beast in
the forest

56:10 hi watchmen are blind: they are all ignor they are all dumb
dog they cannot bark; sleep lie down love to slumber

56:11 yea they are greedi dog which can never have enough and they
are shepherd that cannot understand: they all look to their own way
everi one for hi gain from hi quarter

56:12 come ye say they i will fetch wine and we will fill ourselv
with strong drink; and to morrow shall be as thi day and much more
abund

57:1 the righteou perisheth and no man layeth it to heart: and
merci men are taken away none consid that the righteou is
taken away from the evil to come

57:2 he shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their bed each
one walk in hi upright

57:3 but draw near hither ye son of the sorceress the seed of the
adulter and the whore

57:4 against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide
mouth and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgress
a seed of falsehood

57:5 enflam yourselv with idol under everi green tree slay
the children in the valley under the clift of the rocks? 57:6 among
the smooth stone of the stream is thi portion; they they are thi
lot: even to them hast thou pour a drink offer thou hast offer
a meat offer should i receiv comfort in these? 57:7 upon a lofti
and high mountain hast thou set thi bed: even thither wentest thou up
to offer sacrific

57:8 behind the door also and the post hast thou set up thi
remembrance: for thou hast discov thyself to anoth than me and
art gone up; thou hast enlarg thi bed and made thee a coven with
them; thou lovedst their bed where thou sawest it

57:9 and thou wentest to the king with ointment and didst increas
thi perfum and didst send thi messeng far off and didst debas
thyself even unto hell

57:10 thou art weari in the great of thi way; yet saidst thou
not there is no hope: thou hast found the life of thine hand;
therefor thou wast not griev

57:11 and of whom hast thou been afraid or fear that thou hast
lie and hast not rememb me nor laid it to thi heart? have not i
held my peac even of old and thou fearest me not? 57:12 i will
declar thi righteous and thi works; for they shall not profit
thee

57:13 when thou criest let thi compani deliv thee; but the wind
shall carri them all away; vaniti shall take them: but he that putteth
hi trust in me shall possess the land and shall inherit my holi
mountain; 57:14 and shall say cast ye up cast ye up prepar the
way take up the stumblingblock out of the way of my peopl

57:15 for thu saith the high and lofti one that inhabiteth etern
whose name is holy; i dwell in the high and holi place with him also
that is of a contrit and humbl spirit to reviv the spirit of the
humbl and to reviv the heart of the contrit one

57:16 for i will not contend for ever neither will i be alway wroth:
for the spirit should fail befor me and the soul which i have made

57:17 for the iniqu of hi covet wa i wroth and smote him:
i hid me and wa wroth and he went on frowardli in the way of hi
heart

57:18 i have seen hi way and will heal him: i will lead him also
and restor comfort unto him and to hi mourner

57:19 i creat the fruit of the lips; peac peac to him that is far
off and to him that is near saith the lord; and i will heal him

57:20 but the wick are like the troubl sea when it cannot rest
whose water cast up mire and dirt

57:21 there is no peac saith my god to the wick

58:1 cri aloud spare not lift up thi voic like a trumpet and shew
my peopl their transgress and the hous of jacob their sin

58:2 yet they seek me daili and delight to know my way as a nation
that did righteous and forsook not the ordin of their god:
they ask of me the ordin of justice; they take delight in
approach to god

58:3 wherefor have we fast say they and thou seest not? wherefor
have we afflict our soul and thou takest no knowledge? behold in
the day of your fast ye find pleasur and exact all your labour

58:4 behold ye fast for strife and debat and to smite with the fist
of wickedness: ye shall not fast as ye do thi day to make your voic
to be heard on high

58:5 is it such a fast that i have chosen? a day for a man to afflict
hi soul? is it to bow down hi head as a bulrush and to spread
sackcloth and ash under him? wilt thou call thi a fast and an
accept day to the lord? 58:6 is not thi the fast that i have
chosen? to loos the band of wicked to undo the heavi burden
and to let the oppress go free and that ye break everi yoke? 58:7
is it not to deal thi bread to the hungri and that thou bring the
poor that are cast out to thi house? when thou seest the nake that
thou cover him; and that thou hide not thyself from thine own flesh?
58:8 then shall thi light break forth as the morn and thine health
shall spring forth speedily: and thi righteous shall go befor
thee; the glori of the lord shall be thi rereward

58:9 then shalt thou call and the lord shall answer; thou shalt cri
and he shall say here i am if thou take away from the midst of thee
the yoke the put forth of the finger and speak vanity; 58:10
and if thou draw out thi soul to the hungri and satisfi the afflict
soul; then shall thi light rise in obscur and thi dark be as
the noon day: 58:11 and the lord shall guid thee continu and
satisfi thi soul in drought and make fat thi bones: and thou shalt be
like a water garden and like a spring of water whose water fail
not

58:12 and they that shall be of thee shall build the old wast places:
thou shalt rais up the foundat of mani generations; and thou
shalt be call the repair of the breach the restor of path to
dwell in

58:13 if thou turn away thi foot from the sabbath from do thi
pleasur on my holi day; and call the sabbath a delight the holi of
the lord honourable; and shalt honour him not do thine own way
nor find thine own pleasur nor speak thine own words: 58:14
then shalt thou delight thyself in the lord; and i will caus thee to
ride upon the high place of the earth and feed thee with the
heritag of jacob thi father: for the mouth of the lord hath spoken
it

59:1 behold the lord hand is not shorten that it cannot save;
neither hi ear heavi that it cannot hear: 59:2 but your iniqu
have separ between you and your god and your sin have hid hi
face from you that he will not hear

59:3 for your hand are defil with blood and your finger with
iniquity; your lip have spoken lie your tongu hath mutter
pervers

59:4 none calleth for justic nor ani pleadeth for truth: they trust
in vaniti and speak lies; they conceiv mischief and bring forth
iniqu

59:5 they hatch cockatric egg and weav the spider web: he that
eateth of their egg dieth and that which is crush breaketh out
into a viper

59:6 their web shall not becom garment neither shall they cover
themselv with their works: their work are work of iniqu and
the act of violenc is in their hand

59:7 their feet run to evil and they make hast to shed innoc
blood: their thought are thought of iniquity; wast and
destruct are in their path

59:8 the way of peac they know not; and there is no judgment in their
goings: they have made them crook paths: whosoev goeth therein
shall not know peac

59:9 therefor is judgment far from us neither doth justic overtak
us: we wait for light but behold obscurity; for bright but we
walk in dark

59:10 we grope for the wall like the blind and we grope as if we had
no eyes: we stumbl at noon day as in the night; we are in desol
place as dead men

59:11 we roar all like bear and mourn sore like doves: we look for
judgment but there is none; for salvat but it is far off from us

59:12 for our transgress are multipli befor thee and our sin
testifi against us: for our transgress are with us; and as for our
iniqu we know them; 59:13 in transgress and lie against the
lord and depart away from our god speak oppress and revolt
conceiv and utter from the heart word of falsehood

59:14 and judgment is turn away backward and justic standeth afar
off: for truth is fallen in the street and equiti cannot enter

59:15 yea truth faileth; and he that departeth from evil maketh
himself a prey: and the lord saw it and it displeas him that there
wa no judgment

59:16 and he saw that there wa no man and wonder that there wa no
intercessor: therefor hi arm brought salvat unto him; and hi
righteous it sustain him

59:17 for he put on righteous as a breastplat and an helmet of
salvat upon hi head; and he put on the garment of vengeanc for
cloth and wa clad with zeal as a cloak

59:18 accord to their deed accordingli he will repay furi to hi
adversari recomp to hi enemies; to the island he will repay
recomp

59:19 so shall they fear the name of the lord from the west and hi
glori from the rise of the sun when the enemi shall come in like a
flood the spirit of the lord shall lift up a standard against him

59:20 and the redeem shall come to zion and unto them that turn
from transgress in jacob saith the lord

59:21 as for me thi is my coven with them saith the lord; my
spirit that is upon thee and my word which i have put in thi mouth
shall not depart out of thi mouth nor out of the mouth of thi seed
nor out of the mouth of thi seed seed saith the lord from
henceforth and for ever

60:1 aris shine; for thi light is come and the glori of the lord is
risen upon thee

60:2 for behold the dark shall cover the earth and gross
dark the people: but the lord shall aris upon thee and hi glori
shall be seen upon thee

60:3 and the gentil shall come to thi light and king to the
bright of thi rise

60:4 lift up thine eye round about and see: all they gather
themselv togeth they come to thee: thi son shall come from far
and thi daughter shall be nurs at thi side

60:5 then thou shalt see and flow togeth and thine heart shall
fear and be enlarged; becaus the abund of the sea shall be
convert unto thee the forc of the gentil shall come unto thee

60:6 the multitud of camel shall cover thee the dromedari of
midian and ephah; all they from sheba shall come: they shall bring
gold and incense; and they shall shew forth the prais of the lord

60:7 all the flock of kedar shall be gather togeth unto thee the
ram of nebaioth shall minist unto thee: they shall come up with
accept on mine altar and i will glorifi the hous of my glori

60:8 who are these that fli as a cloud and as the dove to their
windows? 60:9 sure the isl shall wait for me and the ship of
tarshish first to bring thi son from far their silver and their
gold with them unto the name of the lord thi god and to the holi one
of israel becaus he hath glorifi thee

60:10 and the son of stranger shall build up thi wall and their
king shall minist unto thee: for in my wrath i smote thee but in
my favour have i had merci on thee

60:11 therefor thi gate shall be open continually; they shall not be
shut day nor night; that men may bring unto thee the forc of the
gentil and that their king may be brought

60:12 for the nation and kingdom that will not serv thee shall
perish; yea those nation shall be utterli wast

60:13 the glori of lebanon shall come unto thee the fir tree the
pine tree and the box togeth to beautifi the place of my
sanctuary; and i will make the place of my feet gloriou

60:14 the son also of them that afflict thee shall come bend
unto thee; and all they that despis thee shall bow themselv down
at the sole of thi feet; and they shall call thee; the citi of the
lord the zion of the holi one of israel

60:15 wherea thou ha been forsaken and hate so that no man went
through thee i will make thee an etern excel a joy of mani
gener

60:16 thou shalt also suck the milk of the gentil and shalt suck
the breast of kings: and thou shalt know that i the lord am thi
saviour and thi redeem the mighti one of jacob

60:17 for brass i will bring gold and for iron i will bring silver
and for wood brass and for stone iron: i will also make thi offic
peac and thine exactor righteous

60:18 violenc shall no more be heard in thi land wast nor
destruct within thi borders; but thou shalt call thi wall
salvat and thi gate prais

60:19 the sun shall be no more thi light by day; neither for
bright shall the moon give light unto thee: but the lord shall be
unto thee an everlast light and thi god thi glori

60:20 thi sun shall no more go down; neither shall thi moon withdraw
itself: for the lord shall be thine everlast light and the day of
thi mourn shall be end

60:21 thi peopl also shall be all righteous: they shall inherit the
land for ever the branch of my plant the work of my hand that i
may be glorifi

60:22 a littl one shall becom a thousand and a small one a strong
nation: i the lord will hasten it in hi time

61:1 the spirit of the lord god is upon me; becaus the lord hath
anoint me to preach good tide unto the meek; he hath sent me to
bind up the brokenheart to proclaim liberti to the captiv and
the open of the prison to them that are bound; 61:2 to proclaim the
accept year of the lord and the day of vengeanc of our god; to
comfort all that mourn; 61:3 to appoint unto them that mourn in zion
to give unto them beauti for ash the oil of joy for mourn the
garment of prais for the spirit of heaviness; that they might be
call tree of righteous the plant of the lord that he might
be glorifi

61:4 and they shall build the old wast they shall rais up the
former desol and they shall repair the wast citi the
desol of mani gener

61:5 and stranger shall stand and feed your flock and the son of
the alien shall be your plowmen and your vinedress

61:6 but ye shall be name the priest of the lord: men shall call you
the minist of our god: ye shall eat the rich of the gentil and
in their glori shall ye boast yourselv

61:7 for your shame ye shall have double; and for confus they shall
rejoic in their portion: therefor in their land they shall possess
the double: everlast joy shall be unto them

61:8 for i the lord love judgment i hate robberi for burnt offering;
and i will direct their work in truth and i will make an everlast
coven with them

61:9 and their seed shall be known among the gentil and their
offspr among the people: all that see them shall acknowledg them
that they are the seed which the lord hath bless

61:10 i will greatli rejoic in the lord my soul shall be joy in
my god; for he hath cloth me with the garment of salvat he hath
cover me with the robe of righteous as a bridegroom decketh
himself with ornament and as a bride adorneth herself with her
jewel

61:11 for as the earth bringeth forth her bud and as the garden
causeth the thing that are sown in it to spring forth; so the lord
god will caus righteous and prais to spring forth befor all the
nation

62:1 for zion sake will i not hold my peac and for jerusalem
sake i will not rest until the righteous thereof go forth as
bright and the salvat thereof as a lamp that burneth

62:2 and the gentil shall see thi righteous and all king thi
glory: and thou shalt be call by a new name which the mouth of the
lord shall name

62:3 thou shalt also be a crown of glori in the hand of the lord and
a royal diadem in the hand of thi god

62:4 thou shalt no more be term forsaken; neither shall thi land ani
more be term desolate: but thou shalt be call hephzibah and thi
land beulah: for the lord delighteth in thee and thi land shall be
marri

62:5 for as a young man marrieth a virgin so shall thi son marri
thee: and as the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride so shall thi god
rejoic over thee

62:6 i have set watchmen upon thi wall o jerusalem which shall
never hold their peac day nor night: ye that make mention of the
lord keep not silenc 62:7 and give him no rest till he establish
and till he make jerusalem a prais in the earth

62:8 the lord hath sworn by hi right hand and by the arm of hi
strength sure i will no more give thi corn to be meat for thine
enemies; and the son of the stranger shall not drink thi wine for
the which thou hast laboured: 62:9 but they that have gather it
shall eat it and prais the lord; and they that have brought it
togeth shall drink it in the court of my holi

62:10 go through go through the gates; prepar ye the way of the
people; cast up cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a
standard for the peopl

62:11 behold the lord hath proclaim unto the end of the world say
ye to the daughter of zion behold thi salvat cometh; behold hi
reward is with him and hi work befor him

62:12 and they shall call them the holi peopl the redeem of the
lord: and thou shalt be call sought out a citi not forsaken

63:1 who is thi that cometh from edom with dy garment from
bozrah? thi that is gloriou in hi apparel travel in the
great of hi strength? i that speak in righteous mighti to
save

63:2 wherefor art thou red in thine apparel and thi garment like
him that treadeth in the winefat? 63:3 i have trodden the winepress
alone; and of the peopl there wa none with me: for i will tread them
in mine anger and trampl them in my fury; and their blood shall be
sprinkl upon my garment and i will stain all my raiment

63:4 for the day of vengeanc is in mine heart and the year of my
redeem is come

63:5 and i look and there wa none to help; and i wonder that
there wa none to uphold: therefor mine own arm brought salvat
unto me; and my furi it upheld me

63:6 and i will tread down the peopl in mine anger and make them
drunk in my furi and i will bring down their strength to the earth

63:7 i will mention the lovingkind of the lord and the prais
of the lord accord to all that the lord hath bestow on us and
the great good toward the hous of israel which he hath bestow
on them accord to hi merci and accord to the multitud of
hi lovingkind

63:8 for he said sure they are my peopl children that will not
lie: so he wa their saviour

63:9 in all their afflict he wa afflict and the angel of hi
presenc save them: in hi love and in hi piti he redeem them; and
he bare them and carri them all the day of old

63:10 but they rebel and vex hi holi spirit: therefor he wa
turn to be their enemi and he fought against them

63:11 then he rememb the day of old mose and hi peopl
say where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the
shepherd of hi flock? where is he that put hi holi spirit within
him? 63:12 that led them by the right hand of mose with hi gloriou
arm divid the water befor them to make himself an everlast
name? 63:13 that led them through the deep as an hors in the
wilder that they should not stumble? 63:14 as a beast goeth down
into the valley the spirit of the lord caus him to rest: so didst
thou lead thi peopl to make thyself a gloriou name

63:15 look down from heaven and behold from the habit of thi
holi and of thi glory: where is thi zeal and thi strength the
sound of thi bowel and of thi merci toward me? are they
restrained? 63:16 doubtless thou art our father though abraham be
ignor of us and israel acknowledg us not: thou o lord art our
father our redeemer; thi name is from everlast

63:17 o lord whi hast thou made us to err from thi way and harden
our heart from thi fear? return for thi servant sake the tribe of
thine inherit

63:18 the peopl of thi holi have possess it but a littl while:
our adversari have trodden down thi sanctuari

63:19 we are thine: thou never barest rule over them; they were not
call by thi name

64:1 oh that thou wouldest rend the heaven that thou wouldest come
down that the mountain might flow down at thi presenc 64:2 as when
the melt fire burneth the fire causeth the water to boil to make
thi name known to thine adversari that the nation may trembl at
thi presence! 64:3 when thou didst terribl thing which we look
not for thou camest down the mountain flow down at thi presenc

64:4 for sinc the begin of the world men have not heard nor
perceiv by the ear neither hath the eye seen o god besid thee
what he hath prepar for him that waiteth for him

64:5 thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteous those
that rememb thee in thi ways: behold thou art wroth; for we have
sinned: in those is continu and we shall be save

64:6 but we are all as an unclean thing and all our righteous
are as filthi rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniqu
like the wind have taken us away

64:7 and there is none that calleth upon thi name that stirreth up
himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thi face from us and
hast consum us becaus of our iniqu

64:8 but now o lord thou art our father; we are the clay and thou
our potter; and we all are the work of thi hand

64:9 be not wroth veri sore o lord neither rememb iniqu for
ever: behold see we beseech thee we are all thi peopl

64:10 thi holi citi are a wilder zion is a wilder
jerusalem a desol

64:11 our holi and our beauti hous where our father prais
thee is burn up with fire: and all our pleasant thing are laid
wast

64:12 wilt thou refrain thyself for these thing o lord? wilt thou
hold thi peac and afflict us veri sore? 65:1 i am sought of them
that ask not for me; i am found of them that sought me not: i said
behold me behold me unto a nation that wa not call by my name

65:2 i have spread out my hand all the day unto a rebelli peopl
which walketh in a way that wa not good after their own thoughts;
65:3 a peopl that provoketh me to anger continu to my face; that
sacrificeth in garden and burneth incens upon altar of brick; 65:4
which remain among the grave and lodg in the monument which eat
swine flesh and broth of abomin thing is in their vessels;
65:5 which say stand by thyself come not near to me; for i am holier
than thou these are a smoke in my nose a fire that burneth all the
day

65:6 behold it is written befor me: i will not keep silenc but
will recompens even recompens into their bosom 65:7 your
iniqu and the iniqu of your father togeth saith the
lord which have burn incens upon the mountain and blasphem me
upon the hills: therefor will i measur their former work into their
bosom

65:8 thu saith the lord as the new wine is found in the cluster and
one saith destroy it not; for a bless is in it: so will i do for
my servant sake that i may not destroy them all

65:9 and i will bring forth a seed out of jacob and out of judah an
inheritor of my mountains: and mine elect shall inherit it and my
servant shall dwell there

65:10 and sharon shall be a fold of flock and the valley of achor a
place for the herd to lie down in for my peopl that have sought me

65:11 but ye are they that forsak the lord that forget my holi
mountain that prepar a tabl for that troop and that furnish the
drink offer unto that number

65:12 therefor will i number you to the sword and ye shall all bow
down to the slaughter: becaus when i call ye did not answer; when
i spake ye did not hear; but did evil befor mine eye and did
choos that wherein i delight not

65:13 therefor thu saith the lord god behold my servant shall
eat but ye shall be hungry: behold my servant shall drink but ye
shall be thirsty: behold my servant shall rejoic but ye shall be
ashamed: 65:14 behold my servant shall sing for joy of heart but ye
shall cri for sorrow of heart and shall howl for vexat of spirit

65:15 and ye shall leav your name for a curs unto my chosen: for the
lord god shall slay thee and call hi servant by anoth name: 65:16
that he who blesseth himself in the earth shall bless himself in the
god of truth; and he that sweareth in the earth shall swear by the god
of truth; becaus the former troubl are forgotten and becaus they
are hid from mine eye

65:17 for behold i creat new heaven and a new earth: and the
former shall not be rememb nor come into mind

65:18 but be ye glad and rejoic for ever in that which i create: for
behold i creat jerusalem a rejoic and her peopl a joy

65:19 and i will rejoic in jerusalem and joy in my people: and the
voic of weep shall be no more heard in her nor the voic of
cri

65:20 there shall be no more thenc an infant of day nor an old man
that hath not fill hi days: for the child shall die an hundr
year old; but the sinner be an hundr year old shall be
accurs

65:21 and they shall build hous and inhabit them; and they shall
plant vineyard and eat the fruit of them

65:22 they shall not build and anoth inhabit; they shall not plant
and anoth eat: for as the day of a tree are the day of my peopl
and mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hand

65:23 they shall not labour in vain nor bring forth for trouble; for
they are the seed of the bless of the lord and their offspr with
them

65:24 and it shall come to pass that befor they call i will answer;
and while they are yet speak i will hear

65:25 the wolf and the lamb shall feed togeth and the lion shall
eat straw like the bullock: and dust shall be the serpent meat they
shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holi mountain saith the lord

66:1 thu saith the lord the heaven is my throne and the earth is my
footstool: where is the hous that ye build unto me? and where is the
place of my rest? 66:2 for all those thing hath mine hand made and
all those thing have been saith the lord: but to thi man will i
look even to him that is poor and of a contrit spirit and trembleth
at my word

66:3 he that killeth an ox is as if he slew a man; he that sacrificeth
a lamb as if he cut off a dog neck; he that offereth an oblat
as if he offer swine blood; he that burneth incens as if he
bless an idol

yea they have chosen their own way and their soul delighteth in
their abomin

66:4 i also will choos their delus and will bring their fear
upon them; becaus when i call none did answer; when i spake they
did not hear: but they did evil befor mine eye and chose that in
which i delight not

66:5 hear the word of the lord ye that trembl at hi word; your
brethren that hate you that cast you out for my name sake said
let the lord be glorified: but he shall appear to your joy and they
shall be asham

66:6 a voic of nois from the citi a voic from the templ a voic
of the lord that rendereth recomp to hi enemi

66:7 befor she travail she brought forth; befor her pain came
she wa deliv of a man child

66:8 who hath heard such a thing? who hath seen such things? shall the
earth be made to bring forth in one day? or shall a nation be born at
once? for as soon as zion travail she brought forth her children

66:9 shall i bring to the birth and not caus to bring forth? saith
the lord: shall i caus to bring forth and shut the womb? saith thi
god

66:10 rejoic ye with jerusalem and be glad with her all ye that
love her: rejoic for joy with her all ye that mourn for her: 66:11
that ye may suck and be satisfi with the breast of her
consolations; that ye may milk out and be delight with the
abund of her glori

66:12 for thu saith the lord behold i will extend peac to her like
a river and the glori of the gentil like a flow stream: then
shall ye suck ye shall be born upon her side and be dandl upon
her knee

66:13 as one whom hi mother comforteth so will i comfort you; and ye
shall be comfort in jerusalem

66:14 and when ye see thi your heart shall rejoic and your bone
shall flourish like an herb: and the hand of the lord shall be known
toward hi servant and hi indign toward hi enemi

66:15 for behold the lord will come with fire and with hi chariot
like a whirlwind to render hi anger with furi and hi rebuk with
flame of fire

66:16 for by fire and by hi sword will the lord plead with all flesh:
and the slain of the lord shall be mani

66:17 they that sanctifi themselv and purifi themselv in the
garden behind one tree in the midst eat swine flesh and the
abomin and the mous shall be consum togeth saith the
lord

66:18 for i know their work and their thoughts: it shall come that i
will gather all nation and tongues; and they shall come and see my
glori

66:19 and i will set a sign among them and i will send those that
escap of them unto the nation to tarshish pul and lud that draw
the bow to tubal and javan to the isl afar off that have not
heard my fame neither have seen my glory; and they shall declar my
glori among the gentil

66:20 and they shall bring all your brethren for an offer unto the
lord out of all nation upon hors and in chariot and in litter
and upon mule and upon swift beast to my holi mountain jerusalem
saith the lord as the children of israel bring an offer in a clean
vessel into the hous of the lord

66:21 and i will also take of them for priest and for levit saith
the lord

66:22 for as the new heaven and the new earth which i will make
shall remain befor me saith the lord so shall your seed and your
name remain

66:23 and it shall come to pass that from one new moon to anoth
and from one sabbath to anoth shall all flesh come to worship
befor me saith the lord

66:24 and they shall go forth and look upon the carcas of the men
that have transgress against me: for their worm shall not die
neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhor
unto all flesh




the book of the prophet jeremiah


1:1 the word of jeremiah the son of hilkiah of the priest that
were in anathoth in the land of benjamin: 1:2 to whom the word of the
lord came in the day of josiah the son of amon king of judah in the
thirteenth year of hi reign

1:3 it came also in the day of jehoiakim the son of josiah king of
judah unto the end of the eleventh year of zedekiah the son of josiah
king of judah unto the carri away of jerusalem captiv in the
fifth month

1:4 then the word of the lord came unto me say 1:5 befor i
form thee in the belli i knew thee; and befor thou camest forth out
of the womb i sanctifi thee and i ordain thee a prophet unto the
nation

1:6 then said i ah lord god! behold i cannot speak: for i am a
child

1:7 but the lord said unto me say not i am a child: for thou shalt
go to all that i shall send thee and whatsoev i command thee thou
shalt speak

1:8 be not afraid of their faces: for i am with thee to deliv thee
saith the lord

1:9 then the lord put forth hi hand and touch my mouth and the
lord said unto me behold i have put my word in thi mouth

1:10 see i have thi day set thee over the nation and over the
kingdom to root out and to pull down and to destroy and to throw
down to build and to plant

1:11 moreov the word of the lord came unto me say jeremiah
what seest thou? and i said i see a rod of an almond tree

1:12 then said the lord unto me thou hast well seen: for i will
hasten my word to perform it

1:13 and the word of the lord came unto me the second time say
what seest thou? and i said i see a seeth pot; and the face
thereof is toward the north

1:14 then the lord said unto me out of the north an evil shall break
forth upon all the inhabit of the land

1:15 for lo i will call all the famili of the kingdom of the
north saith the lord; and they shall come and they shall set everi
one hi throne at the enter of the gate of jerusalem and against
all the wall thereof round about and against all the citi of
judah

1:16 and i will utter my judgment against them touch all their
wicked who have forsaken me and have burn incens unto other
god and worship the work of their own hand

1:17 thou therefor gird up thi loin and aris and speak unto them
all that i command thee: be not dismay at their face lest i
confound thee befor them

1:18 for behold i have made thee thi day a defenc citi and an
iron pillar and brasen wall against the whole land against the
king of judah against the princ thereof against the priest
thereof and against the peopl of the land

1:19 and they shall fight against thee; but they shall not prevail
against thee; for i am with thee saith the lord to deliv thee

2:1 moreov the word of the lord came to me say 2:2 go and cri
in the ear of jerusalem say thu saith the lord; i rememb
thee the kind of thi youth the love of thine espous when
thou wentest after me in the wilder in a land that wa not sown

2:3 israel wa holi unto the lord and the firstfruit of hi
increase: all that devour him shall offend; evil shall come upon them
saith the lord

2:4 hear ye the word of the lord o hous of jacob and all the
famili of the hous of israel: 2:5 thu saith the lord what
iniqu have your father found in me that they are gone far from
me and have walk after vaniti and are becom vain? 2:6 neither
said they where is the lord that brought us up out of the land of
egypt that led us through the wilder through a land of desert
and of pit through a land of drought and of the shadow of death
through a land that no man pass through and where no man dwelt?
2:7 and i brought you into a plenti countri to eat the fruit
thereof and the good thereof; but when ye enter ye defil my
land and made mine heritag an abomin

2:8 the priest said not where is the lord? and they that handl the
law knew me not: the pastor also transgress against me and the
prophet prophesi by baal and walk after thing that do not
profit

2:9 wherefor i will yet plead with you saith the lord and with your
children children will i plead

2:10 for pass over the isl of chittim and see; and send unto kedar
and consid dilig and see if there be such a thing

2:11 hath a nation chang their god which are yet no gods? but my
peopl have chang their glori for that which doth not profit

2:12 be astonish o ye heaven at thi and be horribl afraid be
ye veri desol saith the lord

2:13 for my peopl have commit two evils; they have forsaken me the
fountain of live water and hew them out cistern broken
cistern that can hold no water

2:14 is israel a servant? is he a homeborn slave? whi is he spoiled?
2:15 the young lion roar upon him and yell and they made hi
land waste: hi citi are burn without inhabit

2:16 also the children of noph and tahapan have broken the crown of
thi head

2:17 hast thou not procur thi unto thyself in that thou hast
forsaken the lord thi god when he led thee by the way? 2:18 and now
what hast thou to do in the way of egypt to drink the water of
sihor? or what hast thou to do in the way of assyria to drink the
water of the river? 2:19 thine own wicked shall correct thee
and thi backslid shall reprov thee: know therefor and see that
it is an evil thing and bitter that thou hast forsaken the lord thi
god and that my fear is not in thee saith the lord god of host

2:20 for of old time i have broken thi yoke and burst thi bands; and
thou saidst i will not transgress; when upon everi high hill and
under everi green tree thou wanderest play the harlot

2:21 yet i had plant thee a nobl vine wholli a right seed: how
then art thou turn into the degener plant of a strang vine unto
