42:8 then call he johanan the son of kareah and all the captain of
the forc which were with him and all the peopl from the least even
to the greatest 42:9 and said unto them thu saith the lord the god
of israel unto whom ye sent me to present your supplic befor
him; 42:10 if ye will still abid in thi land then will i build you
and not pull you down and i will plant you and not pluck you up: for
i repent me of the evil that i have done unto you

42:11 be not afraid of the king of babylon of whom ye are afraid; be
not afraid of him saith the lord: for i am with you to save you and
to deliv you from hi hand

42:12 and i will shew merci unto you that he may have merci upon
you and caus you to return to your own land

42:13 but if ye say we will not dwell in thi land neither obey the
voic of the lord your god 42:14 say no; but we will go into the
land of egypt where we shall see no war nor hear the sound of the
trumpet nor have hunger of bread; and there will we dwell: 42:15 and
now therefor hear the word of the lord ye remnant of judah; thu
saith the lord of host the god of israel; if ye wholli set your
face to enter into egypt and go to sojourn there; 42:16 then it
shall come to pass that the sword which ye fear shall overtak
you there in the land of egypt and the famin whereof ye were
afraid shall follow close after you there in egypt; and there ye
shall die

42:17 so shall it be with all the men that set their face to go into
egypt to sojourn there; they shall die by the sword by the famin
and by the pestilence: and none of them shall remain or escap from
the evil that i will bring upon them

42:18 for thu saith the lord of host the god of israel; as mine
anger and my furi hath been pour forth upon the inhabit of
jerusalem; so shall my furi be pour forth upon you when ye shall
enter into egypt: and ye shall be an execr and an astonish
and a curs and a reproach; and ye shall see thi place no more

42:19 the lord hath said concern you o ye remnant of judah; go ye
not into egypt: know certainli that i have admonish you thi day

42:20 for ye dissembl in your heart when ye sent me unto the lord
your god say pray for us unto the lord our god; and accord
unto all that the lord our god shall say so declar unto us and we
will do it

42:21 and now i have thi day declar it to you; but ye have not
obey the voic of the lord your god nor ani thing for the which he
hath sent me unto you

42:22 now therefor know certainli that ye shall die by the sword by
the famin and by the pestil in the place whither ye desir to
go and to sojourn

43:1 and it came to pass that when jeremiah had made an end of
speak unto all the peopl all the word of the lord their god for
which the lord their god had sent him to them even all these word
43:2 then spake azariah the son of hoshaiah and johanan the son of
kareah and all the proud men say unto jeremiah thou speakest
falsely: the lord our god hath not sent thee to say go not into egypt
to sojourn there: 43:3 but baruch the son of neriah setteth thee on
against us for to deliv us into the hand of the chaldean that
they might put us to death and carri us away captiv into babylon

43:4 so johanan the son of kareah and all the captain of the forc
and all the peopl obey not the voic of the lord to dwell in the
land of judah

43:5 but johanan the son of kareah and all the captain of the
forc took all the remnant of judah that were return from all
nation whither they had been driven to dwell in the land of judah;
43:6 even men and women and children and the king daughter and
everi person that nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with
gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan and jeremiah the
prophet and baruch the son of neriah

43:7 so they came into the land of egypt: for they obey not the
voic of the lord: thu came they even to tahpanh

43:8 then came the word of the lord unto jeremiah in tahpanh
say 43:9 take great stone in thine hand and hide them in the
clay in the brickkiln which is at the entri of pharaoh hous in
tahpanh in the sight of the men of judah; 43:10 and say unto them
thu saith the lord of host the god of israel; behold i will send
and take nebuchadrezzar the king of babylon my servant and will set
hi throne upon these stone that i have hid; and he shall spread hi
royal pavilion over them

43:11 and when he cometh he shall smite the land of egypt and
deliv such as are for death to death; and such as are for captiv
to captivity; and such as are for the sword to the sword

43:12 and i will kindl a fire in the hous of the god of egypt; and
he shall burn them and carri them away captives: and he shall array
himself with the land of egypt as a shepherd putteth on hi garment;
and he shall go forth from thenc in peac

43:13 he shall break also the imag of bethshemesh that is in the
land of egypt; and the hous of the god of the egyptian shall he
burn with fire

44:1 the word that came to jeremiah concern all the jew which
dwell in the land of egypt which dwell at migdol and at tahpanh
and at noph and in the countri of pathro say 44:2 thu saith
the lord of host the god of israel; ye have seen all the evil that i
have brought upon jerusalem and upon all the citi of judah; and
behold thi day they are a desol and no man dwelleth therein
44:3 becaus of their wicked which they have commit to provok
me to anger in that they went to burn incens and to serv other
god whom they knew not neither they ye nor your father

44:4 howbeit i sent unto you all my servant the prophet rise
earli and send them say oh do not thi abomin thing that
i hate

44:5 but they hearken not nor inclin their ear to turn from their
wicked to burn no incens unto other god

44:6 wherefor my furi and mine anger wa pour forth and wa
kindl in the citi of judah and in the street of jerusalem; and
they are wast and desol as at thi day

44:7 therefor now thu saith the lord the god of host the god of
israel; wherefor commit ye thi great evil against your soul to cut
off from you man and woman child and suckl out of judah to leav
you none to remain; 44:8 in that ye provok me unto wrath with the
work of your hand burn incens unto other god in the land of
egypt whither ye be gone to dwell that ye might cut yourselv off
and that ye might be a curs and a reproach among all the nation of
the earth? 44:9 have ye forgotten the wicked of your father and
the wicked of the king of judah and the wicked of their
wive and your own wicked and the wicked of your wive
which they have commit in the land of judah and in the street of
jerusalem? 44:10 they are not humbl even unto thi day neither
have they fear nor walk in my law nor in my statut that i set
befor you and befor your father

44:11 therefor thu saith the lord of host the god of israel;
behold i will set my face against you for evil and to cut off all
judah

44:12 and i will take the remnant of judah that have set their face
to go into the land of egypt to sojourn there and they shall all be
consum and fall in the land of egypt; they shall even be consum
by the sword and by the famine: they shall die from the least even
unto the greatest by the sword and by the famine: and they shall be
an execr and an astonish and a curs and a reproach

44:13 for i will punish them that dwell in the land of egypt as i
have punish jerusalem by the sword by the famin and by the
pestilence: 44:14 so that none of the remnant of judah which are gone
into the land of egypt to sojourn there shall escap or remain that
they should return into the land of judah to the which they have a
desir to return to dwell there: for none shall return but such as
shall escap

44:15 then all the men which knew that their wive had burn incens
unto other god and all the women that stood by a great multitud
even all the peopl that dwelt in the land of egypt in pathro
answer jeremiah say 44:16 as for the word that thou hast spoken
unto us in the name of the lord we will not hearken unto thee

44:17 but we will certainli do whatsoev thing goeth forth out of our
own mouth to burn incens unto the queen of heaven and to pour out
drink offer unto her as we have done we and our father our
king and our princ in the citi of judah and in the street of
jerusalem: for then had we plenti of victual and were well and saw
no evil

44:18 but sinc we left off to burn incens to the queen of heaven
and to pour out drink offer unto her we have want all thing
and have been consum by the sword and by the famin

44:19 and when we burn incens to the queen of heaven and pour
out drink offer unto her did we make her cake to worship her
and pour out drink offer unto her without our men? 44:20 then
jeremiah said unto all the peopl to the men and to the women and
to all the peopl which had given him that answer say 44:21 the
incens that ye burn in the citi of judah and in the street of
jerusalem ye and your father your king and your princ and the
peopl of the land did not the lord rememb them and came it not
into hi mind? 44:22 so that the lord could no longer bear becaus
of the evil of your do and becaus of the abomin which ye
have committed; therefor is your land a desol and an
astonish and a curs without an inhabit as at thi day

44:23 becaus ye have burn incens and becaus ye have sin
against the lord and have not obey the voic of the lord nor
walk in hi law nor in hi statut nor in hi testimonies;
therefor thi evil is happen unto you as at thi day

44:24 moreov jeremiah said unto all the peopl and to all the
women hear the word of the lord all judah that are in the land of
egypt: 44:25 thu saith the lord of host the god of israel saying;
ye and your wive have both spoken with your mouth and fulfil
with your hand say we will sure perform our vow that we have
vow to burn incens to the queen of heaven and to pour out drink
offer unto her: ye will sure accomplish your vow and sure
perform your vow

44:26 therefor hear ye the word of the lord all judah that dwell in
the land of egypt; behold i have sworn by my great name saith the
lord that my name shall no more be name in the mouth of ani man of
judah in all the land of egypt say the lord god liveth

44:27 behold i will watch over them for evil and not for good: and
all the men of judah that are in the land of egypt shall be consum
by the sword and by the famin until there be an end of them

44:28 yet a small number that escap the sword shall return out of the
land of egypt into the land of judah and all the remnant of judah
that are gone into the land of egypt to sojourn there shall know
whose word shall stand mine or their

44:29 and thi shall be a sign unto you saith the lord that i will
punish you in thi place that ye may know that my word shall sure
stand against you for evil: 44:30 thu saith the lord; behold i will
give pharaohhophra king of egypt into the hand of hi enemi and
into the hand of them that seek hi life; as i gave zedekiah king of
judah into the hand of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon hi enemi and
that sought hi life

45:1 the word that jeremiah the prophet spake unto baruch the son of
neriah when he had written these word in a book at the mouth of
jeremiah in the fourth year of jehoiakim the son of josiah king of
judah say 45:2 thu saith the lord the god of israel unto thee
o baruch: 45:3 thou didst say woe is me now! for the lord hath ad
grief to my sorrow; i faint in my sigh and i find no rest

45:4 thu shalt thou say unto him the lord saith thus; behold that
which i have built will i break down and that which i have plant i
will pluck up even thi whole land

45:5 and seekest thou great thing for thyself? seek them not: for
behold i will bring evil upon all flesh saith the lord: but thi life
will i give unto thee for a prey in all place whither thou goest

46:1 the word of the lord which came to jeremiah the prophet against
the gentiles; 46:2 against egypt against the armi of pharaohnecho
king of egypt which wa by the river euphrat in carchemish which
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon smote in the fourth year of jehoiakim
the son of josiah king of judah

46:3 order ye the buckler and shield and draw near to battl

46:4 har the horses; and get up ye horsemen and stand forth with
your helmets; furbish the spear and put on the brigandin

46:5 wherefor have i seen them dismay and turn away back? and
their mighti one are beaten down and are fled apac and look not
back: for fear wa round about saith the lord

46:6 let not the swift flee away nor the mighti man escape; they
shall stumbl and fall toward the north by the river euphrat

46:7 who is thi that cometh up as a flood whose water are move as
the rivers? 46:8 egypt riseth up like a flood and hi water are
move like the rivers; and he saith i will go up and will cover the
earth; i will destroy the citi and the inhabit thereof

46:9 come up ye horses; and rage ye chariots; and let the mighti men
come forth; the ethiopian and the libyan that handl the shield;
and the lydian that handl and bend the bow

46:10 for thi is the day of the lord god of host a day of
vengeanc that he may aveng him of hi adversaries: and the sword
shall devour and it shall be satiat and made drunk with their blood:
for the lord god of host hath a sacrific in the north countri by the
river euphrat

46:11 go up into gilead and take balm o virgin the daughter of
egypt: in vain shalt thou use mani medicines; for thou shalt not be
cure

46:12 the nation have heard of thi shame and thi cri hath fill the
land: for the mighti man hath stumbl against the mighti and they
are fallen both togeth

46:13 the word that the lord spake to jeremiah the prophet how
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon should come and smite the land of
egypt

46:14 declar ye in egypt and publish in migdol and publish in noph
and in tahpanhes: say ye stand fast and prepar thee; for the sword
shall devour round about thee

46:15 whi are thi valiant men swept away? they stood not becaus the
lord did drive them

46:16 he made mani to fall yea one fell upon another: and they said
aris and let us go again to our own peopl and to the land of our
nativ from the oppress sword

46:17 they did cri there pharaoh king of egypt is but a noise; he
hath pass the time appoint

46:18 as i live saith the king whose name is the lord of host
sure as tabor is among the mountain and as carmel by the sea so
shall he come

46:19 o thou daughter dwell in egypt furnish thyself to go into
captivity: for noph shall be wast and desol without an inhabit

46:20 egypt is like a veri fair heifer but destruct cometh; it
cometh out of the north

46:21 also her hire men are in the midst of her like fat bullocks;
for they also are turn back and are fled away together: they did
not stand becaus the day of their calam wa come upon them and
the time of their visit

46:22 the voic thereof shall go like a serpent; for they shall march
with an armi and come against her with axe as hewer of wood

46:23 they shall cut down her forest saith the lord though it cannot
be searched; becaus they are more than the grasshopp and are
innumer

46:24 the daughter of egypt shall be confounded; she shall be
deliv into the hand of the peopl of the north

46:25 the lord of host the god of israel saith; behold i will
punish the multitud of no and pharaoh and egypt with their god
and their kings; even pharaoh and all them that trust in him: 46:26
and i will deliv them into the hand of those that seek their live
and into the hand of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon and into the hand
of hi servants: and afterward it shall be inhabit as in the day
of old saith the lord

46:27 but fear not thou o my servant jacob and be not dismay o
israel: for behold i will save thee from afar off and thi seed from
the land of their captivity; and jacob shall return and be in rest
and at eas and none shall make him afraid

46:28 fear thou not o jacob my servant saith the lord: for i am with
thee; for i will make a full end of all the nation whither i have
driven thee: but i will not make a full end of thee but correct thee
in measure; yet will i not leav thee wholli unpunish

47:1 the word of the lord that came to jeremiah the prophet against
the philistin befor that pharaoh smote gaza

47:2 thu saith the lord; behold water rise up out of the north and
shall be an overflow flood and shall overflow the land and all
that is therein; the citi and them that dwell therein: then the men
shall cri and all the inhabit of the land shall howl

47:3 at the nois of the stamp of the hoof of hi strong hors
at the rush of hi chariot and at the rumbl of hi wheel the
father shall not look back to their children for feebl of hands;
47:4 becaus of the day that cometh to spoil all the philistin and
to cut off from tyru and zidon everi helper that remaineth: for the
lord will spoil the philistin the remnant of the countri of
caphtor

47:5 bald is come upon gaza; ashkelon is cut off with the remnant
of their valley: how long wilt thou cut thyself? 47:6 o thou sword of
the lord how long will it be ere thou be quiet? put up thyself into
thi scabbard rest and be still

47:7 how can it be quiet see the lord hath given it a charg
against ashkelon and against the sea shore? there hath he appoint
it

48:1 against moab thu saith the lord of host the god of israel; woe
unto nebo! for it is spoiled: kiriathaim is confound and taken:
misgab is confound and dismay

48:2 there shall be no more prais of moab: in heshbon they have
devis evil against it; come and let us cut it off from be a
nation also thou shalt be cut down o madmen; the sword shall pursu
thee

48:3 a voic of cri shall be from horonaim spoil and great
destruct

48:4 moab is destroyed; her littl one have caus a cri to be heard

48:5 for in the go up of luhith continu weep shall go up; for
in the go down of horonaim the enemi have heard a cri of
destruct

48:6 flee save your live and be like the heath in the wilder

48:7 for becaus thou hast trust in thi work and in thi treasur
thou shalt also be taken: and chemosh shall go forth into captiv
with hi priest and hi princ togeth

48:8 and the spoiler shall come upon everi citi and no citi shall
escape: the valley also shall perish and the plain shall be
destroy as the lord hath spoken

48:9 give wing unto moab that it may flee and get away: for the
citi thereof shall be desol without ani to dwell therein

48:10 curs be he that doeth the work of the lord deceit and
curs be he that keepeth back hi sword from blood

48:11 moab hath been at eas from hi youth and he hath settl on
hi lee and hath not been empti from vessel to vessel neither
hath he gone into captivity: therefor hi tast remain in him and
hi scent is not chang

48:12 therefor behold the day come saith the lord that i will
send unto him wander that shall caus him to wander and shall
empti hi vessel and break their bottl

48:13 and moab shall be asham of chemosh as the hous of israel wa
asham of bethel their confid

48:14 how say ye we are mighti and strong men for the war? 48:15
moab is spoil and gone up out of her citi and hi chosen young
men are gone down to the slaughter saith the king whose name is the
lord of host

48:16 the calam of moab is near to come and hi afflict hasteth
fast

48:17 all ye that are about him bemoan him; and all ye that know hi
name say how is the strong staff broken and the beauti rod!
48:18 thou daughter that dost inhabit dibon come down from thi glori
and sit in thirst; for the spoiler of moab shall come upon thee and
he shall destroy thi strong hold

48:19 o inhabit of aroer stand by the way and espy; ask him that
fleeth and her that escapeth and say what is done? 48:20 moab is
confounded; for it is broken down: howl and cry; tell ye it in arnon
that moab is spoil 48:21 and judgment is come upon the plain
country; upon holon and upon jahazah and upon mephaath 48:22 and
upon dibon and upon nebo and upon bethdiblathaim 48:23 and upon
kiriathaim and upon bethgamul and upon bethmeon 48:24 and upon
kerioth and upon bozrah and upon all the citi of the land of moab
far or near

48:25 the horn of moab is cut off and hi arm is broken saith the
lord

48:26 make ye him drunken: for he magnifi himself against the lord:
moab also shall wallow in hi vomit and he also shall be in deris

48:27 for wa not israel a deris unto thee? wa he found among
thieves? for sinc thou spakest of him thou skippedst for joy

48:28 o ye that dwell in moab leav the citi and dwell in the
rock and be like the dove that maketh her nest in the side of the
hole mouth

48:29 we have heard the pride of moab (he is exceed proud) hi
lofti and hi arrog and hi pride and the haughti of
hi heart

48:30 i know hi wrath saith the lord; but it shall not be so; hi
lie shall not so effect it

48:31 therefor will i howl for moab and i will cri out for all moab;
mine heart shall mourn for the men of kirher

48:32 o vine of sibmah i will weep for thee with the weep of
jazer: thi plant are gone over the sea they reach even to the sea of
jazer: the spoiler is fallen upon thi summer fruit and upon thi
vintag

48:33 and joy and glad is taken from the plenti field and from
the land of moab and i have caus wine to fail from the winepresses:
none shall tread with shouting; their shout shall be no shout

48:34 from the cri of heshbon even unto elealeh and even unto jahaz
have they utter their voic from zoar even unto horonaim as an
heifer of three year old: for the water also of nimrim shall be
desol

48:35 moreov i will caus to ceas in moab saith the lord him that
offereth in the high place and him that burneth incens to hi god

48:36 therefor mine heart shall sound for moab like pipe and mine
heart shall sound like pipe for the men of kirheres: becaus the
rich that he hath gotten are perish

48:37 for everi head shall be bald and everi beard clipped: upon all
the hand shall be cut and upon the loin sackcloth

48:38 there shall be lament gener upon all the housetop of
moab and in the street thereof: for i have broken moab like a vessel
wherein is no pleasur saith the lord

48:39 they shall howl say how is it broken down! how hath moab
turn the back with shame! so shall moab be a deris and a
dismay to all them about him

48:40 for thu saith the lord; behold he shall fli as an eagl and
shall spread hi wing over moab

48:41 kerioth is taken and the strong hold are surpris and the
mighti men heart in moab at that day shall be as the heart of a
woman in her pang

48:42 and moab shall be destroy from be a peopl becaus he hath
magnifi himself against the lord

48:43 fear and the pit and the snare shall be upon thee o
inhabit of moab saith the lord

48:44 he that fleeth from the fear shall fall into the pit; and he
that getteth up out of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for i will
bring upon it even upon moab the year of their visit saith the
lord

48:45 they that fled stood under the shadow of heshbon becaus of the
force: but a fire shall come forth out of heshbon and a flame from
the midst of sihon and shall devour the corner of moab and the crown
of the head of the tumultu one

48:46 woe be unto thee o moab! the peopl of chemosh perisheth: for
thi son are taken captiv and thi daughter captiv

48:47 yet will i bring again the captiv of moab in the latter day
saith the lord thu far is the judgment of moab

49:1 concern the ammonit thu saith the lord; hath israel no
sons? hath he no heir? whi then doth their king inherit gad and hi
peopl dwell in hi cities? 49:2 therefor behold the day come
saith the lord that i will caus an alarm of war to be heard in
rabbah of the ammonites; and it shall be a desol heap and her
daughter shall be burn with fire: then shall israel be heir unto
them that were hi heir saith the lord

49:3 howl o heshbon for ai is spoiled: cri ye daughter of rabbah
gird you with sackcloth; lament and run to and fro by the hedges; for
their king shall go into captiv and hi priest and hi princ
togeth

49:4 wherefor gloriest thou in the valley thi flow valley o
backslid daughter? that trust in her treasur say who shall
come unto me? 49:5 behold i will bring a fear upon thee saith the
lord god of host from all those that be about thee; and ye shall be
driven out everi man right forth; and none shall gather up him that
wandereth

49:6 and afterward i will bring again the captiv of the children of
ammon saith the lord

49:7 concern edom thu saith the lord of hosts; is wisdom no more
in teman? is counsel perish from the prudent? is their wisdom
vanished? 49:8 flee ye turn back dwell deep o inhabit of
dedan; for i will bring the calam of esau upon him the time that i
will visit him

49:9 if grapegather come to thee would they not leav some
glean grapes? if thiev by night they will destroy till they have
enough

49:10 but i have made esau bare i have uncov hi secret place
and he shall not be abl to hide himself: hi seed is spoil and hi
brethren and hi neighbour and he is not

49:11 leav thi fatherless children i will preserv them alive; and
let thi widow trust in me

49:12 for thu saith the lord; behold they whose judgment wa not to
drink of the cup have assuredli drunken; and art thou he that shall
altogeth go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunish but thou shalt
sure drink of it

49:13 for i have sworn by myself saith the lord that bozrah shall
becom a desol a reproach a wast and a curse; and all the
citi thereof shall be perpetu wast

49:14 i have heard a rumour from the lord and an ambassador is sent
unto the heathen say gather ye togeth and come against her
and rise up to the battl

49:15 for lo i will make thee small among the heathen and despis
among men

49:16 thi terribl hath deceiv thee and the pride of thine
heart o thou that dwellest in the cleft of the rock that holdest
the height of the hill: though thou shouldest make thi nest as high as
the eagl i will bring thee down from thenc saith the lord

49:17 also edom shall be a desolation: everi one that goeth by it
shall be astonish and shall hiss at all the plagu thereof

49:18 as in the overthrow of sodom and gomorrah and the neighbour
citi thereof saith the lord no man shall abid there neither
shall a son of man dwell in it

49:19 behold he shall come up like a lion from the swell of jordan
against the habit of the strong: but i will suddenli make him run
away from her: and who is a chosen man that i may appoint over her?
for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that
shepherd that will stand befor me? 49:20 therefor hear the counsel
of the lord that he hath taken against edom; and hi purpos that
he hath purpos against the inhabit of teman: sure the least of
the flock shall draw them out: sure he shall make their habit
desol with them

49:21 the earth is move at the nois of their fall at the cri the
nois thereof wa heard in the red sea

49:22 behold he shall come up and fli as the eagl and spread hi
wing over bozrah: and at that day shall the heart of the mighti men
of edom be as the heart of a woman in her pang

49:23 concern damascu hamath is confound and arpad: for they
have heard evil tidings: they are fainthearted; there is sorrow on the
sea; it cannot be quiet

49:24 damascu is wax feebl and turneth herself to flee and fear
hath seiz on her: anguish and sorrow have taken her as a woman in
travail

49:25 how is the citi of prais not left the citi of my joy! 49:26
therefor her young men shall fall in her street and all the men of
war shall be cut off in that day saith the lord of host

49:27 and i will kindl a fire in the wall of damascu and it shall
consum the palac of benhadad

49:28 concern kedar and concern the kingdom of hazor which
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon shall smite thu saith the lord; aris
ye go up to kedar and spoil the men of the east

49:29 their tent and their flock shall they take away: they shall
take to themselv their curtain and all their vessel and their
camels; and they shall cri unto them fear is on everi side

49:30 flee get you far off dwell deep o ye inhabit of hazor
saith the lord; for nebuchadrezzar king of babylon hath taken counsel
against you and hath conceiv a purpos against you

49:31 aris get you up unto the wealthi nation that dwelleth without
care saith the lord which have neither gate nor bar which dwell
alon

49:32 and their camel shall be a booti and the multitud of their
cattl a spoil: and i will scatter into all wind them that are in the
utmost corners; and i will bring their calam from all side
thereof saith the lord

49:33 and hazor shall be a dwell for dragon and a desol for
ever: there shall no man abid there nor ani son of man dwell in it

49:34 the word of the lord that came to jeremiah the prophet against
elam in the begin of the reign of zedekiah king of judah say
49:35 thu saith the lord of hosts; behold i will break the bow of
elam the chief of their might

49:36 and upon elam will i bring the four wind from the four quarter
of heaven and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there
shall be no nation whither the outcast of elam shall not come

49:37 for i will caus elam to be dismay befor their enemi and
befor them that seek their life: and i will bring evil upon them
even my fierc anger saith the lord; and i will send the sword after
them till i have consum them: 49:38 and i will set my throne in
elam and will destroy from thenc the king and the princ saith the
lord

49:39 but it shall come to pass in the latter day that i will bring
again the captiv of elam saith the lord

50:1 the word that the lord spake against babylon and against the land
of the chaldean by jeremiah the prophet

50:2 declar ye among the nation and publish and set up a standard;
publish and conceal not: say babylon is taken bel is confound
merodach is broken in pieces; her idol are confound her imag are
broken in piec

50:3 for out of the north there cometh up a nation against her which
shall make her land desol and none shall dwell therein: they shall
remov they shall depart both man and beast

50:4 in those day and in that time saith the lord the children of
israel shall come they and the children of judah togeth go and
weeping: they shall go and seek the lord their god

50:5 they shall ask the way to zion with their face thitherward
say come and let us join ourselv to the lord in a perpetu
coven that shall not be forgotten

50:6 my peopl hath been lost sheep: their shepherd have caus them
to go astray they have turn them away on the mountains: they have
gone from mountain to hill they have forgotten their restingplac

50:7 all that found them have devour them: and their adversari
said we offend not becaus they have sin against the lord the
habit of justic even the lord the hope of their father

50:8 remov out of the midst of babylon and go forth out of the land
of the chaldean and be as the he goat befor the flock

50:9 for lo i will rais and caus to come up against babylon an
assembl of great nation from the north country: and they shall set
themselv in array against her; from thenc she shall be taken: their
arrow shall be as of a mighti expert man; none shall return in vain

50:10 and chaldea shall be a spoil: all that spoil her shall be
satisfi saith the lord

50:11 becaus ye were glad becaus ye rejoic o ye destroy of
mine heritag becaus ye are grown fat as the heifer at grass and
bellow as bulls; 50:12 your mother shall be sore confounded; she that
bare you shall be ashamed: behold the hindermost of the nation shall
be a wilder a dri land and a desert

50:13 becaus of the wrath of the lord it shall not be inhabit but
it shall be wholli desolate: everi one that goeth by babylon shall be
astonish and hiss at all her plagu

50:14 put yourselv in array against babylon round about: all ye that
bend the bow shoot at her spare no arrows: for she hath sin
against the lord

50:15 shout against her round about: she hath given her hand: her
foundat are fallen her wall are thrown down: for it is the
vengeanc of the lord: take vengeanc upon her; as she hath done do
unto her

50:16 cut off the sower from babylon and him that handleth the sickl
in the time of harvest: for fear of the oppress sword they shall
turn everi one to hi peopl and they shall flee everi one to hi own
land

50:17 israel is a scatter sheep; the lion have driven him away:
first the king of assyria hath devour him; and last thi
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon hath broken hi bone

50:18 therefor thu saith the lord of host the god of israel;
behold i will punish the king of babylon and hi land as i have
punish the king of assyria

50:19 and i will bring israel again to hi habit and he shall
feed on carmel and bashan and hi soul shall be satisfi upon mount
ephraim and gilead

50:20 in those day and in that time saith the lord the iniqu of
israel shall be sought for and there shall be none; and the sin of
judah and they shall not be found: for i will pardon them whom i
reserv

50:21 go up against the land of merathaim even against it and
against the inhabit of pekod: wast and utterli destroy after
them saith the lord and do accord to all that i have command
thee

50:22 a sound of battl is in the land and of great destruct

50:23 how is the hammer of the whole earth cut asund and broken! how
is babylon becom a desol among the nations! 50:24 i have laid a
snare for thee and thou art also taken o babylon and thou wast not
aware: thou art found and also caught becaus thou hast striven
against the lord

50:25 the lord hath open hi armouri and hath brought forth the
weapon of hi indignation: for thi is the work of the lord god of
host in the land of the chaldean

50:26 come against her from the utmost border open her storehouses:
cast her up as heap and destroy her utterly: let noth of her be
left

50:27 slay all her bullocks; let them go down to the slaughter: woe
unto them! for their day is come the time of their visit

50:28 the voic of them that flee and escap out of the land of
babylon to declar in zion the vengeanc of the lord our god the
vengeanc of hi templ

50:29 call togeth the archer against babylon: all ye that bend the
bow camp against it round about; let none thereof escape: recompens
her accord to her work; accord to all that she hath done do
unto her: for she hath been proud against the lord against the holi
one of israel

50:30 therefor shall her young men fall in the street and all her
men of war shall be cut off in that day saith the lord

50:31 behold i am against thee o thou most proud saith the lord god
of hosts: for thi day is come the time that i will visit thee

50:32 and the most proud shall stumbl and fall and none shall rais
him up: and i will kindl a fire in hi citi and it shall devour
all round about him

50:33 thu saith the lord of hosts; the children of israel and the
children of judah were oppress together: and all that took them
captiv held them fast; they refus to let them go

50:34 their redeem is strong; the lord of host is hi name: he
shall throughli plead their caus that he may give rest to the land
and disquiet the inhabit of babylon

50:35 a sword is upon the chaldean saith the lord and upon the
inhabit of babylon and upon her princ and upon her wise men

50:36 a sword is upon the liars; and they shall dote: a sword is upon
her mighti men; and they shall be dismay

50:37 a sword is upon their hors and upon their chariot and upon
all the mingl peopl that are in the midst of her; and they shall
becom as women: a sword is upon her treasures; and they shall be
rob

50:38 a drought is upon her waters; and they shall be dri up: for it
is the land of graven imag and they are mad upon their idol

50:39 therefor the wild beast of the desert with the wild beast of
the island shall dwell there and the owl shall dwell therein: and
it shall be no more inhabit for ever; neither shall it be dwelt in
from gener to gener

50:40 as god overthrew sodom and gomorrah and the neighbour citi
thereof saith the lord; so shall no man abid there neither shall
ani son of man dwell therein

50:41 behold a peopl shall come from the north and a great nation
and mani king shall be rais up from the coast of the earth

50:42 they shall hold the bow and the lance: they are cruel and will
not shew mercy: their voic shall roar like the sea and they shall
ride upon hors everi one put in array like a man to the battl
against thee o daughter of babylon

50:43 the king of babylon hath heard the report of them and hi hand
wax feeble: anguish took hold of him and pang as of a woman in
travail

50:44 behold he shall come up like a lion from the swell of jordan
unto the habit of the strong: but i will make them suddenli run
away from her: and who is a chosen man that i may appoint over her?
for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that
shepherd that will stand befor me? 50:45 therefor hear ye the
counsel of the lord that he hath taken against babylon; and hi
purpos that he hath purpos against the land of the chaldeans:
sure the least of the flock shall draw them out: sure he shall
make their habit desol with them

50:46 at the nois of the take of babylon the earth is move and
the cri is heard among the nation

51:1 thu saith the lord; behold i will rais up against babylon and
against them that dwell in the midst of them that rise up against me
a destroy wind; 51:2 and will send unto babylon fanner that shall
fan her and shall empti her land: for in the day of troubl they
shall be against her round about

51:3 against him that bendeth let the archer bend hi bow and against
him that lifteth himself up in hi brigandine: and spare ye not her
young men; destroy ye utterli all her host

51:4 thu the slain shall fall in the land of the chaldean and they
that are thrust through in her street

51:5 for israel hath not been forsaken nor judah of hi god of the
lord of hosts; though their land wa fill with sin against the holi
one of israel

51:6 flee out of the midst of babylon and deliv everi man hi soul:
be not cut off in her iniquity; for thi is the time of the lord
vengeance; he will render unto her a recomp

51:7 babylon hath been a golden cup in the lord hand that made all
the earth drunken: the nation have drunken of her wine; therefor the
nation are mad

51:8 babylon is suddenli fallen and destroyed: howl for her; take balm
for her pain if so be she may be heal

51:9 we would have heal babylon but she is not healed: forsak her
and let us go everi one into hi own country: for her judgment
reacheth unto heaven and is lift up even to the sky

51:10 the lord hath brought forth our righteousness: come and let us
declar in zion the work of the lord our god

51:11 make bright the arrows; gather the shields: the lord hath rais
up the spirit of the king of the medes: for hi devic is against
babylon to destroy it; becaus it is the vengeanc of the lord the
vengeanc of hi templ

51:12 set up the standard upon the wall of babylon make the watch
strong set up the watchmen prepar the ambushes: for the lord hath
both devis and done that which he spake against the inhabit of
babylon

51:13 o thou that dwellest upon mani water abund in treasur
thine end is come and the measur of thi covet

51:14 the lord of host hath sworn by himself say sure i will
fill thee with men as with caterpillers; and they shall lift up a
shout against thee

51:15 he hath made the earth by hi power he hath establish the
world by hi wisdom and hath stretch out the heaven by hi
understand

51:16 when he uttereth hi voic there is a multitud of water in
the heavens; and he causeth the vapour to ascend from the end of the
earth: he maketh lightn with rain and bringeth forth the wind out
of hi treasur

51:17 everi man is brutish by hi knowledge; everi founder is
confound by the graven image: for hi molten imag is falsehood and
there is no breath in them

51:18 they are vaniti the work of errors: in the time of their
visit they shall perish

51:19 the portion of jacob is not like them; for he is the former of
all things: and israel is the rod of hi inheritance: the lord of
host is hi name

51:20 thou art my battl axe and weapon of war: for with thee will i
break in piec the nation and with thee will i destroy kingdoms;
51:21 and with thee will i break in piec the hors and hi rider;
and with thee will i break in piec the chariot and hi rider; 51:22
with thee also will i break in piec man and woman; and with thee
will i break in piec old and young; and with thee will i break in
piec the young man and the maid; 51:23 i will also break in piec
with thee the shepherd and hi flock; and with thee will i break in
piec the husbandman and hi yoke of oxen; and with thee will i break
in piec captain and ruler

51:24 and i will render unto babylon and to all the inhabit of
chaldea all their evil that they have done in zion in your sight
saith the lord

51:25 behold i am against thee o destroy mountain saith the
lord which destroyest all the earth: and i will stretch out mine hand
upon thee and roll thee down from the rock and will make thee a
burnt mountain

51:26 and they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner nor a
stone for foundations; but thou shalt be desol for ever saith the
lord

51:27 set ye up a standard in the land blow the trumpet among the
nation prepar the nation against her call togeth against her
the kingdom of ararat minni and ashchenaz; appoint a captain
against her; caus the hors to come up as the rough caterpil

51:28 prepar against her the nation with the king of the mede the
captain thereof and all the ruler thereof and all the land of hi
dominion

51:29 and the land shall trembl and sorrow: for everi purpos of the
lord shall be perform against babylon to make the land of babylon a
desol without an inhabit

51:30 the mighti men of babylon have forborn to fight they have
remain in their holds: their might hath failed; they becam as
women: they have burn her dwellingplaces; her bar are broken

51:31 one post shall run to meet anoth and one messeng to meet
anoth to shew the king of babylon that hi citi is taken at one
end 51:32 and that the passag are stop and the reed they have
burn with fire and the men of war are affright

51:33 for thu saith the lord of host the god of israel; the
daughter of babylon is like a threshingfloor it is time to thresh
her: yet a littl while and the time of her harvest shall come

51:34 nebuchadrezzar the king of babylon hath devour me he hath
crush me he hath made me an empti vessel he hath swallow me up
like a dragon he hath fill hi belli with my delic he hath
cast me out

51:35 the violenc done to me and to my flesh be upon babylon shall
the inhabit of zion say; and my blood upon the inhabit of
chaldea shall jerusalem say

51:36 therefor thu saith the lord; behold i will plead thi caus
and take vengeanc for thee; and i will dri up her sea and make her
spring dri

51:37 and babylon shall becom heap a dwellingplac for dragon an
astonish and an hiss without an inhabit

51:38 they shall roar togeth like lions: they shall yell as lion
whelp

51:39 in their heat i will make their feast and i will make them
drunken that they may rejoic and sleep a perpetu sleep and not
wake saith the lord

51:40 i will bring them down like lamb to the slaughter like ram
with he goat

51:41 how is sheshach taken! and how is the prais of the whole earth
surprised! how is babylon becom an astonish among the nations!
51:42 the sea is come up upon babylon: she is cover with the
multitud of the wave thereof

51:43 her citi are a desol a dri land and a wilder a
land wherein no man dwelleth neither doth ani son of man pass
therebi

51:44 and i will punish bel in babylon and i will bring forth out of
hi mouth that which he hath swallow up: and the nation shall not
flow togeth ani more unto him: yea the wall of babylon shall fall

51:45 my peopl go ye out of the midst of her and deliv ye everi
man hi soul from the fierc anger of the lord

51:46 and lest your heart faint and ye fear for the rumour that shall
be heard in the land; a rumour shall both come one year and after
that in anoth year shall come a rumour and violenc in the land
ruler against ruler

51:47 therefor behold the day come that i will do judgment upon
the graven imag of babylon: and her whole land shall be confound
and all her slain shall fall in the midst of her

51:48 then the heaven and the earth and all that is therein shall
sing for babylon: for the spoiler shall come unto her from the north
saith the lord

51:49 as babylon hath caus the slain of israel to fall so at
babylon shall fall the slain of all the earth

51:50 ye that have escap the sword go away stand not still:
rememb the lord afar off and let jerusalem come into your mind

51:51 we are confound becaus we have heard reproach: shame hath
cover our faces: for stranger are come into the sanctuari of the
lord hous

51:52 wherefor behold the day come saith the lord that i will do
judgment upon her graven images: and through all her land the wound
shall groan

51:53 though babylon should mount up to heaven and though she should
fortifi the height of her strength yet from me shall spoiler come
unto her saith the lord

51:54 a sound of a cri cometh from babylon and great destruct from
the land of the chaldeans: 51:55 becaus the lord hath spoil
babylon and destroy out of her the great voice; when her wave do
roar like great water a nois of their voic is uttered: 51:56
becaus the spoiler is come upon her even upon babylon and her
mighti men are taken everi one of their bow is broken: for the lord
god of recomp shall sure requit

51:57 and i will make drunk her princ and her wise men her
captain and her ruler and her mighti men: and they shall sleep a
perpetu sleep and not wake saith the king whose name is the lord
of host

51:58 thu saith the lord of hosts; the broad wall of babylon shall
be utterli broken and her high gate shall be burn with fire; and
the peopl shall labour in vain and the folk in the fire and they
shall be weari

51:59 the word which jeremiah the prophet command seraiah the son of
neriah the son of maaseiah when he went with zedekiah the king of
judah into babylon in the fourth year of hi reign and thi seraiah
wa a quiet princ

51:60 so jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come upon
babylon even all these word that are written against babylon

51:61 and jeremiah said to seraiah when thou comest to babylon and
shalt see and shalt read all these words; 51:62 then shalt thou say
o lord thou hast spoken against thi place to cut it off that none
shall remain in it neither man nor beast but that it shall be
desol for ever

51:63 and it shall be when thou hast made an end of read thi
book that thou shalt bind a stone to it and cast it into the midst
of euphrates: 51:64 and thou shalt say thu shall babylon sink and
shall not rise from the evil that i will bring upon her: and they
shall be weari thu far are the word of jeremiah

52:1 zedekiah wa one and twenti year old when he began to reign and
he reign eleven year in jerusalem and hi mother name wa
hamut the daughter of jeremiah of libnah

52:2 and he did that which wa evil in the eye of the lord accord
to all that jehoiakim had done

52:3 for through the anger of the lord it came to pass in jerusalem
and judah till he had cast them out from hi presenc that zedekiah
rebel against the king of babylon

52:4 and it came to pass in the ninth year of hi reign in the tenth
month in the tenth day of the month that nebuchadrezzar king of
babylon came he and all hi armi against jerusalem and pitch
against it and built fort against it round about

52:5 so the citi wa besieg unto the eleventh year of king zedekiah

52:6 and in the fourth month in the ninth day of the month the
famin wa sore in the citi so that there wa no bread for the peopl
of the land

52:7 then the citi wa broken up and all the men of war fled and
went forth out of the citi by night by the way of the gate between the
two wall which wa by the king garden; (now the chaldean were by
the citi round about:) and they went by the way of the plain

52:8 but the armi of the chaldean pursu after the king and
overtook zedekiah in the plain of jericho; and all hi armi wa
scatter from him

52:9 then they took the king and carri him up unto the king of
babylon to riblah in the land of hamath; where he gave judgment upon
him

52:10 and the king of babylon slew the son of zedekiah befor hi
eyes: he slew also all the princ of judah in riblah

52:11 then he put out the eye of zedekiah; and the king of babylon
bound him in chain and carri him to babylon and put him in prison
till the day of hi death

52:12 now in the fifth month in the tenth day of the month which wa
the nineteenth year of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon came
nebuzaradan captain of the guard which serv the king of babylon
into jerusalem 52:13 and burn the hous of the lord and the king
house; and all the hous of jerusalem and all the hous of the
great men burn he with fire: 52:14 and all the armi of the
chaldean that were with the captain of the guard brake down all the
wall of jerusalem round about

52:15 then nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carri away captiv
certain of the poor of the peopl and the residu of the peopl that
remain in the citi and those that fell away that fell to the king
of babylon and the rest of the multitud

52:16 but nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left certain of the
poor of the land for vinedress and for husbandmen

52:17 also the pillar of brass that were in the hous of the lord
and the base and the brasen sea that wa in the hous of the lord
the chaldean brake and carri all the brass of them to babylon

52:18 the caldron also and the shovel and the snuffer and the
bowl and the spoon and all the vessel of brass wherewith they
minist took they away

52:19 and the bason and the firepan and the bowl and the
caldron and the candlestick and the spoon and the cups; that
which wa of gold in gold and that which wa of silver in silver
took the captain of the guard away

52:20 the two pillar one sea and twelv brasen bull that were
under the base which king solomon had made in the hous of the lord:
the brass of all these vessel wa without weight

52:21 and concern the pillar the height of one pillar wa
eighteen cubits; and a fillet of twelv cubit did compass it; and the
thick thereof wa four fingers: it wa hollow

52:22 and a chapit of brass wa upon it; and the height of one
chapit wa five cubit with network and pomegran upon the
chapit round about all of brass the second pillar also and the
pomegran were like unto these

52:23 and there were nineti and six pomegran on a side; and all
the pomegran upon the network were an hundr round about

52:24 and the captain of the guard took seraiah the chief priest and
zephaniah the second priest and the three keeper of the door: 52:25
he took also out of the citi an eunuch which had the charg of the
men of war; and seven men of them that were near the king person
which were found in the city; and the princip scribe of the host
who muster the peopl of the land; and threescor men of the peopl
of the land that were found in the midst of the citi

52:26 so nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them and brought
them to the king of babylon to riblah

52:27 and the king of babylon smote them and put them to death in
riblah in the land of hamath thu judah wa carri away captiv out
of hi own land

52:28 thi is the peopl whom nebuchadrezzar carri away captive: in
the seventh year three thousand jew and three and twenty: 52:29 in
the eighteenth year of nebuchadrezzar he carri away captiv from
jerusalem eight hundr thirti and two persons: 52:30 in the three and
twentieth year of nebuchadrezzar nebuzaradan the captain of the guard
carri away captiv of the jew seven hundr forti and five persons:
all the person were four thousand and six hundr

52:31 and it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the
captiv of jehoiachin king of judah in the twelfth month in the
five and twentieth day of the month that evilmerodach king of babylon
in the first year of hi reign lift up the head of jehoiachin king
of judah and brought him forth out of prison

52:32 and spake kindli unto him and set hi throne abov the throne
of the king that were with him in babylon 52:33 and chang hi
prison garments: and he did continu eat bread befor him all the
day of hi life

52:34 and for hi diet there wa a continu diet given him of the
king of babylon everi day a portion until the day of hi death all
the day of hi life




the lament of jeremiah


1:1 how doth the citi sit solitari that wa full of people! how is
she becom as a widow! she that wa great among the nation and
princess among the provinc how is she becom tributary! 1:2 she
weepeth sore in the night and her tear are on her cheeks: among all
her lover she hath none to comfort her: all her friend have dealt
treacher with her they are becom her enemi

1:3 judah is gone into captiv becaus of afflict and becaus of
great servitude: she dwelleth among the heathen she findeth no rest:
all her persecutor overtook her between the strait

1:4 the way of zion do mourn becaus none come to the solemn feasts:
all her gate are desolate: her priest sigh her virgin are
afflict and she is in bitter

1:5 her adversari are the chief her enemi prosper; for the lord
hath afflict her for the multitud of her transgressions: her
children are gone into captiv befor the enemi

1:6 and from the daughter of zion all her beauti is departed: her
princ are becom like hart that find no pastur and they are gone
without strength befor the pursuer

1:7 jerusalem rememb in the day of her afflict and of her
miseri all her pleasant thing that she had in the day of old when
her peopl fell into the hand of the enemi and none did help her: the
adversari saw her and did mock at her sabbath

1:8 jerusalem hath grievous sinned; therefor she is removed: all
that honour her despis her becaus they have seen her nakedness:
yea she sigheth and turneth backward

1:9 her filthi is in her skirts; she remembereth not her last end;
therefor she came down wonderfully: she had no comfort o lord
behold my affliction: for the enemi hath magnifi himself

1:10 the adversari hath spread out hi hand upon all her pleasant
things: for she hath seen that the heathen enter into her sanctuari
whom thou didst command that they should not enter into thi
congreg

1:11 all her peopl sigh they seek bread; they have given their
pleasant thing for meat to reliev the soul: see o lord and
consider; for i am becom vile

1:12 is it noth to you all ye that pass by? behold and see if
there be ani sorrow like unto my sorrow which is done unto me
wherewith the lord hath afflict me in the day of hi fierc anger

1:13 from abov hath he sent fire into my bone and it prevaileth
against them: he hath spread a net for my feet he hath turn me
back: he hath made me desol and faint all the day

1:14 the yoke of my transgress is bound by hi hand: they are
wreath and come up upon my neck: he hath made my strength to fall
the lord hath deliv me into their hand from whom i am not abl
to rise up

1:15 the lord hath trodden under foot all my mighti men in the midst
of me: he hath call an assembl against me to crush my young men:
the lord hath trodden the virgin the daughter of judah as in a
winepress

1:16 for these thing i weep; mine eye mine eye runneth down with
water becaus the comfort that should reliev my soul is far from
me: my children are desol becaus the enemi prevail

1:17 zion spreadeth forth her hand and there is none to comfort her:
the lord hath command concern jacob that hi adversari should
be round about him: jerusalem is as a menstruou woman among them

1:18 the lord is righteous; for i have rebel against hi
commandment: hear i pray you all peopl and behold my sorrow: my
virgin and my young men are gone into captiv

1:19 i call for my lover but they deceiv me: my priest and mine
elder gave up the ghost in the citi while they sought their meat to
reliev their soul

1:20 behold o lord; for i am in distress: my bowel are troubled;
mine heart is turn within me; for i have grievous rebelled: abroad
the sword bereaveth at home there is as death

1:21 they have heard that i sigh: there is none to comfort me: all
mine enemi have heard of my trouble; they are glad that thou hast
done it: thou wilt bring the day that thou hast call and they shall
be like unto me

1:22 let all their wicked come befor thee; and do unto them as
thou hast done unto me for all my transgressions: for my sigh are
mani and my heart is faint

2:1 how hath the lord cover the daughter of zion with a cloud in hi
anger and cast down from heaven unto the earth the beauti of israel
and rememb not hi footstool in the day of hi anger! 2:2 the
lord hath swallow up all the habit of jacob and hath not
pitied: he hath thrown down in hi wrath the strong hold of the
daughter of judah; he hath brought them down to the ground: he hath
pollut the kingdom and the princ thereof

2:3 he hath cut off in hi fierc anger all the horn of israel: he
hath drawn back hi right hand from befor the enemi and he burn
against jacob like a flame fire which devoureth round about

2:4 he hath bent hi bow like an enemy: he stood with hi right hand
as an adversari and slew all that were pleasant to the eye in the
tabernacl of the daughter of zion: he pour out hi furi like fire

2:5 the lord wa as an enemy: he hath swallow up israel he hath
swallow up all her palaces: he hath destroy hi strong hold and
hath increas in the daughter of judah mourn and lament

2:6 and he hath violent taken away hi tabernacl as if it were of
a garden: he hath destroy hi place of the assembly: the lord hath
caus the solemn feast and sabbath to be forgotten in zion and
hath despis in the indign of hi anger the king and the priest

2:7 the lord hath cast off hi altar he hath abhor hi sanctuari
he hath given up into the hand of the enemi the wall of her palaces;
they have made a nois in the hous of the lord as in the day of a
solemn feast

2:8 the lord hath purpos to destroy the wall of the daughter of
zion: he hath stretch out a line he hath not withdrawn hi hand
from destroying: therefor he made the rampart and the wall to lament;
they languish togeth

2:9 her gate are sunk into the ground; he hath destroy and broken
her bars: her king and her princ are among the gentiles: the law is
no more; her prophet also find no vision from the lord

2:10 the elder of the daughter of zion sit upon the ground and keep
silence: they have cast up dust upon their heads; they have gird
themselv with sackcloth: the virgin of jerusalem hang down their
head to the ground

2:11 mine eye do fail with tear my bowel are troubl my liver is
pour upon the earth for the destruct of the daughter of my
people; becaus the children and the suckl swoon in the street of
the citi

2:12 they say to their mother where is corn and wine? when they
swoon as the wound in the street of the citi when their soul wa
pour out into their mother bosom

2:13 what thing shall i take to wit for thee? what thing shall i
liken to thee o daughter of jerusalem? what shall i equal to thee
that i may comfort thee o virgin daughter of zion? for thi breach is
great like the sea: who can heal thee? 2:14 thi prophet have seen
vain and foolish thing for thee: and they have not discov thine
iniqu to turn away thi captivity; but have seen for thee fals
burden and caus of banish

2:15 all that pass by clap their hand at thee; they hiss and wag
their head at the daughter of jerusalem say is thi the citi that
men call the perfect of beauti the joy of the whole earth? 2:16
all thine enemi have open their mouth against thee: they hiss and
gnash the teeth: they say we have swallow her up: certainli thi is
the day that we look for; we have found we have seen it

2:17 the lord hath done that which he had devised; he hath fulfil
hi word that he had command in the day of old: he hath thrown
down and hath not pitied: and he hath caus thine enemi to rejoic
over thee he hath set up the horn of thine adversari

2:18 their heart cri unto the lord o wall of the daughter of zion
let tear run down like a river day and night: give thyself no rest;
let not the appl of thine eye ceas

2:19 aris cri out in the night: in the begin of the watch pour
out thine heart like water befor the face of the lord: lift up thi
hand toward him for the life of thi young children that faint for
hunger in the top of everi street

2:20 behold o lord and consid to whom thou hast done thi shall
the women eat their fruit and children of a span long? shall the
priest and the prophet be slain in the sanctuari of the lord? 2:21
the young and the old lie on the ground in the streets: my virgin and
my young men are fallen by the sword; thou hast slain them in the day
of thine anger; thou hast kill and not piti

2:22 thou hast call as in a solemn day my terror round about so
that in the day of the lord anger none escap nor remained: those
that i have swaddl and brought up hath mine enemi consum

3:1 i am the man that hath seen afflict by the rod of hi wrath

3:2 he hath led me and brought me into dark but not into light

3:3 sure against me is he turned; he turneth hi hand against me all
the day

3:4 my flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bone

3:5 he hath build against me and compass me with gall and
travail

3:6 he hath set me in dark place as they that be dead of old

3:7 he hath hedg me about that i cannot get out: he hath made my
chain heavi

3:8 also when i cri and shout he shutteth out my prayer

3:9 he hath inclos my way with hewn stone he hath made my path
crook

3:10 he wa unto me as a bear lie in wait and as a lion in secret
place

3:11 he hath turn asid my way and pull me in pieces: he hath
made me desol

3:12 he hath bent hi bow and set me as a mark for the arrow

3:13 he hath caus the arrow of hi quiver to enter into my rein

3:14 i wa a deris to all my people; and their song all the day

3:15 he hath fill me with bitter he hath made me drunken with
wormwood

3:16 he hath also broken my teeth with gravel stone he hath cover
me with ash

3:17 and thou hast remov my soul far off from peace: i forgat
prosper

3:18 and i said my strength and my hope is perish from the lord:
3:19 rememb mine afflict and my miseri the wormwood and the
gall

3:20 my soul hath them still in remembr and is humbl in me

3:21 thi i recal to my mind therefor have i hope

3:22 it is of the lord merci that we are not consum becaus hi
compass fail not

3:23 they are new everi morning: great is thi faith

3:24 the lord is my portion saith my soul; therefor will i hope in
him

3:25 the lord is good unto them that wait for him to the soul that
seeketh him

3:26 it is good that a man should both hope and quietli wait for the
salvat of the lord

3:27 it is good for a man that he bear the yoke of hi youth

3:28 he sitteth alon and keepeth silenc becaus he hath born it
upon him

3:29 he putteth hi mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope

3:30 he giveth hi cheek to him that smiteth him: he is fill full
with reproach

3:31 for the lord will not cast off for ever: 3:32 but though he caus
grief yet will he have compass accord to the multitud of hi
merci

3:33 for he doth not afflict willingli nor griev the children of men

3:34 to crush under hi feet all the prison of the earth

3:35 to turn asid the right of a man befor the face of the most
high 3:36 to subvert a man in hi caus the lord approveth not

3:37 who is he that saith and it cometh to pass when the lord
commandeth it not? 3:38 out of the mouth of the most high proceedeth
not evil and good? 3:39 wherefor doth a live man complain a man
for the punish of hi sins? 3:40 let us search and tri our way
and turn again to the lord

3:41 let us lift up our heart with our hand unto god in the heaven

3:42 we have transgress and have rebelled: thou hast not pardon

3:43 thou hast cover with anger and persecut us: thou hast slain
thou hast not piti

3:44 thou hast cover thyself with a cloud that our prayer should
not pass through

3:45 thou hast made us as the offscour and refus in the midst of
the peopl

3:46 all our enemi have open their mouth against us

3:47 fear and a snare is come upon us desol and destruct

3:48 mine eye runneth down with river of water for the destruct of
the daughter of my peopl

3:49 mine eye trickleth down and ceaseth not without ani
intermiss

3:50 till the lord look down and behold from heaven

3:51 mine eye affecteth mine heart becaus of all the daughter of my
citi

3:52 mine enemi chase me sore like a bird without caus

3:53 they have cut off my life in the dungeon and cast a stone upon
me

3:54 water flow over mine head; then i said i am cut off

3:55 i call upon thi name o lord out of the low dungeon

3:56 thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breath at
my cri

3:57 thou drewest near in the day that i call upon thee: thou
saidst fear not

3:58 o lord thou hast plead the caus of my soul; thou hast
redeem my life

3:59 o lord thou hast seen my wrong: judg thou my caus

3:60 thou hast seen all their vengeanc and all their imagin
against me

3:61 thou hast heard their reproach o lord and all their
imagin against me; 3:62 the lip of those that rose up against
me and their devic against me all the day

3:63 behold their sit down and their rise up; i am their
musick

3:64 render unto them a recomp o lord accord to the work of
their hand

3:65 give them sorrow of heart thi curs unto them

3:66 persecut and destroy them in anger from under the heaven of the
lord

4:1 how is the gold becom dim! how is the most fine gold changed! the
stone of the sanctuari are pour out in the top of everi street

4:2 the preciou son of zion compar to fine gold how are they
esteem as earthen pitcher the work of the hand of the potter!
4:3 even the sea monster draw out the breast they give suck to their
young ones: the daughter of my peopl is becom cruel like the
ostrich in the wilder

4:4 the tongu of the suck child cleaveth to the roof of hi mouth
for thirst: the young children ask bread and no man breaketh it unto
them

4:5 they that did feed delic are desol in the streets: they
that were brought up in scarlet embrac dunghil

4:6 for the punish of the iniqu of the daughter of my peopl is
greater than the punish of the sin of sodom that wa overthrown
as in a moment and no hand stay on her

4:7 her nazarit were purer than snow they were whiter than milk
they were more ruddi in bodi than rubi their polish wa of
sapphire: 4:8 their visag is blacker than a coal; they are not known
in the streets: their skin cleaveth to their bones; it is wither it
is becom like a stick

4:9 they that be slain with the sword are better than they that be
slain with hunger: for these pine away stricken through for want of
the fruit of the field

4:10 the hand of the piti women have sodden their own children:
they were their meat in the destruct of the daughter of my peopl

4:11 the lord hath accomplish hi fury; he hath pour out hi
fierc anger and hath kindl a fire in zion and it hath devour
the foundat thereof

4:12 the king of the earth and all the inhabit of the world
would not have believ that the adversari and the enemi should have
enter into the gate of jerusalem

4:13 for the sin of her prophet and the iniqu of her priest
that have shed the blood of the just in the midst of her 4:14 they
have wander as blind men in the street they have pollut
themselv with blood so that men could not touch their garment

4:15 they cri unto them depart ye; it is unclean; depart depart
touch not: when they fled away and wander they said among the
heathen they shall no more sojourn there

4:16 the anger of the lord hath divid them; he will no more regard
them: they respect not the person of the priest they favour not
the elder

4:17 as for us our eye as yet fail for our vain help: in our
watch we have watch for a nation that could not save us

4:18 they hunt our step that we cannot go in our streets: our end is
near our day are fulfilled; for our end is come

4:19 our persecutor are swifter than the eagl of the heaven: they
pursu us upon the mountain they laid wait for us in the
wilder

4:20 the breath of our nostril the anoint of the lord wa taken
in their pit of whom we said under hi shadow we shall live among
the heathen

4:21 rejoic and be glad o daughter of edom that dwellest in the
land of uz; the cup also shall pass through unto thee: thou shalt be
drunken and shalt make thyself nake

4:22 the punish of thine iniqu is accomplish o daughter of
zion; he will no more carri thee away into captivity: he will visit
thine iniqu o daughter of edom; he will discov thi sin

5:1 rememb o lord what is come upon us: consid and behold our
reproach

5:2 our inherit is turn to stranger our hous to alien

5:3 we are orphan and fatherless our mother are as widow

5:4 we have drunken our water for money; our wood is sold unto us

5:5 our neck are under persecution: we labour and have no rest

5:6 we have given the hand to the egyptian and to the assyrian to
be satisfi with bread

5:7 our father have sin and are not; and we have born their
iniqu

5:8 servant have rule over us: there is none that doth deliv us
out of their hand

5:9 we gat our bread with the peril of our live becaus of the sword
of the wilder

5:10 our skin wa black like an oven becaus of the terribl famin

5:11 they ravish the women in zion and the maid in the citi of
judah

5:12 princ are hang up by their hand: the face of elder were not
honour

5:13 they took the young men to grind and the children fell under the
wood

5:14 the elder have ceas from the gate the young men from their
musick

5:15 the joy of our heart is ceased; our danc is turn into
mourn

5:16 the crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us that we have
sinned! 5:17 for thi our heart is faint; for these thing our eye
are dim

5:18 becaus of the mountain of zion which is desol the fox
walk upon it

5:19 thou o lord remainest for ever; thi throne from gener to
gener

5:20 wherefor dost thou forget us for ever and forsak us so long
time? 5:21 turn thou us unto thee o lord and we shall be turned;
renew our day as of old

5:22 but thou hast utterli reject us; thou art veri wroth against us




the book of the prophet ezekiel


1:1 now it came to pass in the thirtieth year in the fourth month
in the fifth day of the month as i wa among the captiv by the river
of chebar that the heaven were open and i saw vision of god

1:2 in the fifth day of the month which wa the fifth year of king
jehoiachin captiv 1:3 the word of the lord came expressli unto
ezekiel the priest the son of buzi in the land of the chaldean by
the river chebar; and the hand of the lord wa there upon him

1:4 and i look and behold a whirlwind came out of the north a
great cloud and a fire infold itself and a bright wa about
it and out of the midst thereof as the colour of amber out of the
midst of the fire

1:5 also out of the midst thereof came the like of four live
creatur and thi wa their appearance; they had the like of a
man

1:6 and everi one had four face and everi one had four wing

1:7 and their feet were straight feet; and the sole of their feet wa
like the sole of a calf foot: and they sparkl like the colour of
burnish brass

1:8 and they had the hand of a man under their wing on their four
sides; and they four had their face and their wing

1:9 their wing were join one to another; they turn not when they
went; they went everi one straight forward

1:10 as for the like of their face they four had the face of a
man and the face of a lion on the right side: and they four had the
face of an ox on the left side; they four also had the face of an
eagl

1:11 thu were their faces: and their wing were stretch upward; two
wing of everi one were join one to anoth and two cover their
bodi

1:12 and they went everi one straight forward: whither the spirit wa
to go they went; and they turn not when they went

1:13 as for the like of the live creatur their appear wa
like burn coal of fire and like the appear of lamps: it went
up and down among the live creatures; and the fire wa bright and
out of the fire went forth lightn

1:14 and the live creatur ran and return as the appear of a
flash of lightn

1:15 now as i beheld the live creatur behold one wheel upon the
earth by the live creatur with hi four face

1:16 the appear of the wheel and their work wa like unto the
colour of a beryl: and they four had one likeness: and their
appear and their work wa as it were a wheel in the middl of a
wheel

1:17 when they went they went upon their four sides: and they turn
not when they went

1:18 as for their ring they were so high that they were dreadful;
and their ring were full of eye round about them four

1:19 and when the live creatur went the wheel went by them: and
when the live creatur were lift up from the earth the wheel
were lift up

1:20 whithersoev the spirit wa to go they went thither wa their
spirit to go; and the wheel were lift up over against them: for the
spirit of the live creatur wa in the wheel

1:21 when those went these went; and when those stood these stood;
and when those were lift up from the earth the wheel were lift
up over against them: for the spirit of the live creatur wa in the
wheel

1:22 and the like of the firmament upon the head of the live
creatur wa as the colour of the terribl crystal stretch forth
over their head abov

1:23 and under the firmament were their wing straight the one toward
the other: everi one had two which cover on thi side and everi
one had two which cover on that side their bodi

1:24 and when they went i heard the nois of their wing like the
nois of great water as the voic of the almighti the voic of
speech as the nois of an host: when they stood they let down their
wing

1:25 and there wa a voic from the firmament that wa over their
head when they stood and had let down their wing

1:26 and abov the firmament that wa over their head wa the
like of a throne as the appear of a sapphir stone: and upon
the like of the throne wa the like as the appear of a man
abov upon it

1:27 and i saw as the colour of amber as the appear of fire round
about within it from the appear of hi loin even upward and
from the appear of hi loin even downward i saw as it were the
appear of fire and it had bright round about

1:28 as the appear of the bow that is in the cloud in the day of
rain so wa the appear of the bright round about thi wa
the appear of the like of the glori of the lord and when i
saw it i fell upon my face and i heard a voic of one that spake

2:1 and he said unto me son of man stand upon thi feet and i will
speak unto thee

2:2 and the spirit enter into me when he spake unto me and set me
upon my feet that i heard him that spake unto me

2:3 and he said unto me son of man i send thee to the children of
israel to a rebelli nation that hath rebel against me: they and
their father have transgress against me even unto thi veri day

2:4 for they are impud children and stiffheart i do send thee
unto them; and thou shalt say unto them thu saith the lord god

2:5 and they whether they will hear or whether they will forbear
(for they are a rebelli house) yet shall know that there hath been
a prophet among them

2:6 and thou son of man be not afraid of them neither be afraid of
their word though brier and thorn be with thee and thou dost
dwell among scorpions: be not afraid of their word nor be dismay
at their look though they be a rebelli hous

2:7 and thou shalt speak my word unto them whether they will hear
or whether they will forbear: for they are most rebelli

2:8 but thou son of man hear what i say unto thee; be not thou
rebelli like that rebelli house: open thi mouth and eat that i
give thee

2:9 and when i look behold an hand wa sent unto me; and lo a
roll of a book wa therein; 2:10 and he spread it befor me; and it
wa written within and without: and there wa written therein
lament and mourn and woe

3:1 moreov he said unto me son of man eat that thou findest; eat
thi roll and go speak unto the hous of israel

3:2 so i open my mouth and he caus me to eat that roll

3:3 and he said unto me son of man caus thi belli to eat and fill
thi bowel with thi roll that i give thee then did i eat it; and it
wa in my mouth as honey for sweet

3:4 and he said unto me son of man go get thee unto the hous of
israel and speak with my word unto them

3:5 for thou art not sent to a peopl of a strang speech and of an
hard languag but to the hous of israel; 3:6 not to mani peopl of a
strang speech and of an hard languag whose word thou canst not
understand sure had i sent thee to them they would have hearken
unto thee

3:7 but the hous of israel will not hearken unto thee; for they will
not hearken unto me: for all the hous of israel are impud and
hardheart

3:8 behold i have made thi face strong against their face and thi
forehead strong against their forehead

3:9 as an adam harder than flint have i made thi forehead: fear
them not neither be dismay at their look though they be a
rebelli hous

3:10 moreov he said unto me son of man all my word that i shall
speak unto thee receiv in thine heart and hear with thine ear

3:11 and go get thee to them of the captiv unto the children of
thi peopl and speak unto them and tell them thu saith the lord
god; whether they will hear or whether they will forbear

3:12 then the spirit took me up and i heard behind me a voic of a
great rush say bless be the glori of the lord from hi
place

3:13 i heard also the nois of the wing of the live creatur that
touch one anoth and the nois of the wheel over against them
and a nois of a great rush

3:14 so the spirit lift me up and took me away and i went in
bitter in the heat of my spirit; but the hand of the lord wa
strong upon me

3:15 then i came to them of the captiv at telabib that dwelt by
the river of chebar and i sat where they sat and remain there
astonish among them seven day

3:16 and it came to pass at the end of seven day that the word of
the lord came unto me say 3:17 son of man i have made thee a
watchman unto the hous of israel: therefor hear the word at my
mouth and give them warn from me

3:18 when i say unto the wick thou shalt sure die; and thou
givest him not warn nor speakest to warn the wick from hi
wick way to save hi life; the same wick man shall die in hi
iniquity; but hi blood will i requir at thine hand

3:19 yet if thou warn the wick and he turn not from hi wicked
nor from hi wick way he shall die in hi iniquity; but thou hast
deliv thi soul

3:20 again when a righteou man doth turn from hi righteous and
commit iniqu and i lay a stumbling-block befor him he shall die:
becaus thou hast not given him warn he shall die in hi sin and
hi righteous which he hath done shall not be remembered; but hi
blood will i requir at thine hand

3:21 nevertheless if thou warn the righteou man that the righteou
sin not and he doth not sin he shall sure live becaus he is
warned; also thou hast deliv thi soul

3:22 and the hand of the lord wa there upon me; and he said unto me
aris go forth into the plain and i will there talk with thee

3:23 then i aros and went forth into the plain: and behold the
glori of the lord stood there as the glori which i saw by the river
of chebar: and i fell on my face

3:24 then the spirit enter into me and set me upon my feet and
spake with me and said unto me go shut thyself within thine hous

3:25 but thou o son of man behold they shall put band upon thee
and shall bind thee with them and thou shalt not go out among them:
3:26 and i will make thi tongu cleav to the roof of thi mouth that
thou shalt be dumb and shalt not be to them a reprover: for they are
a rebelli hous

3:27 but when i speak with thee i will open thi mouth and thou shalt
say unto them thu saith the lord god; he that heareth let him hear;
and he that forbeareth let him forbear: for they are a rebelli
hous

4:1 thou also son of man take thee a tile and lay it befor thee
and pourtray upon it the citi even jerusalem: 4:2 and lay sieg
against it and build a fort against it and cast a mount against it;
set the camp also against it and set batter ram against it round
about

4:3 moreov take thou unto thee an iron pan and set it for a wall of
