them and will give them to be remov and spoil

23:47 and the compani shall stone them with stone and dispatch them
with their swords; they shall slay their son and their daughter and
burn up their hous with fire

23:48 thu will i caus lewd to ceas out of the land that all
women may be taught not to do after your lewd

23:49 and they shall recompens your lewd upon you and ye shall
bear the sin of your idols: and ye shall know that i am the lord god

24:1 again in the ninth year in the tenth month in the tenth day of
the month the word of the lord came unto me say 24:2 son of man
write thee the name of the day even of thi same day: the king of
babylon set himself against jerusalem thi same day

24:3 and utter a parabl unto the rebelli hous and say unto them
thu saith the lord god; set on a pot set it on and also pour water
into it: 24:4 gather the piec thereof into it even everi good
piec the thigh and the shoulder; fill it with the choic bone

24:5 take the choic of the flock and burn also the bone under it
and make it boil well and let them seeth the bone of it therein

24:6 wherefor thu saith the lord god; woe to the bloodi citi to the
pot whose scum is therein and whose scum is not gone out of it! bring
it out piec by piece; let no lot fall upon it

24:7 for her blood is in the midst of her; she set it upon the top of
a rock; she pour it not upon the ground to cover it with dust; 24:8
that it might caus furi to come up to take vengeance; i have set her
blood upon the top of a rock that it should not be cover

24:9 therefor thu saith the lord god; woe to the bloodi city! i will
even make the pile for fire great

24:10 heap on wood kindl the fire consum the flesh and spice it
well and let the bone be burn

24:11 then set it empti upon the coal thereof that the brass of it
may be hot and may burn and that the filthi of it may be molten
in it that the scum of it may be consum

24:12 she hath weari herself with lie and her great scum went not
forth out of her: her scum shall be in the fire

24:13 in thi filthi is lewdness: becaus i have purg thee and
thou wast not purg thou shalt not be purg from thi filthi ani
more till i have caus my furi to rest upon thee

24:14 i the lord have spoken it: it shall come to pass and i will do
it; i will not go back neither will i spare neither will i repent;
accord to thi way and accord to thi do shall they judg
thee saith the lord god

24:15 also the word of the lord came unto me say 24:16 son of
man behold i take away from thee the desir of thine eye with a
stroke: yet neither shalt thou mourn nor weep neither shall thi tear
run down

24:17 forbear to cri make no mourn for the dead bind the tire of
thine head upon thee and put on thi shoe upon thi feet and cover
not thi lip and eat not the bread of men

24:18 so i spake unto the peopl in the morning: and at even my wife
died; and i did in the morn as i wa command

24:19 and the peopl said unto me wilt thou not tell us what these
thing are to us that thou doest so? 24:20 then i answer them the
word of the lord came unto me say 24:21 speak unto the hous of
israel thu saith the lord god; behold i will profan my sanctuari
the excel of your strength the desir of your eye and that
which your soul pitieth; and your son and your daughter whom ye have
left shall fall by the sword

24:22 and ye shall do as i have done: ye shall not cover your lip
nor eat the bread of men

24:23 and your tire shall be upon your head and your shoe upon
your feet: ye shall not mourn nor weep; but ye shall pine away for
your iniqu and mourn one toward anoth

24:24 thu ezekiel is unto you a sign: accord to all that he hath
done shall ye do: and when thi cometh ye shall know that i am the
lord god

24:25 also thou son of man shall it not be in the day when i take
from them their strength the joy of their glori the desir of their
eye and that whereupon they set their mind their son and their
daughter 24:26 that he that escapeth in that day shall come unto
thee to caus thee to hear it with thine ears? 24:27 in that day
shall thi mouth be open to him which is escap and thou shalt
speak and be no more dumb: and thou shalt be a sign unto them; and
they shall know that i am the lord

25:1 the word of the lord came again unto me say 25:2 son of man
set thi face against the ammonit and prophesi against them; 25:3
and say unto the ammonit hear the word of the lord god; thu saith
the lord god; becaus thou saidst aha against my sanctuari when it
wa profaned; and against the land of israel when it wa desolate;
and against the hous of judah when they went into captivity; 25:4
behold therefor i will deliv thee to the men of the east for a
possess and they shall set their palac in thee and make their
dwell in thee: they shall eat thi fruit and they shall drink thi
milk

25:5 and i will make rabbah a stabl for camel and the ammonit a
couch place for flocks: and ye shall know that i am the lord

25:6 for thu saith the lord god; becaus thou hast clap thine
hand and stamp with the feet and rejoic in heart with all thi
despit against the land of israel; 25:7 behold therefor i will
stretch out mine hand upon thee and will deliv thee for a spoil to
the heathen; and i will cut thee off from the peopl and i will caus
thee to perish out of the countries: i will destroy thee; and thou
shalt know that i am the lord

25:8 thu saith the lord god; becaus that moab and seir do say
behold the hous of judah is like unto all the heathen; 25:9
therefor behold i will open the side of moab from the citi from
hi citi which are on hi frontier the glori of the countri
bethjeshimoth baalmeon and kiriathaim 25:10 unto the men of the
east with the ammonit and will give them in possess that the
ammonit may not be rememb among the nation

25:11 and i will execut judgment upon moab; and they shall know that
i am the lord

25:12 thu saith the lord god; becaus that edom hath dealt against
the hous of judah by take vengeanc and hath greatli offend and
reveng himself upon them; 25:13 therefor thu saith the lord god; i
will also stretch out mine hand upon edom and will cut off man and
beast from it; and i will make it desol from teman; and they of
dedan shall fall by the sword

25:14 and i will lay my vengeanc upon edom by the hand of my peopl
israel: and they shall do in edom accord to mine anger and
accord to my fury; and they shall know my vengeanc saith the lord
god

25:15 thu saith the lord god; becaus the philistin have dealt by
reveng and have taken vengeanc with a despit heart to destroy
it for the old hatred; 25:16 therefor thu saith the lord god;
behold i will stretch out mine hand upon the philistin and i will
cut off the cherethim and destroy the remnant of the sea coast

25:17 and i will execut great vengeanc upon them with furiou
rebukes; and they shall know that i am the lord when i shall lay my
vengeanc upon them

26:1 and it came to pass in the eleventh year in the first day of the
month that the word of the lord came unto me say 26:2 son of
man becaus that tyru hath said against jerusalem aha she is
broken that wa the gate of the people: she is turn unto me: i
shall be replenish now she is laid waste: 26:3 therefor thu saith
the lord god; behold i am against thee o tyru and will caus mani
nation to come up against thee as the sea causeth hi wave to come
up

26:4 and they shall destroy the wall of tyru and break down her
towers: i will also scrape her dust from her and make her like the
top of a rock

26:5 it shall be a place for the spread of net in the midst of the
sea: for i have spoken it saith the lord god: and it shall becom a
spoil to the nation

26:6 and her daughter which are in the field shall be slain by the
sword; and they shall know that i am the lord

26:7 for thu saith the lord god; behold i will bring upon tyru
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon a king of king from the north with
hors and with chariot and with horsemen and compani and much
peopl

26:8 he shall slay with the sword thi daughter in the field: and he
shall make a fort against thee and cast a mount against thee and
lift up the buckler against thee

26:9 and he shall set engin of war against thi wall and with hi
axe he shall break down thi tower

26:10 by reason of the abund of hi hors their dust shall cover
thee: thi wall shall shake at the nois of the horsemen and of the
wheel and of the chariot when he shall enter into thi gate as
men enter into a citi wherein is made a breach

26:11 with the hoof of hi hors shall he tread down all thi
streets: he shall slay thi peopl by the sword and thi strong
garrison shall go down to the ground

26:12 and they shall make a spoil of thi rich and make a prey of
thi merchandise: and they shall break down thi wall and destroy thi
pleasant houses: and they shall lay thi stone and thi timber and thi
dust in the midst of the water

26:13 and i will caus the nois of thi song to cease; and the sound
of thi harp shall be no more heard

26:14 and i will make thee like the top of a rock: thou shalt be a
place to spread net upon; thou shalt be built no more: for i the lord
have spoken it saith the lord god

26:15 thu saith the lord god to tyrus; shall not the isl shake at
the sound of thi fall when the wound cri when the slaughter is
made in the midst of thee? 26:16 then all the princ of the sea
shall come down from their throne and lay away their robe and put
off their broider garments: they shall cloth themselv with
trembling; they shall sit upon the ground and shall trembl at everi
moment and be astonish at thee

26:17 and they shall take up a lament for thee and say to thee
how art thou destroy that wast inhabit of seafar men the
renown citi which wast strong in the sea she and her inhabit
which caus their terror to be on all that haunt it! 26:18 now shall
the isl trembl in the day of thi fall; yea the isl that are in
the sea shall be troubl at thi departur

26:19 for thu saith the lord god; when i shall make thee a desol
citi like the citi that are not inhabited; when i shall bring up
the deep upon thee and great water shall cover thee; 26:20 when i
shall bring thee down with them that descend into the pit with the
peopl of old time and shall set thee in the low part of the earth
in place desol of old with them that go down to the pit that
thou be not inhabited; and i shall set glori in the land of the
living; 26:21 i will make thee a terror and thou shalt be no more:
though thou be sought for yet shalt thou never be found again saith
the lord god

27:1 the word of the lord came again unto me say 27:2 now thou
son of man take up a lament for tyrus; 27:3 and say unto tyru
o thou that art situat at the entri of the sea which art a merchant
of the peopl for mani isl thu saith the lord god; o tyru thou
hast said i am of perfect beauti

27:4 thi border are in the midst of the sea thi builder have
perfect thi beauti

27:5 they have made all thi ship board of fir tree of senir: they
have taken cedar from lebanon to make mast for thee

27:6 of the oak of bashan have they made thine oars; the compani of
the ashurit have made thi bench of ivori brought out of the isl
of chittim

27:7 fine linen with broider work from egypt wa that which thou
spreadest forth to be thi sail; blue and purpl from the isl of
elishah wa that which cover thee

27:8 the inhabit of zidon and arvad were thi mariners: thi wise
men o tyru that were in thee were thi pilot

27:9 the ancient of gebal and the wise men thereof were in thee thi
calkers: all the ship of the sea with their marin were in thee to
occupi thi merchandis

27:10 they of persia and of lud and of phut were in thine armi thi
men of war: they hang the shield and helmet in thee; they set forth
thi comeli

27:11 the men of arvad with thine armi were upon thi wall round
about and the gammadim were in thi towers: they hang their shield
upon thi wall round about; they have made thi beauti perfect

27:12 tarshish wa thi merchant by reason of the multitud of all kind
of riches; with silver iron tin and lead they trade in thi fair

27:13 javan tubal and meshech they were thi merchants: they trade
the person of men and vessel of brass in thi market

27:14 they of the hous of togarmah trade in thi fair with hors
and horsemen and mule

27:15 the men of dedan were thi merchants; mani isl were the
merchandis of thine hand: they brought thee for a present horn of
ivori and eboni

27:16 syria wa thi merchant by reason of the multitud of the ware
of thi making: they occupi in thi fair with emerald purpl and
broider work and fine linen and coral and agat

27:17 judah and the land of israel they were thi merchants: they
trade in thi market wheat of minnith and pannag and honey and oil
and balm

27:18 damascu wa thi merchant in the multitud of the ware of thi
make for the multitud of all riches; in the wine of helbon and
white wool

27:19 dan also and javan go to and fro occupi in thi fairs:
bright iron cassia and calamu were in thi market

27:20 dedan wa thi merchant in preciou cloth for chariot

27:21 arabia and all the princ of kedar they occupi with thee in
lamb and ram and goats: in these were they thi merchant

27:22 the merchant of sheba and raamah they were thi merchants: they
occupi in thi fair with chief of all spice and with all preciou
stone and gold

27:23 haran and canneh and eden the merchant of sheba asshur and
chilmad were thi merchant

27:24 these were thi merchant in all sort of thing in blue
cloth and broider work and in chest of rich apparel bound with
cord and made of cedar among thi merchandis

27:25 the ship of tarshish did sing of thee in thi market: and thou
wast replenish and made veri gloriou in the midst of the sea

27:26 thi rower have brought thee into great waters: the east wind
hath broken thee in the midst of the sea

27:27 thi rich and thi fair thi merchandis thi marin and
thi pilot thi calker and the occupi of thi merchandis and all
thi men of war that are in thee and in all thi compani which is in
the midst of thee shall fall into the midst of the sea in the day of
thi ruin

27:28 the suburb shall shake at the sound of the cri of thi pilot

27:29 and all that handl the oar the marin and all the pilot of
the sea shall come down from their ship they shall stand upon the
land; 27:30 and shall caus their voic to be heard against thee and
shall cri bitterli and shall cast up dust upon their head they
shall wallow themselv in the ashes: 27:31 and they shall make
themselv utterli bald for thee and gird them with sackcloth and
they shall weep for thee with bitter of heart and bitter wail

27:32 and in their wail they shall take up a lament for thee
and lament over thee say what citi is like tyru like the
destroy in the midst of the sea? 27:33 when thi ware went forth
out of the sea thou filledst mani people; thou didst enrich the
king of the earth with the multitud of thi rich and of thi
merchandis

27:34 in the time when thou shalt be broken by the sea in the depth
of the water thi merchandis and all thi compani in the midst of thee
shall fall

27:35 all the inhabit of the isl shall be astonish at thee
and their king shall be sore afraid they shall be troubl in their
counten

27:36 the merchant among the peopl shall hiss at thee; thou shalt be
a terror and never shalt be ani more

28:1 the word of the lord came again unto me say 28:2 son of man
say unto the princ of tyru thu saith the lord god; becaus thine
heart is lift up and thou hast said i am a god i sit in the seat
of god in the midst of the seas; yet thou art a man and not god
though thou set thine heart as the heart of god: 28:3 behold thou art
wiser than daniel; there is no secret that they can hide from thee:
28:4 with thi wisdom and with thine understand thou hast gotten
thee rich and hast gotten gold and silver into thi treasures: 28:5
by thi great wisdom and by thi traffick hast thou increas thi
rich and thine heart is lift up becaus of thi riches: 28:6
therefor thu saith the lord god; becaus thou hast set thine heart
as the heart of god; 28:7 behold therefor i will bring stranger
upon thee the terribl of the nations: and they shall draw their
sword against the beauti of thi wisdom and they shall defil thi
bright

28:8 they shall bring thee down to the pit and thou shalt die the
death of them that are slain in the midst of the sea

28:9 wilt thou yet say befor him that slayeth thee i am god? but
thou shalt be a man and no god in the hand of him that slayeth thee

28:10 thou shalt die the death of the uncircumcis by the hand of
strangers: for i have spoken it saith the lord god

28:11 moreov the word of the lord came unto me say 28:12 son of
man take up a lament upon the king of tyru and say unto him
thu saith the lord god; thou sealest up the sum full of wisdom and
perfect in beauti

28:13 thou hast been in eden the garden of god; everi preciou stone
wa thi cover the sardiu topaz and the diamond the beryl the
onyx and the jasper the sapphir the emerald and the carbuncl
and gold: the workmanship of thi tabret and of thi pipe wa prepar
in thee in the day that thou wast creat

28:14 thou art the anoint cherub that covereth; and i have set thee
so: thou wast upon the holi mountain of god; thou hast walk up and
down in the midst of the stone of fire

28:15 thou wast perfect in thi way from the day that thou wast
creat till iniqu wa found in thee

28:16 by the multitud of thi merchandis they have fill the midst
of thee with violenc and thou hast sinned: therefor i will cast
thee as profan out of the mountain of god: and i will destroy thee o
cover cherub from the midst of the stone of fire

28:17 thine heart wa lift up becaus of thi beauti thou hast
corrupt thi wisdom by reason of thi brightness: i will cast thee to
the ground i will lay thee befor king that they may behold thee

28:18 thou hast defil thi sanctuari by the multitud of thine
iniqu by the iniqu of thi traffick; therefor will i bring
forth a fire from the midst of thee it shall devour thee and i will
bring thee to ash upon the earth in the sight of all them that
behold thee

28:19 all they that know thee among the peopl shall be astonish at
thee: thou shalt be a terror and never shalt thou be ani more

28:20 again the word of the lord came unto me say 28:21 son of
man set thi face against zidon and prophesi against it 28:22 and
say thu saith the lord god; behold i am against thee o zidon; and
i will be glorifi in the midst of thee: and they shall know that i
am the lord when i shall have execut judgment in her and shall be
sanctifi in her

28:23 for i will send into her pestil and blood into her streets;
and the wound shall be judg in the midst of her by the sword upon
her on everi side; and they shall know that i am the lord

28:24 and there shall be no more a prick brier unto the hous of
israel nor ani griev thorn of all that are round about them that
despis them; and they shall know that i am the lord god

28:25 thu saith the lord god; when i shall have gather the hous of
israel from the peopl among whom they are scatter and shall be
sanctifi in them in the sight of the heathen then shall they dwell
in their land that i have given to my servant jacob

28:26 and they shall dwell safe therein and shall build hous and
plant vineyards; yea they shall dwell with confid when i have
execut judgment upon all those that despis them round about them;
and they shall know that i am the lord their god

29:1 in the tenth year in the tenth month in the twelfth day of the
month the word of the lord came unto me say 29:2 son of man set
thi face against pharaoh king of egypt and prophesi against him and
against all egypt: 29:3 speak and say thu saith the lord god;
behold i am against thee pharaoh king of egypt the great dragon
that lieth in the midst of hi river which hath said my river is
mine own and i have made it for myself

29:4 but i will put hook in thi jaw and i will caus the fish of
thi river to stick unto thi scale and i will bring thee up out of
the midst of thi river and all the fish of thi river shall stick
unto thi scale

29:5 and i will leav thee thrown into the wilder thee and all
the fish of thi rivers: thou shalt fall upon the open fields; thou
shalt not be brought togeth nor gathered: i have given thee for
meat to the beast of the field and to the fowl of the heaven

29:6 and all the inhabit of egypt shall know that i am the lord
becaus they have been a staff of reed to the hous of israel

29:7 when they took hold of thee by thi hand thou didst break and
rend all their shoulder: and when they lean upon thee thou brakest
and madest all their loin to be at a stand

29:8 therefor thu saith the lord god; behold i will bring a sword
upon thee and cut off man and beast out of thee

29:9 and the land of egypt shall be desol and waste; and they shall
know that i am the lord: becaus he hath said the river is mine and
i have made it

29:10 behold therefor i am against thee and against thi river and
i will make the land of egypt utterli wast and desol from the
tower of syen even unto the border of ethiopia

29:11 no foot of man shall pass through it nor foot of beast shall
pass through it neither shall it be inhabit forti year

29:12 and i will make the land of egypt desol in the midst of the
countri that are desol and her citi among the citi that are
laid wast shall be desol forti years: and i will scatter the
egyptian among the nation and will dispers them through the
countri

29:13 yet thu saith the lord god; at the end of forti year will i
gather the egyptian from the peopl whither they were scattered:
29:14 and i will bring again the captiv of egypt and will caus
them to return into the land of pathro into the land of their
habitation; and they shall be there a base kingdom

29:15 it shall be the basest of the kingdoms; neither shall it exalt
itself ani more abov the nations: for i will diminish them that they
shall no more rule over the nation

29:16 and it shall be no more the confid of the hous of israel
which bringeth their iniqu to remembr when they shall look
after them: but they shall know that i am the lord god

29:17 and it came to pass in the seven and twentieth year in the
first month in the first day of the month the word of the lord came
unto me say 29:18 son of man nebuchadrezzar king of babylon
caus hi armi to serv a great servic against tyrus: everi head wa
made bald and everi shoulder wa peeled: yet had he no wage nor hi
armi for tyru for the servic that he had serv against it: 29:19
therefor thu saith the lord god; behold i will give the land of
egypt unto nebuchadrezzar king of babylon; and he shall take her
multitud and take her spoil and take her prey; and it shall be the
wage for hi armi

29:20 i have given him the land of egypt for hi labour wherewith he
serv against it becaus they wrought for me saith the lord god

29:21 in that day will i caus the horn of the hous of israel to bud
forth and i will give thee the open of the mouth in the midst of
them; and they shall know that i am the lord

30:1 the word of the lord came again unto me say 30:2 son of man
prophesi and say thu saith the lord god; howl ye woe worth the day!
30:3 for the day is near even the day of the lord is near a cloudi
day; it shall be the time of the heathen

30:4 and the sword shall come upon egypt and great pain shall be in
ethiopia when the slain shall fall in egypt and they shall take away
her multitud and her foundat shall be broken down

30:5 ethiopia and libya and lydia and all the mingl peopl and
chub and the men of the land that is in leagu shall fall with them
by the sword

30:6 thu saith the lord; they also that uphold egypt shall fall; and
the pride of her power shall come down: from the tower of syen shall
they fall in it by the sword saith the lord god

30:7 and they shall be desol in the midst of the countri that are
desol and her citi shall be in the midst of the citi that are
wast

30:8 and they shall know that i am the lord when i have set a fire in
egypt and when all her helper shall be destroy

30:9 in that day shall messeng go forth from me in ship to make
the careless ethiopian afraid and great pain shall come upon them
as in the day of egypt: for lo it cometh

30:10 thu saith the lord god; i will also make the multitud of egypt
to ceas by the hand of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon

30:11 he and hi peopl with him the terribl of the nation shall
be brought to destroy the land: and they shall draw their sword
against egypt and fill the land with the slain

30:12 and i will make the river dri and sell the land into the hand
of the wicked: and i will make the land wast and all that is
therein by the hand of strangers: i the lord have spoken it

30:13 thu saith the lord god; i will also destroy the idol and i
will caus their imag to ceas out of noph; and there shall be no
more a princ of the land of egypt: and i will put a fear in the land
of egypt

30:14 and i will make pathro desol and will set fire in zoan and
will execut judgment in no

30:15 and i will pour my furi upon sin the strength of egypt; and i
will cut off the multitud of no

30:16 and i will set fire in egypt: sin shall have great pain and no
shall be rent asund and noph shall have distress daili

30:17 the young men of aven and of pibeseth shall fall by the sword:
and these citi shall go into captiv

30:18 at tehaphneh also the day shall be darken when i shall
break there the yoke of egypt: and the pomp of her strength shall
ceas in her: as for her a cloud shall cover her and her daughter
shall go into captiv

30:19 thu will i execut judgment in egypt: and they shall know that
i am the lord

30:20 and it came to pass in the eleventh year in the first month in
the seventh day of the month that the word of the lord came unto me
say 30:21 son of man i have broken the arm of pharaoh king of
egypt; and lo it shall not be bound up to be heal to put a roller
to bind it to make it strong to hold the sword

30:22 therefor thu saith the lord god; behold i am against pharaoh
king of egypt and will break hi arm the strong and that which wa
broken; and i will caus the sword to fall out of hi hand

30:23 and i will scatter the egyptian among the nation and will
dispers them through the countri

30:24 and i will strengthen the arm of the king of babylon and put
my sword in hi hand: but i will break pharaoh arm and he shall
groan befor him with the groan of a deadli wound man

30:25 but i will strengthen the arm of the king of babylon and the
arm of pharaoh shall fall down; and they shall know that i am the
lord when i shall put my sword into the hand of the king of babylon
and he shall stretch it out upon the land of egypt

30:26 and i will scatter the egyptian among the nation and dispers
them among the countries; and they shall know that i am the lord

31:1 and it came to pass in the eleventh year in the third month in
the first day of the month that the word of the lord came unto me
say 31:2 son of man speak unto pharaoh king of egypt and to hi
multitude; whom art thou like in thi greatness? 31:3 behold the
assyrian wa a cedar in lebanon with fair branch and with a
shadow shroud and of an high stature; and hi top wa among the
thick bough

31:4 the water made him great the deep set him up on high with her
river run round about hi plant and sent her littl river unto
all the tree of the field

31:5 therefor hi height wa exalt abov all the tree of the
field and hi bough were multipli and hi branch becam long
becaus of the multitud of water when he shot forth

31:6 all the fowl of heaven made their nest in hi bough and under
hi branch did all the beast of the field bring forth their young
and under hi shadow dwelt all great nation

31:7 thu wa he fair in hi great in the length of hi branches:
for hi root wa by great water

31:8 the cedar in the garden of god could not hide him: the fir tree
were not like hi bough and the chestnut tree were not like hi
branches; nor ani tree in the garden of god wa like unto him in hi
beauti

31:9 i have made him fair by the multitud of hi branches: so that
all the tree of eden that were in the garden of god envi him

31:10 therefor thu saith the lord god; becaus thou hast lift up
thyself in height and he hath shot up hi top among the thick bough
and hi heart is lift up in hi height; 31:11 i have therefor
deliv him into the hand of the mighti one of the heathen; he shall
sure deal with him: i have driven him out for hi wicked

31:12 and stranger the terribl of the nation have cut him off
and have left him: upon the mountain and in all the valley hi
branch are fallen and hi bough are broken by all the river of
the land; and all the peopl of the earth are gone down from hi
shadow and have left him

31:13 upon hi ruin shall all the fowl of the heaven remain and all
the beast of the field shall be upon hi branches: 31:14 to the end
that none of all the tree by the water exalt themselv for their
height neither shoot up their top among the thick bough neither
their tree stand up in their height all that drink water: for they
are all deliv unto death to the nether part of the earth in the
midst of the children of men with them that go down to the pit

31:15 thu saith the lord god; in the day when he went down to the
grave i caus a mourning: i cover the deep for him and i
restrain the flood thereof and the great water were stayed: and i
caus lebanon to mourn for him and all the tree of the field
faint for him

31:16 i made the nation to shake at the sound of hi fall when i
cast him down to hell with them that descend into the pit: and all the
tree of eden the choic and best of lebanon all that drink water
shall be comfort in the nether part of the earth

31:17 they also went down into hell with him unto them that be slain
with the sword; and they that were hi arm that dwelt under hi
shadow in the midst of the heathen

31:18 to whom art thou thu like in glori and in great among the
tree of eden? yet shalt thou be brought down with the tree of eden
unto the nether part of the earth: thou shalt lie in the midst of the
uncircumcis with them that be slain by the sword thi is pharaoh
and all hi multitud saith the lord god

32:1 and it came to pass in the twelfth year in the twelfth month in
the first day of the month that the word of the lord came unto me
say 32:2 son of man take up a lament for pharaoh king of
egypt and say unto him thou art like a young lion of the nation
and thou art as a whale in the seas: and thou camest forth with thi
river and troubledst the water with thi feet and fouledst their
river

32:3 thu saith the lord god; i will therefor spread out my net over
thee with a compani of mani people; and they shall bring thee up in my
net

32:4 then will i leav thee upon the land i will cast thee forth upon
the open field and will caus all the fowl of the heaven to remain
upon thee and i will fill the beast of the whole earth with thee

32:5 and i will lay thi flesh upon the mountain and fill the valley
with thi height

32:6 i will also water with thi blood the land wherein thou swimmest
even to the mountains; and the river shall be full of thee

32:7 and when i shall put thee out i will cover the heaven and make
the star thereof dark; i will cover the sun with a cloud and the
moon shall not give her light

32:8 all the bright light of heaven will i make dark over thee and
set dark upon thi land saith the lord god

32:9 i will also vex the heart of mani peopl when i shall bring thi
destruct among the nation into the countri which thou hast not
known

32:10 yea i will make mani peopl amaz at thee and their king
shall be horribl afraid for thee when i shall brandish my sword
befor them; and they shall trembl at everi moment everi man for hi
own life in the day of thi fall

32:11 for thu saith the lord god; the sword of the king of babylon
shall come upon thee

32:12 by the sword of the mighti will i caus thi multitud to fall
the terribl of the nation all of them: and they shall spoil the
pomp of egypt and all the multitud thereof shall be destroy

32:13 i will destroy also all the beast thereof from besid the great
waters; neither shall the foot of man troubl them ani more nor the
hoof of beast troubl them

32:14 then will i make their water deep and caus their river to
run like oil saith the lord god

32:15 when i shall make the land of egypt desol and the countri
shall be destitut of that whereof it wa full when i shall smite all
them that dwell therein then shall they know that i am the lord

32:16 thi is the lament wherewith they shall lament her: the
daughter of the nation shall lament her: they shall lament for her
even for egypt and for all her multitud saith the lord god

32:17 it came to pass also in the twelfth year in the fifteenth day
of the month that the word of the lord came unto me say 32:18
son of man wail for the multitud of egypt and cast them down even
her and the daughter of the famou nation unto the nether part of
the earth with them that go down into the pit

32:19 whom dost thou pass in beauty? go down and be thou laid with
the uncircumcis

32:20 they shall fall in the midst of them that are slain by the
sword: she is deliv to the sword: draw her and all her multitud

32:21 the strong among the mighti shall speak to him out of the midst
of hell with them that help him: they are gone down they lie
uncircumcis slain by the sword

32:22 asshur is there and all her company: hi grave are about him:
all of them slain fallen by the sword: 32:23 whose grave are set in
the side of the pit and her compani is round about her grave: all of
them slain fallen by the sword which caus terror in the land of
the live

32:24 there is elam and all her multitud round about her grave all
of them slain fallen by the sword which are gone down uncircumcis
into the nether part of the earth which caus their terror in the
land of the living; yet have they born their shame with them that go
down to the pit

32:25 they have set her a bed in the midst of the slain with all her
multitude: her grave are round about him: all of them uncircumcis
slain by the sword: though their terror wa caus in the land of the
live yet have they born their shame with them that go down to the
pit: he is put in the midst of them that be slain

32:26 there is meshech tubal and all her multitude: her grave are
round about him: all of them uncircumcis slain by the sword though
they caus their terror in the land of the live

32:27 and they shall not lie with the mighti that are fallen of the
uncircumcis which are gone down to hell with their weapon of war:
and they have laid their sword under their head but their
iniqu shall be upon their bone though they were the terror of
the mighti in the land of the live

32:28 yea thou shalt be broken in the midst of the uncircumcis and
shalt lie with them that are slain with the sword

32:29 there is edom her king and all her princ which with their
might are laid by them that were slain by the sword: they shall lie
with the uncircumcis and with them that go down to the pit

32:30 there be the princ of the north all of them and all the
zidonian which are gone down with the slain; with their terror they
are asham of their might; and they lie uncircumcis with them that
be slain by the sword and bear their shame with them that go down to
the pit

32:31 pharaoh shall see them and shall be comfort over all hi
multitud even pharaoh and all hi armi slain by the sword saith the
lord god

32:32 for i have caus my terror in the land of the living: and he
shall be laid in the midst of the uncircumcis with them that are
slain with the sword even pharaoh and all hi multitud saith the
lord god

33:1 again the word of the lord came unto me say 33:2 son of man
speak to the children of thi peopl and say unto them when i bring
the sword upon a land if the peopl of the land take a man of their
coast and set him for their watchman: 33:3 if when he seeth the
sword come upon the land he blow the trumpet and warn the people;
33:4 then whosoev heareth the sound of the trumpet and taketh not
warning; if the sword come and take him away hi blood shall be upon
hi own head

33:5 he heard the sound of the trumpet and took not warning; hi
blood shall be upon him but he that taketh warn shall deliv hi
soul

33:6 but if the watchman see the sword come and blow not the trumpet
and the peopl be not warned; if the sword come and take ani person
from among them he is taken away in hi iniquity; but hi blood will
i requir at the watchman hand

33:7 so thou o son of man i have set thee a watchman unto the hous
of israel; therefor thou shalt hear the word at my mouth and warn
them from me

33:8 when i say unto the wick o wick man thou shalt sure die;
if thou dost not speak to warn the wick from hi way that wick
man shall die in hi iniquity; but hi blood will i requir at thine
hand

33:9 nevertheless if thou warn the wick of hi way to turn from it;
if he do not turn from hi way he shall die in hi iniquity; but thou
hast deliv thi soul

33:10 therefor o thou son of man speak unto the hous of israel;
thu ye speak say if our transgress and our sin be upon us
and we pine away in them how should we then live? 33:11 say unto
them as i live saith the lord god i have no pleasur in the death
of the wicked; but that the wick turn from hi way and live: turn
ye turn ye from your evil ways; for whi will ye die o hous of
israel? 33:12 therefor thou son of man say unto the children of
thi peopl the righteous of the righteou shall not deliv him
in the day of hi transgression: as for the wicked of the wick
he shall not fall therebi in the day that he turneth from hi
wickedness; neither shall the righteou be abl to live for hi
righteous in the day that he sinneth

33:13 when i shall say to the righteou that he shall sure live; if
he trust to hi own righteous and commit iniqu all hi
righteous shall not be remembered; but for hi iniqu that he
hath commit he shall die for it

33:14 again when i say unto the wick thou shalt sure die; if he
turn from hi sin and do that which is law and right; 33:15 if the
wick restor the pledg give again that he had rob walk in the
statut of life without commit iniquity; he shall sure live
he shall not die

33:16 none of hi sin that he hath commit shall be mention unto
him: he hath done that which is law and right; he shall sure
live

33:17 yet the children of thi peopl say the way of the lord is not
equal: but as for them their way is not equal

33:18 when the righteou turneth from hi righteous and
committeth iniqu he shall even die therebi

33:19 but if the wick turn from hi wicked and do that which is
law and right he shall live therebi

33:20 yet ye say the way of the lord is not equal o ye hous of
israel i will judg you everi one after hi way

33:21 and it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captiv in the
tenth month in the fifth day of the month that one that had escap
out of jerusalem came unto me say the citi is smitten

33:22 now the hand of the lord wa upon me in the even afor he
that wa escap came; and had open my mouth until he came to me in
the morning; and my mouth wa open and i wa no more dumb

33:23 then the word of the lord came unto me say 33:24 son of
man they that inhabit those wast of the land of israel speak
say abraham wa one and he inherit the land: but we are many;
the land is given us for inherit

33:25 wherefor say unto them thu saith the lord god; ye eat with
the blood and lift up your eye toward your idol and shed blood:
and shall ye possess the land? 33:26 ye stand upon your sword ye
work abomin and ye defil everi one hi neighbour wife: and
shall ye possess the land? 33:27 say thou thu unto them thu saith
the lord god; as i live sure they that are in the wast shall fall
by the sword and him that is in the open field will i give to the
beast to be devour and they that be in the fort and in the cave
shall die of the pestil

33:28 for i will lay the land most desol and the pomp of her
strength shall cease; and the mountain of israel shall be desol
that none shall pass through

33:29 then shall they know that i am the lord when i have laid the
land most desol becaus of all their abomin which they have
commit

33:30 also thou son of man the children of thi peopl still are
talk against thee by the wall and in the door of the hous and
speak one to anoth everi one to hi brother say come i pray
you and hear what is the word that cometh forth from the lord

33:31 and they come unto thee as the peopl cometh and they sit
befor thee as my peopl and they hear thi word but they will not
do them: for with their mouth they shew much love but their heart
goeth after their covet

33:32 and lo thou art unto them as a veri love song of one that
hath a pleasant voic and can play well on an instrument: for they
hear thi word but they do them not

33:33 and when thi cometh to pass (lo it will come) then shall
they know that a prophet hath been among them

34:1 and the word of the lord came unto me say 34:2 son of man
prophesi against the shepherd of israel prophesi and say unto them
thu saith the lord god unto the shepherds; woe be to the shepherd of
israel that do feed themselves! should not the shepherd feed the
flocks? 34:3 ye eat the fat and ye cloth you with the wool ye kill
them that are fed: but ye feed not the flock

34:4 the diseas have ye not strengthen neither have ye heal
that which wa sick neither have ye bound up that which wa broken
neither have ye brought again that which wa driven away neither have
ye sought that which wa lost; but with forc and with cruelti have ye
rule them

34:5 and they were scatter becaus there is no shepherd: and they
becam meat to all the beast of the field when they were scatter

34:6 my sheep wander through all the mountain and upon everi high
hill: yea my flock wa scatter upon all the face of the earth and
none did search or seek after them

34:7 therefor ye shepherd hear the word of the lord; 34:8 as i
live saith the lord god sure becaus my flock becam a prey and
my flock becam meat to everi beast of the field becaus there wa no
shepherd neither did my shepherd search for my flock but the
shepherd fed themselv and fed not my flock; 34:9 therefor o ye
shepherd hear the word of the lord; 34:10 thu saith the lord god;
behold i am against the shepherds; and i will requir my flock at
their hand and caus them to ceas from feed the flock; neither
shall the shepherd feed themselv ani more; for i will deliv my
flock from their mouth that they may not be meat for them

34:11 for thu saith the lord god; behold i even i will both search
my sheep and seek them out

34:12 as a shepherd seeketh out hi flock in the day that he is among
hi sheep that are scattered; so will i seek out my sheep and will
deliv them out of all place where they have been scatter in the
cloudi and dark day

34:13 and i will bring them out from the peopl and gather them from
the countri and will bring them to their own land and feed them
upon the mountain of israel by the river and in all the inhabit
place of the countri

34:14 i will feed them in a good pastur and upon the high mountain
of israel shall their fold be: there shall they lie in a good fold
and in a fat pastur shall they feed upon the mountain of israel

34:15 i will feed my flock and i will caus them to lie down saith
the lord god

34:16 i will seek that which wa lost and bring again that which wa
driven away and will bind up that which wa broken and will
strengthen that which wa sick: but i will destroy the fat and the
strong; i will feed them with judgment

34:17 and as for you o my flock thu saith the lord god; behold i
judg between cattl and cattl between the ram and the he goat

34:18 seemeth it a small thing unto you to have eaten up the good
pastur but ye must tread down with your feet the residu of your
pastures? and to have drunk of the deep water but ye must foul the
residu with your feet? 34:19 and as for my flock they eat that
which ye have trodden with your feet; and they drink that which ye
have foul with your feet

34:20 therefor thu saith the lord god unto them; behold i even i
will judg between the fat cattl and between the lean cattl

34:21 becaus ye have thrust with side and with shoulder and push
all the diseas with your horn till ye have scatter them abroad;
34:22 therefor will i save my flock and they shall no more be a
prey; and i will judg between cattl and cattl

34:23 and i will set up one shepherd over them and he shall feed
them even my servant david; he shall feed them and he shall be their
shepherd

34:24 and i the lord will be their god and my servant david a princ
among them; i the lord have spoken it

34:25 and i will make with them a coven of peac and will caus
the evil beast to ceas out of the land: and they shall dwell safe
in the wilder and sleep in the wood

34:26 and i will make them and the place round about my hill a
blessing; and i will caus the shower to come down in hi season;
there shall be shower of bless

34:27 and the tree of the field shall yield her fruit and the earth
shall yield her increas and they shall be safe in their land and
shall know that i am the lord when i have broken the band of their
yoke and deliv them out of the hand of those that serv
themselv of them

34:28 and they shall no more be a prey to the heathen neither shall
the beast of the land devour them; but they shall dwell safe and
none shall make them afraid

34:29 and i will rais up for them a plant of renown and they shall
be no more consum with hunger in the land neither bear the shame of
the heathen ani more

34:30 thu shall they know that i the lord their god am with them and
that they even the hous of israel are my peopl saith the lord
god

34:31 and ye my flock the flock of my pastur are men and i am your
god saith the lord god

35:1 moreov the word of the lord came unto me say 35:2 son of
man set thi face against mount seir and prophesi against it 35:3
and say unto it thu saith the lord god; behold o mount seir i am
against thee and i will stretch out mine hand against thee and i
will make thee most desol

35:4 i will lay thi citi wast and thou shalt be desol and thou
shalt know that i am the lord

35:5 becaus thou hast had a perpetu hatr and hast shed the blood
of the children of israel by the forc of the sword in the time of
their calam in the time that their iniqu had an end: 35:6
therefor as i live saith the lord god i will prepar thee unto
blood and blood shall pursu thee: sith thou hast not hate blood
even blood shall pursu thee

35:7 thu will i make mount seir most desol and cut off from it
him that passeth out and him that returneth

35:8 and i will fill hi mountain with hi slain men: in thi hill
and in thi valley and in all thi river shall they fall that are
slain with the sword

35:9 i will make thee perpetu desol and thi citi shall not
return: and ye shall know that i am the lord

35:10 becaus thou hast said these two nation and these two
countri shall be mine and we will possess it; wherea the lord wa
there: 35:11 therefor as i live saith the lord god i will even do
accord to thine anger and accord to thine envi which thou hast
use out of thi hatr against them; and i will make myself known
among them when i have judg thee

35:12 and thou shalt know that i am the lord and that i have heard
all thi blasphemi which thou hast spoken against the mountain of
israel say they are laid desol they are given us to consum

35:13 thu with your mouth ye have boast against me and have
multipli your word against me: i have heard them

35:14 thu saith the lord god; when the whole earth rejoiceth i will
make thee desol

35:15 as thou didst rejoic at the inherit of the hous of israel
becaus it wa desol so will i do unto thee: thou shalt be
desol o mount seir and all idumea even all of it: and they shall
know that i am the lord

36:1 also thou son of man prophesi unto the mountain of israel and
say ye mountain of israel hear the word of the lord: 36:2 thu
saith the lord god; becaus the enemi hath said against you aha even
the ancient high place are our in possession: 36:3 therefor
prophesi and say thu saith the lord god; becaus they have made you
desol and swallow you up on everi side that ye might be a
possess unto the residu of the heathen and ye are taken up in the
lip of talker and are an infami of the people: 36:4 therefor ye
mountain of israel hear the word of the lord god; thu saith the
lord god to the mountain and to the hill to the river and to the
valley to the desol wast and to the citi that are forsaken
which becam a prey and deris to the residu of the heathen that
are round about; 36:5 therefor thu saith the lord god; sure in the
fire of my jealousi have i spoken against the residu of the heathen
and against all idumea which have appoint my land into their
possess with the joy of all their heart with despit mind to
cast it out for a prey

36:6 prophesi therefor concern the land of israel and say unto
the mountain and to the hill to the river and to the valley
thu saith the lord god; behold i have spoken in my jealousi and in
my furi becaus ye have born the shame of the heathen: 36:7
therefor thu saith the lord god; i have lift up mine hand sure
the heathen that are about you they shall bear their shame

36:8 but ye o mountain of israel ye shall shoot forth your
branch and yield your fruit to my peopl of israel; for they are at
hand to come

36:9 for behold i am for you and i will turn unto you and ye shall
be till and sown: 36:10 and i will multipli men upon you all the
hous of israel even all of it: and the citi shall be inhabit
and the wast shall be builded: 36:11 and i will multipli upon you
man and beast; and they shall increas and bring fruit: and i will
settl you after your old estat and will do better unto you than at
your beginnings: and ye shall know that i am the lord

36:12 yea i will caus men to walk upon you even my peopl israel;
and they shall possess thee and thou shalt be their inherit and
thou shalt no more henceforth bereav them of men

36:13 thu saith the lord god; becaus they say unto you thou land
devourest up men and hast bereav thi nations: 36:14 therefor thou
shalt devour men no more neither bereav thi nation ani more saith
the lord god

36:15 neither will i caus men to hear in thee the shame of the
heathen ani more neither shalt thou bear the reproach of the peopl
ani more neither shalt thou caus thi nation to fall ani more saith
the lord god

36:16 moreov the word of the lord came unto me say 36:17 son of
man when the hous of israel dwelt in their own land they defil it
by their own way and by their doings: their way wa befor me as the
unclean of a remov woman

36:18 wherefor i pour my furi upon them for the blood that they had
shed upon the land and for their idol wherewith they had pollut
it: 36:19 and i scatter them among the heathen and they were
dispers through the countries: accord to their way and accord
to their do i judg them

36:20 and when they enter unto the heathen whither they went they
profan my holi name when they said to them these are the peopl of
the lord and are gone forth out of hi land

36:21 but i had piti for mine holi name which the hous of israel had
profan among the heathen whither they went

36:22 therefor say unto the hous of israel thu saith the lord god;
i do not thi for your sake o hous of israel but for mine holi
name sake which ye have profan among the heathen whither ye
went

36:23 and i will sanctifi my great name which wa profan among the
heathen which ye have profan in the midst of them; and the heathen
shall know that i am the lord saith the lord god when i shall be
sanctifi in you befor their eye

36:24 for i will take you from among the heathen and gather you out
of all countri and will bring you into your own land

36:25 then will i sprinkl clean water upon you and ye shall be
clean: from all your filthi and from all your idol will i
cleans you

36:26 a new heart also will i give you and a new spirit will i put
within you: and i will take away the stoni heart out of your flesh
and i will give you an heart of flesh

36:27 and i will put my spirit within you and caus you to walk in my
statut and ye shall keep my judgment and do them

36:28 and ye shall dwell in the land that i gave to your fathers; and
ye shall be my peopl and i will be your god

36:29 i will also save you from all your uncleannesses: and i will
call for the corn and will increas it and lay no famin upon you

36:30 and i will multipli the fruit of the tree and the increas of
the field that ye shall receiv no more reproach of famin among the
heathen

36:31 then shall ye rememb your own evil way and your do that
were not good and shall loth yourselv in your own sight for your
iniqu and for your abomin

36:32 not for your sake do i thi saith the lord god be it known
unto you: be asham and confound for your own way o hous of
israel

36:33 thu saith the lord god; in the day that i shall have cleans
you from all your iniqu i will also caus you to dwell in the
citi and the wast shall be build

36:34 and the desol land shall be till wherea it lay desol
in the sight of all that pass by

36:35 and they shall say thi land that wa desol is becom like
the garden of eden; and the wast and desol and ruin citi are
becom fenc and are inhabit

36:36 then the heathen that are left round about you shall know that i
the lord build the ruin place and plant that that wa desolate: i
the lord have spoken it and i will do it

36:37 thu saith the lord god; i will yet for thi be enquir of by
the hous of israel to do it for them; i will increas them with men
like a flock

36:38 as the holi flock as the flock of jerusalem in her solemn
feasts; so shall the wast citi be fill with flock of men: and
they shall know that i am the lord

37:1 the hand of the lord wa upon me and carri me out in the
spirit of the lord and set me down in the midst of the valley which
wa full of bone 37:2 and caus me to pass by them round about:
and behold there were veri mani in the open valley; and lo they
were veri dri

37:3 and he said unto me son of man can these bone live? and i
answer o lord god thou knowest

37:4 again he said unto me prophesi upon these bone and say unto
them o ye dri bone hear the word of the lord

37:5 thu saith the lord god unto these bones; behold i will caus
breath to enter into you and ye shall live: 37:6 and i will lay
sinew upon you and will bring up flesh upon you and cover you with
skin and put breath in you and ye shall live; and ye shall know that
i am the lord

37:7 so i prophesi as i wa commanded: and as i prophesi there
wa a nois and behold a shake and the bone came togeth bone
to hi bone

37:8 and when i beheld lo the sinew and the flesh came up upon
them and the skin cover them above: but there wa no breath in
them

37:9 then said he unto me prophesi unto the wind prophesi son of
man and say to the wind thu saith the lord god; come from the four
wind o breath and breath upon these slain that they may live

37:10 so i prophesi as he command me and the breath came into
them and they live and stood up upon their feet an exceed great
armi

37:11 then he said unto me son of man these bone are the whole
hous of israel: behold they say our bone are dri and our hope
is lost: we are cut off for our part

37:12 therefor prophesi and say unto them thu saith the lord god;
behold o my peopl i will open your grave and caus you to come up
out of your grave and bring you into the land of israel

37:13 and ye shall know that i am the lord when i have open your
grave o my peopl and brought you up out of your grave 37:14 and
shall put my spirit in you and ye shall live and i shall place you
in your own land: then shall ye know that i the lord have spoken it
and perform it saith the lord

37:15 the word of the lord came again unto me say 37:16 moreov
thou son of man take thee one stick and write upon it for judah
and for the children of israel hi companions: then take anoth
stick and write upon it for joseph the stick of ephraim and for all
the hous of israel hi companions: 37:17 and join them one to anoth
into one stick; and they shall becom one in thine hand

37:18 and when the children of thi peopl shall speak unto thee
say wilt thou not shew us what thou meanest by these? 37:19 say
unto them thu saith the lord god; behold i will take the stick of
joseph which is in the hand of ephraim and the tribe of israel hi
fellow and will put them with him even with the stick of judah and
make them one stick and they shall be one in mine hand

37:20 and the stick whereon thou writest shall be in thine hand
befor their eye

37:21 and say unto them thu saith the lord god; behold i will take
the children of israel from among the heathen whither they be gone
and will gather them on everi side and bring them into their own
land: 37:22 and i will make them one nation in the land upon the
mountain of israel; and one king shall be king to them all: and they
shall be no more two nation neither shall they be divid into two
kingdom ani more at all

37:23 neither shall they defil themselv ani more with their idol
nor with their detest thing nor with ani of their
transgressions: but i will save them out of all their dwellingplac
wherein they have sin and will cleans them: so shall they be my
peopl and i will be their god

37:24 and david my servant shall be king over them; and they all shall
have one shepherd: they shall also walk in my judgment and observ
my statut and do them

37:25 and they shall dwell in the land that i have given unto jacob my
servant wherein your father have dwelt; and they shall dwell
therein even they and their children and their children children
for ever: and my servant david shall be their princ for ever

37:26 moreov i will make a coven of peac with them; it shall be
an everlast coven with them: and i will place them and multipli
them and will set my sanctuari in the midst of them for evermor

37:27 my tabernacl also shall be with them: yea i will be their god
and they shall be my peopl

37:28 and the heathen shall know that i the lord do sanctifi israel
when my sanctuari shall be in the midst of them for evermor

38:1 and the word of the lord came unto me say 38:2 son of man
set thi face against gog the land of magog the chief princ of
meshech and tubal and prophesi against him 38:3 and say thu saith
the lord god; behold i am against thee o gog the chief princ of
meshech and tubal: 38:4 and i will turn thee back and put hook into
thi jaw and i will bring thee forth and all thine armi hors and
horsemen all of them cloth with all sort of armour even a great
compani with buckler and shield all of them handl swords: 38:5
persia ethiopia and libya with them; all of them with shield and
helmet: 38:6 gomer and all hi bands; the hous of togarmah of the
north quarter and all hi bands: and mani peopl with thee

38:7 be thou prepar and prepar for thyself thou and all thi
compani that are assembl unto thee and be thou a guard unto them

38:8 after mani day thou shalt be visited: in the latter year thou
shalt come into the land that is brought back from the sword and is
gather out of mani peopl against the mountain of israel which
have been alway waste: but it is brought forth out of the nation
and they shall dwell safe all of them

38:9 thou shalt ascend and come like a storm thou shalt be like a
cloud to cover the land thou and all thi band and mani peopl with
thee

38:10 thu saith the lord god; it shall also come to pass that at the
same time shall thing come into thi mind and thou shalt think an
evil thought: 38:11 and thou shalt say i will go up to the land of
unwal villages; i will go to them that are at rest that dwell
safe all of them dwell without wall and have neither bar
nor gate 38:12 to take a spoil and to take a prey; to turn thine
hand upon the desol place that are now inhabit and upon the
peopl that are gather out of the nation which have gotten cattl
and good that dwell in the midst of the land

38:13 sheba and dedan and the merchant of tarshish with all the
young lion thereof shall say unto thee art thou come to take a
spoil? hast thou gather thi compani to take a prey? to carri away
silver and gold to take away cattl and good to take a great spoil?
38:14 therefor son of man prophesi and say unto gog thu saith the
lord god; in that day when my peopl of israel dwelleth safe shalt
thou not know it? 38:15 and thou shalt come from thi place out of the
north part thou and mani peopl with thee all of them ride upon
hors a great compani and a mighti army: 38:16 and thou shalt come
up against my peopl of israel as a cloud to cover the land; it shall
be in the latter day and i will bring thee against my land that the
heathen may know me when i shall be sanctifi in thee o gog befor
their eye

38:17 thu saith the lord god; art thou he of whom i have spoken in
old time by my servant the prophet of israel which prophesi in
those day mani year that i would bring thee against them? 38:18 and
it shall come to pass at the same time when gog shall come against the
land of israel saith the lord god that my furi shall come up in my
face

38:19 for in my jealousi and in the fire of my wrath have i spoken
sure in that day there shall be a great shake in the land of
israel; 38:20 so that the fish of the sea and the fowl of the
heaven and the beast of the field and all creep thing that
creep upon the earth and all the men that are upon the face of the
earth shall shake at my presenc and the mountain shall be thrown
down and the steep place shall fall and everi wall shall fall to
the ground

38:21 and i will call for a sword against him throughout all my
mountain saith the lord god: everi man sword shall be against hi
brother

38:22 and i will plead against him with pestil and with blood; and
i will rain upon him and upon hi band and upon the mani peopl
that are with him an overflow rain and great hailston fire
and brimston

38:23 thu will i magnifi myself and sanctifi myself; and i will be
known in the eye of mani nation and they shall know that i am the
lord

39:1 therefor thou son of man prophesi against gog and say thu
saith the lord god; behold i am against thee o gog the chief princ
of meshech and tubal: 39:2 and i will turn thee back and leav but
the sixth part of thee and will caus thee to come up from the north
part and will bring thee upon the mountain of israel: 39:3 and i
will smite thi bow out of thi left hand and will caus thine arrow
to fall out of thi right hand

39:4 thou shalt fall upon the mountain of israel thou and all thi
band and the peopl that is with thee: i will give thee unto the
raven bird of everi sort and to the beast of the field to be
devour

39:5 thou shalt fall upon the open field: for i have spoken it saith
the lord god

39:6 and i will send a fire on magog and among them that dwell
carelessli in the isles: and they shall know that i am the lord

39:7 so will i make my holi name known in the midst of my peopl
israel; and i will not let them pollut my holi name ani more: and the
heathen shall know that i am the lord the holi one in israel

39:8 behold it is come and it is done saith the lord god; thi is
the day whereof i have spoken

39:9 and they that dwell in the citi of israel shall go forth and
shall set on fire and burn the weapon both the shield and the
buckler the bow and the arrow and the handstav and the spear
and they shall burn them with fire seven years: 39:10 so that they
shall take no wood out of the field neither cut down ani out of the
forests; for they shall burn the weapon with fire: and they shall
spoil those that spoil them and rob those that rob them saith
the lord god

39:11 and it shall come to pass in that day that i will give unto gog
a place there of grave in israel the valley of the passeng on the
east of the sea: and it shall stop the nose of the passengers: and
there shall they buri gog and all hi multitude: and they shall call
it the valley of hamongog

39:12 and seven month shall the hous of israel be buri of them
that they may cleans the land

39:13 yea all the peopl of the land shall buri them; and it shall be
to them a renown the day that i shall be glorifi saith the lord
god

39:14 and they shall sever out men of continu employ pass
through the land to buri with the passeng those that remain upon
the face of the earth to cleans it: after the end of seven month
shall they search

39:15 and the passeng that pass through the land when ani seeth a
man bone then shall he set up a sign by it till the burier have
buri it in the valley of hamongog

39:16 and also the name of the citi shall be hamonah thu shall they
cleans the land

39:17 and thou son of man thu saith the lord god; speak unto everi
feather fowl and to everi beast of the field assembl yourselv
and come; gather yourselv on everi side to my sacrific that i do
sacrific for you even a great sacrific upon the mountain of
israel that ye may eat flesh and drink blood

39:18 ye shall eat the flesh of the mighti and drink the blood of the
princ of the earth of ram of lamb and of goat of bullock
all of them fatl of bashan

39:19 and ye shall eat fat till ye be full and drink blood till ye be
drunken of my sacrific which i have sacrif for you

39:20 thu ye shall be fill at my tabl with hors and chariot
with mighti men and with all men of war saith the lord god

39:21 and i will set my glori among the heathen and all the heathen
shall see my judgment that i have execut and my hand that i have
laid upon them

39:22 so the hous of israel shall know that i am the lord their god
from that day and forward

39:23 and the heathen shall know that the hous of israel went into
captiv for their iniquity: becaus they trespass against me
therefor hid i my face from them and gave them into the hand of
their enemies: so fell they all by the sword

39:24 accord to their unclean and accord to their
transgress have i done unto them and hid my face from them

39:25 therefor thu saith the lord god; now will i bring again the
captiv of jacob and have merci upon the whole hous of israel and
will be jealou for my holi name; 39:26 after that they have born
their shame and all their trespass wherebi they have trespass
against me when they dwelt safe in their land and none made them
afraid

39:27 when i have brought them again from the peopl and gather
them out of their enemi land and am sanctifi in them in the
sight of mani nations; 39:28 then shall they know that i am the lord
their god which caus them to be led into captiv among the
heathen: but i have gather them unto their own land and have left
none of them ani more there

39:29 neither will i hide my face ani more from them: for i have
pour out my spirit upon the hous of israel saith the lord god

40:1 in the five and twentieth year of our captiv in the begin
of the year in the tenth day of the month in the fourteenth year
after that the citi wa smitten in the selfsam day the hand of the
lord wa upon me and brought me thither

40:2 in the vision of god brought he me into the land of israel and
set me upon a veri high mountain by which wa as the frame of a citi
on the south

40:3 and he brought me thither and behold there wa a man whose
appear wa like the appear of brass with a line of flax in
hi hand and a measur reed; and he stood in the gate

40:4 and the man said unto me son of man behold with thine eye and
hear with thine ear and set thine heart upon all that i shall shew
thee; for to the intent that i might shew them unto thee art thou
brought hither: declar all that thou seest to the hous of israel

40:5 and behold a wall on the outsid of the hous round about and in
the man hand a measur reed of six cubit long by the cubit and an
hand breadth: so he measur the breadth of the build one reed;
and the height one reed

40:6 then came he unto the gate which looketh toward the east and
went up the stair thereof and measur the threshold of the gate
which wa one reed broad; and the other threshold of the gate which
wa one reed broad

40:7 and everi littl chamber wa one reed long and one reed broad;
and between the littl chamber were five cubits; and the threshold of
the gate by the porch of the gate within wa one reed

40:8 he measur also the porch of the gate within one reed

40:9 then measur he the porch of the gate eight cubits; and the
post thereof two cubits; and the porch of the gate wa inward

40:10 and the littl chamber of the gate eastward were three on thi
side and three on that side; they three were of one measure: and the
post had one measur on thi side and on that side

40:11 and he measur the breadth of the entri of the gate ten
cubits; and the length of the gate thirteen cubit

40:12 the space also befor the littl chamber wa one cubit on thi
side and the space wa one cubit on that side: and the littl
chamber were six cubit on thi side and six cubit on that side

40:13 he measur then the gate from the roof of one littl chamber to
the roof of another: the breadth wa five and twenti cubit door
against door

40:14 he made also post of threescor cubit even unto the post of
the court round about the gate

40:15 and from the face of the gate of the entranc unto the face of
the porch of the inner gate were fifti cubit

40:16 and there were narrow window to the littl chamber and to
their post within the gate round about and likewis to the arches:
and window were round about inward: and upon each post were palm
tree

40:17 then brought he me into the outward court and lo there were
chamber and a pavement made for the court round about: thirti
chamber were upon the pavement

40:18 and the pavement by the side of the gate over against the
length of the gate wa the lower pavement

40:19 then he measur the breadth from the forefront of the lower
gate unto the forefront of the inner court without an hundr cubit
eastward and northward

40:20 and the gate of the outward court that look toward the north
he measur the length thereof and the breadth thereof

40:21 and the littl chamber thereof were three on thi side and
three on that side; and the post thereof and the arch thereof were
after the measur of the first gate: the length thereof wa fifti
cubit and the breadth five and twenti cubit

40:22 and their window and their arch and their palm tree were
after the measur of the gate that looketh toward the east; and they
went up unto it by seven steps; and the arch thereof were befor
them

40:23 and the gate of the inner court wa over against the gate toward
the north and toward the east; and he measur from gate to gate an
hundr cubit

40:24 after that he brought me toward the south and behold a gate
toward the south: and he measur the post thereof and the arch
thereof accord to these measur

40:25 and there were window in it and in the arch thereof round
about like those windows: the length wa fifti cubit and the
breadth five and twenti cubit

40:26 and there were seven step to go up to it and the arch
thereof were befor them: and it had palm tree one on thi side and
anoth on that side upon the post thereof

40:27 and there wa a gate in the inner court toward the south: and he
measur from gate to gate toward the south an hundr cubit

40:28 and he brought me to the inner court by the south gate: and he
measur the south gate accord to these measures; 40:29 and the
littl chamber thereof and the post thereof and the arch
thereof accord to these measures: and there were window in it and
in the arch thereof round about: it wa fifti cubit long and five
and twenti cubit broad

40:30 and the arch round about were five and twenti cubit long and
five cubit broad

40:31 and the arch thereof were toward the utter court; and palm
tree were upon the post thereof: and the go up to it had eight
step

40:32 and he brought me into the inner court toward the east: and he
measur the gate accord to these measur

40:33 and the littl chamber thereof and the post thereof and the
arch thereof were accord to these measures: and there were
window therein and in the arch thereof round about: it wa fifti
cubit long and five and twenti cubit broad

40:34 and the arch thereof were toward the outward court; and palm
tree were upon the post thereof on thi side and on that side: and
the go up to it had eight step

40:35 and he brought me to the north gate and measur it accord
to these measures; 40:36 the littl chamber thereof the post
thereof and the arch thereof and the window to it round about:
the length wa fifti cubit and the breadth five and twenti cubit

40:37 and the post thereof were toward the utter court; and palm
tree were upon the post thereof on thi side and on that side: and
the go up to it had eight step

40:38 and the chamber and the entri thereof were by the post of
the gate where they wash the burnt offer

40:39 and in the porch of the gate were two tabl on thi side and
two tabl on that side to slay thereon the burnt offer and the
sin offer and the trespass offer

40:40 and at the side without as one goeth up to the entri of the
north gate were two tables; and on the other side which wa at the
porch of the gate were two tabl

40:41 four tabl were on thi side and four tabl on that side by
the side of the gate; eight tabl whereupon they slew their
sacrific

40:42 and the four tabl were of hewn stone for the burnt offer
of a cubit and an half long and a cubit and an half broad and one
cubit high: whereupon also they laid the instrument wherewith they
slew the burnt offer and the sacrific

40:43 and within were hook an hand broad fasten round about: and
upon the tabl wa the flesh of the offer

40:44 and without the inner gate were the chamber of the singer in
the inner court which wa at the side of the north gate; and their
prospect wa toward the south: one at the side of the east gate have
the prospect toward the north

40:45 and he said unto me thi chamber whose prospect is toward the
south is for the priest the keeper of the charg of the hous

40:46 and the chamber whose prospect is toward the north is for the
priest the keeper of the charg of the altar: these are the son of
zadok among the son of levi which come near to the lord to minist
unto him

40:47 so he measur the court an hundr cubit long and an hundr
cubit broad foursquare; and the altar that wa befor the hous

40:48 and he brought me to the porch of the hous and measur each
post of the porch five cubit on thi side and five cubit on that
side: and the breadth of the gate wa three cubit on thi side and
three cubit on that side

40:49 the length of the porch wa twenti cubit and the breadth
eleven cubit and he brought me by the step wherebi they went up to
it: and there were pillar by the post one on thi side and anoth
on that side

41:1 afterward he brought me to the templ and measur the post
six cubit broad on the one side and six cubit broad on the other
side which wa the breadth of the tabernacl

41:2 and the breadth of the door wa ten cubits; and the side of the
door were five cubit on the one side and five cubit on the other
side: and he measur the length thereof forti cubits: and the
breadth twenti cubit

41:3 then went he inward and measur the post of the door two
cubits; and the door six cubits; and the breadth of the door seven
cubit

41:4 so he measur the length thereof twenti cubits; and the
breadth twenti cubit befor the temple: and he said unto me thi
is the most holi place

41:5 after he measur the wall of the hous six cubits; and the
breadth of everi side chamber four cubit round about the hous on
everi side

41:6 and the side chamber were three one over anoth and thirti in
order; and they enter into the wall which wa of the hous for the
side chamber round about that they might have hold but they had not
hold in the wall of the hous

41:7 and there wa an enlarg and a wind about still upward to
the side chambers: for the wind about of the hous went still
upward round about the house: therefor the breadth of the hous wa
still upward and so increas from the lowest chamber to the highest
by the midst

41:8 i saw also the height of the hous round about: the foundat
of the side chamber were a full reed of six great cubit

41:9 the thick of the wall which wa for the side chamber
without wa five cubits: and that which wa left wa the place of the
side chamber that were within

41:10 and between the chamber wa the wide of twenti cubit round
about the hous on everi side

41:11 and the door of the side chamber were toward the place that
wa left one door toward the north and anoth door toward the
south: and the breadth of the place that wa left wa five cubit
round about

41:12 now the build that wa befor the separ place at the end
toward the west wa seventi cubit broad; and the wall of the build
wa five cubit thick round about and the length thereof nineti
cubit

41:13 so he measur the hous an hundr cubit long; and the
separ place and the build with the wall thereof an hundr
cubit long; 41:14 also the breadth of the face of the hous and of
the separ place toward the east an hundr cubit

41:15 and he measur the length of the build over against the
separ place which wa behind it and the galleri thereof on the
one side and on the other side an hundr cubit with the inner
templ and the porch of the court; 41:16 the door post and the
narrow window and the galleri round about on their three stori
over against the door ciel with wood round about and from the
ground up to the window and the window were covered; 41:17 to that
abov the door even unto the inner hous and without and by all the
wall round about within and without by measur

41:18 and it wa made with cherubim and palm tree so that a palm
tree wa between a cherub and a cherub; and everi cherub had two
faces; 41:19 so that the face of a man wa toward the palm tree on the
one side and the face of a young lion toward the palm tree on the
other side: it wa made through all the hous round about

41:20 from the ground unto abov the door were cherubim and palm
tree made and on the wall of the templ

41:21 the post of the templ were squar and the face of the
sanctuary; the appear of the one as the appear of the other

41:22 the altar of wood wa three cubit high and the length thereof
two cubits; and the corner thereof and the length thereof and the
wall thereof were of wood: and he said unto me thi is the tabl
that is befor the lord

41:23 and the templ and the sanctuari had two door

41:24 and the door had two leav apiec two turn leaves; two
leav for the one door and two leav for the other door

41:25 and there were made on them on the door of the templ
cherubim and palm tree like as were made upon the walls; and there
were thick plank upon the face of the porch without

41:26 and there were narrow window and palm tree on the one side and
on the other side on the side of the porch and upon the side
chamber of the hous and thick plank

42:1 then he brought me forth into the utter court the way toward the
north: and he brought me into the chamber that wa over against the
separ place and which wa befor the build toward the north

42:2 befor the length of an hundr cubit wa the north door and
the breadth wa fifti cubit

42:3 over against the twenti cubit which were for the inner court
and over against the pavement which wa for the utter court wa
galleri against galleri in three stori

42:4 and befor the chamber wa a walk to ten cubit breadth inward
a way of one cubit; and their door toward the north

42:5 now the upper chamber were shorter: for the galleri were
higher than these than the lower and than the middlemost of the
build

42:6 for they were in three stori but had not pillar as the
pillar of the courts: therefor the build wa straiten more than
the lowest and the middlemost from the ground

42:7 and the wall that wa without over against the chamber toward
the utter court on the forepart of the chamber the length thereof
wa fifti cubit

42:8 for the length of the chamber that were in the utter court wa
fifti cubits: and lo befor the templ were an hundr cubit

42:9 and from under these chamber wa the entri on the east side as
one goeth into them from the utter court

42:10 the chamber were in the thick of the wall of the court
