toward the east over against the separ place and over against the
build

42:11 and the way befor them wa like the appear of the chamber
which were toward the north as long as they and as broad as they:
and all their go out were both accord to their fashion and
accord to their door

42:12 and accord to the door of the chamber that were toward the
south wa a door in the head of the way even the way directli befor
the wall toward the east as one entereth into them

42:13 then said he unto me the north chamber and the south chamber
which are befor the separ place they be holi chamber where the
priest that approach unto the lord shall eat the most holi things:
there shall they lay the most holi thing and the meat offer and
the sin offer and the trespass offering; for the place is holi

42:14 when the priest enter therein then shall they not go out of
the holi place into the utter court but there they shall lay their
garment wherein they minister; for they are holy; and shall put on
other garment and shall approach to those thing which are for the
peopl

42:15 now when he had made an end of measur the inner hous he
brought me forth toward the gate whose prospect is toward the east
and measur it round about

42:16 he measur the east side with the measur reed five hundr
reed with the measur reed round about

42:17 he measur the north side five hundr reed with the
measur reed round about

42:18 he measur the south side five hundr reed with the
measur reed

42:19 he turn about to the west side and measur five hundr
reed with the measur reed

42:20 he measur it by the four sides: it had a wall round about
five hundr reed long and five hundr broad to make a separ
between the sanctuari and the profan place

43:1 afterward he brought me to the gate even the gate that looketh
toward the east: 43:2 and behold the glori of the god of israel came
from the way of the east: and hi voic wa like a nois of mani
waters: and the earth shine with hi glori

43:3 and it wa accord to the appear of the vision which i saw
even accord to the vision that i saw when i came to destroy the
city: and the vision were like the vision that i saw by the river
chebar; and i fell upon my face

43:4 and the glori of the lord came into the hous by the way of the
gate whose prospect is toward the east

43:5 so the spirit took me up and brought me into the inner court;
and behold the glori of the lord fill the hous

43:6 and i heard him speak unto me out of the house; and the man
stood by me

43:7 and he said unto me son of man the place of my throne and the
place of the sole of my feet where i will dwell in the midst of the
children of israel for ever and my holi name shall the hous of
israel no more defil neither they nor their king by their
whoredom nor by the carcas of their king in their high place

43:8 in their set of their threshold by my threshold and their
post by my post and the wall between me and them they have even
defil my holi name by their abomin that they have committed:
wherefor i have consum them in mine anger

43:9 now let them put away their whoredom and the carcas of their
king far from me and i will dwell in the midst of them for ever

43:10 thou son of man shew the hous to the hous of israel that
they may be asham of their iniquities: and let them measur the
pattern

43:11 and if they be asham of all that they have done shew them the
form of the hous and the fashion thereof and the go out
thereof and the come in thereof and all the form thereof and
all the ordin thereof and all the form thereof and all the
law thereof: and write it in their sight that they may keep the
whole form thereof and all the ordin thereof and do them

43:12 thi is the law of the house; upon the top of the mountain the
whole limit thereof round about shall be most holi behold thi is
the law of the hous

43:13 and these are the measur of the altar after the cubits: the
cubit is a cubit and an hand breadth; even the bottom shall be a
cubit and the breadth a cubit and the border thereof by the edg
thereof round about shall be a span: and thi shall be the higher
place of the altar

43:14 and from the bottom upon the ground even to the lower settl
shall be two cubit and the breadth one cubit; and from the lesser
settl even to the greater settl shall be four cubit and the
breadth one cubit

43:15 so the altar shall be four cubits; and from the altar and upward
shall be four horn

43:16 and the altar shall be twelv cubit long twelv broad squar
in the four squar thereof

43:17 and the settl shall be fourteen cubit long and fourteen broad
in the four squar thereof; and the border about it shall be half a
cubit; and the bottom thereof shall be a cubit about; and hi stair
shall look toward the east

43:18 and he said unto me son of man thu saith the lord god; these
are the ordin of the altar in the day when they shall make it to
offer burnt offer thereon and to sprinkl blood thereon

43:19 and thou shalt give to the priest the levit that be of the
seed of zadok which approach unto me to minist unto me saith the
lord god a young bullock for a sin offer

43:20 and thou shalt take of the blood thereof and put it on the four
horn of it and on the four corner of the settl and upon the
border round about: thu shalt thou cleans and purg it

43:21 thou shalt take the bullock also of the sin offer and he
shall burn it in the appoint place of the hous without the
sanctuari

43:22 and on the second day thou shalt offer a kid of the goat
without blemish for a sin offering; and they shall cleans the altar
as they did cleans it with the bullock

43:23 when thou hast made an end of cleans it thou shalt offer a
young bullock without blemish and a ram out of the flock without
blemish

43:24 and thou shalt offer them befor the lord and the priest shall
cast salt upon them and they shall offer them up for a burnt offer
unto the lord

43:25 seven day shalt thou prepar everi day a goat for a sin
offering: they shall also prepar a young bullock and a ram out of
the flock without blemish

43:26 seven day shall they purg the altar and purifi it; and they
shall consecr themselv

43:27 and when these day are expir it shall be that upon the
eighth day and so forward the priest shall make your burnt
offer upon the altar and your peac offerings; and i will accept
you saith the lord god

44:1 then he brought me back the way of the gate of the outward
sanctuari which looketh toward the east; and it wa shut

44:2 then said the lord unto me; thi gate shall be shut it shall not
be open and no man shall enter in by it; becaus the lord the god
of israel hath enter in by it therefor it shall be shut

44:3 it is for the prince; the princ he shall sit in it to eat bread
befor the lord; he shall enter by the way of the porch of that gate
and shall go out by the way of the same

44:4 then brought he me the way of the north gate befor the house:
and i look and behold the glori of the lord fill the hous of
the lord: and i fell upon my face

44:5 and the lord said unto me son of man mark well and behold with
thine eye and hear with thine ear all that i say unto thee
concern all the ordin of the hous of the lord and all the
law thereof; and mark well the enter in of the hous with everi
go forth of the sanctuari

44:6 and thou shalt say to the rebelli even to the hous of
israel thu saith the lord god; o ye hous of israel let it suffic
you of all your abomin 44:7 in that ye have brought into my
sanctuari stranger uncircumcis in heart and uncircumcis in
flesh to be in my sanctuari to pollut it even my hous when ye
offer my bread the fat and the blood and they have broken my
coven becaus of all your abomin

44:8 and ye have not kept the charg of mine holi things: but ye have
set keeper of my charg in my sanctuari for yourselv

44:9 thu saith the lord god; no stranger uncircumcis in heart nor
uncircumcis in flesh shall enter into my sanctuari of ani stranger
that is among the children of israel

44:10 and the levit that are gone away far from me when israel went
astray which went astray away from me after their idols; they shall
even bear their iniqu

44:11 yet they shall be minist in my sanctuari have charg at
the gate of the hous and minist to the house: they shall slay
the burnt offer and the sacrific for the peopl and they shall
stand befor them to minist unto them

44:12 becaus they minist unto them befor their idol and caus
the hous of israel to fall into iniquity; therefor have i lift up
mine hand against them saith the lord god and they shall bear their
iniqu

44:13 and they shall not come near unto me to do the offic of a
priest unto me nor to come near to ani of my holi thing in the most
holi place: but they shall bear their shame and their abomin
which they have commit

44:14 but i will make them keeper of the charg of the hous for all
the servic thereof and for all that shall be done therein

44:15 but the priest the levit the son of zadok that kept the
charg of my sanctuari when the children of israel went astray from
me they shall come near to me to minist unto me and they shall
stand befor me to offer unto me the fat and the blood saith the lord
god: 44:16 they shall enter into my sanctuari and they shall come
near to my tabl to minist unto me and they shall keep my charg

44:17 and it shall come to pass that when they enter in at the gate
of the inner court they shall be cloth with linen garments; and no
wool shall come upon them while they minist in the gate of the
inner court and within

44:18 they shall have linen bonnet upon their head and shall have
linen breech upon their loins; they shall not gird themselv with
ani thing that causeth sweat

44:19 and when they go forth into the utter court even into the utter
court to the peopl they shall put off their garment wherein they
minist and lay them in the holi chamber and they shall put on
other garments; and they shall not sanctifi the peopl with their
garment

44:20 neither shall they shave their head nor suffer their lock to
grow long; they shall onli poll their head

44:21 neither shall ani priest drink wine when they enter into the
inner court

44:22 neither shall they take for their wive a widow nor her that is
put away: but they shall take maiden of the seed of the hous of
israel or a widow that had a priest befor

44:23 and they shall teach my peopl the differ between the holi
and profan and caus them to discern between the unclean and the
clean

44:24 and in controversi they shall stand in judgment; and they shall
judg it accord to my judgments: and they shall keep my law and my
statut in all mine assemblies; and they shall hallow my sabbath

44:25 and they shall come at no dead person to defil themselves: but
for father or for mother or for son or for daughter for brother
or for sister that hath had no husband they may defil themselv

44:26 and after he is cleans they shall reckon unto him seven day

44:27 and in the day that he goeth into the sanctuari unto the inner
court to minist in the sanctuari he shall offer hi sin offer
saith the lord god

44:28 and it shall be unto them for an inheritance: i am their
inheritance: and ye shall give them no possess in israel: i am
their possess

44:29 they shall eat the meat offer and the sin offer and the
trespass offering: and everi dedic thing in israel shall be
their

44:30 and the first of all the firstfruit of all thing and everi
oblat of all of everi sort of your oblat shall be the
priests: ye shall also give unto the priest the first of your dough
that he may caus the bless to rest in thine hous

44:31 the priest shall not eat of ani thing that is dead of itself
or torn whether it be fowl or beast

45:1 moreov when ye shall divid by lot the land for inherit
ye shall offer an oblat unto the lord an holi portion of the land:
the length shall be the length of five and twenti thousand reed and
the breadth shall be ten thousand thi shall be holi in all the
border thereof round about

45:2 of thi there shall be for the sanctuari five hundr in length
with five hundr in breadth squar round about; and fifti cubit
round about for the suburb thereof

45:3 and of thi measur shalt thou measur the length of five and
twenti thousand and the breadth of ten thousand: and in it shall be
the sanctuari and the most holi place

45:4 the holi portion of the land shall be for the priest the
minist of the sanctuari which shall come near to minist unto the
lord: and it shall be a place for their hous and an holi place for
the sanctuari

45:5 and the five and twenti thousand of length and the ten thousand
of breadth shall also the levit the minist of the hous have
for themselv for a possess for twenti chamber

45:6 and ye shall appoint the possess of the citi five thousand
broad and five and twenti thousand long over against the oblat of
the holi portion: it shall be for the whole hous of israel

45:7 and a portion shall be for the princ on the one side and on the
other side of the oblat of the holi portion and of the possess
of the citi befor the oblat of the holi portion and befor the
possess of the citi from the west side westward and from the east
side eastward: and the length shall be over against one of the
portion from the west border unto the east border

45:8 in the land shall be hi possess in israel: and my princ
shall no more oppress my people; and the rest of the land shall they
give to the hous of israel accord to their tribe

45:9 thu saith the lord god; let it suffic you o princ of israel:
remov violenc and spoil and execut judgment and justic take away
your exact from my peopl saith the lord god

45:10 ye shall have just balanc and a just ephah and a just bath

45:11 the ephah and the bath shall be of one measur that the bath
may contain the tenth part of an homer and the ephah the tenth part
of an homer: the measur thereof shall be after the homer

45:12 and the shekel shall be twenti gerahs: twenti shekel five and
twenti shekel fifteen shekel shall be your maneh

45:13 thi is the oblat that ye shall offer; the sixth part of an
ephah of an homer of wheat and ye shall give the sixth part of an
ephah of an homer of barley: 45:14 concern the ordin of oil
the bath of oil ye shall offer the tenth part of a bath out of the
cor which is an homer of ten baths; for ten bath are an homer: 45:15
and one lamb out of the flock out of two hundr out of the fat
pastur of israel; for a meat offer and for a burnt offer and
for peac offer to make reconcili for them saith the lord
god

45:16 all the peopl of the land shall give thi oblat for the
princ in israel

45:17 and it shall be the princ part to give burnt offer and
meat offer and drink offer in the feast and in the new
moon and in the sabbath in all solemn of the hous of israel:
he shall prepar the sin offer and the meat offer and the
burnt offer and the peac offer to make reconcili for
the hous of israel

45:18 thu saith the lord god; in the first month in the first day of
the month thou shalt take a young bullock without blemish and
cleans the sanctuary: 45:19 and the priest shall take of the blood of
the sin offer and put it upon the post of the hous and upon the
four corner of the settl of the altar and upon the post of the
gate of the inner court

45:20 and so thou shalt do the seventh day of the month for everi one
that erreth and for him that is simple: so shall ye reconcil the
hous

45:21 in the first month in the fourteenth day of the month ye shall
have the passov a feast of seven days; unleaven bread shall be
eaten

45:22 and upon that day shall the princ prepar for himself and for
all the peopl of the land a bullock for a sin offer

45:23 and seven day of the feast he shall prepar a burnt offer to
the lord seven bullock and seven ram without blemish daili the
seven days; and a kid of the goat daili for a sin offer

45:24 and he shall prepar a meat offer of an ephah for a bullock
and an ephah for a ram and an hin of oil for an ephah

45:25 in the seventh month in the fifteenth day of the month shall
he do the like in the feast of the seven day accord to the sin
offer accord to the burnt offer and accord to the meat
offer and accord to the oil

46:1 thu saith the lord god; the gate of the inner court that looketh
toward the east shall be shut the six work days; but on the sabbath
it shall be open and in the day of the new moon it shall be open

46:2 and the princ shall enter by the way of the porch of that gate
without and shall stand by the post of the gate and the priest
shall prepar hi burnt offer and hi peac offer and he shall
worship at the threshold of the gate: then he shall go forth; but the
gate shall not be shut until the even

46:3 likewis the peopl of the land shall worship at the door of thi
gate befor the lord in the sabbath and in the new moon

46:4 and the burnt offer that the princ shall offer unto the lord
in the sabbath day shall be six lamb without blemish and a ram
without blemish

46:5 and the meat offer shall be an ephah for a ram and the meat
offer for the lamb as he shall be abl to give and an hin of oil
to an ephah

46:6 and in the day of the new moon it shall be a young bullock
without blemish and six lamb and a ram: they shall be without
blemish

46:7 and he shall prepar a meat offer an ephah for a bullock and
an ephah for a ram and for the lamb accord as hi hand shall
attain unto and an hin of oil to an ephah

46:8 and when the princ shall enter he shall go in by the way of the
porch of that gate and he shall go forth by the way thereof

46:9 but when the peopl of the land shall come befor the lord in the
solemn feast he that entereth in by the way of the north gate to
worship shall go out by the way of the south gate; and he that
entereth by the way of the south gate shall go forth by the way of the
north gate: he shall not return by the way of the gate wherebi he came
in but shall go forth over against it

46:10 and the princ in the midst of them when they go in shall go
in; and when they go forth shall go forth

46:11 and in the feast and in the solemn the meat offer shall
be an ephah to a bullock and an ephah to a ram and to the lamb as
he is abl to give and an hin of oil to an ephah

46:12 now when the princ shall prepar a voluntari burnt offer or
peac offer voluntarili unto the lord one shall then open him the
gate that looketh toward the east and he shall prepar hi burnt
offer and hi peac offer as he did on the sabbath day: then
he shall go forth; and after hi go forth one shall shut the gate

46:13 thou shalt daili prepar a burnt offer unto the lord of a
lamb of the first year without blemish: thou shalt prepar it everi
morn

46:14 and thou shalt prepar a meat offer for it everi morn the
sixth part of an ephah and the third part of an hin of oil to temper
with the fine flour; a meat offer continu by a perpetu
ordin unto the lord

46:15 thu shall they prepar the lamb and the meat offer and the
oil everi morn for a continu burnt offer

46:16 thu saith the lord god; if the princ give a gift unto ani of
hi son the inherit thereof shall be hi sons; it shall be
their possess by inherit

46:17 but if he give a gift of hi inherit to one of hi servant
then it shall be hi to the year of liberty; after it shall return to
the prince: but hi inherit shall be hi son for them

46:18 moreov the princ shall not take of the peopl inherit
by oppress to thrust them out of their possession; but he shall
give hi son inherit out of hi own possession: that my peopl be
not scatter everi man from hi possess

46:19 after he brought me through the entri which wa at the side of
the gate into the holi chamber of the priest which look toward
the north: and behold there wa a place on the two side westward

46:20 then said he unto me thi is the place where the priest shall
boil the trespass offer and the sin offer where they shall bake
the meat offering; that they bear them not out into the utter court
to sanctifi the peopl

46:21 then he brought me forth into the utter court and caus me to
pass by the four corner of the court; and behold in everi corner of
the court there wa a court

46:22 in the four corner of the court there were court join of
forti cubit long and thirti broad: these four corner were of one
measur

46:23 and there wa a row of build round about in them round about
them four and it wa made with boil place under the row round
about

46:24 then said he unto me these are the place of them that boil
where the minist of the hous shall boil the sacrific of the
peopl

47:1 afterward he brought me again unto the door of the house; and
behold water issu out from under the threshold of the hous
eastward: for the forefront of the hous stood toward the east and
the water came down from under from the right side of the hous at
the south side of the altar

47:2 then brought he me out of the way of the gate northward and led
me about the way without unto the utter gate by the way that looketh
eastward; and behold there ran out water on the right side

47:3 and when the man that had the line in hi hand went forth
eastward he measur a thousand cubit and he brought me through the
waters; the water were to the ankl

47:4 again he measur a thousand and brought me through the waters;
the water were to the knee again he measur a thousand and
brought me through; the water were to the loin

47:5 afterward he measur a thousand; and it wa a river that i could
not pass over: for the water were risen water to swim in a river
that could not be pass over

47:6 and he said unto me son of man hast thou seen this? then he
brought me and caus me to return to the brink of the river

47:7 now when i had return behold at the bank of the river were
veri mani tree on the one side and on the other

47:8 then said he unto me these water issu out toward the east
countri and go down into the desert and go into the sea: which be
brought forth into the sea the water shall be heal

47:9 and it shall come to pass that everi thing that liveth which
moveth whithersoev the river shall come shall live: and there
shall be a veri great multitud of fish becaus these water shall
come thither: for they shall be healed; and everi thing shall live
whither the river cometh

47:10 and it shall come to pass that the fisher shall stand upon it
from engedi even unto eneglaim; they shall be a place to spread forth
nets; their fish shall be accord to their kind as the fish of the
great sea exceed mani

47:11 but the miri place thereof and the marish thereof shall not
be healed; they shall be given to salt

47:12 and by the river upon the bank thereof on thi side and on that
side shall grow all tree for meat whose leaf shall not fade
neither shall the fruit thereof be consumed: it shall bring forth new
fruit accord to hi month becaus their water they issu out of
the sanctuary: and the fruit thereof shall be for meat and the leaf
thereof for medicin

47:13 thu saith the lord god; thi shall be the border wherebi ye
shall inherit the land accord to the twelv tribe of israel:
joseph shall have two portion

47:14 and ye shall inherit it one as well as another: concern the
which i lift up mine hand to give it unto your fathers: and thi
land shall fall unto you for inherit

47:15 and thi shall be the border of the land toward the north side
from the great sea the way of hethlon as men go to zedad; 47:16
hamath berothah sibraim which is between the border of damascu and
the border of hamath; hazarhatticon which is by the coast of hauran

47:17 and the border from the sea shall be hazarenan the border of
damascu and the north northward and the border of hamath and thi
is the north side

47:18 and the east side ye shall measur from hauran and from
damascu and from gilead and from the land of israel by jordan from
the border unto the east sea and thi is the east side

47:19 and the south side southward from tamar even to the water of
strife in kadesh the river to the great sea and thi is the south
side southward

47:20 the west side also shall be the great sea from the border till
a man come over against hamath thi is the west side

47:21 so shall ye divid thi land unto you accord to the tribe of
israel

47:22 and it shall come to pass that ye shall divid it by lot for an
inherit unto you and to the stranger that sojourn among you
which shall beget children among you: and they shall be unto you as
born in the countri among the children of israel; they shall have
inherit with you among the tribe of israel

47:23 and it shall come to pass that in what tribe the stranger
sojourneth there shall ye give him hi inherit saith the lord
god

48:1 now these are the name of the tribe from the north end to the
coast of the way of hethlon as one goeth to hamath hazarenan the
border of damascu northward to the coast of hamath; for these are
hi side east and west; a portion for dan

48:2 and by the border of dan from the east side unto the west side
a portion for asher

48:3 and by the border of asher from the east side even unto the west
side a portion for naphtali

48:4 and by the border of naphtali from the east side unto the west
side a portion for manasseh

48:5 and by the border of manasseh from the east side unto the west
side a portion for ephraim

48:6 and by the border of ephraim from the east side even unto the
west side a portion for reuben

48:7 and by the border of reuben from the east side unto the west
side a portion for judah

48:8 and by the border of judah from the east side unto the west
side shall be the offer which ye shall offer of five and twenti
thousand reed in breadth and in length as one of the other part
from the east side unto the west side: and the sanctuari shall be in
the midst of it

48:9 the oblat that ye shall offer unto the lord shall be of five
and twenti thousand in length and of ten thousand in breadth

48:10 and for them even for the priest shall be thi holi oblation;
toward the north five and twenti thousand in length and toward the
west ten thousand in breadth and toward the east ten thousand in
breadth and toward the south five and twenti thousand in length: and
the sanctuari of the lord shall be in the midst thereof

48:11 it shall be for the priest that are sanctifi of the son of
zadok; which have kept my charg which went not astray when the
children of israel went astray as the levit went astray

48:12 and thi oblat of the land that is offer shall be unto them
a thing most holi by the border of the levit

48:13 and over against the border of the priest the levit shall
have five and twenti thousand in length and ten thousand in breadth:
all the length shall be five and twenti thousand and the breadth ten
thousand

48:14 and they shall not sell of it neither exchang nor alien
the firstfruit of the land: for it is holi unto the lord

48:15 and the five thousand that are left in the breadth over against
the five and twenti thousand shall be a profan place for the citi
for dwell and for suburbs: and the citi shall be in the midst
thereof

48:16 and these shall be the measur thereof; the north side four
thousand and five hundr and the south side four thousand and five
hundr and on the east side four thousand and five hundr and the
west side four thousand and five hundr

48:17 and the suburb of the citi shall be toward the north two
hundr and fifti and toward the south two hundr and fifti and
toward the east two hundr and fifti and toward the west two hundr
and fifti

48:18 and the residu in length over against the oblat of the holi
portion shall be ten thousand eastward and ten thousand westward: and
it shall be over against the oblat of the holi portion; and the
increas thereof shall be for food unto them that serv the citi

48:19 and they that serv the citi shall serv it out of all the
tribe of israel

48:20 all the oblat shall be five and twenti thousand by five and
twenti thousand: ye shall offer the holi oblat foursquar with the
possess of the citi

48:21 and the residu shall be for the princ on the one side and on
the other of the holi oblat and of the possess of the citi
over against the five and twenti thousand of the oblat toward the
east border and westward over against the five and twenti thousand
toward the west border over against the portion for the prince: and
it shall be the holi oblation; and the sanctuari of the hous shall be
in the midst thereof

48:22 moreov from the possess of the levit and from the
possess of the citi be in the midst of that which is the
princ between the border of judah and the border of benjamin
shall be for the princ

48:23 as for the rest of the tribe from the east side unto the west
side benjamin shall have a portion

48:24 and by the border of benjamin from the east side unto the west
side simeon shall have a portion

48:25 and by the border of simeon from the east side unto the west
side issachar a portion

48:26 and by the border of issachar from the east side unto the west
side zebulun a portion

48:27 and by the border of zebulun from the east side unto the west
side gad a portion

48:28 and by the border of gad at the south side southward the
border shall be even from tamar unto the water of strife in kadesh
and to the river toward the great sea

48:29 thi is the land which ye shall divid by lot unto the tribe of
israel for inherit and these are their portion saith the lord
god

48:30 and these are the go out of the citi on the north side four
thousand and five hundr measur

48:31 and the gate of the citi shall be after the name of the tribe
of israel: three gate northward; one gate of reuben one gate of
judah one gate of levi

48:32 and at the east side four thousand and five hundred: and three
gates; and one gate of joseph one gate of benjamin one gate of dan

48:33 and at the south side four thousand and five hundr measures:
and three gates; one gate of simeon one gate of issachar one gate of
zebulun

48:34 at the west side four thousand and five hundr with their
three gates; one gate of gad one gate of asher one gate of naphtali

48:35 it wa round about eighteen thousand measures: and the name of
the citi from that day shall be the lord is there




the book of daniel


1:1 in the third year of the reign of jehoiakim king of judah came
nebuchadnezzar king of babylon unto jerusalem and besieg it

1:2 and the lord gave jehoiakim king of judah into hi hand with part
of the vessel of the hous of god: which he carri into the land of
shinar to the hous of hi god; and he brought the vessel into the
treasur hous of hi god

1:3 and the king spake unto ashpenaz the master of hi eunuch that
he should bring certain of the children of israel and of the king
seed and of the princes; 1:4 children in whom wa no blemish but
well favour and skil in all wisdom and cun in knowledg
and understand scienc and such as had abil in them to stand in
the king palac and whom they might teach the learn and the
tongu of the chaldean

1:5 and the king appoint them a daili provis of the king meat
and of the wine which he drank: so nourish them three year that
at the end thereof they might stand befor the king

1:6 now among these were of the children of judah daniel hananiah
mishael and azariah: 1:7 unto whom the princ of the eunuch gave
names: for he gave unto daniel the name of belteshazzar; and to
hananiah of shadrach; and to mishael of meshach; and to azariah of
abednego

1:8 but daniel purpos in hi heart that he would not defil himself
with the portion of the king meat nor with the wine which he drank:
therefor he request of the princ of the eunuch that he might not
defil himself

1:9 now god had brought daniel into favour and tender love with the
princ of the eunuch

1:10 and the princ of the eunuch said unto daniel i fear my lord
the king who hath appoint your meat and your drink: for whi should
he see your face wors like than the children which are of your
sort? then shall ye make me endang my head to the king

1:11 then said daniel to melzar whom the princ of the eunuch had
set over daniel hananiah mishael and azariah 1:12 prove thi
servant i beseech thee ten days; and let them give us puls to eat
and water to drink

1:13 then let our counten be look upon befor thee and the
counten of the children that eat of the portion of the king
meat: and as thou seest deal with thi servant

1:14 so he consent to them in thi matter and prove them ten day

1:15 and at the end of ten day their counten appear fairer and
fatter in flesh than all the children which did eat the portion of the
king meat

1:16 thu melzar took away the portion of their meat and the wine
that they should drink; and gave them puls

1:17 as for these four children god gave them knowledg and skill in
all learn and wisdom: and daniel had understand in all vision
and dream

1:18 now at the end of the day that the king had said he should bring
them in then the princ of the eunuch brought them in befor
nebuchadnezzar

1:19 and the king commun with them; and among them all wa found
none like daniel hananiah mishael and azariah: therefor stood they
befor the king

1:20 and in all matter of wisdom and understand that the king
enquir of them he found them ten time better than all the
magician and astrolog that were in all hi realm

1:21 and daniel continu even unto the first year of king cyru

2:1 and in the second year of the reign of nebuchadnezzar
nebuchadnezzar dream dream wherewith hi spirit wa troubl and
hi sleep brake from him

2:2 then the king command to call the magician and the
astrolog and the sorcer and the chaldean for to shew the
king hi dream so they came and stood befor the king

2:3 and the king said unto them i have dream a dream and my spirit
wa troubl to know the dream

2:4 then spake the chaldean to the king in syriack o king live for
ever: tell thi servant the dream and we will shew the
interpret

2:5 the king answer and said to the chaldean the thing is gone
from me: if ye will not make known unto me the dream with the
interpret thereof ye shall be cut in piec and your hous
shall be made a dunghil

2:6 but if ye shew the dream and the interpret thereof ye shall
receiv of me gift and reward and great honour: therefor shew me
the dream and the interpret thereof

2:7 they answer again and said let the king tell hi servant the
dream and we will shew the interpret of it

2:8 the king answer and said i know of certainti that ye would gain
the time becaus ye see the thing is gone from me

2:9 but if ye will not make known unto me the dream there is but one
decre for you: for ye have prepar lie and corrupt word to speak
befor me till the time be changed: therefor tell me the dream and
i shall know that ye can shew me the interpret thereof

2:10 the chaldean answer befor the king and said there is not a
man upon the earth that can shew the king matter: therefor there is
no king lord nor ruler that ask such thing at ani magician or
astrolog or chaldean

2:11 and it is a rare thing that the king requireth and there is none
other that can shew it befor the king except the god whose
dwell is not with flesh

2:12 for thi caus the king wa angri and veri furiou and command
to destroy all the wise men of babylon

2:13 and the decre went forth that the wise men should be slain; and
they sought daniel and hi fellow to be slain

2:14 then daniel answer with counsel and wisdom to arioch the
captain of the king guard which wa gone forth to slay the wise men
of babylon: 2:15 he answer and said to arioch the king captain
whi is the decre so hasti from the king? then arioch made the thing
known to daniel

2:16 then daniel went in and desir of the king that he would give
him time and that he would shew the king the interpret

2:17 then daniel went to hi hous and made the thing known to
hananiah mishael and azariah hi companions: 2:18 that they would
desir merci of the god of heaven concern thi secret; that
daniel and hi fellow should not perish with the rest of the wise men
of babylon

2:19 then wa the secret reveal unto daniel in a night vision then
daniel bless the god of heaven

2:20 daniel answer and said bless be the name of god for ever and
ever: for wisdom and might are his: 2:21 and he changeth the time and
the seasons: he removeth king and setteth up kings: he giveth wisdom
unto the wise and knowledg to them that know understanding: 2:22 he
revealeth the deep and secret things: he knoweth what is in the
dark and the light dwelleth with him

2:23 i thank thee and prais thee o thou god of my father who hast
given me wisdom and might and hast made known unto me now what we
desir of thee: for thou hast now made known unto us the king
matter

2:24 therefor daniel went in unto arioch whom the king had ordain
to destroy the wise men of babylon: he went and said thu unto him;
destroy not the wise men of babylon: bring me in befor the king and
i will shew unto the king the interpret

2:25 then arioch brought in daniel befor the king in hast and said
thu unto him i have found a man of the captiv of judah that will
make known unto the king the interpret

2:26 the king answer and said to daniel whose name wa
belteshazzar art thou abl to make known unto me the dream which i
have seen and the interpret thereof? 2:27 daniel answer in
the presenc of the king and said the secret which the king hath
demand cannot the wise men the astrolog the magician the
soothsay shew unto the king; 2:28 but there is a god in heaven
that revealeth secret and maketh known to the king nebuchadnezzar
what shall be in the latter day thi dream and the vision of thi
head upon thi bed are these; 2:29 as for thee o king thi thought
came into thi mind upon thi bed what should come to pass hereafter:
and he that revealeth secret maketh known to thee what shall come to
pass

2:30 but as for me thi secret is not reveal to me for ani wisdom
that i have more than ani live but for their sake that shall make
known the interpret to the king and that thou mightest know the
thought of thi heart

2:31 thou o king sawest and behold a great imag thi great imag
whose bright wa excel stood befor thee; and the form
thereof wa terribl

2:32 thi imag head wa of fine gold hi breast and hi arm of
silver hi belli and hi thigh of brass 2:33 hi leg of iron hi
feet part of iron and part of clay

2:34 thou sawest till that a stone wa cut out without hand which
smote the imag upon hi feet that were of iron and clay and brake
them to piec

2:35 then wa the iron the clay the brass the silver and the gold
broken to piec togeth and becam like the chaff of the summer
threshingfloors; and the wind carri them away that no place wa
found for them: and the stone that smote the imag becam a great
mountain and fill the whole earth

2:36 thi is the dream; and we will tell the interpret thereof
befor the king

2:37 thou o king art a king of kings: for the god of heaven hath
given thee a kingdom power and strength and glori

2:38 and wheresoev the children of men dwell the beast of the
field and the fowl of the heaven hath he given into thine hand and
hath made thee ruler over them all thou art thi head of gold

2:39 and after thee shall aris anoth kingdom inferior to thee and
anoth third kingdom of brass which shall bear rule over all the
earth

2:40 and the fourth kingdom shall be strong as iron: forasmuch as iron
breaketh in piec and subdueth all things: and as iron that breaketh
all these shall it break in piec and bruis

2:41 and wherea thou sawest the feet and toe part of potter clay
and part of iron the kingdom shall be divided; but there shall be in
it of the strength of the iron forasmuch as thou sawest the iron
mix with miri clay

2:42 and as the toe of the feet were part of iron and part of clay
so the kingdom shall be partli strong and partli broken

2:43 and wherea thou sawest iron mix with miri clay they shall
mingl themselv with the seed of men: but they shall not cleav one
to anoth even as iron is not mix with clay

2:44 and in the day of these king shall the god of heaven set up a
kingdom which shall never be destroyed: and the kingdom shall not be
left to other peopl but it shall break in piec and consum all
these kingdom and it shall stand for ever

2:45 forasmuch as thou sawest that the stone wa cut out of the
mountain without hand and that it brake in piec the iron the
brass the clay the silver and the gold; the great god hath made
known to the king what shall come to pass hereafter: and the dream is
certain and the interpret thereof sure

2:46 then the king nebuchadnezzar fell upon hi face and worship
daniel and command that they should offer an oblat and sweet
odour unto him

2:47 the king answer unto daniel and said of a truth it is that
your god is a god of god and a lord of king and a reveal of
secret see thou couldest reveal thi secret

2:48 then the king made daniel a great man and gave him mani great
gift and made him ruler over the whole provinc of babylon and
chief of the governor over all the wise men of babylon

2:49 then daniel request of the king and he set shadrach meshach
and abednego over the affair of the provinc of babylon: but daniel
sat in the gate of the king

3:1 nebuchadnezzar the king made an imag of gold whose height wa
threescor cubit and the breadth thereof six cubits: he set it up in
the plain of dura in the provinc of babylon

3:2 then nebuchadnezzar the king sent to gather togeth the princ
the governor and the captain the judg the treasur the
counsellor the sheriff and all the ruler of the provinc to
come to the dedic of the imag which nebuchadnezzar the king had
set up

3:3 then the princ the governor and captain the judg the
treasur the counsellor the sheriff and all the ruler of the
provinc were gather togeth unto the dedic of the imag
that nebuchadnezzar the king had set up; and they stood befor the
imag that nebuchadnezzar had set up

3:4 then an herald cri aloud to you it is command o peopl
nation and languag 3:5 that at what time ye hear the sound of the
cornet flute harp sackbut psalteri dulcim and all kind of
musick ye fall down and worship the golden imag that nebuchadnezzar
the king hath set up: 3:6 and whoso falleth not down and worshippeth
shall the same hour be cast into the midst of a burn fieri furnac

3:7 therefor at that time when all the peopl heard the sound of the
cornet flute harp sackbut psalteri and all kind of musick all
the peopl the nation and the languag fell down and worship
the golden imag that nebuchadnezzar the king had set up

3:8 wherefor at that time certain chaldean came near and accus
the jew

3:9 they spake and said to the king nebuchadnezzar o king live for
ever

3:10 thou o king hast made a decre that everi man that shall hear
the sound of the cornet flute harp sackbut psalteri and dulcim
and all kind of musick shall fall down and worship the golden image:
3:11 and whoso falleth not down and worshippeth that he should be
cast into the midst of a burn fieri furnac

3:12 there are certain jew whom thou hast set over the affair of the
provinc of babylon shadrach meshach and abednego; these men o
king have not regard thee: they serv not thi god nor worship the
golden imag which thou hast set up

3:13 then nebuchadnezzar in hi rage and furi command to bring
shadrach meshach and abednego then they brought these men befor
the king

3:14 nebuchadnezzar spake and said unto them is it true o shadrach
meshach and abednego do not ye serv my god nor worship the golden
imag which i have set up? 3:15 now if ye be readi that at what time
ye hear the sound of the cornet flute harp sackbut psalteri and
dulcim and all kind of musick ye fall down and worship the imag
which i have made; well: but if ye worship not ye shall be cast the
same hour into the midst of a burn fieri furnace; and who is that
god that shall deliv you out of my hands? 3:16 shadrach meshach
and abednego answer and said to the king o nebuchadnezzar we are
not care to answer thee in thi matter

3:17 if it be so our god whom we serv is abl to deliv us from the
burn fieri furnac and he will deliv us out of thine hand o
king

3:18 but if not be it known unto thee o king that we will not serv
thi god nor worship the golden imag which thou hast set up

3:19 then wa nebuchadnezzar full of furi and the form of hi visag
wa chang against shadrach meshach and abednego: therefor he
spake and command that they should heat the furnac one seven time
more than it wa wont to be heat

3:20 and he command the most mighti men that were in hi armi to
bind shadrach meshach and abednego and to cast them into the
burn fieri furnac

3:21 then these men were bound in their coat their hosen and their
hat and their other garment and were cast into the midst of the
burn fieri furnac

3:22 therefor becaus the king command wa urgent and the
furnac exceed hot the flame of the fire slew those men that took
up shadrach meshach and abednego

3:23 and these three men shadrach meshach and abednego fell down
bound into the midst of the burn fieri furnac

3:24 then nebuchadnezzar the king wa astoni and rose up in hast
and spake and said unto hi counsellor did not we cast three men
bound into the midst of the fire? they answer and said unto the
king true o king

3:25 he answer and said lo i see four men loos walk in the
midst of the fire and they have no hurt; and the form of the fourth
is like the son of god

3:26 then nebuchadnezzar came near to the mouth of the burn fieri
furnac and spake and said shadrach meshach and abednego ye
servant of the most high god come forth and come hither then
shadrach meshach and abednego came forth of the midst of the fire

3:27 and the princ governor and captain and the king
counsellor be gather togeth saw these men upon whose bodi
the fire had no power nor wa an hair of their head sing neither
were their coat chang nor the smell of fire had pass on them

3:28 then nebuchadnezzar spake and said bless be the god of
shadrach meshach and abednego who hath sent hi angel and
deliv hi servant that trust in him and have chang the
king word and yield their bodi that they might not serv nor
worship ani god except their own god

3:29 therefor i make a decre that everi peopl nation and
languag which speak ani thing amiss against the god of shadrach
meshach and abednego shall be cut in piec and their hous shall
be made a dunghill: becaus there is no other god that can deliv
after thi sort

3:30 then the king promot shadrach meshach and abednego in the
provinc of babylon

4:1 nebuchadnezzar the king unto all peopl nation and languag
that dwell in all the earth; peac be multipli unto you

4:2 i thought it good to shew the sign and wonder that the high god
hath wrought toward me

4:3 how great are hi signs! and how mighti are hi wonders! hi
kingdom is an everlast kingdom and hi dominion is from gener
to gener

4:4 i nebuchadnezzar wa at rest in mine hous and flourish in my
palace: 4:5 i saw a dream which made me afraid and the thought upon
my bed and the vision of my head troubl me

4:6 therefor made i a decre to bring in all the wise men of babylon
befor me that they might make known unto me the interpret of
the dream

4:7 then came in the magician the astrolog the chaldean and
the soothsayers: and i told the dream befor them; but they did not
make known unto me the interpret thereof

4:8 but at the last daniel came in befor me whose name wa
belteshazzar accord to the name of my god and in whom is the
spirit of the holi gods: and befor him i told the dream say 4:9
o belteshazzar master of the magician becaus i know that the
spirit of the holi god is in thee and no secret troubleth thee tell
me the vision of my dream that i have seen and the interpret
thereof

4:10 thu were the vision of mine head in my bed; i saw and behold a
tree in the midst of the earth and the height thereof wa great

4:11 the tree grew and wa strong and the height thereof reach
unto heaven and the sight thereof to the end of all the earth: 4:12
the leav thereof were fair and the fruit thereof much and in it
wa meat for all: the beast of the field had shadow under it and the
fowl of the heaven dwelt in the bough thereof and all flesh wa fed
of it

4:13 i saw in the vision of my head upon my bed and behold a
watcher and an holi one came down from heaven; 4:14 he cri aloud
and said thu hew down the tree and cut off hi branch shake off
hi leav and scatter hi fruit: let the beast get away from under
it and the fowl from hi branches: 4:15 nevertheless leav the stump
of hi root in the earth even with a band of iron and brass in the
tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of heaven
and let hi portion be with the beast in the grass of the earth: 4:16
let hi heart be chang from man and let a beast heart be given
unto him; and let seven time pass over him

4:17 thi matter is by the decre of the watcher and the demand by
the word of the holi ones: to the intent that the live may know that
the most high ruleth in the kingdom of men and giveth it to
whomsoev he will and setteth up over it the basest of men

4:18 thi dream i king nebuchadnezzar have seen now thou o
belteshazzar declar the interpret thereof forasmuch as all the
wise men of my kingdom are not abl to make known unto me the
interpretation: but thou art able; for the spirit of the holi god is
in thee

4:19 then daniel whose name wa belteshazzar wa astoni for one
hour and hi thought troubl him the king spake and said
belteshazzar let not the dream or the interpret thereof
troubl thee belteshazzar answer and said my lord the dream be to
them that hate thee and the interpret thereof to thine enemi

4:20 the tree that thou sawest which grew and wa strong whose
height reach unto the heaven and the sight thereof to all the
earth; 4:21 whose leav were fair and the fruit thereof much and in
it wa meat for all; under which the beast of the field dwelt and
upon whose branch the fowl of the heaven had their habitation: 4:22
it is thou o king that art grown and becom strong: for thi
great is grown and reacheth unto heaven and thi dominion to the
end of the earth

4:23 and wherea the king saw a watcher and an holi one come down
from heaven and say hew the tree down and destroy it; yet leav
the stump of the root thereof in the earth even with a band of iron
and brass in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with
the dew of heaven and let hi portion be with the beast of the
field till seven time pass over him; 4:24 thi is the
interpret o king and thi is the decre of the most high which
is come upon my lord the king: 4:25 that they shall drive thee from
men and thi dwell shall be with the beast of the field and they
shall make thee to eat grass as oxen and they shall wet thee with the
dew of heaven and seven time shall pass over thee till thou know
that the most high ruleth in the kingdom of men and giveth it to
whomsoev he will

4:26 and wherea they command to leav the stump of the tree roots;
thi kingdom shall be sure unto thee after that thou shalt have known
that the heaven do rule

4:27 wherefor o king let my counsel be accept unto thee and
break off thi sin by righteous and thine iniqu by shew
merci to the poor; if it may be a lengthen of thi tranquil

4:28 all thi came upon the king nebuchadnezzar

4:29 at the end of twelv month he walk in the palac of the
kingdom of babylon

4:30 the king spake and said is not thi great babylon that i have
built for the hous of the kingdom by the might of my power and for
the honour of my majesty? 4:31 while the word wa in the king
mouth there fell a voic from heaven say o king nebuchadnezzar
to thee it is spoken; the kingdom is depart from thee

4:32 and they shall drive thee from men and thi dwell shall be
with the beast of the field: they shall make thee to eat grass as
oxen and seven time shall pass over thee until thou know that the
most high ruleth in the kingdom of men and giveth it to whomsoev he
will

4:33 the same hour wa the thing fulfil upon nebuchadnezzar: and he
wa driven from men and did eat grass as oxen and hi bodi wa wet
with the dew of heaven till hi hair were grown like eagl
feather and hi nail like bird claw

4:34 and at the end of the day i nebuchadnezzar lift up mine eye
unto heaven and mine understand return unto me and i bless
the most high and i prais and honour him that liveth for ever
whose dominion is an everlast dominion and hi kingdom is from
gener to generation: 4:35 and all the inhabit of the earth
are reput as nothing: and he doeth accord to hi will in the armi
of heaven and among the inhabit of the earth: and none can stay
hi hand or say unto him what doest thou? 4:36 at the same time my
reason return unto me; and for the glori of my kingdom mine honour
and bright return unto me; and my counsellor and my lord
sought unto me; and i wa establish in my kingdom and excel
majesti wa ad unto me

4:37 now i nebuchadnezzar prais and extol and honour the king of
heaven all whose work are truth and hi way judgment: and those
that walk in pride he is abl to abas

5:1 belshazzar the king made a great feast to a thousand of hi lord
and drank wine befor the thousand

5:2 belshazzar while he tast the wine command to bring the
golden and silver vessel which hi father nebuchadnezzar had taken
out of the templ which wa in jerusalem; that the king and hi
princ hi wive and hi concubin might drink therein

5:3 then they brought the golden vessel that were taken out of the
templ of the hous of god which wa at jerusalem; and the king and
hi princ hi wive and hi concubin drank in them

5:4 they drank wine and prais the god of gold and of silver of
brass of iron of wood and of stone

5:5 in the same hour came forth finger of a man hand and wrote
over against the candlestick upon the plaister of the wall of the
king palace: and the king saw the part of the hand that wrote

5:6 then the king counten wa chang and hi thought troubl
him so that the joint of hi loin were loos and hi knee smote
one against anoth

5:7 the king cri aloud to bring in the astrolog the chaldean
and the soothsay and the king spake and said to the wise men of
babylon whosoev shall read thi write and shew me the
interpret thereof shall be cloth with scarlet and have a
chain of gold about hi neck and shall be the third ruler in the
kingdom

5:8 then came in all the king wise men: but they could not read the
write nor make known to the king the interpret thereof

5:9 then wa king belshazzar greatli troubl and hi counten wa
chang in him and hi lord were astoni

5:10 now the queen by reason of the word of the king and hi lord
came into the banquet house: and the queen spake and said o king
live for ever: let not thi thought troubl thee nor let thi
counten be changed: 5:11 there is a man in thi kingdom in whom is
the spirit of the holi gods; and in the day of thi father light and
understand and wisdom like the wisdom of the god wa found in
him; whom the king nebuchadnezzar thi father the king i say thi
father made master of the magician astrolog chaldean and
soothsayers; 5:12 forasmuch as an excel spirit and knowledg and
understand interpret of dream and shew of hard sentenc
and dissolv of doubt were found in the same daniel whom the king
name belteshazzar: now let daniel be call and he will shew the
interpret

5:13 then wa daniel brought in befor the king and the king spake
and said unto daniel art thou that daniel which art of the children
of the captiv of judah whom the king my father brought out of
jewry? 5:14 i have even heard of thee that the spirit of the god is
in thee and that light and understand and excel wisdom is
found in thee

5:15 and now the wise men the astrolog have been brought in
befor me that they should read thi write and make known unto me
the interpret thereof: but they could not shew the interpret
of the thing: 5:16 and i have heard of thee that thou canst make
interpret and dissolv doubts: now if thou canst read the
write and make known to me the interpret thereof thou shalt
be cloth with scarlet and have a chain of gold about thi neck and
shalt be the third ruler in the kingdom

5:17 then daniel answer and said befor the king let thi gift be
to thyself and give thi reward to another; yet i will read the
write unto the king and make known to him the interpret

5:18 o thou king the most high god gave nebuchadnezzar thi father a
kingdom and majesti and glori and honour: 5:19 and for the majesti
that he gave him all peopl nation and languag trembl and
fear befor him: whom he would he slew; and whom he would he kept
alive; and whom he would he set up; and whom he would he put down

5:20 but when hi heart wa lift up and hi mind harden in pride
he wa depos from hi kingli throne and they took hi glori from
him: 5:21 and he wa driven from the son of men; and hi heart wa
made like the beast and hi dwell wa with the wild asses: they
fed him with grass like oxen and hi bodi wa wet with the dew of
heaven; till he knew that the most high god rule in the kingdom of
men and that he appointeth over it whomsoev he will

5:22 and thou hi son o belshazzar hast not humbl thine heart
though thou knewest all this; 5:23 but hast lift up thyself against
the lord of heaven; and they have brought the vessel of hi hous
befor thee and thou and thi lord thi wive and thi concubin
have drunk wine in them; and thou hast prais the god of silver and
gold of brass iron wood and stone which see not nor hear nor
know: and the god in whose hand thi breath is and whose are all thi
way hast thou not glorified: 5:24 then wa the part of the hand sent
from him; and thi write wa written

5:25 and thi is the write that wa written mene mene tekel
upharsin

5:26 thi is the interpret of the thing: mene; god hath number
thi kingdom and finish it

5:27 tekel; thou art weigh in the balanc and art found want

5:28 peres; thi kingdom is divid and given to the mede and
persian

5:29 then command belshazzar and they cloth daniel with scarlet
and put a chain of gold about hi neck and made a proclam
concern him that he should be the third ruler in the kingdom

5:30 in that night wa belshazzar the king of the chaldean slain

5:31 and dariu the median took the kingdom be about threescor
and two year old

6:1 it pleas dariu to set over the kingdom an hundr and twenti
princ which should be over the whole kingdom; 6:2 and over these
three presidents; of whom daniel wa first: that the princ might
give account unto them and the king should have no damag

6:3 then thi daniel wa prefer abov the presid and princ
becaus an excel spirit wa in him; and the king thought to set
him over the whole realm

6:4 then the presid and princ sought to find occas against
daniel concern the kingdom; but they could find none occas nor
fault; forasmuch as he wa faith neither wa there ani error or
fault found in him

6:5 then said these men we shall not find ani occas against thi
daniel except we find it against him concern the law of hi god

6:6 then these presid and princ assembl togeth to the king
and said thu unto him king dariu live for ever

6:7 all the presid of the kingdom the governor and the princ
the counsellor and the captain have consult togeth to
establish a royal statut and to make a firm decre that whosoev
shall ask a petit of ani god or man for thirti day save of thee
o king he shall be cast into the den of lion

6:8 now o king establish the decre and sign the write that it
be not chang accord to the law of the mede and persian which
altereth not

6:9 wherefor king dariu sign the write and the decre

6:10 now when daniel knew that the write wa sign he went into
hi house; and hi window be open in hi chamber toward jerusalem
he kneel upon hi knee three time a day and pray and gave
thank befor hi god as he did aforetim

6:11 then these men assembl and found daniel pray and make
supplic befor hi god

6:12 then they came near and spake befor the king concern the
king decree; hast thou not sign a decre that everi man that
shall ask a petit of ani god or man within thirti day save of
thee o king shall be cast into the den of lions? the king answer
and said the thing is true accord to the law of the mede and
persian which altereth not

6:13 then answer they and said befor the king that daniel which
is of the children of the captiv of judah regardeth not thee o
king nor the decre that thou hast sign but maketh hi petit
three time a day

6:14 then the king when he heard these word wa sore displeas
with himself and set hi heart on daniel to deliv him: and he
labour till the go down of the sun to deliv him

6:15 then these men assembl unto the king and said unto the king
know o king that the law of the mede and persian is that no
decre nor statut which the king establisheth may be chang

6:16 then the king command and they brought daniel and cast him
into the den of lion now the king spake and said unto daniel thi
god whom thou servest continu he will deliv thee

6:17 and a stone wa brought and laid upon the mouth of the den; and
the king seal it with hi own signet and with the signet of hi
lords; that the purpos might not be chang concern daniel

6:18 then the king went to hi palac and pass the night fasting:
neither were instrument of musick brought befor him: and hi sleep
went from him

6:19 then the king aros veri earli in the morn and went in hast
unto the den of lion

6:20 and when he came to the den he cri with a lament voic
unto daniel: and the king spake and said to daniel o daniel servant
of the live god is thi god whom thou servest continu abl to
deliv thee from the lions? 6:21 then said daniel unto the king o
king live for ever

6:22 my god hath sent hi angel and hath shut the lion mouth that
they have not hurt me: forasmuch as befor him innoc wa found in
me; and also befor thee o king have i done no hurt

6:23 then wa the king exceedingli glad for him and command that
they should take daniel up out of the den so daniel wa taken up out
of the den and no manner of hurt wa found upon him becaus he
believ in hi god

6:24 and the king command and they brought those men which had
accus daniel and they cast them into the den of lion them their
children and their wives; and the lion had the masteri of them and
brake all their bone in piec or ever they came at the bottom of the
den

6:25 then king dariu wrote unto all peopl nation and languag
that dwell in all the earth; peac be multipli unto you

6:26 i make a decre that in everi dominion of my kingdom men trembl
and fear befor the god of daniel: for he is the live god and
stedfast for ever and hi kingdom that which shall not be destroy
and hi dominion shall be even unto the end

6:27 he delivereth and rescueth and he worketh sign and wonder in
heaven and in earth who hath deliv daniel from the power of the
lion

6:28 so thi daniel prosper in the reign of dariu and in the reign
of cyru the persian

7:1 in the first year of belshazzar king of babylon daniel had a dream
and vision of hi head upon hi bed: then he wrote the dream and
told the sum of the matter

7:2 daniel spake and said i saw in my vision by night and behold
the four wind of the heaven strove upon the great sea

7:3 and four great beast came up from the sea divers one from
anoth

7:4 the first wa like a lion and had eagl wings: i beheld till
the wing thereof were pluck and it wa lift up from the earth
and made stand upon the feet as a man and a man heart wa given to
it

7:5 and behold anoth beast a second like to a bear and it rais
up itself on one side and it had three rib in the mouth of it
between the teeth of it: and they said thu unto it aris devour
much flesh

7:6 after thi i beheld and lo anoth like a leopard which had
upon the back of it four wing of a fowl; the beast had also four
heads; and dominion wa given to it

7:7 after thi i saw in the night vision and behold a fourth beast
dread and terribl and strong exceedingly; and it had great iron
teeth: it devour and brake in piec and stamp the residu with
the feet of it: and it wa divers from all the beast that were
befor it; and it had ten horn

7:8 i consid the horn and behold there came up among them
anoth littl horn befor whom there were three of the first horn
pluck up by the roots: and behold in thi horn were eye like the
eye of man and a mouth speak great thing

7:9 i beheld till the throne were cast down and the ancient of day
did sit whose garment wa white as snow and the hair of hi head
like the pure wool: hi throne wa like the fieri flame and hi
wheel as burn fire

7:10 a fieri stream issu and came forth from befor him: thousand
thousand minist unto him and ten thousand time ten thousand
stood befor him: the judgment wa set and the book were open

7:11 i beheld then becaus of the voic of the great word which the
horn spake: i beheld even till the beast wa slain and hi bodi
destroy and given to the burn flame

7:12 as concern the rest of the beast they had their dominion
taken away: yet their live were prolong for a season and time

7:13 i saw in the night vision and behold one like the son of man
came with the cloud of heaven and came to the ancient of day and
they brought him near befor him

7:14 and there wa given him dominion and glori and a kingdom that
all peopl nation and languag should serv him: hi dominion is
an everlast dominion which shall not pass away and hi kingdom
that which shall not be destroy

7:15 i daniel wa griev in my spirit in the midst of my bodi and
the vision of my head troubl me

7:16 i came near unto one of them that stood by and ask him the
truth of all thi so he told me and made me know the interpret
of the thing

7:17 these great beast which are four are four king which shall
aris out of the earth

7:18 but the saint of the most high shall take the kingdom and
possess the kingdom for ever even for ever and ever

7:19 then i would know the truth of the fourth beast which wa
divers from all the other exceed dread whose teeth were of
iron and hi nail of brass; which devour brake in piec and
stamp the residu with hi feet; 7:20 and of the ten horn that were
in hi head and of the other which came up and befor whom three
fell; even of that horn that had eye and a mouth that spake veri
great thing whose look wa more stout than hi fellow

7:21 i beheld and the same horn made war with the saint and
prevail against them; 7:22 until the ancient of day came and
judgment wa given to the saint of the most high; and the time came
that the saint possess the kingdom

7:23 thu he said the fourth beast shall be the fourth kingdom upon
earth which shall be divers from all kingdom and shall devour the
whole earth and shall tread it down and break it in piec

7:24 and the ten horn out of thi kingdom are ten king that shall
arise: and anoth shall rise after them; and he shall be divers from
the first and he shall subdu three king

7:25 and he shall speak great word against the most high and shall
wear out the saint of the most high and think to chang time and
laws: and they shall be given into hi hand until a time and time and
the divid of time

7:26 but the judgment shall sit and they shall take away hi
dominion to consum and to destroy it unto the end

7:27 and the kingdom and dominion and the great of the kingdom
under the whole heaven shall be given to the peopl of the saint of
the most high whose kingdom is an everlast kingdom and all
dominion shall serv and obey him

7:28 hitherto is the end of the matter as for me daniel my
cogit much troubl me and my counten chang in me: but i
kept the matter in my heart

8:1 in the third year of the reign of king belshazzar a vision
appear unto me even unto me daniel after that which appear unto
me at the first

8:2 and i saw in a vision; and it came to pass when i saw that i wa
at shushan in the palac which is in the provinc of elam; and i saw
in a vision and i wa by the river of ulai

8:3 then i lift up mine eye and saw and behold there stood
befor the river a ram which had two horns: and the two horn were
high; but one wa higher than the other and the higher came up last

8:4 i saw the ram push westward and northward and southward; so
that no beast might stand befor him neither wa there ani that
could deliv out of hi hand; but he did accord to hi will and
becam great

8:5 and as i wa consid behold an he goat came from the west on
the face of the whole earth and touch not the ground: and the goat
had a notabl horn between hi eye

8:6 and he came to the ram that had two horn which i had seen
stand befor the river and ran unto him in the furi of hi power

8:7 and i saw him come close unto the ram and he wa move with
choler against him and smote the ram and brake hi two horns: and
there wa no power in the ram to stand befor him but he cast him
down to the ground and stamp upon him: and there wa none that
could deliv the ram out of hi hand

8:8 therefor the he goat wax veri great: and when he wa strong
the great horn wa broken; and for it came up four notabl one toward
the four wind of heaven

8:9 and out of one of them came forth a littl horn which wax
exceed great toward the south and toward the east and toward the
pleasant land

8:10 and it wax great even to the host of heaven; and it cast down
some of the host and of the star to the ground and stamp upon
them

8:11 yea he magnifi himself even to the princ of the host and by
him the daili sacrific wa taken away and the place of the sanctuari
wa cast down

8:12 and an host wa given him against the daili sacrific by reason
of transgress and it cast down the truth to the ground; and it
practis and prosper

8:13 then i heard one saint speak and anoth saint said unto that
certain saint which spake how long shall be the vision concern the
daili sacrific and the transgress of desol to give both the
sanctuari and the host to be trodden under foot? 8:14 and he said
unto me unto two thousand and three hundr days; then shall the
sanctuari be cleans

8:15 and it came to pass when i even i daniel had seen the vision
and sought for the mean then behold there stood befor me as the
appear of a man

8:16 and i heard a man voic between the bank of ulai which
call and said gabriel make thi man to understand the vision

8:17 so he came near where i stood: and when he came i wa afraid
and fell upon my face: but he said unto me understand o son of man:
for at the time of the end shall be the vision

8:18 now as he wa speak with me i wa in a deep sleep on my face
toward the ground: but he touch me and set me upright

8:19 and he said behold i will make thee know what shall be in the
last end of the indignation: for at the time appoint the end shall
be

8:20 the ram which thou sawest have two horn are the king of media
and persia

8:21 and the rough goat is the king of grecia: and the great horn that
is between hi eye is the first king

8:22 now that be broken wherea four stood up for it four
kingdom shall stand up out of the nation but not in hi power

8:23 and in the latter time of their kingdom when the transgressor
are come to the full a king of fierc counten and understand
dark sentenc shall stand up

8:24 and hi power shall be mighti but not by hi own power: and he
shall destroy wonder and shall prosper and practis and shall
destroy the mighti and the holi peopl

8:25 and through hi polici also he shall caus craft to prosper in
hi hand; and he shall magnifi himself in hi heart and by peac
shall destroy many: he shall also stand up against the princ of
princes; but he shall be broken without hand

8:26 and the vision of the even and the morn which wa told is
true: wherefor shut thou up the vision; for it shall be for mani
day

8:27 and i daniel faint and wa sick certain days; afterward i rose
up and did the king business; and i wa astonish at the vision
but none understood it

9:1 in the first year of dariu the son of ahasueru of the seed of
the mede which wa made king over the realm of the chaldeans; 9:2 in
the first year of hi reign i daniel understood by book the number of
the year whereof the word of the lord came to jeremiah the prophet
that he would accomplish seventi year in the desol of
jerusalem

9:3 and i set my face unto the lord god to seek by prayer and
supplic with fast and sackcloth and ashes: 9:4 and i
pray unto the lord my god and made my confess and said o lord
the great and dread god keep the coven and merci to them
that love him and to them that keep hi commandments; 9:5 we have
sin and have commit iniqu and have done wickedli and have
rebel even by depart from thi precept and from thi judgments:
9:6 neither have we hearken unto thi servant the prophet which
spake in thi name to our king our princ and our father and to
all the peopl of the land

9:7 o lord righteous belongeth unto thee but unto us confus
of face as at thi day; to the men of judah and to the inhabit
of jerusalem and unto all israel that are near and that are far
off through all the countri whither thou hast driven them becaus
of their trespass that they have trespass against thee

9:8 o lord to us belongeth confus of face to our king to our
princ and to our father becaus we have sin against thee

9:9 to the lord our god belong merci and forgiv though we
have rebel against him; 9:10 neither have we obey the voic of
the lord our god to walk in hi law which he set befor us by hi
servant the prophet

9:11 yea all israel have transgress thi law even by depart
that they might not obey thi voice; therefor the curs is pour upon
us and the oath that is written in the law of mose the servant of
god becaus we have sin against him

9:12 and he hath confirm hi word which he spake against us and
against our judg that judg us by bring upon us a great evil:
for under the whole heaven hath not been done as hath been done upon
jerusalem

9:13 as it is written in the law of mose all thi evil is come upon
us: yet made we not our prayer befor the lord our god that we might
turn from our iniqu and understand thi truth

9:14 therefor hath the lord watch upon the evil and brought it
upon us: for the lord our god is righteou in all hi work which he
doeth: for we obey not hi voic

9:15 and now o lord our god that hast brought thi peopl forth out
of the land of egypt with a mighti hand and hast gotten thee renown
as at thi day; we have sin we have done wickedli

9:16 o lord accord to all thi righteous i beseech thee let
thine anger and thi furi be turn away from thi citi jerusalem thi
holi mountain: becaus for our sin and for the iniqu of our
father jerusalem and thi peopl are becom a reproach to all that
are about us

9:17 now therefor o our god hear the prayer of thi servant and hi
supplic and caus thi face to shine upon thi sanctuari that is
desol for the lord sake

9:18 o my god inclin thine ear and hear; open thine eye and
behold our desol and the citi which is call by thi name: for
we do not present our supplic befor thee for our
righteous but for thi great merci

9:19 o lord hear; o lord forgive; o lord hearken and do; defer not
for thine own sake o my god: for thi citi and thi peopl are call
by thi name

9:20 and while i wa speak and pray and confess my sin and
the sin of my peopl israel and present my supplic befor the
lord my god for the holi mountain of my god; 9:21 yea while i wa
speak in prayer even the man gabriel whom i had seen in the
vision at the begin be caus to fli swiftli touch me about
the time of the even oblat

9:22 and he inform me and talk with me and said o daniel i am
now come forth to give thee skill and understand

9:23 at the begin of thi supplic the command came forth
and i am come to shew thee; for thou art greatli beloved: therefor
understand the matter and consid the vision

9:24 seventi week are determin upon thi peopl and upon thi holi
citi to finish the transgress and to make an end of sin and to
make reconcili for iniqu and to bring in everlast
righteous and to seal up the vision and propheci and to anoint
the most holi

9:25 know therefor and understand that from the go forth of the
command to restor and to build jerusalem unto the messiah the
princ shall be seven week and threescor and two weeks: the street
shall be built again and the wall even in troublou time

9:26 and after threescor and two week shall messiah be cut off but
not for himself: and the peopl of the princ that shall come shall
destroy the citi and the sanctuary; and the end thereof shall be with
a flood and unto the end of the war desol are determin

9:27 and he shall confirm the coven with mani for one week: and in
the midst of the week he shall caus the sacrific and the oblat to
ceas and for the overspread of abomin he shall make it
desol even until the consumm and that determin shall be
pour upon the desol

10:1 in the third year of cyru king of persia a thing wa reveal
unto daniel whose name wa call belteshazzar; and the thing wa
true but the time appoint wa long: and he understood the thing
and had understand of the vision

10:2 in those day i daniel wa mourn three full week

10:3 i ate no pleasant bread neither came flesh nor wine in my mouth
neither did i anoint myself at all till three whole week were
fulfil

10:4 and in the four and twentieth day of the first month as i wa by
the side of the great river which is hiddekel; 10:5 then i lift up
mine eye and look and behold a certain man cloth in linen
whose loin were gird with fine gold of uphaz: 10:6 hi bodi also
wa like the beryl and hi face as the appear of lightn and
hi eye as lamp of fire and hi arm and hi feet like in colour to
polish brass and the voic of hi word like the voic of a
multitud

10:7 and i daniel alon saw the vision: for the men that were with me
saw not the vision; but a great quak fell upon them so that they
fled to hide themselv

10:8 therefor i wa left alon and saw thi great vision and there
remain no strength in me: for my comeli wa turn in me into
corrupt and i retain no strength

10:9 yet heard i the voic of hi words: and when i heard the voic of
hi word then wa i in a deep sleep on my face and my face toward
the ground

10:10 and behold an hand touch me which set me upon my knee and
upon the palm of my hand

10:11 and he said unto me o daniel a man greatli belov understand
the word that i speak unto thee and stand upright: for unto thee am
i now sent

and when he had spoken thi word unto me i stood trembl

10:12 then said he unto me fear not daniel: for from the first day
that thou didst set thine heart to understand and to chasten thyself
befor thi god thi word were heard and i am come for thi word

10:13 but the princ of the kingdom of persia withstood me one and
twenti days: but lo michael one of the chief princ came to help
me; and i remain there with the king of persia

10:14 now i am come to make thee understand what shall befal thi
peopl in the latter days: for yet the vision is for mani day

10:15 and when he had spoken such word unto me i set my face toward
the ground and i becam dumb

10:16 and behold one like the similitud of the son of men touch
my lips: then i open my mouth and spake and said unto him that
stood befor me o my lord by the vision my sorrow are turn upon
me and i have retain no strength

10:17 for how can the servant of thi my lord talk with thi my lord?
for as for me straightway there remain no strength in me neither
is there breath left in me

10:18 then there came again and touch me one like the appear of
a man and he strengthen me 10:19 and said o man greatli belov
fear not: peac be unto thee be strong yea be strong and when he
had spoken unto me i wa strengthen and said let my lord speak;
for thou hast strengthen me

10:20 then said he knowest thou wherefor i come unto thee? and now
will i return to fight with the princ of persia: and when i am gone
forth lo the princ of grecia shall come

10:21 but i will shew thee that which is note in the scriptur of
truth: and there is none that holdeth with me in these thing but
michael your princ

11:1 also i in the first year of dariu the mede even i stood to
confirm and to strengthen him

11:2 and now will i shew thee the truth behold there shall stand up
yet three king in persia; and the fourth shall be far richer than
they all: and by hi strength through hi rich he shall stir up all
against the realm of grecia

11:3 and a mighti king shall stand up that shall rule with great
dominion and do accord to hi will

11:4 and when he shall stand up hi kingdom shall be broken and
