shall be divid toward the four wind of heaven; and not to hi
poster nor accord to hi dominion which he ruled: for hi
kingdom shall be pluck up even for other besid those

11:5 and the king of the south shall be strong and one of hi
princes; and he shall be strong abov him and have dominion; hi
dominion shall be a great dominion

11:6 and in the end of year they shall join themselv together; for
the king daughter of the south shall come to the king of the north
to make an agreement: but she shall not retain the power of the arm;
neither shall he stand nor hi arm: but she shall be given up and
they that brought her and he that begat her and he that strengthen
her in these time

11:7 but out of a branch of her root shall one stand up in hi
estat which shall come with an armi and shall enter into the
fortress of the king of the north and shall deal against them and
shall prevail: 11:8 and shall also carri captiv into egypt their
god with their princ and with their preciou vessel of silver
and of gold; and he shall continu more year than the king of the
north

11:9 so the king of the south shall come into hi kingdom and shall
return into hi own land

11:10 but hi son shall be stir up and shall assembl a multitud
of great forces: and one shall certainli come and overflow and pass
through: then shall he return and be stir up even to hi
fortress

11:11 and the king of the south shall be move with choler and shall
come forth and fight with him even with the king of the north: and he
shall set forth a great multitude; but the multitud shall be given
into hi hand

11:12 and when he hath taken away the multitud hi heart shall be
lift up; and he shall cast down mani ten thousands: but he shall not
be strengthen by it

11:13 for the king of the north shall return and shall set forth a
multitud greater than the former and shall certainli come after
certain year with a great armi and with much rich

11:14 and in those time there shall mani stand up against the king of
the south: also the robber of thi peopl shall exalt themselv to
establish the vision; but they shall fall

11:15 so the king of the north shall come and cast up a mount and
take the most fenc cities: and the arm of the south shall not
withstand neither hi chosen peopl neither shall there be ani
strength to withstand

11:16 but he that cometh against him shall do accord to hi own
will and none shall stand befor him: and he shall stand in the
gloriou land which by hi hand shall be consum

11:17 he shall also set hi face to enter with the strength of hi
whole kingdom and upright one with him; thu shall he do: and he
shall give him the daughter of women corrupt her: but she shall
not stand on hi side neither be for him

11:18 after thi shall he turn hi face unto the isl and shall take
many: but a princ for hi own behalf shall caus the reproach offer
by him to cease; without hi own reproach he shall caus it to turn
upon him

11:19 then he shall turn hi face toward the fort of hi own land: but
he shall stumbl and fall and not be found

11:20 then shall stand up in hi estat a raiser of tax in the glori
of the kingdom: but within few day he shall be destroy neither in
anger nor in battl

11:21 and in hi estat shall stand up a vile person to whom they
shall not give the honour of the kingdom: but he shall come in
peaceabl and obtain the kingdom by flatteri

11:22 and with the arm of a flood shall they be overflown from befor
him and shall be broken; yea also the princ of the coven

11:23 and after the leagu made with him he shall work deceitfully:
for he shall come up and shall becom strong with a small peopl

11:24 he shall enter peaceabl even upon the fattest place of the
province; and he shall do that which hi father have not done nor
hi father fathers; he shall scatter among them the prey and spoil
and riches: yea and he shall forecast hi devic against the strong
hold even for a time

11:25 and he shall stir up hi power and hi courag against the king
of the south with a great army; and the king of the south shall be
stir up to battl with a veri great and mighti army; but he shall
not stand: for they shall forecast devic against him

11:26 yea they that feed of the portion of hi meat shall destroy
him and hi armi shall overflow: and mani shall fall down slain

11:27 and both of these king heart shall be to do mischief and
they shall speak lie at one table; but it shall not prosper: for yet
the end shall be at the time appoint

11:28 then shall he return into hi land with great riches; and hi
heart shall be against the holi covenant; and he shall do exploit
and return to hi own land

11:29 at the time appoint he shall return and come toward the
south; but it shall not be as the former or as the latter

11:30 for the ship of chittim shall come against him: therefor he
shall be griev and return and have indign against the holi
covenant: so shall he do; he shall even return and have intellig
with them that forsak the holi coven

11:31 and arm shall stand on hi part and they shall pollut the
sanctuari of strength and shall take away the daili sacrific and
they shall place the abomin that maketh desol

11:32 and such as do wickedli against the coven shall he corrupt by
flatteries: but the peopl that do know their god shall be strong and
do exploit

11:33 and they that understand among the peopl shall instruct many:
yet they shall fall by the sword and by flame by captiv and by
spoil mani day

11:34 now when they shall fall they shall be holpen with a littl
help: but mani shall cleav to them with flatteri

11:35 and some of them of understand shall fall to tri them and
to purg and to make them white even to the time of the end: becaus
it is yet for a time appoint

11:36 and the king shall do accord to hi will; and he shall exalt
himself and magnifi himself abov everi god and shall speak
marvel thing against the god of god and shall prosper till the
indign be accomplished: for that that is determin shall be
done

11:37 neither shall he regard the god of hi father nor the desir
of women nor regard ani god: for he shall magnifi himself abov all

11:38 but in hi estat shall he honour the god of forces: and a god
whom hi father knew not shall he honour with gold and silver and
with preciou stone and pleasant thing

11:39 thu shall he do in the most strong hold with a strang god
whom he shall acknowledg and increas with glory: and he shall caus
them to rule over mani and shall divid the land for gain

11:40 and at the time of the end shall the king of the south push at
him: and the king of the north shall come against him like a
whirlwind with chariot and with horsemen and with mani ships; and
he shall enter into the countri and shall overflow and pass over

11:41 he shall enter also into the gloriou land and mani countri
shall be overthrown: but these shall escap out of hi hand even
edom and moab and the chief of the children of ammon

11:42 he shall stretch forth hi hand also upon the countries: and the
land of egypt shall not escap

11:43 but he shall have power over the treasur of gold and of
silver and over all the preciou thing of egypt: and the libyan and
the ethiopian shall be at hi step

11:44 but tide out of the east and out of the north shall troubl
him: therefor he shall go forth with great furi to destroy and
utterli to make away mani

11:45 and he shall plant the tabernacl of hi palac between the
sea in the gloriou holi mountain; yet he shall come to hi end and
none shall help him

12:1 and at that time shall michael stand up the great princ which
standeth for the children of thi people: and there shall be a time of
troubl such as never wa sinc there wa a nation even to that same
time: and at that time thi peopl shall be deliv everi one that
shall be found written in the book

12:2 and mani of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awak
some to everlast life and some to shame and everlast contempt

12:3 and they that be wise shall shine as the bright of the
firmament; and they that turn mani to righteous as the star for
ever and ever

12:4 but thou o daniel shut up the word and seal the book even to
the time of the end: mani shall run to and fro and knowledg shall be
increas

12:5 then i daniel look and behold there stood other two the one
on thi side of the bank of the river and the other on that side of
the bank of the river

12:6 and one said to the man cloth in linen which wa upon the
water of the river how long shall it be to the end of these wonders?
12:7 and i heard the man cloth in linen which wa upon the water
of the river when he held up hi right hand and hi left hand unto
heaven and sware by him that liveth for ever that it shall be for a
time time and an half; and when he shall have accomplish to
scatter the power of the holi peopl all these thing shall be
finish

12:8 and i heard but i understood not: then said i o my lord what
shall be the end of these things? 12:9 and he said go thi way
daniel: for the word are close up and seal till the time of the
end

12:10 mani shall be purifi and made white and tried; but the
wick shall do wickedly: and none of the wick shall understand; but
the wise shall understand

12:11 and from the time that the daili sacrific shall be taken away
and the abomin that maketh desol set up there shall be a
thousand two hundr and nineti day

12:12 bless is he that waiteth and cometh to the thousand three
hundr and five and thirti day

12:13 but go thou thi way till the end be: for thou shalt rest
and stand in thi lot at the end of the day




hosea


1:1 the word of the lord that came unto hosea the son of beeri in
the day of uzziah jotham ahaz and hezekiah king of judah and in
the day of jeroboam the son of joash king of israel

1:2 the begin of the word of the lord by hosea and the lord said
to hosea go take unto thee a wife of whoredom and children of
whoredoms: for the land hath commit great whoredom depart from
the lord

1:3 so he went and took gomer the daughter of diblaim; which
conceiv and bare him a son

1:4 and the lord said unto him call hi name jezreel; for yet a
littl while and i will aveng the blood of jezreel upon the hous of
jehu and will caus to ceas the kingdom of the hous of israel

1:5 and it shall come to pass at that day that i will break the bow
of israel in the valley of jezreel

1:6 and she conceiv again and bare a daughter and god said unto
him call her name loruhamah: for i will no more have merci upon the
hous of israel; but i will utterli take them away

1:7 but i will have merci upon the hous of judah and will save them
by the lord their god and will not save them by bow nor by sword
nor by battl by hors nor by horsemen

1:8 now when she had wean loruhamah she conceiv and bare a son

1:9 then said god call hi name loammi: for ye are not my peopl and
i will not be your god

1:10 yet the number of the children of israel shall be as the sand of
the sea which cannot be measur nor numbered; and it shall come to
pass that in the place where it wa said unto them ye are not my
peopl there it shall be said unto them ye are the son of the
live god

1:11 then shall the children of judah and the children of israel be
gather togeth and appoint themselv one head and they shall
come up out of the land: for great shall be the day of jezreel

2:1 say ye unto your brethren ammi; and to your sister ruhamah

2:2 plead with your mother plead: for she is not my wife neither am
i her husband: let her therefor put away her whoredom out of her
sight and her adulteri from between her breasts; 2:3 lest i strip
her nake and set her as in the day that she wa born and make her
as a wilder and set her like a dri land and slay her with
thirst

2:4 and i will not have merci upon her children; for they be the
children of whoredom

2:5 for their mother hath play the harlot: she that conceiv them
hath done shamefully: for she said i will go after my lover that
give me my bread and my water my wool and my flax mine oil and my
drink

2:6 therefor behold i will hedg up thi way with thorn and make a
wall that she shall not find her path

2:7 and she shall follow after her lover but she shall not overtak
them; and she shall seek them but shall not find them: then shall she
say i will go and return to my first husband; for then wa it better
with me than now

2:8 for she did not know that i gave her corn and wine and oil and
multipli her silver and gold which they prepar for baal

2:9 therefor will i return and take away my corn in the time
thereof and my wine in the season thereof and will recov my wool
and my flax given to cover her naked

2:10 and now will i discov her lewd in the sight of her lover
and none shall deliv her out of mine hand

2:11 i will also caus all her mirth to ceas her feast day her new
moon and her sabbath and all her solemn feast

2:12 and i will destroy her vine and her fig tree whereof she hath
said these are my reward that my lover have given me: and i will
make them a forest and the beast of the field shall eat them

2:13 and i will visit upon her the day of baalim wherein she burn
incens to them and she deck herself with her ear and her
jewel and she went after her lover and forgat me saith the lord

2:14 therefor behold i will allur her and bring her into the
wilder and speak comfort unto her

2:15 and i will give her her vineyard from thenc and the valley of
achor for a door of hope: and she shall sing there as in the day of
her youth and as in the day when she came up out of the land of
egypt

2:16 and it shall be at that day saith the lord that thou shalt call
me ishi; and shalt call me no more baali

2:17 for i will take away the name of baalim out of her mouth and
they shall no more be rememb by their name

2:18 and in that day will i make a coven for them with the beast
of the field and with the fowl of heaven and with the creep
thing of the ground: and i will break the bow and the sword and the
battl out of the earth and will make them to lie down safe

2:19 and i will betroth thee unto me for ever; yea i will betroth
thee unto me in righteous and in judgment and in lovingkind
and in merci

2:20 i will even betroth thee unto me in faithfulness: and thou shalt
know the lord

2:21 and it shall come to pass in that day i will hear saith the
lord i will hear the heaven and they shall hear the earth; 2:22 and
the earth shall hear the corn and the wine and the oil; and they
shall hear jezreel

2:23 and i will sow her unto me in the earth; and i will have merci
upon her that had not obtain mercy; and i will say to them which
were not my peopl thou art my people; and they shall say thou art
my god

3:1 then said the lord unto me go yet love a woman belov of her
friend yet an adulteress accord to the love of the lord toward
the children of israel who look to other god and love flagon of
wine

3:2 so i bought her to me for fifteen piec of silver and for an
homer of barley and an half homer of barley: 3:3 and i said unto her
thou shalt abid for me mani days; thou shalt not play the harlot and
thou shalt not be for anoth man: so will i also be for thee

3:4 for the children of israel shall abid mani day without a king
and without a princ and without a sacrific and without an imag
and without an ephod and without teraphim: 3:5 afterward shall the
children of israel return and seek the lord their god and david
their king; and shall fear the lord and hi good in the latter
day

4:1 hear the word of the lord ye children of israel: for the lord
hath a controversi with the inhabit of the land becaus there is
no truth nor merci nor knowledg of god in the land

4:2 by swear and lie and kill and steal and commit
adulteri they break out and blood toucheth blood

4:3 therefor shall the land mourn and everi one that dwelleth
therein shall languish with the beast of the field and with the
fowl of heaven; yea the fish of the sea also shall be taken away

4:4 yet let no man strive nor reprov another: for thi peopl are as
they that strive with the priest

4:5 therefor shalt thou fall in the day and the prophet also shall
fall with thee in the night and i will destroy thi mother

4:6 my peopl are destroy for lack of knowledge: becaus thou hast
reject knowledg i will also reject thee that thou shalt be no
priest to me: see thou hast forgotten the law of thi god i will
also forget thi children

4:7 as they were increas so they sin against me: therefor will
i chang their glori into shame

4:8 they eat up the sin of my peopl and they set their heart on
their iniqu

4:9 and there shall be like peopl like priest: and i will punish
them for their way and reward them their do

4:10 for they shall eat and not have enough: they shall commit
whoredom and shall not increase: becaus they have left off to take
heed to the lord

4:11 whoredom and wine and new wine take away the heart

4:12 my peopl ask counsel at their stock and their staff declareth
unto them: for the spirit of whoredom hath caus them to err and
they have gone a whore from under their god

4:13 they sacrific upon the top of the mountain and burn incens
upon the hill under oak and poplar and elm becaus the shadow
thereof is good: therefor your daughter shall commit whoredom and
your spous shall commit adulteri

4:14 i will not punish your daughter when they commit whoredom nor
your spous when they commit adultery: for themselv are separ
with whore and they sacrific with harlots: therefor the peopl
that doth not understand shall fall

4:15 though thou israel play the harlot yet let not judah offend;
and come not ye unto gilgal neither go ye up to bethaven nor swear
the lord liveth

4:16 for israel slideth back as a backslid heifer: now the lord
will feed them as a lamb in a larg place

4:17 ephraim is join to idols: let him alon

4:18 their drink is sour: they have commit whoredom continually:
her ruler with shame do love give ye

4:19 the wind hath bound her up in her wing and they shall be
asham becaus of their sacrific

5:1 hear ye thi o priests; and hearken ye hous of israel; and give
ye ear o hous of the king; for judgment is toward you becaus ye
have been a snare on mizpah and a net spread upon tabor

5:2 and the revolt are profound to make slaughter though i have
been a rebuk of them all

5:3 i know ephraim and israel is not hid from me: for now o ephraim
thou committest whoredom and israel is defil

5:4 they will not frame their do to turn unto their god: for the
spirit of whoredom is in the midst of them and they have not known
the lord

5:5 and the pride of israel doth testifi to hi face: therefor shall
israel and ephraim fall in their iniquity: judah also shall fall with
them

5:6 they shall go with their flock and with their herd to seek the
lord; but they shall not find him; he hath withdrawn himself from
them

5:7 they have dealt treacher against the lord: for they have
begotten strang children: now shall a month devour them with their
portion

5:8 blow ye the cornet in gibeah and the trumpet in ramah: cri aloud
at bethaven after thee o benjamin

5:9 ephraim shall be desol in the day of rebuke: among the tribe
of israel have i made known that which shall sure be

5:10 the princ of judah were like them that remov the bound:
therefor i will pour out my wrath upon them like water

5:11 ephraim is oppress and broken in judgment becaus he willingli
walk after the command

5:12 therefor will i be unto ephraim as a moth and to the hous of
judah as rotten

5:13 when ephraim saw hi sick and judah saw hi wound then went
ephraim to the assyrian and sent to king jareb: yet could he not heal
you nor cure you of your wound

5:14 for i will be unto ephraim as a lion and as a young lion to the
hous of judah: i even i will tear and go away; i will take away
and none shall rescu him

5:15 i will go and return to my place till they acknowledg their
offenc and seek my face: in their afflict they will seek me
earli

6:1 come and let us return unto the lord: for he hath torn and he
will heal us; he hath smitten and he will bind us up

6:2 after two day will he reviv us: in the third day he will rais
us up and we shall live in hi sight

6:3 then shall we know if we follow on to know the lord: hi go
forth is prepar as the morning; and he shall come unto us as the
rain as the latter and former rain unto the earth

6:4 o ephraim what shall i do unto thee? o judah what shall i do
unto thee? for your good is as a morn cloud and as the earli
dew it goeth away

6:5 therefor have i hew them by the prophets; i have slain them by
the word of my mouth: and thi judgment are as the light that goeth
forth

6:6 for i desir merci and not sacrifice; and the knowledg of god
more than burnt offer

6:7 but they like men have transgress the covenant: there have they
dealt treacher against me

6:8 gilead is a citi of them that work iniqu and is pollut with
blood

6:9 and as troop of robber wait for a man so the compani of priest
murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewd

6:10 i have seen an horribl thing in the hous of israel: there is
the whoredom of ephraim israel is defil

6:11 also o judah he hath set an harvest for thee when i return
the captiv of my peopl

7:1 when i would have heal israel then the iniqu of ephraim wa
discov and the wicked of samaria: for they commit falsehood;
and the thief cometh in and the troop of robber spoileth without

7:2 and they consid not in their heart that i rememb all their
wickedness: now their own do have beset them about; they are
befor my face

7:3 they make the king glad with their wicked and the princ
with their lie

7:4 they are all adulter as an oven heat by the baker who
ceaseth from rais after he hath knead the dough until it be
leaven

7:5 in the day of our king the princ have made him sick with bottl
of wine; he stretch out hi hand with scorner

7:6 for they have made readi their heart like an oven while they lie
in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morn it burneth
as a flame fire

7:7 they are all hot as an oven and have devour their judges; all
their king are fallen: there is none among them that calleth unto me

7:8 ephraim he hath mix himself among the people; ephraim is a cake
not turn

7:9 stranger have devour hi strength and he knoweth it not: yea
gray hair are here and there upon him yet he knoweth not

7:10 and the pride of israel testifieth to hi face: and they do not
return to the lord their god nor seek him for all thi

7:11 ephraim also is like a silli dove without heart: they call to
egypt they go to assyria

7:12 when they shall go i will spread my net upon them; i will bring
them down as the fowl of the heaven; i will chastis them as their
congreg hath heard

7:13 woe unto them! for they have fled from me: destruct unto them!
becaus they have transgress against me: though i have redeem
them yet they have spoken lie against me

7:14 and they have not cri unto me with their heart when they
howl upon their beds: they assembl themselv for corn and wine
and they rebel against me

7:15 though i have bound and strengthen their arm yet do they
imagin mischief against me

7:16 they return but not to the most high: they are like a deceit
bow: their princ shall fall by the sword for the rage of their
tongue: thi shall be their deris in the land of egypt

8:1 set the trumpet to thi mouth he shall come as an eagl against
the hous of the lord becaus they have transgress my coven and
trespass against my law

8:2 israel shall cri unto me my god we know thee

8:3 israel hath cast off the thing that is good: the enemi shall
pursu him

8:4 they have set up king but not by me: they have made princ and
i knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them
idol that they may be cut off

8:5 thi calf o samaria hath cast thee off; mine anger is kindl
against them: how long will it be ere they attain to innocency? 8:6
for from israel wa it also: the workman made it; therefor it is not
god: but the calf of samaria shall be broken in piec

8:7 for they have sown the wind and they shall reap the whirlwind: it
hath no stalk; the bud shall yield no meal: if so be it yield the
stranger shall swallow it up

8:8 israel is swallow up: now shall they be among the gentil as a
vessel wherein is no pleasur

8:9 for they are gone up to assyria a wild ass alon by himself:
ephraim hath hire lover

8:10 yea though they have hire among the nation now will i gather
them and they shall sorrow a littl for the burden of the king of
princ

8:11 becaus ephraim hath made mani altar to sin altar shall be
unto him to sin

8:12 i have written to him the great thing of my law but they were
count as a strang thing

8:13 they sacrific flesh for the sacrific of mine offer and
eat it; but the lord accepteth them not; now will he rememb their
iniqu and visit their sins: they shall return to egypt

8:14 for israel hath forgotten hi maker and buildeth temples; and
judah hath multipli fenc cities: but i will send a fire upon hi
citi and it shall devour the palac thereof

9:1 rejoic not o israel for joy as other people: for thou hast
gone a whore from thi god thou hast love a reward upon everi
cornfloor

9:2 the floor and the winepress shall not feed them and the new wine
shall fail in her

9:3 they shall not dwell in the lord land; but ephraim shall return
to egypt and they shall eat unclean thing in assyria

9:4 they shall not offer wine offer to the lord neither shall
they be pleas unto him: their sacrific shall be unto them as the
bread of mourners; all that eat thereof shall be polluted: for their
bread for their soul shall not come into the hous of the lord

9:5 what will ye do in the solemn day and in the day of the feast of
the lord? 9:6 for lo they are gone becaus of destruction: egypt
shall gather them up memphi shall buri them: the pleasant place for
their silver nettl shall possess them: thorn shall be in their
tabernacl

9:7 the day of visit are come the day of recomp are come;
israel shall know it: the prophet is a fool the spiritu man is mad
for the multitud of thine iniqu and the great hatr

9:8 the watchman of ephraim wa with my god: but the prophet is a
snare of a fowler in all hi way and hatr in the hous of hi god

9:9 they have deepli corrupt themselv as in the day of gibeah:
therefor he will rememb their iniqu he will visit their sin

9:10 i found israel like grape in the wilderness; i saw your father
as the firstrip in the fig tree at her first time: but they went to
baalpeor and separ themselv unto that shame; and their
abomin were accord as they love

9:11 as for ephraim their glori shall fli away like a bird from the
birth and from the womb and from the concept

9:12 though they bring up their children yet will i bereav them
that there shall not be a man left: yea woe also to them when i
depart from them! 9:13 ephraim as i saw tyru is plant in a
pleasant place: but ephraim shall bring forth hi children to the
murder

9:14 give them o lord: what wilt thou give? give them a miscarri
womb and dri breast

9:15 all their wicked is in gilgal: for there i hate them: for
the wicked of their do i will drive them out of mine hous i
will love them no more: all their princ are revolt

9:16 ephraim is smitten their root is dri up they shall bear no
fruit: yea though they bring forth yet will i slay even the belov
fruit of their womb

9:17 my god will cast them away becaus they did not hearken unto
him: and they shall be wander among the nation

10:1 israel is an empti vine he bringeth forth fruit unto himself:
accord to the multitud of hi fruit he hath increas the altars;
accord to the good of hi land they have made goodli imag

10:2 their heart is divided; now shall they be found faulty: he shall
break down their altar he shall spoil their imag

10:3 for now they shall say we have no king becaus we fear not
the lord; what then should a king do to us? 10:4 they have spoken
word swear fals in make a covenant: thu judgment springeth
up as hemlock in the furrow of the field

10:5 the inhabit of samaria shall fear becaus of the calv of
bethaven: for the peopl thereof shall mourn over it and the priest
thereof that rejoic on it for the glori thereof becaus it is
depart from it

10:6 it shall be also carri unto assyria for a present to king
jareb: ephraim shall receiv shame and israel shall be asham of hi
own counsel

10:7 as for samaria her king is cut off as the foam upon the water

10:8 the high place also of aven the sin of israel shall be
destroyed: the thorn and the thistl shall come up on their altars;
and they shall say to the mountain cover us; and to the hill fall
on us

10:9 o israel thou hast sin from the day of gibeah: there they
stood: the battl in gibeah against the children of iniqu did not
overtak them

10:10 it is in my desir that i should chastis them; and the peopl
shall be gather against them when they shall bind themselv in
their two furrow

10:11 and ephraim is as an heifer that is taught and loveth to tread
out the corn; but i pass over upon her fair neck: i will make
ephraim to ride; judah shall plow and jacob shall break hi clod

10:12 sow to yourselv in righteous reap in mercy; break up your
fallow ground: for it is time to seek the lord till he come and rain
righteous upon you

10:13 ye have plow wicked ye have reap iniquity; ye have
eaten the fruit of lies: becaus thou didst trust in thi way in the
multitud of thi mighti men

10:14 therefor shall a tumult aris among thi peopl and all thi
fortress shall be spoil as shalman spoil betharbel in the day
of battle: the mother wa dash in piec upon her children

10:15 so shall bethel do unto you becaus of your great wickedness: in
a morn shall the king of israel utterli be cut off

11:1 when israel wa a child then i love him and call my son out
of egypt

11:2 as they call them so they went from them: they sacrif unto
baalim and burn incens to graven imag

11:3 i taught ephraim also to go take them by their arms; but they
knew not that i heal them

11:4 i drew them with cord of a man with band of love: and i wa to
them as they that take off the yoke on their jaw and i laid meat
unto them

11:5 he shall not return into the land of egypt and the assyrian
shall be hi king becaus they refus to return

11:6 and the sword shall abid on hi citi and shall consum hi
branch and devour them becaus of their own counsel

11:7 and my peopl are bent to backslid from me: though they call
them to the most high none at all would exalt him

11:8 how shall i give thee up ephraim? how shall i deliv thee
israel? how shall i make thee as admah? how shall i set thee as
zeboim? mine heart is turn within me my repent are kindl
togeth

11:9 i will not execut the fierc of mine anger i will not
return to destroy ephraim: for i am god and not man; the holi one in
the midst of thee: and i will not enter into the citi

11:10 they shall walk after the lord: he shall roar like a lion: when
he shall roar then the children shall trembl from the west

11:11 they shall trembl as a bird out of egypt and as a dove out of
the land of assyria: and i will place them in their hous saith the
lord

11:12 ephraim compasseth me about with lie and the hous of israel
with deceit: but judah yet ruleth with god and is faith with the
saint

12:1 ephraim feedeth on wind and followeth after the east wind: he
daili increaseth lie and desolation; and they do make a coven with
the assyrian and oil is carri into egypt

12:2 the lord hath also a controversi with judah and will punish
jacob accord to hi ways; accord to hi do will he
recompens him

12:3 he took hi brother by the heel in the womb and by hi strength
he had power with god: 12:4 yea he had power over the angel and
prevailed: he wept and made supplic unto him: he found him in
bethel and there he spake with us; 12:5 even the lord god of hosts;
the lord is hi memori

12:6 therefor turn thou to thi god: keep merci and judgment and wait
on thi god continu

12:7 he is a merchant the balanc of deceit are in hi hand: he
loveth to oppress

12:8 and ephraim said yet i am becom rich i have found me out
substance: in all my labour they shall find none iniqu in me that
were sin

12:9 and i that am the lord thi god from the land of egypt will yet
make thee to dwell in tabernacl as in the day of the solemn feast

12:10 i have also spoken by the prophet and i have multipli
vision and use similitud by the ministri of the prophet

12:11 is there iniqu in gilead? sure they are vanity: they
sacrific bullock in gilgal; yea their altar are as heap in the
furrow of the field

12:12 and jacob fled into the countri of syria and israel serv for
a wife and for a wife he kept sheep

12:13 and by a prophet the lord brought israel out of egypt and by a
prophet wa he preserv

12:14 ephraim provok him to anger most bitterly: therefor shall he
leav hi blood upon him and hi reproach shall hi lord return unto
him

13:1 when ephraim spake trembl he exalt himself in israel; but
when he offend in baal he die

13:2 and now they sin more and more and have made them molten imag
of their silver and idol accord to their own understand all
of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them let the men that
sacrific kiss the calv

13:3 therefor they shall be as the morn cloud and as the earli dew
that passeth away as the chaff that is driven with the whirlwind out
of the floor and as the smoke out of the chimney

13:4 yet i am the lord thi god from the land of egypt and thou shalt
know no god but me: for there is no saviour besid me

13:5 i did know thee in the wilder in the land of great drought

13:6 accord to their pastur so were they filled; they were
fill and their heart wa exalted; therefor have they forgotten me

13:7 therefor i will be unto them as a lion: as a leopard by the way
will i observ them: 13:8 i will meet them as a bear that is bereav
of her whelp and will rend the caul of their heart and there will i
devour them like a lion: the wild beast shall tear them

13:9 o israel thou hast destroy thyself; but in me is thine help

13:10 i will be thi king: where is ani other that may save thee in all
thi cities? and thi judg of whom thou saidst give me a king and
princes? 13:11 i gave thee a king in mine anger and took him away in
my wrath

13:12 the iniqu of ephraim is bound up; hi sin is hid

13:13 the sorrow of a travail woman shall come upon him: he is an
unwis son; for he should not stay long in the place of the break
forth of children

13:14 i will ransom them from the power of the grave; i will redeem
them from death: o death i will be thi plagues; o grave i will be
thi destruction: repent shall be hid from mine eye

13:15 though he be fruit among hi brethren an east wind shall
come the wind of the lord shall come up from the wilder and hi
spring shall becom dri and hi fountain shall be dri up: he shall
spoil the treasur of all pleasant vessel

13:16 samaria shall becom desolate; for she hath rebel against her
god: they shall fall by the sword: their infant shall be dash in
piec and their women with child shall be rip up

14:1 o israel return unto the lord thi god; for thou hast fallen by
thine iniqu

14:2 take with you word and turn to the lord: say unto him take
away all iniqu and receiv us graciously: so will we render the
calv of our lip

14:3 asshur shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses: neither
will we say ani more to the work of our hand ye are our gods: for in
thee the fatherless findeth merci

14:4 i will heal their backslid i will love them freely: for mine
anger is turn away from him

14:5 i will be as the dew unto israel: he shall grow as the lili and
cast forth hi root as lebanon

14:6 hi branch shall spread and hi beauti shall be as the oliv
tree and hi smell as lebanon

14:7 they that dwell under hi shadow shall return; they shall reviv
as the corn and grow as the vine: the scent thereof shall be as the
wine of lebanon

14:8 ephraim shall say what have i to do ani more with idols? i have
heard him and observ him: i am like a green fir tree from me is
thi fruit found

14:9 who is wise and he shall understand these things? prudent and
he shall know them? for the way of the lord are right and the just
shall walk in them: but the transgressor shall fall therein




joel


1:1 the word of the lord that came to joel the son of pethuel

1:2 hear thi ye old men and give ear all ye inhabit of the land

hath thi been in your day or even in the day of your fathers? 1:3
tell ye your children of it and let your children tell their
children and their children anoth gener

1:4 that which the palmerworm hath left hath the locust eaten; and
that which the locust hath left hath the cankerworm eaten; and that
which the cankerworm hath left hath the caterpil eaten

1:5 awak ye drunkard and weep; and howl all ye drinker of wine
becaus of the new wine; for it is cut off from your mouth

1:6 for a nation is come up upon my land strong and without number
whose teeth are the teeth of a lion and he hath the cheek teeth of a
great lion

1:7 he hath laid my vine wast and bark my fig tree: he hath made
it clean bare and cast it away; the branch thereof are made white

1:8 lament like a virgin gird with sackcloth for the husband of her
youth

1:9 the meat offer and the drink offer is cut off from the hous
of the lord; the priest the lord minist mourn

1:10 the field is wast the land mourneth; for the corn is wasted:
the new wine is dri up the oil languisheth

1:11 be ye asham o ye husbandmen; howl o ye vinedress for the
wheat and for the barley; becaus the harvest of the field is
perish

1:12 the vine is dri up and the fig tree languisheth; the
pomegran tree the palm tree also and the appl tree even all the
tree of the field are withered: becaus joy is wither away from
the son of men

1:13 gird yourselv and lament ye priests: howl ye minist of
the altar: come lie all night in sackcloth ye minist of my god:
for the meat offer and the drink offer is withholden from the
hous of your god

1:14 sanctifi ye a fast call a solemn assembl gather the elder and
all the inhabit of the land into the hous of the lord your god
and cri unto the lord 1:15 ala for the day! for the day of the lord
is at hand and as a destruct from the almighti shall it come

1:16 is not the meat cut off befor our eye yea joy and glad
from the hous of our god? 1:17 the seed is rotten under their clod
the garner are laid desol the barn are broken down; for the corn
is wither

1:18 how do the beast groan! the herd of cattl are perplex
becaus they have no pasture; yea the flock of sheep are made
desol

1:19 o lord to thee will i cry: for the fire hath devour the
pastur of the wilder and the flame hath burn all the tree of
the field

1:20 the beast of the field cri also unto thee: for the river of
water are dri up and the fire hath devour the pastur of the
wilder

2:1 blow ye the trumpet in zion and sound an alarm in my holi
mountain: let all the inhabit of the land tremble: for the day of
the lord cometh for it is nigh at hand; 2:2 a day of dark and of
gloomi a day of cloud and of thick dark as the morn
spread upon the mountains: a great peopl and a strong; there hath not
been ever the like neither shall be ani more after it even to the
year of mani gener

2:3 a fire devoureth befor them; and behind them a flame burneth: the
land is as the garden of eden befor them and behind them a desol
wilderness; yea and noth shall escap them

2:4 the appear of them is as the appear of horses; and as
horsemen so shall they run

2:5 like the nois of chariot on the top of mountain shall they
leap like the nois of a flame of fire that devoureth the stubbl as
a strong peopl set in battl array

2:6 befor their face the peopl shall be much pained: all face shall
gather black

2:7 they shall run like mighti men; they shall climb the wall like men
of war; and they shall march everi one on hi way and they shall not
break their ranks: 2:8 neither shall one thrust another; they shall
walk everi one in hi path: and when they fall upon the sword they
shall not be wound

2:9 they shall run to and fro in the city; they shall run upon the
wall they shall climb up upon the houses; they shall enter in at the
window like a thief

2:10 the earth shall quak befor them; the heaven shall tremble: the
sun and the moon shall be dark and the star shall withdraw their
shining: 2:11 and the lord shall utter hi voic befor hi army: for
hi camp is veri great: for he is strong that executeth hi word: for
the day of the lord is great and veri terrible; and who can abid it?
2:12 therefor also now saith the lord turn ye even to me with all
your heart and with fast and with weep and with mourning:
2:13 and rend your heart and not your garment and turn unto the
lord your god: for he is graciou and merci slow to anger and of
great kind and repenteth him of the evil

2:14 who knoweth if he will return and repent and leav a bless
behind him; even a meat offer and a drink offer unto the lord
your god? 2:15 blow the trumpet in zion sanctifi a fast call a
solemn assembly: 2:16 gather the peopl sanctifi the congreg
assembl the elder gather the children and those that suck the
breasts: let the bridegroom go forth of hi chamber and the bride out
of her closet

2:17 let the priest the minist of the lord weep between the
porch and the altar and let them say spare thi peopl o lord and
give not thine heritag to reproach that the heathen should rule over
them: wherefor should they say among the peopl where is their god?
2:18 then will the lord be jealou for hi land and piti hi peopl

2:19 yea the lord will answer and say unto hi peopl behold i will
send you corn and wine and oil and ye shall be satisfi therewith:
and i will no more make you a reproach among the heathen: 2:20 but i
will remov far off from you the northern armi and will drive him
into a land barren and desol with hi face toward the east sea
and hi hinder part toward the utmost sea and hi stink shall come
up and hi ill savour shall come up becaus he hath done great
thing

2:21 fear not o land; be glad and rejoice: for the lord will do great
thing

2:22 be not afraid ye beast of the field: for the pastur of the
wilder do spring for the tree beareth her fruit the fig tree and
the vine do yield their strength

2:23 be glad then ye children of zion and rejoic in the lord your
god: for he hath given you the former rain moder and he will
caus to come down for you the rain the former rain and the latter
rain in the first month

2:24 and the floor shall be full of wheat and the vat shall
overflow with wine and oil

2:25 and i will restor to you the year that the locust hath eaten
the cankerworm and the caterpil and the palmerworm my great armi
which i sent among you

2:26 and ye shall eat in plenti and be satisfi and prais the name
of the lord your god that hath dealt wondrous with you: and my
peopl shall never be asham

2:27 and ye shall know that i am in the midst of israel and that i am
the lord your god and none else: and my peopl shall never be
asham

2:28 and it shall come to pass afterward that i will pour out my
spirit upon all flesh; and your son and your daughter shall
prophesi your old men shall dream dream your young men shall see
visions: 2:29 and also upon the servant and upon the handmaid in
those day will i pour out my spirit

2:30 and i will shew wonder in the heaven and in the earth blood
and fire and pillar of smoke

2:31 the sun shall be turn into dark and the moon into blood
befor the great and terribl day of the lord come

2:32 and it shall come to pass that whosoev shall call on the name
of the lord shall be delivered: for in mount zion and in jerusalem
shall be deliver as the lord hath said and in the remnant whom
the lord shall call

3:1 for behold in those day and in that time when i shall bring
again the captiv of judah and jerusalem 3:2 i will also gather all
nation and will bring them down into the valley of jehoshaphat and
will plead with them there for my peopl and for my heritag israel
whom they have scatter among the nation and part my land

3:3 and they have cast lot for my people; and have given a boy for an
harlot and sold a girl for wine that they might drink

3:4 yea and what have ye to do with me o tyre and zidon and all
the coast of palestine? will ye render me a recompence? and if ye
recompens me swiftli and speedili will i return your recomp upon
your own head; 3:5 becaus ye have taken my silver and my gold and
have carri into your templ my goodli pleasant things: 3:6 the
children also of judah and the children of jerusalem have ye sold unto
the grecian that ye might remov them far from their border

3:7 behold i will rais them out of the place whither ye have sold
them and will return your recomp upon your own head: 3:8 and i
will sell your son and your daughter into the hand of the children
of judah and they shall sell them to the sabean to a peopl far
off: for the lord hath spoken it

3:9 proclaim ye thi among the gentiles; prepar war wake up the
mighti men let all the men of war draw near; let them come up: 3:10
beat your plowshar into sword and your pruninghook into spears:
let the weak say i am strong

3:11 assembl yourselv and come all ye heathen and gather
yourselv togeth round about: thither caus thi mighti one to come
down o lord

3:12 let the heathen be waken and come up to the valley of
jehoshaphat: for there will i sit to judg all the heathen round
about

3:13 put ye in the sickl for the harvest is ripe: come get you
down; for the press is full the fat overflow; for their wicked
is great

3:14 multitud multitud in the valley of decision: for the day of
the lord is near in the valley of decis

3:15 the sun and the moon shall be darken and the star shall
withdraw their shine

3:16 the lord also shall roar out of zion and utter hi voic from
jerusalem; and the heaven and the earth shall shake: but the lord
will be the hope of hi peopl and the strength of the children of
israel

3:17 so shall ye know that i am the lord your god dwell in zion my
holi mountain: then shall jerusalem be holi and there shall no
stranger pass through her ani more

3:18 and it shall come to pass in that day that the mountain shall
drop down new wine and the hill shall flow with milk and all the
river of judah shall flow with water and a fountain shall come
forth out of the hous of the lord and shall water the valley of
shittim

3:19 egypt shall be a desol and edom shall be a desol
wilder for the violenc against the children of judah becaus
they have shed innoc blood in their land

3:20 but judah shall dwell for ever and jerusalem from gener to
gener

3:21 for i will cleans their blood that i have not cleansed: for the
lord dwelleth in zion




amo


1:1 the word of amo who wa among the herdmen of tekoa which he
saw concern israel in the day of uzziah king of judah and in the
day of jeroboam the son of joash king of israel two year befor the
earthquak

1:2 and he said the lord will roar from zion and utter hi voic
from jerusalem; and the habit of the shepherd shall mourn and
the top of carmel shall wither

1:3 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of damascu and for
four i will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus they have
thresh gilead with thresh instrument of iron: 1:4 but i will
send a fire into the hous of hazael which shall devour the palac
of benhadad

1:5 i will break also the bar of damascu and cut off the inhabit
from the plain of aven and him that holdeth the sceptr from the
hous of eden: and the peopl of syria shall go into captiv unto
kir saith the lord

1:6 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of gaza and for
four i will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus they
carri away captiv the whole captiv to deliv them up to edom:
1:7 but i will send a fire on the wall of gaza which shall devour the
palac thereof: 1:8 and i will cut off the inhabit from ashdod
and him that holdeth the sceptr from ashkelon and i will turn mine
hand against ekron: and the remnant of the philistin shall perish
saith the lord god

1:9 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of tyru and for
four i will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus they
deliv up the whole captiv to edom and rememb not the
brotherli covenant: 1:10 but i will send a fire on the wall of tyru
which shall devour the palac thereof

1:11 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of edom and for
four i will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus he did
pursu hi brother with the sword and did cast off all piti and hi
anger did tear perpetu and he kept hi wrath for ever: 1:12 but i
will send a fire upon teman which shall devour the palac of bozrah

1:13 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of the children of
ammon and for four i will not turn away the punish thereof;
becaus they have rip up the women with child of gilead that they
might enlarg their border: 1:14 but i will kindl a fire in the wall
of rabbah and it shall devour the palac thereof with shout in
the day of battl with a tempest in the day of the whirlwind: 1:15
and their king shall go into captiv he and hi princ togeth
saith the lord

2:1 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of moab and for
four i will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus he burn
the bone of the king of edom into lime: 2:2 but i will send a fire
upon moab and it shall devour the palac of kirioth: and moab shall
die with tumult with shout and with the sound of the trumpet: 2:3
and i will cut off the judg from the midst thereof and will slay all
the princ thereof with him saith the lord

2:4 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of judah and for
four i will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus they have
despis the law of the lord and have not kept hi command and
their lie caus them to err after the which their father have
walked: 2:5 but i will send a fire upon judah and it shall devour the
palac of jerusalem

2:6 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of israel and for
four i will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus they sold
the righteou for silver and the poor for a pair of shoes; 2:7 that
pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor and turn
asid the way of the meek: and a man and hi father will go in unto
the same maid to profan my holi name: 2:8 and they lay themselv
down upon cloth laid to pledg by everi altar and they drink the
wine of the condemn in the hous of their god

2:9 yet destroy i the amorit befor them whose height wa like the
height of the cedar and he wa strong as the oaks; yet i destroy
hi fruit from abov and hi root from beneath

2:10 also i brought you up from the land of egypt and led you forti
year through the wilder to possess the land of the amorit

2:11 and i rais up of your son for prophet and of your young men
for nazarit is it not even thu o ye children of israel? saith the
lord

2:12 but ye gave the nazarit wine to drink; and command the
prophet say prophesi not

2:13 behold i am press under you as a cart is press that is full
of sheav

2:14 therefor the flight shall perish from the swift and the strong
shall not strengthen hi forc neither shall the mighti deliv
himself: 2:15 neither shall he stand that handleth the bow; and he
that is swift of foot shall not deliv himself: neither shall he that
rideth the hors deliv himself

2:16 and he that is courag among the mighti shall flee away nake
in that day saith the lord

3:1 hear thi word that the lord hath spoken against you o children
of israel against the whole famili which i brought up from the land
of egypt say 3:2 you onli have i known of all the famili of the
earth: therefor i will punish you for all your iniqu

3:3 can two walk togeth except they be agreed? 3:4 will a lion
roar in the forest when he hath no prey? will a young lion cri out of
hi den if he have taken nothing? 3:5 can a bird fall in a snare
upon the earth where no gin is for him? shall one take up a snare
from the earth and have taken noth at all? 3:6 shall a trumpet be
blown in the citi and the peopl not be afraid? shall there be evil
in a citi and the lord hath not done it? 3:7 sure the lord god
will do noth but he revealeth hi secret unto hi servant the
prophet

3:8 the lion hath roar who will not fear? the lord god hath spoken
who can but prophesy? 3:9 publish in the palac at ashdod and in
the palac in the land of egypt and say assembl yourselv upon
the mountain of samaria and behold the great tumult in the midst
thereof and the oppress in the midst thereof

3:10 for they know not to do right saith the lord who store up
violenc and robberi in their palac

3:11 therefor thu saith the lord god; an adversari there shall be
even round about the land; and he shall bring down thi strength from
thee and thi palac shall be spoil

3:12 thu saith the lord; as the shepherd taketh out of the mouth of
the lion two leg or a piec of an ear; so shall the children of
israel be taken out that dwell in samaria in the corner of a bed and
in damascu in a couch

3:13 hear ye and testifi in the hous of jacob saith the lord god
the god of host 3:14 that in the day that i shall visit the
transgress of israel upon him i will also visit the altar of
bethel: and the horn of the altar shall be cut off and fall to the
ground

3:15 and i will smite the winter hous with the summer house; and the
hous of ivori shall perish and the great hous shall have an end
saith the lord

4:1 hear thi word ye kine of bashan that are in the mountain of
samaria which oppress the poor which crush the needi which say to
their master bring and let us drink

4:2 the lord god hath sworn by hi holi that lo the day shall
come upon you that he will take you away with hook and your
poster with fishhook

4:3 and ye shall go out at the breach everi cow at that which is
befor her; and ye shall cast them into the palac saith the lord

4:4 come to bethel and transgress; at gilgal multipli transgression;
and bring your sacrific everi morn and your tith after three
years: 4:5 and offer a sacrific of thanksgiv with leaven and
proclaim and publish the free offerings: for thi liketh you o ye
children of israel saith the lord god

4:6 and i also have given you clean of teeth in all your citi
and want of bread in all your places: yet have ye not return unto
me saith the lord

4:7 and also i have withholden the rain from you when there were yet
three month to the harvest: and i caus it to rain upon one citi
and caus it not to rain upon anoth city: one piec wa rain
upon and the piec whereupon it rain not wither

4:8 so two or three citi wander unto one citi to drink water; but
they were not satisfied: yet have ye not return unto me saith the
lord

4:9 i have smitten you with blast and mildew: when your garden and
your vineyard and your fig tree and your oliv tree increas the
palmerworm devour them: yet have ye not return unto me saith the
lord

4:10 i have sent among you the pestil after the manner of egypt:
your young men have i slain with the sword and have taken away your
horses; and i have made the stink of your camp to come up unto your
nostrils: yet have ye not return unto me saith the lord

4:11 i have overthrown some of you as god overthrew sodom and
gomorrah and ye were as a firebrand pluck out of the burning: yet
have ye not return unto me saith the lord

4:12 therefor thu will i do unto thee o israel: and becaus i will
do thi unto thee prepar to meet thi god o israel

4:13 for lo he that formeth the mountain and createth the wind
and declareth unto man what is hi thought that maketh the morn
dark and treadeth upon the high place of the earth the lord
the god of host is hi name

5:1 hear ye thi word which i take up against you even a lament
o hous of israel

5:2 the virgin of israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is
forsaken upon her land; there is none to rais her up

5:3 for thu saith the lord god; the citi that went out by a thousand
shall leav an hundr and that which went forth by an hundr shall
leav ten to the hous of israel

5:4 for thu saith the lord unto the hous of israel seek ye me and
ye shall live: 5:5 but seek not bethel nor enter into gilgal and
pass not to beersheba: for gilgal shall sure go into captiv and
bethel shall come to nought

5:6 seek the lord and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in
the hous of joseph and devour it and there be none to quench it in
bethel

5:7 ye who turn judgment to wormwood and leav off righteous in
the earth 5:8 seek him that maketh the seven star and orion and
turneth the shadow of death into the morn and maketh the day dark
with night: that calleth for the water of the sea and poureth them
out upon the face of the earth: the lord is hi name: 5:9 that
strengtheneth the spoil against the strong so that the spoil
shall come against the fortress

5:10 they hate him that rebuketh in the gate and they abhor him that
speaketh uprightli

5:11 forasmuch therefor as your tread is upon the poor and ye
take from him burden of wheat: ye have built hous of hewn stone
but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have plant pleasant vineyard
but ye shall not drink wine of them

5:12 for i know your manifold transgress and your mighti sins:
they afflict the just they take a bribe and they turn asid the poor
in the gate from their right

5:13 therefor the prudent shall keep silenc in that time; for it is
an evil time

5:14 seek good and not evil that ye may live: and so the lord the
god of host shall be with you as ye have spoken

5:15 hate the evil and love the good and establish judgment in the
gate: it may be that the lord god of host will be graciou unto the
remnant of joseph

5:16 therefor the lord the god of host the lord saith thus;
wail shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the
highway alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourn
and such as are skil of lament to wail

5:17 and in all vineyard shall be wailing: for i will pass through
thee saith the lord

5:18 woe unto you that desir the day of the lord! to what end is it
for you? the day of the lord is dark and not light

5:19 as if a man did flee from a lion and a bear met him; or went
into the hous and lean hi hand on the wall and a serpent bit
him

5:20 shall not the day of the lord be dark and not light? even
veri dark and no bright in it? 5:21 i hate i despis your feast
day and i will not smell in your solemn assembl

5:22 though ye offer me burnt offer and your meat offer i
will not accept them: neither will i regard the peac offer of
your fat beast

5:23 take thou away from me the nois of thi songs; for i will not
hear the melodi of thi viol

5:24 but let judgment run down as water and righteous as a
mighti stream

5:25 have ye offer unto me sacrific and offer in the
wilder forti year o hous of israel? 5:26 but ye have born the
tabernacl of your moloch and chiun your imag the star of your god
which ye made to yourselv

5:27 therefor will i caus you to go into captiv beyond damascu
saith the lord whose name is the god of host

6:1 woe to them that are at eas in zion and trust in the mountain of
samaria which are name chief of the nation to whom the hous of
israel came! 6:2 pass ye unto calneh and see; and from thenc go ye
to hamath the great: then go down to gath of the philistines: be they
better than these kingdoms? or their border greater than your border?
6:3 ye that put far away the evil day and caus the seat of violenc
to come near; 6:4 that lie upon bed of ivori and stretch themselv
upon their couch and eat the lamb out of the flock and the calv
out of the midst of the stall; 6:5 that chant to the sound of the
viol and invent to themselv instrument of musick like david; 6:6
that drink wine in bowl and anoint themselv with the chief
ointments: but they are not griev for the afflict of joseph

6:7 therefor now shall they go captiv with the first that go
captiv and the banquet of them that stretch themselv shall be
remov

6:8 the lord god hath sworn by himself saith the lord the god of
host i abhor the excel of jacob and hate hi palaces:
therefor will i deliv up the citi with all that is therein

6:9 and it shall come to pass if there remain ten men in one hous
that they shall die

6:10 and a man uncl shall take him up and he that burneth him to
bring out the bone out of the hous and shall say unto him that is
by the side of the hous is there yet ani with thee? and he shall
say no then shall he say hold thi tongue: for we may not make
mention of the name of the lord

6:11 for behold the lord commandeth and he will smite the great
hous with breach and the littl hous with cleft

6:12 shall hors run upon the rock? will one plow there with oxen?
for ye have turn judgment into gall and the fruit of righteous
into hemlock: 6:13 ye which rejoic in a thing of nought which say
have we not taken to us horn by our own strength? 6:14 but behold
i will rais up against you a nation o hous of israel saith the
lord the god of hosts; and they shall afflict you from the enter in
of hemath unto the river of the wilder

7:1 thu hath the lord god shew unto me; and behold he form
grasshopp in the begin of the shoot up of the latter growth;
and lo it wa the latter growth after the king mow

7:2 and it came to pass that when they had made an end of eat the
grass of the land then i said o lord god forgiv i beseech thee:
by whom shall jacob arise? for he is small

7:3 the lord repent for this: it shall not be saith the lord

7:4 thu hath the lord god shew unto me: and behold the lord god
call to contend by fire and it devour the great deep and did eat
up a part

7:5 then said i o lord god ceas i beseech thee: by whom shall
jacob arise? for he is small

7:6 the lord repent for this: thi also shall not be saith the lord
god

7:7 thu he shew me: and behold the lord stood upon a wall made by
a plumblin with a plumblin in hi hand

7:8 and the lord said unto me amo what seest thou? and i said a
plumblin then said the lord behold i will set a plumblin in the
midst of my peopl israel: i will not again pass by them ani more: 7:9
and the high place of isaac shall be desol and the sanctuari of
israel shall be laid waste; and i will rise against the hous of
jeroboam with the sword

7:10 then amaziah the priest of bethel sent to jeroboam king of
israel say amo hath conspir against thee in the midst of the
hous of israel: the land is not abl to bear all hi word

7:11 for thu amo saith jeroboam shall die by the sword and israel
shall sure be led away captiv out of their own land

7:12 also amaziah said unto amo o thou seer go flee thee away into
the land of judah and there eat bread and prophesi there: 7:13 but
prophesi not again ani more at bethel: for it is the king chapel
and it is the king court

7:14 then answer amo and said to amaziah i wa no prophet
neither wa i a prophet son; but i wa an herdman and a gather of
sycomor fruit: 7:15 and the lord took me as i follow the flock and
the lord said unto me go prophesi unto my peopl israel

7:16 now therefor hear thou the word of the lord: thou sayest
prophesi not against israel and drop not thi word against the hous
of isaac

7:17 therefor thu saith the lord; thi wife shall be an harlot in the
citi and thi son and thi daughter shall fall by the sword and thi
land shall be divid by line; and thou shalt die in a pollut land:
and israel shall sure go into captiv forth of hi land

8:1 thu hath the lord god shew unto me: and behold a basket of
summer fruit

8:2 and he said amo what seest thou? and i said a basket of summer
fruit then said the lord unto me the end is come upon my peopl of
israel; i will not again pass by them ani more

8:3 and the song of the templ shall be howl in that day saith
the lord god: there shall be mani dead bodi in everi place; they
shall cast them forth with silenc

8:4 hear thi o ye that swallow up the needi even to make the poor
of the land to fail 8:5 say when will the new moon be gone that
we may sell corn? and the sabbath that we may set forth wheat make
the ephah small and the shekel great and falsifi the balanc by
deceit? 8:6 that we may buy the poor for silver and the needi for a
pair of shoes; yea and sell the refus of the wheat? 8:7 the lord
hath sworn by the excel of jacob sure i will never forget ani
of their work

8:8 shall not the land trembl for thi and everi one mourn that
dwelleth therein? and it shall rise up wholli as a flood; and it shall
be cast out and drown as by the flood of egypt

8:9 and it shall come to pass in that day saith the lord god that i
will caus the sun to go down at noon and i will darken the earth in
the clear day: 8:10 and i will turn your feast into mourn and all
your song into lamentation; and i will bring up sackcloth upon all
loin and bald upon everi head; and i will make it as the
mourn of an onli son and the end thereof as a bitter day

8:11 behold the day come saith the lord god that i will send a
famin in the land not a famin of bread nor a thirst for water but
of hear the word of the lord: 8:12 and they shall wander from sea
to sea and from the north even to the east they shall run to and fro
to seek the word of the lord and shall not find it

8:13 in that day shall the fair virgin and young men faint for
thirst

8:14 they that swear by the sin of samaria and say thi god o dan
liveth; and the manner of beersheba liveth; even they shall fall and
never rise up again

9:1 i saw the lord stand upon the altar: and he said smite the
lintel of the door that the post may shake: and cut them in the
head all of them; and i will slay the last of them with the sword: he
that fleeth of them shall not flee away and he that escapeth of them
shall not be deliv

9:2 though they dig into hell thenc shall mine hand take them;
though they climb up to heaven thenc will i bring them down: 9:3 and
though they hide themselv in the top of carmel i will search and
take them out thence; and though they be hid from my sight in the
bottom of the sea thenc will i command the serpent and he shall
bite them: 9:4 and though they go into captiv befor their enemi
thenc will i command the sword and it shall slay them: and i will
set mine eye upon them for evil and not for good

9:5 and the lord god of host is he that toucheth the land and it
shall melt and all that dwell therein shall mourn: and it shall rise
up wholli like a flood; and shall be drown as by the flood of
egypt

9:6 it is he that buildeth hi stori in the heaven and hath found
hi troop in the earth; he that calleth for the water of the sea and
poureth them out upon the face of the earth: the lord is hi name

9:7 are ye not as children of the ethiopian unto me o children of
israel? saith the lord have not i brought up israel out of the land
of egypt? and the philistin from caphtor and the syrian from kir?
9:8 behold the eye of the lord god are upon the sin kingdom and
i will destroy it from off the face of the earth; save that i will
not utterli destroy the hous of jacob saith the lord

9:9 for lo i will command and i will sift the hous of israel among
all nation like as corn is sift in a siev yet shall not the
least grain fall upon the earth

9:10 all the sinner of my peopl shall die by the sword which say
the evil shall not overtak nor prevent us

9:11 in that day will i rais up the tabernacl of david that is
fallen and close up the breach thereof; and i will rais up hi
ruin and i will build it as in the day of old: 9:12 that they may
possess the remnant of edom and of all the heathen which are call
by my name saith the lord that doeth thi

9:13 behold the day come saith the lord that the plowman shall
overtak the reaper and the treader of grape him that soweth seed;
and the mountain shall drop sweet wine and all the hill shall melt

9:14 and i will bring again the captiv of my peopl of israel and
they shall build the wast citi and inhabit them; and they shall
plant vineyard and drink the wine thereof; they shall also make
garden and eat the fruit of them

9:15 and i will plant them upon their land and they shall no more be
pull up out of their land which i have given them saith the lord
thi god




obadiah


1:1 the vision of obadiah thu saith the lord god concern edom;
we have heard a rumour from the lord and an ambassador is sent among
the heathen aris ye and let us rise up against her in battl

1:2 behold i have made thee small among the heathen: thou art greatli
despis

1:3 the pride of thine heart hath deceiv thee thou that dwellest in
the cleft of the rock whose habit is high; that saith in hi
heart who shall bring me down to the ground? 1:4 though thou exalt
thyself as the eagl and though thou set thi nest among the star
thenc will i bring thee down saith the lord

1:5 if thiev came to thee if robber by night (how art thou cut
off!) would they not have stolen till they had enough? if the
grapegather came to thee would they not leav some grapes? 1:6
how are the thing of esau search out! how are hi hidden thing
sought up! 1:7 all the men of thi confederaci have brought thee even
to the border: the men that were at peac with thee have deceiv
thee and prevail against thee; that they eat thi bread have laid a
wound under thee: there is none understand in him

1:8 shall i not in that day saith the lord even destroy the wise men
out of edom and understand out of the mount of esau? 1:9 and thi
mighti men o teman shall be dismay to the end that everi one of
the mount of esau may be cut off by slaughter

1:10 for thi violenc against thi brother jacob shame shall cover
thee and thou shalt be cut off for ever

1:11 in the day that thou stoodest on the other side in the day that
the stranger carri away captiv hi forc and foreign enter
into hi gate and cast lot upon jerusalem even thou wast as one of
them

1:12 but thou shouldest not have look on the day of thi brother in
the day that he becam a stranger; neither shouldest thou have
rejoic over the children of judah in the day of their destruction;
neither shouldest thou have spoken proudli in the day of distress

1:13 thou shouldest not have enter into the gate of my peopl in the
day of their calamity; yea thou shouldest not have look on their
afflict in the day of their calam nor have laid hand on their
substanc in the day of their calamity; 1:14 neither shouldest thou
have stood in the crossway to cut off those of hi that did escape;
neither shouldest thou have deliv up those of hi that did remain
in the day of distress

1:15 for the day of the lord is near upon all the heathen: as thou
hast done it shall be done unto thee: thi reward shall return upon
thine own head

1:16 for as ye have drunk upon my holi mountain so shall all the
heathen drink continu yea they shall drink and they shall
swallow down and they shall be as though they had not been

1:17 but upon mount zion shall be deliver and there shall be
holiness; and the hous of jacob shall possess their possess

1:18 and the hous of jacob shall be a fire and the hous of joseph a
flame and the hous of esau for stubbl and they shall kindl in
them and devour them; and there shall not be ani remain of the
hous of esau; for the lord hath spoken it

1:19 and they of the south shall possess the mount of esau; and they
of the plain the philistines: and they shall possess the field of
ephraim and the field of samaria: and benjamin shall possess gilead

1:20 and the captiv of thi host of the children of israel shall
possess that of the canaanit even unto zarephath; and the captiv
of jerusalem which is in sepharad shall possess the citi of the
south

1:21 and saviour shall come up on mount zion to judg the mount of
esau; and the kingdom shall be the lord




jonah


1:1 now the word of the lord came unto jonah the son of amittai
say 1:2 aris go to nineveh that great citi and cri against it;
for their wicked is come up befor me

1:3 but jonah rose up to flee unto tarshish from the presenc of the
lord and went down to joppa; and he found a ship go to tarshish:
so he paid the fare thereof and went down into it to go with them
unto tarshish from the presenc of the lord

1:4 but the lord sent out a great wind into the sea and there wa a
mighti tempest in the sea so that the ship wa like to be broken

1:5 then the marin were afraid and cri everi man unto hi god
and cast forth the ware that were in the ship into the sea to
lighten it of them but jonah wa gone down into the side of the
ship; and he lay and wa fast asleep

1:6 so the shipmast came to him and said unto him what meanest
thou o sleeper? aris call upon thi god if so be that god will
think upon us that we perish not

1:7 and they said everi one to hi fellow come and let us cast lot
that we may know for whose caus thi evil is upon us so they cast
lot and the lot fell upon jonah

1:8 then said they unto him tell us we pray thee for whose caus
thi evil is upon us; what is thine occupation? and whenc comest
thou? what is thi country? and of what peopl art thou? 1:9 and he
said unto them i am an hebrew; and i fear the lord the god of
heaven which hath made the sea and the dri land

1:10 then were the men exceedingli afraid and said unto him whi hast
thou done this? for the men knew that he fled from the presenc of the
lord becaus he had told them

1:11 then said they unto him what shall we do unto thee that the sea
may be calm unto us? for the sea wrought and wa tempestu

1:12 and he said unto them take me up and cast me forth into the
sea; so shall the sea be calm unto you: for i know that for my sake
thi great tempest is upon you

1:13 nevertheless the men row hard to bring it to the land; but they
could not: for the sea wrought and wa tempestu against them

1:14 wherefor they cri unto the lord and said we beseech thee o
lord we beseech thee let us not perish for thi man life and lay
not upon us innoc blood: for thou o lord hast done as it pleas
thee

1:15 so they look up jonah and cast him forth into the sea: and the
sea ceas from her rage

1:16 then the men fear the lord exceedingli and offer a sacrific
unto the lord and made vow

1:17 now the lord had prepar a great fish to swallow up jonah and
jonah wa in the belli of the fish three day and three night

2:1 then jonah pray unto the lord hi god out of the fish belli
2:2 and said i cri by reason of mine afflict unto the lord and
he heard me; out of the belli of hell cri i and thou heardest my
voic

2:3 for thou hadst cast me into the deep in the midst of the seas;
and the flood compass me about: all thi billow and thi wave
pass over me

2:4 then i said i am cast out of thi sight; yet i will look again
toward thi holi templ

2:5 the water compass me about even to the soul: the depth close
me round about the weed were wrap about my head

2:6 i went down to the bottom of the mountains; the earth with her
bar wa about me for ever: yet hast thou brought up my life from
corrupt o lord my god

2:7 when my soul faint within me i rememb the lord: and my
prayer came in unto thee into thine holi templ

2:8 they that observ lie vaniti forsak their own merci

2:9 but i will sacrific unto thee with the voic of thanksgiving; i
will pay that that i have vow salvat is of the lord

2:10 and the lord spake unto the fish and it vomit out jonah upon
the dri land

3:1 and the word of the lord came unto jonah the second time say
3:2 aris go unto nineveh that great citi and preach unto it the
preach that i bid thee

3:3 so jonah aros and went unto nineveh accord to the word of
the lord now nineveh wa an exceed great citi of three day
journey

3:4 and jonah began to enter into the citi a day journey and he
cri and said yet forti day and nineveh shall be overthrown

3:5 so the peopl of nineveh believ god and proclaim a fast and
put on sackcloth from the greatest of them even to the least of them

3:6 for word came unto the king of nineveh and he aros from hi
throne and he laid hi robe from him and cover him with sackcloth
and sat in ash

3:7 and he caus it to be proclaim and publish through nineveh by
the decre of the king and hi nobl say let neither man nor
beast herd nor flock tast ani thing: let them not feed nor drink
water: 3:8 but let man and beast be cover with sackcloth and cri
mightili unto god: yea let them turn everi one from hi evil way and
from the violenc that is in their hand

3:9 who can tell if god will turn and repent and turn away from hi
fierc anger that we perish not? 3:10 and god saw their work that
they turn from their evil way; and god repent of the evil that he
had said that he would do unto them; and he did it not

4:1 but it displeas jonah exceedingli and he wa veri angri

4:2 and he pray unto the lord and said i pray thee o lord wa
not thi my say when i wa yet in my country? therefor i fled
befor unto tarshish: for i knew that thou art a graciou god and
merci slow to anger and of great kind and repentest thee of
the evil

4:3 therefor now o lord take i beseech thee my life from me; for
it is better for me to die than to live

4:4 then said the lord doest thou well to be angry? 4:5 so jonah
went out of the citi and sat on the east side of the citi and there
made him a booth and sat under it in the shadow till he might see
what would becom of the citi

4:6 and the lord god prepar a gourd and made it to come up over
jonah that it might be a shadow over hi head to deliv him from
hi grief so jonah wa exceed glad of the gourd

4:7 but god prepar a worm when the morn rose the next day and it
smote the gourd that it wither

4:8 and it came to pass when the sun did aris that god prepar a
vehement east wind; and the sun beat upon the head of jonah that he
faint and wish in himself to die and said it is better for me
to die than to live

4:9 and god said to jonah doest thou well to be angri for the gourd?
and he said i do well to be angri even unto death

4:10 then said the lord thou hast had piti on the gourd for the
which thou hast not labour neither madest it grow; which came up in
a night and perish in a night: 4:11 and should not i spare nineveh
that great citi wherein are more then sixscor thousand person that
cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand; and also
much cattle?




micah


1:1 the word of the lord that came to micah the morasthit in the
day of jotham ahaz and hezekiah king of judah which he saw
concern samaria and jerusalem

1:2 hear all ye people; hearken o earth and all that therein is:
and let the lord god be wit against you the lord from hi holi
templ

1:3 for behold the lord cometh forth out of hi place and will come
down and tread upon the high place of the earth

1:4 and the mountain shall be molten under him and the valley shall
be cleft as wax befor the fire and as the water that are pour
down a steep place

1:5 for the transgress of jacob is all thi and for the sin of
the hous of israel what is the transgress of jacob? is it not
samaria? and what are the high place of judah? are they not
jerusalem? 1:6 therefor i will make samaria as an heap of the field
and as plant of a vineyard: and i will pour down the stone
thereof into the valley and i will discov the foundat thereof

1:7 and all the graven imag thereof shall be beaten to piec and
all the hire thereof shall be burn with the fire and all the idol
thereof will i lay desolate: for she gather it of the hire of an
harlot and they shall return to the hire of an harlot

1:8 therefor i will wail and howl i will go strip and naked: i
will make a wail like the dragon and mourn as the owl

1:9 for her wound is incurable; for it is come unto judah; he is come
unto the gate of my peopl even to jerusalem

1:10 declar ye it not at gath weep ye not at all: in the hous of
aphrah roll thyself in the dust

1:11 pass ye away thou inhabit of saphir have thi shame naked:
the inhabit of zaanan came not forth in the mourn of bethezel;
he shall receiv of you hi stand

1:12 for the inhabit of maroth wait care for good: but evil
came down from the lord unto the gate of jerusalem

1:13 o thou inhabit of lachish bind the chariot to the swift
beast: she is the begin of the sin to the daughter of zion: for
the transgress of israel were found in thee

1:14 therefor shalt thou give present to moreshethgath: the hous
of achzib shall be a lie to the king of israel

1:15 yet will i bring an heir unto thee o inhabit of mareshah: he
shall come unto adullam the glori of israel

1:16 make thee bald and poll thee for thi delic children; enlarg
