thi bald as the eagle; for they are gone into captiv from thee

2:1 woe to them that devis iniqu and work evil upon their beds!
when the morn is light they practis it becaus it is in the
power of their hand

2:2 and they covet field and take them by violence; and hous and
take them away: so they oppress a man and hi hous even a man and
hi heritag

2:3 therefor thu saith the lord; behold against thi famili do i
devis an evil from which ye shall not remov your necks; neither
shall ye go haughtily: for thi time is evil

2:4 in that day shall one take up a parabl against you and lament
with a dole lament and say we be utterli spoiled: he hath
chang the portion of my people: how hath he remov it from me!
turn away he hath divid our field

2:5 therefor thou shalt have none that shall cast a cord by lot in
the congreg of the lord

2:6 prophesi ye not say they to them that prophesy: they shall not
prophesi to them that they shall not take shame

2:7 o thou that art name the hous of jacob is the spirit of the
lord straitened? are these hi doings? do not my word do good to him
that walketh uprightly? 2:8 even of late my peopl is risen up as an
enemy: ye pull off the robe with the garment from them that pass by
secur as men avers from war

2:9 the women of my peopl have ye cast out from their pleasant
houses; from their children have ye taken away my glori for ever

2:10 aris ye and depart; for thi is not your rest: becaus it is
pollut it shall destroy you even with a sore destruct

2:11 if a man walk in the spirit and falsehood do lie say i
will prophesi unto thee of wine and of strong drink; he shall even be
the prophet of thi peopl

2:12 i will sure assembl o jacob all of thee; i will sure
gather the remnant of israel; i will put them togeth as the sheep of
bozrah as the flock in the midst of their fold: they shall make great
nois by reason of the multitud of men

2:13 the breaker is come up befor them: they have broken up and have
pass through the gate and are gone out by it: and their king shall
pass befor them and the lord on the head of them

3:1 and i said hear i pray you o head of jacob and ye princ of
the hous of israel; is it not for you to know judgment? 3:2 who hate
the good and love the evil; who pluck off their skin from off them
and their flesh from off their bones; 3:3 who also eat the flesh of my
peopl and flay their skin from off them; and they break their bone
and chop them in piec as for the pot and as flesh within the
caldron

3:4 then shall they cri unto the lord but he will not hear them: he
will even hide hi face from them at that time as they have behav
themselv ill in their do

3:5 thu saith the lord concern the prophet that make my peopl
err that bite with their teeth and cri peace; and he that putteth
not into their mouth they even prepar war against him

3:6 therefor night shall be unto you that ye shall not have a
vision; and it shall be dark unto you that ye shall not divine; and
the sun shall go down over the prophet and the day shall be dark
over them

3:7 then shall the seer be asham and the divin confounded: yea
they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of god

3:8 but truli i am full of power by the spirit of the lord and of
judgment and of might to declar unto jacob hi transgress and
to israel hi sin

3:9 hear thi i pray you ye head of the hous of jacob and princ
of the hous of israel that abhor judgment and pervert all equiti

3:10 they build up zion with blood and jerusalem with iniqu

3:11 the head thereof judg for reward and the priest thereof teach
for hire and the prophet thereof divin for money: yet will they
lean upon the lord and say is not the lord among us? none evil can
come upon us

3:12 therefor shall zion for your sake be plow as a field and
jerusalem shall becom heap and the mountain of the hous as the
high place of the forest

4:1 but in the last day it shall come to pass that the mountain of
the hous of the lord shall be establish in the top of the
mountain and it shall be exalt abov the hills; and peopl shall
flow unto it

4:2 and mani nation shall come and say come and let us go up to
the mountain of the lord and to the hous of the god of jacob; and he
will teach us of hi way and we will walk in hi paths: for the law
shall go forth of zion and the word of the lord from jerusalem

4:3 and he shall judg among mani peopl and rebuk strong nation
afar off; and they shall beat their sword into plowshar and their
spear into pruninghooks: nation shall not lift up a sword against
nation neither shall they learn war ani more

4:4 but they shall sit everi man under hi vine and under hi fig
tree; and none shall make them afraid: for the mouth of the lord of
host hath spoken it

4:5 for all peopl will walk everi one in the name of hi god and we
will walk in the name of the lord our god for ever and ever

4:6 in that day saith the lord will i assembl her that halteth and
i will gather her that is driven out and her that i have afflicted;
4:7 and i will make her that halt a remnant and her that wa cast
far off a strong nation: and the lord shall reign over them in mount
zion from henceforth even for ever

4:8 and thou o tower of the flock the strong hold of the daughter of
zion unto thee shall it come even the first dominion; the kingdom
shall come to the daughter of jerusalem

4:9 now whi dost thou cri out aloud? is there no king in thee? is thi
counsellor perished? for pang have taken thee as a woman in travail

4:10 be in pain and labour to bring forth o daughter of zion like a
woman in travail: for now shalt thou go forth out of the citi and
thou shalt dwell in the field and thou shalt go even to babylon;
there shalt thou be delivered; there the lord shall redeem thee from
the hand of thine enemi

4:11 now also mani nation are gather against thee that say let
her be defil and let our eye look upon zion

4:12 but they know not the thought of the lord neither understand
they hi counsel: for he shall gather them as the sheav into the
floor

4:13 aris and thresh o daughter of zion: for i will make thine horn
iron and i will make thi hoof brass: and thou shalt beat in piec
mani people: and i will consecr their gain unto the lord and their
substanc unto the lord of the whole earth

5:1 now gather thyself in troop o daughter of troops: he hath laid
sieg against us: they shall smite the judg of israel with a rod upon
the cheek

5:2 but thou bethlehem ephratah though thou be littl among the
thousand of judah yet out of thee shall he come forth unto me that
is to be ruler in israel; whose go forth have been from of old
from everlast

5:3 therefor will he give them up until the time that she which
travaileth hath brought forth: then the remnant of hi brethren shall
return unto the children of israel

5:4 and he shall stand and feed in the strength of the lord in the
majesti of the name of the lord hi god; and they shall abide: for now
shall he be great unto the end of the earth

5:5 and thi man shall be the peac when the assyrian shall come into
our land: and when he shall tread in our palac then shall we rais
against him seven shepherd and eight princip men

5:6 and they shall wast the land of assyria with the sword and the
land of nimrod in the entranc thereof: thu shall he deliv us from
the assyrian when he cometh into our land and when he treadeth
within our border

5:7 and the remnant of jacob shall be in the midst of mani peopl as a
dew from the lord as the shower upon the grass that tarrieth not
for man nor waiteth for the son of men

5:8 and the remnant of jacob shall be among the gentil in the midst
of mani peopl as a lion among the beast of the forest as a young
lion among the flock of sheep: who if he go through both treadeth
down and teareth in piec and none can deliv

5:9 thine hand shall be lift up upon thine adversari and all
thine enemi shall be cut off

5:10 and it shall come to pass in that day saith the lord that i
will cut off thi hors out of the midst of thee and i will destroy
thi chariots: 5:11 and i will cut off the citi of thi land and
throw down all thi strong holds: 5:12 and i will cut off witchcraft
out of thine hand; and thou shalt have no more soothsayers: 5:13 thi
graven imag also will i cut off and thi stand imag out of the
midst of thee; and thou shalt no more worship the work of thine hand

5:14 and i will pluck up thi grove out of the midst of thee: so will
i destroy thi citi

5:15 and i will execut vengeanc in anger and furi upon the heathen
such as they have not heard

6:1 hear ye now what the lord saith; aris contend thou befor the
mountain and let the hill hear thi voic

6:2 hear ye o mountain the lord controversi and ye strong
foundat of the earth: for the lord hath a controversi with hi
peopl and he will plead with israel

6:3 o my peopl what have i done unto thee? and wherein have i
weari thee? testifi against me

6:4 for i brought thee up out of the land of egypt and redeem thee
out of the hous of servants; and i sent befor thee mose aaron and
miriam

6:5 o my peopl rememb now what balak king of moab consult and
what balaam the son of beor answer him from shittim unto gilgal;
that ye may know the righteous of the lord

6:6 wherewith shall i come befor the lord and bow myself befor the
high god? shall i come befor him with burnt offer with calv of
a year old? 6:7 will the lord be pleas with thousand of ram or
with ten thousand of river of oil? shall i give my firstborn for my
transgress the fruit of my bodi for the sin of my soul? 6:8 he
hath shew thee o man what is good; and what doth the lord requir
of thee but to do justli and to love merci and to walk humbl with
thi god? 6:9 the lord voic crieth unto the citi and the man of
wisdom shall see thi name: hear ye the rod and who hath appoint it

6:10 are there yet the treasur of wicked in the hous of the
wick and the scant measur that is abominable? 6:11 shall i count
them pure with the wick balanc and with the bag of deceit
weights? 6:12 for the rich men thereof are full of violenc and the
inhabit thereof have spoken lie and their tongu is deceit in
their mouth

6:13 therefor also will i make thee sick in smite thee in make
thee desol becaus of thi sin

6:14 thou shalt eat but not be satisfied; and thi cast down shall
be in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold but shalt not
deliver; and that which thou deliverest will i give up to the sword

6:15 thou shalt sow but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the
oliv but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine but
shalt not drink wine

6:16 for the statut of omri are kept and all the work of the hous
of ahab and ye walk in their counsels; that i should make thee a
desol and the inhabit thereof an hissing: therefor ye shall
bear the reproach of my peopl

7:1 woe is me! for i am as when they have gather the summer fruit
as the grapeglean of the vintage: there is no cluster to eat: my
soul desir the firstrip fruit

7:2 the good man is perish out of the earth: and there is none
upright among men: they all lie in wait for blood; they hunt everi man
hi brother with a net

7:3 that they may do evil with both hand earnestli the princ
asketh and the judg asketh for a reward; and the great man he
uttereth hi mischiev desire: so they wrap it up

7:4 the best of them is as a brier: the most upright is sharper than a
thorn hedge: the day of thi watchmen and thi visit cometh; now
shall be their perplex

7:5 trust ye not in a friend put ye not confid in a guide: keep
the door of thi mouth from her that lieth in thi bosom

7:6 for the son dishonoureth the father the daughter riseth up
against her mother the daughter in law against her mother in law; a
man enemi are the men of hi own hous

7:7 therefor i will look unto the lord; i will wait for the god of my
salvation: my god will hear me

7:8 rejoic not against me o mine enemy: when i fall i shall arise;
when i sit in dark the lord shall be a light unto me

7:9 i will bear the indign of the lord becaus i have sin
against him until he plead my caus and execut judgment for me: he
will bring me forth to the light and i shall behold hi
righteous

7:10 then she that is mine enemi shall see it and shame shall cover
her which said unto me where is the lord thi god? mine eye shall
behold her: now shall she be trodden down as the mire of the street

7:11 in the day that thi wall are to be built in that day shall the
decre be far remov

7:12 in that day also he shall come even to thee from assyria and
from the fortifi citi and from the fortress even to the river
and from sea to sea and from mountain to mountain

7:13 notwithstand the land shall be desol becaus of them that
dwell therein for the fruit of their do

7:14 feed thi peopl with thi rod the flock of thine heritag which
dwell solitarili in the wood in the midst of carmel: let them feed in
bashan and gilead as in the day of old

7:15 accord to the day of thi come out of the land of egypt will
i shew unto him marvel thing

7:16 the nation shall see and be confound at all their might: they
shall lay their hand upon their mouth their ear shall be deaf

7:17 they shall lick the dust like a serpent they shall move out of
their hole like worm of the earth: they shall be afraid of the lord
our god and shall fear becaus of thee

7:18 who is a god like unto thee that pardoneth iniqu and passeth
by the transgress of the remnant of hi heritage? he retaineth not
hi anger for ever becaus he delighteth in merci

7:19 he will turn again he will have compass upon us; he will
subdu our iniquities; and thou wilt cast all their sin into the
depth of the sea

7:20 thou wilt perform the truth to jacob and the merci to abraham
which thou hast sworn unto our father from the day of old




nahum


1:1 the burden of nineveh the book of the vision of nahum the elkoshit

1:2 god is jealou and the lord revengeth; the lord revengeth and is
furious; the lord will take vengeanc on hi adversari and he
reserveth wrath for hi enemi

1:3 the lord is slow to anger and great in power and will not at all
acquit the wicked: the lord hath hi way in the whirlwind and in the
storm and the cloud are the dust of hi feet

1:4 he rebuketh the sea and maketh it dri and drieth up all the
rivers: bashan languisheth and carmel and the flower of lebanon
languisheth

1:5 the mountain quak at him and the hill melt and the earth is
burn at hi presenc yea the world and all that dwell therein

1:6 who can stand befor hi indignation? and who can abid in the
fierc of hi anger? hi furi is pour out like fire and the
rock are thrown down by him

1:7 the lord is good a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he
knoweth them that trust in him

1:8 but with an overrun flood he will make an utter end of the
place thereof and dark shall pursu hi enemi

1:9 what do ye imagin against the lord? he will make an utter end:
afflict shall not rise up the second time

1:10 for while they be folden togeth as thorn and while they are
drunken as drunkard they shall be devour as stubbl fulli dri

1:11 there is one come out of thee that imagineth evil against the
lord a wick counsellor

1:12 thu saith the lord; though they be quiet and likewis mani yet
thu shall they be cut down when he shall pass through though i have
afflict thee i will afflict thee no more

1:13 for now will i break hi yoke from off thee and will burst thi
bond in sunder

1:14 and the lord hath given a command concern thee that no
more of thi name be sown: out of the hous of thi god will i cut off
the graven imag and the molten image: i will make thi grave; for thou
art vile

1:15 behold upon the mountain the feet of him that bringeth good
tide that publisheth peace! o judah keep thi solemn feast
perform thi vows: for the wick shall no more pass through thee; he
is utterli cut off

2:1 he that dasheth in piec is come up befor thi face: keep the
munit watch the way make thi loin strong fortifi thi power
mightili

2:2 for the lord hath turn away the excel of jacob as the
excel of israel: for the emptier have empti them out and
mar their vine branch

2:3 the shield of hi mighti men is made red the valiant men are in
scarlet: the chariot shall be with flame torch in the day of hi
prepar and the fir tree shall be terribl shaken

2:4 the chariot shall rage in the street they shall justl one
against anoth in the broad ways: they shall seem like torch they
shall run like the lightn

2:5 he shall recount hi worthies: they shall stumbl in their walk;
they shall make hast to the wall thereof and the defenc shall be
prepar

2:6 the gate of the river shall be open and the palac shall be
dissolv

2:7 and huzzab shall be led away captiv she shall be brought up and
her maid shall lead her as with the voic of dove taber upon
their breast

2:8 but nineveh is of old like a pool of water: yet they shall flee
away

stand stand shall they cry; but none shall look back

2:9 take ye the spoil of silver take the spoil of gold: for there is
none end of the store and glori out of all the pleasant furnitur

2:10 she is empti and void and waste: and the heart melteth and the
knee smite togeth and much pain is in all loin and the face of
them all gather black

2:11 where is the dwell of the lion and the feedingplac of the
young lion where the lion even the old lion walk and the lion
whelp and none made them afraid? 2:12 the lion did tear in piec
enough for hi whelp and strangl for hi lioness and fill hi
hole with prey and hi den with ravin

2:13 behold i am against thee saith the lord of host and i will
burn her chariot in the smoke and the sword shall devour thi young
lions: and i will cut off thi prey from the earth and the voic of
thi messeng shall no more be heard

3:1 woe to the bloodi city! it is all full of lie and robbery; the
prey departeth not; 3:2 the nois of a whip and the nois of the
rattl of the wheel and of the prans hors and of the jump
chariot

3:3 the horseman lifteth up both the bright sword and the glitter
spear: and there is a multitud of slain and a great number of
carcases; and there is none end of their corpses; they stumbl upon
their corpses: 3:4 becaus of the multitud of the whoredom of the
wellfavour harlot the mistress of witchcraft that selleth nation
through her whoredom and famili through her witchcraft

3:5 behold i am against thee saith the lord of hosts; and i will
discov thi skirt upon thi face and i will shew the nation thi
naked and the kingdom thi shame

3:6 and i will cast abomin filth upon thee and make thee vile
and will set thee as a gazingstock

3:7 and it shall come to pass that all they that look upon thee shall
flee from thee and say nineveh is laid waste: who will bemoan her?
whenc shall i seek comfort for thee? 3:8 art thou better than
popul no that wa situat among the river that had the water
round about it whose rampart wa the sea and her wall wa from the
sea? 3:9 ethiopia and egypt were her strength and it wa infinite;
put and lubim were thi helper

3:10 yet wa she carri away she went into captivity: her young
children also were dash in piec at the top of all the streets: and
they cast lot for her honour men and all her great men were
bound in chain

3:11 thou also shalt be drunken: thou shalt be hid thou also shalt
seek strength becaus of the enemi

3:12 all thi strong hold shall be like fig tree with the firstrip
figs: if they be shaken they shall even fall into the mouth of the
eater

3:13 behold thi peopl in the midst of thee are women: the gate of
thi land shall be set wide open unto thine enemies: the fire shall
devour thi bar

3:14 draw thee water for the sieg fortifi thi strong holds: go into
clay and tread the morter make strong the brickkiln

3:15 there shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off
it shall eat thee up like the cankerworm: make thyself mani as the
cankerworm make thyself mani as the locust

3:16 thou hast multipli thi merchant abov the star of heaven: the
cankerworm spoileth and fleeth away

3:17 thi crown are as the locust and thi captain as the great
grasshopp which camp in the hedg in the cold day but when the
sun ariseth they flee away and their place is not known where they
are

3:18 thi shepherd slumber o king of assyria: thi nobl shall dwell
in the dust: thi peopl is scatter upon the mountain and no man
gathereth them

3:19 there is no heal of thi bruise; thi wound is grievous: all
that hear the bruit of thee shall clap the hand over thee: for upon
whom hath not thi wicked pass continually?




habakkuk


1:1 the burden which habakkuk the prophet did see

1:2 o lord how long shall i cri and thou wilt not hear! even cri out
unto thee of violenc and thou wilt not save! 1:3 whi dost thou shew
me iniqu and caus me to behold grievance? for spoil and
violenc are befor me: and there are that rais up strife and
content

1:4 therefor the law is slack and judgment doth never go forth:
for the wick doth compass about the righteous; therefor wrong
judgment proceedeth

1:5 behold ye among the heathen and regard and wonder marvelously:
for i will work a work in your day which ye will not believ though
it be told you

1:6 for lo i rais up the chaldean that bitter and hasti nation
which shall march through the breadth of the land to possess the
dwellingplac that are not their

1:7 they are terribl and dreadful: their judgment and their digniti
shall proceed of themselv

1:8 their hors also are swifter than the leopard and are more
fierc than the even wolves: and their horsemen shall spread
themselv and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fli as
the eagl that hasteth to eat

1:9 they shall come all for violence: their face shall sup up as the
east wind and they shall gather the captiv as the sand

1:10 and they shall scoff at the king and the princ shall be a
scorn unto them: they shall derid everi strong hold; for they shall
heap dust and take it

1:11 then shall hi mind chang and he shall pass over and offend
imput thi hi power unto hi god

1:12 art thou not from everlast o lord my god mine holi one? we
shall not die o lord thou hast ordain them for judgment; and o
mighti god thou hast establish them for correct

1:13 thou art of purer eye than to behold evil and canst not look on
iniquity: wherefor lookest thou upon them that deal treacher
and holdest thi tongu when the wick devoureth the man that is more
righteou than he? 1:14 and makest men as the fish of the sea as
the creep thing that have no ruler over them? 1:15 they take up
all of them with the angl they catch them in their net and gather
them in their drag: therefor they rejoic and are glad

1:16 therefor they sacrific unto their net and burn incens unto
their drag; becaus by them their portion is fat and their meat
plenteou

1:17 shall they therefor empti their net and not spare continu
to slay the nations? 2:1 i will stand upon my watch and set me upon
the tower and will watch to see what he will say unto me and what i
shall answer when i am reprov

2:2 and the lord answer me and said write the vision and make it
plain upon tabl that he may run that readeth it

2:3 for the vision is yet for an appoint time but at the end it
shall speak and not lie: though it tarri wait for it; becaus it
will sure come it will not tarri

2:4 behold hi soul which is lift up is not upright in him: but the
just shall live by hi faith

2:5 yea also becaus he transgresseth by wine he is a proud man
neither keepeth at home who enlargeth hi desir as hell and is as
death and cannot be satisfi but gathereth unto him all nation
and heapeth unto him all people: 2:6 shall not all these take up a
parabl against him and a taunt proverb against him and say woe
to him that increaseth that which is not his! how long? and to him
that ladeth himself with thick clay! 2:7 shall they not rise up
suddenli that shall bite thee and awak that shall vex thee and thou
shalt be for booti unto them? 2:8 becaus thou hast spoil mani
nation all the remnant of the peopl shall spoil thee; becaus of
men blood and for the violenc of the land of the citi and of all
that dwell therein

2:9 woe to him that coveteth an evil covet to hi hous that
he may set hi nest on high that he may be deliv from the power
of evil! 2:10 thou hast consult shame to thi hous by cut off
mani peopl and hast sin against thi soul

2:11 for the stone shall cri out of the wall and the beam out of the
timber shall answer it

2:12 woe to him that buildeth a town with blood and stablisheth a
citi by iniquity! 2:13 behold is it not of the lord of host that
the peopl shall labour in the veri fire and the peopl shall weari
themselv for veri vanity? 2:14 for the earth shall be fill with
the knowledg of the glori of the lord as the water cover the sea

2:15 woe unto him that giveth hi neighbour drink that puttest thi
bottl to him and makest him drunken also that thou mayest look on
their nakedness! 2:16 thou art fill with shame for glory: drink
thou also and let thi foreskin be uncovered: the cup of the lord
right hand shall be turn unto thee and shame spew shall be on
thi glori

2:17 for the violenc of lebanon shall cover thee and the spoil of
beast which made them afraid becaus of men blood and for the
violenc of the land of the citi and of all that dwell therein

2:18 what profiteth the graven imag that the maker thereof hath
graven it; the molten imag and a teacher of lie that the maker of
hi work trusteth therein to make dumb idols? 2:19 woe unto him that
saith to the wood awake; to the dumb stone aris it shall teach!
behold it is laid over with gold and silver and there is no breath
at all in the midst of it

2:20 but the lord is in hi holi temple: let all the earth keep
silenc befor him

3:1 a prayer of habakkuk the prophet upon shigionoth

3:2 o lord i have heard thi speech and wa afraid: o lord reviv
thi work in the midst of the year in the midst of the year make
known; in wrath rememb merci

3:3 god came from teman and the holi one from mount paran selah hi
glori cover the heaven and the earth wa full of hi prais

3:4 and hi bright wa as the light; he had horn come out of
hi hand: and there wa the hide of hi power

3:5 befor him went the pestil and burn coal went forth at
hi feet

3:6 he stood and measur the earth: he beheld and drove asund the
nations; and the everlast mountain were scatter the perpetu
hill did bow: hi way are everlast

3:7 i saw the tent of cushan in affliction: and the curtain of the
land of midian did trembl

3:8 wa the lord displeas against the rivers? wa thine anger
against the rivers? wa thi wrath against the sea that thou didst
ride upon thine hors and thi chariot of salvation? 3:9 thi bow wa
made quit nake accord to the oath of the tribe even thi word
selah thou didst cleav the earth with river

3:10 the mountain saw thee and they trembled: the overflow of the
water pass by: the deep utter hi voic and lift up hi hand
on high

3:11 the sun and moon stood still in their habitation: at the light of
thine arrow they went and at the shine of thi glitter spear

3:12 thou didst march through the land in indign thou didst
thresh the heathen in anger

3:13 thou wentest forth for the salvat of thi peopl even for
salvat with thine anointed; thou woundedst the head out of the
hous of the wick by discov the foundat unto the neck
selah

3:14 thou didst strike through with hi stave the head of hi
villages: they came out as a whirlwind to scatter me: their rejoic
wa as to devour the poor secretli

3:15 thou didst walk through the sea with thine hors through the
heap of great water

3:16 when i heard my belli trembled; my lip quiver at the voice:
rotten enter into my bone and i trembl in myself that i
might rest in the day of trouble: when he cometh up unto the peopl
he will invad them with hi troop

3:17 although the fig tree shall not blossom neither shall fruit be
in the vines; the labour of the oliv shall fail and the field shall
yield no meat; the flock shall be cut off from the fold and there
shall be no herd in the stalls: 3:18 yet i will rejoic in the lord i
will joy in the god of my salvat

3:19 the lord god is my strength and he will make my feet like hind
feet and he will make me to walk upon mine high place to the chief
singer on my string instrument




zephaniah


1:1 the word of the lord which came unto zephaniah the son of cushi
the son of gedaliah the son of amariah the son of hizkiah in the
day of josiah the son of amon king of judah

1:2 i will utterli consum all thing from off the land saith the
lord

1:3 i will consum man and beast; i will consum the fowl of the
heaven and the fish of the sea and the stumbl block with the
wicked: and i will cut off man from off the land saith the lord

1:4 i will also stretch out mine hand upon judah and upon all the
inhabit of jerusalem; and i will cut off the remnant of baal from
thi place and the name of the chemarim with the priests; 1:5 and
them that worship the host of heaven upon the housetops; and them that
worship and that swear by the lord and that swear by malcham; 1:6 and
them that are turn back from the lord; and those that have not
sought the lord nor enquir for him

1:7 hold thi peac at the presenc of the lord god: for the day of the
lord is at hand: for the lord hath prepar a sacrific he hath bid
hi guest

1:8 and it shall come to pass in the day of the lord sacrific that
i will punish the princ and the king children and all such as
are cloth with strang apparel

1:9 in the same day also will i punish all those that leap on the
threshold which fill their master hous with violenc and deceit

1:10 and it shall come to pass in that day saith the lord that there
shall be the nois of a cri from the fish gate and an howl from
the second and a great crash from the hill

1:11 howl ye inhabit of maktesh for all the merchant peopl are
cut down; all they that bear silver are cut off

1:12 and it shall come to pass at that time that i will search
jerusalem with candl and punish the men that are settl on their
lees: that say in their heart the lord will not do good neither will
he do evil

1:13 therefor their good shall becom a booti and their hous a
desolation: they shall also build hous but not inhabit them; and
they shall plant vineyard but not drink the wine thereof

1:14 the great day of the lord is near it is near and hasteth
greatli even the voic of the day of the lord: the mighti man shall
cri there bitterli

1:15 that day is a day of wrath a day of troubl and distress a day
of wast and desol a day of dark and gloomi a day
of cloud and thick dark 1:16 a day of the trumpet and alarm
against the fenc citi and against the high tower

1:17 and i will bring distress upon men that they shall walk like
blind men becaus they have sin against the lord: and their blood
shall be pour out as dust and their flesh as the dung

1:18 neither their silver nor their gold shall be abl to deliv them
in the day of the lord wrath; but the whole land shall be devour
by the fire of hi jealousy: for he shall make even a speedi riddanc
of all them that dwell in the land

2:1 gather yourselv togeth yea gather togeth o nation not
desired; 2:2 befor the decre bring forth befor the day pass as the
chaff befor the fierc anger of the lord come upon you befor the
day of the lord anger come upon you

2:3 seek ye the lord all ye meek of the earth which have wrought hi
judgment; seek righteous seek meekness: it may be ye shall be hid
in the day of the lord anger

2:4 for gaza shall be forsaken and ashkelon a desolation: they shall
drive out ashdod at the noon day and ekron shall be root up

2:5 woe unto the inhabit of the sea coast the nation of the
cherethites! the word of the lord is against you; o canaan the land
of the philistin i will even destroy thee that there shall be no
inhabit

2:6 and the sea coast shall be dwell and cottag for shepherd
and fold for flock

2:7 and the coast shall be for the remnant of the hous of judah; they
shall feed thereupon: in the hous of ashkelon shall they lie down in
the evening: for the lord their god shall visit them and turn away
their captiv

2:8 i have heard the reproach of moab and the revil of the
children of ammon wherebi they have reproach my peopl and
magnifi themselv against their border

2:9 therefor as i live saith the lord of host the god of israel
sure moab shall be as sodom and the children of ammon as gomorrah
even the breed of nettl and saltpit and a perpetu
desolation: the residu of my peopl shall spoil them and the remnant
of my peopl shall possess them

2:10 thi shall they have for their pride becaus they have
reproach and magnifi themselv against the peopl of the lord of
host

2:11 the lord will be terribl unto them: for he will famish all the
god of the earth; and men shall worship him everi one from hi
place even all the isl of the heathen

2:12 ye ethiopian also ye shall be slain by my sword

2:13 and he will stretch out hi hand against the north and destroy
assyria; and will make nineveh a desol and dri like a
wilder

2:14 and flock shall lie down in the midst of her all the beast of
the nations: both the cormor and the bittern shall lodg in the
upper lintel of it; their voic shall sing in the windows; desol
shall be in the thresholds; for he shall uncov the cedar work

2:15 thi is the rejoic citi that dwelt carelessli that said in
her heart i am and there is none besid me: how is she becom a
desol a place for beast to lie down in! everi one that passeth
by her shall hiss and wag hi hand

3:1 woe to her that is filthi and pollut to the oppress city!
3:2 she obey not the voice; she receiv not correction; she trust
not in the lord; she drew not near to her god

3:3 her princ within her are roar lions; her judg are even
wolves; they gnaw not the bone till the morrow

3:4 her prophet are light and treacher persons: her priest have
pollut the sanctuari they have done violenc to the law

3:5 the just lord is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity:
everi morn doth he bring hi judgment to light he faileth not; but
the unjust knoweth no shame

3:6 i have cut off the nations: their tower are desolate; i made
their street wast that none passeth by: their citi are destroy
so that there is no man that there is none inhabit

3:7 i said sure thou wilt fear me thou wilt receiv instruction;
so their dwell should not be cut off howsoev i punish them:
but they rose earli and corrupt all their do

3:8 therefor wait ye upon me saith the lord until the day that i
rise up to the prey: for my determin is to gather the nation
that i may assembl the kingdom to pour upon them mine indign
even all my fierc anger: for all the earth shall be devour with the
fire of my jealousi

3:9 for then will i turn to the peopl a pure languag that they may
all call upon the name of the lord to serv him with one consent

3:10 from beyond the river of ethiopia my suppliant even the
daughter of my dispers shall bring mine offer

3:11 in that day shalt thou not be asham for all thi do wherein
thou hast transgress against me: for then i will take away out of
the midst of thee them that rejoic in thi pride and thou shalt no
more be haughti becaus of my holi mountain

3:12 i will also leav in the midst of thee an afflict and poor
peopl and they shall trust in the name of the lord

3:13 the remnant of israel shall not do iniqu nor speak lies;
neither shall a deceit tongu be found in their mouth: for they
shall feed and lie down and none shall make them afraid

3:14 sing o daughter of zion; shout o israel; be glad and rejoic
with all the heart o daughter of jerusalem

3:15 the lord hath taken away thi judgment he hath cast out thine
enemy: the king of israel even the lord is in the midst of thee:
thou shalt not see evil ani more

3:16 in that day it shall be said to jerusalem fear thou not: and to
zion let not thine hand be slack

3:17 the lord thi god in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save he
will rejoic over thee with joy; he will rest in hi love he will joy
over thee with sing

3:18 i will gather them that are sorrow for the solemn assembl
who are of thee to whom the reproach of it wa a burden

3:19 behold at that time i will undo all that afflict thee: and i
will save her that halteth and gather her that wa driven out; and i
will get them prais and fame in everi land where they have been put
to shame

3:20 at that time will i bring you again even in the time that i
gather you: for i will make you a name and a prais among all peopl
of the earth when i turn back your captiv befor your eye
saith the lord




haggai


1:1 in the second year of dariu the king in the sixth month in the
first day of the month came the word of the lord by haggai the
prophet unto zerubbabel the son of shealtiel governor of judah and
to joshua the son of josedech the high priest say 1:2 thu
speaketh the lord of host say thi peopl say the time is not
come the time that the lord hous should be built

1:3 then came the word of the lord by haggai the prophet say 1:4
is it time for you o ye to dwell in your ciel hous and thi
hous lie waste? 1:5 now therefor thu saith the lord of hosts;
consid your way

1:6 ye have sown much and bring in little; ye eat but ye have not
enough; ye drink but ye are not fill with drink; ye cloth you but
there is none warm; and he that earneth wage earneth wage to put it
into a bag with hole

1:7 thu saith the lord of hosts; consid your way

1:8 go up to the mountain and bring wood and build the house; and i
will take pleasur in it and i will be glorifi saith the lord

1:9 ye look for much and lo it came to little; and when ye brought
it home i did blow upon it why? saith the lord of host becaus of
mine hous that is wast and ye run everi man unto hi own hous

1:10 therefor the heaven over you is stay from dew and the earth
is stay from her fruit

1:11 and i call for a drought upon the land and upon the mountain
and upon the corn and upon the new wine and upon the oil and upon
that which the ground bringeth forth and upon men and upon cattl
and upon all the labour of the hand

1:12 then zerubbabel the son of shealtiel and joshua the son of
josedech the high priest with all the remnant of the peopl obey
the voic of the lord their god and the word of haggai the prophet
as the lord their god had sent him and the peopl did fear befor the
lord

1:13 then spake haggai the lord messeng in the lord messag unto
the peopl say i am with you saith the lord

1:14 and the lord stir up the spirit of zerubbabel the son of
shealtiel governor of judah and the spirit of joshua the son of
josedech the high priest and the spirit of all the remnant of the
people; and they came and did work in the hous of the lord of host
their god 1:15 in the four and twentieth day of the sixth month in
the second year of dariu the king

2:1 in the seventh month in the one and twentieth day of the month
came the word of the lord by the prophet haggai say 2:2 speak now
to zerubbabel the son of shealtiel governor of judah and to joshua
the son of josedech the high priest and to the residu of the
peopl say 2:3 who is left among you that saw thi hous in her
first glory? and how do ye see it now? is it not in your eye in
comparison of it as nothing? 2:4 yet now be strong o zerubbabel
saith the lord; and be strong o joshua son of josedech the high
priest; and be strong all ye peopl of the land saith the lord and
work: for i am with you saith the lord of hosts: 2:5 accord to the
word that i coven with you when ye came out of egypt so my
spirit remaineth among you: fear ye not

2:6 for thu saith the lord of hosts; yet onc it is a littl while
and i will shake the heaven and the earth and the sea and the dri
land; 2:7 and i will shake all nation and the desir of all nation
shall come: and i will fill thi hous with glori saith the lord of
host

2:8 the silver is mine and the gold is mine saith the lord of host

2:9 the glori of thi latter hous shall be greater than of the
former saith the lord of hosts: and in thi place will i give peac
saith the lord of host

2:10 in the four and twentieth day of the ninth month in the second
year of dariu came the word of the lord by haggai the prophet
say 2:11 thu saith the lord of hosts; ask now the priest
concern the law say 2:12 if one bear holi flesh in the skirt
of hi garment and with hi skirt do touch bread or pottag or
wine or oil or ani meat shall it be holy? and the priest answer
and said no

2:13 then said haggai if one that is unclean by a dead bodi touch ani
of these shall it be unclean? and the priest answer and said it
shall be unclean

2:14 then answer haggai and said so is thi peopl and so is thi
nation befor me saith the lord; and so is everi work of their hands;
and that which they offer there is unclean

2:15 and now i pray you consid from thi day and upward from
befor a stone wa laid upon a stone in the templ of the lord: 2:16
sinc those day were when one came to an heap of twenti measur
there were but ten: when one came to the pressfat for to draw out
fifti vessel out of the press there were but twenti

2:17 i smote you with blast and with mildew and with hail in all
the labour of your hands; yet ye turn not to me saith the lord

2:18 consid now from thi day and upward from the four and
twentieth day of the ninth month even from the day that the
foundat of the lord templ wa laid consid it

2:19 is the seed yet in the barn? yea as yet the vine and the fig
tree and the pomegran and the oliv tree hath not brought forth:
from thi day will i bless you

2:20 and again the word of the lord came unto haggai in the four and
twentieth day of the month say 2:21 speak to zerubbabel governor
of judah say i will shake the heaven and the earth; 2:22 and i
will overthrow the throne of kingdom and i will destroy the strength
of the kingdom of the heathen; and i will overthrow the chariot and
those that ride in them; and the hors and their rider shall come
down everi one by the sword of hi brother

2:23 in that day saith the lord of host will i take thee o
zerubbabel my servant the son of shealtiel saith the lord and will
make thee as a signet: for i have chosen thee saith the lord of host




zechariah


1:1 in the eighth month in the second year of dariu came the word
of the lord unto zechariah the son of berechiah the son of iddo the
prophet say 1:2 the lord hath been sore displeas with your
father

1:3 therefor say thou unto them thu saith the lord of hosts; turn
ye unto me saith the lord of host and i will turn unto you saith
the lord of host

1:4 be ye not as your father unto whom the former prophet have
cri say thu saith the lord of hosts; turn ye now from your
evil way and from your evil doings: but they did not hear nor
hearken unto me saith the lord

1:5 your father where are they? and the prophet do they live for
ever? 1:6 but my word and my statut which i command my servant
the prophet did they not take hold of your fathers? and they
return and said like as the lord of host thought to do unto us
accord to our way and accord to our do so hath he dealt
with us

1:7 upon the four and twentieth day of the eleventh month which is
the month sebat in the second year of dariu came the word of the
lord unto zechariah the son of berechiah the son of iddo the
prophet say 1:8 i saw by night and behold a man ride upon a
red hors and he stood among the myrtl tree that were in the
bottom; and behind him were there red hors speckl and white

1:9 then said i o my lord what are these? and the angel that talk
with me said unto me i will shew thee what these be

1:10 and the man that stood among the myrtl tree answer and said
these are they whom the lord hath sent to walk to and fro through the
earth

1:11 and they answer the angel of the lord that stood among the
myrtl tree and said we have walk to and fro through the earth
and behold all the earth sitteth still and is at rest

1:12 then the angel of the lord answer and said o lord of host
how long wilt thou not have merci on jerusalem and on the citi of
judah against which thou hast had indign these threescor and
ten years? 1:13 and the lord answer the angel that talk with me
with good word and comfort word

1:14 so the angel that commun with me said unto me cri thou
say thu saith the lord of hosts; i am jealou for jerusalem and
for zion with a great jealousi

1:15 and i am veri sore displeas with the heathen that are at ease:
for i wa but a littl displeas and they help forward the
afflict

1:16 therefor thu saith the lord; i am return to jerusalem with
mercies: my hous shall be built in it saith the lord of host and a
line shall be stretch forth upon jerusalem

1:17 cri yet say thu saith the lord of hosts; my citi through
prosper shall yet be spread abroad; and the lord shall yet comfort
zion and shall yet choos jerusalem

1:18 then lift i up mine eye and saw and behold four horn

1:19 and i said unto the angel that talk with me what be these? and
he answer me these are the horn which have scatter judah
israel and jerusalem

1:20 and the lord shew me four carpent

1:21 then said i what come these to do? and he spake say these
are the horn which have scatter judah so that no man did lift up
hi head: but these are come to fray them to cast out the horn of
the gentil which lift up their horn over the land of judah to
scatter it

2:1 i lift up mine eye again and look and behold a man with a
measur line in hi hand

2:2 then said i whither goest thou? and he said unto me to measur
jerusalem to see what is the breadth thereof and what is the length
thereof

2:3 and behold the angel that talk with me went forth and anoth
angel went out to meet him 2:4 and said unto him run speak to thi
young man say jerusalem shall be inhabit as town without wall
for the multitud of men and cattl therein: 2:5 for i saith the
lord will be unto her a wall of fire round about and will be the
glori in the midst of her

2:6 ho ho come forth and flee from the land of the north saith the
lord: for i have spread you abroad as the four wind of the heaven
saith the lord

2:7 deliv thyself o zion that dwellest with the daughter of
babylon

2:8 for thu saith the lord of hosts; after the glori hath he sent me
unto the nation which spoil you: for he that toucheth you toucheth
the appl of hi eye

2:9 for behold i will shake mine hand upon them and they shall be a
spoil to their servants: and ye shall know that the lord of host hath
sent me

2:10 sing and rejoic o daughter of zion: for lo i come and i will
dwell in the midst of thee saith the lord

2:11 and mani nation shall be join to the lord in that day and
shall be my people: and i will dwell in the midst of thee and thou
shalt know that the lord of host hath sent me unto thee

2:12 and the lord shall inherit judah hi portion in the holi land
and shall choos jerusalem again

2:13 be silent o all flesh befor the lord: for he is rais up out
of hi holi habit

3:1 and he shew me joshua the high priest stand befor the angel
of the lord and satan stand at hi right hand to resist him

3:2 and the lord said unto satan the lord rebuk thee o satan; even
the lord that hath chosen jerusalem rebuk thee: is not thi a brand
pluck out of the fire? 3:3 now joshua wa cloth with filthi
garment and stood befor the angel

3:4 and he answer and spake unto those that stood befor him
say take away the filthi garment from him and unto him he said
behold i have caus thine iniqu to pass from thee and i will
cloth thee with chang of raiment

3:5 and i said let them set a fair mitr upon hi head so they set a
fair mitr upon hi head and cloth him with garment and the angel
of the lord stood by

3:6 and the angel of the lord protest unto joshua say 3:7 thu
saith the lord of hosts; if thou wilt walk in my way and if thou
wilt keep my charg then thou shalt also judg my hous and shalt
also keep my court and i will give thee place to walk among these
that stand by

3:8 hear now o joshua the high priest thou and thi fellow that sit
befor thee: for they are men wonder at: for behold i will bring
forth my servant the branch

3:9 for behold the stone that i have laid befor joshua; upon one
stone shall be seven eyes: behold i will engrav the grave thereof
saith the lord of host and i will remov the iniqu of that land
in one day

3:10 in that day saith the lord of host shall ye call everi man hi
neighbour under the vine and under the fig tree

4:1 and the angel that talk with me came again and wake me as a
man that is waken out of hi sleep

4:2 and said unto me what seest thou? and i said i have look and
behold a candlestick all of gold with a bowl upon the top of it and
hi seven lamp thereon and seven pipe to the seven lamp which are
upon the top thereof: 4:3 and two oliv tree by it one upon the
right side of the bowl and the other upon the left side thereof

4:4 so i answer and spake to the angel that talk with me say
what are these my lord? 4:5 then the angel that talk with me
answer and said unto me knowest thou not what these be? and i said
no my lord

4:6 then he answer and spake unto me say thi is the word of
the lord unto zerubbabel say not by might nor by power but by
my spirit saith the lord of host

4:7 who art thou o great mountain? befor zerubbabel thou shalt
becom a plain: and he shall bring forth the headston thereof with
shout cri grace grace unto it

4:8 moreov the word of the lord came unto me say 4:9 the hand
of zerubbabel have laid the foundat of thi house; hi hand shall
also finish it; and thou shalt know that the lord of host hath sent
me unto you

4:10 for who hath despis the day of small things? for they shall
rejoic and shall see the plummet in the hand of zerubbabel with
those seven; they are the eye of the lord which run to and fro
through the whole earth

4:11 then answer i and said unto him what are these two oliv
tree upon the right side of the candlestick and upon the left side
thereof? 4:12 and i answer again and said unto him what be these
two oliv branch which through the two golden pipe empti the golden
oil out of themselves? 4:13 and he answer me and said knowest thou
not what these be? and i said no my lord

4:14 then said he these are the two anoint one that stand by the
lord of the whole earth

5:1 then i turn and lift up mine eye and look and behold a
fli roll

5:2 and he said unto me what seest thou? and i answer i see a
fli roll; the length thereof is twenti cubit and the breadth
thereof ten cubit

5:3 then said he unto me thi is the curs that goeth forth over the
face of the whole earth: for everi one that stealeth shall be cut off
as on thi side accord to it; and everi one that sweareth shall be
cut off as on that side accord to it

5:4 i will bring it forth saith the lord of host and it shall enter
into the hous of the thief and into the hous of him that sweareth
fals by my name: and it shall remain in the midst of hi hous and
shall consum it with the timber thereof and the stone thereof

5:5 then the angel that talk with me went forth and said unto me
lift up now thine eye and see what is thi that goeth forth

5:6 and i said what is it? and he said thi is an ephah that goeth
forth he said moreov thi is their resembl through all the
earth

5:7 and behold there wa lift up a talent of lead: and thi is a
woman that sitteth in the midst of the ephah

5:8 and he said thi is wicked and he cast it into the midst of
the ephah; and he cast the weight of lead upon the mouth thereof

5:9 then lift i up mine eye and look and behold there came
out two women and the wind wa in their wings; for they had wing
like the wing of a stork: and they lift up the ephah between the
earth and the heaven

5:10 then said i to the angel that talk with me whither do these
bear the ephah? 5:11 and he said unto me to build it an hous in the
land of shinar: and it shall be establish and set there upon her
own base

6:1 and i turn and lift up mine eye and look and behold
there came four chariot out from between two mountains; and the
mountain were mountain of brass

6:2 in the first chariot were red horses; and in the second chariot
black horses; 6:3 and in the third chariot white horses; and in the
fourth chariot grisl and bay hors

6:4 then i answer and said unto the angel that talk with me what
are these my lord? 6:5 and the angel answer and said unto me
these are the four spirit of the heaven which go forth from
stand befor the lord of all the earth

6:6 the black hors which are therein go forth into the north
country; and the white go forth after them; and the grisl go forth
toward the south countri

6:7 and the bay went forth and sought to go that they might walk to
and fro through the earth: and he said get you henc walk to and fro
through the earth so they walk to and fro through the earth

6:8 then cri he upon me and spake unto me say behold these
that go toward the north countri have quiet my spirit in the north
countri

6:9 and the word of the lord came unto me say 6:10 take of them
of the captiv even of heldai of tobijah and of jedaiah which
are come from babylon and come thou the same day and go into the
hous of josiah the son of zephaniah; 6:11 then take silver and gold
and make crown and set them upon the head of joshua the son of
josedech the high priest; 6:12 and speak unto him say thu
speaketh the lord of host say behold the man whose name is the
branch; and he shall grow up out of hi place and he shall build the
templ of the lord: 6:13 even he shall build the templ of the lord;
and he shall bear the glori and shall sit and rule upon hi throne;
and he shall be a priest upon hi throne: and the counsel of peac
shall be between them both

6:14 and the crown shall be to helem and to tobijah and to jedaiah
and to hen the son of zephaniah for a memori in the templ of the
lord

6:15 and they that are far off shall come and build in the templ of
the lord and ye shall know that the lord of host hath sent me unto
you and thi shall come to pass if ye will dilig obey the voic
of the lord your god

7:1 and it came to pass in the fourth year of king dariu that the
word of the lord came unto zechariah in the fourth day of the ninth
month even in chisleu; 7:2 when they had sent unto the hous of god
sherez and regemmelech and their men to pray befor the lord 7:3
and to speak unto the priest which were in the hous of the lord of
host and to the prophet say should i weep in the fifth month
separ myself as i have done these so mani years? 7:4 then came
the word of the lord of host unto me say 7:5 speak unto all the
peopl of the land and to the priest say when ye fast and
mourn in the fifth and seventh month even those seventi year did
ye at all fast unto me even to me? 7:6 and when ye did eat and when
ye did drink did not ye eat for yourselv and drink for yourselves?
7:7 should ye not hear the word which the lord hath cri by the
former prophet when jerusalem wa inhabit and in prosper and
the citi thereof round about her when men inhabit the south and
the plain? 7:8 and the word of the lord came unto zechariah say
7:9 thu speaketh the lord of host say execut true judgment
and shew merci and compass everi man to hi brother: 7:10 and
oppress not the widow nor the fatherless the stranger nor the poor;
and let none of you imagin evil against hi brother in your heart

7:11 but they refus to hearken and pull away the shoulder and
stop their ear that they should not hear

7:12 yea they made their heart as an adam stone lest they should
hear the law and the word which the lord of host hath sent in hi
spirit by the former prophets: therefor came a great wrath from the
lord of host

7:13 therefor it is come to pass that as he cri and they would
not hear; so they cri and i would not hear saith the lord of
hosts: 7:14 but i scatter them with a whirlwind among all the
nation whom they knew not thu the land wa desol after them
that no man pass through nor returned: for they laid the pleasant
land desol

8:1 again the word of the lord of host came to me say 8:2 thu
saith the lord of hosts; i wa jealou for zion with great jealousi
and i wa jealou for her with great furi

8:3 thu saith the lord; i am return unto zion and will dwell in
the midst of jerusalem: and jerusalem shall be call a citi of truth;
and the mountain of the lord of host the holi mountain

8:4 thu saith the lord of hosts; there shall yet old men and old
women dwell in the street of jerusalem and everi man with hi staff
in hi hand for veri age

8:5 and the street of the citi shall be full of boy and girl
play in the street thereof

8:6 thu saith the lord of hosts; if it be marvel in the eye of
the remnant of thi peopl in these day should it also be marvel
in mine eyes? saith the lord of host

8:7 thu saith the lord of hosts; behold i will save my peopl from
the east countri and from the west country; 8:8 and i will bring
them and they shall dwell in the midst of jerusalem: and they shall
be my peopl and i will be their god in truth and in righteous

8:9 thu saith the lord of hosts; let your hand be strong ye that
hear in these day these word by the mouth of the prophet which
were in the day that the foundat of the hous of the lord of host
wa laid that the templ might be built

8:10 for befor these day there wa no hire for man nor ani hire for
beast; neither wa there ani peac to him that went out or came in
becaus of the affliction: for i set all men everi one against hi
neighbour

8:11 but now i will not be unto the residu of thi peopl as in the
former day saith the lord of host

8:12 for the seed shall be prosperous; the vine shall give her fruit
and the ground shall give her increas and the heaven shall give
their dew; and i will caus the remnant of thi peopl to possess all
these thing

8:13 and it shall come to pass that as ye were a curs among the
heathen o hous of judah and hous of israel; so will i save you
and ye shall be a blessing: fear not but let your hand be strong

8:14 for thu saith the lord of hosts; as i thought to punish you
when your father provok me to wrath saith the lord of host and i
repent not: 8:15 so again have i thought in these day to do well
unto jerusalem and to the hous of judah: fear ye not

8:16 these are the thing that ye shall do; speak ye everi man the
truth to hi neighbour; execut the judgment of truth and peac in
your gates: 8:17 and let none of you imagin evil in your heart
against hi neighbour; and love no fals oath: for all these are
thing that i hate saith the lord

8:18 and the word of the lord of host came unto me say 8:19 thu
saith the lord of hosts; the fast of the fourth month and the fast of
the fifth and the fast of the seventh and the fast of the tenth
shall be to the hous of judah joy and glad and cheer feasts;
therefor love the truth and peac

8:20 thu saith the lord of hosts; it shall yet come to pass that
there shall come peopl and the inhabit of mani cities: 8:21 and
the inhabit of one citi shall go to anoth say let us go
speedili to pray befor the lord and to seek the lord of hosts: i
will go also

8:22 yea mani peopl and strong nation shall come to seek the lord
of host in jerusalem and to pray befor the lord

8:23 thu saith the lord of hosts; in those day it shall come to
pass that ten men shall take hold out of all languag of the
nation even shall take hold of the skirt of him that is a jew
say we will go with you: for we have heard that god is with you

9:1 the burden of the word of the lord in the land of hadrach and
damascu shall be the rest thereof: when the eye of man as of all
the tribe of israel shall be toward the lord

9:2 and hamath also shall border thereby; tyru and zidon though it
be veri wise

9:3 and tyru did build herself a strong hold and heap up silver as
the dust and fine gold as the mire of the street

9:4 behold the lord will cast her out and he will smite her power in
the sea; and she shall be devour with fire

9:5 ashkelon shall see it and fear; gaza also shall see it and be
veri sorrow and ekron; for her expect shall be ashamed; and
the king shall perish from gaza and ashkelon shall not be inhabit

9:6 and a bastard shall dwell in ashdod and i will cut off the pride
of the philistin

9:7 and i will take away hi blood out of hi mouth and hi
abomin from between hi teeth: but he that remaineth even he
shall be for our god and he shall be as a governor in judah and
ekron as a jebusit

9:8 and i will encamp about mine hous becaus of the armi becaus of
him that passeth by and becaus of him that returneth: and no
oppressor shall pass through them ani more: for now have i seen with
mine eye

9:9 rejoic greatli o daughter of zion; shout o daughter of
jerusalem: behold thi king cometh unto thee: he is just and have
salvation; lowli and ride upon an ass and upon a colt the foal of
an ass

9:10 and i will cut off the chariot from ephraim and the hors from
jerusalem and the battl bow shall be cut off: and he shall speak
peac unto the heathen: and hi dominion shall be from sea even to
sea and from the river even to the end of the earth

9:11 as for thee also by the blood of thi coven i have sent forth
thi prison out of the pit wherein is no water

9:12 turn you to the strong hold ye prison of hope: even to day do
i declar that i will render doubl unto thee; 9:13 when i have bent
judah for me fill the bow with ephraim and rais up thi son o
zion against thi son o greec and made thee as the sword of a
mighti man

9:14 and the lord shall be seen over them and hi arrow shall go
forth as the lightning: and the lord god shall blow the trumpet and
shall go with whirlwind of the south

9:15 the lord of host shall defend them; and they shall devour and
subdu with sling stones; and they shall drink and make a nois as
through wine; and they shall be fill like bowl and as the corner
of the altar

9:16 and the lord their god shall save them in that day as the flock
of hi people: for they shall be as the stone of a crown lift up
as an ensign upon hi land

9:17 for how great is hi good and how great is hi beauty! corn
shall make the young men cheer and new wine the maid

10:1 ask ye of the lord rain in the time of the latter rain; so the
lord shall make bright cloud and give them shower of rain to everi
one grass in the field

10:2 for the idol have spoken vaniti and the divin have seen a
lie and have told fals dreams; they comfort in vain: therefor they
went their way as a flock they were troubl becaus there wa no
shepherd

10:3 mine anger wa kindl against the shepherd and i punish the
goats: for the lord of host hath visit hi flock the hous of
judah and hath made them as hi goodli hors in the battl

10:4 out of him came forth the corner out of him the nail out of him
the battl bow out of him everi oppressor togeth

10:5 and they shall be as mighti men which tread down their enemi
in the mire of the street in the battle: and they shall fight
becaus the lord is with them and the rider on hors shall be
confound

10:6 and i will strengthen the hous of judah and i will save the
hous of joseph and i will bring them again to place them; for i have
merci upon them: and they shall be as though i had not cast them off:
for i am the lord their god and will hear them

10:7 and they of ephraim shall be like a mighti man and their heart
shall rejoic as through wine: yea their children shall see it and
be glad; their heart shall rejoic in the lord

10:8 i will hiss for them and gather them; for i have redeem them:
and they shall increas as they have increas

10:9 and i will sow them among the people: and they shall rememb me
in far countries; and they shall live with their children and turn
again

10:10 i will bring them again also out of the land of egypt and
gather them out of assyria; and i will bring them into the land of
gilead and lebanon; and place shall not be found for them

10:11 and he shall pass through the sea with afflict and shall
smite the wave in the sea and all the deep of the river shall dri
up: and the pride of assyria shall be brought down and the sceptr of
egypt shall depart away

10:12 and i will strengthen them in the lord; and they shall walk up
and down in hi name saith the lord

11:1 open thi door o lebanon that the fire may devour thi cedar

11:2 howl fir tree; for the cedar is fallen; becaus the mighti are
spoiled: howl o ye oak of bashan; for the forest of the vintag is
come down

11:3 there is a voic of the howl of the shepherds; for their glori
is spoiled: a voic of the roar of young lions; for the pride of
jordan is spoil

11:4 thu saith the lord my god; feed the flock of the slaughter; 11:5
whose possessor slay them and hold themselv not guilty: and they
that sell them say bless be the lord; for i am rich: and their own
shepherd piti them not

11:6 for i will no more piti the inhabit of the land saith the
lord: but lo i will deliv the men everi one into hi neighbour
hand and into the hand of hi king: and they shall smite the land
and out of their hand i will not deliv them

11:7 and i will feed the flock of slaughter even you o poor of the
flock and i took unto me two staves; the one i call beauti and the
other i call bands; and i fed the flock

11:8 three shepherd also i cut off in one month; and my soul loth
them and their soul also abhor me

11:9 then said i i will not feed you: that that dieth let it die;
and that that is to be cut off let it be cut off; and let the rest
eat everi one the flesh of anoth

11:10 and i took my staff even beauti and cut it asund that i
might break my coven which i had made with all the peopl

11:11 and it wa broken in that day: and so the poor of the flock that
wait upon me knew that it wa the word of the lord

11:12 and i said unto them if ye think good give me my price; and if
not forbear so they weigh for my price thirti piec of silver

11:13 and the lord said unto me cast it unto the potter: a goodli
price that i wa prise at of them and i took the thirti piec of
silver and cast them to the potter in the hous of the lord

11:14 then i cut asund mine other staff even band that i might
break the brotherhood between judah and israel

11:15 and the lord said unto me take unto thee yet the instrument of
a foolish shepherd

11:16 for lo i will rais up a shepherd in the land which shall not
visit those that be cut off neither shall seek the young one nor
heal that that is broken nor feed that that standeth still: but he
shall eat the flesh of the fat and tear their claw in piec

11:17 woe to the idol shepherd that leaveth the flock! the sword shall
be upon hi arm and upon hi right eye: hi arm shall be clean dri
up and hi right eye shall be utterli darken

12:1 the burden of the word of the lord for israel saith the lord
which stretcheth forth the heaven and layeth the foundat of the
earth and formeth the spirit of man within him

12:2 behold i will make jerusalem a cup of trembl unto all the
peopl round about when they shall be in the sieg both against judah
and against jerusalem

12:3 and in that day will i make jerusalem a burdensom stone for all
people: all that burden themselv with it shall be cut in piec
though all the peopl of the earth be gather togeth against it

12:4 in that day saith the lord i will smite everi hors with
astonish and hi rider with madness: and i will open mine eye
upon the hous of judah and will smite everi hors of the peopl with
blind

12:5 and the governor of judah shall say in their heart the
inhabit of jerusalem shall be my strength in the lord of host
their god

12:6 in that day will i make the governor of judah like an hearth of
fire among the wood and like a torch of fire in a sheaf; and they
shall devour all the peopl round about on the right hand and on the
left: and jerusalem shall be inhabit again in her own place even in
jerusalem

12:7 the lord also shall save the tent of judah first that the glori
of the hous of david and the glori of the inhabit of jerusalem do
not magnifi themselv against judah

12:8 in that day shall the lord defend the inhabit of jerusalem;
and he that is feebl among them at that day shall be as david; and
the hous of david shall be as god as the angel of the lord befor
them

12:9 and it shall come to pass in that day that i will seek to
destroy all the nation that come against jerusalem

12:10 and i will pour upon the hous of david and upon the
inhabit of jerusalem the spirit of grace and of supplications:
and they shall look upon me whom they have pierc and they shall
mourn for him as one mourneth for hi onli son and shall be in
bitter for him as one that is in bitter for hi firstborn

12:11 in that day shall there be a great mourn in jerusalem as the
mourn of hadadrimmon in the valley of megiddon

12:12 and the land shall mourn everi famili apart; the famili of the
hous of david apart and their wive apart; the famili of the hous
of nathan apart and their wive apart; 12:13 the famili of the hous
of levi apart and their wive apart; the famili of shimei apart and
their wive apart; 12:14 all the famili that remain everi famili
apart and their wive apart

13:1 in that day there shall be a fountain open to the hous of
david and to the inhabit of jerusalem for sin and for unclean

13:2 and it shall come to pass in that day saith the lord of host
that i will cut off the name of the idol out of the land and they
shall no more be remembered: and also i will caus the prophet and
the unclean spirit to pass out of the land

13:3 and it shall come to pass that when ani shall yet prophesi then
hi father and hi mother that begat him shall say unto him thou
shalt not live; for thou speakest lie in the name of the lord: and
hi father and hi mother that begat him shall thrust him through when
he prophesieth

13:4 and it shall come to pass in that day that the prophet shall be
asham everi one of hi vision when he hath prophesied; neither
shall they wear a rough garment to deceive: 13:5 but he shall say i
am no prophet i am an husbandman; for man taught me to keep cattl
from my youth

13:6 and one shall say unto him what are these wound in thine hands?
then he shall answer those with which i wa wound in the hous of
my friend

13:7 awak o sword against my shepherd and against the man that is
my fellow saith the lord of hosts: smite the shepherd and the sheep
shall be scattered: and i will turn mine hand upon the littl one

13:8 and it shall come to pass that in all the land saith the lord
two part therein shall be cut off and die; but the third shall be
left therein

13:9 and i will bring the third part through the fire and will refin
them as silver is refin and will tri them as gold is tried: they
shall call on my name and i will hear them: i will say it is my
people: and they shall say the lord is my god

14:1 behold the day of the lord cometh and thi spoil shall be
divid in the midst of thee

14:2 for i will gather all nation against jerusalem to battle; and
the citi shall be taken and the hous rifl and the women
ravished; and half of the citi shall go forth into captiv and the
residu of the peopl shall not be cut off from the citi

14:3 then shall the lord go forth and fight against those nation as
when he fought in the day of battl

14:4 and hi feet shall stand in that day upon the mount of oliv
which is befor jerusalem on the east and the mount of oliv shall
cleav in the midst thereof toward the east and toward the west and
there shall be a veri great valley; and half of the mountain shall
remov toward the north and half of it toward the south

14:5 and ye shall flee to the valley of the mountains; for the valley
of the mountain shall reach unto azal: yea ye shall flee like as ye
fled from befor the earthquak in the day of uzziah king of judah:
and the lord my god shall come and all the saint with thee

14:6 and it shall come to pass in that day that the light shall not
be clear nor dark: 14:7 but it shall be one day which shall be known
to the lord not day nor night: but it shall come to pass that at
even time it shall be light

14:8 and it shall be in that day that live water shall go out from
jerusalem; half of them toward the former sea and half of them toward
the hinder sea: in summer and in winter shall it be

14:9 and the lord shall be king over all the earth: in that day shall
there be one lord and hi name one

14:10 all the land shall be turn as a plain from geba to rimmon
south of jerusalem: and it shall be lift up and inhabit in her
place from benjamin gate unto the place of the first gate unto the
corner gate and from the tower of hananeel unto the king
winepress

14:11 and men shall dwell in it and there shall be no more utter
destruction; but jerusalem shall be safe inhabit

14:12 and thi shall be the plagu wherewith the lord will smite all
the peopl that have fought against jerusalem; their flesh shall
consum away while they stand upon their feet and their eye shall
consum away in their hole and their tongu shall consum away in
their mouth

14:13 and it shall come to pass in that day that a great tumult from
the lord shall be among them; and they shall lay hold everi one on the
hand of hi neighbour and hi hand shall rise up against the hand of
hi neighbour

14:14 and judah also shall fight at jerusalem; and the wealth of all
the heathen round about shall be gather togeth gold and silver
and apparel in great abund

14:15 and so shall be the plagu of the hors of the mule of the
camel and of the ass and of all the beast that shall be in these
tent as thi plagu

14:16 and it shall come to pass that everi one that is left of all
the nation which came against jerusalem shall even go up from year to
year to worship the king the lord of host and to keep the feast of
tabernacl

14:17 and it shall be that whoso will not come up of all the famili
of the earth unto jerusalem to worship the king the lord of host
even upon them shall be no rain

14:18 and if the famili of egypt go not up and come not that have no
rain; there shall be the plagu wherewith the lord will smite the
heathen that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacl

14:19 thi shall be the punish of egypt and the punish of all
nation that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacl

14:20 in that day shall there be upon the bell of the hors
holi unto the lord; and the pot in the lord hous shall be like
the bowl befor the altar

14:21 yea everi pot in jerusalem and in judah shall be holi unto
the lord of hosts: and all they that sacrific shall come and take of
them and seeth therein: and in that day there shall be no more the
canaanit in the hous of the lord of host




malachi


1:1 the burden of the word of the lord to israel by malachi

1:2 i have love you saith the lord yet ye say wherein hast thou
love us? wa not esau jacob brother? saith the lord: yet i love
jacob 1:3 and i hate esau and laid hi mountain and hi heritag
wast for the dragon of the wilder

1:4 wherea edom saith we are impoverish but we will return and
build the desol places; thu saith the lord of host they shall
build but i will throw down; and they shall call them the border of
wicked and the peopl against whom the lord hath indign for
ever

1:5 and your eye shall see and ye shall say the lord will be
magnifi from the border of israel

1:6 a son honoureth hi father and a servant hi master: if then i be
a father where is mine honour? and if i be a master where is my
fear? saith the lord of host unto you o priest that despis my
name and ye say wherein have we despis thi name? 1:7 ye offer
pollut bread upon mine altar; and ye say wherein have we pollut
thee? in that ye say the tabl of the lord is contempt

1:8 and if ye offer the blind for sacrific is it not evil? and if ye
offer the lame and sick is it not evil? offer it now unto thi
governor; will he be pleas with thee or accept thi person? saith
the lord of host

1:9 and now i pray you beseech god that he will be graciou unto us:
thi hath been by your means: will he regard your persons? saith the
lord of host

1:10 who is there even among you that would shut the door for nought?
neither do ye kindl fire on mine altar for nought i have no pleasur
in you saith the lord of host neither will i accept an offer at
your hand

1:11 for from the rise of the sun even unto the go down of the
same my name shall be great among the gentiles; and in everi place
incens shall be offer unto my name and a pure offering: for my
name shall be great among the heathen saith the lord of host

1:12 but ye have profan it in that ye say the tabl of the lord is
polluted; and the fruit thereof even hi meat is contempt

1:13 ye said also behold what a weari is it! and ye have snuf
at it saith the lord of hosts; and ye brought that which wa torn
and the lame and the sick; thu ye brought an offering: should i
accept thi of your hand? saith the lord

1:14 but curs be the deceiv which hath in hi flock a male and
voweth and sacrificeth unto the lord a corrupt thing: for i am a
great king saith the lord of host and my name is dread among the
heathen

2:1 and now o ye priest thi command is for you

2:2 if ye will not hear and if ye will not lay it to heart to give
glori unto my name saith the lord of host i will even send a curs
upon you and i will curs your blessings: yea i have curs them
alreadi becaus ye do not lay it to heart

2:3 behold i will corrupt your seed and spread dung upon your face
even the dung of your solemn feasts; and one shall take you away with
it

2:4 and ye shall know that i have sent thi command unto you that
my coven might be with levi saith the lord of host

2:5 my coven wa with him of life and peace; and i gave them to him
for the fear wherewith he fear me and wa afraid befor my name

2:6 the law of truth wa in hi mouth and iniqu wa not found in
hi lips: he walk with me in peac and equiti and did turn mani
away from iniqu

2:7 for the priest lip should keep knowledg and they should seek
the law at hi mouth: for he is the messeng of the lord of host

2:8 but ye are depart out of the way; ye have caus mani to stumbl
at the law; ye have corrupt the coven of levi saith the lord of
host

2:9 therefor have i also made you contempt and base befor all
the peopl accord as ye have not kept my way but have been
partial in the law

2:10 have we not all one father? hath not one god creat us? whi do
we deal treacher everi man against hi brother by profan the
coven of our fathers? 2:11 judah hath dealt treacher and an
abomin is commit in israel and in jerusalem; for judah hath
profan the holi of the lord which he love and hath marri the
daughter of a strang god

2:12 the lord will cut off the man that doeth thi the master and the
scholar out of the tabernacl of jacob and him that offereth an
offer unto the lord of host

2:13 and thi have ye done again cover the altar of the lord with
tear with weep and with cri out insomuch that he regardeth
not the offer ani more or receiveth it with good will at your
hand

2:14 yet ye say wherefore? becaus the lord hath been wit between
thee and the wife of thi youth against whom thou hast dealt
treacherously: yet is she thi companion and the wife of thi coven

2:15 and did not he make one? yet had he the residu of the spirit
and wherefor one? that he might seek a godli seed therefor take
heed to your spirit and let none deal treacher against the wife
of hi youth

2:16 for the lord the god of israel saith that he hateth put
away: for one covereth violenc with hi garment saith the lord of
hosts: therefor take heed to your spirit that ye deal not
treacher

2:17 ye have weari the lord with your word yet ye say wherein
have we weari him? when ye say everi one that doeth evil is good in
the sight of the lord and he delighteth in them; or where is the god
of judgment? 3:1 behold i will send my messeng and he shall
prepar the way befor me: and the lord whom ye seek shall suddenli
come to hi templ even the messeng of the coven whom ye
delight in: behold he shall come saith the lord of host

3:2 but who may abid the day of hi coming? and who shall stand when
he appeareth? for he is like a refin fire and like fuller soap:
3:3 and he shall sit as a refin and purifi of silver: and he shall
purifi the son of levi and purg them as gold and silver that they
may offer unto the lord an offer in righteous

3:4 then shall the offer of judah and jerusalem be pleasant unto
the lord as in the day of old and as in former year
