of the hous 20:12 say these last have wrought but one hour and
thou hast made them equal unto us which have born the burden and
heat of the day

20:13 but he answer one of them and said friend i do thee no
wrong: didst not thou agre with me for a penny? 20:14 take that
thine is and go thi way: i will give unto thi last even as unto
thee

20:15 is it not law for me to do what i will with mine own? is
thine eye evil becaus i am good? 20:16 so the last shall be first
and the first last: for mani be call but few chosen

20:17 and jesu go up to jerusalem took the twelv discipl apart
in the way and said unto them 20:18 behold we go up to jerusalem;
and the son of man shall be betray unto the chief priest and unto
the scribe and they shall condemn him to death 20:19 and shall
deliv him to the gentil to mock and to scourg and to crucifi
him: and the third day he shall rise again

20:20 then came to him the mother of zebede children with her son
worship him and desir a certain thing of him

20:21 and he said unto her what wilt thou? she saith unto him grant
that these my two son may sit the one on thi right hand and the
other on the left in thi kingdom

20:22 but jesu answer and said ye know not what ye ask are ye
abl to drink of the cup that i shall drink of and to be baptiz
with the baptism that i am baptiz with? they say unto him we are
abl

20:23 and he saith unto them ye shall drink inde of my cup and be
baptiz with the baptism that i am baptiz with: but to sit on my
right hand and on my left is not mine to give but it shall be given
to them for whom it is prepar of my father

20:24 and when the ten heard it they were move with indign
against the two brethren

20:25 but jesu call them unto him and said ye know that the
princ of the gentil exercis dominion over them and they that are
great exercis author upon them

20:26 but it shall not be so among you: but whosoev will be great
among you let him be your minister; 20:27 and whosoev will be chief
among you let him be your servant: 20:28 even as the son of man came
not to be minist unto but to minist and to give hi life a
ransom for mani

20:29 and as they depart from jericho a great multitud follow
him

20:30 and behold two blind men sit by the way side when they
heard that jesu pass by cri out say have merci on us o
lord thou son of david

20:31 and the multitud rebuk them becaus they should hold their
peace: but they cri the more say have merci on us o lord thou
son of david

20:32 and jesu stood still and call them and said what will ye
that i shall do unto you? 20:33 they say unto him lord that our
eye may be open

20:34 so jesu had compass on them and touch their eyes: and
immedi their eye receiv sight and they follow him

21:1 and when they drew nigh unto jerusalem and were come to
bethphag unto the mount of oliv then sent jesu two discipl
21:2 say unto them go into the villag over against you and
straightway ye shall find an ass tie and a colt with her: loos
them and bring them unto me

21:3 and if ani man say ought unto you ye shall say the lord hath
need of them; and straightway he will send them

21:4 all thi wa done that it might be fulfil which wa spoken by
the prophet say 21:5 tell ye the daughter of sion behold thi
king cometh unto thee meek and sit upon an ass and a colt the
foal of an ass

21:6 and the discipl went and did as jesu command them 21:7 and
brought the ass and the colt and put on them their cloth and they
set him thereon

21:8 and a veri great multitud spread their garment in the way;
other cut down branch from the tree and straw them in the way

21:9 and the multitud that went befor and that follow cri
say hosanna to the son of david: bless is he that cometh in the
name of the lord; hosanna in the highest

21:10 and when he wa come into jerusalem all the citi wa move
say who is this? 21:11 and the multitud said thi is jesu the
prophet of nazareth of galile

21:12 and jesu went into the templ of god and cast out all them
that sold and bought in the templ and overthrew the tabl of the
moneychang and the seat of them that sold dove 21:13 and said
unto them it is written my hous shall be call the hous of
prayer; but ye have made it a den of thiev

21:14 and the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he
heal them

21:15 and when the chief priest and scribe saw the wonder thing
that he did and the children cri in the templ and say
hosanna to the son of david; they were sore displeas 21:16 and said
unto him hearest thou what these say? and jesu saith unto them yea;
have ye never read out of the mouth of babe and suckl thou hast
perfect praise? 21:17 and he left them and went out of the citi
into bethany; and he lodg there

21:18 now in the morn as he return into the citi he hunger

21:19 and when he saw a fig tree in the way he came to it and found
noth thereon but leav onli and said unto it let no fruit grow
on thee henceforward for ever and present the fig tree wither
away

21:20 and when the discipl saw it they marvel say how soon
is the fig tree wither away! 21:21 jesu answer and said unto
them verili i say unto you if ye have faith and doubt not ye shall
not onli do thi which is done to the fig tree but also if ye shall
say unto thi mountain be thou remov and be thou cast into the
sea; it shall be done

21:22 and all thing whatsoev ye shall ask in prayer believ ye
shall receiv

21:23 and when he wa come into the templ the chief priest and the
elder of the peopl came unto him as he wa teach and said by
what author doest thou these things? and who gave thee thi
authority? 21:24 and jesu answer and said unto them i also will
ask you one thing which if ye tell me i in like wise will tell you
by what author i do these thing

21:25 the baptism of john whenc wa it? from heaven or of men? and
they reason with themselv say if we shall say from heaven;
he will say unto us whi did ye not then believ him? 21:26 but if we
shall say of men; we fear the people; for all hold john as a prophet

21:27 and they answer jesu and said we cannot tell and he said
unto them neither tell i you by what author i do these thing

21:28 but what think ye? a certain man had two sons; and he came to
the first and said son go work to day in my vineyard

21:29 he answer and said i will not: but afterward he repent and
went

21:30 and he came to the second and said likewis and he answer
and said i go sir: and went not

21:31 whether of them twain did the will of hi father? they say unto
him the first jesu saith unto them verili i say unto you that the
publican and the harlot go into the kingdom of god befor you

21:32 for john came unto you in the way of righteous and ye
believ him not: but the publican and the harlot believ him: and
ye when ye had seen it repent not afterward that ye might believ
him

21:33 hear anoth parable: there wa a certain household which
plant a vineyard and hedg it round about and dig a winepress
in it and built a tower and let it out to husbandmen and went into
a far country: 21:34 and when the time of the fruit drew near he sent
hi servant to the husbandmen that they might receiv the fruit of
it

21:35 and the husbandmen took hi servant and beat one and kill
anoth and stone anoth

21:36 again he sent other servant more than the first: and they did
unto them likewis

21:37 but last of all he sent unto them hi son say they will
rever my son

21:38 but when the husbandmen saw the son they said among themselv
thi is the heir; come let us kill him and let us seiz on hi
inherit

21:39 and they caught him and cast him out of the vineyard and slew
him

21:40 when the lord therefor of the vineyard cometh what will he do
unto those husbandmen? 21:41 they say unto him he will miser
destroy those wick men and will let out hi vineyard unto other
husbandmen which shall render him the fruit in their season

21:42 jesu saith unto them did ye never read in the scriptur the
stone which the builder reject the same is becom the head of the
corner: thi is the lord do and it is marvel in our eyes?
21:43 therefor say i unto you the kingdom of god shall be taken from
you and given to a nation bring forth the fruit thereof

21:44 and whosoev shall fall on thi stone shall be broken: but on
whomsoev it shall fall it will grind him to powder

21:45 and when the chief priest and pharise had heard hi parabl
they perceiv that he spake of them

21:46 but when they sought to lay hand on him they fear the
multitud becaus they took him for a prophet

22:1 and jesu answer and spake unto them again by parabl and
said 22:2 the kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king which
made a marriag for hi son 22:3 and sent forth hi servant to call
them that were bidden to the wedding: and they would not come

22:4 again he sent forth other servant say tell them which are
bidden behold i have prepar my dinner: my oxen and my fatl are
kill and all thing are ready: come unto the marriag

22:5 but they made light of it and went their way one to hi farm
anoth to hi merchandise: 22:6 and the remnant took hi servant
and entreat them spite and slew them

22:7 but when the king heard thereof he wa wroth: and he sent forth
hi armi and destroy those murder and burn up their citi

22:8 then saith he to hi servant the wed is readi but they
which were bidden were not worthi

22:9 go ye therefor into the highway and as mani as ye shall find
bid to the marriag

22:10 so those servant went out into the highway and gather
togeth all as mani as they found both bad and good: and the wed
wa furnish with guest

22:11 and when the king came in to see the guest he saw there a man
which had not on a wed garment: 22:12 and he saith unto him
friend how camest thou in hither not have a wed garment? and he
wa speechless

22:13 then said the king to the servant bind him hand and foot and
take him away and cast him into outer dark there shall be
weep and gnash of teeth

22:14 for mani are call but few are chosen

22:15 then went the pharise and took counsel how they might
entangl him in hi talk

22:16 and they sent out unto him their discipl with the herodian
say master we know that thou art true and teachest the way of
god in truth neither carest thou for ani man: for thou regardest not
the person of men

22:17 tell us therefor what thinkest thou? is it law to give
tribut unto caesar or not? 22:18 but jesu perceiv their
wicked and said whi tempt ye me ye hypocrites? 22:19 shew me
the tribut money and they brought unto him a penni

22:20 and he saith unto them whose is thi imag and superscription?
22:21 they say unto him caesar then saith he unto them render
therefor unto caesar the thing which are caesars; and unto god the
thing that are god

22:22 when they had heard these word they marvel and left him
and went their way

22:23 the same day came to him the sadduce which say that there is
no resurrect and ask him 22:24 say master mose said if a
man die have no children hi brother shall marri hi wife and
rais up seed unto hi brother

22:25 now there were with us seven brethren: and the first when he
had marri a wife deceas and have no issu left hi wife unto
hi brother: 22:26 likewis the second also and the third unto the
seventh

22:27 and last of all the woman die also

22:28 therefor in the resurrect whose wife shall she be of the
seven? for they all had her

22:29 jesu answer and said unto them ye do err not know the
scriptur nor the power of god

22:30 for in the resurrect they neither marri nor are given in
marriag but are as the angel of god in heaven

22:31 but as touch the resurrect of the dead have ye not read
that which wa spoken unto you by god say 22:32 i am the god of
abraham and the god of isaac and the god of jacob? god is not the
god of the dead but of the live

22:33 and when the multitud heard thi they were astonish at hi
doctrin

22:34 but when the pharise had heard that he had put the sadduce
to silenc they were gather togeth

22:35 then one of them which wa a lawyer ask him a question
tempt him and say 22:36 master which is the great command
in the law? 22:37 jesu said unto him thou shalt love the lord thi
god with all thi heart and with all thi soul and with all thi mind

22:38 thi is the first and great command

22:39 and the second is like unto it thou shalt love thi neighbour as
thyself

22:40 on these two command hang all the law and the prophet

22:41 while the pharise were gather togeth jesu ask them
22:42 say what think ye of christ? whose son is he? they say unto
him the son of david

22:43 he saith unto them how then doth david in spirit call him lord
say 22:44 the lord said unto my lord sit thou on my right hand
till i make thine enemi thi footstool? 22:45 if david then call him
lord how is he hi son? 22:46 and no man wa abl to answer him a
word neither durst ani man from that day forth ask him ani more
question

23:1 then spake jesu to the multitud and to hi discipl 23:2
say the scribe and the pharise sit in mose seat: 23:3 all
therefor whatsoev they bid you observ that observ and do; but do
not ye after their works: for they say and do not

23:4 for they bind heavi burden and grievou to be born and lay
them on men shoulders; but they themselv will not move them with
one of their finger

23:5 but all their work they do for to be seen of men: they make
broad their phylacteri and enlarg the border of their garment
23:6 and love the uppermost room at feast and the chief seat in
the synagogu 23:7 and greet in the market and to be call of
men rabbi rabbi

23:8 but be not ye call rabbi: for one is your master even christ;
and all ye are brethren

23:9 and call no man your father upon the earth: for one is your
father which is in heaven

23:10 neither be ye call masters: for one is your master even
christ

23:11 but he that is greatest among you shall be your servant

23:12 and whosoev shall exalt himself shall be abased; and he that
shall humbl himself shall be exalt

23:13 but woe unto you scribe and pharise hypocrites! for ye shut
up the kingdom of heaven against men: for ye neither go in yourselv
neither suffer ye them that are enter to go in

23:14 woe unto you scribe and pharise hypocrites! for ye devour
widow hous and for a pretenc make long prayer: therefor ye
shall receiv the greater damnat

23:15 woe unto you scribe and pharise hypocrites! for ye compass
sea and land to make one proselyt and when he is made ye make him
twofold more the child of hell than yourselv

23:16 woe unto you ye blind guid which say whosoev shall swear
by the templ it is nothing; but whosoev shall swear by the gold of
the templ he is a debtor! 23:17 ye fool and blind: for whether is
greater the gold or the templ that sanctifieth the gold? 23:18
and whosoev shall swear by the altar it is nothing; but whosoev
sweareth by the gift that is upon it he is guilti

23:19 ye fool and blind: for whether is greater the gift or the
altar that sanctifieth the gift? 23:20 whoso therefor shall swear by
the altar sweareth by it and by all thing thereon

23:21 and whoso shall swear by the templ sweareth by it and by him
that dwelleth therein

23:22 and he that shall swear by heaven sweareth by the throne of
god and by him that sitteth thereon

23:23 woe unto you scribe and pharise hypocrites! for ye pay
tith of mint and anis and cummin and have omit the weightier
matter of the law judgment merci and faith: these ought ye to have
done and not to leav the other undon

23:24 ye blind guid which strain at a gnat and swallow a camel

23:25 woe unto you scribe and pharise hypocrites! for ye make
clean the outsid of the cup and of the platter but within they are
full of extort and excess

23:26 thou blind pharise cleans first that which is within the cup
and platter that the outsid of them may be clean also

23:27 woe unto you scribe and pharise hypocrites! for ye are like
unto white sepulchr which inde appear beauti outward but are
within full of dead men bone and of all unclean

23:28 even so ye also outwardli appear righteou unto men but within
ye are full of hypocrisi and iniqu

23:29 woe unto you scribe and pharise hypocrites! becaus ye
build the tomb of the prophet and garnish the sepulchr of the
righteou 23:30 and say if we had been in the day of our father
we would not have been partak with them in the blood of the
prophet

23:31 wherefor ye be wit unto yourselv that ye are the
children of them which kill the prophet

23:32 fill ye up then the measur of your father

23:33 ye serpent ye gener of viper how can ye escap the
damnat of hell? 23:34 wherefor behold i send unto you prophet
and wise men and scribes: and some of them ye shall kill and crucify;
and some of them shall ye scourg in your synagogu and persecut
them from citi to city: 23:35 that upon you may come all the righteou
blood shed upon the earth from the blood of righteou abel unto the
blood of zacharia son of barachia whom ye slew between the templ
and the altar

23:36 verili i say unto you all these thing shall come upon thi
gener

23:37 o jerusalem jerusalem thou that killest the prophet and
stonest them which are sent unto thee how often would i have gather
thi children togeth even as a hen gathereth her chicken under her
wing and ye would not! 23:38 behold your hous is left unto you
desol

23:39 for i say unto you ye shall not see me henceforth till ye
shall say bless is he that cometh in the name of the lord

24:1 and jesu went out and depart from the temple: and hi
discipl came to him for to shew him the build of the templ

24:2 and jesu said unto them see ye not all these things? verili i
say unto you there shall not be left here one stone upon anoth
that shall not be thrown down

24:3 and as he sat upon the mount of oliv the discipl came unto
him privat say tell us when shall these thing be? and what
shall be the sign of thi come and of the end of the world? 24:4
and jesu answer and said unto them take heed that no man deceiv
you

24:5 for mani shall come in my name say i am christ; and shall
deceiv mani

24:6 and ye shall hear of war and rumour of wars: see that ye be not
troubled: for all these thing must come to pass but the end is not
yet

24:7 for nation shall rise against nation and kingdom against
kingdom: and there shall be famin and pestil and earthquak
in diver place

24:8 all these are the begin of sorrow

24:9 then shall they deliv you up to be afflict and shall kill
you: and ye shall be hate of all nation for my name sake

24:10 and then shall mani be offend and shall betray one anoth
and shall hate one anoth

24:11 and mani fals prophet shall rise and shall deceiv mani

24:12 and becaus iniqu shall abound the love of mani shall wax
cold

24:13 but he that shall endur unto the end the same shall be save

24:14 and thi gospel of the kingdom shall be preach in all the
world for a wit unto all nations; and then shall the end come

24:15 when ye therefor shall see the abomin of desol
spoken of by daniel the prophet stand in the holi place (whoso
readeth let him understand:) 24:16 then let them which be in judaea
flee into the mountains: 24:17 let him which is on the housetop not
come down to take ani thing out of hi house: 24:18 neither let him
which is in the field return back to take hi cloth

24:19 and woe unto them that are with child and to them that give
suck in those days! 24:20 but pray ye that your flight be not in the
winter neither on the sabbath day: 24:21 for then shall be great
tribul such as wa not sinc the begin of the world to thi
time no nor ever shall be

24:22 and except those day should be shorten there should no flesh
be saved: but for the elect sake those day shall be shorten

24:23 then if ani man shall say unto you lo here is christ or
there; believ it not

24:24 for there shall aris fals christ and fals prophet and
shall shew great sign and wonders; insomuch that if it were
possibl they shall deceiv the veri elect

24:25 behold i have told you befor

24:26 wherefor if they shall say unto you behold he is in the
desert; go not forth: behold he is in the secret chambers; believ it
not

24:27 for as the lightn cometh out of the east and shineth even
unto the west; so shall also the come of the son of man be

24:28 for wheresoev the carcas is there will the eagl be
gather togeth

24:29 immedi after the tribul of those day shall the sun be
darken and the moon shall not give her light and the star shall
fall from heaven and the power of the heaven shall be shaken: 24:30
and then shall appear the sign of the son of man in heaven: and then
shall all the tribe of the earth mourn and they shall see the son of
man come in the cloud of heaven with power and great glori

24:31 and he shall send hi angel with a great sound of a trumpet
and they shall gather togeth hi elect from the four wind from one
end of heaven to the other

24:32 now learn a parabl of the fig tree; when hi branch is yet
tender and putteth forth leav ye know that summer is nigh: 24:33
so likewis ye when ye shall see all these thing know that it is
near even at the door

24:34 verili i say unto you thi gener shall not pass till all
these thing be fulfil

24:35 heaven and earth shall pass away but my word shall not pass
away

24:36 but of that day and hour knoweth no man no not the angel of
heaven but my father onli

24:37 but as the day of noe were so shall also the come of the son
of man be

24:38 for as in the day that were befor the flood they were eat
and drink marri and give in marriag until the day that noe
enter into the ark 24:39 and knew not until the flood came and
took them all away; so shall also the come of the son of man be

24:40 then shall two be in the field; the one shall be taken and the
other left

24:41 two women shall be grind at the mill; the one shall be taken
and the other left

24:42 watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your lord doth come

24:43 but know thi that if the goodman of the hous had known in
what watch the thief would come he would have watch and would not
have suffer hi hous to be broken up

24:44 therefor be ye also ready: for in such an hour as ye think not
the son of man cometh

24:45 who then is a faith and wise servant whom hi lord hath made
ruler over hi household to give them meat in due season? 24:46
bless is that servant whom hi lord when he cometh shall find so
do

24:47 verili i say unto you that he shall make him ruler over all hi
good

24:48 but and if that evil servant shall say in hi heart my lord
delayeth hi coming; 24:49 and shall begin to smite hi
fellowserv and to eat and drink with the drunken; 24:50 the lord
of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him and
in an hour that he is not awar of 24:51 and shall cut him asund
and appoint him hi portion with the hypocrites: there shall be
weep and gnash of teeth

25:1 then shall the kingdom of heaven be liken unto ten virgin
which took their lamp and went forth to meet the bridegroom

25:2 and five of them were wise and five were foolish

25:3 they that were foolish took their lamp and took no oil with
them: 25:4 but the wise took oil in their vessel with their lamp

25:5 while the bridegroom tarri they all slumber and slept

25:6 and at midnight there wa a cri made behold the bridegroom
cometh; go ye out to meet him

25:7 then all those virgin aros and trim their lamp

25:8 and the foolish said unto the wise give us of your oil; for our
lamp are gone out

25:9 but the wise answer say not so; lest there be not enough
for us and you: but go ye rather to them that sell and buy for
yourselv

25:10 and while they went to buy the bridegroom came; and they that
were readi went in with him to the marriage: and the door wa shut

25:11 afterward came also the other virgin say lord lord open
to us

25:12 but he answer and said verili i say unto you i know you not

25:13 watch therefor for ye know neither the day nor the hour
wherein the son of man cometh

25:14 for the kingdom of heaven is as a man travel into a far
countri who call hi own servant and deliv unto them hi
good

25:15 and unto one he gave five talent to anoth two and to
anoth one; to everi man accord to hi sever ability; and
straightway took hi journey

25:16 then he that had receiv the five talent went and trade with
the same and made them other five talent

25:17 and likewis he that had receiv two he also gain other two

25:18 but he that had receiv one went and dig in the earth and
hid hi lord money

25:19 after a long time the lord of those servant cometh and
reckoneth with them

25:20 and so he that had receiv five talent came and brought other
five talent say lord thou deliveredst unto me five talents:
behold i have gain besid them five talent more

25:21 hi lord said unto him well done thou good and faith
servant: thou hast been faith over a few thing i will make thee
ruler over mani things: enter thou into the joy of thi lord

25:22 he also that had receiv two talent came and said lord thou
deliveredst unto me two talents: behold i have gain two other
talent besid them

25:23 hi lord said unto him well done good and faith servant;
thou hast been faith over a few thing i will make thee ruler over
mani things: enter thou into the joy of thi lord

25:24 then he which had receiv the one talent came and said lord i
knew thee that thou art an hard man reap where thou hast not sown
and gather where thou hast not strawed: 25:25 and i wa afraid and
went and hid thi talent in the earth: lo there thou hast that is
thine

25:26 hi lord answer and said unto him thou wick and sloth
servant thou knewest that i reap where i sow not and gather where
i have not strawed: 25:27 thou oughtest therefor to have put my money
to the exchang and then at my come i should have receiv mine
own with usuri

25:28 take therefor the talent from him and give it unto him which
hath ten talent

25:29 for unto everi one that hath shall be given and he shall have
abundance: but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that
which he hath

25:30 and cast ye the unprofit servant into outer darkness: there
shall be weep and gnash of teeth

25:31 when the son of man shall come in hi glori and all the holi
angel with him then shall he sit upon the throne of hi glory: 25:32
and befor him shall be gather all nations: and he shall separ
them one from anoth as a shepherd divideth hi sheep from the
goats: 25:33 and he shall set the sheep on hi right hand but the
goat on the left

25:34 then shall the king say unto them on hi right hand come ye
bless of my father inherit the kingdom prepar for you from the
foundat of the world: 25:35 for i wa an hungr and ye gave me
meat: i wa thirsti and ye gave me drink: i wa a stranger and ye
took me in: 25:36 nake and ye cloth me: i wa sick and ye visit
me: i wa in prison and ye came unto me

25:37 then shall the righteou answer him say lord when saw we
thee an hungr and fed thee? or thirsti and gave thee drink? 25:38
when saw we thee a stranger and took thee in? or nake and cloth
thee? 25:39 or when saw we thee sick or in prison and came unto
thee? 25:40 and the king shall answer and say unto them verili i say
unto you inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these
my brethren ye have done it unto me

25:41 then shall he say also unto them on the left hand depart from
me ye curs into everlast fire prepar for the devil and hi
angels: 25:42 for i wa an hungr and ye gave me no meat: i wa
thirsti and ye gave me no drink: 25:43 i wa a stranger and ye took
me not in: nake and ye cloth me not: sick and in prison and ye
visit me not

25:44 then shall they also answer him say lord when saw we thee
an hungr or athirst or a stranger or nake or sick or in
prison and did not minist unto thee? 25:45 then shall he answer
them say verili i say unto you inasmuch as ye did it not to one
of the least of these ye did it not to me

25:46 and these shall go away into everlast punishment: but the
righteou into life etern

26:1 and it came to pass when jesu had finish all these say
he said unto hi discipl 26:2 ye know that after two day is the
feast of the passov and the son of man is betray to be crucifi

26:3 then assembl togeth the chief priest and the scribe and
the elder of the peopl unto the palac of the high priest who wa
call caiapha 26:4 and consult that they might take jesu by
subtilti and kill him

26:5 but they said not on the feast day lest there be an uproar
among the peopl

26:6 now when jesu wa in bethani in the hous of simon the leper
26:7 there came unto him a woman have an alabast box of veri
preciou ointment and pour it on hi head as he sat at meat

26:8 but when hi discipl saw it they had indign say to
what purpos is thi waste? 26:9 for thi ointment might have been
sold for much and given to the poor

26:10 when jesu understood it he said unto them whi troubl ye the
woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me

26:11 for ye have the poor alway with you; but me ye have not alway

26:12 for in that she hath pour thi ointment on my bodi she did it
for my burial

26:13 verili i say unto you wheresoev thi gospel shall be preach
in the whole world there shall also thi that thi woman hath done
be told for a memori of her

26:14 then one of the twelv call juda iscariot went unto the
chief priest 26:15 and said unto them what will ye give me and i
will deliv him unto you? and they coven with him for thirti
piec of silver

26:16 and from that time he sought opportun to betray him

26:17 now the first day of the feast of unleaven bread the discipl
came to jesu say unto him where wilt thou that we prepar for
thee to eat the passover? 26:18 and he said go into the citi to such
a man and say unto him the master saith my time is at hand; i will
keep the passov at thi hous with my discipl

26:19 and the discipl did as jesu had appoint them; and they made
readi the passov

26:20 now when the even wa come he sat down with the twelv

26:21 and as they did eat he said verili i say unto you that one of
you shall betray me

26:22 and they were exceed sorrow and began everi one of them
to say unto him lord is it i? 26:23 and he answer and said he
that dippeth hi hand with me in the dish the same shall betray me

26:24 the son of man goeth as it is written of him: but woe unto that
man by whom the son of man is betrayed! it had been good for that man
if he had not been born

26:25 then juda which betray him answer and said master is it
i? he said unto him thou hast said

26:26 and as they were eat jesu took bread and bless it and
brake it and gave it to the discipl and said take eat; thi is
my bodi

26:27 and he took the cup and gave thank and gave it to them
say drink ye all of it; 26:28 for thi is my blood of the new
testament which is shed for mani for the remiss of sin

26:29 but i say unto you i will not drink henceforth of thi fruit of
the vine until that day when i drink it new with you in my father
kingdom

26:30 and when they had sung an hymn they went out into the mount of
oliv

26:31 then saith jesu unto them all ye shall be offend becaus of
me thi night: for it is written i will smite the shepherd and the
sheep of the flock shall be scatter abroad

26:32 but after i am risen again i will go befor you into galile

26:33 peter answer and said unto him though all men shall be
offend becaus of thee yet will i never be offend

26:34 jesu said unto him verili i say unto thee that thi night
befor the cock crow thou shalt deni me thrice

26:35 peter said unto him though i should die with thee yet will i
not deni thee likewis also said all the discipl

26:36 then cometh jesu with them unto a place call gethseman and
saith unto the discipl sit ye here while i go and pray yonder

26:37 and he took with him peter and the two son of zebede and
began to be sorrow and veri heavi

26:38 then saith he unto them my soul is exceed sorrow even
unto death: tarri ye here and watch with me

26:39 and he went a littl farther and fell on hi face and pray
say o my father if it be possibl let thi cup pass from me:
nevertheless not as i will but as thou wilt

26:40 and he cometh unto the discipl and findeth them asleep and
saith unto peter what could ye not watch with me one hour? 26:41
watch and pray that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit inde
is will but the flesh is weak

26:42 he went away again the second time and pray say o my
father if thi cup may not pass away from me except i drink it thi
will be done

26:43 and he came and found them asleep again: for their eye were
heavi

26:44 and he left them and went away again and pray the third
time say the same word

26:45 then cometh he to hi discipl and saith unto them sleep on
now and take your rest: behold the hour is at hand and the son of
man is betray into the hand of sinner

26:46 rise let us be going: behold he is at hand that doth betray
me

26:47 and while he yet spake lo juda one of the twelv came and
with him a great multitud with sword and stave from the chief
priest and elder of the peopl

26:48 now he that betray him gave them a sign say whomsoev i
shall kiss that same is he: hold him fast

26:49 and forthwith he came to jesu and said hail master; and
kiss him

26:50 and jesu said unto him friend wherefor art thou come? then
came they and laid hand on jesu and took him

26:51 and behold one of them which were with jesu stretch out hi
hand and drew hi sword and struck a servant of the high priest
and smote off hi ear

26:52 then said jesu unto him put up again thi sword into hi place:
for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword

26:53 thinkest thou that i cannot now pray to my father and he shall
present give me more than twelv legion of angels? 26:54 but how
then shall the scriptur be fulfil that thu it must be? 26:55
in that same hour said jesu to the multitud are ye come out as
against a thief with sword and stave for to take me? i sat daili
with you teach in the templ and ye laid no hold on me

26:56 but all thi wa done that the scriptur of the prophet might
be fulfil then all the discipl forsook him and fled

26:57 and they that had laid hold on jesu led him away to caiapha
the high priest where the scribe and the elder were assembl

26:58 but peter follow him afar off unto the high priest palac
and went in and sat with the servant to see the end

26:59 now the chief priest and elder and all the council sought
fals wit against jesu to put him to death; 26:60 but found
none: yea though mani fals wit came yet found they none at
the last came two fals wit 26:61 and said thi fellow said i
am abl to destroy the templ of god and to build it in three day

26:62 and the high priest aros and said unto him answerest thou
nothing? what is it which these wit against thee? 26:63 but jesu
held hi peac and the high priest answer and said unto him i
adjur thee by the live god that thou tell us whether thou be the
christ the son of god

26:64 jesu saith unto him thou hast said: nevertheless i say unto
you hereaft shall ye see the son of man sit on the right hand
of power and come in the cloud of heaven

26:65 then the high priest rent hi cloth say he hath spoken
blasphemy; what further need have we of witnesses? behold now ye have
heard hi blasphemi

26:66 what think ye? they answer and said he is guilti of death

26:67 then did they spit in hi face and buffet him; and other
smote him with the palm of their hand 26:68 say prophesi unto
us thou christ who is he that smote thee? 26:69 now peter sat
without in the palace: and a damsel came unto him say thou also
wast with jesu of galile

26:70 but he deni befor them all say i know not what thou
sayest

26:71 and when he wa gone out into the porch anoth maid saw him
and said unto them that were there thi fellow wa also with jesu of
nazareth

26:72 and again he deni with an oath i do not know the man

26:73 and after a while came unto him they that stood by and said to
peter sure thou also art one of them; for thi speech bewrayeth
thee

26:74 then began he to curs and to swear say i know not the man
and immedi the cock crew

26:75 and peter rememb the word of jesu which said unto him
befor the cock crow thou shalt deni me thrice and he went out and
wept bitterli

27:1 when the morn wa come all the chief priest and elder of
the peopl took counsel against jesu to put him to death: 27:2 and
when they had bound him they led him away and deliv him to
pontiu pilat the governor

27:3 then juda which had betray him when he saw that he wa
condemn repent himself and brought again the thirti piec of
silver to the chief priest and elder 27:4 say i have sin in
that i have betray the innoc blood and they said what is that
to us? see thou to that

27:5 and he cast down the piec of silver in the templ and
depart and went and hang himself

27:6 and the chief priest took the silver piec and said it is not
law for to put them into the treasuri becaus it is the price of
blood

27:7 and they took counsel and bought with them the potter field
to buri stranger in

27:8 wherefor that field wa call the field of blood unto thi
day

27:9 then wa fulfil that which wa spoken by jeremi the prophet
say and they took the thirti piec of silver the price of him
that wa valu whom they of the children of israel did value; 27:10
and gave them for the potter field as the lord appoint me

27:11 and jesu stood befor the governor: and the governor ask him
say art thou the king of the jews? and jesu said unto him thou
sayest

27:12 and when he wa accus of the chief priest and elder he
answer noth

27:13 then said pilat unto him hearest thou not how mani thing they
wit against thee? 27:14 and he answer him to never a word;
insomuch that the governor marvel greatli

27:15 now at that feast the governor wa wont to releas unto the
peopl a prison whom they would

27:16 and they had then a notabl prison call barabba

27:17 therefor when they were gather togeth pilat said unto
them whom will ye that i releas unto you? barabba or jesu which
is call christ? 27:18 for he knew that for envi they had deliv
him

27:19 when he wa set down on the judgment seat hi wife sent unto
him say have thou noth to do with that just man: for i have
suffer mani thing thi day in a dream becaus of him

27:20 but the chief priest and elder persuad the multitud that
they should ask barabba and destroy jesu

27:21 the governor answer and said unto them whether of the twain
will ye that i releas unto you? they said barabba

27:22 pilat saith unto them what shall i do then with jesu which is
call christ? they all say unto him let him be crucifi

27:23 and the governor said whi what evil hath he done? but they
cri out the more say let him be crucifi

27:24 when pilat saw that he could prevail noth but that rather a
tumult wa made he took water and wash hi hand befor the
multitud say i am innoc of the blood of thi just person: see
ye to it

27:25 then answer all the peopl and said hi blood be on us and
on our children

27:26 then releas he barabba unto them: and when he had scourg
jesu he deliv him to be crucifi

27:27 then the soldier of the governor took jesu into the common
hall and gather unto him the whole band of soldier

27:28 and they strip him and put on him a scarlet robe

27:29 and when they had plat a crown of thorn they put it upon
hi head and a reed in hi right hand: and they bow the knee befor
him and mock him say hail king of the jews! 27:30 and they
spit upon him and took the reed and smote him on the head

27:31 and after that they had mock him they took the robe off from
him and put hi own raiment on him and led him away to crucifi him

27:32 and as they came out they found a man of cyren simon by name:
him they compel to bear hi cross

27:33 and when they were come unto a place call golgotha that is to
say a place of a skull 27:34 they gave him vinegar to drink mingl
with gall: and when he had tast thereof he would not drink

27:35 and they crucifi him and part hi garment cast lots:
that it might be fulfil which wa spoken by the prophet they
part my garment among them and upon my vestur did they cast lot

27:36 and sit down they watch him there; 27:37 and set up over
hi head hi accus written thi is jesu the king of the jew

27:38 then were there two thiev crucifi with him one on the right
hand and anoth on the left

27:39 and they that pass by revil him wag their head 27:40
and say thou that destroyest the templ and buildest it in three
day save thyself if thou be the son of god come down from the
cross

27:41 likewis also the chief priest mock him with the scribe
and elder said 27:42 he save others; himself he cannot save if he
be the king of israel let him now come down from the cross and we
will believ him

27:43 he trust in god; let him deliv him now if he will have him:
for he said i am the son of god

27:44 the thiev also which were crucifi with him cast the same
in hi teeth

27:45 now from the sixth hour there wa dark over all the land
unto the ninth hour

27:46 and about the ninth hour jesu cri with a loud voic say
eli eli lama sabachthani? that is to say my god my god whi hast
thou forsaken me? 27:47 some of them that stood there when they
heard that said thi man calleth for elia

27:48 and straightway one of them ran and took a spung and fill
it with vinegar and put it on a reed and gave him to drink

27:49 the rest said let be let us see whether elia will come to
save him

27:50 jesu when he had cri again with a loud voic yield up the
ghost

27:51 and behold the veil of the templ wa rent in twain from the
top to the bottom; and the earth did quak and the rock rent; 27:52
and the grave were opened; and mani bodi of the saint which slept
aros 27:53 and came out of the grave after hi resurrect and
went into the holi citi and appear unto mani

27:54 now when the centurion and they that were with him watch
jesu saw the earthquak and those thing that were done they
fear greatli say truli thi wa the son of god

27:55 and mani women were there behold afar off which follow
jesu from galile minist unto him: 27:56 among which wa mari
magdalen and mari the mother of jame and jose and the mother of
zebede children

27:57 when the even wa come there came a rich man of arimathaea
name joseph who also himself wa jesu disciple: 27:58 he went to
pilat and beg the bodi of jesu then pilat command the bodi
to be deliv

27:59 and when joseph had taken the bodi he wrap it in a clean
linen cloth 27:60 and laid it in hi own new tomb which he had hewn
out in the rock: and he roll a great stone to the door of the
sepulchr and depart

27:61 and there wa mari magdalen and the other mari sit over
against the sepulchr

27:62 now the next day that follow the day of the prepar the
chief priest and pharise came togeth unto pilat 27:63 say
sir we rememb that that deceiv said while he wa yet aliv
after three day i will rise again

27:64 command therefor that the sepulchr be made sure until the
third day lest hi discipl come by night and steal him away and
say unto the peopl he is risen from the dead: so the last error
shall be wors than the first

27:65 pilat said unto them ye have a watch: go your way make it as
sure as ye can

27:66 so they went and made the sepulchr sure seal the stone
and set a watch

28:1 in the end of the sabbath as it began to dawn toward the first
day of the week came mari magdalen and the other mari to see the
sepulchr

28:2 and behold there wa a great earthquake: for the angel of the
lord descend from heaven and came and roll back the stone from
the door and sat upon it

28:3 hi counten wa like lightn and hi raiment white as
snow: 28:4 and for fear of him the keeper did shake and becam as
dead men

28:5 and the angel answer and said unto the women fear not ye: for
i know that ye seek jesu which wa crucifi

28:6 he is not here: for he is risen as he said come see the place
where the lord lay

28:7 and go quickli and tell hi discipl that he is risen from the
dead; and behold he goeth befor you into galilee; there shall ye
see him: lo i have told you

28:8 and they depart quickli from the sepulchr with fear and great
joy; and did run to bring hi discipl word

28:9 and as they went to tell hi discipl behold jesu met them
say all hail and they came and held him by the feet and
worship him

28:10 then said jesu unto them be not afraid: go tell my brethren
that they go into galile and there shall they see me

28:11 now when they were go behold some of the watch came into
the citi and shew unto the chief priest all the thing that were
done

28:12 and when they were assembl with the elder and had taken
counsel they gave larg money unto the soldier 28:13 say say
ye hi discipl came by night and stole him away while we slept

28:14 and if thi come to the governor ear we will persuad him
and secur you

28:15 so they took the money and did as they were taught: and thi
say is commonli report among the jew until thi day

28:16 then the eleven discipl went away into galile into a
mountain where jesu had appoint them

28:17 and when they saw him they worship him: but some doubt

28:18 and jesu came and spake unto them say all power is given
unto me in heaven and in earth

28:19 go ye therefor and teach all nation baptiz them in the
name of the father and of the son and of the holi ghost: 28:20
teach them to observ all thing whatsoev i have command you:
and lo i am with you alway even unto the end of the world amen




the gospel accord to saint mark


1:1 the begin of the gospel of jesu christ the son of god; 1:2
as it is written in the prophet behold i send my messeng befor
thi face which shall prepar thi way befor thee

1:3 the voic of one cri in the wilder prepar ye the way of
the lord make hi path straight

1:4 john did baptiz in the wilder and preach the baptism of
repent for the remiss of sin

1:5 and there went out unto him all the land of judaea and they of
jerusalem and were all baptiz of him in the river of jordan
confess their sin

1:6 and john wa cloth with camel hair and with a girdl of a
skin about hi loins; and he did eat locust and wild honey; 1:7 and
preach say there cometh one mightier than i after me the
latchet of whose shoe i am not worthi to stoop down and unloos

1:8 i inde have baptiz you with water: but he shall baptiz you
with the holi ghost

1:9 and it came to pass in those day that jesu came from nazareth
of galile and wa baptiz of john in jordan

1:10 and straightway come up out of the water he saw the heaven
open and the spirit like a dove descend upon him: 1:11 and there
came a voic from heaven say thou art my belov son in whom i
am well pleas

1:12 and immedi the spirit driveth him into the wilder

1:13 and he wa there in the wilder forti day tempt of satan;
and wa with the wild beasts; and the angel minist unto him

1:14 now after that john wa put in prison jesu came into galile
preach the gospel of the kingdom of god 1:15 and say the time
is fulfil and the kingdom of god is at hand: repent ye and
believ the gospel

1:16 now as he walk by the sea of galile he saw simon and andrew
hi brother cast a net into the sea: for they were fisher

1:17 and jesu said unto them come ye after me and i will make you
to becom fisher of men

1:18 and straightway they forsook their net and follow him

1:19 and when he had gone a littl farther thenc he saw jame the
son of zebede and john hi brother who also were in the ship
mend their net

1:20 and straightway he call them: and they left their father
zebede in the ship with the hire servant and went after him

1:21 and they went into capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day
he enter into the synagogu and taught

1:22 and they were astonish at hi doctrine: for he taught them as
one that had author and not as the scribe

1:23 and there wa in their synagogu a man with an unclean spirit;
and he cri out 1:24 say let us alone; what have we to do with
thee thou jesu of nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? i know thee
who thou art the holi one of god

1:25 and jesu rebuk him say hold thi peac and come out of
him

1:26 and when the unclean spirit had torn him and cri with a loud
voic he came out of him

1:27 and they were all amaz insomuch that they question among
themselv say what thing is this? what new doctrin is this? for
with author commandeth he even the unclean spirit and they do
obey him

1:28 and immedi hi fame spread abroad throughout all the region
round about galile

1:29 and forthwith when they were come out of the synagogu they
enter into the hous of simon and andrew with jame and john

1:30 but simon wife mother lay sick of a fever and anon they tell
him of her

1:31 and he came and took her by the hand and lift her up; and
immedi the fever left her and she minist unto them

1:32 and at even when the sun did set they brought unto him all that
were diseas and them that were possess with devil

1:33 and all the citi wa gather togeth at the door

1:34 and he heal mani that were sick of diver diseas and cast
out mani devils; and suffer not the devil to speak becaus they
knew him

1:35 and in the morn rise up a great while befor day he went
out and depart into a solitari place and there pray

1:36 and simon and they that were with him follow after him

1:37 and when they had found him they said unto him all men seek for
thee

1:38 and he said unto them let us go into the next town that i may
preach there also: for therefor came i forth

1:39 and he preach in their synagogu throughout all galile and
cast out devil

1:40 and there came a leper to him beseech him and kneel down
to him and say unto him if thou wilt thou canst make me clean

1:41 and jesu move with compass put forth hi hand and touch
him and saith unto him i will; be thou clean

1:42 and as soon as he had spoken immedi the leprosi depart
from him and he wa cleans

1:43 and he straitli charg him and forthwith sent him away; 1:44
and saith unto him see thou say noth to ani man: but go thi way
shew thyself to the priest and offer for thi cleans those thing
which mose command for a testimoni unto them

1:45 but he went out and began to publish it much and to blaze
abroad the matter insomuch that jesu could no more openli enter into
the citi but wa without in desert places: and they came to him from
everi quarter

2:1 and again he enter into capernaum after some days; and it wa
nois that he wa in the hous

2:2 and straightway mani were gather togeth insomuch that there
wa no room to receiv them no not so much as about the door: and he
preach the word unto them

2:3 and they come unto him bring one sick of the palsi which wa
born of four

2:4 and when they could not come nigh unto him for the press they
uncov the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up they
let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsi lay

2:5 when jesu saw their faith he said unto the sick of the palsi
son thi sin be forgiven thee

2:6 but there wa certain of the scribe sit there and reason
in their heart 2:7 whi doth thi man thu speak blasphemies? who can
forgiv sin but god only? 2:8 and immedi when jesu perceiv
in hi spirit that they so reason within themselv he said unto
them whi reason ye these thing in your hearts? 2:9 whether is it
easier to say to the sick of the palsi thi sin be forgiven thee; or
to say aris and take up thi bed and walk? 2:10 but that ye may
know that the son of man hath power on earth to forgiv sin (he
saith to the sick of the palsy) 2:11 i say unto thee aris and take
up thi bed and go thi way into thine hous

2:12 and immedi he aros took up the bed and went forth befor
them all; insomuch that they were all amaz and glorifi god
say we never saw it on thi fashion

2:13 and he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitud
resort unto him and he taught them

2:14 and as he pass by he saw levi the son of alphaeu sit at
the receipt of custom and said unto him follow me and he aros and
follow him

2:15 and it came to pass that as jesu sat at meat in hi hous
mani publican and sinner sat also togeth with jesu and hi
disciples: for there were mani and they follow him

2:16 and when the scribe and pharise saw him eat with publican and
sinner they said unto hi discipl how is it that he eateth and
drinketh with publican and sinners? 2:17 when jesu heard it he
saith unto them they that are whole have no need of the physician
but they that are sick: i came not to call the righteou but sinner
to repent

2:18 and the discipl of john and of the pharise use to fast: and
they come and say unto him whi do the discipl of john and of the
pharise fast but thi discipl fast not? 2:19 and jesu said unto
them can the children of the bridechamb fast while the bridegroom
is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them they
cannot fast

2:20 but the day will come when the bridegroom shall be taken away
from them and then shall they fast in those day

2:21 no man also seweth a piec of new cloth on an old garment: els
the new piec that fill it up taketh away from the old and the rent
is made wors

2:22 and no man putteth new wine into old bottles: els the new wine
doth burst the bottl and the wine is spill and the bottl will
be marred: but new wine must be put into new bottl

2:23 and it came to pass that he went through the corn field on the
sabbath day; and hi discipl began as they went to pluck the ear
of corn

2:24 and the pharise said unto him behold whi do they on the
sabbath day that which is not lawful? 2:25 and he said unto them
have ye never read what david did when he had need and wa an
hungr he and they that were with him? 2:26 how he went into the
hous of god in the day of abiathar the high priest and did eat the
shewbread which is not law to eat but for the priest and gave
also to them which were with him? 2:27 and he said unto them the
sabbath wa made for man and not man for the sabbath: 2:28 therefor
the son of man is lord also of the sabbath

3:1 and he enter again into the synagogue; and there wa a man there
which had a wither hand

3:2 and they watch him whether he would heal him on the sabbath
day; that they might accus him

3:3 and he saith unto the man which had the wither hand stand
forth

3:4 and he saith unto them is it law to do good on the sabbath
day or to do evil? to save life or to kill? but they held their
peac

3:5 and when he had look round about on them with anger be
griev for the hard of their heart he saith unto the man
stretch forth thine hand and he stretch it out: and hi hand wa
restor whole as the other

3:6 and the pharise went forth and straightway took counsel with
the herodian against him how they might destroy him

3:7 but jesu withdrew himself with hi discipl to the sea: and a
great multitud from galile follow him and from judaea 3:8 and
from jerusalem and from idumaea and from beyond jordan; and they
about tyre and sidon a great multitud when they had heard what
great thing he did came unto him

3:9 and he spake to hi discipl that a small ship should wait on
him becaus of the multitud lest they should throng him

3:10 for he had heal many; insomuch that they press upon him for
to touch him as mani as had plagu

3:11 and unclean spirit when they saw him fell down befor him and
cri say thou art the son of god

3:12 and he straitli charg them that they should not make him known

3:13 and he goeth up into a mountain and calleth unto him whom he
would: and they came unto him

3:14 and he ordain twelv that they should be with him and that he
might send them forth to preach 3:15 and to have power to heal
sick and to cast out devils: 3:16 and simon he surnam peter;
3:17 and jame the son of zebede and john the brother of james; and
he surnam them boanerg which is the son of thunder: 3:18 and
andrew and philip and bartholomew and matthew and thoma and
jame the son of alphaeu and thaddaeu and simon the canaanit
3:19 and juda iscariot which also betray him: and they went into
an hous

3:20 and the multitud cometh togeth again so that they could not
so much as eat bread

3:21 and when hi friend heard of it they went out to lay hold on
him: for they said he is besid himself

3:22 and the scribe which came down from jerusalem said he hath
beelzebub and by the princ of the devil casteth he out devil

3:23 and he call them unto him and said unto them in parabl how
can satan cast out satan? 3:24 and if a kingdom be divid against
itself that kingdom cannot stand

3:25 and if a hous be divid against itself that hous cannot
stand

3:26 and if satan rise up against himself and be divid he cannot
stand but hath an end

3:27 no man can enter into a strong man hous and spoil hi good
except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil hi
hous

3:28 verili i say unto you all sin shall be forgiven unto the son
of men and blasphemi wherewith soever they shall blaspheme: 3:29
but he that shall blasphem against the holi ghost hath never
forgiv but is in danger of etern damnat

3:30 becaus they said he hath an unclean spirit

3:31 there came then hi brethren and hi mother and stand
without sent unto him call him

3:32 and the multitud sat about him and they said unto him behold
thi mother and thi brethren without seek for thee

3:33 and he answer them say who is my mother or my brethren?
3:34 and he look round about on them which sat about him and said
behold my mother and my brethren! 3:35 for whosoev shall do the
will of god the same is my brother and my sister and mother

4:1 and he began again to teach by the sea side: and there wa
gather unto him a great multitud so that he enter into a ship
and sat in the sea; and the whole multitud wa by the sea on the
land

4:2 and he taught them mani thing by parabl and said unto them in
hi doctrin 4:3 hearken; behold there went out a sower to sow: 4:4
and it came to pass as he sow some fell by the way side and the
fowl of the air came and devour it up

4:5 and some fell on stoni ground where it had not much earth; and
immedi it sprang up becaus it had no depth of earth: 4:6 but
when the sun wa up it wa scorched; and becaus it had no root it
wither away

4:7 and some fell among thorn and the thorn grew up and choke it
and it yield no fruit

4:8 and other fell on good ground and did yield fruit that sprang up
and increased; and brought forth some thirti and some sixti and
some an hundr

4:9 and he said unto them he that hath ear to hear let him hear

4:10 and when he wa alon they that were about him with the twelv
ask of him the parabl

4:11 and he said unto them unto you it is given to know the mysteri
of the kingdom of god: but unto them that are without all these
thing are done in parables: 4:12 that see they may see and not
perceive; and hear they may hear and not understand; lest at ani
time they should be convert and their sin should be forgiven them

4:13 and he said unto them know ye not thi parable? and how then
will ye know all parables? 4:14 the sower soweth the word

4:15 and these are they by the way side where the word is sown; but
when they have heard satan cometh immedi and taketh away the
word that wa sown in their heart

4:16 and these are they likewis which are sown on stoni ground; who
when they have heard the word immedi receiv it with gladness;
4:17 and have no root in themselv and so endur but for a time:
afterward when afflict or persecut ariseth for the word sake
immedi they are offend

4:18 and these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the
word 4:19 and the care of thi world and the deceit of
rich and the lust of other thing enter in choke the word and
it becometh unfruit

4:20 and these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear
the word and receiv it and bring forth fruit some thirtyfold some
sixti and some an hundr

4:21 and he said unto them is a candl brought to be put under a
bushel or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick? 4:22 for
there is noth hid which shall not be manifested; neither wa ani
thing kept secret but that it should come abroad

4:23 if ani man have ear to hear let him hear

4:24 and he said unto them take heed what ye hear: with what measur
ye mete it shall be measur to you: and unto you that hear shall
more be given

4:25 for he that hath to him shall be given: and he that hath not
from him shall be taken even that which he hath

4:26 and he said so is the kingdom of god as if a man should cast
seed into the ground; 4:27 and should sleep and rise night and day
and the seed should spring and grow up he knoweth not how

4:28 for the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade
then the ear after that the full corn in the ear

4:29 but when the fruit is brought forth immedi he putteth in
the sickl becaus the harvest is come

4:30 and he said whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of god? or with
what comparison shall we compar it? 4:31 it is like a grain of
mustard seed which when it is sown in the earth is less than all
the seed that be in the earth: 4:32 but when it is sown it groweth
up and becometh greater than all herb and shooteth out great
branches; so that the fowl of the air may lodg under the shadow of
it

4:33 and with mani such parabl spake he the word unto them as they
were abl to hear it

4:34 but without a parabl spake he not unto them: and when they were
alon he expound all thing to hi discipl

4:35 and the same day when the even wa come he saith unto them let
us pass over unto the other side

4:36 and when they had sent away the multitud they took him even as
he wa in the ship and there were also with him other littl ship

4:37 and there aros a great storm of wind and the wave beat into
the ship so that it wa now full

4:38 and he wa in the hinder part of the ship asleep on a pillow:
and they awak him and say unto him master carest thou not that we
perish? 4:39 and he aros and rebuk the wind and said unto the
sea peac be still and the wind ceas and there wa a great calm

4:40 and he said unto them whi are ye so fearful? how is it that ye
have no faith? 4:41 and they fear exceedingli and said one to
anoth what manner of man is thi that even the wind and the sea
obey him? 5:1 and they came over unto the other side of the sea into
the countri of the gadaren

5:2 and when he wa come out of the ship immedi there met him
out of the tomb a man with an unclean spirit 5:3 who had hi
dwell among the tombs; and no man could bind him no not with
chains: 5:4 becaus that he had been often bound with fetter and
chain and the chain had been pluck asund by him and the
fetter broken in pieces: neither could ani man tame him

5:5 and alway night and day he wa in the mountain and in the
tomb cri and cut himself with stone

5:6 but when he saw jesu afar off he ran and worship him 5:7 and
cri with a loud voic and said what have i to do with thee jesu
thou son of the most high god? i adjur thee by god that thou torment
me not

5:8 for he said unto him come out of the man thou unclean spirit

5:9 and he ask him what is thi name? and he answer say my
name is legion: for we are mani

5:10 and he besought him much that he would not send them away out of
the countri

5:11 now there wa there nigh unto the mountain a great herd of swine
feed

5:12 and all the devil besought him say send us into the swine
that we may enter into them

5:13 and forthwith jesu gave them leav and the unclean spirit went
out and enter into the swine: and the herd ran violent down a
steep place into the sea (they were about two thousand;) and were
choke in the sea

5:14 and they that fed the swine fled and told it in the citi and in
the countri and they went out to see what it wa that wa done

5:15 and they come to jesu and see him that wa possess with the
devil and had the legion sit and cloth and in hi right
mind: and they were afraid

5:16 and they that saw it told them how it befel to him that wa
possess with the devil and also concern the swine

5:17 and they began to pray him to depart out of their coast

5:18 and when he wa come into the ship he that had been possess
with the devil pray him that he might be with him

5:19 howbeit jesu suffer him not but saith unto him go home to
thi friend and tell them how great thing the lord hath done for
thee and hath had compass on thee

5:20 and he depart and began to publish in decapoli how great
thing jesu had done for him: and all men did marvel

5:21 and when jesu wa pass over again by ship unto the other side
much peopl gather unto him: and he wa nigh unto the sea

5:22 and behold there cometh one of the ruler of the synagogu
jairu by name; and when he saw him he fell at hi feet 5:23 and
besought him greatli say my littl daughter lieth at the point of
death: i pray thee come and lay thi hand on her that she may be
healed; and she shall live

5:24 and jesu went with him; and much peopl follow him and
throng him

5:25 and a certain woman which had an issu of blood twelv year
5:26 and had suffer mani thing of mani physician and had spent
all that she had and wa noth better but rather grew wors
5:27 when she had heard of jesu came in the press behind and
touch hi garment

5:28 for she said if i may touch but hi cloth i shall be whole

5:29 and straightway the fountain of her blood wa dri up; and she
felt in her bodi that she wa heal of that plagu

5:30 and jesu immedi know in himself that virtu had gone
out of him turn him about in the press and said who touch my
clothes? 5:31 and hi discipl said unto him thou seest the
multitud throng thee and sayest thou who touch me? 5:32 and
he look round about to see her that had done thi thing

5:33 but the woman fear and trembl know what wa done in
her came and fell down befor him and told him all the truth

5:34 and he said unto her daughter thi faith hath made thee whole;
go in peac and be whole of thi plagu

5:35 while he yet spake there came from the ruler of the synagogu
hous certain which said thi daughter is dead: whi troublest thou the
master ani further? 5:36 as soon as jesu heard the word that wa
spoken he saith unto the ruler of the synagogu be not afraid onli
believ

5:37 and he suffer no man to follow him save peter and jame and
john the brother of jame

5:38 and he cometh to the hous of the ruler of the synagogu and
seeth the tumult and them that wept and wail greatli

5:39 and when he wa come in he saith unto them whi make ye thi
ado and weep? the damsel is not dead but sleepeth

5:40 and they laugh him to scorn but when he had put them all out
he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel and them that were
with him and entereth in where the damsel wa lie

5:41 and he took the damsel by the hand and said unto her talitha
cumi; which is be interpret damsel i say unto thee aris

5:42 and straightway the damsel aros and walked; for she wa of the
age of twelv year and they were astonish with a great
astonish

5:43 and he charg them straitli that no man should know it; and
command that someth should be given her to eat

6:1 and he went out from thenc and came into hi own country; and
hi discipl follow him

6:2 and when the sabbath day wa come he began to teach in the
synagogue: and mani hear him were astonish say from whenc
hath thi man these things? and what wisdom is thi which is given
unto him that even such mighti work are wrought by hi hands? 6:3
is not thi the carpent the son of mari the brother of jame and
jose and of juda and simon? and are not hi sister here with us?
and they were offend at him

6:4 but jesu said unto them a prophet is not without honour but in
hi own countri and among hi own kin and in hi own hous

6:5 and he could there do no mighti work save that he laid hi hand
upon a few sick folk and heal them

6:6 and he marvel becaus of their unbelief and he went round
about the villag teach

6:7 and he call unto him the twelv and began to send them forth by
two and two; and gave them power over unclean spirits; 6:8 and
command them that they should take noth for their journey save a
staff only; no scrip no bread no money in their purse: 6:9 but be
shod with sandals; and not put on two coat

6:10 and he said unto them in what place soever ye enter into an
hous there abid till ye depart from that place

6:11 and whosoev shall not receiv you nor hear you when ye depart
thenc shake off the dust under your feet for a testimoni against
them

verili i say unto you it shall be more toler for sodom and
gomorrha in the day of judgment than for that citi

6:12 and they went out and preach that men should repent

6:13 and they cast out mani devil and anoint with oil mani that
were sick and heal them

6:14 and king herod heard of him; (for hi name wa spread abroad:)
and he said that john the baptist wa risen from the dead and
therefor mighti work do shew forth themselv in him

6:15 other said that it is elia and other said that it is a
prophet or as one of the prophet

6:16 but when herod heard thereof he said it is john whom i
beheaded: he is risen from the dead

6:17 for herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon john and
bound him in prison for herodia sake hi brother philip wife: for
he had marri her

6:18 for john had said unto herod it is not law for thee to have
thi brother wife

6:19 therefor herodia had a quarrel against him and would have
kill him; but she could not: 6:20 for herod fear john know
that he wa a just man and an holi and observ him; and when he
heard him he did mani thing and heard him gladli

6:21 and when a conveni day wa come that herod on hi birthday
made a supper to hi lord high captain and chief estat of
galilee; 6:22 and when the daughter of the said herodia came in and
danc and pleas herod and them that sat with him the king said
unto the damsel ask of me whatsoev thou wilt and i will give it
thee

6:23 and he sware unto her whatsoev thou shalt ask of me i will
give it thee unto the half of my kingdom

6:24 and she went forth and said unto her mother what shall i ask?
and she said the head of john the baptist

6:25 and she came in straightway with hast unto the king and ask
say i will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of
john the baptist

6:26 and the king wa exceed sorry; yet for hi oath sake and
for their sake which sat with him he would not reject her

6:27 and immedi the king sent an execution and command hi
head to be brought: and he went and behead him in the prison 6:28
and brought hi head in a charger and gave it to the damsel: and the
damsel gave it to her mother

6:29 and when hi discipl heard of it they came and took up hi
corps and laid it in a tomb

6:30 and the apostl gather themselv togeth unto jesu and
told him all thing both what they had done and what they had
taught

6:31 and he said unto them come ye yourselv apart into a desert
place and rest a while: for there were mani come and go and
they had no leisur so much as to eat

6:32 and they depart into a desert place by ship privat

6:33 and the peopl saw them depart and mani knew him and ran
afoot thither out of all citi and outwent them and came togeth
unto him

6:34 and jesu when he came out saw much peopl and wa move with
compass toward them becaus they were as sheep not have a
shepherd: and he began to teach them mani thing

6:35 and when the day wa now far spent hi discipl came unto him
and said thi is a desert place and now the time is far passed: 6:36
send them away that they may go into the countri round about and
into the villag and buy themselv bread: for they have noth to
eat

6:37 he answer and said unto them give ye them to eat and they say
unto him shall we go and buy two hundr pennyworth of bread and
give them to eat? 6:38 he saith unto them how mani loav have ye?
go and see and when they knew they say five and two fish

6:39 and he command them to make all sit down by compani upon the
green grass

6:40 and they sat down in rank by hundr and by fifti

6:41 and when he had taken the five loav and the two fish he
look up to heaven and bless and brake the loav and gave them
to hi discipl to set befor them; and the two fish divid he
among them all

6:42 and they did all eat and were fill

6:43 and they took up twelv basket full of the fragment and of the
fish

6:44 and they that did eat of the loav were about five thousand men

6:45 and straightway he constrain hi discipl to get into the
ship and to go to the other side befor unto bethsaida while he sent
away the peopl

6:46 and when he had sent them away he depart into a mountain to
pray

6:47 and when even wa come the ship wa in the midst of the sea and
he alon on the land

6:48 and he saw them toil in rowing; for the wind wa contrari unto
them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them
walk upon the sea and would have pass by them

6:49 but when they saw him walk upon the sea they suppos it had
been a spirit and cri out: 6:50 for they all saw him and were
troubl and immedi he talk with them and saith unto them be
of good cheer: it is i; be not afraid

6:51 and he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and
they were sore amaz in themselv beyond measur and wonder

6:52 for they consid not the miracl of the loaves: for their
heart wa harden

6:53 and when they had pass over they came into the land of
gennesaret and drew to the shore

6:54 and when they were come out of the ship straightway they knew
him 6:55 and ran through that whole region round about and began to
carri about in bed those that were sick where they heard he wa

6:56 and whithersoev he enter into villag or citi or
countri they laid the sick in the street and besought him that they
might touch if it were but the border of hi garment: and as mani as
touch him were made whole

7:1 then came togeth unto him the pharise and certain of the
scribe which came from jerusalem

7:2 and when they saw some of hi discipl eat bread with defil
that is to say with unwashen hand they found fault

7:3 for the pharise and all the jew except they wash their hand
oft eat not hold the tradit of the elder

7:4 and when they come from the market except they wash they eat
not

and mani other thing there be which they have receiv to hold as
the wash of cup and pot brasen vessel and of tabl

7:5 then the pharise and scribe ask him whi walk not thi
discipl accord to the tradit of the elder but eat bread with
unwashen hands? 7:6 he answer and said unto them well hath esaia
prophesi of you hypocrit as it is written thi peopl honoureth
me with their lip but their heart is far from me

7:7 howbeit in vain do they worship me teach for doctrin the
command of men

7:8 for lay asid the command of god ye hold the tradit of
men as the wash of pot and cups: and mani other such like thing
ye do

7:9 and he said unto them full well ye reject the command of god
that ye may keep your own tradit

7:10 for mose said honour thi father and thi mother; and whoso
curseth father or mother let him die the death: 7:11 but ye say if a
man shall say to hi father or mother it is corban that is to say a
gift by whatsoev thou mightest be profit by me; he shall be free

7:12 and ye suffer him no more to do ought for hi father or hi
mother; 7:13 make the word of god of none effect through your
tradit which ye have delivered: and mani such like thing do ye

7:14 and when he had call all the peopl unto him he said unto
them hearken unto me everi one of you and understand: 7:15 there is
noth from without a man that enter into him can defil him: but
the thing which come out of him those are they that defil the man

7:16 if ani man have ear to hear let him hear

7:17 and when he wa enter into the hous from the peopl hi
discipl ask him concern the parabl

7:18 and he saith unto them are ye so without understand also? do
ye not perceiv that whatsoev thing from without entereth into the
man it cannot defil him; 7:19 becaus it entereth not into hi
heart but into the belli and goeth out into the draught purg all
meats? 7:20 and he said that which cometh out of the man that
defileth the man

7:21 for from within out of the heart of men proceed evil thought
adulteri fornic murder 7:22 theft covet
wicked deceit lascivi an evil eye blasphemi pride
foolishness: 7:23 all these evil thing come from within and defil
the man

7:24 and from thenc he aros and went into the border of tyre and
sidon and enter into an hous and would have no man know it: but
he could not be hid

7:25 for a certain woman whose young daughter had an unclean spirit
heard of him and came and fell at hi feet: 7:26 the woman wa a
greek a syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would
cast forth the devil out of her daughter

7:27 but jesu said unto her let the children first be filled: for it
is not meet to take the children bread and to cast it unto the
dog

7:28 and she answer and said unto him ye lord: yet the dog under
the tabl eat of the children crumb

7:29 and he said unto her for thi say go thi way; the devil is
gone out of thi daughter

7:30 and when she wa come to her hous she found the devil gone out
and her daughter laid upon the bed

7:31 and again depart from the coast of tyre and sidon he came
unto the sea of galile through the midst of the coast of decapoli

7:32 and they bring unto him one that wa deaf and had an impedi
in hi speech; and they beseech him to put hi hand upon him

7:33 and he took him asid from the multitud and put hi finger
into hi ear and he spit and touch hi tongue; 7:34 and look
up to heaven he sigh and saith unto him ephphatha that is be
open

7:35 and straightway hi ear were open and the string of hi
tongu wa loos and he spake plain

7:36 and he charg them that they should tell no man: but the more he
charg them so much the more a great deal they publish it; 7:37
and were beyond measur astonish say he hath done all thing
well: he maketh both the deaf to hear and the dumb to speak

8:1 in those day the multitud be veri great and have noth
to eat jesu call hi discipl unto him and saith unto them 8:2
i have compass on the multitud becaus they have now been with me
three day and have noth to eat: 8:3 and if i send them away
fast to their own hous they will faint by the way: for diver of
them came from far

8:4 and hi discipl answer him from whenc can a man satisfi
these men with bread here in the wilderness? 8:5 and he ask them
how mani loav have ye? and they said seven

8:6 and he command the peopl to sit down on the ground: and he took
the seven loav and gave thank and brake and gave to hi
discipl to set befor them; and they did set them befor the peopl

8:7 and they had a few small fishes: and he bless and command to
set them also befor them

8:8 so they did eat and were filled: and they took up of the broken
meat that wa left seven basket

8:9 and they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them
away

8:10 and straightway he enter into a ship with hi discipl and
came into the part of dalmanutha

8:11 and the pharise came forth and began to question with him
seek of him a sign from heaven tempt him

8:12 and he sigh deepli in hi spirit and saith whi doth thi
gener seek after a sign? verili i say unto you there shall no
sign be given unto thi gener

8:13 and he left them and enter into the ship again depart to
the other side

8:14 now the discipl had forgotten to take bread neither had they
in the ship with them more than one loaf

8:15 and he charg them say take heed bewar of the leaven of
the pharise and of the leaven of herod

8:16 and they reason among themselv say it is becaus we have
no bread

8:17 and when jesu knew it he saith unto them whi reason ye
becaus ye have no bread? perceiv ye not yet neither understand?
have ye your heart yet hardened? 8:18 have eye see ye not? and
have ear hear ye not? and do ye not remember? 8:19 when i brake
the five loav among five thousand how mani basket full of
fragment took ye up? they say unto him twelv

8:20 and when the seven among four thousand how mani basket full of
fragment took ye up? and they said seven

8:21 and he said unto them how is it that ye do not understand? 8:22
and he cometh to bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him and
besought him to touch him

8:23 and he took the blind man by the hand and led him out of the
town; and when he had spit on hi eye and put hi hand upon him he
ask him if he saw ought

8:24 and he look up and said i see men as tree walk

8:25 after that he put hi hand again upon hi eye and made him
look up: and he wa restor and saw everi man clearli

8:26 and he sent him away to hi hous say neither go into the
