town nor tell it to ani in the town

8:27 and jesu went out and hi discipl into the town of caesarea
philippi: and by the way he ask hi discipl say unto them
whom do men say that i am? 8:28 and they answer john the baptist;
but some say elias; and other one of the prophet

8:29 and he saith unto them but whom say ye that i am? and peter
answereth and saith unto him thou art the christ

8:30 and he charg them that they should tell no man of him

8:31 and he began to teach them that the son of man must suffer mani
thing and be reject of the elder and of the chief priest and
scribe and be kill and after three day rise again

8:32 and he spake that say openli and peter took him and began to
rebuk him

8:33 but when he had turn about and look on hi discipl he
rebuk peter say get thee behind me satan: for thou savourest
not the thing that be of god but the thing that be of men

8:34 and when he had call the peopl unto him with hi discipl
also he said unto them whosoev will come after me let him deni
himself and take up hi cross and follow me

8:35 for whosoev will save hi life shall lose it; but whosoev
shall lose hi life for my sake and the gospel the same shall save
it

8:36 for what shall it profit a man if he shall gain the whole world
and lose hi own soul? 8:37 or what shall a man give in exchang for
hi soul? 8:38 whosoev therefor shall be asham of me and of my
word in thi adulter and sin generation; of him also shall the
son of man be asham when he cometh in the glori of hi father with
the holi angel

9:1 and he said unto them verili i say unto you that there be some
of them that stand here which shall not tast of death till they
have seen the kingdom of god come with power

9:2 and after six day jesu taketh with him peter and jame and
john and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves:
and he wa transfigur befor them

9:3 and hi raiment becam shine exceed white as snow; so as no
fuller on earth can white them

9:4 and there appear unto them elia with moses: and they were
talk with jesu

9:5 and peter answer and said to jesu master it is good for us to
be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee and one for
mose and one for elia

9:6 for he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid

9:7 and there wa a cloud that overshadow them: and a voic came out
of the cloud say thi is my belov son: hear him

9:8 and suddenli when they had look round about they saw no man
ani more save jesu onli with themselv

9:9 and as they came down from the mountain he charg them that they
should tell no man what thing they had seen till the son of man were
risen from the dead

9:10 and they kept that say with themselv question one with
anoth what the rise from the dead should mean

9:11 and they ask him say whi say the scribe that elia must
first come? 9:12 and he answer and told them elia verili cometh
first and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the son of
man that he must suffer mani thing and be set at nought

9:13 but i say unto you that elia is inde come and they have done
unto him whatsoev they list as it is written of him

9:14 and when he came to hi discipl he saw a great multitud about
them and the scribe question with them

9:15 and straightway all the peopl when they beheld him were
greatli amaz and run to him salut him

9:16 and he ask the scribe what question ye with them? 9:17 and
one of the multitud answer and said master i have brought unto
thee my son which hath a dumb spirit; 9:18 and wheresoev he taketh
him he teareth him: and he foameth and gnasheth with hi teeth and
pineth away: and i spake to thi discipl that they should cast him
out; and they could not

9:19 he answereth him and saith o faithless gener how long
shall i be with you? how long shall i suffer you? bring him unto me

9:20 and they brought him unto him: and when he saw him straightway
the spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground and wallow foam

9:21 and he ask hi father how long is it ago sinc thi came unto
him? and he said of a child

9:22 and ofttim it hath cast him into the fire and into the water
to destroy him: but if thou canst do ani thing have compass on us
and help us

9:23 jesu said unto him if thou canst believ all thing are
possibl to him that believeth

9:24 and straightway the father of the child cri out and said with
tear lord i believe; help thou mine unbelief

9:25 when jesu saw that the peopl came run togeth he rebuk
the foul spirit say unto him thou dumb and deaf spirit i charg
thee come out of him and enter no more into him

9:26 and the spirit cri and rent him sore and came out of him: and
he wa as one dead; insomuch that mani said he is dead

9:27 but jesu took him by the hand and lift him up; and he aros

9:28 and when he wa come into the hous hi discipl ask him
privat whi could not we cast him out? 9:29 and he said unto them
thi kind can come forth by noth but by prayer and fast

9:30 and they depart thenc and pass through galilee; and he
would not that ani man should know it

9:31 for he taught hi discipl and said unto them the son of man
is deliv into the hand of men and they shall kill him; and after
that he is kill he shall rise the third day

9:32 but they understood not that say and were afraid to ask him

9:33 and he came to capernaum: and be in the hous he ask them
what wa it that ye disput among yourselv by the way? 9:34 but
they held their peace: for by the way they had disput among
themselv who should be the greatest

9:35 and he sat down and call the twelv and saith unto them if
ani man desir to be first the same shall be last of all and servant
of all

9:36 and he took a child and set him in the midst of them: and when
he had taken him in hi arm he said unto them 9:37 whosoev shall
receiv one of such children in my name receiveth me: and whosoev
shall receiv me receiveth not me but him that sent me

9:38 and john answer him say master we saw one cast out
devil in thi name and he followeth not us: and we forbad him
becaus he followeth not us

9:39 but jesu said forbid him not: for there is no man which shall
do a miracl in my name that can lightli speak evil of me

9:40 for he that is not against us is on our part

9:41 for whosoev shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name
becaus ye belong to christ verili i say unto you he shall not lose
hi reward

9:42 and whosoev shall offend one of these littl one that believ
in me it is better for him that a millston were hang about hi
neck and he were cast into the sea

9:43 and if thi hand offend thee cut it off: it is better for thee to
enter into life maim than have two hand to go into hell into
the fire that never shall be quenched: 9:44 where their worm dieth
not and the fire is not quench

9:45 and if thi foot offend thee cut it off: it is better for thee to
enter halt into life than have two feet to be cast into hell into
the fire that never shall be quenched: 9:46 where their worm dieth
not and the fire is not quench

9:47 and if thine eye offend thee pluck it out: it is better for thee
to enter into the kingdom of god with one eye than have two eye to
be cast into hell fire: 9:48 where their worm dieth not and the fire
is not quench

9:49 for everi one shall be salt with fire and everi sacrific
shall be salt with salt

9:50 salt is good: but if the salt have lost hi salt wherewith
will ye season it? have salt in yourselv and have peac one with
anoth

10:1 and he aros from thenc and cometh into the coast of judaea by
the farther side of jordan: and the peopl resort unto him again; and
as he wa wont he taught them again

10:2 and the pharise came to him and ask him is it law for a
man to put away hi wife? tempt him

10:3 and he answer and said unto them what did mose command you?
10:4 and they said mose suffer to write a bill of divorc and
to put her away

10:5 and jesu answer and said unto them for the hard of your
heart he wrote you thi precept

10:6 but from the begin of the creation god made them male and
femal

10:7 for thi caus shall a man leav hi father and mother and
cleav to hi wife; 10:8 and they twain shall be one flesh: so then
they are no more twain but one flesh

10:9 what therefor god hath join togeth let not man put asund

10:10 and in the hous hi discipl ask him again of the same
matter

10:11 and he saith unto them whosoev shall put away hi wife and
marri anoth committeth adulteri against her

10:12 and if a woman shall put away her husband and be marri to
anoth she committeth adulteri

10:13 and they brought young children to him that he should touch
them: and hi discipl rebuk those that brought them

10:14 but when jesu saw it he wa much displeas and said unto
them suffer the littl children to come unto me and forbid them not:
for of such is the kingdom of god

10:15 verili i say unto you whosoev shall not receiv the kingdom
of god as a littl child he shall not enter therein

10:16 and he took them up in hi arm put hi hand upon them and
bless them

10:17 and when he wa gone forth into the way there came one run
and kneel to him and ask him good master what shall i do that i
may inherit etern life? 10:18 and jesu said unto him whi callest
thou me good? there is none good but one that is god

10:19 thou knowest the command do not commit adulteri do not
kill do not steal do not bear fals wit defraud not honour thi
father and mother 10:20 and he answer and said unto him master
all these have i observ from my youth

10:21 then jesu behold him love him and said unto him one thing
thou lackest: go thi way sell whatsoev thou hast and give to the
poor and thou shalt have treasur in heaven: and come take up the
cross and follow me

10:22 and he wa sad at that say and went away grieved: for he had
great possess

10:23 and jesu look round about and saith unto hi discipl how
hardli shall they that have rich enter into the kingdom of god!
10:24 and the discipl were astonish at hi word but jesu
answereth again and saith unto them children how hard is it for
them that trust in rich to enter into the kingdom of god! 10:25 it
is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needl than for a
rich man to enter into the kingdom of god

10:26 and they were astonish out of measur say among
themselv who then can be saved? 10:27 and jesu look upon them
saith with men it is imposs but not with god: for with god all
thing are possibl

10:28 then peter began to say unto him lo we have left all and have
follow thee

10:29 and jesu answer and said verili i say unto you there is no
man that hath left hous or brethren or sister or father or
mother or wife or children or land for my sake and the gospel
10:30 but he shall receiv an hundredfold now in thi time hous
and brethren and sister and mother and children and land with
persecutions; and in the world to come etern life

10:31 but mani that are first shall be last; and the last first

10:32 and they were in the way go up to jerusalem; and jesu went
befor them: and they were amazed; and as they follow they were
afraid

and he took again the twelv and began to tell them what thing
should happen unto him 10:33 say behold we go up to jerusalem;
and the son of man shall be deliv unto the chief priest and unto
the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death and shall deliv
him to the gentiles: 10:34 and they shall mock him and shall scourg
him and shall spit upon him and shall kill him: and the third day he
shall rise again

10:35 and jame and john the son of zebede come unto him say
master we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoev we shall
desir

10:36 and he said unto them what would ye that i should do for you?
10:37 they said unto him grant unto us that we may sit one on thi
right hand and the other on thi left hand in thi glori

10:38 but jesu said unto them ye know not what ye ask: can ye drink
of the cup that i drink of? and be baptiz with the baptism that i am
baptiz with? 10:39 and they said unto him we can and jesu said
unto them ye shall inde drink of the cup that i drink of; and with
the baptism that i am baptiz withal shall ye be baptized: 10:40 but
to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but
it shall be given to them for whom it is prepar

10:41 and when the ten heard it they began to be much displeas with
jame and john

10:42 but jesu call them to him and saith unto them ye know that
they which are account to rule over the gentil exercis lordship
over them; and their great one exercis author upon them

10:43 but so shall it not be among you: but whosoev will be great
among you shall be your minister: 10:44 and whosoev of you will be
the chiefest shall be servant of all

10:45 for even the son of man came not to be minist unto but to
minist and to give hi life a ransom for mani

10:46 and they came to jericho: and as he went out of jericho with hi
discipl and a great number of peopl blind bartimaeu the son of
timaeu sat by the highway side beg

10:47 and when he heard that it wa jesu of nazareth he began to cri
out and say jesu thou son of david have merci on me

10:48 and mani charg him that he should hold hi peace: but he cri
the more a great deal thou son of david have merci on me

10:49 and jesu stood still and command him to be call and they
call the blind man say unto him be of good comfort rise; he
calleth thee

10:50 and he cast away hi garment rose and came to jesu

10:51 and jesu answer and said unto him what wilt thou that i
should do unto thee? the blind man said unto him lord that i might
receiv my sight

10:52 and jesu said unto him go thi way; thi faith hath made thee
whole

and immedi he receiv hi sight and follow jesu in the way

11:1 and when they came nigh to jerusalem unto bethphag and bethani
at the mount of oliv he sendeth forth two of hi discipl 11:2
and saith unto them go your way into the villag over against you:
and as soon as ye be enter into it ye shall find a colt tie
whereon never man sat; loos him and bring him

11:3 and if ani man say unto you whi do ye this? say ye that the lord
hath need of him; and straightway he will send him hither

11:4 and they went their way and found the colt tie by the door
without in a place where two way met; and they loos him

11:5 and certain of them that stood there said unto them what do ye
loos the colt? 11:6 and they said unto them even as jesu had
commanded: and they let them go

11:7 and they brought the colt to jesu and cast their garment on
him; and he sat upon him

11:8 and mani spread their garment in the way: and other cut down
branch off the tree and straw them in the way

11:9 and they that went befor and they that follow cri say
hosanna; bless is he that cometh in the name of the lord: 11:10
bless be the kingdom of our father david that cometh in the name of
the lord: hosanna in the highest

11:11 and jesu enter into jerusalem and into the temple: and when
he had look round about upon all thing and now the eventid wa
come he went out unto bethani with the twelv

11:12 and on the morrow when they were come from bethani he wa
hungry: 11:13 and see a fig tree afar off have leav he came
if hapli he might find ani thing thereon: and when he came to it he
found noth but leaves; for the time of fig wa not yet

11:14 and jesu answer and said unto it no man eat fruit of thee
hereaft for ever and hi discipl heard it

11:15 and they come to jerusalem: and jesu went into the templ and
began to cast out them that sold and bought in the templ and
overthrew the tabl of the moneychang and the seat of them that
sold doves; 11:16 and would not suffer that ani man should carri ani
vessel through the templ

11:17 and he taught say unto them is it not written my hous
shall be call of all nation the hous of prayer? but ye have made
it a den of thiev

11:18 and the scribe and chief priest heard it and sought how they
might destroy him: for they fear him becaus all the peopl wa
astonish at hi doctrin

11:19 and when even wa come he went out of the citi

11:20 and in the morn as they pass by they saw the fig tree
dri up from the root

11:21 and peter call to remembr saith unto him master behold
the fig tree which thou cursedst is wither away

11:22 and jesu answer saith unto them have faith in god

11:23 for verili i say unto you that whosoev shall say unto thi
mountain be thou remov and be thou cast into the sea; and shall
not doubt in hi heart but shall believ that those thing which he
saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoev he saith

11:24 therefor i say unto you what thing soever ye desir when ye
pray believ that ye receiv them and ye shall have them

11:25 and when ye stand pray forgiv if ye have ought against
any: that your father also which is in heaven may forgiv you your
trespass

11:26 but if ye do not forgiv neither will your father which is in
heaven forgiv your trespass

11:27 and they come again to jerusalem: and as he wa walk in the
templ there come to him the chief priest and the scribe and the
elder 11:28 and say unto him by what author doest thou these
things? and who gave thee thi author to do these things? 11:29
and jesu answer and said unto them i will also ask of you one
question and answer me and i will tell you by what author i do
these thing

11:30 the baptism of john wa it from heaven or of men? answer me

11:31 and they reason with themselv say if we shall say from
heaven; he will say whi then did ye not believ him? 11:32 but if we
shall say of men; they fear the people: for all men count john
that he wa a prophet inde

11:33 and they answer and said unto jesu we cannot tell and jesu
answer saith unto them neither do i tell you by what author i
do these thing

12:1 and he began to speak unto them by parabl a certain man
plant a vineyard and set an hedg about it and dig a place for
the winefat and built a tower and let it out to husbandmen and went
into a far countri

12:2 and at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant that he
might receiv from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard

12:3 and they caught him and beat him and sent him away empti

12:4 and again he sent unto them anoth servant; and at him they cast
stone and wound him in the head and sent him away shame
handl

12:5 and again he sent another; and him they kill and mani others;
beat some and kill some

12:6 have yet therefor one son hi wellbelov he sent him also
last unto them say they will rever my son

12:7 but those husbandmen said among themselv thi is the heir;
come let us kill him and the inherit shall be our

12:8 and they took him and kill him and cast him out of the
vineyard

12:9 what shall therefor the lord of the vineyard do? he will come
and destroy the husbandmen and will give the vineyard unto other

12:10 and have ye not read thi scripture; the stone which the
builder reject is becom the head of the corner: 12:11 thi wa the
lord do and it is marvel in our eyes? 12:12 and they sought
to lay hold on him but fear the people: for they knew that he had
spoken the parabl against them: and they left him and went their
way

12:13 and they send unto him certain of the pharise and of the
herodian to catch him in hi word

12:14 and when they were come they say unto him master we know that
thou art true and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the
person of men but teachest the way of god in truth: is it law to
give tribut to caesar or not? 12:15 shall we give or shall we not
give? but he know their hypocrisi said unto them whi tempt ye
me? bring me a penni that i may see it

12:16 and they brought it and he saith unto them whose is thi imag
and superscription? and they said unto him caesar

12:17 and jesu answer said unto them render to caesar the thing
that are caesar and to god the thing that are god and they
marvel at him

12:18 then come unto him the sadduce which say there is no
resurrection; and they ask him say 12:19 master mose wrote
unto us if a man brother die and leav hi wife behind him and
leav no children that hi brother should take hi wife and rais up
seed unto hi brother

12:20 now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife and
die left no seed

12:21 and the second took her and die neither left he ani seed: and
the third likewis

12:22 and the seven had her and left no seed: last of all the woman
die also

12:23 in the resurrect therefor when they shall rise whose wife
shall she be of them? for the seven had her to wife

12:24 and jesu answer said unto them do ye not therefor err
becaus ye know not the scriptur neither the power of god? 12:25
for when they shall rise from the dead they neither marri nor are
given in marriage; but are as the angel which are in heaven

12:26 and as touch the dead that they rise: have ye not read in
the book of mose how in the bush god spake unto him say i am
the god of abraham and the god of isaac and the god of jacob? 12:27
he is not the god of the dead but the god of the living: ye therefor
do greatli err

12:28 and one of the scribe came and have heard them reason
togeth and perceiv that he had answer them well ask him
which is the first command of all? 12:29 and jesu answer him
the first of all the command is hear o israel; the lord our god
is one lord: 12:30 and thou shalt love the lord thi god with all thi
heart and with all thi soul and with all thi mind and with all thi
strength: thi is the first command

12:31 and the second is like name thi thou shalt love thi
neighbour as thyself there is none other command greater than
these

12:32 and the scribe said unto him well master thou hast said the
truth: for there is one god; and there is none other but he: 12:33 and
to love him with all the heart and with all the understand and
with all the soul and with all the strength and to love hi
neighbour as himself is more than all whole burnt offer and
sacrific

12:34 and when jesu saw that he answer discreetli he said unto
him thou art not far from the kingdom of god and no man after that
durst ask him ani question

12:35 and jesu answer and said while he taught in the templ how
say the scribe that christ is the son of david? 12:36 for david
himself said by the holi ghost the lord said to my lord sit thou on
my right hand till i make thine enemi thi footstool

12:37 david therefor himself calleth him lord; and whenc is he then
hi son? and the common peopl heard him gladli

12:38 and he said unto them in hi doctrin bewar of the scribe
which love to go in long cloth and love salut in the
marketplac 12:39 and the chief seat in the synagogu and the
uppermost room at feasts: 12:40 which devour widow hous and for
a pretenc make long prayers: these shall receiv greater damnat

12:41 and jesu sat over against the treasuri and beheld how the
peopl cast money into the treasury: and mani that were rich cast in
much

12:42 and there came a certain poor widow and she threw in two mite
which make a farth

12:43 and he call unto him hi discipl and saith unto them
verili i say unto you that thi poor widow hath cast more in than
all they which have cast into the treasury: 12:44 for all they did
cast in of their abundance; but she of her want did cast in all that
she had even all her live

13:1 and as he went out of the templ one of hi discipl saith unto
him master see what manner of stone and what build are here!
13:2 and jesu answer said unto him seest thou these great
buildings? there shall not be left one stone upon anoth that shall
not be thrown down

13:3 and as he sat upon the mount of oliv over against the templ
peter and jame and john and andrew ask him privat 13:4 tell us
when shall these thing be? and what shall be the sign when all these
thing shall be fulfilled? 13:5 and jesu answer them began to
say take heed lest ani man deceiv you: 13:6 for mani shall come in
my name say i am christ; and shall deceiv mani

13:7 and when ye shall hear of war and rumour of war be ye not
troubled: for such thing must need be; but the end shall not be yet

13:8 for nation shall rise against nation and kingdom against
kingdom: and there shall be earthquak in diver place and there
shall be famin and troubles: these are the begin of sorrow

13:9 but take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliv you up to
councils; and in the synagogu ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be
brought befor ruler and king for my sake for a testimoni against
them

13:10 and the gospel must first be publish among all nation

13:11 but when they shall lead you and deliv you up take no
thought beforehand what ye shall speak neither do ye premeditate: but
whatsoev shall be given you in that hour that speak ye: for it is
not ye that speak but the holi ghost

13:12 now the brother shall betray the brother to death and the
father the son; and children shall rise up against their parent and
shall caus them to be put to death

13:13 and ye shall be hate of all men for my name sake: but he that
shall endur unto the end the same shall be save

13:14 but when ye shall see the abomin of desol spoken of
by daniel the prophet stand where it ought not (let him that
readeth understand) then let them that be in judaea flee to the
mountains: 13:15 and let him that is on the housetop not go down into
the hous neither enter therein to take ani thing out of hi house:
13:16 and let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take
up hi garment

13:17 but woe to them that are with child and to them that give suck
in those days! 13:18 and pray ye that your flight be not in the
winter

13:19 for in those day shall be afflict such as wa not from the
begin of the creation which god creat unto thi time neither
shall be

13:20 and except that the lord had shorten those day no flesh
should be saved: but for the elect sake whom he hath chosen he
hath shorten the day

13:21 and then if ani man shall say to you lo here is christ; or
lo he is there; believ him not: 13:22 for fals christ and fals
prophet shall rise and shall shew sign and wonder to seduc if
it were possibl even the elect

13:23 but take ye heed: behold i have foretold you all thing

13:24 but in those day after that tribul the sun shall be
darken and the moon shall not give her light 13:25 and the star
of heaven shall fall and the power that are in heaven shall be
shaken

13:26 and then shall they see the son of man come in the cloud with
great power and glori

13:27 and then shall he send hi angel and shall gather togeth hi
elect from the four wind from the uttermost part of the earth to the
uttermost part of heaven

13:28 now learn a parabl of the fig tree; when her branch is yet
tender and putteth forth leav ye know that summer is near: 13:29
so ye in like manner when ye shall see these thing come to pass
know that it is nigh even at the door

13:30 verili i say unto you that thi gener shall not pass till
all these thing be done

13:31 heaven and earth shall pass away: but my word shall not pass
away

13:32 but of that day and that hour knoweth no man no not the angel
which are in heaven neither the son but the father

13:33 take ye heed watch and pray: for ye know not when the time is

13:34 for the son of man is as a man take a far journey who left
hi hous and gave author to hi servant and to everi man hi
work and command the porter to watch

13:35 watch ye therefore: for ye know not when the master of the hous
cometh at even or at midnight or at the cockcrow or in the
morning: 13:36 lest come suddenli he find you sleep

13:37 and what i say unto you i say unto all watch

14:1 after two day wa the feast of the passov and of unleaven
bread: and the chief priest and the scribe sought how they might
take him by craft and put him to death

14:2 but they said not on the feast day lest there be an uproar of
the peopl

14:3 and be in bethani in the hous of simon the leper as he sat
at meat there came a woman have an alabast box of ointment of
spikenard veri precious; and she brake the box and pour it on hi
head

14:4 and there were some that had indign within themselv and
said whi wa thi wast of the ointment made? 14:5 for it might have
been sold for more than three hundr penc and have been given to
the poor and they murmur against her

14:6 and jesu said let her alone; whi troubl ye her? she hath
wrought a good work on me

14:7 for ye have the poor with you alway and whensoev ye will ye
may do them good: but me ye have not alway

14:8 she hath done what she could: she is come aforehand to anoint my
bodi to the buri

14:9 verili i say unto you wheresoev thi gospel shall be preach
throughout the whole world thi also that she hath done shall be
spoken of for a memori of her

14:10 and juda iscariot one of the twelv went unto the chief
priest to betray him unto them

14:11 and when they heard it they were glad and promis to give him
money and he sought how he might conveni betray him

14:12 and the first day of unleaven bread when they kill the
passov hi discipl said unto him where wilt thou that we go and
prepar that thou mayest eat the passover? 14:13 and he sendeth forth
two of hi discipl and saith unto them go ye into the citi and
there shall meet you a man bear a pitcher of water: follow him

14:14 and wheresoev he shall go in say ye to the goodman of the
hous the master saith where is the guestchamb where i shall eat
the passov with my disciples? 14:15 and he will shew you a larg
upper room furnish and prepared: there make readi for us

14:16 and hi discipl went forth and came into the citi and found
as he had said unto them: and they made readi the passov

14:17 and in the even he cometh with the twelv

14:18 and as they sat and did eat jesu said verili i say unto you
one of you which eateth with me shall betray me

14:19 and they began to be sorrow and to say unto him one by one
is it i? and anoth said is it i? 14:20 and he answer and said
unto them it is one of the twelv that dippeth with me in the dish

14:21 the son of man inde goeth as it is written of him: but woe to
that man by whom the son of man is betrayed! good were it for that man
if he had never been born

14:22 and as they did eat jesu took bread and bless and brake
it and gave to them and said take eat: thi is my bodi

14:23 and he took the cup and when he had given thank he gave it to
them: and they all drank of it

14:24 and he said unto them thi is my blood of the new testament
which is shed for mani

14:25 verili i say unto you i will drink no more of the fruit of the
vine until that day that i drink it new in the kingdom of god

14:26 and when they had sung an hymn they went out into the mount of
oliv

14:27 and jesu saith unto them all ye shall be offend becaus of
me thi night: for it is written i will smite the shepherd and the
sheep shall be scatter

14:28 but after that i am risen i will go befor you into galile

14:29 but peter said unto him although all shall be offend yet
will not i

14:30 and jesu saith unto him verili i say unto thee that thi day
even in thi night befor the cock crow twice thou shalt deni me
thrice

14:31 but he spake the more vehement if i should die with thee i
will not deni thee in ani wise likewis also said they all

14:32 and they came to a place which wa name gethsemane: and he
saith to hi discipl sit ye here while i shall pray

14:33 and he taketh with him peter and jame and john and began to be
sore amaz and to be veri heavy; 14:34 and saith unto them my soul
is exceed sorrow unto death: tarri ye here and watch

14:35 and he went forward a littl and fell on the ground and pray
that if it were possibl the hour might pass from him

14:36 and he said abba father all thing are possibl unto thee;
take away thi cup from me: nevertheless not what i will but what
thou wilt

14:37 and he cometh and findeth them sleep and saith unto peter
simon sleepest thou? couldest not thou watch one hour? 14:38 watch
ye and pray lest ye enter into temptat the spirit truli is readi
but the flesh is weak

14:39 and again he went away and pray and spake the same word

14:40 and when he return he found them asleep again (for their
eye were heavy) neither wist they what to answer him

14:41 and he cometh the third time and saith unto them sleep on now
and take your rest: it is enough the hour is come; behold the son of
man is betray into the hand of sinner

14:42 rise up let us go; lo he that betrayeth me is at hand

14:43 and immedi while he yet spake cometh juda one of the
twelv and with him a great multitud with sword and stave from
the chief priest and the scribe and the elder

14:44 and he that betray him had given them a token say
whomsoev i shall kiss that same is he; take him and lead him away
safe

14:45 and as soon as he wa come he goeth straightway to him and
saith master master; and kiss him

14:46 and they laid their hand on him and took him

14:47 and one of them that stood by drew a sword and smote a servant
of the high priest and cut off hi ear

14:48 and jesu answer and said unto them are ye come out as
against a thief with sword and with stave to take me? 14:49 i wa
daili with you in the templ teach and ye took me not: but the
scriptur must be fulfil

14:50 and they all forsook him and fled

14:51 and there follow him a certain young man have a linen cloth
cast about hi nake body; and the young men laid hold on him: 14:52
and he left the linen cloth and fled from them nake

14:53 and they led jesu away to the high priest: and with him were
assembl all the chief priest and the elder and the scribe

14:54 and peter follow him afar off even into the palac of the
high priest: and he sat with the servant and warm himself at the
fire

14:55 and the chief priest and all the council sought for wit
against jesu to put him to death; and found none

14:56 for mani bare fals wit against him but their wit
agre not togeth

14:57 and there aros certain and bare fals wit against him
say 14:58 we heard him say i will destroy thi templ that is
made with hand and within three day i will build anoth made
without hand

14:59 but neither so did their wit agre togeth

14:60 and the high priest stood up in the midst and ask jesu
say answerest thou nothing? what is it which these wit against
thee? 14:61 but he held hi peac and answer noth again the
high priest ask him and said unto him art thou the christ the son
of the blessed? 14:62 and jesu said i am: and ye shall see the son
of man sit on the right hand of power and come in the cloud of
heaven

14:63 then the high priest rent hi cloth and saith what need we
ani further witnesses? 14:64 ye have heard the blasphemy: what think
ye? and they all condemn him to be guilti of death

14:65 and some began to spit on him and to cover hi face and to
buffet him and to say unto him prophesy: and the servant did strike
him with the palm of their hand

14:66 and as peter wa beneath in the palac there cometh one of the
maid of the high priest: 14:67 and when she saw peter warm
himself she look upon him and said and thou also wast with jesu
of nazareth

14:68 but he deni say i know not neither understand i what
thou sayest and he went out into the porch; and the cock crew

14:69 and a maid saw him again and began to say to them that stood
by thi is one of them

14:70 and he deni it again and a littl after they that stood by
said again to peter sure thou art one of them: for thou art a
galilaean and thi speech agreeth thereto

14:71 but he began to curs and to swear say i know not thi man
of whom ye speak

14:72 and the second time the cock crew and peter call to mind the
word that jesu said unto him befor the cock crow twice thou shalt
deni me thrice and when he thought thereon he wept

15:1 and straightway in the morn the chief priest held a
consult with the elder and scribe and the whole council and
bound jesu and carri him away and deliv him to pilat

15:2 and pilat ask him art thou the king of the jews? and he
answer said unto them thou sayest it

15:3 and the chief priest accus him of mani things: but he answer
noth

15:4 and pilat ask him again say answerest thou nothing?
behold how mani thing they wit against thee

15:5 but jesu yet answer nothing; so that pilat marvel

15:6 now at that feast he releas unto them one prison whomsoev
they desir

15:7 and there wa one name barabba which lay bound with them that
had made insurrect with him who had commit murder in the
insurrect

15:8 and the multitud cri aloud began to desir him to do as he
had ever done unto them

15:9 but pilat answer them say will ye that i releas unto you
the king of the jews? 15:10 for he knew that the chief priest had
deliv him for envi

15:11 but the chief priest move the peopl that he should rather
releas barabba unto them

15:12 and pilat answer and said again unto them what will ye then
that i shall do unto him whom ye call the king of the jews? 15:13 and
they cri out again crucifi him

15:14 then pilat said unto them whi what evil hath he done? and
they cri out the more exceedingli crucifi him

15:15 and so pilat will to content the peopl releas barabba
unto them and deliv jesu when he had scourg him to be
crucifi

15:16 and the soldier led him away into the hall call praetorium;
and they call togeth the whole band

15:17 and they cloth him with purpl and plat a crown of thorn
and put it about hi head 15:18 and began to salut him hail king
of the jews! 15:19 and they smote him on the head with a reed and
did spit upon him and bow their knee worship him

15:20 and when they had mock him they took off the purpl from him
and put hi own cloth on him and led him out to crucifi him

15:21 and they compel one simon a cyrenian who pass by come out
of the countri the father of alexand and rufu to bear hi cross

15:22 and they bring him unto the place golgotha which is be
interpret the place of a skull

15:23 and they gave him to drink wine mingl with myrrh: but he
receiv it not

15:24 and when they had crucifi him they part hi garment
cast lot upon them what everi man should take

15:25 and it wa the third hour and they crucifi him

15:26 and the superscript of hi accus wa written over the
king of the jew

15:27 and with him they crucifi two thieves; the one on hi right
hand and the other on hi left

15:28 and the scriptur wa fulfil which saith and he wa
number with the transgressor

15:29 and they that pass by rail on him wag their head and
say ah thou that destroyest the templ and buildest it in three
day 15:30 save thyself and come down from the cross

15:31 likewis also the chief priest mock said among themselv
with the scribe he save others; himself he cannot save

15:32 let christ the king of israel descend now from the cross that
we may see and believ and they that were crucifi with him revil
him

15:33 and when the sixth hour wa come there wa dark over the
whole land until the ninth hour

15:34 and at the ninth hour jesu cri with a loud voic say
eloi eloi lama sabachthani? which is be interpret my god my
god whi hast thou forsaken me? 15:35 and some of them that stood by
when they heard it said behold he calleth elia

15:36 and one ran and fill a spung full of vinegar and put it on a
reed and gave him to drink say let alone; let us see whether
elia will come to take him down

15:37 and jesu cri with a loud voic and gave up the ghost

15:38 and the veil of the templ wa rent in twain from the top to the
bottom

15:39 and when the centurion which stood over against him saw that
he so cri out and gave up the ghost he said truli thi man wa
the son of god

15:40 there were also women look on afar off: among whom wa mari
magdalen and mari the mother of jame the less and of jose and
salome; 15:41 (who also when he wa in galile follow him and
minist unto him;) and mani other women which came up with him unto
jerusalem

15:42 and now when the even wa come becaus it wa the prepar
that is the day befor the sabbath 15:43 joseph of arimathaea an
honour counsellor which also wait for the kingdom of god came
and went in boldli unto pilat and crave the bodi of jesu

15:44 and pilat marvel if he were alreadi dead: and call unto
him the centurion he ask him whether he had been ani while dead

15:45 and when he knew it of the centurion he gave the bodi to
joseph

15:46 and he bought fine linen and took him down and wrap him in
the linen and laid him in a sepulchr which wa hewn out of a rock
and roll a stone unto the door of the sepulchr

15:47 and mari magdalen and mari the mother of jose beheld where he
wa laid

16:1 and when the sabbath wa past mari magdalen and mari the
mother of jame and salom had bought sweet spice that they might
come and anoint him

16:2 and veri earli in the morn the first day of the week they
came unto the sepulchr at the rise of the sun

16:3 and they said among themselv who shall roll us away the stone
from the door of the sepulchre? 16:4 and when they look they saw
that the stone wa roll away: for it wa veri great

16:5 and enter into the sepulchr they saw a young man sit on
the right side cloth in a long white garment; and they were
affright

16:6 and he saith unto them be not affrighted: ye seek jesu of
nazareth which wa crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold the
place where they laid him

16:7 but go your way tell hi discipl and peter that he goeth
befor you into galilee: there shall ye see him as he said unto you

16:8 and they went out quickli and fled from the sepulchre; for they
trembl and were amazed: neither said they ani thing to ani man; for
they were afraid

16:9 now when jesu wa risen earli the first day of the week he
appear first to mari magdalen out of whom he had cast seven
devil

16:10 and she went and told them that had been with him as they
mourn and wept

16:11 and they when they had heard that he wa aliv and had been
seen of her believ not

16:12 after that he appear in anoth form unto two of them as they
walk and went into the countri

16:13 and they went and told it unto the residue: neither believ
they them

16:14 afterward he appear unto the eleven as they sat at meat and
upbraid them with their unbelief and hard of heart becaus they
believ not them which had seen him after he wa risen

16:15 and he said unto them go ye into all the world and preach the
gospel to everi creatur

16:16 he that believeth and is baptiz shall be saved; but he that
believeth not shall be damn

16:17 and these sign shall follow them that believe; in my name shall
they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues; 16:18 they
shall take up serpents; and if they drink ani deadli thing it shall
not hurt them; they shall lay hand on the sick and they shall
recov

16:19 so then after the lord had spoken unto them he wa receiv up
into heaven and sat on the right hand of god

16:20 and they went forth and preach everi where the lord work
with them and confirm the word with sign follow amen



the gospel accord to saint luke


1:1 forasmuch as mani have taken in hand to set forth in order a
declar of those thing which are most sure believ among us
1:2 even as they deliv them unto us which from the begin were
eyewit and minist of the word; 1:3 it seem good to me
also have had perfect understand of all thing from the veri
first to write unto thee in order most excel theophilu 1:4
that thou mightest know the certainti of those thing wherein thou
hast been instruct

1:5 there wa in the day of herod the king of judaea a certain
priest name zacharia of the cours of abia: and hi wife wa of the
daughter of aaron and her name wa elisabeth

1:6 and they were both righteou befor god walk in all the
command and ordin of the lord blameless

1:7 and they had no child becaus that elisabeth wa barren and they
both were now well stricken in year

1:8 and it came to pass that while he execut the priest offic
befor god in the order of hi cours 1:9 accord to the custom of
the priest offic hi lot wa to burn incens when he went into the
templ of the lord

1:10 and the whole multitud of the peopl were pray without at the
time of incens

1:11 and there appear unto him an angel of the lord stand on the
right side of the altar of incens

1:12 and when zacharia saw him he wa troubl and fear fell upon
him

1:13 but the angel said unto him fear not zacharias: for thi prayer
is heard; and thi wife elisabeth shall bear thee a son and thou shalt
call hi name john

1:14 and thou shalt have joy and gladness; and mani shall rejoic at
hi birth

1:15 for he shall be great in the sight of the lord and shall drink
neither wine nor strong drink; and he shall be fill with the holi
ghost even from hi mother womb

1:16 and mani of the children of israel shall he turn to the lord
their god

1:17 and he shall go befor him in the spirit and power of elia to
turn the heart of the father to the children and the disobedi to
the wisdom of the just; to make readi a peopl prepar for the lord

1:18 and zacharia said unto the angel wherebi shall i know this? for
i am an old man and my wife well stricken in year

1:19 and the angel answer said unto him i am gabriel that stand
in the presenc of god; and am sent to speak unto thee and to shew
thee these glad tide

1:20 and behold thou shalt be dumb and not abl to speak until the
day that these thing shall be perform becaus thou believest not
my word which shall be fulfil in their season

1:21 and the peopl wait for zacharia and marvel that he
tarri so long in the templ

1:22 and when he came out he could not speak unto them: and they
perceiv that he had seen a vision in the temple: for he beckon
unto them and remain speechless

1:23 and it came to pass that as soon as the day of hi
ministr were accomplish he depart to hi own hous

1:24 and after those day hi wife elisabeth conceiv and hid
herself five month say 1:25 thu hath the lord dealt with me in
the day wherein he look on me to take away my reproach among men

1:26 and in the sixth month the angel gabriel wa sent from god unto a
citi of galile name nazareth 1:27 to a virgin espous to a man
whose name wa joseph of the hous of david; and the virgin name
wa mari

1:28 and the angel came in unto her and said hail thou that art
highli favour the lord is with thee: bless art thou among women

1:29 and when she saw him she wa troubl at hi say and cast in
her mind what manner of salut thi should be

1:30 and the angel said unto her fear not mary: for thou hast found
favour with god

1:31 and behold thou shalt conceiv in thi womb and bring forth a
son and shalt call hi name jesu

1:32 he shall be great and shall be call the son of the highest:
and the lord god shall give unto him the throne of hi father david:
1:33 and he shall reign over the hous of jacob for ever; and of hi
kingdom there shall be no end

1:34 then said mari unto the angel how shall thi be see i know
not a man? 1:35 and the angel answer and said unto her the holi
ghost shall come upon thee and the power of the highest shall
overshadow thee: therefor also that holi thing which shall be born of
thee shall be call the son of god

1:36 and behold thi cousin elisabeth she hath also conceiv a son
in her old age: and thi is the sixth month with her who wa call
barren

1:37 for with god noth shall be imposs

1:38 and mari said behold the handmaid of the lord; be it unto me
accord to thi word and the angel depart from her

1:39 and mari aros in those day and went into the hill countri with
hast into a citi of juda; 1:40 and enter into the hous of
zacharia and salut elisabeth

1:41 and it came to pass that when elisabeth heard the salut of
mari the babe leap in her womb; and elisabeth wa fill with the
holi ghost: 1:42 and she spake out with a loud voic and said
bless art thou among women and bless is the fruit of thi womb

1:43 and whenc is thi to me that the mother of my lord should come
to me? 1:44 for lo as soon as the voic of thi salut sound
in mine ear the babe leap in my womb for joy

1:45 and bless is she that believed: for there shall be a
perform of those thing which were told her from the lord

1:46 and mari said my soul doth magnifi the lord 1:47 and my spirit
hath rejoic in god my saviour

1:48 for he hath regard the low estat of hi handmaiden: for
behold from henceforth all gener shall call me bless

1:49 for he that is mighti hath done to me great things; and holi is
hi name

1:50 and hi merci is on them that fear him from gener to
gener

1:51 he hath shew strength with hi arm; he hath scatter the proud
in the imagin of their heart

1:52 he hath put down the mighti from their seat and exalt them of
low degre

1:53 he hath fill the hungri with good things; and the rich he hath
sent empti away

1:54 he hath holpen hi servant israel in remembr of hi mercy;
1:55 as he spake to our father to abraham and to hi seed for ever

1:56 and mari abod with her about three month and return to her
own hous

1:57 now elisabeth full time came that she should be delivered; and
she brought forth a son

1:58 and her neighbour and her cousin heard how the lord had shew
great merci upon her; and they rejoic with her

1:59 and it came to pass that on the eighth day they came to
circumcis the child; and they call him zacharia after the name of
hi father

1:60 and hi mother answer and said not so; but he shall be call
john

1:61 and they said unto her there is none of thi kindr that is
call by thi name

1:62 and they made sign to hi father how he would have him call

1:63 and he ask for a write tabl and wrote say hi name is
john and they marvel all

1:64 and hi mouth wa open immedi and hi tongu loos and
he spake and prais god

1:65 and fear came on all that dwelt round about them: and all these
say were nois abroad throughout all the hill countri of judaea

1:66 and all they that heard them laid them up in their heart
say what manner of child shall thi be! and the hand of the lord
wa with him

1:67 and hi father zacharia wa fill with the holi ghost and
prophesi say 1:68 bless be the lord god of israel; for he
hath visit and redeem hi peopl 1:69 and hath rais up an horn
of salvat for us in the hous of hi servant david; 1:70 as he
spake by the mouth of hi holi prophet which have been sinc the
world began: 1:71 that we should be save from our enemi and from
the hand of all that hate us; 1:72 to perform the merci promis to
our father and to rememb hi holi covenant; 1:73 the oath which he
sware to our father abraham 1:74 that he would grant unto us that we
be deliv out of the hand of our enemi might serv him without
fear 1:75 in holi and righteous befor him all the day of
our life

1:76 and thou child shalt be call the prophet of the highest: for
thou shalt go befor the face of the lord to prepar hi ways; 1:77 to
give knowledg of salvat unto hi peopl by the remiss of their
sin 1:78 through the tender merci of our god; wherebi the dayspr
from on high hath visit us 1:79 to give light to them that sit in
dark and in the shadow of death to guid our feet into the way of
peac

1:80 and the child grew and wax strong in spirit and wa in the
desert till the day of hi shew unto israel

2:1 and it came to pass in those day that there went out a decre
from caesar augustu that all the world should be tax

2:2 (and thi tax wa first made when cyreniu wa governor of
syria) 2:3 and all went to be tax everi one into hi own citi

2:4 and joseph also went up from galile out of the citi of nazareth
into judaea unto the citi of david which is call bethlehem;
(becaus he wa of the hous and lineag of david:) 2:5 to be tax
with mari hi espous wife be great with child

2:6 and so it wa that while they were there the day were
accomplish that she should be deliv

2:7 and she brought forth her firstborn son and wrap him in
swaddl cloth and laid him in a manger; becaus there wa no room
for them in the inn

2:8 and there were in the same countri shepherd abid in the field
keep watch over their flock by night

2:9 and lo the angel of the lord came upon them and the glori of
the lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid

2:10 and the angel said unto them fear not: for behold i bring you
good tide of great joy which shall be to all peopl

2:11 for unto you is born thi day in the citi of david a saviour
which is christ the lord

2:12 and thi shall be a sign unto you; ye shall find the babe wrap
in swaddl cloth lie in a manger

2:13 and suddenli there wa with the angel a multitud of the heavenli
host prais god and say 2:14 glori to god in the highest and
on earth peac good will toward men

2:15 and it came to pass as the angel were gone away from them into
heaven the shepherd said one to anoth let us now go even unto
bethlehem and see thi thing which is come to pass which the lord
hath made known unto us

2:16 and they came with hast and found mari and joseph and the
babe lie in a manger

2:17 and when they had seen it they made known abroad the say
which wa told them concern thi child

2:18 and all they that heard it wonder at those thing which were
told them by the shepherd

2:19 but mari kept all these thing and ponder them in her heart

2:20 and the shepherd return glorifi and prais god for all
the thing that they had heard and seen as it wa told unto them

2:21 and when eight day were accomplish for the circumcis of the
child hi name wa call jesu which wa so name of the angel
befor he wa conceiv in the womb

2:22 and when the day of her purif accord to the law of
mose were accomplish they brought him to jerusalem to present him
to the lord; 2:23 (a it is written in the law of the lord everi male
that openeth the womb shall be call holi to the lord;) 2:24 and to
offer a sacrific accord to that which is said in the law of the
lord a pair of turtledov or two young pigeon

2:25 and behold there wa a man in jerusalem whose name wa simeon;
and the same man wa just and devout wait for the consol of
israel: and the holi ghost wa upon him

2:26 and it wa reveal unto him by the holi ghost that he should
not see death befor he had seen the lord christ

2:27 and he came by the spirit into the temple: and when the parent
brought in the child jesu to do for him after the custom of the law
2:28 then took he him up in hi arm and bless god and said 2:29
lord now lettest thou thi servant depart in peac accord to thi
word: 2:30 for mine eye have seen thi salvat 2:31 which thou hast
prepar befor the face of all people; 2:32 a light to lighten the
gentil and the glori of thi peopl israel

2:33 and joseph and hi mother marvel at those thing which were
spoken of him

2:34 and simeon bless them and said unto mari hi mother behold
thi child is set for the fall and rise again of mani in israel; and
for a sign which shall be spoken against; 2:35 (yea a sword shall
pierc through thi own soul also) that the thought of mani heart
may be reveal

2:36 and there wa one anna a prophetess the daughter of phanuel of
the tribe of aser: she wa of a great age and had live with an
husband seven year from her virginity; 2:37 and she wa a widow of
about fourscor and four year which depart not from the templ
but serv god with fast and prayer night and day

2:38 and she come in that instant gave thank likewis unto the
lord and spake of him to all them that look for redempt in
jerusalem

2:39 and when they had perform all thing accord to the law of
the lord they return into galile to their own citi nazareth

2:40 and the child grew and wax strong in spirit fill with
wisdom: and the grace of god wa upon him

2:41 now hi parent went to jerusalem everi year at the feast of the
passov

2:42 and when he wa twelv year old they went up to jerusalem after
the custom of the feast

2:43 and when they had fulfil the day as they return the child
jesu tarri behind in jerusalem; and joseph and hi mother knew not
of it

2:44 but they suppos him to have been in the compani went a day
journey; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaint

2:45 and when they found him not they turn back again to jerusalem
seek him

2:46 and it came to pass that after three day they found him in the
templ sit in the midst of the doctor both hear them and
ask them question

2:47 and all that heard him were astonish at hi understand and
answer

2:48 and when they saw him they were amazed: and hi mother said unto
him son whi hast thou thu dealt with us? behold thi father and i
have sought thee sorrow

2:49 and he said unto them how is it that ye sought me? wist ye not
that i must be about my father business? 2:50 and they understood
not the say which he spake unto them

2:51 and he went down with them and came to nazareth and wa subject
unto them: but hi mother kept all these say in her heart

2:52 and jesu increas in wisdom and statur and in favour with god
and man

3:1 now in the fifteenth year of the reign of tiberiu caesar pontiu
pilat be governor of judaea and herod be tetrarch of galile
and hi brother philip tetrarch of ituraea and of the region of
trachon and lysania the tetrarch of abilen 3:2 anna and
caiapha be the high priest the word of god came unto john the
son of zacharia in the wilder

3:3 and he came into all the countri about jordan preach the
baptism of repent for the remiss of sins; 3:4 as it is written
in the book of the word of esaia the prophet say the voic of
one cri in the wilder prepar ye the way of the lord make hi
path straight

3:5 everi valley shall be fill and everi mountain and hill shall be
brought low; and the crook shall be made straight and the rough
way shall be made smooth; 3:6 and all flesh shall see the salvat
of god

3:7 then said he to the multitud that came forth to be baptiz of
him o gener of viper who hath warn you to flee from the
wrath to come? 3:8 bring forth therefor fruit worthi of repent
and begin not to say within yourselv we have abraham to our father:
for i say unto you that god is abl of these stone to rais up
children unto abraham

3:9 and now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: everi
tree therefor which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down and
cast into the fire

3:10 and the peopl ask him say what shall we do then? 3:11 he
answereth and saith unto them he that hath two coat let him impart
to him that hath none; and he that hath meat let him do likewis

3:12 then came also publican to be baptiz and said unto him
master what shall we do? 3:13 and he said unto them exact no more
than that which is appoint you

3:14 and the soldier likewis demand of him say and what shall
we do? and he said unto them do violenc to no man neither accus
ani falsely; and be content with your wage

3:15 and as the peopl were in expect and all men muse in their
heart of john whether he were the christ or not; 3:16 john
answer say unto them all i inde baptiz you with water; but
one mightier than i cometh the latchet of whose shoe i am not worthi
to unloose: he shall baptiz you with the holi ghost and with fire:
3:17 whose fan is in hi hand and he will throughli purg hi floor
and will gather the wheat into hi garner; but the chaff he will burn
with fire unquench

3:18 and mani other thing in hi exhort preach he unto the
peopl

3:19 but herod the tetrarch be reprov by him for herodia hi
brother philip wife and for all the evil which herod had done
3:20 ad yet thi abov all that he shut up john in prison

3:21 now when all the peopl were baptiz it came to pass that
jesu also be baptiz and pray the heaven wa open 3:22
and the holi ghost descend in a bodili shape like a dove upon him
and a voic came from heaven which said thou art my belov son; in
thee i am well pleas

3:23 and jesu himself began to be about thirti year of age be
(a wa supposed) the son of joseph which wa the son of heli 3:24
which wa the son of matthat which wa the son of levi which wa the
son of melchi which wa the son of janna which wa the son of
joseph 3:25 which wa the son of mattathia which wa the son of
amo which wa the son of naum which wa the son of esli which wa
the son of nagg 3:26 which wa the son of maath which wa the son
of mattathia which wa the son of semei which wa the son of
joseph which wa the son of juda 3:27 which wa the son of joanna
which wa the son of rhesa which wa the son of zorobabel which wa
the son of salathiel which wa the son of neri 3:28 which wa the
son of melchi which wa the son of addi which wa the son of cosam
which wa the son of elmodam which wa the son of er 3:29 which wa
the son of jose which wa the son of eliez which wa the son of
jorim which wa the son of matthat which wa the son of levi 3:30
which wa the son of simeon which wa the son of juda which wa the
son of joseph which wa the son of jonan which wa the son of
eliakim 3:31 which wa the son of melea which wa the son of menan
which wa the son of mattatha which wa the son of nathan which wa
the son of david 3:32 which wa the son of jess which wa the son
of obe which wa the son of booz which wa the son of salmon which
wa the son of naasson 3:33 which wa the son of aminadab which wa
the son of aram which wa the son of esrom which wa the son of
phare which wa the son of juda 3:34 which wa the son of jacob
which wa the son of isaac which wa the son of abraham which wa
the son of thara which wa the son of nachor 3:35 which wa the son
of saruch which wa the son of ragau which wa the son of phalec
which wa the son of heber which wa the son of sala 3:36 which wa
the son of cainan which wa the son of arphaxad which wa the son of
sem which wa the son of noe which wa the son of lamech 3:37 which
wa the son of mathusala which wa the son of enoch which wa the
son of jare which wa the son of maleleel which wa the son of
cainan 3:38 which wa the son of eno which wa the son of seth
which wa the son of adam which wa the son of god

4:1 and jesu be full of the holi ghost return from jordan and
wa led by the spirit into the wilder 4:2 be forti day
tempt of the devil and in those day he did eat nothing: and when
they were end he afterward hunger

4:3 and the devil said unto him if thou be the son of god command
thi stone that it be made bread

4:4 and jesu answer him say it is written that man shall not
live by bread alon but by everi word of god

4:5 and the devil take him up into an high mountain shew unto
him all the kingdom of the world in a moment of time

4:6 and the devil said unto him all thi power will i give thee and
the glori of them: for that is deliv unto me; and to whomsoev i
will i give it

4:7 if thou therefor wilt worship me all shall be thine

4:8 and jesu answer and said unto him get thee behind me satan:
for it is written thou shalt worship the lord thi god and him onli
shalt thou serv

4:9 and he brought him to jerusalem and set him on a pinnacl of the
templ and said unto him if thou be the son of god cast thyself
down from hence: 4:10 for it is written he shall give hi angel
charg over thee to keep thee: 4:11 and in their hand they shall
bear thee up lest at ani time thou dash thi foot against a stone

4:12 and jesu answer said unto him it is said thou shalt not
tempt the lord thi god

4:13 and when the devil had end all the temptat he depart from
him for a season

4:14 and jesu return in the power of the spirit into galilee: and
there went out a fame of him through all the region round about

4:15 and he taught in their synagogu be glorifi of all

4:16 and he came to nazareth where he had been brought up: and as
hi custom wa he went into the synagogu on the sabbath day and
stood up for to read

4:17 and there wa deliv unto him the book of the prophet esaia
and when he had open the book he found the place where it wa
written 4:18 the spirit of the lord is upon me becaus he hath
anoint me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal
the brokenheart to preach deliver to the captiv and
recov of sight to the blind to set at liberti them that are
bruis 4:19 to preach the accept year of the lord

4:20 and he close the book and he gave it again to the minist and
sat down and the eye of all them that were in the synagogu were
fasten on him

4:21 and he began to say unto them thi day is thi scriptur
fulfil in your ear

4:22 and all bare him wit and wonder at the graciou word
which proceed out of hi mouth and they said is not thi joseph
son? 4:23 and he said unto them ye will sure say unto me thi
proverb physician heal thyself: whatsoev we have heard done in
capernaum do also here in thi countri

4:24 and he said verili i say unto you no prophet is accept in hi
own countri

4:25 but i tell you of a truth mani widow were in israel in the day
of elia when the heaven wa shut up three year and six month when
great famin wa throughout all the land; 4:26 but unto none of them
wa elia sent save unto sarepta a citi of sidon unto a woman that
wa a widow

4:27 and mani leper were in israel in the time of eliseu the
prophet; and none of them wa cleans save naaman the syrian

4:28 and all they in the synagogu when they heard these thing were
fill with wrath 4:29 and rose up and thrust him out of the citi
and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their citi wa built
that they might cast him down headlong

4:30 but he pass through the midst of them went hi way 4:31 and
came down to capernaum a citi of galile and taught them on the
sabbath day

4:32 and they were astonish at hi doctrine: for hi word wa with
power

4:33 and in the synagogu there wa a man which had a spirit of an
unclean devil and cri out with a loud voic 4:34 say let us
alone; what have we to do with thee thou jesu of nazareth? art thou
come to destroy us? i know thee who thou art; the holi one of god

4:35 and jesu rebuk him say hold thi peac and come out of
him

and when the devil had thrown him in the midst he came out of him
and hurt him not

4:36 and they were all amaz and spake among themselv say
what a word is this! for with author and power he commandeth the
unclean spirit and they come out

4:37 and the fame of him went out into everi place of the countri
round about

4:38 and he aros out of the synagogu and enter into simon
hous

and simon wife mother wa taken with a great fever; and they
besought him for her

4:39 and he stood over her and rebuk the fever; and it left her:
and immedi she aros and minist unto them

4:40 now when the sun wa set all they that had ani sick with
diver diseas brought them unto him; and he laid hi hand on everi
one of them and heal them

4:41 and devil also came out of mani cri out and say thou
art christ the son of god and he rebuk them suffer them not to
speak: for they knew that he wa christ

4:42 and when it wa day he depart and went into a desert place:
and the peopl sought him and came unto him and stay him that he
should not depart from them

4:43 and he said unto them i must preach the kingdom of god to other
citi also: for therefor am i sent

4:44 and he preach in the synagogu of galile

5:1 and it came to pass that as the peopl press upon him to hear
the word of god he stood by the lake of gennesaret 5:2 and saw two
ship stand by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them
and were wash their net

5:3 and he enter into one of the ship which wa simon and
pray him that he would thrust out a littl from the land and he sat
down and taught the peopl out of the ship

5:4 now when he had left speak he said unto simon launch out into
the deep and let down your net for a draught

5:5 and simon answer said unto him master we have toil all the
night and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thi word i will let
down the net

5:6 and when they had thi done they inclos a great multitud of
fishes: and their net brake

5:7 and they beckon unto their partner which were in the other
ship that they should come and help them and they came and fill
both the ship so that they began to sink

5:8 when simon peter saw it he fell down at jesu knee say
depart from me; for i am a sin man o lord

5:9 for he wa astonish and all that were with him at the draught
of the fish which they had taken: 5:10 and so wa also jame and
john the son of zebede which were partner with simon and jesu
said unto simon fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men

5:11 and when they had brought their ship to land they forsook all
and follow him

5:12 and it came to pass when he wa in a certain citi behold a man
full of leprosy: who see jesu fell on hi face and besought him
say lord if thou wilt thou canst make me clean

5:13 and he put forth hi hand and touch him say i will: be
thou clean and immedi the leprosi depart from him

5:14 and he charg him to tell no man: but go and shew thyself to
the priest and offer for thi cleans accord as mose command
for a testimoni unto them

5:15 but so much the more went there a fame abroad of him: and great
multitud came togeth to hear and to be heal by him of their
infirm

5:16 and he withdrew himself into the wilder and pray

5:17 and it came to pass on a certain day as he wa teach that
there were pharise and doctor of the law sit by which were
come out of everi town of galile and judaea and jerusalem: and the
power of the lord wa present to heal them

5:18 and behold men brought in a bed a man which wa taken with a
palsy: and they sought mean to bring him in and to lay him befor
him

5:19 and when they could not find by what way they might bring him in
becaus of the multitud they went upon the housetop and let him
down through the tile with hi couch into the midst befor jesu

5:20 and when he saw their faith he said unto him man thi sin are
forgiven thee

5:21 and the scribe and the pharise began to reason say who is
thi which speaketh blasphemies? who can forgiv sin but god alone?
5:22 but when jesu perceiv their thought he answer said unto
them what reason ye in your hearts? 5:23 whether is easier to say
thi sin be forgiven thee; or to say rise up and walk? 5:24 but that
ye may know that the son of man hath power upon earth to forgiv sin
(he said unto the sick of the palsy) i say unto thee aris and take
up thi couch and go into thine hous

5:25 and immedi he rose up befor them and took up that whereon
he lay and depart to hi own hous glorifi god

5:26 and they were all amaz and they glorifi god and were fill
with fear say we have seen strang thing to day

5:27 and after these thing he went forth and saw a publican name
levi sit at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him follow
me

5:28 and he left all rose up and follow him

5:29 and levi made him a great feast in hi own house: and there wa a
great compani of publican and of other that sat down with them

5:30 but their scribe and pharise murmur against hi discipl
say whi do ye eat and drink with publican and sinners? 5:31 and
jesu answer said unto them they that are whole need not a
physician; but they that are sick

5:32 i came not to call the righteou but sinner to repent

5:33 and they said unto him whi do the discipl of john fast often
and make prayer and likewis the discipl of the pharisees; but
thine eat and drink? 5:34 and he said unto them can ye make the
children of the bridechamb fast while the bridegroom is with them?
5:35 but the day will come when the bridegroom shall be taken away
from them and then shall they fast in those day

5:36 and he spake also a parabl unto them; no man putteth a piec of
a new garment upon an old; if otherwis then both the new maketh a
rent and the piec that wa taken out of the new agreeth not with the
old

5:37 and no man putteth new wine into old bottles; els the new wine
will burst the bottl and be spill and the bottl shall perish

5:38 but new wine must be put into new bottles; and both are
preserv

5:39 no man also have drunk old wine straightway desireth new: for
he saith the old is better

6:1 and it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first that he
went through the corn fields; and hi discipl pluck the ear of
corn and did eat rub them in their hand

6:2 and certain of the pharise said unto them whi do ye that which
is not law to do on the sabbath days? 6:3 and jesu answer them
said have ye not read so much as thi what david did when himself
wa an hungr and they which were with him; 6:4 how he went into the
hous of god and did take and eat the shewbread and gave also to
them that were with him; which it is not law to eat but for the
priest alone? 6:5 and he said unto them that the son of man is lord
also of the sabbath

6:6 and it came to pass also on anoth sabbath that he enter into
the synagogu and taught: and there wa a man whose right hand wa
wither

6:7 and the scribe and pharise watch him whether he would heal
on the sabbath day; that they might find an accus against him

6:8 but he knew their thought and said to the man which had the
wither hand rise up and stand forth in the midst and he aros and
stood forth

6:9 then said jesu unto them i will ask you one thing; is it law
on the sabbath day to do good or to do evil? to save life or to
destroy it? 6:10 and look round about upon them all he said unto
the man stretch forth thi hand and he did so: and hi hand wa
restor whole as the other

6:11 and they were fill with madness; and commun one with anoth
what they might do to jesu

6:12 and it came to pass in those day that he went out into a
mountain to pray and continu all night in prayer to god

6:13 and when it wa day he call unto him hi disciples: and of
them he chose twelv whom also he name apostles; 6:14 simon (whom
he also name peter) and andrew hi brother jame and john philip
and bartholomew 6:15 matthew and thoma jame the son of alphaeu
and simon call zelot 6:16 and juda the brother of jame and
juda iscariot which also wa the traitor

6:17 and he came down with them and stood in the plain and the
compani of hi discipl and a great multitud of peopl out of all
judaea and jerusalem and from the sea coast of tyre and sidon which
came to hear him and to be heal of their diseases; 6:18 and they
that were vex with unclean spirits: and they were heal

6:19 and the whole multitud sought to touch him: for there went
virtu out of him and heal them all

6:20 and he lift up hi eye on hi discipl and said bless be
ye poor: for your is the kingdom of god

6:21 bless are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be fill bless
are ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh

6:22 bless are ye when men shall hate you and when they shall
separ you from their compani and shall reproach you and cast out
your name as evil for the son of man sake

6:23 rejoic ye in that day and leap for joy: for behold your
reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their father
unto the prophet

6:24 but woe unto you that are rich! for ye have receiv your
consol

6:25 woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger woe unto you
that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep

6:26 woe unto you when all men shall speak well of you! for so did
their father to the fals prophet

6:27 but i say unto you which hear love your enemi do good to them
which hate you 6:28 bless them that curs you and pray for them
which despit use you

6:29 and unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the
other; and him that taketh away thi cloak forbid not to take thi coat
also

6:30 give to everi man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh
away thi good ask them not again

6:31 and as ye would that men should do to you do ye also to them
likewis

6:32 for if ye love them which love you what thank have ye? for
sinner also love those that love them

6:33 and if ye do good to them which do good to you what thank have
ye? for sinner also do even the same

6:34 and if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receiv what thank
have ye? for sinner also lend to sinner to receiv as much again

6:35 but love ye your enemi and do good and lend hope for
noth again; and your reward shall be great and ye shall be the
children of the highest: for he is kind unto the unthank and to the
evil

6:36 be ye therefor merci as your father also is merci

6:37 judg not and ye shall not be judged: condemn not and ye shall
not be condemned: forgiv and ye shall be forgiven: 6:38 give and it
shall be given unto you; good measur press down and shaken
togeth and run over shall men give into your bosom for with
the same measur that ye mete withal it shall be measur to you
again

6:39 and he spake a parabl unto them can the blind lead the blind?
shall they not both fall into the ditch? 6:40 the discipl is not
abov hi master: but everi one that is perfect shall be as hi
master

6:41 and whi beholdest thou the mote that is in thi brother eye but
perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye? 6:42 either how
canst thou say to thi brother brother let me pull out the mote that
is in thine eye when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in
thine own eye? thou hypocrit cast out first the beam out of thine
own eye and then shalt thou see clearli to pull out the mote that is
in thi brother eye

6:43 for a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a
corrupt tree bring forth good fruit

6:44 for everi tree is known by hi own fruit for of thorn men do
not gather fig nor of a brambl bush gather they grape

6:45 a good man out of the good treasur of hi heart bringeth forth
that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasur of hi
heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abund of the
heart hi mouth speaketh

6:46 and whi call ye me lord lord and do not the thing which i
say? 6:47 whosoev cometh to me and heareth my say and doeth
them i will shew you to whom he is like: 6:48 he is like a man which
built an hous and dig deep and laid the foundat on a rock:
and when the flood aros the stream beat vehement upon that hous
and could not shake it: for it wa found upon a rock

6:49 but he that heareth and doeth not is like a man that without a
foundat built an hous upon the earth; against which the stream did
beat vehement and immedi it fell; and the ruin of that hous
wa great

7:1 now when he had end all hi say in the audienc of the
peopl he enter into capernaum

7:2 and a certain centurion servant who wa dear unto him wa
sick and readi to die

7:3 and when he heard of jesu he sent unto him the elder of the
jew beseech him that he would come and heal hi servant

7:4 and when they came to jesu they besought him instantli say
that he wa worthi for whom he should do this: 7:5 for he loveth our
nation and he hath built us a synagogu

7:6 then jesu went with them and when he wa now not far from the
hous the centurion sent friend to him say unto him lord
troubl not thyself: for i am not worthi that thou shouldest enter
under my roof: 7:7 wherefor neither thought i myself worthi to come
unto thee: but say in a word and my servant shall be heal

7:8 for i also am a man set under author have under me soldier
and i say unto one go and he goeth; and to anoth come and he
cometh; and to my servant do thi and he doeth it

7:9 when jesu heard these thing he marvel at him and turn him
about and said unto the peopl that follow him i say unto you i
have not found so great faith no not in israel

7:10 and they that were sent return to the hous found the
servant whole that had been sick

7:11 and it came to pass the day after that he went into a citi
call nain; and mani of hi discipl went with him and much peopl

7:12 now when he came nigh to the gate of the citi behold there wa
a dead man carri out the onli son of hi mother and she wa a
widow: and much peopl of the citi wa with her

7:13 and when the lord saw her he had compass on her and said
unto her weep not

7:14 and he came and touch the bier: and they that bare him stood
still

and he said young man i say unto thee aris

7:15 and he that wa dead sat up and began to speak and he deliv
him to hi mother

7:16 and there came a fear on all: and they glorifi god say
that a great prophet is risen up among us; and that god hath visit
hi peopl

7:17 and thi rumour of him went forth throughout all judaea and
throughout all the region round about

7:18 and the discipl of john shew him of all these thing

7:19 and john call unto him two of hi discipl sent them to
jesu say art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
7:20 when the men were come unto him they said john baptist hath
sent us unto thee say art thou he that should come? or look we
for another? 7:21 and in that same hour he cure mani of their
infirm and plagu and of evil spirits; and unto mani that were
blind he gave sight

7:22 then jesu answer said unto them go your way and tell john
what thing ye have seen and heard; how that the blind see the lame
walk the leper are cleans the deaf hear the dead are rais to
the poor the gospel is preach

7:23 and bless is he whosoev shall not be offend in me
