enter not into temptat

22:41 and he wa withdrawn from them about a stone cast and kneel
down and pray 22:42 say father if thou be will remov
thi cup from me: nevertheless not my will but thine be done

22:43 and there appear an angel unto him from heaven strengthen
him

22:44 and be in an agoni he pray more earnestly: and hi sweat
wa as it were great drop of blood fall down to the ground

22:45 and when he rose up from prayer and wa come to hi discipl
he found them sleep for sorrow 22:46 and said unto them whi sleep
ye? rise and pray lest ye enter into temptat

22:47 and while he yet spake behold a multitud and he that wa
call juda one of the twelv went befor them and drew near unto
jesu to kiss him

22:48 but jesu said unto him juda betrayest thou the son of man
with a kiss? 22:49 when they which were about him saw what would
follow they said unto him lord shall we smite with the sword?
22:50 and one of them smote the servant of the high priest and cut
off hi right ear

22:51 and jesu answer and said suffer ye thu far and he touch
hi ear and heal him

22:52 then jesu said unto the chief priest and captain of the
templ and the elder which were come to him be ye come out as
against a thief with sword and staves? 22:53 when i wa daili with
you in the templ ye stretch forth no hand against me: but thi is
your hour and the power of dark

22:54 then took they him and led him and brought him into the high
priest hous and peter follow afar off

22:55 and when they had kindl a fire in the midst of the hall and
were set down togeth peter sat down among them

22:56 but a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire and
earnestli look upon him and said thi man wa also with him

22:57 and he deni him say woman i know him not

22:58 and after a littl while anoth saw him and said thou art
also of them and peter said man i am not

22:59 and about the space of one hour after anoth confid
affirm say of a truth thi fellow also wa with him: for he is
a galilaean

22:60 and peter said man i know not what thou sayest and
immedi while he yet spake the cock crew

22:61 and the lord turn and look upon peter and peter rememb
the word of the lord how he had said unto him befor the cock crow
thou shalt deni me thrice

22:62 and peter went out and wept bitterli

22:63 and the men that held jesu mock him and smote him

22:64 and when they had blindfold him they struck him on the face
and ask him say prophesi who is it that smote thee? 22:65 and
mani other thing blasphem spake they against him

22:66 and as soon as it wa day the elder of the peopl and the
chief priest and the scribe came togeth and led him into their
council say 22:67 art thou the christ? tell us and he said unto
them if i tell you ye will not believe: 22:68 and if i also ask you
ye will not answer me nor let me go

22:69 hereaft shall the son of man sit on the right hand of the
power of god

22:70 then said they all art thou then the son of god? and he said
unto them ye say that i am

22:71 and they said what need we ani further witness? for we
ourselv have heard of hi own mouth

23:1 and the whole multitud of them aros and led him unto pilat

23:2 and they began to accus him say we found thi fellow
pervert the nation and forbid to give tribut to caesar
say that he himself is christ a king

23:3 and pilat ask him say art thou the king of the jews? and
he answer him and said thou sayest it

23:4 then said pilat to the chief priest and to the peopl i find
no fault in thi man

23:5 and they were the more fierc say he stirreth up the peopl
teach throughout all jewri begin from galile to thi place

23:6 when pilat heard of galile he ask whether the man were a
galilaean

23:7 and as soon as he knew that he belong unto herod
jurisdict he sent him to herod who himself also wa at jerusalem
at that time

23:8 and when herod saw jesu he wa exceed glad: for he wa
desir to see him of a long season becaus he had heard mani thing
of him; and he hope to have seen some miracl done by him

23:9 then he question with him in mani words; but he answer him
noth

23:10 and the chief priest and scribe stood and vehement accus
him

23:11 and herod with hi men of war set him at nought and mock him
and array him in a gorgeou robe and sent him again to pilat

23:12 and the same day pilat and herod were made friend together:
for befor they were at enmiti between themselv

23:13 and pilat when he had call togeth the chief priest and
the ruler and the peopl 23:14 said unto them ye have brought thi
man unto me as one that perverteth the people: and behold i have
examin him befor you have found no fault in thi man touch
those thing whereof ye accus him: 23:15 no nor yet herod: for i
sent you to him; and lo noth worthi of death is done unto him

23:16 i will therefor chastis him and releas him

23:17 (for of necess he must releas one unto them at the feast)
23:18 and they cri out all at onc say away with thi man and
releas unto us barabbas: 23:19 (who for a certain sedit made in
the citi and for murder wa cast into prison) 23:20 pilat
therefor will to releas jesu spake again to them

23:21 but they cri say crucifi him crucifi him

23:22 and he said unto them the third time whi what evil hath he
done? i have found no caus of death in him: i will therefor chastis
him and let him go

23:23 and they were instant with loud voic requir that he might
be crucifi and the voic of them and of the chief priest
prevail

23:24 and pilat gave sentenc that it should be as they requir

23:25 and he releas unto them him that for sedit and murder wa
cast into prison whom they had desired; but he deliv jesu to
their will

23:26 and as they led him away they laid hold upon one simon a
cyrenian come out of the countri and on him they laid the cross
that he might bear it after jesu

23:27 and there follow him a great compani of peopl and of women
which also bewail and lament him

23:28 but jesu turn unto them said daughter of jerusalem weep
not for me but weep for yourselv and for your children

23:29 for behold the day are come in the which they shall say
bless are the barren and the womb that never bare and the pap
which never gave suck

23:30 then shall they begin to say to the mountain fall on us; and
to the hill cover us

23:31 for if they do these thing in a green tree what shall be done
in the dry? 23:32 and there were also two other malefactor led
with him to be put to death

23:33 and when they were come to the place which is call calvari
there they crucifi him and the malefactor one on the right hand
and the other on the left

23:34 then said jesu father forgiv them; for they know not what
they do and they part hi raiment and cast lot

23:35 and the peopl stood behold and the ruler also with them
derid him say he save others; let him save himself if he be
christ the chosen of god

23:36 and the soldier also mock him come to him and offer
him vinegar 23:37 and say if thou be the king of the jew save
thyself

23:38 and a superscript also wa written over him in letter of
greek and latin and hebrew thi is the king of the jew

23:39 and one of the malefactor which were hang rail on him
say if thou be christ save thyself and us

23:40 but the other answer rebuk him say dost not thou fear
god see thou art in the same condemnation? 23:41 and we inde
justly; for we receiv the due reward of our deeds: but thi man hath
done noth amiss

23:42 and he said unto jesu lord rememb me when thou comest into
thi kingdom

23:43 and jesu said unto him verili i say unto thee to day shalt
thou be with me in paradis

23:44 and it wa about the sixth hour and there wa a dark over
all the earth until the ninth hour

23:45 and the sun wa darken and the veil of the templ wa rent in
the midst

23:46 and when jesu had cri with a loud voic he said father
into thi hand i commend my spirit: and have said thu he gave up
the ghost

23:47 now when the centurion saw what wa done he glorifi god
say certainli thi wa a righteou man

23:48 and all the peopl that came togeth to that sight behold
the thing which were done smote their breast and return

23:49 and all hi acquaint and the women that follow him from
galile stood afar off behold these thing

23:50 and behold there wa a man name joseph a counsellor; and he
wa a good man and a just: 23:51 (the same had not consent to the
counsel and deed of them;) he wa of arimathaea a citi of the jews:
who also himself wait for the kingdom of god

23:52 thi man went unto pilat and beg the bodi of jesu

23:53 and he took it down and wrap it in linen and laid it in a
sepulchr that wa hewn in stone wherein never man befor wa laid

23:54 and that day wa the prepar and the sabbath drew on

23:55 and the women also which came with him from galile follow
after and beheld the sepulchr and how hi bodi wa laid

23:56 and they return and prepar spice and ointments; and rest
the sabbath day accord to the command

24:1 now upon the first day of the week veri earli in the morn
they came unto the sepulchr bring the spice which they had
prepar and certain other with them

24:2 and they found the stone roll away from the sepulchr

24:3 and they enter in and found not the bodi of the lord jesu

24:4 and it came to pass as they were much perplex thereabout
behold two men stood by them in shine garments: 24:5 and as they
were afraid and bow down their face to the earth they said unto
them whi seek ye the live among the dead? 24:6 he is not here but
is risen: rememb how he spake unto you when he wa yet in galile
24:7 say the son of man must be deliv into the hand of sin
men and be crucifi and the third day rise again

24:8 and they rememb hi word 24:9 and return from the
sepulchr and told all these thing unto the eleven and to all the
rest

24:10 it wa mari magdalen and joanna and mari the mother of jame
and other women that were with them which told these thing unto the
apostl

24:11 and their word seem to them as idl tale and they believ
them not

24:12 then aros peter and ran unto the sepulchre; and stoop down
he beheld the linen cloth laid by themselv and depart
wonder in himself at that which wa come to pass

24:13 and behold two of them went that same day to a villag call
emmau which wa from jerusalem about threescor furlong

24:14 and they talk togeth of all these thing which had happen

24:15 and it came to pass that while they commun togeth and
reason jesu himself drew near and went with them

24:16 but their eye were holden that they should not know him

24:17 and he said unto them what manner of commun are these
that ye have one to anoth as ye walk and are sad? 24:18 and the
one of them whose name wa cleopa answer said unto him art thou
onli a stranger in jerusalem and hast not known the thing which are
come to pass there in these days? 24:19 and he said unto them what
things? and they said unto him concern jesu of nazareth which
wa a prophet mighti in deed and word befor god and all the people:
24:20 and how the chief priest and our ruler deliv him to be
condemn to death and have crucifi him

24:21 but we trust that it had been he which should have redeem
israel: and besid all thi to day is the third day sinc these
thing were done

24:22 yea and certain women also of our compani made us astonish
which were earli at the sepulchre; 24:23 and when they found not hi
bodi they came say that they had also seen a vision of angel
which said that he wa aliv

24:24 and certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchr
and found it even so as the women had said: but him they saw not

24:25 then he said unto them o fool and slow of heart to believ
all that the prophet have spoken: 24:26 ought not christ to have
suffer these thing and to enter into hi glory? 24:27 and
begin at mose and all the prophet he expound unto them in all
the scriptur the thing concern himself

24:28 and they drew nigh unto the villag whither they went: and he
made as though he would have gone further

24:29 but they constrain him say abid with us: for it is
toward even and the day is far spent and he went in to tarri with
them

24:30 and it came to pass as he sat at meat with them he took bread
and bless it and brake and gave to them

24:31 and their eye were open and they knew him; and he vanish
out of their sight

24:32 and they said one to anoth did not our heart burn within us
while he talk with us by the way and while he open to us the
scriptures? 24:33 and they rose up the same hour and return to
jerusalem and found the eleven gather togeth and them that were
with them 24:34 say the lord is risen inde and hath appear
to simon

24:35 and they told what thing were done in the way and how he wa
known of them in break of bread

24:36 and as they thu spake jesu himself stood in the midst of
them and saith unto them peac be unto you

24:37 but they were terrifi and affright and suppos that they
had seen a spirit

24:38 and he said unto them whi are ye troubled? and whi do thought
aris in your hearts? 24:39 behold my hand and my feet that it is i
myself: handl me and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bone as
ye see me have

24:40 and when he had thu spoken he shew them hi hand and hi
feet

24:41 and while they yet believ not for joy and wonder he said
unto them have ye here ani meat? 24:42 and they gave him a piec of
a broil fish and of an honeycomb

24:43 and he took it and did eat befor them

24:44 and he said unto them these are the word which i spake unto
you while i wa yet with you that all thing must be fulfil
which were written in the law of mose and in the prophet and in
the psalm concern me

24:45 then open he their understand that they might understand
the scriptur 24:46 and said unto them thu it is written and thu
it behov christ to suffer and to rise from the dead the third day:
24:47 and that repent and remiss of sin should be preach in
hi name among all nation begin at jerusalem

24:48 and ye are wit of these thing

24:49 and behold i send the promis of my father upon you: but tarri
ye in the citi of jerusalem until ye be endu with power from on
high

24:50 and he led them out as far as to bethani and he lift up hi
hand and bless them

24:51 and it came to pass while he bless them he wa part from
them and carri up into heaven

24:52 and they worship him and return to jerusalem with great
joy: 24:53 and were continu in the templ prais and bless
god amen



the gospel accord to saint john


1:1 in the begin wa the word and the word wa with god and the
word wa god

1:2 the same wa in the begin with god

1:3 all thing were made by him; and without him wa not ani thing
made that wa made

1:4 in him wa life; and the life wa the light of men

1:5 and the light shineth in darkness; and the dark comprehend
it not

1:6 there wa a man sent from god whose name wa john

1:7 the same came for a wit to bear wit of the light that
all men through him might believ

1:8 he wa not that light but wa sent to bear wit of that light

1:9 that wa the true light which lighteth everi man that cometh into
the world

1:10 he wa in the world and the world wa made by him and the world
knew him not

1:11 he came unto hi own and hi own receiv him not

1:12 but as mani as receiv him to them gave he power to becom the
son of god even to them that believ on hi name: 1:13 which were
born not of blood nor of the will of the flesh nor of the will of
man but of god

1:14 and the word wa made flesh and dwelt among us (and we beheld
hi glori the glori as of the onli begotten of the father) full of
grace and truth

1:15 john bare wit of him and cri say thi wa he of whom
i spake he that cometh after me is prefer befor me: for he wa
befor me

1:16 and of hi ful have all we receiv and grace for grace

1:17 for the law wa given by mose but grace and truth came by jesu
christ

1:18 no man hath seen god at ani time the onli begotten son which is
in the bosom of the father he hath declar him

1:19 and thi is the record of john when the jew sent priest and
levit from jerusalem to ask him who art thou? 1:20 and he
confess and deni not; but confess i am not the christ

1:21 and they ask him what then? art thou elias? and he saith i am
not art thou that prophet? and he answer no

1:22 then said they unto him who art thou? that we may give an answer
to them that sent us what sayest thou of thyself? 1:23 he said i am
the voic of one cri in the wilder make straight the way of
the lord as said the prophet esaia

1:24 and they which were sent were of the pharise

1:25 and they ask him and said unto him whi baptizest thou then
if thou be not that christ nor elia neither that prophet? 1:26
john answer them say i baptiz with water: but there standeth
one among you whom ye know not; 1:27 he it is who come after me is
prefer befor me whose shoe latchet i am not worthi to unloos

1:28 these thing were done in bethabara beyond jordan where john wa
baptiz

1:29 the next day john seeth jesu come unto him and saith behold
the lamb of god which taketh away the sin of the world

1:30 thi is he of whom i said after me cometh a man which is
prefer befor me: for he wa befor me

1:31 and i knew him not: but that he should be made manifest to
israel therefor am i come baptiz with water

1:32 and john bare record say i saw the spirit descend from
heaven like a dove and it abod upon him

1:33 and i knew him not: but he that sent me to baptiz with water
the same said unto me upon whom thou shalt see the spirit descend
and remain on him the same is he which baptizeth with the holi
ghost

1:34 and i saw and bare record that thi is the son of god

1:35 again the next day after john stood and two of hi disciples;
1:36 and look upon jesu as he walk he saith behold the lamb of
god! 1:37 and the two discipl heard him speak and they follow
jesu

1:38 then jesu turn and saw them follow and saith unto them
what seek ye? they said unto him rabbi (which is to say be
interpret master) where dwellest thou? 1:39 he saith unto them
come and see they came and saw where he dwelt and abod with him
that day: for it wa about the tenth hour

1:40 one of the two which heard john speak and follow him wa
andrew simon peter brother

1:41 he first findeth hi own brother simon and saith unto him we
have found the messia which is be interpret the christ

1:42 and he brought him to jesu and when jesu beheld him he said
thou art simon the son of jona: thou shalt be call cepha which is
by interpret a stone

1:43 the day follow jesu would go forth into galile and findeth
philip and saith unto him follow me

1:44 now philip wa of bethsaida the citi of andrew and peter

1:45 philip findeth nathanael and saith unto him we have found him
of whom mose in the law and the prophet did write jesu of
nazareth the son of joseph

1:46 and nathanael said unto him can there ani good thing come out of
nazareth? philip saith unto him come and see

1:47 jesu saw nathanael come to him and saith of him behold an
israelit inde in whom is no guile! 1:48 nathanael saith unto him
whenc knowest thou me? jesu answer and said unto him befor that
philip call thee when thou wast under the fig tree i saw thee

1:49 nathanael answer and saith unto him rabbi thou art the son of
god; thou art the king of israel

1:50 jesu answer and said unto him becaus i said unto thee i saw
thee under the fig tree believest thou? thou shalt see greater thing
than these

1:51 and he saith unto him verili verili i say unto you hereaft
ye shall see heaven open and the angel of god ascend and
descend upon the son of man

2:1 and the third day there wa a marriag in cana of galilee; and the
mother of jesu wa there: 2:2 and both jesu wa call and hi
discipl to the marriag

2:3 and when they want wine the mother of jesu saith unto him
they have no wine

2:4 jesu saith unto her woman what have i to do with thee? mine
hour is not yet come

2:5 hi mother saith unto the servant whatsoev he saith unto you
do it

2:6 and there were set there six waterpot of stone after the manner
of the purifi of the jew contain two or three firkin apiec

2:7 jesu saith unto them fill the waterpot with water and they
fill them up to the brim

2:8 and he saith unto them draw out now and bear unto the governor
of the feast and they bare it

2:9 when the ruler of the feast had tast the water that wa made
wine and knew not whenc it was: (but the servant which drew the
water knew;) the governor of the feast call the bridegroom 2:10 and
saith unto him everi man at the begin doth set forth good wine;
and when men have well drunk then that which is worse: but thou hast
kept the good wine until now

2:11 thi begin of miracl did jesu in cana of galile and
manifest forth hi glory; and hi discipl believ on him

2:12 after thi he went down to capernaum he and hi mother and hi
brethren and hi disciples: and they continu there not mani day

2:13 and the jew passov wa at hand and jesu went up to
jerusalem

2:14 and found in the templ those that sold oxen and sheep and dove
and the changer of money sitting: 2:15 and when he had made a scourg
of small cord he drove them all out of the templ and the sheep
and the oxen; and pour out the changer money and overthrew the
tables; 2:16 and said unto them that sold dove take these thing
hence; make not my father hous an hous of merchandis

2:17 and hi discipl rememb that it wa written the zeal of
thine hous hath eaten me up

2:18 then answer the jew and said unto him what sign shewest thou
unto us see that thou doest these things? 2:19 jesu answer and
said unto them destroy thi templ and in three day i will rais it
up

2:20 then said the jew forti and six year wa thi templ in
build and wilt thou rear it up in three days? 2:21 but he spake
of the templ of hi bodi

2:22 when therefor he wa risen from the dead hi discipl
rememb that he had said thi unto them; and they believ the
scriptur and the word which jesu had said

2:23 now when he wa in jerusalem at the passov in the feast day
mani believ in hi name when they saw the miracl which he did

2:24 but jesu did not commit himself unto them becaus he knew all
men 2:25 and need not that ani should testifi of man: for he knew
what wa in man

3:1 there wa a man of the pharise name nicodemu a ruler of the
jews: 3:2 the same came to jesu by night and said unto him rabbi
we know that thou art a teacher come from god: for no man can do these
miracl that thou doest except god be with him

3:3 jesu answer and said unto him verili verili i say unto thee
except a man be born again he cannot see the kingdom of god

3:4 nicodemu saith unto him how can a man be born when he is old?
can he enter the second time into hi mother womb and be born? 3:5
jesu answer verili verili i say unto thee except a man be born
of water and of the spirit he cannot enter into the kingdom of god

3:6 that which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born
of the spirit is spirit

3:7 marvel not that i said unto thee ye must be born again

3:8 the wind bloweth where it listeth and thou hearest the sound
thereof but canst not tell whenc it cometh and whither it goeth: so
is everi one that is born of the spirit

3:9 nicodemu answer and said unto him how can these thing be?
3:10 jesu answer and said unto him art thou a master of israel
and knowest not these things? 3:11 verili verili i say unto thee
we speak that we do know and testifi that we have seen; and ye
receiv not our wit

3:12 if i have told you earthli thing and ye believ not how shall
ye believ if i tell you of heavenli things? 3:13 and no man hath
ascend up to heaven but he that came down from heaven even the son
of man which is in heaven

3:14 and as mose lift up the serpent in the wilder even so
must the son of man be lift up: 3:15 that whosoev believeth in him
should not perish but have etern life

3:16 for god so love the world that he gave hi onli begotten son
that whosoev believeth in him should not perish but have
everlast life

3:17 for god sent not hi son into the world to condemn the world; but
that the world through him might be save

3:18 he that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth
not is condemn alreadi becaus he hath not believ in the name of
the onli begotten son of god

3:19 and thi is the condemn that light is come into the world
and men love dark rather than light becaus their deed were
evil

3:20 for everi one that doeth evil hateth the light neither cometh to
the light lest hi deed should be reprov

3:21 but he that doeth truth cometh to the light that hi deed may
be made manifest that they are wrought in god

3:22 after these thing came jesu and hi discipl into the land of
judaea; and there he tarri with them and baptiz

3:23 and john also wa baptiz in aenon near to salim becaus there
wa much water there: and they came and were baptiz

3:24 for john wa not yet cast into prison

3:25 then there aros a question between some of john discipl and
the jew about purifi

3:26 and they came unto john and said unto him rabbi he that wa
with thee beyond jordan to whom thou barest wit behold the same
baptizeth and all men come to him

3:27 john answer and said a man can receiv noth except it be
given him from heaven

3:28 ye yourselv bear me wit that i said i am not the christ
but that i am sent befor him

3:29 he that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the
bridegroom which standeth and heareth him rejoiceth greatli becaus
of the bridegroom voice: thi my joy therefor is fulfil

3:30 he must increas but i must decreas

3:31 he that cometh from abov is abov all: he that is of the earth
is earthli and speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is
abov all

3:32 and what he hath seen and heard that he testifieth; and no man
receiveth hi testimoni

3:33 he that hath receiv hi testimoni hath set to hi seal that god
is true

3:34 for he whom god hath sent speaketh the word of god: for god
giveth not the spirit by measur unto him

3:35 the father loveth the son and hath given all thing into hi
hand

3:36 he that believeth on the son hath everlast life: and he that
believeth not the son shall not see life; but the wrath of god abideth
on him

4:1 when therefor the lord knew how the pharise had heard that
jesu made and baptiz more discipl than john 4:2 (though jesu
himself baptiz not but hi disciples) 4:3 he left judaea and
depart again into galile

4:4 and he must need go through samaria

4:5 then cometh he to a citi of samaria which is call sychar near
to the parcel of ground that jacob gave to hi son joseph

4:6 now jacob well wa there jesu therefor be weari with
hi journey sat thu on the well: and it wa about the sixth hour

4:7 there cometh a woman of samaria to draw water: jesu saith unto
her give me to drink

4:8 (for hi discipl were gone away unto the citi to buy meat) 4:9
then saith the woman of samaria unto him how is it that thou be a
jew askest drink of me which am a woman of samaria? for the jew
have no deal with the samaritan

4:10 jesu answer and said unto her if thou knewest the gift of
god and who it is that saith to thee give me to drink; thou wouldest
have ask of him and he would have given thee live water

4:11 the woman saith unto him sir thou hast noth to draw with
and the well is deep: from whenc then hast thou that live water?
4:12 art thou greater than our father jacob which gave us the well
and drank thereof himself and hi children and hi cattle? 4:13
jesu answer and said unto her whosoev drinketh of thi water
shall thirst again: 4:14 but whosoev drinketh of the water that i
shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that i shall give him
shall be in him a well of water spring up into everlast life

4:15 the woman saith unto him sir give me thi water that i thirst
not neither come hither to draw

4:16 jesu saith unto her go call thi husband and come hither

4:17 the woman answer and said i have no husband jesu said unto
her thou hast well said i have no husband: 4:18 for thou hast had
five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thi husband: in that
saidst thou truli

4:19 the woman saith unto him sir i perceiv that thou art a
prophet

4:20 our father worship in thi mountain; and ye say that in
jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship

4:21 jesu saith unto her woman believ me the hour cometh when ye
shall neither in thi mountain nor yet at jerusalem worship the
father

4:22 ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for
salvat is of the jew

4:23 but the hour cometh and now is when the true worshipp shall
worship the father in spirit and in truth: for the father seeketh such
to worship him

4:24 god is a spirit: and they that worship him must worship him in
spirit and in truth

4:25 the woman saith unto him i know that messia cometh which is
call christ: when he is come he will tell us all thing

4:26 jesu saith unto her i that speak unto thee am he

4:27 and upon thi came hi discipl and marvel that he talk
with the woman: yet no man said what seekest thou? or whi talkest
thou with her? 4:28 the woman then left her waterpot and went her
way into the citi and saith to the men 4:29 come see a man which
told me all thing that ever i did: is not thi the christ? 4:30 then
they went out of the citi and came unto him

4:31 in the mean while hi discipl pray him say master eat

4:32 but he said unto them i have meat to eat that ye know not of

4:33 therefor said the discipl one to anoth hath ani man brought
him ought to eat? 4:34 jesu saith unto them my meat is to do the
will of him that sent me and to finish hi work

4:35 say not ye there are yet four month and then cometh harvest?
behold i say unto you lift up your eye and look on the fields; for
they are white alreadi to harvest

4:36 and he that reapeth receiveth wage and gathereth fruit unto
life eternal: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoic
togeth

4:37 and herein is that say true one soweth and anoth reapeth

4:38 i sent you to reap that whereon ye bestow no labour: other men
labour and ye are enter into their labour

4:39 and mani of the samaritan of that citi believ on him for the
say of the woman which testifi he told me all that ever i did

4:40 so when the samaritan were come unto him they besought him that
he would tarri with them: and he abod there two day

4:41 and mani more believ becaus of hi own word; 4:42 and said
unto the woman now we believ not becaus of thi saying: for we have
heard him ourselv and know that thi is inde the christ the
saviour of the world

4:43 now after two day he depart thenc and went into galile

4:44 for jesu himself testifi that a prophet hath no honour in hi
own countri

4:45 then when he wa come into galile the galilaean receiv him
have seen all the thing that he did at jerusalem at the feast: for
they also went unto the feast

4:46 so jesu came again into cana of galile where he made the water
wine and there wa a certain nobleman whose son wa sick at
capernaum

4:47 when he heard that jesu wa come out of judaea into galile he
went unto him and besought him that he would come down and heal hi
son: for he wa at the point of death

4:48 then said jesu unto him except ye see sign and wonder ye
will not believ

4:49 the nobleman saith unto him sir come down ere my child die

4:50 jesu saith unto him go thi way; thi son liveth and the man
believ the word that jesu had spoken unto him and he went hi way

4:51 and as he wa now go down hi servant met him and told him
say thi son liveth

4:52 then enquir he of them the hour when he began to amend and
they said unto him yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him

4:53 so the father knew that it wa at the same hour in the which
jesu said unto him thi son liveth: and himself believ and hi
whole hous

4:54 thi is again the second miracl that jesu did when he wa come
out of judaea into galile

5:1 after thi there wa a feast of the jews; and jesu went up to
jerusalem

5:2 now there is at jerusalem by the sheep market a pool which is
call in the hebrew tongu bethesda have five porch

5:3 in these lay a great multitud of impot folk of blind halt
wither wait for the move of the water

5:4 for an angel went down at a certain season into the pool and
troubl the water: whosoev then first after the troubl of the
water step in wa made whole of whatsoev diseas he had

5:5 and a certain man wa there which had an infirm thirti and
eight year

5:6 when jesu saw him lie and knew that he had been now a long time
in that case he saith unto him wilt thou be made whole? 5:7 the
impot man answer him sir i have no man when the water is
troubl to put me into the pool: but while i am come anoth
steppeth down befor me

5:8 jesu saith unto him rise take up thi bed and walk

5:9 and immedi the man wa made whole and took up hi bed and
walked: and on the same day wa the sabbath

5:10 the jew therefor said unto him that wa cure it is the
sabbath day: it is not law for thee to carri thi bed

5:11 he answer them he that made me whole the same said unto me
take up thi bed and walk

5:12 then ask they him what man is that which said unto thee take
up thi bed and walk? 5:13 and he that wa heal wist not who it
was: for jesu had convey himself away a multitud be in that
place

5:14 afterward jesu findeth him in the templ and said unto him
behold thou art made whole: sin no more lest a wors thing come unto
thee

5:15 the man depart and told the jew that it wa jesu which had
made him whole

5:16 and therefor did the jew persecut jesu and sought to slay
him becaus he had done these thing on the sabbath day

5:17 but jesu answer them my father worketh hitherto and i work

5:18 therefor the jew sought the more to kill him becaus he not
onli had broken the sabbath but said also that god wa hi father
make himself equal with god

5:19 then answer jesu and said unto them verili verili i say
unto you the son can do noth of himself but what he seeth the
father do: for what thing soever he doeth these also doeth the son
likewis

5:20 for the father loveth the son and sheweth him all thing that
himself doeth: and he will shew him greater work than these that ye
may marvel

5:21 for as the father raiseth up the dead and quickeneth them; even
so the son quickeneth whom he will

5:22 for the father judgeth no man but hath commit all judgment
unto the son: 5:23 that all men should honour the son even as they
honour the father

he that honoureth not the son honoureth not the father which hath sent
him

5:24 verili verili i say unto you he that heareth my word and
believeth on him that sent me hath everlast life and shall not
come into condemnation; but is pass from death unto life

5:25 verili verili i say unto you the hour is come and now is
when the dead shall hear the voic of the son of god: and they that
hear shall live

5:26 for as the father hath life in himself; so hath he given to the
son to have life in himself; 5:27 and hath given him author to
execut judgment also becaus he is the son of man

5:28 marvel not at this: for the hour is come in the which all that
are in the grave shall hear hi voic 5:29 and shall come forth;
they that have done good unto the resurrect of life; and they that
have done evil unto the resurrect of damnat

5:30 i can of mine own self do nothing: as i hear i judge: and my
judgment is just; becaus i seek not mine own will but the will of
the father which hath sent me

5:31 if i bear wit of myself my wit is not true

5:32 there is anoth that beareth wit of me; and i know that the
wit which he witnesseth of me is true

5:33 ye sent unto john and he bare wit unto the truth

5:34 but i receiv not testimoni from man: but these thing i say
that ye might be save

5:35 he wa a burn and a shine light: and ye were will for a
season to rejoic in hi light

5:36 but i have greater wit than that of john: for the work which
the father hath given me to finish the same work that i do bear
wit of me that the father hath sent me

5:37 and the father himself which hath sent me hath born wit of
me

ye have neither heard hi voic at ani time nor seen hi shape

5:38 and ye have not hi word abid in you: for whom he hath sent
him ye believ not

5:39 search the scriptures; for in them ye think ye have etern life:
and they are they which testifi of me

5:40 and ye will not come to me that ye might have life

5:41 i receiv not honour from men

5:42 but i know you that ye have not the love of god in you

5:43 i am come in my father name and ye receiv me not: if anoth
shall come in hi own name him ye will receiv

5:44 how can ye believ which receiv honour one of anoth and seek
not the honour that cometh from god only? 5:45 do not think that i
will accus you to the father: there is one that accuseth you even
mose in whom ye trust

5:46 for had ye believ mose ye would have believ me; for he
wrote of me

5:47 but if ye believ not hi write how shall ye believ my
words? 6:1 after these thing jesu went over the sea of galile
which is the sea of tiberia

6:2 and a great multitud follow him becaus they saw hi miracl
which he did on them that were diseas

6:3 and jesu went up into a mountain and there he sat with hi
discipl

6:4 and the passov a feast of the jew wa nigh

6:5 when jesu then lift up hi eye and saw a great compani come
unto him he saith unto philip whenc shall we buy bread that these
may eat? 6:6 and thi he said to prove him: for he himself knew what
he would do

6:7 philip answer him two hundr pennyworth of bread is not
suffici for them that everi one of them may take a littl

6:8 one of hi discipl andrew simon peter brother saith unto
him 6:9 there is a lad here which hath five barley loav and two
small fishes: but what are they among so many? 6:10 and jesu said
make the men sit down now there wa much grass in the place so the
men sat down in number about five thousand

6:11 and jesu took the loaves; and when he had given thank he
distribut to the discipl and the discipl to them that were set
down; and likewis of the fish as much as they would

6:12 when they were fill he said unto hi discipl gather up the
fragment that remain that noth be lost

6:13 therefor they gather them togeth and fill twelv basket
with the fragment of the five barley loav which remain over and
abov unto them that had eaten

6:14 then those men when they had seen the miracl that jesu did
said thi is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world

6:15 when jesu therefor perceiv that they would come and take him
by forc to make him a king he depart again into a mountain
himself alon

6:16 and when even wa now come hi discipl went down unto the sea
6:17 and enter into a ship and went over the sea toward capernaum
and it wa now dark and jesu wa not come to them

6:18 and the sea aros by reason of a great wind that blew

6:19 so when they had row about five and twenti or thirti furlong
they see jesu walk on the sea and draw nigh unto the ship: and
they were afraid

6:20 but he saith unto them it is i; be not afraid

6:21 then they willingli receiv him into the ship: and immedi
the ship wa at the land whither they went

6:22 the day follow when the peopl which stood on the other side
of the sea saw that there wa none other boat there save that one
whereinto hi discipl were enter and that jesu went not with hi
discipl into the boat but that hi discipl were gone away alone;
6:23 (howbeit there came other boat from tiberia nigh unto the place
where they did eat bread after that the lord had given thanks:) 6:24
when the peopl therefor saw that jesu wa not there neither hi
discipl they also took ship and came to capernaum seek for
jesu

6:25 and when they had found him on the other side of the sea they
said unto him rabbi when camest thou hither? 6:26 jesu answer
them and said verili verili i say unto you ye seek me not becaus
ye saw the miracl but becaus ye did eat of the loav and were
fill

6:27 labour not for the meat which perisheth but for that meat which
endureth unto everlast life which the son of man shall give unto
you: for him hath god the father seal

6:28 then said they unto him what shall we do that we might work the
work of god? 6:29 jesu answer and said unto them thi is the
work of god that ye believ on him whom he hath sent

6:30 they said therefor unto him what sign shewest thou then that
we may see and believ thee? what dost thou work? 6:31 our father
did eat manna in the desert; as it is written he gave them bread from
heaven to eat

6:32 then jesu said unto them verili verili i say unto you mose
gave you not that bread from heaven; but my father giveth you the true
bread from heaven

6:33 for the bread of god is he which cometh down from heaven and
giveth life unto the world

6:34 then said they unto him lord evermor give us thi bread

6:35 and jesu said unto them i am the bread of life: he that cometh
to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never
thirst

6:36 but i said unto you that ye also have seen me and believ not

6:37 all that the father giveth me shall come to me; and him that
cometh to me i will in no wise cast out

6:38 for i came down from heaven not to do mine own will but the
will of him that sent me

6:39 and thi is the father will which hath sent me that of all
which he hath given me i should lose noth but should rais it up
again at the last day

6:40 and thi is the will of him that sent me that everi one which
seeth the son and believeth on him may have everlast life: and i
will rais him up at the last day

6:41 the jew then murmur at him becaus he said i am the bread
which came down from heaven

6:42 and they said is not thi jesu the son of joseph whose father
and mother we know? how is it then that he saith i came down from
heaven? 6:43 jesu therefor answer and said unto them murmur not
among yourselv

6:44 no man can come to me except the father which hath sent me draw
him: and i will rais him up at the last day

6:45 it is written in the prophet and they shall be all taught of
god

everi man therefor that hath heard and hath learn of the father
cometh unto me

6:46 not that ani man hath seen the father save he which is of god
he hath seen the father

6:47 verili verili i say unto you he that believeth on me hath
everlast life

6:48 i am that bread of life

6:49 your father did eat manna in the wilder and are dead

6:50 thi is the bread which cometh down from heaven that a man may
eat thereof and not die

6:51 i am the live bread which came down from heaven: if ani man eat
of thi bread he shall live for ever: and the bread that i will give
is my flesh which i will give for the life of the world

6:52 the jew therefor strove among themselv say how can thi
man give us hi flesh to eat? 6:53 then jesu said unto them verili
verili i say unto you except ye eat the flesh of the son of man and
drink hi blood ye have no life in you

6:54 whoso eateth my flesh and drinketh my blood hath etern life;
and i will rais him up at the last day

6:55 for my flesh is meat inde and my blood is drink inde

6:56 he that eateth my flesh and drinketh my blood dwelleth in me
and i in him

6:57 as the live father hath sent me and i live by the father: so
he that eateth me even he shall live by me

6:58 thi is that bread which came down from heaven: not as your
father did eat manna and are dead: he that eateth of thi bread
shall live for ever

6:59 these thing said he in the synagogu as he taught in capernaum

6:60 mani therefor of hi discipl when they had heard thi said
thi is an hard saying; who can hear it? 6:61 when jesu knew in
himself that hi discipl murmur at it he said unto them doth
thi offend you? 6:62 what and if ye shall see the son of man ascend
up where he wa before? 6:63 it is the spirit that quickeneth; the
flesh profiteth nothing: the word that i speak unto you they are
spirit and they are life

6:64 but there are some of you that believ not for jesu knew from
the begin who they were that believ not and who should betray
him

6:65 and he said therefor said i unto you that no man can come unto
me except it were given unto him of my father

6:66 from that time mani of hi discipl went back and walk no
more with him

6:67 then said jesu unto the twelv will ye also go away? 6:68 then
simon peter answer him lord to whom shall we go? thou hast the
word of etern life

6:69 and we believ and are sure that thou art that christ the son of
the live god

6:70 jesu answer them have not i chosen you twelv and one of you
is a devil? 6:71 he spake of juda iscariot the son of simon: for he
it wa that should betray him be one of the twelv

7:1 after these thing jesu walk in galilee: for he would not walk
in jewri becaus the jew sought to kill him

7:2 now the jew feast of tabernacl wa at hand

7:3 hi brethren therefor said unto him depart henc and go into
judaea that thi discipl also may see the work that thou doest

7:4 for there is no man that doeth ani thing in secret and he himself
seeketh to be known openli if thou do these thing shew thyself to
the world

7:5 for neither did hi brethren believ in him

7:6 then jesu said unto them my time is not yet come: but your time
is alway readi

7:7 the world cannot hate you; but me it hateth becaus i testifi of
it that the work thereof are evil

7:8 go ye up unto thi feast: i go not up yet unto thi feast: for my
time is not yet full come

7:9 when he had said these word unto them he abod still in galile

7:10 but when hi brethren were gone up then went he also up unto the
feast not openli but as it were in secret

7:11 then the jew sought him at the feast and said where is he?
7:12 and there wa much murmur among the peopl concern him: for
some said he is a good man: other said nay; but he deceiveth the
peopl

7:13 howbeit no man spake openli of him for fear of the jew

7:14 now about the midst of the feast jesu went up into the templ
and taught

7:15 and the jew marvel say how knoweth thi man letter
have never learned? 7:16 jesu answer them and said my doctrin
is not mine but hi that sent me

7:17 if ani man will do hi will he shall know of the doctrin
whether it be of god or whether i speak of myself

7:18 he that speaketh of himself seeketh hi own glory: but he that
seeketh hi glori that sent him the same is true and no
unright is in him

7:19 did not mose give you the law and yet none of you keepeth the
law? whi go ye about to kill me? 7:20 the peopl answer and said
thou hast a devil: who goeth about to kill thee? 7:21 jesu answer
and said unto them i have done one work and ye all marvel

7:22 mose therefor gave unto you circumcision; (not becaus it is of
mose but of the fathers;) and ye on the sabbath day circumcis a
man

7:23 if a man on the sabbath day receiv circumcis that the law of
mose should not be broken; are ye angri at me becaus i have made a
man everi whit whole on the sabbath day? 7:24 judg not accord to
the appear but judg righteou judgment

7:25 then said some of them of jerusalem is not thi he whom they
seek to kill? 7:26 but lo he speaketh boldli and they say noth
unto him do the ruler know inde that thi is the veri christ?
7:27 howbeit we know thi man whenc he is: but when christ cometh no
man knoweth whenc he is

7:28 then cri jesu in the templ as he taught say ye both know
me and ye know whenc i am: and i am not come of myself but he that
sent me is true whom ye know not

7:29 but i know him: for i am from him and he hath sent me

7:30 then they sought to take him: but no man laid hand on him
becaus hi hour wa not yet come

7:31 and mani of the peopl believ on him and said when christ
cometh will he do more miracl than these which thi man hath done?
7:32 the pharise heard that the peopl murmur such thing
concern him; and the pharise and the chief priest sent offic
to take him

7:33 then said jesu unto them yet a littl while am i with you and
then i go unto him that sent me

7:34 ye shall seek me and shall not find me: and where i am thither
ye cannot come

7:35 then said the jew among themselv whither will he go that we
shall not find him? will he go unto the dispers among the gentil
and teach the gentiles? 7:36 what manner of say is thi that he
said ye shall seek me and shall not find me: and where i am thither
ye cannot come? 7:37 in the last day that great day of the feast
jesu stood and cri say if ani man thirst let him come unto
me and drink

7:38 he that believeth on me as the scriptur hath said out of hi
belli shall flow river of live water

7:39 (but thi spake he of the spirit which they that believ on him
should receive: for the holi ghost wa not yet given; becaus that
jesu wa not yet glorified) 7:40 mani of the peopl therefor when
they heard thi say said of a truth thi is the prophet

7:41 other said thi is the christ but some said shall christ come
out of galilee? 7:42 hath not the scriptur said that christ cometh
of the seed of david and out of the town of bethlehem where david
was? 7:43 so there wa a divis among the peopl becaus of him

7:44 and some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hand on
him

7:45 then came the offic to the chief priest and pharisees; and
they said unto them whi have ye not brought him? 7:46 the offic
answer never man spake like thi man

7:47 then answer them the pharise are ye also deceived? 7:48
have ani of the ruler or of the pharise believ on him? 7:49 but
thi peopl who knoweth not the law are curs

7:50 nicodemu saith unto them (he that came to jesu by night be
one of them) 7:51 doth our law judg ani man befor it hear him and
know what he doeth? 7:52 they answer and said unto him art thou
also of galilee? search and look: for out of galile ariseth no
prophet

7:53 and everi man went unto hi own hous

8:1 jesu went unto the mount of oliv

8:2 and earli in the morn he came again into the templ and all
the peopl came unto him; and he sat down and taught them

8:3 and the scribe and pharise brought unto him a woman taken in
adultery; and when they had set her in the midst 8:4 they say unto
him master thi woman wa taken in adulteri in the veri act

8:5 now mose in the law command us that such should be stoned: but
what sayest thou? 8:6 thi they said tempt him that they might
have to accus him but jesu stoop down and with hi finger wrote
on the ground as though he heard them not

8:7 so when they continu ask him he lift up himself and said
unto them he that is without sin among you let him first cast a
stone at her

8:8 and again he stoop down and wrote on the ground

8:9 and they which heard it be convict by their own conscienc
went out one by one begin at the eldest even unto the last: and
jesu wa left alon and the woman stand in the midst

8:10 when jesu had lift up himself and saw none but the woman he
said unto her woman where are those thine accusers? hath no man
condemn thee? 8:11 she said no man lord and jesu said unto her
neither do i condemn thee: go and sin no more

8:12 then spake jesu again unto them say i am the light of the
world: he that followeth me shall not walk in dark but shall have
the light of life

8:13 the pharise therefor said unto him thou bearest record of
thyself; thi record is not true

8:14 jesu answer and said unto them though i bear record of
myself yet my record is true: for i know whenc i came and whither i
go; but ye cannot tell whenc i come and whither i go

8:15 ye judg after the flesh; i judg no man

8:16 and yet if i judg my judgment is true: for i am not alon but
i and the father that sent me

8:17 it is also written in your law that the testimoni of two men is
true

8:18 i am one that bear wit of myself and the father that sent me
beareth wit of me

8:19 then said they unto him where is thi father? jesu answer ye
neither know me nor my father: if ye had known me ye should have
known my father also

8:20 these word spake jesu in the treasuri as he taught in the
temple: and no man laid hand on him; for hi hour wa not yet come

8:21 then said jesu again unto them i go my way and ye shall seek
me and shall die in your sins: whither i go ye cannot come

8:22 then said the jew will he kill himself? becaus he saith
whither i go ye cannot come

8:23 and he said unto them ye are from beneath; i am from above: ye
are of thi world; i am not of thi world

8:24 i said therefor unto you that ye shall die in your sins: for if
ye believ not that i am he ye shall die in your sin

8:25 then said they unto him who art thou? and jesu saith unto them
even the same that i said unto you from the begin

8:26 i have mani thing to say and to judg of you: but he that sent
me is true; and i speak to the world those thing which i have heard
of him

8:27 they understood not that he spake to them of the father

8:28 then said jesu unto them when ye have lift up the son of man
then shall ye know that i am he and that i do noth of myself; but
as my father hath taught me i speak these thing

8:29 and he that sent me is with me: the father hath not left me
alone; for i do alway those thing that pleas him

8:30 as he spake these word mani believ on him

8:31 then said jesu to those jew which believ on him if ye
continu in my word then are ye my discipl indeed; 8:32 and ye
shall know the truth and the truth shall make you free

8:33 they answer him we be abraham seed and were never in
bondag to ani man: how sayest thou ye shall be made free? 8:34
jesu answer them verili verili i say unto you whosoev
committeth sin is the servant of sin

8:35 and the servant abideth not in the hous for ever: but the son
abideth ever

8:36 if the son therefor shall make you free ye shall be free
inde

8:37 i know that ye are abraham seed; but ye seek to kill me
becaus my word hath no place in you

8:38 i speak that which i have seen with my father: and ye do that
which ye have seen with your father

8:39 they answer and said unto him abraham is our father jesu
saith unto them if ye were abraham children ye would do the work
of abraham

8:40 but now ye seek to kill me a man that hath told you the truth
which i have heard of god: thi did not abraham

8:41 ye do the deed of your father then said they to him we be not
born of fornication; we have one father even god

8:42 jesu said unto them if god were your father ye would love me:
for i proceed forth and came from god; neither came i of myself but
he sent me

8:43 whi do ye not understand my speech? even becaus ye cannot hear
my word

8:44 ye are of your father the devil and the lust of your father ye
will do he wa a murder from the begin and abod not in the
truth becaus there is no truth in him when he speaketh a lie he
speaketh of hi own: for he is a liar and the father of it

8:45 and becaus i tell you the truth ye believ me not

8:46 which of you convinceth me of sin? and if i say the truth whi do
ye not believ me? 8:47 he that is of god heareth god words: ye
therefor hear them not becaus ye are not of god

8:48 then answer the jew and said unto him say we not well that
thou art a samaritan and hast a devil? 8:49 jesu answer i have
not a devil; but i honour my father and ye do dishonour me

8:50 and i seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and
judgeth

8:51 verili verili i say unto you if a man keep my say he shall
never see death

8:52 then said the jew unto him now we know that thou hast a devil

abraham is dead and the prophets; and thou sayest if a man keep my
say he shall never tast of death

8:53 art thou greater than our father abraham which is dead? and the
prophet are dead: whom makest thou thyself? 8:54 jesu answer if
i honour myself my honour is nothing: it is my father that honoureth
me; of whom ye say that he is your god: 8:55 yet ye have not known
him; but i know him: and if i should say i know him not i shall be a
liar like unto you: but i know him and keep hi say

8:56 your father abraham rejoic to see my day: and he saw it and
wa glad

8:57 then said the jew unto him thou art not yet fifti year old
and hast thou seen abraham? 8:58 jesu said unto them verili
verili i say unto you befor abraham wa i am

8:59 then took they up stone to cast at him: but jesu hid himself
and went out of the templ go through the midst of them and so
pass by

9:1 and as jesu pass by he saw a man which wa blind from hi
birth

9:2 and hi discipl ask him say master who did sin thi
man or hi parent that he wa born blind? 9:3 jesu answer
neither hath thi man sin nor hi parents: but that the work of
god should be made manifest in him

9:4 i must work the work of him that sent me while it is day: the
night cometh when no man can work

9:5 as long as i am in the world i am the light of the world

9:6 when he had thu spoken he spat on the ground and made clay of
the spittl and he anoint the eye of the blind man with the clay
9:7 and said unto him go wash in the pool of siloam (which is by
interpret sent) he went hi way therefor and wash and came
see

9:8 the neighbour therefor and they which befor had seen him that
he wa blind said is not thi he that sat and begged? 9:9 some
said thi is he: other said he is like him: but he said i am he

9:10 therefor said they unto him how were thine eye opened? 9:11
he answer and said a man that is call jesu made clay and
anoint mine eye and said unto me go to the pool of siloam and
wash: and i went and wash and i receiv sight

9:12 then said they unto him where is he? he said i know not

9:13 they brought to the pharise him that aforetim wa blind

9:14 and it wa the sabbath day when jesu made the clay and open
hi eye

9:15 then again the pharise also ask him how he had receiv hi
sight he said unto them he put clay upon mine eye and i wash
and do see

9:16 therefor said some of the pharise thi man is not of god
becaus he keepeth not the sabbath day other said how can a man
that is a sinner do such miracles? and there wa a divis among
them

9:17 they say unto the blind man again what sayest thou of him that
he hath open thine eyes? he said he is a prophet

9:18 but the jew did not believ concern him that he had been
blind and receiv hi sight until they call the parent of him
that had receiv hi sight

9:19 and they ask them say is thi your son who ye say wa
born blind? how then doth he now see? 9:20 hi parent answer them
and said we know that thi is our son and that he wa born blind:
9:21 but by what mean he now seeth we know not; or who hath open
hi eye we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for
himself

9:22 these word spake hi parent becaus they fear the jews: for
the jew had agre alreadi that if ani man did confess that he wa
christ he should be put out of the synagogu

9:23 therefor said hi parent he is of age; ask him

9:24 then again call they the man that wa blind and said unto him
give god the praise: we know that thi man is a sinner

9:25 he answer and said whether he be a sinner or no i know not:
one thing i know that wherea i wa blind now i see

9:26 then said they to him again what did he to thee? how open he
thine eyes? 9:27 he answer them i have told you alreadi and ye
did not hear: wherefor would ye hear it again? will ye also be hi
disciples? 9:28 then they revil him and said thou art hi
disciple; but we are mose discipl

9:29 we know that god spake unto moses: as for thi fellow we know
not from whenc he is

9:30 the man answer and said unto them whi herein is a marvel
thing that ye know not from whenc he is and yet he hath open mine
eye

9:31 now we know that god heareth not sinners: but if ani man be a
worshipp of god and doeth hi will him he heareth

9:32 sinc the world began wa it not heard that ani man open the
eye of one that wa born blind

9:33 if thi man were not of god he could do noth

9:34 they answer and said unto him thou wast altogeth born in
sin and dost thou teach us? and they cast him out

9:35 jesu heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found
him he said unto him dost thou believ on the son of god? 9:36 he
answer and said who is he lord that i might believ on him? 9:37
and jesu said unto him thou hast both seen him and it is he that
talketh with thee

9:38 and he said lord i believ and he worship him

9:39 and jesu said for judgment i am come into thi world that they
which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind

9:40 and some of the pharise which were with him heard these word
and said unto him are we blind also? 9:41 jesu said unto them if
ye were blind ye should have no sin: but now ye say we see;
therefor your sin remaineth

10:1 verili verili i say unto you he that entereth not by the door
into the sheepfold but climbeth up some other way the same is a
thief and a robber

10:2 but he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep

10:3 to him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear hi voice: and he
calleth hi own sheep by name and leadeth them out

10:4 and when he putteth forth hi own sheep he goeth befor them
and the sheep follow him: for they know hi voic

10:5 and a stranger will they not follow but will flee from him: for
they know not the voic of stranger

10:6 thi parabl spake jesu unto them: but they understood not what
thing they were which he spake unto them

10:7 then said jesu unto them again verili verili i say unto you
i am the door of the sheep

10:8 all that ever came befor me are thiev and robbers: but the
sheep did not hear them

10:9 i am the door: by me if ani man enter in he shall be save and
shall go in and out and find pastur

10:10 the thief cometh not but for to steal and to kill and to
destroy: i am come that they might have life and that they might have
it more abundantli

10:11 i am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth hi life for
the sheep

10:12 but he that is an hirel and not the shepherd whose own the
sheep are not seeth the wolf come and leaveth the sheep and
fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them and scattereth the sheep

10:13 the hirel fleeth becaus he is an hirel and careth not
for the sheep

10:14 i am the good shepherd and know my sheep and am known of mine

10:15 as the father knoweth me even so know i the father: and i lay
down my life for the sheep

10:16 and other sheep i have which are not of thi fold: them also i
must bring and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold
and one shepherd

10:17 therefor doth my father love me becaus i lay down my life
that i might take it again

10:18 no man taketh it from me but i lay it down of myself i have
power to lay it down and i have power to take it again thi
command have i receiv of my father

10:19 there wa a divis therefor again among the jew for these
say

10:20 and mani of them said he hath a devil and is mad; whi hear ye
him? 10:21 other said these are not the word of him that hath a
devil can a devil open the eye of the blind? 10:22 and it wa at
jerusalem the feast of the dedic and it wa winter

10:23 and jesu walk in the templ in solomon porch

10:24 then came the jew round about him and said unto him how long
dost thou make us to doubt? if thou be the christ tell us plainli

10:25 jesu answer them i told you and ye believ not: the work
that i do in my father name they bear wit of me

10:26 but ye believ not becaus ye are not of my sheep as i said
unto you

10:27 my sheep hear my voic and i know them and they follow me:
10:28 and i give unto them etern life; and they shall never perish
neither shall ani man pluck them out of my hand

10:29 my father which gave them me is greater than all; and no man
is abl to pluck them out of my father hand

10:30 i and my father are one

10:31 then the jew took up stone again to stone him

10:32 jesu answer them mani good work have i shew you from my
father; for which of those work do ye stone me? 10:33 the jew
answer him say for a good work we stone thee not; but for
blasphemy; and becaus that thou be a man makest thyself god

10:34 jesu answer them is it not written in your law i said ye
are gods? 10:35 if he call them god unto whom the word of god
came and the scriptur cannot be broken; 10:36 say ye of him whom
the father hath sanctifi and sent into the world thou blasphemest;
becaus i said i am the son of god? 10:37 if i do not the work of
my father believ me not

10:38 but if i do though ye believ not me believ the works: that
ye may know and believ that the father is in me and i in him

10:39 therefor they sought again to take him: but he escap out of
their hand 10:40 and went away again beyond jordan into the place
where john at first baptized; and there he abod

10:41 and mani resort unto him and said john did no miracle: but
all thing that john spake of thi man were true

10:42 and mani believ on him there

11:1 now a certain man wa sick name lazaru of bethani the town
of mari and her sister martha

11:2 (it wa that mari which anoint the lord with ointment and
wipe hi feet with her hair whose brother lazaru wa sick) 11:3
therefor hi sister sent unto him say lord behold he whom
thou lovest is sick

11:4 when jesu heard that he said thi sick is not unto death
but for the glori of god that the son of god might be glorifi
therebi

11:5 now jesu love martha and her sister and lazaru

11:6 when he had heard therefor that he wa sick he abod two day
still in the same place where he wa

11:7 then after that saith he to hi discipl let us go into judaea
again

11:8 hi discipl say unto him master the jew of late sought to
stone thee; and goest thou thither again? 11:9 jesu answer are
there not twelv hour in the day? if ani man walk in the day he
stumbleth not becaus he seeth the light of thi world

11:10 but if a man walk in the night he stumbleth becaus there is
no light in him

11:11 these thing said he: and after that he saith unto them our
friend lazaru sleepeth; but i go that i may awak him out of sleep

11:12 then said hi discipl lord if he sleep he shall do well

11:13 howbeit jesu spake of hi death: but they thought that he had
spoken of take of rest in sleep

11:14 then said jesu unto them plainli lazaru is dead

11:15 and i am glad for your sake that i wa not there to the intent
ye may believe; nevertheless let us go unto him

11:16 then said thoma which is call didymu unto hi
fellowdiscipl let us also go that we may die with him

11:17 then when jesu came he found that he had lain in the grave
four day alreadi

11:18 now bethani wa nigh unto jerusalem about fifteen furlong off:
11:19 and mani of the jew came to martha and mari to comfort them
concern their brother

11:20 then martha as soon as she heard that jesu wa come went
and met him: but mari sat still in the hous

11:21 then said martha unto jesu lord if thou hadst been here my
brother had not die

11:22 but i know that even now whatsoev thou wilt ask of god god
will give it thee

11:23 jesu saith unto her thi brother shall rise again

11:24 martha saith unto him i know that he shall rise again in the
resurrect at the last day

11:25 jesu said unto her i am the resurrect and the life: he
that believeth in me though he were dead yet shall he live: 11:26
and whosoev liveth and believeth in me shall never die believest
thou this? 11:27 she saith unto him yea lord: i believ that thou
art the christ the son of god which should come into the world

11:28 and when she had so said she went her way and call mari her
sister secretli say the master is come and calleth for thee

11:29 as soon as she heard that she aros quickli and came unto him

11:30 now jesu wa not yet come into the town but wa in that place
where martha met him

11:31 the jew then which were with her in the hous and comfort
her when they saw mari that she rose up hastili and went out
follow her say she goeth unto the grave to weep there

11:32 then when mari wa come where jesu wa and saw him she fell
down at hi feet say unto him lord if thou hadst been here my
brother had not die

11:33 when jesu therefor saw her weep and the jew also weep
which came with her he groan in the spirit and wa troubl

11:34 and said where have ye laid him? they said unto him lord come
and see

11:35 jesu wept

11:36 then said the jew behold how he love him! 11:37 and some of
them said could not thi man which open the eye of the blind
have caus that even thi man should not have died? 11:38 jesu
therefor again groan in himself cometh to the grave it wa a
cave and a stone lay upon it

11:39 jesu said take ye away the stone martha the sister of him
that wa dead saith unto him lord by thi time he stinketh: for he
hath been dead four day

11:40 jesu saith unto her said i not unto thee that if thou
wouldest believ thou shouldest see the glori of god? 11:41 then
they took away the stone from the place where the dead wa laid and
jesu lift up hi eye and said father i thank thee that thou
hast heard me

11:42 and i knew that thou hearest me always: but becaus of the
peopl which stand by i said it that they may believ that thou hast
sent me

11:43 and when he thu had spoken he cri with a loud voic
lazaru come forth

11:44 and he that wa dead came forth bound hand and foot with
graveclothes: and hi face wa bound about with a napkin jesu saith
unto them loos him and let him go

11:45 then mani of the jew which came to mari and had seen the
thing which jesu did believ on him

11:46 but some of them went their way to the pharise and told them
what thing jesu had done

11:47 then gather the chief priest and the pharise a council and
said what do we? for thi man doeth mani miracl

11:48 if we let him thu alon all men will believ on him: and the
roman shall come and take away both our place and nation

11:49 and one of them name caiapha be the high priest that same
year said unto them ye know noth at all 11:50 nor consid that
it is expedi for us that one man should die for the peopl and
that the whole nation perish not

11:51 and thi spake he not of himself: but be high priest that
year he prophesi that jesu should die for that nation; 11:52 and
not for that nation onli but that also he should gather togeth in
one the children of god that were scatter abroad

11:53 then from that day forth they took counsel togeth for to put
him to death

11:54 jesu therefor walk no more openli among the jews; but went
thenc unto a countri near to the wilder into a citi call
ephraim and there continu with hi discipl

11:55 and the jew passov wa nigh at hand: and mani went out of
the countri up to jerusalem befor the passov to purifi themselv

11:56 then sought they for jesu and spake among themselv as they
stood in the templ what think ye that he will not come to the
feast? 11:57 now both the chief priest and the pharise had given a
command that if ani man knew where he were he should shew it
that they might take him

12:1 then jesu six day befor the passov came to bethani where
lazaru wa which had been dead whom he rais from the dead

12:2 there they made him a supper; and martha served: but lazaru wa
one of them that sat at the tabl with him

12:3 then took mari a pound of ointment of spikenard veri costli and
anoint the feet of jesu and wipe hi feet with her hair: and the
hous wa fill with the odour of the ointment

12:4 then saith one of hi discipl juda iscariot simon son
which should betray him 12:5 whi wa not thi ointment sold for three
hundr penc and given to the poor? 12:6 thi he said not that he
care for the poor; but becaus he wa a thief and had the bag and
bare what wa put therein

12:7 then said jesu let her alone: against the day of my buri
hath she kept thi

12:8 for the poor alway ye have with you; but me ye have not alway

12:9 much peopl of the jew therefor knew that he wa there: and
they came not for jesu sake onli but that they might see lazaru
also whom he had rais from the dead

12:10 but the chief priest consult that they might put lazaru also
to death; 12:11 becaus that by reason of him mani of the jew went
away and believ on jesu

12:12 on the next day much peopl that were come to the feast when
they heard that jesu wa come to jerusalem 12:13 took branch of
palm tree and went forth to meet him and cri hosanna: bless is
the king of israel that cometh in the name of the lord

12:14 and jesu when he had found a young ass sat thereon; as it is
written 12:15 fear not daughter of sion: behold thi king cometh
sit on an asss colt

12:16 these thing understood not hi discipl at the first: but when
jesu wa glorifi then rememb they that these thing were
written of him and that they had done these thing unto him

12:17 the peopl therefor that wa with him when he call lazaru
out of hi grave and rais him from the dead bare record

12:18 for thi caus the peopl also met him for that they heard that
he had done thi miracl

12:19 the pharise therefor said among themselv perceiv ye how
ye prevail nothing? behold the world is gone after him

12:20 and there were certain greek among them that came up to worship
at the feast: 12:21 the same came therefor to philip which wa of
bethsaida of galile and desir him say sir we would see
jesu

12:22 philip cometh and telleth andrew: and again andrew and philip
tell jesu

12:23 and jesu answer them say the hour is come that the son
of man should be glorifi

12:24 verili verili i say unto you except a corn of wheat fall into
the ground and die it abideth alone: but if it die it bringeth forth
much fruit

12:25 he that loveth hi life shall lose it; and he that hateth hi
life in thi world shall keep it unto life etern

12:26 if ani man serv me let him follow me; and where i am there
shall also my servant be: if ani man serv me him will my father
honour

12:27 now is my soul troubled; and what shall i say? father save me
from thi hour: but for thi caus came i unto thi hour

12:28 father glorifi thi name then came there a voic from heaven
say i have both glorifi it and will glorifi it again

12:29 the peopl therefor that stood by and heard it said that it
thundered: other said an angel spake to him

12:30 jesu answer and said thi voic came not becaus of me but
for your sake

12:31 now is the judgment of thi world: now shall the princ of thi
world be cast out

12:32 and i if i be lift up from the earth will draw all men unto
me

12:33 thi he said signifi what death he should die

12:34 the peopl answer him we have heard out of the law that
christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou the son of man must be
lift up? who is thi son of man? 12:35 then jesu said unto them
yet a littl while is the light with you

walk while ye have the light lest dark come upon you: for he that
walketh in dark knoweth not whither he goeth

12:36 while ye have light believ in the light that ye may be the
children of light these thing spake jesu and depart and did
hide himself from them

12:37 but though he had done so mani miracl befor them yet they
believ not on him: 12:38 that the say of esaia the prophet might
be fulfil which he spake lord who hath believ our report? and
to whom hath the arm of the lord been revealed? 12:39 therefor they
could not believ becaus that esaia said again 12:40 he hath
blind their eye and harden their heart; that they should not see
with their eye nor understand with their heart and be convert
and i should heal them

12:41 these thing said esaia when he saw hi glori and spake of
him

12:42 nevertheless among the chief ruler also mani believ on him;
but becaus of the pharise they did not confess him lest they
should be put out of the synagogue: 12:43 for they love the prais of
men more than the prais of god

12:44 jesu cri and said he that believeth on me believeth not on
me but on him that sent me

12:45 and he that seeth me seeth him that sent me

12:46 i am come a light into the world that whosoev believeth on me
should not abid in dark

12:47 and if ani man hear my word and believ not i judg him not:
for i came not to judg the world but to save the world

12:48 he that rejecteth me and receiveth not my word hath one that
judgeth him: the word that i have spoken the same shall judg him in
the last day

12:49 for i have not spoken of myself; but the father which sent me
he gave me a command what i should say and what i should speak

12:50 and i know that hi command is life everlasting: whatsoev
i speak therefor even as the father said unto me so i speak

13:1 now befor the feast of the passov when jesu knew that hi
hour wa come that he should depart out of thi world unto the father
have love hi own which were in the world he love them unto the
end

13:2 and supper be end the devil have now put into the heart
of juda iscariot simon son to betray him; 13:3 jesu know that
the father had given all thing into hi hand and that he wa come
from god and went to god; 13:4 he riseth from supper and laid asid
hi garments; and took a towel and gird himself

13:5 after that he poureth water into a bason and began to wash the
discipl feet and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he wa
gird

13:6 then cometh he to simon peter: and peter saith unto him lord
dost thou wash my feet? 13:7 jesu answer and said unto him what i
do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereaft

13:8 peter saith unto him thou shalt never wash my feet jesu
answer him if i wash thee not thou hast no part with me

13:9 simon peter saith unto him lord not my feet onli but also my
hand and my head

13:10 jesu saith to him he that is wash needeth not save to wash
hi feet but is clean everi whit: and ye are clean but not all

13:11 for he knew who should betray him; therefor said he ye are not
all clean

13:12 so after he had wash their feet and had taken hi garment
and wa set down again he said unto them know ye what i have done to
you? 13:13 ye call me master and lord: and ye say well; for so i am

13:14 if i then your lord and master have wash your feet; ye also
ought to wash one anoth feet

13:15 for i have given you an exampl that ye should do as i have
done to you

13:16 verili verili i say unto you the servant is not greater than
hi lord; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him

13:17 if ye know these thing happi are ye if ye do them

13:18 i speak not of you all: i know whom i have chosen: but that the
scriptur may be fulfil he that eateth bread with me hath lift
up hi heel against me

13:19 now i tell you befor it come that when it is come to pass ye
may believ that i am he

13:20 verili verili i say unto you he that receiveth whomsoev i
send receiveth me; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent
me

13:21 when jesu had thu said he wa troubl in spirit and
testifi and said verili verili i say unto you that one of you
shall betray me

13:22 then the discipl look one on anoth doubt of whom he
spake

13:23 now there wa lean on jesu bosom one of hi discipl whom
jesu love

13:24 simon peter therefor beckon to him that he should ask who it
should be of whom he spake

13:25 he then lie on jesu breast saith unto him lord who is it?
13:26 jesu answer he it is to whom i shall give a sop when i
have dip it and when he had dip the sop he gave it to juda
iscariot the son of simon

13:27 and after the sop satan enter into him then said jesu unto
him that thou doest do quickli

13:28 now no man at the tabl knew for what intent he spake thi unto
him

13:29 for some of them thought becaus juda had the bag that jesu
had said unto him buy those thing that we have need of against the
feast; or that he should give someth to the poor

13:30 he then have receiv the sop went immedi out: and it wa
night

13:31 therefor when he wa gone out jesu said now is the son of
man glorifi and god is glorifi in him

13:32 if god be glorifi in him god shall also glorifi him in
himself and shall straightway glorifi him

13:33 littl children yet a littl while i am with you ye shall seek
me: and as i said unto the jew whither i go ye cannot come; so now
i say to you

13:34 a new command i give unto you that ye love one another; as
i have love you that ye also love one anoth

13:35 by thi shall all men know that ye are my discipl if ye have
love one to anoth

13:36 simon peter said unto him lord whither goest thou? jesu
answer him whither i go thou canst not follow me now; but thou
shalt follow me afterward

13:37 peter said unto him lord whi cannot i follow thee now? i will
lay down my life for thi sake

13:38 jesu answer him wilt thou lay down thi life for my sake?
verili verili i say unto thee the cock shall not crow till thou
hast deni me thrice

14:1 let not your heart be troubled: ye believ in god believ also
in me

14:2 in my father hous are mani mansions: if it were not so i
would have told you i go to prepar a place for you
