14:3 and if i go and prepar a place for you i will come again and
receiv you unto myself; that where i am there ye may be also

14:4 and whither i go ye know and the way ye know

14:5 thoma saith unto him lord we know not whither thou goest; and
how can we know the way? 14:6 jesu saith unto him i am the way the
truth and the life: no man cometh unto the father but by me

14:7 if ye had known me ye should have known my father also: and from
henceforth ye know him and have seen him

14:8 philip saith unto him lord shew us the father and it sufficeth
us

14:9 jesu saith unto him have i been so long time with you and yet
hast thou not known me philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the
father; and how sayest thou then shew us the father? 14:10 believest
thou not that i am in the father and the father in me? the word
that i speak unto you i speak not of myself: but the father that
dwelleth in me he doeth the work

14:11 believ me that i am in the father and the father in me: or
els believ me for the veri work sake

14:12 verili verili i say unto you he that believeth on me the
work that i do shall he do also; and greater work than these shall
he do; becaus i go unto my father

14:13 and whatsoev ye shall ask in my name that will i do that the
father may be glorifi in the son

14:14 if ye shall ask ani thing in my name i will do it

14:15 if ye love me keep my command

14:16 and i will pray the father and he shall give you anoth
comfort that he may abid with you for ever; 14:17 even the spirit
of truth; whom the world cannot receiv becaus it seeth him not
neither knoweth him: but ye know him; for he dwelleth with you and
shall be in you

14:18 i will not leav you comfortless: i will come to you

14:19 yet a littl while and the world seeth me no more; but ye see
me: becaus i live ye shall live also

14:20 at that day ye shall know that i am in my father and ye in me
and i in you

14:21 he that hath my command and keepeth them he it is that
loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be love of my father and i
will love him and will manifest myself to him

14:22 juda saith unto him not iscariot lord how is it that thou
wilt manifest thyself unto us and not unto the world? 14:23 jesu
answer and said unto him if a man love me he will keep my words:
and my father will love him and we will come unto him and make our
abod with him

14:24 he that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings: and the word which
ye hear is not mine but the father which sent me

14:25 these thing have i spoken unto you be yet present with you

14:26 but the comfort which is the holi ghost whom the father will
send in my name he shall teach you all thing and bring all thing
to your remembr whatsoev i have said unto you

14:27 peac i leav with you my peac i give unto you: not as the
world giveth give i unto you let not your heart be troubl neither
let it be afraid

14:28 ye have heard how i said unto you i go away and come again
unto you if ye love me ye would rejoic becaus i said i go unto
the father: for my father is greater than i

14:29 and now i have told you befor it come to pass that when it is
come to pass ye might believ

14:30 hereaft i will not talk much with you: for the princ of thi
world cometh and hath noth in me

14:31 but that the world may know that i love the father; and as the
father gave me command even so i do aris let us go henc

15:1 i am the true vine and my father is the husbandman

15:2 everi branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and
everi branch that beareth fruit he purgeth it that it may bring
forth more fruit

15:3 now ye are clean through the word which i have spoken unto you

15:4 abid in me and i in you as the branch cannot bear fruit of
itself except it abid in the vine; no more can ye except ye abid
in me

15:5 i am the vine ye are the branches: he that abideth in me and i
in him the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do
noth

15:6 if a man abid not in me he is cast forth as a branch and is
withered; and men gather them and cast them into the fire and they
are burn

15:7 if ye abid in me and my word abid in you ye shall ask what
ye will and it shall be done unto you

15:8 herein is my father glorifi that ye bear much fruit; so shall
ye be my discipl

15:9 as the father hath love me so have i love you: continu ye in
my love

15:10 if ye keep my command ye shall abid in my love; even as i
have kept my father command and abid in hi love

15:11 these thing have i spoken unto you that my joy might remain in
you and that your joy might be full

15:12 thi is my command that ye love one anoth as i have
love you

15:13 greater love hath no man than thi that a man lay down hi life
for hi friend

15:14 ye are my friend if ye do whatsoev i command you

15:15 henceforth i call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not
what hi lord doeth: but i have call you friends; for all thing
that i have heard of my father i have made known unto you

15:16 ye have not chosen me but i have chosen you and ordain you
that ye should go and bring forth fruit and that your fruit should
remain: that whatsoev ye shall ask of the father in my name he may
give it you

15:17 these thing i command you that ye love one anoth

15:18 if the world hate you ye know that it hate me befor it hate
you

15:19 if ye were of the world the world would love hi own: but
becaus ye are not of the world but i have chosen you out of the
world therefor the world hateth you

15:20 rememb the word that i said unto you the servant is not
greater than hi lord if they have persecut me they will also
persecut you; if they have kept my say they will keep your also

15:21 but all these thing will they do unto you for my name sake
becaus they know not him that sent me

15:22 if i had not come and spoken unto them they had not had sin:
but now they have no cloak for their sin

15:23 he that hateth me hateth my father also

15:24 if i had not done among them the work which none other man did
they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hate both me
and my father

15:25 but thi cometh to pass that the word might be fulfil that
is written in their law they hate me without a caus

15:26 but when the comfort is come whom i will send unto you from
the father even the spirit of truth which proceedeth from the
father he shall testifi of me: 15:27 and ye also shall bear wit
becaus ye have been with me from the begin

16:1 these thing have i spoken unto you that ye should not be
offend

16:2 they shall put you out of the synagogues: yea the time cometh
that whosoev killeth you will think that he doeth god servic

16:3 and these thing will they do unto you becaus they have not
known the father nor me

16:4 but these thing have i told you that when the time shall come
ye may rememb that i told you of them and these thing i said not
unto you at the begin becaus i wa with you

16:5 but now i go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asketh
me whither goest thou? 16:6 but becaus i have said these thing
unto you sorrow hath fill your heart

16:7 nevertheless i tell you the truth; it is expedi for you that i
go away: for if i go not away the comfort will not come unto you;
but if i depart i will send him unto you

16:8 and when he is come he will reprov the world of sin and of
righteous and of judgment: 16:9 of sin becaus they believ not
on me; 16:10 of righteous becaus i go to my father and ye see
me no more; 16:11 of judgment becaus the princ of thi world is
judg

16:12 i have yet mani thing to say unto you but ye cannot bear them
now

16:13 howbeit when he the spirit of truth is come he will guid you
into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoev he
shall hear that shall he speak: and he will shew you thing to come

16:14 he shall glorifi me: for he shall receiv of mine and shall
shew it unto you

16:15 all thing that the father hath are mine: therefor said i that
he shall take of mine and shall shew it unto you

16:16 a littl while and ye shall not see me: and again a littl
while and ye shall see me becaus i go to the father

16:17 then said some of hi discipl among themselv what is thi
that he saith unto us a littl while and ye shall not see me: and
again a littl while and ye shall see me: and becaus i go to the
father? 16:18 they said therefor what is thi that he saith a
littl while? we cannot tell what he saith

16:19 now jesu knew that they were desir to ask him and said unto
them do ye enquir among yourselv of that i said a littl while
and ye shall not see me: and again a littl while and ye shall see
me? 16:20 verili verili i say unto you that ye shall weep and
lament but the world shall rejoice: and ye shall be sorrow but
your sorrow shall be turn into joy

16:21 a woman when she is in travail hath sorrow becaus her hour is
come: but as soon as she is deliv of the child she remembereth no
more the anguish for joy that a man is born into the world

16:22 and ye now therefor have sorrow: but i will see you again and
your heart shall rejoic and your joy no man taketh from you

16:23 and in that day ye shall ask me noth verili verili i say
unto you whatsoev ye shall ask the father in my name he will give
it you

16:24 hitherto have ye ask noth in my name: ask and ye shall
receiv that your joy may be full

16:25 these thing have i spoken unto you in proverbs: but the time
cometh when i shall no more speak unto you in proverb but i shall
shew you plainli of the father

16:26 at that day ye shall ask in my name: and i say not unto you
that i will pray the father for you: 16:27 for the father himself
loveth you becaus ye have love me and have believ that i came
out from god

16:28 i came forth from the father and am come into the world: again
i leav the world and go to the father

16:29 hi discipl said unto him lo now speakest thou plainli and
speakest no proverb

16:30 now are we sure that thou knowest all thing and needest not
that ani man should ask thee: by thi we believ that thou camest
forth from god

16:31 jesu answer them do ye now believe? 16:32 behold the hour
cometh yea is now come that ye shall be scatter everi man to hi
own and shall leav me alone: and yet i am not alon becaus the
father is with me

16:33 these thing i have spoken unto you that in me ye might have
peac

in the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; i have
overcom the world

17:1 these word spake jesu and lift up hi eye to heaven and
said father the hour is come; glorifi thi son that thi son also may
glorifi thee: 17:2 as thou hast given him power over all flesh that
he should give etern life to as mani as thou hast given him

17:3 and thi is life etern that they might know thee the onli true
god and jesu christ whom thou hast sent

17:4 i have glorifi thee on the earth: i have finish the work
which thou gavest me to do

17:5 and now o father glorifi thou me with thine own self with the
glori which i had with thee befor the world wa

17:6 i have manifest thi name unto the men which thou gavest me out
of the world: thine they were and thou gavest them me; and they have
kept thi word

17:7 now they have known that all thing whatsoev thou hast given me
are of thee

17:8 for i have given unto them the word which thou gavest me; and
they have receiv them and have known sure that i came out from
thee and they have believ that thou didst send me

17:9 i pray for them: i pray not for the world but for them which
thou hast given me; for they are thine

17:10 and all mine are thine and thine are mine; and i am glorifi
in them

17:11 and now i am no more in the world but these are in the world
and i come to thee holi father keep through thine own name those
whom thou hast given me that they may be one as we are

17:12 while i wa with them in the world i kept them in thi name:
those that thou gavest me i have kept and none of them is lost but
the son of perdition; that the scriptur might be fulfil

17:13 and now come i to thee; and these thing i speak in the world
that they might have my joy fulfil in themselv

17:14 i have given them thi word; and the world hath hate them
becaus they are not of the world even as i am not of the world

17:15 i pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world but
that thou shouldest keep them from the evil

17:16 they are not of the world even as i am not of the world

17:17 sanctifi them through thi truth: thi word is truth

17:18 as thou hast sent me into the world even so have i also sent
them into the world

17:19 and for their sake i sanctifi myself that they also might be
sanctifi through the truth

17:20 neither pray i for these alon but for them also which shall
believ on me through their word; 17:21 that they all may be one; as
thou father art in me and i in thee that they also may be one in
us: that the world may believ that thou hast sent me

17:22 and the glori which thou gavest me i have given them; that they
may be one even as we are one: 17:23 i in them and thou in me that
they may be made perfect in one; and that the world may know that thou
hast sent me and hast love them as thou hast love me

17:24 father i will that they also whom thou hast given me be with
me where i am; that they may behold my glori which thou hast given
me: for thou lovedst me befor the foundat of the world

17:25 o righteou father the world hath not known thee: but i have
known thee and these have known that thou hast sent me

17:26 and i have declar unto them thi name and will declar it:
that the love wherewith thou hast love me may be in them and i in
them

18:1 when jesu had spoken these word he went forth with hi
discipl over the brook cedron where wa a garden into the which he
enter and hi discipl

18:2 and juda also which betray him knew the place: for jesu
ofttim resort thither with hi discipl

18:3 juda then have receiv a band of men and offic from the
chief priest and pharise cometh thither with lantern and torch
and weapon

18:4 jesu therefor know all thing that should come upon him
went forth and said unto them whom seek ye? 18:5 they answer him
jesu of nazareth jesu saith unto them i am he

and juda also which betray him stood with them

18:6 as soon then as he had said unto them i am he they went
backward and fell to the ground

18:7 then ask he them again whom seek ye? and they said jesu of
nazareth

18:8 jesu answer i have told you that i am he: if therefor ye
seek me let these go their way: 18:9 that the say might be
fulfil which he spake of them which thou gavest me have i lost
none

18:10 then simon peter have a sword drew it and smote the high
priest servant and cut off hi right ear the servant name wa
malchu

18:11 then said jesu unto peter put up thi sword into the sheath:
the cup which my father hath given me shall i not drink it? 18:12
then the band and the captain and offic of the jew took jesu and
bound him 18:13 and led him away to anna first; for he wa father in
law to caiapha which wa the high priest that same year

18:14 now caiapha wa he which gave counsel to the jew that it wa
expedi that one man should die for the peopl

18:15 and simon peter follow jesu and so did anoth disciple:
that discipl wa known unto the high priest and went in with jesu
into the palac of the high priest

18:16 but peter stood at the door without then went out that other
discipl which wa known unto the high priest and spake unto her
that kept the door and brought in peter

18:17 then saith the damsel that kept the door unto peter art not
thou also one of thi man disciples? he saith i am not

18:18 and the servant and offic stood there who had made a fire
of coals; for it wa cold: and they warm themselves: and peter stood
with them and warm himself

18:19 the high priest then ask jesu of hi discipl and of hi
doctrin

18:20 jesu answer him i spake openli to the world; i ever taught
in the synagogu and in the templ whither the jew alway resort;
and in secret have i said noth

18:21 whi askest thou me? ask them which heard me what i have said
unto them: behold they know what i said

18:22 and when he had thu spoken one of the offic which stood by
struck jesu with the palm of hi hand say answerest thou the
high priest so? 18:23 jesu answer him if i have spoken evil bear
wit of the evil: but if well whi smitest thou me? 18:24 now
anna had sent him bound unto caiapha the high priest

18:25 and simon peter stood and warm himself they said therefor
unto him art not thou also one of hi disciples? he deni it and
said i am not

18:26 one of the servant of the high priest be hi kinsman whose
ear peter cut off saith did not i see thee in the garden with him?
18:27 peter then deni again: and immedi the cock crew

18:28 then led they jesu from caiapha unto the hall of judgment: and
it wa early; and they themselv went not into the judgment hall
lest they should be defiled; but that they might eat the passov

18:29 pilat then went out unto them and said what accus bring
ye against thi man? 18:30 they answer and said unto him if he
were not a malefactor we would not have deliv him up unto thee

18:31 then said pilat unto them take ye him and judg him accord
to your law the jew therefor said unto him it is not law for us
to put ani man to death: 18:32 that the say of jesu might be
fulfil which he spake signifi what death he should die

18:33 then pilat enter into the judgment hall again and call
jesu and said unto him art thou the king of the jews? 18:34 jesu
answer him sayest thou thi thing of thyself or did other tell it
thee of me? 18:35 pilat answer am i a jew? thine own nation and
the chief priest have deliv thee unto me: what hast thou done?
18:36 jesu answer my kingdom is not of thi world: if my kingdom
were of thi world then would my servant fight that i should not be
deliv to the jews: but now is my kingdom not from henc

18:37 pilat therefor said unto him art thou a king then? jesu
answer thou sayest that i am a king to thi end wa i born and
for thi caus came i into the world that i should bear wit unto
the truth everi one that is of the truth heareth my voic

18:38 pilat saith unto him what is truth? and when he had said thi
he went out again unto the jew and saith unto them i find in him no
fault at all

18:39 but ye have a custom that i should releas unto you one at the
passover: will ye therefor that i releas unto you the king of the
jews? 18:40 then cri they all again say not thi man but
barabba now barabba wa a robber

19:1 then pilat therefor took jesu and scourg him

19:2 and the soldier plat a crown of thorn and put it on hi
head and they put on him a purpl robe 19:3 and said hail king of
the jews! and they smote him with their hand

19:4 pilat therefor went forth again and saith unto them behold i
bring him forth to you that ye may know that i find no fault in him

19:5 then came jesu forth wear the crown of thorn and the
purpl robe and pilat saith unto them behold the man! 19:6 when
the chief priest therefor and offic saw him they cri out
say crucifi him crucifi him pilat saith unto them take ye him
and crucifi him: for i find no fault in him

19:7 the jew answer him we have a law and by our law he ought to
die becaus he made himself the son of god

19:8 when pilat therefor heard that say he wa the more afraid;
19:9 and went again into the judgment hall and saith unto jesu
whenc art thou? but jesu gave him no answer

19:10 then saith pilat unto him speakest thou not unto me? knowest
thou not that i have power to crucifi thee and have power to releas
thee? 19:11 jesu answer thou couldest have no power at all
against me except it were given thee from above: therefor he that
deliv me unto thee hath the greater sin

19:12 and from thenceforth pilat sought to releas him: but the jew
cri out say if thou let thi man go thou art not caesar
friend: whosoev maketh himself a king speaketh against caesar

19:13 when pilat therefor heard that say he brought jesu forth
and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is call the
pavement but in the hebrew gabbatha

19:14 and it wa the prepar of the passov and about the sixth
hour: and he saith unto the jew behold your king! 19:15 but they
cri out away with him away with him crucifi him

pilat saith unto them shall i crucifi your king? the chief priest
answer we have no king but caesar

19:16 then deliv he him therefor unto them to be crucifi and
they took jesu and led him away

19:17 and he bear hi cross went forth into a place call the
place of a skull which is call in the hebrew golgotha: 19:18 where
they crucifi him and two other with him on either side one and
jesu in the midst

19:19 and pilat wrote a titl and put it on the cross and the
write wa jesu of nazareth the king of the jew

19:20 thi titl then read mani of the jews: for the place where jesu
wa crucifi wa nigh to the city: and it wa written in hebrew and
greek and latin

19:21 then said the chief priest of the jew to pilat write not
the king of the jews; but that he said i am king of the jew

19:22 pilat answer what i have written i have written

19:23 then the soldier when they had crucifi jesu took hi
garment and made four part to everi soldier a part; and also hi
coat: now the coat wa without seam woven from the top throughout

19:24 they said therefor among themselv let us not rend it but
cast lot for it whose it shall be: that the scriptur might be
fulfil which saith they part my raiment among them and for my
vestur they did cast lot these thing therefor the soldier did

19:25 now there stood by the cross of jesu hi mother and hi
mother sister mari the wife of cleopha and mari magdalen

19:26 when jesu therefor saw hi mother and the discipl stand
by whom he love he saith unto hi mother woman behold thi son!
19:27 then saith he to the discipl behold thi mother! and from that
hour that discipl took her unto hi own home

19:28 after thi jesu know that all thing were now accomplish
that the scriptur might be fulfil saith i thirst

19:29 now there wa set a vessel full of vinegar: and they fill a
spung with vinegar and put it upon hyssop and put it to hi mouth

19:30 when jesu therefor had receiv the vinegar he said it is
finished: and he bow hi head and gave up the ghost

19:31 the jew therefor becaus it wa the prepar that the
bodi should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day (for that
sabbath day wa an high day) besought pilat that their leg might be
broken and that they might be taken away

19:32 then came the soldier and brake the leg of the first and of
the other which wa crucifi with him

19:33 but when they came to jesu and saw that he wa dead alreadi
they brake not hi legs: 19:34 but one of the soldier with a spear
pierc hi side and forthwith came there out blood and water

19:35 and he that saw it bare record and hi record is true: and he
knoweth that he saith true that ye might believ

19:36 for these thing were done that the scriptur should be
fulfil a bone of him shall not be broken

19:37 and again anoth scriptur saith they shall look on him whom
they pierc

19:38 and after thi joseph of arimathaea be a discipl of jesu
but secretli for fear of the jew besought pilat that he might take
away the bodi of jesus: and pilat gave him leav he came therefor
and took the bodi of jesu

19:39 and there came also nicodemu which at the first came to jesu
by night and brought a mixtur of myrrh and alo about an hundr
pound weight

19:40 then took they the bodi of jesu and wound it in linen cloth
with the spice as the manner of the jew is to buri

19:41 now in the place where he wa crucifi there wa a garden; and
in the garden a new sepulchr wherein wa never man yet laid

19:42 there laid they jesu therefor becaus of the jew prepar
day; for the sepulchr wa nigh at hand

20:1 the first day of the week cometh mari magdalen earli when it
wa yet dark unto the sepulchr and seeth the stone taken away from
the sepulchr

20:2 then she runneth and cometh to simon peter and to the other
discipl whom jesu love and saith unto them they have taken away
the lord out of the sepulchr and we know not where they have laid
him

20:3 peter therefor went forth and that other discipl and came to
the sepulchr

20:4 so they ran both together: and the other discipl did outrun
peter and came first to the sepulchr

20:5 and he stoop down and look in saw the linen cloth
lying; yet went he not in

20:6 then cometh simon peter follow him and went into the
sepulchr and seeth the linen cloth lie 20:7 and the napkin that
wa about hi head not lie with the linen cloth but wrap
togeth in a place by itself

20:8 then went in also that other discipl which came first to the
sepulchr and he saw and believ

20:9 for as yet they knew not the scriptur that he must rise again
from the dead

20:10 then the discipl went away again unto their own home

20:11 but mari stood without at the sepulchr weeping: and as she
wept she stoop down and look into the sepulchr 20:12 and seeth
two angel in white sit the one at the head and the other at the
feet where the bodi of jesu had lain

20:13 and they say unto her woman whi weepest thou? she saith unto
them becaus they have taken away my lord and i know not where they
have laid him

20:14 and when she had thu said she turn herself back and saw
jesu stand and knew not that it wa jesu

20:15 jesu saith unto her woman whi weepest thou? whom seekest
thou? she suppos him to be the garden saith unto him sir if
thou have born him henc tell me where thou hast laid him and i
will take him away

20:16 jesu saith unto her mari she turn herself and saith unto
him rabboni; which is to say master

20:17 jesu saith unto her touch me not; for i am not yet ascend to
my father: but go to my brethren and say unto them i ascend unto my
father and your father; and to my god and your god

20:18 mari magdalen came and told the discipl that she had seen the
lord and that he had spoken these thing unto her

20:19 then the same day at even be the first day of the week
when the door were shut where the discipl were assembl for fear
of the jew came jesu and stood in the midst and saith unto them
peac be unto you

20:20 and when he had so said he shew unto them hi hand and hi
side

then were the discipl glad when they saw the lord

20:21 then said jesu to them again peac be unto you: as my father
hath sent me even so send i you

20:22 and when he had said thi he breath on them and saith unto
them receiv ye the holi ghost: 20:23 whose soever sin ye remit
they are remit unto them; and whose soever sin ye retain they are
retain

20:24 but thoma one of the twelv call didymu wa not with them
when jesu came

20:25 the other discipl therefor said unto him we have seen the
lord

but he said unto them except i shall see in hi hand the print of
the nail and put my finger into the print of the nail and thrust
my hand into hi side i will not believ

20:26 and after eight day again hi discipl were within and thoma
with them: then came jesu the door be shut and stood in the
midst and said peac be unto you

20:27 then saith he to thoma reach hither thi finger and behold my
hands; and reach hither thi hand and thrust it into my side: and be
not faithless but believ

20:28 and thoma answer and said unto him my lord and my god

20:29 jesu saith unto him thoma becaus thou hast seen me thou
hast believed: bless are they that have not seen and yet have
believ

20:30 and mani other sign truli did jesu in the presenc of hi
discipl which are not written in thi book: 20:31 but these are
written that ye might believ that jesu is the christ the son of
god; and that believ ye might have life through hi name

21:1 after these thing jesu shew himself again to the discipl at
the sea of tiberias; and on thi wise shew he himself

21:2 there were togeth simon peter and thoma call didymu and
nathanael of cana in galile and the son of zebede and two other
of hi discipl

21:3 simon peter saith unto them i go a fish they say unto him
we also go with thee they went forth and enter into a ship
immediately; and that night they caught noth

21:4 but when the morn wa now come jesu stood on the shore: but
the discipl knew not that it wa jesu

21:5 then jesu saith unto them children have ye ani meat? they
answer him no

21:6 and he said unto them cast the net on the right side of the
ship and ye shall find they cast therefor and now they were not
abl to draw it for the multitud of fish

21:7 therefor that discipl whom jesu love saith unto peter it is
the lord now when simon peter heard that it wa the lord he girt hi
fisher coat unto him (for he wa naked) and did cast himself into
the sea

21:8 and the other discipl came in a littl ship; (for they were not
far from land but as it were two hundr cubits) drag the net
with fish

21:9 as soon then as they were come to land they saw a fire of coal
there and fish laid thereon and bread

21:10 jesu saith unto them bring of the fish which ye have now
caught

21:11 simon peter went up and drew the net to land full of great
fish an hundr and fifti and three: and for all there were so
mani yet wa not the net broken

21:12 jesu saith unto them come and dine and none of the discipl
durst ask him who art thou? know that it wa the lord

21:13 jesu then cometh and taketh bread and giveth them and fish
likewis

21:14 thi is now the third time that jesu shew himself to hi
discipl after that he wa risen from the dead

21:15 so when they had dine jesu saith to simon peter simon son
of jona lovest thou me more than these? he saith unto him yea
lord; thou knowest that i love thee he saith unto him feed my lamb

21:16 he saith to him again the second time simon son of jona
lovest thou me? he saith unto him yea lord; thou knowest that i love
thee he saith unto him feed my sheep

21:17 he saith unto him the third time simon son of jona lovest
thou me? peter wa griev becaus he said unto him the third time
lovest thou me? and he said unto him lord thou knowest all things;
thou knowest that i love thee jesu saith unto him feed my sheep

21:18 verili verili i say unto thee when thou wast young thou
girdest thyself and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou
shalt be old thou shalt stretch forth thi hand and anoth shall
gird thee and carri thee whither thou wouldest not

21:19 thi spake he signifi by what death he should glorifi god
and when he had spoken thi he saith unto him follow me

21:20 then peter turn about seeth the discipl whom jesu love
following; which also lean on hi breast at supper and said lord
which is he that betrayeth thee? 21:21 peter see him saith to
jesu lord and what shall thi man do? 21:22 jesu saith unto him
if i will that he tarri till i come what is that to thee? follow thou
me

21:23 then went thi say abroad among the brethren that that
discipl should not die: yet jesu said not unto him he shall not
die; but if i will that he tarri till i come what is that to thee?
21:24 thi is the discipl which testifieth of these thing and wrote
these things: and we know that hi testimoni is true

21:25 and there are also mani other thing which jesu did the which
if they should be written everi one i suppos that even the world
itself could not contain the book that should be written amen




the act of the apostl


1:1 the former treatis have i made o theophilu of all that jesu
began both to do and teach 1:2 until the day in which he wa taken
up after that he through the holi ghost had given command unto
the apostl whom he had chosen: 1:3 to whom also he shew himself
aliv after hi passion by mani infal proof be seen of them
forti day and speak of the thing pertain to the kingdom of
god: 1:4 and be assembl togeth with them command them that
they should not depart from jerusalem but wait for the promis of the
father which saith he ye have heard of me

1:5 for john truli baptiz with water; but ye shall be baptiz with
the holi ghost not mani day henc

1:6 when they therefor were come togeth they ask of him say
lord wilt thou at thi time restor again the kingdom to israel? 1:7
and he said unto them it is not for you to know the time or the
season which the father hath put in hi own power

1:8 but ye shall receiv power after that the holi ghost is come upon
you: and ye shall be wit unto me both in jerusalem and in all
judaea and in samaria and unto the uttermost part of the earth

1:9 and when he had spoken these thing while they beheld he wa
taken up; and a cloud receiv him out of their sight

1:10 and while they look stedfastli toward heaven as he went up
behold two men stood by them in white apparel; 1:11 which also said
ye men of galile whi stand ye gaze up into heaven? thi same
jesu which is taken up from you into heaven shall so come in like
manner as ye have seen him go into heaven

1:12 then return they unto jerusalem from the mount call olivet
which is from jerusalem a sabbath day journey

1:13 and when they were come in they went up into an upper room
where abod both peter and jame and john and andrew philip and
thoma bartholomew and matthew jame the son of alphaeu and simon
zelot and juda the brother of jame

1:14 these all continu with one accord in prayer and supplic
with the women and mari the mother of jesu and with hi brethren

1:15 and in those day peter stood up in the midst of the discipl
and said (the number of name togeth were about an hundr and
twenty) 1:16 men and brethren thi scriptur must need have been
fulfil which the holi ghost by the mouth of david spake befor
concern juda which wa guid to them that took jesu

1:17 for he wa number with us and had obtain part of thi
ministri

1:18 now thi man purchas a field with the reward of iniquity; and
fall headlong he burst asund in the midst and all hi bowel
gush out

1:19 and it wa known unto all the dweller at jerusalem; insomuch as
that field is call in their proper tongu aceldama that is to say
the field of blood

1:20 for it is written in the book of psalm let hi habit be
desol and let no man dwell therein: and hi bishoprick let anoth
take

1:21 wherefor of these men which have compani with us all the time
that the lord jesu went in and out among us 1:22 begin from the
baptism of john unto that same day that he wa taken up from us must
one be ordain to be a wit with us of hi resurrect

1:23 and they appoint two joseph call barsaba who wa surnam
justu and matthia

1:24 and they pray and said thou lord which knowest the heart
of all men shew whether of these two thou hast chosen 1:25 that he
may take part of thi ministri and apostleship from which juda by
transgress fell that he might go to hi own place

1:26 and they gave forth their lots; and the lot fell upon matthias;
and he wa number with the eleven apostl

2:1 and when the day of pentecost wa fulli come they were all with
one accord in one place

2:2 and suddenli there came a sound from heaven as of a rush mighti
wind and it fill all the hous where they were sit

2:3 and there appear unto them cloven tongu like as of fire and
it sat upon each of them

2:4 and they were all fill with the holi ghost and began to speak
with other tongu as the spirit gave them utter

2:5 and there were dwell at jerusalem jew devout men out of
everi nation under heaven

2:6 now when thi wa nois abroad the multitud came togeth and
were confound becaus that everi man heard them speak in hi own
languag

2:7 and they were all amaz and marvel say one to anoth
behold are not all these which speak galilaeans? 2:8 and how hear we
everi man in our own tongu wherein we were born? 2:9 parthian and
mede and elamit and the dweller in mesopotamia and in judaea
and cappadocia in pontu and asia 2:10 phrygia and pamphylia in
egypt and in the part of libya about cyren and stranger of rome
jew and proselyt 2:11 crete and arabian we do hear them speak
in our tongu the wonder work of god

2:12 and they were all amaz and were in doubt say one to
anoth what meaneth this? 2:13 other mock said these men are
full of new wine

2:14 but peter stand up with the eleven lift up hi voic and
said unto them ye men of judaea and all ye that dwell at jerusalem
be thi known unto you and hearken to my words: 2:15 for these are
not drunken as ye suppos see it is but the third hour of the
day

2:16 but thi is that which wa spoken by the prophet joel; 2:17 and
it shall come to pass in the last day saith god i will pour out of
my spirit upon all flesh: and your son and your daughter shall
prophesi and your young men shall see vision and your old men shall
dream dreams: 2:18 and on my servant and on my handmaiden i will
pour out in those day of my spirit; and they shall prophesy: 2:19 and
i will shew wonder in heaven abov and sign in the earth beneath;
blood and fire and vapour of smoke: 2:20 the sun shall be turn
into dark and the moon into blood befor the great and notabl
day of the lord come: 2:21 and it shall come to pass that whosoev
shall call on the name of the lord shall be save

2:22 ye men of israel hear these words; jesu of nazareth a man
approv of god among you by miracl and wonder and sign which god
did by him in the midst of you as ye yourselv also know: 2:23 him
be deliv by the determin counsel and foreknowledg of god
ye have taken and by wick hand have crucifi and slain: 2:24 whom
god hath rais up have loos the pain of death: becaus it wa
not possibl that he should be holden of it

2:25 for david speaketh concern him i foresaw the lord alway
befor my face for he is on my right hand that i should not be
moved: 2:26 therefor did my heart rejoic and my tongu wa glad;
moreov also my flesh shall rest in hope: 2:27 becaus thou wilt not
leav my soul in hell neither wilt thou suffer thine holi one to see
corrupt

2:28 thou hast made known to me the way of life; thou shalt make me
full of joy with thi counten

2:29 men and brethren let me freeli speak unto you of the patriarch
david that he is both dead and buri and hi sepulchr is with us
unto thi day

2:30 therefor be a prophet and know that god had sworn with an
oath to him that of the fruit of hi loin accord to the flesh
he would rais up christ to sit on hi throne; 2:31 he see thi
befor spake of the resurrect of christ that hi soul wa not left
in hell neither hi flesh did see corrupt

2:32 thi jesu hath god rais up whereof we all are wit

2:33 therefor be by the right hand of god exalt and have
receiv of the father the promis of the holi ghost he hath shed
forth thi which ye now see and hear

2:34 for david is not ascend into the heavens: but he saith himself
the lord said unto my lord sit thou on my right hand 2:35 until i
make thi foe thi footstool

2:36 therefor let all the hous of israel know assuredli that god
hath made the same jesu whom ye have crucifi both lord and
christ

2:37 now when they heard thi they were prick in their heart and
said unto peter and to the rest of the apostl men and brethren
what shall we do? 2:38 then peter said unto them repent and be
baptiz everi one of you in the name of jesu christ for the
remiss of sin and ye shall receiv the gift of the holi ghost

2:39 for the promis is unto you and to your children and to all
that are afar off even as mani as the lord our god shall call

2:40 and with mani other word did he testifi and exhort say save
yourselv from thi untoward gener

2:41 then they that gladli receiv hi word were baptized: and the
same day there were ad unto them about three thousand soul

2:42 and they continu stedfastli in the apostl doctrin and
fellowship and in break of bread and in prayer

2:43 and fear came upon everi soul: and mani wonder and sign were
done by the apostl

2:44 and all that believ were togeth and had all thing common;
2:45 and sold their possess and good and part them to all men
as everi man had need

2:46 and they continu daili with one accord in the templ and
break bread from hous to hous did eat their meat with glad
and singl of heart 2:47 prais god and have favour with all
the peopl and the lord ad to the church daili such as should be
save

3:1 now peter and john went up togeth into the templ at the hour of
prayer be the ninth hour

3:2 and a certain man lame from hi mother womb wa carri whom
they laid daili at the gate of the templ which is call beauti
to ask alm of them that enter into the temple; 3:3 who see peter
and john about to go into the templ ask an alm

3:4 and peter fasten hi eye upon him with john said look on
us

3:5 and he gave heed unto them expect to receiv someth of
them

3:6 then peter said silver and gold have i none; but such as i have
give i thee: in the name of jesu christ of nazareth rise up and walk

3:7 and he took him by the right hand and lift him up: and
immedi hi feet and ankl bone receiv strength

3:8 and he leap up stood and walk and enter with them into
the templ walk and leap and prais god

3:9 and all the peopl saw him walk and prais god: 3:10 and they
knew that it wa he which sat for alm at the beauti gate of the
temple: and they were fill with wonder and amaz at that which
had happen unto him

3:11 and as the lame man which wa heal held peter and john all the
peopl ran togeth unto them in the porch that is call solomon
greatli wonder

3:12 and when peter saw it he answer unto the peopl ye men of
israel whi marvel ye at this? or whi look ye so earnestli on us as
though by our own power or holi we had made thi man to walk?
3:13 the god of abraham and of isaac and of jacob the god of our
father hath glorifi hi son jesus; whom ye deliv up and
deni him in the presenc of pilat when he wa determin to let
him go

3:14 but ye deni the holi one and the just and desir a murder
to be grant unto you; 3:15 and kill the princ of life whom god
hath rais from the dead; whereof we are wit

3:16 and hi name through faith in hi name hath made thi man strong
whom ye see and know: yea the faith which is by him hath given him
thi perfect sound in the presenc of you all

3:17 and now brethren i wot that through ignor ye did it as did
also your ruler

3:18 but those thing which god befor had shew by the mouth of all
hi prophet that christ should suffer he hath so fulfil

3:19 repent ye therefor and be convert that your sin may be
blot out when the time of refresh shall come from the presenc
of the lord

3:20 and he shall send jesu christ which befor wa preach unto
you: 3:21 whom the heaven must receiv until the time of restitut
of all thing which god hath spoken by the mouth of all hi holi
prophet sinc the world began

3:22 for mose truli said unto the father a prophet shall the lord
your god rais up unto you of your brethren like unto me; him shall
ye hear in all thing whatsoev he shall say unto you

3:23 and it shall come to pass that everi soul which will not hear
that prophet shall be destroy from among the peopl

3:24 yea and all the prophet from samuel and those that follow
after as mani as have spoken have likewis foretold of these day

3:25 ye are the children of the prophet and of the coven which
god made with our father say unto abraham and in thi seed shall
all the kindr of the earth be bless

3:26 unto you first god have rais up hi son jesu sent him to
bless you in turn away everi one of you from hi iniqu

4:1 and as they spake unto the peopl the priest and the captain of
the templ and the sadduce came upon them 4:2 be griev that
they taught the peopl and preach through jesu the resurrect
from the dead

4:3 and they laid hand on them and put them in hold unto the next
day: for it wa now eventid

4:4 howbeit mani of them which heard the word believed; and the number
of the men wa about five thousand

4:5 and it came to pass on the morrow that their ruler and elder
and scribe 4:6 and anna the high priest and caiapha and john
and alexand and as mani as were of the kindr of the high priest
were gather togeth at jerusalem

4:7 and when they had set them in the midst they ask by what
power or by what name have ye done this? 4:8 then peter fill
with the holi ghost said unto them ye ruler of the peopl and
elder of israel 4:9 if we thi day be examin of the good deed done
to the impot man by what mean he is made whole; 4:10 be it known
unto you all and to all the peopl of israel that by the name of
jesu christ of nazareth whom ye crucifi whom god rais from the
dead even by him doth thi man stand here befor you whole

4:11 thi is the stone which wa set at nought of you builder which
is becom the head of the corner

4:12 neither is there salvat in ani other: for there is none other
name under heaven given among men wherebi we must be save

4:13 now when they saw the bold of peter and john and perceiv
that they were unlearn and ignor men they marvelled; and they
took knowledg of them that they had been with jesu

4:14 and behold the man which wa heal stand with them they
could say noth against it

4:15 but when they had command them to go asid out of the council
they confer among themselv 4:16 say what shall we do to
these men? for that inde a notabl miracl hath been done by them is
manifest to all them that dwell in jerusalem; and we cannot deni it

4:17 but that it spread no further among the peopl let us straitli
threaten them that they speak henceforth to no man in thi name

4:18 and they call them and command them not to speak at all nor
teach in the name of jesu

4:19 but peter and john answer and said unto them whether it be
right in the sight of god to hearken unto you more than unto god
judg ye

4:20 for we cannot but speak the thing which we have seen and heard

4:21 so when they had further threaten them they let them go
find noth how they might punish them becaus of the people: for
all men glorifi god for that which wa done

4:22 for the man wa abov forti year old on whom thi miracl of
heal wa shew

4:23 and be let go they went to their own compani and report
all that the chief priest and elder had said unto them

4:24 and when they heard that they lift up their voic to god with
one accord and said lord thou art god which hast made heaven and
earth and the sea and all that in them is: 4:25 who by the mouth of
thi servant david hast said whi did the heathen rage and the peopl
imagin vain things? 4:26 the king of the earth stood up and the
ruler were gather togeth against the lord and against hi
christ

4:27 for of a truth against thi holi child jesu whom thou hast
anoint both herod and pontiu pilat with the gentil and the
peopl of israel were gather togeth 4:28 for to do whatsoev
thi hand and thi counsel determin befor to be done

4:29 and now lord behold their threatenings: and grant unto thi
servant that with all bold they may speak thi word 4:30 by
stretch forth thine hand to heal; and that sign and wonder may be
done by the name of thi holi child jesu

4:31 and when they had pray the place wa shaken where they were
assembl together; and they were all fill with the holi ghost and
they spake the word of god with bold

4:32 and the multitud of them that believ were of one heart and of
one soul: neither said ani of them that ought of the thing which he
possess wa hi own; but they had all thing common

4:33 and with great power gave the apostl wit of the
resurrect of the lord jesus: and great grace wa upon them all

4:34 neither wa there ani among them that lacked: for as mani as were
possessor of land or hous sold them and brought the price of the
thing that were sold 4:35 and laid them down at the apostl feet:
and distribut wa made unto everi man accord as he had need

4:36 and jose who by the apostl wa surnam barnaba (which is
be interpret the son of consolation) a levit and of the
countri of cypru 4:37 have land sold it and brought the money
and laid it at the apostl feet

5:1 but a certain man name anania with sapphira hi wife sold a
possess 5:2 and kept back part of the price hi wife also be
privi to it and brought a certain part and laid it at the apostl
feet

5:3 but peter said anania whi hath satan fill thine heart to lie
to the holi ghost and to keep back part of the price of the land?
5:4 while it remain wa it not thine own? and after it wa sold
wa it not in thine own power? whi hast thou conceiv thi thing in
thine heart? thou hast not lie unto men but unto god

5:5 and anania hear these word fell down and gave up the ghost:
and great fear came on all them that heard these thing

5:6 and the young men aros wound him up and carri him out and
buri him

5:7 and it wa about the space of three hour after when hi wife
not know what wa done came in

5:8 and peter answer unto her tell me whether ye sold the land for
so much? and she said yea for so much

5:9 then peter said unto her how is it that ye have agre togeth
to tempt the spirit of the lord? behold the feet of them which have
buri thi husband are at the door and shall carri thee out

5:10 then fell she down straightway at hi feet and yield up the
ghost: and the young men came in and found her dead and carri
her forth buri her by her husband

5:11 and great fear came upon all the church and upon as mani as
heard these thing

5:12 and by the hand of the apostl were mani sign and wonder
wrought among the people; (and they were all with one accord in
solomon porch

5:13 and of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the peopl
magnifi them

5:14 and believ were the more ad to the lord multitud both of
men and women) 5:15 insomuch that they brought forth the sick into
the street and laid them on bed and couch that at the least the
shadow of peter pass by might overshadow some of them

5:16 there came also a multitud out of the citi round about unto
jerusalem bring sick folk and them which were vex with unclean
spirits: and they were heal everi one

5:17 then the high priest rose up and all they that were with him
(which is the sect of the sadducees) and were fill with
indign 5:18 and laid their hand on the apostl and put them
in the common prison

5:19 but the angel of the lord by night open the prison door and
brought them forth and said 5:20 go stand and speak in the templ
to the peopl all the word of thi life

5:21 and when they heard that they enter into the templ earli in
the morn and taught but the high priest came and they that were
with him and call the council togeth and all the senat of the
children of israel and sent to the prison to have them brought

5:22 but when the offic came and found them not in the prison
they return and told 5:23 say the prison truli found we shut
with all safeti and the keeper stand without befor the doors:
but when we had open we found no man within

5:24 now when the high priest and the captain of the templ and the
chief priest heard these thing they doubt of them whereunto thi
would grow

5:25 then came one and told them say behold the men whom ye put
in prison are stand in the templ and teach the peopl

5:26 then went the captain with the offic and brought them without
violence: for they fear the peopl lest they should have been
stone

5:27 and when they had brought them they set them befor the council:
and the high priest ask them 5:28 say did not we straitli
command you that ye should not teach in thi name? and behold ye
have fill jerusalem with your doctrin and intend to bring thi
man blood upon us

5:29 then peter and the other apostl answer and said we ought to
obey god rather than men

5:30 the god of our father rais up jesu whom ye slew and hang
on a tree

5:31 him hath god exalt with hi right hand to be a princ and a
saviour for to give repent to israel and forgiv of sin

5:32 and we are hi wit of these things; and so is also the holi
ghost whom god hath given to them that obey him

5:33 when they heard that they were cut to the heart and took
counsel to slay them

5:34 then stood there up one in the council a pharise name
gamaliel a doctor of the law had in reput among all the peopl
and command to put the apostl forth a littl space; 5:35 and said
unto them ye men of israel take heed to yourselv what ye intend to
do as touch these men

5:36 for befor these day rose up theuda boast himself to be
somebody; to whom a number of men about four hundr join
themselves: who wa slain; and all as mani as obey him were
scatter and brought to nought

5:37 after thi man rose up juda of galile in the day of the
tax and drew away much peopl after him: he also perished; and
all even as mani as obey him were dispers

5:38 and now i say unto you refrain from these men and let them
alone: for if thi counsel or thi work be of men it will come to
nought: 5:39 but if it be of god ye cannot overthrow it; lest hapli
ye be found even to fight against god

5:40 and to him they agreed: and when they had call the apostl
and beaten them they command that they should not speak in the name
of jesu and let them go

5:41 and they depart from the presenc of the council rejoic
that they were count worthi to suffer shame for hi name

5:42 and daili in the templ and in everi hous they ceas not to
teach and preach jesu christ

6:1 and in those day when the number of the discipl wa
multipli there aros a murmur of the grecian against the
hebrew becaus their widow were neglect in the daili
ministr

6:2 then the twelv call the multitud of the discipl unto them
and said it is not reason that we should leav the word of god and
serv tabl

6:3 wherefor brethren look ye out among you seven men of honest
report full of the holi ghost and wisdom whom we may appoint over
thi busi

6:4 but we will give ourselv continu to prayer and to the
ministri of the word

6:5 and the say pleas the whole multitude: and they chose
stephen a man full of faith and of the holi ghost and philip and
prochoru and nicanor and timon and parmena and nicola a
proselyt of antioch: 6:6 whom they set befor the apostles: and when
they had pray they laid their hand on them

6:7 and the word of god increased; and the number of the discipl
multipli in jerusalem greatly; and a great compani of the priest
were obedi to the faith

6:8 and stephen full of faith and power did great wonder and
miracl among the peopl

6:9 then there aros certain of the synagogu which is call the
synagogu of the libertin and cyrenian and alexandrian and of
them of cilicia and of asia disput with stephen

6:10 and they were not abl to resist the wisdom and the spirit by
which he spake

6:11 then they suborn men which said we have heard him speak
blasphem word against mose and against god

6:12 and they stir up the peopl and the elder and the scribe
and came upon him and caught him and brought him to the council
6:13 and set up fals wit which said thi man ceaseth not to
speak blasphem word against thi holi place and the law: 6:14 for
we have heard him say that thi jesu of nazareth shall destroy thi
place and shall chang the custom which mose deliv us

6:15 and all that sat in the council look stedfastli on him saw
hi face as it had been the face of an angel

7:1 then said the high priest are these thing so? 7:2 and he said
men brethren and father hearken; the god of glori appear unto
our father abraham when he wa in mesopotamia befor he dwelt in
charran 7:3 and said unto him get thee out of thi countri and from
thi kindr and come into the land which i shall shew thee

7:4 then came he out of the land of the chaldaean and dwelt in
charran: and from thenc when hi father wa dead he remov him
into thi land wherein ye now dwell

7:5 and he gave him none inherit in it no not so much as to set
hi foot on: yet he promis that he would give it to him for a
possess and to hi seed after him when as yet he had no child

7:6 and god spake on thi wise that hi seed should sojourn in a
strang land; and that they should bring them into bondag and
entreat them evil four hundr year

7:7 and the nation to whom they shall be in bondag will i judg said
god: and after that shall they come forth and serv me in thi place

7:8 and he gave him the coven of circumcision: and so abraham begat
isaac and circumcis him the eighth day; and isaac begat jacob; and
jacob begat the twelv patriarch

7:9 and the patriarch move with envi sold joseph into egypt: but
god wa with him 7:10 and deliv him out of all hi afflict
and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of pharaoh king of egypt;
and he made him governor over egypt and all hi hous

7:11 now there came a dearth over all the land of egypt and chanaan
and great affliction: and our father found no susten

7:12 but when jacob heard that there wa corn in egypt he sent out
our father first

7:13 and at the second time joseph wa made known to hi brethren; and
joseph kindr wa made known unto pharaoh

7:14 then sent joseph and call hi father jacob to him and all hi
kindr threescor and fifteen soul

7:15 so jacob went down into egypt and die he and our father
7:16 and were carri over into sychem and laid in the sepulchr that
abraham bought for a sum of money of the son of emmor the father of
sychem

7:17 but when the time of the promis drew nigh which god had sworn
to abraham the peopl grew and multipli in egypt 7:18 till anoth
king aros which knew not joseph

7:19 the same dealt subtilli with our kindr and evil entreat our
father so that they cast out their young children to the end they
might not live

7:20 in which time mose wa born and wa exceed fair and
nourish up in hi father hous three months: 7:21 and when he wa
cast out pharaoh daughter took him up and nourish him for her
own son

7:22 and mose wa learn in all the wisdom of the egyptian and wa
mighti in word and in deed

7:23 and when he wa full forti year old it came into hi heart to
visit hi brethren the children of israel

7:24 and see one of them suffer wrong he defend him and aveng
him that wa oppress and smote the egyptian: 7:25 for he suppos
hi brethren would have understood how that god by hi hand would
deliv them: but they understood not

7:26 and the next day he shew himself unto them as they strove and
would have set them at one again say sir ye are brethren; whi
do ye wrong one to another? 7:27 but he that did hi neighbour wrong
thrust him away say who made thee a ruler and a judg over us?
7:28 wilt thou kill me as thou diddest the egyptian yesterday? 7:29
then fled mose at thi say and wa a stranger in the land of
madian where he begat two son

7:30 and when forti year were expir there appear to him in the
wilder of mount sina an angel of the lord in a flame of fire in a
bush

7:31 when mose saw it he wonder at the sight: and as he drew near
to behold it the voic of the lord came unto him 7:32 say i am
the god of thi father the god of abraham and the god of isaac and
the god of jacob then mose trembl and durst not behold

7:33 then said the lord to him put off thi shoe from thi feet: for
the place where thou standest is holi ground

7:34 i have seen i have seen the afflict of my peopl which is in
egypt and i have heard their groan and am come down to deliv
them and now come i will send thee into egypt

7:35 thi mose whom they refus say who made thee a ruler and a
judge? the same did god send to be a ruler and a deliver by the hand
of the angel which appear to him in the bush

7:36 he brought them out after that he had shew wonder and sign
in the land of egypt and in the red sea and in the wilder forti
year

7:37 thi is that mose which said unto the children of israel a
prophet shall the lord your god rais up unto you of your brethren
like unto me; him shall ye hear

7:38 thi is he that wa in the church in the wilder with the
angel which spake to him in the mount sina and with our fathers: who
receiv the live oracl to give unto us: 7:39 to whom our father
would not obey but thrust him from them and in their heart turn
back again into egypt 7:40 say unto aaron make us god to go
befor us: for as for thi mose which brought us out of the land of
egypt we wot not what is becom of him

7:41 and they made a calf in those day and offer sacrific unto
the idol and rejoic in the work of their own hand

7:42 then god turn and gave them up to worship the host of heaven;
as it is written in the book of the prophet o ye hous of israel
have ye offer to me slain beast and sacrific by the space of
forti year in the wilderness? 7:43 yea ye took up the tabernacl of
moloch and the star of your god remphan figur which ye made to
worship them: and i will carri you away beyond babylon

7:44 our father had the tabernacl of wit in the wilder as
he had appoint speak unto mose that he should make it
accord to the fashion that he had seen

7:45 which also our father that came after brought in with jesu into
the possess of the gentil whom god drave out befor the face of
our father unto the day of david; 7:46 who found favour befor god
and desir to find a tabernacl for the god of jacob

7:47 but solomon built him an hous

7:48 howbeit the most high dwelleth not in templ made with hands; as
saith the prophet 7:49 heaven is my throne and earth is my
footstool: what hous will ye build me? saith the lord: or what is the
place of my rest? 7:50 hath not my hand made all these things? 7:51
ye stiffneck and uncircumcis in heart and ear ye do alway
resist the holi ghost: as your father did so do ye

7:52 which of the prophet have not your father persecuted? and they
have slain them which shew befor of the come of the just one; of
whom ye have been now the betray and murderers: 7:53 who have
receiv the law by the disposit of angel and have not kept it

7:54 when they heard these thing they were cut to the heart and
they gnash on him with their teeth

7:55 but he be full of the holi ghost look up stedfastli into
heaven and saw the glori of god and jesu stand on the right hand
of god 7:56 and said behold i see the heaven open and the son
of man stand on the right hand of god

7:57 then they cri out with a loud voic and stop their ear
and ran upon him with one accord 7:58 and cast him out of the citi
and stone him: and the wit laid down their cloth at a young
man feet whose name wa saul

7:59 and they stone stephen call upon god and say lord
jesu receiv my spirit

7:60 and he kneel down and cri with a loud voic lord lay not
thi sin to their charg and when he had said thi he fell asleep

8:1 and saul wa consent unto hi death and at that time there wa
a great persecut against the church which wa at jerusalem; and
they were all scatter abroad throughout the region of judaea and
samaria except the apostl

8:2 and devout men carri stephen to hi burial and made great
lament over him

8:3 as for saul he made havock of the church enter into everi
hous and hale men and women commit them to prison

8:4 therefor they that were scatter abroad went everi where
preach the word

8:5 then philip went down to the citi of samaria and preach christ
unto them

8:6 and the peopl with one accord gave heed unto those thing which
philip spake hear and see the miracl which he did

8:7 for unclean spirit cri with loud voic came out of mani that
were possess with them: and mani taken with palsi and that were
lame were heal

8:8 and there wa great joy in that citi

8:9 but there wa a certain man call simon which beforetim in the
same citi use sorceri and bewitch the peopl of samaria give
out that himself wa some great one: 8:10 to whom they all gave heed
from the least to the greatest say thi man is the great power of
god

8:11 and to him they had regard becaus that of long time he had
bewitch them with sorceri

8:12 but when they believ philip preach the thing concern the
kingdom of god and the name of jesu christ they were baptiz both
men and women

8:13 then simon himself believ also: and when he wa baptiz he
continu with philip and wonder behold the miracl and sign
which were done

8:14 now when the apostl which were at jerusalem heard that samaria
had receiv the word of god they sent unto them peter and john: 8:15
who when they were come down pray for them that they might
receiv the holi ghost: 8:16 (for as yet he wa fallen upon none of
them: onli they were baptiz in the name of the lord jesus) 8:17
then laid they their hand on them and they receiv the holi ghost

8:18 and when simon saw that through lay on of the apostl hand
the holi ghost wa given he offer them money 8:19 say give me
also thi power that on whomsoev i lay hand he may receiv the
holi ghost

8:20 but peter said unto him thi money perish with thee becaus thou
hast thought that the gift of god may be purchas with money

8:21 thou hast neither part nor lot in thi matter: for thi heart is
not right in the sight of god

8:22 repent therefor of thi thi wicked and pray god if perhap
the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee

8:23 for i perceiv that thou art in the gall of bitter and in
the bond of iniqu

8:24 then answer simon and said pray ye to the lord for me that
none of these thing which ye have spoken come upon me

8:25 and they when they had testifi and preach the word of the
lord return to jerusalem and preach the gospel in mani villag
of the samaritan

8:26 and the angel of the lord spake unto philip say aris and
go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from jerusalem unto
gaza which is desert

8:27 and he aros and went: and behold a man of ethiopia an eunuch
of great author under candac queen of the ethiopian who had the
charg of all her treasur and had come to jerusalem for to worship
8:28 wa return and sit in hi chariot read esaia the
prophet

8:29 then the spirit said unto philip go near and join thyself to
thi chariot

8:30 and philip ran thither to him and heard him read the prophet
esaia and said understandest thou what thou readest? 8:31 and he
said how can i except some man should guid me? and he desir
philip that he would come up and sit with him

8:32 the place of the scriptur which he read wa thi he wa led as
a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb befor hi shearer so
open he not hi mouth: 8:33 in hi humili hi judgment wa
taken away: and who shall declar hi generation? for hi life is
taken from the earth

8:34 and the eunuch answer philip and said i pray thee of whom
speaketh the prophet this? of himself or of some other man? 8:35
then philip open hi mouth and began at the same scriptur and
preach unto him jesu

8:36 and as they went on their way they came unto a certain water:
and the eunuch said see here is water; what doth hinder me to be
baptized? 8:37 and philip said if thou believest with all thine
heart thou mayest

and he answer and said i believ that jesu christ is the son of
god

8:38 and he command the chariot to stand still: and they went down
both into the water both philip and the eunuch; and he baptiz him

8:39 and when they were come up out of the water the spirit of the
lord caught away philip that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went
on hi way rejoic

8:40 but philip wa found at azotus: and pass through he preach
in all the citi till he came to caesarea

9:1 and saul yet breath out threaten and slaughter against the
discipl of the lord went unto the high priest 9:2 and desir of
him letter to damascu to the synagogu that if he found ani of
thi way whether they were men or women he might bring them bound
unto jerusalem

9:3 and as he journey he came near damascus: and suddenli there
shine round about him a light from heaven: 9:4 and he fell to the
earth and heard a voic say unto him saul saul whi persecutest
thou me? 9:5 and he said who art thou lord? and the lord said i am
jesu whom thou persecutest: it is hard for thee to kick against the
prick

9:6 and he trembl and astonish said lord what wilt thou have me
to do? and the lord said unto him aris and go into the citi and it
shall be told thee what thou must do

9:7 and the men which journey with him stood speechless hear a
voic but see no man

9:8 and saul aros from the earth; and when hi eye were open he
saw no man: but they led him by the hand and brought him into
damascu

9:9 and he wa three day without sight and neither did eat nor
drink

9:10 and there wa a certain discipl at damascu name ananias; and
to him said the lord in a vision anania and he said behold i am
here lord

9:11 and the lord said unto him aris and go into the street which
is call straight and enquir in the hous of juda for one call
saul of tarsus: for behold he prayeth 9:12 and hath seen in a
vision a man name anania come in and put hi hand on him
that he might receiv hi sight

9:13 then anania answer lord i have heard by mani of thi man
how much evil he hath done to thi saint at jerusalem: 9:14 and here
he hath author from the chief priest to bind all that call on thi
name

9:15 but the lord said unto him go thi way: for he is a chosen vessel
unto me to bear my name befor the gentil and king and the
children of israel: 9:16 for i will shew him how great thing he must
suffer for my name sake

9:17 and anania went hi way and enter into the house; and put
hi hand on him said brother saul the lord even jesu that
appear unto thee in the way as thou camest hath sent me that thou
mightest receiv thi sight and be fill with the holi ghost

9:18 and immedi there fell from hi eye as it had been scales:
and he receiv sight forthwith and aros and wa baptiz

9:19 and when he had receiv meat he wa strengthen then wa saul
certain day with the discipl which were at damascu

9:20 and straightway he preach christ in the synagogu that he is
the son of god

9:21 but all that heard him were amaz and said; is not thi he that
destroy them which call on thi name in jerusalem and came hither
for that intent that he might bring them bound unto the chief
priests? 9:22 but saul increas the more in strength and confound
the jew which dwelt at damascu prove that thi is veri christ

9:23 and after that mani day were fulfil the jew took counsel to
kill him: 9:24 but their lay await wa known of saul and they
watch the gate day and night to kill him

9:25 then the discipl took him by night and let him down by the
wall in a basket

9:26 and when saul wa come to jerusalem he assay to join himself
to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him and believ not
that he wa a discipl

9:27 but barnaba took him and brought him to the apostl and
declar unto them how he had seen the lord in the way and that he
had spoken to him and how he had preach boldli at damascu in the
name of jesu

9:28 and he wa with them come in and go out at jerusalem

9:29 and he spake boldli in the name of the lord jesu and disput
against the grecians: but they went about to slay him

9:30 which when the brethren knew they brought him down to caesarea
and sent him forth to tarsu

9:31 then had the church rest throughout all judaea and galile and
samaria and were edified; and walk in the fear of the lord and in
the comfort of the holi ghost were multipli

9:32 and it came to pass as peter pass throughout all quarter he
came down also to the saint which dwelt at lydda

9:33 and there he found a certain man name aenea which had kept hi
bed eight year and wa sick of the palsi

9:34 and peter said unto him aenea jesu christ maketh thee whole:
aris and make thi bed and he aros immedi

9:35 and all that dwelt at lydda and saron saw him and turn to the
lord

9:36 now there wa at joppa a certain discipl name tabitha which by
interpret is call dorcas: thi woman wa full of good work and
almsde which she did

9:37 and it came to pass in those day that she wa sick and died:
whom when they had wash they laid her in an upper chamber

9:38 and forasmuch as lydda wa nigh to joppa and the discipl had
heard that peter wa there they sent unto him two men desir him
that he would not delay to come to them

9:39 then peter aros and went with them when he wa come they
brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widow stood by him
weep and shew the coat and garment which dorca made while
she wa with them

9:40 but peter put them all forth and kneel down and prayed; and
turn him to the bodi said tabitha aris and she open her eyes:
and when she saw peter she sat up

9:41 and he gave her hi hand and lift her up and when he had
call the saint and widow present her aliv

9:42 and it wa known throughout all joppa; and mani believ in the
lord

9:43 and it came to pass that he tarri mani day in joppa with one
simon a tanner

10:1 there wa a certain man in caesarea call corneliu a centurion
of the band call the italian band 10:2 a devout man and one that
fear god with all hi hous which gave much alm to the peopl and
pray to god alway

10:3 he saw in a vision evid about the ninth hour of the day an
angel of god come in to him and say unto him corneliu

10:4 and when he look on him he wa afraid and said what is it
lord? and he said unto him thi prayer and thine alm are come up
for a memori befor god

10:5 and now send men to joppa and call for one simon whose surnam
is peter: 10:6 he lodgeth with one simon a tanner whose hous is by
the sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do

10:7 and when the angel which spake unto corneliu wa depart he
call two of hi household servant and a devout soldier of them
that wait on him continually; 10:8 and when he had declar all
these thing unto them he sent them to joppa

10:9 on the morrow as they went on their journey and drew nigh unto
the citi peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth
hour: 10:10 and he becam veri hungri and would have eaten: but while
they made readi he fell into a tranc 10:11 and saw heaven open
and a certain vessel descend upon him as it had been a great sheet
knit at the four corner and let down to the earth: 10:12 wherein
were all manner of fourfoot beast of the earth and wild beast
and creep thing and fowl of the air

10:13 and there came a voic to him rise peter; kill and eat

10:14 but peter said not so lord; for i have never eaten ani thing
that is common or unclean

10:15 and the voic spake unto him again the second time what god
hath cleans that call not thou common

10:16 thi wa done thrice: and the vessel wa receiv up again into
heaven

10:17 now while peter doubt in himself what thi vision which he had
seen should mean behold the men which were sent from corneliu had
made enquiri for simon hous and stood befor the gate 10:18 and
call and ask whether simon which wa surnam peter were lodg
there

10:19 while peter thought on the vision the spirit said unto him
behold three men seek thee

10:20 aris therefor and get thee down and go with them doubt
nothing: for i have sent them

10:21 then peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from
cornelius; and said behold i am he whom ye seek: what is the caus
wherefor ye are come? 10:22 and they said corneliu the centurion
a just man and one that feareth god and of good report among all the
nation of the jew wa warn from god by an holi angel to send for
thee into hi hous and to hear word of thee

10:23 then call he them in and lodg them and on the morrow peter
went away with them and certain brethren from joppa accompani him

10:24 and the morrow after they enter into caesarea and corneliu
wait for them and he had call togeth hi kinsmen and near
friend

10:25 and as peter wa come in corneliu met him and fell down at
hi feet and worship him

10:26 but peter took him up say stand up; i myself also am a man

10:27 and as he talk with him he went in and found mani that were
come togeth

10:28 and he said unto them ye know how that it is an unlaw thing
for a man that is a jew to keep compani or come unto one of anoth
nation; but god hath shew me that i should not call ani man common
or unclean

10:29 therefor came i unto you without gainsay as soon as i wa
sent for: i ask therefor for what intent ye have sent for me? 10:30
and corneliu said four day ago i wa fast until thi hour; and
at the ninth hour i pray in my hous and behold a man stood
befor me in bright cloth 10:31 and said corneliu thi prayer is
heard and thine alm are had in remembr in the sight of god

10:32 send therefor to joppa and call hither simon whose surnam is
peter; he is lodg in the hous of one simon a tanner by the sea
side: who when he cometh shall speak unto thee

10:33 immedi therefor i sent to thee; and thou hast well done
that thou art come now therefor are we all here present befor god
to hear all thing that are command thee of god

10:34 then peter open hi mouth and said of a truth i perceiv
that god is no respect of persons: 10:35 but in everi nation he that
feareth him and worketh righteous is accept with him

10:36 the word which god sent unto the children of israel preach
peac by jesu christ: (he is lord of all:) 10:37 that word i say ye
know which wa publish throughout all judaea and began from
galile after the baptism which john preached; 10:38 how god anoint
jesu of nazareth with the holi ghost and with power: who went about
do good and heal all that were oppress of the devil; for god
wa with him

10:39 and we are wit of all thing which he did both in the land
of the jew and in jerusalem; whom they slew and hang on a tree:
10:40 him god rais up the third day and shew him openly; 10:41
not to all the peopl but unto wit chosen befor god even to
us who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead

10:42 and he command us to preach unto the peopl and to testifi
that it is he which wa ordain of god to be the judg of quick and
dead

10:43 to him give all the prophet wit that through hi name
whosoev believeth in him shall receiv remiss of sin

10:44 while peter yet spake these word the holi ghost fell on all
them which heard the word

10:45 and they of the circumcis which believ were astonish as
mani as came with peter becaus that on the gentil also wa pour
out the gift of the holi ghost

10:46 for they heard them speak with tongu and magnifi god then
answer peter 10:47 can ani man forbid water that these should not
be baptiz which have receiv the holi ghost as well as we? 10:48
and he command them to be baptiz in the name of the lord then
pray they him to tarri certain day

11:1 and the apostl and brethren that were in judaea heard that the
gentil had also receiv the word of god

11:2 and when peter wa come up to jerusalem they that were of the
circumcis contend with him 11:3 say thou wentest in to men
uncircumcis and didst eat with them

11:4 but peter rehears the matter from the begin and expound
it by order unto them say 11:5 i wa in the citi of joppa
praying: and in a tranc i saw a vision a certain vessel descend as
it had been a great sheet let down from heaven by four corners; and
it came even to me: 11:6 upon the which when i had fasten mine eye
i consid and saw fourfoot beast of the earth and wild beast
and creep thing and fowl of the air

11:7 and i heard a voic say unto me aris peter; slay and eat

11:8 but i said not so lord: for noth common or unclean hath at
ani time enter into my mouth

11:9 but the voic answer me again from heaven what god hath
cleans that call not thou common

11:10 and thi wa done three times: and all were drawn up again into
heaven

11:11 and behold immedi there were three men alreadi come unto
the hous where i wa sent from caesarea unto me

11:12 and the spirit bade me go with them noth doubt moreov
these six brethren accompani me and we enter into the man
house: 11:13 and he shew us how he had seen an angel in hi hous
which stood and said unto him send men to joppa and call for simon
whose surnam is peter; 11:14 who shall tell thee word wherebi thou
and all thi hous shall be save

11:15 and as i began to speak the holi ghost fell on them as on us
at the begin

11:16 then rememb i the word of the lord how that he said john
inde baptiz with water; but ye shall be baptiz with the holi
ghost

11:17 forasmuch then as god gave them the like gift as he did unto us
who believ on the lord jesu christ; what wa i that i could
withstand god? 11:18 when they heard these thing they held their
peac and glorifi god say then hath god also to the gentil
grant repent unto life

11:19 now they which were scatter abroad upon the persecut that
aros about stephen travel as far as phenic and cypru and
antioch preach the word to none but unto the jew onli

11:20 and some of them were men of cypru and cyren which when they
were come to antioch spake unto the grecian preach the lord
jesu

11:21 and the hand of the lord wa with them: and a great number
believ and turn unto the lord

11:22 then tide of these thing came unto the ear of the church
which wa in jerusalem: and they sent forth barnaba that he should
go as far as antioch

11:23 who when he came and had seen the grace of god wa glad and
exhort them all that with purpos of heart they would cleav unto
the lord
