god gave them over to a reprob mind to do those thing which are
not convenient; 1:29 be fill with all unright
fornic wicked covet maliciousness; full of envi
murder debat deceit malignity; whisper 1:30 backbit hater
of god despit proud boaster inventor of evil thing
disobedi to parent 1:31 without understand covenantbreak
without natur affect implac unmerciful: 1:32 who know
the judgment of god that they which commit such thing are worthi of
death not onli do the same but have pleasur in them that do them

2:1 therefor thou art inexcus o man whosoev thou art that
judgest: for wherein thou judgest anoth thou condemnest thyself;
for thou that judgest doest the same thing

2:2 but we are sure that the judgment of god is accord to truth
against them which commit such thing

2:3 and thinkest thou thi o man that judgest them which do such
thing and doest the same that thou shalt escap the judgment of
god? 2:4 or despisest thou the rich of hi good and forbear
and longsuffering; not know that the good of god leadeth thee
to repentance? 2:5 but after thi hard and impenit heart
treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and
revel of the righteou judgment of god; 2:6 who will render to
everi man accord to hi deeds: 2:7 to them who by patient
continu in well do seek for glori and honour and immort
etern life: 2:8 but unto them that are contenti and do not obey
the truth but obey unright indign and wrath 2:9
tribul and anguish upon everi soul of man that doeth evil of
the jew first and also of the gentile; 2:10 but glori honour and
peac to everi man that worketh good to the jew first and also to
the gentile: 2:11 for there is no respect of person with god

2:12 for as mani as have sin without law shall also perish without
law: and as mani as have sin in the law shall be judg by the law;
2:13 (for not the hearer of the law are just befor god but the
doer of the law shall be justifi

2:14 for when the gentil which have not the law do by natur the
thing contain in the law these have not the law are a law unto
themselves: 2:15 which shew the work of the law written in their
heart their conscienc also bear wit and their thought the
mean while accus or els excus one another;) 2:16 in the day
when god shall judg the secret of men by jesu christ accord to
my gospel

2:17 behold thou art call a jew and restest in the law and makest
thi boast of god 2:18 and knowest hi will and approvest the thing
that are more excel be instruct out of the law; 2:19 and art
confid that thou thyself art a guid of the blind a light of them
which are in dark 2:20 an instructor of the foolish a teacher of
babe which hast the form of knowledg and of the truth in the law

2:21 thou therefor which teachest anoth teachest thou not thyself?
thou that preachest a man should not steal dost thou steal? 2:22
thou that sayest a man should not commit adulteri dost thou commit
adultery? thou that abhorrest idol dost thou commit sacrilege? 2:23
thou that makest thi boast of the law through break the law
dishonourest thou god? 2:24 for the name of god is blasphem among
the gentil through you as it is written

2:25 for circumcis verili profiteth if thou keep the law: but if
thou be a breaker of the law thi circumcis is made uncircumcis

2:26 therefor if the uncircumcis keep the righteous of the
law shall not hi uncircumcis be count for circumcision? 2:27
and shall not uncircumcis which is by natur if it fulfil the law
judg thee who by the letter and circumcis dost transgress the
law? 2:28 for he is not a jew which is one outwardly; neither is
that circumcis which is outward in the flesh: 2:29 but he is a
jew which is one inwardly; and circumcis is that of the heart in
the spirit and not in the letter; whose prais is not of men but of
god

3:1 what advantag then hath the jew? or what profit is there of
circumcision? 3:2 much everi way: chiefli becaus that unto them
were commit the oracl of god

3:3 for what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the
faith of god without effect? 3:4 god forbid: yea let god be true
but everi man a liar; as it is written that thou mightest be
justifi in thi say and mightest overcom when thou art judg

3:5 but if our unright commend the righteous of god what
shall we say? is god unright who taketh vengeance? (i speak as a
man) 3:6 god forbid: for then how shall god judg the world? 3:7 for
if the truth of god hath more abound through my lie unto hi glory;
whi yet am i also judg as a sinner? 3:8 and not rather (a we be
slander report and as some affirm that we say) let us do
evil that good may come? whose damnat is just

3:9 what then? are we better than they? no in no wise: for we have
befor prove both jew and gentil that they are all under sin;
3:10 as it is written there is none righteou no not one: 3:11
there is none that understandeth there is none that seeketh after
god

3:12 they are all gone out of the way they are togeth becom
unprofitable; there is none that doeth good no not one

3:13 their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongu they have
use deceit; the poison of asp is under their lips: 3:14 whose mouth
is full of curs and bitterness: 3:15 their feet are swift to shed
blood: 3:16 destruct and miseri are in their ways: 3:17 and the way
of peac have they not known: 3:18 there is no fear of god befor
their eye

3:19 now we know that what thing soever the law saith it saith to
them who are under the law: that everi mouth may be stop and all
the world may becom guilti befor god

3:20 therefor by the deed of the law there shall no flesh be
justifi in hi sight: for by the law is the knowledg of sin

3:21 but now the righteous of god without the law is manifest
be wit by the law and the prophets; 3:22 even the
righteous of god which is by faith of jesu christ unto all and
upon all them that believe: for there is no difference: 3:23 for all
have sin and come short of the glori of god; 3:24 be justifi
freeli by hi grace through the redempt that is in christ jesus:
3:25 whom god hath set forth to be a propiti through faith in hi
blood to declar hi righteous for the remiss of sin that are
past through the forbear of god; 3:26 to declar i say at thi
time hi righteousness: that he might be just and the justifi of
him which believeth in jesu

3:27 where is boast then? it is exclud by what law? of works?
nay: but by the law of faith

3:28 therefor we conclud that a man is justifi by faith without
the deed of the law

3:29 is he the god of the jew only? is he not also of the gentiles?
ye of the gentil also: 3:30 see it is one god which shall
justifi the circumcis by faith and uncircumcis through faith

3:31 do we then make void the law through faith? god forbid: yea we
establish the law

4:1 what shall we say then that abraham our father as pertain to
the flesh hath found? 4:2 for if abraham were justifi by work he
hath whereof to glory; but not befor god

4:3 for what saith the scripture? abraham believ god and it wa
count unto him for righteous

4:4 now to him that worketh is the reward not reckon of grace but
of debt

4:5 but to him that worketh not but believeth on him that justifieth
the ungodli hi faith is count for righteous

4:6 even as david also describeth the blessed of the man unto
whom god imputeth righteous without work 4:7 say bless are
they whose iniqu are forgiven and whose sin are cover

4:8 bless is the man to whom the lord will not imput sin

4:9 cometh thi blessed then upon the circumcis onli or upon
the uncircumcis also? for we say that faith wa reckon to abraham
for righteous

4:10 how wa it then reckoned? when he wa in circumcis or in
uncircumcision? not in circumcis but in uncircumcis

4:11 and he receiv the sign of circumcis a seal of the
righteous of the faith which he had yet be uncircumcised: that
he might be the father of all them that believ though they be not
circumcised; that righteous might be imput unto them also: 4:12
and the father of circumcis to them who are not of the circumcis
onli but who also walk in the step of that faith of our father
abraham which he had be yet uncircumcis

4:13 for the promis that he should be the heir of the world wa not
to abraham or to hi seed through the law but through the
righteous of faith

4:14 for if they which are of the law be heir faith is made void
and the promis made of none effect: 4:15 becaus the law worketh
wrath: for where no law is there is no transgress

4:16 therefor it is of faith that it might be by grace; to the end
the promis might be sure to all the seed; not to that onli which is
of the law but to that also which is of the faith of abraham; who is
the father of us all 4:17 (a it is written i have made thee a
father of mani nations) befor him whom he believ even god who
quickeneth the dead and calleth those thing which be not as though
they were

4:18 who against hope believ in hope that he might becom the
father of mani nation accord to that which wa spoken so shall
thi seed be

4:19 and be not weak in faith he consid not hi own bodi now
dead when he wa about an hundr year old neither yet the dead
of sarah womb: 4:20 he stagger not at the promis of god through
unbelief; but wa strong in faith give glori to god; 4:21 and be
fulli persuad that what he had promis he wa abl also to
perform

4:22 and therefor it wa imput to him for righteous

4:23 now it wa not written for hi sake alon that it wa imput to
him; 4:24 but for us also to whom it shall be imput if we believ
on him that rais up jesu our lord from the dead; 4:25 who wa
deliv for our offenc and wa rais again for our
justif

5:1 therefor be justifi by faith we have peac with god through
our lord jesu christ: 5:2 by whom also we have access by faith into
thi grace wherein we stand and rejoic in hope of the glori of god

5:3 and not onli so but we glori in tribul also: know that
tribul worketh patience; 5:4 and patienc experience; and
experi hope: 5:5 and hope maketh not ashamed; becaus the love of
god is shed abroad in our heart by the holi ghost which is given unto
us

5:6 for when we were yet without strength in due time christ die for
the ungodli

5:7 for scarc for a righteou man will one die: yet peradventur
for a good man some would even dare to die

5:8 but god commendeth hi love toward us in that while we were yet
sinner christ die for us

5:9 much more then be now justifi by hi blood we shall be
save from wrath through him

5:10 for if when we were enemi we were reconcil to god by the
death of hi son much more be reconcil we shall be save by
hi life

5:11 and not onli so but we also joy in god through our lord jesu
christ by whom we have now receiv the aton

5:12 wherefor as by one man sin enter into the world and death by
sin; and so death pass upon all men for that all have sinned: 5:13
(for until the law sin wa in the world: but sin is not imput when
there is no law

5:14 nevertheless death reign from adam to mose even over them
that had not sin after the similitud of adam transgress who
is the figur of him that wa to come

5:15 but not as the offenc so also is the free gift for if through
the offenc of one mani be dead much more the grace of god and the
gift by grace which is by one man jesu christ hath abound unto
mani

5:16 and not as it wa by one that sin so is the gift: for the
judgment wa by one to condemn but the free gift is of mani
offenc unto justif

5:17 for if by one man offenc death reign by one; much more they
which receiv abund of grace and of the gift of righteous
shall reign in life by one jesu christ) 5:18 therefor as by the
offenc of one judgment came upon all men to condemnation; even so by
the righteous of one the free gift came upon all men unto
justif of life

5:19 for as by one man disobedi mani were made sinner so by
the obedi of one shall mani be made righteou

5:20 moreov the law enter that the offenc might abound but
where sin abound grace did much more abound: 5:21 that as sin hath
reign unto death even so might grace reign through righteous
unto etern life by jesu christ our lord

6:1 what shall we say then? shall we continu in sin that grace may
abound? 6:2 god forbid how shall we that are dead to sin live ani
longer therein? 6:3 know ye not that so mani of us as were baptiz
into jesu christ were baptiz into hi death? 6:4 therefor we are
buri with him by baptism into death: that like as christ wa rais
up from the dead by the glori of the father even so we also should
walk in new of life

6:5 for if we have been plant togeth in the like of hi death
we shall be also in the like of hi resurrection: 6:6 know
thi that our old man is crucifi with him that the bodi of sin
might be destroy that henceforth we should not serv sin

6:7 for he that is dead is freed from sin

6:8 now if we be dead with christ we believ that we shall also live
with him: 6:9 know that christ be rais from the dead dieth no
more; death hath no more dominion over him

6:10 for in that he die he die unto sin once: but in that he
liveth he liveth unto god

6:11 likewis reckon ye also yourselv to be dead inde unto sin
but aliv unto god through jesu christ our lord

6:12 let not sin therefor reign in your mortal bodi that ye should
obey it in the lust thereof

6:13 neither yield ye your member as instrument of unright
unto sin: but yield yourselv unto god as those that are aliv from
the dead and your member as instrument of righteous unto god

6:14 for sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under
the law but under grace

6:15 what then? shall we sin becaus we are not under the law but
under grace? god forbid

6:16 know ye not that to whom ye yield yourselv servant to obey
hi servant ye are to whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death or of
obedi unto righteousness? 6:17 but god be thank that ye were
the servant of sin but ye have obey from the heart that form of
doctrin which wa deliv you

6:18 be then made free from sin ye becam the servant of
righteous

6:19 i speak after the manner of men becaus of the infirm of your
flesh: for as ye have yield your member servant to unclean and
to iniqu unto iniquity; even so now yield your member servant to
righteous unto holi

6:20 for when ye were the servant of sin ye were free from
righteous

6:21 what fruit had ye then in those thing whereof ye are now
ashamed? for the end of those thing is death

6:22 but now be made free from sin and becom servant to god ye
have your fruit unto holi and the end everlast life

6:23 for the wage of sin is death; but the gift of god is etern
life through jesu christ our lord

7:1 know ye not brethren (for i speak to them that know the law)
how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth? 7:2
for the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to her husband
so long as he liveth; but if the husband be dead she is loos from
the law of her husband

7:3 so then if while her husband liveth she be marri to anoth
man she shall be call an adulteress: but if her husband be dead
she is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress though she be
marri to anoth man

7:4 wherefor my brethren ye also are becom dead to the law by the
bodi of christ; that ye should be marri to anoth even to him who
is rais from the dead that we should bring forth fruit unto god

7:5 for when we were in the flesh the motion of sin which were by
the law did work in our member to bring forth fruit unto death

7:6 but now we are deliv from the law that be dead wherein we
were held; that we should serv in new of spirit and not in the
old of the letter

7:7 what shall we say then? is the law sin? god forbid nay i had not
known sin but by the law: for i had not known lust except the law
had said thou shalt not covet

7:8 but sin take occas by the command wrought in me all
manner of concupisc for without the law sin wa dead

7:9 for i wa aliv without the law once: but when the command
came sin reviv and i die

7:10 and the command which wa ordain to life i found to be
unto death

7:11 for sin take occas by the command deceiv me and by
it slew me

7:12 wherefor the law is holi and the command holi and just
and good

7:13 wa then that which is good made death unto me? god forbid but
sin that it might appear sin work death in me by that which is
good; that sin by the command might becom exceed sin

7:14 for we know that the law is spiritual: but i am carnal sold
under sin

7:15 for that which i do i allow not: for what i would that do i not;
but what i hate that do i

7:16 if then i do that which i would not i consent unto the law that
it is good

7:17 now then it is no more i that do it but sin that dwelleth in me

7:18 for i know that in me (that is in my flesh) dwelleth no good
thing: for to will is present with me; but how to perform that which
is good i find not

7:19 for the good that i would i do not: but the evil which i would
not that i do

7:20 now if i do that i would not it is no more i that do it but sin
that dwelleth in me

7:21 i find then a law that when i would do good evil is present
with me

7:22 for i delight in the law of god after the inward man: 7:23 but i
see anoth law in my member war against the law of my mind and
bring me into captiv to the law of sin which is in my member

7:24 o wretch man that i am! who shall deliv me from the bodi of
thi death? 7:25 i thank god through jesu christ our lord so then
with the mind i myself serv the law of god; but with the flesh the
law of sin

8:1 there is therefor now no condemn to them which are in christ
jesu who walk not after the flesh but after the spirit

8:2 for the law of the spirit of life in christ jesu hath made me
free from the law of sin and death

8:3 for what the law could not do in that it wa weak through the
flesh god send hi own son in the like of sin flesh and
for sin condemn sin in the flesh: 8:4 that the righteous of the
law might be fulfil in us who walk not after the flesh but after
the spirit

8:5 for they that are after the flesh do mind the thing of the flesh;
but they that are after the spirit the thing of the spirit

8:6 for to be carnal mind is death; but to be spiritu mind
is life and peac

8:7 becaus the carnal mind is enmiti against god: for it is not
subject to the law of god neither inde can be

8:8 so then they that are in the flesh cannot pleas god

8:9 but ye are not in the flesh but in the spirit if so be that the
spirit of god dwell in you now if ani man have not the spirit of
christ he is none of hi

8:10 and if christ be in you the bodi is dead becaus of sin; but the
spirit is life becaus of righteous

8:11 but if the spirit of him that rais up jesu from the dead dwell
in you he that rais up christ from the dead shall also quicken your
mortal bodi by hi spirit that dwelleth in you

8:12 therefor brethren we are debtor not to the flesh to live
after the flesh

8:13 for if ye live after the flesh ye shall die: but if ye through
the spirit do mortifi the deed of the bodi ye shall live

8:14 for as mani as are led by the spirit of god they are the son of
god

8:15 for ye have not receiv the spirit of bondag again to fear; but
ye have receiv the spirit of adopt wherebi we cri abba father

8:16 the spirit itself beareth wit with our spirit that we are
the children of god: 8:17 and if children then heirs; heir of god
and joint-heir with christ; if so be that we suffer with him that we
may be also glorifi togeth

8:18 for i reckon that the suffer of thi present time are not
worthi to be compar with the glori which shall be reveal in us

8:19 for the earnest expect of the creatur waiteth for the
manifest of the son of god

8:20 for the creatur wa made subject to vaniti not willingli but
by reason of him who hath subject the same in hope 8:21 becaus the
creatur itself also shall be deliv from the bondag of corrupt
into the gloriou liberti of the children of god

8:22 for we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in
pain togeth until now

8:23 and not onli they but ourselv also which have the firstfruit
of the spirit even we ourselv groan within ourselv wait for
the adopt to wit the redempt of our bodi

8:24 for we are save by hope: but hope that is seen is not hope: for
what a man seeth whi doth he yet hope for? 8:25 but if we hope for
that we see not then do we with patienc wait for it

8:26 likewis the spirit also helpeth our infirmities: for we know not
what we should pray for as we ought: but the spirit itself maketh
intercess for us with groan which cannot be utter

8:27 and he that searcheth the heart knoweth what is the mind of the
spirit becaus he maketh intercess for the saint accord to the
will of god

8:28 and we know that all thing work togeth for good to them that
love god to them who are the call accord to hi purpos

8:29 for whom he did foreknow he also did predestin to be
conform to the imag of hi son that he might be the firstborn
among mani brethren

8:30 moreov whom he did predestin them he also called: and whom
he call them he also justified: and whom he justifi them he also
glorifi

8:31 what shall we then say to these things? if god be for us who can
be against us? 8:32 he that spare not hi own son but deliv him
up for us all how shall he not with him also freeli give us all
things? 8:33 who shall lay ani thing to the charg of god elect? it
is god that justifieth

8:34 who is he that condemneth? it is christ that die yea rather
that is risen again who is even at the right hand of god who also
maketh intercess for us

8:35 who shall separ us from the love of christ? shall tribul
or distress or persecut or famin or naked or peril or
sword? 8:36 as it is written for thi sake we are kill all the day
long; we are account as sheep for the slaughter

8:37 nay in all these thing we are more than conqueror through him
that love us

8:38 for i am persuad that neither death nor life nor angel nor
princip nor power nor thing present nor thing to come
8:39 nor height nor depth nor ani other creatur shall be abl to
separ us from the love of god which is in christ jesu our lord

9:1 i say the truth in christ i lie not my conscienc also bear
me wit in the holi ghost 9:2 that i have great heavi and
continu sorrow in my heart

9:3 for i could wish that myself were accurs from christ for my
brethren my kinsmen accord to the flesh: 9:4 who are israelites;
to whom pertaineth the adopt and the glori and the coven and
the give of the law and the servic of god and the promises; 9:5
whose are the father and of whom as concern the flesh christ
came who is over all god bless for ever amen

9:6 not as though the word of god hath taken none effect for they are
not all israel which are of israel: 9:7 neither becaus they are the
seed of abraham are they all children: but in isaac shall thi seed
be call

9:8 that is they which are the children of the flesh these are not
the children of god: but the children of the promis are count for
the seed

9:9 for thi is the word of promis at thi time will i come and
sarah shall have a son

9:10 and not onli this; but when rebecca also had conceiv by one
even by our father isaac; 9:11 (for the children be not yet born
neither have done ani good or evil that the purpos of god
accord to elect might stand not of work but of him that
calleth;) 9:12 it wa said unto her the elder shall serv the
younger

9:13 as it is written jacob have i love but esau have i hate

9:14 what shall we say then? is there unright with god? god
forbid

9:15 for he saith to mose i will have merci on whom i will have
merci and i will have compass on whom i will have compass

9:16 so then it is not of him that willeth nor of him that runneth
but of god that sheweth merci

9:17 for the scriptur saith unto pharaoh even for thi same purpos
have i rais thee up that i might shew my power in thee and that my
name might be declar throughout all the earth

9:18 therefor hath he merci on whom he will have merci and whom he
will he hardeneth

9:19 thou wilt say then unto me whi doth he yet find fault? for who
hath resist hi will? 9:20 nay but o man who art thou that
repliest against god? shall the thing form say to him that form
it whi hast thou made me thus? 9:21 hath not the potter power over
the clay of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour and anoth
unto dishonour? 9:22 what if god will to shew hi wrath and to
make hi power known endur with much longsuff the vessel of
wrath fit to destruction: 9:23 and that he might make known the
rich of hi glori on the vessel of merci which he had afor
prepar unto glori 9:24 even us whom he hath call not of the
jew onli but also of the gentiles? 9:25 as he saith also in ose i
will call them my peopl which were not my people; and her belov
which wa not belov

9:26 and it shall come to pass that in the place where it wa said
unto them ye are not my people; there shall they be call the
children of the live god

9:27 esaia also crieth concern israel though the number of the
children of israel be as the sand of the sea a remnant shall be
saved: 9:28 for he will finish the work and cut it short in
righteousness: becaus a short work will the lord make upon the earth

9:29 and as esaia said befor except the lord of sabaoth had left us
a seed we had been as sodoma and been made like unto gomorrha

9:30 what shall we say then? that the gentil which follow not
after righteous have attain to righteous even the
righteous which is of faith

9:31 but israel which follow after the law of righteous hath
not attain to the law of righteous

9:32 wherefore? becaus they sought it not by faith but as it were by
the work of the law for they stumbl at that stumblingstone; 9:33
as it is written behold i lay in sion a stumblingston and rock of
offence: and whosoev believeth on him shall not be asham

10:1 brethren my heart desir and prayer to god for israel is that
they might be save

10:2 for i bear them record that they have a zeal of god but not
accord to knowledg

10:3 for they be ignor of god righteous and go about
to establish their own righteous have not submit themselv
unto the righteous of god

10:4 for christ is the end of the law for righteous to everi one
that believeth

10:5 for mose describeth the righteous which is of the law that
the man which doeth those thing shall live by them

10:6 but the righteous which is of faith speaketh on thi wise
say not in thine heart who shall ascend into heaven? (that is to
bring christ down from above:) 10:7 or who shall descend into the
deep? (that is to bring up christ again from the dead) 10:8 but
what saith it? the word is nigh thee even in thi mouth and in thi
heart: that is the word of faith which we preach; 10:9 that if thou
shalt confess with thi mouth the lord jesu and shalt believ in
thine heart that god hath rais him from the dead thou shalt be
save

10:10 for with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with
the mouth confess is made unto salvat

10:11 for the scriptur saith whosoev believeth on him shall not be
asham

10:12 for there is no differ between the jew and the greek: for
the same lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him

10:13 for whosoev shall call upon the name of the lord shall be
save

10:14 how then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed?
and how shall they believ in him of whom they have not heard? and how
shall they hear without a preacher? 10:15 and how shall they preach
except they be sent? as it is written how beauti are the feet of
them that preach the gospel of peac and bring glad tide of good
things! 10:16 but they have not all obey the gospel for esaia
saith lord who hath believ our report? 10:17 so then faith cometh
by hear and hear by the word of god

10:18 but i say have they not heard? ye verili their sound went
into all the earth and their word unto the end of the world

10:19 but i say did not israel know? first mose saith i will
provok you to jealousi by them that are no peopl and by a foolish
nation i will anger you

10:20 but esaia is veri bold and saith i wa found of them that
sought me not; i wa made manifest unto them that ask not after me

10:21 but to israel he saith all day long i have stretch forth my
hand unto a disobedi and gainsay peopl

11:1 i say then hath god cast away hi people? god forbid for i also
am an israelit of the seed of abraham of the tribe of benjamin

11:2 god hath not cast away hi peopl which he foreknew wot ye not
what the scriptur saith of elias? how he maketh intercess to god
against israel say 11:3 lord they have kill thi prophet and
dig down thine altars; and i am left alon and they seek my life

11:4 but what saith the answer of god unto him? i have reserv to
myself seven thousand men who have not bow the knee to the imag of
baal

11:5 even so then at thi present time also there is a remnant
accord to the elect of grace

11:6 and if by grace then is it no more of works: otherwis grace is
no more grace but if it be of work then it is no more grace:
otherwis work is no more work

11:7 what then? israel hath not obtain that which he seeketh for;
but the elect hath obtain it and the rest were blind

11:8 (accord as it is written god hath given them the spirit of
slumber eye that they should not see and ear that they should not
hear;) unto thi day

11:9 and david saith let their tabl be made a snare and a trap and
a stumblingblock and a recomp unto them: 11:10 let their eye be
darken that they may not see and bow down their back alway

11:11 i say then have they stumbl that they should fall? god
forbid: but rather through their fall salvat is come unto the
gentil for to provok them to jealousi

11:12 now if the fall of them be the rich of the world and the
diminish of them the rich of the gentiles; how much more their
fulness? 11:13 for i speak to you gentil inasmuch as i am the
apostl of the gentil i magnifi mine office: 11:14 if by ani mean
i may provok to emul them which are my flesh and might save
some of them

11:15 for if the cast away of them be the reconcil of the world
what shall the receiv of them be but life from the dead? 11:16
for if the firstfruit be holi the lump is also holy: and if the root
be holi so are the branch

11:17 and if some of the branch be broken off and thou be a
wild oliv tree wert graf in among them and with them partakest
of the root and fat of the oliv tree; 11:18 boast not against the
branch but if thou boast thou bearest not the root but the root
thee

11:19 thou wilt say then the branch were broken off that i might
be graf in

11:20 well; becaus of unbelief they were broken off and thou
standest by faith be not highmind but fear: 11:21 for if god
spare not the natur branch take heed lest he also spare not
thee

11:22 behold therefor the good and sever of god: on them which
fell severity; but toward thee good if thou continu in hi
goodness: otherwis thou also shalt be cut off

11:23 and they also if they abid not still in unbelief shall be
graf in: for god is abl to graff them in again

11:24 for if thou wert cut out of the oliv tree which is wild by
natur and wert graf contrari to natur into a good oliv tree:
how much more shall these which be the natur branch be graf
into their own oliv tree? 11:25 for i would not brethren that ye
should be ignor of thi mysteri lest ye should be wise in your own
conceits; that blind in part is happen to israel until the
ful of the gentil be come in

11:26 and so all israel shall be saved: as it is written there shall
come out of sion the deliver and shall turn away ungodli from
jacob: 11:27 for thi is my coven unto them when i shall take away
their sin

11:28 as concern the gospel they are enemi for your sakes: but
as touch the elect they are belov for the father sake

11:29 for the gift and call of god are without repent

11:30 for as ye in time past have not believ god yet have now
obtain merci through their unbelief: 11:31 even so have these also
now not believ that through your merci they also may obtain merci

11:32 for god hath conclud them all in unbelief that he might have
merci upon all

11:33 o the depth of the rich both of the wisdom and knowledg of
god! how unsearch are hi judgment and hi way past find
out! 11:34 for who hath known the mind of the lord? or who hath been
hi counsellor? 11:35 or who hath first given to him and it shall be
recompens unto him again? 11:36 for of him and through him and to
him are all things: to whom be glori for ever amen

12:1 i beseech you therefor brethren by the merci of god that ye
present your bodi a live sacrific holi accept unto god
which is your reason servic

12:2 and be not conform to thi world: but be ye transform by the
renew of your mind that ye may prove what is that good and
accept and perfect will of god

12:3 for i say through the grace given unto me to everi man that is
among you not to think of himself more highli than he ought to think;
but to think soberli accord as god hath dealt to everi man the
measur of faith

12:4 for as we have mani member in one bodi and all member have not
the same office: 12:5 so we be mani are one bodi in christ and
everi one member one of anoth

12:6 have then gift differ accord to the grace that is given
to us whether propheci let us prophesi accord to the proport
of faith; 12:7 or ministri let us wait on our ministering: or he that
teacheth on teaching; 12:8 or he that exhorteth on exhortation: he
that giveth let him do it with simplicity; he that ruleth with
diligence; he that sheweth merci with cheer

12:9 let love be without dissimul abhor that which is evil;
cleav to that which is good

12:10 be kindli affect one to anoth with brotherli love; in
honour prefer one another; 12:11 not sloth in business; fervent
in spirit; serv the lord; 12:12 rejoic in hope; patient in
tribulation; continu instant in prayer; 12:13 distribut to the
necess of saints; given to hospit

12:14 bless them which persecut you: bless and curs not

12:15 rejoic with them that do rejoic and weep with them that weep

12:16 be of the same mind one toward anoth mind not high thing
but condescend to men of low estat be not wise in your own conceit

12:17 recompens to no man evil for evil provid thing honest in the
sight of all men

12:18 if it be possibl as much as lieth in you live peaceabl with
all men

12:19 dearli belov aveng not yourselv but rather give place
unto wrath: for it is written vengeanc is mine; i will repay saith
the lord

12:20 therefor if thine enemi hunger feed him; if he thirst give
him drink: for in so do thou shalt heap coal of fire on hi head

12:21 be not overcom of evil but overcom evil with good

13:1 let everi soul be subject unto the higher power for there is no
power but of god: the power that be are ordain of god

13:2 whosoev therefor resisteth the power resisteth the ordin
of god: and they that resist shall receiv to themselv damnat

13:3 for ruler are not a terror to good work but to the evil wilt
thou then not be afraid of the power? do that which is good and thou
shalt have prais of the same: 13:4 for he is the minist of god to
thee for good but if thou do that which is evil be afraid; for he
beareth not the sword in vain: for he is the minist of god a
reveng to execut wrath upon him that doeth evil

13:5 wherefor ye must need be subject not onli for wrath but also
for conscienc sake

13:6 for for thi caus pay ye tribut also: for they are god
minist attend continu upon thi veri thing

13:7 render therefor to all their dues: tribut to whom tribut is
due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour

13:8 owe no man ani thing but to love one another: for he that loveth
anoth hath fulfil the law

13:9 for thi thou shalt not commit adulteri thou shalt not kill
thou shalt not steal thou shalt not bear fals wit thou shalt
not covet; and if there be ani other command it is briefli
comprehend in thi say name thou shalt love thi neighbour as
thyself

13:10 love worketh no ill to hi neighbour: therefor love is the
fulfil of the law

13:11 and that know the time that now it is high time to awak
out of sleep: for now is our salvat nearer than when we believ

13:12 the night is far spent the day is at hand: let us therefor
cast off the work of dark and let us put on the armour of light

13:13 let us walk honestli as in the day; not in riot and
drunken not in chamber and wanton not in strife and
envi

13:14 but put ye on the lord jesu christ and make not provis for
the flesh to fulfil the lust thereof

14:1 him that is weak in the faith receiv ye but not to doubt
disput

14:2 for one believeth that he may eat all things: anoth who is
weak eateth herb

14:3 let not him that eateth despis him that eateth not; and let not
him which eateth not judg him that eateth: for god hath receiv him

14:4 who art thou that judgest anoth man servant? to hi own
master he standeth or falleth yea he shall be holden up: for god is
abl to make him stand

14:5 one man esteemeth one day abov another: anoth esteemeth everi
day alik let everi man be fulli persuad in hi own mind

14:6 he that regardeth the day regardeth it unto the lord; and he
that regardeth not the day to the lord he doth not regard it he that
eateth eateth to the lord for he giveth god thanks; and he that
eateth not to the lord he eateth not and giveth god thank

14:7 for none of us liveth to himself and no man dieth to himself

14:8 for whether we live we live unto the lord; and whether we die
we die unto the lord: whether we live therefor or die we are the
lord

14:9 for to thi end christ both die and rose and reviv that he
might be lord both of the dead and live

14:10 but whi dost thou judg thi brother? or whi dost thou set at
nought thi brother? for we shall all stand befor the judgment seat of
christ

14:11 for it is written as i live saith the lord everi knee shall
bow to me and everi tongu shall confess to god

14:12 so then everi one of us shall give account of himself to god

14:13 let us not therefor judg one anoth ani more: but judg thi
rather that no man put a stumblingblock or an occas to fall in hi
brother way

14:14 i know and am persuad by the lord jesu that there is
noth unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth ani thing to be
unclean to him it is unclean

14:15 but if thi brother be griev with thi meat now walkest thou
not charit destroy not him with thi meat for whom christ die

14:16 let not then your good be evil spoken of: 14:17 for the kingdom
of god is not meat and drink; but righteous and peac and joy in
the holi ghost

14:18 for he that in these thing serveth christ is accept to god
and approv of men

14:19 let us therefor follow after the thing which make for peac
and thing wherewith one may edifi anoth

14:20 for meat destroy not the work of god all thing inde are
pure; but it is evil for that man who eateth with offenc

14:21 it is good neither to eat flesh nor to drink wine nor ani
thing wherebi thi brother stumbleth or is offend or is made weak

14:22 hast thou faith? have it to thyself befor god happi is he that
condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth

14:23 and he that doubteth is damn if he eat becaus he eateth not
of faith: for whatsoev is not of faith is sin

15:1 we then that are strong ought to bear the infirm of the
weak and not to pleas ourselv

15:2 let everi one of us pleas hi neighbour for hi good to
edif

15:3 for even christ pleas not himself; but as it is written the
reproach of them that reproach thee fell on me

15:4 for whatsoev thing were written aforetim were written for our
learn that we through patienc and comfort of the scriptur might
have hope

15:5 now the god of patienc and consol grant you to be
likemind one toward anoth accord to christ jesus: 15:6 that ye
may with one mind and one mouth glorifi god even the father of our
lord jesu christ

15:7 wherefor receiv ye one anoth as christ also receiv us to
the glori of god

15:8 now i say that jesu christ wa a minist of the circumcis
for the truth of god to confirm the promis made unto the fathers:
15:9 and that the gentil might glorifi god for hi mercy; as it is
written for thi caus i will confess to thee among the gentil and
sing unto thi name

15:10 and again he saith rejoic ye gentil with hi peopl

15:11 and again prais the lord all ye gentiles; and laud him all
ye peopl

15:12 and again esaia saith there shall be a root of jess and he
that shall rise to reign over the gentiles; in him shall the gentil
trust

15:13 now the god of hope fill you with all joy and peac in
believ that ye may abound in hope through the power of the holi
ghost

15:14 and i myself also am persuad of you my brethren that ye also
are full of good fill with all knowledg abl also to admonish
one anoth

15:15 nevertheless brethren i have written the more boldli unto you
in some sort as put you in mind becaus of the grace that is
given to me of god 15:16 that i should be the minist of jesu
christ to the gentil minist the gospel of god that the
offer up of the gentil might be accept be sanctifi by
the holi ghost

15:17 i have therefor whereof i may glori through jesu christ in
those thing which pertain to god

15:18 for i will not dare to speak of ani of those thing which christ
hath not wrought by me to make the gentil obedi by word and
deed 15:19 through mighti sign and wonder by the power of the
spirit of god; so that from jerusalem and round about unto illyricum
i have fulli preach the gospel of christ

15:20 yea so have i strive to preach the gospel not where christ
wa name lest i should build upon anoth man foundation: 15:21
but as it is written to whom he wa not spoken of they shall see:
and they that have not heard shall understand

15:22 for which caus also i have been much hinder from come to
you

15:23 but now have no more place in these part and have a great
desir these mani year to come unto you; 15:24 whensoev i take my
journey into spain i will come to you: for i trust to see you in my
journey and to be brought on my way thitherward by you if first i be
somewhat fill with your compani

15:25 but now i go unto jerusalem to minist unto the saint

15:26 for it hath pleas them of macedonia and achaia to make a
certain contribut for the poor saint which are at jerusalem

15:27 it hath pleas them verily; and their debtor they are for if
the gentil have been made partak of their spiritu thing their
duti is also to minist unto them in carnal thing

15:28 when therefor i have perform thi and have seal to them
thi fruit i will come by you into spain

15:29 and i am sure that when i come unto you i shall come in the
ful of the bless of the gospel of christ

15:30 now i beseech you brethren for the lord jesu christ sake
and for the love of the spirit that ye strive togeth with me in
your prayer to god for me; 15:31 that i may be deliv from them
that do not believ in judaea; and that my servic which i have for
jerusalem may be accept of the saints; 15:32 that i may come unto
you with joy by the will of god and may with you be refresh

15:33 now the god of peac be with you all amen

16:1 i commend unto you phebe our sister which is a servant of the
church which is at cenchrea: 16:2 that ye receiv her in the lord as
becometh saint and that ye assist her in whatsoev busi she
hath need of you: for she hath been a succour of mani and of myself
also

16:3 greet priscilla and aquila my helper in christ jesus: 16:4 who
have for my life laid down their own necks: unto whom not onli i give
thank but also all the church of the gentil

16:5 likewis greet the church that is in their hous salut my
well-belov epaenetu who is the firstfruit of achaia unto christ

16:6 greet mari who bestow much labour on us

16:7 salut andronicu and junia my kinsmen and my fellow-prison
who are of note among the apostl who also were in christ befor me

16:8 greet amplia my belov in the lord

16:9 salut urban our helper in christ and stachi my belov

16:10 salut apel approv in christ salut them which are of
aristobulu household

16:11 salut herodion my kinsman greet them that be of the household
of narcissu which are in the lord

16:12 salut tryphena and tryphosa who labour in the lord salut the
belov persi which labour much in the lord

16:13 salut rufu chosen in the lord and hi mother and mine

16:14 salut asyncritu phlegon herma patroba herm and the
brethren which are with them

16:15 salut philologu and julia nereu and hi sister and
olympa and all the saint which are with them

16:16 salut one anoth with an holi kiss the church of christ
salut you

16:17 now i beseech you brethren mark them which caus divis and
offenc contrari to the doctrin which ye have learned; and avoid
them

16:18 for they that are such serv not our lord jesu christ but
their own belly; and by good word and fair speech deceiv the
heart of the simpl

16:19 for your obedi is come abroad unto all men i am glad
therefor on your behalf: but yet i would have you wise unto that
which is good and simpl concern evil

16:20 and the god of peac shall bruis satan under your feet shortli
the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you amen

16:21 timotheu my workfellow and luciu and jason and sosipat
my kinsmen salut you

16:22 i tertiu who wrote thi epistl salut you in the lord

16:23 gaiu mine host and of the whole church saluteth you erastu
the chamberlain of the citi saluteth you and quartu a brother

16:24 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you all amen

16:25 now to him that is of power to stablish you accord to my
gospel and the preach of jesu christ accord to the revel
of the mysteri which wa kept secret sinc the world began 16:26 but
now is made manifest and by the scriptur of the prophet accord
to the command of the everlast god made known to all nation
for the obedi of faith: 16:27 to god onli wise be glori through
jesu christ for ever amen



the first epistl of paul the apostl to the corinthian


1:1 paul call to be an apostl of jesu christ through the will of
god and sosthen our brother 1:2 unto the church of god which is at
corinth to them that are sanctifi in christ jesu call to be
saint with all that in everi place call upon the name of jesu
christ our lord both their and ours: 1:3 grace be unto you and
peac from god our father and from the lord jesu christ

1:4 i thank my god alway on your behalf for the grace of god which
is given you by jesu christ; 1:5 that in everi thing ye are enrich
by him in all utter and in all knowledge; 1:6 even as the
testimoni of christ wa confirm in you: 1:7 so that ye come behind
in no gift; wait for the come of our lord jesu christ: 1:8 who
shall also confirm you unto the end that ye may be blameless in the
day of our lord jesu christ

1:9 god is faith by whom ye were call unto the fellowship of hi
son jesu christ our lord

1:10 now i beseech you brethren by the name of our lord jesu
christ that ye all speak the same thing and that there be no
divis among you; but that ye be perfectli join togeth in the
same mind and in the same judgment

1:11 for it hath been declar unto me of you my brethren by them
which are of the hous of chloe that there are content among you

1:12 now thi i say that everi one of you saith i am of paul; and i
of apollos; and i of cephas; and i of christ

1:13 is christ divided? wa paul crucifi for you? or were ye
baptiz in the name of paul? 1:14 i thank god that i baptiz none
of you but crispu and gaius; 1:15 lest ani should say that i had
baptiz in mine own name

1:16 and i baptiz also the household of stephanas: besid i know
not whether i baptiz ani other

1:17 for christ sent me not to baptiz but to preach the gospel: not
with wisdom of word lest the cross of christ should be made of none
effect

1:18 for the preach of the cross is to them that perish
foolishness; but unto us which are save it is the power of god

1:19 for it is written i will destroy the wisdom of the wise and
will bring to noth the understand of the prudent

1:20 where is the wise? where is the scribe? where is the disput of
thi world? hath not god made foolish the wisdom of thi world? 1:21
for after that in the wisdom of god the world by wisdom knew not god
it pleas god by the foolish of preach to save them that
believ

1:22 for the jew requir a sign and the greek seek after wisdom:
1:23 but we preach christ crucifi unto the jew a stumblingblock
and unto the greek foolishness; 1:24 but unto them which are call
both jew and greek christ the power of god and the wisdom of god

1:25 becaus the foolish of god is wiser than men; and the
weak of god is stronger than men

1:26 for ye see your call brethren how that not mani wise men
after the flesh not mani mighti not mani nobl are called: 1:27 but
god hath chosen the foolish thing of the world to confound the wise;
and god hath chosen the weak thing of the world to confound the
thing which are mighty; 1:28 and base thing of the world and thing
which are despis hath god chosen yea and thing which are not to
bring to nought thing that are: 1:29 that no flesh should glori in
hi presenc

1:30 but of him are ye in christ jesu who of god is made unto us
wisdom and righteous and sanctif and redemption: 1:31
that accord as it is written he that glorieth let him glori in
the lord

2:1 and i brethren when i came to you came not with excel of
speech or of wisdom declar unto you the testimoni of god

2:2 for i determin not to know ani thing among you save jesu
christ and him crucifi

2:3 and i wa with you in weak and in fear and in much
trembl

2:4 and my speech and my preach wa not with entic word of
man wisdom but in demonstr of the spirit and of power: 2:5
that your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men but in the
power of god

2:6 howbeit we speak wisdom among them that are perfect: yet not the
wisdom of thi world nor of the princ of thi world that come to
nought: 2:7 but we speak the wisdom of god in a mysteri even the
hidden wisdom which god ordain befor the world unto our glory: 2:8
which none of the princ of thi world knew: for had they known it
they would not have crucifi the lord of glori

2:9 but as it is written eye hath not seen nor ear heard neither
have enter into the heart of man the thing which god hath prepar
for them that love him

2:10 but god hath reveal them unto us by hi spirit: for the spirit
searcheth all thing yea the deep thing of god

2:11 for what man knoweth the thing of a man save the spirit of man
which is in him? even so the thing of god knoweth no man but the
spirit of god

2:12 now we have receiv not the spirit of the world but the spirit
which is of god; that we might know the thing that are freeli given
to us of god

2:13 which thing also we speak not in the word which man wisdom
teacheth but which the holi ghost teacheth; compar spiritu
thing with spiritu

2:14 but the natur man receiveth not the thing of the spirit of
god: for they are foolish unto him: neither can he know them
becaus they are spiritu discern

2:15 but he that is spiritu judgeth all thing yet he himself is
judg of no man

2:16 for who hath known the mind of the lord that he may instruct
him? but we have the mind of christ

3:1 and i brethren could not speak unto you as unto spiritu but
as unto carnal even as unto babe in christ

3:2 i have fed you with milk and not with meat: for hitherto ye were
not abl to bear it neither yet now are ye abl

3:3 for ye are yet carnal: for wherea there is among you envi and
strife and divis are ye not carnal and walk as men? 3:4 for
while one saith i am of paul; and anoth i am of apollos; are ye
not carnal? 3:5 who then is paul and who is apollo but minist
by whom ye believ even as the lord gave to everi man? 3:6 i have
plant apollo watered; but god gave the increas

3:7 so then neither is he that planteth ani thing neither he that
watereth; but god that giveth the increas

3:8 now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and everi man
shall receiv hi own reward accord to hi own labour

3:9 for we are labour togeth with god: ye are god husbandri ye
are god build

3:10 accord to the grace of god which is given unto me as a wise
masterbuild i have laid the foundat and anoth buildeth
thereon but let everi man take heed how he buildeth thereupon

3:11 for other foundat can no man lay than that is laid which is
jesu christ

3:12 now if ani man build upon thi foundat gold silver preciou
stone wood hay stubble; 3:13 everi man work shall be made
manifest: for the day shall declar it becaus it shall be reveal
by fire; and the fire shall tri everi man work of what sort it is

3:14 if ani man work abid which he hath built thereupon he shall
receiv a reward

3:15 if ani man work shall be burn he shall suffer loss: but he
himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire

3:16 know ye not that ye are the templ of god and that the spirit of
god dwelleth in you? 3:17 if ani man defil the templ of god him
shall god destroy; for the templ of god is holi which templ ye are

3:18 let no man deceiv himself if ani man among you seemeth to be
wise in thi world let him becom a fool that he may be wise

3:19 for the wisdom of thi world is foolish with god for it is
written he taketh the wise in their own crafti

3:20 and again the lord knoweth the thought of the wise that they
are vain

3:21 therefor let no man glori in men for all thing are yours;
3:22 whether paul or apollo or cepha or the world or life or
death or thing present or thing to come; all are yours; 3:23 and
ye are christs; and christ is god

4:1 let a man so account of us as of the minist of christ and
steward of the mysteri of god

4:2 moreov it is requir in steward that a man be found faith

4:3 but with me it is a veri small thing that i should be judg of
you or of man judgment: yea i judg not mine own self

4:4 for i know noth by myself; yet am i not herebi justified: but
he that judgeth me is the lord

4:5 therefor judg noth befor the time until the lord come who
both will bring to light the hidden thing of dark and will make
manifest the counsel of the hearts: and then shall everi man have
prais of god

4:6 and these thing brethren i have in a figur transfer to
myself and to apollo for your sakes; that ye might learn in us not to
think of men abov that which is written that no one of you be puf
up for one against anoth

4:7 for who maketh thee to differ from another? and what hast thou
that thou didst not receive? now if thou didst receiv it whi dost
thou glori as if thou hadst not receiv it? 4:8 now ye are full
now ye are rich ye have reign as king without us: and i would to
god ye did reign that we also might reign with you

4:9 for i think that god hath set forth us the apostl last as it
were appoint to death: for we are made a spectacl unto the world
and to angel and to men

4:10 we are fool for christ sake but ye are wise in christ; we are
weak but ye are strong; ye are honour but we are despis

4:11 even unto thi present hour we both hunger and thirst and are
nake and are buffet and have no certain dwellingplace; 4:12 and
labour work with our own hands: be revil we bless; be
persecut we suffer it: 4:13 be defam we intreat: we are made
as the filth of the world and are the offscour of all thing unto
thi day

4:14 i write not these thing to shame you but as my belov son i
warn you

4:15 for though ye have ten thousand instruct in christ yet have
ye not mani fathers: for in christ jesu i have begotten you through
the gospel

4:16 wherefor i beseech you be ye follow of me

4:17 for thi caus have i sent unto you timotheu who is my belov
son and faith in the lord who shall bring you into remembr of
my way which be in christ as i teach everi where in everi church

4:18 now some are puf up as though i would not come to you

4:19 but i will come to you shortli if the lord will and will know
not the speech of them which are puf up but the power

4:20 for the kingdom of god is not in word but in power

4:21 what will ye? shall i come unto you with a rod or in love and
in the spirit of meekness? 5:1 it is report commonli that there is
fornic among you and such fornic as is not so much as name
among the gentil that one should have hi father wife

5:2 and ye are puf up and have not rather mourn that he that
hath done thi deed might be taken away from among you

5:3 for i verili as absent in bodi but present in spirit have
judg alreadi as though i were present concern him that hath so
done thi deed 5:4 in the name of our lord jesu christ when ye are
gather togeth and my spirit with the power of our lord jesu
christ 5:5 to deliv such an one unto satan for the destruct of
the flesh that the spirit may be save in the day of the lord jesu

5:6 your glori is not good know ye not that a littl leaven
leaveneth the whole lump? 5:7 purg out therefor the old leaven
that ye may be a new lump as ye are unleaven for even christ our
passov is sacrif for us: 5:8 therefor let us keep the feast
not with old leaven neither with the leaven of malic and wickedness;
but with the unleaven bread of sincer and truth

5:9 i wrote unto you in an epistl not to compani with fornicators:
5:10 yet not altogeth with the fornic of thi world or with
the covet or extortion or with idolaters; for then must ye
need go out of the world

5:11 but now i have written unto you not to keep compani if ani man
that is call a brother be a fornic or covet or an idolat
or a railer or a drunkard or an extortioner; with such an one no not
to eat

5:12 for what have i to do to judg them also that are without? do not
ye judg them that are within? 5:13 but them that are without god
judgeth therefor put away from among yourselv that wick person

6:1 dare ani of you have a matter against anoth go to law befor
the unjust and not befor the saints? 6:2 do ye not know that the
saint shall judg the world? and if the world shall be judg by you
are ye unworthi to judg the smallest matters? 6:3 know ye not that
we shall judg angels? how much more thing that pertain to thi life?
6:4 if then ye have judgment of thing pertain to thi life set
them to judg who are least esteem in the church

6:5 i speak to your shame is it so that there is not a wise man
among you? no not one that shall be abl to judg between hi
brethren? 6:6 but brother goeth to law with brother and that befor
the unbeliev

6:7 now therefor there is utterli a fault among you becaus ye go to
law one with anoth whi do ye not rather take wrong? whi do ye not
rather suffer yourselv to be defrauded? 6:8 nay ye do wrong and
defraud and that your brethren

6:9 know ye not that the unright shall not inherit the kingdom of
god? be not deceived: neither fornic nor idolat nor
adulter nor effemin nor abus of themselv with mankind
6:10 nor thiev nor covet nor drunkard nor revil nor
extortion shall inherit the kingdom of god

6:11 and such were some of you: but ye are wash but ye are
sanctifi but ye are justifi in the name of the lord jesu and by
the spirit of our god

6:12 all thing are law unto me but all thing are not expedient:
all thing are law for me but i will not be brought under the
power of ani

6:13 meat for the belli and the belli for meats: but god shall
destroy both it and them now the bodi is not for fornic but for
the lord; and the lord for the bodi

6:14 and god hath both rais up the lord and will also rais up us
by hi own power

6:15 know ye not that your bodi are the member of christ? shall i
then take the member of christ and make them the member of an
harlot? god forbid

6:16 what? know ye not that he which is join to an harlot is one
body? for two saith he shall be one flesh

6:17 but he that is join unto the lord is one spirit

6:18 flee fornic everi sin that a man doeth is without the body;
but he that committeth fornic sinneth against hi own bodi

6:19 what? know ye not that your bodi is the templ of the holi ghost
which is in you which ye have of god and ye are not your own? 6:20
for ye are bought with a price: therefor glorifi god in your bodi
and in your spirit which are god

7:1 now concern the thing whereof ye wrote unto me: it is good for
a man not to touch a woman

7:2 nevertheless to avoid fornic let everi man have hi own
wife and let everi woman have her own husband

7:3 let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and likewis
also the wife unto the husband

7:4 the wife hath not power of her own bodi but the husband: and
likewis also the husband hath not power of hi own bodi but the
wife

7:5 defraud ye not one the other except it be with consent for a
time that ye may give yourselv to fast and prayer; and come
togeth again that satan tempt you not for your incontin

7:6 but i speak thi by permiss and not of command

7:7 for i would that all men were even as i myself but everi man hath
hi proper gift of god one after thi manner and anoth after that

7:8 i say therefor to the unmarri and widow it is good for them
if they abid even as i

7:9 but if they cannot contain let them marry: for it is better to
marri than to burn

7:10 and unto the marri i command yet not i but the lord let not
the wife depart from her husband: 7:11 but and if she depart let her
remain unmarri or be reconcil to her husband: and let not the
husband put away hi wife

7:12 but to the rest speak i not the lord: if ani brother hath a wife
that believeth not and she be pleas to dwell with him let him not
put her away

7:13 and the woman which hath an husband that believeth not and if he
be pleas to dwell with her let her not leav him

7:14 for the unbeliev husband is sanctifi by the wife and the
unbeliev wife is sanctifi by the husband: els were your children
unclean; but now are they holi

7:15 but if the unbeliev depart let him depart a brother or a
sister is not under bondag in such cases: but god hath call us to
peac

7:16 for what knowest thou o wife whether thou shalt save thi
husband? or how knowest thou o man whether thou shalt save thi
wife? 7:17 but as god hath distribut to everi man as the lord hath
call everi one so let him walk and so ordain i in all church

7:18 is ani man call be circumcised? let him not becom
uncircumcis is ani call in uncircumcision? let him not be
circumcis

7:19 circumcis is noth and uncircumcis is noth but the
keep of the command of god

7:20 let everi man abid in the same call wherein he wa call

7:21 art thou call be a servant? care not for it: but if thou
mayest be made free use it rather

7:22 for he that is call in the lord be a servant is the lord
freeman: likewis also he that is call be free is christ
servant

7:23 ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servant of men

7:24 brethren let everi man wherein he is call therein abid with
god

7:25 now concern virgin i have no command of the lord: yet i
give my judgment as one that hath obtain merci of the lord to be
faith

7:26 i suppos therefor that thi is good for the present distress i
say that it is good for a man so to be

7:27 art thou bound unto a wife? seek not to be loos art thou
loos from a wife? seek not a wife

7:28 but and if thou marri thou hast not sinned; and if a virgin
marri she hath not sin nevertheless such shall have troubl in
the flesh: but i spare you

7:29 but thi i say brethren the time is short: it remaineth that
both they that have wive be as though they had none; 7:30 and they
that weep as though they wept not; and they that rejoic as though
they rejoic not; and they that buy as though they possess not;
7:31 and they that use thi world as not abus it: for the fashion
of thi world passeth away

7:32 but i would have you without care he that is unmarri
careth for the thing that belong to the lord how he may pleas the
lord: 7:33 but he that is marri careth for the thing that are of
the world how he may pleas hi wife

7:34 there is differ also between a wife and a virgin the
unmarri woman careth for the thing of the lord that she may be
holi both in bodi and in spirit: but she that is marri careth for
the thing of the world how she may pleas her husband

7:35 and thi i speak for your own profit; not that i may cast a snare
upon you but for that which is come and that ye may attend upon
the lord without distract

7:36 but if ani man think that he behaveth himself uncom toward hi
virgin if she pass the flower of her age and need so requir let
him do what he will he sinneth not: let them marri

7:37 nevertheless he that standeth stedfast in hi heart have no
necess but hath power over hi own will and hath so decre in
hi heart that he will keep hi virgin doeth well

7:38 so then he that giveth her in marriag doeth well; but he that
giveth her not in marriag doeth better

7:39 the wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but
if her husband be dead she is at liberti to be marri to whom she
will; onli in the lord

7:40 but she is happier if she so abid after my judgment: and i
think also that i have the spirit of god

8:1 now as touch thing offer unto idol we know that we all
have knowledg knowledg puffeth up but chariti edifieth

8:2 and if ani man think that he knoweth ani thing he knoweth noth
yet as he ought to know

8:3 but if ani man love god the same is known of him

8:4 as concern therefor the eat of those thing that are
offer in sacrific unto idol we know that an idol is noth in
the world and that there is none other god but one

8:5 for though there be that are call god whether in heaven or in
earth (a there be god mani and lord many) 8:6 but to us there is
but one god the father of whom are all thing and we in him; and
one lord jesu christ by whom are all thing and we by him

8:7 howbeit there is not in everi man that knowledge: for some with
conscienc of the idol unto thi hour eat it as a thing offer unto
an idol; and their conscienc be weak is defil

8:8 but meat commendeth us not to god: for neither if we eat are we
the better; neither if we eat not are we the wors

8:9 but take heed lest by ani mean thi liberti of your becom a
stumblingblock to them that are weak

8:10 for if ani man see thee which hast knowledg sit at meat in the
idol templ shall not the conscienc of him which is weak be
embolden to eat those thing which are offer to idols; 8:11 and
through thi knowledg shall the weak brother perish for whom christ
died? 8:12 but when ye sin so against the brethren and wound their
weak conscienc ye sin against christ

8:13 wherefor if meat make my brother to offend i will eat no flesh
while the world standeth lest i make my brother to offend

9:1 am i not an apostle? am i not free? have i not seen jesu christ
our lord? are not ye my work in the lord? 9:2 if i be not an apostl
unto other yet doubtless i am to you: for the seal of mine
apostleship are ye in the lord

9:3 mine answer to them that do examin me is thi 9:4 have we not
power to eat and to drink? 9:5 have we not power to lead about a
sister a wife as well as other apostl and as the brethren of the
lord and cephas? 9:6 or i onli and barnaba have not we power to
forbear working? 9:7 who goeth a warfar ani time at hi own charges?
who planteth a vineyard and eateth not of the fruit thereof? or who
feedeth a flock and eateth not of the milk of the flock? 9:8 say i
these thing as a man? or saith not the law the same also? 9:9 for it
is written in the law of mose thou shalt not muzzl the mouth of the
ox that treadeth out the corn doth god take care for oxen? 9:10 or
saith he it altogeth for our sakes? for our sake no doubt thi is
written: that he that ploweth should plow in hope; and that he that
thresheth in hope should be partak of hi hope

9:11 if we have sown unto you spiritu thing is it a great thing if
we shall reap your carnal things? 9:12 if other be partak of thi
power over you are not we rather? nevertheless we have not use thi
power; but suffer all thing lest we should hinder the gospel of
christ

9:13 do ye not know that they which minist about holi thing live of
the thing of the temple? and they which wait at the altar are
partak with the altar? 9:14 even so hath the lord ordain that
they which preach the gospel should live of the gospel

9:15 but i have use none of these things: neither have i written
these thing that it should be so done unto me: for it were better
for me to die than that ani man should make my glori void

9:16 for though i preach the gospel i have noth to glori of: for
necess is laid upon me; yea woe is unto me if i preach not the
gospel! 9:17 for if i do thi thing willingli i have a reward: but
if against my will a dispens of the gospel is commit unto me

9:18 what is my reward then? verili that when i preach the gospel i
may make the gospel of christ without charg that i abus not my
power in the gospel

9:19 for though i be free from all men yet have i made myself servant
unto all that i might gain the more

9:20 and unto the jew i becam as a jew that i might gain the jews;
to them that are under the law as under the law that i might gain
them that are under the law; 9:21 to them that are without law as
without law (be not without law to god but under the law to
christ) that i might gain them that are without law

9:22 to the weak becam i as weak that i might gain the weak: i am
made all thing to all men that i might by all mean save some

9:23 and thi i do for the gospel sake that i might be partak
thereof with you

9:24 know ye not that they which run in a race run all but one
receiveth the prize? so run that ye may obtain

9:25 and everi man that striveth for the masteri is temper in all
thing now they do it to obtain a corrupt crown; but we an
incorrupt

9:26 i therefor so run not as uncertainly; so fight i not as one
that beateth the air: 9:27 but i keep under my bodi and bring it into
subjection: lest that by ani mean when i have preach to other i
myself should be a castaway

10:1 moreov brethren i would not that ye should be ignor how
that all our father were under the cloud and all pass through the
sea; 10:2 and were all baptiz unto mose in the cloud and in the
sea; 10:3 and did all eat the same spiritu meat; 10:4 and did all
drink the same spiritu drink: for they drank of that spiritu rock
that follow them: and that rock wa christ

10:5 but with mani of them god wa not well pleased: for they were
overthrown in the wilder

10:6 now these thing were our exampl to the intent we should not
lust after evil thing as they also lust

10:7 neither be ye idolat as were some of them; as it is written
the peopl sat down to eat and drink and rose up to play

10:8 neither let us commit fornic as some of them commit and
fell in one day three and twenti thousand

10:9 neither let us tempt christ as some of them also tempt and
were destroy of serpent

10:10 neither murmur ye as some of them also murmur and were
destroy of the destroy

10:11 now all these thing happen unto them for ensamples: and they
are written for our admonit upon whom the end of the world are
come

10:12 wherefor let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he
fall

10:13 there hath no temptat taken you but such as is common to man:
but god is faith who will not suffer you to be tempt abov that
ye are able; but will with the temptat also make a way to escap
that ye may be abl to bear it

10:14 wherefor my dearli belov flee from idolatri

10:15 i speak as to wise men; judg ye what i say

10:16 the cup of bless which we bless is it not the communion of
the blood of christ? the bread which we break is it not the communion
of the bodi of christ? 10:17 for we be mani are one bread and one
body: for we are all partak of that one bread

10:18 behold israel after the flesh: are not they which eat of the
sacrific partak of the altar? 10:19 what say i then? that the
idol is ani thing or that which is offer in sacrific to idol is
ani thing? 10:20 but i say that the thing which the gentil
sacrific they sacrific to devil and not to god: and i would not
that ye should have fellowship with devil

10:21 ye cannot drink the cup of the lord and the cup of devils: ye
cannot be partak of the lord tabl and of the tabl of devil

10:22 do we provok the lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?
10:23 all thing are law for me but all thing are not expedient:
all thing are law for me but all thing edifi not

10:24 let no man seek hi own but everi man anoth wealth

10:25 whatsoev is sold in the shambl that eat ask no question
for conscienc sake: 10:26 for the earth is the lord and the
ful thereof

10:27 if ani of them that believ not bid you to a feast and ye be
dispos to go; whatsoev is set befor you eat ask no question
for conscienc sake

10:28 but if ani man say unto you thi is offer in sacrific unto
idol eat not for hi sake that shew it and for conscienc sake:
for the earth is the lord and the ful thereof: 10:29
conscienc i say not thine own but of the other: for whi is my
liberti judg of anoth man conscience? 10:30 for if i by grace
be a partak whi am i evil spoken of for that for which i give
thanks? 10:31 whether therefor ye eat or drink or whatsoev ye
do do all to the glori of god

10:32 give none offenc neither to the jew nor to the gentil nor
to the church of god: 10:33 even as i pleas all men in all thing
not seek mine own profit but the profit of mani that they may be
save

11:1 be ye follow of me even as i also am of christ

11:2 now i prais you brethren that ye rememb me in all thing
and keep the ordin as i deliv them to you

11:3 but i would have you know that the head of everi man is christ;
and the head of the woman is the man; and the head of christ is god

11:4 everi man pray or prophesi have hi head cover
dishonoureth hi head

11:5 but everi woman that prayeth or prophesieth with her head
uncov dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as if she
were shaven

11:6 for if the woman be not cover let her also be shorn: but if it
be a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven let her be cover

11:7 for a man inde ought not to cover hi head forasmuch as he is
the imag and glori of god: but the woman is the glori of the man

11:8 for the man is not of the woman: but the woman of the man

11:9 neither wa the man creat for the woman; but the woman for the
man

11:10 for thi caus ought the woman to have power on her head becaus
of the angel

11:11 nevertheless neither is the man without the woman neither the
woman without the man in the lord

11:12 for as the woman is of the man even so is the man also by the
woman; but all thing of god

11:13 judg in yourselves: is it come that a woman pray unto god
uncovered? 11:14 doth not even natur itself teach you that if a
man have long hair it is a shame unto him? 11:15 but if a woman have
long hair it is a glori to her: for her hair is given her for a
cover

11:16 but if ani man seem to be contenti we have no such custom
neither the church of god

11:17 now in thi that i declar unto you i prais you not that ye
come togeth not for the better but for the wors

11:18 for first of all when ye come togeth in the church i hear
that there be divis among you; and i partli believ it

11:19 for there must be also heresi among you that they which are
approv may be made manifest among you

11:20 when ye come togeth therefor into one place thi is not to
eat the lord supper

11:21 for in eat everi one taketh befor other hi own supper: and
one is hungri and anoth is drunken

11:22 what? have ye not hous to eat and to drink in? or despis ye
the church of god and shame them that have not? what shall i say to
you? shall i prais you in this? i prais you not

11:23 for i have receiv of the lord that which also i deliv unto
you that the lord jesu the same night in which he wa betray took
bread: 11:24 and when he had given thank he brake it and said
take eat: thi is my bodi which is broken for you: thi do in
remembr of me

11:25 after the same manner also he took the cup when he had sup
say thi cup is the new testament in my blood: thi do ye as oft
as ye drink it in remembr of me

11:26 for as often as ye eat thi bread and drink thi cup ye do
shew the lord death till he come

11:27 wherefor whosoev shall eat thi bread and drink thi cup of
the lord unworthili shall be guilti of the bodi and blood of the
lord

11:28 but let a man examin himself and so let him eat of that bread
and drink of that cup

11:29 for he that eateth and drinketh unworthili eateth and drinketh
damnat to himself not discern the lord bodi

11:30 for thi caus mani are weak and sickli among you and mani
sleep

11:31 for if we would judg ourselv we should not be judg

11:32 but when we are judg we are chasten of the lord that we
should not be condemn with the world

11:33 wherefor my brethren when ye come togeth to eat tarri one
for anoth

11:34 and if ani man hunger let him eat at home; that ye come not
togeth unto condemn and the rest will i set in order when i
come

12:1 now concern spiritu gift brethren i would not have you
ignor

12:2 ye know that ye were gentil carri away unto these dumb
idol even as ye were led

12:3 wherefor i give you to understand that no man speak by the
spirit of god calleth jesu accursed: and that no man can say that
jesu is the lord but by the holi ghost

12:4 now there are divers of gift but the same spirit

12:5 and there are differ of administr but the same lord

12:6 and there are divers of oper but it is the same god
which worketh all in all

12:7 but the manifest of the spirit is given to everi man to
profit withal

12:8 for to one is given by the spirit the word of wisdom; to anoth
the word of knowledg by the same spirit; 12:9 to anoth faith by the
same spirit; to anoth the gift of heal by the same spirit; 12:10
to anoth the work of miracles; to anoth prophecy; to anoth
discern of spirits; to anoth diver kind of tongues; to anoth
the interpret of tongues: 12:11 but all these worketh that one
and the selfsam spirit divid to everi man sever as he will

12:12 for as the bodi is one and hath mani member and all the
member of that one bodi be mani are one body: so also is christ

12:13 for by one spirit are we all baptiz into one bodi whether we
be jew or gentil whether we be bond or free; and have been all
made to drink into one spirit

12:14 for the bodi is not one member but mani

12:15 if the foot shall say becaus i am not the hand i am not of
the body; is it therefor not of the body? 12:16 and if the ear shall
say becaus i am not the eye i am not of the body; is it therefor
not of the body? 12:17 if the whole bodi were an eye where were the
hearing? if the whole were hear where were the smelling? 12:18
but now hath god set the member everi one of them in the bodi as it
hath pleas him

12:19 and if they were all one member where were the body? 12:20 but
now are they mani member yet but one bodi

12:21 and the eye cannot say unto the hand i have no need of thee:
nor again the head to the feet i have no need of you

12:22 nay much more those member of the bodi which seem to be more
feebl are necessary: 12:23 and those member of the bodi which we
think to be less honour upon these we bestow more abund
honour; and our uncom part have more abund comeli

12:24 for our come part have no need: but god hath temper the
bodi togeth have given more abund honour to that part which
lack

12:25 that there should be no schism in the body; but that the member
should have the same care one for anoth

12:26 and whether one member suffer all the member suffer with it;
or one member be honour all the member rejoic with it

12:27 now ye are the bodi of christ and member in particular

12:28 and god hath set some in the church first apostl secondarili
prophet thirdli teacher after that miracl then gift of
heal help govern divers of tongu

12:29 are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all
worker of miracles? 12:30 have all the gift of healing? do all
speak with tongues? do all interpret? 12:31 but covet earnestli the
best gifts: and yet shew i unto you a more excel way

13:1 though i speak with the tongu of men and of angel and have
not chariti i am becom as sound brass or a tinkl cymbal

13:2 and though i have the gift of propheci and understand all
mysteri and all knowledge; and though i have all faith so that i
could remov mountain and have not chariti i am noth

13:3 and though i bestow all my good to feed the poor and though i
give my bodi to be burn and have not chariti it profiteth me
noth

13:4 chariti suffereth long and is kind; chariti envieth not; chariti
vaunteth not itself is not puf up 13:5 doth not behav itself
