unseemli seeketh not her own is not easili provok thinketh no
evil; 13:6 rejoiceth not in iniqu but rejoiceth in the truth; 13:7
beareth all thing believeth all thing hopeth all thing endureth
all thing

13:8 chariti never faileth: but whether there be propheci they
shall fail; whether there be tongu they shall cease; whether there
be knowledg it shall vanish away

13:9 for we know in part and we prophesi in part

13:10 but when that which is perfect is come then that which is in
part shall be done away

13:11 when i wa a child i spake as a child i understood as a child
i thought as a child: but when i becam a man i put away childish
thing

13:12 for now we see through a glass darkly; but then face to face:
now i know in part; but then shall i know even as also i am known

13:13 and now abideth faith hope chariti these three; but the
greatest of these is chariti

14:1 follow after chariti and desir spiritu gift but rather that
ye may prophesi

14:2 for he that speaketh in an unknown tongu speaketh not unto men
but unto god: for no man understandeth him; howbeit in the spirit he
speaketh mysteri

14:3 but he that prophesieth speaketh unto men to edif and
exhort and comfort

14:4 he that speaketh in an unknown tongu edifieth himself; but he
that prophesieth edifieth the church

14:5 i would that ye all spake with tongu but rather that ye
prophesied: for greater is he that prophesieth than he that speaketh
with tongu except he interpret that the church may receiv
edifi

14:6 now brethren if i come unto you speak with tongu what
shall i profit you except i shall speak to you either by revel
or by knowledg or by prophesi or by doctrine? 14:7 and even
thing without life give sound whether pipe or harp except they
give a distinct in the sound how shall it be known what is pipe
or harped? 14:8 for if the trumpet give an uncertain sound who shall
prepar himself to the battle? 14:9 so likewis ye except ye utter
by the tongu word easi to be understood how shall it be known what
is spoken? for ye shall speak into the air

14:10 there are it may be so mani kind of voic in the world and
none of them is without signif

14:11 therefor if i know not the mean of the voic i shall be
unto him that speaketh a barbarian and he that speaketh shall be a
barbarian unto me

14:12 even so ye forasmuch as ye are zealou of spiritu gift seek
that ye may excel to the edifi of the church

14:13 wherefor let him that speaketh in an unknown tongu pray that
he may interpret

14:14 for if i pray in an unknown tongu my spirit prayeth but my
understand is unfruit

14:15 what is it then? i will pray with the spirit and i will pray
with the understand also: i will sing with the spirit and i will
sing with the understand also

14:16 els when thou shalt bless with the spirit how shall he that
occupieth the room of the unlearn say amen at thi give of thank
see he understandeth not what thou sayest? 14:17 for thou verili
givest thank well but the other is not edifi

14:18 i thank my god i speak with tongu more than ye all: 14:19 yet
in the church i had rather speak five word with my understand
that by my voic i might teach other also than ten thousand word in
an unknown tongu

14:20 brethren be not children in understanding: howbeit in malic be
ye children but in understand be men

14:21 in the law it is written with men of other tongu and other
lip will i speak unto thi people; and yet for all that will they not
hear me saith the lord

14:22 wherefor tongu are for a sign not to them that believ but
to them that believ not: but prophesi serveth not for them that
believ not but for them which believ

14:23 if therefor the whole church be come togeth into one place
and all speak with tongu and there come in those that are
unlearn or unbeliev will they not say that ye are mad? 14:24
but if all prophesi and there come in one that believeth not or one
unlearn he is convinc of all he is judg of all: 14:25 and thu
are the secret of hi heart made manifest; and so fall down on hi
face he will worship god and report that god is in you of a truth

14:26 how is it then brethren? when ye come togeth everi one of
you hath a psalm hath a doctrin hath a tongu hath a revel
hath an interpret let all thing be done unto edifi

14:27 if ani man speak in an unknown tongu let it be by two or at
the most by three and that by course; and let one interpret

14:28 but if there be no interpret let him keep silenc in the
church; and let him speak to himself and to god

14:29 let the prophet speak two or three and let the other judg

14:30 if ani thing be reveal to anoth that sitteth by let the
first hold hi peac

14:31 for ye may all prophesi one by one that all may learn and all
may be comfort

14:32 and the spirit of the prophet are subject to the prophet

14:33 for god is not the author of confus but of peac as in all
church of the saint

14:34 let your women keep silenc in the churches: for it is not
permit unto them to speak; but they are command to be under
obedi as also saith the law

14:35 and if they will learn ani thing let them ask their husband at
home: for it is a shame for women to speak in the church

14:36 what? came the word of god out from you? or came it unto you
only? 14:37 if ani man think himself to be a prophet or spiritu
let him acknowledg that the thing that i write unto you are the
command of the lord

14:38 but if ani man be ignor let him be ignor

14:39 wherefor brethren covet to prophesi and forbid not to speak
with tongu

14:40 let all thing be done decent and in order

15:1 moreov brethren i declar unto you the gospel which i
preach unto you which also ye have receiv and wherein ye stand;
15:2 by which also ye are save if ye keep in memori what i preach
unto you unless ye have believ in vain

15:3 for i deliv unto you first of all that which i also receiv
how that christ die for our sin accord to the scriptures; 15:4
and that he wa buri and that he rose again the third day accord
to the scriptures: 15:5 and that he wa seen of cepha then of the
twelve: 15:6 after that he wa seen of abov five hundr brethren at
once; of whom the greater part remain unto thi present but some are
fallen asleep

15:7 after that he wa seen of james; then of all the apostl

15:8 and last of all he wa seen of me also as of one born out of due
time

15:9 for i am the least of the apostl that am not meet to be call
an apostl becaus i persecut the church of god

15:10 but by the grace of god i am what i am: and hi grace which wa
bestow upon me wa not in vain; but i labour more abundantli than
they all: yet not i but the grace of god which wa with me

15:11 therefor whether it were i or they so we preach and so ye
believ

15:12 now if christ be preach that he rose from the dead how say
some among you that there is no resurrect of the dead? 15:13 but
if there be no resurrect of the dead then is christ not risen:
15:14 and if christ be not risen then is our preach vain and your
faith is also vain

15:15 yea and we are found fals wit of god; becaus we have
testifi of god that he rais up christ: whom he rais not up if
so be that the dead rise not

15:16 for if the dead rise not then is not christ raised: 15:17 and
if christ be not rais your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sin

15:18 then they also which are fallen asleep in christ are perish

15:19 if in thi life onli we have hope in christ we are of all men
most miser

15:20 but now is christ risen from the dead and becom the
firstfruit of them that slept

15:21 for sinc by man came death by man came also the resurrect
of the dead

15:22 for as in adam all die even so in christ shall all be made
aliv

15:23 but everi man in hi own order: christ the firstfruits;
afterward they that are christ at hi come

15:24 then cometh the end when he shall have deliv up the kingdom
to god even the father; when he shall have put down all rule and all
author and power

15:25 for he must reign till he hath put all enemi under hi feet

15:26 the last enemi that shall be destroy is death

15:27 for he hath put all thing under hi feet but when he saith all
thing are put under him it is manifest that he is except which
did put all thing under him

15:28 and when all thing shall be subdu unto him then shall the
son also himself be subject unto him that put all thing under him
that god may be all in all

15:29 els what shall they do which are baptiz for the dead if the
dead rise not at all? whi are they then baptiz for the dead? 15:30
and whi stand we in jeopardi everi hour? 15:31 i protest by your
rejoic which i have in christ jesu our lord i die daili

15:32 if after the manner of men i have fought with beast at ephesu
what advantageth it me if the dead rise not? let us eat and drink;
for to morrow we die

15:33 be not deceived: evil commun corrupt good manner

15:34 awak to righteous and sin not; for some have not the
knowledg of god: i speak thi to your shame

15:35 but some man will say how are the dead rais up? and with what
bodi do they come? 15:36 thou fool that which thou sowest is not
quicken except it die: 15:37 and that which thou sowest thou
sowest not that bodi that shall be but bare grain it may chanc of
wheat or of some other grain: 15:38 but god giveth it a bodi as it
hath pleas him and to everi seed hi own bodi

15:39 all flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one kind of flesh
of men anoth flesh of beast anoth of fish and anoth of
bird

15:40 there are also celesti bodi and bodi terrestrial: but the
glori of the celesti is one and the glori of the terrestri is
anoth

15:41 there is one glori of the sun and anoth glori of the moon
and anoth glori of the stars: for one star differeth from anoth
star in glori

15:42 so also is the resurrect of the dead it is sown in
corruption; it is rais in incorruption: 15:43 it is sown in
dishonour; it is rais in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is rais
in power: 15:44 it is sown a natur body; it is rais a spiritu
bodi there is a natur bodi and there is a spiritu bodi

15:45 and so it is written the first man adam wa made a live soul;
the last adam wa made a quicken spirit

15:46 howbeit that wa not first which is spiritu but that which is
natural; and afterward that which is spiritu

15:47 the first man is of the earth earthy; the second man is the
lord from heaven

15:48 as is the earthi such are they also that are earthy: and as is
the heavenli such are they also that are heavenli

15:49 and as we have born the imag of the earthi we shall also bear
the imag of the heavenli

15:50 now thi i say brethren that flesh and blood cannot inherit
the kingdom of god; neither doth corrupt inherit incorrupt

15:51 behold i shew you a mystery; we shall not all sleep but we
shall all be chang 15:52 in a moment in the twinkl of an eye
at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound and the dead shall be
rais incorrupt and we shall be chang

15:53 for thi corrupt must put on incorrupt and thi mortal
must put on immort

15:54 so when thi corrupt shall have put on incorrupt and
thi mortal shall have put on immort then shall be brought to
pass the say that is written death is swallow up in victori

15:55 o death where is thi sting? o grave where is thi victory?
15:56 the sting of death is sin; and the strength of sin is the law

15:57 but thank be to god which giveth us the victori through our
lord jesu christ

15:58 therefor my belov brethren be ye stedfast unmov
alway abound in the work of the lord forasmuch as ye know that
your labour is not in vain in the lord

16:1 now concern the collect for the saint as i have given
order to the church of galatia even so do ye

16:2 upon the first day of the week let everi one of you lay by him in
store as god hath prosper him that there be no gather when i
come

16:3 and when i come whomsoev ye shall approv by your letter
them will i send to bring your liber unto jerusalem

16:4 and if it be meet that i go also they shall go with me

16:5 now i will come unto you when i shall pass through macedonia:
for i do pass through macedonia

16:6 and it may be that i will abid yea and winter with you that
ye may bring me on my journey whithersoev i go

16:7 for i will not see you now by the way; but i trust to tarri a
while with you if the lord permit

16:8 but i will tarri at ephesu until pentecost

16:9 for a great door and effectu is open unto me and there are
mani adversari

16:10 now if timotheu come see that he may be with you without fear:
for he worketh the work of the lord as i also do

16:11 let no man therefor despis him: but conduct him forth in
peac that he may come unto me: for i look for him with the brethren

16:12 as touch our brother apollo i greatli desir him to come
unto you with the brethren: but hi will wa not at all to come at
thi time; but he will come when he shall have conveni time

16:13 watch ye stand fast in the faith quit you like men be strong

16:14 let all your thing be done with chariti

16:15 i beseech you brethren (ye know the hous of stephana that
it is the firstfruit of achaia and that they have addict
themselv to the ministri of the saints) 16:16 that ye submit
yourselv unto such and to everi one that helpeth with us and
laboureth

16:17 i am glad of the come of stephana and fortunatu and
achaicus: for that which wa lack on your part they have suppli

16:18 for they have refresh my spirit and yours: therefor
acknowledg ye them that are such

16:19 the church of asia salut you aquila and priscilla salut you
much in the lord with the church that is in their hous

16:20 all the brethren greet you greet ye one anoth with
an holi kiss

16:21 the salut of me paul with mine own hand

16:22 if ani man love not the lord jesu christ let him be
anathema maranatha

16:23 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you

16:24 my love be with you all in christ jesu amen



the second epistl of paul the apostl to the corinthian


1:1 paul an apostl of jesu christ by the will of god and timothi
our brother unto the church of god which is at corinth with all the
saint which are in all achaia: 1:2 grace be to you and peac from god
our father and from the lord jesu christ

1:3 bless be god even the father of our lord jesu christ the
father of merci and the god of all comfort; 1:4 who comforteth us
in all our tribul that we may be abl to comfort them which are
in ani troubl by the comfort wherewith we ourselv are comfort of
god

1:5 for as the suffer of christ abound in us so our consol
also aboundeth by christ

1:6 and whether we be afflict it is for your consol and
salvat which is effectu in the endur of the same suffer
which we also suffer: or whether we be comfort it is for your
consol and salvat

1:7 and our hope of you is stedfast know that as ye are partak
of the suffer so shall ye be also of the consol

1:8 for we would not brethren have you ignor of our troubl which
came to us in asia that we were press out of measur abov
strength insomuch that we despair even of life: 1:9 but we had the
sentenc of death in ourselv that we should not trust in ourselv
but in god which raiseth the dead: 1:10 who deliv us from so great
a death and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliv
us; 1:11 ye also help togeth by prayer for us that for the gift
bestow upon us by the mean of mani person thank may be given by
mani on our behalf

1:12 for our rejoic is thi the testimoni of our conscienc that
in simplic and godli sincer not with fleshli wisdom but by the
grace of god we have had our convers in the world and more
abundantli to you-ward

1:13 for we write none other thing unto you than what ye read or
acknowledge; and i trust ye shall acknowledg even to the end; 1:14 as
also ye have acknowledg us in part that we are your rejoic even
as ye also are our in the day of the lord jesu

1:15 and in thi confid i wa mind to come unto you befor that
ye might have a second benefit; 1:16 and to pass by you into
macedonia and to come again out of macedonia unto you and of you to
be brought on my way toward judaea

1:17 when i therefor wa thu mind did i use lightness? or the
thing that i purpos do i purpos accord to the flesh that with
me there should be yea yea and nay nay? 1:18 but as god is true our
word toward you wa not yea and nay

1:19 for the son of god jesu christ who wa preach among you by
us even by me and silvanu and timotheu wa not yea and nay but in
him wa yea

1:20 for all the promis of god in him are yea and in him amen unto
the glori of god by us

1:21 now he which stablisheth us with you in christ and hath anoint
us is god; 1:22 who hath also seal us and given the earnest of the
spirit in our heart

1:23 moreov i call god for a record upon my soul that to spare you
i came not as yet unto corinth

1:24 not for that we have dominion over your faith but are helper of
your joy: for by faith ye stand

2:1 but i determin thi with myself that i would not come again to
you in heavi

2:2 for if i make you sorri who is he then that maketh me glad but
the same which is made sorri by me? 2:3 and i wrote thi same unto
you lest when i came i should have sorrow from them of whom i ought
to rejoice; have confid in you all that my joy is the joy of
you all

2:4 for out of much afflict and anguish of heart i wrote unto you
with mani tears; not that ye should be griev but that ye might know
the love which i have more abundantli unto you

2:5 but if ani have caus grief he hath not griev me but in part:
that i may not overcharg you all

2:6 suffici to such a man is thi punish which wa inflict
of mani

2:7 so that contrariwis ye ought rather to forgiv him and comfort
him lest perhap such a one should be swallow up with overmuch
sorrow

2:8 wherefor i beseech you that ye would confirm your love toward
him

2:9 for to thi end also did i write that i might know the proof of
you whether ye be obedi in all thing

2:10 to whom ye forgiv ani thing i forgiv also: for if i forgav
ani thing to whom i forgav it for your sake forgav i it in the
person of christ; 2:11 lest satan should get an advantag of us: for
we are not ignor of hi devic

2:12 furthermor when i came to troa to preach christ gospel and
a door wa open unto me of the lord 2:13 i had no rest in my
spirit becaus i found not titu my brother: but take my leav of
them i went from thenc into macedonia

2:14 now thank be unto god which alway causeth us to triumph in
christ and maketh manifest the savour of hi knowledg by us in everi
place

2:15 for we are unto god a sweet savour of christ in them that are
save and in them that perish: 2:16 to the one we are the savour of
death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life and
who is suffici for these things? 2:17 for we are not as mani
which corrupt the word of god: but as of sincer but as of god in
the sight of god speak we in christ

3:1 do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we as some
other epistl of commend to you or letter of commend
from you? 3:2 ye are our epistl written in our heart known and
read of all men: 3:3 forasmuch as ye are manifestli declar to be the
epistl of christ minist by us written not with ink but with the
spirit of the live god; not in tabl of stone but in fleshi tabl
of the heart

3:4 and such trust have we through christ to god-ward: 3:5 not that we
are suffici of ourselv to think ani thing as of ourselves; but
our suffici is of god; 3:6 who also hath made us abl minist of
the new testament; not of the letter but of the spirit: for the
letter killeth but the spirit giveth life

3:7 but if the ministr of death written and engraven in stone
wa gloriou so that the children of israel could not stedfastli
behold the face of mose for the glori of hi countenance; which glori
wa to be done away: 3:8 how shall not the ministr of the spirit
be rather glorious? 3:9 for if the ministr of condemn be
glori much more doth the ministr of righteous exceed in
glori

3:10 for even that which wa made gloriou had no glori in thi
respect by reason of the glori that excelleth

3:11 for if that which is done away wa gloriou much more that which
remaineth is gloriou

3:12 see then that we have such hope we use great plain of
speech: 3:13 and not as mose which put a vail over hi face that
the children of israel could not stedfastli look to the end of that
which is abolished: 3:14 but their mind were blinded: for until thi
day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the read of the old
testament; which vail is done away in christ

3:15 but even unto thi day when mose is read the vail is upon
their heart

3:16 nevertheless when it shall turn to the lord the vail shall be
taken away

3:17 now the lord is that spirit: and where the spirit of the lord is
there is liberti

3:18 but we all with open face behold as in a glass the glori of
the lord are chang into the same imag from glori to glori even as
by the spirit of the lord

4:1 therefor see we have thi ministri as we have receiv merci
we faint not; 4:2 but have renounc the hidden thing of dishonesti
not walk in crafti nor handl the word of god deceitfully;
but by manifest of the truth commend ourselv to everi man
conscienc in the sight of god

4:3 but if our gospel be hid it is hid to them that are lost: 4:4 in
whom the god of thi world hath blind the mind of them which
believ not lest the light of the gloriou gospel of christ who is
the imag of god should shine unto them

4:5 for we preach not ourselv but christ jesu the lord; and
ourselv your servant for jesu sake

4:6 for god who command the light to shine out of dark hath
shine in our heart to give the light of the knowledg of the glori
of god in the face of jesu christ

4:7 but we have thi treasur in earthen vessel that the excel
of the power may be of god and not of us

4:8 we are troubl on everi side yet not distressed; we are
perplex but not in despair; 4:9 persecut but not forsaken; cast
down but not destroyed; 4:10 alway bear about in the bodi the
die of the lord jesu that the life also of jesu might be made
manifest in our bodi

4:11 for we which live are alway deliv unto death for jesu sake
that the life also of jesu might be made manifest in our mortal
flesh

4:12 so then death worketh in us but life in you

4:13 we have the same spirit of faith accord as it is written i
believ and therefor have i spoken; we also believ and therefor
speak; 4:14 know that he which rais up the lord jesu shall rais
up us also by jesu and shall present us with you

4:15 for all thing are for your sake that the abund grace might
through the thanksgiv of mani redound to the glori of god

4:16 for which caus we faint not; but though our outward man perish
yet the inward man is renew day by day

4:17 for our light afflict which is but for a moment worketh for
us a far more exceed and etern weight of glory; 4:18 while we
look not at the thing which are seen but at the thing which are not
seen: for the thing which are seen are temporal; but the thing which
are not seen are etern

5:1 for we know that if our earthli hous of thi tabernacl were
dissolv we have a build of god an hous not made with hand
etern in the heaven

5:2 for in thi we groan earnestli desir to be cloth upon with
our hous which is from heaven: 5:3 if so be that be cloth we
shall not be found nake

5:4 for we that are in thi tabernacl do groan be burdened: not
for that we would be uncloth but cloth upon that mortal might
be swallow up of life

5:5 now he that hath wrought us for the selfsam thing is god who
also hath given unto us the earnest of the spirit

5:6 therefor we are alway confid know that whilst we are at
home in the bodi we are absent from the lord: 5:7 (for we walk by
faith not by sight:) 5:8 we are confid i say and will rather
to be absent from the bodi and to be present with the lord

5:9 wherefor we labour that whether present or absent we may be
accept of him

5:10 for we must all appear befor the judgment seat of christ; that
everi one may receiv the thing done in hi bodi accord to that
he hath done whether it be good or bad

5:11 know therefor the terror of the lord we persuad men; but we
are made manifest unto god; and i trust also are made manifest in your
conscienc

5:12 for we commend not ourselv again unto you but give you
occas to glori on our behalf that ye may have somewhat to answer
them which glori in appear and not in heart

5:13 for whether we be besid ourselv it is to god: or whether we
be sober it is for your caus

5:14 for the love of christ constraineth us; becaus we thu judg
that if one die for all then were all dead: 5:15 and that he die
for all that they which live should not henceforth live unto
themselv but unto him which die for them and rose again

5:16 wherefor henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea though
we have known christ after the flesh yet now henceforth know we him
no more

5:17 therefor if ani man be in christ he is a new creature: old
thing are pass away; behold all thing are becom new

5:18 and all thing are of god who hath reconcil us to himself by
jesu christ and hath given to us the ministri of reconciliation;
5:19 to wit that god wa in christ reconcil the world unto
himself not imput their trespass unto them; and hath commit
unto us the word of reconcili

5:20 now then we are ambassador for christ as though god did beseech
you by us: we pray you in christ stead be ye reconcil to god

5:21 for he hath made him to be sin for us who knew no sin; that we
might be made the righteous of god in him

6:1 we then as worker togeth with him beseech you also that ye
receiv not the grace of god in vain

6:2 (for he saith i have heard thee in a time accept and in the
day of salvat have i succour thee: behold now is the accept
time; behold now is the day of salvation) 6:3 give no offenc in
ani thing that the ministri be not blamed: 6:4 but in all thing
approv ourselv as the minist of god in much patienc in
afflict in necess in distress 6:5 in stripe in
imprison in tumult in labour in watch in fastings; 6:6
by pure by knowledg by longsuff by kind by the holi
ghost by love unfeign 6:7 by the word of truth by the power of
god by the armour of righteous on the right hand and on the left
6:8 by honour and dishonour by evil report and good report: as
deceiv and yet true; 6:9 as unknown and yet well known; as die
and behold we live; as chasten and not killed; 6:10 as sorrow
yet alway rejoicing; as poor yet make mani rich; as have noth
and yet possess all thing

6:11 o ye corinthian our mouth is open unto you our heart is
enlarg

6:12 ye are not straiten in us but ye are straiten in your own
bowel

6:13 now for a recomp in the same (i speak as unto my children)
be ye also enlarg

6:14 be ye not unequ yoke togeth with unbelievers: for what
fellowship hath righteous with unrighteousness? and what communion
hath light with darkness? 6:15 and what concord hath christ with
belial? or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel? 6:16 and
what agreement hath the templ of god with idols? for ye are the
templ of the live god; as god hath said i will dwell in them and
walk in them; and i will be their god and they shall be my peopl

6:17 wherefor come out from among them and be ye separ saith the
lord and touch not the unclean thing; and i will receiv you

6:18 and will be a father unto you and ye shall be my son and
daughter saith the lord almighti

7:1 have therefor these promis dearli belov let us cleans
ourselv from all filthi of the flesh and spirit perfect
holi in the fear of god

7:2 receiv us; we have wrong no man we have corrupt no man we
have defraud no man

7:3 i speak not thi to condemn you: for i have said befor that ye
are in our heart to die and live with you

7:4 great is my bold of speech toward you great is my glori of
you: i am fill with comfort i am exceed joy in all our
tribul

7:5 for when we were come into macedonia our flesh had no rest but
we were troubl on everi side; without were fight within were
fear

7:6 nevertheless god that comforteth those that are cast down
comfort us by the come of titus; 7:7 and not by hi come onli
but by the consol wherewith he wa comfort in you when he told
us your earnest desir your mourn your fervent mind toward me; so
that i rejoic the more

7:8 for though i made you sorri with a letter i do not repent though
i did repent: for i perceiv that the same epistl hath made you
sorri though it were but for a season

7:9 now i rejoic not that ye were made sorri but that ye sorrow
to repentance: for ye were made sorri after a godli manner that ye
might receiv damag by us in noth

7:10 for godli sorrow worketh repent to salvat not to be
repent of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death

7:11 for behold thi selfsam thing that ye sorrow after a godli
sort what care it wrought in you yea what clear of
yourselv yea what indign yea what fear yea what vehement
desir yea what zeal yea what revenge! in all thing ye have
approv yourselv to be clear in thi matter

7:12 wherefor though i wrote unto you i did it not for hi caus
that had done the wrong nor for hi caus that suffer wrong but
that our care for you in the sight of god might appear unto you

7:13 therefor we were comfort in your comfort: yea and exceedingli
the more joy we for the joy of titu becaus hi spirit wa
refresh by you all

7:14 for if i have boast ani thing to him of you i am not ashamed;
but as we spake all thing to you in truth even so our boast
which i made befor titu is found a truth

7:15 and hi inward affect is more abund toward you whilst he
remembereth the obedi of you all how with fear and trembl ye
receiv him

7:16 i rejoic therefor that i have confid in you in all thing

8:1 moreov brethren we do you to wit of the grace of god bestow
on the church of macedonia; 8:2 how that in a great trial of
afflict the abund of their joy and their deep poverti abound
unto the rich of their liber

8:3 for to their power i bear record yea and beyond their power
they were will of themselves; 8:4 pray us with much intreati
that we would receiv the gift and take upon us the fellowship of the
minist to the saint

8:5 and thi they did not as we hope but first gave their own
selv to the lord and unto us by the will of god

8:6 insomuch that we desir titu that as he had begun so he would
also finish in you the same grace also

8:7 therefor as ye abound in everi thing in faith and utter
and knowledg and in all dilig and in your love to us see that
ye abound in thi grace also

8:8 i speak not by command but by occas of the forward of
other and to prove the sincer of your love

8:9 for ye know the grace of our lord jesu christ that though he
wa rich yet for your sake he becam poor that ye through hi
poverti might be rich

8:10 and herein i give my advice: for thi is expedi for you who
have begun befor not onli to do but also to be forward a year ago

8:11 now therefor perform the do of it; that as there wa a
readi to will so there may be a perform also out of that
which ye have

8:12 for if there be first a will mind it is accept accord to
that a man hath and not accord to that he hath not

8:13 for i mean not that other men be eas and ye burdened: 8:14 but
by an equal that now at thi time your abund may be a suppli
for their want that their abund also may be a suppli for your
want: that there may be equality: 8:15 as it is written he that had
gather much had noth over; and he that had gather littl had no
lack

8:16 but thank be to god which put the same earnest care into the
heart of titu for you

8:17 for inde he accept the exhortation; but be more forward
of hi own accord he went unto you

8:18 and we have sent with him the brother whose prais is in the
gospel throughout all the churches; 8:19 and not that onli but who
wa also chosen of the church to travel with us with thi grace
which is administ by us to the glori of the same lord and
declar of your readi mind: 8:20 avoid thi that no man should
blame us in thi abund which is administ by us: 8:21 provid
for honest thing not onli in the sight of the lord but also in the
sight of men

8:22 and we have sent with them our brother whom we have oftentim
prove dilig in mani thing but now much more dilig upon the
great confid which i have in you

8:23 whether ani do enquir of titu he is my partner and
fellowhelp concern you: or our brethren be enquir of they are
the messeng of the church and the glori of christ

8:24 wherefor shew ye to them and befor the church the proof of
your love and of our boast on your behalf

9:1 for as touch the minist to the saint it is superflu
for me to write to you: 9:2 for i know the forward of your mind
for which i boast of you to them of macedonia that achaia wa readi a
year ago; and your zeal hath provok veri mani

9:3 yet have i sent the brethren lest our boast of you should be
in vain in thi behalf; that as i said ye may be ready: 9:4 lest
hapli if they of macedonia come with me and find you unprepar we
(that we say not ye) should be asham in thi same confid
boast

9:5 therefor i thought it necessari to exhort the brethren that they
would go befor unto you and make up beforehand your bounti whereof
ye had notic befor that the same might be readi as a matter of
bounti and not as of covet

9:6 but thi i say he which soweth sparingli shall reap also
sparingly; and he which soweth bounti shall reap also
bounti

9:7 everi man accord as he purposeth in hi heart so let him give;
not grudgingli or of necessity: for god loveth a cheer giver

9:8 and god is abl to make all grace abound toward you; that ye
alway have all suffici in all thing may abound to everi good
work: 9:9 (a it is written he hath dispers abroad; he hath given
to the poor: hi righteous remaineth for ever

9:10 now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minist bread for
your food and multipli your seed sown and increas the fruit of
your righteousness;) 9:11 be enrich in everi thing to all
bounti which causeth through us thanksgiv to god

9:12 for the administr of thi servic not onli supplieth the
want of the saint but is abund also by mani thanksgiv unto
god; 9:13 while by the experi of thi ministr they glorifi
god for your profess subject unto the gospel of christ and for
your liber distribut unto them and unto all men; 9:14 and by
their prayer for you which long after you for the exceed grace of
god in you

9:15 thank be unto god for hi unspeak gift

10:1 now i paul myself beseech you by the meek and gentl of
christ who in presenc am base among you but be absent am bold
toward you: 10:2 but i beseech you that i may not be bold when i am
present with that confid wherewith i think to be bold against
some which think of us as if we walk accord to the flesh

10:3 for though we walk in the flesh we do not war after the flesh:
10:4 (for the weapon of our warfar are not carnal but mighti
through god to the pull down of strong holds;) 10:5 cast down
imagin and everi high thing that exalteth itself against the
knowledg of god and bring into captiv everi thought to the
obedi of christ; 10:6 and have in a readi to reveng all
disobedi when your obedi is fulfil

10:7 do ye look on thing after the outward appearance? if ani man
trust to himself that he is christ let him of himself think thi
again that as he is christ even so are we christ

10:8 for though i should boast somewhat more of our author which
the lord hath given us for edif and not for your destruct
i should not be ashamed: 10:9 that i may not seem as if i would
terrifi you by letter

10:10 for hi letter say they are weighti and powerful; but hi
bodili presenc is weak and hi speech contempt

10:11 let such an one think thi that such as we are in word by
letter when we are absent such will we be also in deed when we are
present

10:12 for we dare not make ourselv of the number or compar
ourselv with some that commend themselves: but they measur
themselv by themselv and compar themselv among themselv
are not wise

10:13 but we will not boast of thing without our measur but
accord to the measur of the rule which god hath distribut to us
a measur to reach even unto you

10:14 for we stretch not ourselv beyond our measur as though we
reach not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in
preach the gospel of christ: 10:15 not boast of thing without
our measur that is of other men labours; but have hope when
your faith is increas that we shall be enlarg by you accord to
our rule abundantli 10:16 to preach the gospel in the region beyond
you and not to boast in anoth man line of thing made readi to
our hand

10:17 but he that glorieth let him glori in the lord

10:18 for not he that commendeth himself is approv but whom the
lord commendeth

11:1 would to god ye could bear with me a littl in my folly: and
inde bear with me

11:2 for i am jealou over you with godli jealousy: for i have
espous you to one husband that i may present you as a chast virgin
to christ

11:3 but i fear lest by ani mean as the serpent beguil eve
through hi subtilti so your mind should be corrupt from the
simplic that is in christ

11:4 for if he that cometh preacheth anoth jesu whom we have not
preach or if ye receiv anoth spirit which ye have not receiv
or anoth gospel which ye have not accept ye might well bear with
him

11:5 for i suppos i wa not a whit behind the veri chiefest apostl

11:6 but though i be rude in speech yet not in knowledge; but we have
been throughli made manifest among you in all thing

11:7 have i commit an offenc in abas myself that ye might be
exalt becaus i have preach to you the gospel of god freely?
11:8 i rob other church take wage of them to do you servic

11:9 and when i wa present with you and want i wa chargeabl to
no man: for that which wa lack to me the brethren which came from
macedonia supplied: and in all thing i have kept myself from be
burdensom unto you and so will i keep myself

11:10 as the truth of christ is in me no man shall stop me of thi
boast in the region of achaia

11:11 wherefore? becaus i love you not? god knoweth

11:12 but what i do that i will do that i may cut off occas from
them which desir occasion; that wherein they glori they may be found
even as we

11:13 for such are fals apostl deceit worker transform
themselv into the apostl of christ

11:14 and no marvel; for satan himself is transform into an angel of
light

11:15 therefor it is no great thing if hi minist also be
transform as the minist of righteousness; whose end shall be
accord to their work

11:16 i say again let no man think me a fool; if otherwis yet as a
fool receiv me that i may boast myself a littl

11:17 that which i speak i speak it not after the lord but as it
were foolishli in thi confid of boast

11:18 see that mani glori after the flesh i will glori also

11:19 for ye suffer fool gladli see ye yourselv are wise

11:20 for ye suffer if a man bring you into bondag if a man devour
you if a man take of you if a man exalt himself if a man smite you
on the face

11:21 i speak as concern reproach as though we had been weak
howbeit whereinsoev ani is bold (i speak foolishly) i am bold
also

11:22 are they hebrews? so am i are they israelites? so am i are
they the seed of abraham? so am i

11:23 are they minist of christ? (i speak as a fool) i am more; in
labour more abund in stripe abov measur in prison more
frequent in death oft

11:24 of the jew five time receiv i forti stripe save one

11:25 thrice wa i beaten with rod onc wa i stone thrice i
suffer shipwreck a night and a day i have been in the deep; 11:26
in journey often in peril of water in peril of robber in
peril by mine own countrymen in peril by the heathen in peril in
the citi in peril in the wilder in peril in the sea in peril
among fals brethren; 11:27 in weari and pain in watch
often in hunger and thirst in fast often in cold and naked

11:28 besid those thing that are without that which cometh upon me
daili the care of all the church

11:29 who is weak and i am not weak? who is offend and i burn not?
11:30 if i must need glori i will glori of the thing which concern
mine infirm

11:31 the god and father of our lord jesu christ which is bless
for evermor knoweth that i lie not

11:32 in damascu the governor under areta the king kept the citi of
the damascen with a garrison desir to apprehend me: 11:33 and
through a window in a basket wa i let down by the wall and escap
hi hand

12:1 it is not expedi for me doubtless to glori i will come to
vision and revel of the lord

12:2 i knew a man in christ abov fourteen year ago (whether in the
bodi i cannot tell; or whether out of the bodi i cannot tell: god
knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven

12:3 and i knew such a man (whether in the bodi or out of the bodi
i cannot tell: god knoweth;) 12:4 how that he wa caught up into
paradis and heard unspeak word which it is not law for a
man to utter

12:5 of such an one will i glory: yet of myself i will not glori but
in mine infirm

12:6 for though i would desir to glori i shall not be a fool; for i
will say the truth: but now i forbear lest ani man should think of me
abov that which he seeth me to be or that he heareth of me

12:7 and lest i should be exalt abov measur through the abund
of the revel there wa given to me a thorn in the flesh the
messeng of satan to buffet me lest i should be exalt abov
measur

12:8 for thi thing i besought the lord thrice that it might depart
from me

12:9 and he said unto me my grace is suffici for thee: for my
strength is made perfect in weak most gladli therefor will i
rather glori in my infirm that the power of christ may rest upon
me

12:10 therefor i take pleasur in infirm in reproach in
necess in persecut in distress for christ sake: for
when i am weak then am i strong

12:11 i am becom a fool in glorying; ye have compel me: for i
ought to have been commend of you: for in noth am i behind the
veri chiefest apostl though i be noth

12:12 truli the sign of an apostl were wrought among you in all
patienc in sign and wonder and mighti deed

12:13 for what is it wherein ye were inferior to other church
except it be that i myself wa not burdensom to you? forgiv me thi
wrong

12:14 behold the third time i am readi to come to you; and i will not
be burdensom to you: for i seek not your but you: for the children
ought not to lay up for the parent but the parent for the children

12:15 and i will veri gladli spend and be spent for you; though the
more abundantli i love you the less i be love

12:16 but be it so i did not burden you: nevertheless be crafti
i caught you with guil

12:17 did i make a gain of you by ani of them whom i sent unto you?
12:18 i desir titu and with him i sent a brother did titu make a
gain of you? walk we not in the same spirit? walk we not in the
same steps? 12:19 again think ye that we excus ourselv unto you?
we speak befor god in christ: but we do all thing dearli belov
for your edifi

12:20 for i fear lest when i come i shall not find you such as i
would and that i shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest
there be debat envi wrath strife backbit whisper
swell tumults: 12:21 and lest when i come again my god will
humbl me among you and that i shall bewail mani which have sin
alreadi and have not repent of the unclean and fornic and
lascivi which they have commit

13:1 thi is the third time i am come to you in the mouth of two or
three wit shall everi word be establish

13:2 i told you befor and foretel you as if i were present the
second time; and be absent now i write to them which heretofor
have sin and to all other that if i come again i will not
spare: 13:3 sinc ye seek a proof of christ speak in me which to
you-ward is not weak but is mighti in you

13:4 for though he wa crucifi through weak yet he liveth by
the power of god for we also are weak in him but we shall live with
him by the power of god toward you

13:5 examin yourselv whether ye be in the faith; prove your own
selv know ye not your own selv how that jesu christ is in you
except ye be reprobates? 13:6 but i trust that ye shall know that we
are not reprob

13:7 now i pray to god that ye do no evil; not that we should appear
approv but that ye should do that which is honest though we be as
reprob

13:8 for we can do noth against the truth but for the truth

13:9 for we are glad when we are weak and ye are strong: and thi
also we wish even your perfect

13:10 therefor i write these thing be absent lest be present
i should use sharp accord to the power which the lord hath
given me to edif and not to destruct

13:11 final brethren farewel be perfect be of good comfort be
of one mind live in peace; and the god of love and peac shall be
with you

13:12 greet one anoth with an holi kiss

13:13 all the saint salut you

13:14 the grace of the lord jesu christ and the love of god and the
communion of the holi ghost be with you all amen




the epistl of paul the apostl to the galatian


1:1 paul an apostl (not of men neither by man but by jesu
christ and god the father who rais him from the dead;) 1:2 and all
the brethren which are with me unto the church of galatia: 1:3
grace be to you and peac from god the father and from our lord jesu
christ 1:4 who gave himself for our sin that he might deliv us
from thi present evil world accord to the will of god and our
father: 1:5 to whom be glori for ever and ever amen

1:6 i marvel that ye are so soon remov from him that call you into
the grace of christ unto anoth gospel: 1:7 which is not another; but
there be some that troubl you and would pervert the gospel of
christ

1:8 but though we or an angel from heaven preach ani other gospel
unto you than that which we have preach unto you let him be
accurs

1:9 as we said befor so say i now again if ani man preach ani other
gospel unto you than that ye have receiv let him be accurs

1:10 for do i now persuad men or god? or do i seek to pleas men?
for if i yet pleas men i should not be the servant of christ

1:11 but i certifi you brethren that the gospel which wa preach
of me is not after man

1:12 for i neither receiv it of man neither wa i taught it but by
the revel of jesu christ

1:13 for ye have heard of my convers in time past in the jew
religion how that beyond measur i persecut the church of god and
wast it: 1:14 and profit in the jew religion abov mani my
equal in mine own nation be more exceedingli zealou of the
tradit of my father

1:15 but when it pleas god who separ me from my mother womb
and call me by hi grace 1:16 to reveal hi son in me that i might
preach him among the heathen; immedi i confer not with flesh
and blood: 1:17 neither went i up to jerusalem to them which were
apostl befor me; but i went into arabia and return again unto
damascu

1:18 then after three year i went up to jerusalem to see peter and
abod with him fifteen day

1:19 but other of the apostl saw i none save jame the lord
brother

1:20 now the thing which i write unto you behold befor god i lie
not

1:21 afterward i came into the region of syria and cilicia; 1:22 and
wa unknown by face unto the church of judaea which were in christ:
1:23 but they had heard onli that he which persecut us in time
past now preacheth the faith which onc he destroy

1:24 and they glorifi god in me

2:1 then fourteen year after i went up again to jerusalem with
barnaba and took titu with me also

2:2 and i went up by revel and commun unto them that
gospel which i preach among the gentil but privat to them which
were of reput lest by ani mean i should run or had run in
vain

2:3 but neither titu who wa with me be a greek wa compel
to be circumcised: 2:4 and that becaus of fals brethren unawar
brought in who came in privili to spi out our liberti which we have
in christ jesu that they might bring us into bondage: 2:5 to whom we
gave place by subject no not for an hour; that the truth of the
gospel might continu with you

2:6 but of these who seem to be somewhat (whatsoev they were it
maketh no matter to me: god accepteth no man person:) for they who
seem to be somewhat in confer ad noth to me: 2:7 but
contrariwis when they saw that the gospel of the uncircumcis wa
commit unto me as the gospel of the circumcis wa unto peter;
2:8 (for he that wrought effectu in peter to the apostleship of
the circumcis the same wa mighti in me toward the gentiles:) 2:9
and when jame cepha and john who seem to be pillar perceiv
the grace that wa given unto me they gave to me and barnaba the
right hand of fellowship; that we should go unto the heathen and
they unto the circumcis

2:10 onli they would that we should rememb the poor; the same which
i also wa forward to do

2:11 but when peter wa come to antioch i withstood him to the face
becaus he wa to be blame

2:12 for befor that certain came from jame he did eat with the
gentiles: but when they were come he withdrew and separ himself
fear them which were of the circumcis

2:13 and the other jew dissembl likewis with him; insomuch that
barnaba also wa carri away with their dissimul

2:14 but when i saw that they walk not uprightli accord to the
truth of the gospel i said unto peter befor them all if thou be
a jew livest after the manner of gentil and not as do the jew
whi compellest thou the gentil to live as do the jews? 2:15 we who
are jew by natur and not sinner of the gentil 2:16 know that
a man is not justifi by the work of the law but by the faith of
jesu christ even we have believ in jesu christ that we might be
justifi by the faith of christ and not by the work of the law: for
by the work of the law shall no flesh be justifi

2:17 but if while we seek to be justifi by christ we ourselv
also are found sinner is therefor christ the minist of sin? god
forbid

2:18 for if i build again the thing which i destroy i make myself
a transgressor

2:19 for i through the law am dead to the law that i might live unto
god

2:20 i am crucifi with christ: neverthless i live; yet not i but
christ liveth in me: and the life which i now live in the flesh i live
by the faith of the son of god who love me and gave himself for me

2:21 i do not frustrat the grace of god: for if righteous come by
the law then christ is dead in vain

3:1 o foolish galatian who hath bewitch you that ye should not
obey the truth befor whose eye jesu christ hath been evid set
forth crucifi among you? 3:2 thi onli would i learn of you
receiv ye the spirit by the work of the law or by the hear of
faith? 3:3 are ye so foolish? have begun in the spirit are ye now
made perfect by the flesh? 3:4 have ye suffer so mani thing in
vain? if it be yet in vain

3:5 he therefor that ministereth to you the spirit and worketh
miracl among you doeth he it by the work of the law or by the
hear of faith? 3:6 even as abraham believ god and it wa
account to him for righteous

3:7 know ye therefor that they which are of faith the same are the
children of abraham

3:8 and the scriptur forese that god would justifi the heathen
through faith preach befor the gospel unto abraham say in
thee shall all nation be bless

3:9 so then they which be of faith are bless with faith abraham

3:10 for as mani as are of the work of the law are under the curse:
for it is written curs is everi one that continueth not in all
thing which are written in the book of the law to do them

3:11 but that no man is justifi by the law in the sight of god it
is evident: for the just shall live by faith

3:12 and the law is not of faith: but the man that doeth them shall
live in them

3:13 christ hath redeem us from the curs of the law be made a
curs for us: for it is written curs is everi one that hangeth on a
tree: 3:14 that the bless of abraham might come on the gentil
through jesu christ; that we might receiv the promis of the spirit
through faith

3:15 brethren i speak after the manner of men; though it be but a
man coven yet if it be confirm no man disannulleth or addeth
thereto

3:16 now to abraham and hi seed were the promis made he saith not
and to seed as of many; but as of one and to thi seed which is
christ

3:17 and thi i say that the coven that wa confirm befor of
god in christ the law which wa four hundr and thirti year after
cannot disannul that it should make the promis of none effect

3:18 for if the inherit be of the law it is no more of promise:
but god gave it to abraham by promis

3:19 wherefor then serveth the law? it wa ad becaus of
transgress till the seed should come to whom the promis wa
made; and it wa ordain by angel in the hand of a mediat

3:20 now a mediat is not a mediat of one but god is one

3:21 is the law then against the promis of god? god forbid: for if
there had been a law given which could have given life verili
righteous should have been by the law

3:22 but the scriptur hath conclud all under sin that the promis
by faith of jesu christ might be given to them that believ

3:23 but befor faith came we were kept under the law shut up unto
the faith which should afterward be reveal

3:24 wherefor the law wa our schoolmast to bring us unto christ
that we might be justifi by faith

3:25 but after that faith is come we are no longer under a
schoolmast

3:26 for ye are all the children of god by faith in christ jesu

3:27 for as mani of you as have been baptiz into christ have put on
christ

3:28 there is neither jew nor greek there is neither bond nor free
there is neither male nor female: for ye are all one in christ jesu

3:29 and if ye be christ then are ye abraham seed and heir
accord to the promis

4:1 now i say that the heir as long as he is a child differeth
noth from a servant though he be lord of all; 4:2 but is under
tutor and governor until the time appoint of the father

4:3 even so we when we were children were in bondag under the
element of the world: 4:4 but when the ful of the time wa come
god sent forth hi son made of a woman made under the law 4:5 to
redeem them that were under the law that we might receiv the
adopt of son

4:6 and becaus ye are son god hath sent forth the spirit of hi son
into your heart cri abba father

4:7 wherefor thou art no more a servant but a son; and if a son
then an heir of god through christ

4:8 howbeit then when ye knew not god ye did servic unto them which
by natur are no god

4:9 but now after that ye have known god or rather are known of god
how turn ye again to the weak and beggarli element whereunto ye
desir again to be in bondage? 4:10 ye observ day and month and
time and year

4:11 i am afraid of you lest i have bestow upon you labour in vain

4:12 brethren i beseech you be as i am; for i am as ye are: ye have
not injur me at all

4:13 ye know how through infirm of the flesh i preach the gospel
unto you at the first

4:14 and my temptat which wa in my flesh ye despis not nor
rejected; but receiv me as an angel of god even as christ jesu

4:15 where is then the blessed ye spake of? for i bear you record
that if it had been possibl ye would have pluck out your own
eye and have given them to me

4:16 am i therefor becom your enemi becaus i tell you the truth?
4:17 they zealous affect you but not well; yea they would exclud
you that ye might affect them

4:18 but it is good to be zealous affect alway in a good thing
and not onli when i am present with you

4:19 my littl children of whom i travail in birth again until christ
be form in you 4:20 i desir to be present with you now and to
chang my voice; for i stand in doubt of you

4:21 tell me ye that desir to be under the law do ye not hear the
law? 4:22 for it is written that abraham had two son the one by a
bondmaid the other by a freewoman

4:23 but he who wa of the bondwoman wa born after the flesh; but he
of the freewoman wa by promis

4:24 which thing are an allegory: for these are the two covenants;
the one from the mount sinai which gendereth to bondag which is
agar

4:25 for thi agar is mount sinai in arabia and answereth to
jerusalem which now is and is in bondag with her children

4:26 but jerusalem which is abov is free which is the mother of us
all

4:27 for it is written rejoic thou barren that bearest not; break
forth and cri thou that travailest not: for the desol hath mani
more children than she which hath an husband

4:28 now we brethren as isaac wa are the children of promis

4:29 but as then he that wa born after the flesh persecut him that
wa born after the spirit even so it is now

4:30 nevertheless what saith the scripture? cast out the bondwoman and
her son: for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son
of the freewoman

4:31 so then brethren we are not children of the bondwoman but of
the free

5:1 stand fast therefor in the liberti wherewith christ hath made us
free and be not entangl again with the yoke of bondag

5:2 behold i paul say unto you that if ye be circumcis christ
shall profit you noth

5:3 for i testifi again to everi man that is circumcis that he is a
debtor to do the whole law

5:4 christ is becom of no effect unto you whosoev of you are
justifi by the law; ye are fallen from grace

5:5 for we through the spirit wait for the hope of righteous by
faith

5:6 for in jesu christ neither circumcis availeth ani thing nor
uncircumcision; but faith which worketh by love

5:7 ye did run well; who did hinder you that ye should not obey the
truth? 5:8 thi persuas cometh not of him that calleth you

5:9 a littl leaven leaveneth the whole lump

5:10 i have confid in you through the lord that ye will be none
otherwis minded: but he that troubleth you shall bear hi judgment
whosoev he be

5:11 and i brethren if i yet preach circumcis whi do i yet
suffer persecution? then is the offenc of the cross ceas

5:12 i would they were even cut off which troubl you

5:13 for brethren ye have been call unto liberty; onli use not
liberti for an occas to the flesh but by love serv one anoth

5:14 for all the law is fulfil in one word even in this; thou
shalt love thi neighbour as thyself

5:15 but if ye bite and devour one anoth take heed that ye be not
consum one of anoth

5:16 thi i say then walk in the spirit and ye shall not fulfil the
lust of the flesh

5:17 for the flesh lusteth against the spirit and the spirit against
the flesh: and these are contrari the one to the other: so that ye
cannot do the thing that ye would

5:18 but if ye be led of the spirit ye are not under the law

5:19 now the work of the flesh are manifest which are these;
adulteri fornic unclean lascivi 5:20 idolatri
witchcraft hatr varianc emul wrath strife sedit
heresi 5:21 envi murder drunken revel and such
like: of the which i tell you befor as i have also told you in time
past that they which do such thing shall not inherit the kingdom of
god

5:22 but the fruit of the spirit is love joy peac longsuff
gentl good faith 5:23 meek temperance: against such
there is no law

5:24 and they that are christ have crucifi the flesh with the
affect and lust

5:25 if we live in the spirit let us also walk in the spirit

5:26 let us not be desir of vain glori provok one anoth
envi one anoth

6:1 brethren if a man be overtaken in a fault ye which are
spiritu restor such an one in the spirit of meekness; consid
thyself lest thou also be tempt

6:2 bear ye one anoth burden and so fulfil the law of christ

6:3 for if a man think himself to be someth when he is noth he
deceiveth himself

6:4 but let everi man prove hi own work and then shall he have
rejoic in himself alon and not in anoth

6:5 for everi man shall bear hi own burden

6:6 let him that is taught in the word commun unto him that
teacheth in all good thing

6:7 be not deceived; god is not mocked: for whatsoev a man soweth
that shall he also reap

6:8 for he that soweth to hi flesh shall of the flesh reap
corruption; but he that soweth to the spirit shall of the spirit reap
life everlast

6:9 and let us not be weari in well doing: for in due season we shall
reap if we faint not

6:10 as we have therefor opportun let us do good unto all men
especi unto them who are of the household of faith

6:11 ye see how larg a letter i have written unto you with mine own
hand

6:12 as mani as desir to make a fair shew in the flesh they
constrain you to be circumcised; onli lest they should suffer
persecut for the cross of christ

6:13 for neither they themselv who are circumcis keep the law; but
desir to have you circumcis that they may glori in your flesh

6:14 but god forbid that i should glori save in the cross of our lord
jesu christ by whom the world is crucifi unto me and i unto the
world

6:15 for in christ jesu neither circumcis availeth ani thing nor
uncircumcis but a new creatur

6:16 and as mani as walk accord to thi rule peac be on them and
merci and upon the israel of god

6:17 from henceforth let no man troubl me: for i bear in my bodi the
mark of the lord jesu

6:18 brethren the grace of our lord jesu christ be with your spirit

amen



the epistl of paul the apostl to the ephesian


1:1 paul an apostl of jesu christ by the will of god to the
saint which are at ephesu and to the faith in christ jesus:
1:2 grace be to you and peac from god our father and from the lord
jesu christ

1:3 bless be the god and father of our lord jesu christ who hath
bless us with all spiritu bless in heavenli place in christ:
1:4 accord as he hath chosen us in him befor the foundat of the
world that we should be holi and without blame befor him in love:
1:5 have predestin us unto the adopt of children by jesu
christ to himself accord to the good pleasur of hi will 1:6 to
the prais of the glori of hi grace wherein he hath made us accept
in the belov

1:7 in whom we have redempt through hi blood the forgiv of
sin accord to the rich of hi grace; 1:8 wherein he hath
abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence; 1:9 have made known
unto us the mysteri of hi will accord to hi good pleasur which
he hath purpos in himself: 1:10 that in the dispens of the
ful of time he might gather togeth in one all thing in christ
both which are in heaven and which are on earth; even in him: 1:11 in
whom also we have obtain an inherit be predestin
accord to the purpos of him who worketh all thing after the
counsel of hi own will: 1:12 that we should be to the prais of hi
glori who first trust in christ

1:13 in whom ye also trust after that ye heard the word of truth
the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that ye believ ye
were seal with that holi spirit of promis 1:14 which is the
earnest of our inherit until the redempt of the purchas
possess unto the prais of hi glori

1:15 wherefor i also after i heard of your faith in the lord jesu
and love unto all the saint 1:16 ceas not to give thank for you
make mention of you in my prayers; 1:17 that the god of our lord
jesu christ the father of glori may give unto you the spirit of
wisdom and revel in the knowledg of him: 1:18 the eye of your
understand be enlightened; that ye may know what is the hope of
hi call and what the rich of the glori of hi inherit in
the saint 1:19 and what is the exceed great of hi power to
us-ward who believ accord to the work of hi mighti power
1:20 which he wrought in christ when he rais him from the dead and
set him at hi own right hand in the heavenli place 1:21 far abov
all princip and power and might and dominion and everi name
that is name not onli in thi world but also in that which is to
come: 1:22 and hath put all thing under hi feet and gave him to be
the head over all thing to the church 1:23 which is hi bodi the
ful of him that filleth all in all

2:1 and you hath he quicken who were dead in trespass and sins;
2:2 wherein in time past ye walk accord to the cours of thi
world accord to the princ of the power of the air the spirit
that now worketh in the children of disobedience: 2:3 among whom also
we all had our convers in time past in the lust of our flesh
fulfil the desir of the flesh and of the mind; and were by
natur the children of wrath even as other

2:4 but god who is rich in merci for hi great love wherewith he
love us 2:5 even when we were dead in sin hath quicken us
togeth with christ (bi grace ye are saved;) 2:6 and hath rais us
up togeth and made us sit togeth in heavenli place in christ
jesus: 2:7 that in the age to come he might shew the exceed rich
of hi grace in hi kind toward us through christ jesu

2:8 for by grace are ye save through faith; and that not of
yourselves: it is the gift of god: 2:9 not of work lest ani man
should boast

2:10 for we are hi workmanship creat in christ jesu unto good
work which god hath befor ordain that we should walk in them

2:11 wherefor rememb that ye be in time past gentil in the
flesh who are call uncircumcis by that which is call the
circumcis in the flesh made by hands; 2:12 that at that time ye
were without christ be alien from the commonwealth of israel and
stranger from the coven of promis have no hope and without
god in the world: 2:13 but now in christ jesu ye who sometim were
far off are made nigh by the blood of christ

2:14 for he is our peac who hath made both one and hath broken down
the middl wall of partit between us; 2:15 have abolish in hi
flesh the enmiti even the law of command contain in
ordinances; for to make in himself of twain one new man so make
peace; 2:16 and that he might reconcil both unto god in one bodi by
the cross have slain the enmiti thereby: 2:17 and came and preach
peac to you which were afar off and to them that were nigh

2:18 for through him we both have access by one spirit unto the
father

2:19 now therefor ye are no more stranger and foreign but
fellowcitizen with the saint and of the household of god; 2:20 and
are built upon the foundat of the apostl and prophet jesu
christ himself be the chief corner stone; 2:21 in whom all the
build fitli frame togeth groweth unto an holi templ in the
lord: 2:22 in whom ye also are build togeth for an habit of
god through the spirit

3:1 for thi caus i paul the prison of jesu christ for you
gentil 3:2 if ye have heard of the dispens of the grace of god
which is given me to you-ward: 3:3 how that by revel he made
known unto me the mystery; (a i wrote afor in few word 3:4
wherebi when ye read ye may understand my knowledg in the mysteri
of christ) 3:5 which in other age wa not made known unto the son of
men as it is now reveal unto hi holi apostl and prophet by the
spirit; 3:6 that the gentil should be fellowheir and of the same
bodi and partak of hi promis in christ by the gospel: 3:7
whereof i wa made a minist accord to the gift of the grace of
god given unto me by the effectu work of hi power

3:8 unto me who am less than the least of all saint is thi grace
given that i should preach among the gentil the unsearch rich
of christ; 3:9 and to make all men see what is the fellowship of the
mysteri which from the begin of the world hath been hid in god
who creat all thing by jesu christ: 3:10 to the intent that now
unto the princip and power in heavenli place might be known
by the church the manifold wisdom of god 3:11 accord to the
etern purpos which he purpos in christ jesu our lord: 3:12 in
whom we have bold and access with confid by the faith of him

3:13 wherefor i desir that ye faint not at my tribul for you
which is your glori

3:14 for thi caus i bow my knee unto the father of our lord jesu
christ 3:15 of whom the whole famili in heaven and earth is name
3:16 that he would grant you accord to the rich of hi glori to
be strengthen with might by hi spirit in the inner man; 3:17 that
christ may dwell in your heart by faith; that ye be root and
ground in love 3:18 may be abl to comprehend with all saint what
is the breadth and length and depth and height; 3:19 and to know
the love of christ which passeth knowledg that ye might be fill
with all the ful of god

3:20 now unto him that is abl to do exceed abundantli abov all
that we ask or think accord to the power that worketh in us 3:21
unto him be glori in the church by christ jesu throughout all age
world without end amen

4:1 i therefor the prison of the lord beseech you that ye walk
worthi of the vocat wherewith ye are call 4:2 with all lowli
and meek with longsuff forbear one anoth in love; 4:3
endeavour to keep the uniti of the spirit in the bond of peac

4:4 there is one bodi and one spirit even as ye are call in one
hope of your calling; 4:5 one lord one faith one baptism 4:6 one
god and father of all who is abov all and through all and in you
all

4:7 but unto everi one of us is given grace accord to the measur
of the gift of christ

4:8 wherefor he saith when he ascend up on high he led captiv
captiv and gave gift unto men

4:9 (now that he ascend what is it but that he also descend first
into the lower part of the earth? 4:10 he that descend is the same
also that ascend up far abov all heaven that he might fill all
things) 4:11 and he gave some apostles; and some prophets; and
some evangelists; and some pastor and teachers; 4:12 for the
perfect of the saint for the work of the ministri for the
edifi of the bodi of christ: 4:13 till we all come in the uniti of
the faith and of the knowledg of the son of god unto a perfect man
unto the measur of the statur of the ful of christ: 4:14 that we
henceforth be no more children toss to and fro and carri about
with everi wind of doctrin by the sleight of men and cun
crafti wherebi they lie in wait to deceive; 4:15 but speak the
truth in love may grow up into him in all thing which is the head
even christ: 4:16 from whom the whole bodi fitli join togeth and
compact by that which everi joint supplieth accord to the
effectu work in the measur of everi part maketh increas of the
bodi unto the edifi of itself in love

4:17 thi i say therefor and testifi in the lord that ye henceforth
walk not as other gentil walk in the vaniti of their mind 4:18
have the understand darken be alien from the life of
god through the ignor that is in them becaus of the blind of
their heart: 4:19 who be past feel have given themselv over
unto lascivi to work all unclean with greedi

4:20 but ye have not so learn christ; 4:21 if so be that ye have
heard him and have been taught by him as the truth is in jesus: 4:22
that ye put off concern the former convers the old man which
is corrupt accord to the deceit lusts; 4:23 and be renew in
the spirit of your mind; 4:24 and that ye put on the new man which
after god is creat in righteous and true holi

4:25 wherefor put away lie speak everi man truth with hi
neighbour: for we are member one of anoth

4:26 be ye angri and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your
wrath: 4:27 neither give place to the devil

4:28 let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour
work with hi hand the thing which is good that he may have to
give to him that needeth

4:29 let no corrupt commun proceed out of your mouth but that
which is good to the use of edifi that it may minist grace unto
the hearer

4:30 and griev not the holi spirit of god wherebi ye are seal unto
the day of redempt

4:31 let all bitter and wrath and anger and clamour and evil
speak be put away from you with all malice: 4:32 and be ye kind
one to anoth tenderheart forgiv one anoth even as god for
christ sake hath forgiven you

5:1 be ye therefor follow of god as dear children; 5:2 and walk
in love as christ also hath love us and hath given himself for us
an offer and a sacrific to god for a sweetsmel savour

5:3 but fornic and all unclean or covet let it not
be onc name among you as becometh saints; 5:4 neither filthi
nor foolish talk nor jest which are not convenient: but rather
give of thank

5:5 for thi ye know that no whoremong nor unclean person nor
covet man who is an idolat hath ani inherit in the kingdom
of christ and of god

5:6 let no man deceiv you with vain words: for becaus of these
thing cometh the wrath of god upon the children of disobedi

5:7 be not ye therefor partak with them

5:8 for ye were sometim dark but now are ye light in the lord:
walk as children of light: 5:9 (for the fruit of the spirit is in all
good and righteous and truth;) 5:10 prove what is accept
unto the lord

5:11 and have no fellowship with the unfruit work of dark but
rather reprov them

5:12 for it is a shame even to speak of those thing which are done of
them in secret

5:13 but all thing that are reprov are made manifest by the light:
for whatsoev doth make manifest is light

5:14 wherefor he saith awak thou that sleepest and aris from the
dead and christ shall give thee light

5:15 see then that ye walk circumspectli not as fool but as wise
5:16 redeem the time becaus the day are evil

5:17 wherefor be ye not unwis but understand what the will of
the lord is

5:18 and be not drunk with wine wherein is excess; but be fill with
the spirit; 5:19 speak to yourselv in psalm and hymn and
spiritu song sing and make melodi in your heart to the lord;
5:20 give thank alway for all thing unto god and the father in
the name of our lord jesu christ; 5:21 submit yourselv one to
anoth in the fear of god

5:22 wive submit yourselv unto your own husband as unto the
lord

5:23 for the husband is the head of the wife even as christ is the
head of the church: and he is the saviour of the bodi

5:24 therefor as the church is subject unto christ so let the wive
be to their own husband in everi thing

5:25 husband love your wive even as christ also love the church
and gave himself for it; 5:26 that he might sanctifi and cleans it
with the wash of water by the word 5:27 that he might present it
to himself a gloriou church not have spot or wrinkl or ani such
thing; but that it should be holi and without blemish

5:28 so ought men to love their wive as their own bodi he that
loveth hi wife loveth himself

5:29 for no man ever yet hate hi own flesh; but nourisheth and
cherisheth it even as the lord the church: 5:30 for we are member of
hi bodi of hi flesh and of hi bone

5:31 for thi caus shall a man leav hi father and mother and shall
be join unto hi wife and they two shall be one flesh

5:32 thi is a great mystery: but i speak concern christ and the
church

5:33 nevertheless let everi one of you in particular so love hi wife
even as himself; and the wife see that she rever her husband

6:1 children obey your parent in the lord: for thi is right

6:2 honour thi father and mother; which is the first command with
promise; 6:3 that it may be well with thee and thou mayest live long
on the earth

6:4 and ye father provok not your children to wrath: but bring
them up in the nurtur and admonit of the lord

6:5 servant be obedi to them that are your master accord to
the flesh with fear and trembl in singl of your heart as
unto christ; 6:6 not with eyeservic as menpleasers; but as the
servant of christ do the will of god from the heart; 6:7 with
good will do servic as to the lord and not to men: 6:8 know
that whatsoev good thing ani man doeth the same shall he receiv of
the lord whether he be bond or free

6:9 and ye master do the same thing unto them forbear
threatening: know that your master also is in heaven; neither is
there respect of person with him

6:10 final my brethren be strong in the lord and in the power of
hi might

6:11 put on the whole armour of god that ye may be abl to stand
against the wile of the devil

6:12 for we wrestl not against flesh and blood but against
princip against power against the ruler of the dark of
thi world against spiritu wicked in high place

6:13 wherefor take unto you the whole armour of god that ye may be
abl to withstand in the evil day and have done all to stand

6:14 stand therefor have your loin girt about with truth and
have on the breastplat of righteousness; 6:15 and your feet shod
with the prepar of the gospel of peace; 6:16 abov all take
the shield of faith wherewith ye shall be abl to quench all the
fieri dart of the wick

6:17 and take the helmet of salvat and the sword of the spirit
which is the word of god: 6:18 pray alway with all prayer and
supplic in the spirit and watch thereunto with all
persever and supplic for all saints; 6:19 and for me that
utter may be given unto me that i may open my mouth boldli to
make known the mysteri of the gospel 6:20 for which i am an
ambassador in bonds: that therein i may speak boldli as i ought to
speak

6:21 but that ye also may know my affair and how i do tychicu a
belov brother and faith minist in the lord shall make known to
you all things: 6:22 whom i have sent unto you for the same purpos
that ye might know our affair and that he might comfort your heart

6:23 peac be to the brethren and love with faith from god the
father and the lord jesu christ

6:24 grace be with all them that love our lord jesu christ in
sincer

amen




the epistl of paul the apostl to the philippian


1:1 paul and timotheu the servant of jesu christ to all the
saint in christ jesu which are at philippi with the bishop and
deacons: 1:2 grace be unto you and peac from god our father and
from the lord jesu christ

1:3 i thank my god upon everi remembr of you 1:4 alway in everi
prayer of mine for you all make request with joy 1:5 for your
fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now; 1:6 be
confid of thi veri thing that he which hath begun a good work in
you will perform it until the day of jesu christ: 1:7 even as it is
meet for me to think thi of you all becaus i have you in my heart;
inasmuch as both in my bond and in the defenc and confirm of
the gospel ye all are partak of my grace

1:8 for god is my record how greatli i long after you all in the
bowel of jesu christ

1:9 and thi i pray that your love may abound yet more and more in
knowledg and in all judgment; 1:10 that ye may approv thing that
are excellent; that ye may be sincer and without offenc till the day
of christ

1:11 be fill with the fruit of righteous which are by jesu
christ unto the glori and prais of god

1:12 but i would ye should understand brethren that the thing which
happen unto me have fallen out rather unto the further of the
gospel; 1:13 so that my bond in christ are manifest in all the
palac and in all other places; 1:14 and mani of the brethren in the
lord wax confid by my bond are much more bold to speak the
word without fear

1:15 some inde preach christ even of envi and strife; and some also
of good will: 1:16 the one preach christ of content not sincer
suppos to add afflict to my bonds: 1:17 but the other of love
know that i am set for the defenc of the gospel

1:18 what then? notwithstand everi way whether in pretenc or in
truth christ is preached; and i therein do rejoic yea and will
rejoic

1:19 for i know that thi shall turn to my salvat through your
prayer and the suppli of the spirit of jesu christ 1:20 accord
to my earnest expect and my hope that in noth i shall be
asham but that with all bold as alway so now also christ
shall be magnifi in my bodi whether it be by life or by death

1:21 for to me to live is christ and to die is gain

1:22 but if i live in the flesh thi is the fruit of my labour: yet
what i shall choos i wot not

1:23 for i am in a strait betwixt two have a desir to depart and
to be with christ; which is far better: 1:24 nevertheless to abid in
the flesh is more need for you

1:25 and have thi confid i know that i shall abid and
continu with you all for your further and joy of faith; 1:26 that
your rejoic may be more abund in jesu christ for me by my
come to you again

1:27 onli let your convers be as it becometh the gospel of
christ: that whether i come and see you or els be absent i may hear
of your affair that ye stand fast in one spirit with one mind
strive togeth for the faith of the gospel; 1:28 and in noth
terrifi by your adversaries: which is to them an evid token of
perdit but to you of salvat and that of god

1:29 for unto you it is given in the behalf of christ not onli to
believ on him but also to suffer for hi sake; 1:30 have the same
conflict which ye saw in me and now hear to be in me

2:1 if there be therefor ani consol in christ if ani comfort of
love if ani fellowship of the spirit if ani bowel and merci 2:2
fulfil ye my joy that ye be likemind have the same love be
of one accord of one mind

2:3 let noth be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowli
of mind let each esteem other better than themselv

2:4 look not everi man on hi own thing but everi man also on the
thing of other

2:5 let thi mind be in you which wa also in christ jesus: 2:6 who
be in the form of god thought it not robberi to be equal with god:
