2:7 but made himself of no reput and took upon him the form of a
servant and wa made in the like of men: 2:8 and be found in
fashion as a man he humbl himself and becam obedi unto death
even the death of the cross

2:9 wherefor god also hath highli exalt him and given him a name
which is abov everi name: 2:10 that at the name of jesu everi knee
should bow of thing in heaven and thing in earth and thing under
the earth; 2:11 and that everi tongu should confess that jesu christ
is lord to the glori of god the father

2:12 wherefor my belov as ye have alway obey not as in my
presenc onli but now much more in my absenc work out your own
salvat with fear and trembl

2:13 for it is god which worketh in you both to will and to do of hi
good pleasur

2:14 do all thing without murmur and disputings: 2:15 that ye may
be blameless and harmless the son of god without rebuk in the
midst of a crook and pervers nation among whom ye shine as light
in the world; 2:16 hold forth the word of life; that i may rejoic
in the day of christ that i have not run in vain neither labour in
vain

2:17 yea and if i be offer upon the sacrific and servic of your
faith i joy and rejoic with you all

2:18 for the same caus also do ye joy and rejoic with me

2:19 but i trust in the lord jesu to send timotheu shortli unto you
that i also may be of good comfort when i know your state

2:20 for i have no man likemind who will natur care for your
state

2:21 for all seek their own not the thing which are jesu christ

2:22 but ye know the proof of him that as a son with the father he
hath serv with me in the gospel

2:23 him therefor i hope to send present so soon as i shall see
how it will go with me

2:24 but i trust in the lord that i also myself shall come shortli

2:25 yet i suppos it necessari to send to you epaphroditu my
brother and companion in labour and fellowsoldi but your
messeng and he that minist to my want

2:26 for he long after you all and wa full of heavi becaus
that ye had heard that he had been sick

2:27 for inde he wa sick nigh unto death: but god had merci on him;
and not on him onli but on me also lest i should have sorrow upon
sorrow

2:28 i sent him therefor the more care that when ye see him
again ye may rejoic and that i may be the less sorrow

2:29 receiv him therefor in the lord with all gladness; and hold
such in reputation: 2:30 becaus for the work of christ he wa nigh
unto death not regard hi life to suppli your lack of servic
toward me

3:1 final my brethren rejoic in the lord to write the same
thing to you to me inde is not grievou but for you it is safe

3:2 bewar of dog bewar of evil worker bewar of the concis

3:3 for we are the circumcis which worship god in the spirit and
rejoic in christ jesu and have no confid in the flesh

3:4 though i might also have confid in the flesh if ani other man
thinketh that he hath whereof he might trust in the flesh i more: 3:5
circumcis the eighth day of the stock of israel of the tribe of
benjamin an hebrew of the hebrews; as touch the law a pharisee;
3:6 concern zeal persecut the church; touch the
righteous which is in the law blameless

3:7 but what thing were gain to me those i count loss for christ

3:8 yea doubtless and i count all thing but loss for the excel
of the knowledg of christ jesu my lord: for whom i have suffer the
loss of all thing and do count them but dung that i may win christ
3:9 and be found in him not have mine own righteous which is
of the law but that which is through the faith of christ the
righteous which is of god by faith: 3:10 that i may know him and
the power of hi resurrect and the fellowship of hi suffer
be made conform unto hi death; 3:11 if by ani mean i might
attain unto the resurrect of the dead

3:12 not as though i had alreadi attain either were alreadi
perfect: but i follow after if that i may apprehend that for which
also i am apprehend of christ jesu

3:13 brethren i count not myself to have apprehended: but thi one
thing i do forget those thing which are behind and reach
forth unto those thing which are befor 3:14 i press toward the mark
for the prize of the high call of god in christ jesu

3:15 let us therefor as mani as be perfect be thu minded: and if
in ani thing ye be otherwis mind god shall reveal even thi unto
you

3:16 nevertheless whereto we have alreadi attain let us walk by
the same rule let us mind the same thing

3:17 brethren be follow togeth of me and mark them which walk
so as ye have us for an ensampl

3:18 (for mani walk of whom i have told you often and now tell you
even weep that they are the enemi of the cross of christ: 3:19
whose end is destruct whose god is their belli and whose glori is
in their shame who mind earthli things) 3:20 for our convers
is in heaven; from whenc also we look for the saviour the lord jesu
christ: 3:21 who shall chang our vile bodi that it may be fashion
like unto hi gloriou bodi accord to the work wherebi he is
abl even to subdu all thing unto himself

4:1 therefor my brethren dearli belov and long for my joy and
crown so stand fast in the lord my dearli belov

4:2 i beseech euodia and beseech syntych that they be of the same
mind in the lord

4:3 and i intreat thee also true yokefellow help those women which
labour with me in the gospel with clement also and with other my
fellowlabour whose name are in the book of life

4:4 rejoic in the lord alway: and again i say rejoic

4:5 let your moder be known unto all men the lord is at hand

4:6 be care for nothing; but in everi thing by prayer and
supplic with thanksgiv let your request be made known unto
god

4:7 and the peac of god which passeth all understand shall keep
your heart and mind through christ jesu

4:8 final brethren whatsoev thing are true whatsoev thing
are honest whatsoev thing are just whatsoev thing are pure
whatsoev thing are love whatsoev thing are of good report; if
there be ani virtu and if there be ani prais think on these
thing

4:9 those thing which ye have both learn and receiv and heard
and seen in me do: and the god of peac shall be with you

4:10 but i rejoic in the lord greatli that now at the last your
care of me hath flourish again; wherein ye were also care but ye
lack opportun

4:11 not that i speak in respect of want: for i have learn in
whatsoev state i am therewith to be content

4:12 i know both how to be abas and i know how to abound: everi
where and in all thing i am instruct both to be full and to be
hungri both to abound and to suffer need

4:13 i can do all thing through christ which strengtheneth me

4:14 notwithstand ye have well done that ye did commun with
my afflict

4:15 now ye philippian know also that in the begin of the
gospel when i depart from macedonia no church commun with me
as concern give and receiv but ye onli

4:16 for even in thessalonica ye sent onc and again unto my
necess

4:17 not becaus i desir a gift: but i desir fruit that may abound
to your account

4:18 but i have all and abound: i am full have receiv of
epaphroditu the thing which were sent from you an odour of a sweet
smell a sacrific accept wellpleas to god

4:19 but my god shall suppli all your need accord to hi rich in
glori by christ jesu

4:20 now unto god and our father be glori for ever and ever amen

4:21 salut everi saint in christ jesu the brethren which are with
me greet you

4:22 all the saint salut you chiefli they that are of caesar
household

4:23 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you all amen




the epistl of paul the apostl to the colossian


1:1 paul an apostl of jesu christ by the will of god
and timotheu our brother 1:2 to the saint and faith brethren
in christ which are at colosse: grace be unto you and peac
from god our father and the lord jesu christ

1:3 we give thank to god and the father of our lord jesu christ pray
alway for you
1:4 sinc we heard of your faith in christ jesu and of the love which ye
have to all the saint
1:5 for the hope which is laid up for you in heaven whereof ye heard
befor in the word of the truth of the gospel;
1:6 which is come unto you as it is in all the world; and bringeth forth
fruit as it doth also in you sinc the day ye heard of it and knew the
grace of god in truth:
1:7 as ye also learn of epaphra our dear fellowserv who is for you
a faith minist of christ;
1:8 who also declar unto us your love in the spirit

1:9 for thi caus we also sinc the day we heard it do not ceas to
pray for you and to desir that ye might be fill with the knowledg of hi
will in all wisdom and spiritu understanding;
1:10 that ye might walk worthi of the lord unto all pleas be
fruit in everi good work and increas in the knowledg of god;
1:11 strengthen with all might accord to hi gloriou power unto
all patienc and longsuff with joyfulness;
1:12 give thank unto the father which hath made us meet to be
partak of the inherit of the saint in light:
1:13 who hath deliv us from the power of dark and hath translat
us into the kingdom of hi dear son:
1:14 in whom we have redempt through hi blood even the forgiv of
sins:
1:15 who is the imag of the invis god the firstborn of everi
creature:
1:16 for by him were all thing creat that are in heaven and that are
in earth visibl and invis whether they be throne or dominion or
princip or powers: all thing were creat by him and for him:
1:17 and he is befor all thing and by him all thing consist

1:18 and he is the head of the bodi the church: who is the begin the
firstborn from the dead; that in all thing he might have the preemin

1:19 for it pleas the father that in him should all ful dwell;
1:20 and have made peac through the blood of hi cross by him to
reconcil all thing unto himself; by him i say whether they be thing in
earth or thing in heaven

1:21 and you that were sometim alien and enemi in your mind by
wick work yet now hath he reconcil
1:22 in the bodi of hi flesh through death to present you holi and
unblam and unreprov in hi sight:
1:23 if ye continu in the faith ground and settl and be not move
away from the hope of the gospel which ye have heard and which wa preach
to everi creatur which is under heaven; whereof i paul am made a minister;
1:24 who now rejoic in my suffer for you and fill up that which is
behind of the afflict of christ in my flesh for hi bodi sake which is
the church:
1:25 whereof i am made a minist accord to the dispens of god
which is given to me for you to fulfil the word of god;
1:26 even the mysteri which hath been hid from age and from gener
but now is made manifest to hi saints:
1:27 to whom god would make known what is the rich of the glori of thi
mysteri among the gentiles; which is christ in you the hope of glory:
1:28 whom we preach warn everi man and teach everi man in all
wisdom; that we may present everi man perfect in christ jesus:
1:29 whereunto i also labour strive accord to hi work which
worketh in me mightili

2:1 for i would that ye knew what great conflict i have for you and for
them at laodicea and for as mani as have not seen my face in the flesh;
2:2 that their heart might be comfort be knit togeth in love and
unto all rich of the full assur of understand to the
acknowledg of the mysteri of god and of the father and of christ;
2:3 in whom are hid all the treasur of wisdom and knowledg

2:4 and thi i say lest ani man should beguil you with entic word

2:5 for though i be absent in the flesh yet am i with you in the spirit
joy and behold your order and the stedfast of your faith in
christ

2:6 as ye have therefor receiv christ jesu the lord so walk ye in
him:
2:7 root and built up in him and stablish in the faith as ye have
been taught abound therein with thanksgiv

2:8 bewar lest ani man spoil you through philosophi and vain deceit
after the tradit of men after the rudiment of the world and not after
christ

2:9 for in him dwelleth all the ful of the godhead bodili

2:10 and ye are complet in him which is the head of all princip and
power:
2:11 in whom also ye are circumcis with the circumcis made without
hand in put off the bodi of the sin of the flesh by the circumcis
of christ:
2:12 buri with him in baptism wherein also ye are risen with him
through the faith of the oper of god who hath rais him from the dead

2:13 and you be dead in your sin and the uncircumcis of your
flesh hath he quicken togeth with him have forgiven you all
trespasses;
2:14 blot out the handwrit of ordin that wa against us which
wa contrari to us and took it out of the way nail it to hi cross;
2:15 and have spoil princip and power he made a shew of them
openli triumph over them in it

2:16 let no man therefor judg you in meat or in drink or in respect of
an holyday or of the new moon or of the sabbath days:
2:17 which are a shadow of thing to come; but the bodi is of christ

2:18 let no man beguil you of your reward in a voluntari humil and
worship of angel intrud into those thing which he hath not seen
vainli puf up by hi fleshli mind
2:19 and not hold the head from which all the bodi by joint and band
have nourish minist and knit togeth increaseth with the
increas of god

2:20 wherefor if ye be dead with christ from the rudiment of the world
whi as though live in the world are ye subject to ordin
2:21 (touch not; tast not; handl not;
2:22 which all are to perish with the using;) after the command and
doctrin of men?
2:23 which thing have inde a shew of wisdom in will worship and
humil and neglect of the body: not in ani honour to the satisfi
of the flesh

3:1 if ye then be risen with christ seek those thing which are abov
where christ sitteth on the right hand of god

3:2 set your affect on thing abov not on thing on the earth

3:3 for ye are dead and your life is hid with christ in god

3:4 when christ who is our life shall appear then shall ye also appear
with him in glori

3:5 mortifi therefor your member which are upon the earth; fornic
unclean inordin affect evil concupisc and covet
which is idolatry:
3:6 for which thing sake the wrath of god cometh on the children of
disobedience:
3:7 in the which ye also walk some time when ye live in them

3:8 but now ye also put off all these; anger wrath malic blasphemi
filthi commun out of your mouth

3:9 lie not one to anoth see that ye have put off the old man with
hi deeds;
3:10 and have put on the new man which is renew in knowledg after the
imag of him that creat him:
3:11 where there is neither greek nor jew circumcis nor
uncircumcis barbarian scythian bond nor free: but christ is all and in
all

3:12 put on therefor as the elect of god holi and belov bowel of
merci kind humbl of mind meek longsuffering;
3:13 forbear one anoth and forgiv one anoth if ani man have a
quarrel against any: even as christ forgav you so also do ye

3:14 and abov all these thing put on chariti which is the bond of
perfect

3:15 and let the peac of god rule in your heart to the which also ye
are call in one body; and be ye thank

3:16 let the word of christ dwell in you richli in all wisdom; teach
and admonish one anoth in psalm and hymn and spiritu song sing
with grace in your heart to the lord

3:17 and whatsoev ye do in word or deed do all in the name of the lord
jesu give thank to god and the father by him

3:18 wive submit yourselv unto your own husband as it is fit in the
lord

3:19 husband love your wive and be not bitter against them

3:20 children obey your parent in all things: for thi is well pleas
unto the lord

3:21 father provok not your children to anger lest they be
discourag

3:22 servant obey in all thing your master accord to the flesh; not
with eyeservic as menpleasers; but in singl of heart fear god;
3:23 and whatsoev ye do do it heartili as to the lord and not unto
men;
3:24 know that of the lord ye shall receiv the reward of the
inheritance: for ye serv the lord christ

3:25 but he that doeth wrong shall receiv for the wrong which he hath
done: and there is no respect of person

4:1 master give unto your servant that which is just and equal; know
that ye also have a master in heaven

4:2 continu in prayer and watch in the same with thanksgiving;
4:3 withal pray also for us that god would open unto us a door of
utter to speak the mysteri of christ for which i am also in bonds:
4:4 that i may make it manifest as i ought to speak

4:5 walk in wisdom toward them that are without redeem the time

4:6 let your speech be alway with grace season with salt that ye may
know how ye ought to answer everi man

4:7 all my state shall tychicu declar unto you who is a belov
brother and a faith minist and fellowserv in the lord:
4:8 whom i have sent unto you for the same purpos that he might know
your estat and comfort your hearts;
4:9 with onesimu a faith and belov brother who is one of you they
shall make known unto you all thing which are done here

4:10 aristarchu my fellowprison saluteth you and marcu sister son
to barnaba (touch whom ye receiv commandments: if he come unto you
receiv him;)
4:11 and jesu which is call justu who are of the circumcis these
onli are my fellowwork unto the kingdom of god which have been a comfort
unto me

4:12 epaphra who is one of you a servant of christ saluteth you
alway labour fervent for you in prayer that ye may stand perfect and
complet in all the will of god

4:13 for i bear him record that he hath a great zeal for you and them
that are in laodicea and them in hierapoli

4:14 luke the belov physician and dema greet you

4:15 salut the brethren which are in laodicea and nympha and the
church which is in hi hous

4:16 and when thi epistl is read among you caus that it be read also
in the church of the laodiceans; and that ye likewis read the epistl from
laodicea

4:17 and say to archippu take heed to the ministri which thou hast
receiv in the lord that thou fulfil it

4:18 the salut by the hand of me paul rememb my bond grace be
with you amen




the first epistl of paul the apostl to the thessalonian


1:1 paul and silvanu and timotheu unto the church of the
thessalonian which is in god the father and in the lord jesu christ:
grace be unto you and peac from god our father and the lord jesu
christ

1:2 we give thank to god alway for you all make mention of you in
our prayers; 1:3 rememb without ceas your work of faith and
labour of love and patienc of hope in our lord jesu christ in the
sight of god and our father; 1:4 know brethren belov your
elect of god

1:5 for our gospel came not unto you in word onli but also in power
and in the holi ghost and in much assurance; as ye know what manner
of men we were among you for your sake

1:6 and ye becam follow of us and of the lord have receiv
the word in much afflict with joy of the holi ghost

1:7 so that ye were ensampl to all that believ in macedonia and
achaia

1:8 for from you sound out the word of the lord not onli in
macedonia and achaia but also in everi place your faith to god-ward
is spread abroad; so that we need not to speak ani thing

1:9 for they themselv shew of us what manner of enter in we had
unto you and how ye turn to god from idol to serv the live and
true god; 1:10 and to wait for hi son from heaven whom he rais
from the dead even jesu which deliv us from the wrath to come

2:1 for yourselv brethren know our entranc in unto you that it
wa not in vain: 2:2 but even after that we had suffer befor and
were shame entreat as ye know at philippi we were bold in
our god to speak unto you the gospel of god with much content

2:3 for our exhort wa not of deceit nor of unclean nor in
guile: 2:4 but as we were allow of god to be put in trust with the
gospel even so we speak; not as pleas men but god which trieth
our heart

2:5 for neither at ani time use we flatter word as ye know nor
a cloke of covetousness; god is witness: 2:6 nor of men sought we
glori neither of you nor yet of other when we might have been
burdensom as the apostl of christ

2:7 but we were gentl among you even as a nurs cherisheth her
children: 2:8 so be affection desir of you we were will
to have impart unto you not the gospel of god onli but also our
own soul becaus ye were dear unto us

2:9 for ye rememb brethren our labour and travail: for labour
night and day becaus we would not be chargeabl unto ani of you we
preach unto you the gospel of god

2:10 ye are wit and god also how holili and justli and
unblam we behav ourselv among you that believe: 2:11 as ye
know how we exhort and comfort and charg everi one of you as a
father doth hi children 2:12 that ye would walk worthi of god who
hath call you unto hi kingdom and glori

2:13 for thi caus also thank we god without ceas becaus when
ye receiv the word of god which ye heard of us ye receiv it not
as the word of men but as it is in truth the word of god which
effectu worketh also in you that believ

2:14 for ye brethren becam follow of the church of god which
in judaea are in christ jesus: for ye also have suffer like thing
of your own countrymen even as they have of the jews: 2:15 who both
kill the lord jesu and their own prophet and have persecut us;
and they pleas not god and are contrari to all men: 2:16 forbid
us to speak to the gentil that they might be save to fill up their
sin alway: for the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost

2:17 but we brethren be taken from you for a short time in
presenc not in heart endeavour the more abundantli to see your
face with great desir

2:18 wherefor we would have come unto you even i paul onc and
again; but satan hinder us

2:19 for what is our hope or joy or crown of rejoicing? are not even
ye in the presenc of our lord jesu christ at hi coming? 2:20 for
ye are our glori and joy

3:1 wherefor when we could no longer forbear we thought it good to
be left at athen alone; 3:2 and sent timotheu our brother and
minist of god and our fellowlabour in the gospel of christ to
establish you and to comfort you concern your faith: 3:3 that no
man should be move by these afflictions: for yourselv know that we
are appoint thereunto

3:4 for verili when we were with you we told you befor that we
should suffer tribulation; even as it came to pass and ye know

3:5 for thi caus when i could no longer forbear i sent to know
your faith lest by some mean the tempter have tempt you and our
labour be in vain

3:6 but now when timotheu came from you unto us and brought us good
tide of your faith and chariti and that ye have good remembr
of us alway desir greatli to see us as we also to see you: 3:7
therefor brethren we were comfort over you in all our afflict
and distress by your faith: 3:8 for now we live if ye stand fast in
the lord

3:9 for what thank can we render to god again for you for all the
joy wherewith we joy for your sake befor our god; 3:10 night and day
pray exceedingli that we might see your face and might perfect
that which is lack in your faith? 3:11 now god himself and our
father and our lord jesu christ direct our way unto you

3:12 and the lord make you to increas and abound in love one toward
anoth and toward all men even as we do toward you: 3:13 to the end
he may stablish your heart unblam in holi befor god even
our father at the come of our lord jesu christ with all hi
saint

4:1 furthermor then we beseech you brethren and exhort you by the
lord jesu that as ye have receiv of us how ye ought to walk and to
pleas god so ye would abound more and more

4:2 for ye know what command we gave you by the lord jesu

4:3 for thi is the will of god even your sanctif that ye
should abstain from fornication: 4:4 that everi one of you should know
how to possess hi vessel in sanctif and honour; 4:5 not in the
lust of concupisc even as the gentil which know not god: 4:6
that no man go beyond and defraud hi brother in ani matter: becaus
that the lord is the aveng of all such as we also have forewarn
you and testifi

4:7 for god hath not call us unto unclean but unto holi

4:8 he therefor that despiseth despiseth not man but god who hath
also given unto us hi holi spirit

4:9 but as touch brotherli love ye need not that i write unto you:
for ye yourselv are taught of god to love one anoth

4:10 and inde ye do it toward all the brethren which are in all
macedonia: but we beseech you brethren that ye increas more and
more; 4:11 and that ye studi to be quiet and to do your own busi
and to work with your own hand as we command you; 4:12 that ye may
walk honestli toward them that are without and that ye may have lack
of noth

4:13 but i would not have you to be ignor brethren concern
them which are asleep that ye sorrow not even as other which have
no hope

4:14 for if we believ that jesu die and rose again even so them
also which sleep in jesu will god bring with him

4:15 for thi we say unto you by the word of the lord that we which
are aliv and remain unto the come of the lord shall not prevent
them which are asleep

4:16 for the lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout with
the voic of the archangel and with the trump of god: and the dead in
christ shall rise first: 4:17 then we which are aliv and remain shall
be caught up togeth with them in the cloud to meet the lord in the
air: and so shall we ever be with the lord

4:18 wherefor comfort one anoth with these word

5:1 but of the time and the season brethren ye have no need that i
write unto you

5:2 for yourselv know perfectli that the day of the lord so cometh
as a thief in the night

5:3 for when they shall say peac and safety; then sudden destruct
cometh upon them as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall
not escap

5:4 but ye brethren are not in dark that that day should
overtak you as a thief

5:5 ye are all the children of light and the children of the day: we
are not of the night nor of dark

5:6 therefor let us not sleep as do others; but let us watch and be
sober

5:7 for they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken
are drunken in the night

5:8 but let us who are of the day be sober put on the
breastplat of faith and love; and for an helmet the hope of
salvat

5:9 for god hath not appoint us to wrath but to obtain salvat by
our lord jesu christ 5:10 who die for us that whether we wake or
sleep we should live togeth with him

5:11 wherefor comfort yourselv togeth and edifi one anoth
even as also ye do

5:12 and we beseech you brethren to know them which labour among
you and are over you in the lord and admonish you; 5:13 and to
esteem them veri highli in love for their work sake and be at peac
among yourselv

5:14 now we exhort you brethren warn them that are unruli comfort
the feeblemind support the weak be patient toward all men

5:15 see that none render evil for evil unto ani man; but ever follow
that which is good both among yourselv and to all men

5:16 rejoic evermor

5:17 pray without ceas

5:18 in everi thing give thanks: for thi is the will of god in christ
jesu concern you

5:19 quench not the spirit

5:20 despis not prophesi

5:21 prove all things; hold fast that which is good

5:22 abstain from all appear of evil

5:23 and the veri god of peac sanctifi you wholly; and i pray god
your whole spirit and soul and bodi be preserv blameless unto the
come of our lord jesu christ

5:24 faith is he that calleth you who also will do it

5:25 brethren pray for us

5:26 greet all the brethren with an holi kiss

5:27 i charg you by the lord that thi epistl be read unto all the
holi brethren

5:28 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you amen




the second epistl of paul the apostl to the thessalonian


1:1 paul and silvanu and timotheu unto the church of the
thessalonian in god our father and the lord jesu christ: 1:2 grace
unto you and peac from god our father and the lord jesu christ

1:3 we are bound to thank god alway for you brethren as it is meet
becaus that your faith groweth exceedingli and the chariti of everi
one of you all toward each other aboundeth; 1:4 so that we ourselv
glori in you in the church of god for your patienc and faith in all
your persecut and tribul that ye endure: 1:5 which is a
manifest token of the righteou judgment of god that ye may be
count worthi of the kingdom of god for which ye also suffer: 1:6
see it is a righteou thing with god to recompens tribul to
them that troubl you; 1:7 and to you who are troubl rest with us
when the lord jesu shall be reveal from heaven with hi mighti
angel 1:8 in flame fire take vengeanc on them that know not
god and that obey not the gospel of our lord jesu christ: 1:9 who
shall be punish with everlast destruct from the presenc of
the lord and from the glori of hi power; 1:10 when he shall come to
be glorifi in hi saint and to be admir in all them that believ
(becaus our testimoni among you wa believed) in that day

1:11 wherefor also we pray alway for you that our god would count
you worthi of thi call and fulfil all the good pleasur of hi
good and the work of faith with power: 1:12 that the name of our
lord jesu christ may be glorifi in you and ye in him accord to
the grace of our god and the lord jesu christ

2:1 now we beseech you brethren by the come of our lord jesu
christ and by our gather togeth unto him 2:2 that ye be not
soon shaken in mind or be troubl neither by spirit nor by word
nor by letter as from us as that the day of christ is at hand

2:3 let no man deceiv you by ani means: for that day shall not come
except there come a fall away first and that man of sin be
reveal the son of perdition; 2:4 who opposeth and exalteth himself
abov all that is call god or that is worshipped; so that he as god
sitteth in the templ of god shew himself that he is god

2:5 rememb ye not that when i wa yet with you i told you these
things? 2:6 and now ye know what withholdeth that he might be
reveal in hi time

2:7 for the mysteri of iniqu doth alreadi work: onli he who now
letteth will let until he be taken out of the way

2:8 and then shall that wick be reveal whom the lord shall
consum with the spirit of hi mouth and shall destroy with the
bright of hi coming: 2:9 even him whose come is after the
work of satan with all power and sign and lie wonder 2:10 and
with all deceiv of unright in them that perish;
becaus they receiv not the love of the truth that they might be
save

2:11 and for thi caus god shall send them strong delus that they
should believ a lie: 2:12 that they all might be damn who believ
not the truth but had pleasur in unright

2:13 but we are bound to give thank alway to god for you brethren
belov of the lord becaus god hath from the begin chosen you to
salvat through sanctif of the spirit and belief of the
truth: 2:14 whereunto he call you by our gospel to the obtain of
the glori of our lord jesu christ

2:15 therefor brethren stand fast and hold the tradit which ye
have been taught whether by word or our epistl

2:16 now our lord jesu christ himself and god even our father
which hath love us and hath given us everlast consol and
good hope through grace 2:17 comfort your heart and stablish you in
everi good word and work

3:1 final brethren pray for us that the word of the lord may have
free cours and be glorifi even as it is with you: 3:2 and that we
may be deliv from unreason and wick men: for all men have
not faith

3:3 but the lord is faith who shall stablish you and keep you
from evil

3:4 and we have confid in the lord touch you that ye both do
and will do the thing which we command you

3:5 and the lord direct your heart into the love of god and into the
patient wait for christ

3:6 now we command you brethren in the name of our lord jesu
christ that ye withdraw yourselv from everi brother that walketh
disorderli and not after the tradit which he receiv of us

3:7 for yourselv know how ye ought to follow us: for we behav not
ourselv disorderli among you; 3:8 neither did we eat ani man bread
for nought; but wrought with labour and travail night and day that we
might not be chargeabl to ani of you: 3:9 not becaus we have not
power but to make ourselv an ensampl unto you to follow us

3:10 for even when we were with you thi we command you that if
ani would not work neither should he eat

3:11 for we hear that there are some which walk among you disorderli
work not at all but are busybodi

3:12 now them that are such we command and exhort by our lord jesu
christ that with quiet they work and eat their own bread

3:13 but ye brethren be not weari in well do

3:14 and if ani man obey not our word by thi epistl note that man
and have no compani with him that he may be asham

3:15 yet count him not as an enemi but admonish him as a brother

3:16 now the lord of peac himself give you peac alway by all mean
the lord be with you all

3:17 the salut of paul with mine own hand which is the token in
everi epistle: so i write

3:18 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you all amen




the first epistl of paul the apostl to timothi


1:1 paul an apostl of jesu christ by the command of god our
saviour and lord jesu christ which is our hope; 1:2 unto timothi
my own son in the faith: grace merci and peac from god our father
and jesu christ our lord

1:3 as i besought thee to abid still at ephesu when i went into
macedonia that thou mightest charg some that they teach no other
doctrin 1:4 neither give heed to fabl and endless genealog
which minist question rather than godli edifi which is in
faith: so do

1:5 now the end of the command is chariti out of a pure heart and
of a good conscienc and of faith unfeigned: 1:6 from which some
have swerv have turn asid unto vain jangling; 1:7 desir to
be teacher of the law; understand neither what they say nor
whereof they affirm

1:8 but we know that the law is good if a man use it lawfully; 1:9
know thi that the law is not made for a righteou man but for
the lawless and disobedi for the ungodli and for sinner for
unholi and profan for murder of father and murder of mother
for manslay 1:10 for whoremong for them that defil themselv
with mankind for mensteal for liar for perjur person and if
there be ani other thing that is contrari to sound doctrine; 1:11
accord to the gloriou gospel of the bless god which wa
commit to my trust

1:12 and i thank christ jesu our lord who hath enabl me for that
he count me faith put me into the ministry; 1:13 who wa
befor a blasphem and a persecutor and injurious: but i obtain
merci becaus i did it ignorantli in unbelief

1:14 and the grace of our lord wa exceed abund with faith and
love which is in christ jesu

1:15 thi is a faith say and worthi of all accept that
christ jesu came into the world to save sinners; of whom i am chief

1:16 howbeit for thi caus i obtain merci that in me first jesu
christ might shew forth all longsuff for a pattern to them which
should hereaft believ on him to life everlast

1:17 now unto the king etern immort invis the onli wise
god be honour and glori for ever and ever amen

1:18 thi charg i commit unto thee son timothi accord to the
propheci which went befor on thee that thou by them mightest war a
good warfare; 1:19 hold faith and a good conscience; which some
have put away concern faith have made shipwreck: 1:20 of whom is
hymenaeu and alexander; whom i have deliv unto satan that they
may learn not to blasphem

2:1 i exhort therefor that first of all supplic prayer
intercess and give of thank be made for all men; 2:2 for
king and for all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and
peaceabl life in all godli and honesti

2:3 for thi is good and accept in the sight of god our saviour;
2:4 who will have all men to be save and to come unto the knowledg
of the truth

2:5 for there is one god and one mediat between god and men the
man christ jesus; 2:6 who gave himself a ransom for all to be
testifi in due time

2:7 whereunto i am ordain a preacher and an apostl (i speak the
truth in christ and lie not;) a teacher of the gentil in faith and
veriti

2:8 i will therefor that men pray everi where lift up holi hand
without wrath and doubt

2:9 in like manner also that women adorn themselv in modest
apparel with shamefaced and sobriety; not with broid hair or
gold or pearl or costli array; 2:10 but (which becometh women
profess godliness) with good work

2:11 let the woman learn in silenc with all subject

2:12 but i suffer not a woman to teach nor to usurp author over
the man but to be in silenc

2:13 for adam wa first form then eve

2:14 and adam wa not deceiv but the woman be deceiv wa in
the transgress

2:15 notwithstand she shall be save in childbear if they
continu in faith and chariti and holi with sobrieti

3:1 thi is a true say if a man desir the offic of a bishop he
desireth a good work

3:2 a bishop then must be blameless the husband of one wife
vigil sober of good behaviour given to hospit apt to
teach; 3:3 not given to wine no striker not greedi of filthi lucre;
but patient not a brawler not covetous; 3:4 one that ruleth well hi
own hous have hi children in subject with all gravity; 3:5
(for if a man know not how to rule hi own hous how shall he take
care of the church of god?) 3:6 not a novic lest be lift up
with pride he fall into the condemn of the devil

3:7 moreov he must have a good report of them which are without;
lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil

3:8 likewis must the deacon be grave not doubletongu not given
to much wine not greedi of filthi lucre; 3:9 hold the mysteri of
the faith in a pure conscienc

3:10 and let these also first be proved; then let them use the offic
of a deacon be found blameless

3:11 even so must their wive be grave not slander sober
faith in all thing

3:12 let the deacon be the husband of one wife rule their
children and their own hous well

3:13 for they that have use the offic of a deacon well purchas to
themselv a good degre and great bold in the faith which is in
christ jesu

3:14 these thing write i unto thee hope to come unto thee shortly:
3:15 but if i tarri long that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to
behav thyself in the hous of god which is the church of the live
god the pillar and ground of the truth

3:16 and without controversi great is the mysteri of godliness: god
wa manifest in the flesh justifi in the spirit seen of angel
preach unto the gentil believ on in the world receiv up into
glori

4:1 now the spirit speaketh expressli that in the latter time some
shall depart from the faith give heed to seduc spirit and
doctrin of devils; 4:2 speak lie in hypocrisy; have their
conscienc sear with a hot iron; 4:3 forbid to marri and
command to abstain from meat which god hath creat to be
receiv with thanksgiv of them which believ and know the truth

4:4 for everi creatur of god is good and noth to be refus if
it be receiv with thanksgiving: 4:5 for it is sanctifi by the word
of god and prayer

4:6 if thou put the brethren in remembr of these thing thou
shalt be a good minist of jesu christ nourish up in the word of
faith and of good doctrin whereunto thou hast attain

4:7 but refus profan and old wive fabl and exercis thyself
rather unto godli

4:8 for bodili exercis profiteth little: but godli is profit
unto all thing have promis of the life that now is and of that
which is to come

4:9 thi is a faith say and worthi of all accept

4:10 for therefor we both labour and suffer reproach becaus we
trust in the live god who is the saviour of all men special of
those that believ

4:11 these thing command and teach

4:12 let no man despis thi youth; but be thou an exampl of the
believ in word in convers in chariti in spirit in faith
in puriti

4:13 till i come give attend to read to exhort to
doctrin

4:14 neglect not the gift that is in thee which wa given thee by
propheci with the lay on of the hand of the presbyteri

4:15 medit upon these things; give thyself wholli to them; that thi
profit may appear to all

4:16 take heed unto thyself and unto the doctrine; continu in them:
for in do thi thou shalt both save thyself and them that hear
thee

5:1 rebuk not an elder but intreat him as a father; and the younger
men as brethren; 5:2 the elder women as mothers; the younger as
sister with all puriti

5:3 honour widow that are widow inde

5:4 but if ani widow have children or nephew let them learn first to
shew pieti at home and to requit their parents: for that is good and
accept befor god

5:5 now she that is a widow inde and desol trusteth in god and
continueth in supplic and prayer night and day

5:6 but she that liveth in pleasur is dead while she liveth

5:7 and these thing give in charg that they may be blameless

5:8 but if ani provid not for hi own and special for those of hi
own hous he hath deni the faith and is wors than an infidel

5:9 let not a widow be taken into the number under threescor year
old have been the wife of one man

5:10 well report of for good works; if she have brought up children
if she have lodg stranger if she have wash the saint feet if
she have reliev the afflict if she have dilig follow everi
good work

5:11 but the younger widow refuse: for when they have begun to wax
wanton against christ they will marry; 5:12 have damnat becaus
they have cast off their first faith

5:13 and withal they learn to be idl wander about from hous to
house; and not onli idl but tattler also and busybodi speak
thing which they ought not

5:14 i will therefor that the younger women marri bear children
guid the hous give none occas to the adversari to speak
reproach

5:15 for some are alreadi turn asid after satan

5:16 if ani man or woman that believeth have widow let them reliev
them and let not the church be charged; that it may reliev them that
are widow inde

5:17 let the elder that rule well be count worthi of doubl honour
especi they who labour in the word and doctrin

5:18 for the scriptur saith thou shalt not muzzl the ox that
treadeth out the corn and the labour is worthi of hi reward

5:19 against an elder receiv not an accus but befor two or
three wit

5:20 them that sin rebuk befor all that other also may fear

5:21 i charg thee befor god and the lord jesu christ and the
elect angel that thou observ these thing without prefer one
befor anoth do noth by partial

5:22 lay hand suddenli on no man neither be partak of other men
sins: keep thyself pure

5:23 drink no longer water but use a littl wine for thi stomach
sake and thine often infirm

5:24 some men sin are open beforehand go befor to judgment;
and some men they follow after

5:25 likewis also the good work of some are manifest beforehand; and
they that are otherwis cannot be hid

6:1 let as mani servant as are under the yoke count their own master
worthi of all honour that the name of god and hi doctrin be not
blasphem

6:2 and they that have believ master let them not despis them
becaus they are brethren; but rather do them servic becaus they
are faith and belov partak of the benefit these thing teach
and exhort

6:3 if ani man teach otherwis and consent not to wholesom word
even the word of our lord jesu christ and to the doctrin which is
accord to godliness; 6:4 he is proud know noth but dote
about question and strife of word whereof cometh envi strife
rail evil surmis 6:5 pervers disput of men of corrupt
mind and destitut of the truth suppos that gain is godliness:
from such withdraw thyself

6:6 but godli with content is great gain

6:7 for we brought noth into thi world and it is certain we can
carri noth out

6:8 and have food and raiment let us be therewith content

6:9 but they that will be rich fall into temptat and a snare and
into mani foolish and hurt lust which drown men in destruct
and perdit

6:10 for the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some
covet after they have er from the faith and pierc themselv
through with mani sorrow

6:11 but thou o man of god flee these things; and follow after
righteous godli faith love patienc meek

6:12 fight the good fight of faith lay hold on etern life
whereunto thou art also call and hast profess a good profess
befor mani wit

6:13 i give thee charg in the sight of god who quickeneth all
thing and befor christ jesu who befor pontiu pilat wit a
good confession; 6:14 that thou keep thi command without spot
unrebuk until the appear of our lord jesu christ: 6:15 which
in hi time he shall shew who is the bless and onli potent the
king of king and lord of lords; 6:16 who onli hath immort
dwell in the light which no man can approach unto; whom no man hath
seen nor can see: to whom be honour and power everlast amen

6:17 charg them that are rich in thi world that they be not
highmind nor trust in uncertain rich but in the live god who
giveth us richli all thing to enjoy; 6:18 that they do good that
they be rich in good work readi to distribut will to
communicate; 6:19 lay up in store for themselv a good foundat
against the time to come that they may lay hold on etern life

6:20 o timothi keep that which is commit to thi trust avoid
profan and vain babbl and opposit of scienc fals so
called: 6:21 which some profess have er concern the faith
grace be with thee amen




the second epistl of paul the apostl to timothi


1:1 paul an apostl of jesu christ by the will of god accord to
the promis of life which is in christ jesu 1:2 to timothi
my dearli belov son: grace merci and peac from god the father
and christ jesu our lord

1:3 i thank god whom i serv from my forefath with pure
conscienc that without ceas i have remembr of thee in my
prayer night and day; 1:4 greatli desir to see thee be mind
of thi tear that i may be fill with joy; 1:5 when i call to
remembr the unfeign faith that is in thee which dwelt first in
thi grandmoth loi and thi mother eunice; and i am persuad that
in thee also

1:6 wherefor i put thee in remembr that thou stir up the gift of
god which is in thee by the put on of my hand

1:7 for god hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power and of
love and of a sound mind

1:8 be not thou therefor asham of the testimoni of our lord nor of
me hi prisoner: but be thou partak of the afflict of the gospel
accord to the power of god; 1:9 who hath save us and call us
with an holi call not accord to our work but accord to hi
own purpos and grace which wa given us in christ jesu befor the
world began 1:10 but is now made manifest by the appear of our
saviour jesu christ who hath abolish death and hath brought life
and immort to light through the gospel: 1:11 whereunto i am
appoint a preacher and an apostl and a teacher of the gentil

1:12 for the which caus i also suffer these things: nevertheless i am
not ashamed: for i know whom i have believ and am persuad that he
is abl to keep that which i have commit unto him against that day

1:13 hold fast the form of sound word which thou hast heard of me
in faith and love which is in christ jesu

1:14 that good thing which wa commit unto thee keep by the holi
ghost which dwelleth in us

1:15 thi thou knowest that all they which are in asia be turn away
from me; of whom are phygellu and hermogen

1:16 the lord give merci unto the hous of onesiphorus; for he oft
refresh me and wa not asham of my chain: 1:17 but when he wa
in rome he sought me out veri dilig and found me

1:18 the lord grant unto him that he may find merci of the lord in
that day: and in how mani thing he minist unto me at ephesu
thou knowest veri well

2:1 thou therefor my son be strong in the grace that is in christ
jesu

2:2 and the thing that thou hast heard of me among mani wit
the same commit thou to faith men who shall be abl to teach
other also

2:3 thou therefor endur hard as a good soldier of jesu christ

2:4 no man that warreth entangleth himself with the affair of thi
life; that he may pleas him who hath chosen him to be a soldier

2:5 and if a man also strive for masteri yet is he not crown
except he strive law

2:6 the husbandman that laboureth must be first partak of the
fruit

2:7 consid what i say; and the lord give thee understand in all
thing

2:8 rememb that jesu christ of the seed of david wa rais from
the dead accord to my gospel: 2:9 wherein i suffer troubl as an
evil doer even unto bonds; but the word of god is not bound

2:10 therefor i endur all thing for the elect sake that they
may also obtain the salvat which is in christ jesu with etern
glori

2:11 it is a faith saying: for if we be dead with him we shall
also live with him: 2:12 if we suffer we shall also reign with him:
if we deni him he also will deni us: 2:13 if we believ not yet he
abideth faithful: he cannot deni himself

2:14 of these thing put them in remembr charg them befor the
lord that they strive not about word to no profit but to the
subvert of the hearer

2:15 studi to shew thyself approv unto god a workman that needeth
not to be asham rightli divid the word of truth

2:16 but shun profan and vain babblings: for they will increas unto
more ungodli

2:17 and their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is hymenaeu
and philetus; 2:18 who concern the truth have er say that
the resurrect is past already; and overthrow the faith of some

2:19 nevertheless the foundat of god standeth sure have thi
seal the lord knoweth them that are hi and let everi one that
nameth the name of christ depart from iniqu

2:20 but in a great hous there are not onli vessel of gold and of
silver but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour and some to
dishonour

2:21 if a man therefor purg himself from these he shall be a vessel
unto honour sanctifi and meet for the master use and prepar
unto everi good work

2:22 flee also youth lusts: but follow righteous faith
chariti peac with them that call on the lord out of a pure heart

2:23 but foolish and unlearn question avoid know that they do
gender strife

2:24 and the servant of the lord must not strive; but be gentl unto
all men apt to teach patient 2:25 in meek instruct those
that oppos themselves; if god peradventur will give them repent
to the acknowledg of the truth; 2:26 and that they may recov
themselv out of the snare of the devil who are taken captiv by him
at hi will

3:1 thi know also that in the last day peril time shall come

3:2 for men shall be lover of their own selv covet boaster
proud blasphem disobedi to parent unthank unholi 3:3
without natur affect trucebreak fals accus incontin
fierc despis of those that are good 3:4 traitor headi
highmind lover of pleasur more than lover of god; 3:5 have a
form of godli but deni the power thereof: from such turn away

3:6 for of thi sort are they which creep into hous and lead
captiv silli women laden with sin led away with diver lust 3:7
ever learn and never abl to come to the knowledg of the truth

3:8 now as jann and jambr withstood mose so do these also resist
the truth: men of corrupt mind reprob concern the faith

3:9 but they shall proceed no further: for their folli shall be
manifest unto all men as their also wa

3:10 but thou hast fulli known my doctrin manner of life purpos
faith longsuff chariti patienc 3:11 persecut
afflict which came unto me at antioch at iconium at lystra;
what persecut i endured: but out of them all the lord deliv
me

3:12 yea and all that will live godli in christ jesu shall suffer
persecut

3:13 but evil men and seduc shall wax wors and wors deceiv
and be deceiv

3:14 but continu thou in the thing which thou hast learn and hast
been assur of know of whom thou hast learn them; 3:15 and that
from a child thou hast known the holi scriptur which are abl to
make thee wise unto salvat through faith which is in christ jesu

3:16 all scriptur is given by inspir of god and is profit
for doctrin for reproof for correct for instruct in
righteousness: 3:17 that the man of god may be perfect throughli
furnish unto all good work

4:1 i charg thee therefor befor god and the lord jesu christ who
shall judg the quick and the dead at hi appear and hi kingdom;
4:2 preach the word; be instant in season out of season; reprov
rebuk exhort with all longsuff and doctrin

4:3 for the time will come when they will not endur sound doctrine;
but after their own lust shall they heap to themselv teacher
have itch ears; 4:4 and they shall turn away their ear from the
truth and shall be turn unto fabl

4:5 but watch thou in all thing endur afflict do the work of
an evangelist make full proof of thi ministri

4:6 for i am now readi to be offer and the time of my departur is
at hand

4:7 i have fought a good fight i have finish my cours i have kept
the faith: 4:8 henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of
righteous which the lord the righteou judg shall give me at
that day: and not to me onli but unto all them also that love hi
appear

4:9 do thi dilig to come shortli unto me: 4:10 for dema hath
forsaken me have love thi present world and is depart unto
thessalonica; crescen to galatia titu unto dalmatia

4:11 onli luke is with me take mark and bring him with thee: for he
is profit to me for the ministri

4:12 and tychicu have i sent to ephesu

4:13 the cloke that i left at troa with carpu when thou comest
bring with thee and the book but especi the parchment

4:14 alexand the coppersmith did me much evil: the lord reward him
accord to hi works: 4:15 of whom be thou ware also; for he hath
greatli withstood our word

4:16 at my first answer no man stood with me but all men forsook me:
i pray god that it may not be laid to their charg

4:17 notwithstand the lord stood with me and strengthen me; that
by me the preach might be fulli known and that all the gentil
might hear: and i wa deliv out of the mouth of the lion

4:18 and the lord shall deliv me from everi evil work and will
preserv me unto hi heavenli kingdom: to whom be glori for ever and
ever amen

4:19 salut prisca and aquila and the household of onesiphoru

4:20 erastu abod at corinth: but trophimu have i left at miletum
sick

4:21 do thi dilig to come befor winter eubulu greeteth thee
and puden and linu and claudia and all the brethren

4:22 the lord jesu christ be with thi spirit grace be with you
amen




the epistl of paul the apostl to titu


1:1 paul a servant of god and an apostl of jesu christ accord
to the faith of god elect and the acknowledg of the truth which
is after godliness; 1:2 in hope of etern life which god that
cannot lie promis befor the world began; 1:3 but hath in due time
manifest hi word through preach which is commit unto me
accord to the command of god our saviour; 1:4 to titu mine
own son after the common faith: grace merci and peac from god the
father and the lord jesu christ our saviour

1:5 for thi caus left i thee in crete that thou shouldest set in
order the thing that are want and ordain elder in everi citi as
i had appoint thee: 1:6 if ani be blameless the husband of one
wife have faith children not accus of riot or unruli

1:7 for a bishop must be blameless as the steward of god; not
selfwil not soon angri not given to wine no striker not given
to filthi lucre; 1:8 but a lover of hospit a lover of good men
sober just holi temperate; 1:9 hold fast the faith word as he
hath been taught that he may be abl by sound doctrin both to exhort
and to convinc the gainsay

1:10 for there are mani unruli and vain talker and deceiv
special they of the circumcision: 1:11 whose mouth must be stop
who subvert whole hous teach thing which they ought not for
filthi lucr sake

1:12 one of themselv even a prophet of their own said the
cretian are alway liar evil beast slow belli

1:13 thi wit is true wherefor rebuk them sharpli that they
may be sound in the faith; 1:14 not give heed to jewish fabl and
command of men that turn from the truth

1:15 unto the pure all thing are pure: but unto them that are defil
and unbeliev is noth pure; but even their mind and conscienc is
defil

1:16 they profess that they know god; but in work they deni him
be abomin and disobedi and unto everi good work reprob

2:1 but speak thou the thing which becom sound doctrine: 2:2 that
the age men be sober grave temper sound in faith in chariti
in patienc

2:3 the age women likewis that they be in behaviour as becometh
holi not fals accus not given to much wine teacher of good
things; 2:4 that they may teach the young women to be sober to love
their husband to love their children 2:5 to be discreet chast
keeper at home good obedi to their own husband that the word
of god be not blasphem

2:6 young men likewis exhort to be sober mind

2:7 in all thing shew thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrin
shew uncorrupt graviti sincer 2:8 sound speech that
cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrari part may be
asham have no evil thing to say of you

2:9 exhort servant to be obedi unto their own master and to
pleas them well in all things; not answer again; 2:10 not
purloin but shew all good fidelity; that they may adorn the
doctrin of god our saviour in all thing

2:11 for the grace of god that bringeth salvat hath appear to all
men 2:12 teach us that deni ungodli and worldli lust we
should live soberli righteous and godli in thi present world;
2:13 look for that bless hope and the gloriou appear of the
great god and our saviour jesu christ; 2:14 who gave himself for us
that he might redeem us from all iniqu and purifi unto himself a
peculiar peopl zealou of good work

2:15 these thing speak and exhort and rebuk with all author
let no man despis thee

3:1 put them in mind to be subject to princip and power to
obey magistr to be readi to everi good work 3:2 to speak evil of
no man to be no brawler but gentl shew all meek unto all
men

3:3 for we ourselv also were sometim foolish disobedi
deceiv serv diver lust and pleasur live in malic and
envi hate and hate one anoth

3:4 but after that the kind and love of god our saviour toward man
appear 3:5 not by work of righteous which we have done but
accord to hi merci he save us by the wash of regener
and renew of the holi ghost; 3:6 which he shed on us abundantli
through jesu christ our saviour; 3:7 that be justifi by hi
grace we should be made heir accord to the hope of etern life

3:8 thi is a faith say and these thing i will that thou
affirm constantli that they which have believ in god might be
care to maintain good work these thing are good and profit
unto men

3:9 but avoid foolish question and genealog and content and
strive about the law; for they are unprofit and vain

3:10 a man that is an heretick after the first and second admonit
reject; 3:11 know that he that is such is subvert and sinneth
be condemn of himself

3:12 when i shall send artema unto thee or tychicu be dilig to
come unto me to nicopolis: for i have determin there to winter

3:13 bring zena the lawyer and apollo on their journey dilig
that noth be want unto them

3:14 and let our also learn to maintain good work for necessari
use that they be not unfruit

3:15 all that are with me salut thee greet them that love us in the
faith grace be with you all amen




the epistl of paul the apostl to philemon


1:1 paul a prison of jesu christ and timothi our brother unto
philemon our dearli belov and fellowlabour 1:2 and to our
belov apphia and archippu our fellowsoldi and to the church in
thi house: 1:3 grace to you and peac from god our father and the
lord jesu christ

1:4 i thank my god make mention of thee alway in my prayer 1:5
hear of thi love and faith which thou hast toward the lord jesu
and toward all saints; 1:6 that the commun of thi faith may
becom effectu by the acknowledg of everi good thing which is in
you in christ jesu

1:7 for we have great joy and consol in thi love becaus the
bowel of the saint are refresh by thee brother

1:8 wherefor though i might be much bold in christ to enjoin thee
that which is conveni 1:9 yet for love sake i rather beseech
thee be such an one as paul the age and now also a prison of
jesu christ

1:10 i beseech thee for my son onesimu whom i have begotten in my
bonds: 1:11 which in time past wa to thee unprofit but now
profit to thee and to me: 1:12 whom i have sent again: thou
therefor receiv him that is mine own bowels: 1:13 whom i would
have retain with me that in thi stead he might have minist unto
me in the bond of the gospel: 1:14 but without thi mind would i do
nothing; that thi benefit should not be as it were of necess but
willingli

1:15 for perhap he therefor depart for a season that thou
shouldest receiv him for ever; 1:16 not now as a servant but abov a
servant a brother belov special to me but how much more unto
thee both in the flesh and in the lord? 1:17 if thou count me
therefor a partner receiv him as myself

1:18 if he hath wrong thee or oweth thee ought put that on mine
account; 1:19 i paul have written it with mine own hand i will repay
it: albeit i do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own
self besid

1:20 yea brother let me have joy of thee in the lord: refresh my
bowel in the lord

1:21 have confid in thi obedi i wrote unto thee know
that thou wilt also do more than i say

1:22 but withal prepar me also a lodging: for i trust that through
your prayer i shall be given unto you

1:23 there salut thee epaphra my fellowprison in christ jesus;
1:24 marcu aristarchu dema luca my fellowlabour

1:25 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with your spirit amen




the epistl of paul the apostl to the hebrew


1:1 god who at sundri time and in diver manner spake in time past
unto the father by the prophet 1:2 hath in these last day spoken
unto us by hi son whom he hath appoint heir of all thing by whom
also he made the worlds; 1:3 who be the bright of hi glori
and the express imag of hi person and uphold all thing by the
word of hi power when he had by himself purg our sin sat down on
the right hand of the majesti on high: 1:4 be made so much better
than the angel as he hath by inherit obtain a more excel
name than they

1:5 for unto which of the angel said he at ani time thou art my son
thi day have i begotten thee? and again i will be to him a father
and he shall be to me a son? 1:6 and again when he bringeth in the
firstbegotten into the world he saith and let all the angel of god
worship him

1:7 and of the angel he saith who maketh hi angel spirit and hi
minist a flame of fire

1:8 but unto the son he saith thi throne o god is for ever and
ever: a sceptr of righteous is the sceptr of thi kingdom

1:9 thou hast love righteous and hate iniquity; therefor god
even thi god hath anoint thee with the oil of glad abov thi
fellow

1:10 and thou lord in the begin hast laid the foundat of the
earth; and the heaven are the work of thine hands: 1:11 they shall
perish; but thou remainest; and they all shall wax old as doth a
garment; 1:12 and as a vestur shalt thou fold them up and they shall
be changed: but thou art the same and thi year shall not fail

1:13 but to which of the angel said he at ani time sit on my right
hand until i make thine enemi thi footstool? 1:14 are they not all
minist spirit sent forth to minist for them who shall be
heir of salvation? 2:1 therefor we ought to give the more earnest
heed to the thing which we have heard lest at ani time we should let
them slip

2:2 for if the word spoken by angel wa stedfast and everi
transgress and disobedi receiv a just recomp of reward;
2:3 how shall we escap if we neglect so great salvation; which at
the first began to be spoken by the lord and wa confirm unto us by
them that heard him; 2:4 god also bear them wit both with
sign and wonder and with diver miracl and gift of the holi
ghost accord to hi own will? 2:5 for unto the angel hath he not
put in subject the world to come whereof we speak

2:6 but one in a certain place testifi say what is man that
thou art mind of him? or the son of man that thou visitest him?
2:7 thou madest him a littl lower than the angels; thou crownedst him
with glori and honour and didst set him over the work of thi hands:
2:8 thou hast put all thing in subject under hi feet for in that
he put all in subject under him he left noth that is not put
under him

but now we see not yet all thing put under him

2:9 but we see jesu who wa made a littl lower than the angel for
the suffer of death crown with glori and honour; that he by the
grace of god should tast death for everi man

2:10 for it becam him for whom are all thing and by whom are all
thing in bring mani son unto glori to make the captain of their
salvat perfect through suffer

2:11 for both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctifi are all
of one: for which caus he is not asham to call them brethren 2:12
say i will declar thi name unto my brethren in the midst of the
church will i sing prais unto thee

2:13 and again i will put my trust in him and again behold i and
the children which god hath given me

2:14 forasmuch then as the children are partak of flesh and blood
he also himself likewis took part of the same; that through death he
might destroy him that had the power of death that is the devil;
2:15 and deliv them who through fear of death were all their
lifetim subject to bondag

2:16 for verili he took not on him the natur of angels; but he took
on him the seed of abraham

2:17 wherefor in all thing it behov him to be made like unto hi
brethren that he might be a merci and faith high priest in
thing pertain to god to make reconcili for the sin of the
peopl

2:18 for in that he himself hath suffer be tempt he is abl to
succour them that are tempt

3:1 wherefor holi brethren partak of the heavenli call
consid the apostl and high priest of our profess christ jesus;
3:2 who wa faith to him that appoint him as also mose wa
faith in all hi hous

3:3 for thi man wa count worthi of more glori than mose inasmuch
as he who hath build the hous hath more honour than the hous

3:4 for everi hous is build by some man; but he that built all
thing is god

3:5 and mose verili wa faith in all hi hous as a servant for
a testimoni of those thing which were to be spoken after; 3:6 but
christ as a son over hi own house; whose hous are we if we hold
fast the confid and the rejoic of the hope firm unto the end

3:7 wherefor (a the holi ghost saith to day if ye will hear hi
voic 3:8 harden not your heart as in the provoc in the day
of temptat in the wilderness: 3:9 when your father tempt me
prove me and saw my work forti year

3:10 wherefor i wa griev with that gener and said they do
alway err in their heart; and they have not known my way

3:11 so i sware in my wrath they shall not enter into my rest) 3:12
take heed brethren lest there be in ani of you an evil heart of
unbelief in depart from the live god

3:13 but exhort one anoth daili while it is call to day; lest ani
of you be harden through the deceit of sin

3:14 for we are made partak of christ if we hold the begin of
our confid stedfast unto the end; 3:15 while it is said to day if
ye will hear hi voic harden not your heart as in the provoc

3:16 for some when they had heard did provoke: howbeit not all that
came out of egypt by mose

3:17 but with whom wa he griev forti years? wa it not with them
that had sin whose carcas fell in the wilderness? 3:18 and to
whom sware he that they should not enter into hi rest but to them
that believ not? 3:19 so we see that they could not enter in
becaus of unbelief

4:1 let us therefor fear lest a promis be left us of enter
into hi rest ani of you should seem to come short of it

4:2 for unto us wa the gospel preach as well as unto them: but the
word preach did not profit them not be mix with faith in them
that heard it

4:3 for we which have believ do enter into rest as he said as i
have sworn in my wrath if they shall enter into my rest: although the
work were finish from the foundat of the world

4:4 for he spake in a certain place of the seventh day on thi wise
and god did rest the seventh day from all hi work

4:5 and in thi place again if they shall enter into my rest

4:6 see therefor it remaineth that some must enter therein and
they to whom it wa first preach enter not in becaus of unbelief:
4:7 again he limiteth a certain day say in david to day after
so long a time; as it is said to day if ye will hear hi voic
harden not your heart

4:8 for if jesu had given them rest then would he not afterward have
spoken of anoth day

4:9 there remaineth therefor a rest to the peopl of god

4:10 for he that is enter into hi rest he also hath ceas from
hi own work as god did from hi

4:11 let us labour therefor to enter into that rest lest ani man
fall after the same exampl of unbelief

4:12 for the word of god is quick and power and sharper than ani
twoedg sword pierc even to the divid asund of soul and
spirit and of the joint and marrow and is a discern of the
thought and intent of the heart

4:13 neither is there ani creatur that is not manifest in hi sight:
but all thing are nake and open unto the eye of him with whom we
have to do

4:14 see then that we have a great high priest that is pass into
the heaven jesu the son of god let us hold fast our profess

4:15 for we have not an high priest which cannot be touch with the
feel of our infirmities; but wa in all point tempt like as we
are yet without sin

4:16 let us therefor come boldli unto the throne of grace that we
may obtain merci and find grace to help in time of need

5:1 for everi high priest taken from among men is ordain for men in
thing pertain to god that he may offer both gift and sacrific
for sins: 5:2 who can have compass on the ignor and on them
that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compass with
infirm

5:3 and by reason hereof he ought as for the peopl so also for
himself to offer for sin

5:4 and no man taketh thi honour unto himself but he that is call
of god as wa aaron

5:5 so also christ glorifi not himself to be made an high priest;
but he that said unto him thou art my son to day have i begotten
thee

5:6 as he saith also in anoth place thou art a priest for ever
after the order of melchisedec

5:7 who in the day of hi flesh when he had offer up prayer and
supplic with strong cri and tear unto him that wa abl to
save him from death and wa heard in that he feared; 5:8 though he
were a son yet learn he obedi by the thing which he suffered;
5:9 and be made perfect he becam the author of etern salvat
unto all them that obey him; 5:10 call of god an high priest after
the order of melchisedec

5:11 of whom we have mani thing to say and hard to be utter
see ye are dull of hear

5:12 for when for the time ye ought to be teacher ye have need that
one teach you again which be the first principl of the oracl of
god; and are becom such as have need of milk and not of strong meat

5:13 for everi one that useth milk is unskil in the word of
righteousness: for he is a babe

5:14 but strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age even
those who by reason of use have their sens exercis to discern both
good and evil

6:1 therefor leav the principl of the doctrin of christ let us
go on unto perfection; not lay again the foundat of repent
from dead work and of faith toward god 6:2 of the doctrin of
baptism and of lay on of hand and of resurrect of the dead
and of etern judgment

6:3 and thi will we do if god permit

6:4 for it is imposs for those who were onc enlighten and have
tast of the heavenli gift and were made partak of the holi
ghost 6:5 and have tast the good word of god and the power of the
world to come 6:6 if they shall fall away to renew them again unto
repentance; see they crucifi to themselv the son of god afresh
and put him to an open shame

6:7 for the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it
and bringeth forth herb meet for them by whom it is dress
receiveth bless from god: 6:8 but that which beareth thorn and
brier is reject and is nigh unto cursing; whose end is to be
burn

6:9 but belov we are persuad better thing of you and thing
that accompani salvat though we thu speak

6:10 for god is not unright to forget your work and labour of
love which ye have shew toward hi name in that ye have minist
to the saint and do minist

6:11 and we desir that everi one of you do shew the same dilig to
the full assur of hope unto the end: 6:12 that ye be not sloth
but follow of them who through faith and patienc inherit the
promis

6:13 for when god made promis to abraham becaus he could swear by
no greater he sware by himself 6:14 say sure bless i will
bless thee and multipli i will multipli thee

6:15 and so after he had patient endur he obtain the promis

6:16 for men verili swear by the greater: and an oath for confirm
is to them an end of all strife

6:17 wherein god will more abundantli to shew unto the heir of
promis the immut of hi counsel confirm it by an oath: 6:18
that by two immut thing in which it wa imposs for god to
lie we might have a strong consol who have fled for refug to
lay hold upon the hope set befor us: 6:19 which hope we have as an
anchor of the soul both sure and stedfast and which entereth into
that within the veil; 6:20 whither the forerunn is for us enter
even jesu made an high priest for ever after the order of
melchisedec

7:1 for thi melchisedec king of salem priest of the most high god
who met abraham return from the slaughter of the king and bless
him; 7:2 to whom also abraham gave a tenth part of all; first be by
interpret king of righteous and after that also king of
salem which is king of peace; 7:3 without father without mother
without descent have neither begin of day nor end of life;
but made like unto the son of god; abideth a priest continu

7:4 now consid how great thi man wa unto whom even the patriarch
abraham gave the tenth of the spoil

7:5 and verili they that are of the son of levi who receiv the
offic of the priesthood have a command to take tith of the
peopl accord to the law that is of their brethren though they
come out of the loin of abraham: 7:6 but he whose descent is not
count from them receiv tith of abraham and bless him that had
the promis

7:7 and without all contradict the less is bless of the better

7:8 and here men that die receiv tithes; but there he receiveth them
of whom it is wit that he liveth

7:9 and as i may so say levi also who receiveth tith pay tith
in abraham

7:10 for he wa yet in the loin of hi father when melchisedec met
him

7:11 if therefor perfect were by the levit priesthood (for
under it the peopl receiv the law) what further need wa there
that anoth priest should rise after the order of melchisedec and
not be call after the order of aaron? 7:12 for the priesthood be
chang there is made of necess a chang also of the law

7:13 for he of whom these thing are spoken pertaineth to anoth
tribe of which no man gave attend at the altar

7:14 for it is evid that our lord sprang out of juda; of which
tribe mose spake noth concern priesthood

7:15 and it is yet far more evident: for that after the similitud of
melchisedec there ariseth anoth priest 7:16 who is made not after
the law of a carnal command but after the power of an endless
life

7:17 for he testifieth thou art a priest for ever after the order of
melchisedec

7:18 for there is verili a disannul of the command go
befor for the weak and unprofit thereof

7:19 for the law made noth perfect but the bring in of a better
hope did; by the which we draw nigh unto god

7:20 and inasmuch as not without an oath he wa made priest: 7:21 (for
those priest were made without an oath; but thi with an oath by him
that said unto him the lord sware and will not repent thou art a
priest for ever after the order of melchisedec:) 7:22 by so much wa
jesu made a sureti of a better testament

7:23 and they truli were mani priest becaus they were not suffer
to continu by reason of death: 7:24 but thi man becaus he
continueth ever hath an unchang priesthood

7:25 wherefor he is abl also to save them to the uttermost that come
unto god by him see he ever liveth to make intercess for them

7:26 for such an high priest becam us who is holi harmless
undefil separ from sinner and made higher than the heavens;
7:27 who needeth not daili as those high priest to offer up
sacrific first for hi own sin and then for the peoples: for thi
he did onc when he offer up himself

7:28 for the law maketh men high priest which have infirmity; but the
word of the oath which wa sinc the law maketh the son who is
consecr for evermor

8:1 now of the thing which we have spoken thi is the sum: we have
such an high priest who is set on the right hand of the throne of the
majesti in the heavens; 8:2 a minist of the sanctuari and of the
true tabernacl which the lord pitch and not man

8:3 for everi high priest is ordain to offer gift and sacrifices:
wherefor it is of necess that thi man have somewhat also to
offer

8:4 for if he were on earth he should not be a priest see that
there are priest that offer gift accord to the law: 8:5 who serv
unto the exampl and shadow of heavenli thing as mose wa
admonish of god when he wa about to make the tabernacle: for see
saith he that thou make all thing accord to the pattern shew to
thee in the mount

8:6 but now hath he obtain a more excel ministri by how much
also he is the mediat of a better coven which wa establish
upon better promis

8:7 for if that first coven had been faultless then should no
place have been sought for the second

8:8 for find fault with them he saith behold the day come
saith the lord when i will make a new coven with the hous of
israel and with the hous of judah: 8:9 not accord to the coven
that i made with their father in the day when i took them by the hand
to lead them out of the land of egypt; becaus they continu not in
my coven and i regard them not saith the lord

8:10 for thi is the coven that i will make with the hous of
israel after those day saith the lord; i will put my law into their
mind and write them in their hearts: and i will be to them a god and
they shall be to me a people: 8:11 and they shall not teach everi man
hi neighbour and everi man hi brother say know the lord: for
all shall know me from the least to the greatest

8:12 for i will be merci to their unright and their sin
and their iniqu will i rememb no more

8:13 in that he saith a new coven he hath made the first old now
that which decayeth and waxeth old is readi to vanish away

9:1 then verili the first coven had also ordin of divin
servic and a worldli sanctuari

9:2 for there wa a tabernacl made; the first wherein wa the
candlestick and the tabl and the shewbread; which is call the
sanctuari

9:3 and after the second veil the tabernacl which is call the
holiest of all; 9:4 which had the golden censer and the ark of the
coven overlaid round about with gold wherein wa the golden pot
that had manna and aaron rod that bud and the tabl of the
covenant; 9:5 and over it the cherubim of glori shadow the
mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularli

9:6 now when these thing were thu ordain the priest went alway
into the first tabernacl accomplish the servic of god

9:7 but into the second went the high priest alon onc everi year
not without blood which he offer for himself and for the error of
the people: 9:8 the holi ghost thi signifi that the way into the
holiest of all wa not yet made manifest while as the first
tabernacl wa yet standing: 9:9 which wa a figur for the time then
present in which were offer both gift and sacrific that could
not make him that did the servic perfect as pertain to the
conscience; 9:10 which stood onli in meat and drink and diver
wash and carnal ordin impos on them until the time of
reform

9:11 but christ be come an high priest of good thing to come by a
greater and more perfect tabernacl not made with hand that is to
say not of thi building; 9:12 neither by the blood of goat and
calv but by hi own blood he enter in onc into the holi place
have obtain etern redempt for us

9:13 for if the blood of bull and of goat and the ash of an
heifer sprinkl the unclean sanctifieth to the purifi of the
flesh: 9:14 how much more shall the blood of christ who through the
etern spirit offer himself without spot to god purg your
conscienc from dead work to serv the live god? 9:15 and for thi
caus he is the mediat of the new testament that by mean of death
for the redempt of the transgress that were under the first
testament they which are call might receiv the promis of etern
inherit

9:16 for where a testament is there must also of necess be the
death of the testat

9:17 for a testament is of forc after men are dead: otherwis it is
of no strength at all while the testat liveth

9:18 whereupon neither the first testament wa dedic without
blood

9:19 for when mose had spoken everi precept to all the peopl
