wa like a fli eagl

4:8 and the four beast had each of them six wing about him; and they
were full of eye within: and they rest not day and night say
holi holi holi lord god almighti which wa and is and is to
come

4:9 and when those beast give glori and honour and thank to him that
sat on the throne who liveth for ever and ever 4:10 the four and
twenti elder fall down befor him that sat on the throne and worship
him that liveth for ever and ever and cast their crown befor the
throne say 4:11 thou art worthi o lord to receiv glori and
honour and power: for thou hast creat all thing and for thi
pleasur they are and were creat

5:1 and i saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book
written within and on the backsid seal with seven seal

5:2 and i saw a strong angel proclaim with a loud voic who is
worthi to open the book and to loos the seal thereof? 5:3 and no
man in heaven nor in earth neither under the earth wa abl to open
the book neither to look thereon

5:4 and i wept much becaus no man wa found worthi to open and to
read the book neither to look thereon

5:5 and one of the elder saith unto me weep not: behold the lion of
the tribe of juda the root of david hath prevail to open the book
and to loos the seven seal thereof

5:6 and i beheld and lo in the midst of the throne and of the four
beast and in the midst of the elder stood a lamb as it had been
slain have seven horn and seven eye which are the seven spirit
of god sent forth into all the earth

5:7 and he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that
sat upon the throne

5:8 and when he had taken the book the four beast and four and
twenti elder fell down befor the lamb have everi one of them
harp and golden vial full of odour which are the prayer of
saint

5:9 and they sung a new song say thou art worthi to take the
book and to open the seal thereof: for thou wast slain and hast
redeem us to god by thi blood out of everi kindr and tongu and
peopl and nation; 5:10 and hast made us unto our god king and
priests: and we shall reign on the earth

5:11 and i beheld and i heard the voic of mani angel round about
the throne and the beast and the elders: and the number of them wa
ten thousand time ten thousand and thousand of thousands; 5:12
say with a loud voic worthi is the lamb that wa slain to receiv
power and rich and wisdom and strength and honour and glori
and bless

5:13 and everi creatur which is in heaven and on the earth and
under the earth and such as are in the sea and all that are in them
heard i say bless and honour and glori and power be unto
him that sitteth upon the throne and unto the lamb for ever and ever

5:14 and the four beast said amen and the four and twenti elder
fell down and worship him that liveth for ever and ever

6:1 and i saw when the lamb open one of the seal and i heard as
it were the nois of thunder one of the four beast say come and
see

6:2 and i saw and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a
bow; and a crown wa given unto him: and he went forth conquer and
to conquer

6:3 and when he had open the second seal i heard the second beast
say come and see

6:4 and there went out anoth hors that wa red: and power wa given
to him that sat thereon to take peac from the earth and that they
should kill one another: and there wa given unto him a great sword

6:5 and when he had open the third seal i heard the third beast
say come and see and i beheld and lo a black horse; and he that sat
on him had a pair of balanc in hi hand

6:6 and i heard a voic in the midst of the four beast say a measur
of wheat for a penni and three measur of barley for a penny; and
see thou hurt not the oil and the wine

6:7 and when he had open the fourth seal i heard the voic of the
fourth beast say come and see

6:8 and i look and behold a pale horse: and hi name that sat on
him wa death and hell follow with him and power wa given unto
them over the fourth part of the earth to kill with sword and with
hunger and with death and with the beast of the earth

6:9 and when he had open the fifth seal i saw under the altar the
soul of them that were slain for the word of god and for the
testimoni which they held: 6:10 and they cri with a loud voic
say how long o lord holi and true dost thou not judg and
aveng our blood on them that dwell on the earth? 6:11 and white
robe were given unto everi one of them; and it wa said unto them
that they should rest yet for a littl season until their
fellowserv also and their brethren that should be kill as they
were should be fulfil

6:12 and i beheld when he had open the sixth seal and lo there
wa a great earthquake; and the sun becam black as sackcloth of hair
and the moon becam as blood; 6:13 and the star of heaven fell unto
the earth even as a fig tree casteth her untim fig when she is
shaken of a mighti wind

6:14 and the heaven depart as a scroll when it is roll together;
and everi mountain and island were move out of their place

6:15 and the king of the earth and the great men and the rich men
and the chief captain and the mighti men and everi bondman and
everi free man hid themselv in the den and in the rock of the
mountains; 6:16 and said to the mountain and rock fall on us and
hide us from the face of him that sitteth on the throne and from the
wrath of the lamb: 6:17 for the great day of hi wrath is come; and
who shall be abl to stand? 7:1 and after these thing i saw four
angel stand on the four corner of the earth hold the four
wind of the earth that the wind should not blow on the earth nor on
the sea nor on ani tree

7:2 and i saw anoth angel ascend from the east have the seal
of the live god: and he cri with a loud voic to the four angel
to whom it wa given to hurt the earth and the sea 7:3 say hurt
not the earth neither the sea nor the tree till we have seal the
servant of our god in their forehead

7:4 and i heard the number of them which were sealed: and there were
seal an hundr and forti and four thousand of all the tribe of the
children of israel

7:5 of the tribe of juda were seal twelv thousand of the tribe of
reuben were seal twelv thousand of the tribe of gad were seal
twelv thousand

7:6 of the tribe of aser were seal twelv thousand of the tribe of
nephthalim were seal twelv thousand of the tribe of manass were
seal twelv thousand

7:7 of the tribe of simeon were seal twelv thousand of the tribe
of levi were seal twelv thousand of the tribe of issachar were
seal twelv thousand

7:8 of the tribe of zabulon were seal twelv thousand of the tribe
of joseph were seal twelv thousand of the tribe of benjamin were
seal twelv thousand

7:9 after thi i beheld and lo a great multitud which no man
could number of all nation and kindr and peopl and tongu
stood befor the throne and befor the lamb cloth with white
robe and palm in their hands; 7:10 and cri with a loud voic
say salvat to our god which sitteth upon the throne and unto
the lamb

7:11 and all the angel stood round about the throne and about the
elder and the four beast and fell befor the throne on their face
and worship god 7:12 say amen: bless and glori and
wisdom and thanksgiv and honour and power and might be unto
our god for ever and ever amen

7:13 and one of the elder answer say unto me what are these
which are array in white robes? and whenc came they? 7:14 and i
said unto him sir thou knowest and he said to me these are they
which came out of great tribul and have wash their robe and
made them white in the blood of the lamb

7:15 therefor are they befor the throne of god and serv him day
and night in hi temple: and he that sitteth on the throne shall dwell
among them

7:16 they shall hunger no more neither thirst ani more; neither shall
the sun light on them nor ani heat

7:17 for the lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them
and shall lead them unto live fountain of waters: and god shall
wipe away all tear from their eye

8:1 and when he had open the seventh seal there wa silenc in
heaven about the space of half an hour

8:2 and i saw the seven angel which stood befor god; and to them
were given seven trumpet

8:3 and anoth angel came and stood at the altar have a golden
censer; and there wa given unto him much incens that he should
offer it with the prayer of all saint upon the golden altar which
wa befor the throne

8:4 and the smoke of the incens which came with the prayer of the
saint ascend up befor god out of the angel hand

8:5 and the angel took the censer and fill it with fire of the
altar and cast it into the earth: and there were voic and
thunder and lightn and an earthquak

8:6 and the seven angel which had the seven trumpet prepar
themselv to sound

8:7 the first angel sound and there follow hail and fire mingl
with blood and they were cast upon the earth: and the third part of
tree wa burnt up and all green grass wa burnt up

8:8 and the second angel sound and as it were a great mountain
burn with fire wa cast into the sea: and the third part of the sea
becam blood; 8:9 and the third part of the creatur which were in
the sea and had life died; and the third part of the ship were
destroy

8:10 and the third angel sound and there fell a great star from
heaven burn as it were a lamp and it fell upon the third part of
the river and upon the fountain of waters; 8:11 and the name of the
star is call wormwood: and the third part of the water becam
wormwood; and mani men die of the water becaus they were made
bitter

8:12 and the fourth angel sound and the third part of the sun wa
smitten and the third part of the moon and the third part of the
stars; so as the third part of them wa darken and the day shone
not for a third part of it and the night likewis

8:13 and i beheld and heard an angel fli through the midst of
heaven say with a loud voic woe woe woe to the inhabit of
the earth by reason of the other voic of the trumpet of the three
angel which are yet to sound! 9:1 and the fifth angel sound and
i saw a star fall from heaven unto the earth: and to him wa given the
key of the bottomless pit

9:2 and he open the bottomless pit; and there aros a smoke out of
the pit as the smoke of a great furnace; and the sun and the air were
darken by reason of the smoke of the pit

9:3 and there came out of the smoke locust upon the earth: and unto
them wa given power as the scorpion of the earth have power

9:4 and it wa command them that they should not hurt the grass of
the earth neither ani green thing neither ani tree; but onli those
men which have not the seal of god in their forehead

9:5 and to them it wa given that they should not kill them but that
they should be torment five months: and their torment wa as the
torment of a scorpion when he striketh a man

9:6 and in those day shall men seek death and shall not find it; and
shall desir to die and death shall flee from them

9:7 and the shape of the locust were like unto hors prepar unto
battle; and on their head were as it were crown like gold and their
face were as the face of men

9:8 and they had hair as the hair of women and their teeth were as
the teeth of lion

9:9 and they had breastplat as it were breastplat of iron; and
the sound of their wing wa as the sound of chariot of mani hors
run to battl

9:10 and they had tail like unto scorpion and there were sting in
their tails: and their power wa to hurt men five month

9:11 and they had a king over them which is the angel of the
bottomless pit whose name in the hebrew tongu is abaddon but in the
greek tongu hath hi name apollyon

9:12 one woe is past; and behold there come two woe more hereaft

9:13 and the sixth angel sound and i heard a voic from the four
horn of the golden altar which is befor god 9:14 say to the
sixth angel which had the trumpet loos the four angel which are
bound in the great river euphrat

9:15 and the four angel were loos which were prepar for an hour
and a day and a month and a year for to slay the third part of men

9:16 and the number of the armi of the horsemen were two hundr
thousand thousand: and i heard the number of them

9:17 and thu i saw the hors in the vision and them that sat on
them have breastplat of fire and of jacinth and brimstone: and
the head of the hors were as the head of lions; and out of their
mouth issu fire and smoke and brimston

9:18 by these three wa the third part of men kill by the fire and
by the smoke and by the brimston which issu out of their mouth

9:19 for their power is in their mouth and in their tails: for their
tail were like unto serpent and had head and with them they do
hurt

9:20 and the rest of the men which were not kill by these plagu
yet repent not of the work of their hand that they should not
worship devil and idol of gold and silver and brass and stone
and of wood: which neither can see nor hear nor walk: 9:21 neither
repent they of their murder nor of their sorceri nor of their
fornic nor of their theft

10:1 and i saw anoth mighti angel come down from heaven cloth
with a cloud: and a rainbow wa upon hi head and hi face wa as it
were the sun and hi feet as pillar of fire: 10:2 and he had in hi
hand a littl book open: and he set hi right foot upon the sea and
hi left foot on the earth 10:3 and cri with a loud voic as when
a lion roareth: and when he had cri seven thunder utter their
voic

10:4 and when the seven thunder had utter their voic i wa about
to write: and i heard a voic from heaven say unto me seal up
those thing which the seven thunder utter and write them not

10:5 and the angel which i saw stand upon the sea and upon the earth
lift up hi hand to heaven 10:6 and sware by him that liveth for
ever and ever who creat heaven and the thing that therein are
and the earth and the thing that therein are and the sea and the
thing which are therein that there should be time no longer: 10:7
but in the day of the voic of the seventh angel when he shall begin
to sound the mysteri of god should be finish as he hath declar
to hi servant the prophet

10:8 and the voic which i heard from heaven spake unto me again and
said go and take the littl book which is open in the hand of the
angel which standeth upon the sea and upon the earth

10:9 and i went unto the angel and said unto him give me the littl
book and he said unto me take it and eat it up; and it shall make
thi belli bitter but it shall be in thi mouth sweet as honey

10:10 and i took the littl book out of the angel hand and ate it
up; and it wa in my mouth sweet as honey: and as soon as i had eaten
it my belli wa bitter

10:11 and he said unto me thou must prophesi again befor mani
peopl and nation and tongu and king

11:1 and there wa given me a reed like unto a rod: and the angel
stood say rise and measur the templ of god and the altar and
them that worship therein

11:2 but the court which is without the templ leav out and measur
it not; for it is given unto the gentiles: and the holi citi shall
they tread under foot forti and two month

11:3 and i will give power unto my two wit and they shall
prophesi a thousand two hundr and threescor day cloth in
sackcloth

11:4 these are the two oliv tree and the two candlestick stand
befor the god of the earth

11:5 and if ani man will hurt them fire proceedeth out of their
mouth and devoureth their enemies: and if ani man will hurt them he
must in thi manner be kill

11:6 these have power to shut heaven that it rain not in the day of
their prophecy: and have power over water to turn them to blood and
to smite the earth with all plagu as often as they will

11:7 and when they shall have finish their testimoni the beast that
ascendeth out of the bottomless pit shall make war against them and
shall overcom them and kill them

11:8 and their dead bodi shall lie in the street of the great citi
which spiritu is call sodom and egypt where also our lord wa
crucifi

11:9 and they of the peopl and kindr and tongu and nation shall
see their dead bodi three day and an half and shall not suffer
their dead bodi to be put in grave

11:10 and they that dwell upon the earth shall rejoic over them and
make merri and shall send gift one to another; becaus these two
prophet torment them that dwelt on the earth

11:11 and after three day and an half the spirit of life from god
enter into them and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell
upon them which saw them

11:12 and they heard a great voic from heaven say unto them come
up hither and they ascend up to heaven in a cloud; and their
enemi beheld them

11:13 and the same hour wa there a great earthquak and the tenth
part of the citi fell and in the earthquak were slain of men seven
thousand: and the remnant were affright and gave glori to the god
of heaven

11:14 the second woe is past; and behold the third woe cometh
quickli

11:15 and the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voic in
heaven say the kingdom of thi world are becom the kingdom of
our lord and of hi christ; and he shall reign for ever and ever

11:16 and the four and twenti elder which sat befor god on their
seat fell upon their face and worship god 11:17 say we
give thee thank o lord god almighti which art and wast and art to
come; becaus thou hast taken to thee thi great power and hast
reign

11:18 and the nation were angri and thi wrath is come and the time
of the dead that they should be judg and that thou shouldest give
reward unto thi servant the prophet and to the saint and them
that fear thi name small and great; and shouldest destroy them which
destroy the earth

11:19 and the templ of god wa open in heaven and there wa seen
in hi templ the ark of hi testament: and there were lightn and
voic and thunder and an earthquak and great hail

12:1 and there appear a great wonder in heaven; a woman cloth with
the sun and the moon under her feet and upon her head a crown of
twelv stars: 12:2 and she be with child cri travail in
birth and pain to be deliv

12:3 and there appear anoth wonder in heaven; and behold a great
red dragon have seven head and ten horn and seven crown upon
hi head

12:4 and hi tail drew the third part of the star of heaven and did
cast them to the earth: and the dragon stood befor the woman which
wa readi to be deliv for to devour her child as soon as it wa
born

12:5 and she brought forth a man child who wa to rule all nation
with a rod of iron: and her child wa caught up unto god and to hi
throne

12:6 and the woman fled into the wilder where she hath a place
prepar of god that they should feed her there a thousand two
hundr and threescor day

12:7 and there wa war in heaven: michael and hi angel fought
against the dragon; and the dragon fought and hi angel 12:8 and
prevail not; neither wa their place found ani more in heaven

12:9 and the great dragon wa cast out that old serpent call the
devil and satan which deceiveth the whole world: he wa cast out
into the earth and hi angel were cast out with him

12:10 and i heard a loud voic say in heaven now is come
salvat and strength and the kingdom of our god and the power of
hi christ: for the accus of our brethren is cast down which
accus them befor our god day and night

12:11 and they overcam him by the blood of the lamb and by the word
of their testimony; and they love not their live unto the death

12:12 therefor rejoic ye heaven and ye that dwell in them woe to
the inhabit of the earth and of the sea! for the devil is come down
unto you have great wrath becaus he knoweth that he hath but a
short time

12:13 and when the dragon saw that he wa cast unto the earth he
persecut the woman which brought forth the man child

12:14 and to the woman were given two wing of a great eagl that she
might fli into the wilder into her place where she is nourish
for a time and time and half a time from the face of the serpent

12:15 and the serpent cast out of hi mouth water as a flood after the
woman that he might caus her to be carri away of the flood

12:16 and the earth help the woman and the earth open her mouth
and swallow up the flood which the dragon cast out of hi mouth

12:17 and the dragon wa wroth with the woman and went to make war
with the remnant of her seed which keep the command of god and
have the testimoni of jesu christ

13:1 and i stood upon the sand of the sea and saw a beast rise up out
of the sea have seven head and ten horn and upon hi horn ten
crown and upon hi head the name of blasphemi

13:2 and the beast which i saw wa like unto a leopard and hi feet
were as the feet of a bear and hi mouth as the mouth of a lion: and
the dragon gave him hi power and hi seat and great author

13:3 and i saw one of hi head as it were wound to death; and hi
deadli wound wa healed: and all the world wonder after the beast

13:4 and they worship the dragon which gave power unto the beast:
and they worship the beast say who is like unto the beast? who
is abl to make war with him? 13:5 and there wa given unto him a
mouth speak great thing and blasphemies; and power wa given unto
him to continu forti and two month

13:6 and he open hi mouth in blasphemi against god to blasphem
hi name and hi tabernacl and them that dwell in heaven

13:7 and it wa given unto him to make war with the saint and to
overcom them: and power wa given him over all kindr and tongu
and nation

13:8 and all that dwell upon the earth shall worship him whose name
are not written in the book of life of the lamb slain from the
foundat of the world

13:9 if ani man have an ear let him hear

13:10 he that leadeth into captiv shall go into captivity: he that
killeth with the sword must be kill with the sword here is the
patienc and the faith of the saint

13:11 and i beheld anoth beast come up out of the earth; and he
had two horn like a lamb and he spake as a dragon

13:12 and he exerciseth all the power of the first beast befor him
and causeth the earth and them which dwell therein to worship the
first beast whose deadli wound wa heal

13:13 and he doeth great wonder so that he maketh fire come down
from heaven on the earth in the sight of men 13:14 and deceiveth them
that dwell on the earth by the mean of those miracl which he had
power to do in the sight of the beast; say to them that dwell on
the earth that they should make an imag to the beast which had the
wound by a sword and did live

13:15 and he had power to give life unto the imag of the beast that
the imag of the beast should both speak and caus that as mani as
would not worship the imag of the beast should be kill

13:16 and he causeth all both small and great rich and poor free
and bond to receiv a mark in their right hand or in their
foreheads: 13:17 and that no man might buy or sell save he that had
the mark or the name of the beast or the number of hi name

13:18 here is wisdom let him that hath understand count the number
of the beast: for it is the number of a man; and hi number is six
hundr threescor and six

14:1 and i look and lo a lamb stood on the mount sion and with
him an hundr forti and four thousand have hi father name
written in their forehead

14:2 and i heard a voic from heaven as the voic of mani water and
as the voic of a great thunder: and i heard the voic of harper
harp with their harps: 14:3 and they sung as it were a new song
befor the throne and befor the four beast and the elders: and no
man could learn that song but the hundr and forti and four thousand
which were redeem from the earth

14:4 these are they which were not defil with women; for they are
virgin these are they which follow the lamb whithersoev he goeth
these were redeem from among men be the firstfruit unto god and
to the lamb

14:5 and in their mouth wa found no guile: for they are without fault
befor the throne of god

14:6 and i saw anoth angel fli in the midst of heaven have the
everlast gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the earth and to
everi nation and kindr and tongu and peopl 14:7 say with a
loud voic fear god and give glori to him; for the hour of hi
judgment is come: and worship him that made heaven and earth and the
sea and the fountain of water

14:8 and there follow anoth angel say babylon is fallen is
fallen that great citi becaus she made all nation drink of the
wine of the wrath of her fornic

14:9 and the third angel follow them say with a loud voic if
ani man worship the beast and hi imag and receiv hi mark in hi
forehead or in hi hand 14:10 the same shall drink of the wine of
the wrath of god which is pour out without mixtur into the cup of
hi indignation; and he shall be torment with fire and brimston in
the presenc of the holi angel and in the presenc of the lamb:
14:11 and the smoke of their torment ascendeth up for ever and ever:
and they have no rest day nor night who worship the beast and hi
imag and whosoev receiveth the mark of hi name

14:12 here is the patienc of the saints: here are they that keep the
command of god and the faith of jesu

14:13 and i heard a voic from heaven say unto me write bless
are the dead which die in the lord from henceforth: yea saith the
spirit that they may rest from their labours; and their work do
follow them

14:14 and i look and behold a white cloud and upon the cloud one
sat like unto the son of man have on hi head a golden crown and
in hi hand a sharp sickl

14:15 and anoth angel came out of the templ cri with a loud
voic to him that sat on the cloud thrust in thi sickl and reap:
for the time is come for thee to reap; for the harvest of the earth is
ripe

14:16 and he that sat on the cloud thrust in hi sickl on the earth;
and the earth wa reap

14:17 and anoth angel came out of the templ which is in heaven he
also have a sharp sickl

14:18 and anoth angel came out from the altar which had power over
fire; and cri with a loud cri to him that had the sharp sickl
say thrust in thi sharp sickl and gather the cluster of the
vine of the earth; for her grape are fulli ripe

14:19 and the angel thrust in hi sickl into the earth and gather
the vine of the earth and cast it into the great winepress of the
wrath of god

14:20 and the winepress wa trodden without the citi and blood came
out of the winepress even unto the hors bridl by the space of a
thousand and six hundr furlong

15:1 and i saw anoth sign in heaven great and marvel seven
angel have the seven last plagues; for in them is fill up the
wrath of god

15:2 and i saw as it were a sea of glass mingl with fire: and them
that had gotten the victori over the beast and over hi imag and
over hi mark and over the number of hi name stand on the sea of
glass have the harp of god

15:3 and they sing the song of mose the servant of god and the song
of the lamb say great and marvel are thi work lord god
almighty; just and true are thi way thou king of saint

15:4 who shall not fear thee o lord and glorifi thi name? for thou
onli art holy: for all nation shall come and worship befor thee; for
thi judgment are made manifest

15:5 and after that i look and behold the templ of the
tabernacl of the testimoni in heaven wa opened: 15:6 and the seven
angel came out of the templ have the seven plagu cloth in
pure and white linen and have their breast gird with golden
girdl

15:7 and one of the four beast gave unto the seven angel seven
golden vial full of the wrath of god who liveth for ever and ever

15:8 and the templ wa fill with smoke from the glori of god and
from hi power; and no man wa abl to enter into the templ till the
seven plagu of the seven angel were fulfil

16:1 and i heard a great voic out of the templ say to the seven
angel go your way and pour out the vial of the wrath of god upon
the earth

16:2 and the first went and pour out hi vial upon the earth; and
there fell a noisom and grievou sore upon the men which had the mark
of the beast and upon them which worship hi imag

16:3 and the second angel pour out hi vial upon the sea; and it
becam as the blood of a dead man: and everi live soul die in the
sea

16:4 and the third angel pour out hi vial upon the river and
fountain of waters; and they becam blood

16:5 and i heard the angel of the water say thou art righteou o
lord which art and wast and shalt be becaus thou hast judg
thu

16:6 for they have shed the blood of saint and prophet and thou
hast given them blood to drink; for they are worthi

16:7 and i heard anoth out of the altar say even so lord god
almighti true and righteou are thi judgment

16:8 and the fourth angel pour out hi vial upon the sun; and power
wa given unto him to scorch men with fire

16:9 and men were scorch with great heat and blasphem the name of
god which hath power over these plagues: and they repent not to
give him glori

16:10 and the fifth angel pour out hi vial upon the seat of the
beast; and hi kingdom wa full of darkness; and they gnaw their
tongu for pain 16:11 and blasphem the god of heaven becaus of
their pain and their sore and repent not of their deed

16:12 and the sixth angel pour out hi vial upon the great river
euphrates; and the water thereof wa dri up that the way of the
king of the east might be prepar

16:13 and i saw three unclean spirit like frog come out of the mouth
of the dragon and out of the mouth of the beast and out of the mouth
of the fals prophet

16:14 for they are the spirit of devil work miracl which go
forth unto the king of the earth and of the whole world to gather
them to the battl of that great day of god almighti

16:15 behold i come as a thief bless is he that watcheth and
keepeth hi garment lest he walk nake and they see hi shame

16:16 and he gather them togeth into a place call in the hebrew
tongu armageddon

16:17 and the seventh angel pour out hi vial into the air; and
there came a great voic out of the templ of heaven from the throne
say it is done

16:18 and there were voic and thunder and lightnings; and there
wa a great earthquak such as wa not sinc men were upon the earth
so mighti an earthquak and so great

16:19 and the great citi wa divid into three part and the citi
of the nation fell: and great babylon came in remembr befor god
to give unto her the cup of the wine of the fierc of hi wrath

16:20 and everi island fled away and the mountain were not found

16:21 and there fell upon men a great hail out of heaven everi stone
about the weight of a talent: and men blasphem god becaus of the
plagu of the hail; for the plagu thereof wa exceed great

17:1 and there came one of the seven angel which had the seven vial
and talk with me say unto me come hither; i will shew unto thee
the judgment of the great whore that sitteth upon mani waters: 17:2
with whom the king of the earth have commit fornic and the
inhabit of the earth have been made drunk with the wine of her
fornic

17:3 so he carri me away in the spirit into the wilderness: and i
saw a woman sit upon a scarlet colour beast full of name of
blasphemi have seven head and ten horn

17:4 and the woman wa array in purpl and scarlet colour and
deck with gold and preciou stone and pearl have a golden cup
in her hand full of abomin and filthi of her fornication:
17:5 and upon her forehead wa a name written mysteri babylon the
great the mother of harlot and abomin of the earth

17:6 and i saw the woman drunken with the blood of the saint and
with the blood of the martyr of jesus: and when i saw her i wonder
with great admir

17:7 and the angel said unto me wherefor didst thou marvel? i will
tell thee the mysteri of the woman and of the beast that carrieth
her which hath the seven head and ten horn

17:8 the beast that thou sawest wa and is not; and shall ascend out
of the bottomless pit and go into perdition: and they that dwell on
the earth shall wonder whose name were not written in the book of
life from the foundat of the world when they behold the beast that
wa and is not and yet is

17:9 and here is the mind which hath wisdom the seven head are seven
mountain on which the woman sitteth

17:10 and there are seven kings: five are fallen and one is and the
other is not yet come; and when he cometh he must continu a short
space

17:11 and the beast that wa and is not even he is the eighth and
is of the seven and goeth into perdit

17:12 and the ten horn which thou sawest are ten king which have
receiv no kingdom as yet; but receiv power as king one hour with
the beast

17:13 these have one mind and shall give their power and strength
unto the beast

17:14 these shall make war with the lamb and the lamb shall overcom
them: for he is lord of lord and king of kings: and they that are
with him are call and chosen and faith

17:15 and he saith unto me the water which thou sawest where the
whore sitteth are peopl and multitud and nation and tongu

17:16 and the ten horn which thou sawest upon the beast these shall
hate the whore and shall make her desol and nake and shall eat
her flesh and burn her with fire

17:17 for god hath put in their heart to fulfil hi will and to
agre and give their kingdom unto the beast until the word of god
shall be fulfil

17:18 and the woman which thou sawest is that great citi which
reigneth over the king of the earth

18:1 and after these thing i saw anoth angel come down from heaven
have great power; and the earth wa lighten with hi glori

18:2 and he cri mightili with a strong voic say babylon the
great is fallen is fallen and is becom the habit of devil
and the hold of everi foul spirit and a cage of everi unclean and
hate bird

18:3 for all nation have drunk of the wine of the wrath of her
fornic and the king of the earth have commit fornic
with her and the merchant of the earth are wax rich through the
abund of her delicaci

18:4 and i heard anoth voic from heaven say come out of her
my peopl that ye be not partak of her sin and that ye receiv
not of her plagu

18:5 for her sin have reach unto heaven and god hath rememb
her iniqu

18:6 reward her even as she reward you and doubl unto her doubl
accord to her works: in the cup which she hath fill fill to her
doubl

18:7 how much she hath glorifi herself and live delici so
much torment and sorrow give her: for she saith in her heart i sit a
queen and am no widow and shall see no sorrow

18:8 therefor shall her plagu come in one day death and mourn
and famine; and she shall be utterli burn with fire: for strong is
the lord god who judgeth her

18:9 and the king of the earth who have commit fornic and
live delici with her shall bewail her and lament for her when
they shall see the smoke of her burn 18:10 stand afar off for
the fear of her torment say ala ala that great citi babylon
that mighti city! for in one hour is thi judgment come

18:11 and the merchant of the earth shall weep and mourn over her;
for no man buyeth their merchandis ani more: 18:12 the merchandis of
gold and silver and preciou stone and of pearl and fine linen
and purpl and silk and scarlet and all thyin wood and all manner
vessel of ivori and all manner vessel of most preciou wood and of
brass and iron and marbl 18:13 and cinnamon and odour and
ointment and frankincens and wine and oil and fine flour and
wheat and beast and sheep and hors and chariot and slave
and soul of men

18:14 and the fruit that thi soul lust after are depart from
thee and all thing which were dainti and goodli are depart from
thee and thou shalt find them no more at all

18:15 the merchant of these thing which were made rich by her
shall stand afar off for the fear of her torment weep and wail
18:16 and say ala ala that great citi that wa cloth in fine
linen and purpl and scarlet and deck with gold and preciou
stone and pearls! 18:17 for in one hour so great rich is come to
nought and everi shipmast and all the compani in ship and
sailor and as mani as trade by sea stood afar off 18:18 and cri
when they saw the smoke of her burn say what citi is like unto
thi great city! 18:19 and they cast dust on their head and cri
weep and wail say ala ala that great citi wherein were
made rich all that had ship in the sea by reason of her costliness!
for in one hour is she made desol

18:20 rejoic over her thou heaven and ye holi apostl and
prophets; for god hath aveng you on her

18:21 and a mighti angel took up a stone like a great millston and
cast it into the sea say thu with violenc shall that great citi
babylon be thrown down and shall be found no more at all

18:22 and the voic of harper and musician and of piper and
trumpet shall be heard no more at all in thee; and no craftsman
of whatsoev craft he be shall be found ani more in thee; and the
sound of a millston shall be heard no more at all in thee; 18:23 and
the light of a candl shall shine no more at all in thee; and the
voic of the bridegroom and of the bride shall be heard no more at all
in thee: for thi merchant were the great men of the earth; for by thi
sorceri were all nation deceiv

18:24 and in her wa found the blood of prophet and of saint and
of all that were slain upon the earth

19:1 and after these thing i heard a great voic of much peopl in
heaven say alleluia; salvat and glori and honour and power
unto the lord our god: 19:2 for true and righteou are hi judgments:
for he hath judg the great whore which did corrupt the earth with
her fornic and hath aveng the blood of hi servant at her
hand

19:3 and again they said alleluia and her smoke rose up for ever and
ever

19:4 and the four and twenti elder and the four beast fell down and
worship god that sat on the throne say amen; alleluia

19:5 and a voic came out of the throne say prais our god all
ye hi servant and ye that fear him both small and great

19:6 and i heard as it were the voic of a great multitud and as the
voic of mani water and as the voic of mighti thunder say
alleluia: for the lord god omnipot reigneth

19:7 let us be glad and rejoic and give honour to him: for the
marriag of the lamb is come and hi wife hath made herself readi

19:8 and to her wa grant that she should be array in fine linen
clean and white: for the fine linen is the righteous of saint

19:9 and he saith unto me write bless are they which are call
unto the marriag supper of the lamb and he saith unto me these are
the true say of god

19:10 and i fell at hi feet to worship him and he said unto me see
thou do it not: i am thi fellowserv and of thi brethren that have
the testimoni of jesus: worship god: for the testimoni of jesu is the
spirit of propheci

19:11 and i saw heaven open and behold a white horse; and he that
sat upon him wa call faith and true and in righteous he
doth judg and make war

19:12 hi eye were as a flame of fire and on hi head were mani
crowns; and he had a name written that no man knew but he himself

19:13 and he wa cloth with a vestur dip in blood: and hi name
is call the word of god

19:14 and the armi which were in heaven follow him upon white
hors cloth in fine linen white and clean

19:15 and out of hi mouth goeth a sharp sword that with it he should
smite the nations: and he shall rule them with a rod of iron: and he
treadeth the winepress of the fierc and wrath of almighti god

19:16 and he hath on hi vestur and on hi thigh a name written king
of king and lord of lord

19:17 and i saw an angel stand in the sun; and he cri with a loud
voic say to all the fowl that fli in the midst of heaven come
and gather yourselv togeth unto the supper of the great god; 19:18
that ye may eat the flesh of king and the flesh of captain and the
flesh of mighti men and the flesh of hors and of them that sit on
them and the flesh of all men both free and bond both small and
great

19:19 and i saw the beast and the king of the earth and their
armi gather togeth to make war against him that sat on the
hors and against hi armi

19:20 and the beast wa taken and with him the fals prophet that
wrought miracl befor him with which he deceiv them that had
receiv the mark of the beast and them that worship hi imag
these both were cast aliv into a lake of fire burn with brimston

19:21 and the remnant were slain with the sword of him that sat upon
the hors which sword proceed out of hi mouth: and all the fowl
were fill with their flesh

20:1 and i saw an angel come down from heaven have the key of the
bottomless pit and a great chain in hi hand

20:2 and he laid hold on the dragon that old serpent which is the
devil and satan and bound him a thousand year 20:3 and cast him
into the bottomless pit and shut him up and set a seal upon him
that he should deceiv the nation no more till the thousand year
should be fulfilled: and after that he must be loos a littl season

20:4 and i saw throne and they sat upon them and judgment wa given
unto them: and i saw the soul of them that were behead for the
wit of jesu and for the word of god and which had not
worship the beast neither hi imag neither had receiv hi mark
upon their forehead or in their hands; and they live and reign
with christ a thousand year

20:5 but the rest of the dead live not again until the thousand year
were finish thi is the first resurrect

20:6 bless and holi is he that hath part in the first resurrection:
on such the second death hath no power but they shall be priest of
god and of christ and shall reign with him a thousand year

20:7 and when the thousand year are expir satan shall be loos
out of hi prison 20:8 and shall go out to deceiv the nation which
are in the four quarter of the earth gog and magog to gather them
togeth to battle: the number of whom is as the sand of the sea

20:9 and they went up on the breadth of the earth and compass the
camp of the saint about and the belov city: and fire came down
from god out of heaven and devour them

20:10 and the devil that deceiv them wa cast into the lake of fire
and brimston where the beast and the fals prophet are and shall be
torment day and night for ever and ever

20:11 and i saw a great white throne and him that sat on it from
whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there wa found no
place for them

20:12 and i saw the dead small and great stand befor god; and the
book were opened: and anoth book wa open which is the book of
life: and the dead were judg out of those thing which were written
in the book accord to their work

20:13 and the sea gave up the dead which were in it; and death and
hell deliv up the dead which were in them: and they were judg
everi man accord to their work

20:14 and death and hell were cast into the lake of fire thi is the
second death

20:15 and whosoev wa not found written in the book of life wa cast
into the lake of fire

21:1 and i saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and
the first earth were pass away; and there wa no more sea

21:2 and i john saw the holi citi new jerusalem come down from god
out of heaven prepar as a bride adorn for her husband

21:3 and i heard a great voic out of heaven say behold the
tabernacl of god is with men and he will dwell with them and they
shall be hi peopl and god himself shall be with them and be their
god

21:4 and god shall wipe away all tear from their eyes; and there
shall be no more death neither sorrow nor cri neither shall
there be ani more pain: for the former thing are pass away

21:5 and he that sat upon the throne said behold i make all thing
new

and he said unto me write: for these word are true and faith

21:6 and he said unto me it is done i am alpha and omega the
begin and the end i will give unto him that is athirst of the
fountain of the water of life freeli

21:7 he that overcometh shall inherit all things; and i will be hi
god and he shall be my son

21:8 but the fear and unbeliev and the abomin and
murder and whoremong and sorcer and idolat and all
liar shall have their part in the lake which burneth with fire and
brimstone: which is the second death

21:9 and there came unto me one of the seven angel which had the
seven vial full of the seven last plagu and talk with me
say come hither i will shew thee the bride the lamb wife

21:10 and he carri me away in the spirit to a great and high
mountain and shew me that great citi the holi jerusalem
descend out of heaven from god 21:11 have the glori of god: and
her light wa like unto a stone most preciou even like a jasper
stone clear as crystal; 21:12 and had a wall great and high and had
twelv gate and at the gate twelv angel and name written
thereon which are the name of the twelv tribe of the children of
israel: 21:13 on the east three gates; on the north three gates; on
the south three gates; and on the west three gate

21:14 and the wall of the citi had twelv foundat and in them the
name of the twelv apostl of the lamb

21:15 and he that talk with me had a golden reed to measur the
citi and the gate thereof and the wall thereof

21:16 and the citi lieth foursquar and the length is as larg as the
breadth: and he measur the citi with the reed twelv thousand
furlong

the length and the breadth and the height of it are equal

21:17 and he measur the wall thereof an hundr and forti and four
cubit accord to the measur of a man that is of the angel

21:18 and the build of the wall of it wa of jasper: and the citi
wa pure gold like unto clear glass

21:19 and the foundat of the wall of the citi were garnish with
all manner of preciou stone the first foundat wa jasper; the
second sapphire; the third a chalcedony; the fourth an emerald;
21:20 the fifth sardonyx; the sixth sardius; the seventh
chrysolyte; the eighth beryl; the ninth a topaz; the tenth a
chrysoprasus; the eleventh a jacinth; the twelfth an amethyst

21:21 and the twelv gate were twelv pearls: everi sever gate wa
of one pearl: and the street of the citi wa pure gold as it were
transpar glass

21:22 and i saw no templ therein: for the lord god almighti and the
lamb are the templ of it

21:23 and the citi had no need of the sun neither of the moon to
shine in it: for the glori of god did lighten it and the lamb is the
light thereof

21:24 and the nation of them which are save shall walk in the light
of it: and the king of the earth do bring their glori and honour into
it

21:25 and the gate of it shall not be shut at all by day: for there
shall be no night there

21:26 and they shall bring the glori and honour of the nation into
it

21:27 and there shall in no wise enter into it ani thing that
defileth neither whatsoev worketh abomin or maketh a lie: but
they which are written in the lamb book of life

22:1 and he shew me a pure river of water of life clear as crystal
proceed out of the throne of god and of the lamb

22:2 in the midst of the street of it and on either side of the
river wa there the tree of life which bare twelv manner of fruit
and yield her fruit everi month: and the leav of the tree were for
the heal of the nation

22:3 and there shall be no more curse: but the throne of god and of
the lamb shall be in it; and hi servant shall serv him: 22:4 and
they shall see hi face; and hi name shall be in their forehead

22:5 and there shall be no night there; and they need no candl
neither light of the sun; for the lord god giveth them light: and they
shall reign for ever and ever

22:6 and he said unto me these say are faith and true: and the
lord god of the holi prophet sent hi angel to shew unto hi servant
the thing which must shortli be done

22:7 behold i come quickly: bless is he that keepeth the say of
the propheci of thi book

22:8 and i john saw these thing and heard them and when i had heard
and seen i fell down to worship befor the feet of the angel which
shew me these thing

22:9 then saith he unto me see thou do it not: for i am thi
fellowserv and of thi brethren the prophet and of them which
keep the say of thi book: worship god

22:10 and he saith unto me seal not the say of the propheci of
thi book: for the time is at hand

22:11 he that is unjust let him be unjust still: and he which is
filthi let him be filthi still: and he that is righteou let him be
righteou still: and he that is holi let him be holi still

22:12 and behold i come quickly; and my reward is with me to give
everi man accord as hi work shall be

22:13 i am alpha and omega the begin and the end the first and
the last

22:14 bless are they that do hi command that they may have
right to the tree of life and may enter in through the gate into the
citi

22:15 for without are dog and sorcer and whoremong and
murder and idolat and whosoev loveth and maketh a lie

22:16 i jesu have sent mine angel to testifi unto you these thing in
the church i am the root and the offspr of david and the bright
and morn star

22:17 and the spirit and the bride say come and let him that heareth
say come and let him that is athirst come and whosoev will let
him take the water of life freeli

22:18 for i testifi unto everi man that heareth the word of the
propheci of thi book if ani man shall add unto these thing god
shall add unto him the plagu that are written in thi book: 22:19
and if ani man shall take away from the word of the book of thi
propheci god shall take away hi part out of the book of life and
out of the holi citi and from the thing which are written in thi book

22:20 he which testifieth these thing saith sure i come quickli
amen

even so come lord jesu

22:21 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you all amen
